reviews.review: Magnificent building to see day or night. It doesn't matter if it is during the day that you visit the plaza where this building is or at night in the Danube cruising this building is a most. It is an extraordinary building.

Incredible architecture on this iconic building. Pretty at dawn, lovely during the day, gorgeous at night. I love the architecture of Budapest's Parliament. This is definitely the defining building of Budapest, and the open area around it is nice, too. Take some photos with it next to the Danube, and maybe even with the cruise ships nearby; it's a fantastic photo opportunity!
Family trip. Very impressive building, there are tours in many languages. The must see if you are planning to visit Budapest

Wonderful Parliament building especially if you catch the changing of the guards. We were lucky enough to get to see the changing of the guards when we got to the parliament which was a treat. Music and marching. The building itself is huge and dominates the city when looking from the other side of the river.

Outstanding architecture. We didn't have time to view the inside. Make sure you walk around the entire building not just the river side. We felt that the entrance and rear was indeed more beautiful and the statues marvellous. We were pleased to see the changing of the guards as well.

Brilliant and Beautiful. The image that defines Budapest! We've seen it in both summer and winter, most recently during a Danube River cruise. Seeing it from the water is something we recommend, and we believe that there are dinner cruises or sightseeing cruises you can take. Tip: if you want to tour the inside, you must plan ahead. Parliament must be in recess, and there are limited and timed tours if you want an English guide. Go to the website and pre-arrange prior to your arrival.

Th parlent a must when visiting Budapest. The parlemsnt is probably the best reserved buildings of hongary. A must when visiting hongary.Take care to take a picture from the buda site which is the best view of the parlement
We just saw the outside and it was magnificent. We weren't there for long enough to get tickets for the inside, but the building is huge and beyond beautiful at night. They didn't skimp on this one!!
Budapest Parliament is very impressive!. Great guided tour to the Parliament! Very impressive. It takes approx one hour. So much gold ,art and beauty!!!

Very informative. The museum is free and a nominal fee for the tour of parliament we went and booked tickets as limited time slots for languages so pre book .very informative and beautiful also look at the two external exhibits

Beautiful Building. The Parliament buildings are impressive, to say the least. When viewed from the river, they are a feast for the eyes, particularly when bathed in sunshine. One of Budapest's highlight sites -- accessible by Tram No. 2 , along the Pest side of the river.

Very impressive building . A stunning building externally and internally. We did the tour which is advertised as 40 minutes although 15 of that is getting through the security check and walking up several flights of stairs so actually only 25 minutes of tour. Still it is reasonably cheap and well worth seeing.
A must see of Budapest. Beautiful visit that gives you a lot of insights and anectodes. Just make sure to book though because visits are on schedule and the time depends on the language.

An extraordinary architecture from both outside and inside. This is located by the side of the Danube river very near to the Chain Bridge. It is advisable to book a 50-minute guided tour beforehand via e-mail jegymesterKft so that you will not be disappointed. If you are an EU citizen tickets are discounted at HUF 2000 + HUF 200 for admin.services.The outside richly decorated architecture is stunning and impressive. The inside is a precious gem decorated in gold. The tour guide explained the history of the building and its present use. If you are not familiar with public transportation taxis are not that expensive and very reasonable. From Corinthia Hotel to House of Parliament we paid HUf 2000 depending on traffic.Many a times when we wanted to go places we either went by walk or by taxi.This is a MUST-SEE attraction. Do not miss!!!

Timed Tours by language available. The building is just stunning. The tours are timed, and also designated by language. We had not arranged ahead of time, and the next English tour was a 90 minute wait, so we skipped it. If you know your day of visit, I would investigate purchasing tickets ahead of time if it is possible. Nonetheless, we enjoyed walking around, browsing the gift shop etc.
Must see. The parliament building is a spectacular place to see. Very informative tour and very beautiful inside.

Do yourself a favour - don't just walk around it, look inside!. With nearly 19,000 reviews already I don't really need to add another review, but please, don't just look at the outside, it's amazing on the inside too. It's also eye catching on the outside from every direction and by day and night.

Magical!. This structure was so breathtaking that we visited by boat, at night, and by tram. It was so incredible at night it looked like it was a 3D image and not real. I have never seen anything so amazing!

Good sight for day and better at night when the lights are on. I walked past here in the day and night and I would recommend to see it at night time because the lights are on and it is beautiful. I did book a tour in the evening and it was a quick 30mins tour of inside parts of parliament. As a Non-EU citizen the ticket prices were expensive and I wouldn't recommend it as the tour was fast. Don't get me wrong the inside of the building is lovely and great architecture however if you're not so fussed on the specs then just the outside of the building is fine.

Imposing and grandiose!. The Parliament is indeed worth visiting because irrespective of who sits inside it, from the outside, it's magnificent! It's modelled on the British Parliament but is bigger than it. Dark red and white, with cathedral-like characteristics, it's bound to take your breath away. And in front of it, two decidedly embarrassed looking guards march round and round the Hungarian flag, much to the amusement of tourists. They try hard not to smile, but they're only too human. The parks and landscaping outside the Parliament provides plenty of opportunities to sit quietly in the beautiful surroundings and take it all in. Guided tours of the Parliament are also available.

Mobbed . An absolutely beautiful building inside & out, which is well worth a visit. Tour inside is a bit disappointing as I feel that you are treated like cattle and rushed round in a group that is too big. Felt a wee bit exploited.

A must-visit attraction in Budapest. A magnificent building any visitor to Budapest must see. Taking the tour inside is also quite an experience you should not miss. For architecture and history fans.

Educational. Good tour though started somewhat disorganized. Make sure to print the tickets in advance.
Beautiful building both inside and out.

A feat of architectural design!!. The parliament building is breath taking. During the day the ornate details can easily be depicted and mired, at night the lights make the building stand out on be river banks. Highly recommend a river boat tour to capture all the buildings beauty.
Must see. Equivalent of $30 Canadian dollars. Beautiful, interesting. Highlight is the chance to see the Hungarian crown.
Very beautiful, would recommend seeing . Very beautiful and unique building. Would recommend seeing at night when it's lit up! Beautiful location and central to much of Budapest's other attractions.
Walking past. Beautiful building - could not stop looking at it from every angle - exhibition outside interesting too

An Architectural Gem. If you are into architecture, this is the place for you. Hungary's Parliament building is a stunning example of Gothic architecture dating from 1904. The surrounding plaza is also beautiful with many terrific photo opportunities. There are many good cafes and restaurants just off the edges of the plaza.

Book early to avoid disappointment. We were recommended to do the tour of Parliament House and it was excellent. A magnificent and richly decorated building, the tour shows just a glimpse of the large and beautiful house of government. The guide provided a good explanation of the history of the building and the highlight was entering the dome and viewing the 1000 year old coronation jewels. Well worth the hustle and bustle of entering the building and checking the coats.

Huge!. The Hungarian Parliament is huge. Reservations are needed to tour the building. Tickets cost about $18 each and you can get them on-line with your credit card. It's about a 15 minute walk from the Intercontinental hotel but should allow about 30 minutes walk time to find the tourist entrance and where to line-up. The lines to get into security are a mess. Signage is poor and the language barrier makes it hard to understand where/when you should get in line If your ticket is printed for 10:30, they will not let you in at 10:25. Once inside, it is fantastic. The tour is about an hour and you can take pictures except in the room where the Hungarian crown is displayed. One woman tried to sneakily take some pictures and a guard came over and made her delete the pictures she took. Hah!
Spectacular . Worth viewing from both afar and up close to admire the fantastic architecture. Lovely building. Would recommend visiting
Beautiful . I watched this from outside. The view at night is overwhelming. It is accessible easily on foot. It beside Danube.

Fabulous structure at the edge of the Danube. unfortunately the lines were long for a guided tour and we had to pass (50 min. long); to avoid them you might be better off to book a tour through your hotel (for a somewhat higher price).
Just looked at the outside of this massive structure is incredible.

Cool building. We only wandered outside, as didn't have time to do the tour. Building is beautiful and very familiar if you have any connection to London. We saw Parliament from one of the night tour boats on the Danube and also walking back at dusk from Margarets Island. Worth checking out as the lit up architecture is breath-taking.

Oh whatever...just another building.. You know what, I got tired of seeing these all lit up big buildings, parliament or not, buildings do not really impress me. Sure it is pretty, whatever...bla...bla...it will impress you if you never seen anything in your life before this.

One word...beautiful . Just wow, spent the whole visit awe struck and just kept looking at the ceiling. Wow!! Only down side was visit was quite short...and weren't allowed to take pictures of the great dome because the crown was in there but it was still amazing to see

The Jewel in Hungary's Crown. The Parliament is a really interesting place to visit. Situated outside Kossuth Lajos Ter station (it is difficult not to miss it), the building has an imposing appearance and also features a changing of the guard near to the flag in front of the building. Tours are available to book both online and at the building itself. I would avoid using the online site since it is the Hungarian version of Ticketmaster (Jegymester) and often doesn't work or offers tickets at a more expensive price than they are at the building. Additionally, if you want to book a tour on the day, remember to take your passport with you since this will be checked when you go through the barriers to the tour (along with your bags). The tour is fantastic, you will see the insides of the building itself including the main hall where politicians meet. However, the highlight of the tour is seeing the crown worn by the kings of Hungary. Be aware that whilst photography is permitted in all other areas of the building, you are not permitted to take any pictures whatsoever of the crown (the tour guides do remind you repeatedly for your benefit, but there is always one). Take a tour and discover Hungary's Parliament.
Worth a visit. Highly recommend visiting the parliament and walk the grounds. Beautiful architecture and surrounding with many great photo opportunities.

Don't miss it at night. We didn't tour the inside -- just viewed the outside at night and during the day. Night views are stunning because of the architecture and lighting. We saw it from a boat on the Danube, which we recommend.
A beautiful building.. A must see.A fantastic building beautiful day or night if yout walking or passing by on a tram. Amazing when lit up at night.

Spectacular building.. Worth the walk to see this spectacular building. We were three just before the commemoration of the up rising. Quite moving to see the soldiers by the memorial and the marks of the bullet holes.

Nice for a rainy day . We visited the Hungarian parliament on a rainy grey day in October. The interior design was spectacular, and the guide we had was so informative. Make sure you buy your tickets beforehand on line, unless you want to wait for hours in the lobby area. Good place to visit !

Big building. Not much more than that. If you've traveled around the europe then you already have seen similar buildings. The surrounds are really nice because its located beside the Tonava river. But if you just look at the building, its not very special. The surrounding areas that are way nicer than just the Parlament building.
The tour - breathtaking. We took the tour of the Parliament, and our jaws dropped on more than one occasion. You tour the building's interior and get to see the crown jewels.
Wow !!. This building is really impressive. Even though Hungary did not have the funds to build this place they did it anyway and out did themselves.Definitely worth the visit.
Beautiful building. This is one of the most beautiful buildings I have seen. Doesn't offer much else for the tourists but eye candy.

Beautiful scenery at night! . I visited to see this building at day time and also night time because it is near from my two-night staying place. I recommend to see this at night! Very beautiful and very goldish.

Beautiful building. We visited on a Monday when the building itself was closed to visitors, so I was only able to see the outside. However, it's an absolutely gorgeous building that is great for photo ops. A must see for Budapest.

Amazing Parliament Building. Be sure to book a free tour of the Hungarian Parliament, it is absolutely beautiful. The Parliament is still in use and has been since the 1800's. They allow you to take pictures on the tour, with the exception of the room where the crown is on display.
Parliament Budapest. There's not many words that can describe this spectacular building that do it justice. It's amazing and viewing from the river Danube is a must.
Just WOW!. No photos on the internet will prepare for actually witnessing all the details of this building up close! It's a stunner!

visit to the hungarian parliament. we visited the Parliament with the guided tour for 45 minutes,offered by the OFFICIAL AGENCY. excellent building,huge,grand staircase & excellent senate room.large croud,so smart to book in advance.
Amazing. One of the highlights of our site seeing trip to Budapest was a visit to the Parliament building. An amazing building and well worth the small entry fee.
Don't miss!. We did not get to go inside but the parliament is a spectacular building from the outside. The plaza includes a fabulous exhibition on the 1956 Massacre and revolution.

Beautiful when seen across Danube when lit-up at night. This, I suppose one of the most beautiful nightscapes in Budapest. Unfortunately, we had no time to tour the interior, but my colleagues who took a tour, said that is something you should not miss if you visit Budapest

So beautiful at night. A must see at night time, highly recommend viewing from Buda side of the river or from a night cruise. We did a 9euro 1 hour cruise on the Danube with Porto cruises near pier 1 and you get a great view for photos. We viewed from the river and then walked along next to it as well to admire up close. Did not do a tour (unsure if you can?)

Most beautiful building on the world. It's a must to see attraction, walk around, step inside, sit in front of the building and relax at the Danube river, and dont forget to check it in the night. :) You will like it..

A guided tour with anecdotes. We arrangd for a guided tour of the Houses of Parliament on our second visit to Budapest as our curiosity went beyond the amazing facades. A bit if confusion in the waiting area was soon cleared when guides speaking various languages took hold of their respective groups. The visit highlighted some key points in the history of the Parliament and the rich decor left us all in awe.

Parliament Tour. Fascinating & beautiful !!! Well worth a visit. I knew I would find this interesting but it was stunning too. The tour itself was relatively short but before you leave you can spend at least twice as long in the gallery areas watching visual displays showing how the building was constructed

Stunning building!. take the tram at night - excellent view! The tram takes you around the entire building and the view is mind boggling. Buy a 3-day BKK travel card (different from the Budapest City Card) - excellent use!
Spectacular building!. View this from liberation monument, or from the top of the tower tour at Matthias church. Amazing!!!

Beautyfull parlament. This building is next to the river ,fantastic trip by boat and great
restaurants and cafe find with terrace,when you could enjoy it a hungarian cousin!!! Amazing!!!
Speccy. Beautiful building outside, but even more impressive internally. Like the Houses of Parliament in Westminster, only better.

One not to be missef. The tour of the parliament building is a must. The guides are very informative and give you a good understanding of the workings of the Hungarian Parliament. It's worth noting that there are lots of stairs to climb at the start of the tour so if you are not good on your feet best to take the lift Instead.

Our Gate 1 tour . Beautiful place to say the least. There are two identical 1/2's to this building. At one time there were two governing bodies just like in the states. Now there is just one, so the side that isn't used is open to tourists. It is huge and very, very ornate. The tour guide gave us a lot of Hungarian history which was very interesting indeed. We had an early tour, so avoided the crowd.

The great beatiful parlament near Danube. This parliament remind me like a parliament of Great Britain in London but for some reason looks more beatiful. The location of parliament and near bridges and the view is breathtaking

Impressive inside and out. I booked the guided tour in English in advance. The cost for EC citizens is 2000HUF, which is ridiculously cheap for the grandeur you will witness. Really good guide too. Great building inside and out. There were demonstrations against the government when we were there- let's hope Hungarian demoncracy is as impressive as its home. Visitors from the UK, get the EC citizen rate whilst you can.
Well worth a visit. We went on the tour of the Parliament which was very interesting. The building is stunning both inside and out. The tour guide spoke excellent English and was very informative.

Worth seen. You can buy tickets online or on the spot about 2 hours before. Tickets aren't expensive in my opinion and there are discounts for EU students :) The Parliament is beautiful and I guess no one expect what is inside (if hadn't have googled it before ;)).
wow. the building from the outside is amazing and yet, the interior is far more stunning. take the tour, book online and you will thank me.

Budapest postcard - specially at night. Amazing construction and Budapest postcard. Make sure you are on Fisherman's Bastion on nightfall to see the building in all its splendor and lights at night. If you want a guided visit to know the interior, better buy the ticket in advance. It may get crowded with tourists sometimes.

Amazing building but tired tour guide. The building is amazing. You must join a guided tour in order to go inside. Half price for EU citizens. I joined the last tour at 6pm and our tour guide seems to be really tired. It was as if she was just trying to rush through her recited script in monotone to get us outta there. Nonetheless, the exhibition at the end actually got me way more excited than the tour guide herself. Too bad I was told that they were closing as I was the only handful of people who actually paid attention to the exhibited materials. Upon leaving the building, it was already dark outside and the view was simply phenomenal. If you're doing a daytime tour, try to head back to the area to see the amazing building at night!
Quick zip. Bit of a "whistlestop " tour but worth it- Audio headphone provided so although a fairly large group everything could be heard.Beautiful building!Free toilets and coffee shop on site too.

Superficial. We took a guided tour and heard the constant cough of the guide in our ears, coupled by the bad English and rather superficial information. During the tour we were informed of the glorious but somewhat propagandistic history of Hungary. We are still not sure what Hungary gave the world, apart from goulash and the Rubick cube, however.
Breathtaking. Such a beautiful building. Saw at night from a boat on the Danube also, lit up by the fireworks, Captivating.
Beautiful architecture. A walk along the Danube to Parliament is a must if you are visiting Budapest. It is a breathtaking building from every angle!

One of the most beautiful building in Budapest!. Although a registration and ticket is necessary, and sometimes a long waiting queue is ahead us, worth of waiting every minutes. You will be able to walk into the second - non-used - House of Common - and see the magnificent lavishly decorated room of jurisdiction. This room is not used actively at this time, however it gives you a possibility to walk in, and feel the same feeling what the member of parliament feels when they making the law.
Parliament Tour. We booked the parliament's tour and we're glad we did. Beautiful and rich history. The guide was able to answer all questions.

Enormous & Beautiful Building. Today's Hungary is much smaller than its historical counterpart. The Parliament Building reflects the plans and ambitions of a Hungary that once planned to rule most of Europe. It is enormous, gorgeous, and architecturally fascinating. A "must not miss" when in Budapest.

The nicest building in the world. Fantastic. When I go with car from north at the other side bank, (wharf road), this is uplifting, magnifical . Regretly not the proper people are sitting in the chairs. They don't feel the honour, the expectation what this building desert. Look inside too, and probably understand, what I feel.

Beautiful building on the riverside. The plan won the 1st prize on the competition at the end of the 19th century. Architect Imre Steindl made a fantastic building with the best technical soultions of that period (eg. heating system). Some yoers ago the recontsruction of the building was finished and now the Parliament is nicer than ever before.

Must be seen once. One of the most beautiful buildings I have ever seen. You need an ID or Passport to get in and it's half price is you are an EU citizen. Obviously there is a security check upon entering the building. Do not carry anything that not supposed to be in the Parliament.
A must see in Budapest. Beautiful architecture.. Very impressive building. A unique piece of architecture. Note the fine details on each door, window and nob.

Absolutely worth a visit. Beautiful building and impressive interior. Book your tour online in advance! If you cannot print your tickets go to information and show them the tickets on your mobile. They will give you paper tickets.
Parliament. The place was huge and good of them to make visitors view its inside and at night its spectacular. It has a magnificent view from the Danubian river.

The Hungarian Parlament. The Hungarian Parlament is worthy to be visited from the Danube by ship. You will get the most beautiful view :)
However, the building is is very nice inside as well.

Parliament. Excellent tour and sites. The architecture is phenomal! The tour guides are attentive to questions. We loved Budapest and the city! Parliament shows detail history of their constructions with audio

Budapest Kossuth square. Fantastic building, it is the history itself!
Remembering the national memories, place of the Hungarian Crown
Very impresive building to visit. Make sure you visit this destination as well as Building, during day there are shift changes very nice to watch.
Parliament. Beautiful building. Must book a tour in advance during the busy months. Short visit (45min). Very informative.
Stunning building a must see. The beautiful building is stunning at night and during the day. It is huge with more surprises as you get closer the detail is unreasl.
Amazing Building!. We didn't go inside, but from outside, either seeing it from the boat, or walking around the feeling is thrilling!!!

Will take your breath away!. Beautiful government building in Budapest and right by the Danube River. I saw it by boat and during the day and it is so large and impressive. I imagine it is even more beautiful at night with the lights lighting the building up!

Just an amazing structure - must see tour!. The magnificence of the Parliament building came as a complete surprise - both externally and internally. The facade and architectural style is impressive and quite breathtaking. The internal decor of gold leaf is vibrantly rich and well done. The tour through the key rooms and the main parliament hall is living history and definitely worth doing. Of course, the view of the Parliament from the river side is a photographer's delight.

The best of Budapest. The Parliament Bldg to me was the highlight of Budapest. Inside by day and outside cruising at night. The inside tour was amazing, the architecture is beyond words. You will need to buy tickets in advance. Thought I was in a palace. Just as beautiful as Catherine's Palace in St Petersburg. Cruising past the Parliament at night was the best way to end our cruise. Absolutely breathtaking. No words or pictures can do it justice as the whole river is lit up.
Beautiful building and excellent tour. Very enjoyable and certainly worthwhile. Be sure to go on line to reserve spot in tour. Building situated right on the Danube

Historical building. The outside of this building is striking especially at night when illuminated. The guide tour of the inside is great although a little too short. The tour only covers a small amount of the interior of this massive edifice. Excellent English speaking guide. Providing more history of Hungary would have made the tour even better.

Most beautiful building in Europe . We spent 2 nights anchored across the Danube from the Parliament Building in Budapest. It is bathed in light at night. Truly the diamond in the lighted crown of Budapest at night.We were aboard the best river cruise ship on the Danube , the Scenic Jade. 15 days from Amsterdam to Budapest in true luxury. If I could find Scenic on TripAdvisor I would give it 5 in all categories.Much better than the other cruise lines.

Spectacular buildings especially seen from the river, day or night. We viewed these spectacular buildings from a boat on the Danube during both day and night. A must see. A future visit is a must to take the tour of the buildings. These buildings are second only to the British Parliament buildings in size and the most beautiful of all Capital cities we have seen over 60 years.

A must do. This building is simply amazing inside and out. I cannot tell you how many pictures my husband and I took of it as we walked around it and as we saw it from the other side of the river. You can tour inside. You purchase tickets in an area you walk down a ramp to get below ground to. It's on the back left side of the building when you are facing it from the river. The guided tours are scheduled by time and language. Get there early so you can purchase tickets as they only have a certain amount of slots for each tour in language and sometimes tickets can go fast if there is a large group wanting a certain tour. We purchased ours and had to come back a couple hours later. You are able to take pictures inside, except for the Holy Roman Emperor Crown that's on display and being guarded. The room where Parliament actually meets is stunning. The tour was very well done and informative regarding history of the building and area. For those with difficulty walking, they do have an elevator that can be used. Very happy we decided to do this. Highlight of our trip to Budapest.

Excellent tour. The tour is very thorough and very interesting. The Czechs are very proud of their republic. Two nearby must-sees: the Holocaust Memorial along the Danube; and the 1956 Rebellion site/museum

stunning. Be sure to take the tour of this gorgeous building. You will be amazed at how gorgeous it is on the inside, too. Be sure to make a booking for a specific language and time, or you may end up touring with a different language group than you speak. But it's all good! Just get there!!!
Absolutely stunning!. I was traveling with a DC lobbyist and we thoroughly enjoyed every minute of the tour. Well worth it.

Beautiful Historical Ediface. Get tickets online before your visit but be prepared for unorganized pushing and shoving to reach the security checkpoint. Tour is short but sweet with hearing devices. Spectacular craftsmanship and a view of the actual parliament process. Worth the cost and hassle.

A must visit-to an Hungarian monument. The visit it self was shorten, but more than enough.
The guide was very hospitable, and the tour was in our mother tongue, which was very nice.
Nice building . Very grand looking building. It easy to get to walking alongside the river. Nice cafe and restaurants nearby.

The #1 must-see in Budapest!. This is the iconic building of Budapest, which looks great on the outside in the day but even prettier with its lights at night. There were 3 free displays which gave insight into the country's 1000 years of legislation and 1956 revolution. The guided tour of the interior is a bit expensive especially for a non-EU adult, but still very worth it (I don't want to spoil it by saying what exactly is inside)!

Breathtaking. This absolutely stunning building is not to be missed.....its stunning on the outside and looks magnificent from the river but once you step inside it really is breathtaking ..... it's a good idea to book up a tour before you travel to save queuing .....the best place to visit.
Superb!. I never thought that their parliament would be so beautiful. Definitely do a night cruise to see this lit.

Interesting/don't miss the underground museums...free. We walked to the Parliament building from our hotel and self guided around the property. It is easily accessible and very interesting to see. We went into the underground museums which are free and wandered around. They were very interesting and emotive...look for them. The guards walk around the flag pole and create an interesting perspective of the area which is old world pre and post communistic. The government buildings around the Parliament are interesting as well. No guide or tour needed. You can't enter the building and the doors are guarded. The location is right on the Danube bank and easy to navigate. For those who like statues there are plenty of those also.
Beautiful!. The most beautiful parliament building I've ever seen! The building is incredible a must see while in Budapest!

So impressive. This is one of the must -see structures of Budapest. Hop on tram 2 to take some pics in the daytime-then jump back on in the evening for a view of the parliament bathed in lights-so beautiful. This building is HUGE!

Incredible view!. When I first time saw this wonderful building at night with lights around I thought I was in some fairy tail. It really makes you feel a kid again and believe in miracles. Very good atmosphere in this place and definitely worth to visit!
Magnificent . Wonderful building whether viewed from across the Danube or up close. There are a couple of free exhibitors on site as well as lovely grounds to wander through.
Absolutely fascinating structure. Definitely worth a visit when in Budapest, its a fascinating structure, stunning would definitely suggest to pay a visit.
Absolutely worth it. Make sure to book your tickets in advance. Our hotel helped us do it as they were sold out on the day we arrived. The highlight is seeing the crown jewels from centuries ago.

Stunning architecture. We visited as part of a walking tour, and the guide explained the history of the buildings whilst we walked. Absolutely stunning, and even more so at night when the building is lit up. Well worth a visit!
Beautiful Place to see. A must see when in Budapest. Especially from the Buda side at night. The crown jewel are spectacular.

You will be blown away!. What an overwhelming experience! Right on the bank of the Danube on the Pest side, this is huge, I would guess about a quarter-mile long. The architecture on the outside is amazing and powerful, and the inside is absolutely palatial! This is the Number 1 attraction in a city of scores of good attractions. This is a real "Don't Miss"!
Iconic Budapest. An outstanding building, the icon of Budapest and when seen from the river at sunset absolutely stunning.

Beautiful building. This is an amazing building, taking a guided tour is definitely the best option, I noticed they have multiple languages as options. I loved the fact that an actual person provides the tour, not a recorded machine. Inside the building its beautiful and its 20kg of gold will make shine all of your pictures. I recommend getting your tours before hand online and print the tickets at home. It will save you a few minutes.
Beautiful !. You can't really go in, you must schedule before, but the view is beatuiful from across the river at night
Amazing!. This building is amazing day and night, from PESTE and from BUDA side. The architecture its unique....
Spectacular building. You cannot appreciate this building fully unless you take a guided tour of the inside.The dome room is breathtaking.
Great architecture. With a great architecture and impressive history the Parliament building is one of the must see places in Budapest.

Plan ahead for tour--don't miss changing of the guard. The Hungarian Parliament is one of the high points of any visit to Budapest. No visitor can miss the iconic building on the Danube. It's beautiful in the daylight, but makes an even more spectacular sight in the evening. We thought the best spot for night time pictures were the steps at the Fisherman's Bastion across the river on Castle Hill in Buda. But in my opinion, to get the full experience, a tour of the interior is really worth the money. To secure a spot on a tour in the language of your choice, it's a good idea to reserve a spot online, especially during the busier summer months. We booked our tour about a month in advance. The exclusive website to do book is "jegymester.hu" and the entire process can be completed in English. You can print your tickets out at home and go directly to the security line when you arrive. It gave me peace of mind to know that we had guaranteed tickets. The tour entry is inside a modern underground entrance in Kossuth Lajos square. If you weren't able to secure tickets for the day of your visit, I would still check at the visitor office for same day tickets. The day of our visit, additional tours were added. Our tour guide was very engaging and informative. She was very proud of her country and history and excited to share. Each member of our tour group got to wear a transmitter/ear phones, so it was easy to hear the tour guide, even if you weren't right in the front of the group. In addition, photography was allowed everywhere except around the crown. The tour took about 45 minutes. The inside of the building was absolutely beautiful, just like the outside, and well worth a visit. One last note: Don't miss the changing of the guard ceremony that takes place outside the main hall on the hour. It's much less grand than the one in England, but after the guards finish their formal exchange, they march into the crowd for pictures with tourists.

Don't miss the guard performance and sunset view. This building has 2 interesting sides: The riverfront and gardenfront. On the garden front, you can enjoy great architecture of huge parliament house and other old government buildings and some other monuments nearby. Whats interesting is you will find also 2 guards keep walking around the majestic flag or even better you will see some other guards coming for shift change ceremony (I heard they change the shift every hour but I did not verify this information -fortunately we were there when they change shift-). The riverfront is not very special in the daylight but become beautiful if you see it during sunset. You should take a sunset boat to see the best of it.

Hungarian Parliament. We visited Parliament in a group of four people. Tickets costed 2200 HUF per person (for non EU members regular price is 5600 HUF!). Upon buying tickets a saleswoman checked our ID cards (a little bit strange situation for me). To go inside with english group we had to wait for 3 hours. Fortunately we could go somewhere else (recommend to visit St. Stephen's Basilica). After three hours we went back and started to visit parliament. It is possible to see only the half of the building (southern?) because the second part is used by hungarian deputies ;-). The most impressives are two places inside: the dome with St Stephen's crown and deputies room (routinely not used).After 45 minutes we went out. Taken together it is not a waste of time but I was not impressed (except mentioned places).
Beautiful building!. We recommend taking a tour of this building which is presently used and full of history. You need to. Are reservations!
Amazing Architecture. This has to be one of the most amazing parliament buildings in the world. Well worth seeing by day and lit up at night. Simply beautiful

Lovely building. Well worth a visit. You have to join a tour but they are frequent and very informative. Do not be duped into going on a guided tour with an outside travel agent as only the official Parliament guides can show you around so you are paying for something you don't get.

It's a must. The Hungarian Parliament is a great place to visit when you're in Budapest. The iconic building is a landmark in the city. Same-day tickets can be purchased only in limited numbers at our ticket office in the visitor center. (Please note that purchasing tickets on the spot might take a considerable amount of time.) Advance tickets are available online at jegymester.hu/parlament

Workmanship is awesome. There's a reason the Parliament is on everyone's sightseeing list. Beautiful and intricate embelishments, ornate, and exquisitely executed. This is Hungarian craftsmanship worth seeing. The Parliament has tours in many languages. Reservations are required and it's best to order your tickets on line.

Just an average tour. They advertised the tour as 45 minutes, but it was no longer than 30. It was an interesting tour, but could have been for longer. For what we paid (5400 HUF), I did not think it was value for money.

Magnificent. This is a must to see. It is the third biggest parliament building in the world. It is a really impressive building and one of the most recognised. There is not enough time to see the hundreds of rooms,courtyards,gates etc.It is so big it is magnificent.
Beautiful views!. Visited on our last day in Budapest. Great views and architecture and it was sunny which made everything 10x better!

Huge!!!. We visited here during our trip.The building is huge (one of the biggest parliament buildings in the world), because it was originaly built for the Austro-Hungarian empire.Amazing site, just to look around and enjoy (we took a tour guide to explain anout the hiatory which was a big plus)

register to enter.... You will need your passport or similar documentation if you wish to tour the parliament. The archetect based his plans on the London Houses of Parliament,so look out for the similarities. Beautiful stained glass windows. It gets very busy so some queues but worth a visit

Fascinating building. Really is the must do thing of Budapest, as well as seeing it from the inside and at night from a boat cruise!English Tours throughout the day and does not take all that long (45 minutes) but you see some truly breathtaking architecture and interiors like the golden stair case, the halls, the Hungarian Crown and the main assemble.Certainly the must do activity of Budapest.

Budapest - Hungary - Parliament Building - Simply Spectacular. Like almost everyone else who visits this wonderful city you view the Parliament Building located on the eastern bank of the River Danube and standing on Kossuth Lajos Square to the rear. This massively impressive building, very similar, and believed to be based, on the Houses of Parliament building in London, was completed in 1904 and originally housed two parts of the National Assembly of Hungary but now that legislature is unicameral it occupies only part leaving much of the building vacant but able to be viewed by Hungarians and the city visitors. Built in a Gothic Revival style the building is truly wonderful and can be viewed from all around but probably best from a river boat on the River Danube. In the evening it is lit up and forms the main part of Budapest's wonderful skyline. I was intrigued by the building. It really is beautiful.
Parliament Building . Parliament building is beautiful and special with all the lights at night Try to get accommodations close by

Such a beautiful building. It's a treat to watch Budapest parliament both from road in a moving bus and then from a boat in river Danube. Unique architecture grace well maintained. One will like to see again n again

Old World Charm. Lovely facility reflecting the grandeur of past times. The guided tour is interesting lasting about a half hour. Unfortunately, no picture taking is allowed inside, but the memories of the opulent style of the aristocrats will be remembered.

Must see. The parliament in budapest is an amazing building with hundreds of rooms.
It us a must to pass around it for few pics .
You can also book and visit from inside but haven't got time to do this one
Nice Parlement building . This is one of the most beautifull buildings along the Danube. I could not believe this is the Hungary Parlement.
Most beautiful Parliament in the world. Neo-Gothic beautiful huge building with pretty Neo-Renaissance dome.. many details you can see.. interior is magnificent also

Tour of the Parliament. Very interesting building and worth the visit if you have enough time in Budapest. Book your tickets online to save time. The meeting place for the tours is on the far left side of the building if you are viewing the building from the river side and there is a metal security check before you go in. The view of the building at night from across the river, when it is lit up, is spectacular.

Fabulous architecture inside and out. Take the tour!. This building is a must see. Originally designed to accommodate 2 legislative bodies but now that there is only one, half of he building is available for touring. The building is lavish and reflects a level of design befitting the home of the country's top legislature. The back of the building is best viewed from the square. Catch the changing of the guards if you can. They will welcome you to join them for a photo. The other face is best viewed from a river boat or from the Buda side of the river. The view is especially magnificent at night when the whole building is lit up. Don't miss this one.

Part of Our Tour Extension. Definitely well worth a visit and we timed our visit to coincide with the changing of the guard around the Crown. Third largest parliament building in the world and very ornate.

Beautiful building. We were looking for the Shoes on Danube and they are about 200m across from the Parliament. The entire building was lit up and it was gorgeous. There were security guarding the place 24/7. Nice place to check out.
Must to see. This is a " must to see" thing in Budabest , especially by night. If You have time to spend, go for guided tour .
Beautiful . Awesome place, we attended after hours so could not go in but has really beautiful features to the building 😬
Breathtaking!!!. I didn't tour the Parliament building,but it was still my most favorite structure to see in Budapest. It's so massive and beautiful. Seeing at night is even better.

Spectacular - particularly at night. We started a river cruise from Budapest and joined our boat parked on the Danube directly across from the Parliament Buildings. They are an architectural gem. Lit up at night they are even more impressive. We took an evening spin up and down the Danube and returned to iyr original berth that same evening. When we got back there wre hundreds of birds in the sky over the Parliament Buildings - most likely attracted by the lights. It presented a unique scene.
Amazing Building. Even if not going inside this is a must visit site just to wander round the outside and soak up the atmosphere.
Not to Miss. If you are in Budapest you will not miss this - a nice walking tour is wonderful in the day or night.

Magnificent . Unfortunately access to the parliament building requires prior arrangement but it is a quite magnificent building which is best viewed either from the river or from across the Danube on the Buda side of Budapest.

well laid out with classic architecture .With imposing lions on the entrance its close to Metro station o. close to the bank of Danube .The buildings are classical .you can walk along the bank and see the famous Jews shoes an art installation to recapture the grim moment of the WW2 when Hungarians jews jumped into Danube being shot by Nazis .

beautiful building. Amazing building by day or night. When it is illuminated at night it is breath taking.Be sure to visit the two underground presentations about the revolution, at the back of the building in the square.

Well worth a visit. We booked pre-online the day before as there are limited time slots for the tours by language each day. You must have the ticket printed out at the Parliament visitors center before the tour starts. The tour is a quick, very well run hour which gives a good snapshot of this stunning building and the workings life of the Parliament. The exhibition room at the end of the tour is well worth spending a little extra time in as there are excellent displays of the more refined details of the building, its architects, architecture and materials.
Architecture at it's best. Don't forget to go round the back of the Parliament and explore the gardens and unique statues that surround the building

Just as beautiful in the inside!. I have been to Budapest a couple of times, but have never taken the time to visit the inside of the Parliament Building. I am so glad I was able to this past trip...so worth it! Beautiful interior and the history behind some of the rooms! The "crown jewels" are on display and if you are lucky you will see the changing of the guards to stand "guard" over them!

Not just Politics. The structure is a gem architecturally and at night is one of the most beautiful sites you will see in Budapest. The huge, symmetrical building with the dome in the center located on the Danube is the office of the Prime Minister and the national Assembly and worth taking a look inside. We took a 1 hr. tour in September and could have taken one late morning or late afternoon. The tour guide was very informative. We were also able to see the changing of the guard inside where the Holy Crown of Hungary is kept. This crown was brought to the United States after being recovered in Austria in 1945 by the U.S. 86th Infantry Division and not returned till President Jimmy Carter authorized it in 1978. Outside this building is where the Hungarian Revolt began in 1956.
Great place . Very impressive place - really magical at night and all lit up - good place to visit and see what it's all about. The architecture is great as is most of the buildings around Budapest.

Wow!. Sadly when we arrived there was no tours in the parliament so we spent some time taking pictures of the building itself from outside and we walked around enjoying the view. I really recommend just chilling on one the benches there and enjoy the view!!

A magnificent and spectacular building. The Parliament building is a magnificent and spectacular building. We first saw it from on the river and then from across the river. When we arrived at the Parliament building we walked the grounds. We did not go inside. We saw soldiers on guard. We got to see a changing of the guard. The building is featured on TV ads for riverboat cruises. It makes a spectacular backdrop for the ads. Viewing it from the fishing bastion at night is worth seeing. Its looks spectacular with the many lights lit up. It was well worth taking the time to visit. It’s a great backdrop for photos.
Great building. One of the top places to see in Budapest. Try to book a tour of the place during the day in advance. Cross the river and take a picture at night, amazing
Huge and beautiful building!. Breathtaking architecture you have to visit it at least on evening for a walk. Near tram station easily accessible

Gorgeous building inside and out - a must see. Parliament is one of, if not, THE gem of Budapest! A truly unique structure. Definitely do a tour to enjoy the inside beauty which matches the exterior radiance.

Golden. I bought tickets online. This saves you queuing but there was hardly a line when we arrived so it would not have been a problem that day. They are very orderly about timing the tours so don't get in line for the wrong tour ! Beautiful building with so much gold everywhere - very stately. Guide spoke good English.

Budapest. Nice place to visit in the capital of Hungary.
Famos building with a great history.
Must to vizit if you are in Budapest. Near the Danube each part of day have an other colour.

Parliament . Beautiful building. The detail is just amazing and the building is huge. We didn't enter but we had a walk round and managed to see the changing of the guards which was nice as there was a band playing

Breathtaking... We took the English tour. Very short. Worth it. A little confusing when you enter the visiting center. Make sure you have ticket in hand, and walk in about 10 min before. It will be crowded--easy to figure out.
Must to visit. It is must to visit this amazing building , me and my wife - we visit the attraction and were surprised from the huge building .

A must if you are visiting Budapest. This is a very impressive building both inside and out. Its position is also impressive on the banks of the Danube. It has been restored well after the stonework started to crumble. It is well worth taking a tour of this building which can be booked online to save queuing. On the tour the extraordinary history is explained from the first King (St Stephen) to present day (No longer a House of Lords). In the central dome area, which is heavily guarded, the gold crown worn by the kings and one queen can be viewed.It is also well worth doing a boat trip at night to see this building and many others splendidly lit up.
Great night views. Aw man! What a beautiful site to see, especially at night. You have to see that great piece of art while in Budapest
Trip up the Danube. We say this building only from our boat but would go again to Budapest and visit this building. It looked lovely.

nice place to see. nice place to visit. when you are an EU member you can get a free tour. You have to be at entrance X before 11 am show your ID or passport and get a free tour in different kind of languages trough the parlement with it nice jewels and marmer stairs inside.

Anmazing splendor but not cheap tours. This seems to be a popular tour, so it was packed all day long. You do need to book it in advance, but we were able to get same day tours. It is very expensive by Hungarian cost standards, about $20 US per person. Even though the tour is short at about 45 minutes, I would still recommend it just to see the interior. I thought taking a tour at the end of day felt less crowded. There is an enormous gift shop for those who like to bring home gifts and souvenirs.

Modeled on Westminster with a bit of St Paul's thrown in!. This magnificent building day and particularly at night is one of Budapest famous landmarks.We didn't get to see inside but just walking around it was a treat in itself. A wonderful piece of architecture.

Impressive Political Center. The tour through the Parliament was interesting and showed the magnificent restoration. Interesting to see the old ash trays where politicians of old ground out laws while chomping on cigars. Crown Jewels are housed in beautiful rotunda. Guards rotate regularly and fun to watch the change. No photos allowed there but rest of facility provided ample photo opportunities. Gift shop had a lot of beautiful Hungarian crafts.

Stunning architecture. The exterior of the Parliament is simply incredible - especially when seen from the river by night. The sunken visitor centre was also a nice touch so not to detract from the old buildings in and around the square.Unfortunately, there could have been more English speaking tour times, given it seemed this was the most popular option.

Probably the nicest parliament building in Europe!. This building is spectacular! I first saw it from the fishing bastion at night when it was lit up and it looked amazing. The next morning we walked over to the other side to see it up close and it was even more impressive. Really worth seeing from afar and up close. You can't miss this in Budapest.

Worth the effort of visiting!. We are just back from Budapest and could see the Parliament Building from our hotel - so could not wait to explore it. There are ONLY guided tours available, so check when the language that suits you is available. We walked to the building fairly early and bought tickets for the English tour which was later in the afternoon. Cost us HUF 2,200 each which we thought was cheap for an iconic building. The inside is absolutely stunning! Based on the design of our own Parliament building in London, it is gilt covered and opulent and contains the holy crown on Hungary (which is the only place you cannot take photos). There are a few steps to manage, but our party included two wheelchair users who were taken via lift - so don't be put off. The building is as impressive inside as out.

The best in Budapest. If you want to see the best view you must see it from the river (from a boat), the view is breathtaking. The lights and its reflection in the river would leave you speechless.After getting off the boat I went there for a closer look and walked all around and I was amazed to see the detailed work on the building !A must-visit site.
Nice to see. Nice buildings along the Danube river. It reminded me a bit of the London parliament where the design was based upon.
Amazing from river view. It is really amazing building from front facade. You enjoy the view from many places in Budapest and you can really call it dominant of the city.

Stunning views at Night time! . This amazing building looks incredible from the river side (Danube). I would recommend a stroll at night time to view this beautiful sight and not to be missed off your Budapest Trip!
Swindon visiting.. Wow, what is the most beautiful building my wife and I have ever have seen in our lives, walked all the way around the parliament shrine. Fabulous.
Nice building. It's right off the downtown metro station so hard to miss. A really well constructed and large building.

Beautiful restoration. Too bad not all rooms are being used. Lucky that the European Union lent the money for the restoration. Hungary is still very economically challenged. Beautiful building near the river and the Chain Bridge. Pay extra and you can go inside.
Be sure to book in advance. This is a very impressive building and while the tour only lasted about 40 minutes it was excellent.

Beautiful inside and out day or night. A must see in Budapest. Take the tour. The building at night from the river or Buda side is breathtaking. Make sure you are visit the 1956 Memorial and the shoes on the Danube.

Amazing!. If you are in Budapest, you must visit the Parliament building and take a tour of the spectacular interior (included with your entry fee). This building is incredible, and massive, a masterpiece of craftsmanship. Also, the small museum provides an overview of the governmental system in Hungary, including the major events during the communist years.
Beautiful. Beautiful place and spectacular architecture. The national memorial, lodged in an underground area within the square is very moving.

Great short activity but very expensive if non-EU citizen. Beautiful building inside and out. Definitely worth the short 40min guided tour. My only gripe was the cost difference being so great between EU and non-EU citizens, DOUBLE the price so we paid over $50nzd for two for 40min. (I am the former actually but didn't have my passport on me so make sure you take your proof along with you and save some cash!).

Beautiful building with the light at night!. I love how they turn on the lights to show the beauty of the building. I went with mom on the tram on both sides of the river. It was wonderful and grand. Highly recommend also to see inside during the day time.

Wonderful structure along Danube River. We have viewed this wonderful parliament building during our river cruise in day time and explored the same site on foot at night time. This neo-gothic structure along Danube River was the landmark of Budapest and should not be missed. Surprisingly during our stroll along the river at night, we found that there were birds flying above the parliament building. They just circled around the area and did not fly away and later learnt that they were migratory herons passing by the region from the north during these few weeks and we were lucky to view this sight. Recommend to others while visiting Budapest.

A must-do when visiting Budapest. This is an absolutely incredible building with an incredible history. A short tour but filled with information and all the necessary highlights. Recommend that you purchase your tickets in advance on-line to avoid disappointment. The tour groups are limited in size and in numbers of tours they do every day. Bring your phone/electronic device with the emailed veirification of the ticket purchase to the information area at the reception desk in the Visitors Centre beside the Parliament Building and you get your tickets there. Arrive at least 1/2 hour before the time of your tour. A little confusing going through security before the tour starts but not a deal-breaker.

Absolutely beautiful . Parliament is absolutely beautiful, it is a must see, we booked city tour and parliament, you see pretty much everything on a few hours, which gave us more time to just relax and visit things twice if we wanted.

Wonderful Building. Visited the parliament building, magnificent architecture. Wasn't able to make the tour unfortunately. Don't miss the October 1956 memorial to the left of the parliament building. Very thought provoking and tasteful memorial to all those who lost their lives to the brutality of the communist regime.

Worth seeing the inside. We approached Budapest boat from Szentendre and the sight of the parliament building under Margit Bridge glinting in the low evening sunlight was absolutely stunning. In fact the view of the parliament from the river or the opposite bank at any time of day is fantastic (it is lit up at night too).We also decided to take a tour of the inside. That was most definitely worth it. You only get to see a few rooms and staircases but you get a good impression. It is ridiculously ornate, not the sort of place I would like to work in but fascinating to see and you’ll see the crown jewels. And as long as you’re (still!) an EU citizen it’s cheaper too,
Stunning!. Stunning archetecture from the Danube. Worth the visit. Large and impressive-bring your camera! If you can see it at night, it is spectacular!

A top sight. Looking across Chain bridge at the Neo Gothic styled vast Parliament is really an amazing sight. Do focus on the 96 m high dome , beneath which is a display of the Holy Crown , the orb and sceptre. We Participated in the noon English language tour of the Parliament by producing our e tickets bought online from Jegymester. During the tour, we saw the red carpetted main staircase, the coronation jewels in the Dome Hall, Session Hall, Great Vaulted Hall. An eye opener. After that we went to visit the grounds and took photos.
Amazing to see. Most enjoyable view was from river cruise included with bus tour. Day view is excellent and lighted by night.
Beatifull . Great and interesting tour. Very educational and the parliament looks amazing inside. Try not to miss
Great building!. Nicely located on the Danube river. A very beautiful building. I recomend to visit during the night. Great view!
Beautiful palace . Me and my wife enjoyed the 45 minutes tour in the parlament building. The place has amazing architecture and beautiful interior. Worth visit

Worth visiting. We booked our tickets in advance and enjoyed the half hour tour. It was quite insightful. The parliament is stunning, inside as well. Shame only a few rooms were shown. However it's still worth it
parliament trip. Walked around and did the boat trip looks lovely all lit up. Stunning building and well looked after

Opulent. The interior of the Parliament building is jaw-droppingly opulent. The tour shows the art and design of the building and its treasures, and is not at all about Hungarian government. Tours are quick -- around an hour -- and should be booked ahead of time on the website. (Morning is probably better than afternoon. I missed a tour of the opera house because I didn't coordinate well). There are a lot of stairs on the tour, but there is an elevator if you ask for it. There are two museum components. One is about history and can be seen either before or after the tour with an audio guide. The other is about the building, is self-guided, and is only accessible after the tour. You can spend as long as you want in the museums. The Parliament gift shop is surprisingly very good and well-priced for Hungarian souvenirs of all sorts.

Nice tour of one of Hungary's most famous buildings. Right on the Danube, the Parliament building is one of the most visited attractions in Budapest. The tour of the building is nice, though, not very long (~30-40 minutes). Entrance to the building can only be done on guided tours. Guided tours are offered in many different languages though the times for specific languages do not appear to be consistent from day to day, therefore, I would suggest arriving early in the day to see what the options are. Tickets can be ordered in advance online, however, the times listed on the website did not match the actual times shown in the visitors center. Ticket prices depend on your nationality. EU citizens pay half that of non-EU citizens. As mentioned above, the tour is not particularly long though you do get to see one of the main hallways, the main entrance stairway, the central dome and parliament chambers. At each location, the guide provides some relevant information. Overall, I would recommend the building and tour to those interested in government, history and architecture.

One of the important place to visit in Budapest. Nice picturesque place with great artifacts, which is just beside Danube river. Try to visit around 6-7 PM, so as to enjoy more.Easy to approach either through Metro or even Tram.
Photographers dream by day and especially at night. I have not been inside this building but love photographing it even if its just on a mobile phone especially at night..

Such a beautiful building!. This building is beautiful on the inside and out. Ur only problem was getting to it. The buses won't park near it, so we had about an 8-10 block walk on a hot day. Interesting history and there is a wonderful model of it downstairs of it in construction.

Stunning - not to be missed!. If you can do only one thing in Budapest, ensure you take the tour of the Parliament. The exterior is stunning, but the interior is breath-taking. There is such gorgeous detail everywhere. It's unfortunate the tour is only 45 minutes long as I could have spent much more time soaking in the beauty. As there are so many tour groups going through each day, they do rush you through. But better to be rushed than not to have seen it. Highly recommended.

Fantastic! You MUST take the tour!. This was one of the best things we did while in Budapest. I loved seeing the inside, hearing the history and also learning of the construction of this fabulous structure. If you take the tour you will see a cut-away model that shows how much of that magnificent dome is actually hollow! A must-do while in Budapest!
Must see it. I think this building is the most beautiful Parliament in Europe. It has interesting history, near to the Danube and its architect is unbelievably beautiful and unique.
Majestic. A must see. Early booking has to be done due lot of demand for the entrance. One of the most beautiful Parlament buildings in the World.

Grand, grand, grand!. The most magnificent structure in the city, the Hungarian Parliament Building is a sight to behold at night aboard a dinner cruise along the Danube River. The inside is even more magnificent with its ornate decor.
Beautiful. Beautiful and very well served by the english speaking guide who also offered the option of using the lift for those who could not climb the 133 steps. Highly recommend a visit.

Post card Budapest. the bigest and beautiful building in Hungary.Located the bank of the Danube river buit a fusion of architectural styles predominating neo gothic revival as well as the London.it has 27 entries and 700 rooms and officers.Guided tours can be purchased next to one of the entrances and take abaout 45 minutes.The most important point is the central room with dome where is keeped the crown of the first Hungarian king Saint Stephen.The internal decoration is full of details in paintings in gold marble and granite.

Must see . The Parliament is a focal point of Budapest. It's something you must see both during the day and at night. The view from the river is breathtaking at night and worth a walk across either bridge to see it from the Buda side. It's something you won't soon forget.

Parliament Budapest. lovely buildings. A bit of info about the Hungarian Revolution Oct 23 - 10 Nov 1956. Very close to City Centre and River Danube. The visitors' centre has loads of historical information about Hungary History. A must if one has interest in History and background info.
Impressive in size. Really Impressive in size building!! One of the best landmarks in Budapest! Impressive building during day or night time.

Interesting . Short tour of Parliament buildings. Reasonably priced. We booked online and paid before we went. Make sure you are in the correct language tour as they do several tours all different languages

Beautiful building with interesting history. This building is the one that you always seem to see in pictures of Budapest, right on the riverfront with its grand facade and dome it is now emblematic of the city. It is based on the British Parliament building and retains some of that history - there are two debating chambers, one each for the Commons and the Lords. Since Hungary now only needs one chamber, however, the Lords section is no longer needed politically so is used for this tour. The general impression is that this building is much grander and more opulent than its British counterpart (I speak as a Brit).There can be a bit of a wait to get in. Different languages each have their own tour which follow each other around. If yours is the last to get in then you must wait while the others go through the airport-type security checks first. Fair enough I think, this is the Hungarian seat of government after all. Our tour guide was knowledgeable and helpful so everything was explained as we went round.You will get to see the magnificent main staircase, the dome (where the 'crown jewels' are kept), the Lords' lounges and their debating chamber. You can take photographs anywhere except the crown jewels - the light levels around them needs to be controlled carefully. There is an exhibition on the architecture and history of the building as you leave so you should allow about two hours for the whole visit.In summary an interesting visit to make inside this beautiful building, but I'd advise against taking very young children - they would find the initial security a bit worrying and rest of the visit boring. For older children, teens and adults, however, there is plenty of interesting stuff to see.
Spectacular to see. This building has incredible history and is most impressive. The main hall and spire leaves you in awe of the beauty. The architecture is amazing.
Wowzers. Stunning building, Very breathtaking, lovely to walk around it. Did not get inside it as we were strapped for time.
Beautiful and historic. Beautiful from all angles and is stunning when viewed from the Buda Castle Heights. Sits upon the Danube and is a must see.

Parliment tour good, but too short.. What a magnificent building. Our guided tour was a quick whizz through. We would have loved more time to look at all the detail. Interesting multi media display on the history of the building near the exit, unfortunately we only had a few minutes allocated by our guide, so only got to see a fraction of the display. I suggest choosing a tour that is more than 45 minutes, or one that gives you access to the parliament, at the end of the tour.

Beautiful architecture. We took for a tour of the interior of the building and were very pleased with both the building and the information provided by Ilona, our guide.We enjoyed her sense of humour in presenting historical information.Sept 2016
What a beautiful building!. This place is amazing at night, and in the daylight! Do not miss this sight, it is a breathtaking backdrop!

It's Pretty Grand. We didn't think that it was worth paying the money for the tour of parliament. The building whilst impressive it is new. I prefer my historic buildings with a little more history. This was only completed in 1904 and offers some wonderful photo opportunity but that was as about interested as we were in the building. If you have an interest in politics of the country through I can't see any reason a tour would not be for you.
Worth the visit. We went to the booking office and managed to get into a tour about 1 hour later. Very good management of visitors, showing the opulence of a past era.
Stunning . We were on the Danube night cruise. The view of the parliament at night was stunning. Worth to visit.
Visit. Only 2 inconveniences, 1 the ticket you can only buy it online and 2 is always full so too many people many groups at the same time.The Parliament building is beautiful inside and outside.
Splendid. The building is located on the Pest side and gives a magnificent view during night, if you take the cruise. The lighting enhances the beauty of the architecture.

Most Beautiful Building In The World .. If you only visit one building in Budapest , make it the Parliament , probably the most beautiful building in the world !Go inside and discover the history ( happy and sad ) of this very proud nation , the highlight of the excellent guided tour , which is available in many languages is being able to see the Crown Jewels, very emotional.Don't forget to see it at night on a boat trip and see it transformed into a magical golden palace , you will not be disappointed!

Weekend break . Me and my boyfriend turned up and early in the morning to pre buy our tickets. I would suggest you pre book if you can or get there early. Tickets usually sell out by 11, everything in Budapest is fairly cheap and this is no different... you get a group tour on your allocated time which lasts around 45 minutes. There is a few things to do in the area while you wait for your time slot. The tour guide was friendly and very knowledgeable of the parliament building and history. The building is very impressive and worth the wait for the tour
Must see in Budapest. A spectacular building along the beautiful Danube River. An absolute must if you are visiting Budapest.
Beautiful inside and out. The exterior is stunning but the interior is literally awesome. The gold finishes are unreal. Check the window sills for the cigar trays.
Wow!. Fantastic building in heart of Budapest. Beautiful at any time of the day and especially in the evening at sunset.

Interesting tour. On our fourth visit to Budapest, we were recommended to take a tour of Parliament, rather than just viewing it from the outside. We turned up relativity early one morning and joined the queue to buy tickets for the next English speaking tour. Unfortunately it was very popular and booked out while we were queuing so we had to book onto the next, which was in the early afternoon. It was definitely worth the wait, as the building is very impressive from the inside and we were talked through a lot of useful information about the building and Hungary's politics.There is a lift which those less mobile are able to use, but otherwise quite an easy walk around a spectacular building.Advice - either pre-book online or turn up early for tickets!
Beautiful Building - lucky to go inside. This is a stunning building and on the day we visited we were able to go inside. Really interesting.

The most impressive Parliament Building I have seen. The building sits on the edge of the Danube River on the Pest side of the river. The building itself is amazing and I cannot recall seeing a more impressive parliament building. During the evening, many of Budapest's buildings are lit up and the parliament building is no exception. We did not manage to take a tour of the building (which I believe you can), but I am told that it is magnificent on the inside as well. Just gazing on the building from across the river or from Castle Hill cannot be avoided.

Excellent to visit day or night. Great historic building with many photo opportunities, daytime as well as all light up at night. It also has much historical significance. There is also a museum/memorial to 1968 uprising and the people who fought and did not survive.
Amazing! . Didn't go inside but the outside is stupendous. Absolutely breathtaking. Both in beauty of architecture and amazement at how it was built

one of the most impressive buildings in Europe. The parliament in Budapest is just stunning and so impressive. I have seen a lot of pictures before travelling to Budapest but I was overwhelmed when I got there. At first we went to the main square (not the river side) and it was already very nice but when we saw it from the other side of the river I couldn´t stop taking pictures. For me it´s one of the most impressive buildings in Europe.
Interesting but rushed. What we saw in the Parliament was interesting and a couple of areas were really beautiful but I felt it was rushed.
stunning building!!. seeing this building from the river is a must do!! it is amazing and you can just feel the history pouring off of it!
impressive duilding. From the out side of the duilding , it's A very impressive duilding, especially from the river side, both day and night
Awesome!. The Parliament Building is a must-see, even if it is just a walk-pass. The exterior architecture is simply awesome!
A must visit. The building from outside is more than amazing, we booked tickets for the inside tour, the place is pure history, it's amazing and for sure worth the visit.
Impressive building. Must see in Budapest, the architecture is impressive. Had the chance to watch it also from the Danube, while cruising, and it is definitely worth it.

Opens your eyes to what happened during the failed revolution. This is a striking and stately place.
You can get a feel for the action from the revolution against the communists by seeing the bullet holes in the buildings
Wow!. Fantastic experience. Take your passport for EU reduction. (For as long as it lasts) nice English guide, cute sense of humour.
great. Its worth to see it, beautiful architecture, great view in the night, great surrounding, just perfect
Parliament. Parliament of Budapest is impressive and huge. We had a boat trip so we had the best fotoshoots of this building from all the ankles. Must see if you ar visiting this town

Not much special to say: Its beautiful in day and night,. Assumingly the most taken picture motive I think there is not so much additional to say.
Just make sure you get it during day and night time - really worth it.

Parliament: a notable gothic revival style. The Parliament of Budapest, one of Europe's oldest legislative buildings, is the seat of the National Assembly of Hungary. It lies on the bank of Danube and is known as the largest building in Hungary and also the tallest building in Budapeste.Although a visitor must climb more than one hundred steps to arrive at its luxurious halls and rooms, frescoes, sculptures and paintings, the climbing is worth the effort.
Night seen . Didn't go inside just from outside and it's fabulous especially at night time. Taking a boot would he an option too , to see it but we just walked next to it .

A beautiful sight and amazing architecture. Best viewed from the Buda side or form the Danube at night when all lit up. An amazing building and recently fully restored on the outside. No visit is complete without glaring at the structure.

Most impressive building i have ever seen!!. The view of this building is breath-taking, no matter from where you are looking at it. From close distance, from the Buda Hill or even from the Danube during a river cruise!!!
Beautiful. Beautiful building, beautiful view, easy enough to access. Fabulous stone work, amazing to see lit up at night.

second time around. This is one not too miss , did not manage to get in last time, so glad to have managed this time, suggest you book before you get to Budapest, 2000 Forints only if you are an EU member . Wonderful place , guides are good , all wear a headset so can hear no matter where you are in the group. Free museum after the tour.

Trying my best to leave my bias behind :-). As a spot for tourism, it is very pretty and catchy outdoor and indoors as well, i do recommend to make a visit here (you cant just walk in, u need a guided tour)! As a Hungarian im not too proud whats going inside :-)

Definitely the coolest building in Budapest. There is two sides of viewing this building - You can go there during the day, but then You will get less impression than coming there in the evening. Actually I am not the biggest fan of the old buildings and etc, but this one makes You speechless.
