Spectacular and Extravagent. The tour of Parliament House is not to be missed. Had to book a day early as the place was booked out.The splendour and amount of gold has to be seen to be believed.
Beautiful view. Phenomenal view and the building is so impressive. The ticket is not so expensive, but they don't show so many things for the guests.

Worth a complete tour of the outside. Copied on the Parliament building of the UK, this Gothic building has artistic stonework to admire along with many soaring towers and a central dome. It's also beautifully white as if newly cleaned, like many other monuments in Budapest. Probably because many had to be rebuilt/repaired after the war.
At night it's amazingly lit.
Great building . Really nice building to walk around. Visited on a Sunday but it was closed..some concert was being set up as we arrived. Right next to Danube so an easy must see
what a view!!!!. by far the prettiest looking parliament building i' ve ever seen. From the opposite side of the river a true eye catcher

Ok, but ....number 1 of things to do in Budapest??. Is ok to visit but if you have one or 2 days to visit Budapest, prioritize castle neighbourhood.
Impressive building with more than 350 towers, it is said that Fredy Mercure wanted to buy it after knowing it. Majestic building over Danube shore.

an amazing building. This is an amazing building, making the landscape unique together with the Danube river.
To me one of the best attractions of the city.
The Parliement Building. A huge piece of art.Shows the Hungarian culture and construction quality.Everybody should go and visit.

Magnificent!. This is one of the most beautiful buildings I have seen in my life (and I do have been to many places). To my opinion, this is the #1 place one needs to visit once in Budapest. Enough said :-)

Nice walk. Something nice to do for free in the City
We enjoyed a nice walk around (working off all the food)
There are much more entertaining places to visit in the city but this should be on the list
Hauntingly beutiful. GO see this at night, from a boat. Bring a good camera with lots of light sensitivity. The best part is capturing the birds flying above the dome.

Parliament tour. The tour of the parliament is interesting but the headsets did not always work and had lots of background noise. It's also very hot inside. It's beautiful outside and the view from the river at night is spectacular

A totally impressive building in the day and night. Going on a beateau mouche at night the views of the parliament were stunning looming our the dark into the orange lights. The sight by day is also impressive a must see in Budapest

An icon to visit. The Parliament of Budapest is one of the earliest governing institutions in Europe.
It has an amazingly beautiful architecture, rivaled by very few buildings in the world.
Its inner area can be visited only by groups, but even from the outside it is a feast for the eyes.
Highly recommended

A 50th birthday 4 day visit. This is a fantastic building day and night but oh when it is lit up and you cruise past it on the river cruise and the seagulls are flying above it and even they light up in the sky - beautiful

Dont book through bus companies. I found the tour very insightful and amazing that you can actually enter areas where voting takes place.
If you want to go, go early and buy at the venue on the day. The bus companies sell tickets but dont trust them. Tickets are around 2000-3000huf, bus companies were trying to get 7000huf out of people.
Mind-blowingly good architecture. We didn't feel the need to go inside but these are beautiful buildings, worth a visit to on your trip to Budapest.

Love this building. We stayed in an Airbnb across the Danube from the parliament. Waking up to this view is magical. We went to visit the inside once, it is as fancy as any palace I have seen. The visitor center is disorganized though. We almost missed our tour due to very long lines, despite we bought tickets in advance. Tickets are sold out way in advance as well. I recommend you by tickets a week in advance and go there half an hour before your scheduled time.

Do the tour.. Do the tour of the parliament, its wonderful. The tour is short so not too tiring and it's really worth seeing the inside of this lovely building. Take your photos quickly, as one is rushed along.
Beautiful place, long waiting lines. The area is very beautiful. The inside of the parliament is very nice too but the tour is quite short and in large groups so you really cannot enjoy it.
Impressive building. The Budapest Parliament is an impressive building for it's size, style and placement. I think it's a "must see" when in Budapest.
Really stunning!. What a stunning building! It's lit up at night. You get a great view from all over the city. I'd recommend a evening cruise along the danube for the best view!
Guided tour. You don't actually see a lot of the building but what you do see is well worth going for. Make sure that you book in advance if you want the English tour.

Fantastic place to be . It is very old nice bulding abselutley nice frescoes it is free only 1 day in year which is revelation day in hungary and it is national holiday , fab in night time too bright and unbelievable ;

The tour is a bit of a let down. The building is beautiful and set in a calm and clean square beside the river. The effort we had to go to to ensure we had tickets was a bit ridiculous and in hindsight not necessarily worth it. Buying them online 2 days before and having to find an Internet cafe to print the tickets only for the tour to last around 40 minutes. This was at the top of my list on our trip to Budapest but there is much more enjoyable things to do besides visiting parliament. I felt the tours were just churned out one after the other and the information provided no great depth. It was too scripted.
Beautiful building, also in the evening. The building is really nice, especially nighttime when it is lit up. The best view is from the other side of the river. We did not go inside.

Beautiful place. We stayed right across the street from the Parliament and just loved the view. We walked to see the building and it was rainy which kept the crowds away. Loved how beautiful the building is.

Superb. A must visit if only to experience the fabulous interior. Rich and opulent with fantastic craftsmanship in wood and stone. The guide was very knowledgeable, friendly and the information was relevant. There is a lift to the top floor for those that cannot manage the 130+ steps.
the highlight. seeing the parliament building from the Danube and at night was probably the best sight in Budapest. the square in front of it gives the building something special.

Impressive in size, design and an amazing interior.. First let me say that this is an excellent place to visit but make your reservations in advance. We had to settle on a 4:30PM start time. The fee is high for non-EU citizens but worth the price. The halls are spectacular and the history lesson enthralling. There is pomp throughout the tour. We were very happy we persisted and took the tour.
Nice building. You must go there at night , the lights make special atmosphere of these huge building. It is located close to the river, in very big area

Impressive. . This place is incredible. Very lavish, very flamboyant. The Parliament is symmetrical with one side for official business the other for visitors and a backup when the other side isn't operational. Good tour with the typical Hungarian sarcastic humour. The tour however was only 45 mins long. Remember to print your ticket which I forgot to.
Big building. A very big and beautiful building. I only visited outside. Not sure if you could visit inside. The details of the structure are incredible. Perfect for pictures 😋

Stunning. Both the interior and exterior are stunning. We joined the parliament tour for roughly USD 20 per adult. The English tour was exactly one hour. It's a bit rush as we are not allowed to stay behind while the tour guide was speaking. Not much time for photos taking as well, so be quick. The English of the tour guide wasn't that easy to understand, but it's still fine. Compared to architecture in many other European cities, you might not find this the most elaborate, but it's still worth a visit if you ever go to Budapest.
Unforgettable experience. It should be your number 1 "Must See" on the list of places to visit in Budapest. Even if you don't have a list.

A stunning sight . We only saw this magnificent building from the outside. I'd read it was based on the London Houses of Parliament but with extra domes and towers. It's a lovely honey stone colour and most impressive by the Danube. It's illuminated at night and so are the birds that fly above the dome. It certainly is an impressive sight.

This building is absolutey amazing. Its a must visit - we only looked on the outside as the building is so huge and impressive - we didn't go inside as it was early evening - its even better lit up at night on a river cruise

Beautiful!. One of the best landmarks in Budapest! I recommend going there twice if you have the time, once in the morning to take some good pictures and once at night. At night the lights are more than stunning and the building looks amazing! You can also enter inside to see the royal crown but you have to pay for the guided tour. Don't miss this.
beautiful tour. book the tour online well in advance. Tickets sell out quickly. Price for EU residents = 6 euro pp.Definitely worth it !

See inside and from outside for the complete picture. Pretty impressive from outside and more so from inside. There are group tours in several languages, but you MUST book online before you arrive. Completely over the top decor wise. As with other buildings in Budapest, well lit at night and visible from the river, so view at night and during the day, and definitely take the tour.PS the security guards are a little soviet era in their attitudes. And dont go near the ones with the drawn sabres guarding the crown jewels ! PPS a little amazing that this was built at a time and occupied by parliament during a time when there was very little democratic in Hungary
Great luxury decorations. A breath-taking experience. The building has been recently completely restored and the guided visits are very well organized.A thing of beauty!

So much gold.. . Beautiful exteriors and even more fascinating interiors. Very interactive museum exhibits, we could take a picture inside and it was sent to us over email. We also saw the Parliament guards parade in the afternoon at about 1pm. In the night it was beautifully lit up and one could see bats flying above it. The guided tour is good. It gives you an insight on the history of the Parliament and if you have read any of it you can put it into perspective. Also you must take the tour inside to see the architecture and the beautiful art inside. My favorite were the cigar stands outside the halls. What innovation, comfort and luxury!

Must see. Spend at least a week exploring one of the most beautiful cities in the world! The Parliament building is the second largest (England has the largest) and awesomely pretty at all times of day and in any weather. It's very tastefully lit at night to show every detail, spire and gargoyle, (hundreds of birds circling above, probably eating bugs attracted by the lights). Truly an incredible sight, but then it's beautiful in the daylight as well. Sunset gives its white stone a pinkish cast (or reds or orange depending on the colors of the sunset). My favorite pictures are just before dawn with the pink and deep violet sky behind the silhouette of its spires and main dome. Take time to make reservations for a tour in your choice of language. Also beautiful and interesting. Go into the meeting halls (if parliament is not in session). See King/Saint Steven's crown and other ceremonial jewels and garb. Don't miss the brass cigar holders with numbers so members can park their unfinished stogies when they have to go back in session (probably not used with the current smoking laws).

Beautiful. Be sure to book your preferred language tour early (you can do it online) as they sell out quick - interiors are lovely and guide will walk you through the building for 45 minutes. Exterior views are amazing whether during day or night. Definitely a must see when in Budapest.

New Park, new Hungary. What a big change, beautiful clean monuments, a place to walk, a place to talk, and all along the Danube River. This is why Budapest is so popular among tourists, the city is still Hungarian, with little parks, local run stores, great food, and now when visiting the parliament it is nothing short of spectacular inside and out! A must visit stop for all tourists and locals alike
Interesting!. This was my first visit to any such place. I was excited to see a parliament from inside and the visit was worth it.

Awesome Architecture. I had the opportunity to view the Parliament Building at different times of the day from afar and near. It is such an amazing structure from every angle both day and night. In the afternoon towards the evening time frame it is best to view it from across the river up in the Castle area. Up close, I suggest going there early in the morning where it is not crowded. There is a nice breakfast place just outside of the subway station and you can admire the building while enjoying your coffee. I could not leave my breakfast table when I realized that there was a flag raising ceremony right in front of the Parliament. It was a short ceremony. As I did not have any advance reservation to enter the building, I just browse through their gift shop as they have books relating to the building. Going back to the subway, take the next stop crossing the river and when you get out you are right across the Parliament building, however, since it was early morning, it was not a good picture taking opportunity. (Tip: you can take the tram going south that passes by to take you to the foot of the funicular that takes you up the Castle/st Mathias church - or walk).

Stunning Building. This is a gorgeous building on the Pest side of Budapest—perfectly situated to take a million photos! We took an English tour of the interior, which I'm not sure I'd recommend. We bought our tickets the day of, which was a mistake. You can (and should) buy them in advance, especially on a rainy day. We waited in a very long, slightly disorganized line for over an hour to purchase tickets for later that afternoon. I will also point out that they kindly show the number of ticket available in each time tour slot. But in reality this serves only to make you anxious as you watch the number of tickets in your desired tour group language and/or time disappear. When we returned, the tour started promptly. We were walked through a total of four rooms and a stairway. You start by climbing up the gold-plated stairway, very cool,—then see the entrance main stairway before being led into the Dome room, where the crown of St. Stephen is housed. There are strangely no photos allowed in here. Then you see the press lobby and the upper house. The tour doesn't take long, but the guide was fairly informative. It was a good rainy-day activity for us while we visited Budapest, but I think most people would be just as happy with photos of the outside of the building. Also, we happened to catch the changing of the guard outside at noon, which was very cute.

Most beautiful parliament in europe, perhaps the world. One of the most astonishing building I have ever seen. Perfect to visit on a sunny day, the light stones almost seem to light up. A full view is best from Buda, a make sure you book tickets in advance if you want to enter the building.
Stunning architecture!. Just the sheer size of the building left me breathless. The architecture is amazing! I recommend visiting it in the evening - the view is incredible!

Beautiful Building. Was really nice to see the building in real life, I had always seen it on television and in pictures and even that doesn't do it justice. Saw it first on the Budapest Party Boat at night, it's so amazing at night when it's lit up.
Beautiful. Grand building. Would recommend taking the guided tour which gives a glimpse into few of the rooms as well as delves into the history

Spectacular. This building is spectacular and is a must see destination in Budapest. You must see it in the daylight and definitely in the night when it is lit up. To see it lit up the best view is either from a river cruise or on the opposite bank on the side of Buda.

Beautiful building, a highlight of budapest. The tour lasts about 45 minutes and is excellent. The interior is stunning and well worth a visit. If you want an English tour it is best to book a few days in advance.
Impressive. Really impressive architecture, different views at day and night - it's worth more than one visit at different times.

Amazing every time. I have passed the parliament building endless times on my trips to Budapest and it never disappoints, every time it's just as breath taking. I would recommend paying for the tour of the building as it isn't too expensive and is very interesting, you get to see Hungarys Crown Jewels. The tours get busy in the afternoon so it is worth getting there early to book and then returning later as there are a lot of other things to see in the area whilst you wait. There are lots of little cafes around the parliament building and it isn't too far a walk to Margaret island from here which is also well worth a look and a good stop for lunch.

Parliament. Very impressive building by the side of the Danube. At nighttime when the floodlights come on it is areal gem. The building is situated on the pest side of the city. A nice walk in the evening, is to cross the Chain bridge and walk along the Buda side to admire it across the river. We did, and it was worth the excellent pictures we took at night. Definitely a must see in the city.

Very impressive building. I found the Parliament building to be very interesting from an architectural point of view. It has similar features to the Reichstag in Berlin. We didn't pay for a tour and go inside, instead we wandered around the site and we found that was enough for us.
Interesting. Nice building, interesting guided tour but not seeing a lot of the inside. You can see the Royal crown inside.

Must visit both in the day and night. Beautiful building, probably the best in Budapest. I would recommend to visit it both in the day and night; at night time, the lights will create a unique atmosphere and make it look even more beautiful.

Lovely!. We walked here from Astoria which wasn't too far...first we came across the shoes on the Danube which was very sad, not far along from there was the Parliament buildings. Based on lovely well kept grounds, just in front of the Danube. The buildings themselves are just brilliant, and at 11am we were lucky enough to see the changing of the guards. Glad we walked there as there is plenty of great architecture around, which we wouldn't of seen on the Metro! Definitely worth a visit!

Amazing!. The building from the outside is enough to invite you for a tour within its marvelous architecture and sculptures. The tour is very well detailed and tour guides are very friendly. An elevator is available for those who are not able to climb over 100 stairs and also parents with pushchairs during the tour.

STUNNING. A stunning building from any angle
We were lucky as our hotel (The Art'otel) had fantastic views of it.
We saw it from the river, from each side, from Margaret Island, from the castle and Fishermans Reach.... All over
Architecture at its best

Beautiful. We did not have time for the tour but were grateful we had time to walk around this site. The structure is enormous and gorgeous; it's difficult to imagine how a structure of this magnitude was constructed so many years ago. Also, in addition to seeing this during the day, be sure to capture this site at night, the glowing lights are stunning.

Beautiful and poetic . After having visited many lavish palaces in Prague and Vienna, I found the Parliament to be quite exciting and beautiful for a functioning democratic building that rivals the palaces we've seen.Though our tour only included a few large rooms, the guide was friendly, interesting, and easy to understand. Lots of time was provided to take pictures, except of the Crown Jewels.
Magnificent. Magnificent, well preserved building that commands serious respect! Inspiring architecture and sculptures all around with plenty of green space to sit and relax.

MUSEUM NEEDS A REFRESH. We could not get into the building tour but visited the free museum. It is interesting but the technology was failing and the numbering system for the audio was very odd indeed.

Hungarian Parliament. This is a "must-do" if you are in Budapest for a few days. Guided tours are in several languages, including English, French, German and Hebrew. The tours can be booked online or in person on the day, but they sell out very quickly. There is also a free museum which is well worth looking at.
Is the best thing to see en Budapest, especially at night. It is a ver y beatufil bulding, and it is important to visit in a guide visit if you have time.The cruise at night is wontherful!!!!
Stunning. Do not miss to see this - from the river, from the square, from the viewing point in Buda, at day and at night. This building is truly stunning.

Impressive. You can book a tour which is very interesting. But (obviously) can only visit a part of the building. The entrance fee for Europeans is cheaper so donot forget to bring an ID. Strolling around the building and the river is very nice.

A MUST SEE!. Totally stunning building. Views from the Danube day or night are incredible, but you must stop off and view close up. Don't forget to go to the rear of the building and watch the guards. There is also a visitor centre and loads of sculptures. Once you have had your fill of Parliament, take a left and visit the shoes on the side of the Danube and then a short stroll gets you back into the hustle and bustle of the city.

Beautiful, a must see.. If can only see one sight while in Budapest, see the Parliament Building. Exquisite architecture inside and out. You must purchase a timed ticket ahead of time. It is a guided tour and you must pass through security. A guide and guard will accompny you on the tour. Tours are available in several languages and last about 45 minutes.

Dramatic focus to city. The location of Parliament House adjacent to the river, the focus to views from the opposite bank, is extraordinary. The colour of the stone, the drama of its architectural form and the space around it all contribute to its beauty and impact. Sadly tickets for internal visits were sold out and we should have been better prepared but there is much to be enjoyed by just strolling around the outside.
Stunning. Must see this magnificent building by river cruise at night. It is truly breathtaking and a moment you will never forget.

Beautiful building. We enjoyed our tour, but it was definitely rushed. Be sure to spend time at the end of the tour to visit the displays which help fill in information that is not given on the tours.
Beautiful building. Didn't go inside but went to look at the Parliament during the day and at night worth seeing, perhaps next time i visit Budapest i'll go inside would be interesting to see.

Tour of Parliament, both interesting and awe inspiring. We booked our tour of Parliament before we left home, and were glad we did, since it was a Monday when many other sights are closed, and it turned out to be pouring rain. It is not inexpensive for non-EU citizens, however, and is a bit dry, but worth the price to get to see the extravagant interior. Parliament was not in session, so there were several English tours available. At busy times, or on Monday, you may want to get tickets online, and you can avoid standing in the very long line for this. It costs a bit more, but is a way to ensure you will get tickets.

Totally Impressive. We were advised that touring the inside was not worth the time so we did not . We did however get to see this beautiful structure twice on both a day and night boat cruise . Perhaps the night view is the most amazing .
Big...huge...amazing. Huge building right on the Danube that looks amazing both in the day light and at night when the lights make it look magical

Beautiful building. Took an early tour of the Parliament. Both the outside and inside of the building are beautiful. Thought the tour was a bit pricey (about $20) for a 45 minute tour. Our guide was knowledgeable.

Breathtaking!. This is by far the most stunning building in Budapest. After seeing it in person, I can totally understand why this is #1 attraction in this beautiful city. This building is incredible from every angle, and is a must to see at night!
Brilliant Architecture . I couldn't believe what I was seeing.. The structure of the building is amazing and you must see it at night with all the lights highlighted its just brilliant
lovely. this is one of the highlights in terms of architecture in budapest and provides a stunning backdrop to the city

Stunningly opulent!. First tip: book your tour ahead of time and arrive 15 min early. Next tip: have your camera ready for an exquisite and visually stunning tour of the architecture! Amazing that it is a functioning arm of the government and people work there every day. Prepare to be amazed

A must see. The parliament was as beautiful inside as it is outside. Interesting to see the details of the structure and hear about the history. 45 minute tour and book in advance on line or you may miss the opportunity.

great building on the banks of Danube. A great looking building reminds me of houses of parlament in london (not a real surprise as design was inspired by them) set in a nice square with some interesting statues, if you want a tour try booking in advance as when we went ticket office was packed and needed to book for tour next day. from here if you go down to the bank of the danube and go left you will come to the Shoes on the river,
very big and impressive- must see at night. One of the most impressive landmarks of Budapest. a must for every tourist. We didn't do the inside tour, for sure next time

Book in advance or don't bother!. This is somewhere you really need to book in advance online. We turned up late morning on a Monday hoping to go round and there was a massive queue to buy tickets. Plus you have to book onto one of the guided tours, and the next one in English was not for hours so we weren’t able to go in.
Looks spectacular in the evening . The parliament looks great with night lights on but is as good during the day too. You have to see it while in town
Stunning architecture!. What a view from the Buda hills!! It's a stunning creation and the next trip I plan on looking inside as well because from the outside it is just incredible!
Impressive arcitecture. One of the most impressive architecture I have ever seen along the beautiful Danube river. A must see in Budapest

Impressive Building. We booked a tour of the Parliament and a city tour. The tour of the Parliament took about an hour with our guide and was well worth it. The building is huge and there was a ot of history explained on the tour.

A must see at night. This place is a landmark for the city of Budapest. The architecture is wonderful and impressive but at night when illuminated it is breath taking. You need to see from the other side of the river to get the full perspective. Ask your driver to take you to the Novotel Budapest Danube parking lot.
Amazing Building. A building that took about 19 years to complete which was in 1904 and they have been renovating it ever since till now ......it sits on the pest side of the river

Definitely a highlight of our Budapest trip. As other reviewers have said, do book your guided tour in advance; ours was at 12.00 and we heard those turning up on the spot beng sent away. You can't just wander round on your own.It is huge, gilded to the eyebrows and spectacular. The centrepiece is the golden coronation crown with its leaning cross on top, and the orb, sceptre and ceremonial sword, guarded by very tall soldiers from a special and distinguished army unit who stand with drawn swords. The impressive legislative chamber combines lavish decorative features with state of the art voting facilities. Outside the chamber can be seen quantities of curiously ridged brass objects which are cigar holders from an earlier era when nembers could nip outside for a quick gasp, leaving their cigar to be returned to later.It was a most interesting visit, and as we walked away across the courtyard the changing of the national flag's guard took place. Very smart and reminiscent of old film footage of bygone empires, not exactly goose-stepping but on the way to it. The guards' official issue sunglasses added an extra air of menace.
Stunning architecture!. The parliament building is great to see during the day time or at night when it is lit up. It is one of the most extragavant parliament buildings I have seen.

Beautiful outside and in. If you watch public TV, you're familiar with the parliament building in Budapest from the Viking River cruises ads. Even if you don't, this building is the first one you see if you're looking at pictures of Budapest. It is big, and it is beautiful. The inside is also amazing, with acres of gold leaf, beautiful sculptures, and marble corridors. You should definitely visit. Just be sure to reserve your tickets online at least a day before you go -- there may not be any available if you wait until the day of your visit. You can only visit with a tour, and they have frequent tours in English. The tours are businesslike and rushed, but they give a good orientation. In the basement there is an enjoyable exhibit about the building's construction in the late 19th century. While you're there, take the time to find the moving 1956 memorial in the grounds (it's underground), It will definitely affect you. Don't miss this building if you're in Budapest.

Amazing architecture. The architecture of this building is stunning. I would recommend booking the guided tour of the parliament in advance as tickets gets sold quite quickly. Take your passports along with you when you book your tickets as you get a discount if you are a EU citizen. For photos i recommend taking the pictures from the river cruise both at day and night time as it looks absolutely stunning at night time from the cruise/buda side.
Impressive!. Impressive, awe inspiring architecture. This is the view from Buda. The Parliament is in Pest across the river Danube.
Lovely building . I was told that I had to visit the parliament building I loved the place and the surrounding area it was a very big building also the gardens surrounding the place were great
Fabulous architecture inside and out. A walking tour of Parliament is not to be missed. The sumptuous architecture and associated history is fascinating.
Parliament a must see!. Be sure to buy tickets before you leave home. Tours were filled when we got there and we would have missed the beautiful interior.

WOW what a building . We didn't actually go inside the Parliament building but what a wonderful building from the outside. You must see it at night when it's dark and lit up WOW. Will definitely go back again to see it.
kool. this building is very historic and well kept,the interior is extremely pleasing to the eyes.It is very kool to see how another country does its governing .
Magnificent. This structure is absolutely magnificent. We saw it first at night from the river and then during the interior tour. it is really a very special place to visit and cant be missed.
Amazing especially at night . This building is the most memorable of all in Budapest. Especially at night. It is like a symbol of the city.
Beautiful by night . We went on a night time cruise to see this all light up,as recommended by someone. Absolutely stunning at night.
excursion. Fantastic place. Very near, all persons they can visit it. Has a magic beauty at night with the lights.
Amazing architecture. When you are visiting the Parliament make sure you don`t miss the free memorial exhibition underground remembering 1956.

Cool. I think this is the best parliament building in europe. I have been in many places and none are more beautiful then this one. It is very nice place to walk to and its lovely in the night.
In my opinion its a must see. Definitely recommend

The most beautiful building on the Danube River. The Hungarian Parliament is always beautiful at any time of the day: day time or evening by the lights.
It's a must to see!
Worth a tour. Tour was shorter than I'd expected but I'm glad I did it, well worth booking in advance as the morning tours can get booked up.
Very Impressive at night. If you are in Budapest, be sure to take a river cruise at night. The Parliament building is really impressive.

Beautiful building. Only seen from the outside but what a magnificent building. If you're not bothered about how you see this building I would recommend a boat trip and see it from the river. Not only can you get a better sense of its size but it's easier to photograph hehe

Beautiful building, informative fun tour.. Very nice good pace tour of the magnificent building. Historically accurate, detailed, interesting information. Enough time for pictures and to absorb the beauty of the inside.... The only place you cannot take pictures is where the crown jewels are....

2 things not to miss. Difficult to get into Parliament tour per se, but more importantly, there is a historical Parliament museum which is free.....Probably better than the Parliament tour....not to be missed is the 1956 Hungarian revolution museum on the left side of the building facing the river. Who needs to see where the gasbags talk when the history is so on much more interesting.
Worth a visit. You can book a tour online, or take your chances on site. Building is incredibly beautiful. Worth your time and money.

Wow, what a sight!. I'm so glad we decided to take a tour of the Parliament building, it was so beautiful and ornate. I've never seen anything like this before and strongly encourage you to not just visit the parliament building, but take a tour to learn more about it.
Beautiful building. The stunning architecture and lovely views of the Danube are well worth a visit. Lots of interesting history. A must see in Budapest!
The most beautiful Parliament in the world :-). The Hungarian Parliament is the most beautiful I have seen in my life. The best view is from Buda and in the evening is much more breath taking...

City break . Parliament Square, with its massive,beautiful buildings. Solders on duty and museum underground about the 1956 uprising. What is not to like. Then you see it from the other side, either Buda side or from the river. It takes your breath away.
Impressive . Worth a visit... really enjoyed walking around the location and thus scenic views. I would make it a point to walk by.
Beautiful Building. Unfortunately, they were sold out for the building tour so we just walked around the outside. Very nice. Lookk even better at night when all lite up.
Beautiful Budapest Castle. Walk along the promenade on the Pest side at night time for magnificent views of the Castle and chain bridge. Must see.
View of the parliament building. Amazing setting absolutely fantastic building. Never ceases to impress especially as a night time backdrop!

Take the tour of Parliament, worth the ticket price. The Parliament building is amazing, both inside and out. You learn a lot about how the building came to be and the history of the Austro-Hungarian empire up to today. At the end of the tour there is a room with videos and information about the building. In the middle is a big replica of the building with a corner missing to see what the inside looked like. Tickets were about 20 USD and it is definitely worth it to get the tickets beforehand online. The line to buy tickets at the visitor center was ridiculous and not worth waiting in. They have tours in 4 or 5 different languages. If you visit Budapest this is a stop you need to take.

Excellent tour guide but a bit busy . The visit was interesting and the building is incredibly beautiful inside and out. Getting tickets can be done online in advance (yes everyone has to buy tickets) but we managed to get some on the day. For this it's best to go early even if it means coming back later.The waiting area is very hectic especially on the middle of the day when multiple tours are running close together. There was a large crowd of people to go through security and the staff weren't especially vocal in making clear which group was being called. Nonetheless, the tour guide was excellent and once we were through security she took care of everything. Her commentary was great and insightful but for reasons of security the tour can only run through half of the building. At the end of the tour is an exhibit on the building of the parliament and includes a number of exciting pieces . If visiting I would highly recommend spending some time there.

Expensive for what you get. This is suggested as number 1 on the places to see in Budapest and it is lovely. But it was by far the most expensive place we paid admission two over two weeks and was quite a short tour. I
Amazing!. Very beautiful place! We love it with my husband! Near the river Dunai, where you can walk or to catch a little river ship.
fantastic building inside and out.. The guided tour was excellent with very knowledgeable guides. Tour was about the right length with just the right amount of detail.

Beautiful building inside and out. The tours are timed. We turned up on the day and paid and booked a time then came back an hour later. It is cheaper if you are an EU citizen. Very reasonable price. Take ID. Security is good, bags are scanned. Very beautiful building and interesting tour.
Amazing building - a must see!. This is like palace. Its a must see, from the river and inside on a tour. You must booked in advance and the online booking is clunky but its worth it.

Cant stay away!. Amazing building..... Whether in the daylight or evening..... It just amazed me! Especially in the evening..... GOLDEN!! I cant leave the place for hours literally :) n thanked to the government for the free wifi there :)

The Crown Jewel of Hungary. Easily the most stunning piece of architecture in Budapest, it is instantly recognizable due to its sheer size and detailed design. Conveniently it overlooks the river and can be seen on both river cruises and across the river.
Simply beautiful. In my opinion, it's the most beautiful parliament in the whole Europe. It's a most see if you're close by!

Impressive Gem by Day and Night. We visited in Sep 2016 and this is my favourite attraction in Budapest. We pre-booked an English tour on-line and enjoyed viewing the interiors of this well decorated grand Parliamenmt House. The tour is only about an hour but is highly recommended as its interiors are impressive!. There is an exhibition with videos depicting features of the building and how it was built and maintained. Standing at the riverbank facing the river, entrance is to her left. We took a night cruise on the Danube (8.15-9.15 pm) and the lighted Parliament House once again stood out as the prettiest gem on the Danube!
Landmark of the city..... Beautiful structure ! from the river its looks more attractive and elegant. A must visit if you in Budapest.

Do night boat cruise of the Danube!. You can take some spectacular photos of the Parliament building from a boat at night. We did a dinner cruise and it wasn't overly exciting until you see the Parliament building lit up at night! WOW! The architecture is amazing.
really worth the effort to get tickets. Very nice. this is an architectural tour, not really politics. Very nice building. Similar to a opera house

Beautiful building . We went on the first tour of the day and it was well worth being up early for as it meant our tour group was smaller and allowed us to better keep up with guide and see everything she was showing us. The building itself is incredibly beautiful both inside and out and is a must-see in Budapest! Make sure you book your tickets online and print them off in advance because you can only buy tickets for that day at the ticket office and they sell out really fast.

A fabulous and informative Tour. We lucked out by getting on a tour even though it was sold out for the day. The guide was amazing and it is definitely worth seeing, contrary to some comments I have read. Pre-book to avoid disappointment.

Stunning. We booked a tour online the night before, and with no way to print the tickets we just arrived at the visitor centre and they printed our tickets for us. The tour was very interesting and the building is stunning! Tour guide was very knowledgeable and friendly. Definitely recommend

Third largest Parliament house in the world!. It is a most awesome building! The tour does justice. Lovely photo ops inside. It looks like a palace rather than a government building. Must book prior as its really busy.
Impressive . A very impressive building. A photographers delight. View from afar to enjoy its beauty. I had the pleasure of viewing it from a boat cruise on the Danube and it didn't disappoint
A Must See. This is a very interesting building and a good tour. Beautiful interior. One of our highlights in Budapest.
Stunning huge building. Free museum inside building.. Worth a visit to see free museum. We didn't visit the parliament (costs to get in at set times). The café is lovely with good food and very cool.
Impressive. We took a guided tpur. The tpur was short and to the point. The building itself is very impressive and worth visiting.

Beautiful building, good history lesson. The exterior and interior of the building is spectacular! Was told I should book the tour in advance, but was able to turn up and book myself on to a tour 20 minutes before it began. I took the tour with a group with an English-speaking guide. Loved being able to hear about the history of Hungary. Cool to see the original royal crown of Hungary - just a pity we couldn't take pictures! I felt the tour was a bit rushed, but overall enjoyed my visit.
Superb monument!!. The architecure is splendid. Just hanging around the parliement in the sun is super relaxing and nice. I was really amazed by how the guards can stay still even under 32 degres!!!
Not that great!. The tour was short and not worth the price paid. It is beautiful inside but not much to see. Enjoy the view of it outside!

The House of the Nation... An incredible and very interesting thru the past thru today. MUST get the tour with a REAL HUMAN as a guide, no ear piece in your language gadget. Can take all the pictures with flash or without. EXCEPT the room we all want to take the picture; The Coronation Items. They are securely guarded by 2 military officers, with swords that they move every 5 minutes to avoid a hit by the enemy. The Congress was in session yesterday. We were allowd to come into the chamber to take pic and listen. Very interesting... The tour is worth all its money...

A must-see in the evening on a bus tour! Spectacular!. A must-see in the evening! We had tickets with the hop on hop off bus, and took the night trip which was spectacular! The memory of Parliament in the evening from atop the hill on the bus will stay with you for a very long time.

Parliament tour is well worth it. The Parliament tour lasts 45 minutes. I didn't have high expectations since it was relatively short but the inside of this building is really amazing. We only saw a small part of the inside of the building. It starts with a walk up a staircase that was 130 steps broken in several segments. It was beautiful with the gold leaf and murals. We went to the grand entrance which was equally as beautiful. The tour also visits assembly hall where the Hungarian legislature conducts session. Again, very impressive. The most impressive part of the tour was the ability to see and learn about the Hungarian Crown. Our tour was sold out. We bought our tickets the day we toured and they printed them for us at the visitor center.
Beautiful building inside and out.. Great tour, good history and the building is gorgeous inside. Our tour guide was very good, and you get to see the Crown Jewels of Budapest. Must see.
Beautiful . It's a must go in Budapest! It's really impressive from the inside. The tour guide spoke perfect English and very nice.At night the view is amazing with all the lights on.

Fabulous building. Booked a tour in advance as advised by parliament website and we're glad we had. The queues were quite long but it was very well organised and our guide wore a microphone so we could hear everything. A truly magnificent building well worth a visit. Don't miss it.

Magnificent Building Inside and Out. The Parliament building dominates the near Pest side of the Danube, not far from the Chain Bridge and it is awe inspiring especially at night from the Castle District in as it is lighted and looks more like a castle. . The modern underground visitor center has an interesting historical exhibit. There is a Lapidarium exhibit and extensive grounds. Tours (about $ 20 per person) of the interior including seeing the ancient Hungarian Royal crown and the throne, the changing of the guard on the half hour, the assembly chamber and some of the unbelievably ornate corridors with vaulted decorated ceilings and stained glass windows. Our tour guide, however, was very disappointing in that she spoke softly, didn't wait I til the large group gathered around and spoke towards what she was describing rather than towards her group. This made it almost impossible to understand what she was saying with no amplification or ability to project her voice. The tour was advertised as being 45 minutes long, but by the time the groups were assembled (by language), and we got through metal detectors, we barely were in the building for half an hour. There are also 140 steps from the u nderground Visitor Center to the main level and back down,so using the one lift may be a good option for some. Perhaps the most beautiful Parliament building and the third largest in the world, but one of the worst tours ever.
Most amazing place!!. There are simply no words to describe how beautiful the Hungarian Parliament is. It is a must see if you are going to Hungary!!

Beautiful both from Pest and Buda. Everyone knows fantastic view on the Parlament from the hills of Buda. But the buildings are wonderful from the Pesti side - when you visit them to see them closely. Probably best riverside piece of architecture...
amazing city. realy nice holiday in Budapest, wonderful atmospher in the city, very wonderufl walk at night to the Parliament

Most interesting. This is a must if you are going to Budapest. The guides are knowledgeable and speak marvellous English. It is huge and beautiful. You visit just one side as it a mirror of the other. Tours are timed so go early to book and be prepared as you may not get on the one you want.

Great visit, easy to book, real wow. we had a short time in Budapest and very glad we did not miss the tour of Parliament. Booking was easy on line and the tour was really interesting. Wonderful to see the crown jewels

Amazing from outside, poor in inside. This building is amazing from outside during the day and also during the night. Rebuild square around with statues is also nice. But I was dissapointed from inside tour.You can take only guided tour, it is not possible solo tour (building is still used as parliament). Waiting lines are too long. There are tours every 15 minutes, but in different languages. In our case we had to wait 2,5 hours for next english tour - they do it in many world languages and english is just one of them. But tour takes about 20-25 minutes only and only interesting think inside is crown, some halls and main parliament room, which is quite small.
Don't miss the guided tour - reserve on Internet. The guided tour is about 45 min but is really worth. The building is amazing outside & inside. You avoid the queue by booking on Internet (8€)

Beautiful. You can't miss it. The building is very impressive right on the banks of Danube. But you have to see it at night when it is lit up. Looks spectacular. Take a boat ride which will pass by it and you can take stunning photos.
A must visit site. A very nice building from the outside and inside. Worth seeing during the day and during the night. The inside tour is recommended as well. Very beautifully decorated interiors.
Government buildings. This is a very majestic building and if impressed you will be more so at night.The lights are very impressive.

Great Parliament. THe biggest in continental Europe, this Parliament is awesome and should be visited. Go there if you want to learn more about the history of central Europe and what it means for hungarians this incredible place.
Amazing!!. The best part was the evening boat tour!!!! The lighted building it was something magnificent and Very impressive!!

Stunning! Go inside.. We first saw it from outside on a Segway tour and our guide said it was the grandest building in Budapest. We went for the tour inside the next day and found that she was absolutely right. It is incredibly beautiful!

You need to pay for a inside your, but is wort it.. The parliament is a nice big historica, building outside. If you happen to be around by night go to visit it completeñy iluminated.At the left of the building, with your back to the river, there are stairs to the subterranean visitor center. There are tours in many lenguajes and they are quite chesp for EU citcens and students.The tour, is best if you buy it in advance in the web page of the parliament, if you forguet to print your tiket, they will print it for you in reception. IMPORTANT: you have to pass a security control to get into the building, so do not take poket knives etc with you.So, the tour is short, you visit the 4 main rooms of the parliament, it takes around 45 minutes but, betwen getting headsets for all the tour and some introduction it can take 1 hour.There are lifts in the tour, but there are 13 streps that everione has to do.The tour was nice and informative, full of history and well explained. You can take pictures in almost all rooms. The carpets are gorgeous and the stone pillars quite impresive. Also our guide gave us a short review of Hungarian history, quite interesting.

Amazing!. A must do! Even if you aren't into history or politics, it is worth a visit just to admire the beauty of the building both inside and out. It really is a stunning place. English tours sell out quickly online - if tickets online have sold out you can still get tickets on the day at the desk. In peak season, you probably need to get them a day or two in advance.
Absolutely Beautiful. Stunning building. You must go and walk all around! We took a tram from our location. Stunning photos.

Beautiful - must see!. Book in advance online and enjoy the splendor of the stunning Parliament!Interior decoration in combination with the history and the scale of the building make for a wonderful visit.

Charming and lovely place where you should see and visit. It was raining when I was there and that made even better. . Highly recommend, however i found Budapest more expensive than Vienna. Take a walk, that straight is fully crowded. People are very friendly and welling to answers you at any time.

Beautiful building. View this beautiful building from the Danube ( take an inexpensive local ferry). View from Fisherman's Bastion and also take the time to walk around this magnificent piece of architecture. Take a walk at night too, as it is magical.We didn't take an inside tour, but if we visited Budapest again, we would make this a consideration.
2 Tram. If you take the 2 tram along the Danube not only do you see the main stretch of the river but the tram also goes slowly around the parliament building. It is a beautiful building.
Amazing . No words to describe this gorgeous building especially at night up close and from the cruise we did at night. Definitely one of the highlights of our trip here

Plan Ahead. Fantastic location with much to see around the square. But plan ahead. Tours are offered in many languages, but only a few times in any particular language each day. For example, they only offered the tour in English 2 times on the day my wife and I visited, and the morning tour was already sold out by the time we arrived, and the next tour was not for another six hours. Plan ahead!

Spectacular visit at the Parliament Building. An absolutely must-see tourist attraction when you staying in Budapest! I can say without prejudice this is one of the most delightful government buildings of the world. You should visit here on the 20th August for free but you will have to deal with a long waiting period at this time, which is the greatest national holiday for Hungarians, celebrated with day-long festivities followed by spectacular fireworks.
Amazing Architecture - Beautiful at Night!. Visited during the day and at night on a river cruise. Very beautiful building which looks astounding at night when lit up!
Marvellous, but too fast. The building is beautiful and the visit was totally worthbit, i just wish we had had some more time to stay inside and explore by ourselves
AMAZING!. Its a huge bulding, its lovely at night when the lights are on..Its really impressive...If you visit Budapest definitely you have to stop by!

Easy and informative. The tour was a great way to spend an hour. Informative guides. Stunning architecture, and you get to see the Hungarian crown, which was lost for 70 years, but found in Fort Knox.
A big WOW.... It is # 1 attraction to visit in Budapest. You should see it lit during a night cruise in the Danube river. Never seen any parliament that huge and artistic

Great architecture - Tours are a bit expenaive. Wether or not you decide to go on a tour inside parliament or view the architecture from outside its worth a visit. There's great photo opportunities to be had by day and night. The evening around 6 or 7 is particularly good as the lighting is great and there's hardly any tourists left wondering around. The tour itself was on the expensive side and the 45 minutes went pretty quickly while walking the length of many of the corridors. The tour guide was polite, funny and informative. As for toilets, don't pay for them inside, next to the cafe. Just outside they are free!
Beautiful part of hungarian culture. Beautiful parliament, up kept very well and a great place to see culture in Pest. A must see if visiting budapest!

Mustn't be missed. Located along the Danube River closer to the southern tip of Margeret Island, its walkable distance. Take a stroll on both side of the Danube River to enjoy the spectacular view from near and far, day and night, equally stunning!
Big parliament for a small country . The building modeled after the English parliament is impressive and huge. Throughout much of its history it has been irrelevant.
Beautiful . This place is out of this world, peaceful, beautiful, and perfect location. What goes on inside must be chaotic given Hungarian government is unpopular.
Impressive building. Very easy to walk along the river embankment and take in the beautiful building and surrounding square.

Must see. Difficult to get tickets, so use a tour guide. Emily our tour guide was able to obtain tickets easily - plus you bypass long lines. The English tour was canceled for some unknown reason. Emily was allowed to give the tour, since she used to do this in the past.

Great palace. This is a must see when at Budapest. It is a great building and it is historical. There was the october revolution 1956 where the hungarians raised from the sovjets invadings.
There are many monuments and statues around, also other fantastic buildings nearby. There are fees to visit and the have also change of guards process daily. Fantastic building

Spectacular inside and outside. The parliament buildings are eye catching both day and night from the exterior. The interior guided visit( in English) is also worthwhile.
Spectacular "House of Commons" seen as well as the Hungarian State Crown". The Parliament is due to be moved to the Castle Hill in the near future

Wow. What a magnificent building both inside and out. Don't forget to go back at night when the building is lit up in all its glory. You must pre book as all tours are with a guide with a language of your choosing. The building inside and out has been maintained to a very high standard.

Beautiful in Day & Night. This building is magnificent. There are tours to visit inside of the building. They are only 45 minutes long and you can take pictures with the exception of one room. They don't show you all the rooms and hallways but only ones that are not in use. Be sure to catch a view of this building around sunset and at night time from Fisherman's Bastion.

The tour is very interesting though a bit short. Love the tour - the guide had loads of interesting information and you get to see some interesting parts of the building. Plus, there is museum at the end of the tour which history nerds (like myself) will enjoy. I just wish that we got to see more of the building.

Nice informative tour. Arranged thru an online site which was a bit of a headache, reservation kept changing, but they did put in the effort to get me a tour. The tour guide was very informative. You could take photos in all but one room - a little disappointing since that was one of the more interesting rooms.

One of the best value for money trips in Budapest. This is a really interesting tour, not too long and we had a really entertaining guide. The building is beautiful and it's so good to see inside. The trip (if you have an EU passport) worked out to only £7 each - amazing value.

Amazing view. The external architecture is amazing whether from the boat at night or by walking. you can spend 1 hour simply looking at it. it is nice. It is possible to visit but you have to take an appointment in booth 10 and you may come back the next day for the visit. There is a fee but could be waived for EU citizen. It is the biggest Parliament building in the EU and the 3rd Worldwide.
A Must see in Budapest. The place is huge, the tours are well organised. I wish to be member of the Hungarian Parliament to see this place everyday.
Nice.. Walked along the waters to find this and it is a very grand looking building, got some nice pictures to show home. Didn't go in though.
lovely. view this beautiful building from the River for the full impact. day or night time, it's incredible.
The most beautiful building I have seen!. Such a gorgeous building with the most gorgeous history! I could sit forever and admire it's beauty! Loved the tour as much as I enjoyed its exterior beauty!
Great. Very good architecture. And very beautiful building. The sitting there is really new sence and magnificat view.
Stunning. Spectacular, local guide included in the ticket price, telling interesting stories. A Must visit in Budapest!
excellent visit.. fascinating design and very efficient tour guide. the story of the building along with the architecture design were worth our money and time a lot

One of the most impresive parlament buildings in EU. one of Budapest"s main spots, impressive building, worth to see, interior sightseeing possible, nice to walk arround, museum before main building about Soviet intervention from 50ies also good spot to see
Parliament from the outside. The Parliament architecture is very imposing and worth a visit. It is a big place even with many visitors so you do not feel crowded while enjoying the view.

Only saw the outside but it is amazingly beautiful for a Parliament. Think it beats the London Houses of Parliament into a cocked hat! Really stunning - you wouldn't know it was home to a bunch of politicians. Only saw it from outside but it is breathtaking and that is the only reason it didn't get the last star, I hope to come back and go around inside next time.

Amazing Show of Architecture. Very impressive building which we get to see from the Bus, along the river cruise & from the top of Castlw Hill.
It's a sight to behold and stands out especially at nite when the lights came out.
A showpiece of Budapest
UNBELIEVABLE. The best way to see it is by boat in a night tour. It´s a image to cry for. You won´t forget in your whole life.

Worth a visit. This is a stunning square and we were taken around by a tour guide that was very knowledgeable and had some great stories to tell. This design has architecture taken from Houses of Parliament in the UK

Expect to buy a ticket in advance. The building itself is imposing and seen from many viewpoints. It is actually large - some 40m bricks used in its construction in the late 19th century though faced with other materials.Inside tours are organised for different language groups, each person given their own audio loop which picks up the live commentary from the guide. Because of security you have to stay in the group and because its a working building tours might not happen at all some days. They only last about 45 mins but give an interesting insight into this part of Hungary's parliamentary system.

Impressive, but short tour.. The Hungarian Parlament is really impressive.Massive amounts of gold and marble was used building this.We took the English guided tour for 2200 HUF.Nice, but extremely short. Only 30 minutes. Could've been a lot longer.
Must see. We didn't enter the building itself but you must make sure you see it when you are in Budapest. Amazing architecture and to see it lit up at night is something special.

Beautiful building . Large symmetrical building from when Hungary had 3 times the territory. About half hour tour of ornate interior including crown jewels, was good but not great. Building looks fantastic at night from the Buda side of the river. There are also short boat tours on the river that give you great views.

Well worth a visit . Queues for tickets were massive so I walked around the building taking in the beautiful scenery and views. Whole area is spectacular. Great place to grab some breakfast /lunch in the spar nearby and sit down and eat and take in the scenery
Fantastic. Very beautiful building. It is probably the best and the famous place and building in Budapest. Gothic style. Must see it.
Breathtaking P in the world! . The most opulent and grandiose parliament I've yet to see. I doubt there is any prettier than the one in Budapest?

Worth taking a tour. We took an inside tour and found it well worth it. The building was indeed gorgeous inside and outside. They offered the tour in various languages and you could purchase the tickets online in advance.
Interesting tour. Highly recommended to check visit hr and to purchase tickets online prior arriving.The tour itself is very interesting.

A must see!. I have been in a lot of capitals in Europe but I have never seen such a beautiful Parlament building. It is absolutely breathtaking. Cant be explained - so if you are in Budapest then go see for yourself :-)

You can nevr miss this out. The tour in Budapest will be incomplete if you don't visit this parliament . All tour agency will have this tour in their list . If you are not visiting with organized tour agency then i would certainly recommend get the ticket online . We visited parliament on a Tuesday and the ticket counters had long queues. Also make sure that there a no parliament session on your days of visit.If there are parliament sessions then you will not be allowed to visit unless you are an Hungarian citizen. There are official guides and each group can join the timings . Ours was English guide and we started our tour at 10 AM sharp. The tour lasted for around an hour. The guide will give you good description about the various chambers and especially the crown. The court of parliament is really majestic. There is provision to keep your personal bags.

A must.. Beautiful structures and interesting tour. You do need to make reservations in advance. They have tours in multiple languages offered at various times during the day. The group size is about 30 so it works well

Stunning interior - very highly recommended. A stunningly beautiful building both outside and in.A visit to the Parliament building is a real 'must'. The interior is really beautiful - a mix of neo-gothic and renaissance, as the tour guide says. The tour takes you through the center of the building; you see the debating chamber and also the crown and sceptre. Photographs are permitted everywhere except in the domed room where the crown is kept.It is easily accessed via a local metro station.The 45 minute tours get booked up very quickly so if you want to go i recommend booking online at least 2 days before you want to go. I noticed the English tours in particular were swiftly sold out, but this may happen with the other language tours too. There is a small discount for those living in the EU - take your passport just in case they ask you to prove it. You need to take paper tickets if you book online - mobile versions aren't accepted.
Great building. It has a very nice placement and it's definitely something everyone that goes to Budapest must see. The Danube is right next to it , which makes it even better to look at.

Budapest is lovely and fun. Everywhere we went, people were helpful and friendly. There are so many things to see in Budapest. We spent 5 days, and still didn't see everything. Definitely go to the Jewish synagogue, very moving and the Hungarian Opera; it's gorgeous

IMPRESSIVE. Dominating the river bank and the skyline, the Parliament Building reflects the mighty grandeur of Budapest some 150 years or so ago. Said to be modelled on the UK’s Houses of Parliament, it also seems to acknowledge and reflect the style of Westminster Abbey that is nearby to the UK Parliament. There’s a small guard changing ceremony to see in the morning.

Wonderful! . We went on this tour at 830. The group size was great and it was long enough to get great info, but not too long for a two year old! Loved the Crown Jewels, changing of the guards and the beauty of the building! It was definitely worth it for us!

Holds its own with other major attractions in the world. . Parliament is number 1 for a reason. We were told that the building took 20 years employing 1000 people a day. The result is incredible and should not be missed. It will rival any building in Europe.
Beautoful. A stunning building in a very clean area, a really nice place to visit and fully recommend to anyone who is visiting Budapest!

Excellent beautifull area. Recently I have visited the surrounding area of our Parliament and wassurprised so many changes!
The beautifull building finally was completely restaurated and renovated - splenberous! And not only the building the all area updated, restaurated as it was before the Second World War! Must visited is you are in Budapest!

Best in Budapest!. Would be better to reserve the tour.
Though fee of non-EU citizens is much higher than EU citizens, it is worth to pay.
Espectacular. Amazing breathtaking Parliament building with over 600 rooms. Definitely worth visiting and viewing from both sides of the Danube!

Stunning in the day, unbelievably beautiful at night. One of the most exquisite buildings I have seen. The interior of the building is even better than the beautiful exterior. There is a 45 minute tour led by a guide which is a must do as they take you inside the building and some of the key rooms. You also get to see the crown and the scepter but you cannot photograph those. There is also a small museum where you can learn of the history of the parliament building which is pretty nice. I was lucky enough to be there during the changing of the guard and saw the whole ceremony. At night make sure you walk on the Buda side of the Danube to get a beautiful view of the building lit up in yellow lights.

MUST SEE in Budapest!!. The Parliament is not only one of the biggest in Europe, but also one of the most beautiful. From the outside, and even more from inside! Inside you will see big rooms covered in gold, with a very nice entrance hall and of course the Hungarian crown! If you are a culture lover then you should definitely see it! and if not, doesn't matter. you will be amazed anyways, believe me!

2016 Summer Vacation. You need half a day to go through the Parliament grounds and have the tour inside. You can only go through the Indoors via Guided tour. Go early to make sure you get your tour tickets for the same day.
Parliament. Very beautiful building , you have to see from the oposite of the danube, Bethany Utca, use , Red Metro, no 2,

Honeymoon . A beautiful and romantic area - go for a stroll and there are plenty of photo opportunities, especially when the lights come on at sun down. Remember to book ahead and don't worry if you don't have a printer - come a bit earlier and they'll print it for you
Spectacula. Amazing architecture by day but magical at night. Wait to go in is long. Best to go early. There is a Cafe inside by ticket counter that helps pass the time.
Long lines and crowds. We didn't end up going in; walking around it taking pictures was enough. Decent coffee shop with Adjacent WC which is credited against any cafe purchase.

GORGEOUS BUILDING. not a long tour but worth it for the architecture. Go early when just open to avoid long waits. Open underground displays are worth seeing down staircases in the park pllaza on non river side of parliament building.

Beautiful building on the Pest side of the Danube. The parliament building is very beautiful. One can visit inside if you book a tour, Situated right on the edge of the Danube, Highly recommend a visit.

Beautiful!. A must see when you are in Budapest. Informative tour given.
Interior décor is exquisite. Exterior of Parliament building is breathtaking after dark.
hitting the highlights. the parliament building very pretty. but, there is more ... there are at least three small free museums just outside in the courtyard that are worth the look.

Beautiful from both sides of the river.. Check it out at night, you can get up close. Nice to sit next to the infinity fountain and look up at the bats circling the dome. Not surprised to hear it was inspired by the British Houses of Parliament.
Guided tour. Incredible opulent building. It looks like it is straight out of Austria or Italy. The art work is unbelievable and the detail can keep you busy for quite a while. Really worth seeing
Must see. One of the most beautiful things I have seen , especially lit up at night. Make sure you are on the other side of the river for the best views / photo ops
Like Whitehall in London. This Hungarian parliament is located at the river bank of Donau. Style of the parliament building is like it's brother in London. Must go!
A must. Beautiful inside and out. When finished hop on Tram #2 for a sightseeing tour for the price of a tram ticket.
Stunning building. I enjoyed the tour. Even better I like the view of the building from the outside - especially at night.

changing of the guard at parliament. Well worth a visit. Lovely to stroll around the building. Be sure to try time your visit to view the changing of the guards - it just takes a few minutes. Well worth watching. Nice coffee shop inside.
Beautiful! . Best at night as the lighting makes it even more beautiful! A must see when you visit this beautiful city

Exquisite Building. We saw the building from the Danube River then toured the next day. Seeing the crown was so exciting. The dome above the crown with the chandalier and all the lights. Stunning. So worth the visit.

Beautiful, well-maintained building + terrible guide. The building, the sourroundings and the new visitor centre are all stunning, and well-maintained. Must see!On the other hand, our guide was terrible. She was a fifty-something Hungarian lady with a terribly strong Hungarian accent and very limited vocabulary. She often misinformed people and told stories in connection with the building and it's history which are simply are not true! Her history knowledge is faaaaaar below elementary school level. It's better to ignore her, and just watch the building.

Breathtaking & Stunning. The Parliament building is a must see if you are in Budapest. You must view it twice,during the day and evening. In the evening it is beautifully illuminated and stunning. As we had stayed at Anabelle B&B hotel, the Parliament was on our way every time we wanted to go out from or back to our hotel. It is a wonderful sightseeing for taking photography shut especially in the evening.
Awesome. The view of the Parliament from the Danube is stunning. At night it is even more with all the lights. It is part of the bus tour and the boat tour.

Great photo opportunity. They change the guard here approx every hour.They also use a sprinkler system to clean the square first thing so brilliant mood / emotion / thought provoking photo shots possible.
A superb view at night from the water. We traveled up the river to see one of the most gorgeous sights ever. The view was truly magnificent, one that is a must see when you visit Budapest.

Really worthy visiting. We had the view of the parliament goer the last day. You have to book in advance. You can only go in with a guided tour which is really worthy. The stairs and all the rooms are amazing and really majestuous . The visit is about 1 hour and really interesting .Liked much more than the castle.
Stunning Building. Dominates the view from the river both during the day and especially at night. Nothing says Hapsburg excess like this building. Its closed on Mondays so plan accordingly

Amazing looking building. Only saw this from the Danube on a boat trip, but what a stunning looking building it is.
Need to go back at some point and see inside!

Take a tour if you have kids, must see!. We took a tour in spanish (depending on the language you want, there are specific timetables. We didnt reserve beforehand and had no problem just buying the tickets at the location. Our guide spoke perfect spanish and was very patient with the kids, answering all of their questions and giving them fun facts. Our tour was around 6:30 pm and I dont know if earlier on there are a lot of people but we were the only ones there which was great. There is a lot of security so be prepared to leave you backpack in storage. My kids really learned a lot in this quick and easy tour. They do not drag a too much boring history into it making it easy to remember the most important information.

Interesting but had I paid more for the tour I would be disappointed. I thought the building was very pretty and the tour was somewhat interesting, but had I paid more for it I would have been disappointed. We were on the English tour and the tour guide was a little rude. I think the view from the river was beautiful but I wouldn't necessary recommend the tour.
Breathtaking. The Parliament building is a must see if you are in Budapest. You must view it during the day and evening for sure
Stunning architecture. Didn't go in, but hopefully my pictures will speak for themselves. Taken day and night from different points.
Nice view from the other side of the river. This building is one of the most impressive ones that i ever saw. The view on it from the other side of the river is simply stunning.
Amazing architecture. Whilst on a river cruise, we were lucky enough to berth opposite the Parliament.What wonder architecture. In the night it's lit up. Amazing

It is fantastic from outside but from the inside as well . The Parliament is spectacular from outside but the inside is really nice and interesting. The guided tours are the only option to visit it so I'd suggest you to check on Internet the time and tickets availability. Bring you proof of Id with you :if you are European you will be entitled to a substantial discount.
Gorgeouse. This place isnt just beautiful on the outside... It truely shines from all the preserved and restored gems from the austrio hungarian empire!! What a treat!!

Don't hesitate - book a tour of this fabulous building!. The modern visitors' center makes the logistics of a tour of the Parliament building simple, and the tour itself is spectacular. We took a guided tour in English, using the remote headsets that allow you to hear the guide's comments as long as you are in proximate range. When his voice started to break up - it meant it was time to stop gawking and get moving!! But, there was so much to gawk at! The interior is wonderful, with complex and sophisticated late 19th century decorations in revival Gothic and Renaissance styles. The tour includes a stop in the breathtaking dome room, where the crown of St. Stephen is on display. That experience - being in that space, and being close to that artifact - is worth the price of admission in an of itself. Then, you get to see the incredibly ornate assembly hall, as well as other impressive interior spaces and views out the windows across the Danube. Wonderful!After finishing the tour of the building proper, the tour lets out into a very well-done and very informative gallery of information about the building, with many great videos, animations, and other impressive didactics. I loved this part of the tour - extremely well done!All in all, I would say a trip to Budapest could not be complete without a visit to this historic and beautiful building.

One of the most beautiful buildings you'll ever see.. We did the tour of the parliament building having seen it several times from the river Danube. We had pre-booked our tickets which seemed to save time at the entrance area which was very busy. You have to go through the usual security as you would expect with a parliament buidling. The tour turned out to be really fascinating. The guide was amusing and informative without droning on. The building was mind-blowingly beautiful. Rich, guilded, well decorated corridors, rooms and staircases were all explained as well as one of the parliament chambers. The building offers photo opportunities aplenty. The tour is quite cheap too (for EU states) and well worth the money. This is one of the highlights of a Budapest trip. Definitely recommended.

Stunning Architecture. Budapest really is a city for lovers of interesting architecture, and the Parliament building is no exception. This iconic building is often feature in adverts for European river cruises, and it is not surprising when one actually sees it. Overlooking the Danube, the facade needs to be seen from several angles, so don't just walk around it it, visit Buda and see it from the Fisherman's Bastion, and then take a night cruise along the river and see it lit up. It really is stunning.It is at the rear on Parliament Square that the action happens, and if you time it well, you will see the changing of the guard. The square also contains a number of older buildings and a couple of museums. Wander around the square and take in the history. Som of the buildings still have the bullet scars and there is an underground museum dedicate to the 1956 revolution.
Magnificent. We have seen this great building both from the street and from the riverside. It is recommended to make a trip by the boat at night when the lighting is on.
