Beautiful Building. Obviously, this is a special building as it is the Hungarian Parliament. However, there are so many beautiful buildings in Budapest and this is another one. It is a very impressive building, near the Danube. Once you are there - visit the Shoes on the Danube memorial place which is unique.
The best is to see from the other side of the Danube. We saw it both during day, from Buda, and from a night cruise in the Danube. Both views are spectacular, far better than seeing it close.
Magnificent Building. This building has a commanding presence on the river as we cruised into Budapest. It is even more impressive at night, lit up and accented. The best view is from the river!
Amazing building. Had morning conducted tour. Very interesting history. Would recommend booking as gets very busy later in the day.

30 min tour, not worth the non EU price. 30 min tour, 2 rooms, non EU members pay more (5200 HUF) than twice what EU members pay (2200 HUF)It's a beautiful building but you experience nothing from the tour that you cvs the by reading the history and looking at pictures in tripadvisor.
Well worth the walk. Relaxed walk on a Sunday meant not as many people around. An impressive building with clean tidy surroundings. Handy benches meant we could sit down and enjoy

Pristine! . Beautiful Building! We went on Sunday and it was so quiet, hardly any tourists. Very easy to get and has such beautiful architecture. This is the biggest Parliament in the world and they keep it so clean and tidy! Pristine! A must on your itinerary for Budapest!

Outside visit. A great house.
What a building, it is magnific.
We dig not visit the inside.
Don't miss it at nighttime

Just outside . The building and plaza are beautiful, I was able to see the sunset sitting on a bench just to the left of the parliament and it was awesome. I didn't go inside because the tours were a little bit expensive but overall a great experience.

Fascinating tour!. Excellent, excellent tour! From a brief history lesson to seeing the crown/sceptre/orb/sword of the former monarchs, our guide was knowledgeable and entertaining. The only mar on the experience was buying the tickets. We wanted the last two tickets for the 10:45 tour but were told, "No! 11:15." The board behind her showed two more tickets for the 10:45 tour and, in fact, the people behind us in line ended up getting those spots. Then the woman told us to be in line for security 45 minutes before our tour; in reality it was 5 minutes. Her rudeness made me regret buying a ticket but I'm glad I waited. I highly recommend this tour!

Beautiful site!. We loved walking by the parliament both day and night. What an amazing place to seeing photograph. We did a free walking tour where our guide explained the amazing history of this building including a story of why the EU flag is missing.
Fairytale building . Looks different in the day and at night. The night view was very beautiful, looks like a castle floating in the air. Very fairytale. Must see attraction.

Nice and interesting. Our concierge booked the tour. EU residents get a big reduction. Nice tour through the building. Exhibition at the end. Beautiful and impressive building. Entrance at visitors centre at the north of the building, below street level.
Amazing place. This place will take your breath away. It has so many details . The place looks like was just built.
Good Tour. Highly recommended to visit and see the inside of the parliament. took lots of pictures and learn a thing or two about the parliament.

Interesting architecture during the day, amazing view at night . The Parliament is one of the most photographed buildings in the country. That should stop you from taking a few of your own. Lights come on at 19:30.

Nice visit. The Parliament visit was interesting and worth visiting when in Budapest. Be sure to make reservations in advance of your trip. Tours are given in small groups and by the language in which you choose.

Iconic!. We only saw the outside, as the English speaking tours were filled. This is a beautiful building. Behind it are many other gov't buildings, with a wide variety of styles. Gardens abound. Lots of fun to compare and contrast the styles. Easy to spot the Russian influenced ones.The colors of this building change during the day, providing great interest.This is very near the Shoes of the Danube monument, as well as the Nagy statue on the bridge memorial.
Beautiful at Night. The building is a solid piece of European architecture. However from the river at night it looks like a story from fairyland. It is one of the most beautiful sights in Europe.
Great architecture . Great place to vist at day and night. Hamg out around the parliament on the chairs and enjoy the view. Relax atmosphere in the heart of the city.
Worth seing. We go to Budapest quite often. Around 3-5 times per year. And we always have joy to have a possibility to discover this marvellous place again and again.
Architectural MUST GO . I think anyone would be amazed. But I'm an architecture student and I went with my mother, an architect, and it was almost a religious experience. Amazing

Inspirational. The Parliament in Budapest is a beautiful stately building overlooking the Danube, and it embodies all the aspirations to freedom and democracy that Hungary has struggled for throughout its history. It is a place of pride and dignity, admirably designed, in the centre of this very clean and green city, Fascinating!

Beautiful. The Parliament was so huge and an amazing site. Sits on the Danube and at night the lights are just lovely. Worth visiting during the day or taking a boat down the Danube at night to see lit up.

Amazing! . Although I only have seen the outside of Parliament, I can tell you it is worth seeing. It's one of the most beautiful buildings I have ever seen and at night it is even more beautiful when it is all lit up. The lights reflect in the water. If you take a stroll on the opposite side of the Danube, you can get a great view of Parliament while walking along the river. Highly recommended to see when you go to Budapest!

Take the tour in the day, boat trip at night. I'd recommend taking the short guided tour. The inside is very interesting, the decor beautiful. And while the building is beautiful during the day, it's stunning at night especially from the river. Take one of the many boat tours at night to see it.

Fun Hungarian activity . We did this on our first day and I thoroughly enjoyed it. I thought it was an hour tour but was actually 1/2 an hour. It's nice to get a bit of history and the tour man we had looked professional (in a suit) and the mic they have means you can hear them clearly (always a worry when you're in a tour group). Nice thing to do in Hungary - make sure you book in advance though!It's not a "rock up on the day" type tour.

Beautiful. I have seen this last year from a distance at night .I wanted to see it from close up and during the day.I hear that the White House is a bold building in the USA but this is just staggering,I did not go inside on a tour but just admired the structure and what was around it.I loved the flag pole displaying the flag and the 2 soldiers in parade uniform guarding it.The statues around it was a siteI only wish these statues and many others in Budapest had English writing so you could get the real spence of what they are for

Tourism. Extremely beautiful architecturally and aesthetically. It's location on the bank of Denube is mesmerizing. It's a very well kept building & manicured surroundings are a treat for all visitors. The guided tour is a must for all adult tourists. All languages are catered for by making different groups. Must carry your passport and immerse yourself in this nice tour. The " Shoes Memorial" is close by which should be visited too. There is a change of guard every hour too. So enjoy your tour of this third largest Parliament in the world.
Parliament. Great building, took the tour indoors and took great pictures from the dinner cruise at night time and went across to the Budda side and took picture from the castle district.

Must visit inside. Needless to say the building is stunning from the outside, but it's true glory comes to life when you see the opulent interiors. Important: ALL visits inside are guided. You will need to pick the slot for your language. For this purpose, book in advance online. Also EU citizens and students get a discount so carry your IDs.

Visually Great from River. This is a magnificent structure. It is lit at night and is a must see building. Inside it is full of decorations and well presented. The inside tour is nothing to write home about as there are heaps of wonderful buildings to see inside in the area. If you are into history and politics you would love it.

Magnificent. A must visit for all travellers to Budapest. It's quite impossible to miss this building. It's a grandiose structure, very detailed, a real treat for architecture lovers. The best view of it is from the Buda side of the Danube, or to take a boat ride (private od D12 public line) a have real good look at it. Marvelous!

Beautiful. We did not actually manage to go around the building as we had short time but after seeing it on the boat tour I wanted to get closer to it for a better viewing. The architecture is gorgeous.
Stunning. Absolutely stunning building and it is definitely worth seeing when you are in Budapest! The architecture and the views are just beautiful!

Quite the History lesson!. We did not pay for a guided tour but did spend a lot of time in both the underground exhibits : the stone masonry and the memorial. Both are very well explained in writing and photographs, and the docents are very knowledgeable. Very few people around at all so picture taking was very easy. Do not miss the Shoes on the Danube which are displayed just south of the Parliament Buildings - another very thought provoking display.
Astonishing . Probably the prettiest sight of the World, huge yet finely detailed building. The tour is a bit basic though.
The parliament building is a master piece of architecture. Very spectacular from the land and from the water during daylight or by night when it led . It is a must see attraction
Phenomenal. What an amazing piece of architecture, a must for a photo opportunity, best view from the boat cruise, truly phenomenal !!
Nothing exceptional.. Says it all really. Obviously it's incredibly historically significant. Apart from that though... well it's the same as any number of other administrative centres.
Impressive architechture. It was a very quick stop, as part of the day tour that I took from Vienna. The building is so majestic and impressive. A must stop for visitors to Budapest

Parliament building. Close to the centre on the Pest side, a short walk up the river and situated on the bank of the river. Spectacular buildings and although we were not allowed entry we spent a good quarter of an hour in the surrounds.

Surprisingly good!. My mother in law booked tickets on the off chance we may want to go and we were really pleased she did. Guides are very knowledgeable and helpful. The interior is as spectacular as the exterior.
Spectacular. The tour is a must. Great audio with earpiece that fits comfortably. A most magnificent building. The lift option rather than100 plus stairs helped the Achilles !!

A beautiful sight!. I think it is more beautiful than the castle. It is very nice to see from the bridge at night. I wish my camera could capture what I saw in real life, but the photos don't do it justice.

Stunning!. This majestic building sits right beside the Danube River on the Pest side. It may be one of the best photo opportunities in the city, especially after dark and from the opposite side of the river!

Don't miss taking the tour!. The inside of the Parliament building is exquisite. The coronation heels are housed here & are guarded. We witnessed the changing of the guards. You are not allowed to take pictures in that room. The chambers room is amazing! Two locals at our hotel said it was their favorite building in Budapest to visit. Glad we did. It's a very short walk along the river from the Shoe Memorial and beyond that The Chain Bridge.
Tour of Parliament. This was interesting and the building is beautiful, but I would have preferred to spend my time walking around Budapest are

Very interesting place. Extremely reasonable ticket prices, especially for EU citizens. Just over £6 each. Very knowledgeable guide on the tour, beautiful buildings and fascinating history. One not to be missed if you visit Budapest!
No wonder No 1 tourist attention. Really very beautiful and a must go place if you visit Budapest !Magnificent view,and a great place to take photos !

I can't beleive how wonderful is the Parliament Building. Do not miss a posibility to see the Parliament building from the boat on the Danube. Tipp: take a Hopp on Hoff of or any siteseeing bus ticked with extra boat trip!
Magnificent architecture. What a beautiful site to witness the beautiful architectural structure. It is right on the Danube. River and by the memorial of shoes which is another go see.

Very good place to visit. Parliament of Budapest is one of the most famous attractions that you can visit. In my opinion you are obliged to see this. Its architecture is amazing and its builded with a lot of details on it.

Parliament tour. This is expensive for non EU for 45 min tour but it is a fantastic interior. Worth doing. Also take time to look at the exhibition at the end about the building and maintenance. Can listen in different languages.BTW the visitors centre is at the north end of parliament building and recessed in to the ground so can be a bit hard to locate if you are running late.
Don't Miss!!!. סיור נהדר, קצר ומעניין. יש הנחה לסטודנטים גם אם התעודה בעברית.Very interesting tour maybe it's better to book the tickets in advance.

One of THE places to visit of course... Pretty from both sides we enjoyed the military marches etc on St Stephens day here as well as the fireworks at night. Bota tpurs offer a nice river view as well...
Beautiful. We thought we could take tours throughout the day but you must make a reservation as they were sold out sadly! Next time.
Beautiful. This parliament house is the most beautiful in Europe, the place is lit up be night and is just brilliant.

This place looks great!. The view is amazing, especially during the night. The illumination is simply breath taking.
I did not take the tour, it just doesn't seem to worth it.
Stunning!. Just amazing! We didn't go inside or anything but went you see it from the river at night it is breathtaking!!!

Tour of Parliament. Although it was a little expensive for the tour (around $20) we thought it was worth the price. The tour guide gave us an informative tour and the building itself is beautiful. If you do get the tour the small museum inside the Parliament is included. I recommend taking the time to go through the small museum either before or after your tour, and get an audio guide. The museum includes a lot of information about the history of Hungary and its transition from a monarchy to a Communist government to a republic. My husband doesn't always like museums and he even liked it. If you do want to take the Parliament tour you need to reserve it ahead of time because they do sell out. You can reserve and pay for your tour on the Parliament's website.

Beautiful building. This is best seen by night, preferably form the river. We saw is at about 10pm as were were sailing into Budapest on a river cruise. The seagulls flying overhead and catching the lights is like a fairy show.

Excellent tour!. We had a chance to tour the magnificent parliament building during our stay in Budapest. Tickets are available in advance on-line, or by standing in a queue on the day of the tour. Tours are given at different times, in different languages. We were lucky and able to get tickets for an afternoon tour at the last minute. But we suggest you either buy yours in advance, or go early in the day

Beautiful at night from the outdoors, beautiful inside during the day. We first saw this place at night from "The Spoon Cafe & Lounge" where we were having dinner. It looked amazing with all of the lights on it. The tour during the next day was wonderful. Such an impressive interior.

Fascinating - remember to book in advance. You have to book in advance on their website for an English speaking tour. It's really cheap while we're still in the EU, and under 24s are half price. Worked out about £20 for 4 of us.Beautiful building and excellent tour guide . You can take photos except in the dome with the Crown Jewels.A must if you're in Budapest
Reserve tickets online. Incredible tour; you MUST reserve tickets early or you can't take the tour. Well worth the visit. Be sure and look also at the October 25, 1956 memorial outside the Parliment.
Beautiful. What an amazing building. Not so far from the river. The building is beautiful. Great architecture and huge. I did not go inside as it was closed but the surrounding area is a must.

Beautiful!!. A must see in this city, beautiful building inside and out. Take the time to do the interior tour but get your admission tickets in advance. Also see it at night from the Buda side of the river-spectacular!!!

Stunning building. The building is simply stunning inside and out. Definitely worth a visit when you're in Budapest.
The public tour of the building is very nice, but I wish there was a bit more to it. Are there other public areas that could be shown?
Great . Definitly worth to see by night, especially in front of (the next side of the river). Sometimes its closed due to the official events.

The second biggest Parliament in Europe. My rating is based only for the outside tour, great location close to the city centre with a very beautiful arhitecture.If you go to Budapest you definetly have to add this to your schedule.
Must see.. Over-the-top lavish building, dripping in gold leaf and architectural details. Hungary's crown jewels are there, too. Worth the tour.

Beautiful and well worth the ticket price. I almost skipped this because a government building sounded sort of ho-hum for a vacation. This one isn't what you think. The guide said the idea, more than 100 years ago when it was proposed and created, was to give Hungarians something to be really proud of and in that, for people who enjoy architecture as a kind of cultural expression, it really works. Our guide was brief, but it was the last tour of the day and perhaps most of us were too weary to ask questions!

Grandios building. The size of this building is unbelieveable. And the architecture is fantastic. The surrounding area is nice, clean and quiet. So sit down and relax. We were there at 18:30, and a ceremony started. They were taking down the flag and carrying it away. Nice little thing to watch :)
The most beautiful sight, especially at night. It's not surprising that the view of the Budapest Parliament is one of the most common used to promote Danube River tours. It is truly stunning.
Beautiful. Beautiful building with great architecture. Amazing view on Parliament open on the other side of the river
Amazing. Amazingly beautiful construction, at day and at night. The lights are a delight for the eyes! Must see
Must see at night. This is a beautiful building. Third largest in Europe. It must be seen at night all lit up and birds circling above.
Must see Budapest site. This is a must-see in Budapest. It is certainly one the highlights of our trip to Budapest. The hallways stairs, ceilings, walls were exquisite.
Open for free on 20th of August. It's stunningly beautiful on the outside and every bit on the inside. Well worth the wait in the queue.
Amazing!. We took a guided tour in the parliament, it was amazing. In the evening I recommend to walk by the Danube river, Parliament looks even better when spotlighted.

Enjoyable experience but could be even better..... Once you get inside the Parliament, you won't be disappointed by the splendour of the public areas. The history is interesting and the decoration stunning. However, the online booking process was very complicated and we initially struggled to find the entrance in the large maze of the buildings. Our guide also seemed a little unfriendly and scripted. Lastly, expect to have yo pay for the inside toilets despite your entrance fee!
Nice building, got to watch change of guards. Was just lucky to see the change of guards. The building and the plants outside were very nice. Didn't do the tour, but the exterior is amazing itself.
Stunning. Not to be missed on your trip to Budapest! The Parliament buildings are situated on the beautiful Danube River and are stunning at night!!
Beautiful Capital bilding. A beutiful, building, and worth the tour. I highly recommend buying tickets online. There is a nice free museum inside the ticket area.

Impresive building. What an impressive and beautiful building. The architecture is stunning and you can walk all the way around this building. The dome is massive. There is a large flag in front of the building with 2 guards who sometimes do a walk, nice to see.

Huge and beautiful . It's huge.. beautiful and catches the eye.. it said that this is the third largest parliament in the world..
One of the best way to look at it is from the Danube river.. during river cruise.. by thus way you can also see the whole city from the river
Amazing building. When you are here, make pictures off it and also join the guided tour. So you can see the Parliament building inside. Amazing!

Stunning Building. Went in the morning just in time to see changing of the guards. A breathtaking building. Very majestic. Guards were actually very friendly as they offered the public to take pictures with them afterwards. Worth a visit

Stunning. Stunning architecture. If you are interested in parliamentary affairs and history then a visit to the parliament is worth a visit. The tour is short.. Just about 45 minutes and we are shown one part off the parliament.. Great frescoes, paintings and sculptures.One can also see the crown and sceptre.The tour guide also explains you how the parliament session is conducted.While booking tickets online one had to pay convenience charge but well worth it..Please book your tickets way in advance

Stunning architecture . The Parlament is definitely the most attractive building in Budapest even if there are plenty of other superb buildings too see too. The Parlament is seen in all it's splendour from the city tour buses and we enjoyed the view from the dinner cruise boat. It is a pitty we did not have time enough for the visit to the Parlament.

Lots of spires. Impressive building, looks like a fancy birthday cake with lots of spires. Similar in style to London's Houses of Parliament. Surrounding area is very clean and spacious. Can't comment on the interior as I was on a Segway tour around the perimeter.
A must see!. Amazing guided tour though the main part of the building. worth a visit, though it is costly. Stay for the changing of the guards.
Ok. You have to buy your ticket in advance. For later on the same day at the ticket office or in the internet for later.

Beautiful architecture. If you are in budapest, you should definately visit the Parliament. The architecture is amazing but if you are travelling on a budget, it would be enough to enjoy it from outside. The indoor tour isn't that fullfilling.
Stunning architecture. We didn't go inside but this stunning building is a must see when you visit Budapest, particularly when viewed from a boat on the Danube and particularly when lit up at night.

Don't miss this fantastic building. When we first visited Budapest couldn't get in here as tickets are available for guided tours but English tours are only every hour or so. This time bought online and you get discount too. (2000 hungarian florints) +small booking fee.The place is just fantastic both inside and outside.The tour tales about 45 mins and you get to see the Commons. The staircase is impressive but the Dome takes some beating as it contains the gold crown which only found it's way back to Hungary from the USA in 1978. The Americans having taken it after the war.There are 132 steps up to main hall but there is also a lift so don't be put off.Our English speaking guide was very good.At 11.30am we saw the soldiers give a marching display outside and you can take pics.We were lucky to take a rivr cruise and pass this building at night when it's lit up. Stunning.You can take pics inside except in crown jewels room.

Beautiful, by day and night. Not everywhere you get to see the Parliament of a country up so close. It's build in a huge area by the river. Even on a sunny day, the wind is strong (beware of wearing skirts and dresses :). I did that mistake) Luckily the place isn't crowded a lot, so you can sit on one of the benched and admire the architecture for long. Then you can stand by the river side railing and enjoy the endless view of the Danube. Must see!

A must see, largest Parliament building around. You cannot tour the inside on your own so please buy a guided tour ticket, do this on line to save the long lines that can be found throughout the day. You will not be disappointed.

You must too see the Parliament House. Buy one, two, or week transport ticket from airport, tourist information. Be careful there is two kinds ticket. Buy just transport. You can use the ticket directly from airport and it is very cheap.
Main landmark. The Parliament is definitely the main landmark in Budapest and it is just amazing. The view from the other side of the river is also fantastic either during day and night.
Wow! What a beautiful building!. Really enjoyed it - one of the most beautiful sights in Europe for sure. A must when in Budapest. Must take a boat trip to fully admire it.

Imposing building. Very impressive building and beautifully lit at night. You are advised to see the change of the guards guarding the Hungarian flag just opposite of the dome. I visited on the 20th of August, on which entrance is free of charge. Needless to say the line was ENORMOUS.Tram line 2 drops you right outside.

Stunningly beautiful and intersting, worth a visit,includes tours in several different languages. We bought our tickets online, for a specific time, with a guide. It saves waiting in line and waiting for your assigned time. The guide was fabulous and the Parliament is stunning.
You have to see it. We didn't go in, but even just visiting the outside is totally worth it. And it's just off the M3 or 2 lines so it's easy to get to.
Amazing bulding. The Parliament is really nice from outside, but the prices are different for local and tourists, Europeen and non Europeen.

Beautiful building. We didn't go inside but I didn't feel I had missed out. We went during the day and walked past it on an evening. Can recommend. The view from across the river is stunning - like a gold jewel.
Most beautiful place I've ever seen. I just loved this building, so beautiful! The nicest building ever. It's just such a lovely style of architecture, do not miss seeing this.

Lovely building, not much to do inside.. A must visit when in Budapest. To make sure you get tickets i would recommend booking online before hand as the first day we tried it was fully booked and almost missed out. Ticket price is very cheap £3-£5 each with an English speaking tour guide, the tour lasts roughly 30 mins and you get to see one side of the building. Some great photos to take and a must see whilst in Budapest
View from the River. We saw this amazing building whilst on a boat trip and you certainly get the best view of it from the river.
Mesmerising!!!. Absolutely fantastic building.Do not miss to see in the night.It's a nice walk alongside the Danube River.it's one of the most majestic buildings on earth.

The architecture is really nice!. Both views from land and danube are wonderful and romantic. Surely, you can't skip it visiting Budapest. Check the places around the square too. I suggest the nocturne view.

Can't miss this! . Definitely one of the highlights. This neo-gothic building is just about 100 years old and be historically speaking not be very important in terms of architecture history, however after its recently completed renovation it looks very beautiful with its clean sparkling white stone facade

A must see. Very nice building based on the Palace of Westminster on the river bank. A very nice piece of architecture. We did a night tour and it is very well lit at night. It is also worth paying for a tour of the inside of the parliament. Please remember to take your passport with you as there is a discount for EU citizens. You get to see the crown jewels and also the house of commons. Would visit again.

Stunning outside and inside.. My only criticism of this otherwise excellent tour was the chaos on arrival. The Visitors' Centre is noisy, and when announcements are made, they are inaudible. No-one knows where to queue.... If tour leaders could hold up large signs rather than make announcements no one can hear, that would be much better! The tour itself was very good - most informative. It was nice to be able to take photographs (except of the Crown), and there was plenty of time to take in the stunning interior.
Very nice . Good looking on the outside and inside. Tour is good and not expensive. Takes a little less than an hour.

One of the most beautiful parliaments. They say that it is one of the most beautiful parliaments in the world and they are right. The building looks very nice and you can even go inside with the tour guide.
One of the hints is to go there during evening, the view on the Parliament is spectacular

Mrs. While we was there we had the pleasure of going inside the parliament where all of the politicians sit and make the important decisions..the architect is fantastic. Our tour guide was fantastic very knowledgeable about it all . We even had the chance to go onto the balcony which is along the river . The sights was fantastic.
Cool building and easily to find.. This old parliament house is a structure of beauty and wonder. Great spot to get some holiday snaps in.
Imposing building worth the view. We did not get inside as it was the time of annual independence day celebrations, but the building is an imposing one on the water edge.
Must see - beautiful outside and inside. Parliament is beautiful from outside and inside. The golden decoration is just amazing. The visit is guided and gives you a lot of information.

Wow, just Wow!. This building is the most majestic structure in Budapest. Located on the Pest side of the Danube, it is little more than 100 years old, but her neo-gothic design feigns 1000 years of history. She is cared for like a rich aging relative, respected and protected. Outside, this building shows off massive peaks, pitches, arches, and a grand dome. At night she is lit up proudly and is breathtaking to behold.Inside the Parliament building is equally magnificent. Ceilings and columns are gilded. Arched doorways are intricately carved. Stained glass, as lovely as you have ever seen, was designed by a Jewish artist who was at the time was free to include abundant symbolism of his faith. Fortunately, during times of war the glass was removed and hidden for protection. The Parliament chambers are not unlike ours in CA, only 50% more beautiful. We were surprised to see real crown of Hungarian on display in the dome room. More than 1000 years old, it has been lost and stolen untold times. Most recently, the U.S. held it at Fort Knox until the end of communist occupation. President Jimmy Carter returned it the Budapest in 1978. In the basement of the building is a small museum that includes the giant red glass star of communism that had been placed on the dome from 1949 to 1989. We gasped to see it, and appreciate it was not displayed proudly, but rather partially obscured from view to diminish its appeal.
Gorgeous view. If you are in Budapest I highly recommend seeing Parliament from the river and especially at night. It is truly spectacular!

Amazing sight. There are soldiers doing routine in the morning so it was good to watch. Nighttime was absolutely beautiful from the other side as the sunset was behind it and it reflected in the river (photographer here, its an amazing shot). Just take the M2 one stop and you're there.

Beautiful architecture at its finest . Stunning building. Missed out on the opportunity to do the guided tour inside but it was worth the visit all the same. The external facade of the building is amazing up close, both bathed in sunshine during the day or illuminated at night - look out for the bats that swarm around the dome too after dark.

What a spetacular monument!. The building is amazing. The history behind it is very interesting, you can read all about it in the exhibition in the basement. Do take the tour inside it is as beautiful as it shows from the outside. Two negatives that I have to say is that the girl in the information booth didn't talk English, we tried to ask her what time the tour was starting and the second is that the tour guide wasn't speaking clear English. I think it would be easier to just read a written guide. The tour guide is included in the ticket.

Beautiful building both by day and night. The Parliament building is magnificent and is a must see during the day and when it is light up at night. (Views from the Danube river cruises allow you to see the building in all it glory). The tour around Parliament allowed us to see the beauty of the building inside, the tour guide was friendly and informative. I would definitely recommend doing a tour, be warned you may have to wait as they get booked up. We had to wait just over an hour for a tour in English. ( They have tours in a number of other languages available).

Amazing place. We have been there by tourists guide which was through hotel concierge as u can go there and there is tour-guide too tickets are same price from hotel or from windows by the way European citizens got discount tickets ..very clear English language they do speak and so nice people there .

Worth a visit. The inside of the Parliament is even more impressive than the outside. Inside you can see the original St. Stephen's Crown and the parliament chambers. A visit needs to be booked in advance, if English is your language a pre-booking online is advised. EU citizens get a discount, large bags are not allowed.

Impressive architecture. We had a walk around the Parliament area, and it is an impressive thing to see. 691 rooms would have been too much to grapple with in the heat, so we stayed on the outside. This is also a good spot to board tram no. 2, which travels along a rather scenic route.
A Truly Beautiful Building. Whether night or day, this is a stupendous looking building. Passing on the boat at night is a real highlight as it is superbly lit up.

Great. Looks great and fantastic we have been the building as if in western super power country and the design and all of the details are just fine we like this building and feel proud for Hungarian people to keep well
Beautiful building. Must see during the day and in the evening worth an evening boat trip to admire from Danube easy to reach on foot in daytime
Beautiful. The Parliament Building is beautiful, both inside and out. Our guided tour took 45 minutes and the guide was knowledgeable and funny. The view at night is stunning.

Parliament in Hungary. . Please see this place during the day , as well to see in front of it on the river side , the Jewish shoe memorial permanent art exhibit. At night take the boat tour and see it lit up. Truly wonderful
Beautiful day and night. Lovely place we managed to catch changing of the guards outside too! Beautiful views available from the Danube river cruises

The second best Parliament building in the world. OK I like Westminster the best but this is a simply stunning wonder of the world. A great stroll along the Danube for me the building I liked the most out of so many in beautiful Budapest.

Absolutely Amaizng. Take the Danube cruise at sunset and see the majesty of this beautiful piece of architecture.
Before you can walk around it but you can definitely see it as whole from the river

well worth a visit. Recommend a visit here but pre book your tour so you don't need to queue. Outside areas impressive and if you time visit to guard change they will let you pose with the guards. Word of warning please don't try taking photographs in crown jewel room you will be stopped by guards. Despite big notices some still tried it on!

Great building, nice visite. The building is very interesting, it´s worth visiting even though the entry is quite high (and there is a difference between the entry for european and non-european citizens which we found really wierd!). Our guide was kind and her speech was interesting BUT the visit was really short! It didn´t even take 30 minutes!
a must see while in budapest. largest building, you can see it from the Danuber river cruise. walking around is free but to get inside you have to pay.

The Jewel in the Crown. Built facing the Danube, the is a resplendent, majestical building and a must see for any visitor to Budapest. You would be hard pushed not to see it once you find the Danube! It is the probably the most photographed attraction in the city, both day and night. Work was started on the construction in 1885 and completed in 1904. You really have to reflect on the fact that over 1000 people were employed in it's construction, using 40 million bricks, half a million precious stones and 88 kilos of gold and all this over a hundred years ago! If travelling to the city and you want to tour the building it is best to research it via Google and book your tickets, in advance online. Trying to buy tickets on the day, at the Parliament can be a bit hit and miss and tours are often sold out.
Tours. Must see... just do it on you own no need to buy a tour online. Go there and buy your ticket. A guide from there will lead the tour anyway

Unique inside and out. The building is even more amazing by inside. More beautiful parliament I have ever seem. They have also a cool museum inside (free). The parliament is full of gold red marble, gothic arquitecture and barroque sculptures. Impressive. The surronding area is really beautiful in a sunny day.
beaufitul. Magnificent buiding this was opposite our hotel you can get to it quickly by takinf the underground which is a 2 min walk from the hotel
good!. what a splendid architecture it is! I recommend that you can reserve on internet before you go. That can save your time.

nighttime visit to Parliament. unbelievable - all lit up in gold lights. The birds flying above the building were also bathed in gold lights, it was surreal watching dozens of gold birds - like stars flying above us.

Worth the visit. Brilliant architecture and interiors. Worth a visit. Be prepared to climb stairs. Knowledgeable guide. Late 19th century so has a gothic medieval pre Raphaelite style. Lots of pattern and colour. Fabulous!

Fantastic!. One of the best buildings I have ever seen! If you see it during the night you will be remember this forever! Thank God the Government didn't sell it to Michael Jackson when he wanted to buy it...
Spotless . I have travelled with my friends and we took a ride with a boat which was definitely worth it! The building of the Parlament looks even more beautiful at night hours.
Awesome. Awesome and majestic both outside and inside...especially by night...the ticket includes a guided tour in many languages.

Looks amazing. . The view from across the danube is awesome. And even more when you get around too in front off the building. There is a tour that you can do. But it does cost more for non eu citezens. The arcitecture from outside is amazing and worth a stroll here.

Extremely overrated. Save the money and skip the tour.. We took the guided tour at 5,400 HUF (non EU-pricing) after it came highly recommended to us by a local. We left incredibly disappointed, and wished we had spent our time and money elsewhere. While the three rooms you get to see are beautiful, the tour is actually only a brief 20 minutes (half the 45 minute tour is getting the group set up and walking to the rooms) and covers a really small portion of the building. Honestly, save your money. Budapest is a spectacular city, the tour of the parliament is not.

So beautiful. Great to go look at, the area is lovely. Loved watching the guards walking around the flag. Definitely go look at it at night time and help me decide if there are swarms of bats or birds circling the upper dome!
Big like westminster. Big beauty building .Good view from the river taxi or from the bridge.Didn't been inside Nice to sit down close to it
must to visit when you are in Budapest. Nice guided tour for English speaking guide, she gave all detail of parliament building. Corridors halls very beautiful and will keep you clicking photos
Beautiful . One of the most beautiful buildings in the world! Stunning, I could stare it for hours, especially from Buda side. It worths a visit in the evening, the lights are breathtaking.

The only Parliament Tour that you need to pay (5400HUK) for non-EC nationals.. The actual (current) Lower House was not shown to us, unlike many Parliament Tours I've joined (Cardiff, Stockholm, Vienna). Very short only 30 mins.

2 hour wait for a free visit is NOT WORTH IT.. Probably a good place to visit if you have a tour booked but not if its open for free on one of Hungary's special holidays. If we had known the queue was going to be 2 hours and we would march through in 15 minutes we would not have gone. Would have died of thirst in the baking sun watching the soldiers parade around and music toot away apart from that a kindly man gave us two plastic bags of water.

My Recent Visit. The Parliament Building and grounds are really impressive to view and are lit up beautifully at night. You need to walk a bit to get there but it is by the river and worth the effort. Many other sites along the way such as the chain bridge.
Tour. Walking tour of Parliament Bldg., good guide, very ornate, Baroque style, very similar to English Parliament.
#1. Went across the river to look at the building from the distance at night - spent about 2 hours just sitting there. Definitely #1 in Budapest.
Beautiful and boring. Overrated, the part you are allowed to see is tiny and honestly its more expensive than it is worth. admire the guards and the outside and move along

Simpy amazing. This is #1 thing to do in Budapest for a reason. Parliament building is so impressive. Make sure you do go inside for a short 45 min guided tour because the inside is equally impressive as the outside (if not more). You will also hear a lot about the history of this magnificent structure. Highly recommend.
Beautiful history!. Very informative tour guides made this tour just perfect! We loved hearing all the history about the parliament.

Bats. We didn't go inside just walked around outside what a beautiful building, we stayed in a hotel just over the river and every night once it got dark the lights all lit up the parliament then the bats came out hundreds and hundreds of them fascinating to see

Inspirational Roman Architecture. We visited the Parliament during the day, with free entry to the museum. The Inside tour of Parliament building is a paid attraction with guided tour. The Museum inside the Parliament is free to enter and is worth visiting if you like to know History of Hungary, the Turkish influence, the Russian influence etc... The lady at the cafe inside the visitor centre of Parliament building was very very rude. She also tries to cheat tourists by overcharging for coffees and teas. Check your bill if you eat or drink here.

Great, really enjoyed it. Would recommend, very grand building, booked a guided tour, was fantastic as we had good quality ear pieces, also was not a long tour, so not too much information to absorb, about 45 minutes so just right for us

Superb Building with Tour. The magnificent Parliament Building is well worth a visit. We arrived early and queued to buy tickets for the next English Tour. We had about an hours wait which was fine because we could walk around the outside of the building and admire the wonderful architecture. The tour guide spoke excellent English and the tour itself was very interesting and informative without overpowering you with too much information. The outside of Parliament Building is wonderfully lit during the evening.

Incredible . The architecture of the parliament is actually incredible and each time I've been to Budapest I've gone back to look around the parliament If you are a member of the EU you can have a free tour around the inside of the parliament too! It's definitely worth a visit!
Our Budapest trip. What an amazing building, really can't say anymore than that.Go and have a close up look you really will not be disappointed.
Parliament at night is very beautiful. Amazing experience on a legenda boat cruise by night and we saw this enormous building lit up. it was amazing.. have some good pics from the river.
Probably the most fabulous looking parliament anywhere in the world!. Very beautiful building. The white house of usa or parliament building in the uk can only dream of beating these looks

Spectacular bulding. Booked it online via parliament website and printed out own tickets. Admission process was very chaotic. Multiple tours were being called at the same time, we could barely hear what was being said and entry took about 10-12 minutes after the scheduled time of tour. Having arrived early, we spent some time in the expensive souvenir shop. One of the few public places in Budapest to have free toilets!Guide was good but she was running through her preset commentary in a monotonous way. Impressive structure inside. A lot of gold plating. The parliament has 190 seats where each member logs in with a smart card which identified the person. Four buttons each desk- yes, no, abstain and permission to speak. The last one tells the speaker your intention to speak. The vote is instantaneously shown on two large screens. We were left wondering, why such a simple and efficient system is not used in the British Parliament.The building is equally beautiful from outside with a lot of photo opportunities. It must be seen from close, from boat in the river Danube and during the day and night.
Budapest site seeing. Excellent visit with very good guides. The building is impressive with the exterior having recently cleaned and restored.

Highlight of Budapest!. The exterior of the Parliment building is absolutely gorgeous, stunning architecture. We made our reservations online for an inside tour about 2-3 months in advance. The cost was about $20 and we were able to select an English-speaking tour. The tour of a few beautiful rooms lasted approx 45 minutes - wish it had included more, however it was definitely the highlight of our Budapest visit. Sailing past it at night on our Danube river ship was breathtaking. I would definitely recommend a visit to this building, whether or not you go inside.

Stunning. We didn't go in the building, but viewed it from outside in both the day time and the evening, and from both sides of the river. We also took an evening cruise on the Danube, the view was absolutely stunning.
Beautiful. We only got to hear the history and see the outside of the building which is beautiful. The building is lit up at night and looks grand from the river.

A stunning piece of architecture . I could spend hours looking at this stunning building. You must see it at night as it looks even more spectacular with the mood lighting. It's a must see place in Budapest

One of the nicest buildings on the riverside. The House of the Parliament is really nice both from outside and inside. You can see the crown of Hungarian kings, the room in which the principal legislative body of the country accepts the laws. At the end of the visit, there is a nice photo exhibition about the restauration. The guide could have been somewhat more enthousiastic and lively...
Breathtaking view during night. You must see the parliament during night from across the river. It looks amazing. Take good camera with you to capture photos
nice exterior. Complicated to buy tickets, and while we tourists are charged for admission, the locals do not pay!! How is that for making us feel welcome! Being fleeced perhaps?

Exellent. one of the most beautiful Gothic Building I ever seen. if you are photo lover the best place for shooting is from Fisherman bastion, pictures from Buda castle are also very beautiful. Don't miss the view from those places in the night, the Parliament is the most beautiful when sky is dark blue....

Amazing building.. Visited the Parliament building whilst staying for 5 nights in Budapest and out of all the amazing buildings in the city this was by far our favourite.
Was fortunate to see the changing of the guards outside the building as this is very impressive.
A must see if visiting the city of Budapest.

Beautiful building. The Parliament was a nice tour. The building is beautiful and the interior equally so. The tour guide was knowledgeable. The only complaint is that there are no signs indicating where to go to buy tickets or pick up tickets for the tour. There should be more signs for the masses of tourists who take the tour.

Gorgeous in the evening . We only had a chance to see this place in the evening on the other side of the river and it is beautiful. Never had the chance to see inside. Unfortunately don't have photos on my phone. Make sure u use a tripod :)

wait till dark. A beautiful building by day, but wait until dark, it is worth it, looks magnificent. The lighting enhances the architecture and causes a great reflection on the water feature. Have a camera ready,
.
Impressive facility, but crowded!. We took a 1.5 hour tour, which was enough. The crowds were bad, but the facility was worth the hassle.
Parliament . Decent tour although very short and much less to see than other tours I've been on. Beautiful building though

Visit to the parliament . One of the largest parliament structures in the world. We did a guided tour in English of one section of the parliament which was informative. The rooms are elaborately decorated and have a lot of history some of which was shared by our guide. A must do when visiting Budapest !

Enjoy the outside. Non EU members must pay about twice as much for entrance. Also prepare for long lines especially if it is Monday because most museums in the city are closed. In addition to the lines be prepared to wait hours for your language speaking tour to be available.

Beautiful but book in advance. You cannot just enter. You have to go on one of the tours and the charges for non-EU visitors is more than 2x that of EU members. I recommend walking along the river to see it - you will hit the Shoe Monument.
Magnificient.. Go by day (at least) once and then enjoy an even more astonishing experience by night. This is a magnificient example of what beauty mankind is able to create.

Amazing building. The building is amazing, especially at night. When we were there, there were hundreds of birds flying round above it at night being illuminated by the lights. They looked a bit like moths around a flame, really pretty, although we couldn't get photos to do it justice.
The inside tour is short but quite interesting.

Nice place but rather expensive for such a short tour. The building truly is very nice the tour was run very professionally it was rather expensive for a 35 minute tour ; The crown jewels which is a highlight was OK but the architectural features was truly the highlight of the tour ; do yourself a favor if you want to spend the money go ahead and book it online to avoid a rather long line .

Probably the least impressive history . We got to the parliament 3h before closing time and found out all tickets were sold out so we bought them online for the next day. Good thing too, when we got there (first tour of the days) it said all their tickets were sold out AGAIN! It turns out they charge extra cost for online tickets and seem to pull the same trick all summer long. They don't allow you to buy them there for the next day.The tour was terrible. We couldn't here anything due to the low quality of the earphones and speaker system. There was basically no history to talk about and all the guide kept reminding us was that there were 40 kilo of golf on the walls. Just the worst thing in Budapest.

Beautiful. A really stunning building. It is even more beautiful at night. The best view is from the Chain Bridge or from a boat on the Danube. I haven't visited the inside, but it might be interesting.

Huge impressive building with huge crowd. Third largest parliament is the world and a must visit in Budapest. The building is very huge and beautifully build. Not able to go inside due to huge crowd because of St. Stephen's Day.

Most beautiful at night . We come every night to see the Parliament in the light and it's magical, we made a joke it looks like Hogwarts but really it does because birds fly over and the light reflects on them truly magnificent.

Didn't go in but beautiful building. We walked up to the parliament building as well as seeing it from the river, and it was a very impressive and beautiful building. They say it was modelled on the Houses of Parliament in London but honestly I think it was a more unique and more beautiful building. Definitely recommend. You can also take tours of the inside (for free if you can prove you're an EU citizen) which I would have done if we stayed longer.

Must visit in Budapest . Wow this place looks awesome at night and just before sunset we saw the guards take down the flags. As it was a hot day they had some cool water steam spray which was great. Definitely a must do
SPECTACULAR. It is the most spectacular building I saw so far. Do not miss to see it by boat at night. It is difficult to visit inside during the day because of there is too many people.

The most beautiful impressive building I have seen day and night. Could not get enough of viewing this fairytale like building. Kept in pristine condition and made even better by the guards and water fountain displays.

A must see when visiting Budapest. The building's interior is stunning, decorated in reds and gold. The only down side is the number of people touring. Tthe guides have to somewhat rush visitors through.

Brilliant tour of the Hungarian Parliament couple of watch outs. we pre-booked tickets .... best idea ever as the queue for tickets on the day was large . The waiting area was over crowded and poorly managed but once you got in it was very slick guide was very knowledgable and had a great sense of humour . fascinating to see the whole thing and well deserving of its top attraction status .

Beautiful during day; Fairytale at night!. One of the most iconic buildings in all of Europe, being the 3rd largest parliament building the in the world. The architecture is stunning, the sheer size is immense! We walked around the perimeter of the building and grounds at the rear, which gave us a real sense of the huge scale of the structure. The guards marching in formation at the rear is a sight in itself. The photo attached was taken from our cruise ship at night. Right out of a fairytale!

Stunning Building, Average Tour. The building is one of the most beautiful I have seen. Its location right on the shore of Pest is gorgeous. The tour inside was not worth it. It was boring and slow moving.
great building. its a real landmark and impressive building, you cannot miss it. specially at night its great to see it from the Buda site of town.

I had no idea Budapest would be so beautiful!. Budapest is a must see, do not skip Hungary in your European tour! The prices are very low for EVERY thing. The city is amazing and full of rich history.

3rd largest Parliament building in Europe . The Hungarian Parliament house is a beautiful Gothic style architecture, the only way to get inside the building is to buy one of the guided tours offered in several languages, this is a 45 minutes tour and the price for European citizens is fairly ok at 2200 huf but if you are a non EU citizen then the price per person is 5400 huf which is quite a lot.

Elegant building. A must visit during a visit to Budapest and a natural stop off on a walk along the Pest side of the Danube. The building is elegant and imposing and the surrounding area is steeped in history. Walk round the square, visit the 1956 memorial and stop for coffee on the corner of the square to watch the trams go by. Also don't forget the statue on the bridge in the park.
Impressive building. Must see. definitely a highlight of Budapest. Breathtaking . Beautiful in every aspect from every angle day or night

It is a must see gem of Hungary. The Parliament is a real piece of art and it is definitely worth visiting because the interior is as good as outside if not more.It is quite difficult to book a guided tour especially the English one so it is advisable to book online. Apart from the guided tour, the exhibition before the exit is also very good, don't miss it.
Magnificent. Historic magnificent place! A must to see in Budapest day and night! Try to come as early as you can to beat the crowd. Take a Danube night cruise to see the illuminated Parliament.
A must see.. There is a memorial for those who died in 1956 revolution. It is very impressive. Street # 2 stops right at right in front, the guards, the building is totally awesome.
Superb building. We didn't have the chance to go inside, nevertheless the square where it is located, the building itself deserve the visit. At night is superb (great illumination).
Amazing architecure. I suggest to visit this colossal building, just before the sunset and then walk by Danube shore to the boat docks. After that enjoj the dinner and boat ride.

Budapest Parliament. Any visit to Budapest must include a visit to the Parliament building which is modeled on the British Houses of Parliament. You can take a tour inside the building and also see the changing of the guard each morning. Its a lovely walk along the river to the Parliament or why not take river ferry that is a regular passenger service along the river.

Great inside and outside. What we see outside is gorgeous. What we can find inside is even better. Lots of interesting facts for history lovers. Great piece of architecture for the ones that love it. Very cheap and doesn't take too much time to see the entire place.
Very impressive building!. The architecture of this building was absolutely stunning, it almost took your breath away. Beautiful location overlooking the Danube.
Beautiful grounds . A beautiful place to stroll the grounds. And if you have kids, keep your eye out for the resident hedgehog that lives near.

Amazing when lit!. It is really magnificent! Very close to the city center, you can take the tram to reach it or you can walk, upstream to the river. When the sum comes down, it is seen lit from Buda side, simply amazing...

Well worthwhile doing. Tour starts with bus ride to Parliament House with major sites described along the way, At he Parliament another guide takes over and gives an indepth description of the ParliamentThis is a magnificent building and must be seen if travelling to Budapest

Impressive building. The first day we walked by parliament we happened to there to see the changing of the guard. Its' on the steps to the building on the opposite site from the river. We tried to get tickets to a tour but the next available English tour did not fit our available timeframe. I tried to buy tickets on line for the following day, but all the English tours for the morning were sold out. We walked by the next day and decided to go in and check on ticket availability and they had just added another English tour. The tour schedule appears to be fluid and you should try to get tickets there even if the website doesn't show availability. The tour was of only a small part of the building but what we saw was very impressive. You can take photos except of the royal crown and septor. We were there to see the changing of the guard that protect the crown. They showed us the main entry and staircase,a parliamentary assembly room and several corridors adorned with art and sculptures. The tour took about 45 minutes.

An absolute MUST!. "Impressive" is such a gross understatement! "Spectacular" would be more fitting. We did not tour the building but happily spent an hour and a half photographing the building and its environs, including the castle across the river and the Museum of Ethnography across the street. I believe that the one of the tours would have added much more, but for anyone with either limited money or simply anyone with a camera and an appreciation of great architecture - this place is a MUST SEE
Very informative . The parliament tour was very insightful and gave us a great understanding of the counter and history. Definitely do this tour. Our concierge was great to coordinate for us!!

Visual Delight. Didnt do a tour through this beautiful building but the exterior is as stunning as it is massive. Its the largest building in Budapest and if I had more time I would have booked a tour, still worth looking at if you cant get in.
Breathtaking building. Tours fill up quickly so order on-line if you can. Beautiful building, the tour guide was knowledgeable. St Stephen's crown is worth the price of admission.

Astonishing. The guided-tour is a must! Not only the outside and surroundings are completely beautiful. The inside is to die for. A great architeture, the history behind it confirms that this is definitely Budapest´s best-known postcard.

Interesting place.. We walked around to the Parliament from our hotel, it was a very interesting building. We did not actually go in but found the outside, architecture, water features and ceremonial guards all very interesting.

Just a visit. Amazing architecture! Not the best location to take pictures, but everyone seems to forget that it's about seeing things with your own 2 eyes, not about taking a picture of it to look at it afterwards...

Truely an impressive structure. The Hungarians seem to have embraced the bigger is better concept and raised it to a higher standard. I walked around the building on a holiday so it wasn't open to the public but the grounds alone are worth the trip.

Fantastic tour - worth booking!. We made a point of booking a tour here on a Monday - when most other museums are closed in Budapest - and it really was a fascinating experience. Learning about the physical building, which is absolutely beautiful, as well as the way government works, really added to our understanding of he city. The exhibits outside Parliament in Kossiuth Ter about the construction of the building and the revolution of 1956 are also worth a look around.

A must-see in Budapest. We nearly missed getting to see inside this fabulous building because on the day and time we had planned our visit, there was official business going on inside and there were no tours available. We returned a couple of days later only to find that all the English-speaking tours were full up. Turning away in disappointment, we suddenly decided - what the heck, let's just take the next tour no matter the language barrier. Were we glad we did? You do not have to understand a word of what is being said to appreciate the art and architecture to be found within these walls. "Just do it" was our motto - and were we glad we followed our instincts!

Magnificent building - mediocre tour. The building is absolutely magnificent! As a former Parliamentarian I was disappointed that there was a fee (and a high one) for touring the building and further disappointed with the guide. Not only did it seem to simply be a memorized script, but there was no time given for questions, nor were questions invited.

A beautiful building with many interesting features. We could only get the 8:30am tour on the day that suited us but this turned out to be good as there were 50 places still available which meant our group was small and could move about quickly and ask questions easily. Our English speaking guide gave us head sets to hear her as she guided us along passageways to the magnificent staircase and into the Great Hall and the Parliamentary sitting room. She gave us details about the various Heads of State, history of Budapest and parliament, as well as many details about the building itself, especially the Crown Jewels. We saw opulent rooms that were exquisitely decorated with statues, chandeliers and frescos. Overall it felt very palatial, particularly with all the gold which adorned many rooms. The tour was over fairly quickly (barely 45mins) but we covered lots of ground during that time. We were allowed to spend plenty of time in the Visitors' Centre afterwards and photos were permitted in all areas except the Great Hall. There was a nice kiosk and a great gift shop if wanting to purchase food or souvenirs.
Nice place. Was living in a hotel just in front of it. In the evening and night time, this place looks amazing. Couldn't visit inside though

Walk around the outside. The place is enormous with not many shaded places. We did a walk around the outside, the building and the statues were in perfect condition when we visited the Parlement.
Some military guards were guarding the flag and more police men were guarding the place.
This place can be combined with the "Shoe's on the Danube bank"

Must see at night. This building is absolutely stunning. We went both during the day and at night - but nighttime was the highlight of my trip. We walked onto the other side of the river and took lots of photos from directly opposite. Not to be missed
must visit,. rare to see the Parliaments incl the actual houses where the sessions takes place, very well organised
So beautiful!. Such an astonishing building in the historical city of Budapest. A must see! Day or night, doesn't matter.

Excellent beautifull. actually a must if you traval to Budapest. Really really worth to visit the Parliament.
The tour inside is just beautiful and interesting.

Impressive. Beautiful to look at, the whole area surrounding Parliament is so clean and wonderful to look at, greenery and a place where you can dip your feet in the water. I happened to be there when the flag was being lowered by the guards which was a very different and interesting thing to view. Beautiful.
Must see. The sign of Budapest, every postcard from Hungary is with parliament, we liked it, beautiful in Hungary there is not lot of tourists everywhere like in other European cities

Amazing building from the outside , not enough open to the public on the inside. I think this is a one amazing place in Budapest , but rather to see it from outside. It's not really worth it to go in , It's a really short visit and definitely not worth it's price.
Beautiful!. The Parliament building is so beautiful and definitely a must see. The tours moved along well and were interesting.

Most beautiful building in Budapest. The Parliament is beautiful from outside and from the inside. I highly recommend taking the guided tour (the only way to visit the interior of the building). In this case, it's wise to book 1 or 2 days in advance. Also make sure to see the facade at night - it's amazing!

Short but interesting tour. Be sure to book ahead if you wish to tour Parliament, during summer the tour can book out days in advance. We went on a morning tour, the organisation of groups could be done a little better, we discovered our group had left without any announcement to the foyer full of people. The original aspects of the interior are great to look at, sadly the room you would most want to remember, you are not allowed to take photos due to fear of degradation of the artworks (can't we move past this rule now that everyone uses smartphones?). I was a little surprised at how quickly the tour ended; couldn't have been more than 25 minutes long.

Beautiful building, nothing to see inside. Beautiful building specially by night. When we visited there was a free entrance, due to national holiday, but after waiting in a queue for 45 minutes there was nothing to see, they should have opened the rooms and parliament too

Interesting 45 minute tour. Booked this ahead of wet weather forecast. Suitable for visiting at other times as well of course. Tour starts with usual, somewhat chaotic security checks etc. Then it's off up 132 steps of a stairs - lift (elevator) available to those who feel unable to do so - they are not large steps so should not be a problem for most people. As the building is symmetrical one gets to see quite a bit of one half of the complex. Has numerous attractive parts and guide was very good with background info. Tour ends in a museum area. Tickets can be pre-booked online and for EU passport holders is similarly priced (with booking fee) and those who pay at the gate. Well worth a visit.

Parliament. We took the tour of the Parliament Building, and found it to be very informative and worthwhile. With that being said, the building, like much of Budapest, becomes a magnificent display of lights, particularly fro a boat on the Danube.
Spectacular both from in and outside. The Parliament is one of the must see points in Budapest - spectacular both from inside and outside, night view strongly recommended

Nice . One of the nicest parliaments. The building is magnificent, very well preserved and perfectly illuminated at night. It is located right on the side of the river Danube. I haven't seen it on the inside unfortunately.

Nice short tour . The Hungarian Parliament is in a magnificent enormous building that none the less can be seen in a couple of hours. Book in advance because special language tours book up early in the summer. Not as interesting as the one in London (at least for an Anglo) but a introduction to Hungarian history.

Must see the Holy Crown inside the Parliament!. The Parliament building was recently renovated from the outside, with the whole square rebuilt. Traffic was directed elsewhere allowing more space for bicycles and pedestrians. It is a good idea to buy tickets in advance and watch the building from the inside. It is sometimes possible to join another group if you don't book ahead, but there is a chance that it will be a French or Hungarian group where you won't understand the guide. Anyway it is still a great experience to see the Holy Crown of Hungary which is a legal entity itself.

Beautiful inside and out . The architecture of parliament is absolutely stunning. We also went on a tour of the inside which was also, unsurprisingly, beautiful. The tour guide did a good job and was very informative.

Budapest parliament building impresses Irish Couple!. We did not take the tour of the inside the parliament building but rather we strolled around the outside and learned from our Guide of the history of the building.The parliament building is a very impressive building on the Pest side of the city. It is an easy walk from the main shopping street. The building is particularly impressive at night when it is illuminated. A must see from the river if you are on a boat. When at the parliament walk down to the bank of the river and look at the Shoe Memorial. The shoes honor the Jews killed by the fascist Arrow Cross in Budapest during World War 2. A chilling sight and makes one think of a similar shoe display the museum in Auschwitz Concentration Camp.This is a must do in Budapest.

So proud to be from Budapest originally. Absolutely beautiful and the new stylish, efficient, cost effective and easy booking adds to the value and overall good impression.Now the entire building renovated and the guided tour improved - this is the most important visit not to miss! I'm unspent born and brought English relatives and could not have been more proud!
Beautiful place. We didn't visit it from the inside, the waiting line was tooooooo long. But outside, great view and try to catch the change of guards, a must see!
Sublime parliament. You would definitely take load of pictures during the Danube cruise yet it isn't enough the night view is also stunning. A must visit attraction.
Amazing architecture . What a lovely building, awestruck, you just can't stop clicking pictures of this magnificent piece of architecture

Budapest Parliament Visit. Prime target during your visit in Budapest. Do not miss the inside guided tour. Very well organized, departs from the visitor centre, on different languages. You will be fascinated by the tour

Book in Advance. My wife & I walked from our hotel to the parliament house, unfortunately, we had not booked ahead as all the tours were booked out & we were leaving the next day. would have loved to have seen through, we had seen the parliament house by night & the lighting is incredible.
Worth a visit. Very nice building.... We visited the parliament and liked it very much. You should buy your ticket in advance on the internet so the entrance gets very smooth.

Elegant building. Tickets have to be obtained ahead of time during busy periods. The interior of the building was elegant and opulent, including the ancient crown jewels. Unfortunately, the guide did not seem adept at leading tours.

Undoubytedly one of the top 10 most beautiful buildings in the world. 693 gorgeous rooms. You need to research in advance to find a tour in your language. If you travel there in the summer (not my recommendation), book online ahead of time. For me, it was the #2 thing to see in Budapest (or maybe a tie with St Stephens Cathedral)!

Lovely tour. This tour was very good and I enjoyed watching the changing of guards at the crowns but the devices for us to listen to the guide were disappointing and when you were to far from the guide you lost signal and couldn't hear. But otherwise good trip and it was beautiful.
Architectural Wonder. Didn't have time to go inside, but even seeing it from outside made my day. The only downside of the amazing location is the busy road between the building and the river.
Expenses of construction. Maybe you do not know, the cost to build it up was equal at that time to build a complete City for 40000 citizen.

Very freindly and helpful people.. We went in November, I think it is probably the nicest time to go. To see the city at night is a sight worth seeing, we did a hop on hop off bus ride at night and in the day (well worth doing), but the evening in the dark and every where is lit up it looks very special. I also did the thermic baths, which are lovely In with bus ticket you also get a hop on hop off river trip, the Danube is a huge river. Yes take good walking shoes you can walk miles. The food was good, we went to the oldest and original Schnitzel restaurant, you can see them making them fresh to order. I would go again, maybe a little later so I could do the Christmas market, they were just setting one or two up as we came home. The indoor food market is interesting, and also on the plus side the weather was fab, brilliant sunshine crisp and cold. Just how I had expected it to be.

Beautiful . This building is so beautiful! It was very well maintained, located just by the river which turned it into a perfect sightseeing point. Can be seen from many places along the river, so it's easy to find

Visit it!. Definitely worth a visit. We unfortunately only took part on the free tour on the national day of Hungary where we could see the crown, but still would say go and check it out. It's huge and brilliant, and by huge I mean huuuuuge.

Fantastic! . This was really a fabulous visit!  Don't miss it, this is really a must do in Budapest.  We have booked our tickets online.  I recommend you do so to avoid waiting long in front. EU citizens get a discount so we made copies of our IDs, but no one asked at the entrance ;). You can only get in with guide tours. So check online for when your favorite online is scheduled.  It is really worth it! Hope this helps :)!

A must do but was not impressed by the tour. Great at night. The Parliament is a beautiful building, but I was not impressed by the tour. Just a bunch of rooms and blah blah blah. I know you need to do it, but on time is enough for me. We visited the Parliament outside at night very often, just sitting by the Danube and drinking a beer. Try to take the trolley during sunset across the Parliament to take an awesome video. Book ur ticket online in advance and make sure your language is offered at that time.

Fabulous!. Well worth a visit, a very reasonable price to see around a lovely building. The tour is short (approx 45 mins), but interesting none the less.Be warned - they aren't kidding when they tell you there's a lot of stairs!

Best bit of architecture in Budapest!. By far the most impressive building in Budapest. The cathedral and churches offer some great interior architecture but parliament seems to be so prominent in the cityscape from wherever you get a good view.

A great piece of Gothic Revival style!. About 1,000 people were involved in construction, during which 40 million bricks, half a million precious stones and 40 kilograms (88 lb) of gold were used. The building was inaugurated on the 1000th anniversary of the country in 1896, and completed in 1904. During the communist regime a red star perched on the top of the dome, but was removed in 1990.

Low value for money and served up by surly staff. This is an awesome building; the history, how it came about, the trials and tribulations that the country went through to see this realized is a rich, hearty tale worth taking the time to appreciate. Sadly, this is apparently run by the gov't who seem to employ staff devoid of the big picture, not interested in what there is to tell or weaving in the background to better explain the situation and who apparently have more pressing engagements elsewhere.By all means, do the tour, but prepare yourself independently. Don't expect much from the docent who will lead you with steel gloves lest you might go off tour. Be ready to take your pictures when permitted, dawdling to soak in the beauty will get you chased off if after the tour guide has moved on by the officious guards.At the end of the tour, put time into the final history gallery where at least you can get an idea of the history - which hopefully you'll already have gleaned prior to coming to the Parliament.If you're a local, be sure to state so - you'll get a discount. And DON'T buy the tickets online - you're sure to pay the premium that way.

wonderful building and fascenating tour. This is like the Palace of Westminster with the brakes taken off. It is also considerably reconstructed after the war and they have turned their unused second chamber into a wonderful symposium venue where they hold their schools parliament.
incredible place. an amazing building just to walk around. We did not go on the tour due to the queues but had a great experience just wandering around.
Stunning!. Only watched it from the river but truly a stunning building!!. Must see in Budapest. Beautiful architecture

Really beautiful. Amazing!. A place which really worth to visit! Only thing which you should do before trip is book tickets through net. www.jegymester.hu.You have to take part of the tour because you can't go wonder around by yourself. There are tours with different languages and guides are really good!
