Stunning. An architectural jewel and very majestic, it is worth visiting inside as well. I highly recommend taking the guided tour of the Hungarian Parliament building.

A must see in Budapest. If you are interested in architecture, the Hungarian Parliament is a must see. It has been recently renovated inside-out. The caffe is expensive inside, so take a bottle of water with you for the kids.

The most vonderfull bulding of Budapest. The Hungarian Parliament has a nicely setup for visitors, sometimes free of charge, but if you would like to buy a ticket do it over the internet and you will avoid the big queue at the entrance.It has a splendid external view and all his internal rooms are daily used by the members of Hungarian government .Special room is dedicated for the Hungarian Crown Jewels which are more the 1000 years old.

Hungarian Parliament House Tour!. We went with our children and all really enjoyed the tour. Its worthwhile seeing. Amazing architecture, craftsmanship, and just the splendor of this building is truly magnificent! We also took our 14 year old nieces when they came to stay with us last year, and they loved it too.

Beautiful structure, very very busy.. If you want to photograph this building, you have to go before sunrise or after sunset. It's very busy and touristy, but worth it. Not just for the building, but the surrounding grounds as well.
Amazing building . We spent a while hanging around the parliament on a lovely May Day. Got some greats photos from across the river and from the castle!
Beautiful house of Parliament!. Worth to see, indeed. Opening hours should be more comprehensive. Use the trams to go there, it is also an "experience", a nice one, too. :)
Amazing!. Make sure to do online reservations as the English does sell out. The guides are very informative and will answer questions.
Never seen such a beautiful parlament. A nice parlament in a nice area by the Danube and close to Margerite Island ... close to shoe monument too
Beautiful example of architecture.. Don't miss this site when traveling to Budapest. It is right on the river and within walking distance of more sites, hotels, shops and restaurants.

Amazing architecture!. This place was AMAZING to look at! We really enjoyed walking around it and taking in the building and just the immense size of it. A very beautiful place that is a must see when visiting Budapest. We were able to see it up close on one side of the river and observe the beautiful architecture. But to get a full picture of it you need to be across the river. I was told later that you can go inside and look around, though we didn't do it this time around. Maybe next time!
Wonderful. It is a great building to see during the night when the lights are on. Try to cross the bridge and see the building from the other side of the river. It is amazing
Parliment building. just the view at night from across the danube is breathtaking. very interesting tours as well. one of the highlights of Budapest.

Bucharesti. Very impressive. Huge. Worth a look, then turn around & take a panoramic view of the area. Walk then down the road opposite at night to the fountains & look back at Parliament, it all lights up.

Great architecture inside and out . A must do in Budapest and you can book on line, and have tickets printed at the visitor centre on the day, saves time. English tours are limited so you can also plan your day. Spectacular architecture, interesting facts and there is a free visual display and history exhibit at the visitors centre which is also very informative. There is also free wifi and the cafe is well priced and pleasant to sit

Breathtaking! Make your tour reservation early.. Pictures of The Parliament are inspiring. Seeing it in person is Breathtaking. Walking around the exterior, you will marvel at the details that don't show up in the long angle views in photos. The interior is also spectacular and not to be missed. Make sure you make your reservations in advance. (I made them 2 weeks out in June and had limited availability.) There are some stairs to climb but they do offer an elevator for those who are unable to navigate them.

Badly organised ticketing hall, lack of info. Warning to fellow travellers, you need to book this attraction in advance. In order to get into parliament you MUST go on guided tour. It is very badly sign posted and unclear about this! We waited 45mins in a long queue only to be told we had to go on a tour and there were no tickets left for today. It's confusing as they advertise audio guides as well which alludes to the fact you can go in alone. Please book at least a few days in advance. Sad we missed it as I've read really good things about it. Hopefully they make the ticketing hall clearer!

Informative tour and awe inspiring building . I visited the Parliament on one of the guided tours (English) with my Mum and sister. The start of the tour is very chaotic as several different language tours all start at the same time. If you're stood at the back of the crowd like we were you can't hear the instructions for how to her through security. We ended up just following everyone else and managed to find the English tour on the other side of security once we picked up our audio guide. As soon as we had the audio guide and had found the right group I found the experience really enjoyable and informative. The building is incredible and I think the tour was good value. Well worth partaking in if you have a spare hour in Budapest.

Stunning architecture. When you are visiting Budapest you can't miss the beautiful Parlement. I have seen the building many times, but wether its day or night, it just never gets old. Every time I discover something new about it. This time we also did the tour which was long overdue. The tour didn't disappoint although it was a bit too short for our liking. The building is so unbelievably beautiful inside and out. A must visit!

A must see . This building is beautiful and the history is a must hear, I recommend getting a guide. We hired a private tour guide and it was worth every dollar he was so knowledgeable and took his time to make sure we were good and that we knew every historical fact before moving on. We were able to see the whole town and more because this man drove us around in a very comfortable car and knew every place building and site you want to see.

Interesting visit - beautiful inside. We decided to visit the parliament as it was a wet rainy day. We booked tickets online for tour about 1.5 hours later - we are glad we did as the queue in the ticket office was quite long.The tour is interesting - not really suitable for smaller children our two year old just about got round. The building is beautiful inside with lots of golden statues.
The most beautiful building in Budapest. Very nice view is from other side of river. It is the most beautiful and bigger building in Budapest city.

Parliament Tour. We booked our tickets for the (obligatory-) guided Tour online and paid 2400 HUF for two student tickets. The tour lasted 45 minutes and was not only informative but also allowed us to take many impressive pictures of a very beautiful building. The guide was very knowledgable and answered also many individual questions. It is advisable to avoid the queue in the visitor-centre and book the tickets online, as you also have to consider potential waiting time at the security check!
Beautiful building. Famous architecture. The parliament us extremely huge for such a small country. The place in front is also worth to see. A must see!

Majestic. The Parliament and the surroundings areas are amazing! The parliament is such a iconic piece of Budapest! Make sure you visit the Parliament both during daytime and at night, when it is lit beautifully. Would suggest taking the boat cruise at 10pm too.

A stunning piece of architecture surrounded by a Zen atmosphere. Take your picnic and your wine to sit and enjoy. Best pictures are around 6:00pm and sunset. There is a big square with fountains and the guards are walking round the clock. During the summer, steams comes from the floor creating a curtain of mist that is amazing to experience. The buildings surrounding the square are historic and a yellow romantic tram #2 surrounds the scene once every 5 minutes.
Very impressive. Would highly recommend a visit to the Parliament building it is really quite impressive. It's also nice to see it all lit up at night, WOW!
More beautiful than I could imagine. Stunning both from outside and inside...a must see place while in Budapest...the tickets tour can be bought before with schedule for the time of the visit
Very nice. A very impressive building. Very hard to figure out how to get a guided tour. They sell out early so we went with Viator to arrange it all. The inside is also very nice.

Beautiful Architecture . Absolutely beautiful building. A must see when in Budapest. The no.2 team takes you tight to the front of the building. On this occasion, sadly we did not go in as I believe that it was closed.

Put this on your list!. Definitely visit Parliament when in Budapest. The lighting inside isn't great for photos but it is interesting to take a tour and see this massive building's interior. From the outside, this is quite an architectural masterpiece -- absolutely stunning. We booked tickets through our hotel the night before the day we wanted to go -- by then, pickings were slim for a group of 4. Recommend making reservations as soon as you arrive in Budapest, if not before. The only reservation we could get was for first thing in the morning. In hindsight, I think this was the best --and definitely the least crowded -- time to go ... so if you don't mind getting up early, book your tour for the morning.

The place to see in Budapest. The best building in the city, from close up views where you can enjoy the details in the architecture, and from across the Danube, where you can appreciate a view of the entire place. At day and at night, is the place to see in Budapest.
Magnificent Building. Love how it overlooks the Danube river and it is exceptionally breathtaking at night for one to gaze at. A bonus for one who took the boat ride.
A gorgeous monument. From whatever side you see it, it's something very beautiful. Architecture and dimensions that can impress everyone.

Great place !. We saw the show of the guards - Very nice.
A huge building, reserved and most recommended for a visit.
Unfortunately, we didn't take the tour inside the Parliament, but you should take one.

Worth the tour. This building is gorgeous from the outside, and especially lot up at night. We also decided to have a tour of the inside. The first day we tried, we arrived early afternoon but all tickets for the day were already sold out, so we purchased online for the following day - so either arrive early or do the online thing and save yourself the wait. Next day we turned up at the allotted time and joined our group and another group of German - speaking. Our tour guide was excellent, and using the special headsets we were all able to hear her. We were able to take photos on all but one room.. The interior is as fabulous as the exterior, and the stories of the history and use of the different rooms make it a very interesting 45 mins. At the end there's a display room with all sorts of extra info about the building, which is also worth spending some time in. All in all, a great place to visit.

Gorgeous outside and gorgeous inside. Tickets are rather expensive to tour the inside of the Parliament Building but we certainly enjoyed it. You get to walk down some hallways, see the main entryway (spectacular), one of the two legislative chambers where Parliament used to meet (they now only use one), the room containing the Hungarian crown, and an interesting museum on your way out. We couldn't get an English tour when we were there, so joined a French tour. You can always read about what you see later on...just being able to look is worth the price. You can take photos anywhere but NOT in the dome where the crown is displayed. A lot of steps going up and down so wear good shoes!
Great!!!. Beautifull in The day and in The night !Its great and special!Not expansive to visit it but they show you one little part of this!I come back,Budapest is romántic!
Huge building . Huge and grand building, took time walking around it. Many decorations and nice ornaments, but be aware of the armed guards and don't cross into the closed area.
Really interesting. You have to get on a tour. Best to book ahead. Tours in many languages. Fascinating tour. Very beautiful rooms. Well worth going to.
Very nice. If you go in Budapest you must visit Parliament, it is one of the most beautiful buildings in town!!!
Must to go. One of the "most go" places in Budapest. It's better get the tickets before on Internet to avoid the lines. Very beautiful building.

Amazing place to visit. The parliament was on the top of every sightseeing list I looked at for Budapest so we decided to pay it a visit. We bought tickets beforehand online and took them with us which worked out well. We read a few reviews which said don't bother going inside but we would totally disagree. The building was incredible and the our guide was very knowledgeable. We were each given a headset so you didn't have to worry about being next to the guide to be able to hear them. Only downside was that we weren't sure we were in the right place to queue as there was a security gate and loads of people stood around but eventually our guide arrived and gave us instructions.
Stunning!. Amazing structure with such incredible detail! A true pleasure to see up close! I would definitely recommend visiting it if you are in Budapest
A must while in Budapest. We did the evening English tour and were very impressed with the Parliament. Well planned and impressive design and architecture both inside and outside.

Beautiful Building. You cannot fail to be impressed by this stunning building sitting on the banks of the Danube. We passed it whilst on a boat trip, but also got some amazing photos of the building when it was all lit up at night from across the river. Truly stunning building!
Beautiful . Very beautiful building with statues all around the location and a museum very close by, you have to pay to get in. But there is quite a lot of interesting things near this place.

Architectural masterpiece. The Hungarian parliament is indeed one of the most beautiful and iconic legislative building in the whole world. From its detailed Gothic architecture to its perfect positioning on the bank of the Danube river, it is sure to impress the visitors.

Great attraction. Great place. Looks beautiful.
U can visit Just as it is one of the main attractions but if you take boat night cruise then the view of parliament building is to die for

You feel like in London. The Parliament of Hungary has been built similar to the UK parliament. The place is on the banks of Danube river and gives a soothing feeling. Its a beautiful architecture that can make good picture background. While it may not be possible to enter the premises, whatever is accessible and can be viewed like ordinary travellers, its enough.

Amazing building, so lucky to go on the day before thete national day, parades, band stands. Such a beautiful building. Amazing building great sights to see right near Margaret Island and a lovely garden need by with a water fountain that imprisons you, definitely worth a look

beautiful building, worth a visit. loved this Parliament building, architecture is fantastic inside and out. Good visitor centre with shop and café. Changing of guard outside hourly and inside as well at crown display. very interesting history and how it is interpreted in the building architecture and visitor center displays.

Beautiful with sunset. The parliament is "a must" in Budapest. It is a real monument, it is huge and visible from almost everywhere. I think the best view is with sunset from the boat or from opposite bank
Outstanding. Absolutely not to miss. The place is wonderful. You get to visit this great place with a guide speaking your language and wearing radio connected earpieces

Beautiful. Such a beautiful building. You come out of the underground tram and arrive at this spectacular architecture with hints of British style. Would advise to book a tour a few days in advance however as we tried and could not get a tour. Fabulous attraction to visit

Beautiful building inside & out. The parliament building is a must see on your trip to Budapest, it can be found on the pest side.
I would advise booking online in advance if you can, otherwise you run the risk of the tour being fully booked.

Iconic building,a must see! Pre book tickets if you can!. This is arguably the most famous/iconic building in Budapest. You can only walk around the building if you are on a tour which they do in many different languages.You can pre book tickets online, which will save queuing on a busy day. The dome is fantastic from the inside.There is a museum in the entrance, free to visit if you have a ticket for the tour. Giving insight on Hungary's history through the ages.
Amazing!. As Budapest has lots to see and do we didn't bother go inside as we were running out of time however outside is beautiful.

Seen from the outside only. Although we did not have time to go inside, the outside facades were immense and very impressive. Overlooking the Danube, this must be one of the best parliament buildings in the world. So, a great place to work????

Beautiful . We visited parliament during both day and night and it is especially beautiful when you go during darkness.Also a brilliant idea is to do the river cruise along the Danube and see it all lit up. Brilliant building which is just amazing.

Stunningly Beautiful. We arrived in Budapest by river cruise and the most distinguishing feature is the Parliament building. It is huge and beautiful. Very imposing during the day, even more so when lit at night. We took a cruise on the river in the evening and the building is really magnificent at night. The next day, we walked to the building to get an upclose look. There are many statues which we unfortunately did not understand. You see a celebration of Hungarian history which you can appreciate even if you don't know the full meaning.
Guided tour was great. The Parliament is beautiful and interesting. I highly recommend the guided tour. You learn a lot about Budapest in general and really understand what you are looking at.

Magnificent. The Parliament is definitely THE landmark of Budapest. It is hard to capture when you stand close to it, so if you can take a cruise on the Danube, do it! You will get unique points of view and maybe a chance to see it by night, when it is all illuminated. The inside tour looked nice, but we ran out of time to do it. A definite must-do!
Budapest at its best! . Definately worth seeing. Dont forget to see iron shoes when your going to the parliment by the river bank!

Beautiful. Nice tour with a good guide. The route was quite small but we got lots of information all-round. It's really an astonishing place. You are allowed to pictures everywhere except at the crown jewels. Which are guarded. A must see!
Just other city attractions. I spent a few days in Budapest, but Budapest have so many things oto do and to visit that just if you have you should visit the Parliament.
Really beautiful inside and outside !. It is a landmark and the identity of Budapest. But the inside view is worth seeing. It is short 50 min tour.
Most beautiful at night. Take pictures in the day time and then you just have a picture at night. Take pictures across the river, on the chain bridge and on a river cruise.

Such a magnificent building. You have to see the parliament when in Budapest, both during the day and at night. At night I would recommend going to castle hill to see the magnificent lights of parliament. It is also interesting to do a walking tour and hear a bit about the history of when it was built and the designing process etc! Also interestingly, right next to parliament you can go down a flight of stairs that takes you to a history exhibition of the massacre that occurred in Budapest.

Awful Staff. This was our only bad experience in Budapest.This is a beautiful building and we were keen to see inside and out despite the best efforts of authoritarian power charged individuals both selling tickets and allowing entry (but not always) to the building.Chaotic arrangements at entrance mean that regularly you cannot here or access when trying to get through to a timed tour. If you are missed then that's it no dice. Gave up after two attempts customer training and the importance of a smile totally missing here.

Stunning. To be honest we ran out of time in this lovely city of very warm people. We opted out of a tour of the inside 'cause we underestimated the amount of time we had relative to the number of sites. Oh well an excuse to return.But if in Budapest you must at least make time to ogle at the exterior of this building and the sites closeby. A good view of the entire building is possible on the Buda side.

Best photo angle - across the river. It is just difficult to capture the magnificent building when you are standing infront of it. You need to take it from the opposite river. Great view both day time and at night. We stayed at Hotel Intercontinental, no missing out!
First visit. Interesting building, perfect background for taking photos; everything it's full of history. You'll have plenty to see and learn.

Beautiful on Outside and Inside; Underwhelming Tour. The Hungarian Parliament is a beauty from the outside. Easily identifiable along the Danube, this building is rightfully a national icon and a stunning remnant of what once was the Austro-Hungarian empire. That being said, I found the actual tour of the Parliament to be a bit underwhelming. The security check took the better part of 20 minutes and after that we walked through all of 4 rooms with a tour guide. While the stories told were interesting and the guide was very knowledgable, I simply felt like there isn't enough for us tourists to see to justify the price and wait. Nonetheless, if you have time to burn and want to see a beautiful interior then feel free to do the tour. However, if you're short on time just scout the outside and move on to the other side of the Danube.
The most beautiful European parliament!. Absolutely beautiful Parliament building on the Danube. Very well maintained. Great place to just handout.
Beautiful building. This could be the most beautiful building I have seen. And its even more beautiful in the sunset and if its possible, even more when its dark.

Long lines, failing audio players, uncaring customer service. The parliament building is beautiful and it's history is interesting, however the customer service of the staff is awful and the your us much too expensive for what you get To get tickets takes a lot of patience waiting in long lines if you want them same day. One person waiting on a huge long line of people while other staff sat behind adjacent desks chatting with each other and going nothingAt least five people in our 4:15pm tour including me found a few minutes into the tour that their audio players stopped working. This device was necessary to hear the tour guide and get the benefit of the tour. The front desk people were completely uninterested in solving that problem. The tour cost 5400 HF (about $20 USD) for non-EU Citizens and was not worth it.
Interesting. One of the most representative buildings of BudapestBeautiful building. Interesting tour to know a little more of Budapest and Hungary
Majestic!. Make sure you see the Parliament at night. Breathtaking architecture and very pleasing to look at. Tons of photo apportunities!
Place for evening meditation. This place is excellent for evening meditation with a glass of hungarian wine. When you sit on the dunai river embankment and the lights of Parliament flow behind.
Such a cool building. The buildng and the surroundings areas are amazing! The parliament is such a iconic piece of Budapest!
Not to be missed. Beautifully maintained historical building. The guide was very informative and the guided tour was extremely good.

Magnificence and Majesty on the Danube. See this magnificent building!Take pictures, walk around it and admire the architecture then get tickets to tour inside if you can.This is one of the top 5 must sees in Budapest. You will find out why almost every image you see of Budapest will include a shot of this building on the Pest shore of the Danube.
An interesting tour. The interior of the Parliament, well the bits you get to see, are fantastic. Very ornate and spectacular.

An architectural jewel. This building is a must-see in Budapest. It is a massive architectural enterprise that should not be missed. Tours last about 40 minutes and take you to a few rooms, including the rotunda that houses the crown of St. Stephen. Our guide was informative and well prepared. Tours are offered every 15-30 minutes and can be booked online at https://www.jegymester.hu/eng/Production/480000/Parliament-visit. Make sure you book during business hours, otherwise tour times will show as unavailable. E-tickets are not accepted at the gate, so make sure you arrive early and get paper tickets at the information desk of the visitor's center. Enjoy it!
Sumptuos Building and Rooms. This is a highly rated tour, and was quite good. The building and grounds are spectacular, particularly the Upper Chamber that used to be the House of Lords.
Stunning architecture . Such a beautiful building and what a incredible piece of artwork . We went on the cruise and passed by the parliment several times. Never get tired admiring it!

Wow is all I can say. Omg. You must see the parliament when in Budapest History meets architecture On a grand scale. It's a bit of walking but each step was filled with wonder and to see the original crown is a highlight Simply put wow
Beautiful . Beautiful. Recommended for sure. Do not miss it. Architectural master piece. Hand painted rooms. Art lovers must see.

Really breathtaking building. There are no words which could explain the beauty of this building. I can't decide if it's more beautiful during day or night, when illuminated. You should see it in both "versions", definitely! Watch it from every angle, look at it from vicinity to see every detail, look at from distance, but it's the most stunning from the other side of Danube. Really - I saw many stunning and beautifully made buildings in Europe, but this one is on my top list!

Impressive once past the chaos at entry. First, you need to book ahead online to be sure of a place on an English tour.On arrival there is a scrum at the entry / security point. They only allow one or two tour groups through at any time. Others are turned away. But, there are no signs saying who gets through. Guides come to the gate and say once which group should now come through. So, only get there 10 mins before tour at the most and then watch/listen for your guide.Once through, the tour and the building are well worth the hassle. Highly recommended and do visit the memorial to the 1956 uprising too.

A Must See. Parliament building is the most iconic image of Budapest, and it's no surprise. The building is spectacular from either side of the river. You should be sure to visit twice, one in the day and once at night. I understand the building is 1/8 occupied. I didn't take a tour, but wish I had. The building is near two of my favorite restaurants, Duran Szendvics (Sandwiches) and Hummusbar. Both provide simple, fresh, flavorful meals at ridiculously cheap prices. (I've reviewed both restaurants elsewhere.) After lunch or dinner, stop at Aldi for a triple chocolate ice cream bar for about 70 cents. You can enjoy your ice cream bar at the local park in Szabadzag ter. It's fun to grab a seat near the statue of Ronald Reagan and watch other tourist take pictures with his likeness.
Wow!. Incredible building next to a beautiful place and the river. Walk by and be impressed! We didnt go in, but just walking around the enormous building took half an hour!
Gorgeous building! . Gorgeous building sitting right on the Danube. Looks really impressive, especially when lit up at night. Tours are available.

Best building. What a lovely building ! A must see from all the sides. From front , back and also across the river. By day and by night. Also if u get the chance must go inside. At the entry they have a machete made from matches that has an incredible story. All the architecture it's just amazing. Love it

Wondeful building, especially at night. Good tour too.. The huge Parliament building is wonderful to see and photograph. It's lit up at niIght, and the pictures are even beter. The tour is a bit disorganized at first, but it's a good tour thereafter, and you can take pictures most places in the building. If you've been through enough Capitol building tours, there's a sameness to them. But each comes with its own heroes and history and architecture. The tour was worth the time and cost (about US20). Consider booking the tour online if you can print the tickets and bring them with you. The Parliaent has a nice gift shop with better souvenirs than the usual schlocky gift shops around town.. There's also a small cafeteria with decent sandwiches and the like. If it's lunchtime when you are there, it may be the best option as other food may be a medium distance away. The cafeteria staff speaks very good English

Outstanding attraction. 3rd largest European Parliament--impressive considering there are only 199 MPs and 600 employees working in this massive complex. Whether you go on your own or with a tour company, you are led on this tour by someone who works for the Parliament. So, unless part of a day-long grand tour of Budapest, this is one attraction easy enough to do by yourself.

Breathless!. One of our main reasons to visit Budapest. Such a beautiful site situated right next to the Danube River. When we visited there were so many river cruises docked nearby and we can see why. Take a stroll along the river and gaze at all the beautiful landmarks across the river as well.

Beautiful building. As others have mentioned this is an architectural masterpiece. It looks wonderful both close up and from a distance both during the day and at night from either the Chain Bridge or the Buda side of the city. The setting is also wonderful although it is worth considering that in front of parliament was where the massacre that ended the 1956 uprising occurred. When we visited there was a small ‘museum’ exhibition about the events of 1956 just a short walk from the parliament building and which was a sobering but worthwhile experience. When we visited the parliament building we had intended to go on a tour inside the building but did not want to wait three hours for the next English Language tour. It is possible to book on-line so if the interior of parliament is something you really want to see then it’s probably a good idea to book in advance. The visitor centre where tours depart from has a nice café and other facilities where it’s nice to escape to be cool on a hot summer’s day.

Gorgeous building. Absolutely sumptuous building, well worth seeing. If you show up without a tour reservation, you can buy a ticket and they will assign you to the next tour that has space. If you have to wait a while, it's a good time to go down to the river and see the Shoes monument which is nearby.

Stand-Out Feature of Budapest. Very imposing buildings with a beautiful architectural style. Certainly a sense of grandeur and splendour attached with them as well as an air of power and governance. Very fitting government buildings. Unfortunately we did not get an opportunity to view the interior but the exterior is impressive as it is. If you walk around the buildings, you can get the opportunity to view the changing of the Guard which takes place every so often. The statue of Imre Nagy is located nearby as well as a collection of ice-cream parlours and cafe's. The Parliament is very scenic along the Danube.
Very impressive. Only watched it from outside from landside and the river. It is beautiful. Tours are also available.

Awesome architecture. If your a lover of fantastic design and architecture this is a fantastic place to go and explore. Guards surround the parliament similar to how they do in Buckingham palace. The amount of time that must be put in to keep the parliament clean and in constant flawlessness is incredible well worth a visit

Stunning architecture. The parliament is a stunning art deco building. A guided tour is mandatory to enter into the Parliament, and in the summer, the tours are quite popular - it's best to book in advance online. Our guide was very knowledgeable and we learned a lot about Hungary's national history during our hourlong visit.

Extensive but need to Book. We tried booking online the day before and had to do the 8.45am slot as later times booked out. They supply audioboxes with the tour and if you want to miss stairs they offer a lift. Great tour. Can take photos on most areas.
Must see. I woule certainly advise to the tourists. Fascinating building, also at night. Im hungarian but always admire it when i go by

Absolute amazing. 1000% worth to view it by night. The most amazing thing to view in Budapest by night.
i take a tour in Danube by night with boat.
The images and the view of the Parliament by night with the lighting it is amazing.

Beautiful!. This is an absolute must-see! The building is just incredible and stunning to look at from the outside. Unfortunately we didn't manage to get inside (out of choice) mainly because we didn't feel the need to, but I can imagine that it's just as amazing. It doesn't take long to walk around the outside and we even managed to see the changing of the guard. Would definitely recommend!

Perfection at night.. Simply amazed by the beauty of the Parliament. However, if you want to have a better view of it, go at night. It looks like another place. Walk along its fabulous architecture, enjoy the view from the other side of Danubian.

Even more spectacular at night . What a view. I stayed at the a intercontinental and had a great view across the water of Parliament. That whole water area is like one big museum. I think you'd be hard pressed to find so much great architecture in one photo capture.

An incredible, awe-inspiring tour. The largest parliamentary building in the world, the tour was well guided, and full of interesting details. Apparently 44 kilos of gold were used in the gold gilding alone! Incredible structure, and one of the most beautiful as well - right up there with the Taj Mahal!

Amazing architecture. These buildings can be seen by from across the river, on one of the many boat trips or by walking around the area, which I would recomend.The area around the building is beautifully landscaped and well maintained.A must on a sight seeing tour of Budapest

Nice enough. . Not a right lot to say about parliament building, If your cutting around Budapest you'll be guaranteed to see it at some point so no real reason to do a specific trip. Save your cash and just look at it from the bus. It's a nice building though, fair one to whoever built it.

Beautiful. Budapest is incredible for the architecture and the Parliament is worth a visit for the view ! You can take the famous picture (or just have a look) on the other side of the Danube, at the end of the afternoon the light is wonderful. You can also visit the Parliament.
Must do. This was ace. Loved it. Definitely something you need to visit and check out! In a good location of other buildings that are good to visit!
Amazing to see from the outside. We visited outside just went to see the building, was amazing! But I reccomand to see from the Buda side, or even to take a ferry on the Danube river! Really worth it
Go for the guided tour- excellent!. It's worth going to book your tickets if you are not successful online, as the tours are timed and absolutely brilliant! So informative and in perfect English.

A charming, if quick, tour. . The tour for the Hungarian Parliament was good! It was a beautiful building and the guide encouraged us to take pictures and was very passionate. We found the tour to be a bit quick, as the tour guide told us she was only going to show us one half of the Parliament because it was symmetrical
Huge building. A really massive building and a city icon. Really beautifull at night with all the lights and even better if you see it from the "Bastión de los Pescadores" or from the "Ciudatella"
Gothic Architecture . We are lucky to have a hotel opposite this amazing building. Very impressive and the guide told us a lot about the history of the building. One architectural gem in the city.

Stately . What a grand edifice - influences of Westminster, but unique in its own way.
We watched a very splendid changing of the guard at the central flagpole - touches of John Cleese and ageing communism.
Very picturesque setting with great bars and coffee shops surrounding this magnificent building.
Beautiful . An amazing building, location near danube river. Goose bumps when you see it at night, illuminated. Will come back soon

Nice. The parliament buildings are by the Danube Promenade, closer to the Museum.
There is a Visitor Centre adjacent to the parliament which has a free toilet.
Incredible architecture. So much to see here in Budapest , the Parliament building is awesome, so huge and incredibly ornate.
Plan ahead. It is a must but be prepared for a few hours. For the shear size takes time then to add all the people and lines asd more. I would say st least 4 to 5 hours

visit card from Budapest. When you say Budapest - this is what usually comes to your mind first.
One of the main attractions in Budapest.

A very interesting visit!. Having not much knowledge of Hungarian culture, we decided to visit the parliament building to learn some more facts. This was the first thing that we did upon arriving in Budapest and we were not disappointed. The guide who took us around was extremely knowledgeable and was able to explain lots of the symbolism inside the building. We were lucky enough to see the ceremony in the crown room between the military officers there. The tour incorporates a visit to the assembly room where politicians debate and hold important meetings and this is a must-see. A very informative visit giving an insight into Hungarian culture.
Fantastic building. Took a cruise down the danube to get a great view of the parliament building. Its meant to be one of the largest buildings and when you see it for yourself its breathtaking.
Must go!. Beautiful and mandatory touristic site. Go at night and by the other site of the river to see it with the lights on.
Huge!!!. I walked to that place and was amazed that the building was that huge. I paid to visit it and althought it was very instructive and very interesting I don't think it's worth the money.

Beautiful!. The Parliament is very impressive. Make sure at arrive early to book a tour. We got there around 11 am and tours in English were pretty much sold out for the day. We decided to book a tour in Spanish since my husbands speaks it. When we returned for our tour it turned out they had guide and headsets in English anyway.
Impressive. What can one say. you need to see this for yourself during the day and at night. certainly one of the most impressive buildings around
Well worth a tour. Beautiful building. Well worth going on the tour. I would recommend getting your tickets in advance. The website is easy to navigate.
Great building. This is a huge builng that you can see from every location of the city, bu you still get closer to see the details.

Go at night! . Incredible lit up at night with birds flying overhead! Well worth seeing it from the far side of the Danube and then crossing the bridge to see up close and walk the gardens. Also be sure to cross the square and see the reflected view in the water fountain looking back towards the building! Fantastic!

My favourite part in Budapest!. I spent 2 weeks in Budapest for summer course. The place was the last place I visited before going back home (which I regret deeply actually).The building is really impressive, the architecture left me speechless actually.I didn't sign up for the tour though, I think the view from inside the building should be as beautiful as outside view.Spend more time to visit the bunker museum near the building and guard change ceremony.Shortly, this place is a must visit while you are in Budapest!

Fabulous and best by night. I visited at 12 pm and also at 22.00 pmIt s gorgeous by day and fabulous by nightIt better if you see the details standing nearby and admire it by farYou can t miss itNext to kossuth metro station (red line)

make sure you take the tour. must see in budapest. we bought the ticket at the ticket counter and wited about half hour. The tour is about 45 minutes. definitely worth it. you can take picture in most places inside except one room. And make sure you come back at night, the build lights up in the night. Best place to view is across the river

Absolute must see- book in advance!. The Parliament tours run throughout the day and are conducted in many different languages. I would recommend booking online as the queues on the day were crazy and unnecessary as the online booking system is straightforward. You have to be part of a tour, you cannot walk around without being part of a tour. The guides are very informative and the building is a must see when visiting Budapest.
Good architecture . Good building, shame about the construction surrounding. Location along the river provides an excellent view. Good distance to the inner city
A day among the royals. I didn't go inside. We just walked around the gardens. It's super pretty! Right by the Danube. You can go inside but you have to pay
Gorgeous. One of the most beautiful buildings on the Danube river. By night it becomes a little gem on the bank of the river. Visit it by day and you must visit it by night also.

The most beautiful Parliament of Europe. Must see it!But go INSIDE!. Inside beauty of the building is also attractive plus the house is the location of the Holy Crown of St.Stephen (1st King of Hungary) which is worth to visit
:). It was a non trivial exercise to get into the Parliament such is the interest from tourists and locals to...
Impressive . Architectural beauty! Large and imposing, it warrants a visit by day and by night to see it lit up. Impressive!
Extraordinary building.. If you have an hour to spare in Budapest, you should take a tour of Parliament. It is easy to purchase tickets in advance on line, and it is well worth every penny!

Stunning, inside and out!. Parliament dominates Budapest's riverside landscape with its grand architecture. After admiring Parliament from the outside, myself and my boyfriend opted to purchase a ticket to participate in a tour inside of the building. Tours are run all day in different languages such as English, Spanish, French, German, Russian etc. You should arrive early in order to make sure you are able to purchase a tour ticket before they sell out, as they are very popular so tours sell out quickly! The tour lasts approximately 45 minutes and guides you into beautiful, grand and decadent halls - the grand staircase was definitely the highlight of the tour for me! I would recommend this tour to friends, however it involves quite a bit of standing around and listening to the tour guide provide information on each room so I would not recommend taking children on this tour.
Impressive building.. Haven't been inside and I don't know if you cab go inside. If you are around it's worth a visit just to walk around and see the architecture.
Impressive view. Looks very impressive from the outside. We only got into the memorial museum in front of the parlement. The building was closed to the public.
Stunning. Absolutely beautiful building! It's worth to see. Also good way to see that is canal cruise in the evening, I also recommend that one.

Like looking at a photo in a calendar. . The Parliament is a magnificent building. From the outside it seems to much to look at. I was very much amazed by all the details in the construction of this building. Security is posted around the building and at night the building is very well lite. Which makes for the coolest photos.The Parliament is very easy to get to from the subway station. It is also very close to The Jewish memorial. It's definitely a site to see if you come to Budapest. If you thought this was helpful please like.

Brilliant . Visited here whilst in budapest in july, did not go inside but even from the outside this building is a thing of beauty and you dont realise how big it is until your right up to it, would definately take the tour if i return

Interesting Insight. Security checks completed this tour was informative and interesting. Not too much detail to make you 'switch off''. Our tour guide was excellent. Beautiful architecture and an opportunity to see the coronation jewels. Well worth a visit. We booked in advance (on line) would recommend doing this to save queuing .
Perfect. Everything in this parliament is cared in every detail. The parliament is shining beauty perfection order and love for beautiful things.
Stunning!. I would highly recommend seeing this during the day and then seeing it again at night. At night it is stunning! The whole building lights up golden

Excellent Interior. Although you get relatively little time actually inside the interior of Parliament, it's worth the steep admission price. The rooms you get to see (the main senate chamber, the Grand Hall, the crown room, and many more) are all stunningly beautiful. I just wish you had a little more time to enjoy it; you're shuffled through pretty quickly. If you don't reserve tickets ahead, arrive here early and get spots for later in the day. This strategy worked fine in April, but in summer you should probably book a few days ahead online.

Beautiful building with an interesting history. I really enjoyed the tour of the Hungarian parliament. I thought the building itself was beautiful inside and out. With the tour you can also get a 45 minute english guide who takes a small group through each food and explains the significance and history. Overall would highly recommend!
Outstanding architecture. We arrived in time to see the changing of the guards - fascinating! Would have liked to have been able to see inside the building!
A must Visit @ Budapest. A must visit if you are at Budapest but make sure that you book in advance through the net else you may not get a guided tour.

Beautiful building inside and out . I had a tour of the parliament and it was worth the time and cost. The rooms are richly decorated, and impressive throughout the building. Photographs are allowed in all but one room.
Majestic building. It is a massive building so good to look at . The architecture is great. On the bank of River the view from cruise boats is phenomenal
Fantastic. A very huge and imposing structure with lovely design. A must see in Budapest. If you want to see it from inside, pls book your tickets in advance. When we visited, all tickets were sold.

Don't just view from the outside. Although it's pretty impressive from the outside alone, make sure you take the time to get a guided tour of the inside. They offer tours in a number of languages and each takes about 45 minutes. The architecture, history, art and gold truly make it a worthwhile visit. The tour provides ear pieces so you don't need to worry about missing anything the guide is saying.
Beautiful place.. Didn't get a chance to see all that this area if budapest has to offer but did see the guard change. Very crowded but we'll worth a look when your here.

Fantastic architecture. Its wonderful to walk around Budapest and this is one of the buildings you can get very close to so you can appreciate all the work that's gone into building it. At night its well lit up and makes a great photo from one of the boat cruises or from across the river on the other bank.

An amazing monument of history and culture!. Our visit to the Hungarian Parliament was truly an amazing experience! We had to pre book our tour based on the lanaguage we desire. It's a guided tour which is mandatory along with an audio guide. The last English tour was at 5pm. Inside, you will be taken through the various corridors and rooms of the palatial structure, which was built in the 18th century. The tour takes you to this gigantic hall which is exactly under the dome, where the Crown jewels are kept and is well guarded by traditional Hungarian guards. The Parliament grounds are vastly spread throughout the area. I would recommend to go early to avoid the crowds.

Interesting guided tour of great building . The Parliament building looks sensational from every angle outside, whether up close or across the river - and inside its more of the same, making a guided tour very worthwhile.Tours are split into languages across the day, with an engaging tour guide showing you around one half of the building (it's symmetrical, so identical the other side, which is the 'working' side I believe). Getting to see the Hungarian crown jewels and the parliament chamber are the highlights, with lots of interesting facts learnt throughout.With discounts for EU citizens and the option to book online before and print tickets, it's well worth a visit for anyone interested in history, architecture and politics.

Architecturally Stunning. When people visualize Budapest, the Parliament building is usually the iconic image most people associated with this beautiful city. While on a Danube River Cruise, my wife and I were lucky enough to stop in Budapest and see this majestic building. It is the epitome of what you expect buildings to look like in Europe.After our guided tour of the city we were able to explore Budapest on our own and had to visit the Parliament building for our photo op. While I believe they offer guided tours of the Parliament building, we did not partake in any of those tours. Instead we simply walked along the river bank and around the building to see it from all angles. What one would imagine to be the front side of the building along the river bank, is actually the back side of Parliament. If you walk around front you can get another beautiful and different view of this classic government house and catch Hungarian soldiers stationed at attention. The Hungarian Parliament is a must see for you to claim your iconic photo. Yes, some people may not see the reason or purpose to go, as it is just a building. However, don't we all enjoy Europe for its classic architecture? As an added bonus, be sure to visit at night when it is lit up!
Amazing Architecture. Very good for history lovers, boring for me. It's very imposing guarding the Buda river and it can be seen from up the mountain. Definitely recommend it.
Pre- book. Make sure you take your EU details so that you can take advantage of the reduced rates for EU citizens. Pre-Book as the tours get very busy and are only in certain languages

Iconic. This is a grand place. We were lucky enough to get there early and see a military honor guard march out and raise the national flag, accompanied by drummers and military flare. We had also prearranged a tour (by computer prior to our trip) of the interior. This is recommended, since there is a size limit for each language group, and they fill up fast. You enter the guest center for the start of the tour. This center also has free toilets just outside, and a very nice gift shop and cafe inside. The tour itself was conducted by a young lady who had excellent English. It is a relatively thorough tour, full of historical facts, that well displays the grandeur of the building. Also, make a point of taking some photos from the Buda side of the river. This gives you that iconic perspective that you often see on travel commercials.
A must visit. Very interesting tour of the Parliament. Very significant in Hungarian history. Lovely building. Entry is lower cost for EU citizens

One of the most beautiful buildings in the world!. Just lovely! This iconic building is as beautiful on the inside as from the outside, the Dome Room being amongst the most stunning anywhere. We would definitely recommend this as a "must do" attraction for anyone visiting Budapest. It was easy to book on line, there are guided tours throughout the day, in a range of languages.

Most Beautiful Building. My husband and I were on a 5 city/country trip across central Europe.We came up from the metro to see the parliament building and it took our breath away.We saw a lot of beautiful buildings on this trip but the Hungarian parliament was one of the most spectacular have ever seen.

Beautiful and insightful. A beautiful building with in an informative tour which is provided in many different languages. The price of the tour was extremely well worth the money and would strongly recommend this to anyone. Also if you get the opportunity see the building from the outside at night!
Beautiful. Only had time to view outside! Understand tours are available unsure if they are in English. Interesting 'shoe' memorial on edge of river!!!!

Simply massive. The Hungarian House of Parliament is really massive. It is probably the biggest building in Hungary and has several wings. It is really impressive to see from the squares surrounding the building. One of the squares also has a pillar which is circled by guards who get ceremonially relieved from duty once every few hours. Fun fact about the Parliament is that there's around 40kg of gold and around 500.000 gems incorporated in the building.
River cruise. Three days in Budapest and we will see this building in the day and night from the Danube. It really is spectacular . Also it's a standout from high up on the other side.
Gorgeous. It was the most beautiful parliament building that I have ever since. Great architecture outside and looks like a palace inside.

Simply breathtaking. We recommend taking a river cruise where you will have a chance to snap some amazing photographs. By foot there are epic gardens located around the vicinity with equally amazing sculptures.

Great piece of architecture ruined by nationalist symbolism. I can't say anything about this building that hasn't been said by someone else here before. Simply great architecture! But what really disturbed me was the flag ceremony which takes place every day in front of the parliament. In a country with a right wing government which turns more and more authocratic and which also stands for discrimination (gypsies) and xenophobia (muslims/refugees) this theatralic display of nationalism made me feel very uncomfortable. It felt a bit like I travelled back to Germany in the late 1930s... even the style of the uniforms... And of course there is no EU flag around this building too.
Very beautiful. One must see the parliament. no one can miss it because it is right there. We took a one hour cruise and the parliament looked very pretty at night - all lighted up.

A definite visit on your trip to Budapest. This is one of the most beautiful buildings in Budapest. The architecture is out of this world. Do a guided tour in the Parliament building but remember to take your passport! They are very hot on checking your nationality. The building is even better at night. A definite 'must see'.

Visit the Parliament . This is a massive building that is very impressive with its no-gothic architecture and impressive massive staircase. Back in the evening and it is all lit up in its splendor. A must to see

Night time visit.. We visited the Parliament at night to see it all lit up. This is a must see especially as the shoes on the Danue are near by also. Fun time was at 9pm when vapour is released by the front of the building from vents that are really cooling.
Beautiful both in the day and in nighttime. It stands in Pest, but the best view is from Fishermen's bastion in Buda. The most beautiful building in Budapest.
Interesting to see. Location of the parkiament building is very nice. Near by the river. We joined an English tour in the building. It can be interesting also for you.

Don't miss it - a glorious building - better than ours!. This place is just lovely. A bargain if you are a UK (or any other EU country) citizen, at 2,200 florint ( £ 6 - 7 ) as it is 5,500 for others. You are let in in groups of about 45 people. Make your reservation on line and choose your time of visit based on language spoken etc very easy,

A view into History. While in Budapest this is well worth the time to visit. The tour is great and very informative and yet not to long. I would recommend going in the morning as it seems a little less busy the earlier you go and cooler especially if you are visiting in the summer months.

All home made. We booked the guided tour in advance (very easy web site) and payed by credit card. The tour is very interesting but there are lots of stairs. The place is fascinating, the guide explained in detail the construction of the palace, that was almost all made by Hungarian people using Hungarian products. Very nice looks from the windows. Remember to cross the bridge and see it from the other side of the river

One of the most stunning I've seen!. I guess the title says it all. The Parliament is truly a beauty! At night and even at daylight. It was so grandiose that I couldn't take my eyes off of it the whole time I was walking along the sides of Danube River. It was probably 1 km of what could be only less than 30 minutes walk but I ended up doing it for more than an hour. Too much pictures were taken. I just couldn't stop but marvel at its beauty. I did this walk around 11pm so it was pretty quiet and no interruptions from other tourists. Securities are visible every hundred meters so I felt safe walking alone.
To . Well worth going. Tour guide was very knowledgeable. Bought tickets at hotel for specific time slot.

Magnificent building ! Great tour !. We arrived at 10am only to find a long queue waiting - early bird catches the worm ! We finally got a same day ticket for 11:30am. The outside of the building is magnificent (especially why an azure blue sky) and the inside is "golden" - nice 45 minute tour with easy to understand English and interesting facts and figures.... Go Hungary !

A tour around Budapest Parliament building.. With 40kg of gold spread widely around this building it is a sight to behold. You are given an audio device so that all within the large tour can hear the guide. The Crown of St Stephen is on display for all to see and watching the rotation of the guards on interesting experience. There are a lot of stairs but if you wish you can take a lift. The staircase however is opulent and worth a visit. All in all a well presented tour of a working building.
Impressive Budapest Parliment. This is the gem architectural building to see in Budapest. Pictures of this structure are amazing from Buda Hill and from a night cruise through the Danube.

Absolutely the most beautiful buildings. Totally breathtaking, the building is located next to the river and is a stunner. I loved every detail of it. Budapest is in my opinion the most beautiful city in the world.

Nice building, frequent tours. My main piece of advice is to plan the visit well ahead: there are many tours per day but if you get there late you may be disappointed because English ones are full.Moreover, the entrance is about 10 minutes walk far from the nearest station..Luckily I could join the Italian one (the guide was so kind to translate in the breaks for English speakers!). Brief security checks are performed at the time of the tour and a receiver with headphones is handed out to hear the guide! Very handy!The building itself is quite nice but not exceptional; the crown in the mid of is the most important part (no photos allowed in that room). The tour is rather informative but may be inessential, such a shame that the recent history is relegated to the end of the tour with a brief exhibition. If you are lucky enough you may witness the change of the guard in the room of the crown jewels.To be honest, I would not recommend to families with little children as it will be a bit boring for them. Overall, it's hard to rank it as the most important thing to do in Budapest..Final reminder: Do keep an eye on your ticket as you can't go OUT without it!

Wow, stunning, but short!. Bought tix online and prior. You will get a weird headset that fits in one ear, sort of. Went on a mid Sunday tour time.The tour is nice. If you can, go up the stairs and take photos.Seeing the crown was my highlight. Who knew it was smuggled out of the country during WWII and given to the Americans, safely held at Fort Knox until the mid 1970's?The tour is under 40 mins, which seemed short for such a large historical building.

Impressive building, poor tour. Impressive building but tour was a very big group so couldn't take in the grandeur of building and information lacked any direction or theme. Random facts about random parts of buildings.

Impressive building!. Parliament building is one of the most beautiful I've ever seen, both from land and water. Museum inside is great also, would suggest buying tickets online before getting there because tours are scheduled by the hour and by language and spaces are limited, so to make sure you get inside at the time you want is better to get the tickets in advance.

Cleanest cleanliness and imponence. The parliament, visible from Buda at the other side of the Danube too, looks extremely well kept and clean. It is majestic! I'd love to be hungarian just to have that.
Simply great piece of architecture. I must say this is the best looking Parliament in this part of Europe. It looks fantastic. Great to stroll aroun and just look at it.

Gorgeous Building. Sailing into Budapest at night on the Danube and you see this large & stately edifice - beautifully lit - what a magnificent view of an architecturally beautiful building. We just passed by it during the day, we did not stop in for a tour.
Stunning!. Probably one of the most lavish parliament building in Europe. The guided tour was concise and easy to understand. The interior of the building was amazing and littered with gold.

Great visit. Booked online for the visit wich is reccommended in summer. Enjoyed very much and well worth visit. Very grand you can take pictures for most of your apart from one part. You are given head set for tour and taken round by guide. Very cheap if you are from eu. Take some nice pics. Your bags are scanned on way in.
Sightseeing. Walked around the beautiful building. There is a very poignant underground museum depicting the 1956 massacre of citizens by the Russians.

Stunning architecture and location. The neo-gothic architecture leaves you stunned as well as the shere dimensions of this building. Take a short walk by the Danube, and approach this building packed with history of hungarian state and independence.

Stunning bldg. Claims to be the 3rd largest Parliament bldg in Europe. Striking architecture and absolutely gorgeous at night when illuminated. One of the prettiest buildings you're likely to see anywhere in Europe.
Superb Building. This is the building featured in the tourist photos of Budapest; a must see and next to several museums. The Parliament Building is magnificent.

Definitely worth an hour of your time in Budapest. We had a private tour for our group which we had arranged beforehand and it was definitely something we're glad we did. Would recommend booking tickets beforehand as there was quite a queue when we arrived. The building looks impressive on the inside and the outside and if you have a good guide it can be an interesting visit
BeAutiful building. Great tour, very passionate tour guide. Interesting history. Well worth the visit. The architecture and interior is awesome! Don't miss this one!

Amazing. Unfortunately I only saw the outside although it is possible to book tickets to view the inside. The building however is breathtaking definitely by night with the lights on. In my opinion you should watch it during day and night but make sure you don't miss the night. Make sure to watch it from the buda side (other side of water) or even better from the water itself.

Excellent visit. Walked around it and it was breathtaking, great architecture and lots of open space. Missed it on our first visit but made an effort to go and we enjoyed it. We got the number 2 tram to it.

Must see in budapest. A tour that is often sold out, the parliament has great architecture, lots of history, and great tour guides. We liked it so much that we bought it for all the other 20 family members who came with us. It overlooks the river and even if you do not take the tour, I would make sure to stop your Segway or boat next to it for some great pictures.Our highlight of Budapest!

Very Impressive. You cannot escape a view of the Parliament Building from pretty much anywhere along the Danube River in Budapest. It is massive and, if you take the tour, you realize, very impressive. It is absolutely stunning and a must-see. Make sure to get tickets as early as possible, as the tour group sizes are limited.
Beautiful architecture. We walked past here by day and again at night. A really beautiful sight, impressive architecture and when all lit up at night it's something to behold.
A nice half hour. A nice quick tour of a beautiful building given by a guide who tried to show interest. It was clear she does this over and over.
Walk by the river. A must see in Budapest. Amazing building that will certainly consume parte of your pictures' storage

Extraordinarily Beautiful from outside. The parliament is an unique building, it deserves a long time just starring at it from all sides. First of all from closer so you can appreciate all the details and then from the Fisherman's Bastion or the Castle to look at it as a whole. In the night is just AMAZING. I haven't been inside but..next time for sure

Most impressive building in Budapest.. The Guided Tour covers all the main parts of the building and its history. The main staircase and parliamentary chamber are outstanding and the tour takes about 45 minutes. Best booked direct as it is cheaper to make your own way there.

Amazing - worth a visit. This is an amazing building. It is just incredible how much governments are willing to spend on their principal government building. For a relatively small country - this building rivals any other you might have seen worldwide. One benefit of the war - is that the building is newly reconstructed. The tour lasts about 45 minutes - adding time for security and so forth - you need to allow 75 minutes. Building is kit at night at least in the street racing side - and makes a nice photo. The river facing side not lit up as much at night. Even if you don't do the tour - you will stop here for sure as it is the place always featured in the photos of Budapest.
Gothic style wonderful building. Visit at night and you might see the thousands of bats swooping around the roof in the spotlights. Great sight.
Highly recommend the guided tour. The tour was really interesting and engaging, and very good value for EU citizens who get a discount rate. Book tickets online in advance as tours sell out.
Great picture at night. I went on a tour and this is worth seeing the inside. The view of the parliament at night when across the bridge is breathtaking!
Breathtaking . Looking from Buda over to Pest side! This is amazing to see ! Take a walk over the chain bridge it's pretty long too.

Interesting and short. 45 minutes of a nice elegant tour.
We have booked in advance in the web and printed at home.
kids and adults can both enjoy.
Interesting history and architecture. Well worth taking the interior tour of this historic building. Easy to walk to from the Pest side pedestrian area across one of the beautiful bridges.

Very impressive Parliament House. It is recommended to register in advance on a tour in Parliament.The tour will be held in several languages and lasts about 40 minutes.Tour we were in, there were some problems with the guide's microphone so that some of the explanations that we did not hear very well.The tour travels between some important rooms and corridors in Parliament and and we saw among other things, the secure the royal crown.

Best Parliament in Europe. This place is gorgeous - book tours before going because it costs money to go in and you need a reservation. But the outside is so stunning that it's worth going just to see the exterior!

Most impressive. This is undoubtedly within my top 3 attractions for Budapest. Arrive early and walk around first enjoying surrounding buildings and change of guards. Buy tickets for a tour online - when we were visiting all tours for the day were sold out. Photos of facade better be taken from fishermen's bastion and/or boat cruise.Consider returning at night - building is beautifully illuminated.Tour itself was interesting but quite rushed.

Very Similar to London. Certainly worth a visit, the building is very similar to the Houses of Parliament in London especially from the river or opposite bank. The changing of the guard is a fairly subdued affair, but the area is excellent for photo opportunities.Then take the tram along the river bank.

Superb hotel with an excellent staff. A great visit in an excellent hotel. Staff were extremely helpful and very friendly. Hotel is in a great location and in walkable distance to many of the sites. Budapest is a great city to visit

Beautiful building!. We visited the beautiful Parliament building with on an English tour. The tour lasts around 45 minutes and the lady who took the tour was very knowledgeable. We booked online before we left England. While on the tour there was a changing of the guards. The tour is very well organized so you don't have to show up until it is time to go in. You have to walk up 135ish steps to go up inside but there is a life if you cant walk so well. There are free toilets just outside the visitors center or you can pay and use the toilets just by the café.

Beautiful building and interesting tour.. The tour guide offered enough Hungarian history along with information about the Parliament to make the tour interesting. The use of headsets made it easy to hear, and the guide provided adequate time and opportunities for photos. An absolutely stunning building both inside and out. Tour well worth the time and cost.

Splendid building. The whole site is amazing, buildings are splendid, especially night views. Try to take both day-time and night-time walk. Also the views from Parliament by the river is amazing, don't miss that out!

A very nice area and museum. Nice gifts to be found and lots of local history.
A must see is the shoes by the Danube.
Carry on from here to chain bridge.
Can be accessed from tram number 2 from Margaret's bridge stop on the 6 & 4 route.

Beautiful building!. Beautiful building and very good landscape architecture around it. Sadly didn't ave time to visit inside but definitely worth at least seeing from the outside. With water features around at particular times of the day and guards.
Magnificent architecture!!. There was a demonstration outside the building during my visit but it did not take away from the beauty of the building. The building was spectacular!!

Visits in differents langages. Need to reserve the tickets on Internet the day before !
Very nice, visit possibles with comments in 45 mins

Impressive both inside and out. Parliament was not in session so we got to see the actual chamber where debates take place and legislation is passed. The building is huge and quite ornate in places. A tour with a guide or audio guide is recommended. Otherwise, you may miss some of the most important features.

This was a surprise.. The parliament building is not the usual place to be a tourist attraction butBudapest is the exception. The building is stunning inside with beautiful decoration which includes 40 tones of gold leaf. Lot's of stairs but does ave a lift. The guides are excellent. Very professional, knowledgeable and well-trained. Tours can be given in a variety of languages.

Beautiful building - must see. Whether your up close, or looking on from across the water, this is one of the most stunning buildings in Budapest. When you go, look up when there is a change of guards as there is a short 5-10 minute parade during the day which is worth watching!
Didn't get to go in. Amazing by day, even more amazing by night. We didn't get to visit but they do do tours if you want to go inside.

Beautiful Building. Must see (actually, with it being so large it's kind of hard not to see it)! A tour is worth going on. You'll only see about a tenth on the building, but it is very pretty. The 1956 memorial on the parliament grounds should be checked out as well. Plus you'll have a great view across the river to Buda Castle.

Loved this stunning building. If your visiting budapest, you have to see this!! Didn't go inside but they do tours of the building with different languages all day every day, as far as i know. Interesting architecture, one of the best in budapest!

Gorgeous at night!. Such a beautiful building and right on the river. They have done a great job of highlighting it. And there is a dedication those lost during the holocaust that is in this area by the river.

Worth Visiting- Beautiful Architecture. It is well worth visiting the Budapest Parliament, especially if you're interested in Architecture. You can only visit the interior on guided tours (prices differ and are slightly less for EU citizens and students) you can buy tickets online or at the ticket office there, but the english tours semmed to tend to sell out during summer time (early july) i bought online and then went there slightly earlier than the tour time as i could not print my tickets, but they printed them for me.The parliament is very large and beautiful inside, very ornate, it seems almost like a palace, decorated with a lot of gold.The only thing is that the headphones they give you to be able to hear your guide don't have good connection so stand near your guide, the tour is interesting and educational about the history and the day by day workings of the parliament.Definitely worth visiting!
A very pretty sight!. You have to see this if you're in Budapest!!! It's so pretty especially on a warm sunny day! I was amazed at the size of the buildings!

Magnificent building and architecture. We had a tour of the parliament building which lasts about an hour or so. The architecture is amazing and the interior extremely ornate. It is a building tour, but if you are interested in the history it will be particularly worthwhile. I am not sure how enthused kids would be (as it is a large group walking around slowly with headphones on, hearing the history) so if you have easily bored kids, stick with the dramatic view from the outside (and especially from the Danube at night).
Tour in English. Worth visiting inside:-)We ordered our tickets online, because there are only few daily tours in English. It takes 30-40 minutes but you can see all important rooms and dome.
nice place for photo. very nice place to take photo in the morning as well as in the night where you can see all the building lighting with a smart way

Must see both day and night!. Although I didn't go inside this is great place to visit and see the changing of the guards, also explore the surrounding area with water features, statues, bridges, café's etc. There is a market close by just behind the Royal Savings Bank which does great food, pastries and drinks. Make sure you go down underground to the left of the Parliament building (as you face it with the water feature and soldiers behind you). There is a free memorial to the people who died in the square in 1956. You can still see the bullet holes in the wall of the building opposite. Makes you appreciate life and the freedom we all have to explore such beautiful cities.

Great Architecture. Buy online ticket if you wish to see parliament form inside. The main dom area is fantastic. We were fortunate as could see the actually working side of the Parliament. At night also this building looks marvelous. During day time every hour there is guards changing parade. So its nice experience

Iconic Landmark. The internal tour of the Parliament Building is a must - breath-taking interior and informative tour helps you find out lots of interesting facts about the building and city. Only takes 45 minutes and well worth doing!
Historical building. This is one of the most impressive building next to the Danube. Must to see it when you are in Budapest as a tourist
Beautiful tour. We had a beautiful tour of Parliament. Staff was helpful to those with special needs who could not climb the stairs. This is a must see if only in the city for a quick visit.

Unexpected . When my boyfriend suggested I look on trip advisor for things to do in Budapest, I did not expect parliament to be so highly ranked. When we got there, however, it truly is the best thing about Budapest! It is so beautiful, from every angle with so much history.We actually went 3 times during our 4 day stay! Photographs do not do it justice the atmosphere is incredible. I'd love to go again. You cannot go to Budapest without seeing this beautiful building.
Beautiful. Didn't go in but saw enough from outside. A stunning building that is beautiful to see. Not sure if going inside would make it any better.
A Magnificent Building. A magnificent building best viewed from the river. At night when the lights are on the windows appear to be golden ! It is also an excellent waymark to find out where you are.
Beautiful. This Parliament building of Budapest is beautiful. This is my 2nd visit after 10yrs and I suggest everyone visiting Budapest not to miss this popular and magnificent building.

Great Architecture - inside and out. Buy tickets in advance for the I side guided tour. Saves a lot of time as you can only buy tickets for the next available tour and it's usually an hour or more away, due to Limited tickets for each tour.The inside furnishings are impressive and worth a visit, although the price is just a little too steep!

Beautiful building, don't miss the 1956 exhibit.. We didn't tour the inside but we walked by it every day and appreciated it's beauty. They don't do tours when they're in session, so check their calendar beforehand. The free 1956 exhibit under the courtyard was quick, but powerful.

Not worth the wait. It's like a tour run by the communist regime- so inflexible. You cannot buy tickets the day before and only the day of the tour which is stupid. And then the tours are only at certain times in certain languages so they sell out and make no accommodations. When you do see the building it is just that - a building. I'd skip the hassle of seeing this place.
Amazing! . Good tour, lots of info.Amazing architecture. Love the facts that all material and labor came from the country Itself , except some diplomatic gifts from Scandinavia .Loved it!

Super pretty!. Such beautiful buildings in Budapest and the parliament budings on the banks of the Danube river are quite spectacular, some of the most amazing views ever in this beautiful and diverse city.
