Amazing sight. This building is very attractive from all sides. We first passed parliament as we were cruising along the Danube river. This is an amazing sight as the sun starts setting. We then visited the building and the architecture is amazing. A must visit when in Budapest
Stunning architecture both inside and out.. Certainly a "must see" when visiting Budapest. We booked prior to arriving . Picked up by agent at our hotel. Very smooth tour

Just looked from outside . If we had more time we would have probably paid the Parliament a visit. I understand that one of the two identical sides is not officially used as the government longer has both an upper and lower house, and as such is open to the public - guided tours daily. From what I read it sounded interesting but time did not permit us to visit.

Magnificent. Besides the splendor of the building, I really thought highly of the underground exhibit of the 1968 uprising in Budapest. The quality of the museum was superb. The interior of the building is a fabulous experience
Awesome. This building is just full of character. The view of it from the Danube was excellent for taking photograph. Its a must go see on your trip

Good tour. We visited the parliament because it's one of the landmarks. You can only do it with a guide because it's actually a working parliament and not just a historic building. The guide was very knowledgeable and the visit very interesting. You can get to see the parliament and even some of the treasures such as the founding crown. You visit the Senate side, which is the same as the Congress, but it's open to visitors because the Senate was eliminated. I recommend this visit.

Parliament visit. Beautiful building, worth visiting. Make sure you book your tour in advance, we had to wait 2 hours from the time we purchased the tickets. Tour is quite short, maybe half an hour at most.

Marvel Architecture. Its really interesting to see it from inside, modern architecture combined with royal elegance, you get to see the crown jewels and beautiful pillars and ceilings when you enter the parliament, and no matter what happens, you will really admire the building when you take the cruise on Danube river, it looks so epic, grand and Beautiful.I would also suggest that you prebook your visit on the website as it is usually very crowded.
45 minutes and not very impressive. A bit short and souless tour. I would stick to enjoying the bulding from outside. I have seen mist parliments in Europe and this one is all about the outside.

Tourists journey. A great building
Master piece of its own type
A beautiful view from across Denube
Huge and great Art
At the top of the hill like structure giving a heart shake at its first glance

So beautiful on the outsite, but don't forget to see it from the inside.. I think the Parliament is the most beautiful building in Budapest. I can look at it from the outside for hours. However, the inside is something you don't want to miss too. It is really beautiful. Also the restaurant at the Parliament is very nice and cheap to wait for your tour to begin.
Stunning. At first sight, one would expect this building to be a church or cathedral not a government building. It is massive, beautiful and best seen from a cruise along the Danube.
Good. This place is worth a visit. They offer discount to Eu visitors get there early as it gets busy the english spoken guide was easy to understand and he knew his stuff

Gorgeous. The most dominating building in the city. Amazing architecture, especially looking from the river.
Huge structure.
Great to see both during the day and in the night.
Beautiful building. I was unable to take a tour there, but it´s worth a visit just to look/study it from outside. Even if you don´t into architecture, you will enjoy it!
Simply beautiful. Getting close is not required, but it doesn't disappoint up close, though the real beauty is better enjoyed at a distance during evening or night.
Huge building. Beautiful and interesting building. Metro goes to the Parlament. They have few exhibitions about 1956 events.

BEAUTIFUL...Book the tour in advance online!. Firstly just some good advice. Book your tour online in advance of your visit. This will avoid long queues. The building is fantastic and steeped in history. Having an English speaking guide make it way more enjoyable. Beautiful grounds and scenery.

Beautiful Building with good History. You can't miss a visit and tour of the Parliament, it's simply an amazing building with interesting history. Tour is short but very helpful and shows details and great information

Fantastic building. This is a famous and fantastic building. You can see the Holy Crown, witch more than 1000 years old. In this building working Hungarian Parlament. You must see inside and outside, if You are in Budapest.

Do the tour. It's worth it.. The Parliament is an amazing building from the outside. Some genuine 'wow' moments. We opted to do an internal tour also and really enjoyed it. The interior is beautiful. My only criticism is that you can't take photos in the dome room. However, you can everywhere else.Our guide was very knowledgeable about the building and was interesting, although it did sound very rehearsed and scripted at times. I'd recommend this if you have the time. Make sure you get there in the morning to ensure you can book a tour for later in the day in your language.

Worth a visit. Beautiful building with great history. We only got to see one side of the building, but we were told the other side was identical. There is a free underground museum about the 1956 uprising that was also interesting.

A fairytale palace at night. Impressive by day, with one small spire for each day of the year, Budapest's parliament building is open in part to the public. The two halls on the lower ground floor were split into one side for the gentry, the other for the commoners - now one is in use and the other for tourists to visit. Whilst the building is beautiful, impressive as you approach it from the square, it is more so from the pier or river behind, especially at night. Worth visiting, for you can clearly see the difference between the flat Pest behind you, the hilly Buda over the river in front of you.
Amazing icon in Budapest !!!!. Beautiful both inside and outside. It impressive day and night and much better the views from the boat cruising the Danube. This is completely a must.

Beautiful inside and outside. We had a tour through the parliament building which is really beautiful! We were lucky that we could so the changing of the guards who protect the Crown Jewels. This happens every hour so I guess that's almost with every tour. Our tour guide was great. She told everything I wanted to know in an enthusiastic way. Sometimes tours can get boring if they give you an overload of information but it was absolutely not like that! Book in advance as the English tours are sold out pretty quickly!

Awesome Architecture. This is definitely the best architecture building in Budapest, if not in Hungary and Eastern Europe. This is the largest Parliament in the world and the architectural tour has to be booked in advance for the language you choose. Sight from Danube river cruise in evening is very nice.

Lots of gold. Book earlier if you want a tour. We went on Sunday morning and most tickets had started selling out. We bought tickets for 3 pm. It is an amazing place. The tour is around 45 minutes and cost around £12 I think so quite pricey compared to everything else. It worth a visit to look round the outside for free and it looks stunning from the other side of the river or from a boat lit up at night.

Beautiful building. We stumbled across the parliament on our first eve in Budapest, it looked beautiful all lit up in the evening. We went to visit in the day and couldn't get to the building because of police and armed guards, looked as if there was an official may going on. Very interesting to watch all the police and people come out. The building is stunning and looks amazing when it's all lit up at night,
Amazing architecture. The best building in Budapest! All my foreign friends loved it. It is possible to take a tour inside, but in case you are our of time, just have a walk around.

Good tour of this spectacular building. We reserved our spaces on the tour the morning we went, printing our tickets at the hotel reception. Booking process very easy, and check-in on arrival simple too. Robust security measures as you'd expect, but this didn't take long.The tour (with personal audio earpiece to help hearing in a big group) was well-pitched; entertaining enough with enough facts and figures. Additionally, it was the perfect length - 30-40 minutes is plenty!A must-see in Budapest.

crown jewel. amazing building. probably the most beautiful parliament in the world. everything was built using materials from the austro-hungarian monarchy. it is a must see along with the fisherman's bastion and the opera house

Impressive building. The Hungarian Parliament in Budapest is huge, but also beautiful.You can enjoy walking around it or looking at it from the Danube river, but the inside is just as impressive. Fantastic gold decorations. I would recommend the tour inside the building during a stay in Budapest.There a several tours each day in different languages. EU-citizens get a discount, so remember to bring the passport if your country is a part of the European Union.

Big place but not as huge as from outside . Visiting parliament is obligation with a tour guide. When I come here, the schedule is a bit late. It should be 11.45 and we have to queue 5 minutes before. But when it's 11.40 they call a group for 11.30 :) Inside the parliament there are many corridors and rooms (which we can't visit it). There is one area, it's a center area I think, we don't allow to take pictures. Because they run 2 groups with 2 different languages in the same time, it's quite funny. Our tour guide is very strict (we don't allow stand near the crown) but other tour guide (Spanish language) is more flexible. Many people in her group stand very close to the guard and crown :) In general, personally, it's not really amazing building inside, compare to the outside. From outside I can see a very huge and wonderful architecture.

Book a tour, and do so timely!. We took the English tour and were very satisfied. It is a fairly short tour (45 minutes) and it flew by. The guide showed us around with humor and offered some key insights into the building and use of the parliament. The content was easy to follow. What a beautiful place, worth a visit to see the beautiful decorations inside.
Worth visiting. Best to book online to save the queues. The tour seemed a bit hurried and they are a bit jittery about security which i suppose is to be expected. But the building itself is gorgeous.
Amazing. One of the most amazing buildings in Budapest, extremely impressive. The building architecture is just wonderful.

Beautiful at night. We did not go into the Parliament Building and only saw it from the Danube River but I'm giving it a 5 just for the beauty of it at night. If nothing else, you must walk along the river to view this beautiful sight if you are in Budapest!!

Huge, representative, historical. Parliament is a symbol of Hungary and Budapest. It is well preserved and restored, with a guard near the main entrance and interesting decorations inside. It is described in all reports and guides. A surprise for me was square and park with many monuments to Hungarian heroes. Different styles, periods, some huge, some are small. Worth a visit and walking around.

Definitely worth going to visit. Lovely building definitely worth a visit. Whilst we were there the guards came out & did a marching parade. Very entertaining. After the parade there was an opportunity to take pictures with the guards which was really nice & unlike our guards they were allowed to smile when photos were being taken

The Ceiling Here Are Gorgeous. We took this tour and our guide was great. It was really worth the money. Although it was only about 45 minutes (it depends on the group because she invites you to spend as long as you want in some areas and some groups like to look and some don't). Then at the end you end up in a interactive museum where you can push buttons and watch all kinds of videos about history and the making of the building. That can take another 45min-one hour. We spent a lot of time in there because we wanted to know all about it. Then there is the store which has a lot of neat things but quite over priced as they all are. All in all we had a great time. It was a beautiful building.

Awesome!. Very beautiful at night with the lights on. The tour is amazing and lots to see or just hang out at the square. There are also interesting buildings if you take a walk back to the St.Stephen Basilica

one of the best place in budapest. Though you have many good places to visits once you in the Budapeat but the Parliament is one of "the must visit one . Its stretches between Chain Bridge and Margaret Bridge on the Pest bank of the Danube river. It draws one's attention from almost every riverside point. One should definitely visit this place at-least during day time as well as during night when the whole parliament building lights up, and panoramic view is awesome Highly recommneded !!

But tickets online in advance. The Parliament building itself is gorgeous from the outside, but definitely spring for the guided tour to see just how beautiful it is on the inside. The tickets are expensive, and I'd recommend buying the online in advance. We made the mistake of just showing up, but that didn't work. And no, the ticket office does NOT sell tickets tickets for any future dates--only that day. The online ticket shop is a bear--you have to register, then choose how you want to pay, etc. Set aside about 10 minutes to get through the whole process. Still worth it though.

Amazing Building and surrodings. Whilst visiting Budapest we walked around most of the city and found the parliament building to be one of the most spectacular. although we did not go in to the building itself you can by a ticket for a tour. we did go in to the memorial tour underground which shows the the history of Budapest and the massacre on the parliament square in 1956. It is also well worth visiting at night as it looks so spectacular all lit up.

Gorgeous architecture!. This parliament that took 14 years to build definitely shows it. On my next visit to Budapest, I would love to go inside. After seeing it in Harry Potter, I couldn't get over its magnificence, both in the daytime and at nighttime by cruise. Extremely picture perfect, and awe inspiring architecture.

Amazing building. We saw this building from several angles and distances and it never failed to wow. We decided not to tour the building (was with teenage son... Would have done if I was alone) but it is certainly a place to put on the list to see. Viewing from the outside was especially good from the river. We were there early evening in summer as the sun was setting behind the castle on the opposite bank, and the light it cast at that time on Parliament building made is just beautiful.

Impressive building. This is a impressive building on the River Danube in one of the most fascinating and interesting cities in the world. We dod not take the interior tour, but just many pictures next to the building and again from across the river.
Beautiful building. Unfortunately don't get to see very much inside the building. Thus expensive. Too many tour groups on top of each other.
Beautiful. A tour of the Hungarian Parliament building is a must. The building is beautiful both inside and out. A special treat is to see the Parliament building illuminated at night.

The most beautiful Parliament in Europe. This is the gem of Budapest with many historical aspects. Exterior and interior views are breathtaking. In the Parliament you can see the original ancient Hungarian crown, too. Take a boat trip on the Danube at night - it's a big hit!
Amazing architecture . What a building! We also paid for the English speaking tour inside...definitely worth it. The decor and paintings inside are inspirational.
Beautiful building . We didn't go in, but was definitely the prettiest building we saw whilst staying in Budapest. You get a very good view on the other side of the river

Hungary’s iconic building. In Hungarian, Országház translates to House of the Nation, also known as Parliament. It is one of Europe’s oldest legislative buildings, and Budapest’s iconic edifice, as well as Hungary’s largest (886 feet long or 270 meters). Construction began in 1885 and the building was inaugurated on the 1000th anniversary of the country in 1896, but not completed until 1904. The Gothic Revival style building seems like a fairy tale castle. I found the best view of Parliament during a night river cruise. The comprehensive tour of the interior is a must-see. It is perhaps the most astounding building I’ve ever encountered. Enjoy!

Opulent inside and out. Guided tour is very good but pay attention when the guide says "no photos allowed." Combine a visit here with one to the Hungarian folk history museum nearby, then walk the riverfront back to the market building.

Everything sold out!. Tickets for the same day I went there were already sold out, the woman at checkout was very unfriendly. 'Book online' was all she could say. The Wi-Fi coffee was a joke. And how to book online, if you don't have the facility to print the tickets out neither cannot be send? Quite complicated, electronic tickets should be embraced.

Very fast but worth seeing. We were able to for the first tour of the day and arrived when the box office opened. It was no problem to get tickets. We did see online that our tour was not yet sold out. After 10am is very popular with tours so if you can get there early it may be less crowded. Our guide was very informative, but there wasn't much chance to ask questions, it was a quick pace to move through. You tour the area that is no longer used for political use, there are parallel sides of the building. The interior is stunning. There is a small museum regarding the building of parliament at the end of the tour and we were able to enjoy that as well. You must pay to use the restroom but you can take your receipt to the cafe and use it toward something there. We got some cappuccino and a pastry to relax there.
Grandeur at its height. Buda-'pesch is full of beautiful buildings - like this and the bullet hole building. Still has bullet holes fron WW2. Many beautiful bridges and great places to visit.

Breathtaking building. The parliament building was the single most impressive piece of architecture in Budapest. A beauty to behold from near and far, it is truly a gem. The tour is just as informative and beautiful. Tour is required to enter the building and I would recommend booking the tour at least a day before as it fills up very fast.

Budapest Parliament House. Visited here 3 days ago and definitely worth a look. Beautiful building that is only accessible with a guided tour as still a working parliament and offices. Tour last approximately 30-45 minutes and you are guided through the building with parliamentary guards.Not a cheap ticket unless you are a local or EU resident but worth the cost. If you are lucky you will see the changing of the guard that protect the Kings crown.Tickets sell out quickly and can be bought in advance online as limited number of tickets available each day.Tours are conducted in several languages at different times.
Beautiful building.. I didn't go in (need tickets), but it's stunning. The architecture is absolutely amazing. I recommend a walk around the outside just to take it all in.

Iconic building.. Don't miss it. Every city should have a building like this! We did
a tour with Viator, which worked out well.

Very nice exterior views by day or night. You must book for English language tours.. This is a beautiful building with very nice exterior views by day or night. The view from a Danube cruise boat is excellent.
We could not get in to any of the English-language tours, despite being in Budapest twice, as we had to book online and we had web access problems on their site.

Put the Budapest Parliament Building on your list. Absolute stunning architecture and history is to be found a the Budapest Parliament building, on the banks of the Danube. On a sunny day, you will get some amazing shots and the silhouette of the building come sunset is stunning. Great for anybody looking to learn more about the history and culture of Budapest.
Stunning architecture . The views from Buda across pest and the parliament building are magical .We took a river cruise and the parliament buildings were truly magnificent !

One of the most stunning buildings I have EVER seen. This is a wonderful building in a fabulous location on the River Danube in one of the most fascinating and interesting cities in the world. What more can I say? Like the UK's Houses of Parliament in triplicate, there are tours in various languages inside, but just taking a walk round the outside is breathtaking. YOU CANNOT muss this in Budapest.

Parliament in Budapest. The Parliament is worth to visit! Very beautiful inside and outside, especially at night. As for excursion: If you speak English fluently, I'd rather advice to take an excursion in the English language. A lecture led by the Russian guide (a gentleman of around 60 years old) doesn't contain many historical facts, he told a lot of flat jokes instead.

Gorgeous interior. Architecturally not a building to be missed. Stunning interior. One-room exhibit at the end of the tour has excellent videos that detail the construction, maintenance, and history. Tour itself is just being herded around with cursory explanations, but it's fine.

Very interesting, but go early. We did a tour of Parliament and booked onto the 9.15 trip as we had visited the day before in the afternoon and saw how busy it gets.The tour was interesting and enjoyable. The building inside is fascinating and you get to see the holy crown and also the room where Parliament business is carried out. The decoration inside is very intricate and impressive.My tip is though that you MUST go to the Museum right next door - it is free and has absolutely tonnes of information, exhibits and interactive technology.
Nice tour. Beautiful and impressive parliament building. The guided tour was well run and informative. I would recommend this tour.
Great guided Tour . We had a great experience with the prebooked guided english Tour. The guide was easy to understand and the Tour lasted for 45 mins. Beautiful building.
Stunning. This building is one of the most stunning building I have ever come across. It is 100% worth the visit day and night and catching a glimpse of it at all angles.
Parliament Building. Located on the river near the Lion Bridge..definitely worth walking to and visiting inside (if possible).
The most beautiful parliament building in the world. The most beautiful parliament building in the world. Take a night cruise on the Danube, Parliament is beautiful at night.
a very beautifull place. Don't loose to see this monument at night, have a walk on the other side of the river to have the most beautifull view
Impressive. This impressive building is must see in Budapest. Better to take a boat and to enjoy the view from Danube river. You won't be disappointed.

Just incredible. A charming piece of Hungarian heritage.
If you really want to experience the Hungarian Parliament building I strongly recommend you catch a boat at night and sail past it with a coffee in hand.

Be there on time and enjoy the beauty. It is almost a must to buy the tickets in advance. The guided tour is held in 8+ languages. Choose which is appropriate to youThere is a security check before entrance and a guide shows you half of the parliament. It takes about 40 minutes to complete the tour and our guide spoke nonstop and told us everything about the history and today of the building.Tourist center is also very well organized, underground and apart from the parliament. Easy to find, navigate and clean.
Stunning building. Book a tour in advance. It is well worth it but doesn't take long. Although you see part of the parliament no longer in use. Guide was very good.
Amazing parliament. We spent 2 hours walking around the parliament & it was 2 hours well spent. The weather was really nice & not too warm, so it was really perfect.
Very pretty. We explored the parliament building by bus and by boat ride. The view is stunning and it is a fantastic piece of architecture.
Amazing architecture. We took a guided tour in English. (I had to purchase tickets online) The building is extremely beautiful. Everyone must see it.

So that's where the money went!. As soon as you see the real gold ceilings you'll know that's where the money went! Truly a magnificent architectural marvel, especially as it was Parliament not a palace!If taking the English tour, book online at least the day before as they sell out early!The museum of the history of the Parliament is good and because it's free with an audio guide you can go into as much or as little detail as you wish.Then have a delicious snack and fresh juice in the snack bar!And use the WC outside the visitors center(entry to the Parliament) on the right as you come in. It's free while they charge for the one inside.This is a must do excursion.
Interesting. Interesting and impressive building inside tour has to be booked for a specific hour. Best advice is to book online ahead.
Beautifull place. Beautifull place. When you go in Budapest.. You must visit the parliament. Before the parliament have one history museum (1956) That is free.
Very nice restaured. Impresive building near Donau. You can make a visit inside also, it is very nice, especially with guided tour. Outside is a very nice park.

2016 European Vacation . This is truly a beautiful building. The tour was interesting to all ages. Our 10 and 13 year old grandsons felt it was very educational and stated they were learning even out side of school.

Iconic landmark on the Danube River in Budapest. The Parliament building in Budapest is an iconic landmark on the Danube River. It is on the commercial for the Viking River Cruises. We docked just past the building at the conclusion of our Viking Cruise and stayed nearby at the Marriott. The architecture is magnificent. It looks spectacular at night from the Chain Bridge.

Great tour. This was my second visit to this stunning building (the 1st many years ago, while still in elementary school). I very much wanted my husband to see it. It wasn't a long tour, completely doable even with small kids but be prepared if you have dust allergies that you will most likely cough. It is a beautiful building, inside and out, with so many gorgeous architecture details (and historical info) you won't want to miss this part of Budapest while visiting. Groups are relatively small (good to have advanced reservations, especially large families) so the tour is comfortable, not crowded.

Stunning building. Absolutely stunning building inside And out, You must check it out at night when its lit up!! Amazing! Especially if You see it from the other side of the Danube like up from the Fishermans Bastion.

Capital Monument. A huge building, designed for the capital of an empire (which Hungary once was, before being dismantled after WWI). Maybe not everything there fits everybody's taste - for me there was a little too much gold inside - but how else can one appreciate the country's past if not by this glorification of bygone days?

A must see. The Parliament is perhaps the most beautiful one I've seen. It sits on the Danube and it is gorgeously lit up at night. The history of it is quite interesting from the amount of spires to the way it's heated. We didn't have time to take the tour but sure wish we had. They also have the changing of the guards out front. Don't miss this gem.
Holiday. Is absolutely gorgeous to see the Parliament in the night! Beautiful view next to the river! Also everything is beautiful in the daytime as well
Beautiful building. The only way to visit the parliament building is a guided tour,tickets could sell out pretty fast,advance booking is advised. A must see

An absolutely majestic must go when in Budapest. I would definitely the following: A visit during daytime to just see the details and just look at this majestic and beautiful building. A visit during night time to see it lit up, might be even more beautiful lit up actually(a river cruise can be a good idea). On a final note you should visit the Castle to get a fantastic perspective and view over the building with its surrondings and the city behind it.
PRETTY and Pretty. Beautiful Architecture. Lively place, many people are always taking pictures. Many cafes around make is a fun tourist place

Must see in Budapest. We visited the Parliament building on a Sunday. It was not to crowded, but you should keep in mind that entrance is with guoded tour only and groups for different languages are available. They offer tours in Hungarian, English, Italian, German, French. With this in mind please note that only a few tours are organized for each language for a day, so you might need to wait quite a lot until your lamguage will be available.If you leave in the EU , price is 2200 HUF for an adult. IF not it's 5400 HUF. Discounts for students and children are also available.The tour takes aproximately 1 hour, and will allow you to see the main rooms, halls and locations in the Parliament. Useful imformation will be provided each step.Really enjoyed this tour. It helped me better understand Hungary and it's roots.

Fantastic experience!. Travel advice suggested that the Parliament was a must-see whilst in Budapest, so we bought advance tickets. For 200HUF (just under £6 for us Brits) we had a guided tour (in English) around the inside of the building. It is absolutely splendid! Ornate decoration - especially the golden ceilings - and an interesting history. Our guide was great and very helpful. There are also lifts available for those who were less able to take the stairs. Really recommend it!

Impressive Building. An impressive looking building apparently based on the House of Parliament in London. Looks even more impressive lit up at night. Not sure if you can enter the building. Armed guards and ceremonial guards dotted around. Saw a'changing of the guard' whilst there.

Stunning. The parliament building is right on the river Danube and can be seen from all the good view points (gellert hill and castle hill) is an absolutely breathtaking building to see! I would recommend taking the river cruise from the hop on hop off ticket at night to see it in its full beauty! Is local to many other sights and is a must see if travelling to Budapest (can't really miss it however!)

Phenomenal. Don't miss the Parliament in Budapest. The building itself is very impressive but you should see the lighting at night - impressive! You should do a nightly boat cruise in order to see the Parliament in the dark.

Marvelous!! . what about this historic building? wonderful just to be seen from outside (day or night light) and marvelous when visited the interior. It is part of the glorious history of Hungary, so it should be seen and must be read immediately when you arrive in this country .... UNIC !!

Excellent view from across the river. Budapest is full of beautiful buildings and architecture, and the parliament house is one of them. Saw this as part of the free walking tour you can take in Budapest.

Fabulous building. This is a stunning building located on the river - the architecture and design is stunning and definitely worth visiting.
I would definitely recommend seeing this building when in Budapest.
Magnificent!. Absolutely magnificent! Seat of power in such beautiful architecture must inspire the law makers to serve people more.
Beautiful architecture. Walkable with a little effort from hotel. Could take the metro but walking along the Danube was a nice experience. A little longer than expected but nice views.

The most impressive Parliament I have ever seen. And I have seen plenty. This is an amazing place, the highlight of out trip to Budapest. Note: You must take a guided tour. But it is professionally done, with the guide speaking through a microphone while you listen through earplugs. This way, you can actually stay back from the tour group and take pictures without worrying about keeping up with the guide so you can hear the commentary. You can reserve a tour online, so make sure you do that or else you might have a long wait if you show up without a reservation.
Impressive. Didn't get tour as they are at different times for different languages worth checking out before your visit. Building itself is very impressive, will return next visit to Budapest .

Beautiful Building!. My husband and another couple visited the Parliament on a private city tour. It's was a beautiful building inside and out. The tour is a must to learn about the history. I would highly recommend seeing the Parliament when in Budapest.

Nice buildnig. This building is very nice, there are a lot of sights in Budapest. So, we recommend to rent a bus what goes around or buy a boat trip, from the boat you can see the most beuatuful view for taking pictures. We didn´t go into the house because we didn´t have that much time.
Beautiful! . Such a beautiful building with such intricate details so it's best to get up close to it to appreciate it fully. Even more stunning in the evening when it's all lit up. A must do!

Beautiful looking building . A real iconic looking building on banks of the danube. Looks gorgeous as you walk along up to it.
The building and square it is in is so well maintained.
Every bit as nice as the pictures you see of it.
A must see for any visit to budapest.

Beautiful building . The parliament building is absolutely stunning in the sun, and the surrounding gardens and scenery are stunning. Well worth a visit, and there are some lovely cafés and bars in the vicinity.
Beautiful . Stunning building both from land and from the boats that go past on the Danube. A must for all travellers to Budapest.

Looks great at night when lit up. We walked past this building many times. it looks great from every angle but you can't get in. There are interesting statues and monuments to look at on the outside. By the flag pole are 2 ceremonial guards. Opposite is the Museum of Ethnography well worth a visit.

Great tour. My wife and I took a guided English tour of the Hungarian Parliament this morning and it was excellent. Our guide spoke perfect English and not only told us about the building but also gave us a brief history of Hungary. Only downside is that non-EU citizens pay over twice as much for a tour.

While in Budapest a must visit and photograph.. Ten months ago my wife and i were in Budapest. On October 2, 2015 we purchased tickets for the Parliament buildings. Times were assigned associated with language spoke. The walking tour was a hour long, and we were under constant visual surveillance, and not allowed to stray from the group. Photos were encouraged. As the pictures will attest the building is a unique architectural marvel with designs not seen in other government buildings in Europe. It is a must see and visit.

Breathtakingly beautiful. By far the most beautiful building in Budapest, a trip is not complete without seeing it on a tour, from the opposite side of the river or on a night cruise, of which the last I would definitely recommend as it is spectacular. I would only recommend the tour really if you are interested in politics, as most of its magnificence is on the outside, yet it was very informative and portable ear pieces were very clever. The tour was 30 mins max, but as it only cost 1000 HUF we couldn't really complain!
Well worth a visit. Definitely worth visiting,mid you are not with a guided tour there maybe some waiting time as time slots are allocated to each language.

#1 attraction in Budapest. The Hungarian Parliament certainly deserves its reputation as the #1 attraction. It is a gorgeous building both outside and inside and has a rich history. In this review I will concentrate on practical information.Views from the outside: There are excellent views of Parliament in the morning from Kossuth Lajos square and in the afternoon/evening from Batthyany Square looking directly across the Danube and from Castle Hill (at top of Funicular, in front of National Gallery, and near Fishermen’s Bastian). Chain Bridge has nice but somewhat distant views mid-day though evening. Ideally you should see Parliament from several views and both daytime and evening/night when it is beautifully lit. See photos with locations identified.Tours are the only way to see the interior. The tour lasts 45 -60 minutes and is informative. You are allowed to take photos everywhere (including flash) except the Dome Hall (where photos are not permitted even without flash). My favorite places were the Assembly Hall, Grand Staircase, and Dome Hall (see photos for the first 2). Tour tickets: Same day tickets can be purchased at the onsite ticket office on the lower level north end of the building (where the tours depart). There are several English tours throughout the day but the times vary with the day. It is best to arrive early in the morning to get the tour time of your choice (or even to get a tour- by early afternoon the day may have sold out in English, although they do sometimes add late tours). According to the ticket office, advance tickets can also be booked online, and as others have suggested, if you know the day/time you want to go before leaving home this is the best option (I would not recommend sending credit card information over hotel wireless). Parliament is on the M2 metro line (Kossuth Lajos Ter station) and the tram line that runs along the river, so if your hotel is on the metro or tram it is easy to run over to get tickets and then go back later for the tour (there are also buses).

Amazing, Beautiful building on the shores of the Danube. We've traveled a lot and my husband says this is his favorite building of all time!! Be sure to make reservations before you go especially if you need an English tour in the summer. It's easy to make reservations online at http://www.jegymester.hu/eng. We did ours the day before. Some friends tried to visit on the same day without reservations and ended up going on a French tour even though they didn't speak French! The tour guide was great at explaining what we were seeing with a little humor mixed in. You can take pictures anywhere except in the Dome Hall with the crown jewels.
Must do. Didn't make into the parliament....they've sessions....took a tour of outside history museum ... this is free and short telling about the parliament history

Budapest Parliament Tour. A huge and very beautiful building. English tours available. Portable listening devices make it easy to hear the guide. Lots of stairs involved but an elevator is also available. Beautiful grounds as well. Seeing this building and taking the tour gives you a taste of the history and culture of Budapest.

Stayed on Buda side a couple of years ago never visited. Saw this amazing building every day when we stayed on Buda side stayed on Pest this time and walked down the river to see it visitor friendly amazing place loely cafe and gift shop must see visit

A beutiful site during the day and at night. Nice exchange of guards with thye opportunity to take pictures with them. Very close too thge shoes memorial.Nice places with very good cakes nearby (including the chocolate museum inside one of them.

No Discussion! . As most of Euro travelers knows that this building is one of the most (if not the most) beautiful building in Europe and especially that you have different breath taking view to it from each point of the 360 circle around.

I'm in ♡ with it. I fell in love with the architect of the building..of the incredible palace!!!every way of my tour ended to this beautiful building.. i just wanted to sit aside and watch and watch.. stanning..amazing.. ♡♡♡♡♡
Splendour. Parliament was closed due to business on our first visit. Given website address for booking visit the next day. Booking is essential. Guides were good and visit was worthwhile.

worth going. we went on the English tour and found the lady very nice and knowledgeable. she mad the visit fun and and interesting. you can take pictures but don't do it whilst taking, you will get told off.. respect the rules

Too Quick. The tour for this went by too quickly! For the top attraction, I felt that it could have been done better, with more rooms to look at, like most other European Parliaments or castles. However, the exhibit at the end was informative, and the two free exhibits underground outside were really very interesting, and something you could do if you're short on time - or cash!It was still a nice visit -- interesting to look at the Hungarian designs and learning about the culture and history about the building and surrounding areas.If you were unable to secure tickets in advance like we did, you can go in the morning to secure your tickets for any time that day. The board shows you how many tickets are available at each hour for your language (English in our case).

Stunning!. The building is absolutely beautiful inside and outside. Take a walk around the building. It's also great seeing it from the water. A "must see" if you are visiting Budapest!
We waited in a short line to schedule a tour. Our tour guide was terrific, and it was great to learn about the building.

Beautiful building. I've admired the Parliament building from afar so today I took a walk round the whole thing close up.
It really is a magnificent building and Huge.
My Tip: Catch either Tram 2 or Metro 2 to Kossuth Lajos tér M and you can't miss it.

Beautiful building but tour covers very little of it. This is without doubt a beautiful building and very well maintained and the only way to see inside it is to take the tour. We bought tickets online and since we are EU citizens tickets were half the price that non EU citizens pay. It says you need to have proof of citizenship so we brought our passports but no-one checked them or asked us any questions. Tour began at 8:45 am. That means the tour guide appeared at that time. We all had to go through security and get our ear amplifiers and then some took the 133 stairs and some the elevator. We paused in the Crown room to view the crown and the changing of the guard. Tour was totally finished at 9:20 and cost with the reduction 2200HUF per person. I would agree with some others that the tour is not worth the money. Anything the guide told us could be found in the description of the building, in guide books, and online.

Incredible building. This is truly one of the most beautiful buildings I have ever seen. We have not been inside, but only walked around. If you want a good picture of the building you'll probably need to book a river cruise. The building is too big to take a picture from close-by and from the other side of the river, your view will probably be obstructed by boats.

Spectacular building. Well worth booking in advance, but they do sell tickets on the door too. One of the iconic buildings of Budapest, it's worth going on the guided tour of the building. A museum is available without the tour though.
Impresionant!. One of the majestous building I have ever seen! The square with all the hungarian 1956 raise!! Fantastic!

Tour was awful. You can't argue the building is beautiful, however the tour was terrible, they didn't do themselves any justice. Advertised as 45 mins, once past security we had 20mins. visited four rooms (crazy considering size of build) The guides main objective was to get through the tour as quick as possible. To the point where we wore head sets if you didn't keep up then it went out of range so had no option to appreciate the decor. High cost for a poor show. glad managed to get at EU price and considered that it wasn't good value at the lower price. Works out £2 a room with full on security check, certainly not my idea of value or fun. Agree security is important however should not be part of the 45mins tour! What a shame, they need to really show off this amazing build and provide a tour guide with passion, neither existed and I would advise to visit and admire the external building for free with beer in hand as the glamour of the building is enough to appreciate this attraction.
Beautiful. I'm sorry, but inside a lot of evil people… They are politicians. But the building is very beautiful.

Walk the perimeter. Because reviews were mixed and time limited, we opted to NOT take the interior tour. Instead, we walked the perimeter of the Parliament Building at dusk. This was perfect. Tourist crowds were absent and light perfect.
Must see . Beautiful! If you are there, buy a gelato by Gelateria Pomo D'Oro and take a walk around the building. Mesmerizing in every weather.

BOOK AHEAD OF TIME. Great looking exterior of the building directly on the Danube River and probably the best photographed building in Budapest. If you want to take the 50 minute tour of the interior be forewarned that it is imperative that you buy your tickets online as very few, if any, are sold onsite the day of the tour. Advanced tickets are available online at www.jegymester.hu/parliament. Tour itself was very interesting (although we preferred the tour of the British Parliament) and is offered in several languages. English tours are offered at 1000, 1200, 1300, 1400 and 1500. Tours depart from the Visitors' Center. We were told that someone would announcement the tour approximately 5 minutes before scheduled start time. Unfortunately it is not announced via microphone so it is difficult to hear, especially since several tours are started at once and all funnel through the same entry point. As a result it was a mad house with people trying to figure out where to go and there was some pushing and shoving as they got closer to the turnstile. We viewed a near fight between two mid-aged females who each thought the other was trying to push ahead in line. Since you have to go through a metal detector it also takes a while for everyone in your tour group to be cleared. Once inside the tour takes you through chamber meeting rooms and impressive hallways. You also get to see the Hungarian coronation symbols: St Stephen's Crown, the orb, the scepter, and the Renaissance sword. If the tour start-up was more organized I would have given the tour 5 stars but I feel that the disorganization was enough to reduce my rating by 1 star.

Pretty outside and inside. A must for everyone visiting Budapest.+ Wonderful building, both outside and inside+ Interesting and no-nonsene guided tour+ Easy to reserve and inexpensive tickets- Annoying "security" measures before entry- Keep close to the guide, otherwise the signal gets lost and you can't hear anything
Great architecture . Very architecturally beautiful. It took us some time to walk around the huge building. Defined great for photography. Unfortunately we didn't have time to visit their museum.

A Gem in Budapest #1. Traveling with friends to Prague, we added Budapest, since if was close. Spent four nights in the city, just enough to regret we didn't stay longer. This photo is of Parliament from the water.

The most impressive architecture I have seen sitting on the banks of the river. We must have passed the Parliament building while riding on a boat many times day and night and it was always impressive and drew you to its beautiful architecture with all its majesty.

Most beautiful building in Budapest . Simply put the most beautiful building in Budapest. Not many cities around the world can be proud of such a beautiful parliament building! A must see on the vacation!

Absolutely beautiful. You will not get tired of seeing this building from all perspectives. It is worthwhile to do a 45 minutes guided visit to the interiors since explanations are interesting and specific. You will be able to do in multiple languages: English, Spanish, German, Italian, French. You can book your tickets online to skip the queue and book a time. If not you, will get whatever is available when you reach (tickets are sold at the visitor’s center next to the Parlament). In our case we hardly found any queue and got tickets for a visit an hour and a half later.
Must see !. Beutiful building . Worth to see and have the guided tour in the parliament . Excellent English guide and the greatest gift shop in Budapest .
Most beautiful parliament in Europe. Watching from the river cruise is quite stunning. However if you visit the building, you can join a walking tour to see the inside.

Magnificent and expansive. Magnificent architecture, old world charm, breathtaking in scope are just a few of the phrases that describe this beautiful building. We enjoyed the grounds and the history of the empire through the nineteenth century as well as the world shaping events of the 20th century. I particularly enjoyed the changing of the guard and how personable the personnel were after completing the ceremony.
What a place. Arrived at place and looked at screen to see when guides available.Had a great guide who told and showed us loads.Very interesting place.
The Kossuth Square is beautiful. I was thrilled how beautiful the Kossuth Square became after the reconstruction. It is absolutely amazing without any traffic.

A Must Visit. The Gothic style Parliament House is really impressive from the outside but wait till you take the well guided tour from the inside, it is amazing to say the least.. You can't miss the cigar stands so well designed to blend with the architecture which in itself is a brilliant master piece.We booked online and that helped a great deal, rather than waiting in long queues.Unfortunately non EU citizens have to pay a much higher fee for taking the guided tour. I wish they could bring parity in fees for one and all.The view in the night from the outside is simply breathtaking and you can catch this from the Buda side or from one of the many night river cruises.
Incredible!. Its great to see this beautiful building from the other side of the river to fully appreciate its majesty. There are tours everyday which we wished we had known about!
Beautiful . Each time you look at the building you find a new detail you haven't noticed before & the setting on the banks of the Danube is beautiful.

The Jewel of Budapest. The Hungarian Parliament must be one of the most photographed buildings in the world - by day and especially by night when beautifully illuminated. It's a MUST VISIT to fully experience a monument of awesome craftsmanship, dedication and phenomenal beauty. You have to book in advance. We were fortunate enough to see the changing of the guards on a Sunday morning - which is also very special !
Standout in the city. Book your tour in advance online to skip the queue. Had a wonderful guide during my tour of the building and make things super interesting and fun.

Amazing and clean area. If only the rest of Budapest was this impressive. Not only is it just unbelievably clean it's impressive on how amazing a city and building can look when they are to this standard. Any city that can maintain this level would be a great city to visit.

A spectacular building inside and out. A gorgeous building, particularly enjoyable for those who appreciate symmetry. The guided tour was well worth the money, and includes information about Hungary's current government in addition to its rich history. Don't miss the spectacular nighttime view of Parliament from the Buda side of the river - Matthias Church is the perfect place.
Budapest Parliament. While I did not go inside Parliament, at night it is lit up and is a must see both the back view and from one of the night boat cruises.

Parliament. We walked by the very large Parliament building that is next to the Danube River. On the riverside there did not appear to be any access to the building. We did not check to see if the building was open to the public. The architecture is impressive and the building is imposing. it is worth walking by..

Amazing!. Parliament is so beautiful, words cannot describe just how beautiful it is.I recommend getting tickets to view the inside, the design and architecture work is insane! The tour doesn't last long, 35 minutes and you get the basic information. I also recommend going up to Fisherman Bastions late in the evening to get an amazing view of parliament lit up.

Parliament of Budapest . Amazing building. One of the many must see sights when in Budapest.
Strongly recommend the tour of the parliament building.

A must see once !. It was a rainy Sunday and I had to ask a policeman for the Visitor Center. It is in the far right side of the buiding watching from the square (Kossuth Lajos tér). No sign but when geting closer you can not miss it downstairs. Staff was all kind - some friendly and competent, some less. I made reservation on internet and had printed tickets from home. On the internet they worn you to be 30 minutes earlier because of the checking of baggage. So we did but surprise! They rejected us 3 times at the checking point till 12 o'clock sharp , the time we should enter anyway. So we had to wait standing more than 30 minutes with a senior among us. It was really unpleasant and tiredfull. Another bad thing it was that we couldn't let our baggage and umbrellas at a cloakroom even it was one there. I don't know why. Apart from this inconvenience the Parliament worth visiting. The rhythm is alert but enough to see this splendor.
tourist visit. beautiful building although had to wait a very long time to get an English speaking tour. PRE BOOK IF POSSIBLE

Impressive building . This is an impressive building surrounded by a large square and several monuments to important historical events in the history of Hungary. Although we were unable to enter the building, it is one of the largest parliament buildings in Europe. It is worth a quick look.
Breathtaking . We did not go through the exhibit. It was a very hot day and the lines were very long. Just to see the architecture and walk around this stately building was enough.A must see

excellent staff and guide. very good short tour, with good English speaking guide. online booking is very effective, but costs a little extra, worth it if you want to have a specific language guide. My father took ill during the tour and the guards and guide were most useful. be careful - the initial walk up to the top of the stairs is 96 steps! ask for the esculator if you do not feel up to the exertion. the visitor centre is on the far side of the parliament building if you are arriving by metro.
WOW!. This is a mega architecture work!It size is make this an overwhelming monument and is beauty enchants.This is a must see place if you go to Budapest!

Most Spectacular Monument in Budapest!. Every travel catalogue includes a picture of Budapest's beautiful Parliament building. It's spectacular during the day but is best at night -- all lit up like all the city's monuments. Breathtaking!
Sandra g. Stunning place, clean, beautiful location and a must see attraction on your visit to Budapest. Great views on evening cruises

Words fail. This was the highlight of our stay. The buildings looked wonderful during the day, magnificent at night from the river and the inside: words fail me. Okay I could get picky about the quality of the earpieces/sound but the overall impression it made on me will last a lifetime. And the museum at the end of the tour - spend time looking at the impressive AV displays: wow! HIGHLY recommended.

Recommend the tour. It is stunning, it's the largest building in Hungary and it has such gorgeous architecture. I had booked us onto the Parliament building tour, which worked out about £5 each. It was so worth it because we got taken around such insanely beautiful rooms.From the windows we were able to see wonderful views of the Danube and there were very interesting snippets of history to see like the old red communist star that was removed from the top of the building in 1990. I also liked the old cigar holders, where people would keep their cigars whilst they went to vote. If you have the time I would recommend the tour.
Best building in the city . A stunning building you can't miss and must see on your travels. It defines the city and from where ever you see it from you will be impressed!
View and location. It is one of the most beautifully located parliaments in Europe - and it is not only the location , but the inside which is also delightfula!

One of the oldest legislative buildings in Europe: imposing and impressive!. The Parliament of Budapest is the place where it meets the Hungarian National Assembly, and one of the oldest legislative buildings in Europe. It was built in the Kossuth Lajos Square, on the bank of the Danube. Currently holds the title of largest building in Hungary, and the second largest parliament in Europe. The building is on the surface of 18,000 square meters has 700 rooms and offices, 27 entries in its two symmetrical sides rise up the Upper House and the Lower House, is now the site of the national assembly with 386 members. It has a central hall with dome, where they keep the crown of the first Hungarian king.
Beautiful building!. A very beautiful building in the middle of Budapest. A must see when you visit here. Especially beautiful in the evening lights!
More beautiful at night. I have not gone inside but definitely gone near by. its a great place to take a picture. visit during night time.

a very nice view of building with river in front. I managed to witness the flag closing ceremony in the evening at the back of parliament building( not facing the river view).I must say that it was an awesome experience. The building has a great architecture and it feels like a palace.One must sit the river view side of parliament to enjoy the great of Buda part of Budapest city.
MUST.....is the best of the city!. this structure is magnificent....you should visit the inside, they have qualified guides that explain everything very good...
Parliament. Toured the inside. Awesome. Pattrned after the English Parliament. Do have some pictures, but won't load.

Golf leafed ceiling!. Our 5th visit to Budapest, so we thought we would give this a go. It had been raining all day so a tour round the building seemed like a good idea. We queued for 11.30am for about 40mins which was okay because of the rain many others did so also. When we eventually got tickets ( no wandering round on your own, only with a guide ) the English speaking tour was at 4.30pm --- 4 hours hence, very little info to let you know that! So back we went again (still raining) for what I would call a whistle stop tour on 3rd floor only. The ceiling is all coated in gold leaf, yup, must have cost millions, bit obscene really. Chambers, galleries are in pristine hospital condition. 45 mins and we're back outside. I would suggest the outside view is spectacular only, would not visit again. PS oldies do have a slight reduction.
Beautiful. A must see if you get the opportunity . It really is beautiful building and area and really worth it.

Beautiful building, well worth a visit.. A visit a must, be carefull not many English tours and you can only enter through a tour, there are 2 places you can visit just outside they are free and worth going down stairs to read about the history of the square. Guards do a display every hour on the half hour, not sure if its all day but certainly 12.30 and 13.30 they did. At around 6 they lower the flag which is worth a watch if your in the area.

Tour guide was rude.. You can book tickets online and if you do not manage to do that then you have to queue quite early in the morning. There is a security check (understandably) so you need to factor it in. The building was beautiful, inside and outside. I found my tour guide to be quite rude and this did give me a negative view on my trip. When I asked some questions about the tour she made me feel like they were stupid and didn't check that everyone could hear when she was speaking.

Very awesome and gorgeous building in the city!. We were unable to visit the building as it was very crowded with large tour groups, so we decided to walk around it. Yes, it was a very awesome and gorgeous building in the city.In order not to disappoint ourselves for not being able to enter the building, we decided to enjoy another perspective on it from our river cruise. And true enough, its more beautiful from the river view and afar, a magnificent huge building! We thought if we would come at night, it would be splendour from the lightings.Highly recommended for a visit and if you are unable to do so, at least see it from afar from the cruise or even at the Fisherman Bastion (i have reviewed also these places earlier, do watch out here) and you too can get a good glimpse on its beauty!

A must see!. You must walk around the parliament during the day for sure!! But one of my favorite spots to view it was from a night cruise in which I highly recommend. It is truly a massive masterpiece of a building.
Beautiful building. Although the tour was relatively short, it did enable us to gain a far better understanding of the building and the history of the parliament.

Tour inside. I would recommend booking online since we ended up having to come back a few hours later to join the next English tour. It was great to see the inside of this stunning building, including the changing of the guard, & to hear the history of Hungary. The tour is less than an hour long, cheap & definitely worth your time.

Beautiful. The tour is fairly short, but worth visiting. The building is beautiful and ornate. The headsets for the tour did not work properly, and it was very difficult to hear the commentary, but still enjoyable.
Just walked around the beautiful park area.. Amazing building with history to boot. This is where the 1956 Revolution began. The blood of many Hungarian people was taken.

Two hour tourist attraction. We booked through the hotel with a local tour operator. You have to go round with a guide which is good as the information is well worth listening to. The building is stunning and highly recommended. The location is only 10 minutes from the Chain Bridge.

Disappointing - must be booked in advance. Tours only permitted using a Tour guide. We arrived without booking an English speaking tour guide and the best offer was to be put on a tour with a Russian guide, and I'm afraid I didn't bring my Russian dictionary with me this time. (LOL ) so had to cancel the visit,

Stunning building inside and out. If you think the outside is impressive you need to book to go on the tour! I booked online in advance before our trip and it was really easy and meant we could jump the ticket line queue. You need to make sure you print out your ticket before you go though because they can't scan mobile screens.Once inside you are given a headset so you can hear the tour guide. She was knowledgeable and happy to answer questions, but to be honest the building is so stunning it speaks for itself. We really enjoyed the tour and there is an interesting exhibition at the end that looks at the design, constructions and development of the building. A lot of people just walked straight through the area, but if you have the time I recommend reading a few of the stands (or there are short videos you can watch) because it is quite interesting and adds to the experience.As a final tip, the entrance to the visitors centre is on the right hand side (when facing the front) of the building and is down some steps. It took us a bit of wandering about and asking for directions to find it!
Well worth a look.. Reception area a bit chaotic, but beyond that it's a beautiful building. Tour lasts around an hour, no photos in the dome though, the rest is fine. Recommended!

Remember your passport!. We didn't actually make it inside,because we forgot our passports! We tried to buy tickets online but, for the English tours, they were booked 36 hours in advance. Also, we didn't have access to a printer to print out ticket (kind of defeats the online purchase concept if one can't bring it up on one's smartphone).Better luck to us on our next Budapest visit !
Beautiful!. We biked to this location and then walked around and took photos. Very quiet and scenic. Also a great view across the river to the castle

This is indeed a beautiful building, both inside and out! But the tour was slow moving and a bit disappointing.. Admittedly, it was late in the day, it was hot, and our group was tired. The Parliament building was crowded with many other tours (this was in May) We may have enjoyed it more at a different time. In retrospect, I would have walked around the exterior of the building to photograph it.

A Beautiful Introduction to Hungary on the Danube River.. Parliament is the largest building in Hungary, second largest parliament in Europe and third in the world! This was the first thing we did and it is a good introduction to the history of Hungary and the beauty of Budapest and the Danube River. There are some stairs but it is not a difficult tour. Tours are available in multiple languages. Be sure to visit the museum underneath Parliament. The gift shop has some very nice items. We waited for the next tour in English and visited The Shoes on the Danube Bank nearby, a memorial to the many Jewish people shot by the fascists there in WWII.

What an amazing tour..... I have a new appreciation of government and history- thru the eyes of our guide. The inside is spectacular and the tour is very well organized. Because you pick your time and language when you book, the tour preparation is very smooth. The beauty of this building- brimming with history made me really think about how we do this in America. Do not miss the tour- and the breath taking view at night when it is all lit up.

visit of the parliament. You can only visit the parliament with a tour. We had not booked ahead, we bought our tickets for a 1:30 pm tour and used the time before to visit the free museum. The museum information was very well presented and provided us with a good political oversight of Budapest. As for the guided tour, it was well worth waiting for. The parliament is beautifully decorated and the tour guide provided insightful information on the building and the history. Would highly recommend the visit.

Excellent visit. The parliament buildings are well worth a visit. The guides are informative and the interior of the buildings are simply stunning. There is a lovely gift shop at the end with reasonably priced souvenirs

Awesome . Beautifully restored and maintained. In a breathtaking area that is full of things to see. Right next to the Danube and a short walk from our room at the Annabel b&b. Really worth a visit as the building is absolutely fantastic!
Wow . Probably one of the most beautiful parliaments on planet. Amazing architecture, beautiful. Make sure to visit. Nice to take a walk along Donau and be amazed by the buildings.
what a sight!. Best bit of Budapest! i would strongly recommend it to walk your way through the bridge so you can fully appreciate the building.

Spectacular!. I can totally recommend it! While the sun is going down, immediately go to the other side of the river to take some incredible photos of this building covered in sunset light. Few minutes later you will see beautiful illumination.

You must see it from Danube river!. One of the most beautiful buildings in Budapest! You must see it from Danube river, it`s the best view on Parliament. And make sure you take the photo when sun highlighting the building - it looks great, i promise!
What a building. Moored opposite this great building whilst on a River Danube trip. Absoluely wonderful especially when lit up at night.

Beautiful Inside and Out!. I absolutely fell in love with this building! Budapest is generally a very beautiful place, but this is by far my favourite building in the entire city. The architecture is impressive and the colour of the dome adds an extra touch. The inside is just as incredible with its gold-plated ceilings, decorative arches, long windowed halls and impressive staircase entrance. We also had an informative English tour guide. I'd recommend you book your tickets online to avoid having to wait around, as you can only enter Parliament with a guide.

Book in advance. Very worthwhile going to visit both during the day and at night. We did the guided tour - this can be booked online which I would advise as we turned up on our chosen day at 12pm & the first available English tour was at 4pm, so we had to go away and come back which wasn't really a problem. If you are a EU citizen bring proof eg passport and you get a discounted ticket for 2200 HUF instead of 5400 HUF. Tour lasts around 40 minutes.
Wonderful building . Budapest Parliament is the most extraordinary building! I loved it! From Dunav is the excellent view on Parliament! :-)

Beautiful building. We went on the tour - turned up at 10am and booked for 11am in July. Was I think around £7 each (they did ask to see EU proof and we only had a bus pass on us which they accepted!) Tour was good lasting around an hour and you get to see a lot of the building which is stunning inside as well as out. Lit up at night it is beautiful.
Beautiful!. We didn't go in, but you can walk on the promenade and it's really great. Make sure you see it at night as well!
Wow. What a building. And we had the best tour. The lady was so detailed about the Hungarian parliament. Absolutely amazing architecture. One of the best I ever seen.
Beautiful architecture!. Took a walking tour and visited the Parliament. However, don't miss out on seeing this building after dark -- the entire city for that matter -- all lit up and just stunning.

Worthwhile . We were very impressed by our visit to Parliament. Queuing can be frustrating though.The architecture is somewhat similar to that of parliament in London. It's location by the river Danube is very appealing, well worth a visit.

Stunning Architecture. The Parliament building is absolutely fantastic especially at night when it is completely illuminated. Unfortunately, we did not get the opportunity to tour the building during our visit to Budapest. Pictures and video of it (like you see in the river cruise commercials) do not do it justice. Must see in person.
Huge. Definite a tourist must go. The pictures taken shall let you feel the enormity of the whole building. Pics can be taken from the other bank of the river

Stunning building - incredible architecture. The Parliament building is so iconic when we think of Budapest, and is the building on the Viking River cruise commercial you see the boat passing. We thought it might not live up to the hype characterized in the commercial but we were wrong. It's simply stunning.The architecture is amazing to see by day or by night. Sailing by it is incredible. We sailed by in the morning and then in the evening our boat did a night cruise to take in the lights of this building and the sites along the Danube -- all of which were absolutely incredible. If you visit Budapest you MUST see it by day AND night to fully appreciate its beauty.We did not tour the interior because of other tours we were taking, but so appreciated its exterior.
Iconic Europe. The parliament building is the most amazing structure I have seen in Budapest. I never had a chance to visit inside but it is so beautiful in both day and night.
Magnificent . One of the grandest buildings you will ever see, instance architecture from every angle. Must see at night as well. For the tour, book ahead online!! They fill up quickly.

Fantastic!!!!!. The most beautiful area in Budapest, perfect inside with nice tour,in many languages...
There is a place that you have to visit!!!!

A must see. The parliament is one of budapests must see. It is spectacular. You can see it for up close, or from a distance at the buda side of town. You should also see from a distance after dark too see it is lit up by beautiful lights.

Do not miss taking a tour of this building. The parliament building is well worth visiting. Guided tour tickets can be purchased online or at the entrance. The grand staircase, the assembly hall and the hexagonal room where the crown is displayed are magnificent. This is a tour not to be missed while in Budapest.

Absolutely breath taking!. Definitely worth visiting, as even though we only had time to walk around the outside, it was magnificent! So huge and intricately designed, one of my highlights in Budapest!
Unbelievable to look at. If you think it looks beautiful in pictures, it looks even better in real life. I really love architecture, so naturally this was an interesting sight.

Iconic Budapest . The parliament building is the the biggest eye catcher on the pest side of the city from the river. It really stands out with its impressive architecture. Good to visit any time of the day. By night the sky above is filled with birds making it almost an erie sight. Tours of the inside are available how ever many big rooms are not accessible. So I didn't find it worth the cost.

Stunning Architecture. Worth a river boat cruise or visiting on the Hop on Hop off tour buses - this building is just one of the many stunning pieces of architecture to be found in beautiful Budapest!
Impressive Building. Impressive Building worth a look and a quick photo but nothing more, looks great from the river Ferry
View in night. We booked a river tour and the view of the parliament at night from the cruise was stunning. Awesome lighting and great to watch

Worth your time. The tour was interesting & informative.
We made advanced reservations so we had essentially no wait. The English tour was good and the guide was well informed.

Wonderful building, excellent tour. I joined the english tour (you should book in advance as they get sold out), the building was, especially the history both recent and historic. The video at the end of all of the renovations post war was great.
Great. Well worth a tour! Very informative and fun. Take your passport for EU discount. Obviously leave sharp objects at home eg small manicure scissors (security check).

One word...: Impressive. An absolute highlight and must see during your city trip. Don't forget to visit the Kossuth Tér Massacre Memorial, amemorial to the victims of the 25 October 1956 massacre at Kossuth Tér, created in the southern ventilation tunnel

Beautiful Government. Probably the prettiest government building I've seen. The dome is especially spectacular with its crown and mitre. But the passageways have interesting sculptures also. Worth a visit, but buy your tickets online before arriving.

Must visit! . A fantastic building, beautifully maintained.. But getting into the building was but chaotic.
We had a guided tour at 12pm - I definitely recommend as the tour guide was excellent but book in advance and collect tickets (or print tour ticket) prior to your tour.
Very interesting and informative!. Beautiful building and furnishings. Breathtaking for all of us to see. Guide very helpful with questions.
Good. If you have time ,go and visit as it is free and has an astonishing architecture,beautiful building so highly recommended

Excellent tour, Get tickets Early. The building is magnificent! It is beautiful and quite large. A tour is a must. Get tickets early but language. It is worth the cost. It is well worth an hour to take in. The guides are Excellant and willing to answer questions.
History . Really enjoyed,our leader was joyfull,well prepared for our questions. Beautiful place,but no pics near the crown! :)

Stunning interiors. The interior is stunning. Buy tickets online for your specified language guide. English tours are about 4 or 5 times a day.You can buy at the information desk, but you won't be visiting there and then. You'll probably have to wait a few hours. They do sell out and popular times like late morning and can be unavailable for a few days before. Some tours last 45mins some only 30mins. So check when you book your tickets. EU citizens are cheaper than non EU. Although they didn't ask for any proof when I arrived. I had tickets on my phone. I queued up and they printed them out for me.

Must in Budapest. A tour of the Parliament is a must whilst in Budapest! This building is beautiful inside out. We booked the tour tickets online a couple of months prior, and we were glad we did. All you need is a print-out of your reservation (no need to queue up at the ticket counter). The tour itself was absolutely worth the money (for us non-EU visitors, the price is steep; however). Everyone can take some good pictures here - too many picturesque spots! The gift shop has nice items but very expensive. Go to the Great Market Hall for souvenir.
Better to visit in the evening. The well known parliament building is best to stroll in the evening when the lights are lit and the chain bridge is behind

Interesting but not awesome. Nice to see around the parliament which is as much a monument to the nation's history and heritage. Amusingly, I read in some tourist blue that it was one of largest and oldest parliament buildings in Europe - event the tour guide suggested as much. At just over a century, I think this claim is wildly exaggerated.Otherwise, it was a reasonably pleasant if brief your of such a large monument. I suspect the 2 sides and floors are mirror images meaning you only need to see half (and only one floor!) mainly being the staircase, the dome and one chamber. Short and sweet.

A must to see but buy your tickets in advance. If you think you have seen it all then think again.These are Parliament buildings on a Grand scale and more like a palace than a political debating chamber.
Stunning.. This building has to be one of the most beautiful buildings in Budapest. Sitting right on the side of the Danube.
Beautifull. Spend a nice day at the Parlament and surrounding area. Tram 4 and 6 from Blaja drives to the Margit Brigde, where you change to Tram 2, which takes you down the Riverside.

Beautiful. Great place to visit if you can get in. Alot of history and much more beauty. You will be on a tour as this is really the only way to get in, so it's as if the history is just like being read a story
View of Parliament. View from street and river stunning. You must see this building at night -wow. Don't forget camera on you trip.

Very Impressive building on the waterfront.. This is the most stunningly beautiful building - and I live in London - with spacious landscaping around it and impressive statues scattered about the area. Easy to walk around the building, that is situated on the waterfront, on the Pest side. Looks even more beautiful at night time when it is all lit up. In the summer months there are 'pop up' concerts to listen to and enjoy with a lot of seating provided and a water feature to cool you down. Tours are also available for those who wish to see the interior of the building. Booking essential. Go see!!!

A beautiful building!. We did not go into the building, just went past it on both a bus and boat ride. The side that we saw from the water was gorgeous! It is definitely worth seeing if you enjoy European architecture.
