Beautiful and Ornate!. Did a walking tour of the Parliament building. The building's architecture and furnishings are stunning inside and out.

Spectacular. This building is not only spectacular outside, but inside as well. We took the 45 minute guided tour (for summer, book in advance, they sell out, especially the English tours). The inside of the building is just out of this world. It is beautiful and describing it here really won't do it justice. IF you are in Budapest, this is a "Must See" both inside and as well, all lit up at night.

Best viewed from across the river.. Best viewed from across the river. This is a stop on the hop on hop off bus, so you can get great pictures here. Get a drink while you wait for the next bus to stop again and pick you up.
Beauty in every line . Excellent planning. You can see the stability in the graceful lines. If you see the beauty of the building you will understand Hungarian virtue.

Beautiful architecture. The building itself is stunning but there were a couple technical issues, which is why I did not rate this 5 stars. First, tours are scheduled at specific times for different languages. There is a queue with signs telling you not to be late, so we lined up 15 minutes prior to our scheduled time to go through the metal detector. However, when a woman came out to start letting the assembled people in, she looked at our ticket and told us to step to the side and wait. No further explanation was given and it became apparent she did not speak English when this happened with multiple people, some of whom became upset and were asking for clarification. After everyone (group of about 30) were allowed to pass through except for about 8 of us, the woman left with no further explanation. 15 minutes later, at our scheduled tour time, she came back and waved us through. At that point, one couple had already left. The second technical issue was that my husband's audio set they gave him did not work, so I gave him mine and ended up not hearing most of what was said on the tour.
Nice bilding. Looks wery nice.Liked wery much just to many cops.Was wery hot thath day ,next to the building has a nice winebar there you can refresh yourself

A dream at night. Please take the bus night tour, the Parliament well light and noble is stupendous... You will remember it for a long long time.The bus goes very slowly so you can take lovely pictures. Please read your camera instructionsto find the right setting otherwise you will only see a blur.You can also see it from a boat and with a Champagne flute it is most romantic!
Great from the river in the evening. The evening cruise is better than trying to go through this in the day. The cruise gives you a perfect view and beutful pictures of the excellent lighting.

Impressive Parliament and worth a visit. We booked for the 1.15pm tour and met by our tour guide. The English speaking tour started at 2pm so had to wait but that was ok. We had a headset so could hear the guide explaining as we went along. The tour lasted 40 mins and was good. Our guide had a sense of humour too. Very impressive building and worth seeinbg.
Beautiful building . Amazing details and great lighting at night. One of Budapest architectural gems. A must see both from close and from across the Danube.

Hungarian Parliament tour. Booked the Parliament tour at the Visitor center underground near the Parliament. The building was awesome and huge. Magnificent Neo-Gothic architecture for the worlds third largest parliament building. The interior is richly decorated, with ample use of gold sheeting, above 10 meters according to the guide. Viewing of the Royal crown was also amazing. Although the tour lasted around an hour it seemed a bit rushed and limited to certain rooms, although important rooms.

The best attraction in the city. The parliament is a must see in Budapest. It's located in the heart of the city by the Danube. I recommend visiting it at night as well and watching the lights reflected on the flying bats above!There's one problem which is the entrance fee. For Euro citizens it costs 2200 HUF but for the rest it's 5400 HUF!
Fantastic . Wonderful interactive displays. Excellent guides, it's very well organised. Amazing photo opportunities throughout.

Stunning!. Stunning sums it all up and there is really no need to say anything else, however . . . .A truly magnificent building which needs to be viewed from a boat on the river and also from the Castle Hill District as well as by walking all around it. To complete your enjoyment you need to take the tour inside. It is hardly surprising that this is the No1 must-see in Budapest. The regular changing of the guard in the square is an added bonus. I also liked the very trendy sunglasses that all the soldiers around the Parliament building were wearing.When we were in the square steam suddenly shot out from the manholes and obscured the view and most of the people in the square rushed into the steam to enjoy the novelty of the situation - very interesting. If all this was not enough there are a number of stunning statues and monuments together with some equally interesting buildings around the square. Look out for the bullet holes spattered all over the face of one of the buildings. I love the way that the trams go round Parliament square.

Impressive and worthy of a visit. Highly recommend pre booking a tour of this most historic and beautiful building. The buildings ornate gothic exterior, gardens, and monuments (especially the memorial to the 1956 Hungarian Revolution) will impress you, but the ornate hallways and chambers inside are awesome. Well worth the several hours for a history of Hungary's past and present.
Parliament . Great place to visit, if you are a EU citizen make sure you take some of with you, you will pay a greatly reduce price to tour the inside.

Interesting tour, but at 30 mins bad value . The Parliament is extremely impressive from the outside. We took the English language tour which had some interesting history and I really enjoyed seeing the Crown Jewels. However, the full price is on the higher side considering the group tour only lasts for 30 minutes.

Fantastic Building. With a large square behind it with soldiers guarding, it makes for a fantastic vista. Two soldiers patrol the national flag poll, every so often coming together and slow marching around the area. Water jets spray and create a mist every so often as well. Great photographic point, and close to the shoe memorial on the Danube also
a must see. those who visit Budapest must not miss this spectacular building. Easily accessible on both banks of River Danube it's memorable by day and night.
Beautiful grounds. I had not made a reservation, so was unable to see the inside, but the grounds, the surrounding embassies are well worth the visit.
So so beautiful place. Very beautiful place what I can do was just sit and look at this incredible building. Need to see it not only at the day but at the night, because of the lights.
Stunning building. Beautiful building by day and even better lit up at night. If your going on a tour you really need to go and book a day before you visit as it gets very busy.

Beautiful !! . Absolutely stunning ! A must do!
It is amazing how the Hungarian parliament is so stunning in its architecture. 2 m higher than the Westminster ; it is also surrounded by two other buildings designed by the winner of the second and third place during the design competition and is the most beautiful building in pest

Tour a bit short!. The parliament building is very beautiful and a must-see when visiting. The tour was reasonably priced and gave a small insight into the buildings history but was overall very short as access was restricted.

Spectacular sight, especially at night!. The Parliament building dominates the Budapest skyline from the banks of the Danube. It is best viewed from the hilly Buda side of the river or by boat cruise. When lit up at night it is truly spectacular, golden against a dark sky

Must visit. We were not able to go inside the parliament , but what we have heard from others is that it is worth visiting. The outside grounds are very nice to roam around , with a good breeze blowing from the river.
Beautiful . It's a very beautiful building built on the river banks ..the architecture is great . Nice view from there and close to the chain bridge

Magnificent . The parliament building is majestic, inside and out. We had a spectacular view of it from the Buda side of the Danube and on the tram from Margrit Island. The interiors are gorgeous--stained glass windows, gold leaf, and beautiful carved statuary we enjoyed the soaring dome and mini "changing of the guard" while inside. The tour, while definitely worthwhile, was short on detail and descriptions of artwork. There is a short visit to an unused legislative chamber (formerly where the House of Lords met). There was not enough room for our entire group to view the room while the guide was talking. If you are short (as I am), be sure to go into the room as soon as possible to get a place at the railing. Also, the visitors entrance for queuing up is at the northern end of the building.

Historical Building in amazing location. Waterfront building in amazing location and surrounded by historic buildings. There is no bad view of the building but the best is across the river at the Fisherman's Bastion

Worth seeing...... You cannot imagine the beauty of this site. We are so glad we paid to view the interior. They have several tours in different languages so you have to select your language when it is available.

Parliment. I spent five days in Budapest this is a beautiful city the Parliament building is a must a guided tour is about an hour and cost about £6 we see the changing of the guard they change every hour inside the Parliament building .There are about 100 steps as you go in there is a lift for those who dont fancy the climb .it is best to book in advance as tickets go very quick.
By night amazing spot!. by night an amazing and beautiful spot in Budapest. Dont miss it! best view of the panorama of Budapest.

Beautiful. The Parliament of Hungary is rightfully amongst the 100 most beautiful buildings of the world! The visitor center is very well run, they make it possible for visitors to tour the building pretty much every day of the year.

See it at night during a canal cruise. Do not go near the building, it is meaningful to look at the building from far away because it is easier to admire the building that way.I suggest that you should see it during a canal cruise. It is fascinating at night. White birds fly over the building at night, and they make the view even more spectacular. :)

Worth a Visit. I was in Budapest for the second time having missed out on seeing this the first time. I would recommend booking in advance as tickets sell out quickly.It's a very impressive building on the inside and the tour was well organised and informative if a little brief. I would definitely recommend a river cruise so you are able to see this lit up at night.

Do you like our Houses of Parliament building?. My favourite building is or own Palace of Westminster but this comes a close second. Stylish & elegant. Got to see the changing of the guard which is a bonus although not with the degree of pageantry us Brits tend to display

Very nice. It is highly recommended to visit the Parliament house, the tour in English was great and offered a lot of information regarding the history of the building. Another key element was the Crown and the guide explained the history of it and what emperors were crowned with it. The arhitecture is impressive and while visiting I constantly made a comparison between this house of parliament and te one from my home country, Romania which is considered the 2nd biggest building in the world. All in all, a definitely must see in Budapest.
Amazing!. Went there on an afternoon, sat on one of the benches waited for the sunset, took photos on different angles with different lighting shades. Also opposite side is the Neprajse Museum.

Beautiful. You have to see the parliament. And the two other building on the parliament square (whose were parliament to be). And be sure to hang out there around noon to see the changing of the guard at which you will be able to take pictures with the guards

Nice but.... Magnificent building but as tourist that doesn't carry his printer with, I couldn't book online as they request to print the tickets. So we had to buy a ticket at 11:00 and wait up to 13:45. Also if you want to use the toilets inside you have to pay.
The most beautiful building in BP. Not to miss, especially recommended at night time! ;-) Looks a lot like a Westminster, but that's where it's copied from
Very helpful guide. Very interesting parliament building, interior ornate, museum history fascinating. Well worth a visit.
need to book tour on line. saw the changing of the soldiers guarding the crown jewels which occurs on the hour. Try and take boat trip at night to witness the lit up Parliament.

Fantastic historical building. Very interesting and enjoyable but you must check beforehand what times your own language guided tours start during the day you are visiting on. The guided tours do have security measures on entering the actual Parliament building, do not miss the additional historical underground exhibit at the opposite side of the building. The changing of the guard outside the building is interesting to watch but again check the times when you visit. The trams and metro station are ideally situated close to the Parliament building.

Stunning.. Never actually went into the parliament because there was some kind show on that day, but it's worth a visit to look in awe at this stunning building. Great photo opportunity, if you can fit it all in!

Amazing architecture!!! . What an incredible building!!! We enjoyed learning about the history of Hungary and its people, in the museum. Had a great conversation with one of the security guards outside the building. Wi-fi all around!!!!

Beautiful!. Best seen at night or on the river! We hung around during the day but the views during the evening are fantastic due to the lighting. We didn't get the chance to tour the inside as you need to purchase tickets beforehand. I would recommend booking a few weeks In advance as it seems quite popular.

Beautiful parliament building. This building was the highlight to our trip. We arrived at night and our hotel was opposite, came out of the metro and was bedazzled by this fantastic building. It looks like a Royal castle, beautifully designed and all in white stone. When you get closer, it just gets better and better. It is spectacular, one of the best buildings I have seen, beautifully placed on the banks of the Danube.

Absolutely stunning. We didn't go into the building although you can go in on a tour which is available on site at a fraction of the cost I'd seen advertised. Be advised you do need photo ID to get in and have to put your belongings into lockers.The actual building is stunning especially at night when lit up which in July happens at 9pm. You cannot miss this as directly on Danube.

Tour is a good introduction to Hungarian history. Arrive at the Visitors Center (where the tours start from) no more than ten minutes before the time on your ticket: that's when security will start letting you in. People ahead of you in line who are not on your tour will be told to come back when their tour starts. Definitely accept the earphones and receiver: that's how you'll hear the tour guide. Our tour guide was excellent. After the tour, you'll exit through the gift shop, which has a better class of stuff than most, but a few of the same items are available at lower prices across the plaza at the Cafe Smuz.
Beautiful building. Glad to have a chance to see the inside of this amazing building... but beyond the architectural features there wasn't much else.

Spectacular Building. The outside looks like London's Parliament and the inside is not to be missed. You need a timed ticket before your go since its so crowded but it's definiftely worth it. it was about $75 for the 4 os us.
Great. What an architect such a beautiful building.One of the best Parliament building considering architecture.Must see in night when lightened

The most beautiful Parliament building in the world. This is by far, the most beautiful building in Budapest. It is around 250 meters long, so if you want to take good pictures of it, I suggest you go to the other side of the river. Behind it, there is a really nice square and a small museum with some info about the history related to the Parliament. The photos at night are incredibly beautiful. It is a must-visit in Budapest.

This is a Lovely and Historic Place. We arrived too late for the formal tour, but just walking around this building is a treat. There's a small museum, a good gift shop, and the building itself is worth a visit. But don't do as I did and forget to sign up for the tour.
Hungarian Parliament. Amazing building, one of the biggest parliament buildings in the world. You must book online.Beautiful passageways covered in gold and house the Hungarian crown jewels.

Spectacular and dazzling. The Parliament building in Budapest is the most opulent building that I have visited that isn't a palace. From the golden staircase to the grand dome everything in this building dazzles. I highly recommend visiting and experiencing the beauty of this spectacular building.

Parliament tour, simply amazing . The Parliament building is a must-see for every traveller, as it is richly decorated with Hungarian symbols and material. It can only be visited with a tour, which lasts for 40-50 minutes. The tour covers both history and the current situation and is very informative. I recommend booking a tour online though, as you may not he able to find a place when you go to the visitor centre while in the city.
Great visit. A well spoken tour of one of the most decorated buildings in Budapest. Less than an hour but packed with great tidbits about past history & current events.

Magestic Bulding. Extremely beautiful Parliament!
If you do one thing in Budapest, visit the Parliament! (or the great synagogue lol)
I recommend the tour for sure but be sure to make a reservation if you want to do the tour in English.

Bold figure on the Danube . Worth a visit and a walk around. One does not need to do the tour inside Parliament to appreciate the architecture and art that went into making this massive building. Enjoy the changing of the guard on an hourly basis.

Parliament from the Buda side of Budapest. I was blown away by the city of Budapest and can't wait to go back again. Background: I'm currently living in Romania so I decided to take a weekend in Hungary to visit Budapest. I'm so glad I did, and I can't wait to go back! The food was amazing and there is so much to see and do that I couldn't do it all in one weekend! I had no idea what to expect before going there, and wish I'd don't more homework beforehand researching the city, but I decided to go last minute. If you're planning a trip you must do your research beforehand to decide what you want to see and do while there. Take a Hop-On Hop-Off tour for sure! If you're able to, I suggest walking from the top of the Citadel down to the Danube. Now about Parliament, I didn't get a chance to visit inside to view the Crown Jewels this trip, but I hear it it is well worth seeing the inside of this amazing architectural building!
Nice old building . Very nice historic building, guided tour with headset in many languages. Every our you can see change of the guards in crown jewels dome.
Nice to see. Interesting to see, especially since it is still a functioning parliament! Historical and beautiful...loved the short but informative tour...45 minutes was enough...

Orszaghaz. One of Budapest's ex-libris, the Parliament is a must see: its architecture is great and its surroundings are also worth a visit.The entrance is not for free, but not expensive, if you're an EU citizen you pay 2000 HUF (~6 euro). I recommend to book it in advance only because of the queues and shortage of tickets you may face if you buy at their shop.
Great tour of the parliament . Book in advance before your visit if you want a tour, they carry out checks! We thought the tour was very informative. Short but sweet.
Must visit . If you are visiting Budapest, take the time to visit Parliament. It is well worth the time. Interesting and extremely beautiful.

Great sight. The area around the Parliament is very nice. The building is quite majestic and stands out from the other building in the river. There are two mist fountains in front of the building on either side of the water wall. They supposedly create mist every hour but we only encounter them once but it's beautiful. Children get both crazy and confused. Adult enjoy it as well. If you come here, don't miss this. Worth the wait.
Unique. Superb building from both inside and outside, don't miss also the jew's shoes monument by the river bank

Great from every angle. If you do one thing in Budapest, visit the Houses of Parliament! No need to go outside, just take a wander around it and soak this incredible building up from all angles.
The other recommendation is to go to Buda and view the parliament houses from the other side, especially at night, simply stunning.

Beautiful and a Must See. It's definitely worth booking a tour of Parliament. It's brief (about 45 minutes in length) and well worth the time. King Stephen's crown and the house chambers alone are impressive.

Terrific tour of Hungarian Parliament . Took the English language guided tour and enjoyed it thoroughly. The building is breathtaking and the tour provides access to many beautifully decorated rooms, halls and corridors. Our guide spoke very good English and provided thoughtful, informative commentary throughout. The tour is quite reasonably priced. Save time in line by buying your tickets in advance online. Well worth the trip!

A must see. When going to Budapest, definitely a must trip. Beautiful inside and out. Recommend the tour for sure. Be sure to make a reservation because if you want to do the tour in English it will be a long wait. To book for the next day, you must book online.

Must see!. This one is not to be missed! Even if you cannot go inside or near it..at least get a good view of it both during day and night (the lights are spectacular!)either from a cruise or from the other side of the danube river.

Parlament. Csodálatos épület, könnyű megközelteni tömegközlekedéssel, közelben rengeteg egyéb szép épület található.
Very beautiful building, you can get there easily by means of public trasport, there are plenty of other buildings, museums and statues next to.
Magnificent and with English-speaking guides available. This ranks at or near the top of things to do while in Hungary. The building is beautiful and there are tours available in many languages.

Lovely. We didnt manage to get tickets as we were only in budapest for 3 days and the ques were always massive but the view from the outside is beautiful especially if you are on the other side of the river perfect for some good photos

Great culture experience. The Parliament is one of the most photographed places in Hungary. Naturally, one has to go. We booked English guided tour ahead of time as it becomes fully booked quickly. We got it online 2 days before our visit and I can't print my ticket but the front desk printed for me.

Beautiful but not quite worth it. Overpriced for a guide who obviously didn't like our mainly American group. They also grouped together languages so that the guide was switching in between English and German the entire time.
Hard to get around, steep walking. The people who work there (security and such) were extremely unfriendly and unhelpful.
One of the most impressive buildings. Definitely go see! Sitting at the parliament watching the sunset over the river was blinding! Wear shades. No really, this was one of our favorite places.

good for photography. didn't visit inside.
it's marvelous outside day and night.
prepare memory card and give it good photo shots.
Ok. Not really impressed with the tour. Of course the building was gorgeous but we didn't get to see a lot. If you are limited on time I would skip the tour.

Worth the Hassle of Needing Pre booked Tickets. Friends who visited Budapest warned us about the need to book tickets online before our visit. They didn't do so and lost out. We'd say the Parliament is one of the top Budapest sights. Tours include a monitor and headphones so you don't have to keep up with the guide or strain to hear her over your fellow tourists. The building is beautiful. One highlight is the dome room that contains the 1,000 year old crown of Saint Stephen. The crown, guarded by two no-nonsense guards with swords and a third man a Soviet style handler, has a very unique history. The tour takes you inside one of the Parliament chambers. Hungary formerly had a bi-chameral legislature but adapted to a one-chamber parliament after WWII. Some of the artifacts in the museum are also interesting such as the former star that adorned the building in the communist era. So don't miss out. Book your tickets online and enjoy.
Breath Taking. Worth the price of the expensive tour. Highly recommended. The entry is in the square parliament is on. If facing Parliament and the Danube, it is on your right side.

Must visit. So, you are in Budapest. What to do? Of course you have to visit the Parliament. I would recommend to have a guided tour, since there is no possibility to enter it without. Great building from the inside aswell from the outside. Biggest Parliament in Europe, so give it a try.

Showcase seat of Power. Impressive complex that is very well maintained. Make sure to take the guided tour which lasts 45 minutes. Our tour guide was excellent. They take you to St Stephen's crown, which is under constant guard (only section where photos are not permitted). You get to see where parliament sits and deliberates. High level of ornamentation throughout. After the tour there is an exhibit area about the building and maintenance thereof. Nice gift shop too but pricey.

Breathtaking at night. This was a short tour but really enjoyable. The parliament building is so beautiful and anyone visiting Budapest must go. The headsets are a great idea to go hand in hand with the tour guide as you could end up missing details if not close up to them. Fantastic building and even more so when lit up at night!!
Not to miss! - Budapest Parliament. This is one of the most beautiful parliaments you will ever visit. I would suggest purchasing the option to take pictures (I didn't and regret it).

Beautiful. The building itself is beautiful and for those who love history as I do will love to go for the architecture, the style and the feeling of greatness.I was disappointed though that you cannot walk feely and the visit is really short, I would have liked to see the rooms and library that isn't included in the guided tour.
Beautiful. Worth while visiting. We didnt go on a tour but the view from the Danube was really amazing especially at night.
Very beautiful and impressive building. We did not have time to go into the Parliament buildings but were in the square. It's very beautiful and close to the metro, restaurants, and cafes.
Stunning Building. Be sure to get on a sunset cruise to capture the most amazing views of this incredible building!! Great views from across the river on the hop on bus

Interesting to see, but if you are pressed for time I would skip. Yes, it is a remarkable building - one can imagine the visiting heads of state and the small statues on the pillars were quite interesting to see.
Beautiful!. Most amazing building of Budapest. Worth visiting during sunset and after dark. The lighting is beautiful!

Unexpectedly mediocre. When we first saw this building we absolutely loved it. We immediately wanted to go in and have a look and took many pictures of the outside beforehand.We want in on our last day and found out taking a guided tour was mandatory. We had to buy tickets and come back three hours later. We had lunch in the lunchroom there (not advisable) and came back three hourse later. We took the tour and were really disappointed. It was about half an hour long and cost us ~10 euro (it's even more for non-EU members). Not really worth the cost!The interior was nice, but it's would be so much nicer if you could walk around privately instead of with large groups. And there's so much more to see, but you don't get to go there as a tourist (the library for example).

Very impressive. This building is beautifully detailed and kept Immaculate. The location is stunning alongside the Danube. I only saw this during daytime but I'm told it's very special when lit at night.
Impressive!. Amazing building both from inside and outside. The main monument of Budaoest is absokutely worth to visit and admirable.

Beautiful building. Preties building in Budapest and I think that this is one repair building in city. You must see the Parliament inside, because there you can imagine Hungarian history in few minutes
Stunning. Definitely worth a guide tour, lasts an hour. Beautiful inside and out, I'd suggest doing an evening cruise to see it lit up at night too!
Guided tour brings the place alive. A must see for every visitor. Take the guided tour, available in almost any language. It brings the place alive.

Impressive building and interiors. Parliament building is an impressive structure - in daylight as well as at night when it is lit. A 45-minute guided tour of parliament shows the richly decorated historical interiors, although the tour covers only a small part of the parliament. Advance booking recommended. Definitely, worth a visit!

Wow of a building. What a magnificent building, inside & outside. To understand this historical parliament, you need lots of time. Entrance to see inside parliament is expensive & under very strict security. The architecture both inside & outside are a "wow" factor. No photography in room where the crown is kept, which located directly underneath the spire. This area is surrounded with guards in traditional military uniform. Viewed the changing of guards during visit. Entrance fees include the displays & exhibition of this historical building. Much time is required to see displays.
Beautiful!!!. One of my most favourite buildings in the city. Be sure to check it out at night when it is all lit up!

Breathtaking beauty and design. One of the most beautiful buildings in the world both from the outside and inside. Recommend paying for a tour to make sure you learn about the history design and modern use of this Budapest landmark. Worth every Forint!
BEAUTIFUL!!!. This place is astoundingly beautiful!!! The whole place is a work of art. The architecture, the sculptures, the paintings on the ceilings... Jaw dropping!

Better than a visit to the Capitol in Washington DC. Maybe it's security issue, but this is DEFINITELY one of the best tour of government buildings in the world. I know there are palaces all over Europe that are magnificent, but those are not exactly government buildings. I dare you to compare this to Kremlin & Westminster...You have to visit this building if you are in Budapest. Don't forget to reserve a spot if you only understand English,

Just a wonderful sight at night when it is all lit up. The Parliament building is located along the Danube River in Pest between the Chain and Margit bridges. While most tourists view the Parliament building during the day, we were lucky to have an evening river cruise with Scenic to see it all lit up at night. Many lights were used which showed off all its main structural features - the towers, the dome, the classic exterior. The building is very long so the lights used provided a spectacular effect, especially with the reflected image on the river - gold on dark waters. On the opposite side of the hill, St. Matthias Church and the Fisherman's Bastion were also lit up. Both, at night, provided a fantastic show of Budapest's tourist sights. Our river cruise ship, the Scenic Jasper, was docked on the Buda side just opposite the Parliament buildings, a notable landmark for Budapest. This location provided different pictures than those taken at the front entrance of the parliament on its square where it was surrounded by many statues of importance to Hungarian history. Similar views of the Parliament would also be seen from the Fisherman's Bastion up on the Buda hill. From across the river, the stone work on the Parliament gleamed in the sunshine. When viewed across the river, it's symmetrical architectural design was apparent with its rows of windows and balanced placement of turrets and a central dome.We didn't take a tour of the inside of the Parliament as it seemed just too complicated to get individual tickets. The time to be spent at the Parliament would thus vary depending upon what you wanted to see.

One of the simbols of Budapest. Built at the end of the 19.th century, this wonderful building is on the shore of the Danube river. If you have time make a visit inside, as it is beautiful. Now the renovation after years is ready and it is now really a wonder.
Best pleace for foto from Pest side. Best foto from Budapest, You have to go to side of Pest and in the background You get most beautiful photo form walk
Could not get in. You need to pre book the tour - on the day we were there they had sold out on English tours for the whole day and they will not let you in without a guide

Totally amazing. Pulled up here on our cruise ship and this was the view from our cabin. Both day and night was just mind blowing. A most beautiful building and I was in awe. Very pleasing to just look at all day and all night. Loved it!

Size and beauty of this building is surprising. Largest building in Hungary and second largest parliament building in Europe. It's HUGE! And incredibly beautiful. The grounds are lovely and other attractive buildings near by which makes strolling through the area feel relaxing and enjoyable. One of the prettiest areas of Budapest. There are two guards who have a routine circular March which is fun to watch. And there is a spray pad you can walk through if you need to cool down. There was a nice cafe across the street you can grab coffee at and enjoy the views. The parliament is also very close to the Shoes on. the Danube Promenade Memorial, so plan to hit that attraction next. It's free and worth a look! Happy touring!

Breathtaking view!. We were on a Danau River cruise and we ended our cruise here in Budapest. Sailing by and seeing the Hungarian Parliament Building all lit up at night was one of the prettiest sites I had ever seen. I won a photo contest with the picture I took from our ship.

The Parliament building is magnificent. We couldn't visit the Parliament because we hadn't booked in advance, and there were no English or Spanish guided visits available when we went there. However, the building is gorgeous, like a cathedral. Don't miss the looks to the Parliament from the Buda side of the river.
One of a kind. This relatively new complex is huge and wonderous to walk around and just marvel at all the detail. Make sure you go across the river to catch it at night.
Spectacular. This was my favourite attraction. Utterly fascinating. Also lovely to see it lit up at night whilst on a river dinner cruise.

Beautiful building. It is what it is -- a large building with a lot of interesting castings, statues, water downspouts, etc. Take a few minutes to visit the underground displays in front of the building for getting up close to the those same architectural bits.

Beautiful!. Everyone raves about this building, and justifiably so. It takes some effort to get tickets for the slightly-under-one-hour tour. We went to the ticket center around 9 am and were able to get tickets for 4 pm. The ticket center is not difficult to find but it is set back from the initial Parliament area--you just need to keep walking and you will eventually find it. The tour was worthwhile and provided some interesting tidbits about the building and the operation of the Hungarian Parliament (e.g. has 96 steps which is significant since Budapest was founded in 896). The crown Hungarian Kings wear at their coronation was on display and under guard. We went to the actual room where one of the houses of parliament meet. The building is very ornate and beautiful.We also saw the building lit up at night on a Danube boat trip--a stunning sight!I recommend this sight as a must see in Budapest.

Best viewed at night. We could only see it from outside due to scarcity of time but it was amazing when seen at night. I would advise viewing it from a distance to get the best view. We saw it from the other end of the river after crossing chain bridge.The parliament is easily accessible with tram stops and a metro station close to it.

This was impressive, both at a distance, and close up.. My hotel was at the other side of the Danube, which gave me a wonderful view of the Parliament building by night. The next day I walked over to the other side to look at it more closely, and the building was no less impressive then. The building and the area around it was well preserved, it was nice and clean everywhere. There were guards there with guns in their belt, but they were friendly and just explained where I should go, when I tried to enter the wrong door. I got the impression that I could have gotten into the library, but I did not take the time, so I never got inside the impressive building. If there is a guided tour, I would like to take that on my next visit to Budapest.

A Grand Building. In awe of the architecture of this building and the size. Be sure to walk around it and see the statues that don't face the river. Also be sure to see it at night from a cruise along the river. Magnificent.
Sophisticated architecture. Awesome looking structure of Budapest.Looking it from afar or close both will fulfill your travel appetite.
Nice architecture. A very beautiful building. We went out at night specifically to view thus building lit up at night. Then visited the next day. Quite a view!

Stunning. Pre booked a tour and was well worth it. The building is stunning both inside and out. Our guide was very informative and made the tour very interesting with all the snippets of information. Extremely grand and lavish. The only disappointment was the cafe which was quite pricey compared to other places to eat

Must-do Parliament. Breathtaking interior and magnificent views. We saw the changing if the guards for the Crown Jewels which is interesting. Museum gift shop has great choices that are reasonably priced; not marked up.
stunning. didn't actually go on the tour inside but obviously took a lot of pictures best view from the Buda side from Fisherman's Bastion

Worth it!. We have been told that visiting this place is worth it. We booked a tour online and upon arrival we got our tickets. The guided tour (English) was interesting and educational. We enjoyed it quite a bit. Highly recommended.

Awesome outside architecture; inside not as impressive . We took the guided tour inside the parliament building and it took 45 minutes. While it was nice to see the crown and the parliament auditorium some of the hallways and rooms were underwhelming. Much more impressive from the outside! It is only 3800 forints so not too expensive.

Beautiful and awesome . Beautiful building, well looked after outside, very very clean everywhere. Peaceful environment, guards friendly. Didn't have time for the tour, so a definite reason to go back

Masterpiece . Just great architecture, freshly renovated including surrounding area. It is a must.
Superb view from the Buda Hills and also from Danube.

average tour in my opinion. The tour is relatively expensive for non-EU citizens and was pretty average in my opinion - could be interesting to learn more about the parliamentary work instead of about how much gold was used in building the building.
Although, the main hall was very impressive!

Solo American Girl - Budapest Siteseeing. Parliament is situated right along Danube river. If you are in Budapest this is a must! It is much more impressive than the US capital or Whitehouse! Get yourself to this location first - either walk, use metro, uber, taxi - & once here you could spend 1-3 hours walking to everything right from here - shoes on Danube are nearby, lots of boat river tours offered right along river in this area, walk across the bridges, stroll along the Danube - start with Parliament building & go south along Danube. You can do lots of walking, but the sights are so beautiful you'll hardly notice.
Stunning. Only allowed in by guided tour. The exterior is absolutely stunning. Third largest in the world I believe and it did not disappoint.

The best view is from the river. We didn't go inside the building during our visit, so can't comment on prices or value. The architect used the Houses of Parliament in London as the inspiration for his design - but it has much more to it. It is perfectly symmetrical and has a dome at the centre. Our first view of the building was from a taxi on the opposite shore of the Danube, at night time - it was amazing! The building would appear to have been either well maintained, or recently cleaned. It was lit up, and had the appearance of an ivory carving. we walked around it the following day, but the best view of the building is actually from a river boat. The building is the largest in Hungary and standing close to it doesn't give the best photographic experience.

Parliament - Short and Sweat. The tour of the Hungarian Parliament was short and sweat. About a 45 minute tour. Beautiful building - architecture and design. Descriptions and background history was minimal. I thought more could have been said. Great to see the Royal Crown of St Stephan.
Beautiful building . Make sure you plan to a tour of the interior. You can buy tickets ahead of time online. Tour takes about an hour. You see the main entrance and most of one side.

What a beautiful building.... This complex was just around the corner from our hotel and was the first major sight we came across on our visit to Budapest. It is beautiful from every angle but the image from a passing cruise boat at night on the Danube is perhaps the most spectacular. It is most definitely a must visit!!

The most photogenic building . It is located near the river and is a very splendid building. It is nice at day time but it has completely different aura at night. I suggest to take a photo of it just across the river.

Worth a visit . We signed up for an overpriced tour that was a rip off - book a tour online or shop around - don't trust your hotel as they push tours that kickback to them 100% worth doing but plan ahead

Take the tour, it's worth it!. The Parliament itself is stunning. The tour was very informative and useful for learning about the construction of the building and some Hungarian history. There are many English tours, you can see and book a slot online to avoid queues.

Must see. This is the most gorgeous building in Budapest.
We viewed it from the cruise ship and loved it enough to take the tram 2 to see it.
Parliament building . The Parliament building is impressive and is with a trip during the day and at night from the river when it has spot lights on.

Beautiful building, don't bother with the tour . The building is fantastic from the outside. There a reason a few free exhibitions that are worth checking out.I wouldn't bother with the tour. It's generally over-subscribed and only lasts about 25 minutes. The tour guides are scripted and monotonous and whilst it's got a spectacular interior, it doesn't compare to the views you get for free from the outside.

Palatial Parliament. The Hungarian Parliament building is definitely worth a visit. The interior is breathtaking & the guide very keen to share knowledge. Book a tour in your language prior to travelling as they can get very full.

Wonderful tour. This was a wonderful visit. Our tour guide set it up for us, but I saw people purchasing tickets, so I think anyone can do it. Our tour guide was wonderful, and we enjoyed the tour very much. The Parliament building is such a prominent attraction in Budapest - to get to go inside - is even better.
Stunning night virw. Been there both daytime and night time, like it at night cos Very nice view at night when the light is on, close to the river and very easy to assess
Wonderful Architecture. Really great looking building, cool looking architecture. It's the largest and tallest building in Budapest!

Amazing! The view from the Danube even more stunning.. We have been to Budapest before, but only saw the Parliament from across the river. This time we walked around it, and took a river cruise and cruised past it. It is gorgeous, and absolutely beautiful at night when the lights are on.

Scenic and outstanding architecture . Just as you see in the pictures. It's truly majestic- just like you see in the travel guides. Highly recommended. It's beautiful by day and night. Just wander around and become captured by the stunning and enchanting architecture.

Simply Stunning.. You have to go here and do the tour. The outside is amazing and so beautiful. The inside is also spectacular, beautiful and steeped in history.
The tour is fantastic and rather inexpensive and lasts around 50 minutes.

Amazing Place. You should see it espesially at night. But if you want to go inside, you need to order etickets before your trip. I advise you to visit this Parliament. You will keep this memory for ever..

Great attraction . Take the tour. We took the English one. It's the only way to see the architecture up close. It is truly amazing. Our tour guide was very gently spoken and had s lovely sense of humor. He was easy on the eye also. However, his narrative paid no attention to the rocky past of Hungary with Nazti and subsequent Soviet rule. It was a sweetened version of the history with all the detail removed. It almost felt like the narrative betrays the struggle these beautiful people have endured. If I were Hungarian, I'd be cross. Take the tour and see what you think of the vanilla historical narrative. By the way, the architecture of the museum Centre where the tour begins is very sympathetic and stylish, allowing the grandeur of the parliament buildings to remain the focus.It's over priced for a 45 min tour.. But you're here right?

Spectacular inside and out. The Parliament tour seemed a little pricey but I would still highly recommend it. The tour last approximately 45-50 minutes. We also saw the changing of the guards. After the changing the lead guard offered people to come up and take pictures with them. Seems unheard of in our security conscious society but it was a memorable occasion for us. Make sure you see the building all light up at night. The daytime is great but nighttime is magical.
A true gem. This is a must see! This imposing building encapsulates many a treasure! One should book a tour in their preferred language online beforehand to avoid disappointment.

Wonderful tour and fascinating building. The Parliment Building is a centerpiece in Budapest and after looking at it in the day and at night, decided to take the tour through the Parliment Building while in Budapest. The building is beautiful, and there is so much to see, felt that could have spent much more time looking at the painting and artwork. The history is also fascinating. A wonderful site and the tour is definitely worth it.
Beautiful building. This fabulous building is best viewed from the other side of the river. Possibly from fisher mans bastion.
Must see. Need to plan ahead though. Have to book your tickets on the Jegymester site. Can only visit with a tour. Many tours per day in various languages. Beautiful, lots of history

A stunning water front attraction! Must see!. By far the most imposing legislative building in Europe, if not the world! At night it is a sight that will stay with you for a very long time and by day, you will truly appreciate its scale and grandeur.22 kms of corridors, hundreds of rooms, scores of stairs and stately appointments.Our only regret was that we could not take a tour on the day we visited! Will go back to Budapest just for this!

Take an appointment in advance for visiting. Beautiful monument but visit only with appointment and space are limited. The architecture is wonderful and structure design fantastic. To e visited if you can get space appointment.

Add this to your attractions list.. Visited 30th June, 2016 - the Parliament is the biggest and most splendour in Europe. Photo 1. My partner and I opted for the English Tour at 14:45 and enjoyed this short but sweet tour of the history of the Parliament - you even get a leg and bum workout going up and down the 140 stairs. The Parliament has the worlds largest hand woven carpet in wool: Photo 2, which depicts the animals and flowers found in Hungary. Most importantly, you can view the original Crown of St Steven of Budapest in the main chamber, but taking photos is not permitted. Do note the crown will be relocated in a couple of years to the Castle; as this is currently under renovations.
Great building, an icon for Budapest!. It's an icon for Budapest and you can view it by night , it takes your breath away! If you are taking a boat trip, you can take amazing pictures!

Must see! Incredible architecture details.. Definitely include a visit to this historic site. It is mind boggling how this beautiful structure was built centuries ago.If possible, try to do the boat tour so you can see these historical sites from another angle.

Spectacular Tour. Stunning building from the outside and the inside. We went on a guided tour of the parliament which was fascinating and entertaining. Unless you go early in the morning, it is a good idea to book your tickets prior to visiting.
Beautiful views. Great place for photos, particularly from across the lake. Best part of Budapest was looking at the Parliament building at night.
Visit the parliament. Interesting but the guide did not speak very clearly.the museum which we were able to visit at the end of our tour was good and self explanatory

Fabulous building inside and out. Exotic gothic building that is extremely photogenic from the opposite side of the river. Toured the interior, 'rebook as it can get very busy in tourist season. Interior was amazing, very opulent. Highlight was the main staircase and entry. Also great to see King Stephens crown and sceptre on display. Tour guide was brilliant.

Beautiest Parliament building ever. Seeing that beautiful parlament building was one of the unforgettable moments of my life. I can recommend anyone to go there and visit it. It has a tourist visiting place under the ground so i could have a look at the Holy Crown of Hungary and lots of informations from the history of the Nation. Thank you!

An insightful visit. An imposing building right on the banks of the Danube. The outside of the building is spectacular just to look at, be sure to stay for the changing of the guard. It's also well worth the guided tour. A brief history and tour of the parliament buildings. See the opulent staircases and Crown Jewels- just don't go near the guards, they have swords. Good value for money. You will not be disappointed.
The Jewel on the Danube. Even if not interested in politics, a visit to the Hungarian Parliament has much to offer. History, architecture, Crown jewels,
One of the greatest places at pudabest. Really a unique place on Danube river. you Must visit it. also you can walk around you will see most of Budapest bridges from there.
As good on the inside as on the outside. Well organised, tour available in different languages, easy to book in person or online. Interesting and informative. Lots of stairs but lift available

Magnificent. This neo-Gothic building irradiates past glory when Austria-Hungary was a monarchy and the twin cities of Budapest and Vienna tried to outshine each other. For a couple of years it has been possible to visit the parliament, best done a little bit off season to avoid long queues. There is even a library inside for those interested in special books.
Just amazing! . If you dont know why you should visit Budapest, you have the answer : Parliament :) The surrounding is incredibly trim.

Amazing. You must see it in the day and at night. If you are going to Budapest you need to go to the Parliament website and reserve tickets to take the tour. If you think the outside is impressive wait till you see the inside.
Wow!. Wow! This building is the most amazing place in Budapest. My favourite thing of our trip was to sit around the building and enjoy the sounds of Budapest.

Great place . The parliament at night is stunning and watching it from the river bank is absolutely breath taking and I kept on going back and forth to get different picture angles at night and during the day
The view at night is stunning!. We did a boat tour in the evening and the views of the city were amazing. Loved it! The city is beautiful in the day but at night....WOW!

Beautiful building and small group English speaking guides.. Well worth a visit, only an hour needed for a guided tour, worth booking online before. There is a lift for those that have difficulty walking as many steps up.
A very impressive building. I hope that they do very good work here as it is a very beautiful building in an incredible location.
Beautiful by night and day. We took a boat tour at night and the sites are awesome with the right lightning, really cool all round we even got off and walked around the area, good history.

Booked tour to Parliament. Like all other tourists we booked our tour and turned up in good time. But just to share with you, all visitors are kept on the Visiter Centre side of the security check until just a couple of minutes before your tour is due to commence. Like other tourists there, we were getting a little anxious if we were in the right place. But you have to remain there until your time and language is called, and even at that, the large booked groups get priority to go through first. There is no problem with that, but not knowing it left us a bit confused. The tour is really impressive because of the grandeur of the building. Well worth visiting.

A must see experience. We had two English speaking guides for our trip, one for the outside and one for the inside. They were both excellent. Both were very well informed and I could not believe it when the trip was over as time went so quickly. The building is magnificent, both inside and out. It should definitely be on everyone's must see list when visiting Budapest. There is a very interesting display about various aspects of the building at the end of the tour which is worth spending quite a bit of time in. There is also a well stocked but quite expensive gift shop and a coffee bar.

Magnificent building day and night.. We only visited the parliament from outside, but could appreciate the fine and great architecture of this majestic building. We also took a close view at night while passing in front of it on the Danube. The site is just fabulous.

Continually Amazed!. I visited Parliament on my first full day in Budapest of an 11 day trip in early June. The building, a true work of art, was of course even more impressive than I could have imagined, but what really shocked me was that I never tired of it. Every time I turned down a street and caught a glimpse of it peeking out above the rooftops, or saw it staring back across the Danube at night it made my heart skip a beat. This is not a building to go and see just once, but to experience from all angles, all across the city, and at all times of day and night.*Budapest has thoughtfully made a bronze miniature of the building and labeled it in Braille so that it's beauty is accessible to even more people. This can be found near the northeast end of the building.
Outstanding. This building is something you can not miss in Budapes and it really is beautifule, it is the best to look at it from river.

Very historical. check the times for language you want; English was about every 4 hours the day we went, so you can't just show up for a tour to get the type you want. We went on an escorted tour, gets you in easily. Gives you a lot of history and you see where they did the legislative work in the past.

Over the Top. As I understand it, Hungary developed an edifice complex as their empire declined in size and power. Consequently there are several buildings (including the cathedral and the Parliament) that are huge and opulent. The Parliament is a bit larger than the one in London and very very grand. The tour is efficient and informative and it's the only way u can tour the building. Reserve in advance.
Stunning building. Pre book your tour as you can't just turn up and expect to get in. We purchased ticket via our hop on hop off bus company.
Beautiful. This building was once a palace and now houses the Parliament. It is impressive to see and visit during the day but even more spectacular at night. It was a highlight of our trip.

Breathtaking. A must see if you visit Budapest easy to get to if you travel by Metro and some sites to see around also. The Parliament building itself is breathtaking, one of the most impressive buildings ive seen and you can take a tour inside. If you wait long enough you can see a performance by the guards and you have the chance to take photographs next to them :)
Beautiful. Make sure you go to the front and watch the guards walk around. You have to go to the parliament if you are in Budapest!!!!!

Incredible views at night. Budapest is a city enjoyed best at night. Most of the sites have lights and the temperature is so much cooler. I recommend dining at one of the near by restaurants and strolling through the Parliament courtyards afterward.

#1 building in Budapest. The Parliament is amazing to see from all sides, so getting closely around it gives some great views, but it is also amazing to see from a Danube boat or any of the Buda high points.

Looks grand and very great. The Parliament is huge and very beautiful. One needs half a day just to enjoy and explore it thoroughly. If you want to take a picture infront of it you must cross the bridge for that since you wont be able to capture the parliament in the single shot.

Must see the Parliment Building at night from the river.. Budapest lights up at night. If you get a chance to cruise the river after dark you will witness the beauty of the city and ooh and ahh at the lights.

Most impressive building in Budapest. Our guide was ok we had a 12 o'clock tour it was only about 45mins, the building is huge you only do a small amount of rooms, the décor inside and the crown jewels which are under guard 24hrs were impressive. the grounds outside and other buildings around parliament would also keep you busy.

Gorgeous. The parliament is not only gorgeous from the outside, its even more gorgeous from the inside. Anyone who visits Budapest, must book a tour of the parliament. Very informative and interesting, and our guide was wonderful!
Beautiful looking Building. Parliament is a beautiful building at day and night. We did not go inside but cruised by it on the River Danube during the day and night. Spectacular sight.
One of the most striking parliaments in Europe.. Travelling to Budapest without visiting the parliament building is like going to Rome without visiting the Vatican.

Stunning Building. During the beginning of our tour we were literally docked next to the Parliament building. This is a major tourist attraction. We didn't go inside, our time was limited but the exterior of the building was great, right on the river.

Impressive. Our first glimpse of this enormous building was travelling up the Danube river at night. With it all lit up its grand stature is breathtaking. Situated on the bank of the river it is beautiful and from whatever angle you see it from it won't disappoint.

The decorative finesse of history connects to the present. For a country with such a rich history, surveying the architectural and historic inscriptions on a building of this scale and finesse is thrilling. A most effective walk through the corridors of history - and great tour guides too.
Hungarian Parliament. The most spectacular building in Hungary. Did you know its about a metre longer than the British Parliament? very pedestrian friendly and excellent amenities in the area
imposing building on the Danube. The white spires of the parliament shimmer in the summer sun Very imposing worth a walk around outside to view from all angles

Definitely the most magnamious architecture in middle of Budapest. By all accounts it does not look like parliament. I personallz thought it was some grand cathedral. On doing a free tour walk I learn it is actually parliament and it is a super pretty sturcture and architecture. Apparently the architect was inspired by London. Right next to the river and one of the highest and most prominent buildings in the skyline of budapest it is worth checking out.

Breathtaking view. It doesn't matter if you look at it at night or during the day, this building is definitely gorgeous and breathtaking. I would recommend to watch it from the other side of the Danube to get the most spectacular view. Personally, I prefer it by night.
Impressive. Very impressive. The second best after westminster in london. Nice area and monuments around the parliament.

A whiz through parliament. A beautiful building with so much history. The process of meeting for the organised tour was efficient and smooth. Our guide took us on their regular tour which was informative and interesting. The building is stunning and we were able to access all the normal places as parliament was not sitting. You have to do this if in Budapest as it is a real highlight. Book well in advance to ensure you get in.

Tour was too short. We visited the parliament as part of their daily tours a few days ago. The tour only took us to a few selected places inside the parliament, probably only one wing of this massive building. I have you say, although the inside is as beautiful as the outside, we were thoroughly disappointed in the tour itself. For the amount they charge, the tour was very short (40 minutes) and the guide was very mono-toned about it all. I didn't enjoy this tour as much as I had enjoyed other ones throughout Budapest. Very disappointed in the quality and length of the tour......
Took my English friends there.. The most beautiful parliament building in continental Europe, located at the Danube bank. The square has just been renewed, and it is a great place to visit with kids.
Beautiful architecture. Lovely view from across the river Danube at night. The lighting is wonderful. Don't forget to take picture.

Incredibly beautiful building. The exterior of this building left me awestruck. More a palace then a parliament building. It actually made the castle on castle hill on the buda side look rather dowdy. You can only see the inside on a guided tour. Tickets can be purchased from several vendors. I think the safest bet is the visitors bureau. Just behind to the south is a lovely sculpture of Attila Jozef a Hungarian poet.
Beautifully maintained facility. It costs to visit but well worth it. Our behind the scenes tour was excellent. Marvelous fixtures, fantastic history excellent guides.
Impressive. This is what I like about Europe. History and the architecture. They have done a lot to make this building the pride of Budapest. A really amazing treat

Cheap Tour. Great but short tour of parliament, would definitely recommend it!The tour only lasted 20 minutes but the guide was very knowledgeable. Good for people with mobility problems as their was a lift. Very cheap but I'd recommend to book in advance as we had to go back 4 hours later for our tour as the others were full
Must do visit. One of the top must do so when in Budapest. Impressive! Try and see it when lit at night. Really nice.

Most beautiful Parlament. I always dreamed about to visit the Parlament in Hungary. It is amazing! I loved every details about it an the cherry on the top is River Danube! I took hundreds of photos! :)

photographs well!. make sure you walk all the way around the parliament and go to see the two underground museums that talk about what happened there. We did not go inside the parliament because of the wait time for an English tour. All tours are guided here.

The Temple of Bureaucracy. For small country Hungary has an edifice of grand proportions for its parliament. A stunning building of spires and cupola. Exquisite in detail hiding the fundamentals of state on a grand scale. You can do tours but being on a weekend and with short time frame we missed those But the view to the castle and along the Danube is awesome. And as you can tell the Parliament buildings are not too shabby either.
Beautiful. It's architecture is simply stunning. Would highly recommend anyone visiting Budapest to take a trip up to the Parliament building and marvel at this building.

Amazing building. Don't worry if you haven't got a ticket. You can enjoy the building from outside. Stunning architecture - looks like gothic parliament. Get the metro and go to the opposite side (across the river) to see how amazing is this building. Definitely must see at night - they turned on the lights in 9.30 pm yesterday (I've been told 10 pm).

Took the tour (in French). I took the tour in French, as it was the only with available spots in a language I at least know a little bit. Even though I only understood about a third of what the guide said, the tour was spectacular, as this is a very beautiful building. One of the must see architecture sights in Budapest, both exterior and interior.

Spectacular, likely the most extravagant government building in the world!. It is brilliant outside, inside, day and night! I was impressed that during the many wars and revolutions, it was not damaged (no traces of any damage).

Very impressive. The parliament was so beautiful inside and out. Probably the nicest we've seen in all central Europe. I highly recommend doing a guided tour, it was a little pricey but they do give student's discounts. Also, very impressive at night time when it is lit up.
Great tour guide!. This building is in an exceptional state. The interior is very beautiful with lots to see. The tour guide was really helpful and knowledgeable about Hungarian history.

Majestátna budova / Majestic building. Jedinečná budova, ktorá Vás nadchne svojou majestátnosťou. Doteraz nerozumiem ako ju mohli vystavať za taký krátky čas. Ak chcete absolvovať prehliadku vnútorných priestorov, odporúčam objednať si vstupenky vopred cez internet v jazyku, ktorému rozumiete. V deň prehliadky sú väčšinou vstupenky vypredané. Pri vstupe prechádzate prehliadkou batožiny a scanerom. Exteriérová majestátnosť sa prenáša aj do interiérov. Určite to stálo za prehliadku. The unique building, which will enchant you with its majesty. So far, I do not understand how it could be build in such a short time. To take a tour of the interior space is advisable to book your tickets in advance over the Internet in a language you understand. The day tour tickets are usually sold out. At the entrance you will go through inspection of baggage and scanners. Exterior grandeur is transferred to the interior. It certainly was worth a tour.
Interesting. Our time was quite limited but enough for a quick visit to this site. Really interesting building and it seems full of history. Lovely architecture indeed.

you have to do a tour to look inside. the building is beautiful and quite austrian in its architecture. If you want to see the inside (its well worth it) you have to go around on a tour which I would definitely recommend booking at least a few days in advance. Its very reasonably priced and worth it. You can learn quite a lot and see some interested aspects of the building, the crown jewels are also here, it only lasts an hour and the whole visit; about an hour and a half.

Fabulous!!! A must see. Need to plan / book in adavnce. This is the most wonderful government place I have seen. You need to book in advance and it is not free. But the efforts are worth it. In addition to the interiors that are fabulous, you also are given the information by some of the most enjoyable travel guides. Loved it. You can take lots of photos (barring the place where they keep royal jewels) and the parliament building makes a great photo on a sunny day!
Great building on the Danube river. From this point it is best to start a walk in Budapest. It will delight you at first sight. I can not believe that this people has built.

Beautiful building wish idhad ti eto go inside. I saw the parliament building as I was walking across to castle Hill and I must have a hundred photos from different angles. Close up it doesn't disappoint either. Definitely a must see in budapest

Gorgeous Modern building overlooking River Danube. We went to the Parliament building around 5:00 pm and saw the guard come out and lower the Hungarian flag, which was very cool. Also there are loads of new monuments and statues around the area. Really cool place.

Reserve in Advance!. I arrived at 9:45 am for my 10:00 reservation, which I had made several weeks in advance. In theory it is possible to get same-day reservations. I'm here to tell you that on the day in May that I was there, by 9:45 am the only tour spots remaining were in Hebrew, Italian or Russian. So if that works for you, fine. If not, reserve your tour time and language online in advance! You cannot tour Parliament on your own; you must go with a tour group. The building itself is truly magnificent, definitely a more beautiful working environment than any of us is likely to encounter. Be sure to take 10-20 minutes at the end of the tour to view the history of the building, how they change the light bulbs in the chandelier in the grand hall, see the Red Star that was removed from the top of Parliament when the Soviets departed, etc.

Brief and disappointing. We bought our tickets on line and showed up almost an hour before this tour. Being under the impression that the tour would be about an hour, we were greatly disappointed that it was about 35 minutes. The guide's English was good, but the group was way too large to see all that was being pointed out. It too a long time to go through security and when it was over, we really did not see that much of the buildingThe best part of the visit to the Parliament building was the outstanding museum exhibit. There were earphones and easily an hour's worth of viewing and listening to the history of government in Hungary. The only way to visit the museum is to have a ticket for one of the tours of Parliament.
Parliament a must see. Really magnificent building and scenic location. It's hard to get perspective because it's so large, but a tour of the interior is a must. You may need to reserve in advance.
One of the most stunning buildings you will see. Budapest is a fascinating city with many attractions, but the Parliament building is a highlight, having a real wow factor.

Fantastic . The building is stunning and the tour was incredible. Our guide was so passionate and knowledgeable about the place. The Hungarian crown and the guards that surround it were great to see. Tour was about 45mins and great value
Do not miss . Very impressive and interesting parliamentThe building in the inside is beautiful and have a lot of history. You have to take the organized tour

Very good to visit this place. The Hungarian Parliament Building, also known as the Parliament of Budapest for being located in that city, is the seat of the National Assembly of Hungary, one of Europe's oldest legislative buildings. MUST VISIT

Excellent place! Must visit from inside!. It is better if you visit the place from inside if you time permits. The place can be accessible by wheelchair. The guide explained us the history. Must place to visit if you are tourist.

Quick in and out.... We walked all around the glorious building but did leave our tickets for a tour too late - this can get sold out in English - only French and Spanish tours were left by lunchtime. Very popular! Best to reserve in advance so you can see inside as well.
Simply Gorgeous!. My absolute favorite building in Budapest! Absolutely stunning! They take down the flag at 6:30 in the evening (a cool changing of the guards sort of affair).

A breathtaking structure!. This building is MUST see when you travel to Budapest. We took soo many pictures. The details that went into the building of this structure is very admirable. So clean and quiet area. Really a great experience.

Even in pouring rain, spectacular. You have to see the Budapest Parliament house at night. Unbelievable! It was a wet miserable day but at night the stars shone and Parliament house was lit up like a fairy tale!
Budapest Parliament House Tour. Booked a tour for the Parliament Buildings in advance. Nice guide to parliament which is stunning and one of my favourite things that I did in Budapest! Well worth it!
Old Europe Architecture. Got off the tram station right in front of the Parliament building around 8 or 9 AM, was able to catch the flag raising ceremony. This building is AMAZING!

What a pearl!. Parliament is the most beautiful building in Budapest! It is situated on the river Danube and it is one of the sights you cannot miss. Take a guided tour! The tickets can be purchased in advance online, or you can just buy it at the ticket office inside the building. Usually, you will have to wait for two hours at least, in order to join the next group. But it is worth waiting!The guided tour takes you through the most important rooms and coridors, and you will have the chance to see the famous crown of Hungarian emperors. Taking photos is allowed. Only the crown cannot be photographed and it is guarded by a warden. Museum is nice and small and shop has a nice selection of different souvenirs like postcards, shirts, mugs, pencils, books,magnets etc. The only thing I find rather discriminating is the diference in the ticket price for EU and non-EU citizens. Non EU citizens pay higher price and I cannot find any good reason for this politics. It really leaves a bitter taste in your mouth before you even start your tour. The Parliament is amazing at night seen from the boat cruise. Enjoy!
Top attraction in Budapest. Group guided tour gives a terrific run down on the Parliament. It's impressive inside and out. Tour guide well informed and helpful
A walk back in time. It was like a trip back in time. the building has its own atmosphere which you feel when you walk around inside and out
What a building. One of the key sites of Budapest, beautiful building from river or land. We didn't get time for a closer look, so hopefully next time

Fabulous building. A must see!. The architecture is wonderful enough from the outside but the inside of this building is spectacular. Go on a Danube River cruise or just walk past at night and have a look at the building with all its lights on. Fabulous.

Stunning Heritage. Stunning and worth the tour, student EU ticker for the tour was about 1,500 HUF. Fantastic sights inside and out. Watching the guards and the inside tour both provided a nice merge in to heritage.

Get tour tickets well in advance. My daughter was in Budapest a few months before us and told us to go online and buy tickets before our arrival. The tour was very educational and such a beautiful building for public spaces.

Go! Walk around the entire building.. Visit inside, if possible. Also, use the restrooms, visit the visitor's center and gift shop. Huge and great! Great architecture. Beautiful at night with the lighting!

one of the most beautiful parliaments. Standing tall and proud next to the danube, the hungarian parliament is ofcourse a must visit at Budapest. Best viewed from buda side of danube especially as the lights come on post sunset.

Brilliant day or night. There is no doubt if you come to Budapest that this will be the focal point of your stay. I suggest taking a night ride on the river and fantastic photo opportunities will amaze you.
Great building. Great building. Great architecture. Recommend you to watch the procedure of flag removing at 18:30 in front of main entrance.

interesting . great and beautiful building with rich history.
parliament official ture was very interesting and informative.
the ture guide was kind and friendly and answer all questions with much knowledge.
my 3 yo son enjoyed also.

What a lovely building. We had bought tickets for a tour beforehand. The tour is the only way you can get to see the inside of the building. The start of the tour in terms of the security checks, getting the tours organized was quite chaotic. But the tour itself was good and quite interesting, and the inside of the building is just as nice as the outside. Strongly recommended.

O. Absolutely fantastic! The guide showed us around the parliament building, the House of Representatives, the crown etc. Magnificent on the inside as it is on the outside! The tour had a great sense of humour, and was very detailed with the information that he gave. A more expensive attraction, at around £14/20€ per person, but well worth it and expected for such a place. If you're going to visit anywhere in Budapest, go here, it won't be beaten!

Absolutely Gorgeous. This beautiful edifice is the cornerstone of Budapest. It is gorgeous in the daytime and stunning at night. The best place to photograph it is from the Fisherman's Bastion across the river. To my dismay, I was only able to see the outside. You can't just wander in and visit. You have to go in with a guide. I understand why, but I just didn't have time to do it. Got there too late on Friday afternoon and was gone by Saturday evening, with a full schedule. Next time it is at the top of my list.

Worth a visit. The guided tour was interesting and informative. The building itself and much of the history is very reminiscent of the opera building tour, so if on a short trip, choose just one of the two attractions. It's a bit pricey with a major discount for EU citizens (although during my visit no one checked).
Spectacular.... Apparently modelled on the Mother of all Parliaments, it's easy to see why...Freddie Mercury offered to buy it...

Book a tour! It's a must if you're in Hungary . This 60 minute tour will take you around the building and show you the beauty of it inside and outside! The interior is breathtaking and you will hear a lot of interesting information! Once you're finished with the tour go outside towards the Danube and walk down to shore! There is a pier there from where you can take Public Transportation boats for the price of single bus ticket! It will save you a lot of money if you want to go on a "boat tour"as you won't have to book with the pricey boat companies !

undescibable. unable to enter due to shortage of time.to look at this building was totally mind blowing.i have never seen a political building anywhere to match this.you can not describe it in words.i think that lit up at night it looked more impressive.
Stunning!. Excellent guided tour. See history coupled with vibrant statues and crown jewels. The guides do a great job describing all of the aspects of this place.
