Best viewed from Batthyany square. Did not take the inside tour of Parliament. It looks grand and beautiful both up close and far away. There are many spots to view the Parliament from the Buda side across the river. The best spot is from Batthyany square. Other spots are Fisherman's Bastion and Castle Hill. Go during the day and at night to see the Parliament lighted up.
Quick tour. We did the English speaking tour and it was quick and sweet less than an hour. You end in a bright museum. You can read about history of the building in museum.
Fantastic. Its maybe one of the most beautiful architectural work in the world. Especially you should see it at night. Under night lights it seems amazing!

The beautiful parliament building. This is a magnificent building and a real treat. You MUST have tickets to be admitted, which you can buy on site. If you're on a riverboat, the concierge can get them for you. They are moderately priced. The tour was absolutely wonderful -- just the right length and the right information. The tour guide was not in love with her voice, but she gave us all the information we needed.
Amazing. One of the best places I visited in Busapest, I had the opportunity of seeing morning and night and definitely night is the beat option!!

Beautiful building. This is a really interesting tour and only takes 45 minutes. The parliament building is still a functioning building which made it really interesting because you learnt a great deal about the Hungarian Government. You need to book beforehand on line as the tour is extremely popular and numbers limited.

A guided visit to the Hungarian Parliament.. We had a guided tour of the Parliament. It is an amazing building, a marvel of architecture and building skills. We highly recommend it. You must reserve visit tickets in advance.

Stunning building and informative tour. Really informative tour and the building is beautiful inside. You need to go and book the tour a few hours in advance and that's the only way you can go inside. Definitely worth a visit.
Good. Good view and very beautiful. It is very charming by night. Easy to find. And it is great. Hope one day will be back there soon.

Beautiful Place, A Must See. Amazing, Beautiful piece of architect, just pure stunning place to see. It just stands out from its surroundings. I didn't go into the parliament to have a look, but just looking outside of it was pure beauty. i am very sure the inside would be as beautiful as the outside. Next time I'm in Budapest, will definitely go in for a look.

Gem Box is seat of Political Power in Budapest. Just a gorgeous building. Great guided tour - guide spoke excellent English and gave an informative and engaging overview of the history of political power in Budapest, and the gorgeous artifacts, adornments and art inside the building. Must buy your tickets online or early in the am or risk waiting in line for hours!

Disappointed ---get advanced tickets!!!!!!!. From the outside, it is spectacular---my fault as I always get advance tickets but didn't ---couldn't take the tour and missed the opportunity. Saw it again at night from the Viking ship---amazing.

Must see. It's definitely top of the list for a reason - it's best from the other side of the river so you can appreciate the whole thing, but the tour is great too. Book it in advance through the Hungarian Parliament website; it's very informative, and the inside is great. I was disappointed by the gift shop, which was a bit expensive and where the staff seem to follow all the customers about - it was really off putting, but the attraction itself was great.

Beautiful Neo-gothic architecture. Must visit place. The architecture is amazing! Located on the bank of the Danube on the Pest side, the setting is absolutely picturesque. You can great photos of the parliament from the Chain Bridge, day or night!

Worth Viewing Multiple Times From Multiple Angles. It's impossible to miss this building when you're in Budapest. The classic view is from up the hill and across the river, preferably at night. But this building is worth actually making a trip to to see up close. It really is spectacular. No, it's not the most historic place ever, when other cities have grand buildings dating backing hundreds of years more, but it's beautiful none the less and a pinnacle of architectural achievement in Budapest.
Stunning place. This is a must see for any visit to budapest. The place is huge and there are plenty of photos to get around this area.
impressive structure. just an impressive building to see either from the river, Gellert hill, or especially up close. dont miss this spot up close
Imposing and lovely.. One of the many sights in this city worth seeing. If time permits do a tour. The history of the place alone is very interesting.
A must visit. I went to the Parliament building in Budapest , if you want to delve into the political history of Budapest (which is interesting) . You simply can not miss this one

A real world treasure!. We have viewed Parliament lite up at night which is magic, the inside does not disappoint! You need to book tours on line and check for the proper language. We had a great guide and a nice size group which allowed us to take plenty of pictures except of St. Stephan's crown. Great explanation of all of the statues and the fact that everything is gilded with real gold leaf! There is a nice shop, restroom and coffee shop at the visitor's center. This is also handicap accessible with a nice elevator.

Most beautiful building at night. Like a lot of people who have written reviews, we viewed this amazingly beautiful building in many ways - we walked around it, we viewed it from Buda, we viewed it from the ferry, we viewed it in the daylight and at night. It is just beautiful and such an icon and at night it is spectacular.
Impressive. It looks amazing, do not miss it. We've seen it only from the outside. Take your time to walk on the streets of Budapest and near the Parliament.
Lovely place . A must place to visit, it's a nice building if you go on a night it looks good from the other side of the river

Gorgeous Building. We had a great tour of the Parliament building. We were allowed to take photographs everywhere in the building except in the immediate area under the dome where the sacred crown of Hungary resides, guarded by two soldiers. I highly recommend this tour for anyone in Budapest.

Parliament. arranged tickets at our hotel which saved queuing and on arrival waited for an English speaking guide .we were issued ear phones and proceeded on our walk through parliament.The architecture and decorations were truly phenomenal and the whole journey absolutely fabulous.Also visited the museum in the parliament grounds commemorating the 1956 uprising.A truly enjoyable experience.
Beautiful and full of History. Visited for a reception dinner part of an Architecture conference. I got a shortened version of it's History but it was amazing to be there!

Gorgeous. Easily one of the most beautiful buildings I've come across while travelling. We didn't go inside, but did walk all the way around and enjoyed the view from every possible side (even across the river a few times and from a boat on the Danube). Gorgeous!

Amazing inside and out. We viewed the outside of the Parliament for several days before taking a tour. It is absolutely a beautiful building inside and out and well worth the tour. Such a great place to take pictures. We also viewed it from a boat on the Danube and across the river in Budda. It is definitely at the top of the tourist list!

Beautiful inside and out. We pre booked a guided tour (its cheaper for EU members & we were told to bring our passport to prove it but it wasn't checked) and the tour guide was very good. She spoke good English and was very knowledgeable. The building is very beautiful inside with lots of gold and beautifully & intricately painted walls and ceilings. You are allowed to take photos in all but one room which is where the ancient crown is kept under armed guard.
Majestic. You can not have enough of its views, the parliament is an imposing building that worths a visit. Looks also great from Buda.

Underwhelming. I was a bit underwhelmed by the actual tour and for the cost. The building is beautiful and I enjoyed seeing it. Would have liked to have seen the House of Lords!! It is worth a visit, but you don’t really see too much. I’d say if you skip it, that’s OK, if you really want to see it, that’s OK, too-----would not make a special point of it---if you have time, it’s OK. I know that’s not as informative as some of my reviews, but it’s just an average site!
Oh my god. Amazing building you must visit. Outside and inside is so beautiful. At the night is very beautiful with the lights.

First time in 7 years, it was beautiful. . I studied in Hungary (not in Budapest) but it was first time to visit. Booked tickets online to skip the queue and it was very smooth to get in. (you need to print out the ticket tho so ask at your hotel). Adults 5200ft, students of non EU citizen 2600ft. Sometimes they sell out if you go to the Parliament to get the tickets so I really recommend you to book it in advance. Unfortunately it'll cost some extra (e-ticket fee and PayPal fee if you choose to pay via that option) but it was only 1000 ft (like $3-4) so I didn't care. Inside was very beautiful and even tho I felt the ticket was a bit pricy the guided tour made it up for it. 45 mins guided tour was very informative and you can take pictures everywhere except the dome (she'll tell you). Walk from chain bridge or use metro. St istvan basilica is also nearby.

Beautiful Architecture. We stayed barely 5 mins walking for the Parliament building and the whole area is beautiful. It is more of a residential and commercial area rather than the touristy one near the river.The Parliament building in itself is a wonderful piece of architecture and looks marvellous both during the day and in the night with spot lights shining on it.I recommend taking a night cruise to catch a beautiful view of the building

Stunning. I have seen many magnificent buildings around the world but this one would have to be just about the best of them all. It's architecture is simply stunning. It is a beautifully clean building surrounded by a public square and some beautiful gardens on one side.We got there in time for the changing of the guard which was a small simple ceremony involving just 5 soldiers. This happens every hour on the hour.The night before on a river cruise we were fortunate enough to see the building lit up in all its glory and is a sight to behold. Words to describe it are hard to find.With so much security around and being a Sunday we did not get to go inside the building and are not sure if you are able to at all anyway.It is an absolute must on anyone's travels list

simply beautiful. Stunning building well worth the visit, we must have taken hundreds of pictures from many different angles and view points but none do this magnificent building credit. You can visit the library if you can find out how to go on line and book a pass, pity we didn't know about this as think it would have been really impressive.

One of the most beautiful buildings around. My family and I took the tour and I felt it was very worthwhile. Go to see the Hungarian Crown Jewels if nothing else. The crown us nearly 1,000 years old and that alone is worth the trip. Tours are offered in multiple languages most days. Go early to get the time that works for you. Tickets for a specific time are required.
Parlamento. There is nice,but I thought it would be bigger.The side for tourists is not really big.It is so beautiful,the parlamento is one of the most interesting thing in Budapest.

Most stunning building in Budapest. A stunning building both up close and from afar. We didn't have chance to do the tour, but would highly recommend anyone visiting Budapest to take a trip up to the Parliament building and marvel at this building. The area surrounding is really nice too, a great place to sit for a while and watch the world go by.

Beautiful but a very short tour. This is one of the most beautiful building I have ever had the pleasure of looking around. The tour is cheaper if you can prove you are from the EU, I presented my drivers licence which was accepted. The beauty of this building defies words, however you only get to see a handful of rooms as this is a working building. Definitely worth a visit.
Stunning. The Parliament building is a beautiful, very impressive building. Right on the Danube river. It's a must see when in Budapest. For the best view take a canal cruise.

A must see. Totally stunning building that dominates Pest. A real photo opportunity from Buda Hill / Fishermans Bastion and up close in Parliament Square either by day or night. The building is immaculate and amazing to see up close.Parliament Square has lots of seating areas where you can watch the world go by and watch the guards on ceremonial duty, despite the summer temperatures. The changing of the guards is completed regularly.
Very Impressive, free tour for EU citizens. Best views from River Cruise, great tours available with information on the history. Definitely a must see!

Amazing building - book onlinr. Book ahead as you can only see the building through a guided tour which get sold out quickly. Also see the building in the night from outside as it is quite amazing. If you make online booking but don't have it printed, the ticket counters can print it for you. In the building, the best part is the Crown Jewels where they don't let you take pics

What a magnificent structure !!!. We took a 45 minutes tour of Parliament building were quite pleasantly surprised by the architecture, planning, up keep of the building and whole detailing of the place. It looks very magnificent in the night with well planned illumination of the building. A must see place on your visit to Budapest.
Must see from Budapest. Recently Hungary renovated the surrounding so it looks really nice and great place to take photos! I didn't make it to inside but worth visiting.

Really Impressive. This has to be a must see for anyone visiting Budapest for the first time. Book the tour in advance over the web to get the best time slot for your language. The tour takes about 45 minutes and is very informative. I was impressed by the interior of the iconic building.Cost for EU citizens is 2200 HUF in advance.

Beautiful . What a building, a must see when visiting Budapest and if you hang about for long enough at the square you'll even see the changing of guards. For a different experience go and see the parliament at night, you'll be blown away.
Beautiful building . Do not miss the chance to visit the Parliament. The outside views are wonderful whether day or night and the interiors are a must see also!

Great building? Very scenic and impressive.. Did not go inside. Very impressive building, changing of the guard was nice to watch. Great building for photos, etc. very many views to be had from all points of the city.

Beautiful building, short tour. This is the building in Budapest that attracts me the most, it's really gorgeous. In our last trip in Budapest, we also wanted to visited on the inside. We booked a tour online and printed out our tickets. The beginning of the tour was a mess, everything seemed very unorganized, it was difficult to find the English speaking group, but in the end we did it. The building is very beautiful on the inside as well, so it was worthed, but the tour was quite short, I wish we could have seen a bit more. I think it's great to visit once.
Parliament at Night. Parliament is a lovely place to just hang out after a full dinner and admire all of the lights. The views from across the Danube and from a river boat are prime.

Beautiful scene of Hungarian capital. The impressive building is alwats something to visit from the outside when traveling to Budapest. The architecture, its hight are imposing and also impressive. We walked on the riverside of Danube and had a close look at it from the main door, it's a perfect way to discover the details.

Great gothic style. We were able to book the 8:15 English tour and felt we were able to enjoy the grander of the entire building from the gold leaf trim, numbered cigar holder, statues depicting the Hungarian people to the stairways and stain glass. The quiet boxes made it easy to hear our wonderful guide. Very nice gift shop, free bathrooms and coffee shop at the end.

Most attractive but the tour is costly. It's a marvellous structure and if you are in Budapest you will not miss it. It is even more beautiful at night with all the lights on. However the tour at HFT5400 is quite costly for a 30 minute tour. It is more cost effective for a person from Euro zone who pay only 2200 than a non European person

Nice walk. If you walk along the Danube river you will reach the Parliament building. It is a great building with amazing facade and the whole area is beautiful. You can also take a tour to check it inside and see the treasury (there is a ticket fare)From there you can continue walking to the main church which is 10 minutes away.

Informative Tour. The tour was quite short, yet informative. I attended the tour with my sister and we found it to be a quite history packed 30 or so minutes, however I don't think this would be that amusing for children 10 and under.
Photographing the house in the evening. You´d better visit there in the evening. You can get nice photos. We also were jogging around the house. There are nice statues.

Beautiful building. We took an English tour. 45 minutes long with group of about 25 -30 people. Our guide had mike and we had earpieces so we could hear. Her english was great but she talked really quickly. Must make reservations ahead of time. They move alot of people through this building. Exit through gift shop (of course), but this one actually has some really nice and useful things that have motifs from the building. For example, I purchased an umbrella that looked like a stained glass window, and a friend got a glasses case that looked like the carpeting.

Tour is short in informative.. Room the tour with my 10 year old daughter and it was not too long and included interesting history. Do not get there late. Give yourself an extra 10 minutes to find the right entrance.

Breathtaking edifice rich in history. This was my favorite site in all of Hungary. We visited 5 cities and I cannot put into words how beautiful this building is! It is the 3rd largest parliament in the world. Hungary lost 2/3 of its empire and this building is a reminder of how great this nation once was. There is hope of regaining that vision as the Hungarian people remember they come from greatness. The tour was worth the cost!

It's impressive and well kept... The Parliament House, I think it's the biggest one in Europe.. I might be wrong. I liked the view from the castle in Buda looking down at the parliament and then came closer and walked around the mammoth of a building.. Well worth the visit..

March through Parliament Building. I wish the tour through the splendid Parliament building was at a little more leisurely pace. When stopping to admire a carving or anything that caught the eye for closer examination we were uncerimoniously moved on by the guards who had a very austere manner. Felt like an express march rather than a tour. Take photos quickly or you will be ordered to move on.

Impressive . The outside facade and surrounding plaza are impressive
The interior even more so. This is well worth the cost of the tour. The English guide was very informative.
You are able to see the grand staircase, Crown Jewels, parliament chamber as well as a variety of paintings and sculptures
Tour takes about an hour
Definitely recommend

Best sightseein of the city. It's the simbol of Budapest and who ever comes in this city can't miss to see it.
It's amazing and huge. Maybe the best sightseein of the hungarian capitol.
Very worth to see, especially if you take a look to it from Buda after crossing the iconic Chain Bridge!

Wow what a building. I do believe you could stand and stare at this building for hours. Beautiful is an understatement, it is sited very near the Danube, and you can walk around it to totally admire. One of those buildings you will remember forever
Marvelous place. Fantastic place for visitors. Tremendous Building and architecture. U can take the tour inside the building too. Enjoy

Magnificent building. It feels pointless reviewing as we didn't go inside and take a tour, and if you've visting Budapest to see the architecture and sight-see, this will definitely be on the list anyway.Regardless though, it really is quite a magnificent looking building, definitely recommended to visit in the evening as well when it's completely illuminated, or try and catch a river boat that cruises past, we tried twice unsuccesfully as the boat turned around just before the building!
Incredible and beautifully kept. Gotta take a wander round here...needs to be seen - a must do for any Budapest grockler. Right by the river and easily reached
Parade. Some Sunday mornings a changing of the guard parade can be seen. Get there at the right time and it is well worth seeing.

Enjoy it from a distance. A building such as this can only be appreciated as a whole from a distance, which is why I recommend waiting for the evening and experiencing this architectural piece from across the Danube.

One of the most beautiful buildings ever!. I've been around Europe. And I would say that this is one of the most impressive buildings I've ever seen. It's massive and yet so elegant and ornately done. Worth visiting Budapest to see this and The Castle Hill.

Can't miss it . Parliament is impossible to missed it if you're miles away, can see building ... it's amazing white architecture, lots of windows ... more grander than London (brown) parliament lol ... I did not go inside though, I just admired it by outside ... metro is nearby ...
Made of Gold at Night!. This building is an incredible sight at night if you see it from the river Danube...I recommend this Highly!
Parliament Visit. Very interesting informative tour the guide gave us a great overview of the workings of the parliament highly recommended.

Fascinating architecture. The Hungarian Parliament is one of Europe`s largest government Buildings; built already in 1896 i represents the perhaps the most expensive building ever constructed in Budapest; decorated with about 40 kilograms of pure gold leaves, paitings, statues, and other fine artwrorks the central dome houses the crown of erly King Stephen.Located on the eastern Banks of Danube river the parliament faces the opposite castele hill and Saint Stepehns Church.

Gorgeous. When you get there, you can see why it is rated so well. Amazing to view from outside and inside. Also if you're across the over side of the river, you can see it lighting up the sky in the evening. I couldn't take my eyes off of it. You get a discount if you're from Europe. Worth going in.

Excellent English tour. This was an excellent, 45-minute long tour of the Parliament building. It was informative and the interiors were gorgeous. They allow photography most places in here. Worth a stop but get tickets in advance because the tours do sell out many days.

Beautiful at Sunrise. Although we never made it inside the Parliament building, the sight of the building alone is worth the visit. We woke up very early to see the sunrise by the Parliament building. We took the metro to Batthyany Ter and watched a beautiful sunset. We then walked about 15 minutes to the Chain Bridge where we saw the sunset through a different vantage point. We even saw a devoted couple taking engagement pictures too. Worth waking up early!

it is a wonderfull building to visit. the building is amazing.still in very good condition and shinning. I love their big discussion room, and the place for cigarette keeping (it was allowed to bring cigarette to the discussion room )

Book Reservations Ahead for English. We are very glad we went on the tour. It's not super long and there are LOTS of people who tour this building. It's well worth it, but you really need to book ahead of time for English tours. Don't neglect that.
Beautiful building. It was great seeing the Parliament building again after 30 years. Beautiful building and a wonderful sight to see.

Spectacular "must see" when you visit Budapest. I was getting a bit tired of churches and museums by our last day in this part of the world. You see this magnificent building on every Viking commercial on TV, so thought we'd take a chance to find an English-speaking tour before we had to leave for the airportGot lucky and found a tour. Truly magnificent building, from the Golden Staircase to the large rotunda with the historical crown that all Hungarian kings wear when they are coronated. Even timed it to see the changing of the guards who guard the crown So glad we got to see it all

Beautiful. So beautiful! We only walked round the outside but so lovely to look at and plenty of cafes and street art nearby to admire. We got the streetcar no2 which was easy and took us straight there.

What a beauty --day or night Saw it by boat metro ride. Just got off the bus the night before and then went into the Central Market to find some fruit from the vendors. Crossed the street after we bought our all day metro ticket and got a boat metro. It was such a great time understanding where and what we wanted to see from the river. The parliament was so amazing and the boat stops right in front so you can get amazing pics. I have a fish eye lens that I put on my iPhone and the pic was great. Tried to go at night but the last ride is at 8 so if you are there in the fall you might be able to get a night pic but it was summer so we had to come back at 9. ENJOY it is a wonderful city and so reasonable.

Beautiful, inside and out!. We did the tour in English and it was well worth it. The Parliament building is huge and you only get to see parts of it but it is gorgeous! One of those places where the pictures don't do it justice. The tour guide did a great job of explaining the different rooms and art/architecture throughout the building. We booked in advance, which I would advise, as our friends did not and could not get tickets. The tour is about 50-60 minutes and there is a little museum at the end.

Breathtaking look at history in the making. The beauty of this building must be seen to be believed, from the main staircase to the holy Royal crown, the walls with 14 carat gold inlays and the statues of former leaders. Be sure to join a tour group, as the guides have a remarkable knowledge, and groups run according to your language preference.
The biggest parliament in the world. The most spectacular scenery in Budapest. Can you travel to Budapest and not admire this parliament?
Best photo opportunity. Its one of the best riverside attractions!! A must see in BudapestAddress: Budapest, Kossuth Lajos tér 1-3, 1055 Hungary

Interesting and informative . My advice is to book before you go, or at least early in your trip as it isn't always open and gets booked up really quickly. We ended up with a very early morning! It was worth it though. The guided tour was very good and the inside is beautiful. There were some quirky aspects too like the numbered cigar rests outside the chamber. It was a shame that we couldn't photograph the Crown Jewels, but there is a replica in St Mathias church so photo those instead! The gift shop is good too.
Spectacular example of neo-gothic exuberance from the turn of the century. Being the biggest building in Hungary, the House of Parliament is at least as showy as it's counterpart in London.

Parliament. An amazing building .... You are able to go inside but you need to book, so you will probably be asked to return the following day. if you can prove your EU citizenship then entrance is normally free. Would also recommend the river cruise to get a beautiful view of it
Beautiful building, well preserved. Stunning architecture and magnificent building. Great views from buda hill, from the Danube cruise and also from the Charles bridge.

Very impressive. It's a very imponent monument, and I think no one should miss the oportunity to visit it inside. But if you plan to do so, you must book in advance and buy the guided tour, that's totally worth it.

Stunning . Really nice place to walk around and enjoy the view of the Fisherman's Bastion or just to admire the architecture :)
Don't forget to visit this place during the night
💕
Hungarian Parliament Building. Definitely worth a visit, the tour is interesting and not too long. Lots of visitors but well organised into times slots. Recommended to visit this stunning building.
must visit. symbol of Budapest, amazing, iconic place, really worth a visit especially during sunset/ sunrise. Take your camera!

Incredibly large. A visit to this huge building is well worth it . Because there are quite a lot of interest you better reserve a place via the internet.
But who does not get inside : even the exterior is nothing short of magnificent.
Except the ( former ) royal crown it is allowed to take photographs inside.
Amazing architecture.. If you travel to budapest this place is a must see ,the building is amazing and soo much history,must see .
Absolutely awesome structure. The structure is awesome even though the materials used are easily damaged. It is a definite must see for every visitor.

Important to book in advance. Enjoyed our English-guided tour of Parliament. The building is gorgeous and our tour guide was quite good. I assumed I could book the tour while in Budapest but I was wrong. Fortunately, our concierge was able to pull some strings to get us in but I wouldn't count on being so lucky again.
Impressive. Breathtaking. Imponent monument. From Buda you Will discover this impressive building which reflects its glory in the Danube river.
Must visit. This is one of the places in budapest that no one should miss and visit. As well as it impressive outside it is more impressive inside

Definitely worth a tour. We went on a 40 minute English tour of the inside of the building. Stunning inside and our tour guide gave us lots of interesting facts. The tour was very cheap with a discount for EU citizens (about £5 each) and young people (£3 each). Would definitely recommend going inside.

Architecturally stunning. Huge building. Didn't want to stand in line to tour the inside, but the grounds and surrounding areas are really nice. I don't think anyone who visits Buda or Pest would want to miss this landmark.
Book in advance to ensure language of your choice.. Beautiful building, interesting history, we went based on the reviews on here, glad we did, well organised. We booked an English tour in advance.

A Lovely building set in an open square and on the banks of the Danube.. Good to walk past, with a very nice nearby coffee shop and lovely planting adding to the pleasure. We caught the ritual of taking down the flag which added a bit of balletic drama.
Nice experience . Nice experience... Hot swimming pool in cold weather... its a great experience... took my 5 year old son... He was the only young kid there...more ppl enjoying beer n hot bath

The Parliament Building is an incredible work of art!. We took a tour through the amazing Parliament building and we also got to enjoy the outside part of the building on boat tour. Seeing the guards guard the Crown Jewels was serious business but also quite interesting. The Parliament Chamber where their government does business has some very beautiful woodwork! It was also interesting to see where they use to place their cigars outside of the chamber rooms. The night view of the Parliament Building is also very gorgeous!

Beautiful architecture inside and out.. Be sure to plan ahead and go on a tour of the inside. We purchased our tickets in advance online and everything worked out great. The tour was very interesting and worth every minute. The exterior of the Parliament building is beautiful as we walked around the circumference if the building. It is even more beautiful at night when viewing it from the Buda side of the river when it is all lit up.
Beautiful building, tour too simple though. Beautiful and impressive building, both from inside and out. Tour was a bit simple for the relatively high price of the ticket

Proud palace of democracy. Modelled on the UK parliament, the tour an insight into the mind of the Hungarians and the time it was uilt and since. Book in advance if you want the language of your choice!

Very poor and boring tour..... The parliament is the 3 largest in the world and the building is pretty amazing, however the tour itself was very dull and boring just like the weather we had on that day.As there are loads of tour conducted on the day and hence protocol has to be maintained and also considering it is the Parliament building security is also very strict, but having said that overall tour was not exciting, the guide was very autonomous and it only lasted 40 minutes.Definitely money could be spent somewhere else may be a TOKAJI wine.....

Nice up close. Amazing from a distance!. The best view of parliament is from citadel. The view of the building is incredible, and I may be wrong, but I think the architecture was inspired by the palace of Westminster.

Pure extravagence !. You have to take a tour to get in to see, but they are clearly shown on a board with times and number of places available - don't forget to show you passport or ID card - as an EU citizen entrance is then cheaper. The security bottle necks things a bit, and they don't really allow you to check in your bag / coat, but you are allowed to take pictures, just obviouisly not where the crown jewels are. The guide was very informative and understandable, the place is full of finery with wood carvings, inlays, chandeliers, wallpaper, fine upholsetery etc. . After the tour there is a museum explaining some aspects in more detail and a video showing the rooms you were not allowed to enter. The building itself is best viewed from the Margaret Bridge or the Fisherman's Bastillion, at night it looks really grand.
Do Not Miss This!. By far one of the most beautiful buildings you will ever see. Be sure to stand on the Chain Bridge to watch it and the city light up at night.

Short parliament tour. Ok afternoon tour but quite short. English speaking tour of parliament and all the trappings but takes ages for the whole group to get through security. You use headsets so can all hear the guide even in a large group. Good all round view of the building and history. If you haven't booked in advance online you can book on the day as they release tickets daily in different language groups.

Beautiful and impressive. Ran by in the morning. Ran by at night. And glazed upon it from the hills.... beautiful building. Especially at night where they take special pains in lighting it up. Must visit sight for Budapest
Amazing. Beautiful, charming, evocative and a must seek when visiting Budapest. Strangely redolent of the Palace of Westminster in the UK, but with so much more to see inside.
Spectacular. Beautiful building, tour was worth the wait. Disappointed not to be able to take pictures in the main rotunda. Not to be missed.

The Glory of the Austrian-Hungarian Empire. Probably the most impressive building on Budapest's Danube, Parliament is a testament to the former European power. Tours in English are only twice a day, so you might want to make reservations. We missed out on the first day we tried to see it.
Spectacular inside and out. The building is beautiful in the day time and looks spectacular at night. The tour was awesome it is so beautiful inside.

One of the most beautiful architecture in the world. The parliament is an imposing and amazing place in Budapest. Rich in details that make you spend hours admiring so beautiful architecture. The best view of Parliament is in Buda, especially in the Fisherman's Bastion. The night view is indescribable. For photography lovers, a tripod is recommended. Book a good time to enjoy the beauty of this place.

Perhaps the most amazing building I have seen to date!. The intricate architecture and sheer size of the building in mind blowing. It looks like it has recently been cleaned so is pristine. There are not enough words to describe how amazing it really is from all angles.

Beautiful Building, Inside and Outside. Parliament Buildings are beautiful and majestic to view from any angle. We had booked a tour in advance (an essential step) and it was a 45 minute tour with guide using radio and earpieces, Most of building was covered and history of Hungarian Government explained as well as different areas of building.
A must visit if in Budapest.
What a building!. Fabulous building, especially viewed in the afternoon light from the Buda side. All round, this is a very impressive building. A must visit!

Fantastic tour well worth going. Well worth a visit. Very informative and the guide was easy to listen to. Reasonably priced and it was good to be able to take photos in most of the parliament building except where the Crown Jewels were kept

Stunning and worth getting up early for. We booked online as tickets seem to sell out quickly. We were glad we did as they had sold out for the day by the time we arrived at 08.45. Glad we are still EU citizens as it gave us a good reduction. We went around as a group,of about 20 with a fluent guide and a security guard. Excellent commentary and easy to hear with provided hearing microphone device. Questions were encouraged and there was no feeling of being rushed. There were lifts for people with mobility problems. Amazing interiors, so much gold and marble. Tour took about an hour and a half in total.
Overwhelmingly beautiful building. The grandness of this building is not to be missed, a walk around during the day is impressive. Catch a yellow tram to make it a little more fun.

Amazing architecture . We personally thought this was one of the most beautiful building in Budapest. Its very distinct. We didn't take the tour but we did visit the Parliament from tram 2. The Parliament looks beautiful from the buda side up the hill especially.

Beautiful building and views across the river. Such a beautiful building with amazing views along the river. We didn't do a tour inside the building but it's definitely still worth a visit if you are thinking of going into the centre of the city as there are little shops and cafe's and you can walk along the river too.
Average . Its a parilament building on the Danube. Nice architecture. That being said they are all veriations on a theme.

It is even more beautiful inside. Donot leave it too late to visit as it gets crowded. The guides are good and they give you audio guides too to help as it is sometimes difficult to hear when there are so many people about

Huge. Place is put of this world. Grand. You have to check it out.
Imagine it costs a few pennies to upkeep.

Absolutely stunning. The size of this place is what Struck me first,it's enormous. I've been waiting for years to see this building in the flesh,it didn't disappoint. It's quite possibly one of my dreams that have now come true.It's quite possibly the best looking building I've ever seen to date.A credit to Hungary and the Hungarian people.

Majestic Building . The Parliament Building is picturesque and when it is illuminated at night it looks very majestic. You can get a nice view from above across the river from the Fisherman's Bastion. The tour explained the very interesting history of the palace and also had a museum that explained the construction. They allow photography in all rooms except the Dome Hall (where the Crown is kept) no videos/photos are allowed. Tip: Make sure to book the tickets in advance (especially for English tours) because there are limited tickets and do sell out fast.
Beautiful. Good place to see 360 view of Budapest. Walk past the first restaurant after the castle and go to self service. Good value for money

Beautiful Inside and Out . This building is truly stunning and a must see on your trip to Budapest. Be sure to go in and book a tour as there are more tours available than shown online. It is certainly one of the world's most grand parliament buildings.
Very Pretty. Didn't actually go in but the building is beautiful. Especially lit up at night. Worth a walk past at least.

The most beautiful building I have ever seen. It has 365 towers and over 20 km of stairs - that's what we heard during the night cruise on Danube. Hungarian parliament is very impressive during the day, but only wait to see it at night. It's breathtaking! An absolute must-see in Budapest!
Absolutely beautiful. Didnt have a chance to get inside this building and take a tour but viewed it during the day and at night and it is spectacular, must see especially the great architecture

Interesting, however tour rushed through,and security bit rude. Enjoyed our brief visit to Parliament. Did the english speaking tour, which was great, good historic detail from the guide. Audio, via headsets, can be patchy if the guide gets too far ahead of you (so stay close). Security pre -tour was very quite rude to other visitors. Tours operate on a timetable, and I saw a security person get handed a ticket from some visitors, she looked at them handed the tickets back and waived the people out of the queue. They stood there , oblivious to what the issue was, and then she shouted at them to get out of the queue and pointed to the time on the tickets (apparently they were booked for another time). Not great to witness paying visitor's being treated in such a way.

Amazing Parliament in Prague. Our tour was not going inside parliament, but our tour director recommended we consider going in our spare time. It is necessary to get reservations ahead of time which we did through the concierge at our hotel. Incredible place! but be aware that there are LOTS of steps. There are places where your guide can have you take an elevator and I would recommend that if you have any mobility impairment.
Parliament . Beautiful building and amazing architecture. Great location down by Danube. Beautiful in the sunshine of an afternoon

Very beautiful. The parliment is very beautiful, inside and outside. You should reserve from the website the tour otherwise you risk to arrive there and have to come back because all sessions are already sold. It is a must in Budapest
Impressive . This building is very impressive, definitely worth checking out. Take a cruise down the Danube and see it from the water!

Not Sure It Was Worth The Price. The Visitor's Center, Gift Shop and Cafe proved more interesting to me. After paying nearly $20US per ticket, I expected much more than a quick spin through the halls. This tour was dull and boring. At the very end of the tour you are ushered into a room with interactive exhibits that tell you much more than what was given by the guide. Regret spending the money.
very interesting. One of the most impressive Parliament buildings.recommended. can be visited with guided tours.free for Hungarians

Such a sight to see. These are by far the most beautiful parliment buildings I have ever seen. Set right across from the Danube their palatial spires and steps stretch for blocks. We didn't pay to go inside but apparently it is well worth it. Book in advance though, as this is a very popular attraction.

Definitely make an effort to do a tour. The 90 minute internal tour of the parliament is a must do whilst. In Budapest. Get there early to ensure a ticket for the day, or pre purchase ahead of time online.

A beautiful building outside average within. entry to the building which are timed visits there are stairs that take about 20 minutes to ascend, having boldly rejected an offer to take the lift I regretted it!! Most areas you can take photos but not in the treasure room where King Stevens gold crown is guarded by 2 guards armed with swords at the ready they stand stock still for about 15 minutes then they change sides with a series of very co-ordinated movements. They are changed hourly. The cabinet they are guarding contains a very modest looking gold crown and a sceptre. their value is in their antiquity rather than their basic metal value. From the treasure room we pass into the Parliament chamber which is quite modern rather like the scottish parliament lay out. The building in general is modesdtly lavishly decorated. much like many grand buildings. Going out I took the lift! very sensible. This building is worth a visit but not overly exciting.
Must!. Something you should see for sure! And is even better during the sunset from the oposite bank of Duna

Amazing. Beautifully restored, easy to get to, magnificent river location. The no 2 trolley along the river goes around Parliament House making access easy and for those short on time. Beautiful day and night, a must for any visit to Budapest.

Good to see wheels of power. The officials now conduct the tour. Somewhat regimented as a result. Make sure you walk around outside yourself for great photo shots. Crown and jewels were impressive but don't try to photograph these.its prohibited.

Beautiful Location. There are tours that you can take of a certain section of the parliament - but we did not for the lack of time. The overall location with the peace and scenary of the Danube across the road are very good. There is a tram service running from there to the other connecting places, which we took.

The Biggest, Tallest (and Most Beautiful) Building in Budapest. Of all the amazing architecture in Budapest, I found myself drawn to the Hungarian Parliament Building. Sadly, all of the English tours were sold out on the one day I had available to visit it inside, so I recommend planning ahead if you want to see inside!

Beautiful exterior and interior but pricey for what you get. The Parliament tour was organized with too large a group herded through the interior. You do get interesting historical tidbits, but we took a late afternoon tour and were rudely escorted out of the museum that was entered afterwards because the building was closing promptly at 7! For the price we paid, we should have been given ample time to see it. My advice: best parts can be seen from the river or by walking around!

Parliament . Do visit this place , has this amazing flavour of the Westminster , it's esp gorgeous at nighttime with the lighting , preferably from a river cruise where you can enjoy it's magnificent vista

One of the most beautiful building in the world!. The Hungarian Parliament is one of the most beautiful building in the world. From any point of the city you can see it, it is impressive, excellent architectual work with amazing location "on the Danube". It doesn't matter if during the day or with changing coloured lights in the evening you have a look on it, just enjoy it!
Cool building. We passed this on a walk along the Danube, its a pretty building, and there are some other cool things to see along the way

A must see. Based on the Palace of Westminster a striking building on the shores of the Danube. Lots of open spaces around the building and opportunity to take a trip through - very reasonable cost with English speaking guides. Make sure you see the 'changing of the guard', outfits are quite spectacular and the whole event, although 'formal' is enjoyed hugely by both spectators and the guards themselves.Other government buildings surround the square, all different but all spectacular. They were building new statues on my visit, all huge and should be very impressive. The whole site overlooks the Danube and can be seen clearly from the Chain Bridge or, my choice, from a boat on the river. At night, everything is illuminated on both sides of the river, perhaps even more impressive.
Iconic building. The Parliament building is one of Europe's most famous, and should not be missed. It is even more amazing in person.

Outstanding from outside.. I unfortunately did not have enough time to see it from inside, but from outside it is outstanding. I even saw if in the sunset from the other bank and it was really beautiful. For me the highlight of BudaPEST.
standard. standard palace which one see's in europe. good place to stroll around . use the funicular to go . one can see the change of guard @ 12 .

Parliment by Land and by Ship. We arrived in Budapest on the Scenic Amber on the Danube. We docked directly across from Parliment during the day. This is a very impressive building! We went to Parliment and did the English Speakers tour that they provide. The outside is spectacular and so is the inside. Lots of gold gilt, carved figures and artwork adorned the walls. The Crown Jewels/Crown were on display so this was special. The tour went quickly so you had to pay attention or you would miss things. At the end, we wound up in a exhibition about the building of Parliment. This was very interesting to me. That evening, after dinner, our ship sailed the Danube... All the buildings were lit and Parliment was the most beautiful building... We took plenty of pictures. This was truly one of the best vistas of the whole trip! Fairy tale!
Magical. The Parliament....breath taking, magical! The biggest Parliament ever seen, with a big square. The night view cannot be described

Brilliant tour of Parliament. We pre-booked at our at the Parliament and it was very impressive. Supposedly based on the British Parliament, the Budapest parliament has retained its grandeur whilst ours looks very shabby and is being left to fall into disrepair.The tour guide was informative and interesting and had a very clear English speaking voice. Inexpensive and beautiful, I recommend it for all that love History.
Beautiful Exterior. Beautiful building but obviously being a government building not much else to do here than look at the exterior, but the exterior is amazing.

not only free..but good too.. It is one of those places in Budapest that says, well it is there so I should visit it. You could go inside the building but it was impressive walking round, with the nice little park and a couple of underground museums. also there was a changing of the parliament guard, that was very interesting. The no.2 tram runs round it too and along the waterfront. While your at the buildings, looking towards the river and to the left, on the waterfront, go and visit the shoes and boots. We found that moving.

Interesting tour. This was a fantastic tour. The guide was very informative and fluent in English. The building itself was very opulent with rich history. I would highly recommend you check the time before going to avoid waiting around. Student prices are also available with a valid student card.

Impressive building. The Hungarian Parliament is huge and impressive. There are beautiful gardens and benches around it where anyone can seat and enjoy the view. You can go there by tram, taxi or on foot. We did the parliament tour but I was a little disappointed because it only lasted for 45 minutes. Depending on the size of the building, I found it very short. There is a small market inside where people can buy souvenirs but they are a little pricey.

Very interesting place to see. Amazing how many parliamentarians smoked cigars. They have trays outside of the meeting for the cigars- many trays. The history associated with the parliament is interesting as are the crown jewels. Good guides.

Majestic. The third largest parliament building in the world is really exquisite and a design wonder. The halls and corridors are laid out perfectly. The royal crown and scepter is one of the main attractions in the building. Never leave Budapest without visiting the Hungarian parliament.

Stunning building, though tour is on the short side. The building is absolutely magnificent, both on the inside and out. You can only visit with a guide who'll sort of rush it through which is a pity. Nonetheless, in about 45 min. you've "seen" the interior and will have received some basic info which I believe doesn't go beyond textbook knowledge. Then again, it's a must see!
beautiful architecture. it's a great really, if you visit Hungary you should see it for sure. but i'ts better to look from another bank of river, it's really big.

Good guide and beautiful building . This building is quite amazing - grand and beautiful in all aspects. In addition, the guide did a great job in presenting in an informative and humorous manner.
This is a must see when visiting Budapest. Remember to book in advance - especially if you want an English tour.
Great architecture . With the sun shining on the Parliament building, the building is presented with clean stonework, and can be view close to, or from across the River Danube.

Beautiful Building although relatively modern. Like much of Budapest the building is much newer than its appearance .We didn't go in but heard all about the interior whilst on 'hop on hop off bus and in guide book. The area around the building(it faces the Danube) is spacious and well designed formed largely by the Kossuth Square which has witnessed many events in Hungarian History good and bad -I will leave you to research in more detail but try to visit the simple underground memorial exhibition which recalls the October 25th 1956 awful events
Well worth a visit. Beautiful building - really enjoyed the tour. We went on to do the city tour after and it was 4.5 hours in total. Would recommend.
Budapest in 5 days. The parliament is one of the most amazing buildings I have seen. Gothic, well preserved, great views.Pictures in day light and night are worth it.

Would recommend! . I would recommend you to book your tickets online at least 1 week in advance if you are going for the english tour as the better timings in the afternoon are sold out pretty fast. It was interesting to visit the parliament and as noted by others, it's a rather short tour (approx 45mins) including the security checks. Do budget for more time to travel to the parliament as the entrance to the visitor centre is at the other end from where we walked over from the city centre.

Well worth a visit. An outstandingly impressive building. Beautifully lit in the evening. Great view from across the river. Entrance for EU is only HUF 2,000 which is about £5. If you are an American citizen it costs HUF 5,200. Tour of the halls and rooms was informative. A great visit.

Overrated and just a lousy experience. When you're the #1 rated attraction in a major city, the bar is set high. And this place fell painfully short for me. For starters, we arrived a couple of hours before the place had closed for the day and were told that there were no English tours left for the day. This was a bit disappointing, but not the end of the world. So we agreed to take the tour in Spanish. We paid the nearly $20 USD (which seemed very high compared to every other attractions in Budapest) and waited. Once the tour began, we asked if we could at least have a guided hearing device that was in English instead of Spanish since we do not speak or understand the language. The answer was "no." During our tour, we crossed paths with 2 other tours that were in English and they were only filled with Japanese tourists. This did not sit well with me because it clearly means that they should add a tour in the Japanese language or not sell out the entire tours in English to an entire group of tourists. Or at a minimum, it means they need to add more tours. They are a humongous building with the #1 Tripadvisor rating for crying outloud! When we got to the Dome part of the tour, the security guard was yelling at people for standing too close to the enclosed crown, but not applying his logic fairly. Everyone was standing at the same distance yet he was yelling at certain people to move back who were at the same distance as everyone else? These people were not doing anything wrong. I also did not understand why we could not take photos in this area but could take photos elsewhere? The tour itself was only 50 minutes and barely covered much of the building. And at the $20 pricetag, it just wasn't worthy of the high rating in my opinion. Spend your money elsewhere. Plenty more beauty to see in Budapest.

Beautiful building on the river. The Parliament building is stunning - we first stumbled across it by accident looking for the Pick store outside the metro station! It's an imposing building with amazing architecture, sitting beautifully on the bank of the river. A must-see when in the city.

Beautiful building. Parliament building in Budapest is very beautiful, specially seen from the river boat in Danube. The first impression is the similarity between British Parliament, Westminster, in London. An architectural wonder.
Interesting, but modern ... Worth visiting; good value for 45 minutes; come 10 minutes earlier to find entrance and your pre-booked group.

Amazing. Really all I can say is WOW . A local told me that Michael Jackson wanted to buy this castle when he visited. I can see why.
A must visit. beautiful at night with all the lights.
Very nice visit!. There isn't much to say go and see the great architecture and enjoy the commentary and interesting history. The people are very helpful

Absolutely splendid. We booked an English tour through the Parliament buildings. The tour group was a bit big so we got left behind taking photos and admiring the splendour and enormity of the inside of the passages, halls and rooms which unfortunately we missed some of the tour guides commentary. We finished the tour at the chambers where the Hungarian parliament sits. Its mind boggling that this beautiful building is still in use today.The enormity and beauty of the front of the building is best captured from across the river. Great photos can be taken as you miss the crowds.Well worth booking a tour

Parliment Tour. Definitely worth it. Did not book in advance, went when it opened in AM and was able to get the 2 of us into the first tour of the morning. There are 130 steps to climb at the start of the tour although there is an elevator available for those who are unable to do the climb.

Beautiful Parliament. Parliament Building when lit up at night looks very majestic and picturesque. You can get a nice view from the other side of the Danube on the Buda side or up in the Fisherman's Bastion. Also try to get a tour in the day time. Very interesting history. It's fun to get a glimpse of the crown in the Dome hall even if you can take any videos/photos there. Make sure to book the tickets ahead (esp an English one) because they only allow certain number of visitors and do sell out fast.

Take the tour. This building looks great from the outside, you can walk beside and around at.But you can also take the guided tour, wich takes you around the building in about an hour. You can see the parlement hall, the crown Jewels (no photos allowed!) etc. They tell you some ins and outs about the builing, wich makes it come more to live!

Must see in Budapest!. Took a morning tour today of the Hungarian Parliament Building, and wow-what a treat. Our guide spoke excellent English and provided lots of historical background. You can only go inside on a guided tour (they sell out often), and you'll truly be oohing and ah-ing the entire time. You ARE allowed pictures in every room except the room with the Crown Jewels. Be aware the entrance is only via the Visitor's Center-and if you only have your ticket in e form (like me), just show up early enough for them to print out your ticket. (You must have a printed ticket to EXIT, so hang on to it.) And don't skip the small museum at the end-it's full of interesting videos on how it was built, how they clean it, ect. I'd allow another 15-20 minutes for that. Also, don't miss the Shoes on the Danube tribute to the Jews shot and thrown in the Danube-slightly past the Parliament Building, on the river, to the South. Seeing this building AND the Opera House really give you an idea of Budapest in its finest times, and that the city is certainly regaining that elegance after a long, utilitarian occupation.

Best place . It is worth it to do the tour inside and see how amazing this building is inside and out! It stands next to Danube river and it is great during daytime as well as night time with all the lights
nice parlament. Very nice arhitecture in deed. It is so huge and beautyful. Next time we should to take a hammer there. Lot of gold in there :D

what a amazing building. Get your tickets early for the tour. It last one hour and the Parliament looks more like a palace on the inside than a government building
Listen carefully to the tour the history of is as interesting as the building itself
Walk the Danube at Night. We were only a block from Parliament so felt very safe. Do try to get reservations for the tour. As it was, a tour of the grounds & surrounding area were very informative.
You should go see it. amazing architecture in a great setting...really stunning at sunset, but nice anytime...wish there were more places around to eat and drink

Breathtakingly Beautiful at night. We were on a Viking River Cruise and Budapest was our first stop. The evening was dry (though chilly) so the ship took us to see the display of the Parliament when lighted at night.
Wow!. The Parliament Building is incredible. We tried multiple ways to get it in one picture....the only way you can is to go across the Danube and take a picture from the Budapest side.
One of the most beautiful buildings. One of the most beautiful buildings i have ever seen. One to fall in love with especially at night. .

Beautiful! . Really nice and beautiful Parliament. We did the one hour tour inside, its worthy! All rooms inside are extremely nice and well taken care. Going with tue tour you get to know the history!

Great start to our break. We booked on line a month ahead for the tour here and pleased we did so for our first day. The building is amazing and the tour memorable - not least for the charming female tour guide who mesmerised us ("dear guests") with her commentary over the wireless audio get up. Definitely worth walking up the golden staircase...just the right length/detail on tour (manageable for our 15 year) and bonus of a Hungarian MP being pointed out en route ! Fab.

visit at night. great view, try a night time visit. look it up on google to learn more about the history, ignore the tourists :-) and make sure your visit ends with drinks at one of the nearby bars or coffee shops, it's a 10 min walk from Moscow ter station
Beautiful building. Saw this on the river cruise, out front of this, down by the river are bronzed shoes in memory of the Jews who were lined up and shot into the river, very emotive seeing them

Fantastic building. One of the reasons we visited Budapest was to see Parliament house and we not disappointed. We saw it by day but really enjoyed the view from a cruise at night, when the building is lit up.

A must see in Budapest. Incredible building tour to see one of the largest Parliament in the world. If you buy a ticket ahead of time make sure you there are on time as you will lose your tour time. Very busy with tour groups. We went right when it open so the crowds were manageable but by the time we left it was crazy

Fun to look at. did not spend the time for a tour but the architecture was impressive from the outside. Beautiful from all sides and great to photograph at night with all the lights. Easy access...located right in the center of everything
Magnificent Structure. Huge beautiful government building located along the Danube. Tours of the interior reveal additional beauty and stunning design.
Wonderful building. This building was simply beautiful visiting at nighttime gives it a whole new perspective. A trip down the Danube allows you to experience the sheer size.
night boat trip. this was a lovely sight while having dinner on a cruise along the river. Very impressive all lit up.
Magnificient. Extraordinary building, very impressive from any corner or point of view. Soldiers of the change of guard were friendly and let people to take pictures with them.

Do not miss; download tickets to mobile device; expect tight security. Excellent tour worth the trouble of arranging tickets. See the 1000 year old royal crown and spectacular building. Recommend pre-buy tour tickets online. You can download/email to your phone and get printed tickets there. Expect tight security (it is THE Parliament Building!) , carry less to get through security faster.

Take the tour.. Yes the external view of the building is a jaw dropping experience expecially from the Buda side of the Danube but the reasonably priced tour is a must. The beauty of the gilded ceilings sculptures and other decoration and the historical context of the paintings crown jewels and structure is clearly explained. Our English speaking guide was exceptional with an informative and witty style. Apart from the crown jewels photos are permitted.
Fantastic building. Walked around outside was beautiful. Lovely gardens quiet and peacefull. It is a working building that is well looked after.

Excellent building, whether viewed from Buda, the River or from within.. Simply a must see building, whether viewed from Fisherman's Bastion in Buda or from the River (day or night). It sits magnificently on the banks of the Danube. Guided tours, in English, are well organised and informative. Whilst the building is based on the Westminster Houses of Parliament, the interior is more beautifully decorated. The Holy Crown is on display and is guarded by 2 soldiers who are changed every hour in a small ceremony.

The most beautiful Parlament. We were not able to book any tour inside because we didn't had time, but the feeting to see this amazing building was unforgettable. It looks like sand castle. The picture can't capture the beauty. Make sure you go the other side of Danube, Metro station: Batthyant tere to see the whole building.

Illuminated Parlament. This building illuminated at night is something you can't miss. You do have to walk around it to see it in its full greatness. And please don't miss the sculpture of a poet sitting on th stairs. And if possible check out the she monument on the other side of the parliament on thrives shore.
Parliament Budapest. This was an amazing experience and I recommend this as a place to visit. The Crown Jewels are held here. We went in spring and the blooms in the square we're amazing
stunning architecture. What a beautiful and stunning this building is. Made even more spectacular at night when all lit up.

Make an online reservation its better. The parliament is so rich and cultural. You can see it from outside but the inside is very interesting. And the only way to enter is through a tour. You hv to reserve the tour preferably online,as the places r limited, and divided depending on the language

Beautiful. There are no words to describe the beauty of this monumental building. From any angle that look at it, it is beautiful. Up to its reflection on the Danube looks like a work of art by the most famous painter.
outside only. Didnt have the time spare to go inside, but stunning building from all angles, including from the river and from the opposite riverside.Well worth a visit

Stunning! . Wow! Firstly, looking out over at this landmark from Fisherman's Bastion on a clear night is an incredible sight in itself. But get up close and you will see the building in its full glory. You can't miss this if you visit.

Beautiful scenery. On my last day in Budapest I walked along the Danube and around the parliamentary buildings. The scenery was gorgeous and is a definite must to go see these buildings. Everything along the Danube is lovely.
Superb. Magnificent building. Wonderful view from Buda. Don´t miss the memorial at the left side of the building, it tells a sad but very interesting story of the place.
Magnificent. The grandeur and splendour of the building. Outside by day and night it is magnificent but wait until you see inside, breathtaking.
Managed to get on the English tour - well worth a visit. There were no places available on the web so we visited and got on the English tour - excellent and informative hour

A Monumental Building. This is the most beautiful Parliament building I have ever seen! It is on the banks of river Danube. It is best viewed from the other side of Danube. Especially from the castle hill.The inside of the building is gorgeously decorated. The old Crown of St. Stephen is displayed here. It is a must see for any one visiting Budapest.
Not worth it . Not enough of the parliament is visible to the public and not worth the entry fee. Only spent 35 mins max being shown around like cattle
Better to view at night . Visited during the day and also went past on a night cruise. If i was to visit just the once I would say night would be better.
Grab your camera!. GORGEOUS building! we didn't go inside but the exterior which is modelled on the London Westminster Palace is seriously impressive. So don't forget your camera- and enjoy the view!
Beautiful . Took a tour of this building in English, this is a stunning building inside and out. Very informative tour, we learned more about the history of Hungary. Thoroughly enjoyed it.
Parliament building . Most beautiful building in budapest. To view this monumental building at sunset from the river is awesome

A stunning surprise. Budapest's Parliament building is a gem. It is remarkable building especially when you take into consideration how scarce was democracy in Hungary's troubled past with 250 years of Turkish and 150 years of Austrian occupation. However it was born in an affluent time of Hungary's past, where an invitation was sent for a public tender to architects for a Parliament building. The proposed plans were so great that the fair jury decided to propose and Budapest's leadership accepted the proposal to build the first three plans on the same square. The winner became the building of the actual Parliament, runner up was the magnificent building currently hosting the Ministry of Agriculture and third came the Ethnographic Museum. The three splendid building makes Kossuth Square a place to be impressed

Stunning Opulence. We visited the Hungarian Parliament Building as part of a Tauck Tour. It is absolutely worth the time. Surprisingly, it dates from the late 19th and early 20th centuries. In the plaza outside, it is an eerie feeling to know that the Hungarian Revolution of 1956 was begun with students marching to that plaza. In the building, the tour timing is rather rigid, but the tours are very well done. The reviewer focusing on the beautiful lighting at night is correct. We did not visit at night, but simply seeing it at night lit up along with the beautifully lit surrounding buildings was nothing short of sensory overload. We recommend it wholeheartedly to visitors. Do not attempt to simply walk up and tour. Make arrangements in advance or you might be disappointed. The 12th century Crown of St. Stephen is displayed there.

Beautiful by day and night!. You can't miss this beautiful building! From a night time river cruise or day time on foot it's a must see sight. Take time to explore other interesting statues, memorials close by too. Dint miss the bronze shies by the rivers edge! Find out the history courtesy of a tour guide, we used a brilliant local guide via segways and found out so much in two hours! Fabulous place to visit!
Lovely architecture. Massive monument standing along the side of river Danube.I can not say enough of the building and the ground!Very impressive !!!
Spectacular building. I took the tour of the parliament building and was quite impressed. Very beautiful. The tour was quite informative.

Magnificent Structure. The easiest way to get there is to reach the Danube river bank and get on the #2 tram which stops right in front. This tour takes about 45 minutes and is well worth it. Strongly suggest that you book your tickets on the internet and pay for them well in advance as the English language tours fill up quickly. This way you can pick the day/time that's fits your schedule. We booked our 2 weeks in advance from USA.Plan to arrive about 45 minutes to an hour ahead. This will give you time to walk around the building, take photos and appreciate the architectural beauty of this building. There is a changing of the guards ceremony every hour in front of the entrance (opposite side of the Danube). Towards the side where the statues are located, look for the entrance to the underground museum (small) that shows the history and reconstruction efforts after the war. This is a free museum. The entrance for the main building tours is at the visitors center which is also located on the same side, far end of the building, and underground. The website says you need to have your passport prior to entry, but that is only if you want to get discounts for EU and local citizens. They did not ask for mine as we had paid the highest price on the web as US citizens. ;-(The tour starts with climbing about 140 steps through the golden stairwells which are decorated with gold leaf. Very ornate and beautiful. The most spectacular part of the tour is under the dome which contains the Crown Jewels or the crown of the first king of Hungary. You cannot take photographs in this room, only. There are several other chambers / rooms with ornate statues and painted ceilings which are also worth seeing.

A Must See landscape in Budapest. Hungarian Parliament house is a landmark in Budapest Capital city.If you get off at Batthany Ter and you can see the House of Parliament opposite the Danube and it a beautiful structure the colours on the roof.It looks like it has been recently cleaned on the stonework. And acrossing on the Danube to Kossuth Lajos Ter you will faces the Parliament up and close by. With massive Square.Well Worth looking.
Worth it . I would highly recommend walking the whole city to see this not only from one side but from multiple places such as across the river like our photo. Spectacular architecture

Amazing architecture! . Located on the Pest side, at the Kossuth Square, and on the edge of Danube river, theParliament is huge, and impress EVERYONE.Built in 1884 with different architectural styles (mostly neo gothic outside), it was inspired on the British Parliament. Has 691 offices (but it’s said that only 10% of its area is used), 268 metros and it’s the third biggest Parliament in the world. Along the external walls, you can see the remembrance of monarchs and military Hungarian commanders shown in 90 statues. Inside, elements of Baroque and Renaissance along with 40 kilograms of gold used on its ornaments. Guided tours of 50 minutes are offered in English and several other languages. Make sure to photograph it and to see the change of guards. I was luck enough to see it on a beautiful blue sky winter day. If you are on the Buda side, photograph it during the night to capture the amazing light that falls upon it.
Stunning Architecture.. Huge parliament building and museum nearby. Interesting and informative. Look out for the water optical illusion feature nearby.
Awe inspiring. The building is massive and the detail that went into it is awesome in the traditional definition of the word.

Pay double if youre not from the EU.. When we aaw that we had to pay double because we were visiti g from a non eu coutry, we skipped the interrior tour. Go have a nice lunch with the money you saved. Guess they forgot that the coutries who stood up for freedom in the east during the cold war? They arent all in the EU.

Very interesting . Really intereating tour. Book tickets ahead of time online. Lots of security which was fine. Wish we could have seen more of the building but did get to see changing of the guard bit not every tour woild see this as it's only 1x per hour.

I have no words with this beautiful. . Jaw Dropping scenery! picture doesn't do justice. I can stare at it all day! We have seen it through the boat tour during the day and night and using the hop on and hop off day and night bus tour. Definitely worth a visit, I recommend seeing it during the day and night. Would have loved to see the inside part of the building but we didn't get a chance

Great visit worth pre booking. Beautiful building. Whilst you can turn up on the day and queue for a ticket, it's the only thing I booked before my trip because there are only a limited number of tours in each language per day. It's stunning inside - I have never seen so much gold! The outside of the building looked particularly beautiful at night
beautiful building. Fantastic looking building sadly we visited on a Saturday so could not go in, but the feedback from others was very good
Beautiful building!. Wonderful architecture! I will not exaggerate telling that this is the symbol of Budapest. Every panoramic shot of the city gets better with this masterpiece

Beautiful both inside and out, don't miss the memorial to the Hungarian Revolution. Last trip we made reservations and toured the inside of the Parliament building. Definitely worth every Forint. This trip, we focused on strolling the building's exterior and surrounding park. Wow, is this a beautiful building! And we just happened upon the underground memorial to the 1956 revolution in front of the building. Hmmm... what is this? Well, stopping in was one of the best surprises of our trip - a small but touching memorial to the crazy days of the October revolution, including first-hand accounts by survivors. Oh, and the external building and memorial are free! Touring isn't though, and make reservations in advance. Good for a rainy day if you're touring the inside, but outside not so much.

The Parlement. I visited this place, it's politicaly interesting but the architecture is really amazing. In Budapest you see very good the conection with Vienna and Praha all thanks to Emperor Franz Joseph and Sissy

Stunning place to visit at night. Budapest is a lovely City to visit with so much to see and do. The views at night time are fantastic, it's also great value for money. And for those looking for a good night life this is your place to visit. Enjoy.
ArchiMagic. The most beautiful parliament in Europe, maybe the most beautiful building in europe. A must see if you are in the city...
Wine tasting tour. Went on a wine tasting boat ride past the Budapest Parliament building & Chain Bridge at night. One of the coolest things ive ever seen. two thumbs up

Sorry, this out does London Parliament by miles!!!!. I was lucky a long time ago to see the transformation of this building from dark, ugly and filthy to one of the most beautiful looking white limestone buildings in Europe. After the bad guys left the city and the local population took control there was a lot of work to be done to clean up all the deferred maintenance and cleaning that lasted decades. Now when I see what has become of this site I even shiver with excitement and applaud the efforts that were put forward to bring this beautiful building back to pristine.

Stunning place. Well worth the visit. Excellent tour of this beautiful building, both inside and out. Remember to take your passport if you're from an EU country as the entrance is significantly lower for EU nationals
Beautiful . The beautiful architecture of the surrounding buildings and plenty to see. Plenty of shops and places to eat.
