Nicely Built. See in the Night from the Danube Cruise.. Amazing view in lights. The Parliament is nicely constructed and we observer the beauty both in day and then later in the night through the Danube Cruise.
Possibly the most spectacular building in the city. Possibly the most spectacular building in the city though best viewed from afar rather than being there.

Simply stunning building, especially when lit up at night!!. The building is simply stunning, beautiful architecture! Even more beautiful in the evening when it's all lit up - definitely worth a visit

Wonderful tour with knowledgeable guides- well worth seeing!. We took a walking city tour as part of an extended river cruise stay in Budapest. The Parliament tour offers the significant background history of Hungary and its rulers, the Crown Jewels, and beautiful architecture. The guided tour is not expensive and ends with a display sharing the building of this edifice.

Must see outside, tour not really worth it if you are not an EU citizen. Yes, you must see the outside. In fact, you can't really avoid seeing it from distance, and a closer look is worthwhile. The troop guard change is also fun for kids. However, at 5200 HUF, the tour inside was overpriced for a 45 minute tour which barely scratches the surface of the history, politics, architecture and arts. At 2000 HUF, the price for EU citizens, it is more reasonable.

a must see an do tour. majestic place were Hungarian politics is done the tour encapsulates you in days gone buy with changing of the guards. also one of 3 designs that was submitted when being built the other 2 designs were built also in in the surrounding square and house other ministry departments
Wish I could have gone inside.... Wandered around the parliament and saw the Oct25 exhibition. Very beautiful building and very interesting exhibiting would have loved to go inside. Another time
Amazing. Good tour.. A must do in Budapest. Grand building and good tour. Book in advance to get the time you want. Weeks in advance at least is best.

Breathtaking inside and out. Considering the size of the country, this parliament building is by far the most impressive one we have seen in Europe. We first saw it from a nighttime river cruise which was spectacularly lit up. Then we took there guided tour the following day to see the inside and out was even more impressive.A must see attraction during your stay.
Majestic Landmark. You can not miss this huge Parliament building. We got to see the changing of the guards. The building is beautiful in day or night.
A must tour. The Parliament tour is about one hour, and gives a nice history of the building and the government. The interior is absolutely stunning and is a must see site.

A stunning place with a tragic history.. While not visiting the inside, the exterior of the Parliament building was moving & beautiful, particularly the underground exhibit on the 1956 uprising and the exhibit on the restoration of the building during much of the 20th century due to bad construction management decisions, moving & fascinating all at the same time. A must see in Budapest.

The royal gem of Budapest. The Parliament is definietly the number 1 must see attraction in Budapest. Its so monumentous, that no turist can avoid its presence. It has a perfect location, and an incredible nightlight! Must do!
Nice!. It is worth to see it, better that in the other European countries. Also, next to this there is a river where you can find boats and bars.

Fabulous Grand Building. This is a fantastic building well worth a visit. Lots to see and the area surrounding the Parliament building is also worth taking the time to explore. The sight of the building in the early evening sunshine is fantastic.

Amazing building by the Danube. Take every opportunity you see the view the Parliament building over the river in 'Pest' so much history, an amazing building and amazing place....to see the buildings is best on foot, get yourself a map and site see on foot.

One of the most majestic buildings in the world. I have been blown away by how stunning the Parliament building is on the banks of the Danube. It's is impressive by day. Majestic, almost magical by night. I recommend taking an evening cruise on the Danube for the best views. The tour should be booked ahead of time because they fill up quickly. I almost missed being able to go inside by not realizing soon enough I had to book online. The tour is interesting and informative and the inside of the building is impressive. Especially the inner dome room with the royal crown. A must do when visiting Budapest.
enchanting. amazing building, pity the free visit can be done only at the hall where the Crown, however, deserves the visit it's free for eu

Quite costly for a 20 minute tour. If you want to see it then You have no choice but to take the tour, the inside is beautiful but not exceptional. The guide didn't want us to ask questions, just ran us through the spiel and off you go. The cafe as well as the guides need basic customer service training. I rated it as good because I liked the 30 minutes I spent in the museum afterwards watching the presentations on the building and maintenance of the building

Great to see from outside, not sure if worth visiting inside.. I found the building far more impressive from outside than inside. Definitely a must-see in Budapest but you could make do without the visit of the interior, it's just a lot of walking and lots of tourists pushing each other through the halls.
Building was magnificent and beautifully restored.. Well worth the visit; it has history, beauty and so much to see, really interesting background. find time to look around the building

The most beautiful Parliament in the world!. Amazing architecture which every tourist should visited. It is beautiful as in daytime as in the evening. Also I recommend to have an internal excursion to get acquainted with the hungarian history a little bit closer.

One of the gems along the prominade. The river running through Budapest the Danube is spectacular and the walk along it's banks is really worth taking the opportunity to make. There's the Bastion on the hill and then there's the Parliment that stand out as sites to check out during this walk. And don't forget the bridge with the lions!

Stunning Parliament!. Visited on a Monday morning and saw few other tourists. A beautiful structure and saw the guards do a ceremonial show at 11:30 a.m. Not sure if this happens every morning, but it added to the experience. The tour schedule changes daily based on when Parliament is in session and tickets can only be purchased the day of visit.

Stunning and interesting tour. The building is simply stunning and one of the most photographed in the city. The tour is great. Very interesting and the building is simply beautiful on the inside. Try and book a tour in advance and direct rather than use an agency if you're an EU citizen or you'll be overcharged.
Great spot. Great visit - very much worthwhile - especially by night! Great by day but unquestionably beautiful by night! There's not much more I can say really - go see it!
Our visit. Enjoyed our visit lots to see the views from here are magnificent looking up toward budapest castle and all the building surrounding

A spectacular building. The Parliament Building is located on the banks of Danube (walking distance from the centre), and a spectacular building. It was built in the Gothic Revival style, and pleasure to watch for architecture lovers. I strongly suggest to visit the building after dark since all the lighting brings another dimension to it...

Amazing. The most beautiful parliament I have ever toured. The architecture is jaw dropping. This is a must see building. Recommend getting reservations online before your trip, as they limit the number of individuals in each tour group. The give tours in different languages at different times throughout the day.

Must see at night!. Beautiful, intricate architecture. Stroll along the river walk to take it in by day & then stay after dusk to see the Parliament light up the night. Better yet, take a night cruise on the Danube. Stunning.
Wonderfull place. Wonderfull place, good to know better the hungarian history, wich includes a bill of rights as old as Magna Carta of England. Worth the visit.

ok, nothing major but a view. Building was ok, nothing too special. Changing of the guard was good to see. The walk along the river was good.
Could do with a café near by or a drinks stall

Can Hungarians really afford this house of the people?. It's magnificent inside out, especially the inside. I don't have enough words to praise the interior decoration, but do wonder where the money came from to build and maintain such structure. The Parliament building and the Opera House are the two architectural landmarks that speak volume about Hungarian sense of style and decorum, and perhaps their tendency to live above their means.You must take the tour offered for a small fee. If you are a student of architecture and interior decoration, this is definitely a significant case study, and you must get your camera flashing and video rolling. The only place where cameras must be turned off is the domed chamber where the royal crown is stored under guard.It's a shame because the domed ceiling is a sight to enjoy, and the guard rotation an added nicety to the visit.This is a must-see landmark if it's your first visit to Budapest, or if you have not had a chance to see it in prior visit. Oh! There is a free rest room just outside the main entrance and that's a bonus in Hungary where a pit stop will usually cost you the equivalent of 50 cents to a dollar. Well, somebody must pay for the lavish decor of the people's house.

Walk to parliament . Budapest is a wonderful city to walk. We walked from the Budhabar hotel to parliament. You have to make reservations ahead of time to get into the English speaking tour. The building in itself is amazing . It's main facade faces the Danube River . It also houses the Royal Crown of Hungary. The architecture is something worth seeing. The whole tour is less than 45 minutes.

You must "come there" twice, a magnificent building. Take a walk to the Parliament and admire the fantastic building and the nice area around. Take a boat trip on the Donau at night time and admire the Parliament with lights on.
And finally, if you wish, you can also visit the Parliament with a guide.

Hungarian Parliament House - A Gothic Revival Beauty. So lovely it is when it is lighted up! A Danube boat cruise at night brings a different appreciation to this architectural marvel.
Ornamental stairs, frescoes, niches....all to be expected when you traipse into the building itself. Clearly, a great symbol that truly expresses the sovereignty of the nation.
Interesting Tour. It is a beautiful building. Highly recommend the tour. English speaking tours sold out early so it is worth making a reservation in advance.

An impressive building. The Parliament buildings are very nice and with memorials commemorating the end of the communist regime scattered throughout the grounds. The plaza in front of Parliament is a popular meeting spot for Budapest residents.
Visiting the Hungarian Parliament. A must see. Very informative tour that takes you inside and gives you insight to many details that one would never know unless you take this tour

You can't go to Budapest and not visit this awesome structure.. Probably one of the most beautiful buildings I've ever had the pleasure of exploring. It is the focal point of Budapest and not to be missed!

A jewel on Budapest's crown. The Parliament building is located on the Eastern bank of the Danube, facing Kossuth Square and two other majestic government buildings. It was inaugurated in 1896, to celebrate the first millennium of the Hungarian state, but it wasn't completed until 1904. It is a magnificant Neo-Gothic building, with tall spires, carved stone decorations, multiple statues of Hungarian statesman and patriots and outstanding bas-reliefs. Inside, a majestic staircase leads up to the second floor. Multiple hallways are impressively decorated and furnished.The ceilings are beautifully decorated with frescoes and the stained glass of the windows shows family crests of Hungarian kings and members of the nobility. The Hungarian assembly uses one part of the building and there are guided tours daily. These are quite informative and this should be a mandatory stop for all visitors. Since the return of the Royal Crown in 2000, it is displayed in the central hall. The entire building was recently cleaned and renovated, so it is in top shape and just downright beautiful.

Outside is impressive, especially at night!. I haven't been on the inside, but the outside is so impressive! It is enormous (over 700 rooms that are still being used) and every corner of the building looks amazing. Don't forget to see it at night. The lightning makes it even more impressive, almost like fairytale. Fun fact: the parlement was designed during a competition who could build the best building for this goal. Three architects made the top 3 and nr. 1 obviously became the parlement. The other 2 are next and across from the parlement, because they felt that they deserved a spot as well. Interesting to see how the parlement is way prettier than the other 2... no competition whatsoever if I had a say in it!

Old and New and still in use.. Took a tour of the Parliament. Beautiful architecture, details in seating assignment for present politicians, interesting locations for cigars in hallways. Make sure to admire the ceiling, as well as the view of the Danube and Pest.
Beautiful building!. One of the great landmarks in Budapest, best seen from a boat cruise. The changing of the guard is a daily event at noon.
Excellent trip. Fantastic restaurant is great Budapest is amazing Esta at the restaurant was so helpful go there if you want help with anything

An attraction not to be missed. A tour of the Parliament, located right on the Danube River in Budapest is integral to any visit in Hungary both because of its majestic architecture and because of its lasting importance to the history of the Hungarian people. While the tour guides may have led one too many tours through the building, the absolute beauty of the rooms, dome, grand entrance and crown jewels make the tour most worthwhile. The anterooms after the tour provide added information to enrich this experience. Don't let the fairly high price of admission scare you away, since this experience is definitely worth it!

A little disappointing . The only way to see the Parliament is by guided tour. These run daily and are offered in most major languages. However, the English tours were very popular and sold out quickly. We were advised to check a website (external site not related to the Parliament) to book for the following day. We found that the 3 English tours were sold out. We decided to visit the next day on the off chance and discovered that there were 2 tours available that were not showing on the website. It is much cheaper for EU citizens (with ID) than non EU citizens. The tour itself lasted an hour including the security check and collection of headsets. To be honest it didn't live up to expectation. The guide was pleasant and knowledgable but her delivery was rather flat. She had a microphone which she kept moving around. This generated a lot of crackling noise in the headset! I expected to see more of the building ( which is very ornate). It's immense popularity might be the reason for the brevity of the tours. The changing of the guard and the view of the building from the opposite side of the river were more impressive than the tour.

Amazing to see from a river boat.. The intricate design of this building has always impressed me. Seeing it on TV or in a photo does not do it the justice it deserves. This is a truly impressive landmark, and a 'must see' if you're in Budapest. Well worth a look !
Amazing building. The tour was very short, didn't hear the half of it. It was over crowded and the people were very loud. Buuut! Beautiful building, nice interior and history. Loved it!

Very very beautiful and elaborate detailed outside structure. Best way to see Budapest is by taking the underground , it is cheap , fast and no steps to climb or long tunnels(like in London). If you stop at the underground arany Janos you are 5-7 min walk to the parliament and also 5mins walk the other way to the St Stephen basilica which is a must see (the most beautiful church I have seen in my 50 years of travel)After reaching the parliament , you can stroll along the promenade , take great pictures of the famous chain bridge , and more. The walk towards the bridge is about 5-7 mins from the parliament .

One of many architectural gems in Budapest. Just to be clear, I have never set foot in the Parliament building. Visits must be pre-booked and there are many tour companies who can arrange this. However, you don't need to enter to appreciate the building. The best views of the Parliament building are from the other side of the Danube ( or from one of the many boats offering river trips). See it in daylight and at night for two equally stunning views.
Gorgeous inside and out.. This building is amazing to look at from all angles. We took the tour, which was interesting. Very pretty when lit up at night.

THE building in Budapest!. A must to visit when in Budapest. I'm not telling you anything the other reviewers haven't already, just confirming that the Parliament and surrounding square is well worth a look, both during the day and when gorgeously lit up at night. :-) The views of the Buda side across the river are also lovely to look at!

Fantastic building, inside and out. The architecture of both exterior and interior is stunning. Don't accept the tour to be to long because many rooms inside aren't open for public. In my opinion a must-visit, definitely filled my camera.
Stunning!!!!. The inskide tour was good but the best thing to do is take a night cruise to see the Parliament at night. I was lucky and it was a full moon. Breathtaking!

See it from all sides, including across the river. We didn't know it was the Parliament on approaching during our first walk along the river so kept a discussion going as to whether it was a church or whatever until we found out. Great amazement at finding such a wonderfully maintained gigantic building complex to house mere politicians... Got the wow factor going.
Beautiful building..... Definitely see this on a walking tour. Take your photo and move on. Save the your for the opera house.
Best building I've ever seen!. Huge hulking beast jutting straight up out of the Danube. Gothic architecture at it's best. HUGE place and a must see.

Definately more impressive exterior. We purchased the guided tour of the Parliament building on our recent visit to Budapest but were somewhat "underwhelmed" by the experience.. The number of rooms that we were shown was very limited during the less than one hour tour, and at a cost of approximately $20 US p/p, we felt that it was an overpriced event. The free outdoor (underground) displays in the courtyard were very interesting and the FREE water closets outside the entrance to the visitor center are one of the best values in Budapest.

Worth a visit but book in advance. . Definitely worth viewing, but know that if you want the English tour you will have to book well in advance to get it. Very educational and ostentatious all at the same time!
Wonderful. The city is beautiful and has a lot of monuments but for me this is the most breath taking building, the architecture is beautiful and its huge, it can be seen from any part of the coast.

Beautiful Landmark. I would rate it as one of the most beautiful parliaments in Europe, with fantastic architecture and great decoration . The view from outside is great, inside it is a magnificent building, the crown jewels are impressive!

Beautiful building, beautiful day to relax on the lovely square. Our perfect weather day made a visit to the Parliament area memorable. The building and surrounding square have recently been upgraded. Views across to Buda are wonderful. The "guards" were so friendly. Easy walk from here to the river and the amazing bridges. Close by is the Liberty (Sabasag Ter) Square - lovely.Because of the beautiful weather we did not take the Parliament tour (lower level of the building). Maybe another time
beautiful. after learning about the history of the country it was great to see especially from Buda side of the river!
highlight. This is an amazing building - you must see! You get tickets in the Information Center under the building - tours are in different languages.

Amazing building. We did not do the tour, ran out of time.
Probably the most picturesque parliament building in the world.

Amazing architecture. I think the parliament building in Budapest is a work of art and the views of the riverside area would simply not be the same without the parliament. A grand building with magnificent design and commanding a picturesque point of interest for architecture and history lovers alike. A striking baroque building that must be visited.
Unforgettable building. The parlament is beautiful by day snd by night! The visit is very well abd the guided tours too. The parlament host the historic crown of Hungary

Huge but a bit disappointing . The main staircase and the changing of the guard in the dome at the crown were worth the trip, but the rest was underwhelming, particularly with the wait to enter and the climb (take the lift when it's offered!). More spectacular from afar!
Nice view!. Unbelievable great building! Maybe greatest in whole Budapest. Very impressive! Hope to visit them again

Amazing . An incredible piece of architecture and needs to be seen to take uour breath away.
Right on the river front it's a beautiful location and looks more stunning every time you look at it, also if reccomend seeing it at night time as when it's lit up its amazing

Even more beautiful at night. The architecture all over Budapest is absolute porn for the eyes, and parliament is truly a sight to see. As beautiful as it is during the daytime, I find it even more beautiful at night

Fabulous building. This is a gorgeous building and even better to view on a boat cruise, especially at night. The architecture is amazing and I believe you can visit inside with a guided tour, although we didn't manage to do it. I will definitley do it next visit to see if it is as gorgeous inside as it is out! I have heard it is AMAZING! Can't wait to check it out.

Beautiful but WAY overpriced. This is a beautiful site with lots of history and a wonderful interior however charging us non EU residents 5400 Forints ($20 USD) for a 30 minute tour is WAY overpriced. The entrance fee of around $8 for EU residents makes more sense.

Beautiful building. Agree very visible and lovely building, especially from the Buda castle side of the river.We hadn't booked in advance but went along, actually on a Saturday morning, and they had tickets available for an English tour +other languages, that day. Take your passport as cheaper tickets if you're EU. Just as lovely inside and very interesting to hear the history. There is a very good, interactive museum at the end of the tour.

Think Big Ben withot the tower... Beutiful. Such a beautiful building and detailed architecture. Definetely a must see in your tour of Budapest. There are some tours available at pay but I just focused on the outside. This is not very close to the center but recommend the walk over regardless.
Stunning architecture. Took the tour and got to see one of the most beautiful parliaments there is. The guide was good and answered all the questions he could. This is a must do while in Budapest.
Great building located at the Danube. It is a beautiful site to see near the Danube. The building has a lot of different intricat details and flower gardens. Old trams run in front of the building.

The Budapest's Jewel. When you come to Budapest, you can not miss it!Huge, large, wide, awesome architecture...Guardian of the Danube...And illuminating the Danube's waters at night...So romantic...The visit of the parliament is allowed and guided tour is recommended!The must see for sure!!!

Beautiful building especially at night.. We had a fantastic view of the parliament from our hotel across the river. We booked to go round the inside which it is wise to do in advance in order to get a time slot that suits you. We had to queue for quite a while as we were early and you can only go in at the appointed time. Security is high and can take a long time. We had a young man to guide us and he was waiting for another guide but in the end we went ahead. It was incredibly hot waiting. Apparently the building is in 2 halves that are virtually identical. One is for the parliamentary use and the other for visitors. It is quite ornate inside, a bit like the Opera House but it was only built in 1905. There are 365 spires on the building and the Dome is for a leap year. We saw the Crown Jewels which are guarded constantly by two soldiers with swords. It was an interesting visit but very hot.
Beautiful . This is an absolute must see! Very beautiful, and so clean well worth a trip to go and see. Stunning well kept building and grounds

The most beautiful at night. We visited Parliament on my birthday trip to Budapest. We were able to see Parliament in the daytime they also offer tours. We were able to catch a changing of the guards which was kind of cool. However, Parliament is most beautiful at night. It is a must see if you do the Danube River Cruise.
spectacular construction. great to get a tour of the parliament. very massive and elabrate. beautfiul construction. quite awe inspiring
nice. It is a really beautiful building and something you just really need to see if you're going to budapest!

Truly A Must Visit!. The most magnificent Parliament building I have ever seen around the world! Though you may see this beautiful building from the Buda side of the Danube river, make it a point to go and see it from near. The guided tour inside is really worth it as the inside of the building is more elegant and ornate than many European palaces. Though the online booking site might show no availability, you may get the same slot once you reach there in the morning.

Parliament . Beautiful at night. Did a lot of night walking in Budapest. Really enjoyed Budapest. If going to Parliament go in the evening when they turn on the lights and take a walk next to the river.

Amazing . A not to be missed experience. Take your passport and book in advance. Ensure you are booked at a time that fits your language. Tour times are language dependant. Gifts are expensive. Beware of long queues

Could stare at it all day. One of the most striking buildings I have seen and visible from so many viewpoints. We found ourselves drawn to it as soon as we arrived, wandered to the other side of the Danube bought a couple of drinks and sat on the rivers edge and stared. Impressive.
Nice looking but not much else. The building is nice to look at night with all the lights, especially if you are doing the danube cruise!

Breathtaking. Seriously incredible piece of architecture and needs to be seen to be appreciated!Right on the river front it's a beautiful location and looks more stunning every time you look at it, also if reccomend seeing it at night time as when it's lit up its magical!

Amazing. One of the most beautiful buildings I saw in Prague. At night, it is spectacular. You need to get your tickets ahead as they book up quickly. The woman who gave the tour was easily understandable and we really enjoyed the tour.

Spectacular!. The tour was a little over priced and short but the inside like the outside is amazing. They even have the Hungarian crown worn by all the kings on display. What I would recommend is going across the river to look at it from the other side or taking a boat tour at night! Very very special

Very impressive building. Whilst we didn't go in it, we spent a while just walking round it photographing its various sides. really impressive building sat right next to the Danube. Two soldiers guarding the main flag pole on one side. Well worth a walk round.
#1 site to vivit in Hungary. its just amazingly beautiful from inside and outside. even all the little tiny details were perfect.loved it.
Cant not miss it. Very interested visit. There are a lot of times of visit in all different languages. So I recomend you to book the visit in advance. Preferably early in the morning.

Grand building and good (if slightly pricey) tour. If you are in Budapest, you have to see at least the outside of this building. Luckily, this isn't difficult, as it's difficult to miss from either the Buda side or from the river itself. If you have the time and the inclination, the tour (the only way for the public to see the inside of the building) is quite good, although more expensive than pretty much anything else we did in Budapest. You'll have to decide for yourself if the tour is worth it, but you do see some pretty amazing architecture and design, including the crown jewels and what's billed as the largest carpet in Europe.
Magnificient. I was on a cruise and the night scene of the Parliament was so beautiful in May. The building was majestic and golden in color.

NO ENTRY. Never got inside as I did not pre-book online which you must do. Also watch out for which language the tours are in and the specific time of the tour. Pre plan this tour or be left out!Very beautiful building and they have a museum of it's history and reconstruction.

It's ok. I was surprised this was the number one sight in Budapest. The other major sites are much better then this. My wife and I were a little bored going through this one and it was jam packed in our tour. I felt like it was over rated honestly.
Beautiful building. This is a beautiful building. It is possible to go inside but we didn't have the time. We did see the changing of the guard!

One of the biggest buildings in the world . On our weekendtrip in Budapest we walked by this amazing building that non of us had a clue existed. It takes about 30 min to walk around and it's perfect if you want to see "The shoes" by the water also. The building is so mesmerizing big so it's hard to understand when standing beside it, be sure to climb the mountain on the other side of Donau and get the best view of the Parlament.
gorgeous mesmerizing. just toooo goooood mesmerizing and grand gorgeous and stunning and you can have a magnificent view from hotel artotel just opposite the parliament
A very large and historic building. Wonderful place to visit. learn a lot about the history and politics of this tumultuous nation. Tour guides are very good, book tickets online.
A stunning building. I was on a Danube River cruise and our boat was docked outside the Parliament - what a magnificent building.

Light up the Danube. It's a large building right on the Danube. It's a nice walk all around to check out the architecture and there are tours inside. The gardens at the back side are also lovely. The highlight is seeing it lit up at night from across the Danube.

Beautiful at night!!. We took an afternoon tour of Parliament. You have to purchase tickets for the tour online or there. We went in the morning and got our tickets for an afternoon tour that was in English. You will go through security before beginning the tour and then walk up several flights of stairs to enter. I think the tour took 45 mins and was worth the price of the ticket. Cameras were allowed inside. Be sure not to miss the building at night when all the lights are on...beautiful!!! There is also an exhibit in the Lapidarium that you will see out front on the right side of the building (go down the steps) on the way to the ticket office that is very interesting but easy to miss...no tickets required.

Beautiful building. The short tour was interesting (although a bit pricey). We were given headsets to be able to hear the tour guide. Photos can be taken everywhere except in one room where the crown is kept. I would go early to get tickets or buy online. We noticed as the day went on that english tours were selling out and people were having to come back hours later for their tour.

River Tour. Did the River tour that they give you with the hop on/hop off bus tickets, and so we saw it at night right from the river. What else can I say except SPECTACULAR. All lit up in its glory, this looks more like the castle than the Budapest castle. We went in January so it was cold--but very very worth it.
Must See. I go here every time I visit Budapest, and it still amazes me, even on a cloudy day. Best viewed also during sunset.

A wonderful sight. No matter how many times we came upon this building we had to stop and gaze at its imposing architecture and comment how very beautiful it was. We viewed it from many angles, but only from the outside. On our next visit we'll definitely make time to tour the interior.

Wait till its dark .... and then drive to the Buda Sude of the danube (Batthyany ter). There just get you a drink at the shop and sit down right on the riverside.We were watching the full moon rise and it was just like a fairytaile.Amazing!!!

Spectacular . Budapest is just fab and the Parliament building is stunning. Would have liked to and look around inside. Not sure if you can go in, didn't see it was advertised. It would give Westminster a run for its money. Well worth a stroll down the river.

Beautiful buildings, worth seeing in daylight and at night. Ver y interesting to see. Beautiful buildings with soldiers all around. Souvenir shop interesting too. next to the Danube and chain Bridge. Very clean area and city.

Short and Expensive Tour. If I hadn't done this tour, I would have always wondered what I missed, so in that sense I'm glad I did it. But the tour was short -- it was supposed to be a 45 minute tour, but after everyone got through the metal detectors and up the stairs, it was more like a 30 minute tour -- and it was expensive for non-EU citizens. Still, the Parliament is an impressive building.
Amazing building. Unbelievable building on the river of Danube... On sunny days you can see the reflection of the building in the river...cool

Amazing building. I would highly recommend to book a tour in advance, first of all to skip the queue and also it's worth to go in. Also great for photography outside and on the opposite side of the river Danube.

Spectacular. We didn't go into the buildings but walked around them. There is an impressive square to walk around. I'm not an architecture expert or anything but the buildings are spectacular and well kept.

Magnificent building. The Parliament Building in Budapest is well worth a visit. If you're from the Eu you can get in at a cheaper rate, make sure you have some ID. The tours take place at different times for different languages. We got there for 10.00 but the next available English speaking tour was14.30 the guide was very informative and the inside of the Parliament was very impressive. There is a cafe on site if you fancy a drink. Also try to see the building from the banks of the Danube, it is lit up at night. We walked from Parliament to Freedom Square which only took a few mins and is also well worth visiting
wander past. Big, old, worth seeingwe didn't go in, only walked past, but is an amazing building to see from outside

Breathtaking. This has to be one of the most beautiful buildings in the world, whether you are looking at it at night or daytime. We did not tour it as we were told that there is limited access to the building and it was not worth the price; however, the plaza around it is landscaped with nice gardens and you can easily look out to the Danube.
Do it!. As everyone has said, an amazing building, as are the grounds and statues on the grounds. Just do it!

Its fine if you are really into Gov buildings. This tour was pretty pricy for what you get. If I had it to do over again I would skip it. The tour guide was the best part of the experience but overall you do not see much and its really just another old government building. If you are into this kind of thing do it, if not walk around, see the guards do their little dance and save your money for more fun things.

Good tour. I didn't really no what to expect .So many of these types of tours are a bit of a let down.This one wasn't although only really lasted about 25mins.You get to see quite a lot of the inside which is very impressive.You pay extra if you want to take photos.£2. Don't see the point of this,better to just charge one price.Under the dome are the crown jewels.You have two guards guarding them and another telling people not to get close to the jewels and the guards. Actually pushing people away from the guards.Very strange and a bit over the top.The jewels were OK but I wouldn't say they were very impressive.The guide was very knowledgeable and did a very good job explaining everything.But beware the over the top guard.
Lovely architecture . It is one of the most beautiful buildings I've ever visited. The architecture is just astonishing. Would recommend my friends to visit it.

Beautiful Building. If you get the chance to see the parliament building in Budapest - give it a go! We went on a river cruise that took you directly past the building and at a time of day when the sun was shining directly on to the white stone. It looked really beautiful. You can see the building from far away and set it in the context of the city and then you can see it really close up. We also took a walk through the square at the front of the building which has some very large statues. Changing the guard was fascinating with a very slow motion walk and ceremonial swords. Worth a look.

Parliament. Well worth a visit, make sure you also it see at night from the river as it is lit beautifully, also walk along the river to see the bronze shoes on the river edge in memory of the Jews shot in WWII. Make sure you book as they do bookings for different languages at different times
Wow!. This is a stunning building right on the banks of the danube. Looks very impressive when all lit up at night.
Great tour.. Very pretty building and worth a visit when you are here. Was quite cheap and they have different language tours.

Impressive. Amazing building from both the square and from the river. Take the time to see the show when the guard changes and don't forget to look at the surrounding buildings, two of them were supposed to be the parlament building, but ended up being to small.
Amazing sight. Not much to add to the comments of other contributions. It definitely is an amazing sight and I especially liked the view from the castle.

Impressive. The first few days of our visit at Budapest was rainy so we decided to take a tour there. It's at least as impressive inside than it looks like from outside. We could take photos which is good, however, the tour is a bit short only 45 minutes.

Most impressive seat of government. Fascinating building, beautifully decorated, a lot of steps but a lift option, lovely location on the banks of the Danube, well worth the cost ( and the security checks)
Stunning. Must see while in Budapest. We had a chance to see it both in a daytime and evening. You will never get bored of looking at this gorgeous place.
beautiful building. a truly beautiful building worth a look at from other side of river to fully appreciate its beauty - need to pre book to do a full tour

Parliamentary interlude. No matter what angle you see the Parliament building from, it is a treasure. Whether you're up close with the changing of the Guard, or viewing from Buda, you will have to admire the spectacle of it's intricate form.
A must. Visiting the interior of the parliament is one of the highlights of a Budapest visit. Buy the tickets at the visitor center.

A must to visit. You have to book online for your visit. They offer tours in several languages. The building is wonderful and huge with many nice places to take pictures. They have a nice garden as well
Take the tour!. We did and it was awesome! Gold everywhere, a good look into the parliament. Building was amazing and it was good value. Really worth it!

Brief Tour of a Magnificent Place. No doubt one of the most spectacular buildings I've ever seen. The tour is only 45 minutes long but well worth it as the guide explains all about the parliament, some Hungarian history and shows you the crown jewels. We would recommend it.

Beautiful Building!. Its a must see. The tour lasts about 45 mins which goes in a flash but is so well worth the time. Whilst we were inside there was a changing of the guard which made it seem even more special.

Probably the best of a very long list of fantastic buildings in Budapest. There are so many very impressive buildings in Budapest; difficult to rate them: but the Parliament building is so photogenic and its location so visible from hundreds of points of views

Beautiful!. The parliament is surely one of the most impressive and beautiful buildings i have ever seen, even tho you are not able to visit the inside, definitely go there and take pictures, it is very worth it!
Iconic. One of the most iconic buildings in Budapest. Fascinating exterior, stunning interior, lovely gardens and overlooks the Danube!

Definitely the most impressive building in Budapest. We photographed this building from all angles as it is so impressive. We also did the tour which was a little shorter than I expected but it probably showed us the most interesting rooms. The main staircase is amazing and it was interesting to see the old House of Lords room.

Magnificent Architecture. This building will place you in awe, it is incredibly beautiful and well preserved, the area around it also very clean and nice to walk , on the other side also the Danube river with another spectacular view. Its beautiful in day and night , so make sure you visit at both times.

Stunning sight and a "must" see.. We saw the building in front and the back a couple of times and took many snapshots.
Full of surprises and history. The daytime view from our Hop on and Hop off bus and the nighttime view from our boat cruise on the Danube never fail to steal all our attention towards the structure of Parliament building.

Beautiful building. Enjoyed the tour. Quite tiring climbing the staircases to start, but they were so awe-inspiring it was worth the climb. It was quite informative but ended rather abruptly and the descent staircase was quite an anti-climax.

Stunning. You simply must come here! I don't know why I'm writing this review because it simply won't do it justice!The scale of this place is unreal! Definitely go to the visitors centre and take the tour. Very well priced and very informative. Would recommend going towards the end of the day as it is less busy. I believe 6pm is the last tour.You can't come to Budapest and not come here!

Beautiful building; tour is short. This is a magnificent building. The history and architecture are very cool. The tour is about $20, but it's short. I was a little underwhelmed. However, I recommend it for the history and the awesome nature of the structure.
Regal. Amazing Structure! If you thought it looked amazing from the outside? Wait till you get inside. I highly recommend that you take the indoor tour, you will not be disappointed.
Glenn . Great building and very nice to see from a river cruise. Best deal is available from hop on hop off bus company 25 € for three days, you get to boat trips on the same ticket

A beautiful place, but the tour could be longer. Let's be clear; the parliament building is exceptional. Stunningly beautiful and awe inspiring with a nice modern visitor centre. That said, the tour itself is rather short,and having experience of the UK parliament tour I was disappointed not to learn more of the history of democracy and not just the building. The Hungarians need to consider their seat of democracy a SYMBOL of that democracy, which I didn't think they did very well on this tour.

Tour today. Booked on line from hotel, paid 4000 HUF each (& e-fee 200) absolutely well worth the money. Enterannce similar to boarding a flight which we expected, great you can take pics in most rooms. The guide was so informative and open to questions- excellent girl. The building is as beautiful inside as wel as out, information room at the end gives a lot of history of the build. Well worth visit.

A must see in Budapest. Beautiful building, representative for Budapest, with an architecture that will remind you that Budapest was a capital of the Austrian-Hungarian Empire; if you are there take some time to visit the nice squares close by the building
Exquisite. A fairy tale structure visible from most of Budapest- gorgeous at night and make sure you go right round it - a lovely quirky metal bridge to see.

Very impressive building. what a great, impressive building – awesome architecture. Make sure you visit the underground "Lapidarium", located at the backside of the building, not the Danube side, it gives a very interesting historical overview concerning the parliament building.
Stunning building. Awesome building well worth the visit both at night and during the day. Visit it by the tour bus to see it all

Stunning Monument!. Absolutely stunning view as one takes a cruise ride down the river Danube!The country talks in numerous ways and its beauty is only surpassed by the gorgeous combination of the two cities lining river Danube
Histoeical building. Don't miss it if you are a tourist. If you have luck, there will be no demonstrations on Kossuth square, what is just in front of the Parliament and also worth to watch.
Majestic . Such a fine building, recently renovated, overlooking the Danube, looking spectacular too from the other side of the Danube.

Wow, amazing!. This Parliament is a must see. Gorgeous, and magnificent. I booked my tour 4 weeks in advance online, highly recommend you do that since it's very popular.It's the only way to enter the Parliament is through the guided tour.Arrive 15 minutes before your scheduled tour time. Don't be late.The staff will call you when it's your turn to receive the guided tour.You will need to bring your printed ticket for scanning.once you complete the ticket scanning, you will go through a security check just like the airport.Then, you are asked to get a headset/receiver so you can listen to the commentary by the guide. Follow the guide closely. You can take pictures without flash. But they have staff watching you, so when in doubt, always ask if you can take pictures.When you get to the area where the crown jewel is displayed, the guide will ask you NOT to take photos. The tour itself lasts about 30 minutes, but the preparation takes about 20-30 minutes. That's why you need to budget about an hour to 90 minutes for this tour. The tour ends in the souvenir shop.

Hungarian Parliament. Definately the most beautiful parliament I've ever seen. The pearl of the Danube.It's really worth to visit by guided tour but you will get the most spectacular view from the Buda side (Batthiany square or Fishermen's Bastion), especially with it's night lights.
One of the most beautiful Parliament in Europe.. Architecturally the Parliament is a magical building. The function and the beauty conglomeration shows the genius of the architect.
A great city. There are many fantastic buildings in Budapest and this is one of them. Stand in the square and you are spoilt as to where to look next. Cracking city.

Book to be sure but excellent . Book to avoid disappointment. Book online if you can as we missed it by trying at lunchtime and had to return at 9 am following morning. Worth it. Excellent tour and amazing views of the inside of the building. Have attached some of the photos. Cafe was excellent croissant and coffee but no wifi. Building has free wifi.
Great building. Did this with a tour guide very good and informative . Best to book this online in advance as the queue for tickets on the day was very long .
Visiting the Parliament Building. Plenty to see and lovely views all round. There is so much history in this beautiful building and wished we could have stayed longer.

Must do if in Budapest. The Hungarian Parliament and the surrounding square is the site for the October 1956 uprising by the Hungarians against the communist regime. There is a museum in the square which all visitors should see.
Fantastic architecture!. A beautiful view on a serene night walk & equally beautiful during the day when seen on high from Fisherman's Bastion or from the river on a boat tour.

Stunning Architect. We did not go inside the Parliament Building, just wandered around the grounds. It is a stunning building, beautiful architecture, it looks lovely in the evening viewed from one of the many available boat trips. Change of Guard is something to be seen. It is very precise and formal, well worth a visit

WOW. This has to be the most beautiful building in Budapest, you shouldn't miss the chance of an evening boat trip to see it floodlit. We needed to book tickets on the internet to go on the tour inside the building but the hotel receptionist did it for us. you can't see the chambers where parliament sits but there is still lots to see and the inside is every bit as stunning as the exterior, the crown, orb and sceptre are also there, guarded by sword wielding soldiers.

Beautiful Building. Must visit if your first time in Budapest, is one of the most majestic buildings in whole Europe and it has a lot of history. You can see it from the Danub and there are guided tours to see the inside.
Must see !!!. Book online in advance .... its one of Budapest s jewels in her crown ...any time of the year is a great time to visit.
Beautiful architecture. Very nice to look at and walk by when you are in budapest. It is a must see. This Parliament lays across the river right in front of the old castle.

More beautiful outside than ibside. Tour is ok not more than that.you dont see alot.
.
. the outside is more impressive.They show very little of the place
Parliament. We only saw it from outside. We were too late for the tour. Beautiful architecture. Spacious outside area.

Beautiful. I highly recommend the tour Its about 45 minutes. The inside is as impressive as the outside We booked in the morning and was able to get a late afternoon tour. In higher tourist months you probably need to book in advance.

Stunning architecture but a short 30 min tour considering the expensive fee. The fee is double for a none-EU citizen and you have to book specific times for the language you want. We came around 10:30 am and couldn't get an English tour until 2:30. Beautiful architecture inside, worth the visit, lots of gold everywhere. You can take picture of the stairwell, hallways, and main chambers but you can't take pictures of the room where the Crown Jewels are housed and there are guards watching. My reason for 4 instead of 5 rating is a found the tour short and we didn't see as much as I thought we would. Took us 15 minutes to get through security and get head sets so give yourself an hour although the tour is 30 mins. Many languages available for the tour besides Hungarian and English such as Spanish, Italian, Russian.
Good luck trying to find the entrance.. The tour around the building was good, informative and a reasonable price. It included a headset for each person to make hearing the guide super easy.

Impressive, and impressively expensive. After stopping by the previous afternoon to find that tickets were sold out, I promptly booked tickets online for the next day. The outside of the building is very beautiful, and I was looking forward to an equally awe-inspiring interior.The ticket comes with a free tour, which is easy enough to understand and quite informative. However, the tour is short enough that the price isn't really all that worth it. I managed to get a student discount, but the regular priced tickets are inappropriately expensive for a government building. There's even an additional fee for buying in advance, not to mention that the website for doing so is extremely confusing.

Interesting but chaotic tour. The Parliament building is amazing - inside and out! Definitely worth seeing. Book ahead to get the time and language you want. The whole experience takes 40-45 minutes, including a long security check in. The tour itself is only about 20 minutes. We only saw 4 rooms. The real issue is the process of getting started. It is chaotic. Many people coming for different tours that start close to each other. They do not have a system for telling people where to go, when they will be next, etc. It creates a lot of pushing and concern, as you think you may have missed your tour. The person making the announcements doesn't have a microphone, so hearing her is difficult. And the bathrooms are not free - you must pay to use the toilet!
Amazing. I watched the Parliament from one of the boat rides, and the architecture is absolutely incredible. A must see for anyone visiting Budapest
So beautiful. So beautiful in darkness.We had night cruise on boat and it is more beautiful when it is dark outsite but It is always beautiful building

Fairytale Building. We didn't have a chance to tour the inside of this beautiful building, but we did visit the outside and marvelled at the architecture. Also enjoyed both daytime and night time views from across the river.
Never regret - Hungarian Parliament. An amazing building complex. Stunning view during the day and even so at night with those flashing lights.

Pre-book a tour. We pre-booked online and as EU citizens only paid £5 each for a 45 minute tour, including guiding of the public areas with an individual audio guide, in your chosen language from 12 available - although not all every day. Our tour in English was attended by many nationalities who all seemed to understand our guide.On arrival to the visitor centre, you wait for your guide to arrive and take you through the security check to collect your audio guide. You need your e-ticket but we weren't asked to provide evidence of EU citizenship and cameras are allowed in all except one room.
pleasant walkabout. metro stops outside, lovely area to walk around in fine weather, plenty of nice resturaunts in the area.
Amazing. The Hungarian Parliament doesn't only look beautiful from the outside: Take a tour - it's even more beautiful in the inside!

Empty line to buy tickets at 8am!!!. We live nearby so after reading the review of massive queue time to purchase the same day ticket, I went to the visitor centre right when it was open, and the line was empty. I got tickets for 10:30 am english tour, went back to our apt, got breakfast, muck around at the square before our tour. Hapoy Days!

Must see!!!!. One of the most beautiful parliament buildings I have ever seen! I was just delighted! I would go everyday if I could. I definetely recommend! Worth a visit inside also. The ticket is not very expensive and you get to see a lot of things. It is also beautiful on the inside and full of history. A lot of beautiful pictures can be made!

Interesting English speaking tour.. We booked the English speaking tour in advance as we had read that those tours sell out quickly, Indeed, when we arrived for our noon tour, we learned that the English tours for the day were sold out. If we had not purchased in advance, we would have been out of luck.
Most beautiful capital building I have seen. The tour was phenomenal. Pictures are allowed except with the crown jewels. Recommend reservations through the website before you go.

Beautiful building, bad tour. Reading the rest of the reviews, I'd have to say I'm very confused at how the tour I went on differed so much from everyone else's.I arrived for a 12:00 pm English tour roughly 15 minutes before tour time. There was a line formed at the turnstile with people quietly conversing in English while a group of school children got sent through the turnstile and the security measures. Once the children were sent through a few of us moved toward the lady checking tickets at which point she literally yelled at several people "5 MINUTES!" as if we were children who had been fooling around instead of going in with our classmates and needed a scolding.It wasn't until a few minutes after 12 that she returned and started checking and scanning tickets. By the time we were through security, had headsets and had convened the whole group it was close to 12:15. Our tour guide showed up briefly before disappearing for a few minutes and by the time we had climbed the "golden stairs" it was almost 12:25.From there, we had 3 stops and the tour lasted a total of about 20 minutes. One of the major stops was of the crown jewels display where no pictures were allowed. Another was of the House Chamber where the viewing landing was so small that half of the group had to sit outside listening to the explanations of things that couldn't be seen. Then the guide ushered off telling those who hadn't been able to see to take their time looking around but then not even 30 seconds later a guard came to tell us to go keep up with the group. We missed an entire display somewhere because we had been out of range of the audio and the guard kept rushing us to catch up with the group.For the money, I don't honestly understand how this tour can be justified. I paid for a walking tour and instead got a light-speed running tour with not much opportunity for picture taking. Definitely feel ripped off. But hopefully your tour will be as lovely as the rest seem to have been.

Breathtaking building. We initially viewed the Parliament building from Buda, as I am certain most people will initially. As we were staying in Pest it was an easy walk to view the buildings close up and we were not disappointed.

Wow!!!. I have been to the Parliament Buildings twice before and every time I am in awe of it's magnificence.Since my last visit they have added a Memorial Museum to the 1956 revolution, an infinite fountain and a new honour guard. I did not take a tour of the inside this time, but it is well worth the $$.This is a place not to be missed.

Beautiful but Pricey Tour. It is magnificent inside but tour was overpriced for what you got. Supposedly a 45 min tour. Was only 1/2 hour and remainder was time spent in the museum/gallery area. Allow extra time for security. You're given listening boxes to hear your guide. They cut in and out and sound was scratchy. Also very crowded.

Parliment. Didn't have time to go, but the outside was incredible. Friends went, and were blown away. Even though the nazis and commies took over, to their credit, they did not trash the place. There are many pounds of gold in them stairs, and they did not harvest it.
Beautiful architecture . We took the English tour and found it very informative . The guide was enthusiastic . I found it far more impressive than Westminster .

The exciting place to see. This attraction give me good impression of Budapest city, the building of architect is very amazing. The landscape also very beautiful, the garden and statue is built with high taste of arts.

Hungarian Parliement. The Hungarian parliament building is absolutely magnificent in architectural terms. Building of the nineteenth century is also one of the oldest buildings in Europe linked with legislative process.Beyond that, it is a building that is majestically reclined on one of the most famous rivers of Europe- the Danube River
A must see. Breathtaking with an intriguing history. Check in advance for the dates and times of the tours offered in your preferred language.

Parliament Building Tour. My partner and I attended the Parliament Building Tour during our stay. We couldn't fault the tour and thought the building and it's history were breathtaking. We didn't feel rushed and taking into account that the building is still very much in use we thought this was excellent. We particularly liked the use of headsets during the tour to ensure everyone could hear the guide. The guide was brilliant and kept the tour interesting, he was very funny too. Leanne & Steve

Great experience. Throughly enjoyed our tour of the parliament buildings. The guide was friendly and told us lots of interesting stories and facts. It was interesting seeing where it all happens. We would recommend taking this tour,huge discount if your from countries within the EEA.

Just beautiful. This is one of the most stunning buildings I've ever seen. Its location is amazing. We walked round it, viewing it and photographing it from all angles and that's well worth doing. However, the night shot of it from the opposite bank of the Danube is just iconic. This is one of the most impressive cities I've ever visited and it seems fitting that this building should provide the icing on the cake!

It is a must to visit also inside. The third largest parliament building in the world. Very nice, detailed architectural work. Awesome also when night lights come up. You must visit also inside. You can buy tickets online.
Incredible building. Well worth your time to admire the architecture. We didn't do the tour because we felt it was a little pricey.

Amazing and picturesque. I didn't get to tour the inside of the Parliament building but the outside and the views at night were simply breathtaking. It's an exceptional building and will server as a great backdrop for photos. Definitely a site to see both during the day and at night.

Astounding building . The parliament building just stands out as one of the most stunning in Budapest. When looking over at Pest from Buda it is just breathtaking. Lovely to walk around and fab to see from the Danube boat tours.

Memorable. Definitely one of the main sights of Budapest and you can't beat seeing it by night from the Danube. The tour bus said it needed advance warning to visit but I note other tour companies run a daily visit. It's just the scale of it that takes the breath away
Our tour of Europe 2016. Absolutely beautiful building. Budapest is probably the nicest ex east block city we have visited. Clean,friendly and very easy to get around

A Magnificent Building. We did the tour which was very interesting & the guide was very knowledgable. There is quite rigorous security vetting (similar to airport) before you are allowed to enter. The tour is well worth the fee.

Beautiful building from the outside. The building is absolutely spectacular from the outside and a must see, however the tour inside the building given the wait time, price and what we saw was just ok.

Gorgeous building . This is, without a doubt, the most beautiful building of Budapest in my opinion. We didn't visit the inside, because we heard it is not really worth it. But we did eat lunch with an amazing view of the building.

Hungarian Parliament, Budapest. One of the most truly incredible buildings I have ever seen. Well worth admission fee. After visiting beautiful churches for a week, it was welcome tour. Make reservations in language of your choice ahead of time! Be sure to walk along the river to the Shoe Memorial while you are in the area.
Decent building . But sadly lots of construction work at the time. Looks better from across the river at night to be fair. Shame about tonnes of tossers taking selfies.
Beautiful architecture. take the boat cruise for evening view and sundowners with friends, IT has stunning evening feel to it and zyou can see it frmo different angles

Interesting tour but short on content.. A tour of the Hungarian Parliament is on every tourists list, if the crowds we encountered there are to be believed, to make sure you get on a tour in English that suits your timetable I recommend purchasing your tickets on line before heading to Budapest. We enjoyed the seeing the session room, the Crown of St Stephen and the magnificent staircase.

Amazing Landmark - Must See!!. We pre-booked a tour of the parliament building online which meant we skipped the queues and were guaranteed entry at the time we wished to go. The Parliament building is magnificent, both on the outside as well as on the inside, and the tour guide (included in the ticket price) gave us a lot of valuable information which made the tour very interesting and informative. The tour is a must-do when visiting Budapest. We also managed to see the changing of the guard in the crown room. I suggest you visit the Shoes on the Danube Memorial after the Parliament tour as it is only a few minutes away on foot. Highly recommended.
like a movies. when they tell you to go travel to Budapest first thing that comes to your head is this beautiful place both day and night looks spectacular

Absolutely gorgeous, by day & night. We felt this was the most beautiful building in Budapest, very grand and majestic. We just walked around it and took photos.Deserves to be seen by day and by night, both are spectacular and different

Stunning achitecture inside and out, sat on the Danube - iconic. A beautiful building, sat on the edge of the Danube, can be seen from many hotels on the Buda side of the city facing it across the river. Amazing inside, well preserved, and well worth a visit

Replica of Westminister Buiding?. It provided that this is a replica of westminister building in London. But...but...this looks better..a lot better. I would never forget the stunning view of this parliament building.At night, the cruise can take you and view the golden lighted building. Cant recommend it more,,,,

Amazing architecture . The parliament is one of the icons of Budapest and a visit to it cannot be missed if you are in the city. After admiring it's architecture and taking an incredible amount of photos I decided that I had to buy a ticket for the tour and it has been a good choice. The guide was polite and very knowledgeable and the few rooms which we were allowed to visit are amazing. All is so rich and so well preserved. This is a must go

A must to view it from 4 different perspectives.. This building is so famous and deserves more viewings than other sites.Firstly view it from the street level to catch the details if the carvings, shades of color and the beauty close up.Secondly, which is my favourite perspective. The view from the Danube. All the grandeur om and squareness if the building.Thirdly, from the castle, looking down, you get to marvel at the spires save roof design.Lastly, at night when it is lit up. It's like another building altogether.

Great building, perfunctory tour. The parliament building is impressive from outside but the guided tour is a mixed blessing. ornate and grand, the interior is great, but the "tour" is effectively a 45 minute march through a series of corridors and a quick shufti at the crown jewels. Security is heavy, and the guide we had was more interested in controlling than informing her "guests". disappinting.

amazing building. This place is huuuuge! It was a lot bigger than I thought. Day time and night time view of this building is totally different. I suggest come twice to see this beauty. The sad part of the parliament is that for Non eu citizens, it costs 5400HUF and 2200 for EU citizens..., so unfair. not sure why non eu citizens has to pay over 2x as much???

parliament review. Fascinating place , well worth paying for the guided tour . It is half price for over 65 Tickets are limited and timed . so you may need to book ahead to get the guided tour in English
The most Beautiful Parliament in Europe. The view of the parliament, especially from across the Danube river is beautiful, come at night to get the Best Shot!
go inside, take the tour - its worth it (don't msis the dented crown). its a beautiful building that they are renovating (at least on the outside). skating in the winter in the back of the building.

If you get an appointment to go inside, it is worth the experience. On the outside, the hourly guard changes are the highlight. On the inside, you get to see all the chambers, furnishings, and even the crown jewels. Worth the extra money to go inside.

An interesting place to visit. We took a guided tour through the Hungarian Parliament building. Tickets were booked in advance, but yet, the mass at the entrance was quite surprising. It took us 15 min to walk in of the 45 min tour. The building itself is quite interesting showing the power of the Austro-Hungarian Empire during the late 19th Century. For first timers in Budapest, and especially for rainy days, visit the Parliament is well recommended.

Raising the Hungarian Flag is the most action you will see. Naturally the grounds and perimeter of Parliament house are guarded. The 'House" popularity means you need to book a time to tour. The tours are grouped by language and you can do this online.If you rise early in the morning you can witness the raising of the Hungarian National flag. A short 10 mins but filled with pom and ceremony.

Amazing architecture, pleasant environment, Europe at Its Best. A stirring expression of humanity at its best and at its worst. A prodigious architectural and artistic achievement of human spirit and inspiration, a monument for evil and brutality reflecting the way in which history is being cruel to the cruelest

See it at night from the water. This incredible building is a must see at night from Buda or from the water. Fabulous architecture and a reminder of the majesty of the Austro-Hungarian Empire. Budapest is a favorite.

Immaculate, incredible and beautiful. . Stunning gilding in immaculate condition, it is highly guarded.
Very beautiful building.
There's a free visual Museum outside the building that you can easily miss so look out for it and that was interesting.

Visit. Beautiful Parliament in Budapest -Hungary. Totally worthy! I took so many pictures outside and inside. Must go to see at night too. Your eyes will be amazed!
Cheer!

Definitely worth a visit. This is by guided tour only, and you can book before you go - and it's well worth it. The building is stunning and the guides are very knowledgeable. A really interesting visit that only takes 45 minutes or so.
Must see. Beautiful building. Book the guided tour in advance on internet. Group of the guided tour can be too big to be comfortable.

Bike rides around Buda... One of the most beautiful architectural works I have ever seen. We spent so much time riding the green bikes you can hire around the square, the building truly is mesmerising.

A marvellous place. The place - where you find concentrated the whole Hungarian history and the modern country - around this place within a square-kilometer you will get in a concentrated way your lesson of history and presence!

Amazing architecture - beautiful historic building!. Overlooking the Danube River from the "Pest" side of this split city of Budapest, the Parliament is a spectacular architectural wonder of a building. From the river view, it is beautiful and imposing, any time of day. From the city or land side, it is a marvelous example of architecture, that will delight and astonish any visitor, and can easily by viewed from any vantage point while walking along the building in either direction. It's a must-see sight!
architecture. Beautiful place , i booking in advance tickets - but is more interesting outside .Is a must see place for people who visit Budapest

Postcard perfect. Architecture of the building is really nice and really good to capture in picture. There are a bit of history that you can see on the surroundings i.e. the mini museum, world War war representation of bullets... Close to American embassy.
Review of parliament . Great architecture. Well maintained though looks like recently done up. The carvings are very good indeed. Worth visiting from outside

Abstain. The outside is as most people say beautiful. Nice views from all areas and with the tram running past it's lovely. Again like others , my friend and I found the tour a bore .Listen if the guide is bored how do they expect the customers to feel . No real energy or interesting facts , no ad libbing or interacting with the group .All in all a little bit of a let down and it could have been so much better as it is a wonderful building.

Magnificent decor inside. Well worth seeing... Especially the domed hall housing the crown jewels.Tour takes 40 mins approx. Recommend booking via the official website to avoid turning up on specAnd being disappointed...as well as wasting sight seeing time

Impressive architecture. The Hungarian parliament building really is a must see for anyone visiting Budapest. I'd recommend visiting the Fishermans Bastion at night to see it lit up in all its glory, and visiting it during the day after a walk along the Danube to appreciate it up close. The grounds and building itself are beautiful. We never got the chance to visit the inside as the tours were fully booked, so I would assume they fill up pretty quickly. Will be back!

Beautiful place. Ugly price . Th place is beautiful. But we only had 30 min max of tour, and it cost 5400 per person if u none EU citizen In th end there is small exhibition with a little history about the place. Nothing out of the ordinary I'd say it's more breathtaking from the outside than the inside.
Worth a visit. I would recommend booking in advance of your trip, as places for the tour(s) on the day were limited. It's a beautiful building in a great location.

Magnificent Building. The Hungarian Parliament lies alongside the Danube in the heart of Budapest. Short tours of the building are quite cheap, in a variety of languages, and last about 45 minutes. Built around the turn of the century it's one of the largest parliament buildings in the world. The design is symmetrical as, when it was built, there were two houses and each had its own chamber and facilities on each side of the building. Now there is only one house and a much smaller number of representatives. The inside is very ornate and the central dome contains the Hungarian Crown Jewels. Well worth a visit.

The most beautiful Parliament building in the world!. When I first came to Budapest in the early 90s, the Parlament (Hungarian spelling) was mainly covered in scaffolding which lasted for years whilst it was being cleaned and restored, so I was amazed to see it in all its glory, white and gleaming for all to appreciate. Inside is as amazing, with a myriad of rooms and offices - a place to get truly lost in. I like the little touches, such as the large ashtrays attached to the walls inside, so that MPs could leave their cigars whilst they went into the chamber to vote.

Landmark Building of Budapest. I think the Parliament building is the landmark of Budapest, due its huge structure it cannot be photographed in full within the close proximity, One should go for the guided tour of the Parliament building when there is no parliament session. There is a tour in English at 10:00 am and another at 12:00 noon.
River side view and good design of the building. Budapest is overall a nice city. elegant , quite, pretty well sprwad. Good mix of new and old buildings. Parliament is one of the main attractions.
Amazing inside out. it's a must-see in budapest. such a beautiful building inside-out with informative tour though you have to book earlier in the day to visit.

Impressive stricture. Worth a visit to see the impressive building and grounds. There is the first parliament building opposite with quite a harrowing depiction of a terrible massacre that happened there with markings on the building showing where bullets had hit.

One of the Must Dos..!. We took a tour of this grand building and felt it was well worth it. It gives you nice overview of the actual importance of the building and the changing times since past several hundred years. As any main building, the interior & the architecture is royal & state of the art and when you stand under the main dome, you'll be amazed. Tip - You might sprain your neck while looking up at it for too long... its really you-might-sprain-your-neck good...

Wonderful tour. You need a reservation to see the Parliament and find the time for an English guided tour. At the start of the tour, you have to climb about 300 steps, but you can ask for an elevator to get you to the top of the building, which I did and greeted the others on the tour gasping for breath as the arrived at the top of the stairs. Our guide was interesting and informative and the tour was well worth the visit. The building is exquisite and incredibly beautiful.

Awesome views. Never went inside but the building itself is indeed a piece of beautiful art - a must is to view this building at night from one of the many river cruises offered by various providers throughout the city.
Beautiful architecture. The outside of the parliment is really amazing architecturally. We didn't go inside but would imagine that the insidde would also be impressive. Definitely recommended

Must see!. One of the most beautiful buildings of Europe, stunning from far away as well as from close distances. It overlooks the river - you can check it from the mountains, ferries or just walk through the plaza next to it. Can't miss it!
Good Views. Looks amazing from the river, I recommend a river cruise if only to see the parliament building. Beautiful

A masterpiece. A magnificent building, it is always beautiful no matter looking at it from near or far, day or night, rain or shine. Take a guide tour to visit the interior if you have time but better secure the ticket by purchase online. The tour last only 45 minutes include the security check. You can only see a very small section of the building within such limited time.

Historical Visit. Definitely worth doing an hour's tour. The building is magnificent and although I've visited far more ostentatious buildings around the world, the decor and simplicity of the place is almost overwhelming.The guide knew her stuff and her command of the English language and sense of humour added to a great tour.

Very Impressive. As this is just such a huge and visible landmark on the Danube, it would be a shame not to visit and see the inside. I purchased tickets on line before leaving the U.S., saving the time having to wait in line. The entrance is crowded and somewhat chaotic. But once inside we had a tour with an English-speaking guide. The place is lavish. Definitely worth seeing.
Spectacular Architecture!!. Excellent building with great views as you walk along the river. During the night you can see its amazing splendor which is great for picture taking.

An amazing building!. Even when 'only' seen from the outside, the Hungarian parliament buildings are beautiful. "Opulent" is probably the right word, verging on the 'fairytale' of magnificence. Do walk round to the back of the parliament buildings and then learn the harsh reality of the dark events of the 1956 attempted revolution that took place behind this lovely building and reflect on the bravery of a world gone by.

Take the guided tour if you have time. We booked our ticket online and bring it there. You can choose the time and date for your visit and also the language for the tour. When reached, we queued for a short while for the scan (like in airport). After that, we collected our audio guide. The tour was short and sweet. You have just enough amount of time to snap pictures/ask questions. Interior was magnificent inside. Really recommended to take the tour.
beatiful. must see on the day and also night when all lights are on ,next to it there are other status to enjoy
