Parliament House.. Parliament Palace is a beautiful architectural monument located on the Danube. Visit guided for a fee. Parliament Palace sees great night on the Danube but also two tram line surrounding him.
Mosty photographed site. Great to see from all over Budapest and especially nice to vies at night especially if you are on a cruise on the Danube River

The most beautiful building I have ever seen. I have traveled a lot around Europe, and I can say with no hesitation that the Budapest Parliament is the most amazing building I've ever seen. Specially lighted on night, is the closest thing to a magical experience you can have nowadays.
Sam. Beautiful building with well maintained garden. Worth a visit. Take the tram number 2 from the centre along the Danube towards the Margit island.

Splendid building. The Budapest Parliament sretches between Chain Bridge and Margaret Bridge on the Pest bank of the Danube. This building is splended from the outside and from the inside. Since the price is high you should plan you visit on some National holidays when it is open to the public for free.
Beautiful place! . Very beautiful, especially in the evening, lightning was very beautiful! This place is nearby everything!
Amazing architecture. Amazing building. Great architecture and nice surroundings to walk around close to the river and the gardens there. highly recommend it.

Absolutely stunning!. Very impressive building and a great view of Pest. It's a lovely walk along the river to get to it and you pass the Shoes on the Danube bank on the way. If you're getting dropped off by the hop on/hop off bus it's a 10/15 min walk to it just to be warned! There are definitely quicker ways then the drop off.

Unique especially during night. The parliament is one of the most beautiful buildings in Budapest. But i think what makes this building awesome is the way it is lighted during night. Simply astonishing..You can t stop staring at it...Good job hungarians, amazing tourist sightseeing
Night visit. We travelled on the number 2 tram to see buildings lit up at night. During the day it was lovely walking along the Danube to the Parliament

Budapest it's extremely beautiful city But.... It's one of the most beautiful cities I've visited so far in Europe. Every single corner has something to see. The only problem was the locals, which in 98% of cases were rude, impolite, unfriendly, serious with no clear reason. Expect some rudeness and bad treatment if you visit this city.
Spectacular landmark. Even if you don't go inside this building is well worth walking past to get an idea of its sheer size! By night it is spectacularly lit up, best seen from a river cruise.
Must Visit when in Budapest.. Great building, one of the biggest Parliaments in the Europe/World. Gold style. English guide available.

Amazing near and far. You should not miss this landmark. Both metro stations take you right to this landmark! See it on the spot and cross over to the other side to see it again. Do it both daytime and nighttime. Its amazing.

Fabulous Building. Upon seeing the Parliament during a night cruise on the Danube, we couldn't wait to tour the inside. The tour lasted 45 minutes, the guide did a good job, the building is amazing. But we all left somehow unsatisfied and feeling like the entrance fee was very high.But honestly it is such a beautiful place.

Breathtaking. I see it in pictures all the time but when I saw it in person, it really did take my breath away. Probably the most beautiful Parliament I've ever seen. You can see the whole building on the Buda side of Budapest and see it upclose in Pest. The place looks so majestic in daytime and night time. Shame that we didn't get to go inside for the tour.
Impressive Building. Very informative tour which covers the building the history and the current use. worth the time to go through.

Beautiful palace . A big, big building in the pest-side. Easy to reach with tram 2 (lovely tram ride along the Danube btw). Great to see from the outside and also possible to see from the inside. This costs money and you can get a headset in several languages.

Not Enough Info. We took an English speakers tour at the end of the day. The tour guide, probably tired, didn't really seem enthusiastic or involved. The guided tour was too quick, only 45 minutes and didn't give enough info.
The building itself is GORGEOUS. The pomp and stately structure is definitely worth seeing.

Great tour, well worth planning ahead.. Great tour of the building, very interesting. You need to book ahead to get the language tour you require. The English tours get booked up very early, so either book online or go in the morning when the place opens.
Really recommend the tour inside!. Just the right amount of time and lovely interior. Really worth it and a beautiful building! Go for it.
great building but the tour inside was poor.. great at night but inside we were only aloud to see certain areas and the tour lasted less than 30 min.
Grand. Wow, it's enormous. You can get a really good view of it on the other side of the river. It's right next to Olympic part too.
A jewel of architecture . This building is really amazing. The architecture is really breath stopping. This is a huge building but seems so thin and rich. A place to visit in Budapest
Great experience. Good visitor centre, clear guide and good level of spoken english. The guide was entertaining and informative.

The Parliament is the most beautiful edifice ever seen. It is worth to visit Budapest and looking at the Parliament is just unforgettable .Do not miss the shoes! It is a must to see this magnificent place by night.

Beautiful both inside and outside . A must see for the outside and do the tour of the inside when visiting Budapest. Keep in mind that the tours are done in different languages and the English sells out very quickly it's best to book in advance. You can book the day of which we did but we're lucky. They only had 6 tickets left also Mondays they don't do as many tours.
Parliament. It was really interesting to see the guards doing their honour march next to the crown. The details on the parliament are quite cool.
Could sit and watch for days. I didn't go inside, but I sat outside it for a long time just admiring the beauty of it. Had to go back the next day again to take it all in

Ms Fiona Dunne . I went on this amazing tour this week and I would totally recommend it to everyone . I just wouldn't book through Viator again as I was charged €61 for the trip which was for two adults and a child . When I reached the cashier desk at the parliament I realised I could have purchased the same tickets there for €20 . A pure rip off in my opinion . I would advise you to purchase your tickets when you get to Budapest . If you purchase on day one you would definitely get to see the parliament by the last day of your trip . It's a short walk from the city centre
Remarkable structure. Beautiful on the inside and especially on the outside. If you look at it from across Danube river, it will take your breath away. Amazing piece of architecture!
River cruise. We never had time to visit the interior as the tour was too long to do this.However the architecture of the exterior is well worth seeing especially by boat over Lucy!

Stunning exterior. This one of the most noticeable buildings along the river in Budapest, reminded me of London. The architecture is spectacular. We didn't get chance to go inside, they were fully booked for tours on all the days we were there. If you want to go on a tour inside I would recommend pre-booking online first to avoid disappointment.

Go there at night this is great . Not been inside but the outside at night followed by the river view worth the walk. You have a look at this and then continue your walk on the river side in the direction obtuse bridge
Worth a visit. We were lucky to visit on the day that the guard was rehearsing for a formal event - impressive building but would have been good to see parliament actually in session.
Beautiful. A very beautiful and interesting tour. Definitely do this on your trip to Budapest, if you love culture ofcourse.

Very Historical. I have visited the grounds a few times in the Spring of 2016.
They currently have an underground memorial that is haunting and a must-see for those who wish to know more about the recent history of the location.
Grounds are very well upkept and feels quite safe.
Definitely a must-see for those visiting and tours

Amazingly beautiful Parliament Building. Seeing the parliament building reflected in the Danube is absolutely amazing. At dusk , the facade is lit and the atmosphere is completely captivating . This is as close to a fairy-tale castle you can get. Please go across the river and watch .

Beautiful Building; Tour Rushed. This is the most noticeable building in Budapest. It's prominent, beautiful and important. The craftsmanship is simply spectacular. By all means, see it from the outside.The tour of the inside is perhaps a bit overpriced, but more importantly too impersonal and rushed. The groups are quite large -- at least the English ones -- and the guides speak through a microphone broadcast to a remote headset you wear. The guides provide basic background information, but the tour isn't particular set up for questions, illustrations, or detail To give one small example: There was is a beautiful corridor, and the guide points out the magnificent ceramic statues up-high that were specially crafted for the building. Each represents a different guild from the late nineteenth century (there are maybe 30 or so). But no examples of what the guilds are, and before there is time to even take a look, the tour moves on to the next room. There were plenty of other interesting features of the building. Unfortunately, the tour does too little to help you explore them. (Honestly, the A/V "museum" room at the end of the tour -- which you can see without the tour, was much more interesting and informative than the tour itself. Rating is 4 for building but 2 for tour. If you are in a rush, the tour is for you!
Breath taking. From all angles this is a beautiful building. One should see it close up and also form far away. Architecturally a master piece

Worthwile. we booked in advance but you could also buy tickets in the day. It was a bit chaotic when your tour was due to start but I think this was due to 2 different languages tours starting at the same time. You get earphones to wear and we could hear the guide clearly albeit he was a bit cheesy but also very cheery and upbeat. The tour was very interesting and building is beautiful and takes about 45 minutes.
Beautiful building. This is a beautiful building and you can go close to it for photographs. Nice surroundings by the water.
Interesting place. An interesting place with perfect architecture, perfect for photos and to look around. There are a lot of things and architectural techniques to look in it
Lovely view. Lovely place to sit and relax and can walk on to the bridge to the other side to the Bud castle taxi are cheap

It's a must. Great place, we had the tour in english with a great guide. The price is 2400 huf for adults. The tour takes 1 hour and you will sea the northern part of the building. You can take photos, except the crown room.

The "must see". We managed to see this spectacular from both a coach at night(lit up and wow!!)and a river cruise on the River Danube.Although we enjoyed the castle district at Buda,this was something very special.We tried to get a tour on the day but unfortunately they were sold out. Visited 4th may 2016
Amazingg place . Great building near metro ..garden is amazing on the danub ..relaxing view and great history.must see in budapest walk around

Walk in the sun. What a fantastic place so clean and well kept the buildings are wonderful Next to the river We played in a fountain with spontaneous water spouts Great place lovely people would recomend
The nicest building in Budapest. This is the nicest building in Budapest. The Kossuth Square also very nice. If you have time you also can go in.
the most beautiful building in Budapest inside as well as outside. Really worth visiting and even having a bite if possible in the restaurant. So much Hungarian history in beautiful surrounding.

Majestic Building. One of the oldest parliament in Europe, and still the tallest building in Budapest. Highly recommend you come to visit two time, at night from the other side of Danube and day time. Very easy to get there by Metro. Unfortunately we arrived on May first, so many places were closed.

Beautiful visit but reserve your tour ahead of time. You can only get in with a language tour and they sell out quickly, even online so reserve early. We chose to go on the Spanish tour which we muddled through but it was our last day and only chance to see the inside of the parliament which is as beautiful on the inside as it is on the outside.
Beautiful walk and views. We just visited the exterior of the parliament. Easily reached by both metro and tram. Grounds were beautiful with lovely views over the river to the castle.
Well worth a visit. Booked online so didn't have to queue. Opulent splendour inside and out. A must see at night from the river as it is stunning.

Worthwhile Visit. Absolutely amazing building spectacular building with tour of the chambers booked online with Jegymester. Tour was £5 per person and last approx 40 mins and not the hour as advertise tho to be honest it was long enough. It's the outside if the building that u will find more amazing...with a beautiful walk along the Danube
Amazing Architecture. Alongside Danube River it is an amazing architecture. Great view from Buda side. Book your guided tour in advance in your preferred language.

Beautiful and good history . We were here as a group of 20. We had the tour of the inside. This is highly recommended. The guide was good and very easy to understand. The inside surely is beautiful and cannot be recommended enough.I did find it quite short and we were ushered out quickly. We were followed and not allowed to roam at all. Picture taking was on instruction and you can't just take it anyhow.All of that aside you will be awed by the beauty awaiting you inside.

Beautiful...day or night. Was lucky enough to be in a river cruise ship parked opposite the Parliment Building...it's amaz, both in the day and at night. Very interesting inside as well...worth the time to do a tour

Beautiful place but make a reservation up front!. If you want to do the 45 minute tour, you should either be there early in the morning or make a reservation online! The parlement building itself is really pretty and our tour guide told us a lot of info!
Stunning views!. A must see if you visit Budapest - I went to see it on a river cruise in the evening and it was breathtaking! (The same cannot be said for the on - board entertainment though!).
Awesome!. Budapest is nice place. Easy transportation, delicious and cheaper meals, awesome buildings and lights everywhere up in nights! You can visit by walking all center.
a must visit. This is a great building to visit and the guides are also very welcoming. Te views around the parliament are also great.
Must see!. Enjoy the beautiful Parliment in Budapest. Just arrive early in the morning to book a tour in English...

Get inside the Hungarian Parliament Building. The tour that the Parliament offers is great. You get inside the chambers (as long as they aren't meeting!)Our tour guide was tremendous (sorry don't remember her name) and gave us stories and behind the scenes information while showing is the building, which is obviously a huge source of pride for the Hungarian people.Take the tour if you have some time...you won't regret it.

Amazing architecture and history on the Danube. A great experience to see the parliament building in all its glory sitting alongside the River Danube. Can get a great view of it from the Buda side of the city especially at night from the bridges or the banks of the river. A must see if visiting Budapest with the tram line 2 stopping right outside.

Outstanding Building. Only accessible with tickets on a guided tour. Tours are in most languages, but need to be booked. English sells out very quickly and is best booked on line in advance on line.There are discounts for EU citizens, EU access is about £6, non EU is £14, you need proof of EU citizenship to get the discount.Building is magnificent inside and out and well worth the visit.Just outside to the front are 2 (free) underground exhibits, one of the October 1956 massacre and revolution and the other on restoration of the building. Both worth visiting.
Stunning from the outside. We chose not to go inside but just enjoy the architecture from the outside and don't regret that. We saw it both during the day and night and it is picturesque at any time.

beautiful building. book a trip by night on a boat on the Donau, the Parliament and the bridges are beautifully lit.
You get the best view from the other side of the Donau (the Buda side)

Srunning when lit up at night. Craftmenship and design that does not exist today. Great night time photogrophy. View in the evening then stop for dinner at the Budapest Bestro just a block away, sit outside and watch the light change.

Stunning Architecture. Beautiful buildings all around and amazing detailing on the buildings themselves. The main parliament building won a design competition but second place which is equally stunning is right behind. Changing of the guards is worth a look also. We didn't use the visitor centre or go inside, maybe next time!

Magnificent. Stunning at night, viewing from the Buda side of the river (where you'll also find somewhat less touristy and nice restaurants). Highly recommended staying around the Buda end of Elisabeth bridge (e.g. Hotel Orion): peaceful area, easy access to panoramic views from Gellért Hill and Buda Castle, 10 min walk across the bridge to city centre on Pest side.Digression: 1. Taxi fare costs about 7000 Hungarian Forints from the airport to Buda side of Elisabeth bridge. We paid over 14000 Forints (got conned by a driver who scorned at Gypsies)2. Currency exchange best done in Budapest - google for TripAdvisor advice ("hungarian currency").

Very beautiful and pompous. a very beautiful and pompous building. Went there for an hour just for enjoying the sight and take a lot of photographs. The sun was shining and people was sitting on benches or just stood and looked at the building or the soldiers at the entrances. Next time in Budapest I will take the tour inside the building.

Impressive building . It is an amazing building and an impressive structure. We only viewed it from the outside so not sure if a tour about it is necessary. By night, the building is lit up which makes for an impressive feature along the river.

Beautiful. The Parlament is an amazing building, just by the river. Its' light that is spot on, during the evening and nights are fantastiskt, it shines far away. Doesn't matter if you are on the Pest side or the Buda side of Budapest.

Amazing Building that needs to be visited at night. The outside of the parliament building is stunning. I highly recommend you take some time to give visit it. There are tours of the inside of the building. They only offer guided tours and they start at specific times depending on the language you speak. I highly recommend you book your tickets in advance to make sure you get the time you desire and actually get to go in. The tour lasts about 45 minutes. If you are able to, visit the building again later at night. We walked on the opposite side of the river and it was amazing.

Worth a tour - otherwise just enjoy the exterior!. Make sure you book tickets in advance - price 2200 HUF pp. The tour takes about 45 minutes and is worth doing. The exterior of the Parliament is absolutely stunning as is the smallish part of the interior covered by the tour.

Just eye filling. What to say? Go there during the day or at night, you'd love it, nothing much to do so don't plan to spend a lot of time around, maybe if you want to set and have a little time to reflect on your life, or how tiny you are compared to this place 😁
Parliament. The building is beautiful inside and out, try and do a tour if you have time. It's worth it to see the crown and the beautiful architecture.
Fantastic !!!!!. It was a fantastic monument especially through the night. The size and and the lightings in comparison wake tha view really great!!! Definitely worth the visit!!!

Fabulous building inside and out. We booked our tour online before leaving for a break in Budapest. The cost for us as EU citizens was 2000Ft or just over £5 each.When you arrive at Parliament the Visitor Centre is at the North end of the building and you access it down stairs to a very modern underground complex. There are nice, clean free toilet at the Visitor Centre. Although yourself a few minutes to get your bearings and be prepared for the airport style security.The tour got underway pretty much on time and the lady dong our tour got the formalities out of the way. Our guide explained that there would be plenty of time for photographs at each stage and also gave very good information throughout. The only place that you cannot take photos is in the room under the dome which houses the crown.The building itself is very grand and beautiful inside and certainly worth a visit. The tour lasts 45 minutes and finishes in an excellent information centre. We stayed a further 30 minutes viewing the history and development of the site. Many attendees brushed over this room. I would strongly recommend spending some time here.
Monumental. After so many years of restauration, we can see this fascinating building without staging in full of glory. One of the most breathtaking building in whole Europe.

A great way to get an understanding on the history of Parliament as well as the building. You need to order your tickets in advance as it is too busy to just buy on th day. There are numerous tours in different languages at different times so you need to pick the right time.They screen you through detectors as this is a live parliamentary building. The guide gives you a good understanding on the building as well as the history.Well worth the tour. You get some great insight into the history and building.
Budapest is as beautiful as any place in Europe . Why did it take me so long to visit? Budapest is gorgeous- do inch to see. The parliament building by day or night is a site to be seen.

My new favourite parliamentary building. Such a beautiful building, the design and architecture is breath taking. We went on a Saturday and happened upon the guards "performance" which is slightly like the changing of the guard but the guards didn't change! This was 12:30 so might be daily. Took the parliament tour which was great! Wished it was a bit longer so we could see more of the interior but understand why it was limited. Only thing that was a little annoying was the entrance through security. It was quite messy and not as efficient as I hoped. But still great tour with a good english speaking guide. Definitely recommend pre booking your tickets online, cheaper for EU citizens by about 50%

Impressive. Everywhere you turn in this city, there is always something nice to look at. This is the most outstanding site on Pest and definitely the biggest site to look at from Buda. Beautiful architecture.

Make sure you book tickets first! . Well worth the £5 entrance fee. Very informative tour with headphone to hear tour guide whose English was excellent. As beautiful inside as out, plenty of photo opportunities . Lasts 45 mins.

I'm so happy I visited it! . The huge palace offers a breathtaking scenery expecially during the evening, when it is completely enlightned! It's magic! The visit to the inside is totally worth! It is possible only with a guide, and i suggest that you book the visit online, since the number of visitors allowed is limited; you will avoid the queue, and you will need to print the ticket in advance. The tour lasts less than one hour.

Beautiful building. We only saw it from the outside. Tours were too expensive for what you could actually see or do on the inside. No pictures allowed inside. It is huge building that our city guide said was far too large & expensive for the Country. It is fully lit at night as is most of Budapest that can be seen from the Danube River.

Magnificent building. This is well worth a visit the building is a wonderful example of magnificent architecture,there is an underground visitor centre and you can walk along the Danube river from here.

Just a quick walk around this time. I took the tour inside the parliament building last time I was here which I thought was very interesting and well worth it. This time it was just a quick walk around the building as it's a pretty amazing piece of architectural magnificence. A must see.

Historical. The tour starts at 10am and another later (around 11am if I recall correctly), costs 2000Ft (about £6) for EU (slightly more for other countries) and takes about 40 minutes. Commentary, via headphones, is in German for one group and English in the other.The building, impressive from the outside is even more so inside and covered in many places with gold leaf and stained glass windows. Our guide explained all the features at every juncture, statues of previous kings in the large dome etc and provided an excellent review of Hungarian history. Strangely enough, the Hungarians show scant to no interest in their history before, during and shortly after the Roman period and also during the Communist era. Their history starts at 896AD with the establishment of the conquest of the Magyars. There are many photo opportunities - The 2 chambers, similar to British House of Commons and Lords and other halls but not for the crown with the bent cross.If you like history and splendid architecture, this tour is definitely worth the money

Probably the most photographed building in Budapest. One of the must-visit places in Budapest. The best time to take pictures of the facade of the Parliament building from across the river is in the afternoon and at dusk when it is illuminated. We went to the parliament grounds ( FOC ) in the morning and took the red M2 metro to Batthyany ter in the evening for the evening view.
History and great architecture. Very informative tour. Lots of gold decoration. Well worth visit. We were scammed by a taxi back to the center. Take the tram or the Metro!

Spectacular and iconic... Not only is this sensational iconic building breathtakingly beautiful when it is illuminated at night, it is simply gorgeous by day and the inside is absolutely beautiful. Guided tours are offered, many in English, and our wait wasnt at all long. The tour was fantastic even affording us the opportunity to see the Crown Jewels, amazing.

Interesting, but something is missing. Booked a tour of the parliament and went on it. It is interesting, but thwy don't even show you all the important rooms, you onlywalk through some corridors. And if the thing is important you're not allowed to take pictures. Too little details.

Really beautiful building. The building itself is gorgeous and a must-see attraction in Budapest. Very easy to get there by subway, and visitors should also take a walk on the sidewalks aside from the Danube when the sun sets. The guided tour was interesting, but the accent was sometimes hard to understand and the mic and headphones full of white noise. The interior, however, was really impressive.

Stunning. They say that the Hungarians spent enough money on these building to build a town for 60 000 people. Expense was not spared and they made a great job of it. Take a camera and take some time to see it all
Parliament. From outside, the parliament looks stunning, and from inside it's the same. Our tour guide was very enthusiastic and told us all about the history of the building.

A must see!. Very well organized site visit inside the parliament. Amazing place and lot of history! Be prepared to take Selfies at dawn. The surrounding properties tell stories which will amaze everyone. The warmth in local folks adds to the flavor and will remind you to travel back to Budapest agin and again!!

nice architecture. the hole city looks old and beautiful magnificent architecture the parliament is one of the best sites to visit in the city .go early or buy ur tickets online i think it was around 40 euros with hotel pick up .

Reviews said the Parliament is magnificent! It is!. We read the great reviews and decided to get tickets for a tour. Go early or sign up online as there are so many people who are aware of this parliament. We had an historian tour guide who led us in English throughout with great insights. There are tour guides in various languages such as Russian and Italian. English tours were running each hour in the afternoon. We were so thankful we got a 4:30 PM tour! The parliament is absolutely magnificent!

One of the most spectacular buildings in the world. I have seen the parliament already for the second time, but it still took my breath away.The building is just amazing. We didn't go inside, but still you can spend there hours just taking pictures from different ankles or just chilling with coffee on the bench while admiring the beauty.It also worth to go to the opposite riverside as the view is great, especially in the night.
Amazing. You have to visit this building, it's amazing... by day is fantastic to turn around and if you have time to visit inside. By night is astonish

Love this architecture. Definitely the most beautiful building of Budapest. Nearly Danube River, marvellous at the dust. In walking distance you can see whole attractions od Budapest. Spent 3 days in this beutiful city, and definitely come back there.
Spetacular scene at night. Amazing building only made more spectacular at night from the river when all the lights in the city and building and bridges are on.
Well worth it!. A Hungarian friend recommended we go on the tour and are so glad we took his recommendation. Absolutely beautiful. The museum afterwards was also interesting.

Budapest in it's most beautyfull way! . If you have not see the Parlement, you missed it all! It is a building so beautyfull and the inhabitants are so proud of it! I only can tellen you: don't miss it!😊

Amazing place, don't miss it!. Well worth the entrance fee. An amazing building and a great insight. Leave plenty of time at the end for the museum, it looks a little dry, but the documentaries are really well produced and fascinating.

Amazing place. You have to see inorder to believe how amazing this place is. We took a tour there.
Come with your tickets printed or you'll need to stand in another line

Impressive Architecture both Day and Night. Being right next to the Danube with no other big buildings competing for the skyline, this is a great place to visit and take beautiful pictures. We walked here from the Sofitel Hotel along the river bank, visiting the shoes and then walking up to the Parliament. A metro station is also there for buying a set of 11 tickets, which we used to take the street car up and down the river bank. At night, with our river cruise leaving Budapest, we also had a great night view of this building.

Beautiful place and view. Amazing view by day,beautiful and romantic at night. Easy way to arrive to the parliment best view is through the metro station batthyany ter. Really nice to sit and enjoy the city view

The world's third largest Parliament building. We didn't have time to take a tour of the Parliament unfortunately. However, the building is beautiful and worth visiting both during the day and after dark to see it lit up on the riverside.

One of my favorite buildings ever!. If you want to have have the full Parliament experience, I recommend to take a guided tour. While the tour is pretty short, it's very informative and you get to see the Parliament in its full glory! Make sure you book your ticket in advance as spaces are very limited.

Must see place. We were able to get tickets the morning we visited for the interior tour. It is a short tour (they say 50 minutes, but this includes leaving you for 10 minutes at a display room at the end). In spite of the brevity of the tour, it is a great tour as the building has ridiculously cool architecture.

Nice guided tour, beautiful place, go there if you have the time.... The place is truly beautiful and the architecture and interior design are amazing, although the idea of this lavishness in a parliament is very disturbing...The guided tour is good and tells some interesting points about Hungarian history and the building itself.We would recommend to go there if you have the time but if on a tight schedule the don't feel too bad about missing it.Tip: book the tickets beforehand online to skip the queue.

Wonderful, a 'must do' in Budapest. We booked our tickets in advance from the UK to save the queues on the day. The parliament building is wonderful and we had a really interesting guided tour. The best photos of the building can be taken from the other side of the river.

Fabulous building viewed from Castle Hill. However greatly disappointed when we came to visit the interior
Tourists outside of the EU are not welcome by being charged almost twice the entry as EU visitors at an expensive 5400
No longer permitted individual entry & have to go on an hour long tour
Expect also to wait up to an hour for a tour

An overwhelmingly beautiful building. This is the second largest parliament building (after London) but the art and architecture are second to none. There are numerous tours in English every day. Some guidebooks suggest that these tours are free, but not so. And it is advisable to book ahead online. Tours sell out quickly, especially on weekends or bad weather days.

Beautiful. If you like history, politics or architecture then you will enjoy Parliament. The tour was quick and short which was nice because for me personally I am not into politics or architecture but it truly was worth my time. My class really thought it was a beautiful building and we really enjoyed the trip. The Parliament is gorgeous inside and out, you cannot miss this when you visit the city.

Guided tour Inside. For non EU residents this costs about 5000 HUF. The tour goes for about 45 minutes and gives you access to the main indoor staircase, one of the actual parliament chambers no longer used and the crown. This tour is very informative and interesting provided lots of facts about Hungary's political history. You have to book the tour either online or in person at the desk as they have different times for different languages and maximum number of participants so it is best to plan your visit rather than just show up. Highly recommend particularly if you have an interest in politics and architecture.
Nice building.. Take pictures from fisherman's bastion. 'Shoes' are right in front of it at the riverside. Change of guards can be seen at other side. Easy reachable with metro.
Magnificent . It looked like an enchanted castle! I think was greater than Budapest's castle!you won't miss it ! You can walk from there and take a danube cruise and see the whole city
the sparkling parliament. the guided tours are very comprehensive. the parliament house is definitely one of the most beautiful in europe. don"t miss it

Truly amazing!. We paid for a tour at a price of about £4 per person. It was worth the price, but you must visit in the evening when it is all lit up. The view from the river cruise was well worth a trip.

Glad I booked a ticket online. Very interesting tour. English tour guide was very informative. Was glad I booked ahead of time online and printed my ticket. Buying tickets on the day can be hit or miss. When I arrived half an hour before my scheduled group tour, all the tickets for english time frame were sold out already.

Not worth it, horribly expensive. First of all, the visits announced in the various languages on the Hungarian Ticket Master website do not match the times of the visit once inside. We got there hoping to get tickets for the next sessions but got told everything was sold out for the day and we could not buy tickets for the next day on the spot. I had to buy them online, thank God I have a Hungarian debit card, the fees must be horrible. The next day, we came back for our visit at 3 o'clock. We did not know we were allowed to pass security only FROM 3, taking time away from the actual visit. No proper queue, a rush of tourists trying to get to the front of the line, a rude person scanning the ticket not saying hello nor smiling... We entered and tried to check our coats. The girl literally ignored us for ten minutes. I had to address her in Hungarian to finally have her answer. No coats, only suitcases. OK, but then, display it somewhere.Then we started the visit, the 3 of us with 47 other person (the group size is 50 people, it's huge). The guide's English was very poor, she had a strong accent and no sense of the language. Her speech was very flat, it was very difficult to understand her (and as a ESL teacher, I know about English) and she would not repeat anything, not even the questions she got asked. People are rushing to take photographs and bump into you with no shame to get the best shots. The guide presents a very politically correct version of the Hungarian politics, too blend to be true. I did not learn anything, as I could not understand her or even sometimes hear her from the headphones. This visit was a pricey waste of time.

The Iconic building on the Danube riverside.. This building is, by day or by night, one of the loveliest I have ever seen; sitting by the Danube it becomes a major landmark of any-ones visit; it can be visited internally by guided tour at certain times of the day.The square in front of the Parliament building was the site of an uprising in 1956 and there is an underground memorial museum (free) to the many lives lost; it is well worth a visit, but be prepared to have the smile wiped from your face; very disturbing!
Very beautiful building. Easy to reach by Metro or tram, the station just infront of the building. The Parliament Building is very beautiful with a lot of pigeons and good for taking a picture
huge. Amazingly large and beautiful.We only saw it from the outside. It is lit up at night. Best from a river cruise in the evening.
Nice tour. One of the highlights of our visit to Budapest. Informative guide with headsets. Worth the tour just to see the gold decorative ceilings.

Enjoy night walk at Budapest. I just realize that the name of Budapest comes from two cities. Buda and Pest. This building is located in Pest area in it is amazing if viewed from Buda side in the evening, because of the lights and water reflection from Danube river.
Beautiful Buliding. What a lovely building. Great to see in the day but please view this at night especially when on a cruise. Fantastic sight

must see. Really nice and really huge building. You need to go there twice, once in daytime and once in the night. If you go the the other side of Danube just front of the Parliament then you can see the whole building with river front of it. Amazing.

Impressive building. When you get out of the metro station, you cross the street and get just in front of the Parlement on the other side of the Danube river.It's really impressive and beautiful architecture.
Goegeous!. Most beautiful building in Budapest! Unbelievable at night, especially. Definitely worth doing a night cruise to see it, and the rest of Budapest, all lit up.

A parliament is a must!. It is very elegant, full of history, good to see.You can also see the Hungarian crown (around thousend years old), and other state symbols. The Primeminister and the President of the parliament are based here,too. I have been there a few times and always felt priviliged to be there.
very impressive.. Walked along river path to see this incredible building. Also took photos of it when floodlit during a rive cruise. A truly impressive building.
Beautiful. This is a beautiful place that reminds me of the British Parliment building. The views from across the river are great and the views at night are the best
nice building in beautiful scenery. nice building in beautiful scenery , impressive from the boat trips and all other points of viewing from the shores of Danube
nice view. the place was great and view is very nice. had time to look around when weather is fine. the structure is very nice.

Great inside tour of an amazing building. The Parliament was by far our favorite site in Budapest, and lit up at night it looks amazing (book a river tour). The tour was around 45 minutes but you got to see a lot more than I thought. The tour guide gave very interesting information at each stop. Including the crown, and the actual parliament chamber itself. It was nice to see this beautiful building both inside and out.
Fantastic building. Immaculate building. Huge. Guards were interesting how they marched around there small area. Must see building

Excellent three quarter of hour Tour. Booked via Hotel Reception. Saved almost 50% on Tour Operators site. You can just turn up but by no means certain of getting on a Tour as these sell out quickly...

Not worth the money!. This building is stunning at night when viewed from the Pest side. Do not take this tour it is a total waste of money! They say the tour lasts 45 minutes but about the first 10 involve going through security. You see very little and it is obvious that there is a rush to get you out so they can get the next tour through.

Awesome building. The architect made the building so it could look like the Westminster in London. But in my opinion this one is better, the white paiting gives a different look and its just on the side of the Danube with a great view to Buda.

Must Visit!. Its worth doing the tour as within a short visit you see so much and hear lots about the country and its history.Differently timed tours cover all languages which make it so accessible and with the headsets no problem with hearing the guideInside the Parliament building was fascinating, how do those soldiers guarding the crown stay so still!!
architectural structure is impressive!. Amazing architecture!An impressive building on dunabe river! You can best enjoy it while on a boat ride!

Wonderful building with a guided tour in English and some other languages as well.. A wonderful architecture outside and a fascinating interior with beautifully preserved objects of the past that are more than 100 years old. I am deeply impressed each occasion I pay a visit to this building (with a foreign group) albeit I am Hungarian. For a foreigner it must be an experience of a life time, I am sure.

Imposing and grand place, must be one of Europe's grandest Parliaments. Impressive architecture and a Parliament of almost 300 meters length, 691 rooms and 27 entrance gates. Though a neo-gothic building, it has a touch of Asian/Oriental architecture. Only visited the external areas (inside visits only possible in groups). The complex houses the (comparatively small) Hungarian Parliament as well as the Office of the President, and the Cabinet plus other official State Rooms.Outside a Guard of Honour.
Most beautiful building in Budapest. Can't get enough of the sight of this building. It's great to see from the Buda part, up close, and from the river.

A public building not to be missed. Budapest does not have many public buildings of interest but this is one of them. It is covered with gold leaf on the inside, was built to be a little bigger than the English House of Parliament, and is truly over the top. Don't miss it.

A genuine experience, both in the morning/at night. Residing the river Danube, the Hungarian Parliament Building is the largest parliament building in vicinity regions. With the nearly 1-hour guided tour, you can explore the magnificent construction of this parliament.Lights were lit at night and shined upon the river Danube. You can take a tramway to visit the amazing night view of this parliament building (or even walk along the river if the weather is allowed).Tips: make a booking ahead, tickets usually sold out in the morning.
Impressive architecture. Have you ever fallen in love with architecture of a building? This is a place where it could happen. Amazing Parliment! Check by yourself.

Parliament Building. A must especially at night when lit up also a short walk to the left of the building are shoes. Boots etc that are cast onto the pavement where people leave flowers. Candles etc this is where people fell in the cross fire
Short tour. It was nice to see inside as its such an impressive building and the tour was short. Recommend to pre book the day before.
Breathtaking architectural beauty!. I would add this place to the world wonders as it's absolutely gorgeous - one of the 'must see' places in Europe and perhaps the whole world.

Icon of Budapest. The Parliament's interieur is also unique and worth for visit by guided tours.
The building hosts the royal crown, displayed under the Cupola.
fantastic building. A lovelly building on the outside and the inside was fantastic.Very decorative.Guided tour was very imformative
Great place to see. Brilliant tour. Really interesting and wonderful to see Parliament from the inside. Really colourful and grand.

Very nice and wealthy building. This parliament building looks amazing. It shows the wealthy history of the country. There is nice guidance through the building. On weekend days its advisable to make reservatiob

Interesting . This is a beautiful building with an interesting history. The place has tours which run every so often and I would highly recommend going on one of them- they're very informative and you get to see the beautiful inside.
Beautiful! . The building and it's surroundings are amazing! If you have the possibility, visit it also at night, since the building is all light up.
Take a short tour inside . Very interesting building and it's history .. Take a short tour inside . Very interesting building and it's history . The tours runs every hour on different languages .

More bling than substance. This is a beautifully stunning building. Both inside and outside. The visitor centre , where the tour starts, is an absolute chaos. Impossibly to hear the instructions of the tour leads and no way of telling when your tour starts (unless you are at the very front of a large crowd of people. The tour itself felt rushed and the guide sounded like she was just reading a script. We didn't see half as much of the place as we'd hoped. Id check up on Goolge before and after if you'd like a bit of info to go with your tour.
Wonderful city in east europe. I have been travel to Budapest ,,i have heard people say it s very nice capital city,,,,so it is so true ,,i like city people and foods here ,,,
Amazing place to visit. This place is wonderful outside and inside. It's beautifully designed and has wonderful view. It's place you need to take plenty of pictures.

Breathtaking Beauty. We cruised in at after 10 PM and the sight of this enormous Parliament building lit up truly took my breath away!!! Nothing compared with seeing it in person, at night, with a full moon welcoming us to Budapest!!! The memory will forever be etched in my mind. Viewing it during the day was also nice but not the same. It is a massive and impressive building!Tried to get tickets to take a tour but were sold out quite early each day, so keep that in mind.

Breathtaking. Budapest Parliament is my favourite building in the world, it is magnificent, I could stand an stare at it all day. Make sure you visit at night when it is lit up, spectacular. Beautiful beautiful Budapest.

Etkileyici / Attractive. Özellikle gece aydınlatması parlamento binasına ayrı bir güzellik katıyor. Elizabeth köprüsünden gece görüntüsü muhteşem diyebilirim. Especially at night the wiev of the Parlament Building is fabulous. I recommend night boat tour and take photo while the boat passing thorough in front of it.
Lovely Building. Lovely Building to take pics off, and see the true essence of Budapest. We didn't go inside this time around however its on my list for my return trip to Budapest.
Clean spacious and beatiful. Amazing building from afar and up close, so clean and spacious. The monuments around it are quite something.
Must see. An amazing building both inside and out worth the admission fee but remember to take id with you in order to buy admission tickets.
Perfect. Unique building, very beuitiful inside, definitely go inside and take tour, must see in Budapest for sure

Cannot really rate inside because we could not get in our fault. We wanted to visit this attraction from the outside it is amazing but when we went to purchase tickets they only do a couple of set time for small parties which we could have come back.So we decided to purchase two tickets but because we did not have our Eu passport or driving licence the price was kicked up to extortionate prices ?? .I can understand from a security point of view needing the Id but as a non Eu member the price quadroupled .I am an Eu citizen but I cannot understand why this hike is needed.
Need to book. Check the time slots for the tour and take passport or some form of identification.Go one street behind as there are lots of other things to see
Majestic!. Loved gazing over from the outside and later was given a tour with an expert lady guide who spoke fluent English. Amazing architecture.
Book ahead. Reservations required for tours of the interior. Stunning architecture. Don't miss the 1956 Memorial below the square.

Pretty!. Nice to view from buda or from the danova river(:
Great to run and look..
(:
Huge place with amazing architecture

Magnificent building. We had the opportunity to view this beautiful building in different ways, and each was well worth it. First, we took a cruise past it at night- a breathtaking view! Next, we saw it on a bus tour from the outside. Finally, we took the tour of the interior; I envy the lucky legislators who get to work here each day.

Looking good from far outside, but.... Hard to describe the bad feeling in this building. Full of lies, and not only because the politicians. The building has no professional maintenance and the security team is agresive. We are allowed to visit many places. Huge disappointment.
Must see. What else to say? This is a must food every visitor. A bit of a mad building, but due to its colossal structure and abundance of ornaments it's breathtaking, especially at night.

Tour. -The building is amazing-The tour is nice but a little to crowded and we couldn't hear the guide wellAll an all a must place to see in Budapest oneof the most beautiful buildings that I have ever saw.

The tour is nice, its a lot of walking and stair climbing. Wear comfy shoes and don't get two close to the crown jewels, the swords and soldiers are real! The room at the end is amazing regarding the building, rebuilding and modifications over time. Don't just blow by - this was worth the entry fee by itself

Don't Waste Your Time. Long waiting lines, pushing and shoving. For the price of admission we were rushed through only a small portion of Parliament. Once inside, very elegant and formal. Beautifully lit up at night. Other sights more worthwhile.

Impressive building but poor orchestration. The building is fantastic and worth seeing but there are some major drawbacks to the tour: Very large tour groups.Very poor organisation to get the groups through the security checks.A not particularly informative tour.Quite expensive compared to other, better tours such as the opera house.
Great architecture. My family and I were impressed in architecture. So great decoration. Tour was so short for this great building I think we should have seen more.

Amazing sightseeing. An amazing building especially when you are from the opposite site of Danube you look all the view.The river the chain bridge and the parliament in my opinion is the best view in whole Europe.
Beautful building. I did not go inside but admired it from a river boat as well as walking around it. The detail is incredible. Best to take pics when the sun is reflecting on it. Beautiful.

Beautiful building. Worth a trip to view the outside of the Parliament and surrounding area. We were lucky enough to catch a changing of the guard type thing which looked a bit like a square dance but couldn't say what time it happens each day as it was 11.25 when we saw it. Worth checking times before you go.

Gorgeous building. You can pay and visit inside the parliament building and get discount if you are under 26. The tours take place at set times with set language tour guides at specific times, so you best to head there first thing to book your viewing tour for later on in the day :) beautiful building and very experienced tour guides. Highly recommended

one of the best spots in Europe. gorgeous building, highly recommend the tour as well, because it is an incredible experience. make sure to observe the parliament from all sides, and across the danube.
Dreamy Budapest . Parliament house is the one of the biggest and iconic building of Budapest ... Day and night has different views... Boat is the best way to see there

Breathtakingly beautiful. The parliament building is a sight to behold by day but please dont miss this awesome building by night. The reflection of the light onto the danube glows like prescious gems and is like nothing Ive seen before!
Amazing. Just so amazing building!! It has a free space and it's very close to the Donau so you can include a walk to there :)

in the bowels of parliament. to view the parliament and the crown of King Stephen it is necessary to book a trip and they are in many languages at different times. this is not suitable for under 12 years of age
beautiful building. the parliament building is stunning best viewed from the river on a nice little cruise with a cool beer and camera at hand.
Worth the trip. Very cool to see such an awesome building just off the danube. Very much a must visit. Tours are available for in the morning.

stunning building. This enormous, beautiful gothic building (the largest in Hungary, apparently) is a must-visit, even if you only have a look at it from outside. Sitting on the banks of the Danube, there are also stunning views of the building as you pass on the boat. It's lit up at night and in well-maintained grounds in a nice area of the city.
A trip to the past. Worth a visit. Unique structures; easy to get to. There are over 484 rooms. Our guide said that it was built to show off Budapest that was in the shadow of Vienna.

Beautiful on the outside, interesting on the inside. The Hungarian Parliament has an amazing architecture. I couldn't get enough of it during the day and at night it's amazing! I've visited it inside too, it was really interesting what the guide told us, even if I'm from Romania and Romanian and Hungarian history is linked, so I already knew a few things.
Breathtaking!!!!. Visited in the daytime and during the night.What beautiful architecture.The guided tours are limted though and of course not in our language (Greek). Just plain beautiful.
Shruti . Very Grand...Lovely view when it's lit up at night. A night cruise is the best way to see Budapest. A must when u are here.
Stunning building. Parliament is beautiful. The square around the building is big and it sits along the river. It's definitely worth a short walk around.
Gian. It's really giant and so beuteaful!Worth seeing the replacement of guard.And a cold winter in Budapest - get dressed well

The Architecture is Stunning. The Budapest House of Parliament, kinda has a medieval feeling to it. It's so beautiful like a lot of places in Budapest. The only down side is that the tour of the building is 30 dollars, I don't think they allow flash photography inside.

Interesting Tour. We had the hotel concierge book an English tour for us. We tried to do it online ourselves but couldn't figure it out. The concierge printed tickets for us. Tours meet in the underground visitor center at the farthest end of the building. Everyone is given a hearing device so that the guide can speak in a normal voice and everyone in the large groups can hear. A guard accompanies the group to make sure no one lingers and to lock doors after the group is out of a room. The building is where the government functions so expect to see police and soldiers and to be expected to stay with your group. Lingering on your own to take photos isn't allowed but there is time to take photos along the way. I would have liked more time in some places but I understood why we had to maintain the required schedule. The tour was informative. The building is impressive both inside and outside. It's worth a visit.

Great building. What a great building to see. It is lovely. Make a stop by, even if you don't go in. There is a little market out the front too. And make sure you see it from the other side of the water for the best view.
Stunning building . A must do tour. The building is fantastic and history varied. Try and time it so you get to see the changing if the guard at the Crown room.

Not your average parliament building!. Was one of our pre visit musts and not disappointed. Went on one of the free walking tours and our guide advised to book in advance. We did this over the phone on line and our hotel Three Corners Art Hotel printed the tickets off for us. Fabulous building, cathedral like, wood and gold leaf. Guide was very informative hardly any questions needed to be asked. To be recommended.
It was amazing. Did the tour inside the parliament and it was just amazing. I loved it. Well worth the money. Also try the soup at the cafe inside the parliament.

The Symbol. Every city has a symbolic building. In Budapest it is the Parliament. Established to be the leading edifice of a then very large country, the Austro-Hungarian Monarchy, and the then one of the fastest developing European cities, Budapest, it stands as a gem on the shore of the Danube. Elegant, grand, beautiful inside and outside. Don't miss it.

Breathtaking and interesting. We pre booked online and arrived just a few minutes before. The tour was well organised and lasted about an hour. We each had an audio device which allowed the guide to talk to us all so we could hear. Very interesting history and a must see for any trip to Budapest.

Renovated square in front of Parliament building. Even if you don't get a chance to have an inside tour (nice architecture, so if you are into it, it might worth a visit), just to visit the Parliament building from the outside can be a great experience. I would definitely recommend going there in the night as the lights are wonderful, the recently renovated and recalibrated Kossuth square is just great and the atmosphere can be very calm (not like during the day). Lights are really the highlight of this place as you can not only see the Parliament building but the Buda side too. In the background you will see the Royal castle and the Fisherman's Bastion.

Must visit. It was very interesting visit. The combination of art and history is unique.We visit the Parliament at winter time so we got tickets to the tour we wanted. On summer it's recommended to buy tickets in advance.

Amazing visit!. We did the guided tour in Spanish and it was very good! We learn about the story of the Parliament and we were allow to take pictures (except in the crown room). It is a must see in Budapest!
Nice and big building.. The parliament is a really BIG and beautiful building its unique architecture really catches the eye!
great from the outside at day and night. I was inside and outside and I recommend only to see it from the outside because it was not so fascinating inside
Incredible. Amazing structure. I highly recommend stopping by it by day on a stroll up the Danube, as well as viewing it after dark from the other side of the river.

Parliament OverpisitorsDo not take my picture!". I had read many positive reports concerning the tour of the interior of the Parliament.It certainly is beautiful, inside and outside. But I fear the tour is vastly overrated. Popularity has made it a tough ticket. Many people need to buy timed tickets in advance for a tour in their language. Non EU citizens are being forced to pay a premium yo take the tour. My ticket was 5200 HUF, in the neighborhood of $20. This for a tour that lasts roughly 20 minutes. Some additional time is required for security and climbing 100 plus steps.There are only four rooms to see. The crown jewels are flocked by two armed guards. We tourists are warned to be sure and not to come within two meters of a guard, or things could get bad. Comfy yet?The information from my English speaking guide was boring, when it was even understood. It was clear she was bored as could be with it and was half dozing. The only time she showed any spirit was when she though someone may have snapped her picture. "Do not take my picture!" And there was a big surprise at the end of the tour. Not announced in advance, we were required to have our original tickets available to leave the building. Many of us searched pockets and handbags for the missing ticket.Nice to see, but not worth $20. The bored tour did not help a bit.There are so many free tours in Budapest that are wonderful. Better bang for your buck.
Viewed as part of a river cruise. Amazing structure.beautiful during the day but even more wonderful at night when illuminated! Best way to see this in my opinion is from the water at night!

Revolution. On Oct 25 1956 the Russian Troops opened fire on the Hungrian people in the Parliament Square. There is an exhibit under the square that will bring this event to life. Very worthwhile to see,
Beautiful. This is must see and both time, Day and Night. We enjoyed both views, night view was phenomenal. Different Architecutre.

An excellent outing. We went on the guided tour and loved every bit of it. The staff were accommodating - we went with our 1.5 yr old and 5 yr old and both were functioning at their peak disruptive behaviors. The staff were not only tolerant but helpful. I love this about people of Hungary. We went with a pram and the staff provided us access to lifts. Where there were stairs, guards if visible came to assist my wife.The parliament itself is worth a visit as its hallways and ceilings and halls are grand in every aspect. One of the staircases has 40kg of gold embellishing it- you get the picture. Recommended.
Birthday. Walked round the building did not pay to go on tour has advised it was not worth the money. Lovely building and plenty to see walking round.
take the tour of the interior of the building. quite a lovely landmark outside but inside it was even prettier. take the tour. worth the wait. can eat a bite at the cafe inside.

It never gets boring!. Viewed the Parliament building only from the outside. It was fantastic - day or night! Walk by, sit & stare, take the boat ride, view from a mountain... In any angle; near & far, its a beautiful piece of architecture. Wish I had seen the interiors too! Apparently it was built over several years at an extremely high cost... Probably it is all worth it!
Tram 2. Beautiful building we visited this building first as a drive by on the tram 2 then via the metro. The views over the rest of the city from here are outstanding.

Brilliant . Brilliant tour of a stunning building. The highlight of our trip to Budapest. Biggest tip is to pre book on the Internet. Bookings whilst in the city can only be made on the day from 8am - and the English speaking tours sell out quickly.

Stunning, especially at dusk. It is a very impressive building, and the view from across the river is equally as beautiful as up close. You can walk right next to it and at dusk when the lights come up makes for an even more stunning picture!
Stunning view from Buda. Go to the Castle or the Fisherman's Bastion to get the best view of this huge building from across the Danube.
Another beautiful building in Pest. Another beautiful building on our Pest walkabout. There was a changing of the guard ceremony at 1230 - not very elaborate.
Exceptional. Wonderful sight externally and absolutely fantastic interior. Crown Jewels magnicent and changing of guard a view worth seeing!!
Lovely on a sunny day . Great place so nice to sit on bench and admire the vast architecture!!! Can see the guards on parade too which is nice to see

Awesome building!. The building was so cool!
When you just walk in the night it looks amazing lighted!
You should took some pictures there!!

the building is a symbol of this wonderful city, not to miss. the neo-gothic parliament on the east side of the danube was built during the austrian-hungarian monarchy. enormous, fascinating to visit inside. and in one of the main halls you can admire the crown of st. stephen, Hungary'sold national hero. if you get a visit inside you plunge into Europe's past

Stunning views inside and out. The Hungarian Parliament is a fantastic attraction to visit. I arrived at the visitor centre soon after it opened, on my stay that was 10.00 and was able to book a guided tour for the 11.15 English tour. You will be asked for photo ID passport or driving licence at the time of booking.After going through the security scanner the same as at any airport, the tour guide takes through a very informative visit of the Parliament that lasted about 45 minutes. You can take photos in all but one place where the state Crown Jewels are displayed.The outside of the Parliament building is stunning to say the least, with many statues to observe, taking your camera is a must.
A feast for the eyes!. A beautiful awe inspiring grandeous place! Well worth a visit walk to the left of parliament along the river to see the famous shoes of the Jews along the Denube.
Stunning. If you do the Danube River Cruise Trip you get fantastic photos of this stunning building! Do the bus tour and get this free...

Excellent views from the outside. We didn't tour the interior, just spent around an hour walking around the outside and admiring the views. A great building to photograph from an architectural viewpoint. The 1956 memorial was very symbolic, though it lacked signage explaining just what happened.

Amazing. A breath-taking building, one can stare at it forever and keep seeing something new. It is as amazing on the inside as it is on the outside. A must visit in my opinion. Although the tour is not particularly long, it was still a good experience being able to see the inside of the building.
Must see. Take the Hop on Hop off buses to all of the attractions. Parliament, Fishermen's Bastion, Danube cruise, Basillica and all of the other sites.

Interesting Architecture. My friend and I bought a tour on a boat and saw the parliament building almost up close- we were very close to it. It's an interesting building that you don't easily miss. Also made a few pictures, but we didn't HAVE to see it as in pay for a tour throughout the entire building. So seeing it on the boat in my opinion was enough.

Wonderful building. We booked a tour of the parliament online before leaving home. I would recommend you do this as it's very popular and there are only about 3 tours a day in English. It's very easy to book and costs about £5 per adult and half for under 25's. The tour is excellent and takes about an hour round this amazingly beautiful building. If you want a good view of the parliament from the outside, which is spectacular, go over one of the bridges to Buda and you can see parliament from there. Highly recommended tour.
A Must See for Budapest. The interior is just as stunning as the exterior. Be sure to take the tour. The opposite bank off the Danube offers excellent photo opps
Nice!! . Nice place to visit and take pics!! I love the city!! The food soo tasty!!! The river is so largeThe architecture of the city is amazing

Worth seeing the inside. Interesting tour,would recommendThere is only one small area where you cannot take photosEntrance/ticket area is a bit chaotic.Everyone trying to listen for when their timed tour is able to go through airport security type turnstilesIt looks very popular so I would recommend pre booking online to ensure a place in your preferred language and time slot

A must-see. In a city with as much culture and history as Budapest, it can be difficult to find a central feature but the Parliament Building definitely fits the bill. Combining the grandeur of Hungarian history with the solemn democratic values of the late nineteenth century which it represents, the Parliament Building offers visitors a trip into the history of this fascinating and beautiful country.

Tour of the Hungarian Parliament in Budapest. Beautiful building situated on the Danube in Budapest. Tour was very interesting. Who knew that the United States sheltered and protected the Hungarian Crown Jewels during and after WWII.

Parliament building is a favorite memory of our trip. Such a beautiful building! Very impressive. The tour was great! Informative without being too lengthy. Would definitely recommend going to see this. We fell in love with the surrounding area too.
good atmosphere. good place i enjoy the view, calm and charming thing, if u come to budapest u can miss this spot, a must !!!
Fantastic!!!!. We did a guided tour of the building and it is a must! Pre book to secure your place - it was a highlight of our trip to fabulous Budapest

tour round parliament. found this more interesting than I thought I would. The person leading the tour spoke excellent English, and answered any questions people had. Lasted about an hour - which was just right
Nice view. Great view . really clean and beautiful . nice statuettes much nicer at night from the Danube cruise.

to see how it looks inside. Booked tickets for the tour in advance online after reading that I might not get tickets to go in immediately if I purchase on the spot. Price is different if you are European or not. Have to go through security check before entering for the tour which went well and is not too cumbersome. Tour is short, 30 min with a few points of attraction. Highlight is the crown jewel which is guarded by two guards. Headsets are given so we can hear what the guide says. Nice to spend an hour to see how it looks like inside this famous building.
Beautiful . You most see it. What an amazing architecture. A must on your to do list when you come to Budapest. It just looks way amazing..!!
Interesting . We didn't go in - it would be better if we had booked the day before - if you can prove you are eu resident then it is cheaper . Big queue to get in through security. Great little cafe.
4day break. Fabulous English guided tour, amazing building, it was like going back in time, a timeline of it's history given.
A must see. Wish we would have toured the inside but the outside is truly stunning, even better to see all lit up at night
Amazing. Great building and monument to see. Around the parliament and in front. Next to it is Dunav river with shoes bank. Definitely you need to walk around the building to see its best.
Huge and fascinating building. Very beautiful during day and night with its nice lumination! There are also guided tours available to visit the inside of the building.
Amazing architecture. Well worth your time to just wander around outside but the inside is a spectacle that should not be missed. If you can, make sure you come back at night to see the lights.
Miss. It is a beautiful place to visit. One of the things that I found really interesting is the one thousand year old crown. A must visit.

The outside of the building is stunning, the inside isnt. You must book in advance to make your visit run smoothly, they conduct tours by language, and they typically do tours in each of their key languages I(English, French, Russian, Germany, and I think Spanish) every other hour, so if you get there and you've just missed your chosen language and haven't booked, you have to wait a along time to get onto the next tour, assuming they haven't pre-sold all the slots. Security takes 10 minutes which also takes the edge off the visit, although entirely correct that they do this. The crown jewels are deeply under whelming, changing of the guard pointless, and the whole tour is pretty drab.
Elegant and luxurious. The fee is expensive, but the visit is a must. We had the chance for a good lighting in the ceileing of the holy crown room. They light it in special occasions.

A must see. Fabulous building from the outside by night and day. It is also worth doing the interior guided tour. We booked online prior to our visit and chose the English speaking option. It was very busy when we arrived and we were concerned we would miss our time slot but they made sure those booked on timed tours got though the line for their allotted time. It wasn't crowded once inside the Parliament building and the tour lasts about 45mins. Definitely worth your time!

Especially illuminated at night. If you want an amazing views over the parliament, go to the opposite river bank during night time (be careful because lights are switched off at some point). I loved it.
Parliament at night. We saw Parliament at night, as we take a boat along the Danube, it looked great I was thrilled, you must do that

Amazing Building. This place is a must-go as it looks really pretty. Feels like a disney castle. Would recommend you to take photos of it both in the day and night. Night view of this building is pretty too as it feels like a glowing castle.

Just one of so many amazing sights. A must visit place we could not go in at the time we visited but we went in the underground bunker which tells the story of the 1956 revolt just to wander around the magnificent building is a treat if you require refreshments there is a café and toilets but the toilets cost 200 huf about 45to 50p most public toilets charge so keep some coins handy.

Organised tour on Saturday morning. Worth booking ahead. The time of the tour was the time that we were let through security. Beautiful building. Tour a little brisk but very interesting. Don't miss it
B-e-a-utiful. Wow! What a spectacular building!!! We didn't have time to go in but lovely to see even from the outside. Make sure to also see when it's lit up at night!!
Beautiful. Very grand and beautiful, especially at night with the lights on. Love how there is zero fuss about the area and people go about their life amidst the beauty of the city

A good activity on a rainy day. The parliament building is beautiful, though it's pricey for non-EU citizens. I didn't go inside and tour it for this reason, but at least there are free bathrooms inside.
Modern and good toilets. Best thing I will say was the fact there was free and very clean lols here. Most places will charge 200huf but here is free. Enjoy!

Best building in Bucharest. Beautiful building, peaceful square, great for photography. Really near the red metro line. Nice to walk from here along the river, past the shoe memorial, the Chain Bridge and along prom to city centre.

Must see!. A beautiful building - inside and outside. We buy a online tickets and everything was OK. The guide was thrifty information, but always you can get one if you 're interested . A place not to be missed in Budapest.

one of the nicest building in Budapest. The parlament situated by the Danub river and was built slightly more than 110 years ago when Hungary was a powerful state. the building worth seeing at day and with all lights at night . Magnificent to watch at night during boat trip !

Beautiful Buildings. We cruised the Danube at night and the Parliament was beautiful lit up at night. During the day we went past and took photos but did not have time to go inside. I believe that you can have a tour inside in English.

Amazing Building. Its an amazing structure build in a the Gothic Revival style; it has a symmetrical façade and a central dome. The dome however is Renaissance Revival architecture.You can get the best view of the building from across the Danube from the Buda side. Best time is the twilight time when the building is just lighting up. If you want to take a closer look then take the tram no 2 or get down at the kassut lajos metro station.
Amazing!. Spectacular building from the outside a d just as amazing inside.Our tour guide was also excellent and full of information.A must visit!

One of the most beautiful parliament buildings in the world!. Well, you just have to see it. And if you are in Budapest, you will see it. Look at it from Pest or from Buda castle - both ways it's something, during the day or during the night, when it snows or when it doesn't...

An exceptional building and a must see if you visit Budapest. Whilst we did not join any of the guided tours(regrettably we did not have the time), a walk around the Parliament building was a memorable experience in itself.From any angle, this is a truly exceptional piece of architecture, and the recently improved gardens and square simply add to its presence and interest.The must see views are clearly to be gained from the Buda side of the Dabube, and even the walk across the chain bridge, but climb the strairs to the Fishermans Bastion and on a sunny day the views back over to the Parliament building are stunning.
Huge, imposing and beautiful. We were there at a time when we could not go inside but just taking in the magnificence of the outside was something special.

Imho, the grandest building I've ever seen. See it, visit it, love it! I really recommend coming to look at it at night, when it is even more marvellous (although it just might seem impossible) being lighted up from all sides like a fairy-tale castle.

Unbelievable landmark. (Tour review included). The Parliment, castle hill, fishermans bastion do not need to be reviewed as they are obvious stand out attractions in Budapest. A great time to see the Parliment is at night time from across the river, the lights will switch on every night of the year. Looking at the Parliment on the outside is amazing, all around Budapest you should see spectacular sculptures on the majority of buildings, but the Parliment is excellent! The tour has taken away a star. The tour costs no more than 10euros per person therefore it's probably worth doing. You will find the tour interesting but rather basic. You are guided by one or two people who will take you to a few rooms and provide knowledge and history. Considering the size of the Parliment, you don't see much! The tour lasts around 20minutes and you will see the hall, lobby and chamber during the tour, it's very good but there is more to be seen.To enter the Parliment, behind the building there is a glass dome which takes you underneath. You can visit the shoes on the Danube also, why you're in the district.

Fabulous in daylight and stunning at night. Saw the outside only but visually stunning. Inside tours are available. Right on the Danube and easy walk from anywhere downtown, or cruise ship docks. Lit up at night like most of Budapest. Just stunning from the water.

Tour of Parliament buildings. The tour was well organised and very informative. The tour guide was very informative about the buildings the history. You need to bring good walking shoes a good camera. The tour starts on time and is not too long. At the end of the tour you get to see a lot if what repairs etc they ha to do.
