Stunning architecture, day and night.. From the FIsherman's Bastion, the views of the Parliament was amazing! Since we were on a day trip, I was not able to go inside. Before we left, I saw the the Parliament being lit up and it was even more glorious!

stunning. The architecture in Budapest is like nothing I have ever seen. All the buildings were spectacular, but Parliament was a personal favorite of mine. There is also plenty to do and see around Parliament, and a metro stop is right on its door step 😊

Great arhitecture. The 2 Tram stops here and is worth taking and seeing up close. We did not tour inside. However, a block from the Tram stop is another government square with a bunch of older buildings. Don't miss the Ronald Reagan monument on your way.
Great place to see!. It is "must to see" place in Budapest, great walk around and view to the Buda castle on the other side of the river.
Very interesting!. We took the English speaking guided tour which we had booked online. It was very informative but not too long - a nice way to spend a morning. A beautiful building.

Interesing visit. I would highly recommend you pre-book a tour of the parliament building. The interior is very beautiful, and although the tour is only about 25 minutes it's an interesting insight into the way politics work in Budapest.

Must see sight in Europe. The view of the Parliament across the Danube is one of the must-see sights of Europe
A stay across at the Castle area is great for tourists

Great experience. A really interesting trip, we did a guided tour that was enjoyable and informative.I would recommend booking a tour in advance or going early in the morning to book a tour later in the day to avoid disappointment. We arrived at 11am and booked the only English speaking tour available for 17.00pm. We felt lucky to experience it, the architecture and history bringing a great experience.A must whilst in Budapest.

Mindblowing Architecture. When in Budapest, a visit to Hungarian Parliament is a must see. It’s a beautiful building. To go in you have to take entry ticket which you can buy at visitor center or you can book online on Jegymaster. The ticket will also give you guided tour of Parliament and explain about the Kingdom of Hungary, the design and technicalities of the Parliament and why the building had an architecture modern for its era.Must see. Better to book tickets in advance. Only a number of people are allowed in a tour and in a day so in a peak season you might not get a ticket or have lots of waiting. Also they don't let you inside until the time of your ticket, not even for security check. The guided tours are in various languages. Metro is Kossuth Lajos Ter, cross the main road walk and walk to go other side where visitor center is. Dont go towards river. Tram is nearer and its Orszaghaz latogatokkozpont, Its a short walk to visitor center.

"Worth the tour ". You must do the tour, see the chambers, crown jewels,changing of the guards etc etc. The inside is magnificent and you can take photos, except around the crown jewels! Takes around 50 mins and well worth it, don't forget to take your passport for discount.
Spectacular. We didn't manage to get a tour as we arrived late in the afternoon. The building is stunning and there are great views across the Danube to castle hill, well worth visiting.

Must see. This is not a long tour, and one that will fit into your schedule nicely if you allow a few hours, including your transportation. The guided tour was excellent. The building itself is outstanding. This is a 'must-do' while in Budapest.

Odd. I visited parliament during my time in Budapest recently and the building was beautiful. I saw it from the river Danube the night before and it was beautiful. I paid for a guided tour when I was there and the guide was sufficient. The theory behind history in Hungary is very strange, they tell you want they want you to hear, and the communist star is plonked in a small exhibition room, not in a glass box, with no information around it, which was very odd as it was the most interesting thing there. It was worth a visit but all facts have to be taken with a pinch of salt

Must See at Night!. We did not go inside, but instead admired the view at night. I encourage you to walk by/around it in the day time then enjoy the view in the evening. Easy to get to - close walking distance within city. Very impressive building - gorgeous!

Impressive architecture . Walked around the outside and then plumped for a tour where you saw the Lords chamber and the unimpressive crown jewels. Tour was OK but outside of building was stunning. Best view was from the other side of the river at Fisherman's Bastion.

Impressive building. The Parliament building of Hungary is really impressive, an expression of Hungarian confidence and a symbol of how great their 1,000 year old parliament stood. The tour inside is quite disappointing because we had to stand in line for almost 15minutes just for security check but the tour itself is just maybe 20 minutes!
Great. Wonderful siteSo great and fantastic i can't describe it.You have to visit there and just walk around in the evening or at a night.
Lovely parliament . The parliament your was clear and concise, ticket price was extremely good, especially as EU students, tour guide was lovely, building is beautiful and the grounds are great too
Majestic building. What more can I say..A perfect parliament building.. facing the Danube river.. totally a scenic view, especially at night.
Amazing view,. This building is amazing, by day or night, and from the 19 tram across the river, in the evening is a stunning view.
Majestic Building. Well worth a visit... Saw the changing of the guards well I assume that's what it was. When they were done the spectators were allowed to take pictures with them.

The most impressive parliament in Europe. It's worth visiting it and admire the architecture at least from outside. It must be the most impressive parliament in Europe! I had the chance to watch the swap of the guards as well.

Amazing architecture. The parliament building is not open to the public, but the grounds are and definitely worth a visit. The building is beautifully lit at night and the high point of an evening cruise through the city.
spectacular. Me and my mom saw the parliament from a little boat cruise during the sunset and it was so beautiful! I wish we had taken a tour inside. This is a must-see tourist attraction.

Wow. What an interior! Breathtaking, not what you expect to see. Guide is clear and you can hear him well through the audio guide. Takes about 45 mins to go round. E were able to turn up and get tickets for tours in an hours time.
Didn't actually go in just viewed it from outside.. Very impressive building although I didn't go inside - still worth taking a visit just to admire the architecture.

There is no reason to miss this place when you are in Budapest. From my experience, get the tickets earlier. Tours get full fairly quickly. The tour guide said the architectural style of the Hungarian parliament was to mimic that of the Westminster in London. I went to both of them and honestly there are some similarities. But because that in Budapest is bigger, it makes the architecture even more impressive.We get to the souvenir shops at the end of the tour, and 4 of us got 23 beautiful postcards! just a 50-minute tour, quite short, open daily and is easy to arrange during trip planning. I can't think of any reasons for not visiting this place.

Nice but short tour. Totally worth it!. Book tickets through the parliament and not through a tour operator, since it is way cheaper.The building is stunningly beautiful, and the tour is very informative on the country's history but its a bit short.
Great!. Especially beautiful in the evening. I recommend to take a trip on a boat (it takes 1 hour) on the Danube to see the city,s lights at night

Must see in Budapest. Of course the parliament should be on your list of must see spots when you are in Budapest. You can also do a guided tour in the building which is really nice, but only the outside is worth the trip.

Very beautiful!. This is the kind of building that really amazes you when you first see it. It's huge and in a great condition. When in Hungary you should really visit the outside. We also went inside. It was beautiful and we had a good guide. If you are viewing the outside and thinking about how the inside would look like, just do the trip! It's not expensive and it doesn't take too long.

Beautiful building, but no self guided tour available. Walked over to the building, and it was spectacular. I would have liked to to see the inside, but you have to schedule a guided tour, and there were none left for the day. Wish they had a self guided tour
Fantastic view!. Incredible building to look at; fits in so well with the river and other buildings. Wish I'd gone inside but the exterior view was superb enough in itself!

Beautiful !. We were unable to go inside the Parliament in Budapest, but thorougly enjoyed its vistas from various places in the city, particularly viewed at night from a boat on the Danube. Breathtaking!

This tour was great, but only 45 minutes long.. It was great to see the inside of this beautiful building but the tour is only 45 minutes long and getting tickets was a bit of a hassle, but worth a visit!

Amazing building. I took Guided tour inside the parliament building. Its even more beautiful inside, then from outside. But our guide was little roboty, I think its long time she works there, so during the tour she was walking too fast and talking fast as well, almost did not have time to understand what she was talking about. Sadly. But otherall I liked it, must take the tour inside.

Gorgeous building. Beautiful buildings. Clean and we didn't know about the October 1956 uprising that is chronicled in an underground exhibit. Go to that - free and very informative. You'll see signs for it on the plaza.

One of the most beautiful buildings I've visited. The tour of Parliament was well worth it. The building is one of the most architecturally beautiful buildings I've ever visited. A lot of gilded interior space. The crown jewels were also on display. Tour guide was pretty good. A trip to Budapest would not be complete without a tour of Parliament!
Average. We just saw this from outside and while on the cruise, did not really feel much interested to go in and have a look.

Beautiful Building. We saw parliament on the boat trip that came free with the big bus tour. Really is worth see in an evening when all lit up.
Fantastic City, beautiful building
Very nice architecture . A really nice looking building we had a tour booked it was interesting but you are only shown round quite a small portion of it but very impressive
A must. If you visit Budapest, you can not leave without visiting the Parliament and walk along the river Danube. Amazing view.

What a beautiful building. situated on banks of the Danube this is an impressive building which is believed to have been inspired by the UK Houses of Parliament. You can apparently get access if you are EU citizen and have your passport. We did not go inside but walking around the exterior is beautiful

Beautiful . One of the most beautiful buildings I have ever seen. When in Budapest it is a must to visit this building - I traveled by the City Sightseeing Bus and was able to hop off outside so I could get a better view. It is the largest building in Budapest and looks superb when viewed from a cruise along the Danube. You cannot visit this city and not go here.

Majestic Building. One of the must see places in Budapest. Unfortunately to acquire tickets is difficult and be aware that the tickets for the English tour finish very quick. You can buy them only online or at the place in the same day. The entry access to the parliament could be more organized as well.
Beautiful architecture viewed from all sites. A proud parliament sits besides the river Danube. Can be seen from a distance, lighting at night is magical and reflects on to the river
Very beautiful !. We spent weekend in Budapest and the pariliament house was our first choice to see. Great building with interesting architecture. Also square near the parliament house is very nice.
Very nice place. This is one of the main landmarks of Budapest and for me, this is the most beautiful place in Budapest. People who like architecture must see this wonderful building
Historical and interesting. Definitely must do. Beautiful building, interesting history, my kids enjoyed learning about the government structure.

Make sure you book in advance and check what is happening on the day you want to go..... I loved Parliament however a) was disappointed when I first went at lunchtime as there was a notice that said the days visits were all full and b) when I did go the following day there was a sitting in one side of the building so couldn't visit there. That said, the architecture both inside and out was stunning and the history that we were told about during the trip was wonderful, the crown with the standing guards was stand out. Well worth a visit but like I say, make sure you plan in advance.

“My three ways to explore”. This is the largest building in Budapest located on the banks of the Danube River. A must visit place. My three ways to see this magnificent architecture: 1) Take a boat tour in the evening to see the lit up building, that was a WOW for us. 2) Visit Fisherman's Bastion, from there is the best spot to capture the whole facade of the Parliament in your camera and your sight. That was another WOW for us too. 3) Go to the Parliament inside and outside. We didn’t have the tour because the queue was too long, we just walked around outside and took some close up photos of parts of the building. Happy Travelling!

Alright. You can't miss it, its huge.We didn't book a tour but viewed it from the outside instead. Architecture is great, the metro 2 bus will go past this and you can watch the guards changing here too.

Impressive. The Parliament Building is best seen from the Danube River or from across the river at Fisherman's Bastian. We were lucky enough to cruise on the river at night which is a view we will never forget. Not only the Parliament Building, but the entire city is a wonderland of castles, bridges and lights. Gorgeous!
view from a tour boat on the river. impressive architecture, the 2nd largest Parliament building in the world. if you go on a sightseeing bus tour they give you free tickets for a boat cruise

Stunning!. Was in Budapest a few weekends ago for a hen party and some of us decided to arrive a day early to have a little explore around the city. These buildings are absolutely stunning - couldn't quite believe how intricate the design was, not to mention how beautifully clean and well taken care of it was!

Interesting but could be more informative. The building was very impressive and the tour was interesting. However, given the history of Hungary there seems to be a lot more to the building that the tour doesn't go into. The tour was reasonably short (c. 30 min) so there's definitely room to add more. It's more just a quick tour of the building than going into detail about anything. Could easily be 5/5 if there was more added. Check the tour times in your language and book before going. You're not able to go without a tour group and there seems to be 1-2 hours between each language tour.
Wonderful building. Amazing building with a rich history. Our guide was knowledgeable and funny. Well worth a trip, the crown room was jaw-dropping.
Greatest building in Budapest . In my opinion it is the greatest piece of architecture in whole city. Great view from the other side of the river also, if there is no fog.

Interesting to see the building, but the tour is lacking something. Make sure you buy your tickets online in advance as they sell out quickly. The tour was a nice way to see the Parliament and the Crown Jewels, but the tour itself was rather large and it felt like a recorded tour even though there was a guide talking to you.

Wow. Beautiful from every angle, highly recommend visiting even if only to walk past and take in the exterior. I read to took 19 years to complete and given the detail it's not hard to believe. Like most places Ive visited in Budapest, very ornate.
Beautiful. This is a beautiful building by day and especially at night. It is fantastic to see from the river as you get a full view.

GO!!!. If you are in Budapest you have to visit this place. Absolutely gorgeous, after climbing the 122 stairs believing I was taking a heart attack I thought what have I got myself into here. Well that lasted for almost 5 seconds when the first sight you see is the gold leaf decoration which adorns the interior. The guided tour includes a Wi-Fi headset which is presented to you after passing the airport like security. Fascinating Hungarian history presented by a professional guide with a mix of comedy comments thrown in which enhanced the tour. Only bummer being no photography in the main dome where the crown jewels are shown, fine for the rest but not the dome. I'm sure the guards are there for aesthetic purposes but they would gladly chop your head off if required. One of our party almost lost her head after she ventured too close. The guide advised a two metre gap to the soldiers which she ignored. As I said GO!!! and experience this delight, you won't be disappointed.

A must see . Well worth a visit for very little cost . The tour only takes about 1.5 hours and is given by many very informative guides. Book in advance as it can be very busy at peak times. The building is truly opulent inside. Not to be missed!

Beautiful building outside and inside - the English tour was bad.. The Parliament building is beautiful, I love it - outside and inside. The park is great to walk around and sit in. The English tour was bad, but seeing the Parliament inside, is beautiful and worth it.

"Worth a vist". We booked a tour via our hotel,which was very reasonably priced.we made our way there but found it quiet confusing and chaotic,there seem to be different lines and we became anxious we would missour tour.The tour is interesting but fairly short certainly a impressive building with all the gold fittings,you could take photos during most of the tour,if you struggle with your walking there are a lot of steps.
Cheap if your in eu and book at home. We went to see the building brought tickets on line before arriving and you get a discount for being a eu citizens four rooms visited and you get a wow factor

Parliament Building is a Gem. Wonderful on the inside and out. Magnificent architectural structure restored after significant WWII damage. Still used for active sessions of Parliament. Tour was 45minutes but full of wonderfulf historical data and interesting facts. Tour tickets must be reserved in advance online in desired language. Reserved one day prior however tickets sell out quickly especially for larger groups. Cost in under $20/pp.
Nice . Short guided tour (about 30 minutes) inside the Parliament. Beautiful place. A bit expensive. Make sure to book on advance.
wonderful building. historical, impressive building. Worth booking in advance if you wish to go inside, even just wondering around the grounds and the site itself is impressive

Make Sure You Get Your Tickets Early. If you want to tour the Parliment building make sure you get tickets online early. We arrived at 10:00 and no more tickets were available to view the interior of the palatial building, kicked ourselves for not better planning.However, the monument to the 1956 uprising is very impressive as well as the bullet holes on the buildings surrounding the square. There is an exhibition downstairs of videos for the 1956 uprising that is worth a visit, if are not familiar with the history.Finally stop and view the statue of Attila Jozzef, the beloved Hungarian Poet who killed himself at 32.
Impressive building. A beautiful building to walk around and just take in the architecture. Looks amazing at night and most impressive from a distance on the Buds side.
Sightseeing . Beautiful building , fantastic photo opertunity & well worth a visit xVery good restaurants nearby the hilton hotel which we would highly recommend x

Worth the view at night! . This looks spectacular at night. It was modelled on the Houses of Parliament in London but I have to say this looks so much more magical than our Palace of Westminster does at night!

Stunningly beautiful viewed from the Danube. Take a boat cruise which travels up and around Margaret Island and back to the city Centre. The Parliament House on the Pest side is just stunning both day and night.....

Most special Parliament of Europe. Hungarian Parlament is a beautiful building of the Hungarian architecture. The front part facing the Danube has been renovated a few years ago and now its even more enjoyable, you can sit on benches and just relax. Unfortunately i haven't been inside,what is open for tourists.

The Parliament. A very glorious and huge building, on of the most beuatiful parliament in Europe. It worth visiting and walking in the area around of it. It is in the side of Pesti.We did not enter in the building, but its outside look was astonishing.

Amazing building. Thankfully we took up the suggestion of pre-booking our visit to the parliament building beforehand since tickets are quickly snapped up.The guide had excellent English and her detailed explanation of the building ensured that all visitors could appreciate the its beauty.It is very easy to reach either by tram or metro both stopping right in the square.Make sure to pre-book!
beautiful. probably the most beautiful parlament in the world. on of my favorite places in the city. love budapest

Visit to the Parliament building. The Parliament building is situation on the Buda side of the river. Beautiful architecture and awesome design. we took some photos of the building from a river cruise that we did while there.

Nothing special. You are able to access just a restricted area of the parliament, the guide and the price are okay, but the inside of the parliament didn't meet the expectations that the outside gave.

Nice to see inside. The visit inside the parliament was nice. The architecture is amazing.
I was a bit disappointed with the explanation the guide was giving.
Be sure to reserve tickets in advance.
Nice building. It s a must see place.from there you can walk around the Danub.It is close to many other good places to see.

Very impressive indeed!. This is an absolute must during your visit to Budapest!! The views by night are simply breathtaking. The best place to view the parliament building is from Fisherbastei.
Enjoy!

Outstanding Architecture. This is another of the many beautiful buildings in Budapest, standing on the "Pest" (flat) bank of the Danube. It is brilliant by day and stunningly floodlit at night. There is considerable civic pride in these buildings which are kept waterblast clean.
Impressive. Wonderful landmark of the city, nice to stay there or go up to the Castle Mountain to watch a wonderful combination of architecture and Danube river

First time to Budapest. What a stunning architectural building. The area around parliament square were a photographers dream come true.nand what a real pleasure for a photo not to include litter within it
Well worth a visit if you have time. . Certain areas inaccessible because of dignitaries visiting. Be prepared to wait in long queues. Toilets available.
view from across the river. Did not opt to take a a tour inside since non-eu prices are too high (thanks for the warm welcome -_-) but it is a beautiful building from the outside.

Beautiful building with lovely grounds.. Beautiful building with lovely grounds and statues to see as you walk around. There were ceremonial guards marching in formation when I went which was good to watch. I don't know if they do that everyday. I didn't go inside as apparently it's best to book online before hand.
Great brief tour. Really worth booking ahead and going on this 40 minute tour of this sumptuous historic building. Interesting and beautiful. The number 96 is significant!

A must see in Budapest!. The most beautiful Parliament that I have seen ever. An absolute must is to see it both during the day and night! Take one of the boats and see it by night, it is marvellous, or just see it from the bridge:) Wow, what a stunning view! Spectacular building with millions of impressive details.

Another highlight of Budapest. Situated by the river it really is a worthwhile visit on a nice day. Interesting historians easy to get to... you can catch a No2 tram that winds its way around Parliament if you just want to drive past. I would allow an hour to have a wander around and take a few photos... lit up at night it is easy to photo with a phone camera. If you get a chance to catch a night photo from across the river it is well worth it.
So pretty. I went on a boat tour at night (party boat). The parliament at night looks so amazing due to the lights and fixtures. Reccomend day and night trip :)

an enlightening experience. Had a very informative guided tour through the Parliament house gaining knowledge about the building structure and the past and present parliamentary activities of Hungary.

Absolutely Beautiful. First off what a beautiful building, this was top of my list when visiting Budapest and is located right outside a metro station so is incredibly easy to get too. Whilst we were walking to the tour entrance we were lucky enough to see the changing of the guard and was allowed to take pictures after ( roughly 5 minutes before they go back). we paid for the English guided tour and it was well worth the expense. The tour was informative and had a casual approach to it, much like that of walking around with a friend with discussion points. If you have the time you would be a fool to miss the tour.

Really nice area to walk around. Initially I took photos from the other side of the river but on one of the lat days we had in Budapest we decided to walk up to the parliament building to see what it was like up close and personal. A fantastic building, great architecture too. Whilst on the way, why not check out the shoes along the danube too?
Pretty Good. View of Parliament from oher side of danube was good. You can walk over the chain bridge to the danube river or see it from the River ride they have.
Nice. Very nice place to wonder about . Alot of nice architecture in this city. Friendly locals and also the streets are kept well clean

Buy tickets in advance. The parliament and surrounding buildings are beautiful. If you want to make the tour inside you have to buy the tickets. 5200 Ft for non EU citizens. Buy them in advance on the Internet because they usually get sold out, specially in English. Visitor center in located on the north face of the building.
What an amazing building!!! . My advice is to cross the Danube via Chain bridge and walk to the other side to get the best view of the parliament building

Beautiful. Very very beautiful, both at night and day time, the best picture i feel is across the river where you can see the entire building. The lights are amazing at night. Really not to be missed.
Danube Delights. Beautiful views on a river cruise a must for all tourists in Budapest! Wrap up warm if travelling in Winter !!!
Wow . A must see, we didn't go inside (will do next time) beautiful building. It's a need to see, pictures just don't do it justice.
Great to do. Beautiful building, great to see it from the inside! The tour was really informative, even though the guide was sometimes difficult to hear, as the earphones had some difficulties.

Stunning achievement - beautiful interior and worth the time.. Had a great trip here - needed to book ahead (and should have arrived 20 minutes before booked time to allow for security) Astounding building, and included the state jewels too. Enjoyed the exhibition afterwards too as that did a good job of explaining the background and history

What a breathtaking building.... Budapest without visiting the Parliament is not a real visit after all. We took a guided tour, the price was very good-only for 2000 fiorints per person in French or English...it lasts approx. an hour, you view and wander around the building and the several different rooms, you may take pictures but not in the coronation room which in my opinion is the most impressive...The building is majestic on its own and it is for sure that you will feel mesmerized by the size and the grandeur of it!You will be able to pay attention to all the details, the paintings and the wooden decoration inside...Inside or outside it is absolutely FANTASTIC!
Stunning architecture. Must visit Parliament in Budapest. Gorgeous architecture situated on the river and is stunning at night, Would recommend

Stunning. The Parliament building is magnificent, on such a grand scale being the largest building in Hungary and the tallest in Budapest, we didn't go inside but when we done the river trip at night it was magical to see it all lit up.
Hungarian Parliament. Tip: buy you ticket one day before because we are there at noon and it was full for that day. Very nice view from the Buda side of the river,
That's beautiful.... It majestically sits on the riverbank and every time I see it I'm amazed by its grace. It really is a beautiful site in the city. Gaze upon it from the other side.
mart 16.. amazing work of art, couldn't take my eyes off it..so beautiful and attractive. we were on the evening cruise on the Danube, the view was really fantastic
Stunning architehture. Looking at it up close you can see the detail of its design, recommend to view close and also from Fisherman's Bastion.

The symbol of the city. You can admire this magnificent building by the Fisherman Bastion and take some nice photos. At nights it is even more beautiful. It worth attending a guided tour. The price for EU citizens is 8 Euros and you can visit a few of the rooms of the building and see the royal crown that is really very old. Access is easy with metro line 2 (Kossuth Lajos ter), or tram line 2.
WOW. That's all I can say. Just WOW. NOt a long tour and you must purchase tickets ahead of time but worth it.
Spectacular . Went for a walk round Budapest and visited the parliament building.Stunning building, and looks even better from a cruise boat, along side on the river!
Huge. One of the most beautiful buildings in Budapest, the parliament is special both night and day! A must see for everyone visiting the city.

Beautiful at day, amazing at night. Location: it's just in the exit metro of Kossuth Lajos tér.Experience: it is a very great building with its architecture. You must visit at day and night to get the best experience and photos.
Beautiful. Not much to do but we'll kept and clean. Nice for pictures good to check out daily drop of flagg.suppose asking too much of food vendors around. Close to transport .
Architecturally eclectic and wonderful. Joined the English tour. I suggest to book your ticket online as the slots are limited. Most of the tour allow photography except in the dome.

Visited it long time ago. I have been in Hungary long time ago may be more than 10 years , I went there with some friends and during our stay we visited the parliament building, it was amazing we loved it specially the model that is made of matches .... It worth giving it a visit if you are the kind of traveler who likes architecture and buildings ...

beautiful building at day and night. I went there with my girlfriend. Positioned close to the river the building itself is beautiful. Unfortunately you cannot visit the interior or parts of it just like that, you need a guided tour. I suggest as well to visit at night with all the lights.

Stunning palace inside and outside. I have visited the Parliament on the Easter weekend while visiting Budapest. You get the best view of the palace from the Fishermen's Bastions, on the other side of the Danube, preferably at night.I strongly advise to book a tour of the Parliament palace because inside is absolutely stunning as well as outside. It lasts 45 mins and is available in several languages.
The best!!!!. In my opinion, this is one of the best historicall monument in the city. Outstanding building, takes your breath away. Especially at night, when the lights are on, it is magicall!

Impressive building plus museum in memorial on 1956 riots. When you exit the metro satiation on Kossuth Lajos square you are immediately confronted with this beautiful complex of buildings - a mix of Houses of parliament in London and Firetian Duomo. Nevertheless, it is very impressive and beautiful. On the other side of the square is the entrance to the visitation center. However, we had no luck since all the tickets were sold at 13.00?? And you couldn't buy the tickets for the next day - too bad! What we could visit is underground memorial on unexplained manslaughter in 1956. during the SSSR intervention - that is free and quite strong multimedia exhibition. I recommend it!

So grand!. The guided tour was informative and only took an hour. The parliament is so grand and beautiful, the pictures just don't do it justice! You can only book the day of or online, so definitely plan ahead if you would like to visit. Great use of time!

Feels a bit rushed. It would seem a shame to come to Budapest and not admire this magnificent building from both outside and in, so I would definitely recommend taking a tour.However, the tour felt a little rushed without the quirks of interesting tales form the tour guide who delivered everytging in a rather monotone manner.
Parliament. A must see. Well worth the entry fee but you will need your passport to get the discount. Use the Hop on Hop off bus to get there and you will need at least a hour

Fabulous building.. The parliament building dominates the pest side of Budapest. There is a tram that runs from Margaret Bridge that stops at the parliament. It is the no. 2 tram that runs along the bank of the Danube. Should you want to go inside there are steps leading down at the side of building on the Margaret Bridge side. This takes you to the ticket office. The tours in English run about every 2 hours and get booked up in advance. It is about £10 or £5 if you are 65 and an E.U citizen. Proof is required to obtain the discount. You can pay by card or Forints. Euros are not accepted. The tour takes approx. 1 hour. It is magnificent inside and is a must to see.

Think Budapest, Think Gothic Parliament on the Danube!. This has to be one of, if not the, most impressive display of Gothic architecture i have seen in all my travels. We visited on the national holiday of march 15th where the flag rose! we queued for just over an hour to get a look inside. For the time we waited i would say it wasnt quiet worth it although if you catch it on a quiet day its definetly worth a peep inside at the marble walls and golden ceilings, along with the crown jewels. Budapest knows how to show off its sights at night, the parliament is no different. Be sure to check that out too guys! if u step down to the danube and walk just 50 metres towards chain bridge you will also find the show memorial. Enjoy your holiday everyone!

Awesome!. We took a Parliament tour, which was great. What an outstanding building with amazing architecture and history. Make sure to take a Danube River tour to see this glory in its beauty at night!

Make sure to book a reservation in advance.. Make sure to book a reservation in advance. When I arrived at 1pm the rest of the tours were already sold out.
The tour doesn't last long.. only an hour. But the inside of the facility is quite impressive and worth a visit.

amazing at night!!. The Hungarian Parliament is a huge building. You can go inside for a tour where you can see the Main Staircase, the coronation jewels in the Dome Hall, the Old Upper House Hall and the Lounge. It las 45 to 50 minutes.

Amazing architecture. . Take the tour inside. Reserve tickets in advance. Tours in English fill quickly.
Other languages usually can reserve same they.

An impressive attraction. We were told the most beautiful sights were Parliament and the Opera House. If you like stately elegance, this is the place. Lots of interesting details and information of the government all in one place.We ended the tour at the entrance to the building for a very dramatic finish.

Amazing!you cannot miss it! Book online. Amazing guided tour for only 7 euro, due to the high affluence is suggested to Book online some days before! building Rich on history and curiosities! Staff is very Kind and the 30 minutes of the tour pleasently flow

Simply Stunning. A very beautiful building on the Pest side, on the bank of the Danube river, especially interesting when you catch the changing of the guard. A stunning view of Hungarian culture and architecture.

Building is a great example of gothic architecture based on the Houses of Parliament in London.. Our hotel booked timed tickets for us so we didn't have to wait around for the tour of this beautiful building. We were all given headsets and the tour was in English with a knowledgeable guide. The Parliament is definitely a must-see in Budapest and we were able to take lots of photos. The only place photography is forbidden is in the domed part where the crown jewels, guarded by soldiers, is situated. There is a lift if you are unable to manage the stairs.
A must-do. The visit is quite short, but it isn't shocking given that the building still serves public purpose. Interior is rich and well-decorated.

It really is worthwhile. Whilst in Budapest i googled the top 10 things to do and the houses of parliament appeared high in the list. At first i wasn't too sure, but after having done the tour it is certainly worthwhile if you have a half day spare during your travels. I say half day because there is quite a wait from first booking, so go in early, get a slot booked, pop out for coffee/cake/brunch then enjoy the tour. I won't give too much away but there is lots of gold decoration involved.

Beautiful exterior and interior. The parliament is beautiful building. This goes for the exterior as well as the interior. You can only visit the building via guided tours. Make sure to buy a ticket in advance via their website. Otherwise you will end up having to wait in line to buy a ticket and you wi probably have to return at a later time for the guided tour, since all the tickets for the current time slot will already be sold out. If for example your ticket states that the guided tour starts at 1pm, this means that at 1 pm you will go through a security check and after 10 minutes or so, the tour itself will start. Everyone will get a headset, so that you can hear the guide clearly when he or she speaks through their microphone. You also get to see the room where the members of the parliament itself are seated. All in all the whole tour lasts for around 45-50 minutes. There are plenty of opportunities to make pictures. Only pictures of the crown jewels are forbidden (but the guide will tell you so too). An impressive building, which should not be missed!

Take your passport!. A stunning piece of architecture which makes our parliament look rather dull.Walk around the building and admire its structure and the traditional guards and their sabre drill. There is an underground memorial to the 1958 uprising at the south end.Guided tours are available around the inside at set times in various languages. I think you can book in advance and that is the best idea. I queued for a ticket on the day. There were three girls at the ticket desk but only one seemed to be serving at any one time. The other two were typing on their PC or showing each other something on their smartphones, completely oblivious to the large queue snaking around the reception. After 25 minutes queuing we eventually got served (or not) There are two prices 2000HUF for Europeans or 5200HUF for non Europeans such as Russians, Americans or Japanese. (sounds a bit racist to me?) Despite being English and asking for a tour given in English they refused to sell me the cheaper 2000HUF ticket unless we had our passports to prove we were English! By that time I had lost the will to live so just walked out.

Absolutely Stunning Building. This is my favorite building in Budapest. The view from the Castle in Buda is the best and best place to take a pic. This is best viewed and photographed from the Buda Castle.
Stunning Architecture! . It looks stunning on the water. I suggest to take a boat tour or admire the building from the outside before going inside. It's the best part of Budapest.
Beautiful building. Definitely on the "to see" list. A beautiful building, even if you cannot go inside, walk around from the outside, well worth it!
Nightly visit . Looked awesome in the night. Never went inside but thought that the view from outside was majestic. The water fountain outside was nice.

Highly Impressive. This is impressively designed building is similar to the Houses of Parliament, London. It is possible to walk close to it. There are armed soldiers guarding the building. For taking pictures there are better views from across the water. The best place I saw it was from Fisherman's Bastion.
Nice, but overpriced. Group was too big and guide talked too fast and we couldn't see what she was talking about. Hard to ask questions.
Stunning Building. The parliament building in Budapest is one of the most stunning buildings in Europe! By day or by night, you will not regret a visit to see it!

Beautiful. No trip to Budapest is complete without at least looking at parliament. You can get tickets to go in, it cost money but it is annoying because you have to go get the tickets and then go back later to start your tour

Time visit to watch guard dance!. Beautiful buildings steeped in history and our visit timed with the not guard change but a guard sword dance almost.
Really interesting to watch and added atmosphere to visit.
Beautiful. The Parliament building is the iconic picture of Budapest. Dont miss the view at night. Tours are available and can be booked in advance.

Stunning. The most beautiful building I have ever seen in my entire life. Spectacular by day and night. Go to the bar at the top of the Fisherman's Bastion at sunset and watch the parliament building light up. An experience you will never forget.

The tour is worth it!. A 40 minute tour of the key areas of the building is all that is needed. Everyone gets a head set through which to hear the guide who spoke English perfectly and was enthusiastic to share the information. The rooms and halls are beautiful. A must see. Outside Parliament is beautiful as well. Very well maintained and clean and just a wonderfully magical location.
Short visit . We saw this from our cruise, this is beautiful. There are tours daily for the parliament as well available. Must visit..

Interesting. You can online enter with a guide at specific times.The guided visit is not long, it's interesting and here you can find the crown of hungarian kings. If you don't want to wait you have to purchase tickets online.
Amazing. Beautiful gothic architecture. Together with the Danube behind and Kossuth Lajos square in front make a beautiful historic hungarian landascape.
Stunning. We only had time to view the outside, but this beautiful historic building is extremely well preserved and very clean. If the outside is anything to go by, the interior should be amazing?
Beautiful place, awesome at night. Budapest, what a lovely place to be at. The city is adorable, full of a lot of worth seeing places and beautiful monuments.

Amazing View. This is a very impressive structure, and absolutely massive. You can't get the full effect until you're standing in front of it, but it is really awe inspiring. I recommend going just before it gets dark outside seeing the building both with the lights off and on is truly spectacular. There is also a memorial to the Hungarian revolution and the October 25th massacre that is free to the public and has interesting information on the event.

A must see in Budapest! . Stunning gothic architecture! Impressive both from the outside & inside. We took a guided tour and were pleased with both brief history and sights. Pre-booking is recommended as gets crowdy.
Parliament7. Well worth the treck not able to get in the building is stuning with the local Hungarian are on duty you really get the atmosphere

Wonderful place to visit. Interesting place with underground exhibits. Beautiful and huge building. You can chose between a lot of guided tours. It amazing from the outside as well. At night don't miss take a picture about it. Unbelievable!
Beautiful!. A really impressive building with beautiful surroundings. Really calm neighbourhood. Everyone should go. Have a good day

majestic!. The architecture of this building is amazing with a lot of detail and when you see it, you will not be able to take your eyes away from it for a long time. It also cost A LOT of money when they built it and it shows. In the top 3 sightseeings of Budapest for me!
A "must see"!. Very impresive building, both night and day! You can enjoy it while you ride by boat on the Danube but it is definately worth to walk around it!
Stunning sights. Absolutely gorgeous parliament house especially during night when it is lighted. Otherwise stunning.
Amazing architecture. A must see if in Budapest and it's free. This building is so beautiful and at night time it's even prettier with all lights lit up till midnight.

It's just a nice building . It is just a nice building. What else is there to say??
I can highly recommend to take a boat cruise on Donau. The place looks really good from the water side.
An Architectural masterpiece!. An imposing structure on the shore of the Danube with statues galore! Don't miss the walk of shoes on the quay outside;a poignant reminder of man's inhumanity to man.
Amazing city with great value for money. We looked at this view every day from our balcony at the Atr'otel which is very well located and close to the tour bus stop.

A spectacular building!!. I was last in Budapest 19 years ago - and boy has it changed! The buildings were then under a layer of communist soot, but not only have they been beautifully cleaned now, they are brilliantly illuminated at night! Really really a spectacular building! But don't only admire it from the outside, take a tour inside! It takes about an hour, and it's given in numerous languages. You see some of the main halls as well as the beautiful chamber where the government sits!

An hour well spent - impressive. We had booked the tour in advance through Jegymester (costs 200 huf extra per booking) and I would recommend that seeing that they offer many languages but at different times of day. Airport style security. Elevators for those who don't want to walk the beautiful stairs. Nice guide and not too much information crammed in the 45 minutes. Impressive with the St Stephens crown that is a 1000 years old and the soldiers guarding it.
Beautifully architecture. . This building is amazingly in perfect state. Not what I expected after all Hungry has been through. Well worth the visit.

Well worth a visit. We happened to be in Budapest when all public buildings had free entry, so this is one place we just had to see. Amazing architecture, so clean and bright. Would take you an hour to see it properlyCheck parliament isn't actually sitting before you visit otherwise you will be restricted which parts of the building you can see. (Hotel reception can make a quick phone call)

Closed for National Day. Bad info from the concierge that Parliament would be open on National Day. I had run buy it for a couple of days but actually seeing it uncles was fantastic. Very large building that just has amazing eye appeal. Will get the inside tour next time.
Amazing building from every angle. It's a must-see of Budapest. There's a small underground memorial museum you can see there, it tells a story of the 1956 shooting that occurred there.
Insight into the seat of power. Took a tour; good explanations, and got to see lots of the building's features. Offered in languages including English - guide was fluent.
Worth seeing. Get the guided tour which is a great value for money and offers you some very nice insights on the history of the country and the parliament itself.
Local history . Interesting place well worth seeing before you leave budapest the work that has gone into the building is outstanding

Gorgeous building beside the Danube. What a beautiful building in a lovely location. There are wonderful benches with trees that you can rest and relax on. The view across the Danube is great and it is also close to the Budapest Shoe Monument. Make sure you keep warmly clothed in spring as the breeze from the water can be very cold. The area looks wonderful at night under lights.

Nice guided tour. The bulding is insanly big ! After a security check, we visit the parlement in 30min guided tour. Considering the size of the building, we maybe see only 5%, but still, it's nice, eloquent and worth it.About 12§ pp.
Very neat! . Really a cool place with a nice view. Kind of hard to figure out how to reach the entrance of this place, but worth it once we discovered the way. Slightly chilly, but worth the cold!

Great experience. Wonderful place to visit, make sue you see both the underground exhibits either side of the parliment. They tell you how much restoration work has been done on this building due to damage by wars and weather. there are lots of statues around the outside to see. You really must see this place at night when it is lit up it is more amazing than in the daytime.
Excellent day and night. How nice architecture is it.How beautiful place by danube river.One of the most lovely building not only in budapest, but in whole europe.Night so brillant.Go and see.
Nice building!!. It was one of the biggest parliament building we have ever seen. Looks like a palace from the middle age. If you are in Hungary, you must visit it!
That is amazing. Best house of Parliament of the world. I really offer everyone in Budapest. You will love it. Renuwed few years ago.

Most beautiful parlament in Europe. Definately a must have in Budapest.Guided tours are availabe in many foreign languages.Amazing, huge and beautiful.Michael Jackson and Freddy Mercury wanted to buy it but certainly it was not for sale.

Iconic spot of the capital, always good to look at. I went to university in Budapest so I saw this building a lot of times and I joined an inside tour 3 times, as well. Always spectacular from inside, from the square, bridges or Buda's hills. Have a look at it in shining daytime and with the evening illumination, too!

Beautifully & Historic. A Gothic revival style building with 2 identical parliament halls. A joy to have a look around, but definitely with a guide.Local Cafe;s nearby and a small park to sit and admire the architecture

Superb building. Must see building
You can serif well during boat cruise and get down from hop on hop off bus and visit the it personally. Very well connected by public transportation

Unique in Europe!. A really unique Parliament with a special architecetura. It is a great thing to see it from outside, but worthy to visit inside as well.
If you are European citizen you can enter for free...So Do not get fooled...some guys asking for money...they say its a guided tour...but even a guided tour is free...
Truely impressive. Beautiful building and what suprised me the most was how close you can get to it considering its the power seat of Hungary. Amazing view of the Buda side as well...
Amazing place!. Wow, stunning building, this is great on foot during the day,however take an evening cruise to see it at its best!

Beautiful building. We didn't venture inside the Parliament building for the tour (good excuse to come back to Hungary) but the outside was spectacular enough. This building would put most parliaments and palaces to shame. Get up close it take a boat ride, both will give you amazing photo opportunities. A definite must when in Budapest.

Outside view. Parliament is best viewed from afar, across the river Danube or from gellert hill. It is a very imposing building. We did not have time to view the inside so cannot comment. Also looks great at night from our boat trip down the Danube. Very well lit up
Monumental Parliament. One of the biggest and most beatifull parliament buliding on esrth,it is worth to wait the tour and visit from inside as well.Renovation finished 2 years ago.

So grand. Venice apart is anywhere so photogenic as the Parliament building ?
Just cannot get enough of it. Be mindful that tours are at specific times in specific languages. You may drop lucky but we had a 2 hour wait for English to get its turn
Beautiful Building especially at night. Best seen from across the river in Buda. I suggest you take late afternoon drink at a cafe near the fisherman bastion looking at the Parliament `s view
Amazing Building. Parliament Building was amazing by day and night. Do take time to walk around the whole building as there are some wonderful statues in the grounds.
Amazing Building. Parliament Building was amazing by day and night. Do take time to walk around the whole building as there are some wonderful statues in the grounds.
have to see it. I was walking in buda with my foreigner friend when he saw the parliment and he said.. I hate when people know I'm a tourist but i have to take a picture :D

Must see Attraction. Amazing building Structure and internal décor must be seen,you need to do the 45 minuet group tour, which is in English the guide was very knowledgeable and spoke very good English.The tours can only be booked on the day at the venue, bookings can be made on linecosting 2200 Hufs aprox £6It takes aprox 20 minuets to walk from the centre of Budapest

Amazing every time. I am always amazed by the details on this huge and beautiful building!! Visible from almost any part of the city, it will be even more memorable when you see it close up, as the architecture is truly stunning!

Stunning. A visit to the Parliament Building is a must whilst in Budapest. Looking across the Danube towards this breathtaking piece of architecture we couldn't wait to see it in more detail. After a stroll along the banks of the river and across Margaret Bridge we were up close and personal with this beast of building. From whatever angle you gaze at this mighty wonder you can't be anything other than impressed.

brilliant impressive building. the building is magnificent and in a wonderful river side location. It is worth booking on line for the tour as spaces are limited and there are only daily English speaking tours. The tour was really worthwhile as the splendid inside is as impressive as the outside.
A must see! . The building is charming in night, i hope if i can visit it from inside, can i? , but you will really like it

Incredible!!. One of the richest places we have ever been too... definitely worth the visit. The guide was knowledgeable, and we ended up watching a change of guards around the crown jewels, which unlike in many museums, were the real ones.

Huge, beautiful building. If you go to Budapest, you need to visit the parliament building. It's huge and it's beautiful. They offer guided toors in various languages (get the tickets in advance!). Our tour guide gave us a lot of information about the history of the building, some remarkable technical details, etc. Overall very impressive and well worth both, time and money.

Stunning structure inside and out. The building of Hungarian Parliament is the most beautiful structure I've ever seen. Truly a magnificent gem. Makes sure to book a tour to see the inside too - the designer sure loves gold and marble, but despite the kitsch, it's a beautiful sight to behold. The tickets aren't cheap (HUF 5,200 for non-EU residents) and the tour is brief (about 30 minutes), but it's worth it.

Wow!. This place is HUGE! My travel group was not able to go inside the building as we were pressed for time, but the view from outside was impressive to say the least. Don't miss this! And if you get the chance, make sure to also take a look at the shoe memorial at the Danube river nearby.
Excellent. Beautiful place I do recommend pick a tourist guide they speak many languages it's what wild to pay them feel fairings

A gem in the heart of the city.. The Parliament is the most iconic building of Budapest, and Hungary in general.
The beauty of it stands on its impressive gothic style and its enormous size. The recent renovation of the square around the Parliament made it even better, especially for tourists.
In case you find yourself in Budapest, make sure you make a visit to the Parliament.

Enjoy the Parliament form the Outside. At around 5:30 pm you can witness the flag retreat ceremony (flag is lowered and folded). Stay until 6 pm when all the lights turn on and enjoy the great view of Buda and Pest.

Overpriced. The outside is great... Gorgeous! A focal point in fact from the river... But the tour. Overpriced and you see about 3 main rooms, It was over way too quick (25-30 mins if I recall correctly). We could also not understand the tour guide, either because of her strong accent or the way she sounded like she was eating the microphone (we all wore headsets to hear her). I'd go here just to say I've been, nothing more.
Out and about. Visits to the Parliament building are by prior arrangement only,but the outside of the building is stunning
Impressive building.. We walked around the building. Pretty impressive and nicely refurbished. It is even more impressive from the other side of the Danube.

Nice architecture, interesting. I looked up the tour times in English and we decided to go for the 10am one. When we bought our tickets we were offered a 0945 tour which wasn't advertised anywhere and we went for it. They don't make you take off your bags and clothes which we found a little odd. They give you a headset and the tour guide speaks into a microphone which works well. Our guide was pretty good, her English was satisfactory and accent not too bad. The building is quite big with lots of gold, lots to see.We enjoyed the tour. They don't label anything and don't explain some things that we found interesting. There could've been more descriptions and information on what's what and why is it there. Otherwise great visit.

Run-of-the-mill tour, but amazing building. The Parliament building itself is amazing - from the outside as well as the inside. However, in order to see the inside you need to book a guided tour. For EU citizens the tour price is ok, but for non-EU citizens (my friend happened to be American) the tour is just overpriced. The tour lasts around 45 minutes of which 15 minutes are spent waiting for all tour participants to pass the security check. We were given audio guides to better understand the guide, but the system was not working very well so that we often only understood fractions of what she was saying. Still, the views inside the building are stunning. So, if you are a EU citizen, have an extra hour of time and primarily want to see the inside, you should just do the tour.

weekend visit. This is the iconic view of Budapest which appears on every advert for river cruises! It is based on our own houses of Parliament, which I suppose is some kind of compliment. However you cannot gain entry during the summer and there is little in the immediate surroundings to attract visitors. I do however recommend the boat trip up the river to an island which offers you a range of views of the city. Yu board from a spot just downriver from the parliament building
Gorgeous piece of art. Absolutely amazing building and the best piece of architecture I have seen. Beautiful when lit up at night, cruise on Danube is a must.

Extraordinary building. Beautiful during the daytime, but amazing when lit up at night. The ideal way to look at this is from an evening river cruise ship, ours was free, included with our hop-on, hop-off bus tickets.

This is a must!. When you are in Budapest, you must see this building from the inside as well. We booked a guided tour, which was informative and took about 45 minutes. Amazing architecture and history.

Fantastic building over looking the Danube. We didn't actually go in because the queues were to long my recco is to go early, problem is the hop on off bus drops loads off at the same time so may be better to make your own way and avoid bus arrival times
Parliament buildings. Stunning! Well worth the walk to see. Love the architecture! Don't know if you can go inside, time wasn't on our side!

Loved it. We all loved it. We bought the tickets online. The guided tour was very nicely organized and started on time. We learned some interesting facts and got to see one of the oldest crowns in Europe. The building is absolutely impressive. Definitely worth the visit.

hard to get tickets. Our guidebook said to go first thing in the AM in order to get tickets. We got there 10 minutes after the ticket booth opened and they were sold out. In hindsight we should have paid a ticket fee and booked online before .

Huge and magnificent!. Only visited at night. So I can not tell about the interior. It is huge and magnificent. Took some of my best photos while in the opposite bay of Danube river looking at this building! The view to Fisherman's Bastion and the Palace is worth also to take the metro and stop to visit Parliament.

Beautiful building. Unfortunately as we were only in Budapest for 1 1/2 days we didn't have enough time to do the tour. Well worth a visit to see this lovely building. The area nearby has lots of antique shops.
A must visit, but needs to be booked well in advance of travelling.. Lovely building, interesting visit, book ahead, don't be late! One of the main attractions in Budapest.

Beautiful building. Unfortunately we had booked this trip and only when we tried to book for the tour of the parliament did we discover that it was a 2 day public holiday. I would advise anyone who would like to do the interior to check and book the tour from home to save any disappointment. You don't get in during any sessions so it's not as simple as just turning up
Beautiful building. The architecture and ornate interior are amazing, and well worth a look. The tour was a little weak, owing mainly to very poor and crackly ear phones.

Anniversary trip. Although we didn't get to visit inside the parliament building, I still found the outside truly spectacular. Every time I looked at this building it never failed to amaze me.....I think I have about 30 photos taken from all angles
amazing. This has to be one of the most amazing looking buildings i have seen did not manage the tour inside as it was a national holiday when we were there but all good
Parliament Square. Worth a walk alone the Danube to visit the beautiful Parliament Building then wander back to the city centre through the streets.
well worth visiting the Houses of Parliament. excellent guide, with lots of non boring anecdotes.worth going back in the evening to see the Houses lit up at night.
Beautiful building. The price was a little steep to tour it but it was worth seeing. Be prepared to go through metal detectors to go through.
A most beautiful building. View it from Fisherman's Bastin and visit ti to see the beautiful intereior and the crown and regalia.

Worth a visit. This building dominates the riverfront horizon in the daytime and is one of the most beautiful buildings in the city when it lights up at night. I recommend a cruise along the Danube to view the entire riverfront, and Parliament will be the highlight of that trip. It takes a tour or special invitation to visit the interior, but tours are easy to find and plentiful and can usually be arranged through your hotel or one of the tourist venues in the city, or you can pick up tickets at the booth at the main gate. The building is an amazing amalgam of neo-Gothic, Renaissance and Baroque architecture and these details carry into the interior. Soaring ceilings, marble staircases, statuary and amazing artwork are everywhere inside. The tours conclude at the crown jewels, and although some of these are copies (the originals are in a vault) they are worth seeing and the history behind them is very interesting. We highly recommend taking an hour for the visit.

Changing of the guard. Awsome place and a must to visit. Time it right and see the spectacular changing of the guard. To get to it, take the funicular. That is an experience on it's own. Loverly places to eat and drink around the loverly buildings. Don't miss it.

Beautiful impressive building . Largest building in Hungary and tallest in Budapest!
Visit day or night for great views. Tours are available and is best to book as they can get very busy.
Perfect place to chill. The Parliament has an amazing architecture. And it is not a busy area, you can just sit down by the benches and admire the building itself, which for me is enough.

Splendid Building. It is well worth viewing this quite magnificent building from a river cruise at night! A princely structure. Decided to visit and take a guided tour to view the interior. As beautiful inside as it is from outside. Excellent tour guide with good headphone clarity in English. The parliament chamber and seeing the Hungarian Crown Jewels are the highlights. Well worth a visit. Our return to the city centre was by tram-- tickets available from the nearby Metro station.
Beautiful at night . Well Worth a visit, especially at night, very beautiful building which is all lit up at night. You also get a good review from fisherman bastion of you fancy a walk

Beautiful building. We stood outside the parliament building admiring the architecture and how well preserved it was.At night is a must visit it was lit up beautifully plus the other statues in the massive square.Did not go inside but you can book a viewing. Well worth a visit
Excellent building and political membership. When you have a visit while there is a meeting of the parliament members and visitors, it gives an excellent view and impression.
Beautiful buildings. Beautiful buildings if you get the River cruise you will get some really nice photos of the front. It is lit up beautifully at night

Majestic. A landmark not to be missed. This is one of the major landmarks on the Pest side of the city. Parliament is exactly by the river side. There is also a cafeteria adjacent to the building. Definitely a place to see.

One of the most wonderful and largest Parliament of the world is in Budapest, Hungary. The giant and fancy building is prevail on the riverside of Pest in between two also historical and eye-catching bridges. (the Margaret and famous Chain-bridge) Its main façade overlooks the river Danube, though the main entrance is from the spacious square (Kossuth sqr.) on the other side of the building. All in all 242 noble sculptures on the wall, in-and outside.There are guided tours (takes about an hour on super affordable price) to show your around in the main venues: great entrance stairs, lobby area and the chamber of crown jewels etc.

Could be better. Booked a pre payment ticket from Cityrama Tours but don't bother. Greeted by a rep. who just thrust tickets at us and said he was going. Just go along and get a timed ticket. Very chaotic on entering. The building is amazing but the whole experience was marred by the poor organisation from start to finish.

Beautiful building, great tours and tour-guides. Fantastically organized tour with great explanations. Tours take place every 30minutes to 1 hours depending on the language you choose. The guides are knowledgeable and friendly and the building is truly worth your time
an impressive building. one of the most impressive buildings in the city, and probably one of the most impressive parliaments n Europe
The most beautiful building I have ever seen . Take a cruise down the danube at night to see this magnificent building lit up in all its glory, breathtaking!

Wonderful building in amazing city. Book a tour as places are limited and English speaking tours are excellent but limited. The money spent on parliament is amazing and the amount of decoration is unbelievable.We had to reorgnaise our 4 day trip to Budapest to make sure we were able to visit and we are very glad we did. Make sure that you take all the id that you are required to take and show. You will also have a security search, like at an airport.

A "must" see in Budapest. We did the 45 minute tour of Parliament, and it was definitely worth the time and money. The guide was excellent in her presentation of the history of this beautiful building, and it was very well organized. There is such grandeur, and the view of the Danube and city is spectacular. I would definitely recommend this as a sight you won't want to miss in your visit to Budapest.

Brilliant! The most beautiful building in Hungary . Didn't go inside. The queue was big and didn't want to spend too much time. However I've walked around the building. Awesome architecture! Beautiful views. Stunning
Impressive historical building. Budapest is generally a wonderful city, but this building is special. It actually shows how you can preserve an architectual monument while using it.

Hungarian Parliament - a must see. A masterpiece outside and inside. Built in the beginning of the 20th century, modelled on the British Parliament, but has its own special features. It houses the holy crown of Hungary and wonderfully ornamented, rich in gold, painted glass windows etc. It has taken decades to renovate the outside as it had been built of crumbly limestone, but now it is finally ready and beautiful as ever. The landscaping and new statues on the square in front of the building have also been completed. Organised visits depart hourly - booking must be made in advance for a low fee.
Amazing. Spectacular building when seen from close or from across the river definately a must see in budapest

Another Stunning Building. Took in an evening riverboat cruise. It is well lit up for pictures at night and is really another fabulous building in Budapest. We took a walk around it a few days later and is covers a fair old distance to walk around and was certainly deceptive, going from the view we had saw from the boat.Another building you should make sure you take time to visit, during your sightseeing in this wonderful City!
Walking. Very nice place to walk along Danube Promenade and a little Parlament square. You can enjoy architecture and interesting monuments as "Shoes of Danube"

Worth a visit. The parliament is already amazing from the outside, but a guided tour inside is well worth it, especially if you're a student (Only 1000 HUF). The tour is quite short, it lasts a little more than 30 minutes, but you have time to see all of the best things. I love the inside of the dome, the architecture is amazing.

beautiful building. THE PARLIAMENT BUILDING is one of the most iconic buildings in Budapest and along with THE CHAIN BRIDGE is certainly the most photographed.During the day it looks cool but at night when it's bathed in light it looks awesome .It's an amazing structure, i love to catch the ferry across the Danube and see it from water level,your B.K.K public travel pass allows you on the boats so no need for an expensive tour boat ride.A great tourist attraction and well worth a visit.

Very impressive. Before we came to Budapest, I tried to book online two Saturday tickets. But their website said they would be closed Saturday and Sunday. However when we went to just sight-see the Parliament exterior building, we found that the visitor center was open. We were overjoyed and reserved immediately the afternoon English guided tour. The guide is very experienced and obviously knows the history well. At the end she would answer our questions and then sent us to the small exhibition room downstairs and say good bye to everyone. We paid 2000 fl for the EU residence (otherwise 5200 fl). The tour is about 30 minutes or so. It is very impressive to see the fabulous interior of the parliament and the gold crown in the dome room. It is definitely worth every penny of it.
Beautiful . Had an amazing time here with my family. So relaxed and the weather made it better!Reallt enjoyed walking around seeing new and different things.
beautiful parliament. I went here during the night to see the parliament and see the shoes statue! love it very much. I prefer seeing the parliament at night rather than at day

Beautiful but be sure to see both at night and from the Buda side. Building is quite beautiful but be sure to not only walk around it during the day but also to see it at night and from the Buda side. Fishermans Bastion across the river on Castle Hill is a great place to look down at the entire Parliament Complex. We had a scheduling problem as the Parliament was going to be closed on both Tues for Independence Day as well as Wed. We were able to get in to the building on Monday but not on a tour. Inside is quite beautiful and ornate. We saw St Stephens crown and scepter but didn't see too much of the other 700 rooms.

Interesting tour - a bit rushed. We took the tour in english. Thought we would have an english speaking guide - guide had memorized the script in english but she was unable to answer any questions because she did not understand them! Tour is a rushed walk through the Parliament. Interesting architecture but overall not sure it was worth the time invested.
Very nice. Excellent landmark and fascinating history. Recommended to take pictures at night from the other side of Danube.

The greatest Parliament building in the world. The Hungarian Parliament, also known as the Parliament of Budapest for being located in that city, is the seat of the National Assembly of Hungary, one of Europe's oldest legislative buildings, a notable landmark of Hungary and a popular tourist destination of Budapest. It lies in Lajos Kossuth Square, on the bank of the Danube. It is currently the largest building in Hungary and still the highest building in Budapest.

Amazing Building. A visit to Parliament is a must. It is an outstanding structure both inside and out, At night time the building is floodlit and from the opposite bank of the Danube it looks absolutely stunning. The guided tour (in English) is well worth doing at a very reasonable price.

Beautiful building. We took the time to walk around the building to see the architectural highlights up close and also walked out to a boat dock platform to be able to capture the entire building in a single photograph. Worth taking the time to walk in the plaza and see the statues commemorating historical figures and events.
Just looking . Huge building, not much to see, really pompous! Lots of tourists milling about. Great when it's sunny out!
Beautiful! . Beautiful place, very ornate interior. tour is good and not too long, worth a visit ! Pre booked tickets for the tour, was easy to do.

The pictures do this place no justice. . The size of the Parliament building is gigantic. The architecture is absolutely amazing. I don't believe it is a place you can go into but from the outside its worth the trip. I highly recommend a trip to go see and take it in.
Amazing building. One of the most beautiful buildings in Europe. Style of the builing is amazing, and it was build long time ago.

Beautiful building . My partner and I were staying not far from the parliament building so we walked through the grounds quite often. It's a magnificent structure and the dressed guards Marching around the spire in the yard makes for an interesting watch.
Beautiful Stunning Building. Most beautiful building, night and day this jewel shines in Budapest.The architecture is absolutely amazing with 68Kg of Gold used in internal decor!

Beautiful at night. The Hungarian Parliament is a very impressive building and well worth a visit. If you're only interested in looking at the outside then make sure you go back on an evening once it's dark, as the way the building is lit at night makes it even more imposing than it is during the day.By pure chance we happened to be outside as the guard was changed and whilst there is an element of aggressive Morris dancing to it, the offer made by the Captain at the end to go and have your photo taken with the soldiers made the British version with no interaction seem rather old fashioned.Tours around the interior are available throughout the day in a number of languages and can easily be booked online or at the visitors centre. Despite Bop's best attempts at persuasion, Beep put his foot down and insisted we went on a tour in our own language, rather than trying to understand what was going on in one we don't speak.Our tour was completed by a very knowledgeable guide and the use of headphones to transmit the guides comments made it easy to hear all the information without having to push to the front of a large group. The magnificent climb up the golden staircase is well worth the effort even if your feet are aching from climbing Gelert hill the day before and the modern technology within the debating chamber again made the British Parliament look antiquated.

Must see. Book your tour in advance online to make sure that you get in. The entrance is downstairs in the right end of the building when you're facing the main door in the middle from the court side.The tour will start on time after the security control -no toilets on that side!- and will take about 30 min. The building is amazing! The largeness of it all is breathtaking in a way that no other equal building has so far done. And yet, all the gold and high ceilings would be too much for a longer time. So this would be managable even with some kids or at least teenagers.
boat. saw it from boat trip you get a great view it is in with the hop on hop off sightseeing bus trip very good value

Best Parliament in Europe.... I have been in a lot of cities in Europe and 4 times in Budapest and still everytime I go I always get impressed with the size en beautifulness of the building. I love it and it's worthy to visit it. You can say you went to Budaptea if you didn't visit/see the Parliament.

Wonderful Building. Very good guided tour, about 45 minutes taking in the main debating chambers. Interesting museum at the end interpreting the history of the building and also displaying the original red star that adorned the tower in the Soviet era. Reasonable price but can get busy in high seasons.

Walked round the outside. Interesting. You can get much closer than you'd think. Good place to at least see as most directions start with 'from the Parliament'. Geat art outside. Guard change time is interesting too.

Great tour especially the royal crown with sworded guards. Really interesting view of hungarian parliament . very ornate with lots of gold . on first floor you will see the crown of former king which is guarded either side by special soldiers in traditional dress carrying a large sword each . You are told to stand well away from them and when they 'perform' their sword swirling to surprise you it is a sight to remember . NB You need ID to get in such as a passport or national insurance card . There are limited numbers to each tour so whilst we were able to walk in out of season I guess that would not be possible when busy .
