Magnificent building with a good bit of patriotic one upmanship in that it is bigger in size than any other parliament building in the world

Amazing building inside and out. Had guided tour, tour guide very informative, good price, tour took 40 minutes. Take passports to prove your European citizens to get discounted price. Spectacular ceiling paintings, gold leaf every where. High security but no issues. Definitely worth a visit.

Wroth a vist, the best buikding in Budapest. Well worth spending half a day but you have to pre book. The building is one of the best in Budapest, our hotel arranged the trip but you can book through Viator

A Must Visit ... If there is one must thing to do in Budapest it is a visit to Parliament buildings.How ever you must book a timed visit prior. We booked online before leaving home and had our etickets. But you can book at the vistors centre, but are not guaranteed a same day entry.The parliament is easy accessed on the number 2 yellow tram that runs along the pest side of the Danube.Nice modern visitors centre. With cafe, shop, and toilets.Arrive about 15 mins before your allocated time. Not to early as tours seem to go through in 15 minute slots. Also more than likely be another language tour going in at the same time as you. There is a clockroom for coats not bags once through airline type security.It is a guided tour takin around a hour. The party can be upto 50 but you get audio guides which means you will always hear your guide.There are large flights of stairs but if required the guide will direct you to the lift.On finishing the tour you will go through a small museum. Which has artifacts showing history of the building.
Stunning. Beautiful architecture up close as well as from the Buda side. It is recommended you register online before visiting the library as it is a government building.

One of the most beautiful buildings in Europe!. This building is an architectural gem and definitely worse the time to visit it. It should be the first item on every tourist's to-do list in Budapest. I recommend to take the guided tour, (about 30 minutes, various languages). Also, a walk on the Danube's bank in front of the Parliament is a nice experience.

Worth a look. It costs very little to visit the parliament building, you can walk round the outside for free. The visiting times are governed by what nationality you are so you will have to check either online or by going to the visitor reception, once inside you will have a guided tour around the chambers etc, it is quite beautiful as are the hungarian crown jewels which are also housed there, worth a visit to say you,ve been
Worth seeing. Beautiful architecture, 5 min walk out of town, definitely worth a visit! We went twice and were still amazed the second time. Lots of resteraunts, coffee shops and attractions near by.
A must see . A must see on a trip to Budapest, amazing building right on the Danube with stunning sculpturing and views over the river.

Beautiful architecture!. Parliament is a beautiful building, large and majestic. The tour was around 45 minutes and I thought to be a bit expensive unless you have a discount (EU, student, etc). I do recommend taking a walk around. Come near sunset and you can watch the Parliament light up on the outside, and then take a lovely stroll down the Danube back to the Chain Bridge, and you'll pass Shoes on the Danube along the way.

One of the most impressive building you will ever see.. Hugely impressive gothic revival building that dominates the riverfront. As amazing as it looks in daylight, illuminated at night it is simply magical. Take an after dark river cruise and marvel.

Incredible architecture!. Just amazing architecture, different than anything back home! Beautiful building and we even got to see the guards do their march because we came around noon. If you're in Budapest, it's definitely worth a stop.

Worth seeing!. The building is absolutely beautiful from the outside and inside! Worth purchasing a ticket and taking a 30 mins tour through the parliament building. My recommendation is to buy tickets online, because tickets are being sold out quickly in the tickets office at the location. In case you buy tickets online - remember that the price is lower for EU citizens. In my case I have bought ticket for EU citizen online, however I am not an EU citizen, just living in EU with Ukrainian passport. I was lucky and they didn't check my passport, so maybe it is worth trying the same trick :) The only check they are doing at the entrance - is the security check. The tour itself was not too long, so you don't get tired or bored of it (approx. 30 minutes). The tour guide speaks in the microphone and everyone gets a personal earphone - this allows you to hear every word of a tour guide even if you are stuck behind the group while taking photos.

Our 25th Anniversary. We toured here for our anniversary and the trip was magical! This building is so beautiful and intricate. We traveled with Trafalgar Tours and learned so much history. It is beautiful!

Must see. Went to see this today. The internal tour cost 2000huf which is reasonable as it comes with an English speaking guide and headphone. Amazing building inside and out. We were allowed to take photos too in most part of the building. Very good tour. A must visit while in Budapest. The grounds outside and the river walk nearby make this a lovely day out.

BREATHTAKING. After going through security you are presented with a audio device.The tour last approximately 45 minutes it feels like 5, the guide was very knowledgeable and was clear and concise, and not rushed.The whole building is breathtaking and the dome room with the crown jewels was something special, if there's one place to visit this has to be up their.The staff are very helpfull

Stunning building. What a fantastic building even more spectacular at night all lit up. The guided tour in English helps to make you understand how the building was built and all the various functions it has now.
Great to look at . The parliament is great to look at but the detail is 'dry' unless the inner working of administrative functions excites you. I would visit but the best view is by boat and at night

EPIC. This place is huge and epic. I strongly recommend you not just to come and see it. Take a free walking tour and you'll find out a lot of interesting stuff about the building and about the communist years. It's also worth it to take a tour inside the Parliament, to see how great it is from inside as well.

Stunning building that deserves to be visited. This is such a stunning building it's worth the effort to book a tour and see the amazing interior. Unfortunately the tour is quite short (only 1/2 hour) and I would have loved more time to see more rooms.

Interior and Exterior Marvel!. The Parliament is wonderful to look at from the outside but it is so much better from the inside. Therefore, you just have to get inside the Parliament to truly appreciate the real beauty. There are separate prices for EU and non EU peeps. It's almost double in price if you're not from the EU. :P But just go in. You won't regret it! So beautiful and filled with history!
Must see. EU citizen costs 2000 huf each with passport or ID.Non EU costs 5600 huf.Tour is with a guide in your chosen language, can get busy get there early.

Worth taking the tour and seeing it from inside. Very impressive decoration of the old style, beautiful and worth paying the tour.At the end of the tour there is a room with a lots of visual information about how, when etc the Parliament was built. It is very well preserved.

Good tour , lots of info.. To visit parliament you need to take a guided tour. It's quite impressive inside and the guide is full of info. Beautiful corridors and stairs all gold. Would not recommend to people visiting from outside the EU though, as the cost of a tour is double for them. No explanation why.
Need to visit!. Great building, friendly stuff, answering on all of our questions. Recommend for everyone. Just be sure that you have tickets before you go there.
beautiful building. A must to see! Within walking distance from most hotels. The architecture is superb. The location is amazing.

Longest parliament in Europe . Spectacular architecture. Great views from afar but upclose it is really superb. Didn't get to go in to any of the over 600 rooms. But enjoyed the courtyard. Also guards are posted and the look serious. Also lots of sculpture near by

Really impressing. You should definitely visit that place while staying in Budapest. The tour provides interesting details about building's story.
Be sure to book tickets in advance.
If you are lucky you will have the chance to see guardsmen's parade around noon,

Impressive, both day and night. An incredible and impressive building in a city literally littered with amazing architecture. At 11:30am at the entrance facing the square (rather than the river) the guards did an impressive march and invited people to have their pictures taken with them.
The most beautiful parliament!. The Hungarian parliament is one of the most beautiful parliament I have ever seen. Big building with delicate details.
Beautiful building with amazing interior. We were arranged for a quick tour of this magnificient building. Just enough to know enough. We had a good time with our good guide.
Stunnig!. The hungarian parliament is one of the most beautiful buildings in Europe! The best view you can take from the other side of the river (Buda side).

Beautiful Building and Interior. We went by metro for 350 HUF and entrance is 2000 HUF foe EU residents. Audio tour with guide is included so why pay more to go on a tour. Great exterior adorned with sculpture and detailed reliefs. The interior is similarly grand and reflects the passion for democracy in Hungary. Well worth a visit.

Rainy day activity. Yes it was raining and we needed to be indoors. The guided tour was good value and we didn't book ahead but only had an hour to wait for an English tour. Remember to take ID to get discounted tickets. The tour lasted about 45 mins. There was a gift shop selling quality souvenirs and a cafe.

Amazing place! . We took a tour around parliament and it was really interesting. Building was spectacular with all decor made from real gold. Tour guide was really good. Def recommend a visit here. Very cheap too.
Imposing!. This is a beautiful building but we didn't get the opportunity to go inside. But still worth the visit. Especially nice to view at night.
Amazing interior and tour. Well worth the visit beautiful to see the inside and hear about the history. Get your tickets ahead of time.
Very nice particularly at night. I love it , even if it is a bit a copy of London parliament but at night reflecting into the Danube is so great. Stumming photos to do.
Visit to the Parliament Museum. Well worth an hour of your day. An excellent audio guide gives full information of the rich history of the politics of this country
Splendid architecture. We had a tour of parliament, very quick, about 40 minutes. Enjoyable throughout, with the help of a very knowledgeable tour guide.
Amazing Building. This is a must visit if you are in Budapest. I didn't have time to go in as I was on a business trip however I took these photos. I hope you like them.

Beautiful viewed from the river lit up at night. Our river tour started at 6.30pm in March. Sailing past the Parliament was breathtaking however the cruise was about 10 mins too long and everyone was frozen by the end. If sitting upstairs on the vessel try and sit near one of the speakers as it was hard to hear the commentary from anywhere else.

Educational and interesting!. We both really enjoyed the tour around the parliament building. It was quite a big group but it didn't take anything away from the tour. We were lucky enough to visit the sout wing of the parliament as well as the Northwing which added to the enjoyment of the visit. It is stunningly beautiful isnide and out and I would highly recommend taking a visit around. Good value for money if you can prove you are an EU citizen.

Pretty building, tour okay. The Parliament is a very beautiful building, and is quite nice inside, but you don't really see much on the tour. The first problem is booking tickets--you can only get tickets for that day at the visitor center (if they have tickets available). We got on the cell phone and booked tickets for the following day while we were in the visitor center. They are able to print out the tickets for you about 15 minutes before your tour start time, so don't worry about not having a printer. For the tour itself, it felt like we were rushed through the few rooms we were able to see (main stairway, rotunda with the old Hungarian crown, hall, and the lesser used Parliament room). There was some interesting information, and I enjoyed seeing the old Hungarian crown, but I'm unsure if it was really worth the time and effort of booking and paying for the tickets. Our children (8&5) were bored, and I might have enjoyed it better without them. For a family tour, the Opera is a better choice.
Impressive. This is an impressive building of the city. You have to take the tour to learn the history of it. Also this is the most photographed place in Budapest.
The most beautiful at night. This breathtaking building is worth a tour and a must see at night. Go on a Danube dinner or drinks cruise to see this place floodlit at night.

just a massive and beautiful building. so your walking down the river and you come across a massive, clean and just aweinspiring building. easily walking distance from everywhere and so close to the river too.

Unusual architecture!. The parliament was amazingly large and beautiful for a relatively small country, It is the largest building in the country and the tallest in the city. We came here by car but it is accessible by metro. Inside it was very crowded at the X-rays scanner that we had to wait for about 10 minutes. There is a discount for student even you did not bring the student card. Inside, it look similar to other palace in central Europe tough but the guide tour is great. Therefore, It actually look more stunning from outside.
Beautiful building- enjoyed the tour!. A few friends and I visited this building and had a great tour of the inside- it was very informative and interesting, plus the rooms were beautiful!!

Worth visiting. Book the tickets online. Worthwhile going and interesting. You can check your coat as it can be warm in there. Also you go,up a great staircase so take it in as you exit a different way.
amazing. this was a great walk around but the uprising museum was closed on our visit but still plenty to see

Stunning building. The houses of Parliament can be found on the Pest side of the Danube. It is a stunningly beautiful neo-gothic eclectic building and it was built from 1885 - 1904, designed by Hungarian architect Imre Steindl. It is a whopping 96 meters tall and it spreads over 17,745m2, making it Europe's 2nd and the world's 3rd biggest Parliament building. The crown of St Stephen (Hungary's first king) can be found in the building too. Photo tip: I have taken some great pictures of the Parliament from Buda Castle - it really is such a majestic, beautiful building, a must-see attraction for all architecture lovers. Ticket prices:Full price ticket:4000 Ft/personConcessions:Students(6–24 years):2000 Ft/personAdults from EU states:2000 Ft/personStudents from EU states(6-24 years):1000 Ft/personChildren under 6 can get in free of charge.Student cards / ID cards must be presented for concessions.Tickets can be bought on site on the day of the visit.They do guided tours as well, in several different languages, every day at the following times:Hungarian: 10:30, 13:30English: 10:00, 12:00, 13:00, 14:00, 15:00French: 11:00, 13:30Hebrew: 12:30German: 10:00, 13:00, 14:00Russian: 12:30, 15:15Italian: 10:15, 13:15, 14:15, 15:30Spanish: 10:15, 13:15, 14:15, 16:00
Great scenery. I travel very frequently to Budapest but each time I can't miss seeing the parliament. It is more beautiful at night with lights.

Book your tour to avoid queues. First of all, the building is fabulous. Really worth a visit.Only problems were that the group was rather large and the guide's English was very heavily accented so it was hard to understand at the back of the group
Amazing . It was so amazing just a stones throw away from our hotel. Stunning at night too. Interesting to see the change of guards around 12middday. You can visit the parliament for a small fee
Beautiful at night . We didn't go inside but we took a river cruise along the Danube at night the the parliament building was spectacular. Don't miss it

Great tour . It was great to see the inside of this amazing building. There are plenty of tours in a variety of languages. You get to see the Crown Jewels and where parliament sessions are held. The internal architecture is stunning and there was great views across the river too. Note, you are not allowed to take photos of the Crown Jewels although that didn't stop people trying, which was very disrespectful!

amazing. beautifull and unique this building is the equal as the one in London and its possible to visit it but go early and book it in advance to make sure you are invited in there is almost same amount of gold as in Synagoga
Amazing architecture!... When we visited Budapest, we took a boat trip, to see this beautiful unique building the best way. Its huge! :)
Must see. A must see especially on a night cruise down the river! Stunning architecture. Have a coffee at the cafe close by with views of the Parliament building
Lovely Site. This Parliament is a lovely place to see but it is especially lovely when lit up at night. I would advise a boat cruise along the Danube to view this at it's best.
Such an amazing looking building. This building is a must visit. At night it's all lit up and looks beautiful. It's a huge building and right on the river front. You can't go inside.
impressive. the building is impressive inside and outside.. you can take very good photos and the view is fascinating. dont forget to go all around it.. speechless every time i visit it :)

Book online before you go - stunning visit. We booked and printed our tickets before we left the UK. The guide spoke good English and provided a very interesting tour, with lots of photo opportunities. The building is even more impressive on the inside and by the time we'd looked at the exhibition and had a drink in the cafe, we had spent virtually a whole morning here. My only gripe being the charge to use the toilets!

HUGE. It was really huge, walking around the grounds is pleasant specially during spring. There were honor guards marching and performing a flag retreat during the afternoons. After visiting this landmark walk along the bank of the Danube and check out the Shoes on the Danube memorial

Stunning Building. Both the inside and outside of this building are beautiful. We did the guided tour, however felt it was a bit short lived and possibly not worth the money. You get to see the golden staircase, crown jewels (not allowed to take photos of these) and the old House of Lords. Would definitely reccomended a visit even if it is just to take photos of the outside.

Lovely Majestic Architecture.... ... both up close and from a distance. The building is beautiful and kept very well maintained. It is a site to see from the river or opposite side on the other bank. I love the intricate detail worked into the building and spent at least an hour walking around the building taking photos from every angle possible.The area around the Parliament is also very well kept and nice to walk around on a summers day. If you get a chance don't just view it from afar but come closer and enjoy this building and it's character.

Super building. The building itself is super big with really nice architecture. We were impressed. Unfortunately we didnt have time to go inside. But we made it to see this bulding from the other side of the city which is superbly nice view.
Outstanding exterior of the Parliament. Grand gesture of power manifested by this magnificent building. Also best seen from Buda Hills. Watch the soldiers do their marching parade.
Well worth 2 hours. This is a beautiful building next to the Danube which we enjoyed looking at. It would seem the stonework has recently been cleaned giving it a real gleam enjoyed it a great deal
Nice Architect . This massive monument standing along the side of Danube speaks volume of the Austro-Hungarian wealth. This is really beautiful and with taking a closer look.
Must see. Watch out for shoe war monument on rivers edge near building. Beautiful building, would rival anything in Rome.

Not worth it. This could be a fantastic tour if it was done properly. Paid well over what we thought it was worth. Didn't get to see much at all and it felt very rushed, almost like they were trying to cut the tour short. It's great to visit but would think twice before paying for the tour.
Nice view . We didn't actually go inside but stayed round the corner from the parliament and heard all about it on our buda bike tour. Very pretty at nice.
Changing of the guards.. They seem to change every half hour to a rocky inspired theme tune! Just kidding but you'll understand if you see it. Amazing building with 20km of stairs!
Great building!. The building looks very nice! It is one of the nicest of Budapest I have not been inside though but the outside is worth it

A great building near Danube. I have not seen inside the building, but the rest looks great.
It would be good to see the protocol of changes guard and after that you can take photos with the soldiers

Impressive architecture. This building is beautiful inside and out. The tour is reasonable, it lasts about 45 minutes and our guide welcomed questions along the way as well as giving information. You can take photos in most parts of the building, just not of the crown jewels. Guide books advise you to book tickets in advance because each tour has a maximum number of participants. We didn't book (but it's not the height of tourist season) and got tickets for the next tour on the door.
Parliament building. Beautiful, closed on Mondays.on the Pest side of Budapest beside the Danube . Train and trolley bus stops beside it.

Don't miss this. Apart from looking wonderful from the outside, especially from a boat at night, the Parliament is well worth a visit and tour around. There are English speaking tours at various times, so check in advance when they take place. The interior of the building is really impressive, so much gold! And the tour was very informative.

Walked around building. We didn't go inside. The outside was beautiful. We walked into the gift shop and to see all of the statues outside. We stopped to have coffee at Elysees and got to people watch all of the people coming and going. It was wonderful.

Beautiful. The Parliament is one of the most beautiful buildings in Europe, inside and out, day and night. It's worth taking one of the tours if you get the chance, there are several daily with guides in different languages.

From outside, looks better from further away. We wandered up to this during our night time stroll and it was lit tastefully. Up close you can see its ornamentation. However, I feel the better views of it were from Buda Castle and from the Buda waterfront.
great building. Well worth a visit nestling on the Danube great architecture, and surrounded by building showing signs of the uprising i.e. bullet holes in the walls

Beautiful by night. Informative tours take place throughout the day but you do really need to book in advance. Duration is around an hour - 90 mins. You get to see the gold staircase / hallways and are allowed to take photos except in one room. The best view of Parliament is from the other side of the river, ESPECIALLY by night! I have never seen a building lit so beautifully and with the darkness of the river - it just a 'wow' moment.

A must see. My sister and I booked our tickets online and went on a Sunday morning. What a beautiful building inside and out, a highlight of our trip. We had a lovely tour guide who was funny and well informed. If you go to Budapest this is a must see.Also check it out at night!

Grandeur with a capital G. One of the most beautiful buildings in Budapest, if not, in the world. The tour was short but well worth it. The magnificent architecture is impressive both inside and out. But probably the most memorable is the view of the well lit building from all over Budapest, especially from Pest.Budapest has made a deep and lasting impression on me, it is by far the most beautiful city I've ever visited, and the Parliament building definitely contributed to that.
Great . Nice building ! Everyone should visit while in Budapest! You might need to take your time there while it's a nice place to hang out. The environment is pleasing

Mildly interesting, scripted guide, very fast. This was a take it or leave it tour. Impressive building but the guide spoke non-stop without taking any breathes for 50 mins pretty much following a script. Some interesting aspects, in particular with respect to Hungarian democracy, the working of parliament and the holy nature of the crown. Overall worth it if you are an eu citizen and get the reduced priced tickets.

Beautiful Building. Go at night to see the Parliament lit up at night...magical! Best thing is to take the Budapest tourist bus and go late afternoon to see the Parliament building all lit up..magical !

Great history. Excellent tour to understand more about the history of Budapest and the political and Royal background of Hungary. I'd advise to book online to avoid disappointment as we didn't know there were only certain times for tours in your language. Facilities were modern and a lovely cafe onsite.
Nice architecture . We could only see it from the outside. Very picturesque. Not far from the shoes on the Danube memorial. Lovely stroll.

Impressive building. We decided to have a tour around parliament after seeing how good it looked from the outside. It was 2000HUF to enter which is a discounted price if you are a member of the EU and have a document to prove it. You have to go through airport style scans and searches so if like my wife you have a butter knife for your picnic in your bag, they will understandably relieve you of it before entry. The tour itself is not very long, about 45 mins and you get to see the debating chamber and the crown jewels, as well as art and architecture of other rooms You can join a tour in many languages and there is a cafe and gift shop which you can enter without paying.
Must see. We had few hours and decided to go to Parliament. Great architecture and quite boring excursion. But there is no other chance to get inside.
Parliament. You definetly have to see the building at the night. It is beautiful but we sadly haven't been inside-

The masterpiece of architecture. Before our arrival I knew that Parliament is the most known building in Budapest. And when we came here I understood why. The Parliament is HUGE and simply wonderful from the outside, makes a great impression. But also the interior part is worth seen. We paid for 2 EU students' tickets 2000 HUF. What is also important, the Parliament looks at night even more impressive and is visible from every view point in the city. I would strongly recommend all the tourists to visit the Parliament building.

Very. Recomandes tour.
We visit in off season so no crowdy.
The guides are very good english talker.
The building is very impresive.
I warm recomand this tour.
Amazing. Well worth the visit.. its a short walk down and the views then are amazing. you can book tours also but they need to be booked in advance.

Exactly what you'd expect. The exterior of this building is one of the most impressive and finest I have witnessed; you will see it multiple times during your trip. A tour is worthwhile but unexceptional. The interior is as sumptuous as the exterior but has few surprises. The tour is cheap and the guide was excellent.
Go at night if you can!. We did a Danube cruise as part of our bus tour -I'd recommend going at night as it's absolutely beautiful and the lights make for excellent photographs!
A wonderful building. Booked a tour online to ensure we got on a tour in English at a time that suited us. It was well worth it as the interior of the building is as impressive as the outside.

The Building of Budapest. Ah inspiring. This building is the main reason we chose Budapest. It is magnificent in stature and I could have looked at all the intricacies for hours. The photo opportunities were great. Early morning or night shots were both fantastic.

Worth the visit. Budapest's parliament is not only worth to see from the outside but also to visit on the inside. Every 45 minutes there's a tour in a variety of languages for small groups, so you should be aware that you may have to wait a while for the next tour, specially if you want to take the one in english.

Fascinating. Really worth going on this short guided tour. You have to book and go through security to see an opulent neogothic style interior, strongly reminiscent of London's parliament, and the famous gold St Stephen's crown, guarded by two soldiers with drawn swords. The crown was made in the 10th century and is of huge symbolic significance to Hungary.

Stunning at night! . We didn't go inside for the tour but aesthetically this is probably the most beautiful building I've ever seen. Although it's impressive in the day time nothing compares to the incredible views at night. Try to get as high as you can on the Buda side for the best pics - Fishermans Bastion is the ideal spot!

Tour of Parliament. Having seen this beautiful building floodlit at night, we wanted to see the interior and booked online for the 2pm tour in English the following afternoon. Definitely advise booking ahead rather than turning up and hoping for tickets - the entrance area was quite congested. The building is simply stunning and well worth going to see.

Great tour. My family and I took a tour of the parliament today. They offer the tour in English which was great. The tour guide was very enthusiastic and had a great knowledge of the building and artefacts. The only suggestion I would have is to maybe limit the tour to 20/25 people as it can seem harder to hear when there is more people in the tour.

amazing place. i think thats the best place you have to be in budapest.you can seat and watch the architecture of the building for hours.the entrance ticket costs 2000HUF and thats about 6-7 euros.theres a guide to explain you about the halls that you will see.there are specific times in guided english tours,french spanish etc.you can reach parliament with metro line 2 (red line) kossuth lajos ter
Nice place to see. we had to order tickets before our visit, must to vizit when you are in Budapest. great building. sinagoge is must too
Really worth doing. This tour was one of the highlights of our stay. Fascinating place and very reasonably priced - best to prebook
Impressive building. Absolutely stunning building as most in the city are. Hadn't realised how big it was. Well worth a walk to see.
Nice. Seems nice from outside. Like British parliament building. Architect was affected by Lindon style. Boat trip is also nice to have a look at that.

Beautiful building . First thing is the best thing about parliament building is the view from the river especially at night! It's stunning. We decided to do go on tour on our last day. We arrived at 9.45am and got tickets for 10am English tour, it was cheap enough about £5. Tour was about 45 minutes but this is what they advertise so no surprise. Only saw a few rooms and staircases but it is stunning and gives you a good idea of rest. It is still a working building not just a tourist attraction so wouldn't be practical to see it all. I would definitely recommend.
Well worth a visit. Really amazing decor . Interesting history . Dull English male guide who didn't really give much detail.

Beautiful Building!. The parliament building has a very interesting past and I was very glad we took an hour out of our day to visit. It is a little expensive for what you get out of it but I love visiting architecturally interesting building so it was worth it for me. Not really a great place to take children.

Wow, what a building!. Went here a few days ago on a short break to Budapest.On first seeing Parliament from outside we were in awe. Went into the Visitor centre and easily bought tickets for the next available tour in English - take ID to get the European Citizen rate (much cheaper).The tour itself lasted about 45 mins and the guide was great, stopping enough for photos and telling us everything we could have thought to ask about. What an amazing building with such an interesting history.We also went back when it was dark to see the building lit up - definitely worth doing even in the freezing cold!
Amazing Building. Amazing beautiful Building during the day and when lit up at night.there are tours of the building during working hours

Amazing building, inside and out!. We visited parliament in February which is outside the tourist season but it was still fairly busy. We arrived at around midday and booked onto one of the two English speaking tours available that day. While we waited for our tour to begin we paid to visit the parliament museum in the same building. The museum gave us a great introduction to the parliament tour and as we didn't know much about the political history of the country, really added to our experience. Surprisingly we were the only visitors to the museum despite the parliament building itself being really busy with tourists, we couldn't understand why everyone else skipped it as we learnt so much from our short visit! The museum had free audio guides in English too. Our English speaking guide on the parliament tour wasn't exactly a bundle of joy but she got the point across. Inside parliament is amazing, the decor and architecture is stunning. I was surprised at how the idea was based on learning about the English parliamentary system as they seem to have done much better in many ways!
Beautiful . So Budapest parliament is really nice and most spectacular and i would say biggest kind of "building" on this side of Pesta. I would recommend walking around it and river Duna.
Breathtaking. Beautiful in every way, from the architecture to the view to the exhibits. Great souvenir shop. Easy to get to.

Amazing building, key location. This must be one of the best and most imposing Parliament buildings in Europe it has real character and is really accessible. If you are going try to pre book the tour I wanted to do it but the next English speaking tour available was 2 hours away when i arrived on Sunday lunchtime. I would have liked to go in but it didn't suit my timings. The outside looked amazing.
Lovely Views. Royal Palace Then Here. Great Place For Views. Nothing Else There Apart From A Cafe Inside Fisherman's Bastion. That's It.

Stunning building. A must-see stop on your sightseeing trip. Do the tour if you have time, very interesting - remember to keep 2mtrs away from the guards guarding the Crown Jewels, those swords look like they mean business!
Incredible. Of course this is the main attraction in Budapest and if you have time it is totally worth going inside and know a bit more about the construction and the history behind this building.
enjoyed the flag gurading. we saw the soldiers patrolling around the flag for long and they are doing it without any miss , the steps are even matched perfect

Stunning building. A great place to explore from the city or from the river cruise. See the difference in the buildings in the area. Easy to walk to from chain bridge with the castle on the hill just over the river
Beautiful. While we didnt go inside, we admired the view from the outside. Photographs do not do this landmark justice.
Parliament Tour. Book in advance. The tour was very interesting and our guide was very knowledgeable. The tour lasts about 45 minutes and well worth the small fee.

An Illuminated Star of Budapest!. Without doubt, the Parliament is the iconic symbol of Budapest that resembles the Westminster of London. Since i stayed in an apartment along the River Danube on the Buda side, i can admire the beauty of the Parliament on the left and the Chain Bridge on the right. Here, I'm feel privileged seeing the Parliament during dawn and dusk, day and night. I did not join the tour inside the Parliament because being Non EU, i have to pay 5200 HUF that i considered very expensive. I walked around the buildings a couple of times as i stayed 8 nights in this city. The embankment of buda and pest also enables me to admire the beauty of the Parliament.
Beautiful buildings. We did not manage to visit inside as tickets were sold out however the grounds are amazing enough. Definitely worth a visit
Must See!. If you're anywhere in central Europe, a day trip to Budapest is a must. Once in Budapest, the Parliament building is at the top of the list.

Worth the time and money. Parliament is a great place to learn about the history of Hungarian Gov. When visiting, be sure to take the tour which has many session a day. Different language runs at different time, and slots are limited. Do book online in advance. You can book the tickets at jegymester.hu this is the link given by the hungarianparliament.com The tour brings you into the Parliament, you can see the Crown, Golden Dome, the Parliament chambers and the Hungarian Parliament Stairways. The tour takes about 20 mins or so but you can stay back to enjoy the exhibition to learn more information about the building plans, the architect, competition for design etc. I spend around 3 hours in total and it is totally worth it.

A must see when in Budapest. A stunningly beautiful building.. The building is stunning on the outside and is very well maintained. BUT, it is even more so when you take the 40 minute your (at the underground tour center adjacent to the side of the Parliament). Tours are offered at different times in the day in about six languages. Online reservations are recommended.

Magnificent. One of the most beautiful buildings I have ever seen! You should come see it in daylight and also from the other side of the Danube river or from a boat during the night. You will never forget the view!
Mesmerizing !. Very beautiful especially at night. I also liked the part behind the parliament and we saw the ceremony of soldiers raising the flag which was interesting !
River Rampage Night Tour. Take the boat tour at night where you can see the beautiful parliament lit up and enjoy some champagne
Nice Tour. Enjoyed the tour of parliament. It was really good value and it was about 45 minutes long with good information but not so much that you get bored!

Most beautifull building in Budapest?. It is the building of the parliament so didn't want to enter it, thought it would have strict rules and limited access points. But from the outside it is very beautiful, especially from the other side of the river and at night.
Beautiful building. Beautiful building with both wonderful exterior and interior. Looks great in the evening due to the illumination

beautiful at night. Impressive and beautiful building, walked around but didn't go inside.
Personally, I thought it looked it's best at night lit up from across the Daunbe ( viewing it from the Buda side)

Must see in Budapest. Their entrance fee is well worth the price especially if you are a student. The tour was very informative but may be a little shorter than expected. Very nice interiors and well preserved.

Quick tour. My friend booked this online and we both enjoyed the tour although it is quite fast paced. Very stunning interiors. We were both a bit miffed however as we are both students from outside the EU and there was no option for us to buy student tickets online but when we got to the visitors centre we could have brought them for half price; for non- EU students might be worth while trying to find student tickets online somehow (try emailing I guess) or buy tickets from the visitors centre once you arrive in Budapest.

Great Tour!. The Parliament Building was fantastic. The tour we took only lasted about 45 minutes, and barely tapped into the vastness of this building. Great location and very clean. Highly recommend.
Best at night!. Best experience was when me and my partner viewed it at night as it was al lit up. best time and place to see it will be on a boat cruise around sunset / night!

A nice sight. I find the parliament to me one of those must see in many cities. In Budapest this building is huge and absolutly stunning. It`s nice to see up close but even better to cross over to the Buda side in the evening and see it from a distance at night when all the lights are on.
Breathtaking. A definite must see in budapest. The building\s architecture is stunning. Nice views from the other side of the river.

Must be seen. The Parliament building is just over 100 years old and is the third largest Parliament building in the world. This building is stunning both inside and out. The inside is detailed with large amounts of gold and stained glass and the outside should be viewed at night when it is outlined with lights.

Amazing building. This building is absolutely incredible. No matter how many times we walked past the building it never failed to amaze me!! Make sure you go and see it when its lit up as well because it really is magical. We did not go inside the building but I wish that we did!

Beautiful architectural miracle . I passed through the parliament, enjoying it's stunning exterior, emphasised by a very good backlight. There is a bookstore and café open till late, so it's a very comfortable for locals and tourists to explore its history.

Wow. Fantastic Building.
Great opportunity for some fantastic photos, especially at night when it is lit-up.
If you are visiting Budapest make it part of your plans.
My opinion . It's a really nice looking building and the tour is interesting, if only a little bit short. I would recommend people to go and see this amazing buildings from within.

Beautiful building, unfortunately filled with crazy people. One if the most beautiful buildings of the world. It is a shame that these crazy people are sitting in it. To visit inside take your passport with you, it is for safety.
Amazing building, best viewed at night. A really breathtaking building, even better when seen at night from afar (or especially from the river)
Stunningly beautiful building . A must see at night! This building has been restored and looks immaculate and stunning fly beautiful against the Budapest skyline!
Wow. This is a very beautiful building, so so pretty. Great for some nice pictures. Definitely a must if you are in Budapest.

Beautiful building, informative tour. The tour was not overly long, but took you through the important parts. A little pricey for the amount of time. Visitor entry is facing the river all the way on the left.

Stunning building. The Parliament building is one of the most stunning buildings to be seen in the city. It is best appreciated from across the Danube on the Buda side, where you can take in the complete majesty of the building. The construction was started in 1885 and was not completed for 17 years. The position and design of the building was heavily influenced by the Palace of Westminster in London, and similarly the interior contains many fine stone carvings and guilded columns characteristic of the old Austro-Hungarian empire.A visit to this impressive building just has to be high on the list of the sightseer. My first sight was at night and with the building bathed in lights it is an enduring memory.
Impressive. Extremely grand. We did not go in, however from the outside was extremely impressive, with a number of good photo areas. As good up close as it was from the river, or the other side of it

Good thing to visit but the tour was a bit uninspiring . Great to see from the outside and glad we paid to see the inside. However, the tour guide didn't have great English and it felt very much like she had just learned a script which was fine but it made it a bit uninspiring. I definitely found myself zoning out at times.If you bring your EU passport then you get the tour half price - it definitely isn't worth full price!
beautiful building. A must see building in Budapest. The tours inside the building run all day in different languages. The building inside is beautiful

A must. This was high on our agenda as it was recommended by a friend. It was not disappointing. The best place we visited over our mid week break.It's a must see for all visitors. Only takes about an hour and you won't be disappointed.Look for the visitors centre to the right of the building as you look at it from the square ( or to the left if you are by the river)
Beautiful Place and well worth a visit!. Book in advance on Jegymeister to avoid queueing. 45 mins tour, really interesting and gives you a great insight into Hungarian history.

Spectacular at night. Although it already looks so beautiful during the day, it looks even more breath-taking at night when it's all lit up. Visited in the month of August, we saw there were some birds flying around the building at night which made it kind of look like glitter- a truly magical sight!

Parliament House. Well worth seeing the sight of Hungary's Great Parliament House. Since the grounds have been redone the garden and water feature on the grounds are a wonderful way of spending time before entering the magnificent building and viewing the glorious architecture and beautifully decorated walls and rooms. The visit is not complete without viewing the Great Room where the original Crown of St Steven's sits. Here the Crown can be viewed encased in a special cabinet being guarded by a selected, hand picked Guardsmen. The longer the guided tour one is willing to take the more one's eyes are opened to the magnificent rooms and paintings. The main chambers where the Politicians are seated and debate or discuss the future of the Hungarian country is also a must see.
Stunning Building. An extremely worthwhile tour, great idea for a rainy day, beautiful building and very interesting tour guide.

Stunning views and amazing architecture. Budapest is incomplete without this building. Its not just another building but as the people loves, it seems to be the heart of city. The beauty from both the front and back side are just amazing. The view are different in night and day. Still for me the best view was to see it in the night from the river all flooded with light. Locals over here are very proud of having this and will tell you stories about how riches rich of world have tried to purchase it but people have not let it happenNeedless to say that a visit to the city is incomplete without seeing it at least twice in day and night
Majestic on appearance.. The seat of government with a large square facing patrolled by guards. The time we visited the building was not open to visitors.

Somewhat expensive entry but guided tour for all !. It is a beautiful building from outside. The highlight of Budapest.
The interior tour is somewhat expensive for the duration but it is guided in multiple languages.
The highlight of the interior tour is the royal crown !!!
Very similar to the British Parliament. It was a great journey to see it inside. I came from London but never seen our Parliament. It was just beautiful

One of the best building in the world. A magnificent example of Neo-Gothic architecture just over 100 years old. It's a must to see in Budapest.
In summer, at night, it's fascinating and a little dark to see the birds that fly around the towers ... ;)!
Worth a trip. Definitely a must see building in Budapest - and cheap too - only £2.00 to visit. Go back at night and be wowed by the building when illuminated
Definitely worth a tour.. Tour guides are just ok , the sites are worth the trip. If you are able, take a walk over at night and get pictures of the building all lit up. Fantastic!

Okay, seems like a typical parliament structure. Okay, but not super exciting. Seems like they were trying to replicate buildings from the UK and such. Always interesting to see guards standing outside, just in case the parliament is overrun?

Stunning building inside and out, worth visiting. Fantastic. Amazing building inside and out, guided tours in many different languages,be sure to take your camera as photos are allowed in most places inside the building, a must not to be missed.
Most beautiful building ever. Just increible. It is a must for everyone who travel to Budapest, both in the afternoon and at night.

Amazing place for photographers. By far the best attraction for photographers. I would recommend especially at night. You can also visit the interior with limited hours, but it was much less impressive than the view from outside.

Stunning by night!. Take the river cruise to see this beautiful building lit up at night. We visited during the day too and were lucky enough to see the changing of the guards.Architecture at it's best!
Interesting and beautiful . Informative, reasonably priced tour. The gold wall coverings are a must see as is the crown. The tour lasted around 35 minutes.
Stunning architecture. We actually visited at night-time but night or day you can see the building from afar and it is absolutely beautiful. It is definitely worth a visit when in Budapest.
Worth a visit . Lovely walk up the hill, which is optional. Once at the top you will see a great view of the city, definitely worth a look around.
Well worth visiting. Although the guided tour lasts less than an hour, the Parliament Building is well worth a visit. The interior decoration is just amazing.
Very beautiful . We decided to take a walk along the Danube and came across the Parliament building . The building is amazing beautiful , we couldn't get over how bright the building is.
well worth a visit.. It is around £5 and takes an hour. just book a slot in your native tongue and turn up at that time.the parliament is really ornate inside and based on Westminster.

Stunning from the river Danube. We took the River Danube evening boat cruise on 18th February. Light rain but not too cold (great food on board!) - but the view of Parliament all lit up was spectacular.
A 'must do' when visiting Budapest

Stunning building. Lovely building within walking distance from chain bridge or Margaret Island. Although we didn't go inside we stood and marvelled at the beautiful building that sets the tone for the architecture in the city.

Lovely except for tourists with phones!!. Worth going down to see Parliament, we were lucky to be there as they changed the guard which was nice except for all those tourists with their phones out filming it!!! Enjoy the experience you muppets but DO NOT get in front of me or I'll rip your phone from your hand and chuck it in the Danube, WHY would you stand there and film this?? To play it to your parents when you get home!!!?? Stop it, get a life or just go away Anyway a lovely thing to see and an amazing building!
Impressive building. Very pretty and impressive. Could not go inside due to an official visit. Will try to visit when I return to Budapest another time.

Truly breathtaking. Amazing place. Gorgeous by day and night. Bought our tickets on-line and attended the first tour. Great tour and guide. I was in a wheelchair due to a fall in the opera house and they were able to accommodate me. Amazing paintings, stucco work, gold guiding and stunning assembly room. They also have a nice exhibit to teach you about the changes the Parliment building underwent during the communist occupation.
Amazing Building. Beautiful building. My daughter assures me in summer that the air is filled with the scent of lavender from the ornamental gardens.

Stunning!. What a stunning building! You should book tour online before you visit. 2000 huf entry for EU citizens. Tour takes 45 to 50 minutes. Excellent tour. Building overlooks Danube. Lovely cafe for before or after. Do not miss!

Just beautifull. We dindnt have the time to explore the place inside but if you see it from outside it was just enough for me.The place is so beautifull and at night the way the light the place is just magnificent.i would definately suggest to visit.
Gorgeous!!. A beautiful building with mysterious insects flying above at night, that create a very lovely glow! Great view from a wine cruise as well!!

Gorgeous interior. Make sure you book a ticket well in advance and arrive well in time, because of the possible congestion in the holiday season.The luxurious interior worths a visit, even Michael Jackson wanted to buy the building... ;)

Perfect for photos. An excellent and very impressive building, easily spotted from the tram that runs right by. Also perfect for photographing from the water. Guards patrol by day adding an extra element of official status

A beautiful building with an intriguing history. We arrived well ahead of time and were directed by the front desk to join a group which turned out to the be one before us. They would't let us join them because our allocated time was for the next tour. Realistically not a big deal but it was annoying having a disconnect between groups of the staff.Once past security (same as for an airport), there's an included (won't call it free as we paid for the tour) cloak room and we went on a lovely guided tour of some of the building.They gave us earpieces so we could all hear the guide and the tour mostly consisted of corridors (with gorgeous stained glass windows) and a couple of halls. The most beautiful room was of course the area where photos are not allowed and two security guards with swords guarded the king's crown (complete with crooked cross).Altogether happy to have visited and blown away with the generous decoration that while overpowering in areas, worked well.
Impressive building. Impressive building especially lit up at night and viewed from the river cruise. Easy to get to using the tram
It is stunning.. By day or by night, from the road or from the river it is truly spectacular. You can get guided tours, it is better to book them prior to going as the queues can get very long.

A Parliament that Looks the Goods !. Ran out of time to do the full tour but was still able to appreciate this fabulous building that dominates the Pest bank of the Danube ! I hope that the decisions made in the Building match the Beauty !!

It's a must to visit❗️. Plan ahead and get enough time to visit the parliament and all the statues, memorials, parks and buildings around as the area is beautiful!
The change of the guards is curious to see.
In one of the pictures I show the app that I was using to listen all the information about the city. I downloaded it for free 😉
True land mark of Austria-Hungarian Empire. Nice to be seen, offer tours for visitors. It is quite impressive building even from outside. It is well illuminated over night
The Parliament tour is a must. The Parliament building is amazing both inside and out and the tour is a must. It made our holiday and If I return to Budapest I'd go again!

Budapest Parliament. We enjoyed this short visit and would recommend it a to others. Just be aware that some of the times on their website don't match the times displayed in the tourist office where you start the tour. Also there are only a certain amount of participants allowed for each tour so best to either prebook or get there a bit early to secure your place. We were lucky...just a turned up and got the last 2 tickets for the English tour at 10 am.
Magnificent building. Wonderful decadent building in the hear of Budapest. Very easy to get too and you can walk the perimeter with ease.

Great parliament tour. I went for a parliament tour in English and the tour guide was explaining very well regarding the history of the parliament. The interior of the parliament is magnificent as its appearance and I would strongly recommend tourists to go if they have not been to there yet.
For arquitecture lovers. Very nice building and views of the Danube, a must once you are in Budapest. Designed by the same Hungarian architect who did the Houses of parliament in London.

Rather nice. Despite the website saying tours weren't open we got to the Parliament to have a look and the visitor centre was packed with people buying tickets. We decided to go on a tour. It cost 2000ft which is roughly £5 which isn't bad for what you get. Make sure you take some ID because they ask for it when booking tickets and it costs more if you are not from the EU. Not sure why.
Stunning. This bulding stands haugthy next to Danube waiting for your admiration! The bulding architecture will not leave you unmoved.
Amazing architecture. We didn't go in, but the outside is very beautiful. The architecture is amazing and overlooks the Danube.

A stunning building . A truly stunning place to visit the guided tour is both reasonably priced and very informative. The building itself as you would expect is architecturally very beautiful and at night with the lighting it takes on an almost magical air . A must see if you're in Budapest.
Amazing buildings. A stunning collection of buildings but most moving is the monument to the 1956 deaths. I especially liked the bridge sculpture.

Very short tour. Beautiful building, but compared to a few years ago, when it was less commercialized, the tour is not that great anymore. You can feel that the guides are under time pressure. Still worth the visit!
The most beautiful Parliament. Great building which looks magical at night. I am convinced this is the best Parliament building in the world.
Great tour!. he building is opulently decorated. Only organized tours can visit. The price for non-EU citizens is 5200 HUF. It is a good idea to book the tour 1-2 days in advance.Great tour!

Stunning Building. The buildings in Budapest must be seen to be believed. Many of them still hold on to the glamour from when the Hapsburgs ruled, even if you can't always tell from the outside. It's incredible how many of these buildings were even able to hold on to most of their beauty through World War II and the communist regime.One of the most beautiful inside and out is the Hungarian Parliament building, which you can tour at several times throughout the day. If you are looking for a tour in a specific language, I highly recommend booking your tour ahead of time so you can make sure you can get a place on a certain language tour when you want it.The biggest downside of the Parliament tour is that it's a little unorganized when you are checking in and going through security. There are tours in many languages going on either at the same time or around the same times, so it can get very confusing as to who should be going through security and what time you should be going through, especially if they get behind.Other than that, the tour is fantastic. The history of the Hungarian people is truly fascinating, and the building is stunning to look at. There are gold pieces everywhere, and the Parliament is filled with paintings, statues and gorgeous colors. The gem of the tour is the Holy Crown of Hungary, which sits in the middle of the building. The crown has a crazy history, and it's heavily debated whether the Americans stole it or were just keeping it safe from communism at the end of World War II. Either way, it's a crown that has seen a lot in its days, and it's awe inspiring to see it in person.The tour lasts about an hour, and there's a great gift shop in the Parliament building, too. This is a highlight of anyone's trip to Budapest, and is a must-do. Add this to your list.

Art!. The Parliament is such an amazing building, I couldn't believe my eyes! Unfortunately we did not have the time to see the insight of it but for me it was already stunning from the outside. If you want to do a hop on hop of tour I can recommend the company "big bus". If you buy a ticket with them you can automatically do a river cruise and stare at the parliament when it's right infront of you! Especially beautiful in the evening!

Really worth a visit. Excellent short (50mins) guided tour of Hungarian Parliament.
Just the right amount of information without being overload or causing teenagers to wish they stayed in the cafe with their iPhones. Be sure to take your passport to ensure you get EU member discount.
Tour inside was amazing!. Booked tour online day before to avoid queues. Amazing building inside and great tour guide too. Also interesting small museum at end of tour.
Impressive. Seeing this building from the Buda side it really stands out. Also when seen at night lit up its a sight you won't forget.
Majestic building!. More stunning outside and viewed from the Danube, a real must see for the architecture! A real Austro-Hungary achievement and testament to the 'glory days' of opulent buildings

Beautiful. We were staying on the Buda side of the Danube and so had this spectacular building to look at numerous times. It is a beautiful building to walk around, extremely clean area and this time of the year, not busy.
Fascinating Visit. Worth booking onto the Parliament Tour. You get to see inside this beautiful building and understand a bit more about democracy here in Hungary.

Worth a tour. I took a private tour during my first visit to Budapest while a friend was interning in Parliament and it was worth the visit. The building and decorations are incredibly ornate. The grand halls were beautiful. Worth a quick tour.

Awsome place. If you have time,spare 45.min and do the trip. It is really remarkable building from both inside and outside. Keep in mind that groups are lead by a guide,depending on the language so there is a chance you might need to wait for your group language to start so it is better to book in advance.

Beautiful building but bad guided tour. Very beautiful building, perfect architecture from outside and inside. Unfortunately the guided tour inside was very bed. Very short, only a few rooms, and guide said only a little bit about function of the building and his history. It could be longer with more interesting information
Amazing building . So took a walk around the outside on a wet day, pretty fantastic building and it is huge! Also had chance to watch changing of the guard out the front!

Interesting Tour of Parliament. We enjoyed touring inside the Parliament building. Have to buy admission ahead or go early, tours fill out fast for the day. We went just before 9am to buy tickets for same day. While we waited for our 10:30am tour. We spent time admiring the beautiful building outside. There are bronze shoes along the Danube bank near Parliament building to honour Jews shot and fell into the river during WWII.

Worth a visit. This is a grand building and the scale of it's expense becomes clear during a tour. This represents a huge running cost. The military uniformed guards are a bit silly, what with flicking their bayonets every 5 minutes in front of the Royal thingee in the middle of the building. Other than that seemingly idiotic aspect, the photo opportunities are many and the building provides a good potted history of Hungary.

Great view. Visit february 2016, we tour by hop on hop off bus and cruise tour, great view from the Buda castle and/on cruise especially in the night with the lights.Good for people who love art, photography and for travellers.Hop on-hop off bus was 6,000 huf for 2days with 2free cruise. It's reasonable amount of money for the tour. But it starts around 10am and finished about 4/5pm.
Over priced tour. At 26 euro per person you only get a 30 minute tour of the parliament so this is not good value for money.
Magnificent building . The structure of the parliament is amazing! I recommend to see it by the cruise by the river during the late afternoon, it's such a beautiful experience!!! Very nice :)
Beautiful building. We didn't go inside but saw it from a boat cruise. It's a beautiful building but seeing it from the outside was totally enough for me.

Lovely. Parliament building is the seat of government of the republic of Hungary. It was built from 1885 to 1904 (officially opened in 1896 in honor of one thousandth of the country) and represents one of the most beautiful Gothic style monument in Budapest.
Stunning architecture - also great to view at night from Buda!. Absolutely beautiful building - great to see up close, but also from across the river from the hill, especially at night.
Very nice building!. We went down to have a look at the Parliament building which was visually great, not much to do though as officials were in when we went!
Incredible. These are some of the most beautiful buildings I have ever seen. First the view across the river is stunning, then walking the grounds... A must see in Budapest

Informative.. Visiting Parliament in Budapest was an informative and enjoyable experience.
We had a guided tour and it helped us understand better the history of Budapest.
Parliament is large and extremely ornate...just beautiful.
If one enjoys architecture and history, this is a must see.

The greatest Parliment on the World. Did you know when this parliament was designed and than built (1885-1904) it has already been made with air condition and in today terms quite sustainable wit the use of ice from the Danube collected in winter and stored in isolated chambers next to the building? This is just one of the uniqueness of this place worth to visit. Do not forget the crown which is the 1st and single ever used by kings over 1000 years.

Summer & winter visit. A must visit! During the day make sure you go to see the guards on duty at the flag point, changing of the guard is best. If visiting in the summer months look out for the 'golden birds' overhead at night. Beautiful. Oh and don't forget to take a reflective moment and look over the river with the thinking man (as I called him).
Hungarian parliament . Beautiful building, did not get to go in though as they had officials in on the day we visited, beautiful buildings though

Good tour. Tour was informative, well done and plenty to see. The building was very impressive (inside and out). Not too pricey, lasted just less than an hour, photos allowed everywhere except by the crown jewels.

Happy to see the new visitor cnter too.. I really liked the new visitor centre, directly attached to the old building, throough the cellar, including new exhabition about the history of the Hungarian Parlament, and an other about the building, in a very special glass covered cellar under one of the yard of the bulding. The old building is amaizing inside too.

See it at nfut. This building is beautiful, and even more so at night when all the lights are on. You can easily walk from here towards the Chain Bridge to get the Buda Castle etc - a great scenic route

The building is massive!. The Parliament is a must see in Budapest by night!! It's like never ending, splendid masterpiece of human construction. I even prefer this one than the overvalued Palace of Westminster in London. There's just something so regal with this building, you have to see it by yourself to understand!
A beautiful building. We didn't visit the inside of this building, but it was worth visiting the outside as it is majestic! It is easily reached using the number 2 tram which runs beside the Danube.
A beautiful building. Even if you're not an architecture freak, you will love the building - it's beautiful, especially at night.

Must see. Best to book online at busy times of year. We visited during a quiet time so turned up on day to get a tour guided in English a couple of hours later. Just under £5 each, but if booking at Parliament on day you will need to show a passport or driving licence to get this discount price for Eu citizens. Very knowledgeable guide. Fabulously decorated building. Really interesting visit. Our guide answered questions husband asked. A must see visit!
Unbelievably beautiful!. One of the best Parliament buildings on this planet. A must see landmark, when you visit this beautiful city, once called the Paris of the east

Beautiful - worth a visit!!. Visiting Budapest, the Parliament is a must go! We didn't book tickets in advance which I would probably recommend to do beforehand. The ques were not bad at all, but the english guided tours tend to sell out very quickly, we was lucky enough and got there just in time. The building itself is stunning, and the tours are very informative - which tend to last around an hour. Would recommend for all visiting Budapest. :)
Grand Old Building. This is a masterful architectural structure, with lots of history. It looks really great when lot up at night.the Doctor 14.2.2016 St Valentines Day
Stunning, even better at night! . This building is absolutely stunning definitely worth visiting The view is even more beautiful at night so it's definitely worth the trip of a night time
Good to see. Popular attraction. Make sure you book in advance or can come back later. Groups are perhaps a bit large for one quiet tour guide. Still worth seeing and value for money.

Breath-taking View. You can reach The parliament easily by metro line 2, get off at Kossuth station. The massive square and the parliament building is immediately in front of you.It is a pleasant experience to have a leisure walk in a sunny day. Coffee shops around, sit,.lay back, relax and continue your journey.There will be some square perfprmance by the soilders, with the nayional music. It surely gives you a serious feeling and prosperous image of the empior.

Short and Sweet Tour. Overall, a nice short tour - about 45 minutes, but very overpriced for non EU visitors. A family of 4 cost 60 bucks. The crown jewels will be a disappointment if you have been to Vienna, Rome or London. The gold leaf and artistry inside was spectacular.

Incredible building! very fancy and nice!. This building is a highlight if you are planning to visit budapest! is hugee a d very fancy. After this visit we walk by the river and took many pictures. Super nice place to be! I highly recommend it!
Great. Perfect atmosphere Gorgeous building great view great place... I love Budapest I will go back soon!! If you haven't gone, have to go...
Must do trip. Visit the Shoe Memorial nearby to see what the Hungarians did to their Jewish people during the war. The Parliament trip is every hour, and very informative

Worth the admission. Guided tour of parliament was well organised (if not herded like cattle) through the various rooms. Before entering, you go through security (similar to airport) and have the options to check your jackets etc into cloak room. Your unable to take photos of the jewels (advised by tour guide) and two very large guards standing beside it. Overall worth a visit.
Parliament. This structure has a stunning exterior from all sides of the building. Seeing Parliament is a must, even if it's just a walk-by.

One of my favorite building in Europe. So far this is one of my favorite building in europe as i took many selfie in all angles of this huge awesome structure, cant help but admire this and looking forward to comeback to explore its interiors.

First attraction of this city. I enjoyed too much this magnificient building. It is lovely and you need at least 40 minutes to admire it. It's arhitecture remember by neo gothic. Do not hesitate to go there also in the evening.
Must see.. We took the tour here and it was excellent. As the Parliment was not in session we got to see the inner chamber which was great.Wonderful decoration. Very good tour guide.
Stunning 360 views. Best time to visit this is at night! Breathtaking Can do this by foot or make it better by taking a river cruise

Worth a visit . Made online reservations beforehand so don't have to buy tickets at the parliament itself. So made the whole process faster. Very impressive building with ingesting history. Worth a visit
Very big and luxurius. A must in budapest . If you don't see it you loose half your visit. Easy to reach . Guide languages 5
Amazing building.. The building itself is so impressive.Would have loved to go on a tour though.Am guessing they are available but couldn't find anything.
Absolute MUST. The Parliament building is an amazing site, but before you go check the tour times as there are many different language tours thoughout the day. Do NOT assume they will all be English.
Grand. We did the guided tour for 2000Ft, it was great and well worth the price! The building is incredible. My favourite in Budapest!

Worth going early. We did a tour of Parliament through a guided tour. There is some amazing history in this building and is well worth a visit. It gets quite crowded so is well worth getting there as soon as it opens.
Beautiful building, short guided tour. We booked tickets online for €15,- per person as EU citizens. The few rooms were gorgeous but the tour is very short!
One of the most beautiful buildings. Budapest's parliament is one of the most architecturally intricate buildings I have ever feasted my eyes upon. The inside is worth taking a peak at as well!

Make Time To Visit!. We didn't have much time in Budapest so tried to fit in as much as we could. Luckily, visiting the Parliament was one of the places we fitted in. We turned up in time for the 12pm tour. Cost around 2000huf's each which is about £5 each? Excellent value for money. The tour around this beautiful building was informative and so interesting. You're allowed to take photos in most of the building. It's so beautiful inside. Took around 45 minutes all in all.

Amazing architecture....Stunning building on the Danube!. Such a beautiful building both during the day and at night!We did a cruise along the Danube and each time we passed the Parliament building i just cudnt stop admiring this beautiful structure!For pics its best to go to the other side of the Danube and get pics with the parliament building in the background!

Such a pretty building inside & out!. Whilst visiting budapest it is well worth taking a tour around parliament. It is incredibly cheap and totally worth it!The architecture of the building is amazing and it only gets better on the inside!The tour is only about 45 mins long! Also parliament is right next to the shoes on the danube memorial which is also worth visiting whilst in the area!

Majestic. The parliament building in Budapest is stunning architecture from any angle. due to limited time we saw this building from the outside only but it was still breathtaking, don't miss it if you are in the area.
The best. The best sightseeing I have ever seenYou cant leave from budapest without being thereWonderful view
Outstanding. Incredible building, our experience was enhanced by a "performance" from the guards, which was very unexpected.
Exquisite architecture!. The Hungarian Parliament, one of the largest parliaments in the world, has absolutely exquisite architecture! Take time to walk around the parliament and admire its beauty!
Gorgious Building. The build is gorgious!!!! If you are travelling at Budapest you must see this building!!!You can go by tram or with metro (line 2).

Impressive. Don't miss seeing this at night on one of the many river cruises. Lit up it is really something impressive to see. Did not tour the building but walked the grounds. They also do a changing of the guard if you're so inclined.

Stunning. A must see, absolutely stunning, you need to see this building to understand the sheer size and incredible architecture which is phenomenal. We also walked over the bridge to Buda to see this from the a distance as seen in my pictures.
I would recommend it really is amazing.

Impressive. The Parliament of Budapest is just suprising. It looks so beautiful both from the outside and from the inside. Located in the Pest side, next to the Danube this Parliment is a must if you're visiting Budapest even if it's just for a couple of days.They organize guided tours that last around 40 minutes several times per day and in many languages for a very reasonable price (it was like 1000 florins for students if I remember well). Completely worth it to visit such an impressive monument from the inside.

Beautiful Structure. An architectural marvel on the banks of Danube in centre of city. Tours in many languages. Ensure you have booked it in advance. Stands out prominently during nights with all lights on.
Breathtaking!. Marvellous, grandiose!! I have seen this beautiful building several times in photos, but seeing it in reality it is simply breathtaking!!
Good place. It is a good place. I like it. I take the tour with giude which explane a lot of things about the parliament and the history

The house of the state. Wow! (previous journey) I still have the feeling when I first saw this building. Huge. Half gothic half modern. Beautiful. Some local girls told us there are several politicians working inside that not worthy to have this...but still... the image of this building gives you a feeling that it is a hard thing to be Hungarian and also the most beautiful thing in the world! (dont miss the Danube side either)
Impressive architecture. Quite a sight to take in! Massive, classic building, right along the river. Worth checking out up close and from a distance.
from the outside. we walked for miles trying to find the parliament, we didnt end up going in but from the outside is an outstanding building and so clean!

Amazing building. We went to the parliamemt with a guided tour. The building and its history are really unique. We found the guide a very nice and professional lady. We should have spent more time for visiting the building as a tour was only around 45 mins.
Outside only. We unfortunately did not have time to do the interior tour. The outside is spectacular though particularly from across the river.
Parliament. a must see by day AND by night- especially night. Tour probably was not worth it. Especially if you're a poor college student like me.

Fantastic experience in a beautyfull building.. This was a great value experience in one of the most beautiful buildings I have ever been in. The guide was efficient and informative. The tour was about 45 minutes long and was well worth the cost. The only negative criticism I make is that getting the tours together in the different langue groups was a bit shambolic.
Beautiful building but underwhelming tour. Well worth the tour to get inside, but I found the content of the tour to be underwhelming and altogether too short.

Amazing building, view to Danube is spectacular too. The building is a miracle itself, even from outside. It is located in the center of the city, close to the most famous shopping street and next to the Danube. Enjoy some coffee and treats on a bench, chilling in the sunshine!
Wonderful place for walk. You should have a walk around the Parliament, it was recently renewed. Keep going to Danube river and enjoy your life.

Arguably the greatest Parliament building in the world!. I really didn't know what to expect when i arrived in Budapest, but was amazed by the sheer quantity of stunning architecture.
One of the stand out buildings has to be the Parliament building! It is arguably the greatest Parliament building in the world and slightly betters the House's of Parliament in London in my opinion.
Definitely worth a visit!
