Impressive. Luxury at its best. Some rooms are even better from the inside. The tickets might be a bit pricey but it is worth the visit. The guide we had, was one of the best guides we've ever had.

Brilliant Opportunity. Suggest you book prior to your visit on line.. as long queues.Lovely experience beautiful building .. should be free for anyone that studies architecture as it is stunning. The history and building is really interesting.If you have time, please go to the river and turn left (10 min walk) and see Monument of the Shoes - memorial of the Jews killed by the Arrow Cross Party. Moving and understated - should be remembered more.

Worth doing. I am a local guide, going almost every week with groups to this location, and all the time, it is amazing. A beautiful building, representing the history of Hungarians, looking like a palace, or a church, but the architecture is astonishing. Also the story of the building and its surrounding. If you would like to visit the building, mainly in season, you should book it in advance. Depend on language, but for english, it is very busy.

Great to look at from any angle!. A splendid building right on the Danube. You can see it from lots of places, including from St. Matthias up on the hill on the other side of the river, which is just great.

Good value directly booked tour. We pre booked a tour directly through the hungarian parliament which seemed far cheaper than going though Viator or Expedia. It was a bit confusing when we arrived but we managed to work out where to queue. The tour was very good and informative. There was time to ask questions which the guide knew the answers to. I would highly recommend a visit here.

Magnificent View on the Danube. You can see the parliament building all along the Danube. It is lit up at night and during the day you can visit the building with an knowledgeable tour guide. Half the building is reserved for tours.
The most picturesque in Budapest . A wonderful impressive building, one of the most beautiful buildings in Budapest. Nice photos from the next bank of Duna river - Buda
Excellent coffee shop. Called into the coffee shop here on our site-seeing tour of this 'civic' area. Very peaceful, quite reasonable and great coffee and cakes!

One of the most beautiful buildings in Europe. Have you ever thought that such a small country would have this huge parliament. Hungary used to be much bigger and this building reflects this. Worth a trip inside and also walking around in the evening.
Well woth a look. Well worth a visit but make sure you pre book your tickets, its so much easier.They do many different language tours so be sure you book the right one

The Splendour of European architecture. A must see attraction if you visit Budapest. Go early and book a guided tour (available in many languages including English). This grand building is set on the banks of the Danube, and is beautifully illuminated at night. One can view this from Castle Hill in Buda, a good vantage point is the Fisherman's Bastion neat St. Matthias Cathedral next to the Hilton.The exterior architecture is stunning, but the interior has a lavish beauty that gives the impression that no expense was spared in this important national place and symbol of Hungarian statehood. The interior is decorated with significant historical motifs- paintings, statues, stained glass, depicting important figures or events which were seminal in Humgarian national history. One of the highlights is the viewing of the Hungarian crown and regalia- sceptre, orb, sword and cloak. The crown of St Stephen, first king of Hungary was a gift from the Pope. There is an interesting gift shop and Cafè that you can visit at the end of the tour.

a lot ado about nothing. big hassle with pasports for an entrance ticket and visiting hours in your chosen language. So be prepared and bring your pasport when you buy your ticket.The tour inside is quickly done and not value for money considering budapest prices. I prefer to do other things with them oney I paid to visit the parliament

Always wanted to be there .. A must See. The Hungarian Parliament is one of the major tourist attractions in Budapest and in Europe I'd preferably say. The architecture is something you don't get to see a lot. Its location at the edge of river Danube makes the view more eye-catching. It has its own beauty at day and makes you feel totally different at night with the beautiful lights and it's reflection in the river.
Very nice. The building itself is amazing! The tour of the interiors is very nice - but you need good guide :) The most interesting was the room with crown jewels
Beautiful place!. Looks beautiful from far and amazing when you're there. Didn't have the chance to enter but it's worthy the visit!
The most beautiful parliament in Europe. If you visit Budapest, you must see the parliament building. It is one of a kind, manysay, the most beautiful parliament building in Europe.

Lovely building . Lovely building, great to look at . Everything clean and tidy , right on the river , a must if in Budapest , going off topic, just to be aware of the tourist tax when you stay in Budapest it's not much but something to be aware of.
Beautifull. A beautifull stunning building! In the evening nice view with lights and the soldiers walking around!
interesting. Very beautiful looking building from inside and out. Inside you even get to see the guards change with their special march!

Beautiful setting and worth a trip to see this side of the river. This area has so much history, it's a must to see. The view from this side of the river is worth the trip. Take a guide; it's important!

Amazing at night. Budapest really is one of the most amazing places i've ever visited, everything about the city is just perfect. I would recommend going to see the Parliament at night, you can see the bats fly high above while you just appreciate an amazing building from the side of the river.

Beauty of Budapest by night is completed with Parliamentary building. I can dare to say the most beautiful city at night is Budapest. And the core part is taken by Parliamentary building. I'd like to share some best cuts with you.
Breathtaking. It's a must-see. Most scenic pictures and beautiful surroundings. One cannot get tired of this place.

Breathtaking. As soon as I exited the Metro, I saw the beautiful Parliament building in front of me and breathed "wow". What a stunning building, surrounded by other historical buildings, monuments and statues. A must see.

Visit this place. You cannot missed to visit the Parliament. A guided tour is 45 min in different languages. On 20 Aug every year it is free of charge to visit (National Day of Hungary). Here you can see also the crown jewellery.

very imperessive. walked to find the shoes on the danube , and this building is opposite , was a very cold windy day, when we visited , would be nice to spend more time there in the summer , lots to see

Impressive . Awesome views and definite must see. Impressive architecture, close to the river.
We went during the day but heard it's fantastic to see at night when lit up.
impressive building on the danube. strolling through Budapest you can´t miss that building...good choice they decided to let that building win the competition!

Worth to visit. Beautiful building inside as outside. Reduction for eu citizens with passport or any identity card. Different time slots for different languages. Possible to buy ticket for time slot and come back later. Interesting guided visit about 1 hour.
Incredible night views. They don't make them like this any more...incredible architecture, and wonderfully lit at night. A must see on your visit, but make sure you get some photos at night
Interesting and Informative Visit. You must book a guided tour of the Parliament building if your in Budapest.....just arrive and book once your there.

Stunning. Was keen to do the tour of the parliament anyway and certainly wasn't disappointed with it. Incredible building. The tour was approx 45 minutes. It worked out around £5 each. We didn't prebook. Went on a Sunday which is probably better because you can only see inside the chambers if it isn't in session. Worth going to see if you are visiting budapest.

Don't miss it!. A building made to impress: the amount of gold and statues is really remarkable. Make sure to book well in advance and buy your tickets online, as there are only limited places available for visit.

An amazing building. The Crown Jewels are a must see.. We went on an excellent tour of parliament on me and my partner's trip to Romania and Hungary. The crown jewels are definitively the highlight of the visit.
wonderful view especially in the evening!. We used river cruise on January 2016 and enjoyed with amazing views around. Recommended place to visit
Beautiful architecture. Really wish I could have gone inside. It's an amazing building. View from across the danube at night is spectacular.

Bad guide, astonishing building. Don't know how much is it worth to pay almost €20 for the visit.For the building maybe (4 stars), for the guide totally no (zero!!!).Since my family comes from South America, we asked for a Spanish guide. Some speak Spanish, some Portuguese.At the beginning of the tour, the guide barely presented herself (Fabiana - I had to ask). When we should get the elevator, she saw a line of another group and then decided to climb all the stairs. She didn't even noticed that my parents are over 70 years old and one couldn't climb stairs easily. A guide that doesn't have a perception of its group could never show the building with its desired emotion.After we reach the floor where we should start the tour, she started to walk so fast we couldn't even appreciate the beautiful halls and corridors of the building.When some couldn't understand what she was saying, she didn't even showed effort to explain.It was like she was telling a memorized text. The building is amazing, but the guide completely screwed the visit.Hope the museum administration gets better concern of theirs guides.Pros- beautiful buildingCons- pricey compared to other similar tours in Europe (I.e. Versailles, Schonbrunn, etc)- rude guide (an audio guide would be better for less)
Spectacular!. This is such THE famous building that is shown on all River cruise commercials! Absolutely fantastic architecture and a must visit!
Exquisite looking building. This building is full of amazing architecture but do not forget to see it at night when it's lit up !

Beautiful Building - nice architecture. I have always admired the exterior of this building. I have a bigger appreciation of it after visiting the inside and the museum. Don't miss the Crown of St. Stephen while you are there. Gorgeous place.

Beautiful building must see day and night. Visit the fisherman bastion for fabulous views from across the Danube! Beautifully lit up at night. Walked around the building during day time then at night visited buds castle and the fisherman bastion to see the city lit up.
See it at night. Up front and during the day this is beautiful. But from further away, at night when it is all lit up, its breathtaking.

Great Spot and Great Buidling. Went here and the area around it was very nice- great public spaces and buildings - all now very clean and looking smart. There are guided tours and in many languages - at different times. Great architecture and history. Good café and book store etc. Right on the river and easy to get to by tram, subway or walking. All OK. Better than I expected.
Overpriced . Outside is the beauty, not sure worth to see inside...overpriced and inconvenient ...But definitely worth to walk around
Interesting visit. Parliament is something you just can not miss at Budpest. It is really interesting what the tell you and a beautiful building on the inside and on the outside.

Beautiful from a distance and impressive from close up.. We were able to take decent pictures when on the Buda side which show the greatness of this building but it wasn't until we ventured up close, did we realise the sheer size of it. Like many buildings in Budapest... size definitely matters.

Breathtaking. Lovely structure which looks good both in the day and night. For good shots go up castle hill and to the fisherman's bastion from where you can get lovely shots of the building. to get to the parliament building you can take a tram 2 which drops you right outside. The shoes on the Danube are also nearby, just a few minutes away. If you walk further you can reach the Jaszai Mari Ter stop around which there are several cafes and shops.

Impressive. A magnificent building on the bank of the building. Good to go around dusk, as the building had lighting, that makes it look even more spectacular! Be warned that children are NOT allowed in the square at the front of the building, however
what a sight. i seen it in the day which was amazing and then seen it at night time on a boat trip which was outstanding really was an amazing sight to see so beautiful all lit up
Stunning place to visit. Amazing architecture set beside the Danube, Modelled on Westminster Palace in London, this is a wonderful building that looks spectacular when lit up at night
Fantastic building. Beautiful building in a beautiful city. Every time you turn a corner there is another gothic style building. Worth a visit
Impressive Building !!. It was a wonderfull experience. The tour was very worthwhile and informative. It is a "can't miss" experience when one is in Budapest.
A really great tour. This really is a must see! A great tour that last approx 1 hour. The grandeur of the building is awesome with brilliant views of the Danube.

Visiting Budapest. Had heard about Budapest and on my bucket list so had to visit. The building is a stunner!! Especially at night time. No visit would be complete without seeing the parliament. Actually you can't miss it if you take the hop-on hop off bus. The cruise came with it and we took the one at night. Just spectacular!!

Day or night, this is a beautiful sight. Be certain to take the M2 across the Danube to the Buda side one stop to Batthany to see the building from a distance (like in this picture). And at night the building is all lit up and is amazing. Also you can reach Kossuth Lajos ter on the #2 tram, which, by the way runs along the Danube River. It is well worth the ride and runs right past the Parliament Building.

Incredible. It is really an amazing a beautiful place which you must see once you are at Budapest. In fact you can appreciate this building during the day and the night, espeecially in the latter where the building will be lit up by lights and it is impressive.
Too hefty for non eu citizens. Beautiful yet unfair, the ticket for eu citizens is 2000 fiorints whereas it's 5000 for non eu citizens. Totally unfair.

Amazing architecture, visit day and night. Perhaps the most beautiful building in Budapest (a city overflowing with beautiful buildings) great during the day and at night. The tour is also very interesting - quite quick but I feel like thats best rather than a long dragging tour.
Amaizing Parliament in Budapest. I think this must be the most beatiful parliament in the world , the architecture and dimension of this building is amazing.
Amazing place!. Wonderful place.. even better at night. It's huge, fancy, preserved.Pics aren't enogh to show all the beaty.

Worth half a day: get the tour. The tour is well worth it and the building is extra ordinary; ornate and lovely. I enjoyed the hour tour and then walked along the river back to the center of town; a short walk

Majestic building. If you are in Budapest you cannot miss the majestic building of parliament. You just cannot miss it. It is beautiful both in the morning and in the evening. My husband and I are visiting last December and we went right near the building but unfortunately on that day it was not open to the public. However we also had the opportunity to see the building all lit up during an evening boat cruise on the river Danube. Really worth seeing. Obviously the inside of the parliament must be fantastic so I suggest you include it if you can.

Tour a disappointment . We dragged ourselves out of bed for the early morning tour, preceeded by a 25 min trek in the cold from our appartment and we really needn't have bothered. The tour, supposedly a 1.5hr entertaining excursion, was a 40 minute snore. The most exciting and thrilling details of the country's history ignored and way too much time spent in boring corridors talking about metres of carpet and statues of tradesmen. Our tour guide was sloth-like and totally unenthusiastic and the most interesting and insightful part of the tour was divulged to me by a TV screen on a loop at the end.
Lovely place. great sight, beautiful building, amazing night lights, very nice location, however very unsuitable for kids as over looking the danube so very bad weather around so kids were miserable.

Magnificent . Similar in style to the Houses of Parliament in London, but would love to have gone in. It wasn't clear how or where you got a tour, but at 11.30 on Sunday we saw, the equivalent of changing of the guard. They seemed to find it funny so do did we.

A must-see. The parliament building is perhaps the grandest sight in Budapest. It stands as one of the tallest buildings in the city, and boasts some of the most breathtaking architecture. With a history entwined with the political and historical culture of the city, seeing the parliament building is an absolute must no matter how short your stay. There is a tour of the interior and it is highly recommended. Be advised though as a tourist hotspot, and given that many tours are in different languages, you may have to wait an hour or two. With this in mind I would recommend booking your tickets early on or in advance. The tour takes you through the interior of the building and shows you the main entrance, crown jewels and more. Tour guides are friendly and very informative.
Worth a visit! . Pay for the guided tour in English it makes all the difference. The inside is beautiful and decadent - gives real insight into Hungarian history.

Most beautifull building in Budapest. The building at the riverbank, is a real eye catcher, not to be missed.At the visitor center, which is on the right side of the building, you can take a guided tour inside.The tour will take you to some really nice areas, and also to the guarded crown jewels. We also saw the changing of the guards, which is always special.Our tour guide gave us a lot of information and was very friendly.I would recommend this tour to everyone, who is visiting Budapest.
grand. What's more to say? Symbol of Budapest. You can see this from all points along the Danube and makes for great pictures, especially at night.

Parliament in Budapest. By now I am sure that most of us have seen The Viking River Cruise ads showing on of their ships rounding a river curve in Europe with a stunning building in the fore-ground that looks very much like a Cathedral. That building is Parliament. It is used to house Hungarian government officials.Not all of this beautiful building is occupied as it is so large . The hotel where we stayed after our craic was located only a couple of hundred yards away, therefore a short stroll to find yourself in front of this fairy tale looking castle.
Stunning building by day and night!!. A stunning building, luckily to see it both day and night, architecture is beautiful on a sunny day in Budapest and even on a snowy day.
Great 1 hour tour, amazing building. So pleased I did this tour, very interesting and the beauti inside this amazing building is definitely worth a look.

Beautiful building. My sister and I booked the English tour for mid-morning online in order to make sure we wouldn't need to queue at the ticket counter. The visitor center is easy to find and everything you see in the building is a spectacle, very impressive. The tour requires a lot of walking, and you really only stop in five locations around the building. Pictures are allowed along most of tour, except in the rotunda where the crown jewels are on display. The guide was competent, but quiet, and was hard to hear, even with her speaker, unless you were in the first couple of rows of visitors. The undersold part was at the end in the Museum. The guide described it as a "small display" of the history of the building, almost as if the museum was an afterthought of the tour. To me, the museum was more informative and interesting that the info on the tour. And after the museum it all ends in classic "exit thru the gift shop fashion." Instead of having tour groups wait in the lobby area before passing security then starting the tour, they should reconfigure the tour so you can pass security and explore the museum before you begin the tour.

Night time treat. This building is a must by night, its amazing to see especially if you manage this on a night boat trip, it is also worth sightseeing during the day. We didn't manage a visit inside due to tight time schedule, but we will return.

Superb building on the River Danube.. I enjoyed my visit to the Parliament buildings. It lasted about 40mins with an English speaking tour guide. EU residents get a reduced entrance fee price of 2000Huf but you need to bring your passport to avail of this cost.Interesting stories during tour and nice to see the change of guard.
Very Beautiful Architecture. Very magnificent view from either side of the river. We went for a strudel around the corner and walked around the building.

Just magnificent. How to describe this building? Didn't have the change to explore it internally but walked all around it a few times and had the unique experience of seeing it from the boat cruise at night with all its lights on and all its glory. It is extraordinary. A beauty not to be missed.
Beautiful building. Fantastic building our hotel was right opposite so we had a good view of it. Highly recommended visiting

Magnificent - Must See. This Neo-Gothic building is so beautiful. Not only did we enjoyed the guided tour of the interior. I took hundreds of photos of the Parliament from all around. Most of the materials were sourced from Hungry as the theme was to glorify the country. Our first stop was between the Grand Staircase (inspired by London's houses of Parliament) and the Domed Hall (the spiritual heart of the building where 16 Hungarian kings are honored and the Holy Crown of Hungary is displayed). The National Assembly Hall was opulent as well. I found the paintings on the ceilings and the statues around pillars interesting. (Husband booked the English tour from his phone, and we picked up the tickets in the Visitors Center in the North side down the staircase.)

A Hands-On History Lesson!. We took the English-speaking tour. The guide was patient, audible, kind, and thorough. She allowed time for each of us to gather at the spot she spoke about. Further, we all had time to read, look, photograph, etc. This is a wonderful tour for anyone visiting Hungary. It's a must for history/political/current events buffs!
Looks like a picture. Parliament is absolutely breathtaking. It looks like a painted picture especially at night from the Danube. The architecture is breathtaking!

Must visit at sunset. . Beautiful building day and night. The scenes at sunset however are breathtaking. I recommend getting a coffee and enjoying the scenery of the Parliament building and across the river.

Beautiful during the day, a dream by night. Budapest's Parliament Building does not only impress because of its size (3rd in the world) but because of its beauty, a very classic design and you can see it from different places in the city, it is a beauty during the day but take a river tour at night and you will think you are dreaming
Beautiful palace . Very beautiful building, we visited with my sister and brother in law, the new face of the Kossuth Square is very nice, much better than it was before. Visit it, worths! :)
must see in Budapest. Dominant of Budapest, recommended to see- especially beautiful during nighttime from a boat.... 268m long, 163m wide, 96m tall. Over 65k square meters. Very impressive
Amaizing architectural work of art and beauty. Very fast visit with a cheap price.It is marvelous.And the tour inside is so interesting.A nice place to breathtaking at night.

Fabulous Building. not just from the outside but from inside as well.. Fabulous Building not just from the outside but from inside as well.
Recommend taking a tour so to know what it is you are seeing. Most everyone speaks English and very well, not to worry.
guided tours in many languages. I visited many times and participated in at least two guided tours; the grandiosity of the building was shocking every time.
Cool Place !. Nice place to see, however maybe a little disapointing compared to chat you can see from the movies. Would recommend to see from the main bridge or from the castle.
Good building. Interesting neo-gothic building to view from the outside. Not a lot of information available around the site.

Coffee at Parliament Cafe inside the Hungarian Parliament, Budapest.. Our Budapest city tour included the Parliament Visit which we visited at the end of the day trip. The security check was similar to that for international flights. We had an English speaking guide. Photography is allowed all through except in the room where the Royal Crown is displayed. The inner decor of the entire building is very impressive. The walls, the stained glass windows, the statues depicting common people, the carpet that was woven in nine months, the horse-shoe shaped main hall and the excellent maintenance of everything displayed were truly stunning. There's a cigar stand in the corridor just outside the horse-shoe shaped hall. Our guide explained, it was for the members of the parliament to keep the cigars before entering the hall to attend the session. In case a cigar burnt till the end before its owner could come back for a puff, the speech he had been attending was described as "worth the Havana" ! Much of the Parliament building was reduced to rubble by the WW II bombings. There's a permanent gallery before the exit which shows how the new building has been reconstructed from old photographs and damaged pieces. Even a cursory visit to this area is a must : it's all about human determination to start afresh with pride and confidence. It's only a few years that entry to this place has become priced. To enjoy a sip and bite at the Parliament Cafe is an added attraction. If one has time to spare one shouldn't miss the "change of guard" ceremony just outside the Parliament at about 6 pm ( bright sunlight ), as far as I can remember. After the visit to the Parliament one can walk down to the bank of the Danube in ten minutes.

Fast paced . The tour guide we had was very quick with ever explanation and with some it was as bland as 'this is a hallway' which I thought wasn't worth £20 for. Aside from that the building itself is amazing but we were not allowed to go to every part of it, or take photos in some parts, if you're offering a tour guide, it shouldn't have limits and a tour should allow photos everywhere in the building, why would we be able to access the main crown room and not take photos of the main thing or even the roofs design for that matter - overall I don't think it's worth attending the tour but it's a nice building on the outside
Beautiful . Most amazing place never seen prettier building especially at night from the River Cruise. Quick walk from Hotel Iberostar.

Magnificient Building. My expectations about Budapest were low but after been there I got impressed. It is a clean city, very modern and classic at the same time. It is very safe and tourist friendly. The Parliament is a breathtaking structure, I have the oportunity to see it from the distance during the night and it is spectacular. Got in love with this city and it was a highlight of the tour.

One of the most stunning buildings in the world . I was very lucky to stay near the Parliament Building but even staying there for a week, each walk past this building still led me to draw breathe. It really is one of the most stunning buildings in the world. Lovely during the day, but even more stunning in the evening, you will inevitably see this when you visit the city. You can do a tour of the building, in my case I took the tour in English and it was great to see inside the building too. Some amazing parts on the inside too. Plenty of opportunities for photos too - if you buy the photo ticket for a little bit more cash. The tour lasts an hour or so and its a pleasant way to spend an hour in the city and completes the Parliament 'experience'.
Nice. Place what everyone in Budapest should see. Thats it. Really impressive place, mostly for people with artistic soul :)

Awakens curiosity. Absolutely stunning from the outside (particularly in the snow). The guided tour (that is the only way to visit) was very informative but not too long that it became boring. It was given in a fluent French, and other languages are also available (the day we went Spanish was also on offer). It left me with a thirst to discover even more about Hungarian history.

Don’t Miss Your Visit. You know it is here, you know how does it looks like, you know where it is, you know what is it. But would you like to get inside? You should. The building from outside is magnificent on its own, but when you get inside, you will see, it is more magnificent than you have expected. It is worth to book your visit in advance as then you have almost nothing to do and be sure there are crowds waiting to get inside, so every moment you don’t spent in a queue is good one. It took a lot of time, but it is pretty fast and the guide explains a lot of details and historical events related to the building. Coronation jewels are also nice with interesting history as well. Simply go for guided tour, it is worth of it, because you can read about it, you can see pictures, but once you are inside, you can imagine how big and nice this place is. And the Hungarian accent is lovely as well, so the tour has another dimension as well ;-)
Striking view. This building is just amazing, the architecture is brilliant and it is huge! We just had a walk by, so there is a view to watch but nothing do there really. Worth seeing though.
Very interesting . We did the tour and it was really very interesting. The inside of the parliament is as impressive as the outside so is worth taking a look! It's about £10 each for an hours' tour.

Beautiful building - tour slightly disappointing . Hungarian Parliament is a breath taking piece of Architecture and holds lots of history. It is defiantly worth a visit. The tour is around about £5 and lasts about an hour - I would say it's definitely value for money however your limited to what you can see and the tour guide wasn't particularly welcoming which is why I have rated it a 3. You also have to pay 200HUF to use the toilet so make sure you have change!
very beautiful seeing. one of most important tourist attraction in Budapest, it is better to see it from the opposite bank of Danube

Absolutely fantastic . One of the most amazing buildings I have ever seen.Beautiful both inside and outside.Tip: get early there in order to find an available English tour (we did the Russian one). Excellent any way.

Stunning building!!. There are so many great views of this from all over the city! It's a beautiful piece of history! Make sure you walk up close to see the detail in the architecture and go across the river so you can take it all in!!
Absolutely beautiful! . Been in Budapest a few days now and every time I go past I have to take another picture. It looks best at night lit up and you get great views of it from Buda castle!

Stunning Building.... Beautiful, gothic style building in a great area.Always things happening there and close to the sombre holocaust (shoes) memorial. Walk down to Margaret Island and make an afternoon of it!

Imposing exterior and Impressive ornate interior in an interesting area of Budapest. We bought our tickets for the English language tour and had to wait for 3 hours. This gave time for a bite of lunch but it may be an idea to buy tickets on-line. If you are an EU citizen you can obtain a significant discount on the ticket price (bring your passport). The building is an interesting pastiche of architectural styles built not much over 100 yrs ago. No expense was spared on its rich interior which is vast. Watch out for details such as the many brass cigar holders in the corridors - apparently all members of parliament smoked large cigars in the early days of the parliament building's life. The crown of King Stephen - a sacred national treasure - is housed here. If you are visiting please heed the rules about no photos of this national emblem and treating it with due respect. On our tour one American girl unfortunately insisted on blithely ignoring these requirements and got a sound telling off from the tour guide and soldiers who insisted on her deleting the photos. Frankly she thoroughly deserved her robust treatment but it did mar the tour slightly.There's a changing of the guard ceremony that can be viewed outside the Parliament building (for free).

The place you see on European river cruise commercials. An absolutely spectacular sight from the Pest side or from a boat on the Danube. Tour of the building itself, which is surprisingly modern, is well worth taking.
Beautiful . The building is incredibly big and gorgeous, the guide with us was very nice and the beauty of the crown is astonishing. A perfect proof of an incredible history.
beatiful parliament. I think this must be one of the most beatiful parliaments , the architecture and dimension of this building is amazing.

More than expected. As a non EU citizen this was reasoned costly (EU citizen around 50% less) but turned out to be a very interesting experience. Seeing the gold encrusted ceilings and incredible architecture form inside was worth the entry. The guide also gives some excellent background and history of the building.
You got to see this!. Just extremely impressive. Very posh and pomp, but stylish and all goes well together. Very tasteful and astonishingly functional. I would say a must in Budapest.
Beautifoul! . very knowledgeable and good at explaining, we had booked a visit to the Italian lady has proved helpful. parliament is beautiful, one of the most beautiful places I've ever seen.
Parliament . Worth a visit you have to have your passport on you to get the discount on entry possible the best thing we saw on our time in Budapest

Don't miss the guided tour. Before I say anything about the tour itself PLEASE make sure you don't miss out on this by not booking online in advance! We were extremely lucky to find a slot where we could book, I say we it was actually the concierge at our hotel who did it for us, and it was one of the highlights of our trip.The tours are each day in various languages and do get booked up very quickly. They are very well organised - make sure you arrive about 10 mins before yours. When you are allowed through the security there is a cloackroom where you can leave all your outdoor wear - great for us as we were so well wrapped up - felt like Nanook of the North! and then you are excorted around the public areas.Our guide spoke excellent English and knew his stuff. Could answer all our questions - probably about 25/30 people- and spoke loud enough so we could all hear him. It is an extremely impressive building both inside and out and we loved hearing the history of it and some of the items there - a crown which was bent and its story. Security is good which you would expect for a building with a parliament in everyday use but not overpowering. Don't miss going!

Amazing building. The building is amazing, I think everybody has to visit it once. The tour guide was an expert, there was no unanswered question. There are guided tours in English, German, Spanish, French, Russian, Hebrew, Italian - I think everybody can choose.There are strict safety regulations, the start of the tour was a lit bit too circuitous because of the guards. The tour should be 50 minutes long but it was only 35 minutes - the guide told us its the normal time.

Beautiful building . Went on a tour of parliament (2000 Forint) it's worth doing the building is very beautiful and it's quite and interesting tour.You get to see the crown!Make sure you cross the river to see the true beauty of the building.

Budapest By Night. While a spectacular building in any light, for it's true 'Wow' factor, it must be seen at night. Absolutely stunning. Visit the Holocaust memorial on the wall just outside parliament house during the day. Not to be missed

Fantastic Architecture. We took the tour of this building. The architecture is amazing and it was fun to hear the history of the country and how it evolved through the Hapsburgs and through the wars to where it is today.
Stunning from the inside and outside . You can't visit the place without going in for the tour A very special place Not a long visit do go in ...And later on walk around the whole building
Beatiful. Only saw from the outside but would have loved to have taken the tour if we had more time. Good views of it from Buda side and on the river tours

Grwat. Visited this as part of a tour and was very impressed at the professionalism of the tour guide and the well reserved nature of the Parliament House. Even lucky to have caught the changing of the guard. A must see!
Beautiful building. The building is beautiful and can been seen from miles away. It's only until you get there, that you realise how big the building actually is.

Stunning. By far the most beautiful building in Budapest. What a beauty. A must see when it's lit up at night.
Bigbus bus tours offers a night tour. They make a stop right in front of the parliament, which is a great photo opportunity! Open the windows for no glare in photos ;)
The Westminster of the East. The most beautiful building in Central-Eastern Europe. Forty kilos of gold foils to adorn the place. Fine architecture, statues, carpets and glass work.
Impressive . An impressive building, a great reminder of the Habsburg empire. It's beautifully lit up by night, well worth a few photographs
Parliament building. amazing arcitecture in an amazing city. This is quite similar to the houses of parliament in the UK . Inside is mind blowing . Its great to photograph from across the river

Perhaps my Favorite Building in all of Europe (of those I have yet visited). The size, beauty and grandeur of the Parliament Building overwhelmed us when it first came into view. The Hungarian Parliament Building, completed in 1904, is the quintessential image of Budapest that made me fall in love with the city. I blame Viking River Cruises for my obsession with visiting Budapest. Every time I saw one of their commercials of their river boat cruises down the Danube River across the Chain Bridge opening up to the impressive and exquisite Parliament Building, I knew we would explore Budapest one day because I had to see it for myself. I never thought it would be as soon as it was.The Parliament building was everything I dreamed it would be. The building was constructed in Gothic Revival style. We crossed both bridges on either side of the Parliament Building and walked the length of the river between the bridges to gain an appreciate of the extraordinary building from all angles. We did this walk both in the daytime and in the evening because the views in both lighting are majestic. It just took my breath away.Budapest, while stunning during the day, was breathtaking once the sky turned pitch black. All of the buildings glowed in the darkness, especially the Parliament Building. It looked majestic as it glowed above the Danube River. All of the buildings along the river appeared enchanting.
Really impressed . The tours occurred regularly, the guide was so friendly, answered all questions and had amazing knowledge, the tour was very very interesting, would recommend

Save Money, Book on Hilton Website. We were a party of 6 and booked the tour on the Hilton Website when we booked our room. It was substantially cheaper but you had to provide your own transportation. The Parliament was stunning and the tour/museum was so fun. You could actually take the tour in any language, as the museum explains everything at the end. It lasts about 1 hour, then the museum about 45 minutes. Well worth the money. We took a cab down from the hotel, walked along the Danube (the Shoe Memorial is on the way), walked across the chain bridge, then the funicular up. The beautiful art museum is right at the top of the funicular if you are not too tired. It was a great and interesting day.

Great Tour. The tour is a little expensive for what you get. You get to see the amazing dome, the original Hungarian crown, and the actual parliament.
The outside is beautiful to walk around if you don't have time to take the tour, roughly one hour.

Amazing Building. It's one of the most amazing buildings you must visit while your stat in Budapest. You can go around the building and take many pictures but having pics inside the building is priceless, its very amazing with its fabulous decorations, sections and monuments. You must see 😊
Must see. It's not needed to go inside, you can take a good look from a river boat if you take the river tour or form Buda

Went for a look. We were on a tight schedule and went in a Sunday, so could only really take the building in from the outside. It was a beautiful building, and we saw the guards marching which was also a novelty

Don't waste your time or money. When the Pest side of Budapest was repeatedly flooded by the Danube in the 19th century the Hapsburgs decided to reinvent the city in the style of Paris and Vienna, with the Parliament building modelled on Westminster in London. Joseph Palatinate rebuilt most of the city in a short time, which is why much of the architecture and decoration of important buildings look much the same. The Parliament reception has rude staff, queues for everything and if you have seen the cathedral, opera house and Alexandra cafe you will have a sense of deja vu as you eventually spend 30 minutes being shown corridors and a big staircase (modelled on Westminster).Don't waste your time and money on this visit; there are far more interesting things to see in Budapest (especially if you are a non EU citizen, where you are charged lots to be kept waiting and abused).

Extremely impressive. An absolute must on a trip to Budapest. Stunning building modelled on the Westminster Parliament but about twice the size. Managed to catch the changing of the guard ceremony at around midday by chance which although seemed to be purely for tourist purposes was pretty entertaining. Tour is well worth the small contribution, friendly, helpful and insightful guides. Would have been nice to go inside some committee rooms etc. Museum also definitely worth visiting with a fascinating insight into Hungary's political history with audio guides included in the tiny price in lots of different languages. The museum 'guide' was also extremely friendly, helpful and informative and willing to chat and answer questions. Highly, highly recommended.

Interesting and good value. Very interesting tour round this remarkable building. Tours in several different languages, guides have good knowledge and are friendly. Good for photo access, and good cafe afterwards

Hungarian Megalomania. These were the words of a tour guide with a group of English. You go in at the far end by a visitors' centre entrance - not really well signed. The tour is rapid but fine and the interior is magnificent and makes Westminster look like a Travel Lodge whereas this is the Ritz. Very grand indeed and really not to be missed. Ends, as they all do, in the shop but you can dash swiftly out from that. I did a tour with the English speaking guide but it hardly matters as it is one of those to look at rather than to know about places. You can photograph everywhere except at one point with St Stephen's crown. Do check in advance as when the House is sitting you do not get in.
Organised tour. Building is amazing.We didn't have enough time to fully enjoy the visit as we went with an organised tour.
Must see. Wonderful building, a must see when you are in budapest especially in the evening. Easy to reach by metro.
Beautiful building. This was a very easy walk from our hotel (the Sofitel) and the tram runs right by there as well. Beautiful architecture. We didn't go for a tour, wish we had.

Fascinating trip. Fabulous building with delightful features. Interesting tour well explained with a changing of the guard on route. Avoid the lift and use the stairs to get a good idea of the scale of the building. Tour could have been longer.
Impressive building . An enourmous Renaissance building housing the parliament. It dominates part of the river bank. It is guarded by military at the rear end.

Beautifull Arabian look palace. This is stunnin! You must visit this beautifull palace. The best fotoview from the other side off the river but the walk around this building is also very nice. Looks like an arabian palace
Amazing architecture. Has to see it in person to marvel at the l details. Best photo op can be done off a pier on the Danube. We caught the changing of the guards which was a pleasant treat.
Amazing Building. This amazing building is probably the most beautiful building you will see in all of Europe. Definitely worth have a look at!!
A landmark. the building is really impressive from the outside, standing right by the Danube river with majesty and peace

Puts all other government buildings to shame. We happened to just come across this during a changeover of guard. That was an amazing thing to see. The head of the patrol was great with the crowd and allowed people to take photos at the end of their 'routine'. Beautiful and amazing structure of a building. It has beaten all other Government buildings I have seen; mind I am planning to visit Washington soon so who knows if it will still be number 1!
Opulent building!. Nice short tour, only 45 minutes, that is just enough. Beautiful building and short history of the empire, the crown jewels and the building itself. Definitely worth the visit.
Beautiful sight. We took the canal tour at night. What a beautiful city. The buildings are laid out in all their splendor for us to take in. The day tour was just as beautiful. Loved it here!
Outstanding. Antone who goes to budapest need to visit the parlament, it's important to buy thickets in advance(site), it's amazing
great building. to be visited, great building, nice position, history,, culture, art, easy to reach by metro or by bus.

Very grand and amazing at night. This building is an amazing structure. It looks great during the day but more amazing at night. Did a tour of the Parliament and found it quite worthwhile and interesting, was about 45 min long. I usually get bored with these kinds of things but found it enjoyable to hear a bit of history and to see the structure from inside. The crown jewels are also inside and you'll get the opportunity to see that too.

Beautiful Building. This building is beautiful from every angle. You can have a guided tour inside. The spanish tour lady was very nice. The visit takes around 45 minutes. Best view is from Fisherman's Bastion.
Spectacular . A MUST visit in Budapest. Eat your heart out, London!!! Take the #2 tram along the river and stop at Kossuth Lajos Ter to walk around Parliament for 10-15 mins.

Beautiful interiors and very attractive outside too. The only way you can see the inside of the parliament buildings is to go on one of the guided tours (several times a day, various languages, costing 2000 huf, but its definitely worth it as the interiors are beautiful, there's a little museum and they also hold the crown jewels. At busy times of the year you can book ahead of time online. The exterior is beautiful too.
Beautiful building . A must see in Budapest. You need to book ahead to go inside which we didn't do but just walking around the outside is worth doing.

Tour in parlamentet. We bought two tickets around 2000 HUF pr.person. The tour is 45 min. We had a enligsh guide there. Amazing tour in the parlamentet, great experience and we learned alot of history etc. You can take pictures in most of the places inside parlamentet. Recommend for everyone to go there.

** beautiful building,excellent architecture**. one of the beautiful building in Budapest, very huge (that's why it is considered as the 3rd largest building parliament in the world ), walk around from one end to the other, take lots of photos !Easily accessible by metro line 2 (red line) stop Kossuth tér.
A must visit site. The stunning exterior make this a landmark that must be visited to appreciate. Take your time, the more you look the more you see.

suprise trip! Christmas present from loved children!" what a fab idea!. Lovely trip. was unsure as to whether Budapest was my kind of city. However, the trip has changed my mind! Had a lovely break in a fab hotel, what more could you want!
you can walk all around and take pictures, no problem at all. Is just the Parliament, so, you cannot go inside, also the architecture is incredible, pay attention in the top and columns.

the most beautiful building of the city. When you are at Budapest, uou will be impressed from this beautiful building! the landmark of Budapest for my opinion! great architecture and really impressive next to Dunabe!
Go opposit to Buda to take pics with light as well as at night!!!
Parliament tour. You must go inside. It's worth visiting. the only negative was that the English spoken tour was too crowded,they should have divided us in two groups

Beautiful, A must see!. Gorgeous parliament. Took the tour and well worth the money. The guide was very knowledgeable and the interior of this building was gorgeous. Definitely a must see while in Budapest!

Walk there by night. It looks amazing from viewpoints on other side of the river.
However, it looks the best by night! Find good spot to take amazing pictures.
Close by you can find "Shoes on Danube river".

Short tour but fantastic history. Me and my friend purchased the tour from the visitor centre which was very modern and helpfully mostly in English. The tour was very interesting albeit slightly short at around 45 minutes. It was novel having a police/military escort around the building. I found the tour interesting, relevant and the building itself beautiful and steeped in a mixed history. Well worth the 2000 HUF, be mindful if visiting from the EU to take driving license or passport to get the discounted rate.
Impressive building. This is an impressive building on Danube River. The architecture is amazing. Very, very beautiful place.
See from the river!. No need to go inside but be sure to see from across the river, better yet FROM the river and do it at night! The building looks even better at night with the illumination.
Amazing building on the river. This is the must see in Budapest. How this was built way back then i cannot imagine. Detailed to the max.

The most unique buildings in the city Budapest!. Parliament Building in Budapest is the most beautiful place in the whole city!
Come visit and see it for yourself!
Beautiful. This landmark is worth visiting just for the architecture alone. There's interesting history inside if you have a colorful guide as we did b
Incredible. What a beautiful view of the history of Hungary! We were blown away by the building and by the tour. Everyone who comes to Budapest has to do this.
Walk by Danube. A great idea is to have an hour walk aroun both sides of the Danube, form Parlament to Buda Castle, and crossing Chain Bridge
Beutiful. It looks amazing...especially from the river side of view,by day is beautiful,but by night is impressive

Amazing tour. It is a must if you visit Budapest. I was there when I was a kid but going back it was a great experience as there are a lot of new things and different expos time to time. For the best experience i recommend getting a guide....

A must do. The guided tour of Parliament is informative and the building is truly magnificent. Our guide was very knowledgeable and we leaner much about the intricate history of Hungary. I think it is a must do for Budapest
Stunning. Beautiful building, set in a pristine square surrounded by amazing 19th century stone buildings. Great views of the Danube from the western side. You will not be disappointed.
Parliament Visit. Unfortunately did not have time to have a tour of the inside, but the outside is beautiful. Plenty of information of statues and history available on the statues also.

Absolutely beautiful, but the tour is a rip off. You have no choice but to go in by tour and you pay for 45 min of which at least 10 min are going through security. We had about 50 or more people in our group and the lady spoke softly and you could not hear in the back. Also, another large group was next to us in some of the areas talking in another langauge and it became even harder to hear. The guide also would NOT wait until everyone was caught up to her to talk and we were rushed in the session room so those of us in the back did NOT have time to take pics. Another group from our family went the next day and experienced the same thing. It's unfortunate as everyone should see the parliament, but it's a disappointing tour.

Beautiful. This is the most beautiful building in Budapest, home of the policy. Kossuth Square impressive since renovated. I recommend all visitors to Budapest to visit this.
Not easy to get into, inform themselves before the Internet!
Must take tour inside!. Buy tickets online and you wont have to wait in line. They book out fast. Tour was fast and easy and worth getting inside to see this building and history.
A Hungarian version of Westminster. Very ornate Westminsterstyle building with tours in most languages. Check for times though. Nice cafe

Stunning building, great vaule tour and I loved the windows. Went on a tour got the EU discounts. Great facilities to be offered the tour in lots of languages. You have to go through tight security checks (makes sense) and there is a free cloakroom post this but pre tour. The guide was good and showed us good key features, a few stories about things rather than plain facts might have made more entertaining. The building is a place the Hungarians are very proud of and with every right, it is stunning. Like the museum at the end very informative. The stain glass is what will stick in my memory.

Out of Story book. Amazing , beutiful , marvelous , worlds can not describe the beauty of the Parliament . Simply when visting Budapest it must be a non - negotiable to visit . Look at these pictures . I have also taken them from Danube during my cruise .
Nice Architecture. one of the finest looking buildings in Budapest. well worth a visit. situated on the riverside in Pest, the architecture is simply stunning.

Beautiful neo-gothic palace. Hmm...what can I say? It is just a beautiful piece of architecture, simply stunning. A must see if you ever find yourself in Budapest. Although me and my girlfriend didn't take the tour (we didn't know the was one) we still enjoyed just standing in the shade on the benches right next to the palace and admire it. A little tip, there are a number of fountains in front of the building, and in the torrid days of summer you can put your feet in the water as long as you do it without the guards seeing you. It's a great way to cool down a bit, but you have to be quick. A final word, go and visit it.

Lovely Building, "Meh" Tour. A pretty dry tour of a beautiful building. The guide was difficult to hear/understand at times (and the group was really large, which didn't help) Maybe it seemed more boring because we had just taken a really really interesting tour of the Reichstag the month before. Even the kids had liked that one.Also, the entry procedure seems a little disorganized -- they only let you in to the security area about 5 minutes before your scheduled tour time and then you have to file through the metal detector/cloak room, which takes a really longggg time. They could have you do that ahead of time, or have you gradually go through instead of having a mob scene.The gift shop at the end (because you exit through the gift shop, of course!) has some really nice items in it, things we didn't see elsewhere.

Great tour. We went to the Parliament building on a Sunday morning and we're lucky enough to see the changing of the guards. The tour was great and really informative. Worth a visit. EU citizens should bring their ID as it is a lot cheaper!

Definitely worth a visit. What can one say? Impressive building for sure. We took the guided tour, and that is definitely to recommend. The guide knew his house and history, and gave us a good update on Hungary's history.
Visit . Go and see,its a must,only 2000HUF if you take ID and proof that you come from UK otherwise it will cost you 5200HUF
Magnificent. It is very beautiful at day, but at night the lights are on and it is truly magnificent. We took a nice walk by Danube.

Awe- inspiring!. Quite possibly one of the most impressive buildings I've ever seen. The tour is well worth the approximately 10 Euro ticket. You're led through breathtaking guilt halls and parliament rooms; a truly magnificent structure. You even get to see the Hungarian crown jewels as an added bonus!
Beautiful at night. Great architecture, beautifully lit at night. large open space around with many benches, careful of the armed guards!

This majestic palace has certain appeal to it. This place is bound to become your cover pic. The serene river side alongside this monumental palace is one of the most beautiful experience you will ever have.

Imponente !!!!! Imposing !!!!!. Hungarian historic building ... Majestic, imposing, admirable Parliament. And if you have to go on a Sunday and watch the changing of the guard guarding the building asylum, it is an excellent addition !!!!!Histórico edificio del Parlamento húngaro... Majestuoso , imponente, admirable. Y si toca ir un domingo y ver el cambio de guardia de lo asilados que custodian el edificio , es un excelente extra !!!!!

Very beautiful building but not a complete visit. You can only visit some corridors, the secondary parliament hall and the treasure hall (wy are photos forbiden in this hall? It will be enough to not allow flash).Anyway, the outside sights are fantastic.
place to visit. well it is one of the places that for sure you should visit in Budapest because it is one of the most interesting buildings that I have see it.
Lovely walk. Was very impressive! Worth a little stroll very near the water front which is also nice place to visit. Buildings are beautiful
Must see for Budapest. Make sure you get there early for a ticket (English tour sold out about 9am on the day we went) as it is well worth seeing the inside of this building.

Amazing architecture in Budapest. On my first day staying in buda, I went to a thermal baths then for a walk along the Danube in the evening between the margin bridge and the chain bridge and the whole place was lit up, it was beautiful and a great phot opportunity of the bridges and the parliament building. You can visit inside at a discount as an ey citizen taking along your passport or proof which is worth a little saving. Like lots of other buildings they are stunning
beautiful building from the river. this is a most beautiful building. saw it from the river, Would love to go around it. reminds me of London's Parliament building but is nicer.
Very nice. Very nice scenery, a beautiful building. We went there in the dark, the building was lighted beautifully.
River cruise past parliament. Good value for money and duration and informative headphones about history of historic buildings . Went past parliament on tram too . Beautiful .

Beautiful but Bureaucratic. This is a beautiful, gorgeous building. Its magnificent exterior is matched on the inside by a series of symbolic carvings, frescos, carpets, etc. that you could spend hours looking at. Unfortunately, the tour is rather hurried so you won't get much time except to snap a couple photos and jostle with 40-50 other tourists.The tours for non-EU adults are 5600 FT (about $20 - pretty expensive for Hungary) as well as a processing surcharge. You must make a reservation in advance and print the ticket. When you arrive you must go through security. I had to be patted down. Then you must check your coat. The tours are technically 45 minutes long but this time includes security and coat check, which, for 40-50 people, took around 15 minutes for us. So the tour was only around 2/3 of the time that we thought.That said, the interior is so lovely, you may forget about the bureaucratic machinations you've had to jump through to get there. You will see the grand staircase, a nice lobby, the crown of St. Stephen, and one of the legislative chambers. At the end there's a nice exhibit on the construction of the building, a detailed model, and the inevitable gift shop. You can take photos anywhere except around the crown, which is guarded by 2-3 soldiers. The tour guide was fine but hard to hear at times, since many rooms echo.In sum, I would recommend doing this but keep in mind that you may have to jump through a couple small hoops. You will be climbing stairs, go through security, and you will be hurried along. But you will see a true architectural gem.
Fabulous view..!!!. Its simply amazing.. ultimate view.. the architecture is superb.. the look at night is awesome.. present on the Danube edge its simply superb.. not to be missed...

40 tons of gold leaf!. Best to book online, as there are limited places on each tour. The Parliament buildings were modelled on the Westminster Parliament, but the House of Lords equivalent was abolished in 1944, only the House of Commons is in use, so you tour the House of Lords side only. The central dome houses the ancient crown, orb and sceptre, and this is the only area where you are not allowed to take photos. The opulence is amazing, even gold leaf on the skirting boards!BTW avoid the cafe, over priced and truly inedible food the worst we ate in our entire stay in Budapest.
Glowing. During the day it looks very nice,but in the night it is absolutely amazing,it is fitting in perfectly in panorama with chain bridge.

Beautiful on the inside and the outside. Great for pictures, both on the inside and the outside. You better by tickets to visit the interior online.It is very beautiful inside, but they show you only a very, very small part of the parlaimant...
Loved the tour!. Although we had a shortened tour, it was still great. The building is beautiful and our guide was very knowledgeable. I would definitely recommend this as a must see in Budapest!

Majestic . We went in winter with snow on the ground. It's an unbelievable building that I can't put into words. Walk round the whole building even along the river bank as you will miss out beautiful views of the majestic building if you don't. It's a must for any visitor to Budapest.

Nice city. This city is amazing. We visited Budapest last year September. You may find spectacular view along the Danube river at night time. Its full of light. We took a cruise along the river and we really enjoy the viewing all the building beside the river. And surprisingly the Danube River is so blue. Nice experience been in Budapest.

Very noble and nice place. You need to book your tour at least day in advance online and print it, but it's not a problem, there are copycenters everywhere in Budapest. When you come there directly, ticket are usually already sold out.The Parliament itself is very beautiful and stylish building. I love the insides, with very symbolic things (number of stairs corresponds with year of establishing Hungary and so on).

Great sightseeing in Budapest. Excellent piece of art to understand Hungarian nation and mind. Very beautiful building and interior. Good caffeteteria inside. Advanced (the day before) booking for the native language is needed.

The Jewel of Hungary. You have to visit the Parliament in Budapest and you will love it!There were 30-40 people in the group and you had a chance to see the Hungarian Crown as well. The building is a true masterpiece inside and outside! Whether it is cold or hot, rainy or sunny this program will KO you! :-)  I highly recommend to spend some time in the small museum when the tour is over. You have to come through that area, so you cannot miss it!

Can't really spend too much time looking at this building!. A key site in Budapest, you will want to see this from Castle Hill, the bridges, from across the Danube, and right up close. Tours are held daily in dozens of languages. The interior is just as exquisite as the exterior. Well worth the time to see it up close and take the tour. It gets crowded, so book your tour time in advance.
Magnificent!. From either the outside or interior this is a splendid and stately building representing more than just today governmental seat. Well worth any time you can spend here.

Must see in Budapest. It's the third largest Parliament building in the world! It looks more like a gothic cathedral from the outside with all of it's stained-glass windows. Inside is equally as awesome! It houses a crown that is the second oldest in the world(I believe) and it is worth seeing! I highly recommend visiting the Parliament when you are in Budapest!

Highly recommended. Booked the tour online to avoid standing in line (price is the same). Very beautiful building inside and out, ineresting tour, wonderful interior and you get to see the crown jewels and the change of the guard on them.

Breathtaking inside and out.. This building was absolutely gorgeous close up. Unfortunately the city was very foggy when I visited so I was not able to have a good view of it during the day but it was lit up beautifully at night. Make sure you go and take the tour through the inside as well!

Stunning and very historically interesting tour.. Just the interior decor is worth it, but the tour guides, who speak and tour in several languages, are very interesting. Also you get to see the recently returned Crown of Hungary that was stolen from the country and after a hard fought international negotiation was finally returned.
View from the other side. I didn't enter the parliament but only walked along it and looked from the cruise and the other side of Danube. It is impressive when the sun goes down.
Amazing Building. This building is wonderful but if you have the time to visit after dark do this as well as it is even more imposing when lit up that in the daytime.

One of the most beautiful Parliament buildings in the world. Must see it. It's a very interesting place, full of history and worth a visit. It's better to book in advance if you're looking for a guide in your language.

the most beautiful place in Budapest. I can't believe that this place was built just 100 years ago. Why all new buildings can't be so beatiful?
Reachable by public transport, possible to see from everywhere.

Wonderful! Must visit if you are in Budapest!. I was amazed by the beauty of this building. It is in a very good condition and the tour guide we booked was very helpful and explained many interesting fact. I suggest you go to the first tour!

Amazing!. It really worth to get in! It reminds me to a royal palace and not to a political institution! one of the best place to visit in Budapest. There is a metro to get there, it is really close.Remember you need to book online in advance and you can get a guided tour! have a look on the official website of the parliament in the tourist area.
Beautiful . Beautiful. Mostly at night from the Danube river on a cruise. Inside nice but nothing specia. I think you can pass on entering the place
Spectacular. Inside and out.. Externally this building is in immaculate condition. Internally just the same. The whole family found the tour very insightful and enjoyed it very much.
gorgeous. Budapest has amazing scenery and architecture, it is a gorgeous city. Parliament building is fabulous, grand and a must see.
Amazing. Beautiful building. Amazing architecture. Looks like in a fairytale. Worth visiting. It is a must see.

Stunning building. A very impressive building, designed with the obvious intent of upstaging Vienna during the Dual Monarchy. The tour is a bit short but gives you the chance of seeing the most impressive parts of the building, including the former House of Magnates, where the Magyar nobility had once sat as legislators. The underground visitor's centre is sleek and comfortable.

The U.S. capital is imressive but this... wow!. Such a cool "government" building.... it's beautiful during the day and well lit at night. Very dramatic, indeed. I don't know if they offer tours inside - we didn't have time for anything like that, but just to wander around it was spectacular. By the way... the monument Shoes on the Danube is a few hundred meters away so if you're walking around the Parliament building, cross the street and head south along the river to see it.
Astonishing. Impressive building... look at it, enjoy it from the different angles and lights, take tons of photos. It's worth.

Amazing view. The Parliament is a monumental architectural building.We visit in the day light but it's better in the night.For a good pictures it's mandatory to cross the river ( opposite ).The best way is to have a car for Budapest.I remember to all visitors that some objectives are closed but in the winter is hard to walk (very cold).Also the parking hour is 1,25 euro.Free on holiday days.

Impressive Parliament, Definitely Get a Tour!. You don't have to be interested in politics, history or architecture to visit here, as I think it is interesting for anyone!We booked tickets for this in advance online to save waiting in queues (good idea as the queue was huge!), it was quite cheap and definitely worth the money.Our tour guide was so interesting and made the experience much more enjoyable. She was very knowledgable, spoke English very well and answered any questions you had,The tour is only about 30 mins-45 mins long, which is perfect really. You get told about the building, about Hungarian royalty and about the government. You seen the Hungarian royal crown, the main entrance hall and the house of lords. At the end of the tour there is also a bit of a museum/exhibition about the building. The architecture inside is stunning!It's very easy to get to, you can see it from all over the city and it's on the bank of the Danube. At night it's lit up with all other attractions in Budapest which is nice.Definitely a must see if visiting Budapest!

A must when in Budapest. You really need to visit if you're in the city. You need to book ahead I'd say, I gave it a few days notice and it was sold out eventually. The process getting in through security is long, you need to wait until your appointed time. When in the tour is okay but to be honest quite short and not full of detail. No real time to pause and look.There is a gift shop on the way out and a decent cafe.It could be better but it's still a must just to see and feel the history.
Excellent place to visit.. Realy great and beautiful. I've traveled more than 40 countries and this building is one of the most beautiful I've ever seen.Strongly reccomending.
Very nice . Parliament is very nice with good location, excellent experience when you visit Budapest you have to visit Parliament.
Budapeszt. One of the objects which You should see during Your life time. Best for architecture, history tourists.
Nice Place. The most beautiful parliament as well know. if you go to budapest, you should go to get here. I'm cheer
Breath taking!. We were lucky taking a boat along the river to see how beautiful it was from outside. Definitely we be back some day. ❤️
Very beautiful. Beautiful place, amazing tour, Bit expensive, it's very recommended to see the parliament from the Danube on a cruise.
magical. Wonderful building which is stunning when lit up. Walk all the way round to enjoy the full splendour.

A Huge and ornate Building. The one hour tour is sufficient to see most of the building. There are many stairs, but if you need you can take the elevator to the upper floors. It is well decorated are some rooms have gold inlay. The tours are in English and other languages as well.

Wonderfull Parliament building to be visited. A world class attraction to be visited if you are in Budapest!!! Do not miss this opportunity!!! And for traveling through the city use the public tram no. 2 as the quayside way to the Parliament is an attraction in its self, with its wonderful view to the Buda Castle and the Danube. This shall be a must in Budapest!
Magnificent building. The most impressive building in whole town! The Parliament Square is one of the best places for pics in Budapest.
Impressive building and location.. The night time lights are amazing and boats on the river go back and forth just to allow for photos. Grounds are lovely. We didn't have time to go inside.

Amazingly beautiful. Great day out, really beautiful put your walking shoes on as there's much to see..👌🏻🍀
Great to come across some as big and beautiful steeped in history and great to see its being kept in a good state
Budapest tour 2015. Beautiful building, amazing architecture!!! Gorgeous view to Danube river and couple of bridges. Pretty close to it there is monument with shoos....

One of the most beautiful parliament in Europe.. During the visit we were guided through the Parliament, where we could see the hungarian crown and the delicately designed and maintained Baroque style of the building. It's recommended to visit and gain a broader perspective of the hungarian culture and history.

VERY IMPRESSIVE BUILDING!. It's worth to visit the Parliament at night time!It looks really amazing!A nice option is to plan a Boat tour at Danube River and you will be able to make very nice photos of this Building!
Must-do visit in Budapest. Very impressive but it felt a bit short. Can get very busy in peak season so make sure you book online.

Great Architecture. The Parliament building offers a fascinating architectural design and some amazing interiors....
Don't miss the chance to take a cruise on the Danube to see it by night..breathtaking!!

Magnificent. Just went to see the outside and a change of guard.
Is an impressive construction, shame we can´t get inside.

Amazing At Night. We saw the Parliament grounds just as it was getting dark and it looked at its best once it was fully lit-up. Make sure you don't just walk along the river-front, do a full walk around the building.

One of the most amazing buildings in the world.. I have been to Budapest a couple of times and everytime I am equally blown away by this enormous ands stunning building. The inside is just as impressing as the outside, do take a tour if you like to see insane luxury and room after room covered in gold. Also very enjoyable is seeing it from a distance fron the other side of the city, like castle hill or fisherman's bastion.

Always wanted to see the building they show on PBS commercial for Viking River Cruises?. This is a must for anyone visiting the Budapest. The visitors center is a very modern underground facility that doesn't compete with the incredible Parliment building. Worth seeing.
Beautiful building, good tour guide. Great, well worth a visit. Be sure to book online as queues always massive. Eu passport holders get a discount so go with it!
Spectacular building!. Must see in Budapest! Amazing building and architecture. Also close to the water for a lovely view of Buda and walk to chain bridge.
A Good visit in the evening. Take a cruise in the river and see the Parliament castle and it will be amazing. The castle has a well connectivity with trams from city centr.

Amazing . As well as seeing the amazing view from the outside, I do the tour if the parliment building which was most insightful. I would recommend doing this tour for anyone interested in the history of the city and a chance to glance the jewels.

Buy ticket online & enjoy the pomp. To save waiting time & make sure to have a spot (esp. in the afternoon & for groups >3) you can buy the tickets online (200 HUF fee per ticket). The ticket counter at the Parliament also print the tickets, then waiting time should be counted in. The parliament itself is imposant and the tour informative, however not much detailed or politically critical.
Vacation . A must seen place in Budapest. The architecture & the building is magnificent to see. The mixture is spectacular and huge. It is definitely not to be missed
Amazing building!. We only saw it from the outside. Quite an impressing building! If you want the tour, you should probably book tickets in advance.
Stunning Day and Night. This is a must see attraction both close up and from across the Danube. A night cruise gives perfect views of this building.

parliament Budapest. we had our tour guide arrange a tour here on our short visit to Budapest. She had suggested we see this when we were here and she was so right. The building was amazing...it was a short one hour tour and worth every minute.
Must see at night. Truly inspiring building/monument - go their after the sunset, looks even better with the lights on!
Amazing. Simply amazing and a stunning building, 3rd largest parliament building in the world. Make sure you do a river cruise at night to capture it's full glory.
Stunning . A stunning example of Hungarian architecture that is well worth a visit. The building is beautiful and especially worth a visit by night.

Beautiful building. Stunning, would recommend viewing this multiple times. We saw it at night first which was stunning, no people around so great chance to take photos. Also viewed from a boat tour which gave more information and on a free walking tour, enabling us to learn more. Also view from Buda to be able to take in the full beauty of the building. Did not get a chance to view inside.
Beautiful. The most beautiful parliament i have ever seen!! Teriffic architecture! Especially from a cruise on the danube!

The symbol of Budapest. An eclectic but mainly gothic revival style building from the end of the 19th century, it majestically occupies the riverfront in the middle of the city. The oversized and overly ornate building hosts the Hungarian legislation and the Prime Minister's office. Built from sandstones some parts of it are almost always scaffolded for renovation. Visits can be booked.
On the Danube, beautiful to see, one of prettiest in world. Don't just view this beautiful building from outside, go inside and tour the facility. One of the most beautiful in the world.

A majestic place . The Hungarian Parliament was supposed to look like its British counterpart, but having seen both I lean more towards the one in Budapest. It can be seen in all its glory from the Buda hills. I recommend a stroll on that side of the city especially at night, because the illumination of the building makes it look even more spectacular.If you want to visit, I highly recommend purchasing the ticket online in advance, because there's a limit of the visitors. The tours are in various languages. I took the Spanish one and I really enjoyed it. The building is accessible with wheelchair and baby carriage.
