Beautiful building, very disappointing tour. Beautiful building with tours in multiple languages and a museum. Our tour was at the end of the day, maybe that is why it felt so rushed and short. These tours are approx $20 per person for non-EU residents. Our tour guide led us to three areas in the building then left us off in the museum. Wished we had more time in both the building and museum but we were rushed out as they needed to close. Beautiful building worth seeing, but disappointing tour.

Truly palatial. Quite special even from outside and beautifully located on the river bank. A must visit at night when it is all lit up and the birds soar overhead in the lights. Most definitely worth taking the tour of the interior. So much gold and such a luxurious interior and the bonus of it being a guided tour.
Great. Great building..One of the best thing to see in budapest..It is free and it is reachable by metro that is near by

Be sure not to miss!. The Parliament building was our top spot while visiting Budapest. We took advantage of the organized tour (booked in advance online) which was informative and efficient (some tours are just too long). The best view of the building is at night from one of the river cruises. Highly recommend you take the hour long tour for the views along the Danube.

Budapest Parliament: A Magnificent Palace where Democracy Reigns. It is literally jarring. When you fits come across this massively ornate buildings with the exquisite Gothic jagged towers to wring over the Danube it games me stop and observe with my mouth agape. Breathtaking." Amazing, " I muttered out loud.Inside, it is even more fascinating with the crown of Hungary guarded by luxuriously decorated, high-stepping guards with swords from another era.I have covered the Senate in The US and while our U.S. Capitol is a beauty this bicameral institution is fascinating and unique. A hi-light was being able to see the House Floor where legislators debate and vote. This is a mandatory tour when you come to Budapest. And buy your tickets at your hotel ,Ike we did. It saves a lot of time.

Ornate. It's difficult to believe that a building which would probably be classified as a museum in Rome, is just a normal functioning Parliament in Budapest. It's a gorgeous building, with amazing frescoes all over the walls. Must visit.
Ornate and spectacular!. Definitely the top place to visit Budapest! The details that have gone into building this structure are incredible. Check the timings for various language tours.

Gorgeous . A stunning building.
There's not really a lot to do around the building, but if you like to sit and admire architecture and all of its details it is a beautiful and must see spot
spectacular building. I love how this building looks, great during the day or night. Very gothic and lights up beautifully at night.
Parliament. Very nice sight to see, and very easy to get there by public transport. Also very nice view to Danube river and Budim castle.

Out of this world!. Not to be missed. Had to return a couple of hours later for next available English tour. Excellent guide very well informed and the decoration inside the building was out of this world. You do not see a huge amount of the building but what you do see is just incredible - so colourful and unusual statues in the rooms. There are plenty of opportunities to take photos and the groups are not too big. The views across the Danube from inside are amazing too. The information in the museum at the end is very interesting too.

Super!. Magnificent building, of course guarded by the police. Sentry guards next to the flag of Hungary. Nice location mext to Danube, easily accesible with the metro network. Nearby are also some other monuments to visit and the shopping area of downtown Budapest is not that far away on foot.
Tour in parliament house. Definitely beautiful architecture. Looks like older brother in London, but I prefer this. Worth of visit.
Imposing building. Imposing building, great arhitecture, the building is renovated two year's ago, near the building is metro and tram station.
What a building. This is a stunning building, regardless of if it is viewed during the night or day. It has very impressive architecture and certainly worth seeing.

Exceptional . This is one of the most beautiful buildings I've ever seen. Stunning Gothic building. Magnificently and beautifully detailed inside, really amazing. Try to go on an early morning tour, when it's empty.
See at night. Pretty amazing building and th walk along the river is unreal. Looking back at the castle and the chain bridge.

Great building!. Although I have never been inside (yet), the outside of the building is pretty amazing! I recommend taking a boat trip in the morning at sunrise or in the evening at sunset. The view is beautiful and you can take great pictures. If you go by foot, make sure you "visit" the other side of the building as well where you can find important monuments. Also, it is very nice when they change guards.If you want to go inside, the visitor center is underground in the left part of the Parliament (Danube view). You can find on their website updated information regarding ticket price, dressing code and visitor route.You can reach this place by public transport with tram 2 or red metro line. The place you need to get off is called Kossuth Square.

Why all this fame?. I do not understand why in all countries parliaments are a must visit. Ok, see this building from the outside, take a picture at night, because it looks great with so many lights but truly there is no point of visiting this place from the inside. I believe it's a waste of time.
Spectacular. The parliament building looks beautiful during the day and iconic at night. I would recommend a dinner river cruise for the best views.

Impressive architecture. THE view from across danube river was just stunning! The reflection of the water of the parliament building is a picture worth taking for symmetrical shots! One of the two tallest buildings together with st stephen basilica, this landmark is impressive both from the inside and outside. Visit the basilica for 360 panoramic view over budapest then visit the parliament building which is accessible on foot since they are so close to each other.

Travel dairies- Budapest . My first trip to Europe starts with visiting Parliament (Orszaghaz) . An impressive human talent of building a monument. Enjoyed the guided tour and learned more about the history of the monument.

Outstanding place to be visited. Excellent visit supported by an extraordinary young lady keen to describe all secrets of this magnificent palace. The visit includes the crown and one chamber. You can not miss the cigar ash trays located on the corridors !

Pure gold above head level. Stunning building on the inside and outside, immense and very much worth the cost for the internal tour (visits by tour-guide only!). EU citizens pay c. 8-10EUR, non-EU pay 2.5 times that amount. Prominent historical architecture, rich with colour and cultural significance.Guide was professional if not overly entertaining. Recommend booking online (small booking fee, c. 2EUR) as guided tour spots are limited and only at certain times in any particular language.
Impressive. A grand building set on the Danube is a site to behold. This is a stunning building with beautiful architecture. Make the time to visit this building.
Magical Place to visit. Great views, architecture, power and strength. The christmas tree is just amazing, colorful and charming. Stay for night to watch the lights.

Fantastic building. Make sure you book online before you go. The queue to get through security is a bit of a bun fight; but the tour itself fantastic. The building is just beautiful and the guide spoke very good English.

Impressive and Free!. These buildings are very beautiful, well maintained with surrounds kept very clean and best of all, it's free to go and see it! Me and my friend didn't go into the museum but it's nice enough walking around seeing the exterior.
Easy access by walking or by no.2 tram which operates every 3-7 minutes along the waterfront.
stunning. really stunning area visited this off the hop on and hop off bus, right on the river and well known for the views
Huge and spectacular. Hard to believe that such an amazing building is so beautiful! Especially when you see it from the bridge 🌉 is amazing!
Impressive historical monument . Full of History, make sure as well to have a coffee and maybe a soup in the winter time at the Elysee cafe next to it.

Nice presentation. If you're going there randomly you might have a lot of time between buying a ticket and going on the actual tour. We had to wait more than 2 hours till our tour. The presentation was very informative, the inside of parliament is realy luxurious and ful of arhitectual details. Just don't piss off the staff there because they can get quite rude.

Must see and go back to Boda and look at the parlement building. While you are over there don't forget to go to the Belgian brassarie for an authentic beers. then come out and take pictures of the parliament building and if you like to walk towards the building and it is the most refreshing walk at night.
Impressive. Built in 1896 to commemorate the 1000 year anniversary of Hungary, this huge and beautiful parliament building is well worth seeing. It is especially attractive when illuminated at night.

Magnificent. The outside of this magnificent building is awesome. The inside equally impressive. The parliament offers it's own tour guides and their English is clear and their presentation of the history of the building is excellent. The very formal changing of the crown guard is fun to watch. The official entrance and old and new chambers are beautiful. You cannot miss this building in your Budapest visit, truly georgous!
Magnificent. The architecture was breathtaking. Several visits were made especially during different times of day. Lovely christmas tree set up in its vicinity👍🏼

Simply amazing!. We were too late to book tour tickets, but we decided to visit Parliament with our two young children in the evening in the cold anyway and it was worth freezing our butts off for! The building is stunning and I loved the massive Christmas tree with tons of lights! If I am ever in this beautiful city again I will do the tour for sure. The gift shop is lovely and the walk along the river at night with the view of the lights on the bridge and on the Buda side is something I will never forget! So go check it out, even if you can't get tickets for the tour!
Stunning. Absolutely stunning environment. Very clean and great open spaces. Good Elysée Bistro near by. Very reasonably priced.

A stunning building. I've long admired the Hungarian Parliament building and recently had the chance to look around the interior. Although tours in English weren't running as frequently as I'd imagined, we bought tickets that allowed us to return four hours later. The tour only takes you to a small amount of the building, but what you do get to see is impressive nonetheless.
Must see. Very nice building with tremendous facade, easily reachable by public transport, including metro.Amazing view from the other side of the river especially at the sunset.

Horrible experience. My friend and I took a tour and it was probably the biggest waste of money. Our guide was nice enough and the building was certainly impressive however, we were unable to hear anything our guide said. While this was supposed to be an English speaking tour, it was filled with non-English speaking people wearing headsets in their language who were extremely rude. They were very loud and crowded around our guide preventing us from hearing anything. They were also completely disrespectful to the building by crossing barricades and sitting where they were not supposed to and touching things they were not supposed to. We did say something to the guide, but she did nothing to remedy the situation and told us that they can't control who goes on tours. I was extremely disappointed, as I had been looking forward to that tour most of all during my stay in Budapest. I truly feel the tour was a waste of money.
Budapest Beauty. This is the most stunning of buildings by any standard. Looks great from any distance and any angle.
Amazing building. We didnt have enough time to visit the parliament but it is a very impressive building from the outside...

One of my favorites in Budapest . Properly magnificient. We can see the Saint Stephen's coron, the Assembly, the "Escalier d'honneur" and admire the elaborated windows or the numerous lights. If only the visit had lasted longer...

A trip into extravagance.. Has to be seen to be believed. I gather the only way to see the Hungarian Parliament is by guided tour although audio guides are available but wandering around with these is very limited and you miss out on the main building. I suggest play it on the safe side and take the guided tour. If you do best to book in advance. You can do this on line. While there are several tours daily and in a variety of languages they often sell out well before you get to the ticket office or, in our case get suddenly rescheduled. Staff are not overly helpful and as another review observed it does get chaotic. Tours are short but well worth it. High season crowds would be a definite deterrent. The House sits right on the banks of the Danube and is easily accessible by ether bus or tram. The Number Two tram running along the Danube stops right outside the Visitors Centre. I won’t even attempt to describe the truly extravagant décor, cavernous halls and long high corridors because it would be impossible to do any of it justice. If you are in Budapest and have the time a visit to Parliament house is a simply a must.

Breath-taking experience!. If you travel to Budapest, you can't miss to visit the Parliament.
Remember to buy the ticket in advance since it's very easy to find it completely fully booked!

Wow. Were very surprised it cost as much as it did and they only took local money. Learned a lot about history of Hungary and saw lots of gold. The staff looked and felt like leftovers from Soviet era. It was actually fun and done in several languages. Large place.

The symbol of Hungarian Independence. It isn't so easy to find the entrance of this wonderful building, An this is something that should have improved, Anyhow when you'll find it everything goes very smoothly. You'll find some very good leaders that drive you through all the huge and beautiful rooms and the grand staircase telling you all sort of stories, like the one that there is a place where the ancient parliamentarians had their own place to put the cigar they were smocking, when they had to come into the collective room for voting.. The Parliament has not, as a difference with ours, a kind of huge pit where the Parliamentarians sit in a declining fashion. It is smaller and the people suit normally, next to each other. The building was built so imposingly as an underlining of the independence rejoined within the Austro-Hungarian Empire. His style is mainly neo-gothic, but also other styles, like neo-baroque. Anyhow the neo-gothic was a very much fashionable style, at the time when it was built, the end of the XIXth century .The building started in 1887 and ended i 1904 and it lays on the Danube's banks of Pest..At night is all lighted.

Beautiful on the outside; terrible organization/museum inside. Admittedly this is a beautiful building that you absolutely have to see close-up (as well as from across the river up at the castle). Or from a boat cruise. However, as soon as we walked into the "visitor center" for the tours, we walked into a disorganized hoard of people and rude employees. Their website says one thing about tours, but the inside says another. To actually see the inside of Parliament, you have to buy a ticket for a tour in your language (about 52000 HUF for non-EU and 2000 for EU) — but when we showed up at 12pm, it seemed that the only available time for English was at 3:45 (I don't know why their website says 10, 12, and 2). People are swarming the small entrance gate trying to get through the metal detectors, but the staff is either only making announcements in Hungarian, or shooing people at the front away unless it's their exact tour time. We decided to do the "exhibit" with an "audio guide" instead, but this was basically a couple of small rooms with some historical artifacts and a terrible boring audio accompaniment. The TV screens "aren't working yet" since this is new, and so it wasn't much to see. Basically, show up early and try to get a ticket for an early morning tour of the inside if you can. Otherwise, don't bother.

Stunning building. A beautiful building, that is even more stunning when viewed lit up in the night sky. We didn't go in to the building, but watched the guards perform at the front side of the building in the morning.

Very beautiful. You can see the parliament building from almost any plase in Buda, a huge unmistakable towering building, even at night, its lit up till early morning, There were no tours during our stay in budapest, but in one of our walks on the Danube we stopped to take a look upclose and it was very impressive.I would recommend going to the shoes on the dunabe memorial if your already in the area

Great architecture. even though i could not get a ticket to get inside this beautiful architecture, being in the vicinity is more then enough to admire this. On a evening ferry, light filled view of this building is breathtaking and also from the top of castle hill. you can view this from numerous place and every view is equally beautiful.
Stunning. The view from the Danube cruise for this attraction is amazing, it's a very impressive building, done in Gothic revival style. Largest building in Hungary, no doubt.

Wow. Another place must visit in Budapest,not far from chain bridge very beautiful ,nice to walk around or other option take tram No 2 to see around very nice view from Danube river behide the parliament
Beautiful. Only saw this from a boat on the Danube, so cannot comment on the inside of the building... but the outside is fabulous and well worth taking a look at.
Divine!. We saw the parliament from an evening boat ride. The mood was tranquil and over a glass of wine, we admired the parliament with its bright lights and old world charm.

Our Favorite Trip Yet. The Cities of Buda and Pest makes visitors feel welcomed. The transportation system is second to none and the cleanliness of both cities is remarkable. As far as the Parliament Building, the picture does not do it justice. Remarkable

Good. Very good and interesting tour with explanations on everything.
amazing place inside and outside.
Recommends not to skip the tour
Stunning. Exceptionally beautiful and very different during the day than at night. It is well lit at night and worth visiting again then to really appreciate the beauty of this building

This is one of the most beautiful buildings in Budapest!. This important building is incredibly beautiful and has a truly lovely history. A visit to Budapest would be incomplete without a tour of this majestic building. Tours are available from the visitor centre, and are cheaper and the only official tour operators.
wow!!!!. this building is the best one i ever seen in my life...especially at night with the lights on is a miracle!!!

A must see attraction - such s beautiful building . This is a magnificent building from both the inside and outside. We pre booked a tour before we went so that we didn't have to queue for tickets when we got there. It should be noted that as long as there's availability (which there was even the day before we went) it's really easy to change your time slot on the online booking system. With regard to the tour itself our guide was very good and led us on a relatively short tour (it took about 40 minutes) around the building. There are quite a lot of steps to walk up at the start (but there was an option to get a lift if needed). You also get to see the crowd jewels (guarded by guards) as part of this tour and the beautiful dome and chandelier in the central part of the building. Overall I think it's a must see when in Budapest. It's such a prominent feature on the bank of the pest side of the Danube it's certainly worth taking the time to have a tour. especially for the cost which was only 2000 HUF each.
Very impressive building!. Amazing architecture, probably one of the most known building of Hungary. You MUST see if you are in Budapest.

Fabulous. The only way to describe this is 'gorgeous ' This is a must see when in Budapest. This building is incredible when viewed at night, but the true beauty is only see when wandering around during the day. Definitely recommended.
Fantastic building!. What a gorgeous building! Especially during the nighttime, the lights surrounding the building are just awesome.

Absolutely beautiful !. This building is really beautiful from the outside but try to get tickets for the guided tour as the interior is just breathtaking.We were lucky to get the last 2 tickets for the tour on the day we arrived but had to wait 3 hours before the tour started so if you can it might be better to book online.If you can prove that you are an EU resident you will get a good reduction on the admission price.
Beautiful but short. Place to see and experience from first hand. Tour is short but that is because it is very interesting.

A must see. The Parliament building and tour are must do's while in Budapest. While there, you have the option of buying tickets for a guided tour in an appropriate language (I think there are just a few - I chose English), or to the museum. Tours run about every hour and it is advised in heavy seasons to buy in advance. Given today was the first day after a few day's of holiday closure, I was lucky to buy same day as an individual. The building is quite spectacular, and I enjoyed learning some Hungarian history by the guide. In addition, there is a small shop if you need a souvenir. You will need about 2 hours there.

Must see!. Parliament is definitely worth the walk by day as you will also find the shoes on the Danube promenade memorial near, however i would recommend a night river boat cruise as it looks amazing by night!
Gorgeous! . Absolutely worth a visit to Budapest just to see this incredible building! We wandered around outside and couldn't get enough of the architecture.
Must see. An obligatory program in Hungary The building and the crown is a must seeTake care of opening hours and guided tours schedule

Parliament. The building, which is the pride of the State of Hungary, one of the two highest buildings in the Centre of Budapest. At the height of the custom 96m, at length over 280 m, has 365 Windows, which means the symbolism of the independence of the city. You can view it from the inside.
Christmas visit. We couldn't go inside because of Christmas but it is really great to see such an amazing building even from the outside. Excellent piece of architecture and really close to visit it

Beautiful piece of art!. One of the most beautiful parliaments in the whole Europe. Have a walk down the riverbank in the evening/night.The whole parliament is lighted up and looks like a castle from a fairy tale... Very romantic !

Stunning architecture. We passed round this majestic building during our stay in Budapest and I have to say we were amazed with its stunning architecture. Even though, we did not take the tour I believe you can also appreciate it by just looking at it.

Worth the visit, but go on the free day!. Visiting Parliament is a good choice if you're looking to get a glance into Hungarian culture. If you are there around August 20 (a national holiday), everyone gets in free! Although you have to wait for at least an hour in a line that does offer views of the changing of the guards and all sides of the Parliament building. Once inside you are able to see the precious Imperial Crown of Hungary and beautiful gold brushed architecture.

Magnificent building where crown jewels are kept. If in Budapest it's a must, but if there for a weekend like me, it's best to plan ahead. I wasted valuable sightseeing time trying to buy a ticket and then as tickets are timed hanging around. A bit disappointed that after all that, the tour was super short, but still the ornate rooms of the building are well worth it all. Even if you want to avoid all that the building looks great from the outside too.

unique site. a place you can see in every picture of Hungary Budapest unique architecture recommended to visit inside EU visa enter for free other pay for entrance take a guided tour inside , if you visit on national day its free but no guided tours.unique intriguer.
worth seeing. must visit this attraction if you are in Budapest. close to tram station and beautiful in the evening

Palace of Westminster step aside. This building is spectacular. If you get the chance to visit take it. Remember to take your passport(EU nationals) for free tour. I know and love the UK parliament building but this trumps it.

A bit over-rated. Certainly a must see, but a bit pricey. The hour tour took 20 minutes to get through security and another 20 minutes for the tour. The English speaking tour guide did a good job, the building is beautiful, although you only see a small part of it.
Imposing. Well conducted tour with an English speaking guide. Such a beautiful building. The tour is no longer free for senior citizens but is not expensive (2000 forints, approx £4.50)

Marvellous architecture. My boyfriend was simply fascinated with this building and you can see it from many places in Budapest, including Buda Castle, the Fisherman's Bastion and the other side of the river. It's simply stunning to look at, go and take lots of pictures. There is also a tour.

Guided tour in English, my native language. The inside of this iconic structure is even more impressive than the outside. Hearing about the reverence with which most Hungarians hold the Imperial Crown was inspiring. A trip to Budapest is not complete without a visit to this historic building. Buying tickets online in advance is important.

A must see. We decided to go the day before, so we looked for the tickets online and it was possible to get the tour for the day after. The guide was excellent, she explained many interesting things and in a way that all the group was paying attention.Very nice and interesting visit.

Wonderful. One of the most outstanding building in Budapest . The architecture , the rooms , the view , it's beautiful . If you take a tour on the Danube and you are in front of the the parliament you really see the grander of it . When it's night and the parliament lights up it's even more beautiful.
Great views of Pest. It was a lovely area to walk around, don't bother to queue for the venicular as it is an easy walk up to the top

Budapest parliament. You cannot miss the parliament building in Budapest,it must rank one of the best and most interesting in the world.The view from the River Danube boat trip is particularly amazing.A real treasure.

Beautiful decorations, well organised tour. Book the trip in advance if you could, especially for English tours. I had to wait 2 hours as the previous English tours are full. Free coat check when you enter, and the tour guides are kind and friendly. The building itself is beautiful, but you can only visit a very limited part of it (understandable). The visit route is well organised, and the guide tried to make some jokes- which didnt work. You can feel the Hungarian national pride throughout, which was really impressive. Overall it's a good experience.
Sunday morning tour . Tours get booked up in English quick so if up want one try and plan ahead. The tour is quite short, but informative.try and stay close to the guide or you may struggle to hear

very nice. impressive building. Nice visit, change of guard at the crowne juwels is worth seeing. You cannot visit on your own, only guided tours, accompanied by two armed soldiers. Also worth seeing nights when illuminated.

The most photogenic building in Central Europe!. Beautiful during the day and spectacular at night, especially if you do a river cruise or see it from the Buda side. Tickets get sold out fast and we had to go online that next day to buy tickets to do the tour in English to see the inside. For the price, unless you are a history buff, skip it. It is pricey.Nothing fancy inside other than the grand staircase and was disappointed to see that the Royal Hungarian Jewels only consisted of the crown, orb, scepter and a small sword. The pomp and changing of the guard inside the massive dome around the crown adds to the show. The rest of the building is massive with long corridors with lovely stained glass windows. The outside is very grand that is accessible to all tourists and a perfect backdrop for wonderful pictures.

Very interesting. You have to schedule a tour to view Parliament from the inside. Caution, there is a point that you have to walk 130 steps, you can choose to take the elevator....they didn't tell our entire group about this option. The tour group is rather large and the tour guide does not wear a microphone, so stay close if you want to hear.

Beutiful building. This is The most amazing and beautiful building. We went there and had a guided tour. Ithink the guide tolled us that there is 600 rooms in the parlement. Everything is restored and you can reale feel the old

Budapest's Parliament. The building and its architecture is really outstanding. It is an ornament near the Danube, easily accessible on foot from the city center. Just before that you can see also the "Shoes near the Danube"

What a difference two years makes. We visited the parliament in Budapest a couple of years ago and did one of the tours inside. It was beautiful and a great experience - especially the changing of the guard on the crown jewels (you have to make sure you get one of the tours that covers this as timing is critical and they only let one group in at a time for security). But the outside was being renovated/ restored and quite frankly was a beautiful building hidden in a building site. We visited again this year and the difference was amazing. It is now all finished and looks like a fairy-tale castle with a beautiful open space in front so you can really appreciate it. Well worth a visit

GOLD Everywhere you look! Architectural's Delight. Wow first you have to climb 96 steps into the Parliament, then 96 steps up through beautifully designed halls to get to the central of the building. There is a reason for that, but I will let you hear it from the tour guide. If you can't make the stairs they do have an elevator. I wanted really to see the crown that was held from WWII at Fort Knox in the United States and returned in 1978 to the Hungarian Government. Unfortunately you can not take a photo the Kings crown , but you can everything else. I will let the photos do the talking for me. It is worth your time to ooo and aaa at the architecture and the furnishings and the carpet that 40 Hungarian women took two years to make, that fills one of the halls. Words don't do this justice.

Blown Away. I went on a trip and saw fifteen cities in Europe. This city proved to be the best out of all of them. parliament was stunning. It is HUGE and ornate and unlike any of the buildings I saw in my life. This city is a must see. The architect rue of Parliament is so so impressive.
Biggest and best looking. The country was first division before WW1 , they built the parliament house expecting to be a big country , still a specular site
Beautiful building . The building is one of the most amazing buildings i have seen in my live but the tour they give is very short and the information very limited

Worth the visit just for this building. With some much beautiful architecture, this building has to top it off in Budapest. Worth seeing during the day and especially at night. Great to do a river cruise also.
Impressive. Very detailed building, can get very up close to it which is great for taking photos, a very very impressive thing to look at
Only visited outside. No guided visits in that week.. Very impressive building. On the back side ( not the Danube front) we saw the exchange of the guards.

Perhaps the most beautiful building at night that I have ever seen.. Large, stunning and over the top architecture. No visit to Budapest is complete without at least a slight tour of this building. You can't miss it from the Buda hills or from the Danube and it is spectacular at night!
Lovely. Lovely building and beautiful! it was very very very peaceful in the square and very clean. Would recommend visiting the memorial in the square.

Enormous building. The tour office is on the left side of building with your back to the river. We ordered on line without issue. The ticket is scanned for entry and there is a security screening with personal effects scanned similar to the airport. Tours leave regularly, so no need to stand in line until your tour time. The tour takes you to the building highlights with two stair cases, the royal crown, the legislative room, the back corridor with cigar rests and ends with a small museum information centre. Tram #2 stops just past the building from the city centre. There is also a good gift shop. A recommended site to visit.

..beautiful building. We didn't go inside but loved wandering nearby taking photos of the beautiful building and observing the military guardsmen and a small ceremony on the steps. We discovered an underground museum very nearby....the Lapidarium. It is well worth a visit if you are interested in the history / architecture of the parliament building.
Sightseeing Budapeste . Very beautiful place specially at night when the view is amazing with all of the people gathering at the main entrance

Awe Inspiring. You need to see this up close and to walk all the way around it. We could not go inside but the outside was incredible. We even got to see the guards marching around the flag pole. It was quite and experience and worth going to see. We also saw it from the Danube at nighttime all lit up and this also was an image fit for a King. A definite must.

Very impressive major landmark. We didn't go inside the building but it certainly looked impressive close-up from the river towpath and looked even better from the other side of the river at night from a high viewing point at the Fisherman's Bastion.
Just beautiful. This is a beautiful building. During the night it looks the best with all those light. The best vie is from the opposite of the Danube. This has to be seen when you are in Budapest.

Stunning!. One of the most incredible pieces of architecture I've ever seen - what a beautiful building! Best way to admire the building is from a river cruise either by day or night! No visit to Budapest should be complete without seeing this iconic landmark!

Short city break in Budapest. This is the most beautiful building that I've ever seen. It's worth to go there when it's getting dark. The military guards pull down the flag with great honor to the sound of trumpet.
Best Parliament. Best Parliament from a river, oriental green and red colours, reall well illuminated by night and amazing also with sun light.
Very expesive . The people in the ticket office are not pleasant. They not give any discount fo blind person. We not entered bacause of that.
Beautiful Building. This is a wonderful building which looks best viewed from the Danube especially at night. It is also nice to to get up close .
Better than London??. We only visited the outside of the building, tours internally are available if you pre-book. The building is wonderful especially at night.

The most gorgeous building in Budapest. We walked around this beautiful building and it was well worth it. We were confused about the proves of entry on the internet and chose not to go in. However, upon looking, it is 2000ft to go into and isn't confusing at all there! But there are many statues and other beautiful things to look at. I would recommend, with a braille version of the building being a lovely touch.

The most photographed building!!!. Our hotel was across the Danube from it and the picture above was exactly what we saw from our hotel. The interior was amazing and the tour was very informative. We took a lot of pictures.......

Beautiful day and night!. We took the vilamos (small yellow train) over to the parliament earlier today and were not disappointed. Our son, who is 9, said "is that the Buda castle?" ... it is quite a site to see up close. Several helpful locals were nice enough to tell him (and us) about the historical significance and importance of the Parliament. We are about to head back out now to get some photos of the castle at night from the bridge.

Walk around on foot. Parliament is amazing from the riverside, from the bus etc. But if you have some free time - go there by yourself, metro station is just next to the parliament. If you book in advance through Internet your ticket you can explore it from inside.

Worth looking at by day and again by night. The sheer size and architecture makes this a must see. I don't think it requires much planning or time. At some point while over in Buda you must look across the river and a building that rivals the Palace of Westminster in size and splendour.
Stunning. The Hungarian Parliament is stunning. It is an absolute must see in Budapest. Make sure to see it at night too as it is breathtaking.

Imposing and gorgeous building. Located opposite the Kossuth Lajos metro stop. The huge building has 691 rooms and 19km of corridors. In the front and centre of the Domed Hall [main entrance hall] are the Hungarian Holy Crown Jewels. Imposing exterior spires and interior filled with carved wood work, stained glass windows, Gothic arches. On the northside is a small park with statues of former prime ministers. Ministry of Agriculture is nearby. Open Mon-Fri 8am-6pm; Sat 8am-4pm; Sun 8am-2pm. An informative 1 hour English guided tour with lots of photo stops, is available 5 times a day. Tour cost HuF3500. Advance booking is a must.
Must have in Budapest - Parliament. Buy tickets on-line at official website before your trip, it's possible to choose time for excursion and language.

Stunningly beautiful exterior, bit disappointing interior. Determined to go on a tour as we missed doing it on our last visit and the exterior is so beautiful. in comparison the interior is a bit disappointing. Apart from the main hall which was beautiful, a small area where the jewels are ( crown ,orb and sceptre) and debating chamber which was interesting it was corridors. Having said that the tour guide gave lots of interesting information. The first Parliament I've been to that has brass cigar holders along the corridors. Glad we visited though
Amazing building. Guided tour is expansive and short. But still worth a visit. Building is beautiful. Just don't expect to get answers from a really busy guide.

Great experience. We chose Budapest be our first night in our honeymoon trip. All of our reason for selecting this city is this parliament.We intend to look this parliament from the other side of the river, however, we caught the tram in the wrong line and the tram bring us to the parliament. It's the destiny! We can see the parliament by face to face. Tremendous. Fantastic.If you go to Budapest, watching the parliament from both sides are so perfect.Romantic a lot.
Amazing place. Nice view. Full of history. Nice architecture. Nice place for family. Only there is a fee for the tour however it is affordable. Must recommended.

Beautiful . What a beautiful building!Saw it by day and at night it was even better! Take a river boat down the Danube to see it in all its glory at night.We didn't get a chance to have a tour as the timings are very precise and they close it regularly for official events.Definitely a sight to see though!
Interesting. This was a great experience, a brieft tour but worth it, especially seeing the jewels in the massive hall. Very nice architecture.
SAW FROM RIVER. magnificent building, much better seen from the water, on a night cruise preferably, beautifully lit up.

Beautiful Building. Hopped of at the metro outside the Parliament on our way over to the Castle District. Would have loved to have booked a tour but didn't have time. Sure it's fantastic inside! We were here the first week of December and so, so lucky with the weather! Bit windy but otherwise quite sunny. Got some great pictures of the building and across the Danube river to the castle district!

Well worth a visit..... We visited Parliament House the first day we arrived in Budapest as we made a booking before the weekend crowds. It was a good overview of the history on which we learnt more over the next 3-4 days. Interesting building and good, succinct tour. If there was one criticism it was the size of the group, with others talking and you couldn't always hear.

Great building. We visited during the day and the architecture is extraordinary, being so close to the river it is really difficult to take in so I would recommend a boat tour to see it in all its glory, we didn't go inside so can't comment on that, but still a must see whilst in Budapest.
What a building... One of the finest architecture building in Budapest. The most beautiful parts of it is the one that turns to Danube side.

Spectacular building inside and outside. We had already seen the outside of the Parliament buildings from the Buda side and then by foot on the Pest side, before doing the guided English tour of inside Parliament. Inside was elaborate and sumptuous, and just as impressive as the exterior. Then, in the evening, we went on a Danube river cruise which showed the Parliament lit up in all its glory.
the must see in budapest. its absolutely amazing day time and even more night time. if you have a change, you can take amazing pictures from the bridge next to it.
Was Awesome . Wow what an amazing historical building!! We saw it in different lights at different times of day and night and each time it took our breath away!
Breathtaking. A piece of history that is still in use. With a so many details that is in today's time... If you appreciate beauty and history you have to see it.

Worth taking time out to do. I nearly booked an organised trip from the hotel to do this at over 5000HUF but after looking online realised I could do it myself and as an EU CITIZEN THE ENTRY COST WAS ONLY 2000HUF!!!This was a good tour to do, easy to get to using the M2 metro line and a really beautiful building to explore. You can also walk here easily from the centre along the river taking time to view the 'shoes' memorial on the river bank. You need to book to get onto the limited places available for the English speaking tours. Booked this online from the hotel and they printed the tickets for me which was really helpful. Once inside you get to see some of the iconic sights like the golden stair case and the Hungarian Crown Jewels. Worth doing and only takes an hour so plenty of time to walk along to Castle hill along the river bank, across the bridge and up the funicular to have lunch by St Matthias' church and look at the view back to the Parliament building!
Interesting architecture. This is one of the most beautiful buildings you will see. It sits right on the Danube River, so it is easily accessible. Make sure to photograph it at night.

Gorgeous Building. One of the famous parts of the building is the hexadecagonal (sixteen-sided) central hall, with huge chambers adjoining it: the Lower House and the Upper House. The modern National Assembly is unicameral and meets in the Lower House, while the Upper House is used as a conference and meeting room. The Holy Crown of Hungary, which is also depicted in the coat of arms of Hungary, has been displayed in the central hall since 2000.

Breath-taking from the outside!. A huge, breath taking building! Αmazing from the outside! It's like a palace of a princess! The inside tour costs 1000 huf if you are a student, which means 3 euros, very cheap (even though i have been to other countries parliaments and the entrance was for free). There are English tours every 2-3 hours. We booked one, in order to see the inside. Honestly, it was really good but there were so many people that i couldn't hear the quide so i just looked around and admired everything! Great building! If you have time, you must visit it!
Amazing buildings. Stand in awe as you snap photos of these impressive buildings on the riverbank. The architecture is amazing & well worth continuing to walk along the adjoining streets.

awe inspiring building. This is the most amazing looking building. It is best viewed from the Buda side of the river. It is lit up at night and looks wonderful. We didn't have time to go into it but even viewed from outside it is so impressive.
Beautiful even if you don't go inside. This is one of the many buildings that make Budapest beautiful. I did not go inside, but it is magnificent even just looking at the building.
bar/restaurant in the wall has great views. Shared a bottle of wine with friends overlooking the Danube and all of Pest, such a great spot for an afternoon rest.

Splendid high Victorian mock-Gothic icon. This is the building that appears on all the tourist brochures. It is quite splendid, built when Hungary was more than twice the land area that it has now, and as a result it feels a bit big for the country it now steers.To visit the inside, you have to go on an organized tour. I visited in mid-June, before the main rush of tourists, and simply walked in and bought a ticket on the spot with no problem. Tickets are also sold at the usual tourist offices.The crown of King Saint Stephen is on display, but photographs are not allowed, which is a bit annoying.To take the standard tourist photograph, you have to go on a boat on the Danube, preferably at sunset - otherwise you cannot get far enough away to fit the whole building into a photo.There is an excellent café on-site.
most photographed building in Budapest. certainly very impressive certainly at night, number 2 tram stop right outside - get on it and ride the whole length for a great sense of Budapest
Fabulous architecture. Well worth a trip. Theplace is huge and the changing of the guard out front by the flagpole is worth seeing.
Worth the walk. Didn't go in but the outside is superb and dominates the skyline. The towers look like they have been hand carved from ivory

the most wonderful building. Everybody visiting Budapest MUST take time to visit this fantastic building, walk around it, pay for a guided tour inside. You can not describe it, you must see it with your own eyes

Interesting. If you come along to this building and wish to tour the interior take some id, there is a big discount for EU citizens but they do like even an NHS card as ID.It s fantastic value for money at £5. Tours are available in many languages and with a guide, not a headset. A beautiful staircase, information on how it was built and opportunity to ask questions, at all times. The debating room is great to see. At end there is a gift shop and a nice café selling great hot chocolate!
An immense building along the Danube River.. While I did not tour this building on this visit to Budapest, it is certainly visible because of its impressive size.
Astonishing. An astonishing building overlooking the danube. Worth taking the guided tour not too expensive and worth it for theh local knowledge

Dracula's castle at the Danube. Did you know that this building's buildings costs are the same as the money they should have spent to build up a city for 20k citizens with schools, hospital, church, etc. Did you know that a lot of politicians used to hide there after the WWII and the Revolution of 1956?

Parliament. The parliament is beautiful from the outside. but a must see inside.
the stained glass is something to see. don't miss the visit.

Beautiful building nice small museum area. The building was beautiful and the tour guide was good. I didn't think we saw enough of the building although it was in use at the time and there were areas we could not see.

better from the out side. The place looks amazing from the outside but a tour is just ok. You are tightly guarded witha soldier and lots of restrictions including many on photos. When we went lots was off limits beause of use. There are a few good rooms but most you can see by going to your home city hall.

The Highlight of the week. Having seen photos of the parliament building when booking the holiday it was high on our list of places to visit but wow was I blown away by the sheer scale of it. The fact that it is the first thing you see when walking out of Kossuth Lajos metro station really does take you back a step, during the week it is surprisingly quiet as well. A truly remarkable building in terms of sheer grand scale is a must see for anyone visiting the city. In addition to this the Shoes on the Danube memorial is just 5 minutes down the river on the promenade, and the Hungarian folk and culture museum is directly opposite. Both of these are well worth visiting. We had planned to take a quick look around the museum but ended up spending 3 hours there before walking down to the dock for the evening danube cruise.

See by night!. We strolled around by day but took a boat cruise at night (cost included in hop on /hop off bus ticket). The Parliament building is lit at night and looks spectacular like some thing from a fairy tale.

Grand Parliament Building with a wow factor. We booked a tour of inside the Parliament Building and so glad we made the journey. The tour was great value for money and gave you a good insite of the day to day workings of the parliament and the beautiful architecture inside the Parliament building. If you are visiting Budapest put this visit near to the top of your list
Beautiful building. A beautiful building, outside and inside. Very knowledgeable tour guide. Tours in many different languages available.
Night walk. Must see. When it is Dark the lights are stunning. You Can have some grate pictures. I Can highlyrecommand it. It was breathtaking
Splendid place. So magnificent and breathtaking in the evening! Danube river taxi is a must-do tourist thing. I'll never forget the city due to this ride also

Beautiful!!. The most beautiful and magnificent neo-gothic building!! I love this place! You should try to see it during day and night, because at night it's even more beautiful with all the ligths on.
Enjoy the view!!

Architectual masterpiece!. We did not go inside this building, there are tours available, but it is a beauty to behold. If you are an architectural freak like my boyfriend and I then you will truly appreciate the beauty, design, and monstrosity of a grand building that the parliament building displays!

Exquisite Inside and Out. The tour of the interior was interesting to see the crown jewels and design, but almost too short to appreciate. The exterior is a must see, especially at night from the river!

Eastern Europe is known for its architecture!. The beauty of this building can not be overstated! The architecture in Budapest is incredible - and to see a city that was so recently communist creates perspective, especially in contrast to western Europe.

Impressive!. Lovely building with an informative tour. At the entrance it does take patience in that it isn't clear what is going on to start the tour. We had bought tickets on line for 10 am English tour. Arrived 9:45. Saw a group lined up by security to get in so lined up behind. No one from security or tour there. Thru listening to the group they had a 9:45 tour so felt safe we had not missed the tour. It was almost 10 before anyone came out and then they announced they were only looking for 9:45 English tour ticket holders. Nothing said about timing for those with other tickets, but again figured if they just took the 9:45 tour they would get to 10. Which yes they did but you are standing not in a line but a cluster with everyone new coming along wondering why they can't go in and with different cultures with different ideas of personal space a bit of pushing even tho you tried to explain not yet. The 2-3 hours I recommended is for the tour and walking around outside. Bonus, there is a bathroom just outside the entrance which is free.
Nice building. Budapest is really nice city but Parliament building is for sure one of the landmarks of the city :) its worth seeing it and cant really say is it nicer day or night ;)Must see
Very good architecture. Very good architecture. you should visit there. Near to the river. You can go there by trum service.

Best at night!. Walked past this spectacular building during the day and passed it at night on a river cruise and in my opinion it's far more magnificent at night. The archetecture is unmissable and resembles the houses of parliament in London. During our airport transfer the chauffeur said the house of commons is the biggest in Europe and during its design phase was deliberately built a few centimeters larger than the house of commons in London. Much to our annoyance haha. We did not go inside but I'm told it's glorious.

Outstanding. Both inside and out it is a must if you are visiting Budapest,the tour inside is stunning and the highlight of our visit .It cost 2000 h u f but more than double that if you live outside the E U.They required I d as proof so take some with you ,we where asked and did not have any with us.We went the next day there are tours in different languages ,the tour times are on displayed .

Interesting place to visit.. Bigger than the White House - one of the many facts that we were given on our tour by an English speaking guide. Lovely building but no air con so - as it was very hot - we were given permission to use the lifts.

Excellent Visit. Be aware that this is Guided Tour only which is understandable considering the Attraction you need to book as the Tours are at set times for different languages. We arrived at 12 noon without a booking told the next English speaking tour was at 3.oo.pm. we went away rather dissappointed, however I went back and enquired what the next tour was in any language and wad told 5 mins in Spanish. we joined this tour and to be honest you can understand everything just from the surroundings. Well Pleased.
Fun Tour. Informative guides and Beautiful building. Quite a bit of the building is explored during the tour and we were able to see a changing of the guards. Definitely worth the visit.

Stunning landmark and display of pride in democracy. This is a must-see if in Budapest; we didn't have time to take the indoor tour, but spending time in the area was fabulous; a great place for a picnic lunch!
Most impressive. This is the most outstanding building in the whole of Budapest. It is very well maintained and clean. This landmark is the center of the government and thus gets all the attention.

Totally interesting. Great tour to take. Our guide told us the windows of this building were removed during world war 2 so they would not get destroyed during bombing. After the war, the windows were returned to their original position. The building is impressive and well worth the visit.

Stunning Architecture . I have seen a lot of magnificent edifices in my life, but the Parliament building on the Pest side of Budapest is beyond detailed amazement. The craftsmanship and eye for detail defies definement. Gotta see it to believe it. The river view is the most stunning...especially at night.

Look for the Crown. This poor building is one of the most beautiful Parliament buildings in the world. It is a pity that hungry has never had a democracy is beautifully constructed as this poor woman this parliament building. It is like a beautiful, elegant Belle Epoque Music box. The tour is worth taking. Of course this is the location of Saint Stephen's crown. It would be impossible to overestimate the importance of his crown to the people of hungry.

Beautiful . Stunning architecture .Whether visiting by day or night this building is imposing yet breathtaking . High level of policing . Very safe and relaxed atmosphere here, the changing of the guards kept my children mesmerized.
Short and sweet . You have to go in with a tour. Well worth it. 40 minutes. Reduced price for eec so don't forget to take your passport

Little country, big parliament. Why is it that the smallest countries have the largest parliament buildings? Hungary has the second largest parliament building in the world, beaten only by Romania. Regardless, it's as gorgeous on the inside as it is on the outside and well worth a visit. The new visitor center is a huge improvement over the old system I first encountered here 20 years ago. You even reserve your tour and buy your tickets online now. Amazing.

A surprise. We went to see the Parliament as it was by the river and a lovely building.What we did not expect, was a gift shop and a cafe which was busy with locals and tourists and that you could just pay and look around inside, we must have missed this fact in the guide book.This is a great concept and a good way to raise money, not sure why our own government doesn't do this.Sadly we did not have the time to visit inside, but the entry price was very cheap.Certainly recommend a visit and next time we go we will do the tour.
Night time cruise to enjoy the lights. We took a dinner cruise to see the lights of Budapest. They are spectacular. Well worth the trip. The parliament building in particular Was stunning.
Incredible. A magnificent building on the bank of the Danube it is easily accessible. The tours book up quickly especially the English tour

One of the Most Beautiful Parliament Buildings in Europe. Great place to see inside, but also just to walk around outside and admire the fascinating building. You also get great views of the river from the front.
Interesting. Excellent historical tour, the old is kept remarkably well and the tour guide was very informative and spoke excellent English.

Beautiful. Probably our most photographed building of the whole trip - beautiful by day and stunning by night.We didn't do the tour but when we went down to the visitor centre it looked like we could easily have bought tickets for that day.So easy to walk up to and around too.We also tried to visit the small underground museum for the 1956 Uprising. It's well-hidden and several locals we asked directed us instead to the House of Terrors but it is one of two underground museums; the other has details of some of the renovations to Parliament (we think). If you are standing between Parliament and the tram lines just south of the building, you need to look for the barriers with bullet holes - go between them and you will find the museum.
Must see. . One of the most amazing buildings. I've ever seen (especially at night). This is a can't miss. View from Buda (or boat tour) is amazing. Again, especially at night.

magnificent. what an amazing building and thats only from the outside didnt get to see inside as you have to book prior to going and have to take your passport we went as part of the walking tour but great photos of building and the guards outside
Amazing. Simple...the title says it all! The building is massive and looks beautiful at night! Nice christmas tree too
The best place in Budapest. Must see. That's definitely the best place in Budapest. There are a lot of people any day. If you want see the interiors - book excursion in advance online.

Rude staff. Walked all the way down to the parliament buildings hoping for a tour which was recommended by our hotel, when we finally arrived into the visitor centre we found a small sign at the information desk saying it was sold out for the day and when I asked the lady if I could buy tickets for tomorrow she was quite rude and simply said no, try online. We were quite frustrated at the fact that there were no signs put up outside. The building itself is fabulous to look at, pity about the staff that are working at the visitor centre. I didn't bother returning for a tour.

Stunning!. This is a must see if you are in Budapest (although I can't see anybody missing it), so make sure you book a tour in your language. You can only enter the building by being part of a guided tour group, and before you do you have to go through the security. We booked our tickets online, but you can buy tickets there as well. The Parliament is just as stunning from the inside as it is from the outside. Our guide was very good as well. The only thing is that they are a bit disorganized. Our tour was to start at 13:00, so you would expect from them to gather us all 15 minutes earlier, but that didn't happen. So not knowing what to do, we all started queuing to go through the security alongside people who had their tours in other languages, and waited to see what happens. At one point we were called by our guide, left the queue, told a few details, and then asked to go through the security, but by this time instead of two queues like we formed half an hour ago, they ended up with 5 queues trying to get through two security checkpoints. Also, once in the Parliament it would be a good idea to wait 10 minutes for the group before to finish their first part of the tour, because on few occasions we ended up with the German group in the same room, so it was hard to focus and hear what our guide was saying as they were both talking at the same time.

well worth a visit. An excellent guided tour of the building . The security is ' airport like ' but having said that it only took a short time to get through it . It's a beautiful building steeped in history .
Beautiful. We walked around the parliament area and it was really beautiful and pleasant.. The building is amazing and the area is extremely nice!
More than I expected. The building is huge and beautiful. I loved the model of it, made of matchsticks, exhibited on the ground floor

Purely amazing architecture. This is a truely impressive site to see. Walking along the pest side to see it up close is worth doing, then cross the bridge to Buda for a good camera shot. Amazing site at night!
Beautiful place - don't miss it. This is one of the most amazing buildings, not just in Budapest, but in whole Europe. Don't skip the other monuments nearby..

Beautiful. We took the guided tour in English. The tour guide spoke very clearly and was easy to understand. You had to stay close to her to hear it all though. The building is very impressive, and because we were there on a Saturday we were able to see areas that are off limits Monday thru Friday. Please be aware there is a fee to use the restrooms, even if you have a paid ticket in hand.

Wonderful Visit. This was an amazing experience! The building is incredibly iconic and so beautiful from the outside. The inside, however, was even more impressive (if that's possible)! They only offer admission during certain months of year (when parliament isn't in session) and you would be wise to book your ticket ahead of time (we booked our tickets early, and when we arrived for our midday tour, all of the remaining tours in English were sold out). Definitely a must-see as one of the most beautiful and impressive spots in Budapest!

Impressive building. We walked round this impressive building but chose not to take a tour inside. The whole area was quiet so we could enjoy the location and the beautiful buildings in the vicinity; certainly worth a look.
Great place to walk and relax.. We lived near it, so started our trip from it everyday. Great building and great photo point). Train and metro stations are there too
Real beauty. Attraction number 1 in Budapest. It looks great from the other bank of Danube as well as from the castle hill. I couldn't stop looking at it as it was really breathtaking.

Simply stunning. Based on the design of Westminster, it's surprising that the British parliament has become so iconic yet this building is much unknown outside of Hungary. To me it was most impressive when illuminated at night. There are many great view points from which you can get an awesome look at this structure such as the chain bridge and castle hill district.

Budapest Parliament. We came here just as they were closing so we couldn't go inside. Instead we walked around and saw the guards change. It is really beautiful up close, but it is even more beautiful if you see if from the citadel or Castle Hill at night time when they light the whole thing up.
wow!. We were guided around the Parliament by a very knowledgeable English speaking guide. The interior decor was amazing -so colourful and rich. Well worth the entrance fee.

Parliament well worth a visit. The Parliament building is stunning inside and out. The English speaking guide was interesting and easily understood. The guided tour well worth the money, it is necessary to book a tour slot. Photography was allowed except in one room where the "crown jewels" were displayed.

Fantastic Building. The old Parliament building is well worth a visit. It is a magnificent building from when Hungary was a really powerful part of the Austrian/Hungary nation. If you the best view from the outside a boat trip on Donau is recommended.
Great Building nad Arhitect. Great Building and Arhitect, best view from the buda side (buda castle) I 've liked budapest very much.

Beautiful building and spectacular at night.. The best view of this architectural wonder is from the opposite side of the Danube. Better yet, is to see it at night! If you have the money, spend it on a short river or dinner cruise on the Danube. If you want a free view, just walk along the pedestrian walkway on the opposite side of the river.

Interesting visit. Beautiful, massive building. Your tour is around 45 mins (30 inside main parliament) and is well worth a trip. Learned that it was based on Westminster when it was built and seats 199 politicians under a non-presidential ruling. Very cool tour.

The MOST BEAUTIFUL BUILDING IN ALL OF BUDAPEST. My friend and I were here in 2009. I can honestly say that viewing the Parliament building either from close up, across the river, or high above makes one marvel at the sight! I felt myself thinking that even the Taj Mahal could not rival this building. Do be forewarned that if you plan to see the interior, you absolutely must purchase your tickets well in advance. My friend and I attempted to purchase our tickets around noon and were told that they were all sold out! Even though we weren't able to tour the interior, we were allowed to tour the grounds for free. If you take the riverboat taxi/tour, which we did, you will be able to get your best photos.

The most outstanding building to see in Budapest. Gorgeous from every angle. The interior is no less opulent than the exterior. I highly recommend taking a tour of the interior. It is not possible to wander around unescorted so this is something you need to plan for in advance. A hotel concierge can assist with this, or you can do it yourself on-line. I recommend not doing this in person unless it is a last resort. During high season, queues can be long.It is possible to take photos without flash of the interior, there is one area that includes a crown where it is not possible and you will be clearly told this when you approach that area.This is appropriate for both children and adults. Not to be missed if you make it to Budapest.
A must to see. Enjoyed this visit it's a must to see beautiful to see all the jewels views over the donau its breath taking one of the to ten things to do

Lost tickets. HiI bought tickets for parliament tour for my wife and me, extremely expensive for non EU (5200Ft per person, ~17.5$, so 35$ for two, for a 50 minutes tour). I came to the parliament and bought by credit card for the same day. I lost the tickets (probably fell out of my pocket) and when I arrived they did not do anything to help, I asked to find the purchase by the credit card, they were very rude and simply told me to purchase more tickets. When I asked to talk to a manager, they told me that there is no manager. I am very disappointed with this kind of behavior towards tourists.
A Must Whilst in Budapest. The tour through the Hungarian Parliament is a "must" if you are visiting Budapest. Although the cost may seem high for non EU residence, the expense is well worth it.
Excellent view from a cruise !. If you happen to be in Budapest, please take a cruise along Danube and then enjoy the beauty of Parliament. Its truly exquisite.

An absolute must when in Budapest. The inside is simply fantastic, and very golden. The views from the inside overlooking the Donau is georgeous. And of course, this is a historic place and includes a diosplay of the king's crown. Allow time to get through security (like in airports)
Must Do!. This is a must do! To see the jewels, its an amazing building....i was completely stuned by his inponence

Was okay . We went on the tour of the Houses of Parliament. Take your EU driving licence or passport and you get a discount. The tour is not that long and you don't really get to see much, but do get to see the crown jewels! Looks great form the river boat at dusk!
Super. Our hotel overlooks the Parliament building, beautiful to look at night and spectacular during the day. The grounds and building are very well kept, very impressive indeed
Interesting place to visit. The parliament is more of a palatial place. There are red carpets everywhere, and the tour guide (English) was so nice, and helpful it made our visit even nicer.

Must see - even on a misty & murky day. This is a must see in your time in Budapest - even on a misty and rainy day it looks amazing ...... then once it gets dark and the lights come on..... well worth a visit !

Beautiful Building. Well worth a visit. Takes about 45 mins once inside the building.
Guided tour and very informative.
Take time to explore the surrounding area.

Incredible buidling not to be missed!. We decided to visit the parliament building one afternoon. The visitors centre where you book the tickets for the tour has very good eating and toilet facilities. The tour can be booked in various languages - ours was in English. We had to pass through airport style security to enter the building. A free cloakroom was available to leave coats and recommend using this option as it's warm in the building and saves you carrying so much. The guide for the tour (you have to be escorted throughout) was very knowledgeable and her English was excellent. We walked through this amazing building with some of the most beautiful interior décor we have ever seen. Good value for money and a most enjoyable visit.
One if the nicest ones in the world. You should not miss the visit if this beauty while in Budapest. Both the building and the history told are worth the time.
Wonderfull Building!. This Building looks wonderfull, day and night! We recommend to everybody to see. If you want to explore this place inside, you must pay.
main site of Budapest. How can you not gg and walk around this building. It's huge and is so famous. Took loads of pictures. Go in daylight and again at night. Looks amazing all lite up.
A must see!!. Amazing architecture, beautiful in both day and night. Tours of the building itself last about 45 mins ... would definitely recommend.
Beautiful Building. Probably the best building in Budapest - terrific gothic architecture. Changing of the guard routine is very traditional!

It really worth a visit. I booked for two people only few hours in advance and everything was perfect. Our guide was Hungarian and spoke a good Italian. She showed us a small part of the building but it was the most important one as we had the opportunity to see the crown wore by Mathias Corvinus. It is a one - hour trip really interesting, which gives you the opportunity to better understand the Hungarian culture from the past till today. The price is very low, only 2000 HUF. I recommend to take a look at the souvenir shop inside the building.
Great architecture . Highly recommended. Book a tour in advance. EU residents might get a free tour provided you show ID.Looks absolutely amazing in the evening.
Worth £5!. Good tour in English around the stunning parliament building. You also get to see the Hungarian crown. Book ahead though.

Beautiful architecture. Have to pass by the is beatiful building and get some amazing pictures. Although the best pictures to get are from the other side of the danube as the grandeur of the building can only be captured from far away! It's a pleasant walk around the building around are also nice so recommended
Gotta See. Magnificent - day or night. Beautiful all lit up at night. I've seen a lot of great structures all over the world and this one is as good as it gets. Too big inside to appreciate.
MOST BEAUTIFUL ATTRACTION IN BUDAPEST. Highly recommend! Beautiful and amazing attraction, it's one of my favourites in the whole Europe!! A picture from the other side of the river is just amazing!
Stunning Architecture and Grounds. I was really amazed by the beauty of the building. The grounds are all immaculately clean and accessible. I didn't get to go inside this trip.
must see at night .. magnificent building, public allowed very close, see at night when illuminated, try and visit when the guards are changing.

a great building. A very impressive building, partly open to the public for a guided walking tour. It is a bit regimented and the information provided is not too informative. definitely worth it for one visit.

Very impressive. A modern very high tech building this is a most impressive place. Booking is necessary for groups and then guided tours in several langueges are aranged. Although the building is completely modern great attention is paid to tradition and many tableaux, statues and paintings are on display.Airport type security is applied on entry but staff are pleasant.The high tech voting system, individual seating with full IT facilities for members, and the general provisions seems to put our own Houses of Parliment to shame.however, there can be a downside and it appears that members can occasionally push the wrong button and vote differently to what they intended. Overall, a very worthwhile visit.

Pricey. We're not from EU so the prices were very high compared to the 30 minute tour they offer. The security in the beginning takes about 15 minutes and there's a museum in the end, but the place itself is at least beautiful and the tour guide helpful.

Gorgeous building. Gorgeous building in heart of the city! Best to go over the bridge and up the hill to get a good view of the building across the water. Also suggest going back to see it at night as it is lit up and truly beautiful!
A must. This building is mostly of interest to forgeigners for its amazing architecture inside and out. There are guided tours in English which are worth the hassle to reserve.

Hungarian Parliament . This is a MUST do stop when you visit Budapest. You can book tickets online and see when a tour will be given in your language. Tour is just under an hour. Parliament is second largest in Europe. Over 600 rooms and all being actively used. The tour is very informative. You also get a chance to see the royal Crown Jewels as first worn by St. Stephen.

Nice visit, need to get tickets in advance. It took us a while to figure it out, but there is a side entrance to the Visitor Center for the Parliament tour. You can order tickets online before, as there were limited number of tickets for the English tours (they also do tours in multiple languages including Hebrew, Russian, Spanish and some others). The tour takes about 45 minutes and you can see the Dome, the main staircase, some of the interior rooms and hallways and one of the chambers. For a non-EU citizen, the ticket was about 5200 HUF.($18 USD). There is also a coffee shop inside that serves good coffee, but not very good pastries. There is also free wi-fi there after you register for the service.

Saw from our river cruise. We saw this at night while on a "dinner cruise"--it is gorgeous at night. The next day we walked up to walk around it. It is very impressive and we saw the guards who come out and stand for pictures. It is awkward and funny.

Fabulous!. This really is a "must see" in Budapest. The scale of the building and its architecture are seriously impressive and the interior is stunning. It's worth bearing in mind when planning a visit that entry is by timed ticket with a guided tour in your own language. The number of tours in each language depends on demand so there may be lots in English and German for example but fewer in French. Make sure you book your ticket early so that during the winter months your tour is during daylight, because some areas of the interior are dimly lit to save energy and you can't appreciate the impressive stained glass at night. If you're from an EEC country you get a huge (more than 50%) discount off your entry ticket, but you must produce your passport to qualify, so don' forget to take it with you!It's also worth taking a boat trip to see the building from the river. These trips are cheap and plentiful from the numerous landing stages, they take about an hour and you can even get a beer onboard for about £1 so are a good way of taking a bit of a rest from walking!
Breathtaking at night. A must see while there. The view form across the Danube at night will force you to take several pictures to send home.
Magnificent building. Didn't go inside but saw the building lit up at night time, in the distance from Castle Hill and the guard change. A must see building if you're in Budapest!
Need to Book before. Good visit With a french guide. (11h. 12h45 and 13h)You need to book by internet your visit.It is 2000ft for UE citizens.More expédiée for foreigners!!!

Nice to visit. I visit national parliament in Budapest, before entry you have to go accross security check the same as the airport. Inside it is quete atractive but I waited a little more. But interies are very nice and luxury. Only comment the souvenires are very expensive in the parlaiment, buy it at another place.

Simply a must!. If you only have time for one place to visit - try the Parliament! You have the opportunity to guided tours throughout the building complex from the Visitor Center, located at the north end. Groups are limited to 45 and they have guided tours in several languages at different time-slots during the day. My English speaking guide was excellent and service-minded. You may take pictures all over - apart from the main hall displaying the famous Holy Crown of Hungary (also known as the Crown of Saint Stephen)- the coronation crown used by the Kingdom of Hungary for most of its existence.A strange policy for entrance fees; EU-members 2000 HUF, non-EU 5200 HUF. They asked me where I came from; I said ' Norway' and I was surprisingly told they had a special deal so I paid the EU fee only! (Norway is not an EU member...)As mentioned: This attraction not to be missed - simply very impressive
Don't miss it!. Great building. Book your visit in advance. The ticket includes guided tour. You can book on line. The tour takes about 45min.

Amazing - you really must see it!. Tour only takes an hour and whilst you don't get heaps of information whilst on the tour it is still more than worth a visit as it is so beautiful inside!
