Definitely book in advance as the tours can get really busy (easily done online). Worth noting too that it's ridiculously cheap to visit! Just a tip - once you've been on the tour head out of the vistiors centre to the Danube and walk left so you can see the shoes on the Danube in memory of the Holocaust.
So beautiful!. Simply breathtaking at night or during the day!! Go to any bridge close by and take photos with the reflection when the sun sets!
Don't miss this building. Absolutely gorgeous inside. Definitely a must see. So beautiful at night from across the river. Knowledgeable and friendly guides.

Beautiful. It's not the first time I visit this construction, but I still go there every time I have the occasion. It is beautiful, the river Danube in front, the bridges around, great pictures there.

A MOST GORGEOUS BUILDING !!!. This is probably one of the most architecturally gorgeous buildings I've ever seen. The exterior is definitely a must see !!! The interior is remarkably beautiful, but having taken the "tour", I must say that it was very disappointing. I could not understand the guide's English and after climbing several flights of stairs, the tour began and ended within 15 minutes. You are taken into two rooms but not allowed to take pictures in the more beautiful of the two rooms. That being said, I cannot recommend the tour. Be sure to see the exterior!!!

Stunning Architecture. What a beautiful building. One of Budapest's most iconic sites along the Danube river. You can get a stunning view of the parliament buildings from the Chain Bridge and Castle Hill

An Incredible Building (and Riches). We had a nice tour of this fabulous building and saw a changing of the guard. This is also the location of the Holy Crown of Hungary, which we were told is the only intact crown in Europe.

Amazing!. Amazing building!! a whole story..We bought the ticket online because we thought that it would be a line bu no..there was no line so we just got in with the english spoken group.. Ticket costs around 7E and in the beggining you have to go upstairs about 200 or more stairs if i remember good. the whole touring took about 20minutes. it was amazing all the building but you can't see all... just some rooms.. My opinion is that with those 7 euros of the ticket you can enter the Acropolis museum in Athens and see the whole museum..not just some rooms...so, for me apart from being amazing, i would propose the outside fotos only...

Beautiful building recently cleaned looks spectacular.. A real value for money Parliament tour. Tours run throughout the day in multiple languages.If you prefer an english tour book online as English tours sell out quickly.
Brilliant. From the outside looking in, tradition is there, just a pity one cannot see the full view of Parliament House , if it is even 10% of what the outside portrays, then sign me up.
Very nice. Take an excursion to the parliament. It is no so long, but very interesting. The guide tells a lot about the bright moments of hungarian history.
Place worth visiting. We took a guided tour inside. The building looks great and you can understand the history of Hungary during this visit. I liked it.
Amazing. Beautiful and absolutely stunning and even more beautiful at night. A must visit when in Budapest. Book your tickets online.

Beautiful. Very worth the visit. The building is incredible.The whole entry process is very confusing and chaotic. Someone who may or may not be able to project their voice will announce a tour at which point everyone rushed the gate and there may be three tours at once. The tour guide, although informative, was rather bland.
nice tour. I ve booked in advance guided tour in Hungarian Parliament. it worth 5200 HUF ( 17 euro) at jegymester.hu site. I recomend it to everyone. Parliament is Excellent inside.

Beautiful structure and view!. This about a 15 minute walk from the Hilton and well worth it. The structure is beautifully designed and very imposing. We could not go inside as there were armed policeman patrolling the grounds but it has a nice garden and benches in front where you could sit. The Danube is also there so it is an idyllic setting and great photo op.

Amazing building. The building is amazing, even if the visit is quite quick.It's like we were running in the corridors at the beginning, whereas we were finally waiting to see the hemicycle at the end...

Amazing. This is the most beautiful building on the Danube
Weather you are sailing past walking past or standing on the other side of the river you will get a great view of this magnificent building
By far my favourite view is from Fishermans bastion at night it is breathtaking

A must see but more bling than history.. Should you go? Of course you should, but at only a hundred years old and hugely over ornate it lacks the functional classiness of the parliament in Berlin on the one hand and the power of history embedded in Westminster of London on the other. You should book online in advance to avoid missing a time slot. Tour groups are a bit large and trotted round a bit quickly which is the price of popularity.
Respect. Well, probably saw it 100 times. For me No. 1 in the world as far as democracy site is concerned. More impresive than Capitol in Washington... Can't compare with polish Parliament
impressive. We were only on the outside. But very impressive and beautiful. Can be seen from a lot of corners in the city.

Gothic splendour!. This magnificent building with its soaring pinnacles and central dome is an amazing sight to behold - and it's just as beautiful inside. Best appreciated from Fishermen's Bastion on the other side of the river.
Beautiful. Excellent architecture....Great view from batthyany ter at night when it is lighted gold!!!Beautiful and huge building....

Mediocre. After suggested by friends who had visited Budapest and came to this site, we took their advice as they reported it was a "must do". I attended an English speaking tour today and wasn't too impressed. It's a beautiful structure inside and out, but there were so many members in the group, leading for the tour guide to be audible. There weren't many sites to see on the tour. Do a tour if it rains, you won't be bummed if you miss it on your visit.

Inside is as impressive as the outside. I know........there are thousands of reviews of this most popular site. Have been to Budapest a number of times....once had tickets to get inside but the tour was cancelled because Parliament decided to go into session....on a Sunday morning, no less.This trip I hit paydirt.....it was, in my opinion, worth the wait. Yes, the exterior is beautiful but so is the interior. We had a good guide, which helps.Yes, the crown jewels are an extra bonus.Suggest you purchase your tickets online directly from the Parliament.
Beautiful space. Building itself is simply unreal. Very good tour. Nice combo of historical and current information. Definitely a must see while in Budapest.
Impressive!. The parliament looks amazing during the day as well as at night! Spectacular building! Really impressive! Take the public river cruises to snap some really nice photos!
Large government plaza . Nice building - don't think public can go in which was disappointing. Nearby Shies on the Danube Memorial was nice. Not much else
Best attraction in Budapest. You must visit Parliament if you visit Budapest. Its really nice! Advice: Book your tickets-tour online cause specially on weekend are sold out!

Great from inside and outside. I was amazed by how beautiful this great architecture when i saw it from outside and when i took the guided tour i was more amazed to take a look inside this beautiful building and i liked the tour guide comments and explanation

Great View of the Danube. We had no problems booking out tickets at the Parliament House about 30 minutes before the tour was due to take place. This tour was very short and quick unlike the tour of Houses of Parliament in London or the Bundestag in Berlin. Although EU citizens get a discounted rate of Forint 2000, the price for non EU citizens is quite expensive. There is concessionary rate for pensioners. The view from outside the Parliament of the Danube is outstanding.
Amazing structure. The most beautiful building I have seen so far. Worth taking a tour, interior is amazing as well....

Stuningly beautiful building!. When we previously visited Budapest the Parliament building and environs were being renovated/improved so were shrouded in building works! Wow did they do a good job! Never mind Polish builders I'd recommend the Hungarians!Managed to get a tour to view the spectacular interior, and the exterior on a beautifully sunny crisp clear November day. Night time views of the illuminated building across the Danube are even more spectacular!

A priceless gem. The sheer majesty of the place is just stunning. Join a guided tour. We went on the Russian one that was full of interesting folk. Loads to see but don't stray from the assigned path. You'll be scolded. That aside, the tour is fascinating; the architecture fantastic; and the design detail fabulous. You also get to inspect the guards on the way out. A must see and do.

Unique and beautiful . How can I say -- this building is a must-see when you visit Budapest. It is grand, unique, and beautiful. You need to see it yourself. It's even more beautiful at night.I visited it in summer 2015, so it was very hot. There was cold water steam sprayed from the floor, attracted many kids and even adults!

Beautiful. It was raining the day that we were there. We happened to arrive right at the changing of the guards which was an interesting experience. Beautiful views, of the Danube even though it was incredibly foggy. There were a number of things to look at indoors and under ground, the memorial was very moving with interactive pieces.

Way better than Westminster in UK. Stunning architecture, best parliament building or palace I have ever seen. The size of the building and the design is amazing. Its location on the Danube is perfect

Must see inside!. One of the most beautiful public buildings I've ever been to. You must go inside and see the wonderful architecture from the floor to the ceiling. Just try to buy tickets online because lines tend to be really big.

Incredible Beauty.. An extremely impressive building on the Danube, The Parliamentary building has to be one of the most incredible parliament buildings within Europe!! For the best view I would recommend going at night time and viewing it from the opposite side of the Danube!! Well worth a visit.

Amazing. The architecture of this building is so gorgeous one could stare at it all day. The plaza in front has many benches to rest and gaze and on the other side is the lovely Danube River. When you learn of the sordid history of Hungary it is hopeful how far far they've come in government and The Parliament represents that. Don't miss getting a close up look!
A very impressive building. We walked around the building which is very impressive, but couldn't go inside except to the museum. The building was well guarded.

The best parliament!. So far in my life I haven't seen a Parliament as exquisite as this one! You have to see it during the day, to walk in the square that is right behind it and at night from the Margaret bridge. Absolutely stunning!

Impressive building. I visited last year for the first time and found the building to be extremely impressive, I didn't have time to go inside the first time and went back a second time this year, it's well worth a visit if you are in the city. Don't miss the view from the other side of the river, especially at night.

Outstanding beauty. This place was amazing. Booking our tickets in advance was easy and stress free. We were able to book onto an English tour and had a comprehensive description of the parliament building without it being too technical. The only down-side to this trip was that we did not know that the visitor centre (where the tour starts from) is on the right hand side of the building as you face the river. We went to the left hand side and almost missed our tour because the guards told us to walk (run) round to the other side, not allowing us to cut through, and the building is enormous. I would highly recommend booking a tour for this building, but be sure to book via the official parliament website. the price was very reasonable and I was able to pay in Euros when I purchased the tickets.
Great!. The view of Parliament is so great.It looks amazing from the river Danube as well as from the city side.Parliament is popular among tourists.I would say it is landmark of beautiful Budapest.
Interesting visit. Tour takes approximately 45 minutes and is offered in many languages. It's best to purchase your ticket in advance online and select a designated tour time.
Parliment. Did not go into the museum but it is an outstanding building with lots of detail. You cant miss it, right next to the danube giving ideal photo oppertunities.

impressing!. Very impressing sightseeing!!you must visit it,at least from the outside,and defenitely at night,which is totally lightened!from all the areas it has,only three are available for the visiters.

A beautiful building outside and inside. Don't miss the 1956 memorial in the plaza in front.. Even in November, there is a lot of pressure on tickets for each tour so be sure to get there in good time. Don't miss the 1956 memorial in the plaza in front; at the time we visited (Nov 20 2015) this was, sadly, undergoing renovation, but is still worth seeing.

Sightseeing. Lovely view from the fishermans bastion. A must do site in Budapest. We opted to buy the Budapest card & two free walking tours where included within the price. Parliament was our last stop. Such a beautiful building

Photostop. Its a famous few from of the Parliament Building from over the Danube at night and a photo stop i simply had to do. Its about 10 mins walk from Chain Bridge over the Buda side of the river for the straight on view. Looks fantastic after dark. - Long exposures work great
Impressive.. A very impressive building from the river and up close. Well worth a visit. And they hadgluten free cake in the cafe. Always a bonus...lol
Stunning View from the Danube. I took a river cruise on the Danube with some friends and saw Parliament. The building is absolutely fantastic from the water!

Beautiful building on the Danube. The impressive Parliament building is perfectly situated on the banks of the Danube. With the recent restoration of the surrounding square it is magnificently situated and is the largest building in Hungary. It was built between 1884 and 1902, based on the Neo-Gothic architecture of the Palace of Westminster in London but is far more striking and symmetrical. The nearest metro is at Kossuth ter. There is a modern visitor centre where tickets for guided group tours in a given language can be obtained and the guides are very informative. Tickets for European visitors at 2000 Huf are considerably cheaper than those for non-Europeans. We had to wait an hour before our tour so we visited the adjacent cafeteria for coffee and then strolled around the exterior of the building. The Parliament was designed for an Upper and Lower House when it opened but the current government National Assembly meets in what was the upper house and the lower house is fully open to the public. The Hungarian crown jewels are displayed and guarded under the central atrium and dome in the only location where photography is not allowed. This building is the jewel in the crown of a beautiful city.
Worth the visit just for the outside. I visited the parliament but I didn't actually go inside for a tour; I just admired the architecture outside and that was enough for me to photograph.

Very informative and well priced! . As I am a fan of politics and history I loved this tour! Very insightful good English speaking tour guide! As a student 1000ft was a absolute bargain! However 2000 with a 72h Budapest card was also very well priced. Very good for pictures of statues and the building its self, it's also Well connected to the metro and the number 2 tram!

One of the most impressive buildings in Europe. Have been here several times before and after the restoration of this magnificent building. Since it has been restored it is even more beautiful. Truly a majestic building, often the site of protest which are usually very calm. Great view of the castle hill from here and all the activities on the busy Danube. Great place to sit and people watch and then stroll along the river.
The most beautiful parliament in the world. One is never bored when seeing this building, especially at night or from the inside. While extremely excessive, it remains balanced and somehow subtle.

Perfect short little tour to see the inside of the Parliament, really worth it!. Very impressive tour. We bought our french tour tickets in the early morning for a 13 o'clock visit (some reviews from previous years mentioned that it was free entry Europeans, we however had to pay despite being Europeans, I think they changed this!). The tour lasted about 45 min, it is really the perfect timing, not too long however it is more than enough time to see it all!Loved the architecture, the richness of the building, you can clearly see Budapest's prime years from before the revolution here (no wonder Budapest was called the Eastern Paris).The guide was very informative, gave a thorough history and was very friendly. For me this is a must for everyone who passes through Budapest.

Worth a viewing. The parliament building is worth a viewing to appreciate the scale of the building. The design was inspired by the Houses of Parliament. One of the best views is from the opposite side of the river.

Way overpriced. Beautiful building but not worth cost to tour. You have to take the guided tour of the inside here, and it was 5200 HUF for non EU residents, which was outrageous. The inside is nice, but they just walk you to the crown and scepter, which are under glass, and show them to you. You cannot take pictures, and then they walk you to another area where you see a chamber of parliament, then you leave. One of the most expensive things we saw in Hungary and was not worth it. Admire the outside...that's enough.

Lovely Building. Visited Budapest a few year ago. The Parliament Building sits right across the river from Buda Castle. We never went inside the building. We walked along the river bank along side this beautifully detailed building.
This place is unbelievable. One can visit the inside, but the BEST is the outside, seen from the Danube at night. A sight right out of a Fairy Tale.
STUNNING PARLIAMENT HOUSE. We saw the Houses of Parliament, on a short cruise along the Danube. This was based on the UK's Houses of Parliament and the resemblance is striking.

Beauty I didn't realize until I saw it. Seriously, this building is a must. All the history all the info! You can still see bullet holes from squashed uprisings on building surrounding it. Even better at night.
Well worth vidut. We booked an English speaking your and thoroughly enjoyed the beautiful building and learning a little about Budapest history
Amazing building. Very impressive architecture, amazing view from the other side of river , especially in the night when Parlament is shining, looks amazing

Absolutely beautiful. They have mutli-language programs, which start at different times. You are taken thru the building with a guide that speaks your language. There are no pictures taken of the crown jewels otherwise you can take pictures without flash. You are able to view the parliamentary portion of this building as well.If you have an issue of taking the stairs, there is an elevator available. The first staircase you take will make you a bit winded.

Beautiful building and interesting tour . The parliament building is beautiful both from the outside and many parts of the inside. The your was very interesting and our guide was friendly and knowledgeable. Amazing price for a tour in a big city and definitely worth a look.

Impressive building . Went here just to have a look and see what it was like compared to parliament building's back home (uk) it by far beats it on architecture. We seen changing of the guard that seemed very relaxed compared to the uk but was good to see it all the same.
1 hour tour. book your tour in advance so you don't face lengthy queues or disappointment. we visited on a cold windy day to escape the elements - very reasonable

Beautiful view . Great view from the river and just in front of the building. There is a cute guard exchange in afternoon. In the evening it is completely different colorful experience. A must go, and if you have to choose evening or day go for the evening.
Stunning building. The outside of the building which is based by the River Danube has amazing architecture. We went on a 45 minute tour of the building, well worth it.

Beautiful monument. We didn't visit the inside of the building because you have to book tickets early to have the guided visit in your language and you visit only a very small part of the building, just enjoyed the big place outside. And lucky to see the "dance" of soldiers at 12:30pm.
Beautiful Architechture. Awesome views, right on the banks of Danube.Do not forget to scan the night view from Castle District.

Beautiful building especially at night. The building is postcard perfect, especially in the evening. Bring your best camera to be able to capture it well. Too bad I couldn't get a ticket to enter the building (day time only). Please book beforehand (better if you do it before you go to Budapest) if you intend to see the inside.

A wonderful place. I visited the Parliament on a rather rainy and windy day. To be honest, I didn't mind it that much because it gave the place and the surroundings a completely different feel and look. The building looks amazing. I took the tour inside the parliament, and I enjoyed it very much. It is just as beautiful from the inside as from the outside.

Impression! . Take the boat in the evening and have ready your camera. The view from the river is fantastic. The excursion take enough time to enjoy the whole city and if you take the hop on hop off bus it's included in the ticket.

Amazing building with poor tours. The building is amazing both in design and in location on the Danube - however the tour was terrible - expensive (15.00 Euro each) with way to large a group (probably around 50 in our group), lots of steps (I believe they said 172) and not much to see with a guide who was not helpful and could not be heard (partly dud to the size of the group) and could have cared less about the guests - I'd suggest skipping the tour and just spending the time viewing the building and the river

You have to pay for the toilet??haha yes in budapest..do not pay go outaide there is a free toilet. In budapest you pay for the toilet!yes i know it ia funny.please be carefull when you go inside next to the tocket area has a big sign toilet here(do not go.mthere is a free toilet in the right side outside)you pay 5000fy and they want to pay extra the toilet 200ft..come one my friends.and if the tour was nicemmi will say ok.but it ia not.Today we visit this building.outside was fantastic and especially at night is 5 to 5 stars but i give 1 because the guide tour does not worth.we make the tour today at 11.45 english tour. The price is 2000ft for europian citizens and around 5000 for not eu citizens.the tour starts was really bad.one of the most impprtant things that we learn at 45minutes is that when make meeting they have outside a place for their big ciggarets...the rour is nothing inportant just to take tour money.the tour ahould be more organize and to learn somerhing from this. Just walk outside at night or worths to go by only outside
amazing building. very nice building, form everywhere ,at any time!must see from the hill on the opposite side off the rivergood restoration
beautiful view. The most beautiful building what I have ever seen at the bank of Danube river. The biggest building in Hungary.
Stunning building. Beautiful. We walked around outside and it is a stunning building! Guards do a funny semi circular change.

Architectural marvel. An amazing building of splendour that cant fail to impress. It is quite special to get so close to where the current parliament sits and makes the county's decisions. Our guide gave lots of interesting facts and we were able to watch the rotation of the guards protecting St Stephens crown under the fabulous dome. Only drawback was the lack of information on entry to the building as it was very busy with different timed and different language tours and was hard to know which queue to join!
Worth seeing. A pretty interesting place and it looks incredible. I'd definitely recommend seeing it at night when it's lit up.

Magnificent building. Awesome, splendid....no single word can describe this magnificent structure. Anyone who is interested in grand design and architecture, this building will surely satisfy you. I did not have time to explore the interior but I am already amazed by its grand design and massive built.

next to Danube river, one of the main sights of Budapest, hardly missable. As for now, the street and the square in front of the building is a walking street, making it perfect for some "professional" tourist photos. :)

Historic Marvel !. This building is a historic marvel which has a majestic image in the Budapest scenery. It stretches beautifully alongside the Danube river which one can never miss. At night, once it is lit up its picture perfect, glittering in its own glory. Perfect moment to capture this epic beauty is definitely at night.

Amazing historic building. Went to see these buildings on a rainy day but they are still spectacular and in such a setting. We sailed past them by night all lit up and they look so romantic like the rest of Budapest at night. Worth going to see from the land and from the river

The most beautiful building in Budapest! . This is a stunning building with amazing architecture. Without a doubt the nicest building in Budapest. Unfortunately there were no English speaking guided tours on the day we visited so we couldn't take the tour, which was a little disappointing, but was fabulous to walk around the grounds and take photos. Definitely worth a visit during any trip to Budapest.
Mini Break Budapest. Take pictures of this from Buda Castle, and on a night time it is a stunning building with many great features.

Spectacular. Take a tour of the inside of this beautiful and important building. you will want to buy your tickets ahead of time if at all possible. There is a changing of the guard outside in the rear courtyard and ceremonial guards inside which you will see as part of the tour. As beautiful as the interior and the exterior of this edifice are to behold, they are incomparable to the view from either a riverboat or Buda at night. Spectacular doesn't do it justice!

Magnificent parliament building. The building alone is worth the tour. It compares favorably with many of the great parliaments of the world. The one fault I found is with the guided tour. It is short and they rush you through it. Unfortunately you can only see the insides via a tour.

Enormous building nicely highlighted at night. This huge building, which is much better to see from the other side of the river (otherwise you cannot admire it in full). On the other side there are nice buildings and squares close to the Parliment definitely worth seeing.
Average, but impressive. Very cool to see and impressive building. A bit boring at times. The AC was broken so it was also very hot.
Breathtaking!!! :). A must-see!! I am still surprised how beautiful is Budapest and this building. My friends told me, but I had to visit it to believe.

Such a stunning outside and interior!. This parliamentary building is so amazing! It's not only beautiful from the outside but also from the inside! You should book the tickets online in advance though. If you don't have a printer, don't worry, they can also print the tickets for you there on the spot ;)
THIS IS WHAT A PARLIMENT SHOULD LOOK LIKE. Beautiful building well worth walking to have a look. Easy to find just follow the river. Couldn't get in as you have to book in advance.
Don't miss IT!. You cannot immagine how interesting it is until you aren't inside! Take part of a guided tour in your language

Magnificent Buildings alongside the beautiful Danube. 22nd October 2015. We did not go in, but you can do so. We were content to wander along the vast square in front and to admire this huge and quite magnificent building from the outside. There is a small "infinity" water feature in the square which people enjoyed taking pictures of their friends apparently waist deep in water. About 100 yards away is the Schmulz cafe - good for snack....and if you're desperate for the loo you can use theirs for a small fee without having to eat there.
Loved the fabulous architecture and decor. Very interesting guided tour of this modern parliament where a large percentage of the MPs are women

Wonderful building. What a lovely building. Great architecture. When we visited it looked like it was a changing of the guard which was nice to see. You cannot visit budapest without seeing this majestic building
Gorgeous Building!. I loved the landscape around the parliament and the river is right next to the parliament! A great place to take a stroll.
lovely place to visit. lovely place to visit, you can see it lit up at night if you done a river cruise or just get a taxi to Buda and have a look up close.

Worth the trip . We booked into an English language tour in advance. Guide was very knowledgeable and helpful and gave us a fascinating insight into the history of the country. Not expensive so well worth it if you have time.

Quite a Building!. The sheer size is impressive. The tour covers some hallways, one meeting are ( similar to where Parluament meets on opposite end) and the rotunda under the dome. Pictures are not allowed in the dome area. The history is interesting as are the details about the building itself.
Beautiful interior and grand. The parliament building is iconic in the city and the interior is beautiful and grand. It can only be visited by the guided tour. Worth visiting.

Cool. Cool place
Great building. Very pretty
Look at it at night and by day especially from castle district is very pretty
Did guided tour. Very informative and beautiful building
Wow. It is definitely breathtaking. If you want to enter the parlament you should book online before going.

Majestic and worth a tour!. This famous landmark, recently made even more popular by being featured prominently in the Viking Cruise Commercials, is well worth a visit. We turned up late afternoon without making a reservation and luckily managed to get tickets for the English language tour. Tickets for our tour sold out within a matter of a few minutes so I highly recommend making a reservation ahead of time to avoid disappointment. The tour itself was conducted in a very efficient manner once the tour party all passed through the security check. It starts with a 133 step climb up a staircase which eventually leads to the grand entrance hall. Behind that the royal crown is displayed in the center of a room under the dome and is guarded by two soldiers in ceremonial dress.Total duration of tour is about 40 minutes. Bring your passport if you are a from an EU country because there is a substantial discount offered off the regular admission price. Highly recommended part of your visit to Budapest.

Beautiful at Day, Incredible at Night!. In my humble opinion, the Parliament Building all lit up at night, is one of my favorite vacation sites ever! I'm guessing it is one of the most photographed sites in Budapest, for good reason. We saw it while taking a Viking River Cruise, and viewing it from the river is special. A must see when visiting Europe!
Great. The building is really nice, the architecture and the whole place are great. They have really good guides.
Best part of the Danube. The most iconic sight in Hungary; best viewed on a night or day cruise down the Danube. Be sure to get a closer look at all the statues and base relief, so bring a zoom lens.

Another must see!. To be able to visit you need to buy a ticket at the visitors' center. Depending you mother tongue you will go with a different guide. The building is magnificent with so much decoration everywhere. I was lucky enough to see the change of the guards outside of the ceremonial stairs case. Just go and let you surprised.

Beautiful Building. The building from the outside is beautiful and mesmerizing. Unfortunately, I was not aware you had to purchase a tour of the inside online or from some other source other than going direct to the building. The English tour was fully booked when we arrived and we were told to come back the next day if we book ahead. Was very disappointed that we were only able to go inside the gift shop and not able to return the next day. However, we walked all around the grounds which were also beautiful.

Beautiful building but short tour. The building is massive but the tour only takes you to small area but still worth going on tour. Make sure you book it a day before on line, your hotel will help you with the booking and printing the ticket after you have paid by your debit or credit card. You can also go to the parliament and buy the ticket for next day. The tours are half an hour and in several languages. Walk outside the building and visit a free entry small museum of material that has been used to build the parliament.

Well what can I say its parliament.. This was the second time for me at the parliament. First time with Hebrew tour this time the English your this was really nice to see the Hungarian parliament house from inside to see all of the halls. Must visit while in Budapest

Just like in London. From the outside , it does looke like the British House of Commons. Unfortunately, it is not easy to visit, but anyways, these buildings arms always nicer from the outside. While you are around don't miss the chance to op on tram #2 that stops right in front of the parlement building . It follows the Danube for at last 5 kilometers so that the scenery is very agreeable and even romantic. It is much cheaper than the big bus and much nicer because you are right on the river. Have a nice ride

Fabulous Building in a beautiful part of Budapest- Highly recommended!. Fabulous Building in a beautiful part of Budapest. There are very pleasant garden areas and many truly beautiful buildings surrounding the parliament.Highly recommended!
well worth a visit. What a wonderful occasion to feel European and have access to the Hungarian Parliament. Tour is well worth it.
Great buildings, nice tour. Nice to Tour one of World biggest house of parliament. Around the square several reminders off October 1956 uprising
most beautiful building in hungary. Each time i saw this building, i was amased by it's design, and beauty.i recommend seeing it up close and from an higher view.
Amazing building. We visited here as part of our walking tour. The building is very impressive and a real icon of the city. Next time we would love to visit inside.
Magnificent building . Really enjoyed our tour of parliament it was brief but enough. Remember to tKe your passport if you are from the EU as you get a reduction in your admission fee
Impressive!. very beautiful and spaciel state.just incredible :) do not miss it if you are traveling in Budapest.
THE GRAND BUDAPEST. lovely romantic city very affordable safe and very very clean nice people friendly and full of a historic and artistic style

Magnificent. The Parliament is one of the most beautiful buildings in the world. It is so majestic and regal. The architecture and design is just jaw dropping. If you stand across the Danube (in Buda Hill) in the late evening, you will see that the Parliament is all golden due to the lighting. Simply beautiful.After visiting the Parliament, you could walk down to the river bank to visit Shoes on the Danube. Or alternatively, you could ride on tram or yellow bus no. 2 to take in the scenic areas. The tram stop is near by the Parliament.
Beautiful building. Best to go on a guided tour as the guides know the facts and history. To watch the guards guarding the Crown Jewels is truly amazing

Fabulous building but tour guide not brilliant. From the outside this is one of the most stunning buildings I have ever seen. Sitting on the banks of the River Danube and looking as though it has just been built it really is quite something. However, the tour inside is quite short and we found the guide to be uninteresting to say the least. You see the national crown jewels and the debating chamber. All terribly gothic - parts reminiscent of our Houses of Parliament. At the end of the tour there is an exhibition about the building itself.
Visit this gorgeous building with guide. Easy to find visitor center, English speaking guide. The tour was interesting, the inside of the house is also very beautiful as are the outside.
Imposing buidine and interior. This is a must for any visitor to Budapest and includes a really good English language guide round a really interesting building

The Most Impressive Parliament Building I've Visited! . The Hungarian Parliament Building tour is amazing! It is a must for travellers to Budapest! In my opinion, it is the most impressive Parliament Building I am aware of (even more beautiful than the British Parliament!!)The Grand Staircase is truly breathtaking with the beautiful marble pillars and steps with ruby-red carpets lining the staircase. You are permitted to take pictures inside but NOT IN THE DOME HALL. The Dome Hall is fascinating with the vaulted dome in a similar shape to a lotus flower! Tours are done with a guide only and I would advise to BOOK IN ADVANCE as it is very popular!

Beautiful building, interesting tour. The building is great to look around both from the inside and outside, the tour guide takes you through the great hall, to see the crown jewels and you can also visit the chamber and take photos even when they're in conference.
awesome sight on the river. either from the far hill or on the river it makes londoin parliament look small-the great bridges spanning make this a gorgeous viewing

Really nice to see. The parliament is one of the nicest buildings in Budapest's skyline. My recommendation would be to go initially to the castle to see it from the other side of the river, and then go walking to see the building closely. It is a 1 hour tour from the castle to the parliament, more or less.
Great to look at. Looks amazing, will venture inside next time. Lovely space in front of the building so you can take good pics
the biggest building in downtown. It is beautiful also from inside, where a local guide can drive you to see the most important rooms, in about 50 minutes.
beautiful building. This building is very large. Took the tour inside and it was beautiful. Saw changing of guard. Visited the labadary and museum.

Amazing architecture but no pics allowed in best room. The grounds of the Hungarian Parliament is impressive but I would definitely recommend participating in the indoor tour as well. They offer English-speaking tours and the guides do a fairly good job explaining the history & background. However, the English-speaking tour is the most popular so book ahead! The internal architecture is intricate, ornate, elaborate and quite impressive. Unfortunately, it is prohibited to take a photo in the best room (in my opinion), which is the under the dome with the jewels. So you just have to absorb & remember :)
A beautiful building from every angle.. This building is stunning and the setting by the Danube is perfect. Take a scenic ride past on the number 5 tram, you can get off to take photos.
Loved the guards!. The parliament was beautiful! I wish I had more time to see everything, but the guards in front were awesome! The building was beautiful and definitely worth seeing!

An Amazing Building. The visit to the parliament building was a highlight of trip to Budapest. The building was overwhelming. I booked the tour through my hotel the day before and was able to get an English tour without a problem. I suggest you do the same because when we got there all of the English tours were booked. I understand that there is another museum near the building devoted to the uprising in 1956. We didn't know that until after our tour. The tour was excellent and the guide explained what we we seeing as well as the history of the building. The view at night from the Danube is my special picture of our European trip.

Stunningly Beautiful!. Of all the gorgeous buildings in beautiful Budapest, I found myself constantly drawn to the majestic Hungarian Parliament Building, perhaps because it is the largest and tallest building in Budapest. I was only able to experience it from the outside since all of the English tours were sold out on the Sunday that I had a little free time. Next visit to Budapest, touring the inside will be a must as I understand it has ten courtyards, cathedral ceilings, and is the third largest legislative building in the world!

Beautiful day. Stunning view. The Parliament is a wonderful way to spend the morning. It is a lovely walk, I walked down past the West End Center and Andrassy. The weather was mild and the shops were quiet
Amazing architecture . Fabulous building. So much craftsmanship and detail. Looks beautiful in the evening. We didn't go into the building, but you can book tickets to go inside designated areas.

Must see. This beautiful bulding, you cant miss when in Budapest. Firstly, because its so big and centrally located that you CANT miss it, secondly due to its fabulous design and resemblance to Westminister Abbey. When you walk by the Danube bank, you will appreciate its glory, trust me!

Organised tour is a rip off!. I have down rated this review not because of the parliament building but because of the organised tour we went on. Think we paid around 4 times the cost of entry to the Parliament and I'm not sure quite what for. We were told it can get busy and that's why tour is better but we still had to hang around waiting for tickets to get in etc. The building itself is amazing and worth seeing but It was actually more hassle on the tour as we had to go back to our hotel to be picked up when we were already nearly down at the building.

very nice monument. This si a very nice monument from outside and inside as well.
It is not allowed to take picture in some rooms.

Beautiful in and out. The building is stunning at night and very nice during the day. The entrance is underground and accessible from both the river and plaza sides. Tickets cost about $19.80 for US citizens. The EU citizens get in for half that price. The inside gets very crowded. English tours are given only a couple times each day. Book a day ahead so you can attend. They sell out fast. Only a few languages are used during these tours. About 50% of our English tour were foreign tourists. The tour takes you above the grand staircase. It showcases several rooms and halls with gold leaf and beautiful woodwork. No pictures are allowed in the room with the royal crown. When finished with the tour, you can take the elevator or stairs down. The elevator goes to the main lobby. The stairs will take you through a small, but nice museum to the gift shop.

Gilded Lily. Wow! A must-see. Stately neo-Gothic built in 1902, and the seat of the Hungarian government . Guided tours with advanced booking. Romanesque and Arabic features, Lots of gilt. Tessellated floor mosaics, crocketed pinnacles, vaulted and groined ceilings, torcheres, stained windows, marble columns, dentilled Romanesque arches
Outstanding architectural feat. Must see. Biggest parliament building in the western world. Makes D.C. look like a hillbilly's back yard. Impressive.

Parliament tour October 2015. try to book online prior to day , however there are limited numbers available on the day, just saves any disappointment. Beautiful building with well informed tour guide.

Fantastic Site to see. There were long lines for the tours and we had one in German since 3 of us were Germans. The English one didn't start for another 4 hours. The one we were on starting in 2 hours. The sights were worth the wait.

Beautiful - day or night. You have to see this landmark, modeled apparently on the British parliament (same architect). The views are great both day and night. Book in advance to see inside, better to go on week days, discounted tickets for EU citizens with a passport.
Step! :). Beautiful view! Beautiful structure! In front of the Danube particularly during the night with light
GR8 Structure. Nice heritage structure on the bank of the river. has great view from either side of the river. At night looks great form the palace.
Beautiful . A stunning building, well worth a look. A group of friends and I wandered past a few times on a recent weekend trip to Budapest.Great picture opportunities too...
Must see at nighttime!. Beautiful,amazing to see at night and day time. One of the most beautiful buildings I have ever seen!

Beautiful . Beautiful and so rich in architecture! ! It was great getting there on a Segway. Unfortunately it was very annoying that the visiting hours were very limited for exploring inside the building. Make sure you go on time!

Great Tour!. Get the number 2 tram to here and get off right outside. Walk round the building and there is a subterranean entrance to the visitor centre. We booked well before we left the UK online to get the time of tour we wanted and to avoid queues. If you are a citizen of the EU then make sure you get the cheaper ticket! Tours are in different languages so make sure you book the right one (loads hadn't when we were there). It's just amazing inside, so much gold leaf, incredible stairways and halls and corridors. Very informative guide and the tour includes the crown jewels which is really only one crown but it's in a spectacular setting. Get there a good ten minutes early if you've booked online it's a bit chaotic especially if it's busy and there are lots of tours going on. Takes about an hour to get through.

very impressive. We had seen it from the river, so we almost skipped the 'mandatory' visit to the parliament...but I'm so glad we didn't - the building is really amazing, and we were lucky to see the parliament protocol guard perform a short ceremony for the tourists - it was 11.30 am and they marched to music and even offered to take photos with us at the end...great tourist fun :)

loved it - just magnificent. This is probably my fav building in Budapest, and I loved it even better than the parliament building in London, which had always remained my fav. There is a large area to cover, so if visiting on a hot day take water and a hat - there's not much shelter there! They open up tiny fountains in front of the building and that is something I have never seen before. Well maintained and good sight seeing attraction. Would recommend.
Very impressive indeed. A beautiful and impressive building on the edge of the River Danube is a great sight from all angles. Worth s visit. Take your camera!

One of the Star at Night. It is a beatiful building with a great surronding to walk around or relax in the garden. You can visit the place in conviniet times and learn about the great history of the parliament bulding. It has a magnificient view from the opposite side of the river in the evenings.

Parliament. Hungarian Parliament building situated in Lajos Kossuth Square just a few minutes walk from the 16 Nos bus and No 2 Tram junction.bus stop.It is the largest and highest building in Hungary and is designed in the architectural style of the British Parliament in London.The guards on duty resembled statues akin to the sentry's of Buckingham palace guards in London.In fact from a distance i initially mistook them to be statues until they performed their change of guard march.The view of Parliament from the Buda side of the Danube river is scenic , especially from Castle hill or the Citadel.

sightseeing and weekend gateaway. one of the best iconic and landmark it has to offer in Europe and Budapest. It is charming and sophisticated by night with the amber lights. It is best view on the opposite side of the Danube River.A must visit place in Hungary
Do not miss the tour of the Parliament.. The building is grandiose and the inside is stunning. The tour of the place is very instructive and enjoyable. Do not miss this attraction.
Incredible by night. Try to see it by night or day time from the boat, really worth the time. Amazing building to be remembered
Beautiful exterior. This is a beautiful building with large grounds outside. It is free to visit the grounds, however you will need to arrange access in side beforehand. Definitely worth a visit.

Impressive building, so-so tour. The structure itself is very impressive and awe-inspiring. However, the tour given by the guides of the parliament left a lot to be desired. First of all, the tour was conducted with such a big group in tow that there wasn't an opportunity to ask questions without feeling like you were holding up the entire group. You also felt like the tour was rushed because there were other tour groups right behind you who needed to be shown the same thing. In addition, the tour itself was too short and lacked substantial information to merit the price of the tour (Price differs between citizens of E.U and non-E.U countries). The parliament can do the public a favor by creating a walk at your own pace audio or self-guided tour.

beautiful building!. The building was beautiful & the tour was OK. It would help if we had headphones. Our group was 30-ish and if you were not right behind the guide you could not hear much of what was said.

Amazing!!. We were surprised by how amazing the Hungarian Parlament is, both inside and outside. Its gothical architecture is breathtaking, specially at night!The guided tour is very informative and give access to some of the main rooms of the building.

Beautiful view, tour was decent. Building is massive and looks great day or night - plenty of photo opportunities. Would recommend taking the paid guided tour, although they all seemed to be massively crowded and you don't get to see a lot of the inside, but it was very informative and the parts you did get to see were interesting.

Impressive Building. Is this beautiful imposing building with its large rooms, staircases, meeting facilities and meeting room of Parliamentarians. It's an educational visit, guided by a very knowledgeable person in the history of Hungary and its different stages lived under the Austro-Hungarian Empire, the foundation as a republic, its permanence under Communist rule until 1994 and today. Very interesting visit to this building rich in architectural detail.

Interesting and beautiful building . Managed to get the last few spaces on an English speaking tour here. The inside was beautifully decorated and we had a guide with us throughout the whole building to give us information. Really enjoyed our visit!
Beautiful building. This is a must see especially at night when lit up.It is the focal point from both sides of the Danube.
Fabulous windows. The windows appear to be the basis of the design for that wonderful porcelain made in Budapest! Amazing buildings all over Budapest.

One word: amazing!. A real must-do in Budapest. Well organised guided tours in many languages at a popular price. You have the chance to see the 1000 year old St. Istvan's crown with its original bent cross on top, guarded by two statuesque sworded soldiers. The architecture and details of the building are really wonderful, as it fits for this well-kept masterpiece of the eclectic style.
Very beautiful building. Very nice exterior design,sample of the beautiful hungarian medieval architecture.I haven't been inside but I think that the building itself is an ornament

See it at Night. The Parliament Building is a beautiful site, not to be missed. The architecture is incredible but to see its true beauty you should take a river cruise at night when it is lit up. Take a look at the Big Bus tours which include a night cruise. We did tour the inside so we cannot offer any insights to that part of the experience.

simply the best. very beautiful building,especially at night with the lights.there is a free small museum down earth,telling the story of its making.beautiful statues,great views of bridges and Buda side. a must.

Stunning building. Just walked around it and took photos. Late at night it's also beautifully illuminated. Even looks good from a plane at night - distinctive at a distance. Just don't expect a smile ftom the surely security guards.

Budapest at it's Best. You haven’t seen the beauty of Budapest unless you have viewed it at night from a boat. The Hungarian Parliament Building is massive and is very beautiful in the daytime but it’s true beauty is seen at nighttime. It, as well as the bridges along the Danube, are illuminated at night and is well worth your time to see it.. Our Vantage cruise captain made sure we all experienced the splendor of the building with a night time viewing as we departed Budapest for our next port.
Very good. Very interesting, the guide was excellent with a wealth of knowledge, nothing was too much trouble when the group asked loads of questions.

Overrated and overpriced!. We visited the place during the Redbull Air Show and we could only purchase tickets online because they told us that they might be sold out until we get there next (we wanted to visit the place on Saturday but they were sold out, so they advise us to come back the next day and purchase the tickets online). When we bought the tickets only we were overcharged with an "internet tax" which was quite high (I cannot remember the exact amount).The next day when we went there, we had to wait over 20 minutes over the scheduled time before we could go in, thing which kind of pissed me off.Anyway, we finally got in!  We were quite dissapointed by the tour, as it was faster that is was supposed to be (they were already late) and we were dissapointed by the interior design if the place. All I could remark it was the opulence and extravagancy of the building! We did not find it an historical place, as we could even be attentive to the guide's explanations because we very so distracted by the blinking of the gold everywhere you looked. Everything was so"in your face" and extravagant and just too much, a mix of arhitectonic features and different styles.Per total, I think it was a waste of money and time and I do not recommend you to visit it! Do something with your time
Stunning. Did not go in but this is an amazing building from the outside. Worth seeing in the day and at night.

Beautiful at night. We only visited the outside of the parliament and at night. It is definitely worth seeing as they illuminate it very well. The statues and reliefs are really displayed to their best under the lighting

The highlight of Budapest. This building is beautiful inside and out, it dominates the view wherever you are in the city. We booked onto a tour, there are quite a few people booked onto each tour so make sure you arrive early and get to the front of the group. The tour guide was knowledgeable and took us all around the building, into a chamber and to see the crown. She told us about the statues and wall paintings, all fascinating. I would also recommend walking around the outside of the building, especially at night when it is beautifully lit up.
A wonderful building now traffic free.. Only trams are now allowed to go through the square behind the building, and thus walking through the square is a wonderful experience

Easy location; worth seeing (at least outside). Not sure why this is such a popular venue-to be truthful, we didn't want to spend the time touring the inside of the building. That being said, the building itself is quite striking and easy to get to either by Metro or Tram #2. There is a regular changing of the guard and the area itself is interesting with shops and restaurants. There is also a very nice gift shop downstairs next to the building. If the weather were bad, it might be worth going on the tour, but otherwise I think there are better ways to spend your time!

great architecture and history. A nice walking tour covering a small part of parliament which lasted for about an hour including the display of crown and the erstwhile upper house keeps you riveted for a while. well worth the walk

great architecture!. when we planned our budapest trip the only place i want to visit is this parliamentary building. i would say it did not disappoint us. one of the most beautiful parliament in the world. built by a hungarian architect. an example of neo gothic architecture built in 1885. inspired by the parliament building in London the westminster parliament.for EU resident you can even get a discount for the entrance fee. and for high season it is advisable to prebooked the ticket for they allowed 40 person in a guided tour group every 30 minutes.

Wonderful architecture but hard to get in.... We were lucky enough to get in although had to line up for about 2 hours. It was a National Holiday - 20 Aug - when you can have an quick unguided visit to parts of the Parliament House. If you are there at that time and that is eniugh for you go for it. Alternative, you can visit it in a guided tour. They offer them in many languages at different times. Getting ethe tickets for the guided tour is a bit difficult!1./ You pay more if you are not from an EU country though! 2./ You can purchase tickets in person but be prepared that you might not get in right away as the sessions booked out and have to come back later or wait there.3./ You can NOT book in person for next day session ONLY on line for an extra fee!That makes it difficult and very disappointing when you try to see this wonderful building you see all over the TV when they advertise river cruises. They built the Parliament House entirely from building materials sourced in Hungary, except the marbles which came from Italy! Parliament is symmetrical and has two absolutely identical parliament halls out of which one is used for the politics, the other one is used for guided tours. It has 691 rooms and its height of 96 meters, it is one of the two tallest buildings in Budapest, along with Saint Stephen's Basilica. The number 96 refers to the nation's millennium, 1896, and the conquest of the later Kingdom of Hungary in 896. The Holy Crown of Hungary has been displayed in the central hall since 2000.TIP: if you have to wait or feeling a bit hungry go in to the Kossuth metro station - do not go downstairs or buy metro ticket - and there is this small bakery franchise with cheap but nice little food to munch on. You find these all over the city at many metro stops ( they are called Princess ) including here.

Amazing inside (and out). We arrived in the evening by ship, and the lighting on this building (and many others) was awesome. Walking around the outside during the day, it was fascinating to see all the detail (don't miss underground exhibit in the square featuring sculptured gargoyles). Get a timed ticket to tour the interior, which is magnificent by late 19th century standards.
colorful tour. visit the parliament for its beautiful colorful decoration and history (for free on Cultural heritage days)

A glorious building.. Tours of this spectacular building are available. Book a day in advance. Take your passport and get in free if you from an EU country. Its the 3rd biggest parliament building in the world.
Amazing view. No words about this building! just take so many pictures as you can, is so so amazing, I super recomend!

Awesome!. We were fortunate enough to visit Budapest on a National Holiday so admission was free! We waited in line for about an hour. Most of the folks were locals (free admission/day off from work). The building is beautiful, we walked the red carpet. The main attraction was the viewing St. Stephen's Crown.

Great if you like architecture and history. This was a stop on our bicycle tour off the boat. We didn't stay long because of the rain but we got to see the changing of the guard, which was worth the stop. We never went in and I don't know if they even do tours but the exterior is magnificent and the location along the river is stunning.
Nice visit. Awesone form outside astonishing inside! The guided tour is brief but exhaustive. It worth the time!
if you have the time this is worth visiting. great tour, though you need to book in advance and pay the fee. amazing building with lots of history/
Stunning. Possibly the most beautiful building I have ever seen. We had a rainy day on our trip and it was perfect to visit the Parliament. It's a must for everyone visiting Budapest.
Very nice monumental building. Very nice monumental building in the centre of city. The most famous building in Budapest. Must to see

Absolutely Beautiful. We stayed down the road from the Parliament building and it never got old every time we walked past. It's an amazing building. They had armed guards outside for photo opportunities, there is also a tourist centre with helpful staff.
Stunning. An example of sheer beauty in architecture.A prominent building overlooking the Danube River.t is particularly imposing when illuminated at night.

Magnificent. It is very big with many statues along the way. For toilets, u can go to the one at the tourist office beside the parliament. Due to its size, u can't view it as a whole from there so it is good to view it from castle hill.
Amazing must see !. It is just beautiful you got to see it if you are in budapest and you will see it in his prominent position. Now the restored the square in front it looks very nice.
Make sure you see at night time. Get on a boat, and cruise up and down the river. The parliament building lit up is stunning. Worth a wander around during the day time as well to compare
Beautiful at night. Take a river cruise at night so you can witness this beautiful building at night. The pictures you will get you will not forget.

Parliament buildings. The building itself is magnificent. The gardens and square with its beautiful statues is well worth a visit. As the guide book said take the number 2 tram from here for a spectacular view of the danube but before you do check that the tram is running as there is lots of restoration working going on at the moment in budapest.
Budapest trip. Visited this building twice it really is in a super position and worth a good luck around its right by the river and next to some other sights ,

Beautiful place, inside and out.. Came here with a big group for a tour of the inside of the Hungarian Parliament Building. Was amazed by this brilliant attraction. It is simply beautiful. After taking in the beauty of the exterior of the building, we were summoned inside by the tour guides that would be showing us around for the next hour or two. We went through security and took our first steps into the beautiful place - golden arches and breath taking European architecture were everywhere. The tour guides took us around and were brilliant in giving us information about the history of the place - they were very competent in speaking English. We visited the commons room, a balcony with an amazing skyline of Budapest as well as various other parts of the parliament building. It was extremely interesting and the place continued to pleasantly surprise us with its sheer beauty. We came out, enlightened with information, and watched the spectacular theatrical change over of the guards. What a wonderful trip! I would recommend anyone staying in Budapest.

A bit pricy but worth it!. So much depends on which tour guide you get. I felt ours was just phoning it in, so to speak. But the building is stunning, and the history worth learning. Definitely include a visit to the museum, which is free- it's very informative and well designed. Take a walk around the outside and have a seat on the stairs overlooking the Danube beside the statue of the very humble Hungarian poet...
Beautiful!!. this is an absolutely stunning building! we took a river cruise at night and this was so stunning all lit up!
Great View. I liked the view and the look at sunset is amazing. Also it was beautiful being able to take a picture by the donau in front of the parliament.
Beautiful. It is so majestic... And the lights at night were amazing. See the photos... We didn't go inside since we only had a few hours.
So beautiful!. What a stunning landmark. You can't miss it, luckily! See it by day and by night. And see it several times, you will not grow tired of it.
Grandiose Visit. So often these grand governmental buildings are off limits, I was able to get a ticket and tour the building with little wait in Oct 2009.

Informative and stunning. Although not a long tour (about 45minutes after security etc), you got to see some of the magnificent rooms and hallways of this beautiful building. Our guide spoke English well and had a good sense of humour. We'd highly recommend a visit inside the parliament. We did book ahead for our tickets.

BEAUIFUL TO DAY OR NIGHT. The Hungarian Parliament House is similar to the one in London, visited a while back. Lovely to see day or night, as we were here for a short time we did not get a chance to venture inside.

A night time fairy tale. This is a beautiful building the architecture outstanding, watching the changing of the guards a must if your taking children. There is a 30 minute tour but we preferred just wondering around. At night its a fairytale of beauty all lit up and just inspiring. Somewhere you must visit especially at night

Magnificant!. If you see one thing in Budapest, it must be the Parliament. It is an easy walking tour and the interior is like nothing else we have seen. The exterior,at night, is one of the greatest sights in the owrld.
Parliament is worth the visit. Be sure to get your tickets in advance. We did ours online a few days before, which wasn't a problem in October, but might not be enough time in high season.

Proud icon of Hungary. NeoGothic building (not all that historic) but interesting as part of Hungary's history and there is a pride in having such a visible and beautiful building. It includes the "crown of Stephen" (the first king, St. Stephen of Hungary) as part of its attractions

Iconic. I've seen this beautiful building on all those Viking cruise commercials and was thrilled to see it in person. We took the English language tour...while you don't see a whole lot, for me it was very worthwhile to see the inside of this beautiful landmark and to see the crown of Hungary

Very good tour of a spectacular building. The Hungarian Parliament Building is draw droppingly gorgeous and impressive! Our group of four booked tickets online ahead of our visit to Budapest and the reservation process was quick and efficient. We also got an email reminder a day or two ahead of the visit. This is a guided tour approximately one hour long which is the perfect amount of time to give you details of the building and its history and a brief history of Hungary itself without becoming boring. The interior of the building is equally impressive and our tour guide was interesting and informative. Highly recommend this tour. We went early in the morning which I think was a good choice since we were able to take pictures outside before the site became overrun with tourists.

Stunning architecture. A beautiful, majestic building that was actually built relatively recently. We watched the changing of the guard which was brilliant. The guards were very friendly and encouraged tourists to take photos with them! The tour of the building is ok. The inside of the building is gorgeous, but I think the tour lacked detail. It would have been good to have a little more information on the processes. There is a souvenir shop, as well as a cafe. There are toilets too, but you have to pay to use them!

The House of the Nation. This magnificent building was constructed to be a celebration of the 1000 year anniversary of the Magyar nation. Built on the Pest side of the Danube river in Gothic Revival style . One must tour the inside of the Parliament to fully appreciate the beauty of the special structure.
Beautiful building. Well worth visiting the parliament building as it is very beautiful and watching the soldiers change guard is fun.
Great piece of archtecture in Budapest!. Very beautiful piece of architecture in Budapest. Nicely illuminated at night! Great view when you are taking night boat trip.

Beautiful but.... We spent the money and waited for the tour. The Parliament building is beautiful both inside and out, but the tour is 30 minutes and unimpressive. Spend your time and money some where else. Not worth it.
Beautiful building. Beautiful architecture and a very large building. Very beautiful. In the district clean and nice. Lovely view of the Danube
Beautiful. Amazing, beautiful, specially in the night!! I haven`t been inside as I didn`t have time but I`m sure is unbelievable. It is just near the Duna which is nice and clean ;)

Beautiful Building!. We only visited the Parliament from the outside, having neither the time nor the physical ability to tour the inside. But observed, especially from across the river and at night, this building is absolutely spectacular.

Gotta love gold leaf.... Very ornately decorated. The crown is jeweled, but underwhelming. Most interesting is the crooked cross. You can easily spot the crown in picture because of it.
We had forgotten our tickets at the hotel, but the ticket desk kindly printed new tickets out for us when we showed them the e-mail confirmation.

One of the best places in Budapest. Beautiful building and worth learning about. I haven't taken the tour but I do plan to during my 4 month stay.
Thus building is always gorgeous at night and has free WiFi on the square!

Based on the houses of parliament , London, but nicer !. This building is awesome, our guide gave us so much information about this building that it is clearly packed with historical interest. It is well worth a walk around and come back at night to see it lit up its beautiful.
FABULOUS. If you do one guided tour do this one! Fantastic building, interesting history. You need to book and take your passport for EU discount. Exceptional

Beautiful architecture. In my opinion, this has to be the number 1 attraction in Budapest. The cleanliness and stunning architecture won me over.
Watch the guards change over and even those on guard swap by walking around in aa circle in front of the building. Be aware the photo opportunity may just run away with you!

Ok. Quite interesting. Seemed a bit of a waste of money for a 20 minute tour, it went very quickly and finished quite abruptly. I much preferred seeing the architecture from the outside and visiting the exhibition just outside which was also free. Bring your passport if you're an EU member, you get a discount.

Parliament . Arrived on the day and booked a tour. Tour was very insightful and the views inside was well worth the visit. Make sure you have id with you to prove you are an EU national as you get a considerable discount

Just another parliament. The parliament building as such is beautiful. More scenic the Danube and the places around it. You can just walk around it at any time during the day or evening. Calm and wonderful location.
Parlament. It's building is fantastic. Absolutly most beautiful in Budapest. Come to Budapest and not see Parliament is sin.

Very impressive. We took Tram 2 to Parliament area. The building and grounds are quite impressive. We decided to skip the tour of the interior as many of the more impressive areas were not being shown due to government being in session that day and we would have to come back a couple of hours later for the English tour.

Well worth a visit! Great tour guides.. This is well worth a visit, you can only visit in a tour group but without their knowledgeable tour guides you wouldn't get half as much from the visit. The building is incredibly beautiful with lots of little historic quirks. If you're an EU citizen, take your passport for a cheaper entry ticket.
Overrated. Totally boring visit with a overly large group and a guide who spoke low and heavily accented English. Not worth the time or expense.
Good tour.. For EU members. Bring your passport and entry fee is 2000 compared to 5000 for non EU members. Dosent seem fair but thats the way it is. Tour last approx 45 mins. Worth a visit.
Wow!. This is one of the most beautiful buildings I have ever seen! I couldn't stop staring at it especially at night. The best way to see it is on a boat at night. Breathtaking!!!
Made famous to Americans by the Viking River Cruise commercial!. The tour here is very good and worth the price. After all, this is the most famous landmark in Budapest and a must see.
It should be "must see" on your list. On of the most expensive builidnigs in Budaest. Although you have to get up early in the morning to get the tickets it is worth seeing.

Must do!. This was one of the top things to do while visiting Budapest. You need to make reservations in advance, as they fill up quickly. The Parliament building is absolutely stunning. This tour isn't long, maybe 1 hour. One word of warning, there are MANY steps to climb. I would guess about 8 flights of them, without stopping, at a very quick pace. If you think you might have trouble with that, there is an elevator. Don't be afraid to use it.

Impressive building. Best to book ahead of time as you need the tour in your language - English tours appeared to be every two hours. A bit chaotic getting in but five minutes before your tour starts it will be announced and you can proceed through the security barriers.Guides as you would expect are very knowledgeable and proud of the building which itself is very impressive with lots of gold covered ceilings and ornate carvingsThe speed of the tour going from one room to the next and the impressiveness of the rooms was sufficient for occupy my teenage son and my wife and I found it fascinating. At the end of the tour you are left in a small exhibition which details the design and building process. It also has the original red star from the communist period. We found the gift shop to be reasonably priced compared to the centre of town shops
beautiful view. I only see it by the outside.By the night it has lights and you have a great view of it by the Danube.

Worth the visit. Beautiful on the inside, very well organized for visiting. Tours in several languages, free coat check, interesting history and museum. The guide knew a lot, answered all the questions,

Just lovely. You cannot miss it on any tour of the City of Budapest. Lovely structure and nice building. Even more impressive in the evenings by the lighting effect. Well worth seeing it. Recommended.

Impressive Sight. Parliament is beautiful, during the day and very impressive at night. We walked by it almost daily just to admire it's beauty. It is massive and sits right on the river. Do not miss seeing it at night as the lighting is quite a sight.

One of the best things in Budapest. Really liked the tour of the Parliament buildings. The tour guide was funny yet informative and some of the architecture is amazing to see. Very cheap and relatively quick as well (no longer than 1hr from start to finish).

Truly AMAZING !. Where can I start I was looking forward to seeing this building since I booked the trip and it didn't disappoint , I think it's better than the London Houses of Parliament but my wife disagrees ? Judge for yourself our apartment was close and I never got bored of going back for numerous more views.

An interesting place to visit. A well organised and reasonably priced guided tour around the Parliament building. The English speaking guide was well informed and happy to answer questions. Well worth it. An interesting insight into recent Hungarian history.
Must See at Night. While on a river cruise we had the opportunity of seeing all the buildings on the Danube lit up at night. It was beautiful. If in Budapest one has to take an evening cruise.

It is interesting but not fantastic. We had a private guide for the day in Budapest. Private guides are not allowed to take you in the parliament. So our guide arranged for our tour to stop at the parliament for an English speaking tour. Not all tours are all languages so it was nice she had arranged the time correctly. It is a hour tour and the building is beautiful. The highlight for me was seeing St, Stephens crown and jewels which were guarded by Hungarian police.
Gorgeous. We were not able to tour inside the building, but even the exterior was breathtaking!! Seemed to be a very popular tour. Next time we will ensure we make the time to visit.

Amazing building. Really impressive building and architecture. Square and statues around really nice. Amazing how they could build like this in the past compared to the monstrosities that go up today. Really clean city.
Must see in Budapest. Amazing building. When in Budapest you must take a tour there. It is better to book online in advance.

A beautiful building. It's clear why Hungarians are so proud of their Parliament. It's a beautiful building, and the 45 min English tour was worthwhile to see the stunning interior. The new exhibition at the end is also very interesting. To avoid disappointment, make sure you book your tickets online in advance.

Rip off. Had every intention of visiting, but on arrival found there was premium to pay for non EU residents for entry. In Australian dollars this would have equated to the cost of dinner in Budapest. Instead we went into the book shop and looked at the photos of the interior and left.
amazing by night. The parliament building is a sight to behold, take a river trip on the danube at night and see the Building at its golden best
Nice to have not must. Nice to have not must. The outside of the building is much more impresing than the inside...the guided tour was not interesting.
Photographer's dream. I could have spent all day just taking artsy photos of this beautiful building. It is beautiful to look at, and surrounded by interesting historical museums.

One of the Highlights. Definitely one of the best place in Budapest and highly recommended.
Easy to get to either way and accessible by Public Transport
Stunning Architecture. Brilliant to view from the river or go up to the Fisherman's Bastion for a sensational view. It is open to the public, but we did not have time to go in.
The building is shear art!. This spectacular design won a competition back in the 1800's and by day or night, it's drop-dead gorgeous. A tribute to the resilience of the Hungarians.

It's a must!. I haven't read the other reviews but I'm sure they are ecstatic. Seeing the interior of this building is a must when in Budapest. The only problem is that you often have to go in the morning to get tickets and then come back in the afternoon. I've never succeded in using their online booking system.

Gothic beauty. For the first time this trip we visited a beautifully decorated building that was not a cathedral or a palace.
