While ornate it was mostly intricate carvings, no angels, Greek mythological figures, stations of the cross or suffering saints. Very well maintained with vaulted ceilings and stained glass.

Amazing. It's such an opportunity to visit this place. People said you got to lined up to have a tour here. The interior was amazing,.especially the old crown that was kept safely. Overall this building is just beautiful..

Don't leave Budapest without a tour of Parliament. The highlight of our visit. The Parliament building is beautiful and a must see. There is airport-like security to enter. We saw the guard change in the area of the "crown jewels" and the architecture and decor spectacular. Seeing it from the river at night when it is illuminated is surreal.

Great sight at night !!. Its a great sight when it is completely lit up. Since the parliament is on the Pest side you need to see it from across the river from the Buda side. We were really tired at night so we cabbed it down from the Pest side saw the beautifully lit Parliament took a few photos and came back in the same cab. It would cost you something around 6000 Forints which is roughly Rs. 1500/- or USD 23 or 20 euros. So it would make sense that you stay in the buda side till the sun goes down for 1 of the days that you are in budapest to see the parliament and then come back to the pest side as tourists mostly stay in the Pest side so i assume you would also do the same.

Good structure. You should see the parliament building for the beautiful architectural point of view. We didn't get time to visit inside the parliament as the session of parliament was on but would have loved it.
Beautiful house. You need to visit it both during daytime and nighttime. We did not visit the inside, only outside. It is a magnificent building.

Massive, Gorgeous Architecture!. Based on several TA reviews and my limited time in Budapest, we opted not to tour the building but WOW, it truly is an architectural marvel when viewed on the outside. No matter the angle, you will see details that are mind boggling. As a hint, I've attached a photo that was taken from across the Danube at the Fisherman's Bastion in the Castle District. It's so huge, you need to be far away to take in its enormity. Gorgeous!

Breathtaking experience. Unbelievably opulent and beautiful building that rivals most of the palaces we've seen in Europe. Tour guide was very knowledgeable and informative but guards were very stern and had no sense of humor!

Stunning building, ok tour. The building itself and the surrounding area are a must see. It is really amazing architecture. The tour itself was pretty basic - and while it was very factually informing - I would have loved a bit more colour / stories etc... You also don't get to see too much of the building and it feels quite quick!

Stunning architecture and history. Beautiful building inside and out, steeped with history. Tours are available in different languages throughout the day; you do not get to stop and linger because of this. If you can prove you are an EU Citizen you get in half price. Good coffee shop but expensive gift shop. Expect high security measures when entering the building.

Stunning Building. Really cool building situated in great spot with amazing views. The whole make up and size of the building and variety of it makes for something special. Looks amazing both by day and night.

Amazing Building!. When in Budapest, be sure to take a guided tour of the Parliament Building! The architecture, both inside and out, is absolutely beautiful. Our tour guide was very knowledgable on the history of the building and country overall. We learned a great deal on this tour!

Good tour, not great though. We did the tour on our last day and we could have skipped it. It was a quick 45 minute tour with about 50 others. It makes sense that our tour is somewhat limited as its still an active parliament and I can say exactly what more I would want but its one of those things that is skipable. The exterior is not to be missed though.

A must to see. Can only be seen by tour, check their Website for dates and times for English speaking tours and prebook online which will save you time from standing in line . Tour was a little short about 45 minutes but very informative tour guide, The entrance is not well marked however the police surrounding the building were able to point us in the right direction to the Visitors center, there is a thorough security clearance, Absolutely stunning building

This was interesting to see and hear the history. We visited the Parliament by recommendation of our Tour Guide. It was interesting and educational. Walking the Halls and Rooms of this Building, learning about the past and the future of the city and its People are best descripted by the Tour Guide there.
What a Gorgeous Building. Everytime we see it, we sigh. It looks great during the day and majestic during the evening. A genius of a building.
Guided. we took the guided french tour ( check the hours of the tour) its one of the "not to miss" places, and you can see it clearly from the boat cruise.

Stunning building. We took the English tour of the Parliament, Tickets are available at the visitor centre, we bought our ticket a couple of hours before the start of the tour. Tickets are cheaper for EU citizens.The building is stunning, the crown is just a small part of it because the corridors with gold celings and the parliament hall were absolutely beautiful. The guide spoke very good English and provided interesting information.

Don't leave Budapest without taking a night cruise past Parliament!. A massive, impressive building viewed during the daytime, Budapest's Parliament was spectacular lighted up at night and viewed from a Danube cruise boat.

I'd be on the fence for recommending . This was probably my least favourite thing I did when travelling solo to Budapest. I went with a friend from my hostel, and we thought it was ok.The tour guide was informative, but I found it difficult to hear her at times and occasionally found it a bit dull compared to other tour guides I'd met in BudapestThe building is stunning however, and some amazing parts to it. I'd say that if you do go, just go for any language tour as for the English one seemed a bit dull. It is very stunning, so I'd probably say go visit it if I'm pushed into a yes/no decision.
Magnificent. One of the biggest and prettiest monuments i have seen so far. It shows its beauty better from cross the river.

Amazing. This is a spectacular sight. Also, a number of underground museums are located just outside the building. These are very interesting and are completely free of charge. The parliament is a must see for any person visiting Budapest.
Parliament of Hungary. This building is just incredibly beautifull. I love it, you must visit it if you come to Hungary. There are other nice places nearby because it is in the center of Budapest.

Stunning but very expensive for the short tour.... Firstly, buy the expensive tickets online. Print it out and take a copy with you. When you arrive at the main entrance, which is down the steps to your right as you face the parliament building and river, you will be greeted with a mad house of people, all wondering where to go. Just wait near the area where you need to get your bags scanned etc. 10 minutes before your allocated time. The tour leader will arrive and tell you how to proceed. Inside, the decoration is simply jaw dropping.

Mesmerizing to visit. This is a very opulent building, both inside and out, with much to see and do. The guide was very informative gave us time to take photos etc, although no photography was allowed where the crown jewels are kept, you do get to visit the room though and security is very strict about photos.
Stunning!. The majesty of the parliament building, and the grandness of the scale, is impressive. The beauty of the interior makes the tour and admission charge well worth it.

It's ok . Maybe it's because we just saw the parliament in Bucharest, Romania but we weren't impressed with this one. It's still a nice building and worth a visit if you're in town. Buy your ticket online to avoid the long lines plus I think there might be a discount. The tour is about 45mins to 1 hour long. During parts of the tour photography is not allowed, which they strictly enforce.
Official guided tour - worth while doing. Definitely pre-book before your trip - you will save a lot of time and effort hanging around. Visitor centre is by the right hand side of the square

Really crowded. Bad experience with the personal, not about their English level but because they were unable to explain themselves. (They didn't tell us at the counter that we had to keep the ticket, and inside a woman started almost to yell saying only 'ticket, ticket!') Hottest sauna was 55 C° (finish) thats quite low, considering how big the place is. Also the water wasn't really hot enough, the could have at least one really hot pool. Inside the little pools the water was quite dirty :/ Really big place but we expected much more.

Amazing place!. Go on the tour of parliament, the building and its history are absolutely amazing! Don't stand too close to the guards when viewing the crown jewels - they have swords and do complicated ceremonial manoeuvres with them! Stunning place :)

Tip: don't miss your tour time! . We arrived 8 minutes late and missed our tour time! Absolutely our fault. Reception were super accomodating and let us join the next tour... this happened to be a Russian speaking tour. While we didn't understand anything. .tour guides gave a lengthy discussion about the parliament and seemed to be genuinely interested in sharing their knowledge. Would love to go again and join the English tour!! It's a gorgeous building from the inside and outside!
Beautiful. Great photo opportunity. Lovely setting. Looks like a fairytale castle rather than a political centre

Excellent building, pre-book if you can!. Had a great visit to the Parliament building. We didn't pre-book so we couldn't get tickets to the first tour (you need to have your tickets to enter). We were able to get tickets to an afternoon tour & it was great. The tour was about 45 mins & they answered all of our questions. Not an old building, but beautiful & impressive nonetheless.

Stunning. Beautiful day and night. You have to see it in both. Didn't go in but it's beautiful to look at from the outside. Go across to the Buda side to get a photo of the whole building. Good views from the castle area too.

Beautiful!. Interesting tour, which lasted about 30 minutes. You're allowed to take pictures inside, and you're probably going to want to. Really, really great looking inside and out, very impressive. Reportedly there's 42Kg of gold leaf all of the walls, pillars, ceilings, and just about anything else you can see in there, which makes for a very shiny and striking appearance.The tour felt a little short, but it was worth doing and was well worth the money.A must see in Budapest!
I only regret to not being able to see the interiors. This is a stunning building. A true icon of Budapest. I took a number of pictures of it at at the daylight and in the evening.

Another Budapest landmark. If you are in Budapest you have to go here. It's one of the nicest and most impressive buildings I've ever seen. Great for photos. It's also worth stopping in at the 1958 area as well
Amazing. One of the most amazing buildings in Budapest, on the Pest side of the city. Must see sight since the square was recently renovated.
Wonderful Building. This is a must-see both on foot and from the river. Very ornate. We caught the changing of the guard which was 'interesting'.
Beattiful. In such a stunning location. You cannot leave Budapest without seeing this in both daylight and at nightime!!
Beautiful Architecture. The architecture of many of the older buildings are very beautiful. The parliment is no exception. I do not konw if its possible to see the inside.
Azazing building. Great place for photos and go visit the 1956 exhibit underneath in the square. Well lit up at night. Next to the river and the childrens shoes on the riverbank
It makes me wanna be a politician!. Incredible architecture design! At night is so bright! Inside the building there are more interesting memorials! I had bought a slingshot!

A Parliamentary treat. First time in Budapest, the Parliament building had to be on my to do list. It just so happens that my girlfriend had a Hungarian friend that has a contact in parliament so we got a personal tour as opposed to the Organised ones. The building is absolutely stunning and has a lot of history hidden inside!I highly recommend a visit!

Lovely Historic building, lack luster tour.. We were disappointed. They wasted a lot of time counting people and getting our group tickets. Then we waited in another line for our English speaking guide. I found the material to be lacking in history.
Beautiful building. Very impressive and beautiful architecture. A must see for all visitors. Take the tour if you get a chance.

Very interesting. Stunning building.
We bought a tour in English on the day we visited and were able to persuade the cashier to sell us tickets although we had forgotten our ID. Well worth doing as the interior is as beautiful as the exterior.

Budapest Parliament is a Must See. In US, you can only visit the capital, but only Washington compares, but does not have the beauty of this European architecture. Only London and Buenos Aries are larger, but this place is pristine with numerous limestone, carved monuments and historical hero statues. Viewable from just about anyplace in Buda across the river day or night, its one of the most beautiful governmental buildings in the world.The grounds are so clean there is nothing for the birds to eat.There is a coffee shop onsite near the tourist store, but there is a really good, trendy bistro across the street named, Elyse'e Bistro, great food and Wi-Fi, good prices. Also near the back of the Parliament building, just a few hundred feet along the Danube is a memorial titled, Shoes on the Danube, dedicated to the Jews who were murdered during WW2 and tossed in the river.

Beautiful Architecture That Words Cannot Describe !. Not to miss the impressive sight and architectural beauty that the parliament has to offer! Apparently it is ranked as number 1 for the most beautiful parliament building and its not hard to see why, magnificent arches neo-gothic design, incredible dome... do I need to say more, incredible both during the day and night not to miss when it is all lit up.The building is still the largest in Hungary and tallest in Budapest. It is also one of Europe’s oldest legislative buildings. You are welcome.Please note the attraction and square is free to view, but if you would like to go inside for a tour, that will cost you money. (Book early as there are set tours per day and they sell out fast) !

Beautiful Structure Day or Night.... Beautiful Building... Tours are offered only so many times a day in your language, so buy your tickets ahead of time on line. Saw more than one person turn around & leave as the language/tour they were looking for was sold out/no longer available that day. The Parliament building is beautiful inside & out. You are allowed to take pictures almost everywhere. Don't plan on standing around gawking or gazing though as each tour has an escort/guard moving you along. Felt that being rushed through the place was a negative, and there were too many people on the tour. This made it hard to understand/hear the tour guide. Still worth doing as the building is a must see. There is a gift shop & over-price snack on sight as well...
Simply amazing. You think you've seen it all , but when you get inside it's a completely different story . worth your time .

Amazing building. The parliament building sits alongside the Danube, and is often shown in adverts for river cruises! Built in the late 19th century when the Austro-Hungarian empire had money to burn, no expense was obviously spared here. A 45 minute tour is available, but be warned, this is an active building, so security is tight for visitors. It is best to book online, 1 or 2 days in advance. There is a box office next door, but this only sells tickets for the current day, on tour slots that are not fully booked-so the available tour may not be in your language! The building can be reached on Tram route 2.
A very beautiful and unique building.. We took the tour of the Parliament building and I usually do not like tours with a crowd of people. The tour guide was engaging and knowledgeable.

Stunning Architecture. Fantastic building to visit which looks phenomenal both during the day and even more so under the illuminations at night. We took the tour which lasts about an hour. The tour was informative, showed you the main chambers and kept the interest of all guests. We bought the tickets in advance on the web which was a bonus and saved standing in-line and taking passports documents.
Excellent. Α making architecture and very nice gardens around it...right opposite by the river side you will find the famous shoes....

Nothing Understated Here! Exponential Elegance. We toured the Parliament building for about two hours. Even though the outside of the building is beautiful to behold and rather imposing, it was the interior of the building that took my breath away. It was elegant. There was so much gold that it was closing in on the line between majestic and gaudy.Parliament was in session and there were visiting dignitaries about the halls. There are more than a few steps, but elevator service was available to the less hardy folks.The guide was very knowledgeable and answered our many questions with ease.
spectacular building. wonderful experience. dining on a cruise in Danube with these historical buildings in the background.... mesmerizing experience!

Spectacular inside and out. The view from the Danube is breathtaking.Reductions for EU citizens if you take your passport,unfortunately the company we went with neglected to tell us.Best just go under your own steam.Guided tour is brief but well worth doing.Hungarian Coronation regalia included in the tour. Avoid the tat in the shop some of the worst we've seen.

An excellent visit. It's worth it to see the crown jewels and the guards around it alone. Make sure you book in advance to get the time and day you want. It is a bit manic in the reception area when busy so listen out for your tour call or ask the staff so you don't miss out.
Beautiful. This was beautiful and very ornate. Lots of walking around so be prepared for that. Well worth the visit.

A Magnificient Stately Building. It takes your breath away, its that Stately. Standing on the Danube it overlooks the Pest side and one wonders how the inhabitants of this beautiful city, Budapest , handled years under the communist regime of the Soviets..

Impressive. Our tour offered us a great insight of the Hungarian history. The views from the Parlament over Buda were quite breathtaking. Only a small part of the building is actually visitable, but it's well worth the time and money.

Majestic. Standing on the Buda part of Budapest, this majestic building is steeped in history. It is one of the most beautiful sights in the night which can be enjoyed during a river cruise or if you are walking the promenades on the pest bank.
Budapest's most beautiful building.. Stunning. That's all I can say. Truly the most amazing sight in the city. Do yourself a favour and go see it. Inside is worth a look too. Don't miss.

Impressive Place. I had the opportunity to take a tour of this magnificent place, truly impressive architecture. I was able to do it independently, but I am guessing you could book a tour ahead of time too. Definitely a place to add to you list on your visit to Budapest.

Parliment. The building was incredible. Very nice. It is like a jewel in besides the Danube river.
The information issued very nice at the end of the tour.
It must be seen by all tourists in budapest.

Impressive building but badly organized. The building itself is impressive, as well from the outside as from the inside. To go in you need to book in advance via a website or go on the day itself and try to get a ticket at the visitor center. At the visitor center you start the tour. It's very unclear when you have to get in line for the security check. There are a lot of TV screens showing a lot of information but apparently it's not possible to show the information guests really need. If they would just state which guest needed to go through security things would go a lot smoother. The tour itself was chaotic since more groups walked through each other and the guide talked trough a small audio system which was hard to follow.
Amazing Structure. Built during the Hapsburg Austrian-Hungarian Empire, this structure has retained its splendor and luster and its history is fascinating

Magnificent inside and out. It is a beautiful structure to observe outside and equally grand on the inside. The tour size seemed a bit too large but our guide was great and spoke loudly enough so we could hear. You can't visit may rooms as this is a functional government facility, however, the few places you are allowed to see contain beautiful craftsmanship and decorative details. The Gold staircase is really stunning as is the Session room. Book your tickets online to ensure you have a spot as certain languages only occur during specific times each day. Also, the tour starts at the visitor center which is (if you are facing the front of the Parliament building) to the left and down the stairs.

You have to atleast see it from the outside!. We saw this on our Segway tour and its a very impressive building.. we didn't do a tour inside but changing of the guard and the outside is well worth a visit.Beautiful large building and you can see it from miles around!
1956 exhibition worth a vist. Did not do the parliament because of time but the 1956 exhibition is well worth a visit if you have just an hour or so to spare

Stunning place. Plan and buy the tickets early on line to avoid disappointment. I went in on Saturday midday and found out all the tickets were sold out, I was very disappointed with the bad news because I was planned to go back on Sunday. However, one local tour guide sell me the spare ticket for me without any additional cost, that was down to pure luck. The tour lasted about 1hr long, very interesting elements.
what a building. Gorgous building on the banks of the danute, very impressive at night compliments buda castle well worth a look

Truly grand. You must take a tour of the inside and pay about $20 entrance. Do not waste time on private tours. The building is best seen from a boat on the Danube and at night is one of the grandest views in the world. Get a private guide to explain the extensive history of events outside the building.

Breathtaking style. The architecture both inside and out are fantastic. The tour had some interesting highlight and showed off the magnificent structure. Definitely worth booking in advance and taking the time to visit

Superb. We pre-booked a guided tour in English at the Hotel Reception. Our guide was very knowledgeable regarding Hungarian history and politics. The building itself is impressive for its size - the largest Parliament in Europe at the time of its construction in 1902 - and its finest and magnificent gothic façade overlooking the Danube.During the Tour you will have the opportunity to see the Crown Jewels in the Domed Hall, the sumptuous Grand Staircase and other rooms of great interest and beauty. Photos are allowed in all rooms with the exception of the Crown Jewels.

Like a palace. This is a pretty impressive building and worth a tour. You can buy tickets online the day before to ensure when you arrive they have a tour in your desired language. If you want to avoid the service charge just go the day before and buy your tickets at the entrance. The tourist entrance is located at the far end of the building. There are stairs that take you downstairs to a large waiting area. You will see a que for tickets and a que for people waiting for their tour. I've attached a few photos that I took inside. It's about a 15 minute walk along the river from the chain bridge.

The Parliament Building is Awesome!. I have seen many buildings, castles, palaces in Europe but none are as beautiful as the Parliament building in Budapest! I saw that I could make a reservation for a tour which is the only way to see it so I made the reservation and paid with a credit card. I then printed out the receipt so I would have the bar code and reservation time and date. Let me just say to be very careful about the time and date that you make your reservation. We made ours for the day of arrival in Budapest and I should have made the reservation for the next day. We made it by 5 minutes! I can't even describe the beauty of this building on the inside so make that reservation and go. You really have to see it to believe it!
The most stunning building ever!. This is truly magnificent, I guess I could stare at it for hours, either day or night. Worth seeing.
Nice . Defenetly one of must see places in Budapest. You can go there with a free walking tour but ask them furst if its included.

Save your $ and view from Outside!. I agree with Brave Jane. View from the outside as the tour we took and booked 2 days in advance for a Monday tour which was not worth the $25p.p. .paid for a 45 mins.tour of which took 15 mins to clear security where everyone had to put all their belongings including coats, jacket through the security scanner. Basically what we heard I could have read on internet if you could hear at all since the group is so large. True inside is magnificent to see but the tour was so short that I think everyone expected to see more and were surprised the tour was over. Definitely not worth the money paid. Don't know how Jeff got close to an hour tour. We were told in advance the tour was only 45 mins. and this of course is without factoring at least min.10 mins for security check.If you do book thru your iphone and cannot print out your tickets, all you do is take take your iphone with the email confirmation ahead of time to the clerk at the information desk and she will print out the tickets for you. We did not know this in advance and had to go to ask at the Parliament information desk and ask. You can only purchase same tickets but most likely all the tickets for English will be sold out. You also cannot purchase advance tickets at the information desk. They tell you to purchase tickets on line yourself and they will print the tickets for you if you cannot print them out yourself.I also would not have paid so much money for so little if I knew what I know now.

Awesome architecture!!. This is absolutely a must see. My wife and I both unconsciously said "wow" when we first saw the building in person as we approached by foot. I recommend taking a tour of the inside as well. This building really is a significant symbol of Hungary.
An Excellent structure. A must visit in Budapest, situated on the river bank connected by metro and tram. Evening when lightning is on it's a beautiful sight to watch.
Monument . Very impressive building, especially at night! There's also a free wi fi over there! :D must see monument in the city
Outstanding Tour. Fantastic tour of the Parliament Building in Budapest, really interesting tour guide and lovely on the inside. Worth going on the full guided tour to see this magnificent building.

Breathtaking beautiful. The Parliament is breathtakingly beautiful viewed at night from the banks of the Danube River at the Buda side. A guided tour is required to see the inside of the building which is as beautiful as the outside. The tour lasted for approximately 45 minutes and is very informative A must see when visiting the country.

Excellent Tour. The tour of the Parliament building is a great experience. Get tickets online to avoid lines and booked tours at the ticket office. I used jegymester.hu and it was super easy. You print your tickets after you purchase them and never have to go to the ticket lines. The experience lasts about an hour and our guide was very informative and professional.) You visit several of the rooms, view the crown jewels, watch a guard change, and visit the chamber of Hungary’s upper house of parliament. There are quite a few steps involved in the tour (an elevator is available but few chose to use it.) Photographs are allowed, except in the Dome Room where the crown jewels are located. Security staff follow the tour to enforce that rule.

Still a beauty. We were told that the most photographed building in Hungary has just been banned from being seen in close up. We were informed that upon fear of assassination, local leaders have deprived tourists of this beauty . Great news. It is as beautiful from afar and inspiring at night.
Beautiful. We took the guided tour in hebrew and it was really good. Short and comprehensive.Whoever likes to photograph a lot will enjoy it.

A bit over-hyped?. Ok so this is a gorgeous building and I guess people visit because they feel like yes, you must while you're in Budapest. At least, so did I. It's definably nice and it's a guided tour which makes it more interesting. However it's not that much of a must see, compared to the exterior. Getting tickets is a bit of a thing. You must either book in advance or show up, buy a ticket for a certain time slot and come back at that time. Tours do sell out completely about 2 or 3 hours in advance. Is it worth the planning? If I knew what I know now I wouldn't have paid to go inside.
Pretty. We didn't go inside, but the look of the Parliament outside in every angle is so pretty, my favorite spot is across the Danube river. A must see in Budapest

Spectacular!,. Wonderful building right on the banks of the Danube. We did the tour which started at the visitor centre adjacent to the parliament building. Tours go off every hour roughly in many different languages so make sure you book the right language. They can be booked online the previous day or you can go along to the visitor centre on the day, but often English tours are sold out so call in first thing in the morning and reserve places for the tour that suits you. Tour lasts about 45 mins and is most interesting, this was our favourite tour of the trip.

Stunning building. You will need to book your guided tour for a specific time so be prepared to book ahead or arrive on the day and return later after paying for you ticket when your next language slot is available. It's sounds a bit of a faff but it's worth it. The tour is interesting even if it is not an especially long tour. You will see all the important areas including St Stephens crown, just don't stand too close the the guards. It's a stunning building and a must on an itinerary for Budapest.

Great place to visit, guided tour a must. I visited Parliament on a holiday with my friend. She had booked us a guided tour before we came away and it's entirely worth it. The building is absolutely beautiful and the history is so interesting. You can't fail to be impressed by the architecture and the setting, really good and interesting tour and really glad we did it.

beautiful building. We did not go inside this building but well worth walking to just for the architecture. We saw change of the guards outside and they have a nice water feature adding attraction to this building
Magnificent view. A must see both during daytime and at night. The building is a masterpiece and the view with its lights to shine in the danube waters is astonishing.
most beautiful building by the river. must visit and just below the Parliament, on the river bank there are few shoes ..... go in the evening... beautiful site.

An organised visit. This is a very busy attraction but certainly worth a visit. Understandably tours are organised and I would recommend that you book online before you arrive. The tour is interesting and informative.
Stunning Building. Amazing to look at does not look like a Parliament Building more like a Palace well worth a walk around the area lots of different buildings to see

Fascinating & beautiful, LOTS of steps - reserve ahead of time if you want tour in English. This is a fascinating and beautiful place. There is a terrific tour available in English but you need to reserve ahead of time if you want it - otherwise you may have to wait for hours.You can opt for an elevator - otherwise there are 135 steps up from the front desk to the area where you walk around and look at the various rooms that are used by Parliament members.You can learn a lot about the history of the country by coming here - strongly recommended.The building also is stunning at night from the Danube - if possible take both the inside building tour and arrange to go by the building at night.

The most emblematic building. If in Budapest, it's impossible to miss the Parliament building. It's really impressive (but did not get "Excellent" due to some misleading information the official guide told us). There are beautiful rooms and you see works of art and history. It's very important to book ahead!
budapest break. came to Budapest for a long weekend break and this is definitely one to see it is a magnificent building itd like a fairy tale building
Iconic views and setting. The perfect setting and style of the this beautiful buildingWalk around the building to the reflection pool at the back.
Amazing. The place is amazing! Great construction! Very interesting, really really worth visiting. The tour is so so, but it is very beautiful and outstanding inside, so you have to take the tour..

A stunning, beautiful parliament. Beautiful architecture, stunning view particularly when look at from a Danube cruise ship or from Buda Castle on the opposite side. The most beautiful parliament i've ever seen.
Brilliant . Amazing building architecture is mind blowing. Also next to it some mist was blow from under the ground which cooled us down on a hot day.

budapest. see it night on one of the river tour boats. Every thing lights up and it is very impressive. All the monuments, buildings, bridges, and all the river boats shine at night. Daytime is nice but night is much more impressive.

Good for a rainy Budapest day. We enjoyed finding out about the history of Hungary and Budapsest . Had an informative guide. Quite a short tour but we booked online before we went and as EU members it wasn't expensive. fantastic building inside and out especially at night with the lights form the other sid eof the Danube. So clean . Reasonable coffee shop in vistors centre helped as well.

Jimmy Carter and the Crooked Cross. “He wouldn’t like it,” she said assuredly. “Wouldn’t like it? Why?” I exclaimed. “It’s not his thing,” she continued with complete conviction. “Why?” I persisted monotonically. “Don’t know,” she conceded instantly. I found it hard to fathom any measure of indifference one could retain when faced with such lavishness and magnificence. There was gold leaf by the kilogram gilding the relief moldings of every column pedestal. Entire walls were constructed of pink and blue marble throughout the massive domed structure. Inaugurated during the illustrious but fleeting reign of the Austro-Hungarian Empire (an early 1900’s world power), Hungary’s parliament majestically overlooks the River Danube. Well-organized tours are offered throughout the complex, in a variety of languages, including sneak peaks into the working parliamentary rooms. The jewel in the crown of the tour, quite literally, is the medieval gold crown of Saint Stephen, which is on display but guarded 24/7 under the dome of the colossal gothic legislative edifice.Nevertheless, my wife contends that this is of no interest to my brother-in-law. A few weeks before we arrived in Budapest my American kin traveled thousands of miles to join a cruise where he apparently declined to visit all the main attractions, including the magnificent St. Stephen’s Cathedral, Parliament, the palace, and countless other wonders of Austro-Hungaro historical significance. I wait eagerly to read the detailed review of his room.Sometime back in the 1600’s, the treasured crown was locked away in a box in a bad way, bending its cross. At the onset of World War II it was stored at Fort Knox and only by controversial presidential decree was it returned to its rightful place of origin. Jimmy Carter is a rock star in these parts.
Really worth the guided tour.. Astonishing building and the guided tour was very very interesting A must view in Budapest. klojkiio

The Parlament Building lit up at night is breathtaking.. The Parliament is very beautiful and huge building and you must go. You should go for a night river cruise because the Parliament amazing in the lights! The Parlament Building lit up at night is breathtaking. You have to take a tour inside as well, it is spectacular inside also.
Hungarian Parliament. It was a 45 minute tour which was informative and showed the parliament building in all its glory, a must see.Please book on line or in advance since tours fill up fast.
I Amazing at night. What a beautiful building this is, we took a boat trip at night along the Danube and it looks fantastic all lit up, best way to see it

Amazing architecture. An absolute must do in Budapest. Make sure you buy your tickets in advance, we bought on line before leaving home and avoided the queue at the ticket office. Guide was informative, tour went for 45 minutes and there were plenty of opportunities to take photos.

Nice visit. We were a bit disappointed that the Hebrew guide wasn't available at 12/10/15 for some reason altough it was written in the site, but not available for ordering.
The visit is nice.
Recommend guided tour. Fantastic building, recommend doing the tour and on a day when MPs not sitting (Thursdays and Fridays I think) so that you get to see the parliamentary chamber.

Plan Ahead. This is a worthwhile site to visit if you appreciate opulence, but book ahead online, as the tour in your language may already be full if you wait until you arrive. Photos are allowed, except in the area of the crown jewels. Explore the surrounding grounds afterwards.
beautiful. I viewed the Parliament at night and during the day. It is impressive regardless and a must see when visiting Budapest. I
Lovely Building. Make sure you make advance reservations (or book through one of the HOp on & OFF BUS TOURS) you cant just walk in!

Excellent visit to the interior of the Parliament House.. Make time to visit an organised tour of the Parliament. Excellent experience. Can be booked in advance, good to go at the end of the day. Nice cafe to relax while waiting to join the tour.

Fun, informative tour that doesn't take too long or make you feel tired afterward!. One of the more organized and institutional tourist spots in Budapest, Parliament is a great way to spend an hour of your time in the city. The architecture is gorgeous and the history is compelling, it was one of the few times any Hungarian person enthusiastically wants to tell you about the country (the normal people are normally very reserved and it would take time for a tourist to get to warm up to them, at least that was my experience in the short time there). Very much enjoyed seeing the facilities, and when we visited, the elevator was broken so we got to see even more as we had to move through the normally closed off staircases and corridors. Of particular note was the great accessories for the king (sword, crown, etc.) stored in the middle of the building!
We saw from the outside and at night. Impressive sight though a bit freaky at night. The whole building had bats swarming all over it. not far from the land of Dracula......

Spectacular. A must see place when you are in Budapest. Can't miss it. The place is so gorgeous day or night. Best view is go across the river to see it light up at night or hike up Citadel and view from the above.Highly recommended!

Very pretty. An extremely pretty building that is on the edge of the tourist area in Budapest. A little bit of a hike out here but so worth it. It sits along the bank of the Danube. Make sure as you walk back toward the heart of Budapest to do it along the Danube so you don't miss the Shoes on the Danube only about 150-200 yards away. This memorial is to honor the Jews who were ordered to take off their shoes, shot at the waters edge so their bodies fell in the river and carried away. It is so moving!Don't miss it or Budapest!!!

Sumptuous elegance. The view of the grand staircase from the top is wondrous. It is also a treat to see St Stephens crown because it means so much to Hungarians.The building is not very old but it is a gem both inside and out and the view from Buda on the other side of the river has to be the iconic memory of this delightful city

Amazing building. Well worth the effort. You must pre book your tickets...we turned up twice on spec to buy tickets and all English tours were sold out. However, our 8.45 tour only had 8 people on it and was great. The building inside and out is spectacular. We had the added bonus of seeing the changing of the guard for the Crown Jewels.

a piece of pearl of Hungary. The building of the Parliament is truly a piece of pearl of Hungary. We went there last weekend and altough we just walked there in the evening from Margaret Island, the whole view was amazing. As we were walking by the beautiful Danube getting closer and closer to the building, it became more and more spectacular. The sight when the whole building lit up with yellow lights is eye-catching. You can even feel the power of the enormous edifice as you walk in front of it. The dome and the walls in the evening lights..breathtaking. The hungarian Parliament has a lot of history, take time do a little research before visiting. Can’t wait to take a boat ride to see it from the river. Already prepared my camera. It’ll be unique I’m sure.

A must see... maybe. This is an incredibly beautiful building inside and out. The tour we took was rushed, the group was too big, and not a lot of interesting was shared by the guide. I feel like if we had skipped the tour we wouldn't have missed much.
No 1. Use the tram number 2 .. has 2 routes! With some walking in between. Very impressive also if you are traveling on a boat. Recommended MeuterMedia

Spectacular building, be sure to reserve a tour. The building exterior is now famous from Viking Cruise advertisements. The interior is spectacular. Tours in English (and other languages) are available, and are the only way to see the interior of the building. Tour tickets are available on-line, and can sell out several days in advance. Kids might be bored with the tour. Tip: - the tour entrance to the building is an underground structure on the upriver end of the building. Most tourists will be approaching from the downriver side, and will need to walk around the building.
PARLIAMENT OF BUDAPEST. This is a beutiful building. You can seat and enjoying looking this wonderful building. It really worth visiting and walking around it. Take some pictures, etc. .

Like a dream. Especially by night from a boat.. It's kind of silly to review the Parlament building, but nevertheless it never stops impressing me. Especially the views from the river at night are like a dream.
fairytale. as much as it is wonderful to see outside, visit to the interior was worth it. well organized and easy to access
Stunning building. Amazing to see and better in the evening as it is lit by hundreds of light, a view to see along the river, dominating the view.

Gorgeous visit nicely explained. It is an impressive building from the outside but the inside is gorgeous. The visit of the place takes about 45 minutes, depending on when you visit you willl be able to see more or less of the building. The best day would be Sunday because there is no political activity and therefore you may have the chance to see more of the building. You MUST book in advance, all visits are guided visits and you need to book one in order to be able to go inside. The visitors center where you can book / buy your tickets is located underground next to the Nothern side of the building, clearly marked. It can be booked online which is the way to go.... we got there at 9:30 and we only managed to get tickets in a language we would understand at 13:30. It is worth the visit.
One of the most beautiful building in Budapest. As the Parliament has renewed, it gaves the whole place a great look, the square and everything around. Very nice.
Stunning!!. This is one of the most beautiful buildings I have ever seen. It is breathtaking, especially when seen from the Danube at night.

The most beautiful parliament of the world. As I live in Budapest, I can have a look at this building every day BUT...I don't go to see the building at every day. W my business partners I wanted to do a sight seeing and the Parliament building has been offered to me.Very good suggestions was, unbelievable good experience. My partners loved it and I also picked up a lots of information about this hugh historical building. Why is there a gn bullet whole in the main podium, how many one piece stone coloumn are in the main entrance and many things about the crown jewelery.Do this prgramme if you are in Budapest, easy and very interresting, it is about 1,5 hours long.Good luck guys, thanks for coming to Budapest. Also must visit the Spoon Boat Restaurant by the Chain Bridge at the dock 3.Don't forget the advantaged of the week Hunagrian currency - Forint (HUF). You got more for your money.
Super beautiful when lit at night!. This must be the most beautiful parliament building anywhere in the world, especially at night!! A must visit in Budapest!

One of the most beautiful buildings in Budapest. An great example of the beautiful architecture you can see in Budapest. You can see the outside of the building from land or when taking a relaxing Danube River cruise.If you want to take a tour of the building then this must be booked in advance on line or in person at the ticket office. The price is fair. We had our holiday at peak time and was still able to do this without a problem and only a couple of days in advance. The taking of photos is allowed, but unfortunately not in the dome where the Hungarian Holly Crown is on display.
First Visit to Budapest . Not the cleanest of cities, did not enjoy the food, unfortunately had a bad flight so a bit grumpy flight,flightgrggrumpygrumpyarrarrival
The "first building" of the country. Marvellous outside also, but take your chance inside at a reasonable fee. Its original lead-glass windows are worth visiting.

Incredible night vision. The Orszahag is the most beautiful building in Pest, and overnight enlightened is an incredible view, with bird storms flying around its 96 meters tall top. It's definitely a place to visit,although the indoor tour shows you no more than 3-4 rooms, and the Crown is seen from some distance.
Must see!. We booked a tour in this incredibly grandad fascinating building. The tour guide was great and very informative. Well worth the money and a must see in Budapest.
Impressive. Well worth a visit ! Booked tickets for the 45 minute guided tour which we thoroughly enjoyed , very interesting .

Stunning to see. Be aware that you must buy a ticket to get inside the building. We waited in line for about 20 minutes to get tickets only to find out that they are only sold as a guided tour. Since the next English tour was four hours away, we left. Another note: visitors from EU pay approx 2000Huf for an adult ticket, but non-EU visitors pay 5200Huf. Given the number of people that visit each day, I would suggest getting there early in the day.

Worthwhile tour, small caveats. Be certain to make a reservation, don't just show up or they may not have room, and you cannot use an electronic ticket for entry, so get there with time to spare. You are forced to wait in same line with people who are attempting to reserve a spot for later tours - we jumped to the front and flagged someone down who helped us, or we would have missed our tour. It was a chaotic scene on a Friday morning. Tickets are pricey for non-EU citizens as well.Tour itself, once you are in, is well-organized. Information was a little superficial (language barrier, perhaps?), but the building interiors are impressive, and there are ample opportunities for picture-taking. Excellent gift-shop.
Gorgeous!. Must see it from Budim side of the city. Exelent by the day as well by the ñight. Great arhitekture. Loved it!
The Parliament is very grand!. On the day we visited The Parliament, it was raining. However, it didn't ruin our excitement to see this grand old building in Budapest!

Just stunning. Visit!. You have seen these place on every Viking Tours ad when they come around the corner. It does not look real. It looks like a place they put up during the day and take down at night. Surreal.And not that old!

Informative. Brief tour of Hungarian Parliament building. Tours are through out the day in various languages. Had difficulty hearing tour guide at times as group of school children were nearby, also on a tour. Interesting to hear history of the building and of Hungary. Beautiful building, inside and out
Must see!. An absolut fantastic building, inside and out. The tour is a little short but informative. Bring your best camera.

Mr. There is no doubt the quality of the building and the beauty all around. There is most definitely money in government, but we already knew that! My concern was the quality of the English tour guide, not her personally, just her heavily accented English transmitted through an electronic headset. There were times in the vast areas of the building where the echo made the narration completely incomprehensible.

Very "Gold". You will tour this site with a guide and must sign up for a tour. You will be screened by Security before you enter: no large bags are allowed and anything resembling a weapon (even a pen) may be confiscated. A Security guard accompanies the small tour group. He is very vigilant and opens and locks rooms after the group. There are 120 steps at the beginning of the tour but there is an elevator that is convenient for those with minor mobility issues. You are allowed to take photos in all areas except the one where you probably would most want to do that : the guards of the royal crown room.

Worth a visit!. Definitely worth visiting BUT book tickets in advance or check your languages and times before you go. We didn't get to do a tour as no English one was available the afternoon we were there. It is a beautiful building right on the river bank.

‪Parliament Visit. We visited the Budapest ‪Parliament
Very nice and interesting place
Make sure to book your tickets in advance.
beautiful historic building. The building is beautiful with nice surroundings.At night it looks even more impressive from a boat .
nice to see. great bulding, nice to visit. nice view from river, it is at river bank. if you spend few days in Budapest you can visit it together with St Istvan bazilika.

Beautiful architecture. Parliament house is a beautiful building that looks like old palace temple on the bank of danueve .Also a war memorial- 'shoes on danueve' is there. Rear side of parliament is marked by beautical facade and supreme court and other old buildings .Bridges eg Margaret bridge , ring bridge , liberty bridge and elizabeth bridge are all situated near parliment connecting BUDA with PEST. Take a tram ride (NO-2) ad also go for river cruise .All around Danueve ,on pest side beautiful old buiildings , bridges , hotels , markets etc are located .Must click pictures. Vaci street is full tourists and shops for marketing - must visit place.
visit at night!. this building is one of the most impressive I have ever seen when its lit up a night. Take a trip an view from across the other side of the river. Its a wow moment to admire it.
A Budapest must!. conveniently situated and within easy walking distance of most major hotels. A guided tour is informative and worth the fees

Stunning building.. Budapest offers amazing views, every single corner of this city is beyond beautiful. This place is not the exception. During the daytime or even at nighttime, this building is amazing.

Beautifule Building. We enjoyed our tour of Parliament but in a city where everything is inexpensive we found $25 for what turned out to be a 30 minute tour a bit pricey considering there were at least 25 people int he tour and it wasn't always easy to hear her.But for the money you get to see an amazing building and learn more about Hungary's history.

Impressive building and very interesting tour. The hotel booked the tour for us and at 2200HUF each for EU visitors it was well worth it. English guide was very informative and happy to answer our questions.
Not a great value. Over $20 for non-EU, bad online purchase process. Tour was slow, crowded and short. Our guide did not seem to want to be there. Wish we had spent our time on other things.

Hungarian nationalism. The inside is just as impressive as the outside, but the best view is still from the Buda side of the river, at night. The only way to get inside is to follow a guided tour, and the price is much higher for people from outside the EU. Also, one has to go through a security check like at the airport, and if the guided groups are full there is no way to get in, so it is best to get tickets a few hours before and then walk around the outside, or look at something else for a bit. There is also a café which I did not try. Anyway, this means visiting takes a lot more time than the tour itself.The tour isn't very long. It is interesting if you are interested in history, politics or architecture, but in some way the impressiveness of the building becomes less impressive simply because it was built to impress. Still, it is beautiful, and visitors are allowed to take pictures in all but one room on the tour.For the visitor with less time or less interest in buildings, just take a walk around it or enjoy the view from theBuda side or one of the bridges.

Well Organized Tour. Purchased my ticket from the www.jegymester.hu site before hand, and though the tour is expensive for Budapest (specially for non-EU citizens), I think spending the extra 200 forint to pre-order is worth it. You guarantee yourself a time and you don't have to stand in a purchase line (long one when I was there) when you arrive, then maybe have to come back later in the day (was there for a 10:00 am tour and they were selling afternoon tickets). You find the tour entrance at the North end of the square, down a wide set of stairs. One complaint, it would be nice if they had electronic sign specifying which tour was going through the security scanners, instead of just someone trying to talk above the crowd. Security did not take long, as it should be a breeze if you spend any time watching the looping security films playing on a number of TVs in the lobby. Further, with security, you will be escorted by two guards throughout the building. The female member of our accompanying pair came armed with strong eye-roll ability for those barely paying attention to instructions as to where we were supposed to go.You start with a bit of a stair climb (though elevators are also available) and you are immediately struck by the extravagance you would expect from, what I grew up calling, the Austro-Hungarian Empire. I found the Hungarian part left off during my visit not just in Budapest, but also in Krakow and Prague. The tour was quite smooth, with the timed entry stopping any area from getting crowded. And our tour guide was an experienced hand who really knew her material. Outside, it is such a fabulous landmark. Be it from the square itself or from the Fisherman's Bastion across the Danube or while floating along the river. It is particularly beautiful when lit up at night.

Beautiful visit; buy tour tix in advance and save on waiting in line!. Gorgeous parliamentary building. Totally worth the touring price. Tour guides were very knowledgeable and had excellent English skills.
A majestic buildings. A stunning majestic and beautiful building. It looks even more beautiful in the night. A must visit place in Budapest.

Worth a visit for sure. Need to book yourself on a tour - only way of looking round. If you don't get there early, all the English speaking tours may book up. We decided to book on a Spanish tour, just so we could look round that day. I downloaded a fabulous app whilst at Parliament that gave me information as we went on the tour.
Stunning architecture.. We only saw the outside as the English tours had finished for the day, so I can only comment on the marvellous exterior architecture which is pretty impressive.

Amazing architecture. We thoroughly enjoyed our tour around this wonderful building. We went for a coffee while we waited for the English speaking tour to start. The guide was pleasant and very informative. Just stunning.

Very Very Impressive. Around every corner in Budapest there is something that catches your attention, if you're on the other side of the Danube or right in front of it, the Parliament building is something you cannot go to Budapest and not see.

A Must. We booked for a tour around the Parliament and could not believe the secuirty. We were picked up by a taxi and taken to a minibus where we had to produce photo I/D,. We were taken to and escorted into the building where we had to pass through airport type secuity and then we had an English speaking guide and a security man for our tour. This was excellent and the building is so opulent and steeped in history and photos caan be taken except where the crown jewels are. A lovely experience
Most beautiful building in the world?. Fantastic architecture with great surroundings. An absolute must-see for everyone visiting Budapest. Easy access by tram or metro.
Wonderful light of the Hungarian Parlament. Everybody need to see this wonderful building,mainly in the night with its uniqe,warm yellowish lights!

Hungarian Parliament. There are English tours during the day at a specific time. So don't think you are going to show up and take a tour. The price was 10,000 Foints. You will see very little of the inside of the building. It was Ok.
Worth seeing the parliament. A very impressive building inside and out. The crown jewel is inside as well but not allowed to take a picture of. Book ahead of time.

Budapest Parliament - Gorgeous Inside & Out!. The Budapest Parliament, at the edge of the Danube River, is a gorgeous building inside and out - both day and night! The exterior is an architectural jewel in the daylight. In the evening, the structure is brightly illuminated, showing the lovely design and attention to detail. The inside is equally well designed and appointed. All of the many large stained glass windows and statues, the huge stairways, the long hallways and the vaulted and highly decorated ceilings throughout the Parliament Building are all spectacular! The General Assembly Hall is large, well decorated and impressive. Many visitors were surprised to see the numbered cigar holders in the hallway outside the General Assembly Hall. The crown jewels of Hungary are available for viewing, but unfortunately no photos are allowed in this room. Happily, photos are allowed everywhere else at the Parliament building. We were lucky to be able to view the Parliament Building at night from the Danube while on a very pleasant evening dinner cruise.It is well worth a guided tour see the gorgeous interior and to learn about the importance of this building in the history of Hungary.

Budapest was Center of Austrian-Hungarian Empire: Parliament Buoding is Example of Wealth and Power. There was quite a crowd and the English tour was to begin in a couple of hours,CSA we just walked around and watched the guards. Quite impressive on the outside!
Imposing Edifice Dominates the Pest Skyline. Hungarians did an amazing job constructing this new-gothic centerpiece after the near total destruction after the soviets left. Highly recommended.
Worth doing the tour.. Amazing place. You can see 'changing of the guard'. Make sure you get tickets for the tour in the language of your choice. Accesible easy with tram car.
Very beautiful. The Parliament is very beautiful and you must go.It's necessary to make a reservation to visit all the place.
Wow!. Excellent tour. Easy to purchase tickets online.,A must see in Budapest! Tours offered in many languages. 130 steps to climb but an elevator available.
Its big. You can't miss it and it is a little ironic given the history but there are a host of more interesting places to see. That said you probably do need to see this.

Amazing Building Lots of Hungarian History. The architecture of the building, both inside and outside is amazing. That alone was worth the price of the tour. It was somewhat disappointing as it did not cover much of the facility, but overall still worth the visit.
you need to book. Worth a visit one of our best sight seeings experiences in Budapest. You need to book.if is interesting to see the difference from british parliament.

Beautiful Sites. Got to the building as the sun was going down, took some really nice photos outside the building. Looks stunning with the river running beside the building as the bridges all lit up. Unbelievable architecture
Visible everywhere in Budapest. This building is visible throughout Budapest and is especially beautiful lit up at night. It's a reminder to all Hungarians about the beauty of their city.

Stunning building in the evening!. People said that this is a must place to visit when you came to Budapest and it was! I didn't go inside the building. However, you can just enjoying the view of Parliament building from afar. Sitting in the riverside and just adoring the building. Free of charge and relaxing.
Storslået. I agree that the Hungarian Parliament is the most beautiful one in the world. A special experience to watch the two soldiers guarding the flag.

A must see. You must book tickets in advance to take a tour of the inside of the building! You can take your chances by going and seeing what is available but you will then need to return. They offer tours all day long is about 5-6 languages. The building is astoundingly beautiful. It is definitely worth spending the money for the 45-50 minute tour. It isn't inexpensive but if you don't buy a ticket you cannot see inside the building. It is over the top ornate with gold leaf paint adorning most of the walls of this massive building. The tour guide explained that there is 40kg of gold. The outside of the building is equally great to see, especially at night all lit up!

Impressive architecture. Situated right next to the Danube river, in the centre of the city, Parliament is very impressive! Great at night too when it's lit up. Lots of benches nearby to sit and admire it.

Great History & Great Tour.. Would highly recommend a visit to parliament and take a tour. The building is stunning from the outside, inside is majestic and our tour guide explained the history. Superb afternoon.
fantastic by night. the most wonderful building,at night from the river it looked fantastic,i thought it was the most beautiful building in budapest

an absolute MUST in Budapest. Just DON'T miss a guided tour of the parliament , while in Budapest. Both from outside and inside the building is stunning. Despite its size , it is very well proportionned, and stands very elegantly along the Danube, intro which it reflects itself. the comments of the guides are quite interesting, and take you deepinto the history of Hungary. i spent a fantasting afternoon touring the building.

Not just an amazing building - real Hungarian history. You need to plan and book a visit with a tour ahead of time to ensure a spot for a tour in your preferred language, but it's easy on the website. You'll then be able to see the Hungarian crown jewels under and amazing dome in the center of the building (no photos here) being guarded by guards with swords. The tour guide had a seemingly-scripted tour, but happily answered any questions and was very knowledgable. It's not just about the building and architecture (although amazing) but about Hungarian history. I loved the cigar holders outside the chambers.Of course you need to experience it outside, all the way around the building - day time and night time when it's lit up and looks like a fantasy. Lots of great photo ops and history in the square right in front of the building (including the 1956 Uprising memorial museum).

Architecture 4 stars: Tour 2 stars.. It's a beautiful building to look at from outside. But we didn't think the tour was worth $15. We went to learn more about Hungary history, but the tour was very flat and non-informative. We barely understood what the tour guide said. I'm not complaining about her foreign accent, but she wasn't a good story teller. Not engaging at all. And to the foreigners who don't know much about Hungary, I think they could've planned this tour a little better.

30 minutes of tedium. Very little value in the tour or the commentary which was provided by a guide with a heavy accent who should learn how to slow down and enunciate without a heavy Eastern European accent.Not enough information on the past or current system of government and politics as opposed to the 'Soviet' style commentary about the material used in some of the columns and the buildings' construction.A head set would be better value and quicker.
Magnificent building. The tour is a bit on the expensive side but the building is so exquisitely beautiful it is worth it to get to see inside.

Impresive building, short tour.. Very impressive building, but the tour was quite short.Although it's 3rd largest Parliament Building, our tour took us only on part of it and was just shy of one hour.
Super. One of the most amazing buildings, i 've ever seen in my life. Better seen from Buda side day and night.
Parliament. Very nice building as well inside as outside; Visit the Parliament is a MUST when you do a city trip to Boedapest.
Great sightseeing location. The building is very big and it has an interesting story behind it. If you are visiting Budapest, the Parliament is something you must see.

Stunning architecture. What a sight when lit-up at night! There are stunning buildings all over Budapest, but this is absolutely the most spectacular. Right on the river, and best viewed either from a boat cruise at night, or the far side of the river, this is the one photo you must get!

INSIDE WEALTH. Visist the inside parliament is a MUST. It's absolutely amazing. You can't imagine the money they invested to built this building.
Tickets should buy in advance.

A Stunning piece of Architecture. The Parliament building is absolutely astonishing. The architecture is quite stunning regardless from where the building is viewed and the interior décor takes ones breath away, particularly in the Dome Hall. A guided tour is well worth the money and thoroughly recommended. It may have cost a king's ransom to build, but has become the symbol of Hungary that nobody who sees it could ever forget and its paying visitors must certainly help the country's economy. It takes on a magical appearance when illuminated after dark and viewed from a sightseeing boat on the Danube.

CANNOT MISS THE VISIT. Mind-blowing beauty and refinement in the decoration and architecture. Visit provides a unique experience, better yet if timed with the change of the guards at the crown display

Stunning Building Inside & Out. One of the most beautiful buildings in Europe. We completed a tour inside Parliament which we fortunately booked in advance. The tour guide was very good and we thoroughly enjoyed the many historical stories associated with the house. Strongly suggestion that if anyone wants tour inside the building that you book in advance otherwise expect to queue for an hour or more.

A "Must See". Quite an experience. Right on the Danube. The architecture was fantastic and quite a bit of the building was included in the tour. Even saw the General Assembly area. Saw the changing of the guard for the crown/scepter display. Particularly enjoyed the numbered cigar holders outside of the Assembly area.

Amazing but way too short. You can only visit the parliament with a tour so we booked on one (do this in advance if possible). Bring ID/your Passport! Tours are given in different languages at different times. The building was gorgeous and the history of it was so interesting. Unfortunately the tour only ran for 45 minutes which is such a shame and many of the people on our tour were confused when it was suddenly over. Worth it, but hopefully they will consider lengthening the tour! Stunning from outside as well.
beuatiful buidling. one of the most beautiful buidlings I have ever seen, looked spectaclar at night from our DAnube River Cruise
Most beautiful. Most beautiful place in budapest. The guided tours are very worthy. Luxuous building, with lots of gold details

Stunning architecture and decoration. Absolutely stunning building with a great tour. Make sure you reserve in advance. A bit disorganized when entering the building--side opposite the river and to the right. Brand new visitor center--interesting gift shop.
Parliament. Didn't go on the tour but the building is stunning to look at. The building is lit up at night and is breathtaking.

Government Grandeur. Big and grand building, that looks like it's had a facelift recently.
Reflection pool in front is good place to take a photo.
The third largest parliament building in the world. Of course, not to be missed. Impressive, especially, in the evening. Enjoy the views both from the Danube and from parliament square.

A photos do not do this attraction justice. This is an amazing building.We saw it at night and during the day and it was the highlight of Budapest. It is truly breathtaking at night when the river is lit up.We also took a tour inside and it is spectacular inside also. If you arrive at 8.30am you can see the guards fly the flag. Inside the guards change on the hour which is also interesting.
Beautiful. It's a beautiful place, with an amazing construction and garden. The day we met tickets available only for the afternoon so we didn't not get in. The place is amazing at night too.

Parliament is stunningly beautiful from the outside at night. We went on an English speaking tour at 6PM. It was too late. Light was fading and it was difficult to see. It was a 45 minute tour ~ I think it was $36 for two of us. It seemed too high for what it was. I would skip the tour and walk by at night.
Beautiful at night. Beautiful at night. This not to be missed. We did not take the tour, but this is a beautiful building, espcially at hight

Well worth the visit. Purchase tickets in advance. This a building on a grand scale, think UK Houses of Parliament with flourishes turrets and extravagent ornamentation. You will not see Parilament in progess. You will see the Grand Staircase, the Lord's Chamber and the Cupola Hall. Look out for the brass ashtrays where members of the Lords left their cigars while going to hear a speech. You will see St Stephen's Crown and the Coronation Regalia: there is a lot of folklore attached to these. Hungarian fascists took the crown to Germany but after many apparent adventures it ended up in Fort Knox. It was returned to Hungary in 1978.The best place to purchase a ticket is at the visitors' Centre near the Parliament itself. You can buy on the web but contray to what it may say it is not cheaper that way. The best is to arrive early in the morning and book accordingly, especially as tours do not always go in the language you want at the time you thought was advertised! We purchased an English tour ticket at 10.15 for the 12.15 tour. Note: English speaking in our experience included many Australians, Americans and other language speakers who could not get a tour in their own language but understood English.There is a cafe in the Visitors' centre (not specially good for Budapest), and toilets, but the ones outside do not require payment.
Amazing building . Watched guards change over. Very interesting. View of building at night is spectacular! Definitely agree with the reason why this is budapest's number 1 place to visit

Hungarian Parliament. This building is quite grand and impressive. I am not sure if you can go in without a guide but even if you can, I advise you to have one. Pictures are allowed except in the central dome where the coronation crown is kept. There are two armed soldiers who guard it and if you come any where near them or the ropes surround them, a stern looking third soldier comes over to you. At a certain point the guards change position with each other in a small ceremony. I did find it a little disconcerting, as their uniforms resemble Nazi uniforms or those worn by soldiers of Cold War communist countries. It didn't help when they goose stepped around the crown.As Parliament was in session, we did get to see only one chamber of the building.There is an elevator for those who cannot walk up the 132 steps to get in.

You have to take a tour to see the inside.. Amazing building with a lot of history. I recommend strongly that you get your ticket on line. The tour guide was adequate, and there is no other way to see the inside. I liked it a lot.

Flanking the old city.. Superb structure overlooking the river with lovely grounds, worth a visit if you have time. The tram affords easy access and there is a nice coffee shop in the museum of Ethnography across the street.

Beautiful by day and night. The Parliament is an impressive and grand structure built in Gothic style. Would be one of the biggest buildings I've seen in a while. The location makes it even more enchanting as it falls along the banks of the Danube on the Pest side and one can get fantastic views from the Fisherman's bastion or the boat tour. At night one can spot white birds (not sure which) are circling the building once its lit up.

a highlight. The interior matches the exterior. Be sure to book online or you may miss out. It is crowded. The tour is short, to the point and well organised. The highlight for some could be the crown of St Stephen. It is a pity you may not take a photograph.

Stunning architecture and interesting history!. This building is a must-see in our opinion. It's so beautiful, inside and out! Be sure to take the tour, but know that the tours sell out quickly. Best way is to go online to buy tickets for a certain time slot and specific language. We thoroughly enjoyed the tour. So much history surrounds this building. Awesome!
Beautiful building. I walked a few miles to the other side of the river just to get a good photo of this building. I didn´t have the opportunity to go inside.
Amazing shape & Archetic. I saw it from the yacht we were riding in the Danube .It has an amazing shape & architecture but we didn't enter.

My favourite place in Budapest. This building is breathtaking. It summaries all that I love about Budapest. If you go when the sun is setting you have a spectacular view and then at night this building is lit up which is beautiful. In the day there are guards around and often some activities. Dont miss this building if you visit Budapest!

A must see. Very impressive especially the decorations inside. The central hall with crown jewels is fantastic. The tour is not very long, but you get to see enough to enjoy. The guide was good, but stand close. Reserve in advance or you will be disappointed. EU citizens pay a lot less than others for entrance.

Comparable to the British Parliament. First of all, the building itself and its location on the bank of Danube river are magnificent. Inside guided tours can visit half of it, the one which is not used by the members of the Parliament, but is exactly the same as the other one. The highlight of the tour is the Crown, an important national symbol of Hungary. The whole tour takes about 45 minutes and, contrary to what is written on their website, there are English tours much more often than just three times a day. It's probably best to buy your tickets online in advance, but as for the beginning of October, there were no queues and I bought mine on the spot. Also you need to go through airport-like security control, but they allow liquid containers.
Wonderful. It's an architectural masterpiece on the Danube side. Wonderful building. It even looks nicer in the evening lights! The park is nicely renovated. Wonderful!
Simply the most beautiful Parliament in Europe.. Most Beautiful Parliament in Europe. Go on the night cruise on Danube river to get a gorgeous view from the water too!

Vote with your feet. Just completed this tour with our Canadian friends. Really disappointed. It lasted 30mins and cost us (EU) 2000fts but cost our friends a whopping 5200fts. It was noisy and the guide really should have been mic'd up, so she could be heard. It comprised of 3 parts, all of which were pretty uneventful. Read the book!

A Great place to visit. Have a wonder round the Hungarian Houses of Parliament, the place has so much history and is a beautiful building both inside and out. Tours for EU citizens ere about £5 and is well worth the money. The have guided tours throughout the day in a variety of languages. Take a look at this building at night and see the hundreds of bats flying around the roof tops, it looks like a scene out of a Dracula movie!!!

Solo Trip. I give this bldg a perfect score even if I never had the chance to tour the insides. I think viewing it from the outside or from afar (from the castle across the river) is worth it. I visited early in the morning around 9 or 10 am and there are not many people in the area. The building was HUGE and there are a lot of sights to see around it. It was a cool experience. I thibk viewing the inside is an added bonus, if you have money to spare. The views from the outside is equally magnificent though. Def one of the higlights of my trip to Budapest.
Simply amazing. Iconic building, one of the best in Europe. Went there both day and night time.. Different feel but just amazing...
Beautiful sight seeing . Go to the opposite side of the Danube river to take photo with the whole background of the parliament. You can also climb to the hill to admire this wonderful monument.

Great attraction but lots of tourists.. We visited the Parliament as part of our purchased tour ticket. We had a bus tour of the city and ended the tour at the Parliament. When we got inside the Parliament area where the tour tickets had to be purchased there were hundreds of people in this area. We had to wait for at least twenty minutes to get our tour tickets. There were tours given in different languages and organizing the people into their different tour groups was a hectic and disorganized affair. Everyone had to go through a security check and this delayed everyone even more. Groups of tourists again had to be re-organized according to the language the tour was to be given in once everyone got through the security check. This was a long process and was somewhat disorganized and frustrating. Eventually our English group was collected and were able to start the tour. The Parliament is a glorious building with a tremendous history. We could not see every aspect of the Parliament since it was in session and some rooms were out of bounds to tours.
