However, what was seen was impressive. The tour lasted about an hour and was worth seeing. The disorganized start is something that should be rectified somehow to make it more pleasant for people taking the tour. Our tour was at 1:00 P.M. Perhaps earlier or latter tours are not as disorganized. Try to stay away from mid-day tours at the Parliament.

One of the few Must-see's in Budapest. Depending on the language with which you are most comfortable, make an advanced reservation as tours are done in several languages during each day. We didn't but they also have same-day tour sales beginning at 8am. Get there early though. I got there at 8:15 and they only had 4:45pm English tour left.That said, the 45-minute tour was great. The building is as beautiful inside as it is outside. Would visit Wash DC for first time and not go to the Capital? Hardly.

Unrivalled Opulence!. If you go to Budapest, you must take the Parliament tour. Book it online in advance to secure the time that you want. You will not believe how "over the top" this building is. Must see!

Funky architecture. The building is featured in all the promotional materials for Budapest. A variety of architectural styles but it works and is quite beautiful. View it from the Pest side and see the changing of the guard then walk over to the Buda side and wait for sundown. You won't be disappointed.

Parliament buildings Budapest. The most beautiful building I have ever seen, It is so pretty and amazing, the detail in the architecture is fascinating this is a definite must see. Also beautiful to see by boat

Worth a visit.. Get a tour of the inside of the parliament buildings, very opulent and attractive architecture. Disorganized entry as there are usually lots of groups there trying to get through security. If you are in a fairly large group you will have to stand right beside your guide if you hope to hear anything. Fairly expensive for what you get.

Going inside is not a must, seeing from outside IS a must. I had a hotel across the river with a spectacular view of Parliament. So after looking at this magnificent building for 2 days and nights I opted to pay the 5200 Forint for a non EU citizen to buy the ticket.  The tour is about 45 min and the lobby is crowded and a bit chaotic. You seem rushed in the tour as there are groups ahead and behind. Anyone wanting to linger for pictures is out of luck, so snap one and keep up with the group! If you dont guards will see that you do! The real beauty is the outside of this building. I wouldnt call the inside tour a must do. You do get to see the crown though, and the is the highlight of the tour.

Awe inspiring. Beautiful building with infinity pool outside. Was impressed how clean the building was & had clean and quiet area outside. Lots o f places to sit down & take in atmosphere. Shame some people ignore the 'keep off the grass' signs. We didn't see it lit up at night, but is apparently breath taking.
Was ok. Stunning but short tour. The guide was knowledgeable and the royal crown with guards was amazing. A bit chaotic to enter with long lines for security.
Beautiful building. The most beautiful parliament in Europe? It's really fantastic and well worth a guided visit! The big clue is an ancient crown.
Speachless . Amazing. Nothing to say actually.We rent an apartment for our 6 days holiday just close to the parliament.Simply amazing !!! WOW!!!
Amazing Building! . One of the most beautiful buildings' in Budapest! Go there after 6 in the afternoon to watch it when its being lighten up! Also take pictures of the building from Buda side!

Absolutely Stunning. The best way to view the outside of this structure is from the river. We took a cruiseand were able to view the parliament from various sides and angles. Like the title says,absolutely stunning
Magnificient building. A beautiful building magnificently lit at night. Similar to out Houses of Parliament in England in some ways. Cannot be missed as along the river Danube.
nice one. located just on the bank of the river. stunning lights at night, big buliding. and u can easily find it out.

huge building. its a huge building. must visit if u r in budapest.very easy to find and reach. u need to ticket to enter, which is bit high in my opinion.u may take a lot of pic in and around it. has a nice garden and big square in front of it.

Great value with an EU passport. We didn't pre-book so were pleasantly surprised when we got tickets for the 17:15 English tour after only getting there at 5. If you take your EU passport the tour is only 2000HUF so is pretty good value. It lasts around 30 mins and then another 15 mins to get through security. Is a beautiful building though, so much gold!! The guard on the crown is also pretty cool to see.
You'll see for yourself.. One of the most beautiful buildings I've ever seen. The architecture and detail is breath taking. Well worth a visit, situated close to the river.

A magnificent setting on the river with a new visitor centre to this historic building. A visit here must not be missed. Comparisons will naturally be made with other Parliament buildings, here the recently restored interiors are a blaze of colour and rich in paintings and sculpture relating to Hungary's history. Look out for the cigar holders outside the debating chambers, where smoking was not allowedA well-designed and discrete new visitor centre provides tickets, cafe and toilets, an exhibition gallery and a new underground access for visitors. Tours are provided in many languages and are well worth booking in advance as they can sell out quickly on the day. It sits in a superb location on the riverside and is beautifully floodlit at night.

The most beautiful building from the water!. This was breathtaking at night as I viewed it all lit up from a cruise on the river. I could have looked at it for hours. In addition, I did the tour of the inside during the day which I highly recommend. Coming from the U.S.A. there just is nothing in my country that compares to it and it's hard to explain the vision. An absolute must see!

Beautiful Building. We strongly recommend viewing this amazing building. With English speaking Guides all the more interesting in this 1hour long tour. Note you must be part of a tour. You can book tours online, best if you wish to select your time to advance book at least 24 hours. You can of course turn up on the day and try your luck, which while not impossible, you may not get your preferred time slot, in the language of your choice.

Worth to see it from inside as well. You can have visited tour to the Parliament in many different languages. I think it worth it, although it's really quite a short visit. We visited the crown and could see the changing of the guards which was interesting. It looks much smaller from inside what is interesting I think.The tour was quite short, and in the café next to it there was not any power outlet or any other option to charge a phone, what was quite disappointing, just like the very not nice way the waitress talked about us (thinking that I don't understand them...)
Beautiful at night. Make sure you visit and walk around the whole building - lots more to see around the back. Beautiful architecture.
Nice . It is a nice building but if you want to visit you have to pay. And if you are not european citizen it is double. It is a symetric perfect building and has the best view of budapest.

visit the museum to the uprising. Parliament building and square very appealing, worth a visit and the visitors centre is user friendly for a coffee break.We enjoyed the museum covering 1956 uprising, it's around the corner from the main Parliament building and down stairs as if using the subway. Very instructive and after the visit the parliament square became more 'alive' if that's the right expression.Bit of a walk along the Danube but worth it. You'll pass the 'shoe memorial' on the Danube bank, very solemn, stop and consider the events it reflects.

Majestic. start by choosing a tour in the morning, read from a written guide book before to maximize your experience, exam the exterior design, once inside, climb the stairs, check the furniture, lamps, tapestries, but most of all, the famous crown guarded by two soldiers.

Okay but not worth the queuing. Paid for an english tour and queued to get through security but they weren't letting anyone through. Eventually we got through and 10 of us then were shown into a lift and told to go "that way" eventually found a tour guide who told us "we were late and she wasn't going to start at the beginning for us (10 people). so the half tour that we got for our money was not good value...From my other reviews you may see a pattern and I can't abide poor customer service. People pay money and expect service when things go wrong is when you see if they care or not. When we complained to the ticket office after we were offered another tour but we didn't bother...

Beautiful building . I was completely mesmerized by this stunningly beautiful building. I took so.many photos of it and got some very good night shots of it from the Danube as well from the Chain Bridge.
Holiday. Very nice so rich in archeticture so beautiful buildings many tourist so popular place very beautiful place in Budapest.

Do Parliament internal visit tour. You can appreciate beauty of this magnificent building from inside and outside as well. The tour is little expensive but it's worth money spent. Only thing we didn't like about tour is there is no individual head set and you need to be always close to guide who is giving info. English tours are always full so go as early as possible. For nice snaps in morning and evening goto nearby bridges. The on where tram 4/6 runs. Also in nightly if you stand on this bridge , you can see magical bats flying around the sacred dom.

Great Tour. The tour guide was very informative, and the building is beautiful, both inside and out. Highlights include the Hungarian crown, the grand staircase, and legislative chambers.Be sure to book your tickets in advance as it can sell out quickly.

Wish I hadn't wasted my money.. Not as impressed as I'd hoped to be. The information was rapidly fired at the large group and was cursory, maybe due to the numbers of visitors the guides were having to show through. I was surprised at the brevity of the tour - only just 45mins.
Think Budapest :-). This is the building that is coming on your mind when you think about Budapest.I don't think that any description or comment is needed

Worthwhile tour. We took the English tour here, which lasted about 45 minutes. It is a beautiful building with an interesting history. Definitely worth doing. Recommend buying tickets online in advance as tour times depend on language and do sell out.

Spectacular. It is amazingly beautiful inside and outside. Can only be visited with a provided tour which must be scheduled in advance so it is best to go early to get on an language specific tour at a time you want.
not bad. it was ok.. not bad, a little dreary at first, but for the historian buffs it would be a great place to be.
A handsome structure. The Hungarian Parliament always seems to have some work being done to the exterior. Built along the Danube, it makes a terrific backdrop for a Budapest photo.
Stunning Architecture. Great buildings. The architecture is stunning. Once inside a guide will be helpful for all the info. you would need to enjoy what you are looking at

The highlight of our trip. In a city packed with beautiful architecture, this was simply the best. It looked amazing both from the Danube and as we walked towards it. We went on a guided tour (In English) inside the building and it was just as good inside. If you are going to visit Parliament and you are an EU citizen, remember to take ID because the prices are much lower for EU citizens.
A gem. Make sure you see this famous landmark building in daylight and after dark when it is beautifully lit. Utilised as the National Assembly of Hungary it is a truly remarkable gem of a place
Make reservations. Beautiful building, but if you don't have reservations don't expect to tour inside. I understand it is quite beautiful, but I was not able to get inside.
Parlament. The most amazing parliment ever. Amazing architecture and lightening. The Danube is very close. Good place just for chill with your friends

Budapest holiday.. We came to view this beautiful building as part of our lovely holiday here. Although we didn't get to go inside we admired the wonderful architecture. Reservations are to be made to look inside. Worth looking at.

A must see attraction. This is one of the most magnificent building that I have seen. It is on the banks of the Danube and with it illuminated at night, has become the subject of many photographs related to Budapest . There is a guided tour of the Parliament, you can buy tickets online to avoid queing at the ticket counter. The building is over 100 years old and the interior is really awesome. Photography is allowed, except in the central hall under the dome, wherethe crown is kept. The inside of the dome, that cannot be photographed is really fantastic and has to be seen.
Overpriced. Too much people trying to get in - you my order tickets online.Too short tour (only 45 minutes). Too high price (5200 HUF).
Budapest icon. Rather bombastic eclectic style, but lovely. Being under reconstruction at time of my visit, unable to enter inside.
Beautiful from the outside . We didn't get to visit inside the parliament house, but walking around it, seeing the beautiful building and the interesting statues around it, was well worth the visit.
Beautiful . A beautiful building with a lot of photo opportunities.Well worth walking around the grounds and taking in the magnificent buildings that surround it too.
Nice visit. Réservation are required, but Early morning çan,also do. Guide tour is Good and the building is very nice.
Be sure you arrange cards far before. Nice intersting tour inside the parlement. Interesting and rather spectacular.A must see in Budapest

A night time wonder!. We were introduced to Budapest as the final port on our river cruise. We arrived on a rainy night and as we climbed the stairs to the top of the boat, we were greeted by one of the most sights. Budapest ablaze in lights. I think of this often and long to return.

Amazing. This building was just so amazing and beautiful. We did not go inside so can't comment on whether it is worth the expense or the lineup. The best views of course are from across the Danube up Castle Hill and Fisherman's Bastion.

Wounderful details, especially at night. Cannot be described must see I live here in Budapest and I'm woundeing everytime when I pass by our Parliament. Everything flows in lights at night and also great in the daylight.
Beautiful building. The tour of the parliament was very interesting. The guide spoke excellent English and was very informative and the whole tour was very efficiently run.

Beautiful Building. The parliament building is huge and impressive. It was built when the Austro-Hungarian Empire was one of the leading powers in Europe. In retrospect, it was very optimistic. Only half of the building is in use. The other half is a tourist attraction.The entrance is a staircase to an underground plaza on the North side of the building. That is worth mentioning, because it is not very obvious. You may need to look around a bit.Advance tickets are a must. They only allow timed entry, and the ticket line can be quite long. That being said, it is worth the time and trouble to see it.

Another beautiful building in Budapest. Another of Budapest's stunning pieces of architecture (of which there are many!) The building is beautiful, and presents some interesting photography possibilities (especially the reflections cast by the water feature to the east of the building.) Worth the visit

Important because it links Pest and Buda, but it's just a bridge.. We walked over this bridge a couple of times, yes it's important and part of their local history, but the bottom line is it's just a bridge, ok to linger and gaze up or down the river, but not in the same category as London's Tower Bridge or the Golden Gate Bridge in SF.
Beautiful building, worth to visit. This is the most beautiful building in budapest and maybe in whole of europe. You can go on a guided tour and look inside.
Fantastic. Regardless of your interests, a grand experiance, full of history architecture and gained knowledge.

The gold parlament. Very exclusive building outside and an amazing view of gold and portraits inside. Absolutly to visit! There are tour guide in different language, so it's possible and interesting to know also the history of this important building.
Magnificent building. A most beautiful building. Puts the British Parliament to shame. Best viewed from the other side of the river.

Spectacular Building Inside and Out. Spectacular building both inside and out, recommend the Parliament Museum as well as the interior tour - it is a very informative exhibition of the history of Hungarian rule. Entrance is next to the tours entrance. The best way to tour the Parliament is with an organised tour - that way your timed tickets are organised for you. The alternative of queueing for tickets yourself can be painful and take a while. If queueing, get there when the ticket office opens and you might be lucky. I still had to wait half-an hour despite being near the front of the queue.
Beautiful Building. This is an interesting thing to see in Budapest. It's a bit challenging getting in, with large crowds and security but it was worth it.
A little bit of party:). A very young capital in europe with nice places to visit and beutiful night life but not so 100 % safe by night to walk:)

Impressive by Day and Pretty at Night. We were told that this is probably the second largest Parliament House in the world and it's an impressive building by day (with soldiers guarding the entrance) and beautifully lit up at night. The views from the Danube are equally enjoyable. It's easy to reach on foot or just hop off Tram #2.

An unexpectedly worthwhile visit.. A most beautiful building inside and out and a tour not to miss. A good idea to book in advance on the internet and take ID. Airport type security to get in. Staff were unnecessarily abrupt.

Awe inspiring build, quite magnificent.. An outstanding building, and one which you must see when in Budapest, stand back and admire the wonderful architecture, a place not to be missed when in Budapest.

We lived next door!. Beautiful building with incredible architecture!
Our apartment was located on the parliament square and we loved that we left the house to see this amazing building everyday.
Amazing to see in the evening especially when the strange mist/sprinkler things were on!
Best at night. During the day is good you can see a lot of detail but in the evening when it is all lit up its amazing.

Not to be missed. You can book when you get to town if you have a few days. Book early, there are only so many English speaking tours a day. We had to wait three days for an opening.
Really coffee in the cafe. A medium was big, very good.

The Guide Had Done This Tour Before!. You have to join an organised tour for obvious reasons. The Lady who took us round was quite difficult to understand a lot of the time and we missed quite a bit of her talk which was unfortunate I think she was getting near the end of a long day possibly had a cold coming or was bored! The architecture is stunning however and it was a treat to get a look inside, security quite strict but all the staff very friendly. Recommended.

Book a guide to appreciate the building. We were part of a tour group when we visited the Parliament. It is a very beautiful building rich with history. It is better appreciated when a tour guide is there to explain the significance of the structure and parts of the building.It is also best seen at night when cruising on the Danube. The spectacular lights gives it more character.

Impressive visit. This visit is one of the most impressive visit you could do in Budapest. It is ecxellently organized and really worth it money and time. The tickets should be reserved and bought on Internet few weeks ahead of your desired day of visitation .

A parliament beyond!!!. If you think the Hungarian Parliament building is beyond beautiful from the outside...it is magnificently noble on the inside...! In fact no tourist or traveler should miss looking into it. It is the place where the Holy Crown of Hungary (in real) is on display!

Tour guide does not do justice to the building and history.. Building is not that old but it is beautiful. Access is somewhat limited but you do get to see the key rooms and corridors. The government tour guide seemed bored with her job which is unfortunate. She repeated several times that no one should take pictures of her. Hard to do when she is standing in front of you in a small room. If she does not want to be in a picture she should be doing another job. We could have read a pamphlet to learn more about the buildings. Unfortunately you do not have a choice. You should still go see the meeting.

Beautiful Parliament. What an impressive set of buildings to look at! You can leisurely stroll around the Parliament and every time you look at the building, you see a different angle to draw your attention. The statues are magnificent to marvel at. And, the guards at the flag are a sight to see!

So much gold!. I just fell in love with Budapest and The Patlament is one of its jewels. It is beautiful from the outside and gorgeous inside. It's is elegant, all that glitters is gold, the window panels are just beautiful ( do I use beatiful too much? Sorry but it is) The tour is about 30 minutes and quite interesting. I understand tours are sold out fast. I bought the tickets from their web site 4 days before! Waiting in line is such a waist of time. I always make an effort to learn a little history about the places I visit and this is a great place to do just that.

Must see in Budapest. Very impressive parliament buildings. Two houses, upper and lower, with wooden desks and red carpets are very attractive. Large wide marble staircases with red carpets, with gold gilt chandeliers are also impressive. Over 700 rooms, most not available to see. Lots of history, including 1956 revolt.

Magnificent building. All lit up at night. This is beautiful by day and even more gorgeous with the lights on by night. See it from a river cruise or from the middle of the chain bridge for free.Walk across the chain bridge to the opposite side of the river across and take a photo towards the Parliament.During the day there are 2 guards standing very still facing the Parliament. Walk around the building for free. Even the gardens are nice.
Capital Attraction. Wonderful architecture and setting complete with military guards. Be sure to walk all around this amazing building to see it from all sides.

Visit to the Parlament in Budapest. Beautiful to behold both inside and out. An inside tour affords one a deeper knowledge and appreciation of both Hungry and Budapest. The tour ticket line can be long and 'sold out.' Best to pre-order your tickets early and avoid that inconvenience. The tours are called one by one by language. The English speaking tour is usually last. Therefore one can show up just 'on time' and still plan in a 5-10 minute wait. The building is larger than the US Capital Building so the tour is fairly fast paced. Stairs are also involved with very limited elevator service for those who have trouble negotiating several floors of stairs. The building is right on the river and its facade is highlighted in many River Cruise TV ads because of its magnificent structure and setting. Don't miss it!
Amazing architecture. This is one of the most spectacular buildings I've ever seen. Unfortunately I didn't have time to go in - but just the exterior is worth checking out.
Beautiful building.... Just stay away from those no good Hungarian politicians. Specially from the Dictator Viktor Orbàn...

Very impressif building.. It seems that the Budapest parliament is the largest parliament building in Europe. It's lying beneath the Danube and if you just have the choice for one visit in Budapest, choose the parliament building. You will not be disappointed.
Must see in Budapest. Must see in Budapest. Simply amazing. Boasts as the most expensive building in the world. Stunning at night also.

It's the most beautiful building I've seen. It's amazing ! You should book before and then you visit it. Unfortunately you can see few places, because it's a government building, so the secury is very hard.
Definitely Visit. In India cannot imagine going to the Parliament unless one pulls lot of strings. The Parliament is a palace like structure with lots of stuff to see and not staid at all.
Danube cruise, view of Parliament building. This striking building is best seen from the river and even better if seen at dusk as the lights come on.
Absolutely stunning. Incredibly beautiful building. But who woukd use call that space? We did not take the inside your as it was 5000 ft pp.

A brief look into Parliament splendour. We prebooked the tour before we left UK and it advertised three quarter of an hour tour but a quarter of an hour is taken up with getting through security and generally gathering at the entrance, so it is in fact half an hour tour. It is interesting to see the splendour of the inside and see where parliament sits and the crown jewels with the bent cross on the crown. As OAPs we also were entitled to a lower entry price but whether it would be worth the full price it is debatable. Sometimes you just have to do these things when you are tourist.
Is on of the mst impresive and armonic constructions I have seen. It si worth an speciic visit and it is visible from different places, special attenion from across the river

Nice place for pictures.... This site is a must in Budapest becouse the bildings are unbelievebly beautiful. Across the Danube from this place is an amazing view to the Buda part.Over all we spent there about one hour... You can get there by the Trem3 from any station on across town on the main street near the Danube.
See this at night.. The building is impressively large. You must see it at night. It is pretty and very dramatic with all the lights.

Mesmerising Parliament. This is so huge, must see place at Budapest. Beautiful building and much adorable from Inside. You are guided by local guide in the language you are comfortable. Takes about 1 hour for complete tour and know the history.

Take the guided tour. There are guided tours throughout the day in several languages. Take the guided tour to see the interior of the beautiful Parliament building and to learn about Hungary's long parliamentary tradition
Parliament is a must see when in Budapest. Beautiful location, right near the river , seeing it at night is even better than it is in day time. You can't miss it if you are visiting Budapest.

If you have time.... The parliament is very imponent, inside you can visit only 4 rooms, but you see the crown!! Keep in mind to book your tickets or to buy them the first day you arrive in Budapest because you have only few groups for each language and the place finish very soon!!!

must-see part of a first Budapest visit. This iconic image of Budapest is even more beautiful inside than out, if that's possible. Tours are generally sold out early (especially the English-speaking ones), so plan to get there early or better yet reserve in advance. They last about 30 - 40 minutes, show you most of the interiors and give just enough history to be interesting and not so much as to be boring. If you happen to be near the Parliament in the afternoon, watching the removal of the flag is also quite interesting. Between the inside tour, walking around the outside grounds, and exploring the gift shop, budget about 3 hours if you have a pre-booked tour.

Visit the Parliament and admire it from the Buda side. You can book the tour of the Parliament in different languages and at different times online at jegymester.hu (official site).EU citizens pay HUF 2,000 p.p.The tour guides are friendly and knowledgable. We found the 50-minutes tour very interesting, certainly worthwhile.The building is spectacular from the outside too. The Hungarian flag is risen in the morning and carried away in the evening, and changing of the guard happens frequently. It's all rather pompous.The huge building is easily recognizable from the Buda side, or from the Danube. Especially beautiful at night.

Dissapointing. The building is amazing from the outside, no question about that... however, the inside is another story completely. We went on the tourist tour of the inside of the parliament. We only saw two staircases, two hallways and two rooms. I am not making this up, this is indeed what we saw. The whole tour lasted some 15, 20 min. We were highly disappointed. The tour is way to short and they don't show you much.In Bucharest the parliament tour lasts much, much longer and they show you more than 2 rooms, 2 hallways and 2 staircases. If you have never been inside a parliament like this before, sure, go ahead, but if you have then save your money and don't go because it's simply not worth the money and the 20 minutes you lose.
Must visit! prebook!. I advise pre booking as that is what I did. They do tours in a multitude of different languages and our guide was really informative. Inside is wonderful- all gold. Must visit!
Beautiful to look at at night. It's pretty to look at at night. Gorgeous 19th century buildings everywhere in the city, and this one is definitely one of the largest and the most grandiose one.

Absolute gem. Visiting many parliament buildings around the world this one is definitely my favourite. You can see many similarities to British Parliament House but Hungarian is much more sophisticated in details. Also surrounding areas and proximity of Danube river makes it even better. And absolutely nothing can beat the view of this magnificent building at night during the Danube river cruise !!!

Beautiful sight . Hard to find a day to enter it but deff worth taking pic
Easier from Buda
Esp at night when enlighted

Beautiful at day and nighttime. Beutifully designed building by the side of the Danube. I saw during the day the outside and witnessed the change of guards with classic music in the background. This building even looks better at night and you can see it from the river during a 1 hour rivertour. Do not miss it

Seeing the inside of Parliament is worthwhile. Took a tour of the Parliament building interior. What a lovely space with some very beautiful baroque style decoration. Tour is only an hour; worth the price of admission to all six of us who went.

Parliament a must see. What a beautiful building. Best to view from the Buda side, specially from the Bastion. It is a must see at night either on a river cruise or Tram 2. The guided tour is worthwhile even if a little expensive. You learn about the history.
Stunning. Stunning building, it is very grand and imposing and next to the Danube, giving great views of Pest from Buda. There are some nice monuments in the area too.

Stunning building. The Magyar parliament is a place which harbors lot of history. It is a stunning building both in the interior and exterior. Whether you approach it or see it from afar it is always gorgeous. It is a must see for any Budapest visitor

Beautiful. I wasn't expecting this to be so beautiful. This building makes me think of Cinderella going to the ball here. The royal crown, the solders guarding it, the gilded ceilings, royal staircase, just beautiful.

Great River View. Beautiful architecture and a great backdrop for photos. It seems to have scaffolding on it at some point at all time for maintenance but it can be cropped out easily for a great shot.
Great building and even greater tour price.. Gorgeous building, but f you want to go around the inside it will set you back about US$50, so an expensive tour.

Gorgeous inside/outside. I've been many times in Budapest and always enjoyed the views of the most emblematic building in the city. During one weekend I decide to visit the Parliament on the inside and attended the guided tour. Wow! I've never imagined it looks so great on the inside as well, it's like an art gallery. Do not miss it!
one of my favorite buildings in the world. I don't know what it is but I just love the way this building looks its absolutely gorgeous. saw it from the hills and on the river night and day.

Magyar Magnificent. This is a capital building that commands attention. It's situation at the side of the Danube provides a frontal view that will not be readily forgotten. The tour of the building is well worth the charge. To see the building at night as part of a ruse to see the lights a special experience.
Architecturally pleasing. What a beautiful building inside and out. I took the hour tour inside and it was well worth the visit as it is very dramatic inside.
Hungarian Parliament. very interesting and VERY ornate! Haven't seen so much gold leaf for a while! well worth a visit - usual security applies when visiting such buildings but not obtrusive!

Better views from far but must see.. It's better to look at the biulding from the far specially from the castle than the real thing if you are not going inside . Frankly we did not go inside the parliament building as the time was not correct. But was surprised to the Opulence and grandeur of the building in this part of the world. A definite worth see.

A must visit. Great architecture! You can easily buy the tour tickets from inside the parliament building, you will need a photo identity for the same. They have tours in different languages and at regular time intervals

One of the most beautiful interior I've ever seen. If you stay for a one day or longer in Budapest I recommend visiting Parliament first. Not only from the outside but especially from the inside.The Parliament is easy to reach, next to the red metro line and kossuth l. ter stadion. There are really good and short guided tours (aprox, 45 minutes) in many languages. I'm sure you won't regret :) but the best point of view to make photographs is on the Buda site. You can take a picture of the whole building.

Gorgeous inside and out.. My favorite building in Budapest. By night it is mesmerizing. Especially the birds (yes, they are birds) that look like small lights flying above the lit building. By day the tour is informative, interesting and truly beautiful. We also caught the changing of the guards, which I've seen in plenty of places before, but this was worth the show. Grand building. Music. Pomp in the way that makes you stop and smile. Book in advance for tours as they sell out in advance and are limited. None of us are huge 'tour' people and we all really enjoyed this one.
Spectacular history and beautiful building. We went on a tour through the Hungarian parliament building, which is simply stunning with photos only allowed in curtain areas.

Excellent. Book online if you want an English speaking tour. Book online for this as the English speaking tours get booked up first. There's several times and I booked through jegemester online. The building is spectacular and the tour takes about an hour. Allow time to find the right entrance as it can be confusing when you arrive and it's a huge building. It looks equally impressive from the outside and is visible from most locations in Budapest looking spectacular via a night cruise along the Danube. The architecture & interior design are awesome & the Hungarians are rightfully proud of this great building.

Stunning . Lovely place to visit, can't go in but better to visit at night when it's all lit up.
Loved walking through on our way back to the hotel

Iconic Building. If you're going to Budapest this is a must see landmark. There's a rumour that Freddie Mercury loved it so much he wanted to buy it. If you're anywhere alongside the river you can get the number 2 tram to close to the Parliament (and the tram ride is magnificent in its own right).

Ultimate folly, but what an edifice!. You just cannot believe how opulent this Parliament House is. Modelled to outdo the British Parliament, it certainly achieves its aim. If ever there was a monument to wasteful and excessive expenditure, this is it.And yet, I have to admit it is magnificent. Ornate beyond belief, it is summed up by a parliamentary chamber built for about double the number of members who currently occupy it. No expense has been spared, either on the outside or inside.You can't miss this if you are in Budapest. However, note that, in order to get inside, you have to be on a guided tour, and these sell out very fast, so that it is a good idea to book on the internet or via your hotel concierge, as soon as you arrive. There are tours in most languages, and English tours are reasonably frequent through the day, but very popular. You can sometimes get a ticket for a later tour by arriving at 9am, but I wouldn't count on it. It will also mean a long wait till your tour starts.If you do have a wait for your tour to start, or if you have 30 mins to spare after the tour, visit the terribly sad "Memorial of the Shoes" situated on the Danube as a tribute to the Jews killed by the Arrow Cross soldiers who formed a Nazi allied government after the German occupation. It is about 10 mins walk from the Parliament.We were lucky enough to see the building both by night and day, and it was equally impressive. If you are there at noon, there is a pleasant changing of the guard ceremony, after which the soldiers mingled with the crowd for photographic opportunities.
Wow!. A must visit if you are in Budapest. Amazing structure which you will never tire of. Looks exceptional at night.
Beautiful from the river side and all business on the other. Not to be missed from across the river and the changing of the Guevarais a real spectacle to watch !!!
Amazing!. All I can say is you need to go and check it out you will be amazed! W were speechless from the moment we walked in till we left just amazing

Possibly the World's Most Beautiful Building. Stunning! Viewing the Parliment whether inside or outside is very special. I could look at it all day/every day and never tire. If you do nothing else on a visit to Budapest, make sure to see this!

Must See. The building is really impressive. It has to be on the sight seeing list. It has 365 points on the top and is 96 meters high. Nothing on the Pest side can be higher than the top of the Parliament building. We were there for the changing of the guard. Don't get this confused with London. It is a small ceremony but still fun to see.

Magnificent building inside and out. We pre-booked tickets via jegymester web site and it’s just as well because when we got to the Parliament, there were no English language tour places available until 6.30pm. The queuing and entry via security were a bit of a pain but once inside, the tour was well worth it. The building is marvellous inside and the tour guide was very informative. Although the tour lasts only about 45 minutes, it is still worth doing and certainly worth the fee.

Magnificent building . A great building, similar to the Westminster Abbey. It was the highest and the longest house of Parliament in Europe. It is also very beautiful during the late evening time, when it is lit with a lot of lights! But notice, that all the lights were off at 1 o'clock.

Amazing structure short tour. Worth a look. But do your selves a favor and use the website to preorder tickets to avoid long lines. I used the wifi there to buy on the spot and avoided the line.The structure is simply amazing but the tour is very short (35 minutes). Not sure it's worth 20 euro per person but couldn't visit Budapest without seeing it

Stunning. This is probably one of the most beautiful buildings i've ever seen. It's beautiful during the day and at night. I didn't take the tour so I can't speak to that but just walking around it is breath taking. The gift shop inside offered good items at what I considered a reasonable price for a gift shop.

Most Beautiful site at night in the city. I recommend a tour if you like to learn about history and see decor from old europe. It was not crowded and a large space so easy and comfortable to walk around and you can get a grip tour in your language of choice. Must got to cable hill to see the view at night. It is breathtaking and romantic.

Beautiful Houses of Parliament.. An impressive looking building built around the same time as the London equivalent but bigger. Apparently one of the largest parliament buildings in the world. You need to book a tour if you want to go inside, but talking to a couple who did the tour its not that impressive on the inside.
Impressing.. Nice and interesting, like the one in London but bigger. Nice looks from the Danube river. Great plaza in front, worth the visit.

Grand building. A good visit to an impressive building. Considerable time was taken going through airport style security before heading off through the corridors of power. Not too sure what we expected but looking back the tour itself was quite short and akin to visiting a stately home. Don't get me wrong though, I would still say this is something that should be done when in town.

Pretty from the ouside. I had a tour inside the parliament which was a bit short to me since the building is huge. Inside you can see the crown and the parliament meeting place. The tour inside is not very important you can read about it and look at pictures. But if it is important for you to see it go for it.
E bike. Great pictures here very big building enjoyed our visit good guide. Thanks Asmal . Cant think what else to say worth a visit

Worth It! Buy Your Tickets Ahead of Time!. This tour was great. We bought our tickets ahead of time, which I was very glad of, because many of the tours were sold out. They offer the tour in many languages. Our tour guide was very knowledgeable, went through the tour at a good pace, and overall it was a great experience. The building was gorgeous, you get to see the armed guarding the Hungarian Crown Jewels. You’re able to take photos throughout the tour except in the dome room where the jewels are. The building is beautiful, laced with gold and history. Definitely a good choice for something to do in Budapest.
No Parliament, no Budapest.. This is sooo impressive, stunning, gorgeous, marvellous, beautiful, and exciting!! I really love the building of Parliament both at day and night time.
No Parliament, no Budapest.. This is sooo impressive, stunning, gorgeous, marvellous, beautiful, and exciting!! I really love the building of Parliament both at day and night time.

Unbelievable building and interior. Be sure to make a reservation to tour this building. The structure is unbelievable both in its design and its size. It is second only to Westminster in size. You have to reserve a tour and it is well worth it.

marvellous architecture. Modeled upon the UK parliament buildings, this is a most impressive building. there is some construction renovation going on at present and we were most impressed by the way in which any work, like masonry chiseling stopped as a pedestrian walked by

Breath-taking view.. There are no words to express my admiration for Parliament building on Budapest. We were lucky to visit the library inside the Parliament building and even got a guided tour. Also we witnessed the ritual of changing guards, took pictures with guards .
Second only to London's House of Parliament. Colossal building and equally attractive by day and by night. Dominates Pest's side of the Danube. Tours available by day, but need to pre-book

Architecture grandeur & history. Had night time view from the river while on boat ride & then day time view after completing a round of market & lunch. Night time lighting is breathtaking & day time facilitates admiring the architecture. Only regret couldn't enter to see the interior.

Worth a visit. Great place to visit by strolling along the banks of the Danube or getting there by tram. The tram ride is excellent as it goes all along the side of the Danube. The parliament building is very impressive.
One of the most important places in Budapest. The most characteristic place in Budapest. The best view for the Parliament is from Batthyany metro station- it is opposite the Danube River.

Beautiful building, terrible guided tour. We visited this place with my boyfriend and his mom. The price is OK, but we needed to wait a lot. The entrance was a chaos, nobody knew where to go, which is his-her group, the tourguides were shouting and yelling. Our guide who supposed to speak German...well...she didn't. The tour was indeed in German but nobody understood what did she say, and not because of her accent...we were always rushed, we were out of the building in 35 mins although the tour was supposed to be almost an hour. The building is beautiful but the service: terrible.
Great buildings to see. This set of buildings is so big, you can spot it from almost any place in Pest and especially Buda. It's nice to see the cleaning water spread.

Amazing building. Beautiful interior, ornate and mind boggling. How did they construct this huge building? It has a natural air conditioning system! You must go with a guide in a group and it was difficult to hear everything the guide said. The architect designed it to look like a "ship sailing along the river". The sheer size is more like an ocean liner sailing along the river. Different language tours are scheduled at different times. It can be very crowded in the visitor's center where you enter. Go early for the first tours available in your language.

worth a visit. Very good value for money, the tour guide spoke very good English and knew her stuff. Really beautiful inside and out. Queuing system at the beginning was a little confusing and I did get shouted at by one of the ticket attendants for using the wrong turn style.

Extremely impressive architecture. We were able to view this most impressive building at 9:30 on Sunday morning and witnessed the military guards put on a show which was so precise it was just amazing, unfortunately the guided tours on that day were only in French or Russian so we opted out but just to walk the perimeter of the building really does give you quite an appreciation of its grandeur

Not sure why everyone is so impressed. . The building is very beautiful, but nothing better than you would see in any other European country. The tour itself was somewhat perfunctory and I didn't learn anything much of interest. When we went into the Lord's chamber, the guide was standing within the seating area and we were behind a barrier. The guide was referring to things on the walls that could only be seen from her perspective and we could not see them at all. The security guards were also very scruffy and rude. I a was also surprised that the tickets for non EU nations las was 5200 HUF rather than just 2000 HUF for EU nationals. I have given it three stars as its one of the things you basically have to do when you visit Budapest, but don't get too excited.

Amazing. Just visited Budapest last 2 weeks. It was amazing. We were surprised that this building is really beautiful especially at night time. We took a night cruise. It's really a sweet memory for us enjoying that night panorama throughout Blue Danube. Wish we can come again in future.

You can't miss a visit. You can't miss the visit. It's very well organised by languages so that you'll always find a guide who speaks at least the most important ones. It's a great experience to see all the magnificence of the parliament.
Excellent architecture and facade design. Didn't have time to enter and view from inside but the outside architecture is great. Best view is by the evening when the lights are on.

Gorgeous interior. I have been at Prlament several time, for me it's one of beautiful place in the world. I recommend to book visit online before you start travel to Budapest, it's guarantee you access even during high season.
One more must see sight. This building is so beautiful when looking from across the Danube. At night it glows double with the reflection. Just remember..... Lights out all over at nidnight
Beautiful Building. The true standout of Budapest is this gorgeous building. The view of it from the water at night is amazing. Each room tells a different story. Not to be missed.

what a building. This building is awe inspiring in the day, lit up at night and the inside is beyond words. We had an English speaking tour that lasted about 30 minutes. The marble and gold decorations, carvings and state rooms are worth the visit. I recommend it to anyone.
Must see. You can't come to Budapest without stopping off for a quick tour of this beautiful building. I recommend walking by at night also.

Well worth seeing in all its majesty. Tours are in groups of 20-30 according to language and you must book a time slot in advance and be prepared to wait. Beautiful architecture comparable to our own Westminster parliament though more modern.

One of the best sights in Europe. This majestic edifice on the banks of the Danube is one of the most iconic images of Europe. In person, it does not disappoint. Visible from almost everywhere along the river, day and night. The tour of the inside is interesting, but not a must. The decor is neat but the tour is short, pricey, and you can't take pictures of the main event: dome and crown jewels.

Gorgeous interior to match the exterior. I managed to visit the Parliament on the Hungarian national holiday, St. Stephen's Day, and it was such a treat. On their holiday a walk through the Parliament is free (usually costs around $20 to get in), but had to wait in about a three hour line. It was worth it though. The inside is gorgeous and decorated with all kinds of designs all over. The crown of Hungary is also on display inside since it is a requirement to always display it in a public place. Since there were so many people going through on that day my group was rushed through and only spent about 20 minutes looking at everything. Not sure how long the typical tour takes. You are not allowed to take pictures inside, especially no pictures of the crown.

Fascinating tour of the main rooms of this beautiful building. I recommend you book this on line before you go, to guarantee access during the busy season. The tour is 45 mins long and takes in some of the main rooms. You get a real sense of history and see some beautiful art work throughout. There is a number of stairs to climb, but the guide gives you the opportunity to use a lift and avoid the stairs. The guide is knowledgeable and well practised. The gift shop is also a very high standard and there is a cafe and public toilets. The only negative is that finding the visitor centre was tricky as its steps go down on the northern side of the building, so are not visible if you approach from the south side. I could not see any signs to direct you to the visitor centre, but a friendly palace guard helped. Also near the parliament building on the south side there are some steps leading down to a memorial to the 1956 revolution, which was very interesting.

Majestic both during the day and at night. Seeing pictures doesn't do justice to this massive and beautiful building that is the largest building in the country and that sits regally on the Danube River. We saw it during the day, but at night when the lights come up, it is magical. Being on a Vantage river cruise, we enjoyed seeing it not only lit up at night, but did so sailing up the river, and actually got to do it again the next night before heading on to our next destination.

Beautiful building. I had the opportunity to walk around and view this huge building. It's architecture is beautiful. It sits on the banks of the Danube River. It was a Sunday, and appeared to be closed. There was a lot of people in the plaza surrounding it, but it appeared that no one was coming in or out. I was lucky enough to witness some type of changing of the guard ceremony, which was very nice

Worth a look. This is a stunning building and worth a visit. The visitors centre is in the basement so the actual Parliament building looks quite perfect. We booked tickets on line with a specified time for £5 each. Very busy and difficult to hear the Guide, they really need microphones. Interesting tour, short but you get an idea of it all. Beautiful interior.

The Parliament. Amazing and grand building,wonderful architecture. It is even more beautiful in the night when it is lit by many lights....It is a wonderful sight to see in the night standing on the bridge

Beautiful building. This is a stunning building - both inside and out.
It's great to see on an evening from the river but also having a guided tour of the inside is s must too.
Inside there is lots to see, it's very grad and very beautiful.

View at night is even better. Do yourself a favour and book a cruise along the Danube in the evening and marvel at this magnificent, HUGE building in all its lit-up glory. Truly one of the most impressive buildings in Europe.

Breathtaking Architecture. Breathtaking architecture from every which angle. Especially beautiful at night up close, when the illuminated birds are flying above. Makes for a lovely photo. -Make sure you book tickets for the inside tour in advance, they book up fast.

What a building!. Taking the tour is mandatory. Not too expensive (2000 HUF for EU citizens).Great to see the building. Is looks like a castle and a church. The tour lasted about 45 minutes. We found that the groups were rather large, maybe 50 people and 1 tour guide. She was talking through a headset and it was quite difficult to hear everything. But the building made up for that. We had a bonus. We saw the minister of foreign affairs.

Gorgeous. Gorgeous building. Loved the architecture. It's just massive yet so tiny in a way. The building is worthwhile! Too bad that the tour is actually rather short. Would have loved more time and more things to see

Excellent informative tour. Booked this tour online a couple of hours in advance and was glad that I had as there were long queues when I actually arrived. Is not expensive - about £8The tour itself was very informative and well paced. Grand Staircase a vision of bling. I was lucky enough to be by the Crown Jewels (one crown an orb and sceptre!) on the hour which meant that I was there for Changing of the Guard which was fun.Thoroughly recommend

Unique!. Beautiful place that I recommend to anticipate especially in summertime cause tickets are quickly sold out. You can purchase your guided tour online (on the "jeggymaster" site, local version of ticketmaster.com). The guides are nice and fun and there's a lot to learn about the great Austro-Hungarian history.

Looks good but.... This building is really spectacular inside, and out.We did the guided tour and a few complaints... The area where you buy tickets/begin the tours is absolutely manic. There is no order whatsoever and no body seems to know where to wait for their tour. Also once your on the tour there are far too many people on the tour at one time and there are also other tour groups in front of you getting their tour delivered, it was like a traffic jam of tours and it made us feel awkward because tour guides try to talk over each other.Also our English guide spoke poor English, I do respect people who work in their second language but it was poor; she spoke too fast and couldn't project her voice so we could barely hear.If your under 24 you can get the tickets really cheap, at £2.35 per person you can't go far wrong. I think if I'd have paid full price for tickets I would have felt a bit more hard done by.
Parliament Budapest. Great attraction. You need to book early for the conducted tour especially the English speaking one.

Take the next guided tour, even if it's not your language. We bought tickets and returned two hours later for the guided tour in English. We should have gone with the Russian tour that was about to leave. We were in a group of 35-40. Our tour guide spoke very fast and could not project to the edge of the group. We heard very little of the speedy 25 minute tour. The interior of the building is truly impressive and the Crown Jewels are full of history, especially with the slanted cross. With a group this size, in the small space and time permitted for the parliament room, people were pressing for time to snap pictures and the rest of us missed the guide's commentary. It is expensive for so little!!

Impressive Building - inside and out. Arrived around 10:30 a.m. hoping to get a tour with an English speaking guide. All the English tours were booked until 1:30. Rather than hanging around for 3 hours, we reversed our sightseeing itinerary and came back for the 5:45 tour. We didn't know it, but you can book these tours online, in advance, by visiting their website directly. Sadly, Americans are charged more than twice the price that members is the EU pay. The building is more like a cathedral than a government building. There were over 100 steps to climb to get to the primary viewing areas. No worries though. If that's an issue, the guide will let those who can't do the physical climb use an elevator. There were a lot of people on our tour. As a result, it wasn't always easy to hear our guide. Still, the building is impressive enough it's definitely worth seeing. As a bonus, they have ample WC (restrooms) & you don't have to pay to use them!
Amazing. Beautiful building. It's easy to get to, the places around are nice as well. There was no access to the inside and no tours inside.

Amazing Architecture. This is the one of the landmark of tourist attraction in Budapest. You can see amazing architecture of the building. You can explore the museum which is located downstairs of the parliament. I'm sure you will love it.

Interesting and palatial. We hadn't realised that we needed to book in advance and that there are different times for differing languages. We were able to book and pay on line however and went the following day. There was a little of 'faffing' about in the beginning but the guide was extremely nice and spoke English clearly. All the sights to see are on one floor - 193 or so steps up - however there is a lift offered so it is accessible for people who find walking challenging. It was extremely impressive internally - stunning décor, highly decorated ceilings, the Hungarian Crown, sceptre etc had interesting history and guards... parliament itself was also interesting. A fairly short tour but one worth doing.

Parlamento Budapest. Quite Amazingly Budapest Parliament. Very Huge and fantastic building with a superbeb view to Danube river. And inside is even more beautiful. Excellent located & good place to take photos! Don't forget to walk around the parliamente, you'll find amazing statues around.

overwhelming architecture. It's a must-see thing to do, as the building is simply overwhelming to the eye. Located next to a metro stop, it's easy to get to.Among the various tours we've taken in Budapest, it was the priciest -- though worthwhile to see the inside of the building. Tours run every 15 minutes, and are devoted to specific languages and limited to a manageable number of people. English tours came around once every 75 or 90 minutes, I think. We bought our tickets, but then had 75 minutes to spare till the tour started. To kill the time, we walked over to the neighboring Museum of Ethnography and did a quick visit there. It was interesting, inexpensive and kept us out of the hot sun.The Parliament tour lasted 45 minutes, but 15 minutes were wasted filing through the security gate (which you do as a group). So then it was just a 30 minute tour to see the most of the main halls and rooms. But that was perfect for my short attention span!

Great experience. We booked this via a commercial tour but would recommend the standard tour which is what you end up being on. We were told all standard tours for the day were booked! That aside, the exterior and interior of this neo-gothic building are stunning. The guide was knowlegable though her accent was challenging at times. This is a must see in Budapest.

Most spectacular parliament building in the world. I know it is modelled after the British Parliament but this building really is more impressive, in large part because of its spectacular location on the shores of the Danube. It is particularly spectacular at night, lit up, viewed from the river. Tours are available and are very professional and well worth the time, but buy your ticket ahead of your visit as they are in big demand.

Another impressive building. Well worth visiting this area as the buildings locally are superb. Try viewing late in the day as getting dark either via the Hop on, Hop off bus tour or from a river cruise.

Very quick tour. I just think that the tour is quite hurried and there is not enough interesting things to see inside - only the crown jewels which ia not much and the assembly room. Ths about it. If you have €15 to spare and you reaaally want to see whats inside this massive building then go for it. But I mus say it is not a must. I would gave liked to spend more time in the museums in castle hill.
Parliament. Parliament buildings were absolutely beautiful! We did not go inside but walked around it and viewed it from across the river and from on the river. Very impressive! Better than pictures!
Book early. Get your tickets either online or as soon as you arrive in Budapest. We could not get an English speaking tour before we left.
Fantastic Architecture!. Fantastic visit, so much history in the building. It was just a shame that the main chamber was shut due to the parliament sitting.

Historic, beautiful building.. Be prepared for many steps or find the elevator so that you can visit all floors. This is a magnificent building; at night when it is lit up, it looks amazing. If you're lucky, you can be there for the changing of the guard.

Architecturally Stunning!. We were on a cruise boat that was moored on the Buda bank, directly opposite the Parliament building on the Pest bank.In the early morning, although the Gothic Revival architecture is obviously stunning, the building appears somewhat drab. It is only as the sun rises higher and shines on the façade of the building that you appreciate how stunningly beautiful it is.As the sun sinks lower, the stonework appears more mellow; as the sun is setting, the light reflects beautifully off the buildings many windows.At night, as many buildings along the Danube in Budapest are, Parliament is beautifully illuminated.There are also great views of Parliament to be had from Castle Hill and the Fisherman's Bastion.

Adventure Budapest. This is a breath takingly beautiful building setting on the Danube. It is a great location to visit with Freedom Square right next to it. Wonderful restaurants very close. Do not miss this site. You must have a passport to enter.

When in Budapest must see . We visited September 13 with a small group of friends. Our tour was great and it seems the people are very proud of the complex. It may not be the best in the world but it is the best in Budapest

Awesome architecture. We were not able to see the inside as the building is closed when we passed by, however, just looking at the outside of the structure - its size and details - will leave you awed. This building, its facade, and the great views around it, are must-visits while you're in Budapest.

Amazing building both inside and out. You will be able to see this building from lots of vantage points around the city but it is worth a look close up.You have to book tours which are in various languages so it is worth booking online and slotting the tour into your schedule so you are not sat around. Remember to take your passport and or student id as you get in cheaper if an adult EU member(2€) or student under 24(1€).

Changes your perception of Hungary. Seeing the magnificence of the parliament building really brings home the depth of history of Hungary. Booking online was a bit of a pain and the queues to get in were chaotic, but it is the building which is the star. The tour in English was a bit rushed and I wish we had had more time, but it was still one of the highlights of our trip, even for my teenage daughters.

Changes your perception of Hungary. Seeing the magnificence of the parliament building really brings home the depth of history of Hungary. Booking online was a bit of a pain and the queues to get in were chaotic, but it is the building which is the star. The tour in English was a bit rushed and I wish we had had more time, but it was still one of the highlights of our trip, even for my teenage daughters.
Amazing building both in and out. You can buy tickets online to avoid queues but there were no queues when we went. Cost was 9 Euros only so a bargain for a tour of a most magnificent building

Parliament with pizazz. Want to see a parliament house with a difference? This building is simply stunning. From the grand staircase to the chambers themselves, every inch of this building is stylish on a grand scale. On the banks of the Danube, this is a photographer's dream. In this building you will be able to see the Holy Crown of Hungary in the central hall. On the approach to the Assembly Hall, before entering this area, you will see an amazing brass cigar rack - each one numbered to correlate with the seat number in the Assembly Hall - cool.

Purchase a ticket in advance. It is very beautiful from the outside and has a lovely garden. At the first time we arrived, we could not get in to the tour because there were no available tickets (all were purchased in advance). The second time we arrived (after purchasing tickets in advance), the tour was very nice, but quite short. Generally, it's a must see place.

Beautiful interior, impressive outside too. Book at least 2 days ahead if you want a spot on an English tour. You probably won't get a spot if you just show up. You can only see the interior on a tour. The tours are not cheap, but the sumptuousness on display makes it a worthwhile spend.Access is via the visitors centre which is underground on the far sidd of the building relative to the nearby metro station. No photos are allowed inside & the security check is at an airport level.
Summer family vacation 2015. The highlight for the family was the hop-on hop off bus; cruise down the Danube, Segway tour, walking tour of the city, castle, parliament
Beautiful ceilings.. Worth the entry fee. Beautiful décor. Easy to reach by public transport. Very elegant and historical
Magnificent building. If you are in Budapest you should Not miss this tour. This was the highlight of our tour though we had to wait for 2 hours but wait was worth. A must go place..

Worth seeing, but looks similar to other interiors. Is it me, or does the inside of this building look just like the Opera House, St Matthias Church, etc.?It's also very much a 'conveyor belt' feeling tour.To be fair, it is a must see if in Budapest and is also lovely from the outside, but not sure it deserves to be number 1.
Must visit in budapest. Very beautiful building. I would recommend a guided tour. Its cheap and worth it, but you need to book it one day before.
Amazing. One of the most beautiful buildings I have ever seen in my life. When the sun goes down and it lights up it's just something amazing.

Worth the queuing. 2 and a half hour queue (as we went on St. Stephens Day), if you go on this day arrive at 10am, its free! On other days arrive when it opens, well worth the wait however. Forewarning, you aren't allowed to take photographs in the main Dome Room unfortunately.
Stunning! . The building is absolutely stunning it blows you away and with it being the tallest building in the city it stands out a mile. Lit up in the evening it looks even better.

You must check out at night!. Our APT tour was a cruise on the Danube at nite.
It was spectacular- all the buildings including Parliament House and the bridges were lit up. It just happened that some white seagulls were flying above Parliament House and as they were illuminated also - it gave the whole scene a magical touch.
Beautiful building. What a pretty building. This is definately worth a visit. It is right on the Danube River. The surrounding buildings are also very nice.
Beautiful building. Worth a wander to. Not sure why the big mist cloud that comes on every 30mins or so outside the main doors.....
Must see. Beautiful interior with hand painted everything, perfect detail, good informative tour and well worth the time.

Worth a visit. Really interesting place. We took the 45 minute tour and it was very informative and enabled us to see quite a lot of the interior of the building. Very impressive decor with a touch of elegance retained. The working chambers were also interesting to see.

Stunning. This big beautiful building laced with 40kg of gold!
I took the tour and highly recommend it, great information and a good work out going up all the steps :) seeing the crown jewels is also a treat

A bit of a let- down. The visit to the Hungarian Parliament was a bit of a let down. No doubt, one cannot find fault with the building, which is majestic to view. However, the visits are not properly organised, with Groups hitting into one another. And then, half the building is closed, so, an hour's visit ends quite abruptly. Personally, I felt that the English guide lacked confidence -- both in the language department and in going over the details one expected her to know.

To understand hungarian history and culture!. The visitor center has a very good organisation! I suggest to book your visit on web; the website is easy and full of any information. The guided tour in italian was fantastic; our guide gave us the informations that a tourist really need about this building speaking about politics, modern history of Hungary, culture, the most important politicians, kings, etc. The structure is very rich and during the tour are showed the most important rooms, stairs (the Golden stair), corridors and you can breathe the really atmopshere of an ancient and modern parliament. Price of ticket is really cheap!
Outstanding architecture . This building set along the river danube stands out with its amazing architecture. We didn't go inside but looked amazing from the outside

Dramatic from the outside; colorful inside. It is difficult to book an English-speaking tour so we joined one in Spanish and were able to understand most of what was said with a bit of help from our multi-lingual guide. Always amazed that people can speak three or four languages with such confidence. The building has recently been cleaned and is lovely from both sides of the river. Tour is short, only about 45 mins and you visit grand staircase, Crown Jewels and the former meeting hall for the House of Lords. Now only one entity which meets in a room we did not see. We visited on a Sunday and the building and tour were available but of course the parliament was not in session. We decided we could have skipped the inside without disappointment.

You can skip the inside tour. Amazing building from the outside. Looks more like a church than a parliament house. The inside tours takes 45 minutes and the tour aloud only with a tour guide so if you do want to do that you should register for it from the website. But on the other hand, think, in 45 minutes, what will you see of this huge building? Probably not too much.

An average touristy tour. The tour is not very long and all the informations the guide provided us were quite average, something we could read on any guide.The interior is nice, spectacular even if not old or ancient, but the true beauty of this building is without doubt the exterior, expecially at night. A wonderful sight.I would advise booking your visit through the internet to avoid a too long queue.
Lovely building. If you have the time in Budapest, this is a nice place to visit. I suggest that you book your tickets in advance online. The English version of the guided tour sells out quickly.

Ok to visit if you have time. There was a fairly chaotic start to this tour as the 1.15 Itslian tour tried to push ahead of the 1pm English and German tours, only about 20 people in that group but enough to cause some chaos. Security check airport style. Worth a visit but you need to book ahead and the actual tour is about 30 mins, you get to see lots of corridors, the dome (no photos here) with a small amount of Crown Jewels and one of the two main chambers. It was ok, interesting but nothing to particularly rave about. Don't use the toilets in the cafe as you have to pay, walk 20 feet to the free ones at the entrance to the visitors centre instead.

Breathtakingly Beautiful; Informative Tour. For the price, the Parliament is well worth a visit. I don't think it's worthy of the top spot of things to do necessarily but it is definitely worth a trip, especially considering how cheap the tickets are. It is highly advisable to pre-book your tickets as they are often sold out well in advance. The interior of the building is astounding, as is the exterior. Our English speaking tour guide was great, very informative and she encouraged questions. It should be on everyone's to-do list.

Tour. Book your tour online in advance if you can as the English speaking tours sell out quickly. Or stop by and buy tickets for a later tour. You will need actual paper tickets, but the ticket desk was willing to use my confirmation number and print the tickets for me.The building is stunning. Lots of history, included being bombed over 300 times during WW II.

Basic tourist tour. The building looks amazing outside and the actual tour was ok. It wasn't a must see thing to me personally but since it doesn't cost mutch to EU citizens and everyone will ask you if you visited there, please go ahead.

Stunning Architecture. It was a Sunday so it was closed but our cruise ship Emerald Sun was moored in the most prime position on the opposite bank -Viking et all were a mile on the Pest bank (-:The views by day and by night were tremendous and the commentary by our Cruise Director on the history will ensure that when we return to this lovely City (which we will) then a visit to Orszaghaz will be top of our list.
Iconic. Spectacular neo-Gothic beauty, an iconic Budapest feature. A stunning sight as the sun goes down and it takes on a coppery tone.

Stunning architecture. The parliament is one of the many impressive buildings of Budapest. Accessible easily by metro or while walking along the Danube.Due to the stone type used in its construction , the magnificent building is always partially being cleaned/restored. Good luck getting a perfect picture of it without any scaffolding.There are guided tours every day when the parliament is not in session, on various different languages.You can also so it in its full beauty from the other side of the river, at the Buda side from the castle district.

A peek inside this glorious building. It is worth it to purchase you're tour ticket ahead on the internet in order to avoids wait lines. The tour is very informative and you get to see inside this glorious building. Although the tour is less than an hour it really is worth it.
Stunning building.. Was in the vicinity when the flag was lowered (6.30pm). What a delight to see a little boy marching alongside one of the guards, so serious with his little rifle.

By Night or Day a Spectacular Building. The Hungarian Parliament Building is one of the most photographed sights in Budapest. It overlooks the Danube creating a majestic picture both day or night. It is worthwhile also getting up close and exploring rather than just taking in the majesty from afar. I never tire of this view.
The building is magnificent the tour expensive and not esencial. A very beautiful building, tour much less, guide does not share too much information and has difficulties in answering to questions

Take the time - it's well worth it!. I visited on Independence Day so it was open to the public. Although crowded it was still worth it. Stunning architecture and it was a privilege to be with locals and tourists - all seeing different wonders. Saw the outside in the evening from the Danube - with the public holiday fireworks - wonderful memory!

Once in Budapest..... ... You must see the Parliament. Impressive building, but more impressive is what you find inside. The crown and the symbols of the Hungarian monarchy, they impose respect and speak by themselves of this nations impressive history
Sightseeing. Beautiful building, could be described as a fairy tale building - especially beautiful when lit up at night.

One of the great sights of Budapest. This is one of the most emblematic buildings in a city full of fine ones. A visit to the inside (guided tours in many languages) is highly recommended. The interior is a highly
decorated cross between the Houses of Parliament in London and the St Pancras Hotel but with a Magyar twist.

WOW factor - 45 minute tour. The only way to see the interior of Parliament is to pay for the priviledge. This way you are assisting in the conservation of the building. There were approximately 50 of us on a early morning English tour which did make it a little difficult to hear the tour guide. You are allowed to take photographs of everything except the Crown. All in all it's a tour you must do whilst in Budapest. You will not be dissapointed.

Amazing architecture. This really shows how amazing architecture can be. Looks similar to British parliament. It has a lot of sculptures around. The whole building looks perfect at any time of the day.
A work of art!. This is such an incredible work of architecture! I must have taken over 100 pictures of this huge building from different angles and elevations! I could not stop looking at it!
Very impressive building. Very impressive building, it is nice to see it from both sides of river. Great view from the castle hill side

Impressive. Hard to miss this gem,situated as it is right on the Danube in between St Stephens basilica and Margaret island.A huge imposing building beautifully lit at night is a highlight of visiting Budapest
Truly amazing . For me this has to be one of the best looking buildings in the city truly amazing, definitely worth having a look at night when it's all lit up to.

Must see!. If you are in Budapest and miss the Parliament, you have missed one of the highlights of the city. If you think the outside is beautiful (and it is), wait until you see the inside. The interior architecture and decor is breath taking and you can take photos (except of the royal crown). Be sure to visit the memorial museum under the Parliament with a lot of photos and documentaries of the Hungarian Revolution.

Beautiful from all angles. This is definitely my favourite landmark in the city. Walking close up to it, seeing it at night on the river cruise and spying at it from castle hill, every view of it is breathtaking.

Must in Budapest. Book in advance!. The guided visit lasts only 45 minutes, but it allows you to see the stunning interior of the Parliament, the Holy Crown of Hungary. I recommend it, and to book in advance the tickets in your language, as the guided tour is the only way to access the building. The Danube Corridor is amazing.
