Beautiful-Inside, out!. Luckily, we were accompanied by a local, which made our 1-day trip to Budapest very productive. This magnanimous structure is visible from any angle, no matter where you are. It is the crown of this city. So beautiful by the day and simply awesome by the night. We took a river cruise at night, to see the city lit up. Walk around this structure to find the ticket office. The day we went, english tour was at 1:45 pm. I would recommend researching tour times so that you don’t have to come back to this place again just to take the tour.Inside tour: You have to see it to believe it. The inside of the parliament is like a palace. They even show you the house of commons and photography is permitted inside.

Beautiful Parliament. The Hungarian parliament building is simply beautiful. The facade has been cleaned and the stonework is an amazing piece of architecture.The height of it is 96 metres to the top of the dome.Tickets for the visits sell out quickly. The entry price is 2,000 Forints for an adult and 1,000 Forints for a child of school going age. These prices are as at August 2015 and for those holding a European Union passport. So you need to take your passport when you buy your tickets. Non European Union visitors pay higher prices. We obtained our tickets around 9.30am in the morning for an English guided tour that started at 3.45pm. It goes without saying that you have to go through an airport style security check before you enter. Then you climb up 132 steps to get to the main area. You will be amazed by the stained glass and the beautiful architecture. The Parliament chamber itself is fantastic and is arranged in a U shape with some beautiful furniture.You also get some great views of the Danube River from one side of the Parliament building.The tour lasts about 30 minutes and is definitely worth it.There is a cafe on the ground floor that sells a range of sandwiches and hot and cold drinks - at an inflated price.The gift and souvenir shop sells a range of items - again at inflated prices.
Beautiful!!. Beautiful building, and is the second biggest Parliament building in the world second to ours. Great views from Buda of Parliament as you go up the hill towards Fisherman's Bastion.

Amazing Architecture! . Amazing architecture from outside. If you are on a crunch visit, avoid going inside; but absolute beauty from outside and a very nice place to stroll around. If possible, go at night; the lighting around is very beautiful. Be lucky enough to see from Buda side as well. Very majestic. One of the best Parliament buildings across Europe.

Make sure you book in advance. We were glad we booked online in advance as the tickets sell out quickly. There are a lot of security questions to complete when applying for a ticket. If you are unable to print out your ticket, take your mobile phone confirmation to the help desk and they will print you a ticket. The English language tour was large, and it took some time to get everyone through security, but once the tour started it was very interesting. You are allowed to take photos everywhere EXCEPT around the Crown Jewels, and a guard will quickly let you know if you reach for your camera! The tour lasts around 45 minutes, and you must keep up with the tour guide. The area around the Parliament is huge, and seems to be a meeting point. Be sure to visit the "shoes" as it is close by.

Beautiful tour, poor Russian speaking. We arrived to the parliament at 2:30 and found out no English tours were available so we took the Russian one. The place was very impressive but the guide, even though he was nice, had an extremely heavy Hungarian accent which was hard to overcome.The main hall with te crown with the guards around him was cool.

Impressive exterior. The Parliament building is one of the dominant landmarks on the Budapest Danube shoreline. Its dome and exterior detailing is very impressive. There is a visitor's centre for the building, whose subterranean entrance is to the right of the building when facing the front door - I did not go in due to time constraints as well as being a non-EU citizen having to pay over double the price to EU citizen tourists.

World Class. A "Must visit" place and well worth the experience, BUT; 1) you have to book in advance for a tour in your language online2) not easy if you are staying in an apartment and can't print your ticket3) we had a saviour, who fronted the booking desk at 8am in the morning to book our tickets for that day.You also have to be able to climb 130 stairs or use the lifts.The tour is for about an hour

Awsome architecture. Didn't go in due to a protest, but the building itself is great to look at. Considering it's not that old it shows that until recently humans could still build amazing structures. The detail is incredible. Got some great pics and everyone at home knows you've been to hungary when they recognise this building.

Beautiful Building. I loved watching this huge,elegant & very beautiful building from our Danube river cruise as we passed close to it.There is a museum inside & a cafe but the restaurants in the streets behind it are worth visiting for the delicious Hungarian food at reasonable prices.A garden around the building also.
Parliament. You can visit the Parliament, just buy the tickets online so you don't have to wait in line the guide will tell you stories about the building and the governement.

Iconic. No trips would be completed without seeing Parliament building which is one the best structure in Danube.
It is just beautiful and iconic.

Beautiful building inside and out. . We reserved a tour, very disorganized start and security. The areas you see are very opulent including the crown jewels, but the tour guide spoke softly and quietly so hard to hear and for the price (expensive by Budapest's standards) it was very short and hurried.

Interesting . It was a really beautiful building and it was great to see the Crown Jewels. The tour guide was brilliant at answering questions about politics and the monarchy. It would be brilliant for anyone interested in history politics or architecture.

Budapest Parliament buildings. Very interesting building, quite impressive. The tour was only about 45 minutes but seemed somewhat pricey for non-Europeans.....about $26CDN per person. Tours are offered in several languages and the guide was very good. Suggest you buy you tickets ahead of time online at a pre-determined time so that you don't waste time in line. We enjoyed it, but like I said some people might be put off by the price.
Incredible experience. Parliament tour is a must when you visit Budapest. I have never seen such a beautyful building, every detail is a piece of art. Don't miss it!!!

Must book. We arrived At 9.15 expecting not to be able to get in on an English tour until 16.00 ( according to website) but we were able to book a tour at 11.15. It is defiantly worth the £5 fee for EU citizens, need to take photo ID. I would advise that you pop into visitor centre on your first day so you don't miss the tour. The toilets in the visitor centre cost 50p each, even with an entry ticket, but the toilets just outside are clean and free. The tour guide was very informative. The tour is not suitable for wheelchair users as there is 11 steps before a lift is available for about 10 of the 50 people on each tour, the other 40 need to be able to climb the other 121 stairs. There is security checks on entry, so ensure you don't have any sharps etc.

Lovely building.. Well secured, so couldn't get really close, but didn't need to. A beautiful building. Not sure about grand staircases on river side which go up to small doors, and down to a road - why?Felt sorry for couple of small soldiers at flag mast.

Beautiful building but tours are overpriced and poorly organized. The building is beautifully restored and is certainly worth seeing. I would recommend buying your timed ticket in advance if time is tight. However expect bedlam when you arrive. There was a crowd surrounding the entry gates. One poor woman was trying to give instructions but she could not be heard above the noise of the crowd. When we did finally get in our English tour was paired with a German one and our guide could not be heard above the German one. The tour was very short. We saw the Hungarian Crown Jewels, the magnificent staircase , the House of Commons and the connecting corridors. Disappointing.

Great and big, bold and beautiful. Simply a must. Go and loose yourself into the grandeur that Hungary once had. The size reflects that empire of days gone by. Very well renovated after the disasters of the war and communism.
very beautiful at night. Go and see the building at night as its very beautiful when the lights are on. Also see the changing of the guard each hour as its interesting.

Impressive!. When I read that it is only 100 years old, I couldn't believe my eyes. Wish I saw it inside, but it is built in such an impressive style that your jaw will drop regardless. It's supposed to be the third biggest parliament in the world, which can be easily believed. Worth seeing during the evening (you practically cannot not-see it) as it's beautifuly lit. Make sure you walk all the way around it, as it gets more stunning with every step.

Plan ahead. Great venue, but buy your tickets in advance online, all tours have specific times and languages. we were disappointed to arrive and not be able to see Parliament . However we were able to take a very interesting, historical tour of an interactive exhibit on the ground floor that really gave us insight into the history of Hungary.
Most amazing building in Busapest. Walk around it, enjoy the beauty, the architecture, the location next to the danube ..... Etc etc the list goes on!Pro tip: see it at night by boat
Amazing building. Up there with one of my favourite buildings. Beautiful! Shame about the criminals that work in there...........
wonderful. its an amazing structure and took so long to be renovated after destrution.the architecture is superb.it looks so beautiful at night specily from the cruise boat

Absolutely Beautiful and Even More So at Night. If you are in Budapest be sure to take in the Parliament building, which is enormous and absolutely stunning. While you cannot go inside every day, it is worth the walk just to admire the view. From there it's a quick walk to the Danube. As magical as this building is in the daytime, at night, light up, it is even more beautiful. The 1956 exhibit, describing the fall of communism, is on the grounds underneath (you see the words 1956 and enter through a tunnel). Also very interesting to see, and free of charge.
Hungarian Parliament. This is by far the most beautiful parliament building I'v eseen in terms of architecture.It makes for a amazing sight at night with the lights.

A must-visit. The Parliament building in Budapest is breath-taking and a must-visit. You have to book your tour slot in advance, preferably the day prior. Tours are available in several languages. Absolutely beautiful and highly recommended!
Marvellous archtecture. this is also an architectural beauty. this building one should see from the river Danube in day o r night . it is historical

Should have been a castle!. Parliament looks like it should have been a castle. It looks magnificent during the day, and extraordinary at night! I had the pleasure of riding along the Danube river in a cruise at night, and the view was spectacular.

Worth visiting. The Parliament building is worth a visit, because of its political importance and the history behind it. Only disappointment was the guide whose strong accent made it hard to understand her english.

outside better. I was inside and pay a lot of money to see the parliament inside but was really disappointed, we saw only 2-3 small rooms and that all! really dont go inside the view from outside is better and free!

Never actually made it on a tour!. My boyfriend and I turned up yesterday for the two o'clock tour that we had found out by the website was on. So when we go there we were told there was no tour until 6 but come back tomorrow (today) and there would be tours on at 10, 12, 1, 2 and 3 o'clock that we would be able to go on. We arrived today just after one to be told by the notice board that there was once again no tour until 6! We decided to still queue up to ask somebody as the queue had only 5 or 6 couples in it but we were still in the queue at 2 after nearly an hour and having not moved at all. An absolute shambles. And horrendously expensive. Only good thing I can say is that the toilets were free.

Nice building. Impressive building. I was impressed by the fact that in the price of the ticket there are organized tours with a guide to explain everything. I also appreciate the ticketing system, we were able to buy the tickets from home on the internet and avoid lines.

This is one beautiful building on a mountain.. This is a beautiful building. make sure you take photos from the other side of the river, because ones on the same side it is hard to do so.Get the hop-on hop-off bus to take you up there and all the other attractions. lots of people at bus stops will sell you the tickets. we had the 48 hr one and planned out two days around the bus routeonce up there you have a beautiful view of the whole city. we must have taken at least 300 photos. it is a beautiful place to be at. there are a couple of attractions in there, but we elected to miss them due to lack of time (museums of some sort). considering how beautiful it is from outside, I did not see the reason to go in. small cafes and restaurants in the little village just outside. busy so only go when you have to, otherwise take the bus back down.one or two attractions around it too.

Well worth getting reservations. The parlement building is the third largest in the world, larger than the U.S. Congress. When Hungary had an empire and nobels they were bicameral. Now they have one country and one house so that the building duplicates itself. Both sides exactly the same. One side for tourists and other uses, one side for the legislature when it is in session. In the middle are the Crown Jewels and the color guard. Elegant and historic.

Parliament View at Night. Parliament is one of the many wonderful places to visit in Budapest, Hungary. Our tour group got to see and visit it during the day and I did the optional Danube River Dinner Cruise to see it and many other beautifully lit buildings at night. In addition to Parliament and other buildings, the centuries old bridges were well lit. Some other recommended places are the Matthias Coronation Church, Fisherman's Bastion, Royal Palace, Jewish Interest Tour and Mount Gellert. The local tour guides are friendly, knowledgeable and speak very good English. Planned tours done with travel agencies are the best way to learn the history and see the most famous sites.
Beautiful place for a conference. I visited the parliament as participant in a conference. What a beautiful place. Guided tours are also very good so I can also recommend this for tourists!

Interesting visit. Although I've been to Budapest a number of times I'd never been on the Parliament tour until now. Some friends recommended the exhibition on the events of 1956, which is free and adjacent to the Parliament (very well worth a visit) and while I was there I decided I might as well do the tour. Contrary to even recent guide books you don't get in up the main steps, but through a visitor centre to the right of the building as you face the river. Visits are in groups only, with a guide in your chosen language at different times. It's worth booking in advance for popular languages (like English!) as they book up quickly, but the booking desk was very helpful in my case and booked me onto a German tour with spaces, that had an English tour going at the same time that I managed to sidle over to. The guide spoke good English and was very informative about the political system and the building itself, which is beautiful both inside and out. Very well worth the visit.

Incredible building - guide was hard to follow.. This is an absolutely breathtaking building and I absolutely recommend it as a must see. It does tend to get rather crowded so definitely try to get tickets ahead of time either through your hotel or online by yourself.They don't allow any photography in the main (and one of the most beautiful) rooms where the relics of St Stephen are kept. But otherwise it's a pretty open tour.I would recommend reading up on the building in advance if possible. The huge crowds and the guides accent made the actual tour a bit hard to follow for me personally.

Very interesting. I would recommend booking the tour of Parliament. Tip: you have to book online and print off the tickets - they did the printing at the counter for us. The tour guide was very knowledgeable. The building was beautiful.

Cigar holders!. We did not reserve tickets ahead. We got to the ticket desk at 10:00AM and asked if we could still join the 10:00AM English tour. We were very lucky in that we could. The guided tour was interesting and informative. You have to see the cigar holders outside the parliamentary chambers! They are numbered so you don't lose track of your cigar.

To see from the other side of the river and by night. You will only have a true idea of the dimension and beauty of the parliament if you see it by night and from Buda. One of the best views of Budapest and impossible to miss it.
Worth the small cost. A real gem. a 50 min tour, lots of interest. You can get tickets on the day but pot luck, best to purchase in advance. hotels charge an admin fee.

A Must See. As political junkies we made sure that we got the tickets beforehand to visit the Hungarian Parliilment. It!s beautiful, the Hungarian king'crown, orb and scepter as well as accompanying guards are a sight to see. But best, are the memorial to the 1957 Revolt located next door underground and the cannon balls from tanks in the walls of the building across from Parliment which represent citizens killed the first day, many of whom were never identified.
Highly advise. A very nice and tranquil area in an otherwise buzzing city. The architecture is amazing and there are loads of places to just sit and watch the world go by.

Most beautiful building in Budapest . Must visit this area when visiting one of the most beautiful cities in the world.The Parlament building is taking up a huge area and are wonderful, it's amazing architechture. Lot's of History around this area.
Stunning building. The building is on most adverts featuring Budapest and there is no wonder. It is stunning but massive

Excellent tour of where Hungary operates. Beautiful rooms and corridors. . Booked the parliament tour for Sunday 12 noon. English tourIt was packed. About 50 people with easy pace and nice tour guide. She was clear and patient in giving details and operations of he parliament. Rooms and corridor halls were decorated with gold pillars and red carpeting. Assembly hall was impressive and showed us Hungarian crown jewel. Pictures are allowed except for 1 room. The dome with the crown jewel guessed by 2 Hungarian army guards. Overall tour is rather short but concise and full explanation of purpose of the parliament and each of the rooms shown. FYI. Booked in advance. If not you will not allowed to go on any tour or entrance.

The parlament is amazin, the tour guide is awful. We wanted to visit the parlament, and the only way possible is with a guide. If youre european you'll receive half price or if you're a european student even more discount, if you're not european you'll have to pay 5000 HUF for 45 min of tour. Which I think is too much considering the quality of the tour and the time.Our guide had a horrible english, we could barely understand her and also seemed she was in a hurry, she never let us stop to take pictures or to admire the building, she was always walking and walking. Pictures are allowed in all places of the building except in the dome where the crown is placed.An advice is to buy the tickets in internet, you can be lucky and find places available for that same day if not you'll have to buy them for another day and this means you'll loose a lot of time. The parlament is amazing but I'd to put 3 stars for the tour and the guide, as this is the only way to visit the building it should be a very good visit, with more time and better quality, also considering the prize you've to pay.
Like a fairy-tale. Most impressing at sunset. Like a fairy-tale. One almost expect to see Disney characters peep out the tiny windows.
Georgious Architecture. Wow, it's amazing! It is massive! It 's hard to imagine these structures being built. I took pictures while we cruised on the riverboat. Enjoy the view.

Must book in advance!. Tours fill up very quickly and, you are lucky if you can walk in and get on a tour, so would highly recommend booking a few days in advance. Some rooms within the building photography is not allowed however there are rooms where there is an opportunity to do so. Not very expensive and very impressive building for a great view of the outside of Parliament head over to Batthyány Square or book yourself on a river cruise both offer the best views of the whole building in all its glory. The guides are well informed and are happy to answer any questions, the cafe situated in entrance is also very nice place to eat.
Must have. Clear, nice, historycal, amazing. A must have afternoon in Budapest. Do not use any kind of guided help. Just listen the walls, feel the atmosphere.

Could have been better. When we arrived we were given no direction of where to go so just joined the security queue to have your bags checked for weapons etc. The queue was very long and badly organised with people queue jumping. When we finally got through, we were in a very large group of about 40 people and the lady who presented the tour would begin speaking (very quickly which made it difficult to understand!) in the next area before the rest of the group had caught up. I thought that they would show us some more areas of Parliament as we were only shown into about 3 different areas. The tour lasts roughly 45 minutes and I would recommend booking your tickets in advanced online for convenience.

Underwhelmed. I really wanted to see more of the interior of this magnificent building. The tour takes around 45 minutes which includes getting through security. Non EU residents are charged a much higher fee for the guided tour and I felt it was too high for the content of the tour. What we did see was beautiful, and the guide provided good information if you could hear it clearly. The tour group was quite large.

Parliament. Excellent tour, brilliant historic building. Buy tickets on-line to avoid disappointment.The web site is terrible, it says tour times are "closed" then releases new batches of tickets. Check early morning.

Fabulous outside and in. Every visitor to Budapest will have seen the iconic Parliament Building from the river. Well it's just as stunning inside too. In fact you could be forgiven for thinking you were in a palace.You need to book in advance on the Internet, and come at the appointed time. Tickets were pretty cheap. Tours last around 45 mins.

Beautiful structure, looks stunning at night. The parliament building is a large and dominating structure in the Landscape of Budapest.It looks very pretty by day but even more stunning at night. We didn't get a chance to explore the inside of the building, though i hear it is quite nice on the inside as well. A tour guide is needed to explore the interiors.There are water spray points on the exterior which help bring down the heat a little bit. Take the escalator and go down for a few minutes to pay homage to those who lost their lives at this venue. A stark reminder of the grim history that the city has undergone.

Breathtaking. Entering is like in airport high security controls but believe me... All worthy!They offer different language guided tours with very kind and friendly people.The first thing did impact me is the gold made stairs. The guards who custody the crown and the statues of all the Kings (included one queen).The parliament's room for parlamientaries is some thing kind of wow!!We were lucky enough to see the change of guards who custody the crown.The building was builder at the 1814 and from them it was designed with a very interesting air conditioner system which permitted to keep the same temperature the whole year, producing five tons of eye every 5 days. You guys hVe to visit this awesome place!

Even Better Seeing it in Person. This famous building, Hungary's Parliament, is a well photographed site, and rightly so. Situated right on the Danube River, this magnificent building is well worth a visit, at the very least, one should see if from the outside. The place is even more beautiful in person than its photographs. The best views of the Parliament by far are at night. If you can take a cruise on the Danube at night, do so, you will not be disappointed. The Parliament building floodlit at night as you cruise past it will be an unforgettable highlight of your visit to Budapest.

Book Ahead. Worth taking tour if..... The outside of the building is stunning, particularly at night from the river. The tour is worthwhile if you are interested in a bit of history and seeing the inside of beautiful public buildings - I was so it was worthwhile for me. Architecture and internal decorations were spectacular. Got to see one the chamber and the crown jewels (no photos of jewels).Definitely book ahead of time on the net to avoid the long lines. Nearby in the square is a short walk down to an exhibit that describes the Hungarian Revolution.
Spectacular and historic building. This building ranks with the most beautiful and interesting in Europe. Don't miss it - outside or in. Well organized tour.

AMAZING!!!. Must see in budapest number one!!The building is amazing!!! That's THE attraction of budapest. I don't think it's necessary to take a special guide for that, because you must scedule a tourguide to enter the building, and I recommend to do it online. It is great!

The Second Largest Parliament Building in Europe after Westminster. This is one of the most beautiful attractions in Budapest. Either by day or night it is incredible. If you have the time you have to take the guided tour. You have to get there early in the morning because they have limited groups and the tickets sell out especially at peak times. The wood work on the inside is fantastic and the main chambers and the grand halls are impressive. This is a time machine which takes you back to a time when Europe and the Austro-Hungarian Monarchy was flourishing before the Great War. A ten year renovation and cleaning of the outside of the building was completed a couple of years ago and it is now scaffolding free. It is a must see! I live here and I take all of my visitors there. At night, view it from the Fisher Bastion next to the Hilton Hotel. Trust me it is worth it.

Book ahead!. Not the most organized place you'll visit but worth seeing. Definitely go to Parliament early to reserve tickets for later in the day or try booking online. Tix go fast, at least in the summer time. Oh, & the tour is shorter than you may expect- roughly 40 mins.

just a nice building but no intellectual challenge. bit boring. short tour through building with guide, some interesting facts but nothing challenging your brain. nice building, but not spectacular. if i compare to e,g, Segrada Familia this is one star compared to 5.

Weed in Budapest. This building is big and beautiful. If you pay full price I don't think it is worth it but if you can pay the EU price then I recommend touring this attraction. It really is beautiful and there are a lot of interesting facts provided by the tour guide. oh and get there early in the AM to buy your tickets for the day. You will probably not get right in. you will probably buy your tickets for later in the day. Pics are allowed during the tour.

Nice. We did not have the chance to visit the inside of the building due to a national holiday. Other than that the outside of the building from all sides is excellent and the surrounding area as well. It is worth visiting day and night when it is lighted.

Beauty of Budapest. I was not inside but i was outside of this magnificant building!
This is maybe the most beautiful building you will see in Budapest. Make sure you go in front of it, but also you should go across Danube for panorama views that also included perfect sports to see this in early morning and late evenings.

Place to visit. Great location for Architecture and history lovers, this building is really worth of seeing at least from the outside.
Don't forget to visit a "shoes on Danube" monument in memory of people shot into the Danube in 1944-45

Beautiful. This was one of our highlights of Budapest. Obviously, the outside of the building is amazing and beautiful, but highly recommend taking a guided tour. The inside of this historical building is unbelievable and breathtaking. Our guide was very friendly and knowledgeable. We even had the opportunity to see a changing of the guard inside while viewing the Crown Jewels.

Beautiful decoration. We took a guided tour and got to see the beautifully decorated parliament building. A lot of it is decorated in gold. We got to see the grand stair case, the crowd jewels and the dome. We were also very lucky and to see the assembly hall where parliament sessions take place. You can take pictures throughout apart from where the Crown Jewels are.There was enough information during the guide but you were not over loaded. There is a nice cafe where prices are reasonable

Amazing architecture. The most expensive Hungarian building, with its cost it would be possible to build a city for 40 000 people. Having said that, a majestic building with the most amazing wine-coloured domes.

The MAGYAR (Hungarian) Parliament. One of the most beautiful Government buildings in the World. Since they "pressure" washed it, it glistens in the rising and setting sun.Tours of the building are available, take advantage of it.

Amazing building. The Parliament building is a must to see, it seems to shine in the sunlight, it's spotless facade is so beautiful by day and at night it is breathtaking, illuminated by spectacular lighting, if you get hot and tired there is a small cafe across the square at the side where you can sit and cool off with an ice cream or drink while taking in the view.

I'd seen in advertisements for traveling in Budapest, so what a thrill to see it in person!. My husband and I took a tour of the Parliament. It was quite a bit of walking, but worth it. Our guide was very friendly and informative. I especially loved seeing the Crown Jewels that were protected by the Americans during World War 2 and returned to Hungary by President Jimmy Carter. I hope I remember correctly...

Beautiful building. Worth a visit even if you are not particularly interested in the history. The parliament building is beautiful inside and out, and considering the entry fee is so small, it is definitely worth taking the time to look at the stunning architecture inside.
Beautiful building. This building was so clean it looked like new and the spires and dome etc were stunning. One of a number of wow buildings in the city

Hungarian Pride. This is a beautiful building and historically significant. Be sure to buy your tickets on-line before traveling to save time and ensure entry as space is limited and be prepared for the usual security check before entry. The tour is only 45-minutes and a quick run through the building but it is worth it.

Beautiful Neo-Gothic work of Majesty. A must see attraction of Budapest. Can't be missed from the river views but better to plan ahead and visit inside. We had limited time and arranged a full day private tour of the city. The guide was able to help us purchase tickets and skip the long lines and waiting to purchase a ticket. Limited visits in English so do plan ahead. The interior is majestic. Photos allowed in parts but not the dome area. Access is restricted to guided tours which run about 50 minutes.

Impressive building. Huge building - although the tour only goes thru a portion it does cover the focal areas and provides some great photo ops. Don't plan on showing up and catching the next tour - it's busy and we had to wait an hour and 1/2 before next available tour time.
Maybe someday. Building looked great from the outside. Unfortunately the line up to get in was too long and the tour in english was only done twice a day, so we did not wait for the tour.

The number one thing to see - for millions it seems!. Fabulous architecture, wonderful setting, very very busy so go early or book in advance. The central feature, the domed hall, is impressive and uniquely beautiful - but all the chambers and corridors are splendid.
Parliament house. View from palace across the river. Walk around. View from local Margaret bridge and again view from river boat cruise. Fabulous

magnifecent. the building of the parlament is huge. whate ever the side you look at it walking aroud is just amazing very easy acces with a metro station in front of it. all the square is full of statues of nacional heroes . the inside is suntous. the independebce day in augoust is celebrated there with soldiers horses and espades beautiful style. u got to pay but At Hungary every thing is very cheap. must be visitef

A masterpiece of architecture. The Hungarian parliament building in Budapest is truly a masterpiece of architecture. This is the seat of the National Assembly of Hungary, and is the highest and largest building in the country.The building is located on the Pest side of the Danube, at Kossuth Lajos Square. You can reach the building on Line 2 of the Budapest Metro, and with the Line 2 tram. The building is fantastic!! The only way you can get inside is by buying a tour ticket. It’s advisable to pre-purchase your tickets online [at Jegymester.hu…this means Ticketmaster.hu in Hungarian]. The English-speaking tours are limited in number every day, and they sell out quickly. You might luck out and be able to buy a ticket at the new Visitor Center when you get there, but I’ve been disappointed by trying to buy tickets at the last minute. The tour guide clips along pretty quickly, so get your camera ready! The main staircase is magnificent, and the assembly halls are splendid. Look for the cigar holders along the window sills. The Crown Jewels in the Dome Hall are spectacular. However, you can’t get too close to them, and photos of the jewels are not allowed. Also note that when parliament is in sessions, and other official receptions are taking place, the guided tours are cancelled or postponed without advance notice. And, Parliament is closed on Hungarian holidays. Do your homework about dates before you order tickets to avoid disappointment.
Great, informative tour!. One of the most comprehensive tours of a Parliament building that I've ever had. Really interesting to hear about how the building is used and, of course, it is stunning.
Beautiful building. Really beautiful building on the banks of the river Danube - must see for visitors to he city you cannot miss it!

Worth taking the tour, not just looking from outside. We took the English speaking tour of the Parliament building. A breathtaking building especially the great domed hall that contains the Crown Jewels. Well worth visiting.

Possibly the most beautiful parliament building in the world. Very beautiful building, striking similarities to Westminster palace. Visit the place in the night - the view from the river is especially great.

Impressive Parliment site. The Hungarian Parliament building on the Danube River is very impressive both inside and out! They have daily tours in English ; however, the tour is very brief and not that informative. The staff should really improve the tour as it could be made into a world class tour considering the history involved .Great photo opportunities. Definitely worth a visit.

A must see to appreciate Hungary's history. Highly recommended to book the Parliament tour to go inside Hungary's biggest building. Amazing to see the intricately designed rooms gilded in 40kg of gold. We were lucky to witness the changing of the guards inside the Dome Hall where the Holy Crown is. Tours are available in different languages and can be booked online. The tour gives visitors a better understanding and appreciation of the Hungarian history. It is also a sight to see from the Danube river cruise at night.

Picturesque Budapest. Did both a day and nighttime viewing of the Parliament building - on the banks of the 'Blue Danube'. I prefer and would definitely recommend a night viewing - the building takes on a magical quality and is well lit to show off its beautiful architectural features. A must see when you are in town.

This place gets better and better. I have been coming to Budapest for 18 years and have to say that my visit last week was highlighted by the way that the parliament building and the entire area around it has been so splendidly restored. There is a new visitor centre and a memorial to the 1956 revolution too. The landscaping, both hard and soft makes it look stunning. It is awesome at night too, as are both banks of the Danube around the central area, very photogenic!
Beautiful builsing. Get here early during the tourist season as the tickets sell out fast (at least for the English tours). Well worth it - beautiful building.
woowwy picturious parliment. I haven't been inside but view from outside, especially from the mount other side of the river or from the boat trip is amazing.
Get your tickets via internet and save the line!. Cool trip trough the Parliament, get your tickets via internet and save the line! It was worth the trip :)

A place that you must see in Bucharest. This was the place that I loved to see. For me was so interesting also because of different stories of each corner of this building.For visit, don't forget to bring your PASSPORT. Driving license and the ID cards are not acceptable.Well for myself, I didn't like the ticketing section as it was so hot and not in good order.

The Most Beautiful Building In Budapest. This is the most beautiful building in Budapest, the architecture is breathtaking.
Tip: The best place to get a photo is from across the river, directly across from it there is a stone wall you can sit on or lean against to capture the building and the river

Could have been a lot better.. The building is spectacular, but the official tour was a little disappointing. The organization was chaotic and the tour itself was very short. It was worth doing, but don't expect too much.

Wow, especially at night. Beautiful building, quite a sight at night when it is all lit up. A very comfortable visitor centre, but crowds, so book tickets ahead of time, we didn't, and didn't have time to do the interior tour. ( 2 hour wait).

Be sure you booked your visit. The Parliament is really cool and worth a visit, but it cannot be visited without a guide. Guided tours are scheduled each day in several languages and you're only allowed to get in within one of them, so be sure you book it before you get there - you can book it there too, but you would probably find yourself waiting a couple of hours before your scheduled tour.

A triumph of Austro-Hungarian architecture.. Modern and efficient visitor centre. Take passports and student cards for all EU citizen and under 26 discounts. Airport style security takes time as does climbing many stairs to start the tour but well worth it to see St Stephen's crown and one of the chambers. Look for the cigar holders outside the chamber.

Unbelievable Landmark. This is an absolutely amazing building and a very worthwhile tour. You need to get there early as it gets very busy. You can buy your tickets on line and it will show you what times during the day are English speaking tours. The tour lasts about an hour.I believe we paid the equivilent of about $12 US for our tickets.If you are looking at the building from the river, the Visitor Centre is on the left hand side, Gate #12.
stunning building. wow what an amazing building this is, truly a joy on the eye and make sure you take a boat ride up and down the Danube at night to see this lit up at night an unfogettable sight.

Very impressive . The building is beautiful both outside and inside. You can walk inside the house only with a tour guide. The tickets lines where very long and there was no air-conditioning. After standing for a long time in line, we found out that there are no longer tickets for the English tour. We found out that it's much easier to make reservations by the Website.

Beautiful building without any extras except.... ...there is an underground exhibition next to it. It is a great view from outside and not easy to get inside. If you want to have extra fun, go on a boat tour and check the Parliament out from the Danube. You can do it either by public transport or a boat for tourists or a hybrid bus that goes around the city and finally enters the river at the end.

Awesome building. We didn't go inside, but the outside was amazing. We went there at nighttime, when the spotlights illuminated the building. One of the greatest buildings I've ever seen, architectural and otherwise. A must see in Budapest.

Amazing view. They have good service here. The ticket booking website was pretty easy .
This place is just so stunning. You will have an amazing night view from the Danube(don't miss it)! The lighting is an unforgettable sight to see.

Tour not worth it. The building is beautiful but the tour is not worth it. Need to pay 5200 ft and some area can't take picture. Tour only lasts 30+ min. A guard is following u all the time forcing u to move forward! The city hall tour at Vienna is much better and also free!

Purchase online tickets in advance. It is a must visit while in Budapest. Do purchase tickets online at least a few days in advance. English tours sell out fast (other languages are not nearly as popular).

Changing of the Guard. We sat on a nearby bench to eat our lunch and go view the building.While there we realised the changing of the guard was in progress so we joined the throng to get a closer look.After the ceremony was completed the public was invited to have close contact with the guards to take "selfies"Unfortunately we did not take notice of what the time was when the event took place

just to walk around its well worth a visit. We saw the parliament from buda and thought the distance view would be good enough. The next day however we took a closer look and it was well worth getting close to. We didn't go inside but the outside was very attractive.w

Wonderful architecture & loved the guards. Pictures of the building are all over the net.... We really enjoyed the guards protocol. Especially when they allowed a little boy to march with them. Good sense of humour!Unfortunately couldn't do a tour - all sold out. Get there early

You need to know it. One of the main buildings in Budapest. You need to learn its history and walk around his spaces to appreciate all its structure. A very special moment each 15 minutes with the guardians change in the custody of the crown. Great views from Buda side at nights. Very specials from the river.

Stunning details . When I think about Budapest this is probably the first thing I think of. A beautiful symbol of the city, it's better seen from the other side of the river but only when you're standing right in front of it you can admire the astonishing details of every window. Simply a piece of art.

Almost better than the London. Its a spectacular building on the edge of the Danube, well worth a walk to but didn't have time (need passport) to go inside; at night lit up its something else and very impressive.
The icon of the city. An exquisite and grand building, at the side of the Danube River. This building is the icon of the city, and surely you have seen it in many pictures of Budapest.

See the interior!. The tour was okay - you don't really have a choice if you want to see the interior. The guide's English wasn't very good, so I couldn't understand her at times. But the grandeur of the interior makes the visit worth it!
Tip: Reserve your tickets early online. They get sold out really quickly.

Impressive building that is even more stunning at night. This is an impressive building. Didn't have the time to go inside but went back to visit it again in the night and it is truly truly stunning at night. Those night shots are beautiful.

Great place. Nice architecture, great building, very well maintained. Tip: after visiting by foot, take the tram from the back up to the docs - 4 stops - and get a cruise to Margaret Osland and back, is @ 2100 Huf for adult and free for childs up to 12 and see the building from the Danube. In the afternoon the sun will put a great light on the facade.

Magnificent Parliament Building.. This magnificent Neo-Gothic 100 years old,is one of the largest parliament building in the world.The building facade is very impressive decorated with many statues of Hungarian rulers,pointed arch arcades & numerous gargoyles,spires & Gothic ornaments.From my Danube cruise i marveled at the beauty & harmony of the 96 meters high building with huge central dome, with 27 intricately carved spires, give it a commanding view from a distance.I entered inside as a part of a tour group & found the interiors as stunning as the exteriors with decorations from some best Hungarian artists.There are marvelously decorated staircase hall with granite columns & a huge ceiling painting by the Hungarian artist Karoly Lotz.The crown jewels Hall is another highlight not to be missed with the crown of Hungarian king Stephen 1.A worth while visit.
Really impressive building!. With its strange gothic architecture the Parliament of Budapest is a sight you won't often see! As beautiful by night and by day, it is a must stop if you're in Budapest!
GORGEOUS. I didn't get inside because you need a reservation and I didn't have the time to get it, but the view of the Parliament from river Danube is simply gorgeous.

See the Hungarian Royal Crown. You must make your reservation online, but if you miss your tour - as we did - they were accommodating and put us on the next available English tour. The tour guide seemed a little bored with his job, but the architecture, art and crown were worth it all. We did here another tour guide get a robust round of applause so all guides are not equal!
Simply beautiful . Very beautiful place to visit. Best time to do so is at night, because the nocturnal lighting is phenomenal.
Very beautiful! . Any weather, any part of the day, from any side - always beautiful building! And a free WiFi in the park nearby :)
Book it a day before, at least. Nice walkthrough of Parliament with good guide. It is not possible to just come and go. Usually you have to book it in advance - use wifi day before your visit.
Fabulous building. Gorgeous building, didn't go inside, but saw it from various landmarks and the Danube, you need to book I think.
excellent visit. We prebooked our tour to avoid the long queue.well worth the visit.probably one of the high lights of city visit

Is it a picture?. When we first saw it we thought that it was a picture from a very famous artist! We didn't have the opportunity to get in and I don't know if the entry is permitted to the public but just go there and watch all these small details that make up this building an art miracle!

The most beautiful Parliament !!!. At the time I visited the parliament it was evening, and sun was setting. The amazing colors of sun setting was reflected on to the clouds just above the parliament. The clouds reflected Magenta color which a perfect match to the parliament's color. A spectacular view indeed. The parliament looks amazing in the night as well. A must see attraction in Budapest!!! Highly recommended especially in the evening and night! I have put up the photos in my profile to correlate my description!

Don't miss seeing the parliament buildings at night. I base my 5 star rating on the view of the parliament buildings at night; not on the inside tour. We sailed into Budapest after dark and were overwhelmed by the beauty of the scene. The parliament buildings, the bridges, and all other important buildings were all beautifully lit. My wife and I, together with many others on the cruise ship, agreed that it was the most beautiful sight we had ever seen. We later toured the inside of the building and found it interesting but not overwhelmingly so. If you have to choose between a tour of the inside and a nighttime cruise on the Danube, go with the river every time. It is a sight you will never forget.

Amazing experience. Amazing experience, but it's pity that in tourist centre is so bad organization. And I was little disappointed that our visit was at the same time like visit of spanish group, so lot of people and two different languages at the same place

Parliament outside . We were not able to get inside but even the outside is worthwhile to come and see.Beautiful view on the Buda side and if you're around don't miss the shoes monument a few hundred meters away along the river.
Nothing interesting. Not bad, but it's poor without instructor.The crowd is terrible, and no rules to behave.I don't offer

ONLY 3-4 tours per day in English!. Actually never made it inside the building as to manage to buy a ticket for the guided tour in English you either need to buy online and have your card charged in the local currency (not good rates) or wake up at 7 to be in line at 8 to get a tour for around 12pm as they offer limited tours in English!!! We tried three separate days to get in but not luck. I am on holidays I dont need to wake up at 8 to see the Parliament's inside :) Wonderful building. HUF2000 is not bad either.
Imposing building. For the second time in Budapest, it is not possible not to see this majestic building; beautiful show the change of the guard and the spectacle offered to tourists !
A landmark of the city. An impressive building which will remind you the one in London. Take the chance to see it by the Danube by taking the public shuttle boat operating like a bus.

Don't miss!. Beautiful building, and of the main attraction of the city. Even if you're not going to have a tour in the building, still amazing place to visit around. Don't miss watching it from both sides of the river. If you do plan to have a tour, make sure to book it in advance.
Outstanding Baroque Era Style Interiors. Outstanding decor inside the houses of Parliament building with Baroque Era style! Over the top embellishment and gilding in addition to history of Hungary.

Stunning! You Can Say it Again: Simply Stunning!. By day or night, by land or sea just gorgeous. Forget that it's the latest parliament building or the tour inside.. It's just Stunning-Simply Stunning!

Magnificent building. This is a truly magnificent building on the Pest side of the Danube. It's modelled on Westminster with both a House of Commons and House of Lords but unlike Westminster the House of Lords was never used oh and you can walk right up to the building. It's just as inspiring at night when floodlit. There are tours available and it's best to book in advance or see your hotel concierge
The best monument in Budapest. See at the Parlament during the night from the Buda size is something amazing!We also entered and it is a very luxurious place!
Well worth a visit. Glad we booked in advance, because the English tours get booked up quickly. Very interesting history and Spectacular architecture.

Gorgeous Architecture in Budapest. The Parliament Building in Budapest is an architectural beauty. During the day it is fun to watch the changing of the guards and at night the lights on the building attract flying insects high above the spiers which in turn attract the bats that circle above. It is a very interesting and beautiful sight in Budapest!!!!

Incredible architecture. I went twice to Budapest and every time I want to see the parliament building. It is soooo beautiful. If you go there walk around the building because it is beautiful from all sides.Last time I went there it was on july 2014 but here the latest I can put is september.

Wonderful architecture!. This building is absolutely beautiful. It can't be missed in any of the great views around the city. It is found along the Danube. While walking along the river, I found the 'shoes' along the Danube, which are worth seeing on the way.I did not go outside but the sheer size and beauty of it should be seen from all sides. I have seen pictures of the inside and it looks beautiful as well. It would be cool to hear some of the history, as they have guides available in many languages. There are many statues found around the parliament which are worth checking out. There are also awesome views of the castle as it is lit up at night time. I put up a couple pictures that I took from the Buda side of the city.
gorgeous building. See the parliament at night. It´s all lit up and the birds are flying on top of it .. really amazing. looks like a castle from the fairy tales

Outside is enough. After reading the reviews, we decided not to go inside. This is an attractive structure that looks great in photos looking down the Danube, but if you've got limited time, I'd prioritize the Buda side attractions like Gellert Hill and Castle Hill.

Incredibly Beautiful!. The parliament building puts Buda Castle to shame! This stunning piece of architecture, while it is so much newer than any of the other buildings in Budapest, is incredibly beautiful! And its sheer size as it sits along the river is only truly appreciated when you visit the building - its huge! Don't miss the views of this beautiful piece of architecture at night too!

Stunning!. Amazing inside and out. You can purchase tickets for a tour on line but we rolled up on the day and had no problem obtaining a ticket. EU citizens are able to purchase a discounted ticket showng a passport as identification. The tour isn't long but really worth it to feast your eyes on the the opulence within this building.
Must see!. The most dominant and beautiful building in the area! Check it out from across the Danube at night, as it is breath taking!
Stunning. Stunning Building, especially at night. Did not get a chance to go see it as ya have to book in advance. Tip book when you arrive :)

Magnificent Parliament architecture. The sheer enormity of the building and the detail of the architecture must be admired and taken in from all four sides. If possible take a pair of binoculars because I thought I was looking at figurines on top of the chimney only to see the enlarged pictures showing even smaller chimneys on the chimney roof!
Amazingg. I saw it on photos, but I'm telling you, once you get there it's nothing like you have seen before. It leaves you speechless.
Nice building. It is a huge building, it is really beautiful.I didnt enter but it was still worthy, the other buildings around the parlament are also really nice.

Most amazing building ever. This building is simply stunning and makes the Danube promenade something really special by the and night. We also did the tour of the government and it was very interesting as they shared a lot of information with the visitors and you have the chance to see the famous crown of the last Hungarian King. Book your tickets in advance, because there are huge crowds and limited spaces for tours in other languages than Hungarian or English.

OMG -just incrdible. One of the most impreesive structure you'll ever see, up there with Versailles, Westminster Abbey and the like.
You must view it from directly opposite side of the river to really get a grip on the magnitude of this structure.

beautiful building. Had an interesting guided tour round the building. EU residents are able to purchase their tickets cheaper if the produce their passports. We showed our EHIC card and this was accepted. Well worth a visit.

Worth a look. Walked pas the Parilament building,not that impressive but still grand,we were luck enough to have stayed on the Buda side and the view of the parliamen at night lite up was spectacular.

Disappointed with the tour. We booked this tour through Viator which handled transportation and logistics in the beginning but to our surprise left us to find our own transportation back. The actual tour was conducted by a government worker. She was on automatic pilot with a memorized script and spoke so fast you couldn't understand her English. The building was beautiful but I would have rather had a more informative tour.

Spectacular Building. We didn't venture into the parliament building or around it but saw it from a distance. It is massive and spectacular. We got to see it at night which made it even more magnificent. We had a limited amount of time in Budapest but will definitely return one day.

Amazing for night pictures!. We came here at night and during the day to go inside. In my opinion, it is really not worth the entrance fee as it resembles St. Stephen's Basilica which costs a lot less.Come here for the night shots as they are breathtaking!!!!!!!!!!!
Love Budapest. Loved the Parliament, beautiul inside worth seeing it. Budapest a nice city to visit. You can have a great view at night of the Parliament from the roof terrace of the JW Marriott.
Parlament . One of the most beautiful buildings I've ever been in! Take the guided tour it's good and you see more that way

Breathtakingly beautiful landmark. One of the most beautiful landmarks in Europe IMO. This is especially glorious when looking over the Danube river at night. You simply can't afford to miss it in Budapest .

Amazing from the outside and well worth going in too. This is one of the most beautiful buildings in Budapest so is a must visit by day and night to get the full experience. We also did the parliament tour inside which was similarly beautiful and interesting. The whole area has been recently re-done so the visitor centre and areas around the building are all spotless. We booked the tour online in advance from our hotel to make sure we got our desired time slot and didn't have to queue up for tickets.
Beautiful place.. Absolutely beautiful. Great for an evening walk or sit on the bench just next to it. Every time, I am in Budapest, I have to walk around as it still amazes me.
Not worth it. I did not enjoy this tour. It's hot and dusty inside and only lasts a half hour at most. There are much better things to spend 5,200 forint ($18) on in Budapest.

If you go to Budapest, You Have to go to the Parliament!!!. I was in Budapest this August and We did the tour and we loved it cause as you might know or not, this was the only building which was built on purpose to be a Parliament. So it is a very rich building not in gold (even there`s 40 Kg of it in there), but in arquictetal (?) elements. You can see the royal jewels too. Yeah! It`s worth it and even more if you take into account the Hungary`s History.

Book before you go. We booked online before we went which is a good idea as this is a very busy tour (and got it cheaper as we are members of the EU). It was very interesting and informative, but security was strict
Worth A visit.. Well worth a visit, just a few pounds to enter, its worth visiting if only to see the Hungarian Crown Jewels and the changing of the guards.

Aboslutely fantastic inside and outside!. Hungarian Parliament in my estimation is the world's most beautiful government building. With being right on the banks of the Danube, it is spectacular. A terrific new visitor's center, wonderful gardens and statues, unbeatable architecture outside and an interior that will leave you in awe. Fantastic!
Amazing building. Haven't been inside, but you definitely have to see the building. It's beautiful.I saw it from the opposite hill.
Don't miss the Parliament tour. This is a popular site. We made our reservation and bought our tickets online a week before our trip to get the date and time we wanted.

Worthy of a visit but it's more impressive at night. The Parliament is a huge, impressive building right on the Pescht side of the Danube. They have tours throughout the day in various languages. We were able to book a small group tour (of the outside of the building) through our hotel and that guide arranged for tickets to the inside of the building for that same afternoon. The entry process into the building is somewhat chaotic -- at least it was in peak tourist season -- so plan on standing in the lobby with hundreds of other people waiting to go through security. The tour itself is fine -- we had about 25 people in our group. The rooms we visited were worthwhile seeing but I wouldn't say that this is a "must do" in Budapest. The building is most impressive at night when it is all lit up.

Charming Parliament. Budapest's Parliament is a big building decorated with luxuriuos furniture and it's rich of Ungarian History. You must book a guided tour to have a visit in the palace that last about 1 hour. At night, from outside the Parliament is charming.

Absolutely spectacular!. A magnificent building on the Danube River serving as the centerpiece of architecture in the capital city. Located on the "pest" side of the city. Clearly, the #1 visual attraction in the city. A can't miss attraction in the city.

Good to see inside and out. The building looks sensational from the outside and best of all it is free!
To tour the inside best to purchase via the Internet for face a long and boring wait at the visitors centre.
If you have an EU Documentation, bring it, was you will pay less for tickets.
Internally it's also good to see.

The Parliament building lit up at night is a sight to behold. We travelled on the Amadeus Silver II down the Danube. During our visit to Budapest we cruised at night to see the lights at night. it was amazing

An imposing building. An imposing Gothic style building. It's a very impressive building during the day and even more so at night when the light is on. Take a leisurely stroll on the ground around the building but it's best viewed at a distance from the Buda side of the Danube.

Stunning building. When in Budapest you will find yourself photographing this lovely building from all over the city.We took the tour which was very interesting and saw the guard change at the crown jewels.Book your tickets in advance if you can as it gets very busy and be ready for an airport-style security check. When you arrive the entrance is to the right of the parliament building (as you look at the parliament and the river) down a slope.
Hungarian Parliament. A must see.If you think the outside is impressive wait for the inside ! Well worth every penny spend.
Great building. This building was my favorite. It's view from the river is really great. Pay a visit. Take a boat and see the Parliament from the river to see how elegant this building is.
Beautiful!. The parliament is very eye catching when you see it from the castle in Buda. We saw the parliament in the evening, and it was very very stunning!
Stunning building . This is a stunning building , architecture Is amazing.Watched the changing of the guard's which was very interesting
Stunning. Amazing architecture and display. Take in the immensity of this building and walk along the river. Very impressive!
A beautiful building. This is a really impressive building and the tour is well worth it to see the interior and hear the history.

Extraordinary architecture and a must-see!. It is a beautiful sight both during the day and during the night when it is all lit up. We also took an english guided tour to visit the inside. It has a beautiful interior, although the outside is much more impressive. During the tour you will visit few of the main rooms, the Parliament room where the members of parliament meet and the Crown Jewels. Make sure that you go there the earliest possible to buy the tickets so that you will get the time of the tour which is most convenient as they fill up fast, especially the english tour.

Looks better by far!. You will have the most beautiful pictures of this place if you are located far from here. It is not open ti public but you can go to the Museum of the parlament that is down there.

The tour is worth doing. An incredible building, by day or night. A tour is well worth it, but bear in mind you will have to pass through the equivalent of airport security to get in. The tours are also quite packed with lot of people in each (especially when it comes to the lifts you have to take!) but the information you get and the rooms you see are worth it. This building is most definitely worth seeing and learning about.

Picturesque. We didn't get to go inside as we lacked in preparation, but from the outside it is a massive and glorious looking building. Both day and night, it's just a wonder to look at from either the land side or the water.

Magnificient attraction. A magnificient building with oodles of history in it. The area outside the Parliament is also so beautiful and breathtaking. We did a tour of the Parliament which was short and sweet - just what you would need.

Insight into the History. The tour of the inside of the parliament building is very informative providing an insight into the history of Hungary, the building itself and the workings of the hungarian parliament. Pre-booking of the tour online is available and eliminates any waiting if your time is at a premium. An educational insight to a building that is as beautiful on the inside as it is on the outside.

Very nice. We visited parlament last week. Palace is very nice inside, guided tour is very interesting but also very short (30-40 minutes) with quite big groups so if you dont stand near the guide, you dont hear very well.

Extraordinary building!. This a a beautiful, very ornate building and well worth a visit. Make sure to get your tickets in advance. You are assigned a time to visit-get there 15 minutes early. The Parliament chambers are very interesting!

Amazing structure towers above the Danube. The Parliament is a working building which shows its heritage of eastern European architecture. The massive structure on the Pest side of the Danube is best photographed from the water or the Buda side of the river. There are areas which are open to the public and the artifacts in the building bolster its rich history. there is a tour bus stop steps away so getting there is easy.

A must see in Budapest.. We went to Parlament in Budapest in August 2015. We ordered an English guided tour inside Parlament. The interior is beautiful, and you get a lot information about the history of Parlament. The guide spoke easily understandable English. The exterior is beautiful especially during the night hours because it is illuminated.

Astonishing architecture. As a construction/architecture peace, is astonishing. Mainly when the sun goes out and the lights turn the building into a art peace. From any angle. The visit inside is very nice, maybe not a 5 stars. But surelly to go to. Reserve in advance from theyr webside during summer, can get crawded.
Great place to visit. Impressive and well worth a visit, stunning buildings and excellent at night...even better from river view at night

Beautiful outside, and definitely worth it to visit with guided tour. This is a must-see in Budapest. Just looking at Parliament from outside is beautiful, but it's worth the ticket to take the guided tour (the only option - cannot enter without a tour). The tour was interesting and lasted 50 minutes, though it only felt like 10. For a ticket, at the beginning of August we had no trouble stopping by in the morning to reserve for later that day. You cannot buy at the ticket counter for any days in advance, and pay a small fee extra if you buy online. I recommend taking the tour! You get to see the Golden Staircase, the crown, and where Parliament has its sessions. Impressive and interesting.

A grand building. This is the building that symbolizes Hungarian Democracy, even though it's dome was decorated with a red star for years. Inspired by the Palace of Westminster as both are designed on gothic revival lines. Both have a high dome in the center and a balanced facade. The Parliament building is spread along 268 meters of Danube, on the Pest side. Neo gothic turrets, pinnacled gables, ornamental staircases, stained glass windows and gothic arches embellish its white face along with statues of prominent military and royal members of Hungary. The domed Assembly Hall and the rest of the interior is done very artistically. The building can be seen at it's best from the Danube or from the Buda side at night, when most of the interior lights are turned on. No building can be higher than 96 meters because the parliament dome and St.Stephan's Basilica are that height. Tours to the Parliament Building can be booked in advance in various languages.

Beautiful. In 2006 half of the building was in maintenance, so, it wasn't possible to see the entire building with objects around.But it's a great, great building, with a beautiful architecture.I saw it from the river too, a different angle.Try it from different viewpoints in the city... it's a must see!

Make reservations for a tour well ahead. We did not make reservations for a tour but since we really wanted to see the interior we signed up for one in French. While my wife could understand some of what the guide said ( she spoke too fast to really understand) I was left with just enjoying the surroundings. As I did my homework I pretty much knew what it was about. It is a beautiful building full of history and the tour takes you all through it.
Bof. Really not Worth the trip. Expensive, the guide we had was not sympatic and she was doing her job, no more!the building is nice, staff not great, and we had to wait a long time before entry.

Beautiful especially at night from the river. Had the opportunity to cruise past this magnificent building at night and was mesmerised by is beauty, it was like a fairy castle, one not to miss especially at night
Beautiful building. You can't miss checking out this building while in Budapest! We just walked around the outside and it was gorgeous. Best was seeing it at night from the river on a cruise.
magnificent. we didn't go in but it's the largest in the world. It's so magnificent especially if you look at it at night from the Buda side.

Beautiful. Book tickets for a guided tour in advance online since in summer time its very busy. Tour was too short for me, just 30 minutes op so, but everything you see is beautiful... Would recommend this one!
Overlooking the parliament. We took a boat sail in Budapest at night time and the highlights of the cell was definitely going through the parliament
Impressive. The parliament building is very impressive and it's worth visiting during the day and especially at night when it' illuminated - truly a great sight.
Reservations. You must make reservations for language preference in advance. I did not know this on my first visit to Budapest and missed this wonderful experience because of limited time.

Beautiful inside and out, but tour isn't in depth. Nothing to fault on the outside and well worth a visit. We took the interior tour which was inexpensive although only 30 minutes. It was beautiful inside, but has hardly been used so there isn't actually any history to speak of. So worth it the once, but I wouldn't bother again.

A masterpiece of Architecture. Seeing the parliament during the day and at night is a must in Budapest. You are just shocked how a building can be built with that much detail and beauty and also last the test of time.

Impressive do not miss. It is a magnificent Neo gothic construction to hold the parliament sessions.it is impressive in siza and in details quality.The restoration took longer ( 23 years) than the construction .A new sector which includes entrance hall, tickets sale pointsCoffee corner and gift shop in a basement with opening tothe riverside is very well integrated architecturally to the old building.The interior is magnificent guided tour is a must...EU citizens have A special price reduction ..senior citizens no preference unlessHungarians.Rest rooms at the coffee place have a tariff.no soap in the containers of ladies or gentlemen the day we visited.Guide was not to enthusiastic but we did see the change of the guards.Also you get to see the royal crown.Our English lady guide did not use a microphone while others did.It was no a plus.Go with time to get tickets .in the interval you can visit the ShoeSculptures just near by.

Tour is short. The Parliament is a beautiful building both inside and out, though the tour is a bit overpriced for what it is. Very short, and you only see a few rooms. If you're VERY interested, take the tour, otherwise just enjoy the view from outside and catch the flag ceremony in front.
Magnificant Building. The outside of this building is stunning. The inside is equally so. While the tour guides are a bit rote, the decor inside is incredible.

50% queuing 50% tour. We arrived about 30 mins prior to our tour scheduled for 1pm. We had bought our tickets online so we did not need to queue for this. The queue for security (bag checks etc) was a nightmare and not organised at all, people for all tours were queuing at the same time and there was frustration and people were reaching the front of the queue only to be told that it was not time for them to go through security yet. We finally were told it was our time to go through by a woman shouting at us. We finally got through security at about 1.10pm then had to wait another 10 mins in a holding area before our tour started. We set off only a couple of minutes behind a German tour so it was difficult to concentrate at times as we could hear the German tour guide over ours. The total tour time was around 35 minutes and in this time we whizzed around the main corridor, saw the crown jewels and main staircase and briefly visited the main parliament. We were surprised when our guide announced this was the end of the tour as we were expecting a lot more.The exterior parliament building is spectacular and I recommend an evening visit when it is illuminated.

Get there early and make sure you have Forint or a credit card with you. I visited this place last week (August 2015). A few worthy tips:- Make sure you have enough Hungarian Forints (currency) with you to purchase a ticket. They do not accept Euros, only Forint or credit card. As a non-EU person, the fee was 5,200 Forint (around 16 euros). - If you do not have Forint with you, you can purchase something with Euros at the Parliament cafe. They will return you change in Forint (I had to do this). The money changer is a 10 minute walk away).- Book your tickets online, in advance. They sell out fast! Or, like me, wait at the entrance at 8am in the morning (there were already 10 people when I got there). Then quickly queue up to buy a ticket.It is worth the visit! You are allowed to take photos. There are 2 guards who guard the royal crown; it is quite a sight.The outside is stunning as well, of course. Visit at night, when the Parliament lights up -- stunning!
Absolutely beautiful!. We visited the parliament house by day and also by night. It is definetely worth to visit! It is the most beautiful building in Budapest!

Cool!. We only saw the Parliament buildings from the outside in the day where we captured great pictures on our cameras. Great tourist spot and highly recommend going to see it as it is very close to a metro stop.
A Must Visit. Need to pre-book to visit but worth the trouble and the cost. This is a magnificent building and a must see from the river at night

Beautiful!. Beautiful building and worth the small price for the tour inside. If you turn up on the day expect to book tickets and return later as tours are at set times for each language and have a maximum number per tour. Can be booked in advance online.
Great place!. It's a must to visit in Budapest, very beautiful building all around the Kossuth Tér - The Kossuth Square. Great place!

Like a Disneyland Castle.... But this is for real! Very impressive building from the outside. I recommend you to take the guided tour and experience the interior which is as impressive...We saw changing of the guards around the crown jewels- The corridors and rooms are so beautiful decorated and the cigarstands/ashtrays outside the parlamentrooms are awesome...
Beautiful Building. We did not go into the building, but the views around it are excellent. Definitely Cross the river and view it as the sun sets. It looks amazing
Amazing architecture. Unique building, amazing architecture. Nice to visit inside as well, but don't forget to book your ticket in advance on the internet to avoid a long queuing.

Magnificent Building. At a minimum, go look at the building and the area around it. I would highly recommend the one hour guided tour which take you through half of the building and gives you the history of not only the building but the Hungarian government's history.
Must see and visit. Beautiful Gothic building. Daily interior Tour at a price. Go early. EU citizens pays reduced price of 2900 Forint (adult). It is on the pest side.
Perfect parliament. Perfect location and impressive building. This building speaks for it's self. It commands your respect.

Beautiful. Beautiful architecture and decoration inside. Our guide was great and knew her stuff. Worth a visit if you can squeeze it in. I would suggest you get your tickets well in advance if you can.

Impressive. If the exterior is beautiful, the interior is amazing.
We took a spanish tour and we got a good perception of the building and its history.
Must to go. . It is very nice place to visit , we have been there twice. But do not go inside it's very expensive and nothing to see.

Spectacular building...inside and out!. First of all be aware that you can only see this attraction on a tour and the English tours fill up fast. Apparently you can book online, but if you go the day you want to tour, you may have to wait until there is space in a later group. There is a nice cafeteria on site. We ended up buying our tickets and wandering around elsewhere, having lunch until it was time for our tour.This parliament is spectacular, inside and outside! (the view of it all lit up from the river at night is wonderful). The building is definitely worth seeing, but I was a bit disappointed with the tour itself. Our guide's English was very heavily accented and she was hard to understand. She didn't give that much information and wasn't open to questions at the end. Nevertheless the building speaks for itself and I would recommend going to this attraction.

Serene and beautiful parliament. An extremely impressive parliament. Very serene. Family sat and viewed for some time. Next to the river and so spent a lovely time wandering. Could have spent longer with visits around.

stunning by day and briliant by night. It is spectacular by day and brilliant by night especially from the Danube.This is a must visit. A walk around this building is worth a couple of hours. Relax and photograph the many sights including the military marching around the flagposts. The yellow trams clikityckacking past thd building ads to the photo opportunities
