Most impressive parliament i've ever seen, but the tour isn't that great. The dimensions and the neogothic style impressed us very much, but we were a bit dissapointed of the tour inside. The guide tells a story like she said it a thousand times before (is actually like that, but it's obvious). You can't film while the guide talks, but that we could understand, but still, it disturbs a bit the atmosphere.

Great architecture . One of the most architecturally articulate buildings I have seen in my travels. Perched on the edge of the Danube it is a marvel in its own right. Don't miss it especially by night.

Impressive. Didn't actually go inside the parliament building but from the outside it was a fantastic building! If you have time to go up the citadel the view of parliament is amazing from here and also the church by the palace in Buda
Beautiful buildings. Only saw the builldings by river boat but they are gorgeous & quite similar to our houses of parliament but more colourful. Can book tours in advance.

Stunning. We went at night and it looks spectacular lit up. More so because you become mesmerised by the birds that fly above the parliament building clearly feeding off the insects attracted in by the light. The birds shine golden against the night sky
Impressive. Make sure you go all around the building. Then go down to River side and go left where you will find memorial of shoes to those who lost their lives during the war.
best architecture in Budapest!!. beautiful magnificent building!!! must see during the day and at night!!! great to see from the Danube or across the river!!!

One of the most beautiful buildings in Budapedt. An absolute must place to visit in Budapest. Well worth the time and expense. Décor rivals any top rated Imperial Palaces. Guided tours are excellent and very informative.
Neo Gothic Beauty. This impressive building shines in its full beauty when it is lit up at night. You can even see birds soaring above it, after dark. I guess the Parliament Birds never sleep.
Day or night, it's worth it!. Nice to look at from the other side of the Danube... If you can, it's nice to see it in the night too.

Parliament. Spectacular,both inside and out. We did the tour and loved it. It's beautiful both day, it is very well kept and clean, as at night when it is illuminated. We saw the changing of the guard, we enjoyed it. For us, obligatory visit if you travel to Budapest
More than beautiful!. The tour of the Parliament especially in English is always fully booked. So if you want to visit inside (and you should) please book the tour in advance.
Don't miss. Wonderful place full of history. Great guide. Time spent in pleasant and useful way. Hope to go again.
Well worth a visit. Beautiful and fascinating building, and we had an excellent tour guide. Don't miss the brass cigar holders outside the chamber!

Amazing inside and out. . Book your tickets online in advance if you do nothing else with this review. We did and where we arrived at the 3pm tour the day had sold out. Inside is spectacular the tour was well worth while. We saw a changing of the guards type display outside around 12 noon on one day. Visit at night aswell as the building is lit up amazingly for photos.
Verry beautiful, have to see,. If you vissit hungary you have to see this building. It is so beautifull. Also nice to so see from the other site of the donau river. or at night.
Must to see in Budapest. The Parliamant building and the neighberhood area is beautifully restored in the previous years, in point of my view this is one of the World's most beautiful parliament.
Ornate building. fascinating building with interesting historical inclusions. The gilded details are wondrous. Worth the cost of the tour.

Make time for this. It is well worth queuing (or being more organised than us and booking online) to get a ticket for a tour of the parliament. It is a staggering neo-gothic building with some wonderful decorative quirks. Seeing the Crown of St Stephen was a real highlight - it's a piece with a fascinating medieval and modern history, having been smuggled out of Hungary during the occupation and kept for a while in Fort Knox in the USA. The guides are great too.

1956 Underground Museum. At the back of the Parliament building In Parliament Square there is an amazingly, informative underground museum dedicated to the events which took place in1956. It is only small but the video films and personal experiences by the people involved and also those who lost loved ones is over whelmingly sad. The 3D film of a tank turning and bearing down on you is amazingly realistic, so you can really imagine what these poor people went through. This museum is a must for anyone interested in the events which took place in Budapest. There is a completely free museumhttp://www.tripadvisor.co.uk/ShowUserReviews-g274887-d276817-r243123265-Parliament_Orszaghaz-Budapest_Central_Hungary.html#
Architecture plus. Beautiful building, and a wonderful city. It is a must see while there and exceptional from the river view as well.
Fantastic building. This parliament building rivals to London Parliament. The architecture is neo gothic and become the best Budapest landmark at the bank of Danube river. A must visit for Budapest.

Unforgetable sight at night. Partly inspired by the Palace of Westminster, the Hungarian Parliament building designed by Imre Steindl in 1882 is a dazzling site along the Pest side of the Danube at night. If possible take a cruise at night and see the Parliament and other buildings, it's magical. During the day 50 minute tours are available on the half hour. Tours are conducted in English, French, German, Russian, Hebrew, Japanese, Italian and Spanish and start at Gate #12..Here you can also buy catalogues, albums and souvenirs. The are two seasons but both seasons start the tours at 8 am. The outside walls have statutes of Hungarian monarchs and military commanders. The are 691 rooms, 12.5 miles of corridors and a 96 meter central dome. Wall paintings depicting historical events, coronation objects and the assembly hall of the House of Magnates are shown. The 16 sided central hall is a sight to see.. An adult ticket is 2520 HUF which is roughly $10 US or 9 Euros. A students ticket is less. The library contains 500,000 books and documents which are accessed by a modern information system. Cameras are allowed.

Exterior impressive by day, luminous at night: interior colourfully lavish.. In August the queues to book a guided tour (the only way it's permitted to see the inside) are long and often the next ones in the language you want are fully booked. You can book online. The visitor centre is where you make reservations, where you wait for your tour, and where toilets and refreshments are.Inside the building is magnificent. Crazily expensively decorated. The Crown (of now extinct Royalty) is guarded by soldiers and the changing of the guards amazing to watch.

Stunning architecture. We booked tickets online at our hotel the day before our tour. It's a beautiful building with stunning architecture. The guide was rather boring and not very informative, but I would recommend going just to look at the gilded ceilings, crown and stained glass. You can take photos too!

Beautiful and interesting building. The parliament building is stunningly beautiful and well worth a visit. It is right on the edge of the Danube and easy to get to by bus or metro. If you want to do the guided tour (which I highly recommend) you will need to take some form of ID with you as they ask for it when you book. Tours are conducted in several languages and at various times if you have to wait there are gardens outside with seating and statues and there is a changing of the guards to keep you occupied whilst you wait.

Night View Stunning. We did not book any inside tour of the Parliament this time around but still enjoyed walking the grounds and reading abou the history. The view at night was quite spectacular so we made a point of walking the Danube in the evening to soak it all in.

Eastern Europe's most impressive parliament house. This parliament building is a unique breathtaking piece of gothic architectural style worth visiting and a must in Budapest. In my opinion, its beauty and details are only comparable to structures such as St. Stephen's cathedral at Vienna, the London Houses of Parliament and Sagrada Famlilia in Barcelona.

Beautiful Building. The Parliament is a beautiful building with an interesting fountain in front. If you enjoy antique stores, there is a street to the right of the front of the Parliament (if you are looking at the building, it's the street on the front right), that has many interesting antique stores with good values.

Amazing building. Didn't go inside but walked around outside during that day and at night when it was cooler. In front is an underground exhibition (free to enter) remembering the 1956 attempt at freedom from communism. Very thought provoking and well presented. As we left there were small cooling sprays in the floor of the square which were very welcome. We were then treated to a guard's ceremonial display (Sunday at approx 10:30). Very impressive area that was not busy so plenty of space to take photos and take in the amazing building.

A must see for sure. Once you are in Budapest, it is better to buy tickets for the Parliament online, as you have to book a guided tour in your language. Otherwise go at 9 in the morning to buy it. The building is amazing, historical and very beautiful inside as well as outsideJust a piece of advice, they should add some attractive stories to the tour as it sounds very normal to me !

Make sure to book!. Short tour, but I had booked online which was good as all yours were sold out when I got there. Best part is seeing the crown with the Hungarian guards standing by. The tour itself is quick and to the point...wouldn't have been more than 30 minutes. Worth it for interest sake and to see the inside where the Government sit.
Visit to the Parliament. So good!!! Everyone should come out to Pest to see the Parliament !!!!!! There are guided tours in different languages.
well worth booking. The Parliament tour is excellent and well worth booking in advance. There is a great deal to see and learn inside the building and there is a nice café on site.

A top attraction in all of Europe!. Parliament is a huge highly decorated, prominent building on the river banks of the Danube in Budapest. Inside, it is even better, much more appealing, interesting, and decorated than many of the churches we have seen. A tribute to Hungary's past as an empire, then major political player. We visited Vienna first, so the history of Austro-Hungarian empire meant more to us because of that. I loved the figurines depicting the many different occupations of Hungarian people. The inaugural crown w its bent cross from the 11th century is displayed. Yes, this is THE top attraction to see in Budapest. Go early as those people around us who had not gotten tickets beforehand had to get tickets for the next day.

Impressive. We watched the building from the outside - once your on a Panorama Platform you will always See the parlament, which is incredible 5m longer than the London Parlament. We've not been inside - thats the minus point. ;)

Wonderful building!. Example of functional architecture to its purpose. In it there is the size of a state building and the sense of belonging of the democratic people.Well maintained and cared for, full of works of art and precious relics.Both the exterior and interior of the building are superb and are accessible and usable by all! Unlike what happens in other countries.

A must in Budapest!. I advise that you book your tickets before you arrive through a website called Jegymester as English speaking tours are limited. There is a lift if you can't make it up the stairs. It's only a short trip but the guides are very good. The inside of the Parliament is so beautiful! Try and hang around outside to see the changing of the guards. The entrance is on the far side and down the stairs - it's not obvious.
pretty both in the day and at night. we had the pleasure of viewing the hundreds of bats flying around at night....with the lighting it looked quite good.

One of the most beautiful sites in Budapest. We bought tickets on line beforehand for the parliament tour. The security check and waiting in line took a long time. This parliament complex is huge and there are several rooms that are quite impressive. However the interior visit dos not compare to the beautiful exterior architecture that you can freely enjoy without having to pay for the ticket.

Most Impressive Attraction in Budapest. I was in Budapest in June, 2015 as part of my MBA program. We had a tour of Parliament and met with the Senior Advisor to Prime Minister Orban. It was an amazing experience, but the building itself is a must see. After passing through security, our guide gave us a detailed tour and we were able to see the chambers of Parliament, the marble columns, the ornate decor, the murals in the antechambers to Parliament and more. A visit to Parliament, however, is not complete without viewing the building from the Danube. Make sure you take a Danube River Cruise at some point to see the building in all its magnificent glory both during the day and all lit up at night.

Very interesting peek into Parliament . The Parliament building is a famous sight on the Danube in Budapest. If you want to see inside then you have to book on a guided tour. These are run throughout the day in several languages. You need to plan ahead and book before you go if you want a tour at a time, day and in a language of your choice. If you are an EU citizen you only have to pay 2000fts.I didn't plan ahead so ended up on the 8.45 morning tour. You have to pass through security so think about what's in your bags before you go. Once through security the tour gets off to a brisk start, taking you up a golden staircase to the impressive corridors of the main building. The tours only last about 40 minutes and you are free to take photos in most areas. The guide was interesting and witty throughout. The highlights include the Dome Room (absolutely NO PHOTOS here) where you see the crown of the Kings of Hungary guarded by two guards who will carry out. As all ceremony while you are there; the chamber of the abolished Upper House is a mirror image of the lower chamber (which you don't get to see) and is well worth a visit; and my favourite part, the story of the cigar holders. If you can get on a tour it is well worth it.

Majestic Building- must see when dark and lluminated. We were in Budapest during 2015 Easter period and on the second day we planned to visit this. We stayed in a hotel in Pest side and it was walking distance from the hotel. However, in another day, we took Tram No 2 which has a stop near Parliament. It is located on the Pest side on the bank of river Danube. The construction started in 1885 and completed on 1904. The Parliament building is a magnificent example of Gothic architecture. It is also the third largest Parliament building in the world and second largest in Europe. We did not go inside, although that is possible with prior appointment. The view of the Parliament from the Castle hill on Buda side was also beautiful, particularly in the evening, when it was dark outside and the building was illuminated.

Wonderful building on the Danube. We visited it during daylight and it is stunning, huge and very well kept.We were lucky enaugh to watch a performance of the hungarian guard and then people took pictures with them for a few minutes.I recommand to visit when comming to Budapest.

Beautiful but. . .. While the interior is spectacular (architecture, gold leaf, statues) , the crowds are not. We visited on a Friday with several hundred of our closest friends. We could not hear our English speaking guide very well as they had 2 groups sometimes together. Now we must Google to find information that aligns with our 17€ each tour. If you visit, pre-purchase your tickets to avoid long ticket lines.

Take the tour. We took the tour around Parliament and although we had to wait a couple of hours it was not disappointing to be able to enter, listen to the interesting information and to take some unique photos. The building is the outstanding landmark along the Danube embankment stretching 268metres in length with turrets and arches. The Hungarians are very proud of this building, its design, history and what it represents. Tours take place when Parliament is not in session, it really is worth the wait.
A must see point while visiting Budapest. A gorgeous building from outside AND inside! Must see during day and night. A guided inside is quick and definitely not boring.
Amazing building!. Very nice view of the Parliament by the side of the Danube. Great during the day and also amazing during the night with its lights.

don't go on a Monday, but go!. My dummy travel mate - who insisted on 'steering the ship' - chose Monday to visit this beautiful edifice... all his travel guides mentioned that it was closed on Monday, yet we slogged through miles of cold & rain to walk there. I've heard that the interior is stunning, so it was a huge shame. Exterir is nice during the day, but gorgeous at night!

So huge and beautiful parliamanet for a small country. One of the most beautiful building in Europe and I think the nicest parliament in the World :)Very scenic location, just a few meters from the Danube. During evening reflecting nicely in the river the beautifully illuminated building.You would wonder why a small country like Hungary needs a so huge parliament? It was build an opened for the millenium in 1896 when Hungary was more then three times larger. Inside the building is like a jewerly: only the best and most expensive materials were used, and already back in 1896 was used "air condinationing" (via the air vent cold air was coming produced by huge blocks of ice) and was one of the first building having built in electric elevators. A visit is definitely a must.

Book before you go but definitely go. I decided to book online as the tours have limited numbers but was unable to print my tickets so headed up to the building early. The line was long and we had to wait 20 minutes to buy tickets. The next available tour in English was in two hours so we decided to book one for five hours later to give us time to see something else then return. It was worth the wait,the tour guide was excellent and the building is stunning. We learned loads and really enjoyed seeing inside as the outside of the building was beautiful. If you book online before travelling you can plan ahead,otherwise be prepared to wait or backtrack but it's a must visit attraction.

A work of Art. The building is one of the must see in Budapest and in Europe and you could get amazing views during the Danube cruise and from the opposite Castle Hill. During evening time it is illuminated in a very nice way.. So don't miss that. For an interior look the long queue was a turndown for us specially with the limited time we had.
What an amazing building. Make sure you also visit it at night - especially from a Danube River Cruise. The birds circling in the night sky is something to behold.

One of the highlights of Budapest- magnificent interiors, crowns, history!. We were not expecting that much, but the interiors and windows were beautiful. You get to see their crown. We were surprised that this building had one of the first air conditioning systems of modern times- really clever! We were very glad that we visited. It was one of the highlight of Budapest.
Amount of detail is immense.. Only saw the Parliament buildings from the river boat and bus top. Very detailed and pretty. A must see if in the city.

Beautiful building. What a site! This is an impressive building during the day and especially at night.It's nice to walk around it during the day and appreciate the architecture, but when it's lit up at night it really is a spectacle.

Worth a visit. I went here with a friend whilst staying in Budapest. After going through security, you walk up a few flights of stairs before an explanation from the tour guide about the rooms, then on to the room with the guarded crown & sceptre. The guide explains a little about the structure, materials used, war damage etc. we move on to the room where the politicians meet to discuss important issues. Although the tour was not expensive, I found it slightly rushed. Worth a visit if you are in the area, just be quick with your camera.

beautiful building. was really easy to buy the tickets at the counter, they made a creazy security controll, just like at the airport, but can understand, it is the house of the nation.Amazing inside aswell, didn't really understand why was not possible to take photos about the crown or anywhere uner the dome... or step on the red carpet at the main staircase... maybe cecouse of cleaning? but for this price they could find cleaning staff :Danyway was great to be there... guide was...not the best, but okay.

Long lines, small tour group sizes. Enjoy Parliament from the outside. Long lines for tickets wind around the lobby and if you don't buy in advance, you may not be going on the tour you want. We didn't arrive early enough to anticipate the long lines. Our tour in English sold out before the line moved a few people. Next tour was hours later. We even considered joining a few other tours in other languages just to get inside, but eventually gave up. Standing in line for long periods of time seemed to be a waste to us on our last day. I have enjoyed the building from the outside and am happy to have really enjoyed it. Best enjoyed in my opinion during the sunset hours and into the night from across the Danube on Castle Hill. The building, once lit at night is spectacular.

Beautifull building along the Danube river.. From the castle hill you have a nice view at this building. Standing in front of it the building is impressive. Especially in the evening the building is so beautifull.

Top 5 Favorite European Buildings. The Parliment building in Budapest is one of my favorite historic buildings in Europe. There is so much about this place but it's beauty from every angle is truly amazing. At night the light it up and it gets even better. People literally sit here for hours just taking in all the different angles. I could come back again and again to enjoy this site.

Sunset View. I had the opportunity to see the Parliament building in mid-July 2015. It is absolutely amazing! I've visited more than 35 countries and this one one of the most impressive buildings I have seen. I recommend visiting more than once; for example, I was able to capture some beautiful photos at sunset. The entire area is beautiful, both along the river and in nearby parks, including one which had a statue of Ronald Reagan and a memorial tribute to WWII Hungarian military veterans and holocaust victims. If you get the chance, go to Parliament and take it all in.
Brilliant . Absolutely one of the most beautifully constructed buildings in Budapest. Symmetrically perfect, sitting on the bank of the Danube. Wonderful!

Expensive, but still worth it. The ticket prices for non-EU adults are a little steep (5000+ HUF). However, the building is phenomenal. The architecture is stunning, and the tour information is helpful. Also, buy tickets beforehand on the website.

AMAZING OUTISDE.... POOR TOUR INSIDE. Beautiful to visit and walk around. 5 starsOutstanding surroundings too, with some nice parks. 12.30 the guards change and its AMAZING CEREMONY + you can take photos at the end with guards!! 5 starsBooking for inside tour is complicated. Hard to buy online since servers keep crushing so i went to their office to buy a ticket. 0 starOffice for tickets got amazing long queue time (cca 1h) AND U CAN BUY ONLY TICKET FOR THE SAME DAY. Gift shop have good but pricy offer. Prices for inner parliament are resonable if u are UE citizen. 2 STARSInner parliamnet tour is more or less boring. The guide is like a computer. Loved the main chamber with crown yewlery, otherwise Budapest opera offer more interesting interior!!!! 2.5 stars
One of the best I´ve ever seen!. Impressive and magnificient, like the whole city! Try to see it both during day and during night, and from the river!

WELL WORTH A VISIT. Stunning building, both inside and out. The tour/ticket sales are very well organised. If you are from the EU don't forget to take your passport and you get a huge reduction in the entry fee.
Dont miss when in Budapest. Incredible building with amazing history to match the tour was just long enough and covered all aspects of the history
Magnificent building.. This is one of the highlights of Budapest. Elegant, beautiful, and very large building. If you like that sort of thing you will want to see it. .

A must see wonder. The parliament in Budapest is an incredible building on the bank of the Danube. The architecture is amazing. You must see the Parliament lit up at night from the Danube. It was the highlight of out river cruise from Nuremberg to Budapest.

One of the great parliament buildings. I arrived in Budapest by boat from Vienna and sailed right by it. I remember saying "I've got to go there!" It looks amazing from the outside especially at night when it is lit up on the shores of the Danube. I got there early to book my tour as they do get quite busy. The inside was as amazing as the exterior. I was standing beside an American guy at one point and he looked at me and said, "Kind of makes our Capitol buildings look pretty crummy doesn't it?" Indeed....
Huge historicist building. Huge historicist building, one of the most beautiful vistas of Budapest, especially by night! You have to enough time to tour inside and out.
Amongst the top 10 places to see. Did not see from inside...but stunning building from the outside. Beautifully lit at night...one of the iconic buildings
Amazing building.... ...best seen from the river, and very pretty by night. Certainly one of the most attractive buildings in Budapest

Very well worth the money. If you are inside the EU dont forget to bring your passport so you get almost 50% discount for the entrance. The most annoying thing about this tour is that the guards are following everyone and you always feel pushy . you cannot take as much pictures as you wish and freely go around. Don't forget to check the english guiding time. i ended up join the russian tour haha because i cannot wait and schedule is hard to fix. anyway it is still worth it. One of the best place in budapest.

Great tour guide - beautiful building with interesting history. Our tour guide provided a lot of interesting information and stories about the building and its users. Her English was very good but with an accent so we tried to stick close to her to hear every thing she said. The building itself is beautiful. Entrance requires security check. Recommend to reserve tour in advance.

Must see!!!. I have booked a guided tour online and the price was great - about £11.00 for two tickets (EU citizens - but we did not have to show our passports to anybody). The building is amazing and the tour was one of the highlights of our trip to Budapest. We have seen some of the rooms in the building and photography was allowed everywhere but the Great Dome. However the tour was a little bit rushed as there were lots of other groups and no explanation during the Change of the Guards was given. The queuing system is a little bit erratic as there is no information provided if you had printed your tickets earlier. Just remember to come 5 minutes before the time of your tour and you will be fine.

Architecture is really nice. If you want to go inside, make sure you are in time to buy tickets. Tickets sell out fast. The buidling is described as the biggest, the most expensive and the most beautifull in all of Hungary

couplertw recommends a tour. You won’t miss it, even if you want it. It’s located in the Pest side in the bank of the Danube and is 268 meters long and 96 meters high in the central dome. The Hungarian parliament is one the biggest and oldest legislative buildings in the world. Imre Steindl used the English one as an inspiration. The building is beautiful and is inspiring to look at from every possible angle. Inside it is full of details, golden ornaments and beautiful rooms. The tour will guide you through the these rooms and sights which include the Holy Crown, the magnificent staircase and the session room. Our guide was very knowledgeable and seem to really enjoy her work, which only made the tour more interesting.TIP: If you want to visit the inside (and you should) you can reserve the tour online – you will save time, money and guarantee your ticket. In peak seasons the tickets sell out quickly.

expensive but good tour. We chose to go on a parliament tour which was quite informative however the pricing was on the higher side. The release of water vapours in the grounds was quite entertaining for us especially my one year old.

Majestic building on the water front. I am glad to return to Budapest to see the Parliament building completely white washed. It was always covered with scaffolding on my previous visit. It is also beautiful at night when the lights are on.

Impressive. We weren't inside but the outside and its surrounding buildings were more than impressive. Definitely take time to stroll the area. If you are on the Buda side and you look across at the Parliament building you can see the span of it and how beautiful it is. It's been shown as the backdrop on river cruise adds. Impressive.

Amazing at night!. It was great to walk around and view the building, I believe it was around 6:30 that the guards removed the flag with musical assistance but not entirely sure. The guards were all very proffesional as well was interesting to watch. Would definitely recommend seeing the building from night and if you can be bothered the opposite side of the Danube. Did not go inside the building myself, I believe you need your passport to get in so i would check up if you plan to go.

Great but short. A great building with many thins to see. The guided tour is free but because of that so not expect at very friendly treatment. You are always on the rush and you see only a very small part of the house. Overall it is a great way to spend 1 hour. I highly recomand a visit.

Parliament tours are marvelous!. We booked our tickets online well in advance for a guided 45 minute tour inside the Hungarian Parliament building. The building itself is a treasure. The rooms go from splendid to more splendid. The changing of the guards at the Holy Crown of Hungary is wonderful to watch. The parliament itself is modern but still has the original stateliness of the building. This is a must see.

Spectacular from across the river and up close!. It's amazing that this building is so large and is only a little over 100 years old! If you are taking the tour, make sure to get tickets way in advance. We got them 1 1/2 hours ahead and there were only 10 tickets left for the tour in English.

Stunning building!. This is well worth a trip, it's a stunning building. Remember to book online before you go, as it gets busy. The tours available in several languages. The tours are (in my opinion) too crowded, and the tour guide was difficult to hear unless you were in the front row of the group. The power had been switched off for maintenance/repairs while we were there, but it didn't spoil our enjoyment of the surroundings. We were able to take photos throughout the building apart from the central room where the crown jewels are kept.

Magnificent view from the opposite side of the river. Very beautiful building showing the power of the country. My advice is to go on the opposite side of the river because the view from there to the Parliament is much better compared to when standing next to it.

Beautiful building. We booked on-line prior to our trip and went on one of the English speaking tours which last an hour. It was excellent value and well worth the visit. You are taken through various rooms in the building and the history explained. Would recommend.
Amazingly Beautiful. Nice to just chill at the area at night with the beautiful riverside view. Even in hot summer, the nights are chilling enough with the breeze and wind

Too expensive just for this. 5200Ft for non EU citizen is too expensive just for this. It is not worth the price. No need to come here for non EU citizen. Tour is too shout and we can only see some room Only. Explanation from guide is too systematic and it is not interesting at all. It is better to use money in other country. EU citizen price 2000Ft is OK for everyone but non EU price is not OK. I complained to staff but staff is useless. She said "this is our price" butI feel the price is some kind of discrimination such as rational or national. Developing country such as India has two price for Indian and foreigner but I think Hungry is already developed country. Two price is not suited for Hungry because the non EU citizen price is extremely expensive just for this

The Hungarian Seat of Power. We arranged to visit with the tour in English. The tour is not vey long (45'), but it's very interesting and being able to see inside this great building, and its architecture makes it very worthwhile. Photographs are also allowed with the exception of the Hungarian Crown.

Beautiful building but just OK tour. When we toured there was no electricity but we weren't told this until after we paid and our tour was starting so we didn't have a choice to come back when things were in working order. We had to climb 149 steps. ..no air conditioning. Again, beautiful building but not much to see.
must see!. beautiful building, both inside and out. couldn't stop looking at the intricate arhitecture and it's definitly worth taking a tour of the inside

Well worth a visit.. A quite beautiful building overlooking the Danube. We walked all round in lovely well kept gardens. Unfortunately for us the English tour of the building was fully booked. I am sorry we missed the tour - try and go if you can.

A must see in Budapest. The architecture is outstanding; beautiful during the day but spectacular when all lite up at night.
The tour offered in many different languages is well worth the price of admission.

Must see. A visit to Budapest will be incomplete without a visit to this beautiful architecture beauty. It is one of the most beautiful building in Central Europe. See it from the river, see it up close, outside and inside, you will be impressed by it. Somehow I am charm by it.

Magical!. There are no words to describe this building, it is just magnificent. Especially in the evening when the lights come on, most beautiful I have ever seen! You can also have a tour inside which we have not done, but definitely will next time.
beautiful builidng. Beautiful building, worth a visit and look around right on the river Danube and close to our hotel (parliament hotel) as well as the tram and metro stations

One of Europe's Most Iconic Buildings. We never made it inside for a visit but we walked around the grounds outside. This is one of the most impressive buildings I have ever seen and it sits as the gemstone of Budapest. You can spot the building from just about anywhere in the area and at night it is lit up like a Christmas tree! It makes for some great pictures day or night. If you cross on the Buda side of the city at night (take the M2 to Batthyany ter use tram 19) you will get some great river shots of the building at night.

Incredible architecture . This is, in my own opinion, is Budapest's most impressive building. Book tickets online beforehand as only a limited number of tickets are available on the day from the ticket box. We purchased our tickets the day before so there wasn't a long wait. The tour was impressive, taking you through grand stairwells and hallways, before seeing the Hungarian Crown Jewels, and the legislative chamber. Definitely worthwhile also going for a walk at night to see the building lit up. Is a beautiful sight to see.
Beautiful!. Really worth a visit! We haven't been inside but also that is supposed to be gorgeous! Really nice view over the Danube!!

Beautiful on the outside, stunning on the inside!. Wow! What a treat this was! Beautiful building to look at both during day and when it is lit up at night. To go inside, you need to sign up for a tour at the visitor’s center on north side. Guided tours in multiple languages take place all day. Tours fill up, so I would recommend either booking online or buying tickets in person in the morning for an afternoon tour. Tour of building lasts about 45 minutes. Interior is stunning! (Make sure your camera is charged up and has lots of memory space available for photos!). I won’t spoil it for you by describing the interiors, but I heard a lot of “Oohs” and “Aaahs” and “Wows!” from our tour group. The Hungarian government spared no expense on this building and it really shows. Definitely a must-do while in Budapest.

Fantastic building. The most impressive building in Budapest. The architecture is unbelievable.We were unlucky because the day we visited place the last entrance was for 14:00 and we arrived 14:15.People that visited inside Parliament were very excited. Unfortunately we didn’t have the pleasure but for sure you need to visit.

Fantastic building & tour - A must see!. This building is one of the most beautiful I have ever seen. I couldn't have taken more photos if I tried. From the outside it looks brand new, although I think it has recently had some work done to it. The tour was great as well - lasted about 45 minutes. Our guide was funny and spoke very loud so even at the back of the group we could still hear what she was saying. The inside of the building is just as spectacular as the outside, and photography is also allowed. There are some steps on the tour (about 180 if I remember correctly) however there is a lift for people who have trouble climbing the stairs. We came back just after sunset and waited for the lights to come on and it is even more beautiful.

Impressive building. looks good from the outside and is just as good on the inside. Spectacular rooms with gold leaf on the majority of the interior ceilings. As a tourist attraction they could do with better signage and explanation of how the 'visit' process works, but even without that they seem to manage to move a lot of people through the building reasonably efficiently. Well worth doing the tour which takes about 40 minutes and can be booked in quite a few languages. In tourist season, if you want to go on a specific tour, then I suggest you book online at least the day before.
Stunning to see from water.. This is the building you see on all the TV ads for river cruises. It's amazingly beautiful. Have to get special tickets to go inside.
Impressive building. We didn't actually go in but passed it many times. It is a very impressive building and worth a look whilst you're in Budapest!

Piece of art made into a building. MUST SEE Atraction in Budapest. Great history, it is a piece of art made a building, much better than the London parlament, similar style. It Is a shame that such a nice building is where polititians work!Go in the morning, less crowded, pick a tour in your language then plan your day around it.
Parliament. We visited the Parliament, it is a splendid building, very impressive, full of history! We loved it!
Fantastic night view. If you go to the other side of the river, the beautiful arcticture with lights and shadows will catch your eyes and you just lost into it. Perfect!
The most beautifully lit building ever!. The parliament by night is one of the most beautifully lit buildings I have ever seen. But the daytime interior tour is wonderful and well worth the time.

Equal to Westminster houses of Parliament. This building is absolutely magnificent. The architecture and statues, monuments and external areas have just been cleaned. The sandstone looks brand new! I must have taken a 100 photos of every angle - couldn't get enough of it.

Beautiful edifice with terrible tour guide. We visited the Parliament building on a rainy mid May day. It is truly a magnificent edifice. Hungarians are rightly proud. The government run tour is a totally different story. The government tour guide was a totally different story. She made her initial presentation before all people in the tour arrived. We were unfortunately the last people in this tour. We were not provided with an option of joining the next tour. The tour group was strung out and we have difficulty navigating closer to the front of the group so we could hear her. We felt we missed significant portions of her presentation. We feel tour participants would be much better served if the number of participants were reduced significantly. We got the impression emphasis was placed on maximizing revenues (read number of people) rather than on tour quality.
Budapest highlight. Impressive architecture. Lovely to visit both during day and night (when it is beautifully lighted).
Huge building. Very nice building just in the river bänks of Budapest. Really beautiful with lights on and a huge building.

Must go!. No trip to Budapest would be complete without a little visit to the parliament! If there is one thing worth seeing in Budapest, this is it! What a beautiful work of art, very majestic, and can be seen from many points of view in the city (although I recommend you actually go there, you can see it from Castle Hill, or if you're walking along the Danube river)

Majestic Structure - Beautiful Styling. The Second Largest Parliament building in Europe after UK - and therefore probably one of the largest in the world too. Don't miss it and in high season plan to book a trip in advance as guided tours do tend to get filled up.It is a beautifully styled and constructed building - and it looks even more imposing due to its location right on the banks of River Danube.
Beautiful Building. The building itself is stunning and can be seen from many viewpoints in Budapest. We greatly enjoyed the tour as well, the interior somehow exceeds the beauty of the exterior.
Beautiful Palace. We went on a walking tour with our Budapest card. Parliament is along the Danube River. Be sure to be there by 6:15. Soldiers remove the Hungarian flag at 6:30 in the evening.
Nice to visit. Nice to visit with a lot of internal decoration and Arts inside , the visit could take around 2 hours
Nice to visit. Nice to visit with a lot of internal decoration and Arts inside , the visit could take around 2 hours

Beautiful building, great history. Stunning building that stands as a symbol of Hungary's defiance of occupation and - more recently - as the nationalistic heartbeat of the city.The outside of the building is just beautiful and I would recommend taking the tour. The crown of St. Stephen is there but no pictures allowed (they are serious about it, so just don't even try). Right next to a Metro stop however you'll need to hoof it to the complete opposite site (North Side) of the complex to get to the visitor's center.Tickets are timed by language of the guide. If you are interested in trying this, leave yourself some wiggle room --- posted tour times/languages in guide books (I had lonely planet and checked their website) may not be accurate. I'd recommend popping by for tickets in the AM that way you can purchase and plan your day.I believe you can only buy tickets on the day of, so don't wait until the end of the day to try and buy them.

Absolutely beautiful!. The Parliament on the Danube surely is one of the most beautiful sights in the World. The exterior of the building is beyond compare. The interior is also quite wonderful and contains many historic treasures. We had a terrific tour of the interior with a great guide provided by the Parliament. Highly recommended.

Worth a vist. This is a stunning building. We arrived on foot by walking on long the Danube. Lovely walk and went past the Shoes on the Danube memorial (which is also worth seeing). We didn't go into the building but walked around it and to the Square in front. This was the scene of the 1956 Kossuth Term massacre. An underground memorial underneath the Square has testimonials and photographs from this "Bloody Thursday" when Soviet tanks fired into the crowd. Opposite the Parliament building bullet holes are seen on the buildings opposite.

Fantastic. A great building all in all. My 19 year old son said it was the greatest building he has ever seen. Tour for non EU nationals was around $18 US for adults and half price for students. EU nationals are $2000 HUF. The tour was in English and was informative. Tours last 45 minutes which is enough time to get the grandeur of the place without droning on and on. You see the crown jewels of Hungary, the grand staircase, the overall feel of the building, the Parliament meeting rooms. Only problem we had was trying to book a tour online. We are staying in an apartment and were thus unable to print a reservation so could not get an online spot. Made it a longer process when we arrived, but overall was still a great experience.

The most beautiful parliment building anywhere. 12:30 pm display by guards. The building is not that old, but has been carefully cleaned and renovated. It is large; very, very large. It is worth seeing from all 4 sides.There is also a display by the parliament guards at exactly 12:30 pm. 5 guards march to some recorded music on the front steps. They finish on the paved area below and allow photo opportunities once finished.Not to be missed sight in Budapest.Fee for the tour inside, but no cost outside or for the marching display.

A must see. You will have to be early to get the tour in your preferred language. Very busy place but more than worth the look. We prebooked a tour with a tour operator with the only advantage a guaranteed tour at the time of your choosing as only Parlaiment guides can take you through.

Magnificent Hungarian Parliament in Budapest. One of the most magnificent landmark of Budapest is the Hungarian Parliament. It is more than 100 years old and is the third largest Parliament building in the world, easily rivaling the British Parliament in London, England. It is located on the Pest side of BudapestThis building is one of the must see sight when one visits Budapest. The magnificent building is transformed to a spectacular sight at night when it is fully lit from the outside. It is a symmetrical building housing the two former bicameral National Assembly on each side. Presently, the National assembly is unicameral. The architecture is of the Neo-Gothic design with some Renaissance and Baroque flavour. the Hungarian crown jewels are housed under the main dome (photography not allowed). Guided tours are available when the parliament is not in session. the tour lasts about 45 minutes and costs about 5500 HUF (for non-EU citizens). Best way to book a tour is on line normally obtainable from the concierge desk of various major hotels in the area. Don't miss this attraction along the Danube in Budapest especially at night.

Grand and elegant building. The Gothic style Parliament Building of Budapest is one of the most impressive buildings I have ever seen – so grand and majestic. The limestone building is massive, yet delicate. Outside are many large statues of notable Hungarian figures. This building is comparable to the Parliament building in London and its design was inspired in part by it. However, we feel the Budapest Parliament is a bit more elegant.It is right on the Danube River, which only adds to its beauty. Actually seeing the Parliament Building from a boat is wonderful way to view it.Inside you could be overwhelmed by the opulence, the gilding everywhere, the beautiful paintings, the large halls the long corridors, the central dome. The building has over 600 rooms.This is a not-to-be-missed site in Budapest. Highly recommended.
Well worth the time.. Visited on an English speaking tour. The building is not super old, by European standards, but beautiful inside and out. The tour was very informative and interesting.

A Grand, Awesome Building on the Danube. Surrounded by statues and amazing facades on three sides and the Danube on the fourth, the Parliament rises above all else. It is spectacular and comparable to any other such structure in Europe. Enjoy!!!

The Bling Parliament. The building was nearly wiped out during the siege in 1944/45 and so it is mainly a reconstruction. It is however so way over the top and far from the austerity found in other democratic institutions that it is a must see.Guided tours take around 1 hour. Order tickets online or expect to wait for a tour in your language. Tours are fast paced and the group size of +40 combined with terrible acoustics and heavy accent of the guide made it unintelligible. Read the story before going and use multiple sources.Security screening starts 5 min. before the time on the ticket. Photo allowed except for 1 room.
Fascinating Architecture, Beautifully Lit. Drive along the water at night and get a view of the Parliament all lit up at night. Definitely better than just seeing it in the day!

Excellent. Personally I didn't expected the parliament building to be that beautiful inside .Keep in mind that there are a lot of tourists especially in high season, so buying the ticket in advance will be a good idea, to be sure that the preferred language tour is available.

Took my breath away. I've wanted to visit the Parliament for some time and when I saw it I was truly blown away, it's really so stunning and much bigger than anticipated! We did the tour also, which was good, although I could hardly understand the tour guide, the inside was still beautiful so still worth going to!

Massive Building, best appreciated at night.. We have visited Budapest several times and every time we make a point to stroll around the Parliament. This edifice is huge and beautiful, and walking around during the day gives you scale and detail that you might miss from a distance, say across the Danube on Castle Hill. For example, up floe you can see the how tiny the man is cleaning the building. That said, the Parliament really shines at night when it is fully lighted. Magnificent from the river or from the Fisherman's Bastion. When visiting Budapest, it is hard to miss seeing this sight at night.

Interesting visit with small buts. It's worth a visit simply for the Neo-Gothic architecture, magnificent stairs in the main hall, dome with Hungarian Crown Jewels and of course the Old House of Lords which is just amazing.The guide person was speaking of very good English and was ready to answer any questions however you could tell that she works on the strict time schedule as we were in the rush at all times. Yes, the tour it takes about 45 min but half of the time you walk up and down the stairs were nothing interesting is to be seen.It would be great to see more rooms,cabinets were the real politic take place perhaps.All in all interesting visit to the third biggest parliament building in the world.The price for UE citizens is just 2000HUF=5GBP
Spectacular. Very luxurious. The guided tour is a must. It costs 16 euros for no european people. Dont forget to go across the river and see it at night!

Too crowded. Beautiful building with well designed ticket office and a great cafe. The only trouble is the tour group was HUGE so unless you used your elbows to get near the guide impossible to hear a word. Don't dare to fall back behind the main group as snappy security guards push you on. The changing of the Guards ceremony looks like Hollywood's idea of how Buckingham Palace shoul do it...

One of the world most famous buildings. The Parliament building in Budapest is one of the main attractions in the city. At the parliament square you can see the three winning designs for the building. The actual Parliament, opposite of the square the building of Museum of Ethnography and the Ministry of Agriculture,
Excellent!. The Parliament in Budapest is very beautiful. We sow it from Margaret Bridge. You have to see this in Budapest!

Magnificent Governmental Building. The Parliament was in session so we walked about outside. Freshly cleaned and restored. This is a magnificent building. Built along the lines of Parliament in London, but much newer. 1880.

Beautiful building. Parliament is a very big building right next to Rover Tonava. It is impressive at night time because of the lights. And when we were there there were lot of birds flying above it. Parliment is a total must see when you visit Budapest!

A super building. Quite an amazing building , an even more impressing is the view from the Danube river ! Also, the guard in front of th eparliament are friendly , and kind to show the way and take photos
Beautiful view from the Viking Legend at night. Our Viking river cruise took a night ride by the Paliament. A gorgeous view at night all lit up facing the Danube. It looks like a brochure picture.

Impressive . Really impressive building both from outside and inside. Inside is very beautiful and opulent. One needs to book a tour to enter the building. Costs 2000 HUF for EU citizens and 5200 HUF for others. Must book in advance (jegymester.hu) to skip queues and ensure availability.
Wow. Beautiful building to look at and study - I was amazed how large it was as well as how clean and tidy it looked outside.
Wow. This is a beautiful building on the inside, ornately carved and tiled and carpeted in Hungarian artisanal work. The spaces are each amazing. Well worth the tour and the tourists.

Outstanding building. Wow wow wow what a absolutely amazing building. And definitely worth visiting. Nighttime it's all Lit up and looks even more impressive. The birds flying over it a night lols like tiny specs of gold. Loved it
See it everywhere. Parliament is seen in many river cruise promotions. Has to be seen from the water at night. The architect must have had a free hand and unlimited funding as it it a standout
Impressive Historical Building. Just amazed at the size, cleanliness and how close you can get to the building. Visitor center is also worth the stop.
Not typical. The shutters on the outside really threw me off, but the rest of it was beautiful. The square has beautiful statues and landscaping. I got some great pictures!

Top architecture. Really impressive Parliament building!
We never went for a tour because sold out already. So if you're interested, queue early! It's very crowded.

Spectacular exterior and interiors. This has to be one of the most beautiful Parliament buildings in the world, both inside and out. The reddish dome against the white is distinctive and magnificent up close and from a distance.To see the interiors you have to join one of the guided tours. These are pretty expensive, especially if you pay the non-EU rate (a whopping 5200HUF). Note that if you are not an EU citizen but reside in the EU and have eg a visa to show it, you should be able to buy an EU ticket which is considerably cheaper (2000HUF).It seems that in peak season you need to buy your tickets at least a couple of hours in advance (eg we we arrived in the morning the first available tour in English was about 2 hours later). If you want to avoid delayed entry you can buy tickets online (small administration fee of 200HUF per ticket).As some people have commented, the guided tour is pretty quick but it is worth paying for the ticket to go in - the exteriors of the Parliament house are opulent, and the ceiling of the dome room where the crown jewels are housed is breathtaking. Unfortunately you can't take photos in the dome room, but photos are allowed everywhere else.

Does not worth the price I paid. The ticket for non-EU priced at 5300HUF (50% discount for EU citizens). I think this is a bit too expensive for the 50min tour and all I remembered after the tour is the crown, the heating system of the parliament and the number 96. I am expecting more of the architecture of the interior design and interesting locations or history within the buiding, considering the external of the parliament looks majestic. Nevertheless, I have to give credit to the English speaking tour guide as her speech is clear and structured. In conclusion, others might find this attraction interesting but it is just not my cup of tea. If you are into the history of the development of the whole city, I would recommend the history museum at the Buda castle.
excellent. a gem of hungary.i liked everything around and in the city. surely will come back soon for the love of the city.

Besutuful Parliament. Definitely worth visit. Even more impressive inside. Book in advance especially if want English speaking tour. We left it too late so signed up for Spanish tour as we were short of time. We couldnt understand guide but it didn't matter. Visually we appreciated the amazing architecture and interior which is so beautiful.
Rushed guided tour. Parliament is well worth a visit which has to be by 50 minute guided tour - but the tour seemed pretty rushed. Would still recommend the tour though

It was a great tour. If you are European citizen bring your passport and you will get a huge discount. They gave me the discount and also gave it to my husband who is american citizen. This is definitely worth spending the time. very interesting inside and tour guides are very relaxed about picture taking. Advice: don't eat anywhere close to the Parliament. Food is pricey and not good.

Magnificinet building!. It's no doubt a gorgeous building from the history. If you are those who only want to admire the structure, it's fine to skip the tour and entrance fee like us, as we did not think it's necessary. We had a walk around the building, there were many clean benches to enjoy the river breeze and the Hungarian Parliament. Btw, there are clean public toilets near the entrance.Slowly enjoy your time!

No way you can miss and you definitely should not :). I would really sum it up using my daughter's words on the Parliament Building in Budapest: "Mum, why our Parliament building can't be as beautiful as this one?" Amazing, stunning, love the Gothic Revival style.

Wow. Inspired by the British Houses of Parliament, an exquisite building made even more so at night when it is floodlit and amazing especially when viewed from the river. Didn't go inside, but worth a stroll past on your way to the antique district.
Must be landmark!. Full of history with an impressive architecture this building will make you get inside and learn more about it. You can compare it with Westminster abbey!

Fantastic. This is just an awe inspiring piece of architecture. Take a walk around the building. It is beautiful to look at from every angle, including from across the bridge. They also send cool mist up from the ground on a hot day. It is great fun for adults and kids alike.

Beautiful, although that dance is a little weird. The parliament is a very very beautiful building to see. When we were there, all of a sudden the guards started dancing, and that was a bit weird. Even more so because there was a photo session at the end. This is just something done for tourists, which personally, I do not really like.

Book English tour online. We booked the English Tour of the Parliament online before we went to Budapest and because we stay within the EU you get it at a discounted price. It wasn't that expensive and worked out about £12 for two of us to get in. I was glad we booked it online as the day of the tour we arrived and there was a sign saying that all English tours for that day had sold out and this was 1pm so it was very busy. I really enjoyed the tour and it was a chance to see inside the amazing building. The decor was traditional Hungarian and was great to see it. You also get to see the Guards protecting the crown and you see inside the chambers were MPs meet and debate. The tour guide was really nice, friendly and answered all questions. I would highly recommend booking a tour of the Parliament.

Parliament and Tour. Definitely worth a visit for the exterior alone. They also offer tours of the interior at particular times which should be booked in advance. The tour itself is fairly short, and most of the rooms visited are no longer in use, but it is still worth the admission.

Book your tickets in front on the internet, saves time. We pre-booked our tickets for the English guided tour. If you live in Europe you pay a lotless money for entrance. Getting clear where to gather for the start of the tour was a bit chaotic and you need to pass security to get in. Tour takes about one hour and provides insight in a very heavely golden decorated place. Is worth the time and money, it provides insight in the Hungarian history.

Beautiful Building. We booked the english tour in advance which took about 45 minutes. A really interesting visit although the tour guide wasn't great - you see all the main points including the grand staircase, debating chamber and crown jewels. Well worth a visit but book in advance on the internet

Gold stars.... The tour guide was knowledgeable and engaging on this quick trip around the fantastic interior of the Parliament. I particularly loved her attention to small details and her clear enthusiasm for her job.Only downside was that as a mature student I didn't qualify for the student discount...
Beautiful building. This is a beautiful piece of architecture. While we did not go in, our group thoroughly enjoyed seeing the details and scope of this building and the surrounding area.

Amazing architecture. Must see - Parliament to see from inside, outside and from a distance!!!!. Night time view from fisherman bastion or from the chain bridge is breathtaking. For inside viewing, don't forget to book online, price is 2000 forint (for EU nationals) which includes audio guide (various languages) and the best mode of transport is either metro or bus. Enjoy!!!
Not to be missed. This is an amazingly beautiful and unique building inside and outside. Definitely go on a guided tour inside the parliament building.

Amazing Building. The Parliament building sits on Duna river, it is beautiful architect and worthwhile to take a tour. The building is well led at night and is beautiful to view from a night cruise.Touring Budapest is easy and very accessible by public transit, we took a night cruise, picture taken from the cruise with Parliament building an Chain Bridge are beautiful.
Beautiful!. A very ornate, beautiful building. Be sure to go there both, during the day, and at night. It becomes two different buildings!

A bit expensive . The only way to see this is by guided tour and it is beautiful inside but the price tag for non EU people is 5,200HUF compared to EU people who pay half that. We walked away feeling like we did not get any great value for our money and the tour is probably only worth the price paid by EU residentsThe tour was very pram friendly

Amazing building. Looks amazing when you looking it from both side of river, close or from the hill. We didn't have time to visit it inside, maybe next time. One day, around noon maybe, we saw soldiers marching in front of it, nice performance. Only thing that I didn't like was that lights didn't work at night, I really wanted to see this building during night with all the lights

Worth visiting !. Very big and impressing building that has a lot of history and took a lot of effort to build it and maintain it till this day.The tour guide girl was very good explaining about the building in a funny and easy way. It was great for me to learn these facts and see how Hungarian save there culture traditions.

Budapest Parliament. This is the building that you most see in advertisements for Budapest and rightfully so because it is amazing and huge. We were told on an earlier tour that for what it cost to build the parliament building they could have built a city for 30,000 people.The tour is well worth taking as it is a spectacular building inside and out. Our tour guide was very informative and fun. It was great to learn about the history not only of the building but of the politics of Hungary.
Breath-taking. Its the jewel of the Danube without a doubt, the heart of the city and of you like photography you will spend hours and hours taking every detail and every angle of it. Its wonderful.
Best sites in Budapest. Magnificent. Impressive size, lovely old architecture. As we walked around the square we had the surprise of a mist spray coming from the ground - a beautiful sight.
Beautiful Building - Worth the trip. The building and grounds are beautiful. Take the #2 tram by the river to reach the building. At night the lights around the area add to the beauty.
WOW...!!!!. what a building! this is a breathtaking masterpiece, very elegant and glorious.. a must-see in Budapest, as for me it comes on top of my list!

Impressive tour of huge, richly decorated Parliament building. Best to book on to an English speaking guided tour to best appreciate a visit. There aren't many of these each day, so you could book a tour in the morning for the afternoon, and visit other attractions in Pest in between. The guide was very informative and paced things well. Because the building was designed when Hungary had a bi-cameral system of government and its House of Lords is now abolished, the tour takes you into the H of L chamber, a mirror image of the currently operating Legislative chamber, to get a close up view of the elected representatives facilities. The tour also includes the Hungarian Crown Jewels.

Amazing building. Do take a tour nor only to the outside area, but to the inside. It is definite a must see.Lots of history, and architectural structure.Great night views from the opposite side of the bank

Architectural beauty.... This has to be one of the most beautiful buildings in the world...it is up there with Westminster Palace! I would recommend walking along the opposite side of the river (the Buda side) to really appreciate the beauty of this building!

A tour worth doing.. The Parliament tour is definitely one worth doing. Gives you an insight to the history and how things work there. Also there are some fantastic rooms within, not forgetting the crown jewels.

Beautiful inside and out. Parliament is beautiful inside and out. I definitely recommend taking a tour inside so that you can see all of the halls. Super easy to get to on public transit, and the English tour was informative.
Buildings all the way. When you see the Parliament you just Ask yourself how did they make this structure in the those times...This piece of Magnificent Architecture will make you Spellbound
Great place. Big and really beautiful building, the best time for trabel hese is during the night, when it is lightened
Stunning. Start the walking at Parliament, towards the food market. Stunning view and so much to see and enjoy, don't miss it

House of the Country. That is what exactly means Orszaghaz in Hungarian. The neo-gothic famous ladnscape of Budapest, so known Parlament is amazing not only otside, but the interior and inerspace is also something Ypu must see if You are in Budapest. Not so long ago it was opened a new touristic center, where You can buy the tickets for the inside visit of Parlament, there is souvenir shop with good quality souvenirs, WC, and everything for tourists, just like, for example, the Vatican Museum.Guided tours in english, german, russian, japanese and other languages starts every day, the price is different for european and non/european citizens, but it is betweeen 10-25 EUR. The stories what guide will tell are interesting, the history of building, sight inside, like the Hungarian Crown, so the Hungarian Parliament Tour is made now professional and I honestly can reccomend to everyone who likes the architecture and the history, or simply the nice things.
Amazing. What a gorgeous building. I looked at it from the Buda side, then drove over the bridge. Absolutely astounding!

Worth the visit. If you can get a tour of the Parliament it is certainly time well spent. There are frequent tours in many languages that can be booked on-line and a few walk up places each day. We were very lucky to get walk-up places, but I would not rely on this. The outside of the building is wonderful both day or night, but the inside is gorgeous too. No expense was spared in finishing this building.
Outstanding. One of the most beautiful building of Europe I would say. We walked by it, cruise along, day and night ,and took dozen of pictures from different angles

Enjoyable . This is a nice tour. Instead of repeating the same points as below, I would offer a few tips - book in advance, show up just a few mins early, enjoy a refreshment afterwards in the very reasonably priced cafe (toasted sandwiches, cakes, coffees, fresh juices etc are devine!). Walk around to the area where refreshing cool air/mist sprays out each hour (or more often) & enjoy the sensation of the spray in the summer months! Finally get some pics at the infinity pool - if you pose right, it looks like you are in the water - quiet cool :-) Overall, this is worth a visit!
An Incredible Architectural Accomplishment. One of the largest Houses of Government in the world and the view at night is a sight not to miss. The architecture is spectacular.

Architectural masterpiece. Buildings with fascinating achitectural solutions. People who come to Budapest it is a must-see. For me the only negative thing is that only little green territory left after rebuliding the surrounding area of the park.

Great water fountains and architecture. Other than the fact that the building itself is stunning, and you can get right up to it (unlike other heavily-guarded parliament buildings), there is an amazing water feature every hour (I believe).A mist of water comes out of the ground on both sides of parliament, and visitors can play amongst this mist - great photo opp. and very refreshing!
Awesome building. What a majestic building! The tour is an absolute must. English tours get sold out quickly, book a few days ahead. Don't miss it.

What a sight. The Hungarian Parliament is a huge and beautiful building. You can arrange to have a tour. The grounds are fantastic. Visit the free exhibition in the grounds - Kossoth 1956. This is a moving and informative exhibition, showing the public the history of the area and the tragic consequences of a bygone era. Be prepared to be very touched, and realise things you never knew about the very ground you are standing on. I cried.

Wow...... Ok. I've been to a LOT of countries in my life (70+) and have seen a lot of capital cities and parliaments. But this one? Wow. Unbelievable. I strongly recommend a visit! However, I would do it in April - June or October/November. It is HOT in July and August!! It's 100 (38 Celsius) here today. Beautiful -- but really hot!!

Amazing building that's hard to overlook. Building is really amazing in the day and night. It looks like from a fairytale. It's huge with original ornaments.Tickets for UE citizen are cheaper than for all the rest. The tour takes about 45 minutes with security check. The interiors are quite beatiful. Guide says a lot about the history of the building and customs.If you are in Budapest you have to visit the Parlament.If you want to reach to the ticket office from the metro station you must go to the other side of Parlament.If you want to visit the Parlament you should buy a ticket online couple weeks before your arrival, it's much quicker than buying it on site.

Book in advance on line only. A beautiful building which was closed on the day we wanted to visit. Fair enough but although the ticket office was open we were not allowed to book for the next day. We were advised to book on line which was not possible, or come back the following day, which we did. Then we had to wait in a queue while tour guides were allowed to go to the front and take ages to ask their questions This caused resentment because anyone at the back of the queue who has phone access can book ahead of those at the front. Not very fair!! We were given a slot in the afternoon but when we arrived there was no indication where we should gather or indeed if we were in the right place. Our guide duly appeared but she did not give us instructions. By following others who were in our group we eventually found we had to go through security and then on to the tour. Our guide stopped every so often to explain about the beautiful building but she did not wait until everyone was there. It was not possible to get to the front because you were just in a line. It was a shame not to hear what was said some of the time. Having said all that we were glad we got on the tour and enjoyed seeing the inside of the building. It was only the lack of organisation that spoilt out visit so don't let me put you off going, just book on line if you can.

What a building!. From the outside, I was awestruck by the sheer size and beauty of the building. After taking the tour, it was even more impressive! So much history, and also where they keep the old Crown Jewels. The changing of the guard at the front of the building is a must see. For EU citizens, it's about £5 entry, non EU citizens is about £13 entry, but worth it. Tour takes about 45 minutes

A must see in Budapest. The timbers in this building are related to timbers in the British Parliament in London. If you visit, make sure to take the tour, it is amusing. But if you plan to go, make sure you can get in. We ran into some French tourists who found themselves out of luck. It's a gorgeous building, chock full of history on the river in Budapest. That city, in my opinion, is home to some of the most beautiful people in the world.

Lovely but meh..... While the outside is beautiful and the parts inside are lovely...you really don't get to see a lot for the cost of almost $20 USD...that is IF you bought your ticket online. which I highly recommend. The tour I would have missed if not for my friends I was traveling with, and to be honest if I would have missed it I never would have noticed.

Beautiful, Incredible Building. Buy your tickets online!! This is important as there are many tours scheduled in different languages. The building is phenomenally beautiful. While it is modeled after the British Parliament, Hungary takes lavish and gorgeous decoration to a level that the Brits would never even think of, let alone contemplate. There are stain glassed windows, painted walls, and statutes of former kings of Hungary. Considering how the Communist regime destroyed the interior of Buda Castle beyond redemption, it is amazing how Parliament has survived.
Beautiful building and good tour included. An amazing building with a very informative tour as part of the admission. It was one of the high points of our time in Budapest.

Great building. It was a great building to look at. Pretty amazing architecture. Also we saw the changing of the guards in front of the parlement. Nice ceremony.You can go inside and have a tour but it costs some money.

A Must See At Night. I've lived here for two years, and I tell everyone who visits or I meet that the one thing you MUST do in Budapest is see the river front lit up at night--particularly Parliament from the Buda side. An easy and fantastic viewing point is from Batthyány tér, which is a stop on the M2/Red Line Metro. Another fantastic viewing point is from Fisherman's Bastion, which is in the Castle District.

Buy Your Tickets Online. Very nice building inside and out. However, you only see a small part of it so the tour is short. It is a little pricey (5200 Forints which was about $19 US when we went).You can buy tickets online which I would recommend as tours sell out quickly in prime season.

Pride of the city. This is probably by far the most stunning building in Budapest; beautiful during the day and at night. The tours of the inside of the Parliament are worth it. It is one of the biggest and oldest parliaments in Europe. Be prepared for some stairs (104 exactly) and be sure to observe (if you get a chance) the change of guard ceremony or the military exercise. The one we watched was impressive and the soldiers stand down and let you take pictures.

Well organised visit once one finds the way in. Thoroughly enjoyed our organised tour round. No photos allowed which caused problems as some in the group kept taking photos which greatly annoyed the curator. Took a little while to work out how to get in round the far side and underground.
History and respect . Very interesting visit, because we started with a show from the army guards, thrn visit a very beautiful parlament with a lot history associated.

Fabulous. Wonderful tour. This is a fascinating building and a must see. It is too difficult to describe how beautiful and stunning the interior is. Don't settle for just looking at the outside of the building!
Spectacular Edifice. The tram takes two stops here because the building is so large. An impressive structure and worth seeing up close.

Diamond (parliament) of a set (the Danube).. A wonder. Grand but not pompous. A flower among flowers. It attracts attention and tantalizes the senses. To visit, to discover, to advise. Great tour, good organization ... The pleasure of a day.

Stunning Building. Viewed from the other side of the Danube or riding the river cruise, this is the most beautiful building, it stand out among the structures along the river. Built along the Danube River it is a gorgeous building.

Majestic! Marvellous! Breathtaking beauty!. Not sure if I've or will ever see any building/architectural masterpiece more beautiful than the Hungarian Parliament building!!! The first encounter was a non-stop WOW! We were simply agasp! I would call this type of beauty an insatiable one, there is no other word for that! Now, about the Parliament guided tours - you should take one; The guide was one of the best in the world; a very interesting tour that I would love to take again :) If you have time - go to visit the Parliament area again at night and then again during the day time; to sum up go and enjoy this beauty as much as you can!
Stunning. Take a river cruise for the best view of the front, and the number 2 tram for a trip around the back.

Be Sure to Tour One of the Most Spectacular Buildings. It's one thing to see this spectacular building from your hotel window (Hilton Castle District), or covered in gold light from a river tour (Legenda), it's an even more impressive sight from within. Get a ticket to the English speaking tour (a couple a day). This is the second largest Parliament building in Europe. Ornately decorated, with wood everywhere. Remarkable. If you only have one day, do this. It's that impressive.

Unbelievable!. This is absolutely beautiful, unbelievable really. The location adds to its beauty. I took pictures from every angle, each one more awesome than the next. I especially loved viewing it from across the Danube.
Parliament - Budapest Hungary - GORGEOUS!. Breathtaking structure. Could not be more beautiful --- unless you've seen it lighted up at night. Just a fabulous place.

Gorgeous building. Five years ago on our first trip to Budapest we tried to get to the Hungarian Parliament, but were never able to wake up early enough to get the tickets. This time around we ordered e-tickets online at jegymester.hu while still at home and printed them ourselves.
