The tickets for EU citizens cost 2000 Ft / person (about 6€) plus a service charge 400 Ft, for the non-EU citizens the price would've been 5200 Ft / person. We booked an English tour, which all start at the Visitor Center located "underground" on the right-hand side of the building (when standing in front of it), on the opposite side of the building than Kossuth Lajos tér subway station (M2). You should arrive at the Visitor Center 15 minutes before your tour, which we did, and then the tour guide first guided you through a security check similar to an airport. A guard also followed us all through the tour.The first part of the actual tour was either to take the elevator upstairs or climb up quite a few stairs, which we wholeheartedly recommend as the staircase is beautiful, and the ceiling is made of real gold. The whole building is absolutely amazing and you just couldn't help but stop and stare all the gorgeous details. Unfortunately the tour kept us moving in such a fast pace that there really wasn't enough time to see everything we would've wanted. The fast pace also meant that as we weren't the greediest ones to take the front row when the tour guide was talking, we didn't hear everything she said, or see everything she was talking about until the group had moved on. Still, the building itself was worth it. The Main Staircase and the Dome Hall were just beautiful, as were pretty much all the rooms and even the corridors.One thing about the Dome Hall, it is the only place in the building you can't take pictures in. But that wasn't a problem for us since we found a booklet of the Parliament with great pictures at the gift shop after the tour. You can get the booklet in several different languages and it only cost 1480 Ft (about 4,50€). The whole thing was money well spent and the staff was very friendly and helpful.

one of the most beautiful buildings in the world. it is amazing to visit it on the inside and also see it day and night from the outside.take tram number 2 all the way from hotek intercontinental until the end of the line.

Nice building, short tour.. The building is beautiful and well worth seeing. However, the tour was relatively short - 20-30 minutes in total. It's still worth doing, but don't expect too much from it.

Stunningly beautiful building. The Parliament Buildings are definitely worth wandering around (we didn't go in, just enjoyed the building from outside). The architecture is beautiful and location next to the river wonderful.

One of the most outstanding buildings I've ever seen. The building is beautiful, but it is immaculately clean as are its surroundings. The statues in the grounds are also impressive. With the Danube in the background this is a view you will remember for a long time.
Magnificient building. A must see when in Budapest. This iconic parliament along the danube river is beautiful at day and night.

Great tour guide, very informative, beautiful building not to be missed. Really enjoyed this tour, not too long and able to take photos pretty much throughout. There are quite a lot of steps (even though they describe them as a few) so if you struggle with steps take the lift option. Both the interior and exterior of this building are absolutely stunning.

Check it out inside, not just outside. Great building both inside and outside. Not too long excursion will give you an overview of the history of this marvelous building - you'll discover how many gold was for decoration and other interesting parts.

Beautiful building. A beautiful building, worth a visit to see its soaring spires and gothic inspired facades. There is a fountain at the front that has been set to commemorate the failed revolution against the Soviets in 1956.
Beautiful building. We only saw this beautiful building from the outside and it is amazing in the daytime but especially pretty lit up in the evening!

Palatial government building. we had a private after hours tour of Paliament and were very impressed with the immenseness of this structure. It was ornate, and made with lots of granite, marble and gold leaf. Made "for the people", and the cost supposedly enough to maintain a town of 10,000 inhabitants
Gorgeous!. Definitely gorgeous and worth a walk by. I highly recommend! Shoes by the Danube is also not far and so is the olympic park which is fabulous with children!

Take your Camera. Impressive building for a Parliament House. Watched the changing of the Guards at 11:30am on Sunday ( by chance ) & people were encouraged to take photographs with the Guards. At 12noon light spray mist popped up from pavement in front of Parliament ( refreshing on a warm day ).

Architectual and Garden Wonder. Very beautiful building during the day and night. Did not see the opportunity to visit the inside. Around the parliament is several parks and museums within a short distance. Summer has the grounds with flowers.

Nice trip. We went about 10 am and got an English speaking tour booked for 11.30am. There is a nice cafe to spend an hour or so just where you get your tickets. We could show out UK Driving License as proof of EU residence...which is better than lugging your passport around. 2000HUF to get in, but 6000HUF for a non EU resident...Not worth that!A 50 minute tour and the views are great, a lovely building.
Stunning. We didn't go in, but the architecture of this is absolutely incredible. This is set overlooking the danube.

Worth a visit. Not only is this a beautiful building from the outside, but it has a stunning interior. I would recommend the tour, but you should book in advance as you are allocated a specific time for the 45min tour.

One of the most beautiful building in Budapest!. This building is definitely something everyone should see if the visit Budapest. Arguably the most famous building in Budapest, expectations do not disappoint. The sheer size is impressive as well as the architecture.We took the guided tour round the building. We just turned up and booked the next available English tour. It was a couple hours away so it might be worth booking ahead of your schedule isn't flexible. We went to near by attractions such as the basilica in the waitin period.The tour inside I would definitely reccomend, the inside is adorned in gold and is beautiful. The tour guide was funny, friendly and interesting.
Impressive Building. Take a camera - its an impressive building and a good walk around when the weather is good. Didn't go into the museum
Worth the money. For non-euro countries the entrance fee is quite high, but worth it. The tour is very well done and the rooms visited are really beautiful.
Nice building. A very special tour we got today. One of the most interesting man gave us this trip, we heard about history and literatu too. Thank you Mr. White!

This is what architecture means!!!. We were very lucky... not only because we had the chance to see the Hungarian Parliament from the Castle Hill and during a night cruise on Danube... but mostly because we got in (!!!) The 96m high dome is a masterpiece... Beneath the dome is a display of the Holy Crown of Hungary. I could write a book for this building... Daily tours (in english) every morning at 10...

Extraordinary opulence. It is highly recommended that you book online for this tour at www.jegymester.hu before you go. I tried the morning that we wanted to visit and there was nothing convenient in English when I looked at 7.30 am. For some reason, when I checked at 8.00 am all these spots had opened up. Anyway, it is worth the visit just to see the extraordinary opulence that was employed by a country that was once big enough to justify a parliament this grand. Now, with just 10 million population, Hungary only uses half the building!

A must see on any trip to Budapest. This is a must see on any trip to Budapest. This is a active Parliament building. See where the Country of Hungary is run. The outside of this building is wonderful, but the inside is even better. See the gold lined hallways. See the Hungarian Crown Jewels. Guided tours in english and other languages available.

Beautiful building and monument. I walked around whilst walking down the Danube and the building is absolutely magnificent. If you have some time to spare, seek out the Imre Nagy monument and visit the 1956 memorial - even if you're not a history buff, this is really important to the history of Hungary and will be referenced across the tourist attractions
Not just any old building. Politics aside, this building is one of the finest architectural masterpieces in Europe. Try to take a tour inside. Walk all around, and take in the details.

Fascintating veiw of Neo-Gothic classic, well-organized and informative. After taking hundreds of photos from all angles and all times of day, it was finally time to go inside and the tour was well worth it. Booking online is a very good idea to make sure you get a tour in the language you need. Come on time and be prepared for airport style security checks. What I particularly liked was that they under-promised and over-delivered. They warned us that we would not get to see about half of what we came to see because of high-level visitors and then, to the surprise of the guide, everything was open and we got to see everything. The guide was very good at pointing out interesting features. My only complaint was that group size was large and time allotted for taking photos was very, very short.

Beautiful, flawlessly maintained with a sense of pride. The building is absolutely wonderful to look at, it is clear why it is a focal point within the city. The area it is situated in is flawless, there is absolutely no litter in sight and the building and grounds are maintained flawlessly. It only get better at night! The building gives off so much the light the birds circle it all night, it is truly a sight not to miss, absolutely breathtaking.

Worth seeing it!. Fantastic, imposing, majestic architecture. It is surrounded by a garden, where you can sit and relax. Nearby is Szabadság tér (Liberty Square), from where you can walk to the Parliament.

Old building, but not much to see.. It is a beautiful building, but that is all there is to see and do. We took the tram, stopped and took a look and then onwords again. That is the beauty of Boedapest; the transportation is wonderful and cheap :)
Must see. Actually, if you came to Budapest and didn't see the parliament building you did something very wrong. It provides the best photographic background and, day or night, never disappoints.

Regret not going inside!. Great architecture to look at along with the guards and statues. Great riverside location. I was a little rushed - having lots of other things to see in the city, that I did not try to get a tour - something I now regret.

Sets the architectural tone for Budapest. The Parliament is the most spectacular structure on the Danube in Budapest and is the focal point for the views, day and night, from the river and the Buda side of the city. The gardens are beautiful.

An amazing tour of a most beautiful building. If you get to Budapest this is singularly the must see of your adventure. To see this structure along the Danube is breathtaking, day or night. The outside just whets your appetite for what is within. Make your reservations the day before and i would advise going with a tour. If you just drop in to buy a ticket on the day you wish to see it then you are likely to be turned away. It is that popular. The architecture is awe inspiring with detail the likes of which I have not seen in any national structure in the US. It rivals the best of Europe. The marble, gold leaf, frescoes and then there are the crown jewels. You can look at the pictures online by googling the name but there is nothing like standing in the halls of history.

We almost missed it! Book your language specific tour ahead of your desired visit.. This building is just as impressive on the inside as it is from the exterior. Our small group was exploring the city in the morning and decided to inquire about tickets for the Parliament tour. Fortunately there were still tickets available for the English tour that afternoon. Note that separate tours are offered in multiple languages. The guide was friendly and helpful and there was an elevator for those who could not take the stairs. Most of the sections of the Parliament building were able to be photographed. However, one visitor did not honor the request during the viewing of the crown. The guards quickly redirected him. I was amused at the cigar holders. They were even numbered!

Don’t miss the Parliament!. Rest assured: Not visiting the Parliament Building, the third largest in the world, is close to a crime! Many beautiful buildings exist in the world, but there are no too many featuring such an amazing architecture like this one. Although at the time it was built, Hungary was much larger (it lost approx 2/3 of its territory after WWI), I never understood why the country had to create such a huge building, and why they spent so much money on it. On the other hand it is really gorgeous, and it would be a pity not having it. The facade is just superb, decorated with statues of past Hungarian rulers, pointed arch arcades and numerous gargoyles and Neo-gothic ornaments. Its interior is even more striking than the exterior, bejeweled by Hungary's best artists of that time. Every piece has its reason; all are symbols from the Hungarian culture or history. Your jaws will hit the floor, when seeing the main entrance stairs and hall, one of the lobbies, the earlier House of Lords and the Hungarian Crown Jewels with their guards. Miraculous!Guided tours are held in all major languages, and certainly in Hungarian. A visit takes around 45 minutes, and is definitely worth the price. Be prepared for chaos, though: At the time we were there, the crowd was fairly big in the so-called Visitor Center. One had to find out where her/his group was assembling. Maybe this is the routine there. Before entering, you have to surpass a security clearance that is not less severe than at any airport. Admittance is HUF 2,000 for EU citizens (don’t forget to take your ID-card or passport with you!), for non-EU citizens hefty HUF 5,200. Children and students pay less. Only a limited number of tickets are available for each tour, for that reason it makes sense purchasing online, at www.jegymester.hu/parlament. Very annoying though that instead of an online discount you will pay 10 % more, but the upside is that you will not need to queue and admission will be guaranteed. Getting there is easy: Either you take Metro No. 2 to Kossuth tér, or the tram No. 2, which runs along the Pest side of the Danube river and has a stop at Kossuth tér too.

The symbol of Budapest -must visit. The most must visit attraction in Budapest . The parliament building is the symbol of the Budapest city. Amazing and huge building . Must see the parliament gards shift change performance in the start of every hour and to take pics with them .

Great exterior ,amazing interior but a little bit expensive. Great architecture but I wish there was a way to book online because they gave specific time for each language because I'd security .In my opinion the ticket price for non EU resident is expensive fir 45 minutes tour .15 minutes out of that goes for security check
Amazing Building. This building was amazing. Don't miss seeing it. They have English tours every 15 minutes. The grand entrance and the dome are impressive.

A magnificent piece of Architecture. This tour was one of our highlights. We were a party of 5 ranging in ages between 17 and 75 and everyone enjoyed the tour. Also should mention the lifts available for people who can't manage the numerous staircases one is expected to walk up.The building truly is a master piece, which the Hungarians can be very proud of.The tour 45min - 60min was informative and light.
i think it is the best parliment ever. an outstanding building i had ever seen we saw through a Danube cruise and i saw at again at night with the lights

Beautiful building. A must see/visit in centre by the river front. Fantastic building looking like Disney world castle. Lovel day in 28 degs sunshine. Then walk down by the Danube for relaxing stroll.

Architecture. Well, architecture of the building is just amazing! OK, you may have seen it on pictures, like I have before arriving in Budapest, but the real view was much more impressive. Huge cultural monument - and a legislation office together in one place :)

Every bit as gorgeous as it looks on TV!. This magnificent structure absolutely dominates the Pest side of the Danube and is as stunning in real life as it appears on TV. We did not have time to go inside the structure, but circled it on 2 different tours and enjoyed the view from the top of Castle Hill.

Very impressive. This is a huge and impressive building. The details of everything from rooftops, towers,windows, walls are beautiful. You can keep looking and finding new things. There is a tour of the inside you can sign up for in the visitor center.The visitor center also has very clean WC facilities if needed. We chose just to walk around outside and admire it.The grounds are beautiful and well maintained, a nice walking promenade.Definitely a must see!

Worth doing and just long enough. I was press ganged into going here. I'm not into looking at buildings and architecture (prefer natural views etc.) but it really was impressive. It was a stunningly restored building, stunning when lit up at night, and the tour takes you into rooms and halls with fantastic painted ceilings, fabulous carvings and sculptures everywhere. The guide was informative and it last less than an hour. I think any longer and I'd have lost the will, and I only gave it 4/5 as it's not really my thing. Worth doing though and not expensive.

It was a special experience admiring the Parliament from a boat cruise on the Danube. Breathtaking architecture in it's every detail. I recommend taking a river cruise on the Danube at night - it will take you all along the Parliament which will be all lit up and shining. Not to mention other sites you will be able to see, such as the magnificent Buda castle, and the beautiful bridges you will pass under.

Huge building. Fantastic interiors. This Parliament building is great and very rich. It worth a visit. Hungarian crown is shown on the center room.
Make sure you buy tikets by internet in advance. It is difficult to get them on the day.
The biggest and the niciest parliament.... ... in Europe definitely. It's really worth to see:-). Much gold and art, good guides. Wonderful architecture and interior.

Impressive. Check it out from both sides. It may be the 2nd largest Parliament building in the world but it's definitely the most beautiful. Walk around it on the Pest side and make sure to cross the bridge at sunset and get a shot of it when it's reflection is glowing on the river.

The most beautiful parliament building in the world!. This iconic building is so beautiful from the exterior, and at night it's all lit up looking positively magical. We viewed it at night from Buda as well, and walked by it too. Wait till you see in from the inside!!!We booked our tour on the internet, taking the 09:15 one. We walked from the area of the opera house where we were residing, the most beautiful walk passing the gorgeous cathedral, the American embassy, and by Szabadsag ter with it's interesting buildings and lovely fountain, all of which we scoured before going to the parliament building as we had time.Since we still had time we had coffee in the adjoining cafe which was very nice. And then came the highlight.....a guided tour of very probably the most beautiful parliament building in the world. You can deposit your stuff at the counter so you don't have to lug it. After the tour, when we collected our stuff, Thomas was so sweet and gave us a lot of tips for seeing the city (not that we hadn't done our homework). During the tour I just gaped all along and couldn't stop gasping. Truly beautiful and decorated in such good taste! The building is huge but we get to see only one half of it...the other half is identical but tourists are not allowed in as that's the seat of the government proper. They use the house of lords (which tourists get to see) if their equivalent on the other side is out of function for any reason. The guide too was great and quite chuffed by my enthusiasm. Pity one may not linger a bit more!The whole locality is wonderful so be sure to take your time and stroll around, enjoy the square itself with all it's statues (don't forget to pose with Reagan), and the cute little bridge with the man on it (it has a tale but I don't remember it), sit in the wonderful cafes and enjoy. God's own city is Budapest!

Parliament, never miss to see it!. Although I haven't had the chance to go inside this place, when I am around Budapest, I never miss to take a picture and just enjoy the nice architecture of this building.

Nightwalk Budapest. An impressive structure. So huge and clean. Very well maintained. A memorable slice of history. Should be visited during the night too - so as to admire the lighting affects, as compared to during daylight hours.

The most beautiful building.... If you are in Budapest you just have to visit this beautiful building. The Budapest Parliament building is the third largest Parliament building in the world and you can enter to the building and visit the amazing rooms and interiors.
Beautiful. I think it's one of the most beautiful buildings in the world. I came back to Budapest just to see it again! The architecture is amazing. It's a must see pace!

Superb!. One of the most beautiful buildings I have ever visited, it's worth every penny! No doubt, a must see if you go to Budapest. Remember to book in advance, otherwise you might not find any tickets available. Enjoy!
get tour tickets online. make reservations online if you want to visit it. the outside is pretty, but we couldnt tour it because all the english tours were sold out by the time we got there.
see at night!!!!. we passed the building more than once during the day and it is an impressive sight. But best was seeing it from the river at night, when it was lit. Not to be missed in Budapest.

Parliament by the Danube. We took a night cruise along the Danube and the highlight was the Parliament Building lit up at night. Sitting up on top of the boat and passing the building from the river was awesome. The building is beautiful by day but magical at night.
The steps are worth it. Very memorable building, full of history and stories. There are a lot of steps (not steep) to climb, but really glad this was part of our tour.

Superb Architecture. Perhaps you could easily say that Architecture in Budapest is unique. Modern and the ancient mixed together. Parliament is an outstanding example of the same. Close to the Danube River it stands majestic and mighty. Coming from most countries, parliament houses are inaccessible even driving close to them is a problem but not here. You could enjoy the building, the statues around it and visit it, wow, could not have seen anything better anywhere. View of the building specially during the night hours when it is illuminated is a view to watch. Watch it from the river to have its best view. Should not miss it.
Hungarian Parliament. The main facade is in front of the Danube River. The main entrance is on the east side. It is the largest and the highest building in Budapest.

Stunning building well worth the okay tour. My husband and I did an English guided tour inside the Parliament building on a Saturday morning (first tour at 9h45). I had purchased the tickets online a couple days in advance; at that point, there was already limited availability. Absolutely book this as soon as you know you want to go if you need particular times.The building is impressive from the outside. The inside is stunning and ornate. Often I find the inside of palaces and even government buildings so decorated as to be gaudy, but I actually thought this was quite beautiful and impressive - so worth the somewhat steep price of the tour simply to see the inside. The tour guide was quite nice, but they book very large tours and if you don't keep up at the front it's very hard to hear the guide despite the small microphone she used. However, she didn't really impart any information that I hadn't already learned doing a bit of research myself before the trip. If you read up a little ahead of time about the building, and remember the one room where you can't take pictures, you could perhaps buy tickets for any tour if your language sold out or you wanted to go at a particular time, as the main attraction is just seeing the building. It's easy to find information about it online before you go.You can take pictures everywhere inside, even with flash, except in the center dome room where guards stand watch over the crown (but there was a quite nice postcard showing this room and the guards and the dome that you could purchase in the shop). I had an email on my phone with our tickets, but you need a PRINTED version of the tickets on paper (I think because their scanner has a hard time with phones). However, we showed up a bit early and there was no line luckily at the ticket counter and they printed our tickets for us after checking the reservation number. Best to print your tickets ahead of time if you can, otherwise leave some time to pick them up in case there is a line.Don't bring pocket knives, nail files, pepper spray, etc. as you'll have to fish them out and hand them over when you go through security to enter the building.Show up about 5 minutes early if you have your tickets printed already. It'll last about 45-50 minutes, then there is a souvenir shop (found elsewhere in the city too, Memories of Hungary I think it's called) with some nice stuff that you may want to browse afterwards. Leave a good hour for this. Also see the building at night from the river - it's also very beautiful in a different way lit up at night! You can even see it well enough from Castle Hill or the Chain Bridge at night.You do climb up stairs (I think they said it's 135?) and then down again at the end, but those who need to do so can take the lift with the guide while the group goes up with the guard. However, don't take the lift unless you absolutely need to - the first staircase you go up is the most beautiful in the building (it's something like 27 staircases - 1 beautiful, 1 ugly, the rest in between) - and you descend by the ugliest :) Definitely an actual highlight of the tour, so don't be lazy - only take the lift if you have real need. The stairs are low and not hard, nor is the pace difficult.
Do you like scaffolding?. A truly stunning building completely spoiled by perma-scaffolding. When did they take those photos in the tourism propaganda?

Book your tickets beforehand!. A visit to the Hunagarian Parliament is definately worth while. It is better to book a slot beforehand on the Internet to ensure that you have a place in the language you prefer.All tours are guided and last about one hour. Apart from seeing the amazing Hungarian jewels, you are also allowed into one of the debating chambers and given a comprehensive history about the building. I particularly liked the brass havana cigar holders in the lobby area!

Spectacular!. l saw the parliament building during the day and night and highly recommend the nighttime view. It's stunning. It is the iconic building you see when you envision the city of Budapest. The architecture is breathtaking and it is probably the most beautiful parliament building in the world.

guided tour. Best book in advance by internet to chose the time to suit you.The number2 tram goes to the entrance so no problem to get there.The tour guide is very informative but stay close to hear him/her.Take the lift offer at the start as the 136 steps do get you out of breath.The tour is pitched to the right length of time 45 mins approx. depending on the amount of questions asked.This is a well worth the money tour and gives a insight of the history and present running of HUNGARY, fasanating.

Beautiful Building!. This is one of the most beautiful buildings we have been through. Not only was the exterior and river front position spectacular but the interior was absolutely beautiful.We have been through a lot of the famous buildings of Europe and this building is a standout!! The interior is tasteful and the opulent decorations were truely beautiful.The only problem was the organization at the ticket office and the lack of crowd control while waiting for your particular language tour group to begin. I can only describe it as verging on chaos.Give yourself plenty of time,preferably the day before to get your ticket , and you need to select your language time as well. We were not able to buy on-line when we were there. Then, unless they have been able to organise the crowds, prepare yourself for a chaotic wait for your time slot. But put up with it all to reap the benefit of seeing this amazing building and their beloved "Hungarian Crown - 1000year old " guarded inside.
Amazing. Beautiful architecture, very well looked after. Go see this at night as it will blow your mind. Go all around it as there is more to is as meets the eye.

Awsome both inside and outside. This is an imposing building that speaks of Hungarian majestic past and present. While the interior and grand by any measure and the work inside is spectacular, the outside architecture including the surrounding areas is equally impressive. The moment you step out of the metro stop (if this is how you arrive), you see this massive and expansive grand babe of Budapest next to you. The Parliament building is next to the Danube and surrounded by equally majestic historic buildings. Its a working building and as you take a tour with your tour guide, you will be followed by a watchful security guard that ensures you do not wander off the dedicated areas for visitors. Their a sovenier shop and restaurant inside the building. There is an entrance ticket of about 8 Euro. A top pick of Budapest. With such grand buildings and so much much history and powerful kings who ruled beyond Hungary, you begin to understand where Hungarian arrogance comes from. In fairness to Hungarians, such arrogance is a hallmark of people who have rules others in the past

Truly Spectacular. The building and facade have been maintained impeccably.Viewed from a slow moving boat on the Danube, you can really appreciate the magnificence of this meeting place and imagine world leaders contemplating the future of Europe.

Wonderful building but tour crowded & rushed. We booked the discounted EU Citizens discounted tour online & printed the tickets before we left home. Our tour was due to start at 9:45am but due to a security cordon around the building, which meant you had to walk all the way round, everyone was late. It was also unclear where you supposed to go to join the tour, luckily we just joined a crowd of people shuffling through the barrier & that was our tour. Although the building was extraordinary & well worth visiting the tour group was really too large & we often could not hear or could only hear the next tour group which was a shame.

The most beautiful parliament of the world. After 1000 years spent in the Carpathian basin it was time to build the "House of the Nation". Maybe it took a long time but it was worth it. Inside and outside the building is beautiful. You can meet here some "old kings" and you can see the 1000-year-old Holy Crown. There are very professional tour guides for the tours in many languages too. At the entrance you it is possible that you have to wait, so it's better to buy the tickets online.

Very interesting tour. You could only visit the inside the Parliament with a tour group. We were lucky to be able to get a place on the tour that we wanted as they fill up fast - so I recommend booking online. The parliament building is very beautiful inside and out. Don't forget ID as we were asked for it and also don't forget your student card if you are a student as this gives you a reduced price entry.

Parliament. If you don't visit anything else don't miss the Parliament. It is a stunning building and there are tours in many languages. You cannot order from one day to the next, only on the same day. You can go on line at 8 am and order and pay for the tour you want. We were 2 couples. At 11:15 there was a tour in English (for us) and a tour in Spanish (for our friends) so that worked out perfectly. If your country belongs to the EU you don't pay very much. If not, we paid 5200 florint. But it was worth every penny. It is a gorgeous building.

Grandiose exterior matched by a sumptuous interior. Hungary's largest building, the beautifully ornate Parliament is the perfect balance to the Royal palace in the Buda hills on the opposite side of the river. It is hard to miss whatever your location.The grandiose exterior is matched by an equally sumptuous interior.Entry to the building is by tour only and they get booked up very quickly, particularly the English language ones. Tickets can be booked on online however, so I would recommend booking before you leave home. You still have to pass security, but the queue moves quickly. The tour lasts about 45 minutes and only visits a handful of rooms as it is still a working building, but we saw the impressive 96 step, sweeping main staircase which leads to the Domed Hall where the crown jewels are displayed under armed guard. This was the only part of the tour where we were not allowed to take photos. The tour finishes at the hall where the Members of Parliament sit when Parliament is is session.Although the building closes to the public in the evening, it is well worth revisiting the area at night as the building looks even more impressive lit up.

Well worth a visit. Visited here during a recent short trip to Budapest and thoroughly enjoyed it. You do need to go early and be prepared to come back later in the day as tours do get booked up but unless you are on a very tight time scale it's no big deal. our guide was very informative.

Weekend break. The tour we had was extremely badly organised. Getting the tickets was painful with no proper queuing system and a free for all to get to the desks. The amount of people wanting tickets meant the two people serving couldn't cope. The 3 others behind the desk looked on doing nothing. We were told to wait 5 mins before our tour by the security gate. Again the queuing system was awful and the guide didn't arrive until 5 minutes after the stated time. Although clearly spoken the guide was difficult to hear because of the other guides voice in a foreign language drowning her out. All in all a very disorganised tour. Very disappointing
magnificent. Book a tour to see inside this majestic building full of history and amazing interiors including the crown jewels.

Stunning architecture. Went passed this building on many trips whether on the on off bus tour, a river cruise or walking by or seeing it from hilltops it is without a doubt a beautiful building. Well worth seeing

Over the top!. An unbelievably fantastic Gothic concoction! 19th century excess at its most grandiose. Elaborate exterior decoration and sumptious interior. Visit to see historic 11th century crown of Hungary and royal regalia on display under the dome.

English Tour of Parliament. I purchased my ticket on line. The security line moved quickly. We were able to see the Crown and hear the stories of past Kings/Queens.Also, we were able to see where Hungarian politics take place.The Parliament is absolutely spectacular.A definite must do while in Budapest

An essential visit. You cannot go to Budapest and miss the famous Parliament building. In fact, the incredible structure features on almost any photograph of the City. As with many such buildings it looks more spectacular from a distance. But it is still a 'must see'. You have to book a guided tour. We actually booked online before we left UK to avoid disappointment. The tour gives you the history of the Parliament which was inaugurated in 1896 to celebrate the 1000 anniversary of Hungary. The grounds are lovely with some beautiful statues and, of course, memorable views across the Danube to the Buda side.

Most beautiful Parliament building in Europe?. This is a major landmark on the Pest side of the Danube River. It is hard to miss it if you are down by the river. Its outside has recently been restored and the facade is now more beautiful than ever.

Unforgettable emotional experience.. Beautiful building in a lovely setting on the banks of the Danube.Easy to get to by bus or boat. Do not miss the emotive "shoe memorial" commemorating the terrible fate of those driven into the river by the Nazis in WW2.It is arranged along the river walkway. You will never forget it.

Great English tour at Parliament. It has been some years since I took a tour in English at this beauty. The guide was fabulous with small details and stories to go with the building. I expect it may be good to book a tour now as it must be busier. Since the govt changed the setting and grounds are spectacular. This was a highlight of my visits to Budapest.

Do NOT MISS. Advisable not only to visit the guided tour around the Parlament and see the famous Crown of the country, but after the tour come back to its museum free of charge- excellent presentation of the Hungarian history in brief.

Parliament bldg - the 3rd largest in the world. Parliament bldg - the 3rd largest in the world. But why do they need such a huge one? And the 2 bigger than these, even more baffling. But it's a good sight, made in pure white- it' look seven better when u see it all lit up during a night cruise on the Danube. It has a ticket and needs advance permission to enter the same during its working hours, but would there be many takers?

Inside tour is not worth for money. I joined an English tour, which costs 5200HUF for non-EU adult. The price for EU is 2000. The building is large and some part of inside is very shiny. But no more. There is not much history to remember, at least to foreigners, when compared to Britain's parliament tour.
The Magnificent Building. Take the tour (English). The building is well worth visiting. The guide takes you through the building and explains the significance of the rooms and history of building.

Interesting tour, saw the guard change, very neat inside.. It was worth the tour - although the building is wildly impressive from the outside, the interior is beautiful as well. Some nice views from the tour and the small groups made the tour intimate enough to ask questions.

Amazing building. The parliament building in Budapest, Hungary was awesome from the outside as well as inside. There was a lot of history about the building. The tour of the whole building was excellent.

breathtakingly ornate and beautiful!!!. They really spare no expense or detail on the parliament buildings in Budapest!! Take the guided tour and book before you go, it is well worth it. The English guide was very fluent and easily understood throughout our tour, she also answered questions along the way. The royal holy crown, scepter and orbit were impressive to say the least. Very interesting tour and great gift shop at the end for souvenirs. We highly recommend this site and the guided tour. Enjoy!!

If you haven' seen it, you haven't seen anything in Budapest. The most important sight from the point of the hungarian history and from the point of cultura and art. You can not visit it alone only within a group, ticket can be purchased only on the same day, ther eis a little fee nowadays for european members, you can try to book it online if you ar ea group. The place is just like the Airport and the Synagoge, terror dangeroued, so you will be going in through detectors.
A gem from Pest. This building is really impressive. I didn't had a chance to visit it but the views from Buda and from Danube (at night) are impressive.
Beautiful building. As an architecture student this was a must do for us. The tour is great and well worth the money, the guides were knowledgeable and friendly
Parliament Building that you can get right up close to. Absolutely stunning building and you can get right up close to this building so great for photo opportunities.

Breathtaking inside and out. The whole building made my jaw drop. The ornate and expansive exterior is so impressive that one must walk the perimeter. English speaking tour guides are available and cost about $7.50, but you have to register in advance since the English ones fill quickly. Visitors are not admitted to ramble and tour on their own; visitors must go with a group, and veering off the path is prohibited. The tour features a stop at the top of the main entry staircase which could have lasted longer as this was magnificent in decor and regal-ness. Under the dome is housed the jeweled crown of St. Stephen and the crown jewels alongside the crown in a guarded display case. The assembly chamber is also intricate and interesting to see how their House of Lords operates. A couple of lobbies or ante-rooms with frescos on the ceilings add to the elegance of this building. All the chambers on the tour show ceilings at which are to be gawked with the gold trim, painted arches, statues of important Hungarian statesmen, kings, and 1 queen. Soooo worth the effort and time. Tour takes an hour, which was seemingly too short for such a vast building and architectural wonder.

A lovely interior to match the imposing exterior. We took the English tour which enabled you to get a good look at the interior, and also see the famous crown jewels, and the changing of the guard. Pace of the tour a little quick in places, not allowing you to fully take in your surroundings or take pictures, which you were permitted to do in most areas.

It's big and nice!. I didn't go inside the building, but i made the circle around it. It's a nice big building, and you can take some photos, but there aren't a lot of things to do there. Worth a visit for the photo!
Stunning building. Even if you wont manage to book and see the inside, just looking from the outside is a MUST! An absolute stunning building.

Parliament. We spent a whole day admiring the beautiful architecture of the building. We watched the changing of the guards and also the salute to the flag. Pay a vist at night after dark when it is all lit up, it is a magnificent site.
Huge beautiful beacon. The tour of the Parliament is well worth doing. I learned so much about history and the way Hay is governed. At night the lights on the building are magnificent!

A true highlight. This is a beautiful building modeled after London's Parliament building. The best views are from Buda. Due to terrorism it's not possible for visitors to roam around inside since there is very high security. It's an architectural marvel.

Spires!. There are 365 spires (yes, one for every day). someone had a lot of money to spend (government probably). It is a beautiful building. We walked around a little on the outside (there Sunday morning). Very impressive

A Must See!. This is one (of the astonishing number) of the most beautiful buildings in Budapest. I'm only sorry that we didn't get to do a tour of the inside of the building as I'm told it's phenomenal. Next time for sure (plan ahead/book ahead for tours in English)! Just walking around the outside of the building is gorgeous - make sure you see the changing of the guards - it's solemn and fascinating.

Huge!. The facade is gorgeous. While I've seen this building in a lot of films, seeing it in person certainly blew my breath away. The tour inside was pretty cool too. We saw the change of the guards that protect the crown jewels and went into the room they hold congressional meetings in. Very cool!

Amazing Building. I'm not usually into architecture, but this building is amazing. The ornate statues that line the building, and the detail are absolutely stunning. You must see this building from up close. It's not sufficient to see it from across the river. The surrounding area is also very nice. Worth a walk over to the Parliament building.

Fancy Parlament building. It was a very ornate building and a very popular tourist spot. Try to book your tour early in the morning or by internet as the tours book early. If you book in person be prepared to return hours later for your slot.
Glorious Leadership. Absolutely stunning architecture set in a lovely city by a (sadly not blue) historic river! Glorious construction.
A must see in Budapest. For architecture lovers this is a must see in Budapest. It is as beautiful on the inside as the outside and stands majestically in the skyline. Not to be missed.

Gorgeous building, tour is okay. The building is stunning. The tour is a bit of a pain, frankly. You have to line up to get your tickets in the morning or buy them at least a day ahead online (from a system that is a real pain). Then come back at your tour time and hope you can get through security at the right time for your tour in your language. The tour takes about 45 minutes and much of the time is spent marching through corridors and listening to the recap of a lot of Hungarian king statues. If you are a fan of architecture or enjoy over-the-top opulence, you will love this building tour though. The main staircase is covered in gold.

Worth the trek!. What a building, great dome. An amazing square. Not overrun with tourists in June when we went. Metro and trams go to it. We walked to the parliament building from deaks square . A long trek. Took 30 mins in hot sunshine. But worth it. Walked back along Danube past metal shoes nailed down on the bank to represent victims of Auswitch. Very poignant .Parliament building were spectacular but couldn't go inside . Pity. Great backdrop for photos. Well worth a trek!

Very impressive. The building itself was very grand and well kept. the tour was interesting and we learnt a lot about the Hungarian political system currently and in the past. The interior of the building was very grand and was traditional and had been adapted to modern needs.

Impressive and its all gold that shines. Be ware security checks are stringent, though if you carry e.g. a knife you can give it to the guards and they will keep it for you till the end of your tour. It is a huge building, we took the tour in German language (I would suggest to pay the extra couple of hundred Forint for a reservation if you are in to an other language than English). Lovely little details about the building where told and it is indeed a monument to show the glamour of the Hungarian democracy from the time.

Stunning.. Stunning building, if you pick the right day to go, you can go into the actual Parliament hall instead of the secondary hall. So much gold, such fantastic artistry all over the building. I would suggest that the English tour guides are given a bit more training in the language as some times it was a bit awkward and difficult to figure out what she was saying.
The most spectacular building in Budapest. Visiting the magnificent Parliament building is a must. it is grand on the outside and beautiful inside.

Superb. This building is very nice. I loved the windows, all the building.
Once I will go in the building too.

The Budapest Parliament. Not to be missed essential to book a time and leave sufficient time to find the entrance. The biggest Parliament building in the world we were told. The interior is breathtaking, for sheer size and decoration. Leave time yo explore outside

Fantastic building. Most pictures you see of this building are taken from the opposite bank of the river but the front is equally impressive and managed to coincide my visit during the changing of the guard

Wonderful place selected out of four definitetge best.Looks good from inside and from the river. you just have to go and experience it yourself.Wonderful to watch from all sides the river (cruises) and inside. There have been four entries and they decided on this beautiful one.
Also if your lucky you can see the soldiers changing guard. No laughing no expression.
Noticed Hungarian people did not watch kept on going.

stunning architecture. I was really lucky when i went, because some guards were having a performance, following which we were allowed a few minutes to take photos of them. this was at around 1230pm.
the architecture of the building is really breathtaking and makes it extremely recognizable.

Beautiful building, worth the money. It is worth the money to pay for the tour, book in advance because it sells out quickly or go early. It is very pretty on the inside and outside. Make sure you do a boat tour or dinner cruise at night too..
Stunning with night lighting. Exceptional old world architecture with wonderful lines and situated along the Danube. A must see for all visiting!

Fantastic tour of an architectural icon in Budapest. Tourism of this site is well-organized and tasteful. Twice, I have been on a tour and each time I have been able to see the changing of the guard around the crown jewels. The building is spectacular and I enjoyed being able to see where the parliament convenes.

Must not be missed!. If you have limited time in Budapest, this is one attraction that can't be missed. It is the most stunning building on the Budapest skyline, no matter what time of day or night, and the interior is just as magnificent. Such a pity that the tour is only one hour. Highlight of our stay.

beautiful archictecture. Astonishing building. Very nice to have a stroll next to the water up to the parliament.
Very clean area and not too crowdy

The world class monument. A must visit place. Outside the parliament at 12 p.m. and 1 p.m. soldiers perform traditional ritual, the can walk around the parliament and take pictures from the Danube river side.
While inside the parliaments is the most spectacular with stairs, golden ornaments, royal jewelry, big halls, monuments, colorful windows, etc. Definitely Budapest visitor should visit this place.

Must-see despite High Prices. To start with prices are roughly doubled for non-EU residents with adults paying around €17. Another negative was the large numbers of people in each tour. Now for the positives. The interior of the building is just as beautiful and intricate as the exterior and the tour is fairly comprehensive. Also photography is allowed in every room but one which happens to case some royal treasures. There is a fair bit of walking on the tour and quite a lot of stairs, but their is an option to use an elevator where the largest section of stairs are. To save time and hassle you should buy tickets online because you'll be guaranteed a spot and also know what time the tours are in your preferred language.

Incredible Building and view. I can not discribe my feelings - you must see that yourself!!!!You will not be dissapointed! Very unusual and place is very open and green! The most beautiful vies is from the brige opposite the Parlament building

beautiful architecture. The most gorgeous looking building on the outside, very impressive and very beautiful at night when all lite up and viewed from accross the Danube. Would recommend a guided tour very interesting history of the building
Neogothic. Marvellous building on the East shore ot The Danube. Take the interesting guided tour and you will see all there is to see!

Gorgeous on the outside, predictable on the inside. It's a wonderful building, in the daytime as wel as at night. You can admire it from the Chain Bridge or from the Buda Castle; I don't think you can miss this, but the inside tour is a different story. It starts with a staircase full of gold, then the guide points out that the carpet has different colours on both side of the symmetrical building etc. When some people of our group asked questions, the (official) gide clearly didn't appreciated this. So for me, it a no-go. But from the outside, it's really fantastic!

Beautiful architecture. From the outside, on Buda's side or Pest, the stunning architecture will amaze anyone. Once a year, they open the parliament to the public. We had the chance to do so, even if it gets pretty crowded, it's worth the tour. Beautiful inside out!!!

Worth a Visit. The Parliament has some splendid architecture and some interesting art. Access is by guided tour so you get some explanations along the way - thorough if not particularly inspired. Note that the visitor center is located below Plaza level on the north side: we stumbled around a bit before finding it. And the tours book up. When we wandered in around 10:15 AM the first available tour was 12:15 PM.

Well done!. My son and I are European government and history fans, and try to see Parliament buildings when we visit various European capitals. Of all our visits to the continent, our tour guide here was the best. The English speaking group size is limited, so it was very manageable). She specifically asked people not to take pictures until she was done explaining things, then allowed plenty of time for photos at the end of each stop of the tour. It was an excellent way to allow those of us interested more in the content than snapping photos of stuff of which we had no idea of the significance or meaning to enjoy the tour and learn. Book well in advance online if possible, as tours sell out quickly. The first tour of the morning is the best bet, as the place becomes kind of a zoo later in the day. The visitor center near the main entrance sells tickets (and has a will-call window) and souvenirs and is quite easy to navigate. One of our best experiences of our trip, but not if you're not keen on European history or parliamentary process, you might want to make other destinations a higher priority. For us, it was great.

Wow. It doesn't matter which angle you take, This has to be one of the most impressive buildings that you will ever see...given that it lies on the banks of the Danube River, in the heart of Budapest, simply adds layers of cream on to an already amazing treat

parliament. this is one of the so many great buildings to see architecturally magnificently built so much to take in and again like most of the buildings steeped in history and in my opinion another one not to be missed

Beautiful palace. This is one of the best and most important landmark in Budapest. 3 ways to see the real beauty of this palace, 1) from pest part of budapest 2) while cruising on the boat at the river 3) during night
Take the lift!. Bling bling bling! Gold leaf in profusion. We took the tour around this AMAZING building. VERY INTERESTING! Saw the Crown jewels and the changing of the guard!

This is a georgeous seat of government. Not only is the outside of the building stunning, you will be blown away with the interior. And you get to view the Crown Jewels, (Crown, Orb, Scepter, Sword and Pillow)
Do take this tour.. you will not be disappointed... (Be sure to look out for the cigar holders!!)

Magnificent Parliament. 1896 Parliament building (3rd largest in world), grand site on the Danube, spectacular lighting at night. Worth taking tour - 96 steps up to rotunda to see Crown of St, Stephen, basement museum of 1000 years of Hungarian History and nearby museum of 1956 Hungarian Uprising

Wow. What a building.. We didn't go inside but the building itself (from outside) is just unbelievable. From everywhere we went we wanted to take pictures of it so we could get different angles. This is an amazing piece of Architecture.
What a building!. We where strapped for time and sadly did not have time to see it at night time! But wow! Its super impressive and deserves some of your time whilst in Budapest!

You'll enjoy. This a beautiful, splendid building from the outside and inside too. You can take a lot of nice pictures here. :)
(You can't take anything in, they gonna check you seriously.)

Ornate iconic building. Fantastic building, a must see. Looks very impressive close up as it is so ornate and even more impressive from a far - there are many places in the city to get good views due to the hills on the Buda side of the river and when it is lit up at night it looks beautiful. If you view it at night from the opposite side of the river you can take in the entire building and see the light reflections in the water whereas if you are up close, you get a bit of a crick in your neck!

Brilliant building. Lovely building viewed from night all lit up and during the daytime.
I viewed this building from the evening cruise ship which is also a must.

Impressive building - schedule your tour. This is one of those must-do's for Budapest. The Parliament building is larger than London's. There are plenty of impressive views to be had from the exterior, but it's also impressive to see parts of the interior, which you need to take a tour to access. Schedule the tour in advance. We did - and when we showed up there was a sign that said all tours for the day were booked, so if we hadn't arranged it ahead of time we would not have been able to get in. You can book online. The tour takes just under and hour and walks you through a golden staircase, the room with the crown jewels, their main staircase, and the actual house of the Parliament.

Worth the wait !!. Hard to get passes to tour this magnificent structure from the inside.. but if you succeed.. IT IS WORTH IT... Take it all in and if there is a problem with a camera.. then be sure to walk the grounds outside for GREAT pics.. Don't forget to watch the soldiers guarding the rear and, maybe take a pic of yourself alongside one of them.. The whole experience is memorable.........

Parliament. Worth a visit not cheap to go on a tour but the only way to go inside. So beautiful you may take photos everywhere except in the dome so hard to describe the beauty in there. The chandelier and the gold amazing. Also enjoyed the house sitting room

Beautiful. Stunning, both outside and inside. Be sure to time your visit so that you can join a tour. Spend a few minutes walking around the building and enjoying the different views and angles of the Parliment building as well as the other statues and sights around the area.

Simply great!. Great value for your money as the tour is not too cheap and very interesting. The tour also has a optimal lenght with a skillful guide telling you exactly what you should know and more thereafter.

It's a Must-See in Budapest. Everyone who goes to Budapest is familiar with the iconic Parliament Building that is a highlight view of those cruising the Danube. However, we were amazed at how many travelers we met actually took the time to go into the building and take the tour. You will be richly rewarded if you make the effort to do so.This is, indeed, the most spectacular legislative building I've ever seen! Don't miss it when you go to Budapest.
Magnificent and opulent. This building is impressive during the day and night, it is an iconic landmark along the Danube. It is situated on the Pest side

Well worth a tour. We booked a ticket first thing in the morning for 16:30. I would definitely recommend booking in advance. The tour we had was in English and was fairly easy to follow, although the guide did have a strong accent. I thought the tour went quite quickly and certainly didn't drag. The 'house of commons' is very impressive as are several of the other rooms. This is a good place to go to cool down in summer, probably good in winter too. The outside of the building is spectacular too and it's great how you can see it from so many other places in the city.
Spectacular. Just walking around the grounds of this building is worth it. The structure is spectacularly designed and maintained.
Breathtaking Building!!!. The view of the building is just scintillating - day time, night time, back-side, river-side. I couldn't take my eyes of it.

Interesting Building.. You can book your tickets online before you go, I would recommend this as it is a very popular attraction. The tour takes about 45 minutes and it gives you a great overview of the building and its history. The tours main focus is on the building and not so much about the politics. Defiantly worth a visit.

Impressive and important. Visited yesterday on the spur of the moment. Arrived early (8.30am) and was told there were still tickets for the 10am tour (which was the last one). Ticket office is on the far left side of parliament if viewed from the river, downstairs. Paid 2000 ft each, reduced due to being an EU citizen (luckily we had copies of out passports on is as proof otherwise it would have been significantly more).The tour chosen was in English by a young lady who was very knowledgeable in the language and the subject. We saw the golden staircase, the main staircase, dome hall, chamber of the National Assembly and the anteroom of the house of deputies, as well as many beautiful corridors. Most importantly we saw the coronation insignia in the Dome Hall. The ancient crown is truly amazing, but please remember that no photos are allowed here. Everywhere else is fine, just not the dome hall. There is a fine guidebook available in the gift shop for 1480 ft which has far better photos than would normally be achieved anyway. Please also be cautious about standing too near the guards here, as they swing their swords every five minutes. You have been warned!You leave via part of the museum which has a scale model of Parliament. A truly amazing experience

INSIDE OUT. The building is stunning from the outside and the view from across the river at night is memorable. But I didn't think the tour of the interior was worth the price, the planning, and experiencing the extremely intrusive security guards who herded you from area to area. In short, best seen from a distance.

Don't waste your time touring inside the Budapest Parliament if you're a non-EU member. Booked the tour to see this parliament building a month before I saw it. Once landed in Budapest I was told by my tour guide for the city that it isn't worth going if a non-EU member because pay a high price (around $25 US/person). The tour is only a 45 minute tour where a one-fifth of the time is going through a security check. We then are taken with a tour guide who memorized lines but when it comes to asking them a question you can tell they don't know. the crown jewels were nice to see but other than that it truly was not that high price. If it was $10 US I would consider it but not for the current price. As my tour guide told me.. just save the $25 US and go out for a nice dinner and spend that evening googling the photos of the parliament versus paying that high price for a waste of a time tour. Totally regret buying the tour tickets a month early..
Beautiful building. Likely the nicest parliament building in the world! It is hard to believe that the building is as old as it is and in such great condition.

impressive. Magnificent building overlooking the Danube on one side and facing the cultural museum with huge pillars on the other . There is a huge square in the middle. This building looks even more impressive at night as it is all lit up. You can also venture inside but I think it might be better to book in advance as there are only certain viewing time for different languages.
Amazing . To describe this building in only one word is amazing. I've seen many parliamentary buildings across the EU and North America but this is hands down the most beautiful.

Beautiful. Parliament is an absolutely gorgeous building and I'm so glad we stumbled upon it. We only saw it from Pest and we walked around but I think it would be a good idea to get a boat tour and see it from the river as well. It's such a detailed, huge, incredible building, it's definitely worth having a look around.

Pre-book if you can and select any early tour time. We were glad we prebooked this tour from the UK - it cost around £4 to book online and printing tickets meant no effort on arrival. We were booked for 9.45am tour and this went in late due to security checks I imagine if you plan to visit in the afternoon this delay could back up to to at least an hour.Once through airport type security our guided tour was conducted in faultless English - the interior is very spectacular - part of the tour includes the Hungarian Crown Jewels and their goose-stepping guards. The building dazzles and the quirky nature of the tour is great fun.Small exhibition about the restoration completes the one hour tour - and there is an excellent gift shop too.

Mega Building. Walked down by the river and was blown away by this amazing construction
If you are in Budapest find time to stroll down and see the scale and scope of this

All that glitters...is gold. This is a very beautiful building certainly worth to take the tour. However, it should be noted, that tickets for daily tours can be hard to get because they tend to be sold-out. I would therefore reccomend that you reserve your tickets beforehand through internet.

Budapest Parliament. Oh this building is just so good. We loved Budapest & there are so many things to see including lo this beautiful building with the crowning jewelled historic crown taking centre stage guarded by the soldiers round the clock. The beautiful timber & intricate wood work has to be seen & the carpets - so old yet in perfect condition . One of these carpets rugs is bigger than our house! A must see.

Breath taking!. Whether you go for a visit during the day or at night time, this sight is breath taking!. We were in a boat before the sun set, taking photos and videos of River Danube and the Parliament building. At night time, the building lights up and is so beautiful. I would suggest to take a river cruise and take photos and videos along. Worth seeing!
Best by boat. Take the boat tour on the Danube in the early evening which is adelight in itself and then view the spectacular scene of the beautiful architecture lit up looking like GOLD

Very luxurious Parlamient. When you get close, you are absdolutely caught by this impressive building, the lovely jardinated square and the astonishing view of the Danube. However, you must go inside and take one of the multiple guided tours (in different languages!) and then you'll see that it's even more beautiful from then inside! A not-to-miss one in Budapest!

Beautiful building, disappointing tour. I have more pictures of Parliament than anything else in Budapest as it is a supremely beautiful building that looks amazing day and night. However, we may have been unlucky with the tour, it lasted less than 30 mins after spending almost that long getting our group through security. I didn't feel the tour gave much information and it felt very rushed.

Spectacular to Look At From the River.. We did not go inside the Parliament as we were short on time and did not want to go through the security lines which were long. But we were able to view this building from the outside during the day. We took a River Boat ride at night for an hour which showed us the spectacular lit up bridges, Parliament buildings and the Buda Castle. A great way to see these buildings!

Disappointing and badly organized tour. The ticket for the tour is 2'000HUF for EU citizens abd 5'200 for others. The security check was understaffed and took well over 15min. Two groups (italian and spanish) started at the same time which led to confusion and congestion on the way. Akso two guides in the same room ard not ideal. The tour consists of only three rooms and takes 30min. Main stairs, crown room and upper house are the stops. There are few explanations and our guide was not cery helpful on our additional questions. Not worth your money and time.

Best Parliament Building Ever??. I have to say this is one of the most impressive buildings I've ever seen. I'm not certain if the building has been recently renovated but it practically looks brand new???...It's is huge... Even with a wide angle lens on its difficult to get all of the building into shot unless you are on the river, however outside of photography it well worth a visit and walk around.

Grate atraction. Went there on a guided tour with friends. It was very interested to se that amassing building from inside. It's really worth a visit if you are interesting in architecture and history. From outside it's fantastic both day and night.
Don't miss this if you are in Budapest
Huge. Huge building. Very beautiful. But to be honest, i do not understand why in such a small country it should be so huge parliament.

Dazzling ,spectacular architecture. you can see this building from all over. Wonderful piece of architecture looks fabulous right next to the river .This building is visible from above the castle ,across the river ,no way you can miss it .we didn't go inside. But tours are avaliable & need to be booked ahead .
Outdoors only. It looks like it could have been a Gothic church complete with dome and towers. It is very white and quite beautiful. Better seen at night from a boat. You cannot visit inside.

Good but not great. Magnificent building, 3rd largest parliament in the world. You get great views of the Parlinent building from most of the Buda side and from the river and many bridges. We took a tour. You will need to prebook your tour most days. The English tour was full at 50 people - however this wasn't a problem - the guide was good! The tour is 2000F if you can are an EU citizen - and you can prove it with drivers license or passport. Good value for money!Worth doing this 45mins tour to view the inside of this grand building! Beautiful but like most of Budapest a mix of styles and architecture.

Not to be missed. Drop in and look for a slot. If you have to wait there are plenty of options nearby for a coffee and snack. It's like the Houses of Parliament in the UK on steroids. Built when the country had oodles of money and no expense spared. 43 KG of gold leaf were used on the interior and has the bling of St Petersburg. Tour guide in English had a wicked sense of humour. Highlight of our trip.
Spectacular. A very impressive building with stunning architecture, would have liked to have done the tour inside but the English version was only once a day mid afternoon

Unique Building!. This building is one of the landmarks of this amazing city. It's impossible not to take millions of photos when you see it :)The inside of the Parliament is also very beautiful and the guide was very nice. I only would prefer if there were fewer tourists in each group during the guided tour, but I also understand that there are too many people who wants to visit the Parliament.

Perhaps one of the most beautiful buildings ever constructed by human hands. The inside of the building of course is very political and large with many meeting arms and kilometers with the staircase however the outside is magnificent it trumps any parliament building I have ever seen in Europe and I have been most. It warrants a float on the river by this building or walking just see it. It ismuch more beautiful up close.

One of Budapest's major highlights, and it's gorgeous inside too. Wow, what a stunning building! Unmissable from both sides of the Danube, it's majestic and beautiful at the same time. Comparisons will inevitably be made about its resemblance to the Houses of Parliament in London. Indeed, the building in London did serve as the inspiration for its counterpart, the latter being inaugurated on the 1000th anniversary of the country in 1896. At over 250 metres long, the neo-Gothic building has been described as a modern palace.Fifty-minute tours of the Parliament Building are scheduled throughout the day and, although they may seem somewhat rushed, are highly recommended. Most tours are conducted in Hungarian (naturally) with at least one or more daily tours in English, French, Italian and Russian, and in a few other languages at least once weekly. Tour schedules can be found online and it's best to try to reserve tickets at the rather dingy-looking booking office a day or two earlier (if possible) as it's not unknown for tours to be cancelled with no reasons provided. Tour groups assemble outside the building at designated spots facing grassy Lajos Kossuth Square. There's a security check prior to entering the Parliament Building but once inside, check out the sets of grand stairs that lead up to the main landing. Tour routes may vary but highlights should include the central domed hall, the royal symbols of Hungary (Crown of St Stephen, sword, sceptre, and globe), the Chamber of Deputies, and the Reading Room. In a throwback to the old days, look out for the simple but elegant numbered cigrarette/cigar holders outside the Chamber of Deputies.

A Must see in Budapest. This is the must see destination in Budapest which is the national treasure. Inside is different style from the gothic outside. Booking in advance is recommended and can be made through http://www.jegymester.hu. Then print yourself ticket with a4 paper. Ticket is about 5200 HUF for non EU citizen or around 17euro.

What a view from the River .. We saw the Building from the river when we docked in the morning , and then illuminated at night.
The following day we did a tour of Parliament, it is as grand inside as is outside, a tour worth doing !!!!!!!
Impressive but not ancient building. Completed in 1902 this is an impressive building although the entry price for non EU citizens seemed a bit steep to us.

Impressive display of architecture at its finest.. A must see for the sheer size of this artistic masterpiece. Absolutely the crowing jewel of Budapest. Be sure to view the illuminated Parliament on the Danube at night.
Beautiful building. A fabulous and imposing building on the Danube. Not to be missed and can't be missed. We didn't go inside but tours can be arranged in advance.

Lovely place to visit. We had a guided tour around the parliament, this is a big building and great to take pictures off , we had about 25 people in our group, the lady was very knowledgeable, although I would have thought it may have lasted a bit longer ....

This is why you travel to Budapest..... Whatever time of day or night, from whatever angle, this building is always amazing
Look at it close up or from Buda Castle or from the Danube
It is awe inspiring. Mind blowing and worth the whole trip
Try to go there at midday when they have the changing of the guard

Stunning, inside and out.. Whether you're viewing this stunning building from the road, on a boat on the Danube, on a number 2 tram or simply standing in front of it; it is simply beautiful. We highly recommend that you pay to take one of the regular tours in English. If you take your British passport, you will get a discount on the ticket price for being part of the EU. We can't remember how much we paid but it wasn't too bad and whatever it was, it was worth every penny.Hungary has a very proud history. For 1,000 years since the time of St Istvan, it was a huge country in the middle of Europe which fought many battles to defend Europe from invaders. They were also the Juniour partners in the Austro-Hungarian empire and all of this history is represented in the large and wondetful parliament building.The Hungarian parliament, like the very special country it represents, is beautiful and well worth a visit.

Stunning architecture. Actually it looks like from a fairy tale the proud of the Hungarian people their Parliament. I took also the tour. If your e a proven eu citizen you pay half without its over 4000 forint which is a bit too much measured at the duration of the tour inside the building. With the EU price definately woth visiting.

Hungarian Parliament. Maybe we had a less enjoyable time because Parliament was in session, but our tour started 20 minutes late (for some reason no one was getting through the security check until 10:20) but still ended at 10:50, for an originally scheduled 50-minute tour. The tour guide, though, was informative and spoke English well enough.The architecture inside and outside is stunning so we are still glad we took the tour, but I was disappointed with the tour from the value I was given regarding the amount of time and things we saw.
Hungarian excellence. One of the most magnificent examples of the restoration efforts of the Hungarian people. This city is wonderful during the day, but unbelievable at night. Don't miss it.

Interesting tour. We came in May and managed to get a reservation on the day. In fact as all the tours in English were filled another was added. We then went away until the time. The building is very impressive and the tour interesting. Worth a visit .there is also a nice cafe and gift shop. It is also impressive floodlit at night. It is cheaper to visit if you come from an EU country!

If you can only see one sight, then see the Parliament. This is an architecturally stunning building and must be seen inside. You need to book the tour and they sell out quickly. We had a lot of trouble getting one in English and would recommend that you either go online in advance or buy the ticket a day or so before you want to go. We could not get a ticket and therefore booked the tour in Spanish. When we got there they allowed us to switch, but it took a bit of persuading. You will love the tour.

Couldnt get enough of a look. Walk around this building. Then walk around again. Go over the river and look at it. Go up the hill and look at it. It is just beautiful. The longer you look, the more you see. We were fortunate to see the changing of the guard, on the hour, an experience in itself. Unless you are particularly interested, you don't need to spend the money to go inside. Btw, the gift shop is very good with very competitive prices.
Hungarian Parliament. The building itself, inside and out is beautiful, our guide was knowledgeable and informative and it is a must see attraction if visiting Budapest
Amazing!!. The night view of Budapest was amazing especially this Parliament building. Is a must to enjoy the building from far across the river. It was really amazing.
Incredible architecture. Some great buildings to walk around with outstanding architecture. Beautiful setting right by the river. Definitely a must see.

Spectacular!. Took an evening dinner tour on the Danube and saw this building lit at night. What a sight! Decided I must take the tour and it was amazing. There is a fee about $10 but well worth it. Not an old building - finished in1904 - but the Gothic style gives it the look and feel of early construction. The interior has great carpeted stairs and wonderful frescoes. One oddity is the cigar holder (see the photo) where members had to park their stogie before entering the Assembly hall. This is a must see in Budapest.

book online before you go. I booked from home as the tours are in several languages and you can get a ticket on the day but will probably have to come back another day. This is a lovely building well worth a viist, the tour is about an hour.

Best viewed from river or Castle Hill area. A magnificent building which is the iconic photo of this wonderful city and known the world over. Does anyone visit the city and not at least take a walk around the outside? It looks as if the entire building has recently been totally cleaned and the plaza at the rear all looks new.

magnamoius. What a fabolous structure , well preserved , it would have been great if we could take a tour inside but there were some event going on so we had to see the parliament from a far distance , but still was worth it and if you are in budapest this place is must
