As grand as Westminster. Beautiful building but we saw it at night first like most of Budapest's best spots which was so much me amazing. Best photos at not from bridge or opposite riverside ;-)

Definitely most see. Very impressive building and surroundings. UK Parliament might look like this if they ever catch up on 200 years of missing maintenance.
Knowledgeable and entertaining guide.

Well worth a visit. The Parliament was a must see on my list for our short stay in Budapest. There were a lot of people trying to get tickets for a tour in the reception area and the English tour had sold out for the day. We bought our tickets as part of a 'Grand tour' from Gray Line: http://www.grayline.com/tours/budapest/grand-city-tour-with-parliament-visit-5962_2/ (other tours may offer the same), so we walked straight in.There are 5 miles of corridors, 691 rooms and 26 staircase (give or take). But the tour covered very little really. We walked up a highly decorated staircase, along highly decorated corridors to see the main staircase (see photo). Then into the dome room (NO photos) to see the crown (anti-climax) guarded by two diagonally opposite guards with bayonets drawn. They change places every 15 minutes which is a bit of fun.We viewed one of (or the) chamber then out through the servants staircase.I don't think you can 'do it yourself' with an audio guide which is a pity. So I must admit I was a little disappointed.

What a Parliament!. In my recent visit to Budapest, I’ve had the opportunity to visit this magnificent piece of architecture and the seat of the Hungarian legislative power, This is a must see in Budapest and my recommendation is that you should take at least one day to visit monuments in each side of the Danube, one day on Buda (Buda Castle, Fisherman Bastion, Citadel, etc.) and one day to Pest, (Heroes's Square, Parliament, Synagogue, etc.). Get your tickets online and enjoy the tour to learn more about this splendid country.

My favourite building in Europe. A magnificent piece with lots of undeserving people in it (politicians). Visits are cheap and tours show you around in this architectural masterpiece. If you can only look at it from the outside, you get the gist but I recommend to take a tour inside for interesting details. Beautiful!

Stunning Building with Sound Historical Knowledge. I pre-booked my Parliament visit with my two friends as there are limited places, especially if you have a specific language requirement. It's a beautiful building, a short climb up 29 staircases or a lift is available with the guide. You can take photos throughout except of the Holy Crown, where two soldiers with swords, looked quite scary and best not to get to close to them as they do a turn every so often. The assembly hall was the best part of our visit, with a good view from a side balcony, I was impressed to learn that all of the 691 rooms are in use and how clean the building was, truly magnificent.

A must see in Budapest. You have to tour the Parliament if you are visiting Budapest but you MUST GET YOUR TICKETS ONLINE OR EARLY IN THE DAY!!! This place sells out fast and if you get there in the late morning you will probably not get to go that day. They have limited tour times. The place gets pretty crowded. It was probably one of the highlights of our European trip. The interior is very opulent and beautiful. We were lucky to get there in time to get an English tour but we saw people getting turned away because they were sold out. I think you can reserve tickets on line. If not, get there very early to reserve your tour time. This is a must see and is worth the ticket price. Enjoy!

Beautiful Building, but the Tour was fast and Short. The Parliament Building is spectacular and rooms are beautiful, but the tour is very short and crowded. It took me two days to get on the English tour. (I recommend that you buy your tickets well ahead of time) Once the English Speaking group was called to go through security and strat the tour, they also called a German speaking group at the same time. The two groups were basically in the same places at the same time, so at times it was hard at times to hear the guide. At other times some of the German group became part of the Engkish Tour. So we were encouraged to move along the whole time. I enjoyed seeing the inside of the Parlialment, but would have liked more time to take in the beauty of the building.

Interesting but guided tour not a must-do. Very impressive from the outside. I wouldn't say the guided tour inside of it is a must do, it is of course cool if you have time to do it but if you have other priorities, it is not so bad if you miss it, I guess. The tour takes only 45 minutes so I guess we didn't get to see not even one third of the Parliament. You can buy the tickets online to save time and chose from different languages available, so if you are a poliglot, there are more chances that you find a free spot for a tour. I booked one day prior to my visit and got a place in the German tour, I suppose the English tour is aalways overbooked so try other languages. :D Price for EU-Students: 1200 Forint, which is about 4 Euro. VERY CHEAP. You can take pictures almost everywhere but not of the Hungarian crown. :-(

Gorgeous Building. This is the iconic building of Budapest and you can see why. Apparently, it is based in the Houses of Parliament in London and you see this in the ornate nature of the outside. Unfortunately, we ran out of time so didn't get to go inside but I would love to do this if I ever go back.

Recommended if Interested in Landmark Buildings. Definitely worth a short visit but you have to book a tour which is approximately 45 minutes in duration. Tours are held in various languages so if you prefer English you need to look out for the tour times in English. Group sizes are restricted to about 40 people so if you miss a tour you may not get another. I turned up in person and had a 2 hour wait but I believe you can book on-line. Entry was 2,000 HUF which is about £5 provided you have an EU identity like a driving licence or passport otherwise the cost is 2 or 3 times higher. Possibly a bit boring for kids though. If like me you have to kill 2 hours then walk along the Danube and cross the first bridge, walk along the other side and cross the next bridge and complete the loop. Have a beer or coffee in the Parliament cafe and you will have consumed your 2 hours.
Amazing Building. Whether you look at the Parliament building from the road or from the river, it is a large imposing building. Amazing!
So many rooms to see. Book ahead a tour in the language of your choice . A must see specially the changing of the guard in the parliament.

beautiful. Unfortunately we didn't get tickets the guided tour. every tickets were sold out for that day. you should book the tickets on web site. tickets are very expensive!But we entered the museum. its free and nice. the building is gorgeous!

Yes you can take photos. Had a pre booked tour lasted one hour . Impressive from the outside but inside has to be seen to believed. Can take photos in all rooms except the dome room but still many photos to be had. Airport security before entering but this is expected. I believe if you visit this lovely city it should be a high priority on your list of things to do, you also see the original crown jewels and the amount of gold used on the interior walls, you may be lucky enough to see the changing of the guards every hour.

AMAZING BUILDING. Amazing building, sitting regal on the River Danube. Styled on UK Houses of Parliament with the addition of a dome. Beautiful when lit during the evening. Located a few minutes walk from the shoes memorial. Point of interest to look out for - what appears to be small sprinklers located in the block paving is supposed to be tear gas outlets!

Opulent parliament building. The tour seemed a little pricey by Hungarian standards but really well worth it to see the interior of this amazing building. The tour lasts approximately 50 minutes and it covers the grand entrance, the rotunda with the Crown Jewels and one of the parliament rooms. It is noisy since multiple tours are going on at a time.
Tour of Parliamentv. Good tour and an amazing building .Very organised with a nice visitor centre and reasonable coffee shop .Tours provided in many languages ,beautiful building

Parliament. This is an absolutely stunning building....both inside and out. I think it is a must see, however, this is not a cheap tour about $18 per person (depending on currency exchange values at the time) for a 45 minute tour. There are about 45 visitors on each tour and there is no audio amplification used which means if you are not standing next to your guide you will miss a great deal of the narrative. This might not be a problem for a 25 year old, but for an old foggy like me it was an issue. Even with that said, I am very happy that I took this tour the building is just that beautiful!

Spectacular on the outside, a tour is a tourist trap. Parliament building in Budapest on the outside is one of the most spectacular building you ever get to see. However, the guided tour of it is simply a tourist trap. You paying a hefty 5000 Ft for seeing a couple of rooms. You strictly forbidden to take pictures of one of the main attractions of the building-the original crown of Hungarian kings. Entire tours lasts under an hour, about 15 minutes of it takes security control at the entrance similar to one in the airport. It is simply is not worth it
A must. What an amazing building. The best view of this building is at night. If you are taking a boat ride at night take some pics. It is a magnificent structure. Make sure you walk around the back.

Watch the sunset and the lights go on!. If you go across the river to the Buda side and set yourself up on that side facing the parliament building, you can watch the sunset's golden colours wash over the building and see the lights turn on, around 9pm I think (in June). It's quite romantic and lots of couples seem to do this. Bring a bottle and some ice cream? Or bring you camera and tripod and take some snaps - you'll be lucky to get a 30 second exposure without one of the ferries getting into the frame!
Spectacular. A very impressive building. Didnt get to do the tour through lack of time.The area around the parliament is a brilliant place to visit with all the statues.

May be the best lightened monument in Europe!. Very nice monument, especially at night, where its views from Danube river are breathtaking! Try also the night view of the Parliament form Citadella hill. Its magnificent!

Magnificant. Such a great building for a little country. Tour was worth taking, but the guide was hard to hear at times. Expensive compared to most prices in Budapest. New Visitor Centre was hard to find - far end of the building away from the subway stop.

A Must visit in Budapest. I booked in advance a guided tour, my tour was in hebrew, the guide was realy good in his trade and gave us a vital informaion on the building and it's history.The bulding itself is beautiful and very interesting.

The exterior is spectacular; the interior is over the top. The architecture is rich. The facts about the building are fascinating. Only half of the building is used by Parliament these days. (Maybe the other half can be rented?) The crown jewels are on display, complete with armed guards. When asked how the country afforded the building, the tour guide replied, "We saved for a long time." There is an excellent display at the conclusion of the tour with photographs showing restoration of the building.

Tour. The parliament buildings are magnificent you cannot go to Budapest and no visit this wonderful building we went to view during the day and then returned one evening to view the building when it was lit up wonderful

An amazing site at night. I just saw it from outside so far and had the pleasure to cruise past it at night. Unbelievable and beautiful and some decades ago they say Freddy Mercury wanted to buy it as his home ;-)

Interesting tour. The Parliament building is beautiful and the tour guide shared lots of
Historical information. Photography is allowed everywhere except the council room.

Great view from the Danube. My friend and I literally stumbled across the houses of parliament whilst walking down past the Danube to find the 'Shoes on the Danube' (which is very close by)... my father in law had told me the Houses of Parliament in Budapest were actually modelled very much on the United Kingdoms Houses of Parliament in London, and you can certainly tell by the architecture. We didn't have a tour or go inside the buildings, just walked around the grounds and saw a guard exchange. Amazing buildings and look fantastic when lit up at night.

Amazing. This is one of the most beautiful and interesting buildings I have ever seen. At night it is all lit up and is truly magnificent. A personal recommendation: when you go there, don't miss Hungarikum Bistro, one of Budapest's best restaurants - it's 2/3 streets away and definitely worth the visit as well.

Extravangent interiors of the Parliament. Absolutely over the top interiors do justice to the xterior of the beautiful Hungarian parliament. Fortunately we were advised to book in advance and had a tour. Otherwise it's not possible to see inside the building.

A must in Budapest!. This has to be one of the most beautiful and interesting buildings I have ever seen. The tours are guided and you can also get the headphones, but either way you will have a guide and a guard as you go through the tour. At night it is all lit up and is truly magnificent. We got to go into the upper house or senate chamber, which may or may not be allowed depending on whether or not they are in use. Don't miss this.

Seen from the river. Take a boat trip down the Danube and see the wonderful Parliament buildings. The "shoe memorial sculptures " lies not far from the Parliament building but cannot be seen from the boat.

Parliament House. Parliament House is located in a central area, is easy to get to. We were not allowed to go inside. The grounds, flowers and surrounding areas are kept very clean, and are well taken care of. The best view of this is from the boat in River Danube at night, when it is all lit up!

Beautiful Building But..... Outside building and surrounding area is beautiful. But we had purchased tickets in advance from Jegymester.hu, as told because of tours filling up. The staff would not recognize the tickets or answer any questions because it was an "outside company". They were also unhelpful in trying to purchase new tickets. The company also has not responded to any inquiries. So I feel this puts visitors between a rock and a hard place- they tell you to purchase in advance but then don't honor the tickets from that site. Next time, I will just take my chances to go live when I get there rather than wasting money.

Magnificient Structure. We were awed by the size and extent of this building. The visitors center "underground" has good information and a café. We saw the guards marching out front. Good security around the building at all times. I would run in the early morning and always saw guards. Good landmark to judge where you are in the city.

disappointment. Gaudy and spatious outside, depressing and stressful inside. The foyers are too narrow, the ceilings are at times too low. The ornaments heavily weigh on you. Now I know why are state legislation is so twisted.

Spectacular Architecture. We were lucky to have a private tour by a friends relative who is a member of parliament. The interior is something that should not be missed when visiting Budapest. The architecture is magnificent and awe inspiring with every corner you turn. We were there the day before the NATO Conference so it was very interesting to see it set up for that purpose as well. We thoroughly enjoyed our tour and would certainly go back again.
What a building. Not to be missed, walk around the back to , the park in the back has monuments, the unknown solder exchange, and is worth seeing, we could not go in do to some function
beautiful building. Located on the banks of denube. It is nicely decorated white and red building. building is lit in the evening. One can visit the building inside with guided tours.
Superb architecture. To look at this magnificent building from the Buda side is a must, especially at night. Wow! What a memory

Magnificent architecture!. We purchased the 45 minute tour tickets for the Budapest Parliament and felt that they were very worthwhile. The building is gorgeous on the inside-just wished that we were able to see more than we did! Photos allowed-many opportunities, especially the main entry way staircase-beautiful!

Beautiful from the inside and outside. Just walking around Parliament building is a great experience - it's no doubt one of the most beautiful government buildings I have seen. And the interior is just as amazing. You get to see only cwertain part of the building, but it;s just enough for the great experience. A word of advice: it's best to buy a ticket in advance to ensure you can actually visit it. You can either go day earlier and buy ticket at the office or buy the ticket online.
The beauty of Golden light. The parliament house's elegance is breathtaking. We saw it during the day but however, at night it was in its full glory. Beautiful building.

Puts the U.S. Capitol to Shame. An amazing architectural masterpiece, built to celebrate the Hungarian Millennium, starting in 1896. Interesting that Hungary, presently with about 10 million people, and even in the late 19th century with a population that was much smaller than many other countries, built such a magnificent structure to house its Parliament. The building also houses the Hungarian Crown, which some natives regard with reverence. On the down side, security is tight and the tour felt rushed by the security guards. There were too many tourists in our group, which meant that I couldn't hear the guide most of the time.

The Single Most Impressive Structure in a City with Much Beauty. The Parliament is especially striking in the evening when its full complement of lights is on. The angles and scope of the building are remarkable. From the Buda side at night, you may find it different to continue your walk along the Danube because the Parliament Building has seized your imagination.

Magnificent Building and Grounds. We recently visited Budapest and were very impressed by this magnificent old building. In recent years they have improved the surrounding grounds and it is much more pedestrian friendly. We rode the tram from the MarketPlatz and it was convenient and we exited the tram right in front of the Parliament building.

Still worth it.. They make you jump through a lot of hoops - the way they make you buy your ticket (mostly online, since onsite tickets are likely not to be available); then when you arrive for the tour, you have to queue up for your tour and go through airport like security. Added to this is a price of the approximate equivalent of $19/person for non-EU citizens, and a tour that doesn't last terribly long. Despite all this, when it was over, we were glad we did it.

Stunning Architecture. The Orszaghaz (literally, "House of the Country") is, in my opinion, the most beautifully constructed building in Budapest. It makes for wonderful pictures in the background of the Danube, but you really should walk around its base and observe it up-close. There are several monuments (Imre Nagy Bridge, Ronald Reagan Statue) around the building that are worth seeing as well.There is an option to take a tour inside the parliament building. For this, you need to go to the left side of the building (if your back is to the Danube) and walk down the stairs that lead underneath the building. While it is a very expensive tour, I will still recommend it for history buffs or those who enjoy historic government buildings.
Need reservations ahead of time. This structure can be seen from both sides - Buda and Pest.You will think this is the castle... Gorgeous structure and buidlingthat is seen for miles along the river

A compulsory part of the sightseeing. It's really breathtaking. From outside and from inside too. If you can, you need to check it. It's really one of the most beautiful buildings that I have ever seen.

Beautiful. This building would have to be one of the most beautiful, by day and spectacular by night.Budapest was a real surprise. Lots of great restaurants and a beautiful city full of fascinating buildings and attractions.

Parliament. One of Hungary's popular attraction. According to our guide this was constructed in the 19th century. The dimension is breathtaking with close to 700 rooms, chambers and halls. Some very important items are housed here like the Crown of St Stephen, Renaissance sword of state, etc. Don't miss this!

Worth the visit. You can buy the ticket for the guided tour for the time you wish to go and then go walk around the city and come back only when it's you time to take the visit.It is a beautifull building and the guide tells us about the history of Hungary. It was very interesting.Best part is the thousand years old crown used by King Sthepen, the most important historical figure in the country.
Wonderful. One of the best building I ever seen, especially in the night with all the lights. Looking at from the Danube, if you're dinnering on a boat, is one of the best experience you can do.
Beautiful building. A very interesting tour.Book tickets early.Gets very busy.The whole place is attractive and in a stunning location on the river

fantastic looking building. We visited here in May and what a lovely and grand place to see. We pre booked the tour which takes you around inside to see just how beautiful this place is. We were disappointed with the tour guide's English which wasn't helped by the P.A system she was using. This meant that we didn't get the full story of the place. Worth seeing though.

This is a must visit.. This is a beautiful building by day and by night when fully lit. We were lucky enough to watch the changing of the guard which was very interesting. Also the sentries have to stand motionless when on duty. I actually thought they were statues until I went up close with my camera and the eyes moved.

Beautiful from every angle!. This building is amazing! Be sure to look on it from all sides- pictures are great from any angle! Behind parliament is the river and you can see behind the building. Close to the the chain bridge (where you can walk across to see the museum and other castles). Also near parliament is a cute park with some good restaurants. I'm sorry I don't remember what street is is, but adjacent there is a street that has a statue of a US president on a bridge- that street has the great restaurants and leads into the park :)
The old parliament House. The beautiful parliament house of budapest lies on the banks of the danube river. An awesome architecture.

A short glimpse of a beautiful building. Fairly interesting although a bit short (some 45 minutes) visit. To avoid queues, before coming to the Visitors' Centre (north of Lajos Kossuth square) remember to check out the times of guided visits in your language and buy tickets in advance at jegymester.hu. There's a considerable amount of climbing up the stairs, but the gilded corridors and the hall of the Holy Crown are absolutely worth it. The guides have smallish speakers so be sure to stick close by if you don't want to miss the explanations.
Beautiful Building. Architecture marvel!Do not miss night view from both sides of the Danube. Get advance tickets to see inside. Waiting lines disorganized. Ornate and colorful interior.
Beautiful and fantastic building. Beautiful and fantastic building. You have to see this central and beatuiful building when you visting Budapest.

a building with the wow factor. up close or viewed fro a distance this is a stunning building from the outside - the detail is incredible ad when you get inside you get a sense of the wealth and opulence of days gone by. This iconic masterpiece takes pride of place overlooking the Danube

Impressive. I did not tour the Parliament, but it is very impressive from the outside. I have been twice, sadly it was being renovated the second time so was unable to get a good view. Can be seen from over a large part of the city, and is worth walking around to get the better views!
Beautiful building. Book your tickets online before you go. There were no tickets available to buy on the day when we went.

Worth a visit. We took the tour, and it was very nice...the building is incredible.However, I could not give this attraction a 5 for 2 reasons.1. The English-speaking guide had such a heavy Hungarian accent, we caught about 50 percent of what she said2. There was much confusion and crowds, when trying to use the entrance tickets.This is a worthwhile venture, anyway. If you tour in English, perhaps you will get a more understandable guide

Mesmerising construction. Probably my favourite building in Budapest. Make sure you see it from the other side of the river at night too, at the Fisherman's Bastion. You won't regret it. I look at my pictures and still can't believe it was for real.

Magnificent. Must, must visit Parliament while in Budapest. It is absolutely magnificent - from the time you enter until you leave you will be in awe. Do visit area at night to see the building lit -- especially if you can get on the water you will be grateful for digital cameras because you will be hard pressed to stop taking pictures
Budapest. While we didn't tour the Parliament Building (inside) it is a beautiful structure and a great place for the views and photographs.

Often Used as the Symbol of Budapest, Why Not Go Inside?. Some people read the mediocre reviews in guide books or balk at the price and not bother with the huge Parliament, but I found the tour interesting and worthwhile. One only gets to see a small portion of the building, but it is impressive and full of detail.The highlight of the tour was getting to see the storied crown of Hungary placed directly beneath the large dome and with armed guards standing beside it. Read about the history of the crown before you take the tour; it is very interesting.
Parliament Tour. Excellent tour of an incredible building! Very organized, nice cafe at ticket entrance. Clean bathrooms. A nice tour, lots of steps! But worth the tour for sure!

Must go... Book in advance. It was a very nice tour... Parliament is beautiful from outside and Inside. I felt it was the most beautiful building in Budapest. The guided tour was really informative n nice. Specially to look at the crown with big jewels. Please make sure you book the tour in advance. You cant book it on the spot. Sply the english one is the first one to fill up quick. Website can be found by googling.

The crown jewel of Budapest. It is B-E-A-U-T-I-F-U-L and so photogenic you will never tire nor get enough of every angle you can possibly take a photo of it . Take tram no.2 if you do not want to walk . The best station to directly alight from is Kossuth Lajos Ter. Your jaw will drop guaranteed !

One of the largest Parliament buildings in Europe - magnificent and opulent.. Took the official guided tour, in English, which was very good. Need to buy the tickets in advance or you may have to wait a day to take the tour. Cannot see the interior on your own. The numbered brass cigar holders in the hallway was an interesting feature. The number 96 plays prominently ion the design as Hungary was founded in 896 - 96 steps, 96 feet in several spots.

Guided tour. We visited Budapest during last week in May 2015. We were attracted by this architectural beauty since our first day in Budapest when we were just randomly cruising around. It is a large building complex right next to the Danube River. It has various different langue guided tours at different time slots. However English is the most popular ones and it's always filled quickly. We got there before 11 am and were lucky to get the 5:15 pm guided tour. In the mean time, we visited the museum located on the ground floor. It is free admission if you got the guided tour ticket. It is a small museum and we finished within 30 mins. There are quite a bit of interactive activities but mostly in Hungarian. The staffs in the museum are very friendly. Although we have language barrier, they tried very hard to explain how to use or the history of those activities. We really appreciated it. For the actual parliament guided tour, as there were a lot of other tourists for the same tour, even though we were 10 mins late, we were still able to catch the end tail to go through the security desk. As soon as we got through the security, we were told that we needed to climb over 160 stair steps to the starting point of the tour. For those who have difficulties to use the staircase, it does have elevator but you need to tell them separately. Unfortunately my husband didn't feel well half way up and we decided to leave the tour to catch some fresh air. After a small break, he felt better and therefore we tried to explain our situation to its ticket office, and hoping for rescheduled for another tour or plain refund. Without much effort, the lady immediately offer the next available tour (it's in Spanish since the English one is completely over booked). They are definitely tried to be as friendly and flexible as they possibly can be. Overall, it's a very pleasant experience.

Must see if only see 1 Budapest building!. There is a good reason they say this is the most beautiful building in Budapest. Neo-Gothic design at its best. Guided tours are meant to be available, but was shut up and fenced off with ropes when I visited. Still spent 30 mins examining the multitude of carved people, animals, creatures, and that was on top of its amazing spires. If wasn't in a rush would of stayed for 2 hrs.Inside must be breathtaking, but don't let that stop you visiting!
A must see at night. This baroque building is best seen at night from the outside of a small dinner cruise boat. It us very well illuminated and from the Danube you can see all sides.

Beauty and the beast. What a stunning building/s, and as with most places in Hungary so clean. Love the infinity stream too. However ....... who would think of putting that ugly 60's type building next door. Shame!
Worth a visit. Great guide for a lovely tour. Well worth booking in advance for an English speaking guide. Gives access to history and sights not available otherwise.
Parliament Budapest. This is a beautiful building and very large for the number of representatives. It is beautifully guilded and used to have 2 houses like ours but now only one.
Magnificent building and good tour. Well organised. Booked ticket at 10.00am for 3.30pm tour. Do not need to book on line, go and queue - easy
Wowwwwww. Compare it the Scottish Parliament - you can't. The Parliament in Budapest is magnificent, vast, pristine and so impressive! A must for your photo album.

Great. Really loved the whole of Budapest
It's wonderful the parliament building is spectacular and I would recommend a visit

Make sure you visit. Had a great guided tour of the Parliament building. Tour lasts approx 45mins.. A great experience. You'll need to wait a short while to go through the security checks but it's well worth it. Book ahead of your visit to ensure you get your preferred time slot. Very reasonably priced (approx £5)

If you don't mind waiting.... This attraction is very popular with the tourists - and justifiably so - so in the streets and on the tour buses tickets can be bought on the pretext that then you don't have to queue to buy them on the spot. That might be so, but there is still a lot of queuing up and waiting to do: when your guide does it for the (then quite small) group, after collecting all the ID's to show who is and isn't from a EU country, then again for the security procedure (like in an airport) just after you are added to a very large group !!, with a guide speaking the required language, in our case English. And at various points waiting until one of the other guides had finished speaking and led his/her group away from the area you were trying to squeeze into. When we came out there were no more queues at the ticket counter, so it might well be worth your while to go and buy tickets at a quiet time and actually visit at the time set for it. In spite of all the above we thought it was still a very interesting and worthwhile visit.

Visit to Parliament. You need to book this online before you want to visit especially if you want the guided tour in English. We did this when we were there which is probably best. Reduced rates if you are a UK citizen. Considering what you are visiting and compared to what you would pay to see similar in this country, it is extremely good value for money. Very interesting building and you get to see where the Hungarian parliament meets.

beautiful interior/exterior. book the tour in advance online and print it out if you can. they sell out and it's the only way in. 45 min tour is easy to fit in. gorgeous and worth seeing inside. walk to danube after to see the shoe holocaust memorial sculpture. there are more time options online than listed on main website/travel books.

Had to join a Spanish speaking tour. This building has just had a huge makeover and it shows. It is huge and stunning. I wasn't able to join an English speaking tour during the time I was there (all sold out). Instead I joined a Spanish tour and that was interesting. The building is beautiful and worth seeing, the attention to detail is something to behold.

Overwhelming architecture. Inspite of many steps to climb inside, this is one of the most beautiful public buildings we have visited. I believe it was the most expensive structure in the world to build at the time. Every inch of the interior had been masterfully constructed. We were surprised though at how small the actual space was where Parliament sits. Not recommended for anyone with mobility issues. Don't think we saw an elevator one.

Beautiful architecture. I bought the tickets online for the tour, we were there on time and paid about $25 plus CAD and the tour was so disappointed to us, they only show us the main entrance with the lions, the room with king crown and the guard ceremony and a extra room were the Senate meet, the explanation was very poor, and a guard guy behind the group walking out everyone as soon as the guide was done talking.The whole tour was like 20min counting every stop and waiting for her to talk.Just giving 4 out 5 because it is a beautiful architecture in(the little we saw in) and out.

Make reservations online!!. I was amazed by the enormous, beautiful building, and sadly that was all I got to see.As I walked into the Visitor Center, the lady at the front desk had just turned the "No more tickets for today" sign.I was thorn apart.Make sure you buy tickets online. Also, check their schedule.The building is not open for visitors on certain days.

wow wow wow. my father and I were here at sunset with a bit of a rain shower. there was almost no one else in the square and the scene was magnificent. an amazing structure and a full reflection on the wet stone. brilliant place on the planet.

Spectacular! You won't know Budapest if you don't take the tour.. We travel with a friend who's a lobbyist in the U.S. So, if there's a legislative building to see, we see it. This is a great one. We got an English language tour. It takes less than two hours. The building is spectacular and you get to see the crown of St. Stephen which has been the symbol of Hungarian nationhood since 1000 A.D. The wide use of gold leaf, the parliamentary chambers, statues and friezes are memorable. I guarantee you will be glad you took the tour. If you take a night river cruise, your enjoyment will be magnified by knowing what the Parliament looks like inside and out.

Great visit . Went with family on the visit to the parliament and found it very attractive and very informative the guide was superb inside was incredible and saw the crown jewels which are very old and would recommend this visit

Great building, tours could be better organized. We enjoyed the building and English tour, but it was chaotic at the visitor's center before the tour started: there were no clear signs telling people with tickets for the tour what to do, and even when the tour guide appeared, his instructions were drowned out by the noise at the center, so we just followed what the others did. We could hear him fine once we left the visitor center, though.Definitely pre-book the tours in advance as there were signs stating that all tickets were sold out on the day we were there.

Awed by the magnificent beauty. The parliament of Budapest is the 3rd largest and the most beautiful in the world. I recommend strongly to view it during the day and the night time and also from the inside. The tour tickets for EU residents is around 5£ only and the duration is 1 hour. The tour runs in various languages so book your tour early in the morning and arrive at the scheduled time.

Magnificent and historic place. This is well worth a visit. It is beautiful and very interesting building. Before going,however, check the schedule of tours in your language because you must join a tour and cannot walk around on your own. Tours sell out quickly, so be sure to book a place early. You can book on line. Worth the effort.

Get Reservations Online Ahead of Time. We really enjoyed our Parliament visit, however we were not able to get an English tour for either day we were in town. Wish I'd been smarter and gotten reservations a few days early on the internet! Believe me, we didn't get very much out of our Russian language tour, but at least we got to see this beautiful building. The Russian speaking German who gave the tour, caught on that several of us on the tour only spoke English, so he helped us a little :-).

Impressive. We joined an English spoken tour and got a good impression of the inside of the Parliament. The tour started right on time and is worth well the entrance price. Forint 2.000 for European inhabitants.
Interesting. This was great. Very informative and interesting. Easily one of the best things we did all week.Really enjoyed it.Tip: Take your passport (EU Only) for a discounted entry price!
Beautiful building. Beautiful building in a huge square. We didn't manage to go on the tour inside as all English tours booked up. Worth pre booking online.

We only visited the outside. An amazing architectural confection- it is fabulous from every angle. Definitely worth taking in a boat rip to see it from the Danube and well worth a circular walk. Very impressive on the outside. We didn't have the oppotunity to take in the inside.

The icon of Hungary. The Parliament is a worldwide unique building. ...and now that its main square and its surroundings have been completely re-designed and refurbished it brings its old glory onto a new level in my opinion. You can only see a part of the Parliament when you visit it (certainly) as it still operates accordingly to its function. However even with the short stroll you are allowed to make in it you definatelly understand its magnificiance. The marble they used, the 1000 year old crown you can see, etc.. It is "young-old" enough to do not expect something jaw dropping. However visiting it and have a nice walk around is definately a MUST. It is also in walking distance from many sights and here you could have a rest as well if the weather is nice (at the square or at the Danube or at the nearby Olimpia park.Oh, if you can, check out the daily flag taking up/down ceremony. I liked it (it is a new thing if I am not mistaken).

A Disorganised Rabble !. I don't often write negative reviews, as the advice given on Trip Advisor usually helps me avoid visiting those places that fail to deliver. The inside of the Parliament House in Budapest is indeed beautiful, however the tours are very expensive and absolutely disorganised from the moment one arrives. We had pre-booked our timed tickets before leaving Australia. On arrival there is no sign to say which time slot is entering the security area, so there were people almost missing their tour as they were lined up behind people waiting for later tours. Confusion reigned whilst they scanned tickets as numbers for group tours did not tally. Once through the security gates a long speech was delivered in Hungarian, despite the fact we were on the time slot for an English speaking tour. We were rushed by our guide from feature to feature and it was very difficult to stay in the right group as different groups criss-crossed over each other. At one stage two tour guides had a "demarkation dispute" , as our tours ended up in the same area at the same time. My husband described the tour guide as a "jack rabbit" as if one didn't keep an eye on her she would "jack rabbit off ". I was trying to take photos , and would indeed have been left behind on many occasions if not for my husband. We wondered afterwards if there were some poor souls left wandering around lost in the many rooms of the Parliament House. The inside of Parliament House is indeed beautiful, but the tours need to be lengthened and organised a lot better before I would recommend them. They were our most expensive tour on our trip and certainly delivered a lot less due to poor organisation. Smaller , less groups & far better organisation is required to justify the cost.

Amazing masterpiece. From the onset when you view this architectural masterpiece it is stunning. Leaves you speechless and every picture taken from every angle is exquisite. Take the the number 2 tram to this masterpiece. Tours last every 45 mins and are fully informative. Had a mango smoothie for 750ft at the cafe, skip not worth the cost but stay for the tour. The grounds of the Parliament is equally exquisite with loads of nearby buildings to take pics and soldiers outside for photo ops. This is a truly majestic building. You're going to love it.

Majestic. From afar it is grand, but close-up it is majestic. Inside tour is a must and not long. Be sure to call/reserve ahead as sometimes Parliament is in session or there is a special foreign guest so it is closed to the public.
Impressive. A beautiful building on the river. The seat of government and so impressive. You can not go the Budapest without a visit.

New Square, Nice new statues. I took a walk over to parliment yesterday. It is really quite inviting and I truly enjoyed strolling past the largest parliment in Europe. The neo Gothic style has been maintained very well and the new square is easy to walk on. There are a couple of exhibits that you can visit underground. Stroll past and pay tribute to Kossuth and others as they are depicted larger than life. I didn't like the overgrown plants that seem to have been a planned garden at one time. Maintain it if you plant it! But the experience was lovely.

A must see. This is worth a visit and tour take your passport if your in EU cost is half tours last about 45 mins I was lucky as I got on a tour about to go as I was on my own go first thing and you might get on first tour 10am
WONDERFUL. You may have to wait a while to get in, but it is worth the wait. The interior is absolutely stunning.
huge. it seems that the building is not used in full, i.e. they have like 40% of the rooms empty/not being used. outside is better than inside.

Outatanding design and details. The Parliament is a stunning building standing with all its elegance beautiful from every corner that you see. Walking around the building, sitting on the benches of its garden and admiring the details is a must for any visit to Budapest. Don't miss this unique architectural structure that is stunning in every way.

Well that was a treat. The performance of the guard is just lovely... and we stumbled on it totally by chance. Go and watch and enjoy and be a part of an historic tradition.. Love Budapest... totally nice place.

Visit 28/05/2015. We went to try to get tickets to visit on 26/05 but we were met by a forbidding woman who told us we must buy and print our tickets online, she could not have been less helpful. Eventually we managed to buy some tickets and saved them on my daughters phone. It was with some trepidation we arrived today but we had a different experience; a charming young lady printed our tickets from the phone. The Houses of Parliament are ok but more impressive outside than in

Unexpected surprise. We toured the Parliament building as part of an extensive city tour we booked through the Intercontinental Budapest Hotel. We spent almost 2 hours inside. Our guide was excellent and gave a great narration of all the rooms we saw. This building was an unexpected surprise. It was a beautiful building with very ornate architectural features. Highly recommend it.

Absolutely one of the most beautiful government offices I've seen!. The Hungarian Parliament building might be one of the most photographed sites in Eastern Europe. It is absolutely magnificent when seen from the river at night, as it is lit up to show every detail of the building. If you can find a tour guide to take you around the neighborhood, it will probably be worth it. There is a lot of history from the pre-communist and communist eras that is well worth hearing.

You cannot miss the huge elaborate building of the Parliament!. Wow, at night this Parliament building is spectacular! It's so large and magnificent even by daylight it's truly wonderful with the 4 turrets and rotundas it is a highlight of Budapest!

Beautiful architecture. The parliament building is just beautiful !!! This is a massive building, not sure if there are tours inside but something tells me you can organize something. Must see in the night time when it's all lit up.

The architecture of Hungary's Parliament is stunning. We didn't have time to take the tour inside Parliament.....but we certainly shall next time we return to Budapest . If the inside of the building is as beautiful as the outside we are in for a treat.

Amazing Architecture. The architecture of this building is simply stunning.
Take a stroll on the opposite side of the river, grab a seat along the bank of the Danube river around dusk, and wait for the lights to come on.

Very beautiful place. A must see and well within walking distance from the center of everything. Very impressive to see during the daylight and especially beautiful when lit up at night. A must see...

Wow!. This was a surprise to us! It is bigger than the English House of Parliament and even more ornate. There is a guided tour (inside) but we were unable to get access as we had not pre-booked. The exterior, gardens and location on the bank of the Danube, were really impressive!

Beautiful architecture.. We saw this from the bastion and walked across to it. Beautiful clean area bigger than what we thought it would be. Bonus they have guards at the flagpole behind parliament where you can take a picture with them.

Wonderful building. This building is stunning from the outside and on the inside! We did the guided tour - only about £5/6 and well worth it. You need to take photo id to get the reduced price for EU citizens!

WORTHWHILE TOUR WHILE IN BUDAPEST. The Parliament Building is well cared for and a visit is reasonably priced. The tour takes about 40 minutes and can be combined with a full city tour through Cityrama Tours. Our city tour following our Parliament Tour was excellent and lasted about 4 hours.

Architecture!!. Amazing construction. Take a guided tour through the parliament, to know the history of Hungary and drink in the beauty. The official guide was very knowledgable, efficient and thorough. Was willing to provide answers and share information.
Loved the tour and it is a must visit.

Stunning Building. Did this tour with 3 adults and a 12 year old. It goes for one hour so it did not stretch the 12 year old past her boredom threshold.Absolutely stunning building and really worth the time. It is best to book online beforehand, especially if you want an english speaking tour. At the venue you can only book tickets for the same day.

If you do not visit anything else, this is the place.. It lies in Lajos Kossuth Square, on the bank of the Danube. It is currently the largest building in Hungary and still the highest building in Budapest. The Parliament Building is in the Gothic Revival style; it has a symmetrical façade and a central dome. The dome is Renaissance Revival architecture. Make sure to go for at least for several hours. It is MAGNIFICENT.
Best in Budapest. Only good thing in Budapest to see. Very beautiful to see from boat and during night and day. Architecture is amazing.

Interesting and educational. We booked a tour online several weeks prior to arriving in Budapest. We picked our day, time and language and printed out the tickets. We arrived at the Visitor's Center just in time for the 45 minute tour. Our guide spoke good English. The parliament building is gorgeous and the tour provides an excellent history of the building and of Hungary. We learned a lot and thoroughly enjoyed it. A do not miss stop in Budapest.
Fabulous architecture and space. Don't miss out on a visit to this majestic parliamentary building with its wonderful open space for everyone to enjoy.
A must see at night!. One of the most beautiful buildings in Hungary. While it was impressive by day, night time viewing is over the top!!

Great experience. The guided tour is amazing and the guides are friendly and ready to answer your questions. During 45 minutes you will enjoy some amazing parts of the parliament. The price is also good, depending if you are EU citizen or not, or if you are student or not.

Most worth visiting spot in Budapest. - Popular that need to queue up for ticket purchase and entrance for guided tour- Can try to book ticket online to secure the tour time slot (especially the morning sections)- There is a flag-raising in early morning outside the Parliament- Nice to have a walk along Danube River if before/after the guided tour- The new museum inside just opened when I visit so we have a free ticket to that section also

Budapest Parliament Excelent experience. The visit to the Parliament was an incredible experience. The Parliament and the building around have an incredible architecture worth the visit. We walked around the city all around without using the tour us. Even we had the Hop on - Hop off ticket, we decided to walk the main attractions to appreciate the beauty and history of Budapest

Magnificent. Showing power and impressive architecture.Day and night the parliament is impressive. Guards at the front entrance (away from the river) is funny to watch as the stand like dolls and when the do exercise completely synchronized.
Well worth a visit. A very interesting building which our guide explained very we'll although our group was rather large.
Don't miss it. The Parliament building is as beautiful inside as it is outside. It was a highlight of our trip to Budapest. Be sure to pre-book your tickets online before you go

Absolutely Staggeringly beautiful. This is of such deceptive proportions you literally have to walk all the way around it to appreciate both its size and the different and spectacular elevations.
Don't forget you camera, you will need it!

Content to discover the exterior.. After two weeks on the river cruise from Amsterdam to Budapest we had seen an enormous amount of gothic revival architecture so walking around the grounds of the magnificent Budapest parliament building was another rewarding afternoon as it has been completely refurbished and is gleaming as if it had just been completed. Would have liked to see the interior as it looks impressive in the guide but for European Union residents the entry price is $10 but for non E.U. citizens it is $25+. I'm sorry Budapest but I know a rip off when I see one. Not very welcoming.
Impressive size. Beautifull building right in the Pest side of the Danube river, the bigest parliament in europe.Impresive architecture, very clean surroundings

From the outside going inside tomorrow. It was amazing just walking around the large park around the Parliament buildings.There is an underground exhibit on the 1956 Revolution that is very moving--no feeThe only way to see the interior of Parliament is by purchasing a ticket. We did go to the visitor center to get tickets but none were available at the time we went and you cannot buy tickets for other days. Jegymester.hu was the web site we used. It was given to us by staff at the visitor's center

Behemoth building. We were not able to do the inside tour of Parliament due to NATO meetings going on during our stay in Budapest. That being said it's still worth a close up look all around the outside. The sheer size is amazing. I believe it's the biggest Parliament building in the world. It's actually 3 buildings designed by 3 different architects. There are several very interesting statues around it as well that are worth seeing. Take the time to at least get a close up view of this amazing structure.
Huge building. Seems great from outside and sparkling view from the opposite city (Buda). Unfortunately the days we visited it, it was closed for people.

Tour of Parliament. We booked for the guided tour of Parliament. I would recommend visiting but the guided tour was very short and you did not get to see much of the building. The tour wasn't very heavy on history or facts
Must see. The parliament is so grand and beautiful. The tour was good but the organization is a bit out of order. Our tour guide was very good and fluent in English.

Disorganized, even if you booked your tour.. You must go through a very long line and have security check your belongings, pretty much like at the airport. It is a very disorganized mess, the keepers had no idea of what to do, and took orders from a very agitated person, who seemed rather disoriented as well. With people breaking into the lines, the heat is unbearable, so was the stench from the sweaty crowds. We were told that most of the time it is like that, a total circus. Guides from different groups kept yelling, and some of us who were on our own, were kept waiting at the side, without being told why. So, instead of the grand tour, we decided to only visit the newly opened "museum", which is more like a show-and-tell about Hungary's royalty, priests and the military. We might return in a couple of years, and hopefully by then, this royal mess will no longer be. Only then shall we visit the Parliament.
Best building in Budapest. Did not tour the inside, but loved the outside by day and night! Intricate and gorgeous with lots to see in the immediate area.

Very nice place to visit but one upsetting dual pricing observation. It's a nice place to visit, very wel restored and showing the lusture of the past. Recommended. Now the trip is small, mainly a small top floor section showing the large meeting room and a few halls and walk ways. It takes about 45 minutes and you are out again.they practice dual pricinf, 5200 for non EU residents =, 2000 forint for EU residents. They check PP. But being a EU resident, having arranged for the ticket via boedapest travel in NL, I found out that the prepaid ticket was charged 7200 forint equivalent. Agent intervemtion only to buy the ticket for you which showed the low 2000 price. Be warned.

Fantastic to visit but book your tour in advance. I'd highly recommend seeing the Parliament building as its a land mark of Budapest. It has some remarkable and different architecture which appeals equally to young and old. However please book your tour in advance which can be done online. We missed out on the insider tour as we wanted to get a ticket for the same day and it wasn't available!

Very ornate and huges. The Pariliment is an imposing sight from everywhere in Budapest. It is a lovely building and definitely worth a visit. Make reservations in advance if you want a tour inside, but just visiting the square in back of the building offers much to see including a plethora of stature (in front and back) and plenty of free space and benches too take in the grandure of it. While only a quarter of the space inside is used for legislature, it exemplifies the archetiture and excesses of the ruling classes! A visit to the visitor center is a good place to find free WC, and more info.

YOU'VE SEEN IT ON PBS. If you watch PBS's Masterpiece Theater you've seen this magnificent building on the adverts for the cruise line that helps to sponsor "Downton Abbey" etc. I can't imagine how this architectural gem survived World War II. Thank God it did! It's magnificent to gaze upon and fascinating to explore.

# 1 Attraction in Budapest. The Parliament building is the Best known in the city and you can see this impressive building in any postcard of Budapest alongside the Danube. Book ahead one of the guided tours because this is the only way to go inside. something you should not miss

Beautiful and powerful. Very beautiful construction beside DAnubio river, it was very rich inside and well decorated. Meeting rooms are great. At night, don't loose a tour by boat where you can see the parliament with special ilumination.
A bit of Westminster. Inspired by The houses of parliament in London this was an impressive scale and it a great feature on the banks of the danube.
A magnificent building !. Don't forget to admire this buiding by night from the Buda area. Very beautiful illuminated....we didn't visit the building inside....that's for next time !

One of Budapest's jewel buildings. Built in 1904 by architect Imre Steindl, it's one of the oldest lesgislative buildings and the 3rd largest in Europe. In Budapest it's the highest and largest building with 691 rooms. Next to the Danube River and to Lajos Kossuth Square. In Gothic Revival style, it has 2 parliament halls, one for the politics and one for the guided tours. Since 2000 it houses the original Hungarian regalia, a copy of which you may see at the ecclesiastical museum of Matthias Church. The visited area inside the Parliament is limited and no photos are allowed in certain halls. There is a security check at the entrance, similar to the airport one and you must have a document to cofirm your name and your nationality. There are no restrooms and lockers. To get inside you must have a timed ticket with the language you have chosen to find the right group. Tickets can be bought on-line (recommended) because at the spot, the queuing is always very long in front of the visitor centre at the north side of the building. You must check also when the Parliament is open to the public. Prices are: For European citizens € 15.- for adults, for non-European citizens € 30.- But even from the outside, the building is so impressive. When illuminated during the night, it's part of the special panorama of Budapest, if not the central piece of it.
Amazing and worth the visit. One of the better sites we visited in Budapest. The history, the size, and the grandeur of the Parliament gives one a real sense of the history of the area and town.
Inside tour of parliment. Though the outside is beautiful, the inside tour is well worth it. The only disappointment is that the guide from the staff was a bit hard to understand.
impressiv. Such a huge beautiful bilding in very good condition. One part to visit as a museum, the other part for the government

Wow!. This may was my first time that I saw Parliament without any constructions around it and it was perfect! Fountain in front of main building is very simple, but visually perfect. Whole area around Parliament is insane clean!

Excellent History. Take a tour as the Parliament Building has so much to see and so much history to learn about. It is in the square that you can still see the bullet holes from the 1956 revolution against the Soviets.
Beautiful . This building is incredible and so big! We stayed across the Daube from the parliament building and it's as beautiful up close as it is from the river!
View at night. It is well worth viewing the beautifully illuminated Parliament building from across the river at night.
architectural marvel.. parliament house view from the river cruise, from the hill is stunning.entry inside not allowed.absolute must.

Beautiful. Modeled after the British Parliament complex, the Hungarian Parliament building is a wonder. Viewed from the Buda heights or the Danube, day or night; it fills the eye and the soul. An absolute wonder.
lovely building. Very like the parliament in London. lots of steps, but it is an old building. They may have lifts. We were so glad to have the opertunity of seeing the inside at long last.

Extremely beautiful architecture and an uninspiring guided tour. The building itself and the square and buildings around it are very well taken care of. This is a must see !
We took the guided ticket tour but it wasn't worth it ... very textbook and uninspiring.
Like sagrada familia but in in width :). Very nice and large parliament, the first place in your must see. Super view from other side of Danube )
Well worth a visit. We enjoyed our tour. It was well worth it. Lovely building. Interesting to see the crown jewels. Guide was very informative.

The most beautiful building in Europe.. I loved it. The facade is quite impressive when you see from the other side the Duna river. In my opinion, to take good photos, you've to try many times in differents parts of the day. ( morning, afternoon , sunset, night).They have tours in many languages, the guide woman, was very kind. Inside the building is so nice as outside. The gift shop is little bit expensive.
Best at night. Best viewed from the other side of the river at nights as its spectacular!! Also lovely by day but especially at night!
very nice building in very good 'shape'. we visited the parliament in the evening at sun set; the building is very nice and in very good 'shape'; certainly worth visiting.

A Rather Familiar-Looking, Budapest Must-See. Designed by the same architect as Westminster Palace (the UK Houses of Parliament), this magnificent building dominates the Pest side of the river. The uninspiring but extensive surroundings, with some other impressive buildings and soldiers on guard duty, are worth a walk around, before heading inside for the tour. You have to pre-book online (yes, madly, you can't pre-book in advance in person) to be sure of getting in. The tour lasts 45-50 minutes and is a good snapshot of the magnificently ornate building and Hungarian modern history. It costs 2000 Hufs each for European citizens and is well worth it.Tip: walk from there (10 mins) to the Hutte outdoor cafe in Szabadsag Ter for a pleasant drink and snack as well as to see the monument there and the modern fountain.

Mini-bus City Tour. Our very helpful receptionist at the Palazzo Zichy Hotel booked 4 of us on to a city tour taking in most of the main city sights and ending with a guided tour of the Parliament. we were picked up from the hotel by taxi and taken to the tour starting point near Chain Bridge. From here we toured the sights as a small group in a mini-bus with an excellent (if rather full!) commentary provided on the histiry of the city.The history of Hungary was reinforced once we started the guided tour of the interior of the Parliament and the original settlers' migration from Asia now reflected in the colourful local adaptation of its Gothic Revival style - based on the UK Houses of Parliament.The golden staircase is quite spectacular and visitors also get to see the Hungarian Crown Jewels - not as spectacular as the British Crown Jewels but steeped in important histoiry nonetheless.

lovely area. we didn't go into the parliament building due to lack of time but it is impressive from a river cruise or by walking past.....visit some of the streets in the area for a very cosmopolitan style of coffee shop (October 6 street)

Was expecting more. Although a fascinating place to visit, the public are limited to seeing very few rooms and we were generally disappointed with the tour. The group was too big and it was sometimes difficult to hear what the guide was saying.

Spectacular. This is an immaculate building on the banks of the Danube with very impressive architecture, not unlike the Houses of Parliament in London. Also the grounds surrounding the building are very accessible.
Beautiful. We walk around parts of this outside and saw it when we was on a boat trip. Such a beautiful building. My only wish is that I could of seen it at night.
Super!!!. The architecture of the building and the landscape are beautiful,including the park and the view to the river.

Beautiful, but guided tour is not much. Parliament building is beautiful and interesting from an architectural point of view, and historically. Naturally, good security scanning is necessary which means both that the only way to see inside is with a guided tour and after proper security scanning. However, the tour cost about US$20, and lasts about 45 minutes, max. Of this, about 15 minutes is lost by security scanning.Another 10 mins is lost dragging up,and down staircases, some of which are impressive, some of which are just the "servants staircases". The tour in English takes about 100 visitors, so you are lucky to hear much from the guide. Overall, too quick, too expensive anda pretty unsatisfactory experience. On top of the entry fee , there is a$1 fee for the lavatory....
Impressive. Really beautiful and impressive architecture. Would recommend taking the ferry to get a view from the water

Beautiful building. Beautiful building but it's a shame they pack the tours with so many people. We went to purchase tickets on a Sunday morning and were told the next tour with spaces wouldn't be until 14:45 so we bought our tickets and then went back later in the day.
Golden. We booked our tour on the internet. You really should do that, because it could be sold out. The guide was nice and interesting. Although it didn't last long, approx. 30 Min, it was enough.

magnificent. We had a good visit to this impressive monument, led by a cheerful and energetic English speaking guide. His walking speed was a bit fast for some in our group, and it is a vast building, requiring lots of walking.

Impressive from land or the river.. A stunning landmark from every direction, maybe best from the river and at night time it's lite superbly to show off it's towers and dome. If you visit Budapest, you can't miss it.

Impressive from land or the river.. A stunning landmark from every direction, maybe best from the river and at night time it's lite superbly to show off it's towers and dome. If you visit Budapest, you can't miss it.
Fantastic!. You could see this place all over the guidebook but it is worth to visit there one time. The view from the other side across the river is most fantastic moment in Budapest.
Parliament house. One of the most Beautiful buildings I have ever seen. Make sure you visit in both daylight and Night-time. Be sure to watch the changing of the guard also.

Impressive!. Wow what a building me and my boyfriend spent a good hour just sat out the front looking at it because we were in such awe of what an incredible building it is. We didn't do the tour as we didn't have time but possibly on my next trip it would be nice to do a tour and see the inside.

Beautiful building. This is Budapest's jewel in the crown. It seems visible from most places we visited. Also the building is beautifully renovated and for the first time in years there's no scaffolding on the outside. Make sure you book ahead for a tour.
Beautiful. This is a must see. If possible come back at night. The building is gorgeous with the lights on it as is much of the buildings along the Danube

Gotta see it! Best from a distance.. Impressive building for sure. But with no front lawn, the best view is from a cruise from the middle of the Danube, or perhaps from the other side of the river. I'm not sure I'll go inside tomorrow...there are too many other things to occupy our day.

One of the most beautiful parliaments. This definitely had to be one of the most beautiful parliament buildings. Not only does it look immaculate, but is maintained in the same way. Definitely worth a check at night too.

Impressive from both sides of the river. Up close or from far away this impressive building is worth walking around. Tours are available in English for the inside. My best tip is come back at night time and enjoy the building lit up like a Christmas tree.
Huge. Something amazing to see from the distance, especially at night when they light it up! Too big of a place to take a picture from up close but amazing to take a picture from a distance.

Beautiful architecture, strange rituals. Very nice building, symetric concept. We did see a strange ritual though. First we thought it was about changing of the guard but it was more a small military parade/dance on Händl's music. We were not able to figure out what it was all about.
Interesting. We really enjoyed our visit to parliament, this very exquisite building arqitechture and history, we totally had a fabulous visit....

A log e lymphoma experience, Go!. A reasonable sized group, tour guide with an audio and good English. a huge beautiful building, no additional charge for photos. I bought tickets s for the English tour on line in advance. they sell out quickly during the day. you must go t h rough airport type security screening to gain entry.

majestic and dignified building. I think the building is really magnificent! It is different with other parliement. This building has variouse attractions. We can see many of dream of painters and architects. We can watch relieve guard. And you can sit benches and have relax. and see Donau river and enjoy views!
Breathtakingly beautiful . Much bigger than expected but was absolutely stunning with a new statue out front as well. Great view from the river cruise!

Gorgeous building. We first saw this building on an evening cruise and it is stunning when lit up. The next day on our segway tour we found out it was the parliament building and we rode around it close up, didn't know we could go inside though?

Tour in English. Spectacular building, inside and out. Walking around the outside MUST make you want to book a tour of the inside. Difficult to hear what the tour guide was saying, made worse by some the group talking in different languages while the guide was speaking English! Easy to book on line.

Beautiful building but overpriced tour & systemic issues.. It is truly a gorgeous building. However, for non EU members, it is expensive for such a short tour...barely 35 minutes long by the time we all got through the security check. Considering we had a 3.5 hour walking tour for almost the same price a different day, I think we could have just looked at the outside and saved ourselves the $50 Canadian dollars. Also, as tourists, we can order our tickets online, for an extra fee...but then we can't show the ticket on our iPad...we had to figure out where a copy shop was to log into our email andprint. That seems a little crazy to us in this day of technology. When arriving, there are FREE bathrooms...that is seldom found in Europe so we were happy about that. The lineup to get in is disorganized as no one knows how it works except the staff who don't seem to help much. Basically, don't crowd around the entry point...a guide will call your tour time and language when they are ready for us, we got called at 11:59 for the 12:00 tour. THEN, you can all push on tougher instead of lining up? Frustrating. The othe thing that was irritating was the the sound system the guide used was really static sounding so it was really difficult to hear what she was saying, Your tour ticket includes the basic museum (not a lot of English and NO pictures allowed). However, you have to ask for the free tickets...another line up and then re-enter the security check AGAIN so more lining up. Wow...there are so easy fixes here that would make it a lot more pleasant of an experience.

Simply Beautiful!. My wife and I moseyed over to this stunning building after photographing the heck out of it fr the opposite side of the Danube the day before, and it is even more beautiful up close.As an American it puts our governing buildings to shame in terms of sheer architectural design. Also, when we arrived we were treated to a guard ceremony with music that was definitely something we didn't expect but greatly enjoyed (after they finished they even invited tourists to come right up next to them and take photos, which was really cool of them).Overall, it's absolutely worth the time to see.

Gilded government. The Hungarian Parliament handles tours in various languages, and all security measures, in fairly good order. The tour was about 30 minutes and limited to three primary areas, plus an exhibit room and gift shop. While there is elevator service, be prepared to climb about 4-5 stories. While we heard interesting stories about government and the construction of this gorgeous building, we heard even more about it on a city walking tour, truth be told. Passports are required for all visitors. Don't miss the night view of this building from the Danube. Stunning.

Too Expensive for what we saw. Our Budapest card said that it was free to visit Parliament, but it cost us. Also we were not asked if we wanted to see the museum and after the tour we had to ask someone where the museum was and she had to go back to the counter and ask for another ticket and go through security again to visit it. It should be explained better when paying.

What A Place to Govern!. Simply an amazing tourist site in one of the most beautiful cities in Europe. The Parliament is simply stunning. I remember this from 32 years ago when Trip Advisor did not exist. Glad I finally got a chance to comment.

One of the world's most beautiful buildings. The Parliament was built between 1885 and 1902 and its Neo-Gothic design was inspired by the Houses of Parliament in London. It however has a great presence due to its siting and the views of it from many places in the city. Externally it is decorated with 88 statues of Hungarian rulers, gargoyles and spires. Particularly good photos can be taken looking down from the Fisherman's Bastion and Castle Hill on the other side of the Danube or from the river, It is also magnificent at night.

This is a grand city and spectacular in every way. The Buda may have height and the dramatic skyline of Castle Hill, but the building that most characterises the power and gravity of the city is this monumental parliament building, over on the Pest- side of the river. Of-course, it comes with the obligatory raft of statistics..... 17 years in building.... 691 rooms.... 40 million bricks and a workforce of a thousand men. Thinking about its size, my femme quipped that for Ceausescu this would have been a kitchen extension , however in 1902 it was the largest parliament in the world. Outside the frontage, a huge, rather disdainful bronze lion reclines below the twin flags of Hungary and the Euro Union, both hanging limp and lifeless on this torpid morning. Inside, we find ourselves on a wide, red-carpeted staircase with stained-glass windows and gilded columns rising high on either side. One can definitely not deny the presence of the place. The red carpet leads inexorably up into a high- domed central hall and another iconic national image encased in an impregnable glas case on a marble plinth, set directly below the highest point of the 300-foot dome, guarded by three soldiers with drawn swords. They protect the 1000 year old crown of Istvan I, father of the nation. We were taken by the extravagance of the Chamber of Representatives, not unlike a grand opera house. We walk out onto the gleaming limestone terrace overlooking the Duna. The ramparts of Castle Hill rise up across the river, a hazy skyline of walls and roofs tiled in red and gold. This is a grand city.... and spectacular in every way.
most beautiful building. without a doubt the most beautiful building of this city! even just outside worth to watch, even from a boat at the Danube it looks like a ferrytale

Simply stunning at night from the Danube. Simply stunning at night from the Danube. We were able to do a dinner cruise on the Danube the buildings are all lit up in the Parliament is the most stunning!

A top site in Budapest. Many of the other reviews have said that the Parliament is an essential visit in Budapest and we agree. It is a truly splendid building – both inside and out. The ancient crown jewels are housed directly under the main dome, guarded by army sentries who march a small lap of honour at regular intervals. You have to pass through airport-style security to enter the building and this was rather chaotic when we visited, delaying the start of the tour. It is now possible to book a specific tour online and this is recommended as it is a very popular attraction.

Stunning inside and out. This is a lovely building from any angle ans spectacular from the river & Fisherman's Bastion. Well worth taking a look inside, it doesn't cost much but best to book. Tram No2 runs every few minutes from the front of the building to the far end of Budapest right along the river.
Rich!. This tour is incredible. History mixed with tradition. All the parliament is covered with gold leaf. This place is incredible. Must to see and try the amazing experience.

Huge!. We were looking for Shoes on Danube (which is like 30m long) and "stumbled upon" (well, kind of) this HUGE building of parliament (just coincidentally sitting next to Shoes on Danube :-)Parliament building is just awesome!

Danube's jewel. This building is one of my all-time WOW sites. It has a marvellous outline on the riverscape as well as from all of the city's bridges and Buda & Gellert hills. You must see it floodlit at night - unbeatably iconic!

I just wish there was more of it on show!. This is the grandest and most impressive parliament building I've ever seen, The sheer scale of the place is breathtaking and then the finish - the decor, the furnishings and the grandeur! It's advisable to book a tour in advance. In our case an English speaking tour meant a two and a half hour wait when we did not book in advance. The tour itself is fascinating and leaves you wanting more. I seem to recall the tour guide saying we had seen only about two percent of the building inside. It was mind-blowing as we walked around there, up and down corridors and stairs and into rooms and chambers, to think what a tiny fraction of this really impressive building we had seen. I would highly recommend a visit and I'd also recommend advanced booking to make the most of your time in this spectacular city.

Worth taking a tour.. It was a cold windy morning so getting inside the Parliament building was a pleasure. Tickets for a tour aren't very expensive, worth seeing. The Crown Jewels are inside guarded by two armed guards who swiftly shifted their swords every 15 seconds - cool to watch. Also loved all the brass cigar holders lining the hallways, hilarious to think about guys going out to the hall for a puff or two then putting it back in their personal numbered holder.There is a nice little cafe on the main floor, coffee, sandwiches etc.
