A glorious building with Turkish/Habsburg interiors. A building worth visiting just for the sheer Over the Top decoration inside; magnificent staircases and ceilings frescoes. It is worth having a good guide th show you around and see the depating chamber as well beautifully wood panelled.
Great architectural masterpiece. Spectacular building in a panoramic position, great to see at night light. Visits are well organized.

Beautiful in the day and even better by night!. Very beautiful building. As I was told by out tour guide, there were submissions by several architects for the Parliment building and the runners up are some of the surrounding buildings...so in one place in the city you have an opportunity to see some pretty spectacular architecture. I also had a chance to see this from the river at night at it is magical. If you have the time to take a river cruise at night, you have to do it...you will not regret it!Also...this is near the Shoes on the Danube memorial. As you are navigating the city it is a quick walk from Parliment to this very moving memorial.
Nice but too short tour. This is the second largest Parliament in the world, but the tour only takes you to few places inside. The tour is well organized, the place inside is breathtaking.

True perfection!. I have seen many beautiful buildings, but this Parliament is a miracle. It is so beautiful, so majestic that one fan of Gothic (like myself) remains only to lose breath. I did not go inside, I looked outside but I can say that once people have done miracles. This building has a soul.
Impressive. Impressive building which could rival the Parliament in London (although I am biased as I live in London:)). Beatiful at nigtht. Did not do the tour so I cant comment.

A dont miss at the Parliament. When you enter the Parliament square it is easy to overlook the memorial to the 1956 uprising. Do not miss this exhibit. If you can not locate it yourself make sure that you ask any one of the guards around the building It is on the Southwest side of the building

world master traveller in central europe. this was the goal of my last full day in budapest, keeping on the pest side of the river, from the apartment near the chain bridge it was a good 20-30 minute walk but again the blue skies and full sunshine were upon me so it was a stroll along a fine embankment, passing all those massive cruise barges and the many sideshows along the way. there was a busy 4 lane motorway going down between the river the and this very ornate building, so my best vantage point for seeing it in all its "sunday best" was to pop down onto one of the ferry boat jetties, about 100 metres out into the river, great spot also for having a good breather, away from the milling crowds on the promenade and allowing the full majesty of the building to be taken in with a bit of peace and quiet, great also for photo ops. She really is a fabulous looking building with all manner of spires and domes, sticking out in all directions. Not sure how much free speaking there has been inside these last 100 years or so what with the nazis and soviets getting their tuppence worth as well as the Hapsburg empire lot as well. i very rarely go inside such edifices as the look is all about the exterior, still very good, splendid even!! Enjoy!!

Impressive. The exterior is large and impressive. Soldiers on guard everywhere. The Danube is on one side, a large grass area with the Courts of Justice on the other. Entrance to Parliament for a tour is underground, free toilets outside, pay per pee inside by the cafe.the tour was efficient. If you cannot bring it on an aircraft, you cannot bring it into Parliament. There is a stringent check before you can come inside. The building is grand. Really impressive, well eorth the cost of admission.

A must see at Budapest!. We visit this amazing government building as our own. They have many different guided tours in different languages. Since we were running with no so much time we chose the next available tour, it was In Italian, we are Spanish speaker and we understand some of the information. Try to be early and buy your tickets in advance since nut of the tours are always full. We recommended this guided tour and amazing parliament building.

Building is Beautiful, but tour is POORLY planned. The building was spectacular! It is really unfortunate that the tours are so poorly planned and executed. First, there was just a mob of people with no order to get into the actual building from the visitor center. People are too rude to not have lines set up for queueing. The group was HUGE with at least 40 people, which made it impossible to hear the tour guide. Also, there was another tour directly behind us, which made it even harder to hear our tour guide. It was overall a terribly planned tour.

Budapest Parliament Visit. This is an interesting place to visit but make your reservations on line before you go. We had been warned to do this and were glad we did. You are in a much smaller group and go in a different door, etc. You also go before the other tours and don't have to wait outside in the long lines. It is a beautiful building on the inside as well as being very impressive on the outside.

Great tour. A beautiful building from the outside proved to be incredibly interesting inside. The tour and tour guide was fabulous. We made the last tour of the day as Parliament was to meet in the afternoon.

views from foot, bus and river. These buildings are beautiful and positioned beside the Danube allowing all round viewing from roads, bridges and river boat. Fairy tale like turrets, domes and statues. that is just from outside, as we did not have time to go inside on a tour.

A marvelous piece of architecture, inside and out. My wife and I took a tour of Parliament today and were amazed by the sheer magnitude of the place and the beautiful architecture inside and outside. It is very well kept and I highly recommend this tour.
Beautiful Building by Day and illuminated at Night. The seat of the Hungarian government. Beautiful inside and outside. A must see. At night from the river the site is outstanding

The building itself gets 5 stars, the guided tour 3. The parliament building in Budapest, which stands at the banks of the river Danube, is certainly impressive. However, as many other people have said, the guided tour, which costs around £6, is rushed. The guide wasn't hugely engaging, and seemed to rattled off the same script with little enthusiasm. Saying this, however, this does very little to detract one of the most impressive buildings in Europe. One tip for travellers - the ticket office isn't signposted. It is to the right of the building.
stunning architecture. Just gorgeous inside and out. Best to book in advance, which we did online. Right on the banks of the Danube

Took the City Tour page which I bought from Hop On HO.. Tour was great. Saved us from standing in line and assured us of getting a ticket. Sent a taxi to our hotel to pick us up and deliver us to a central meeting point. From there we went by large tour bus to theParliament. Impressive building. We were quickly ushered in to our English speaking guide. Very nice. One hour tour and there is elevator service if you cannot climb the steps.

A Parliament to Behold. The words "ornate" and "opulent" hardly do justice to this beautiful building. It is well worth your time to take one of the daily tours to see a structure which harkens back to Budapest's grand past. From the painted ceilings to the gilded walls, seeing the Parliament will be a treat for your eyes. Just don't forget your camera when you go!

Beautiful!. A beautiful building which is even better at night lighted!!!The tour inside the parliament is also very exciting!The most interesting spot in the parliament is the hexadecagonal central hall in which the Holy Crown of Hungary is placed.A must see!
Re: landmark . It's one of the landmarks in Budapest. We saw it well lighted when we took the Danube river cruise. It's spectacular at night.

A stunning building, a must do when in Budapest. This is a beautiful building both inside and out. The intricate exterior is perfectly complemented by the ornate interior and really must not be missed when visiting Budapest.Entry to the Parliament building is by guided tour only, and this was the only disappointing thing about the whole visit. It lasts for 45 minutes and really doesn't provide any useful or interesting information. However the beauty of the building more than makes up for it. Guided tours can be booked for the same day, but should be booked in advance. We went on a Friday morning (arrived at 10am) and the next available English tour was at 12.
Spectacular. Great architecture and very large.Impressive from afar and internal tour is great. At night it is fabulous as it is lit.

Another must building. We got a time for our visit with the help of the hotel reception.It was a bit confusing at the gate as we had to wait for the English group to go through together. The guide told us lots of interesting facts and we saw the crown jewels which were being guarded, the main entrance and the debating chamber. There are many statues along corridors . It has a lot of gold paint and marble and paintings. It was cheaper as we belong to the EU.

Thoughtful. Its a beautiful building, eye gazing architecture but after seeing the shoes I was happy not to go in and move on. Certainly worth a stop. This building can be seen everywhere almost in the city so it should be on your list of things to see.

A beautiful building - can't vouch for the politicians though !. Believed to be Copied from Houses of Parliament - quite modern but still a fantastic building - we were told another complete city could have been built for the cost of this one !

Disappointing. The tour of parliament lasted barely 40 mins. Although the inside was beautifully decorated it was very stylised and the guide gave us very little info about how it all works. Fortunately, as EU citizens it was inexpensive but booking was certainly not easy.

pricey building. worth a visit - Its the 2nd largest parliament building in Europe (nearly 100m tall) - they used 40kg 23carat gold for decoration - the total cost of construction reached the value of a 40000 inhabitant cities price at that time..
Best at night. This building is spectacular. Best seen at night from Danube. I was enamored by the architecture. It is pretty during the day but awesome at night.

Great Architecture. This building is so great you can just sit down in front of it and admire the great detailed architecture, it is a very impressive building , you should see it from all sides to appreciate the great effort and work put in this building. it should be marked on your plans when you visit budapest

Impressive and magnificent building.. We looked at the building only from outside and did not take the tour. The building is amazing even from outside and presents good photo opportunity. There were also guards marching by and they looked pretty impressive. Worth a visit even if you don't have the time to take a inside tour.

Beautiful. A beautiful building standing proud on the Pest side of the Danube - looks even more striking all lit up at night. The museum is free to go round - but if you want to actually go round the Parliament itself it is advisable to book in advance. Tours are approx. 45 mins long - unfortunately we didn't manage this as there were on 2 tickets left for the English speaking tour (we were a party of 4) much later in the day. Had we realised we would have booked in advance

House of Parliament area, Budapest. This is a wonderful building, the 3rd largest parliament building in the world and modelled on those at Westminster, London. We were there on a glorious sunny day and the gardens and wide open spaces of lawn were a joy to walk around, admiring the building itself from the outside. There is a tour you can take inside but we did not have time. Also we had been advised to pre-book. A MUST is the underground museum of the tragic events of 25 October 1956. When you re-emerge into the beautiful surroundings it is almost impossible to believe what happened there barely 60 years ago. Along the front of the parliament building, on the edge of the Danube itself, is a haunting memorial of another terrible time in this beautiful city's history in the form of sculpted shoes of all shapes and sizes. This is to honour the Jews who, during World War II, were ordered to take off their shoes, and were shot at the edge of the water so that their bodies fell into the river and were carried away.
Amazing. It is worth visiting to undrestand the history of Hungary. One of the most imposing buildings in Eastern Europe. Very good guides take you around to all the mail rooms in the building.
Impressive decorations but very short visit. Building is impressive. Inside and outside. The guided tour (compulsory) was fine but too short for the price. Make reservations online to avoid waiting!

Hungarian Parliament Buidlings. Make sure you reserve tickets in advance, numbers are limited for tours in different languages. It was somewhat chaotic getting through security but worth the hassle to see the beauty of the building. The guide was clear and professional. I would have liked some more history but that I can read up on. Worth a trip.

Cattle market tour. The numbers in the tours are far too large. Beautiful building. The tour takes 45 minutes. You have to climb 140 steps to get to the 1st floor. The groups are so large if you are at the back you cannot hear what is being said and at the end you are taken to a small viewing chamber to view the parliamentary hall but the whole group cannot fit in and those at the back are hurried out before they even get a chance to get to the front and take a picture or see the room making the whole visit a bit pointless.
House of Parliament. Over 100 years of structure still standing strong - very good guided tour as well as cultural and historical immersion.

Include this building on your running route!. If you start s run on the pest side and cross over the Chain bridge, you can readily loop back over the Danube and include this incredible building on an early morning running route. The square will be empty other than for a couple of guards, and it's a pretty amazing way to see one of the city's most impressive historical sites.

Breathtaking. This was the most beautiful building that I have ever seen. When we approached Budapest on our Viking ship at 11:00 p.m. the Parliament Building was lit up like a Christmas tree - it was a sight that I will never forget. It was just as impressive during the day. Loved walking around the building and in the square around the building. Came across the 1956 Memorial in the Square as well which was moving to me. An absolute must see while in Budapest.

my favourite place in budapest. Really enjoyed this tour very reasonable(take your passport eu passport holders get half price) staff were very friendly & helpful. Tour guide was very informative we were lucky to see the chamber where they hold parliment only accessible twice a month. I recommend to get there early as there can be queues but we were lucky as it was feb so quieter. This is a must do in budapest.
A must visit in Budapest. Definitely worth the visit to see one of the largest parliament house buildings in the world. Very imposing structure and the guided tour explains a lot.
Parliament. Beautiful big buildings with beautiful exteriors, huge area.. There is beautiful garden outside the building and also some water fountains.
The Symbol of Budapest. Majestuous building,the symbol of Budapest after the Chain Bridge,please take a guide in your own language to get the whole story of it.
Stunning. Absolutely beautiful building. Recommend seeing at night also...we did this on a river cruise. Most beautiful parliament building i have seen
Amazing. Enjoy the atmosphere of this famous sight. Go around and have a seat for some minutes in this area. and don`t forget a photo :-)

Absolutely marvelous.. I never get tired of looking at this building, every time you see it, you notice something new.
I liked to just sit on one of the benches in front of the building and enjoy the sun, and the view.
Totally worth a visit after the sunset.
My favorite. This is a gorgeous building. I suggest you see it from the Buda side during the day and take a boat at dinner/evening.

Stately. In my opinion is one of the most beautiful parliament in Europe, it's huge and full of decorations both outside and on the inside. It sits on the bank of the river and it offers you a stunning view from the opposite bank. When lights turn on at night it enlightens all the surrounding area and it's worth a visit during this time. Tours are offered in several languages and the guides are really well prepared and give you a very good idea of the history of the building and its rooms. Maybe the ticket office could be placed somewhere else because right now only few people could be in there at the same time so the queue could become a little bit longer.
Awestruck!. What an amazing sight! We booked a guided short tour! The architecture of the monument is simply stunning! A must visit!

Amazing structure and very good tour.. The structure is amazing and vast. The tour was very good and quite interesting for the four of us who are not particularly history buffs. After seeing the inside we made sure to walk across to the Buda side of the river to see it lit up at night. Simply stunning and worth the walk.

Worth a look . Definitely work a peek and if your an EU resident take your ID and you get entry for 2100 instead of 5000. The tour lasts about 40 mins you get to see the MP's chambers and the main debating room as well as lots of gold corridors and stairwells. You can book on the spot if there's spaces at the visitor centre to the right of the main building. Security is airport style & there's a free cloakroom for coats.

Overpriced . This is a fantastic building, don't get me wrong, and it should be more famous all around the world. The tour however was quite short and not greatly exciting. Of course the architecture is stunning, but that doesn't justify the price. I felt very underwhelmed when it was over. I also found the two guards walking around the crown every 15 minutes a bit, well, weird.Just my opinion.

Over priced and low value. Worth avoiding. This place charges you twice the price for being a non local, and then gives you a terrible tour. They say that they will answer questions and then do not. It does have a lot of gold, but for half the price you can get into the louvre in Paris, or a plethora of other better locations. If this is your reason to visit Budapest, go to some other city.

Impressive exterior, average tour inside. The Parliament tour is actually quite expensive compared to most things in Budapest (about 17 Euros if you are not from Europe) and I didn't think that the short tour inside the building was worth it. If the cost doesn't deter you, it could be worth it as the inside is massive but you only see a very small portion of the interior. I could have done without the tour, and I wouldn't have felt that i missed anything in Budapest.
A wonderful side trip .... A real must see in Budapest ... gives you a real impression of how much progress Budapest has made over the years... A great landmark and must see!
Beautiful building..... A treat to see by day and by night. Take a walk around the vicinity as there are numerous monuments nearby.

Fabulous Tour. We booked the English tour; guide was very knowledgeable and the building itself is stunning, a very creative design. Not to be missed both for the architecture and insight into the political reality of Hungary today.

Beautiful!!. Do book in advance online according to the time convenient to you.Very difficult to get tickets on the spot.Short tour but very interesting.And very beautiful.Tour guide spoke good english and of course was very knowledgeable.

stunning architecture. This building is amazingly beautiful. Right on the banks of the Danube it's worth having a look! If you want: have passport on you so you can enter and have a look around inside
Worth a visit. We visited the Hungarian Parliament in April. It was a really good walk around the building and the guided tour was very interesting. It's definitely worth paying to go inside.

Beautiful building. Amazing building and architecture inside - very ornate and a bit over the top! The tour lasts around half an hour with a bit of explanation at first. It is not at all expensive and is good value for money when in Budapest. You can photograph most of it although the jewels cannot be photographed. A worthwhile visit.

Grand scale. There are a limited number of places on each tour, and the tours in English happen every two hours- we arrived about 11.30 and booked on the 3pm tour, the last English tour was 5pm so it's definitely a good idea to get tickets early. Tickets were 2000 Forints.There's a security check before you go in and then a hundred odd steps to climb to the start of the tour- although there is a lift if stair climbing is a problem. The Grand Staircase , Congress Hall and Lobbies are impressive but the Crown Jewels in the vast space of the Domed Hall is spectacular. The two guards on duty have drawn sabres, and no photography is allowed under the Dome- the Security personnel accompanying each tour will make sure cameras aren't used , and they're very firm with anyone who looks like they're ignoring the no pictures request. In any other part of the building they don't mind how many photos you take! The scale model of the Parliament at the end of the tour is a fantastic piece of work- even down to a the scale models of the state regalia and St Stephen's crown- and there are some really good photos of the development and restoration of the Parliament building. The tour's the only way you'll get to see inside such an iconic neo-Gothic building , but I suspect you might get more info about the building by reading an informative guidebook rather than relying just on the tour guide.

Must must must in Budapest..!. Must see night and day separately. Lightning is incredibly beautiful. I preferred to see the building in the morning and after walked across the chain bridge. While walked around in the old city time was night so could spend my time more effectively and had great photos..

Stunning prcision of finishing. I was amazed by the prcised finishing of this building. It is a must to see at least from the outside! Looks majestetic and almost like a castle from a fairy tale. We did not have the option to visit it inside as on some days it is closed due to the Parlament summon. It is no longer free of charge for EU citizens, the only adavantage as a EU citizen is that you have a discount ticket for 2000HUF to buy, normal ticket 5000HUF.

Stunning building but chaotic inside. Walking around the outside of the Parliament building, it's impossible not to be impressed by the architecture. The building is stunning, crafted from limestone and sporting lots of towers. If you time it right, in the square the guards will come out and do a marching 'dance' routine. With swords. I don't know how often this happens; we happened to stumble upon it just as it was about to begin. The head guard then let onlookers take photographs with them. Pop around the side to the visitor centre and you have 2 options: a guided tour for about 40 mins (costs about 2000ft if memory serves me correctly) or PPP into the museum for free. We didn't manage to get onto a tour. The English speaking tours sell our very quickly so it's best to buy tickets in advance. We were there at about 1:30, 2:00pm and the next one with spaces wasn't until 6.So we decided to go to the museum. You need to get a free ticket from the desk (this isn't made clear). You can't go straight through; you need to hang around at the security turnstile and when there is a gap between the tour groups, they let you go through. This took 4 attempts and we almost gave up. You then go through airport style security and through to the museum. There are a few signs in 3 or 4 languages to tell you what some of the artefacts are. Otherwise, you're on your own to work things out. The toilets are decent and free, and they are outside the entrance, so they are a top tip if you need to go as public toilets in the city are elusive. Overall, stunning building, would like to have gone on a tour but it was pretty chaotic inside.

Amazing Architecture!. I did not take a tour of the interior, but the exterior is stunning and impressive. We walked the plaza at night. The entire plaza is lit up and has an amazing presence throughout the city. As we walked through the streets, you can see the glow between the buildings. It was breathtaking.

Huge and Grand. So you need to get tickets early in the morning or online. The ticket booth is to the right of the building (if you're facing the Danube) and underground so lookout for it. Also - if you're an EU citizen you get a discount but it's pretty pricey for Americans/non-EU citizens. The tour is nice but a bit stilted. The building itself is huge and amazing having been built for the AustroHungarian Empire. Much of it was redone in the '90s including the main statue out front.

Parliament is newly renovated and looks incredible. Parliament is newly renovated and looks incredible. It was replaced stone front, which grew black .Parliament is newly renovated and looks incredible. It was replaced stone front, which grew black .There is a very small show with changing of the guard at the flag.

Nice arhitecture. Found it rather boring, the guard put up a show, speaking hungarian, maybe changing shifts or something. It may be fun for old folks. Realy nice architecture. Did not visit inside because I was so bored but maybe when it rains or something, it might be a good option.

Impressive. Dominates the waterfront. Circa 1896 but extensive restoration required after WWII. Lots of 96s in the design and a lot of gold used in the decoration. The cigar holders are a relic of another era!
Stunning. Excellent attraction. Good guide. Cafe good. Building is very ornate and well maintained. Very much enjoyed my visit.

Amazing building.. This is a must see. A beautiful and majestic building that should not be missed. It is necessary to book on line and print your booking form out so do at your hotel or somewhere you have access to a printer. If you are an EU citizen you will get discount. There are a lot of stairs but a lift is available if required.
Picturesque. A huge building with an elegant architecture. Make sure you see it at night, from the Buda part, so that you fully enjoy the picture-postcard view.
Perfect spacious views. Breath-taking views from all sides of the complex, quiet and cozy neighboring district with lots of beautiful buildings and monuments.
Magnificent buiding. A must to see, although you cannot really miss it as it stands very proud on the riverbank only a short walk from the City centre.

Most beautiful building ever.... This is one of the most beautiful buildings ever seen...
A day and specialy at night...
You can also visit this building (2000 HUF). We made a reservation on the internet. The tour is small but beautiful.

Fascinating building and contents. A must if you are in Budapest. We had an excellent guide and saw all the most important bits within an hour and a half. The history is fascinating and the architecture amazing.

Very beautiful building. If you like gold and glitter then try to get inside. You can also see one crown which was transfered into hands of americans before communists invaded country, during ww II. Quite enormous building, impressive. Very beautiful outside, worth a walk there along riverside.

Tour. Had a tour around the parliament, it was a bit short and only showed you around less than a 5th of the building but well worth it, fantastic architecture and interior. being an active parliament you got searched and escorted around by two guards and a tour guide, one leading and one making sure no one fell behind, friendly enough and allowed plenty of time to take photos

Incredible. We brought tickets to go on a tour. There were fifty on the tour with a tour guide who had a microphone that at times was difficult to hear. To start the tour it wasn't obvious what you had to do lots of people were confused. Turns out you have to wait in the main reception part of the visitor centre. Your tour guide will then come out and rally everyone. You then have to go through the security similar to that at an airport. Then you get taken on the tour.I was very interesting seeing the gold leaf absolutely everywhere. The main entrance is incredible. You see the crown as well. They strictly enforce the no photo rule at this part of the tour. Unfortunately we had a short tour because the parliament was in session and there was also a conference.It is a shame we had to pay the same price as if we had seen the whole tour.

Should go. The Parliament house is huge. dont be shay to take the elevator (120 steps up in the start). The tour guide was clear and knowledge, the place is beautiful. wait to see the guards change...

It's huge... But not really great. There was lot of build up given for this building and must watch etc. Actually speaking in terms of its architecture, it's not that great.. Outside overall look stands as an identity to the country. But the inside set up and is simple and normal lik any palace or builds of any country kingdom. Personally feel that ticket entry is too much for it. And they say.. It's made out of 40kilos of gold.. But in India many temples hold more than 100 kilos of gold. Apart from that it's nice to see a parliment and get it's feel but nothing out of the world or extraordinary.

Waste of time and money. Poorly organized tour.. After reading mostly favourable reviews I decided to book a tour of parliament. It's about US$20 per person for non EU traveller, and we booked it online ahead of time.The building of parlament is magnificent and I was really excited for the tour. We came to the meeting point, which is located at visitor's centre, a few minutes before the start of the tour. It's not very easy to find it, because the are no signs, but we found it to the right of the parlament building if you face the main entrance.The lobby was packed with people, and it was pretty chaotic. We were told to wait for the guide outside of security check point. After we were waiting for a while, a guide for the German tour group said to go inside security line and wait for the guide there. English speaking guide was running late.Once she showed up she took us to the main floor. The whole tour took no more than 20 minutes. It felt pretty rushed, not very informative and a complete waste of money.The building looks very impressive inside, but absolutely not worth paying for the tour.The tour guide told us that you can also go for a free Parlament Museum inside the same building, but to go there you have to walk outside and re-enter security point(after waiting again in the long line). We didn't want to wait and left, so I can't comment if you can see the building inside just by going to the museum for free instead of paying for the useless tour.

wonderful place to see. if you find yourself in the area of Parliament and you can get a guide group in any language without having to wait for a while, do not skip it. it is overwhelming. unfortunately, only 4 spaces are visited but it is enough to know about the Parliament architectural style.
Beautiful buildings. We enjoyed the view of the Parliament building from many viewpoints in the city. We also took the inside tour, nice.

Take the tour - beautiful building.. We took the 45 minute tour of Parliament and it was well worth the time and price. It is absolutely beautiful and grand and stately and still being used today as the Parliament for Hungary. You will see chambers where sessions are held and the royal crown which is guarded and encased in glass and learn about its history. As our guide said it has had a sometimes difficult life!
excellent. Booked a tour here, was very informative and very interesting. Maybe a bit boring to little children but my daughter who is 9 yrs old was very interested with the tour.

Worth the visit but.... ...the tour is overpriced (non EU citizen tkt) for what you see. The building is beautiful both inside and out. My tour guide was very knowledgable and spoke excellent English. You can take as many pictures as you would like in any room except the room which contains the crown and scepter. I would advise against taking the last tour unless absolutely necessary because I got the impression the staff was rushing to get out of work on time.
Fantastic . Such a beautiful iconic building.Be sure to check this out when in Budapest, even if its just a walk down by the river to admire the views across to this masterpiece.

Incredible architecture and content. This building is easily a top target if you visit Budapest. It is amazing inside and out.It is an exceptional opportunity to see the Hungarian Holy Crown - just be sure to ignore most of the silly things the guide says about its origins.Unfortunately it is not easy to pre-arrange visit tickets, but once you've made it to one of the visit groups it is well worth the effort!

Breathtaking from every angle. We were lucky enough to have many views of this beautiful building! We saw it from the river cruise, bus tour and in the day, night and during sunset! I might say it's most beautiful at night! It goes without saying that you must visit this sight if you're in Budapest!

Amazing building. We only walked by the parliament but it is an amazing building and we were flashed of its beauty :) But there were too many cars driving in front of it. The traffic was definitely too much to enjoy the moment…
Awesome. Superb arcitecture, A must place to visit, changing of the guards was not quite "London" style but still worth watching.

Parliament. We didn't book online, just went there & bought a ticket for a later tour. In the mean time we visited the surrounding area. The ticket price cost 2000 HUF.The tour is approximately 45mins including the security check. The tour leader was fantastic & he explained everything in good English.It is very beautiful from the outside & richly decorated in the inside.The place is fantastic & a must see.
''Fantastic''. This is the most beautiful building. The architecture and décor is amazing. The tours are very reasonable and very well organised.

One of the best ones. Parliament usually are boring and gray places modern as much as possible , this one is the exact opposite of, grace, craftsmanship, pride in one building.
You feel here you are part of history.
Budapest is a beautiful city and sure the parliament is one the pearls of it.

Poor organisation. Good to see the parliament building during this tour, but a few niggles....First of all, there is a lack of information on arrival, so it's not clear where to wait if you have already bought tickets (as we had). We saw a queue for security and joined it for 10 minutes, only to discover as we reached the front, that this was for the visit before ours. One lady eventually came to the front and talked (without microphone) over the noise of the crowd to let us know what to do....we couldn't hear any of this, but word spread through the crowd and we understood that it was now our turn to go through security. Once through this, the tour got in place. The main problem with the visit was that there are several tours taking place at the same time, so there is constant background noise of other language tours taking place - the acoustics of the high-ceilinged rooms makes it really hard to focus on your own guide's words.

superb architecture. Make sure u do a pre booking as there are fixed slots for visiting the parliament chambers. The tickets are slightly on the pricier side - considering we had earlier done the Reichstag tour in Berlin for free. Also make sure u carry your photo ID cardsThe guided tour though is short - approx 45 minutes only. But the architecture of the building and its interiors are truly awe inspiring.The parliament cafe though is on the pricier side

A city landmark. The Parlament building of Budapest is the ex-libris of this great city. Everywere we go is in front of our eyes...and that is best thing that can happen. Wonderfull from the outside and beautifull from the inside.
Stunning architecture. . This was just over the road from where we stayed. It is a beautiful building. Couple this with Margaret island (not too far from Parliment) and you got a lovely day
fantastic. the architecture and detail of the whole place is absolutely incredible, every angle of the place is amazing. worth the visit

Magnificent Inside and Out. As impressive and dominating a structure that the Hungarian Parliament building is from the outside, the inside is more than its match. It is simply stunning and a very effective way to experience the grandeur of an empire. Tickets for the English language tours can be bought in advance on-line and is highly recommended as they often sell-out well in advance. (See: Jegymester.hu) The first English language tour starts at 0945, lasts about 45 minutes, and is truly a top to-do in Budapest. It is a great way to start a full day of touring.
Interesting Guide. The guide was brilliant, the interior spectacular. Be prepared for airport like searches. It takes about 50mins.

What a place. When you see this beautiful building with all its history and architecture, its simply amazing. The guided tour is comprehensive and very informative. You look into the main chamber and see the way its set up and the beautiful decor, words fail me.
Amazing. To be seen. An amazing building, with a lot of hisotry to be told. Our guide was polite and nice. The ticket price is correct. The visit started as scheduled at 13:15 without delay.

Not only the outside but also the inside is beautiful!. The most beautiful thing in the Budapest is view of the Parliament from the Buda in the night. Inside is none less. A must to be taken tour. Though short, the tour takes through the important places in the parliament including the hallway and the place where the crown and sceptre is kept.

Expensive for only small area you can see. The guided tour is expensive for non-EU residents. Exclude waiting time, the tour only last for no more than 30min. After walking up over 150 steps, you can only see the top floor & the old crown jewellery. I think it too expensive & not worth for money and time.

Beautiful at night. Absolutely impressive structure and a must see at night. It is enormous and really close to some of the best restaurants in Budapest. It's a good nighttime walk after dinner to see it.

OMG. What an absolutely magnificent building. No wonder the politicians claimed it as their own. It is right on the Danube on the Pest side of the city and is best viewed from the Buda side of the river. It is magical during the day but absolutely awe inspiring at night when it is all "lit up". I would highly recommend travellers view this attraction both during the day and night to get maximum value. The cost of a night time river cruise is very reasonable and a 48 hour "hop on hop off" bus ticket (which cost 20 Euros when we were there) includes access to a "hop on hop off" boat tour that operates at night at three times (7pm, 8pm & 9pm).

Hungarian Parliament. Definitely worth a visit, however you might be slightly disappointed by the brevity of the tour and the inconvenience of having to queue for a ticket. Those on a tighter budget might prefer to appreciate the exterior, which is impressive initself. Loved the MPs cigar holders and the grand. Staircase.NB Some walking is required, but elevators are available for those who have difficulty ascending the staircases.

Worth the visit. Make sure you book the tickets online in order to avoid the queue. If buying online, you just need to print the tickets and be at the visit centre right before the viist time, which is perfect!The visit did not seem to be very well organised, as 3 tours were booked at the same time (German, English and Spanish) and staff could not cope with the huge amount of visitors and the required security checks. Despite the delay and the overall mess (there is no other word for it), the visit is totally worth it! The building is beautiful!

Impressive. The Parliament from Budapest is an impressive building. The best way to take photos is from the Danube (there are different kind of cruises that you should take when you are in Budapest). My advise is to take a cruise at night too. The Parliament is beautifully illuminated by night. The view is breath taking.

One of the most beautiful places in Budabest. It is huge and beautiful. You can't get in but it doesn't matter, it's so beautiful on the outside. Best way to see the beauty is on a night cruise when everything is lit up.

marching policemen. By luck, we arrived just before 11.30 ....soon music started and a group of policemen in their dress uniform marched out, using their guns in a series of manoeuvres. Very good fun and reminiscent of Trumpton! Good cafe in foyer of entrance.

Exquisite building!. I think the best views of this building are from the other side of the river or up on castle hill. The detail is great, we didn't go inside, i'm not sure you can but the outside of the building is quite special.
Get tickets online in advance!. I was so glad I pre-booked our tickets, as the day of our tour they were SOLD OUT! Be sure to add this tour to your Budapest Itinerary!

Gold leaf and more gold leaf and stairs!,. Be prepared for lots of stairs and a wait for your tour to startYou must buy a ticket before you get here as may be fully booked as it was the day we touredLoveley building and really interesting to hear the history and see where the MPs sit and vote All the gold is real gold leaf and it was great to see the crown and its accoutrementsWell worth a visit Lots of stairs though so be prepared

Great tour, magnificent architecture. This is a must tour for anyone visiting Budapest. On the bank of the Danube, it is one of the largest parliament buildings in Europe (I think it is the second largest after the one in Bucharest...) Meticulously maintained, outside and in. The park outside is beautiful, with lots or gardens and great statues. Make sure you book the tour ahead of time, and that you ask about the availability of the language you want for the tour. They have lots of them in English, but they can be sold out unless you book ahead.

Well Worth The Trouble. As you would expect there is tight security to get into the building and it can get chaotic as you pass through security . Once inside the guides are great and the building fantastic . You wonder why they spent so much money but they did and it shows

Amazing interior. Make sure you book your tickets online before your visit, we were there in the middle of the day and we read there were no tickets left in any tour. The cafe is quite nice for a coffee and snack whilst you wait for your tour. About 5 minutes before your tour the guide will come out, announce the tour is to commence will give you details about security etc. You then go through security once your ticket is scanned do not lose your ticket as you need it to exit the building. The tour only takes approx 30 minutes, you have a lot of steps to climb, they do offer the lift. If you have any mobility issues or bad knees I suggest you take the lift. Inside is quite magnificent, extremely ornate, marble, paintings, the crown with its crooked cross. The guide was informative without giving too much detail, which we appreciated.

Impressive and Great Tour. It is undeniable that this is an impressive building from the outside and is particularly stunning when lit up at night. We booked a guided tour of the Parliament building and were very glad that we did! The tour was well organised; our tour guide spoke brilliant English, gave you plenty of time to take photos and was very helpful with any queries. The building is just as stunning inside as it is outside. The tour is very reasonably priced (especially in comparison to the London equivalent!) and we would definitely recommend the tour if you have time to spare.

Absolutely beautiful. They only have English tours at certain times, so make sure to look these up before you head over. Not only is the outside pretty breathtaking, the inside is absolutely gorgeous as well. There's a lot of history in the building, and it happened to be a special day so we were able to visit some areas that aren't normally part of the tour. The tour guide was great and easy to understand. As a student, I thought the price was worth it, but I got to pay the student price. Can't say I would have paid if I had to pay the regular adult fee.

Go at night when it's all lit up .... ...and cross the Danube to see it from the other side on a sunny day. Once you see it, you'll recognize it in all the ads. It's architecturally spectacular and in the spring when I saw it the time before last, the gardens were magnificent.

Very nice outside, especially at night. I recommend going there at night when it is beautifully lit up. I didn't go inside because it seemed to be a hassle and also expensive and there are mixed reviews about the length and waiting times..

Tour organization is a disaster, but the building is indeed fabulous. I've been inside the Parliament before on official business, but I thought I'd see what the tour is like. It is a nice opportunity to see a beautiful historical building so it's hard not to recommend it.That said, you have to be prepared for the lead up to the tour. The place is a complete disaster. I recommend purchasing tickets in advance, which we did. You pick the language of interest and the specific time slot. You print your ticket and show up. Then what? Good question. The place is complete chaos. No one tells you where to wait or what to wait for. At the exact time of your tour (if you are lucky) someone using a rather weak microphone will welcome you and will tell you tedious details about security. Then you will proceed through security with members of your group. This will take about 20 minutes. There are no seats to sit inside as you wait for others to join you. You can leave your coat and bags at bag check after you go through security.The tour then follows. It's rather short, but the guide does share some interesting pieces of information. And you do get to see some of the most important areas of the building. They allow flash photography almost everywhere. What I cannot wrap my head around is why they do not allow photography, say, without flash, in the main dome area with the crown. It is one of the most beautiful architectural elements and you cannot take a picture. There aren't really opportunities for questions although if you ask one, hopefully you'll get an answer. I cannot give the tour five stars as the organization is completely lacking and chaotic. But generally speaking, it is a nice experience so if you plan it ahead of time and go in with the above knowledge, hopefully it won't be frustrating.

worth it!. building is very impressive, both from the outside and the inside. Guided tour is highly recommended - allows viewing of the beautiful building and gives interesting info on Hungarian history.

Worth a visit. The parliament building is beautiful and indeed huge. We booked a tour online for the next day and had no problems. One complaint is that there is lots of disorganization when it comes to getting through security to start the tour. Nevertheless, our tour started on time and we had no problems. The tour lasts about 40 minutes and you can take pictures inside. Our guide was very insightful, but with had sense of humor (something that is always appreciated with these types of tours). Highlights include the Hungarian crown heels and their guards, the parliamentary chamber, and the documentary photograph of the restoration. We also happened to see the performance of the parliament guards outside of the building (not part of the tour) although it's not clear when or how often they do this, it was pretty neat to watch. There is also an underground memorial to the 1958 massacre. This is free and worth stoping in.

ABSOLUTELY BEAUTIFUL PIECE OF ARCHITECTURE - STUNNING AT NIGHT. We visited Budapest for 6 nights in March 2015. This building was a definite highlight of the trip. We saw it during the daytime (took an escorted tour of the interior) and it was well worth the price. The building inside and out is stunning. We also saw it lit up from the Danube Promenade and also on Danube Boat Cruise at night. Took many jaw dropping pictures. Paris is the "City of Lights" but Budapest (along the Danube Promenade) easily rivals that other great city. If you visit Budapest and neglect to take the tour of this stunning architectural achievement (or at the very least the boat cruise at night to see Budapest lit up) then you are truly not seeing Budapest at its best.

Beautiful inside and out!. Although the tour is quite short (ours was only around 35 minutes) and getting through the security is tedious, it is well worth a visit. The cost is very reasonable- 2000 HUF for an adult with an EU passport (around a fiver) and for a student it costs half of this. The facts told by our tourguide were very interesting and there were plenty of opportunities to capture some beautiful photos; the building inside is as spectacular on the inside as it is on the outside. The highlight was getting to see the 1000 year old crown and it was followed by a rather amusing show of the guards marching round it. The only thing I would recommend to do is book in advance as the tours can sell out very quick.

Spectacular Surprise. The Parliament building is more than you might imagine. It's huge! And, the detail in the exterior design is exquisite! If you like architecture, this is a must see when in Budapest. And definitely, pay for the interior tour!
Amazing!. I highly recommend everyone to take a tour inside the building. The inside is beautiful, all of marmor and gold. Tickets for students are cheap.
Beautiful. The outside of the building is very impressive but wait until you see the inside. We had a guided tour which was very informative.

Astonishing structure!. Although I haven't been inside of the building, I am still amazed how huge it is. Especially at night, when all the lights are pointed to it. I was on a cruise on the Danube river and we had great view. Shame I didn't go inside, I'm not sure it is allowed.
get your tickets early!. Well worth a visit - it is a stunning building. However, you should get there early to get tickets, or try on-line, though I didn't have much success with this.

Fun and Muscial. There was a protest near the Parliament during our time there, which I assume is probably a common occurrence. When we walked towards the front of it, there were guards playing their instruments and marching. I assume they may have been changing out the guards. There are guards that stand of each side of the silver flag pole. The water behind them looks to be a wishing well with coins in it (we also threw coins in it) that overflows on the other side as a small waterfall. Definitely beautiful building!

Looks Good from Across the Danube. It's a very impressive building, the architecture is wonderful. We didn't go inside, but we walked around it, saw the lowering of the flag and just took in the majesty of the place. At night from the Buda side you get a brilliantly lit sight of this building as it sits next to the Danube

this is the MUST. INSIGNIA from Budapest! a great building, the interior is also beautiful, just be on time to the tour. The tour itself is not really worthy but checking the building from inside is amazing.

An amazing building. We booked on the English tour and the lady who took us round the building was just brilliant. She was very knowledgeable and answered any other questions we had. The building is amazing. Seeing the crown of Saint Stephen and hearing it's history was wonderful. The beautiful 96 steps leading from the front doors only used on state occasions are stunning. This is a real must do tour for any visitors to Budapest.

Rivals Westminster. Do the tour and see the wonderful gold adornments everywhere. Crown jewels aren't up to much though. Outside is just as amazing and a lovely quiet square where we saw the guards changing at 11.30am good fun

Be sure to book!. We were advised to do a tour of Parliament, and after viewing stunning exterior it was clear why. I hadn't quite read my LP book properly and didn't realise that you had to do a tour at a specific time. We then went back the next day to get on an English speaking tour, fail part 2- It was full. So we booked for the 2pm tour and finally got to see it! We were told that the tour was about 45 minutes long, It took about 20minutes to get through the security- which was included in this time.Our tour guide spoke really good English and was very informative. The only issue was hearing what she was saying once inside as there was another tour running at the same time (not in English) so it was really hard to concentrate.The tour itself lasted about 20 minutes, In comparison to the size of the building what you got to see was minimal but extremely beautiful and it was interesting to learn about the politics, Be sure to take lots of amazing photos both inside and out!Definitely worth a visit!
Ode to democracy ????. Disney like parliament, in your face wow architecture, good french speaking guide, little mention of parliament and democracy mostly an ode to Hungary's past royalty

Simply Stunning. We booked our tickets online. We arrived to join the a English tour. Fairly chaotic as there were tours in Hebrew and German getting organised at the same time! Once we commenced it was wonderful, a real gem of a building. We saw the Crown Jewels, toured part of the central parts of the building and even looked into the main chamber. The decor and design is stunning. Would highly recommend this for any visitor to Budapest.
Very beautiful building. One of the main sightseeing of Budapest. The square next to it is a right place to have rest after a long walking

nice tour,fantastic interior. We took a tour around this wonderful building as in all the years we have been coming to Budapest have never actually seen the interior. The tour lasts about 30 to 40 minutes and covers all the main aspects you would like to see,ROUND ROOM,ORNATE STAIRCASES,PAINTED CEILINGS,STAINED GLASS WINDOWS ,etc,etc,just superb and a good insight to the Hungarian parliament. We stay in the Carlton hotel Buda side of the river and for the best views of this wonderful building we alway's take the BKK BOAT which goes past ,great photographic opportunities and the BKK TRAVEL TICKET,which is superb value allows you on the boat plus the tram's, busses and trolley busses, unbelievably good value. The parliament building looks especially impressive at night, illuminated perfectly, it just looks magical and seen from CHAIN BRIDGE, just perfect.If your in this wonderful city in my opinion take the time out to learn about this wonderful building with this nice tour.
Parliament. That is the most beautiful building in Budapest. I love to see that they preserved the history, and they still work there.

Worth visit. Had a half hour tour of the Parliament with our 2 year old sonWe booked our tickets online on the morning of our trip as EU citizens cost was 4,000 Huf you need to take passports with you but they never checked ours.I imagine at busier times you may need to book tickets a few days in advance. You have to book a guided tour. The building is very grand, saw the Hungarian equivalent of the Crown Jewels. Security takes about 10 - 15 mins to get through .Only advice would be to avoid the Cafe over priced and not great coffee.

AFTER MONGOLS, TURKS, AUSTRIANS, GERMANS AND RUSSIANS - AT LAST HUNGARIANS NOW CAN RULE THEMSELVES.. I stood on the hill above the Danube looking down at the Parliament House. "Why copy London's," I thought, "You people are extremely capable of designing your own unique building." - Even though a local, Imre Steindl, designed this; and it was completed only in 1904. After WW 2 the Russians refused to go home, and in 1956 Hungarians fought their hardest to 'encourage' them. The Red Star placed above this Parliament was not removed until 1990The entrance is just magic. The staircase, red carpet and the ceiling, are just beautiful!!Hungarians have a wonderful sense of color, usually based on red and gold.Similarly, the chamber and dome are color co-ordinated and very attractive. And to the attractions add 242 statues. If the ques are long - hang in there. - It really will be worth it! Brian, from Perth. W. Australia.

Impressive building and breathtaking tour. Me and my Hungarian girlfriend were lucky enough to be staying only one block away from the Parliament building, which is bigger than you could imagine from postcards and even from the river cruise view - Up close it is impressively huge.We took the English group tour around 2pm and the curator was excellent. We got to see the original royal crown (no photography allowed), which is heavily guarded by 4 guardsmen in the centre of the building. The place isn't lavish, but is smothered in Gold leaf and the grand staircase just makes you say WOW! What made this tour for me was the house of parliament itself (the round room, its history and coat of arms - photography allowed).I like this tour purely because not many parliaments around the world open their doors for an insight like this one. Truly breathtaking.
Parliament. The tour guide was terrible she rushed us and talked very fast. We didn't get anything out of the tour except spending money on a lousy tour.

Advisable to Book. Well worth visiting. The tour is well worth taking but it would be advisable to book. The tour lasts just over 40 mins. and the rest of the time is taken by going through the elaborate security checks. The whole building has been refurbished to a high standard and there are magnificent ceiling paintings by Karoly Lotz and stained glass by Mikha Rath (?)

Genuinely Stunning. One of THE buildings of Europe. Iconic, memorable, stunning. It never fails to take your breath away, day or especially night. Amazing as the outside is, a guided tour (2000 HUF Mar 15/£4.87) for EU Citizens is well worth the money. It only lasts 30 minutes but shows you all you need/want to see. Photography is allowed everywhere except the Main Dome, which houses the Hungarian Crown Jewels. The rest is extraordinary. Almost like a Disney set, but this is for real. Highlight of our holiday, and highly recommended.

Very Good!. We made the reservation of the tickets from the Internet because they have left only a few available in English. The building is marvellous. There is a strict security check in the entrance but it is for safety reasons! The inside of the parliament is beautiful, full of gold! I am sad though, because it is forbidden to take photos of the crown and the great dome! But it is worth visiting! Both inside and outside and both day and night!

Parliament. A must see attraction in Budapest. I think the best way to see it and take nice pictures is by river cruises, but also you can walk around it. We didn't visit the interior because the line on the entrance was pretty long.

Beautiful building. The building is impressive from outside, but to be honest I was not so impressed about the inside. I mean is beautiful, but after reading the reviews in here I had high expectations.The tour is educative and you can find many information about Hungarian history (at least their version of it - because you might disagree most of it if you come from a country that they claim it was "their territory") and about the Austro-Hungarian Empire in general. The English tour guide was well prepared and she answered nicely to all questions.In regards to the rooms, the entry and the mail hallway are charming while the parliament room is not as large as in other countries because there are only 199 parliament members. The building is symmetrical and has two identical parliament halls out of which one is used for the politics, the other one is used for guided tours. You actually visit only half of the Parliament, but you don't actually losing anything as the other half is identical.Overall it is a very beautiful building with an amazing architecture. If you are in a hurry I don't think you are missing a lot if you don't go inside, but you should definitely admire it at least from outside.The fee was around 7 euro for EU members (you will need to show and ID) and less (I think half) for kids/students. I don't recall exactly how expensive is for nonEU citizens, but I think a little more than double.

A beautiful building. A brief tour that gives an insight into the history of this awesome building. The internal decorations are stunning and if you like architecture you will not be disappointed. Very enjoyable.

Great tour. After a slightly chaotic start through the security gate, and confusion over where to meet the guide we began what was a very good, informative and worthwhile tour. The building is beautiful and I was very glad that we had made the effort to go on the tour
Amazing building. I am so glad tge first sight of this was at night it was stunning. In the day lovely, elegant and clean but night time was the time to capture it with your camera

Stunning building. As we didn't have a lot of time we didn't go inside but just wandered all around the outside, it's an amazing building, just kept taking lots of photos, hopefully we will come back and revisit and get to go inside.

Architecture to admire. The Parliament building is really impressive, and offers great photo opportunities for those who love architecture, or like to find interesting angles to shoot from. It is possible to visit the interior, but we were happy just admiring the exterior and snapping away!

Worth the Expense. The tour of Parliament is a little expensive for non-EU citizens, but it is definitely worth the money. The building is the most beautiful parliament in Europe and home to one of the oldest sets of crown jewels. The improvements they have made in the visitors' center and the ability to buy tickets online have streamlined the process so there is no more waiting in long lines.

Incredible. This is by far one of the most stunning buildings I have ever seen in my life. We didn't even go inside, but just walking around the building was a fantastic experience. It's clean, there are benches, there are other beautiful buildings surrounding it. At first glance, I honestly thought it was a palace!!
Impresive. Beautiful Building on the banks of Danube river. It is large, with nice ornaments. lots of history linked with it

Stunning. Beautiful, Unique! Day and Night, this is a must see, I have never seen any buildings like this before, it is too bad they cannot be toured, it is really cool to see the guards though and also to see the protestors out front! Standing from one of the bridges looking at the buildings is breathtaking at night especially!
Great but book online. Great guided tour although it's only 30 mins long. Book online to avoid disappointment - it was busy even in March

Don't visit Budapest without visiting here. The parliament building is incredible when it's lit up at night. Amazing to look at from the opposite side of the river. We also went during the day and there was a parade on with a brass band which added a little something extra to our visit.

One of the top things to do in Budapest. For a very cheap ticket, you get a nice tour which isn't overly extensive but they give you time to look around and the tour guide was very nice and knowledgeable. Definitely worth the money. Also, given so many of the buildings in Budapest are large and magnificent, but run down, it was nice to see one properly maintained!We had our tour from 10.30-11.15 so meant we got to see the changing of the guard for the crown jewels at 11. Definitely recommend for any ages/interests.

Beautiful Building. We last visited Budapest in 2006 and a lot has changed - it's getting a bit gentrified but I like what they've done with the park outside parliament. They've moved some statues and put new ones in. They've paved most of the park giving everything a more open feeling. On our latest trip we passed here most days and it was really nice to get a good view of Parliament
visit. what a amazing building and it so big, we didn't go inside on the tour which you are able to book, we took photos from outside

Beautiful at night. This building is the most spectacular building both at day and night although I have to say at night it looked amazing. Again very quiet and peaceful I was so impressed at how clean the building was and the grounds around were well kept even though it was February and not much grows. At night it was lit up and looked like a decorated iced cake the most beautiful ever.

Amazing building. Very picturesque. Just admired building from outside and worth seeing. Did not go to the museum just walked around it and then strolled along the river bank to Chain bridge. While strolling along the river bank came across the Jewish shoe memorial.

Lovely outside.. I went to the outside during the evening and enjoyed a bit of night photography. One can truly see the influence that Westminister in London had on this building. I returned the next day, hoping to go inside and see it,but it was closed for tours due to the session of Parliament and a speaker being there. I think I really missed out - especially after viewing the postcards in the gift shop. (Items in the gift shop very overpriced - check local shops before buying anything other than Parliament specific postcards here).

Beautiful. Historic place, very important to Budapest. The little tour inside is very worth the money. The ceilings are impressive, beautiful arts inside. You can't see much though, just a few rooms, still very good. The tour lasts around 40-50 mins and you can't enter by yourself. The Parliament is wonderful inside and outside.
Lovely looking building. Lovely looking building with an Idyllic position overlooking the Danube. We didn't pay to go inside, have a tour but overheard people saying it was well worth it.

Beautiful building with a story. You can visit the Parliament with a guided tour. Buy your tickets early as they are likely to sell out especially on the weekend. The interior was just as beautiful as the exterior!

One of the most gorgeous buildings in the world.. The building is indescribably beautiful. It's majestic, ornate, and very colorful. There is so much to see that it is impossible to take it all in. Every detail of the building is gorgeous. There are tours in many languages, and they sell out early, so be sure to make your reservations in advance.
Beautiful tour!. One of the best things to do in Budapest! Very impressive tour with an excellent speaking French (!) guide. What an amazing building with a very turmoiled history.
Average tour. Beautiful building and short tour but would have liked more information about the actual workings of Parliament.

5/5. What should I say! The building is absolutely stunning, inside and outside! Our guide gave us a lot of useful information and made the tour (which lasted around 45-50 minutes) really interesting. It was a shame though that we weren't allowed to take pictures of the crown. Highlight the grand staircase of course. Would visit again, the entrance fee is really cheap, especially for eu students.
Spectacular building. I would go again to gape at the architecture. The tour was a little average, but it is definitely worthwhile.

Budapest's Best Building!. We did not manage to go inside(need to book in advance) but went past the Parliament on the river Cruise and also by foot!This is the most iconic building in the City and looks amazing at night when it is lit up! Can't imagine that there is a more beautiful or impressive Parliament Building anywhere in the World!

very impressive. I really enjoyed this visit with a tour.Once inside the building it is very ornate but quite beautiful and grand.Our tour guide was pleasant and knowledgeable.There are a couple of niggles but they do not really detract from the experience.The first was booking which i did fairly easily but then could not so easily print the ticket. I only managed this with help however i now know if you get to the Parliament ticket office early enough they will print this for you. The tour is a bargain for EU citizens. Incidentally I brought my passport but was not asked for it.The second issue was the guards' officious manner. Both at the beginning and end of the tour they were rude and unfriendly. I am sure we all appreciate the importance of the building but I felt there was absolutely no justification for their unpleasantness.
a large building worth the visit. Only guided tours are available, in various languages. They take about 45 minutes. The royal crown can be seen there as well. It is worth it.

Tour wasn't great. Although the outside of the building is beautiful with amazing architecture, I would not go on a tour of the inside. The inside is beautiful but the tour does not provide great information about parliament. If you are only interested in what the inside looks like then the tour is for you. There was a lot of "heres this room and now you can take a picture" with no real information provided. Also if you are planning on going on the tour it is worth booking in advance.

Struggle to stop taking pitcures!. This building is massive, in both size and architecture! Even with a wide angled lens struggled to fit the whole building in when up close and personal. We did not go on a tour of the building, just admired it from the outside, and is a very dominant building when along the waters edge, at Castle Hill or even Gellert Hill!
Masterpiece!. Must be one of the most beautiful buildings in the world. Now its renovated so its almost white and shiny!
Fantastic Spanish Guided Tour. Impressive place! Worth a visit inside; 2000 forints for EU citizens. The Spanish guide was very friendly!

Whatever you do avoid Viator's tours of Parliament. I recently booked a day tour of the Hungarian Parliament and was forced to cancel the shortly thereafter. According to the Viator website I was entitled to cancel within 7 calender days of having ordered the tour. I filled in the appropriate form for a cancellation only to be told that Viator refused to refund my money but would cancel my booking. According to their terms I forfeited the entire cost of the tour but had I purchased their travel insurance I would have been covered. As I live in Sweden and had made the booking on a Swedish website Swedish Consumer Protection laws allow me to cancel all internet purchases within 14 days. Quite honestly this feels like a scam and Viator is apparently a subsidiary of Trip Advisor. This is not a good way to run a business and attract future (unsupecting) travellers.

Interesting place to visit. My wife and I visited the Parliament in March this year. You can actually undertake an organised tour of the Parliament for a small fee. However please book early via the internet as the small number of daily tickets available are sold out quite quickly. I did not mange to get on the organised tour, but there is plenty to see by just wandering around the buildings, which are located right next to the Danube. There is a Metro station right next to the Parliament building

Breathtaking Photo Op. One of the best photographic opportunities you'll ever have. Looking at the Parliament from across the river, or at night from the castle, is indeed breathtaking. The size is massive, the architectural detail and complexity overwhelming. Remember at night to use a tripod or prop your camera firmly. Also best to use a remote or a shutter delay to avoid camera movement and a fuzzy shot.

Changing of the guards. Missed the English tour. Guide book said it was closed on Sundays, but it was open! Watched, instead, the changing of the guard. Lovely building set on the banks of the Danube.
A real wonder. It's the most iconic building of Budapest and when you see it you know why. The inside tour is a must!

Massive building. The parliament was visible from the hill castle and it looked beautiful. Its well worth a visit , the building from outside and inside is historic. The tickets and tour can be arranged at the venue...

Quick tour!. This is well worth going to see. You will see a very small part of the parliament building, but what you do see is stunning. Beautiful stained glass windows, glorious ceilings, very grand chamber and lots of steps! We did get tickets on the same day - they run tours for different languages at different times. The English speaking guide was a bit tricky to understand.....
Magnificent. Sight of this building is amazing. Something you have very rarely seen before.It is something that leaves open mind person speachless...

breathtaking building. I visited the parliament building on the anniversary of the revolution, on this particular day the tour of the building is free and the entrance to the "Terror Museum" in Andrassy Ut is also free.From the outside the building is very impressive and imposing, it occupies a prominent position on the banks of the Danube which is even further enhanced if viewed from across the river on the Buda side.Inside you are not disappointed as the decor is extremely ornate and quite breathtaking, however, on this particular day, because the entrance fee is waived more people than usual went to visit and was primarily opened for all Hungarians for respect of the revolution therefore there was no specific English guided tour, however, there were English speaking guides on hand to offer advice and to answer any questions you may have.There are many places to visit in Budapest but I think the Parliament building should be at or near the top of any visitor's list of places to see in Budapest.

Good tour great building. The tour we had was only about an hour long but we didn't pay that much and it was in good English. The rooms we viewed were beautiful and ornate. We saw the crown and the internal guard change. Great experience.

A quick expensive tour. I would highly go to the website prior to your trip and book tickets. Even on a Tuesday in March the English tour was almost sold out. It is a bit tricky to find where to go because it is rather hidden on the back side of this building. Look for a very modern looking visitor center and go downstairs. If you have your ticket printed just wait until your time and correct language tour. People with coats may check them at a coat check. All people need to go through security. There are 130 stairs to climb before the tour actually starts. There is the option of using an elevator. The cost is 5,200ft and 2,600 Ft for students.A person may take pictures except in the room under the dome where the crown is located. This crown is not very ornate and the cross at the top is bent to one side. The crown may have been sent to St Istvan in the year 1,000. In the meantime, the crown has been stolen, misplaced and lost. Between WWII and 1978 the crown was at Fort Knox until President Carter had it returned to Hungary.The interior is decorated with 84 pounds of gold. The building was constructed between 1885 to 1902. There is a changing of the guard outside every hour. At the end of the short ceremony, a person may take a picture with them.The tour was supposed to last 45 minutes but by the time everyone goes through security, climbs the 130 steps, the tour is about 30 minutes.

Learnt a lot. We did the parliament tour (which we bought online) and found it really interesting. You get taken around the building while a tour guide explained things around the tour. Although the tour group for English was slightly too big there was always enough space and time given to have a look at everything and take photos.

Intresting but brief tour.... I enjoyed my tour of the Hungarian Parliament in Budapest but was a little disappointed that the state rooms were not available for view. Although I understand this is a working building and we were still able to view the dome room and crown. The tour guide was extremely knowledgeable and the focus seemed to be primarily on the history and architecture of the building which appealed to me. However, she did speak a little quietly and briskly which was a little problematic as the group size was around 50 on the last English tour of the day. My highlight was the guards change of position inside the dome, well worth a view. The photo exhibit in the basement focused on the recent renovations was not very interesting, particularly as the English translations were not easily available but you can always zoom through this bit if it's not your cup of tea.
So impressing. This is how a house of law makers should look like! impressive from the outside and the inside it is a recommended experience. The visit itself is well organized and well guided.

Just like being in London. The Parliament Building is almost the double of London's Houses of Parliament and on the tour you are informed that it was modelled on it. The best view of the building is from the Buda side of the Danube and from the top of the hill. The building is stunning in the evening.

Historic. Our friends took us on this tour. We walked it in the evening. It was beautiful. When you are at the top you can see the Chain bridge. Amazing, stunning.... There was some street musicians performing.

Absolutely stunning. Book a guided tour in your language and you will be enthralled, as we were. Stunningly beautiful building outside, and breathtaking inside, with stained glass windows, gold and marble columns and statues. Lots of unique stories told.... fascinating... don't miss it!

Incredible Building. One of the biggest parliament buildings in the world, 3rd largest if I remember rightly. Beautiful during the day and especially when lit up at night. Great from a river boat!! Apparently the tours underneath the building to see relics etc are well worth it but you should book in advance, I think they are at 10am.
parliament. What a fantastic building. Take passport as if you can prove you are an EU citizen they wave the cost. Architecture amazing. Lit at night and looks lovely.
Amazing pictures at night. I didn't go inside but you can get some lovely pictures. It's a must see. It's taken from English parliament building vet impressive

A magnificent building!. This neo-gothic building had me awestruck. Fantastic structure with ornate 'spikes'. Unfortunately, was ready to tear my legs apart from walking all the way from the Market Hall to see this great piece of architecture in the bitter cold so did not venture inside. The view from the outside by the river was mesmerizing enough, and worth the long haul.

Actually it was worth the wait!!. We were in Budapest for 4 days and had heard you need to go early to get a tour for the parliament buildings and that you need passport. We went about 10am and already all English tours were booked out for that day!!
