We were offered to book for next day but we're leaving that evening so couldn't take it, rather than miss out we opted to take the next available tour in any language as we had heard it was beautiful inside. Well we arrived a little late but the back of the tour was still going in (security check takes a while) and a very kind guard let us run up and catch them. Turned out it was an English tour, but we realised the Italian tour was just ahead of us. My point is the way they work groups you could tag on to any once your in as long as groups are big! The inside was Beautuful, stunning, gold everywhere, you see a few different parts of the building but it's advisable to look all around and up as there's so much detail to take in!While we were there there was also an official marching guard change over at the front (not visitor entrance) not sure how regularly they happen but was interesting to see.

Beautiful outside and inside. The building is most often shown by the media when Budapest is featured. It is huge, beautiful and wonderfully located on the Danube. The view from the opposite bank of the river is stunning.Tours are conducted in many different languages by very competent guides, where you can learn about the history of the building and its current many uses. As a matter of fact it was just recently renovated to its original splendour. The interior is very impressive, lots of gold on the wall, beautiful stained glass windows ( survived the war hidden in the basement) and opulent rooms. It also houses the royal crown of St. Stephen fiercely guarded by two men, sword drawn . No picture allowed in that room. It is certainly worth the visit.

Not worth it. Yes, the parlament inside is amazing. But the mess during the check-in was unbelievable. You can come in with your ticket only 5 minutes before your time after guide came. Guides were collecting their groups for a long time, cause they couldn't distinguish their groups, then security... So, we started 15 minutes later. We joined the Russian group and there was several Italians, who were left without Italian guide and were told to join Russian group. Is it ok? I don't think so, because Russian guide wasn't speaking Italian. For EU citizens ticket price is 2000 Ft, for others - 5200 Ft. The building inside is fantastic, but after this mess I wanted to leave.

Stunning. This is one of the most stunning buildings i have ever seen whether in the day or night or whether your close to it or from the other side of the river it just looks incredible, we also took the tour of the inside just as breathtaking.

Opulent!. We were lucky in being able to do a tour of the stunning parliament building. It was very opulent inside (well, and out!) with much gold and red in design. The English tour did go at rather a pace and some people felt we should have been given more time to take in the beauty and splendour - perhaps we should have spoken up. Well worth going - but take some identification as they need this for security before you can purchase a ticket.

Not worth the wait.. Joined the queue for the tour of the parliament only to find that the places were filled for the next 3 hours. Fortunately there is a good system which informs you how many places are available in each language for each tour. We didn't want to wait around so long so we just bought a guide book in the shop and read about the interior. Then we spent time taking photos of the exterior from all angles. It was a lovey sunny day so we didn't want to waste it waiting to do a tour. I imagine it must be very busy in the summer so would recommend buying a ticket in the morning for an afternoon tour then coming back after a day of sightseeing in the city.

nice to see it. Was a nice tour if you can prove your from the European it is cheaper passport drinking licence etc we only had an b&b card but she accepted that you only see four rooms but all very elegant worth it for the money
Beautiful building. This was for us the most beautiful building. It almost looks like a model. The domes and placement . We didn't have time to do the tour but it looked interesting.

Finally open. It's been under construction for a year and a half since I moved to Budapest. Looks like it was worth the time taken. Very close to the center, walking distance to Margit Island, St. Stephen's Basilica, and the Buda Hills. The square in front of the Parliament is a must for those who take low budget walking tours by themselves in Budapest.

Fantastically beautiful!. Budapest is a really beautiful city. But of course the parliament building is fantastically beautiful. Watch and take pictures better from Buda side. The hand itself takes the camera, when you see this magnificence. I went to Balinese massage Spa "5 Elements" and in the evening after the massage came out on the Danube embankment. View with illumination just funky!By the way, this Balinese Spa I also advise.
Beautiful. Beautiful building. Must see day and nBy night. Good view from the river cruise. Did not have time to go inside.

Great. We booked the apartment just across that building so this was the first and the last thing was saw from our balcony. It is difficult for me to say, where it looks more monumental or better, from the ground or from Danube. Both ways, it is really great building, in and out,.

Marvellous structure. The Hungarian Parliament building is an imposing structure and makes for a very good photographic piece both from the other side of Danube as well as from the front. This structure also looks amazing at night, when it is brilliantly lit up.

would like to have seen more. easy to reach metro line 2, off at kossuth lajos ter, and straight across the road. To enter it you have to go to the visitors centre which is round the other side of the building and down some stairs. We bought our tickets on line, was easy to do, as the tours get booked up. There are different languages at different time slots. The tour is only 1 hour and consists of a walk down a corridor to the main grand entrance, a look at the crown and then into a conference room and then one of the rooms where the nitty gritty stuff takes place. Would have liked to have seen more , especially the library. We did the 9.45am tour and saw the changing of the guards where the crown is kept. You can take photos but not of the crown. There is also a café in the visitors centre part, and toilets but you have to pay.

Don't waste your time or money. Our tour was ended after about 15 minutes as the guide told us we could not go proceed. She had no idea why. The whole group was very angry as there was no explanation, and we had walked up over 100 steps to see two rooms and that was it! The small part of tour we did get was poor quality anyway, and we could hardly hear the guide. You were also not allowed to take photos of the crown - the only good bit of the tour! :(We actually spent more time going through security than on the tour itself. What a joke!! Most of the group went to complain and were ignored by the staff who practically hid on the other side of the room behind their counter, trying to pretend we were not there. It was like they hoped we would all give up and go away if they ignored us long enough. They kept telling us they had called a senior manager who would sort the situation in 5 minutes.... It took OVER 1 HOUR until we were eventually refunded 50% of our ticket price. And still no apology! It was all very disrespectful, and they should treat their tourists much better.The worst part of this disaster was not the waste of money but the waste of time. When you only have a limited time in a city, you want to make the most of it, and if we had known what a shambles this place was, we would have gone elsewhere!DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME HERE! Even without our problems, the full tour is only of three rooms, and you won't hear or learn much at all. Security takes ages and staff are uninterested. Just take some nice photos outside.

cultural visit. Its was interesting to visit the Parliament, its just been renovated so I had seen it covered in scaffolding for quite a number of years, but inside its very interesting, they do visits in English which we booked from the hotel and we were picked up, but not taken back to our hotel but we were glad as we walked, at the back of the parliament is the memorial for the 1956 uprising, and we found by accident the wonderful statue of Imre Nagy.And the got on the No.2 tram that runs along the Danube back to the stop near the Intercontinental and Marriott Hotels.There is a wonderful bronze figure of a child sat on the fence, which my children have always called the King of the Fairies.Its is probably the most photographed thing in Budapest.

Great building and very good tour.. We pre-booked the tour but could probably have got tickets at the desk on the day. A great building from outside and inside with a friendly and informative tour and plenty of opportunities to take pictures except in the central dome. Really good exhibition at the end of the tour too, plus the usual gift shop.

Impressive. Very impressive building from the outside, the best photos taken from the other bank of the Danube or from the boat if you take a boat trip or use public transport boat lines. The interior not so much splendid but photography is allowed everywhere, do not forget your camera.

Mighty. This is one mighty building, looking as a whole or coming near for millions of details I can't imagine any of the modern rises competing with this one, the most beautiful parliament in the world.

Amazing!. The outside is amazing and so architectural, apparently based on the design of Londons houses of parliament.It also sits next to the River Danube. There is a visitors centre where you can buy tickets and souvenirs and use the toilet.I arrived on a special celebration day where the guided tours were finishing at noon and all that was left was a French speaking one!I didnt understand a word the guide said, but the inside of the building speaks for itself. You can take photos everywhere apart form the crown jewels, at least I think thats what they were!!If you are EU, take your passport as it is only 2000 Florins, about £5. It is also shut on a Monday, as are all museums in Budapest.Lots of steps and stairs so I dont know how you would fair if disabled.Also you go through airport style security before entry, which can take a while.
nice to visit. It is a nice palace with great architectural design (inside and outside) too bad that they only showed us only 2 rooms from the palace

At night. I was on 2 days trip, so i wanted to see as much as i can! So when i riched the parlament it was night, but i think that gave it an impressive look! It is on wonderful place and the architecture is amazing! Definitely must see

Architectural Beauty. This classic building is one world's great architectural beauties - that's why it seems to be featured in all those Danube river boat tour TV adds on PBS! The best view of exterior is across the river from Buda Castle promenade. Take the inside tour of the building (arrive early) it is an historic beauty. They let you take pictures everywhere so don't forget your camera.
A must see. please book in advance the tour and take one hour to visit this wonderful building. the outside is more suggestive than the visit inside. But please don´t miss it!

beautiful. If you are in Budapest, it is a must see. The tourguide isgreat, and the information shared is interesting. The inside architecture and beauty is breathtaking. The buiding outsiede is wonderful. You should be very quick for taking photos, as there is not much time given for it (most of the time)For non EU citisens the price is quite high.
One of the coolest house in europe. The building, the square, the location, and the whole package with the Danube is outstanding.Have to look at it!

Very short tour. Since the opening of the visitor center there were some slight change in the tour , they don't take you up anymore on the great stairways as they used to before which I found a bit disappointing, also the tour feels shorter but the building is still breathtakingly beautiful which compensates everything.
Wonderful looking building. No security like the UK Houses of Parliament, here you can get up really close to the building which is a must for a photograph.
wow. I haven't been wowed like that in a long time. SO beautiful! make sure to have a look at it from the Buda side of the city as well! breathtaking from any angle.

A must see!. The architecture is clearly world class. The marble walls and the intricate statues are quite remarkable. The statues of the most significant leaders through Hungary's history are great, as are the Crown Jewels.
Don't forget to take pictures.

Guided Tour. Booked the guided tour in English on-line before we travelled and printed off the tickets. Tour takes just under an hour so it is not too arduous.Very good guide who explained the history and operating procedures of the current Parliament. It is only @ 100 years old and modelled on the Westminster Parliament, however it is much more opulent and access is much easier!Definitely worth an hour, extremely interesting.
Well worth the tour. The guided tour of parliament was well worth doing! Make sure you taje your passport as its half price if you are eu member! Guide spoke excellent English .

Glorious building, shame about the tour.. By any stretch of the imagination this is a spectacular building but I wish that our tour had been a lot more informative about its creation and how it functions rather than have a guide who basically re-iterated what I could read in a guide book. As an EU citizen the charge for me was 2,000 HUF and not free like some guide books would have it. Given the brevity of the tour - 40 minutes tops - I would say that the value-for-money was a bit on the low side. There can be no doubt that the interior is opulent - gold leaf and marble everywhere - and the statues of the important kings and queens of Hungary's turbulent history are here in abundance but it could do with more information boards around to get a better sense of what made Hungary the nation it is today. Sadly, there is very little to reflect Hungary's history in the second half of the 20th century but I did visit during the week of Vladimir Putin's trip to Budapest so maybe anything to do with that era was purposely put under wraps.I could not get away from the feeling that the Hungarian Tourist Board have cottoned on to the fact that people want to visit the country's seat of power but they want to control this desire in order to financially benefit from it - no one could deny that the Visitor Centre looks brand-spanking new and is geared up to parting tourists from their money. It could explain why the tours are hurried and tightly controlled - you could not wander off exploring without causing a security incident !!!If there was one thing that did stand out for me it came at the end of the tour, when our guide left us in a room that showed photos of the restoration work done to the building to bring it up to its current stunning condition. These were fascinating, although again I could have done with some accompanying text to describe what was going on in the photos.So I would not make a particular beeline for this building unless it was my last day in town and I wanted to get rid of 2,000 HUF in change that I had collected. There are too many alternatives that are more worth your time, effort and money.

Spectacular. This is one of the beautiful buildings ive actually visited, we also did the tour of the parliment building, the inside was just as beautiful as the outside and the tour gives you a lot of information about the building, definitely worth a visit

Parliament tour!. I am giving this a 4 instead of 5 just because the tour we went on inside the building seemed to be pretty short. Although this didn’t mean it wasn’t informative, insightful or lacking in quality.The tour we were on was 2,000HUF as we were EU citizens, otherwise it was 4,000HUF. The guide was English speaking, with plenty of information about the Parliament. Just book your tickets at the visitor’s reception area which is at the northern end of the building.Inside the building itself is beautiful, you get a chance to see the crown jewels, however you are unable to take photos of them. You also visit the debating chamber& a museum at the end showing photos of construction& renovation through the years. You finish the tour in a souvenir store.Overall a great visit to a must see attraction whilst in Budapest!

Must see.. Expect to wait in line to see the gorgeous building but the wait is worth it. Enjoy the park in front of the building for strolling around. I believe they have tours in several languages. Close to my heart as my grandmother had worked on the beautiful gold leaf work in this building. Enjoy!

A beautiful and must see place!!. The building is simply amazing and it owns the most beautiful jewellery of Hungarian : the crown!! The tour guide exists in several languages and run out every 15 min!The visit is very interesting, you must visit if you are in Budapest!!
Majestic!. It's not everyday that you to get to see inside of a country's parliament. Fantastic architecture. A very enjoyable tour indeed. It is a pity entire place was not open during my visit.

Great tour of an amazing building!. Recently we took an English tour of the Parliament building and was very pleased with the quality. The guide spoke English very well. The history presented, the discussion of the architecture and ornamentation, and the overall knowledge of the tour guide was very good. I look forward to our next set of visitors to Budapest so we can take another tour. When visiting Budapest definitely take the time to tour this beautiful building and enjoy the history of it!

Beautiful architecture. We found the best view of the parliament building is from the Danube. It is very impressive, the intricate stone masonry is a credit to the men who painstakingly sculpted each nook and cranny. Not to be missed.

Afternoon at Parliament, Budapest. A very enjoyable tour of the Parliament building in Budapest. You MUST book tickets ahead of time. The building is exquisite, both interior and exterior. The only negative was that is was very difficult to hear our tour guide. Entrance is in an underground visitor center on the side of the building; there are few if any signs directing to the entrance. Tours are schedule by language so be careful.

Good tour. What an amazing building. You have to go in on a tour, which is really only about 30 mins by the time you get through security. We took the earliest tour in the morning which seemed to work well as lots of tours following us seemed to get stuck in the bottlenecks. The guide was engaging and informative, though the group was quite big so sometimes it was a struggle to hear her. The visitors center is very well organise, I understand it is only about a year old, and the square in front of parliament is lovely too, pedestrianised except for the trams.
Grandious. It's a spectacular building, the guided tour shows a tiny part of it. Worth the visit. I have seen it 4 times at least:)
Most beautiful parliament in the world. Personally an extremely beautiful building. We recommend the tour, where you will get a glimpse of the crown jewels and the parliament itself.

WOW!. The most spectaculre Place in Budapest. Beautifull in every way you look at it. I recommend getting in and taking the tour,since this place is amazing not only from the street view,but is also very unique inside.

Magestic. The Parliament has this magestic feeling about it. It reminds you of the British Parliament by Westminster as it is next to the river but i have to say the Hungarian one has a greater beauty with magnific red tiled domes.
SPECTACULAR. An incredible building, well worth a visit. About 100m to the north on the river bank is the Holocaust shoe memorial and that is a must see.
Imposing building . Apparently the biggest building in Hungary? A serious landmark and looks fantastic from every angle! Check out the interior too as it's rather opulent

Amazing building but short tour. This building is HUGE! I loved the tour, but it was only 45 minutes. I felt like I only got a taste of the building. I left wanting more. This was one of my favorite places in Budapest so you should definitely go. I loved the story behind each of the crown jewels. I wish I heard more about the Parliamentary process in Hungary.

Worth a visit. A really beautiful building which is definitely worth seeing, but make sure you take your passport if you're an EU citizen to claim your 50% discount on the ticket price.Other things to note -You can't access the Session hall on Monday or Tuesday because the MPs are using it.It took approx. 10 minutes to get through the airport style securely before the tour could begin.The tour lasts approx. 40 minutes.
Stunning!. Dont miss this building, especially at night. If you can take the river cruise. It is well worth it.

Not worth it. Our flight from Budapest was late at night, and we had a whole day to spend, so we decided to visit the Parliament. The building is absolutely stunning. (If you love architecture you have to visit Budapest!) And the area where the Parliament located is amazing.The entrance fee is really high, 4000 Ft (about 13 euro) per person. After visiting there I can imagine that they charge so much in hopes someday to cover for the building expenses. You can enter the building only with a tour guide they provide, and they have tours in different languages (if you decide to go check first the time of each tour). We took the tour in Russian (just because the English tour was starting 45 minutes after). The guide was a really nice old man who tried to be funny. The information provided in this tour wasn't something you couldn't read in a book, and basically you see to corridors, the main stairs (but you are not allowed to walk on), the hall where the "real" crown is being guarded and you are not allowed to take pictures, and the main hall where the Parliament takes place.If you have free time (approximately an hour) and you don't care about the entrance fee then go there and you will see the most beautiful Parliament in the whole world (based on our guides words).
Informative, funny and stunning. We didn't book and joined an English speaking tour. A good combination of spectacle, history, information and entertainment. A real sense of Hungarian history.

Pretty building/limited tour/inaccurately represented history. Having visited Hungary every year since 2000 we somehow managed never to be able to go on the tour of Parliament. Once we tried & the ticket office was closed due to broken equipment. Another time we tried the tours were canceled due to the presence of a visiting dignitary. We finally tried again when a friend was visiting us in B'pest & finally succeeded. Don't remember what we paid, but it was not a bargain. Although the building is quite sizable, the tour only covers a small section of the building. And one cannot take photos in the rotunda. Why? Because there, guarded by numerous soldiers is a REPLICA of the crown of Hungary. The actual crown is in a vault somewhere. From there we went to the hall where the legislators take their breaks & finally into the parliamentary chambers. All in all, the building was beautiful, but the tour was rather lame &, as is often the case in Hungary, the version of history that the guides give the tourists is not accurate in its portrayal of the roles various countries/governments have played in Hungary's history.

Stunning at night. This is the most beautiful Parliament I've ever seen. We didn't take a tour of the inside, but it's still amazing to see it from the outside. It's a gorgeous and very ornate building.Be sure to view it at nighttime from the Buda side across the river. It's stunning after dark when it's lit up with lights. It's very impressive and a must-see!
Nice day trip. Very educational and interesting. Tour includes information of the city. Buda side and Pest side. A must see do whilst in Budapest.

Simply stunning to view!. This building is the pride and joy of not only the residents of Budapest, but also everyone who shares in the wonder of this magnificent piece of architecture. The best views are from the Buda side of the Danube and it looks stunning at night time. Even if buildings and landmarks are not your first priority when visiting cities, you must make sure that you at least view this attraction as you will take away your own personal memory of true magnificence.

Book a tour ahead of your visit. Eclectic neo Gothic architecture with a Hungarian twist. This is apparently the third largest Parliament building in the world and is magnificent no matter which view you choose from the outside. The tour will take you around an hour to complete and you'll get a good flavor for the historic and contemporary Government. Personally, I really liked the old cigar holders reserved for each member. They rested their cigars here whilst voting and before returning to re-light and get on with the real business of running Hungary

Ornate Building. We visited the Parliament building twice on our holiday. We didn't take any of the tours inside but would highly recommend visiting, even if it is just for a look at the exterior. It is also interesting to go and see the changing of the guards.

One of the Most Beautiful Buildings. This is architectually stunning and catches your eye as one looks up stream from the Castle. With a Budapest Card you can have free tours around the inside. Well worth a visit.

The most beautiful Parliament. I visited the British Parliament and I must say that the Hungarian one is the most beautiful Parliament I have ever seen (queen Elizabeth said it was the second one, I don't agree). It is the third biggest Parliament in the world (after Britain and Argentina). After the Second World War the Hungarians reconstructed as much as they could and it is AMAZING. I tried to visit it in Summer but there was a huge list of people waiting so I wasn't able (if you go in peak season it is mandatory to book in advance). In winter there is much less people waiting to see this monument, but be careful and book your tickets anyway! There are tours in many languages and in the inside you can see the crown with which all the kings were crowned (since St. Stephan). Don't miss the Parliament, it is amazing.

Beautiful Building. Our last day in Budapest we decided we would walk along the River as far as this buildingWe did not take the tour so dont know what the prices are like The building was amazing from the outside and we walked all way round it was so clean and magnificent as it stood in the beautiful sunshine with the river in the background a must do when you visit BudapestThere is a beautiful area on the opposite side off the building were 2 guards are standing outside of the National Flag I had photos taken with one off the guards who never moved an inch There was a group of people setting up make shift tents etc to Demonstrate I got speaking to one person a lady who could speak English and she took time to explain that in recent times the demonstrators would have been removed by the police or military so they took their case to court and won the right to camp outside and hold their Demonstrations Very interesting trip

Stunning landmark. This gorgeous building is prominent from just about anywhere on the river on the Buda side. It;s beautiful both from far away and up close. Worth visiting at night when it's all lit up.

Freddie Mercury wanted it. Yes, he joked about buying it. :) Apart from this fun fact, the House of Parliament is beautiful, if you like old buildings, you definitely should visit. The outside is the best if you look at it from across the river, but it's definitely worth to visit the inside too, no matter how long the security check takes (not too much, anyway). The delicate decoration in the rooms and the corridors are truly amazing, and the guide will tell you many interesting details about how it was built. Since last year there's a visitor centre on the nothern side of the building.

Very interesting guided tour. I organized a guided tour for our group on February 11, 2015.Everyone liked it very much as it is so interesting, even when you don't like history. The tour took us around in 45 minutes' including the holy croon and the change of watchmen which is every hour.The building is in a very good condition and has a great story.I bought tickets in advance since it was a group but during the winter, there is normally no queue.

Not to be missed. The Hungarian Parliament Building is one of Europe's oldest legislative buildings, a notable landmark of Hungary and a popular tourist destination of Budapest. It lies on the bank of the Danube. It is currently the largest building in Hungary and still the highest building in Budapest.The building is 268 meter long, 123 meter wide in the middle, 96 meter high with the dome. The interior walls are decorated with 152 statues.The building has 27 doors, 29 staircases, and 13 elevators. The Parliament also includes an extensive library of around half-a-million books and documents, the huge reading-room is situated on the lower floor. Organised tours are available . Highly recommended to visit.
Really nice tour. The parliment was beautiful on the inside and on the outside. Also the tour was nice and informative, we saw a few rooms and the change of guards taking care of the crown

Must see. The Parliament is a must see in Budapest but for me it was more beautiful in the outside than in the inside. The entrance is not easy to find (on the left side when you look at it from the Danube). You can't visit it without a guide and the tours are scheduled by languages. Be careful to arrive at the time corresponding to your language. We weren't aware of that so we had to visit it in Italian..Don't forget to bring your ID and your student card for price reduction. We tough that the tour was really short and not at all representative.

One of the most beautiful Parliament buildings in Europe. It is one of the most beautiful and recognisable buildings in Budapest. It is in every travel guide and on a lot of postcards and souvenirs. It is a magnificent neo-gothic construction on the Danube's banks that impress everybody. You can admire it by day or even by night because it's silhouette is illuminated.TIP: The Fisherman's Bastion is one of the best spots to look at the Parliament building.It is easy to get to the Parliament by car or taking the metro and or tram. Near, in Kossuth Square, you will also see some monumental statues with national heroes of Hungarian history.
Budapest. You must come to see Budapest and especially the Parliament (I think this is one of the most beautiful building in Europe)!

The wow factor. really loved this. Well worth the visit. Take your passport to prove your country of origin as this reflects the price of your entrance. The tour is very well informed & truely a beautiful place

Lovely building. First saw parliament from across the Danube, then visited another day. The building is very big and picturesque, it was interesting watching as the guards changed their watch. Glad I visited such an amazing building.

A gothic palace that represent a beautiful country. I have been lucky to have been invited a couple of times from some deputies and the magnificent stairs take you back in time. Walking inside this beautiful palace is like walking back in history and feel all the important historical events that have crossed the doorways.A must visit in Budapest.

Fab!. Fantastic building. Looks amazing lit up at night, well worth a look. There is a boat tour that goes through the night, i didnt do it as the weather was too cold being January but its a great building with some lovely restaurants near it .
Beautifull building.. Very nice old building. After renovation that seems new outside and inside. You should make a visit if you are in Budapest.

Rushed. You can visit the Parliament via escorted walking tours throughout the day. If you're an EU citizen, be sure you have ID on you in order to gain a discount on entry, otherwise you pay double.The Parliament from the outside is beautiful and this continues inside too. You're escorted through various corridors and rooms and get to see the crown jewels (one glass case featuring a crown and sceptre essentially) which are guarded by two swordsman, as well as the speaking chamber.The reason I didn't give this a higher score is that our tour guide was miserable at best and the tour felt very rushed. On top of this, the guide would start speaking about the next stop long before the whole group had assembled.
parliament building. definately a place to visit ,very beautiful building and interesting history attached to the parliament

Beautiful. As we couldn't enter the building there is not much to say other than it is a beautiful piece of architecture and we have some great pictures with the parliament building in the background.

Fabulous!!. The Hungarian Parliament situated right on by the Danube is a must-see, especially in the night! It is marvellous and looks fabulous from the outside and is the same inside as well! It is a must do in Budapest!

Symbol of Hungary's independence. The Parliament, situated on the Pest bank of the Danube, is a symbol of Hungary's independence since its construction began after the signing of the Austro-Hungarian Compromise which partially re-established the sovereignty of the Kingdom of Hungary.
The best way to visit this magnificent building is to go on an organised guided tour.

Budapest parliament building. Wonderful visit. Spectacular from the outside but sumptuous inside. The debating chambers are incredible. First class guide and no hassle. A must see in this most impressive of cities.
Beautiful. Have to see at different times of day (beautiful during the day, spectacular at evening), great views from the river (a must in BUD)

Impressive Building. The Parlament of Hungary is one of the must for foreigners to visit. Here you see one of the biggest Parlaments of earth and can remind the time when Hungary had money. The are around the Parlament is also fresh renewed and in a really nice shape. If you want to go inside (guided Tour only) you can book Tickets for tours online. You can choose your favorite language and schedule. Costs are about 1500 Ft (5 Euro) Even if you don't want to see inside it is nice to go there. Closed a lot of other sights are located.e.g. - the Shoes at the Danube river, Place of freedom with a monument for the Soviet Soldiers who freedom Hungary from the Nazis - and a Monument reminding to the Occupation Hungary by the Nazi.
Great place. Beautiful buildings. The most beautiful view of the building in the evening with the walls of Fishermen's fortress.

Inside the Parliament Building. The inside of the Parliament building was definitely the highlight of my trip to beautiful Budapest. Inside was very elaborate and ornate and very regal. You are guided through the building climbing a grand staircase and onto the room where the Parliament meet and discuss.The inside of the dome is beautiful but be careful, you are not allowed to use flash photography and the guards are very good at letting you know that!This tour is definitely worth doing and queuing for and gives us non political people an insight into how governments spend their days.
Parliament. We went on a tour of the parliament and it was very impressive. Our grandchildren enjoyed it tooDo not miss it!!!

Just the best Parliament House. We viewed this from the outside many times and at different times of the day during our week in Budapest - it is spectacular at any time but probably at its best at night - it is just overwhelmingly beautiful.This is modeled on the London Parliament but we think more spectacular - and at least open to touristsWe took a tour of the inside of the building and were not disappointed - it is just as spectacular inside with the ornate decorations and use of gold. The Crown Jewels are not as impressive as others but do have an interesting background. It is also amusing to watch the guards go through their motions (if your tour is lucky enough to be there at the time).A must do in Budapest.Hint: there is a WC inside the visitors area but the cafe does charge - go outside and use the one there - its just as good and free (what a wonderful difference that is for we who come from a country that does not charge for toilets)

Great attraction. One of the highlights of my visit. Started by accident with the changing of the guard outside Parliament. A well choreographed display which ended with the officer in charge offering himself and his men to pose for photographs. A gesture warmly received by us all!Then the escorted trip through the Parliament by a knowledgeable guide. Worth every cent. Take your passport because as an EU citizen it's half price. A really impressive uilding and informative tour

One of the most stunning buildings in Budapest. Those who have gone to Budapest can say it is full of stunning buildings however, I think the Parliament building is the most stunning of all. Well worth a visit.

VIP Guest. Visited Parliament with my Fiancee, you will likely have to book ahead as the tours all seemed to be pretty busy, you can do so online or by popping to the reception area next to parliament during the day.The building itself is magnificent and well worth the visit. The day we did the tour the President of Georgia was also there which did mean our tour guide had to leave us to attend to some more important duties, understandable really, but it did leave us feeling a bit short changed as we had to tag onto the end of another tour in another language. That being said, I am sure its not a usual occurrence and I am not going to seriously fault the place for having more important people to attend to than some English tourists.

Exciting but very limited. We have been there last Jan. found it so exciting. The only problem is you are allowed to see a very limited part of the building but paying very high price if you compare with whole world's other museums. Guiding services is very helpful and done kindly.
Stunning at Night !. Truly one of the most stunning pieces of architecture in Europe. Has to be seen at night while on a river cruise. One of the highlights of Beautiful Budapest !

Great building. This is a beautiful building, unfortunately we didn't have time to look around inside only the outside for us. We did speak to some other travels and they showed us some photos of what we missed out on, which looked amazing.

Book ahead, follow the rules, 96 stairs. Book your tickets online ahead of time, as the tour you want will most likely be sold out if you try to walk-up. Read all of the notes and tips on the ticketing website, so you don’t break any rules. Tours are given in multiple languages at different times during the day. The Tourist Center (entrance) can be reached on either side of the Parliament (front/back). It is at the Margaret Island end of the building. Take some extra time and walk all the way around the building and marvel at the details. The interior is even more opulent, if you can imagine! This is a working Gov’t building and it treated as such, ie: armed guards and tight security. Guards are with the group at all times, and stragglers are prohibited. In approved locations, get your pictures taken quickly, because if you are in the back & can’t see, once the Guide moves on to the next room, the Guard won’t allow you to move forward to get your shot. When you go into the Crown Room, and they tell you “no photography” they mean it. There was a gentleman that must have thought using his cell phone camera didn’t count – and he was quickly grabbed by the arm and escorted from the room. He was never brought back to the group, so I don’t have any idea what happened to him! Something that was not listed on any review or any website, that we would have found helpful, was that as soon as you pass thru security for the tour, you have to climb 96 stairs! All… at… once! My 75 year old mother almost didn’t make it. It was flight after flight of stairs, and with the Guard on your tail, there was no time to stop and catch your breath. The tour doesn’t take long, and you will go thru all of the rooms rather quickly, but it is still magnificent to see.

Triumphant and magnificent. This parliament building is the mascot of Budapest. It lies on the river bank of the Danube and is very difficult to be missed. From the outside, it is already a great piece of architecture. It is well lit during the night as well. Internally, it is divided into two houses of Parliament. One of them is still in use while the other one is open to visitors. You have to be accompanied by a tour guide in order to go inside. The tour takes you to one of the hallways, the crown jewels and to the Parliament chamber which is not in use. The crown jewels are always guarded by two soldiers. And the room where they are placed has a wonderful dome. This is definitely worth visiting.
a grand building.. Like a european palace. Only thing lacking is artwork.Good to spend an hour in.Such a large building for such a small country , shows how large hungary use to be.

Nice tour of a very impressive building. On a very cold Sunday in February we were disappointed we had left a visit to the Parliament until the last day of our holiday since the area was deserted, all the doors shut up and only a few security guards to be seen; it’s closed on a Sunday we thought. However don’t be fooled! Keep walking round to the north side of the building and the visitor entrance can be found, not actually on the building as such but down some stairs into a modern constructed area which feels underground, complete with a cafe area, gift shop and free toilets. It isn’t brilliantly signposted so make sure you keep looking!You can only get inside the Parliament building as part of a guided tour which can be booked at the desk in the visitor area. These are organised by language and times displayed on the large display. We arrived around 2pm and the next (and only) English tour was at 3pm. Last tour on a Sunday looked to be around half four. It’s useful that they display the remaining places on each tour on the screen too. Prices were very reasonable really; 4,000HUF for an adult ticket. However if you are an EU citizen you get half price. They will ask you for some ID to prove this so tuck your driving license or passport in your pocket before you go.Our tour guide was perfectly fluent in English and could be easily heard across the group of around 35 people on the tour. We gathered at the electronic barriers and proceeded through security were bags are searched and bodies x-rayed. There is a free cloakroom here to save lugging too much around.The tour lasts about 30 minutes and begins by climbing around 100 small stairs to the main floor (there is a lift available if required). It was nice that photos were allowed in all but one area and the pace was good enough to be able to occasionally stop and look at some of the more non-obvious features. A great description was given of the grand staircase and then the decorations around the jewels and crown (the area where photos are prohibited). The only criticism I would have of the tour was that with the size of the group it was a little harder to fully admire the views inside the commons area; this is because fitting all thirty or so people into the two press viewing areas resulted in a scrabble to the front etc.For the price this is definitely worth a visit. Get there early in the summer or pre-book as only a limited number of people are allowed, especially if you do want a specific language tour. The interior of the building is even more grand and impressive than the outside and we learnt a lot of interesting facts and history about Budapest in general form the great tour guide.

Beautifully looked after............ Only saw from outside but visually Stunning and well looked after. Stunning views of the Danube and opposite bank. Lots of other attractions nearby. Will take tour of interior on next visit.

A must see. Its hard to miss the Parliment Building when in Budapest. Most would stand outside and photograph it. But I would recommend the guided tour. Its not long at all, and very interesting. They take you through one side of the parliment that is not in use, but identical to the "active side." Theres a lot of interesting anecdotes and history surrounding the building and the crown jewels are spectacular. The architecture on the inside is just as beautiful as the outside.
Golden parliament. Great views within the building a tour well worth the £ 5 it cost . The dome is particularly spectacular

Wonderful building & sight ever... It's one of my best experience to had a chance visited this place. You will more enjoy the sightseeing from Buda side in night time; the lights were so wondeful. I'm impressed.
Amazing!. Very beautiful building. So pity that it's not allowed to walk on it's balconys and have a look to interiors.

Parliament. I would suggest you firstly to book tickets online and in advance so you can plan your day or else up on your arrival tour could be sold out for half a day ahead.great idea of hungarian government on extra earnings as this seems to be one of the most popular things to do in budapest and great use of building while parliament is off the sessions.i dont know many countries (Brussels is in my mind on first hand) where this kind of service is provided

Could be better, but worth a visit. We got here to see the magnificent views but was a little annoying when it came to wanting to go inside. The tourist centre is to the far side as though you are walking away from the city and we couldn't see any signs telling us where this was. Infact the first day we didn't even see it. The second day we found it after walking round the building properly, but heard a couple asking some locals where it was. Need better signposts!When we went inside we were shocked as to how cheap it was so decided to go ahead. It was around £3/£4 The woman then told us the next English tour wasn't for another 3 hours. I explained we didn't want a tour and just wanted to look around, we weren't interested in the history etc but no, apparently this isn't allowed?! Then on the board I saw another 2 times before the one she had said for an English tour and it was saying spaces still available! We can't be the only ones to have walked out. Not everyone wants a guided tour. But apart from this, worth the visit for the exterior views.
Must See. This is a must see, you can not really see it unless you view from Pest or a 1 or 2 hour river cruise. Don't miss this building.

The most beautiful building in Europe. This is clearly a masterpiece of architecture, and for me, the most beautiful building in Europe. You NEED to see the Parliament building when visiting Budapest.

Don't miss it. Stunning exterior - especially lit up at night from across the river. Don't miss the tour inside the building - take your passport along for a 50% discount on the entry fee. Entry is only in small tour groups, we showed up at 9.30 to get on the 10.00 tour, but it was already booked up - but there were spaces on the (not advertised) 9.45 tour. Not sure if an extra one was laid on, but either way, it worked for us. The tour was informative and delivered in faultless English. The tour took in several of the most impressive rooms, and we were treated to the changing of the guard of the soldiers guarding the crown jewels. All in all, a must see - and lots of helpful background info too.

Must see for any visit to Budapest. Excellent location - 10 minute walk along the Danube from the Shoes Memorial. Spectacular architecture and scale. Lovely open space to view and take it all in. 2 guards guard the national flag and we were lucky enough to see the change of guards and witness the military ceremony that takes place at 1130 and 1230 everyday. There is a visitors centre with plenty of information, free toilets, a cafe, wifi and a souvenir shop. The tour costs 2000 Forint (about £5) for EU/EEA citizens. This was something that we missed as the guided tour language was not for another hour and a half and we couldn't afford to miss out on everything else with what limited time we had but from the other reviews it seems that we did miss out. An important piece of any visit to Budapest.

Stunningly beautiful building. This stunning building is one of the most beautiful I have ever seen. Modelled on the Houses of Parliament in London this gloriously beautiful building dominates the riverbank in the centre of Budapest. One of the best views is by night from the river when the city is all lit up.The square on which it stands is full of other impressive buildings. Some of them have small iron balls, like large pellets, in the places on he walls of the buildings which were hit by gunfire in the revolution against communism in 1956. We will be back to see inside!

Fantastic Building !!!!!!. Visited Budapest Feb 2015 Hotel booked us in for the tour, It was cheaper with a EU passport I was blown away with the sheer quality and splendour Not to be missed !!!!!!!!!!!!!!We did the boat trip at night and i got a wonderful photo of the building by night Brian (Lancashire England)

Magnificent building. There is a reason this building is always in photographs of Budapest. Lovely river location and even more beautiful on the inside. Tours start in the information center which could use a bit more organization as tour groups tend to congregate around the entrance gates. If you aren't paying attention, you might end up in a tour group that speaks the wrong language.Otherwise, you can take pictures of most everything except for the royal crown in the rotunda.

Unmissable. The city itself is incredible. Clean, safe, and a perfect mix between modern and classic. Even if you only see it from the outside it is something you must see, and I recommend that you visit it at various hours since it looks beautifull with and without loights. You can view it on foot, from castle hilo, and from amboat. All of these are highly worth it.

Stunning Building by Day or Night. This is probably the stand out building when visiting Budapest and it is a beautifully designed building which was actually based on the House of Commons (Parliament building in London) but with a traditional Hungarian flavour. A striking building whether seen in daylight or illuminated in the evening. We saw the Orszaghaz building from the Fisherman's Bastion, from a river cruise and by taking a closer look by stopping outside the front using Tram 2. It seems impossible to miss and would be a massive loss for anyone visiting the city
AMAZING. Amazing to see both in the evening when it all lit up and also during the day, I have taken some great photos on the river cruise, highly recommend it!!

Very pretty to look at. We didn't go in so it's not fair to judge but this is magnificent from the outside - best view is from the other side of the Danube. Also if you are at the parliament take a little time to walk on the riverside path (go left) and see the Shoes on the Danube exhibition which is only a couple of hundred yards away.

An amazing building. Unfortunately, we didn't get to go inside. Although we did appreciate the building from the outside. It was always a dominant building whenever you look over in to Pest from the Buda side.

Interesting. We booked on the tour which was really interesting. The state crown jewels weren't as impressive as they were perceived but the interior buildings gold decoration was beautiful. The tour guide gave interesting information and at the end there was a great 3D model of the exterior ad interior of the building. Photos allowed everywhere apart from the dome area. Well worth a visit
A thing of beauty. It's beautiful, well worth a visit. One of the better looking parlements in the world, in my opinion.

Imposing building. Very impressive building. Best photos are to be taken from the Buda side of the Danube, looking across to the Parliament building. There was a protest out front which always makes for a fun atmosphere.

Definitely worths visiting. When I went there, back in 2012, I remember that the queue was as long as 300m but luckily I had made my reservation online 1 week ago, I had also received my invitation so I 've skipped the queue and went straight at the front. The guard send me directly at the tickets office since I had priority and there I was...Not sure if you can still do the same as I have heard that the prices had changed but for sure it worths trying sending an email.Make sure you bring you ID with you, as you have a discount as an EU citizen and also your student card in case you are a student.More info you can find herehttp://www.jegymester.hu/eng/Production/480000/Parliament-visit
Very impressive. The guided tour Parliament was very short. The guide was have a good knowledge and have a good English.
Great architecture. It's better to see there in the night and in the day.

A guided Tour is a must. Being a political person I was very interested in this tour and our hotel very kindly booked an English speaking tour for us. The crown jewels were also kept these and there was a short funny ceremony when the guards changed! It was a pleasant couple of hours.
Superb restoration. The largest parliament building in Europe will take your breath away. From the stained glass windows to the statues to the overall design, a magnificent structure.
Must go!. The most interesting sightseeing in Peste! You should do the guided tour and you will understand part of the Hungarian's history!
Spectacular. We did not get to go inside. We only enjoyed the view outside and took lots of pictures from pest and Buda side. At night, it looks spectacular especially the lights.

Huge Pretty Bride of Budapest !. AWSOME view from OutsideBUT AVERAGE INSIDEStunning architectural Neo Gothic style. 1902 finished but looks older.Highly recommend to see this Parliament with 691 rooms.Specially in the night from Cruise river.Dont expect so much about visit inside, even its nice to see and suggested.for EU citizen it has 2000 HFR around 7 EUROS And for NON EU is 4000 HFR !!! 14 EUROSYou can reserve and buy your ticket in advance but for low season be relax to go when you want.The visit is with guides every 15 min and different language. they have cloak room and Metal security like airport so dont bring unnecessary staffs.Our Guide was ERIKA, very kind and knowledgeable, but unfortunately the visit finish earlier than you expecting. cause of next groups arrival.In the end there is a exhibition and some photos and model of the building.Languages and schedule• Hungarian: 10.30, 13.30• English: 10.00, 12.00, 13.00, 14.00, 15.00• French: 11.00, 13.30• Hebrew: 12.30• German: 10.00, 13.00, 14.00• Russian: 12.30, 15.15• Italian: 10.15, 13.15, 14.15, 15.30• Spanish: 10.15, 13.15, 14.15, 16.00

A tour worth taking. We pre-booked this online a week or so before we went to Budapest as we weren't sure how busy it would be. It was really cheap (like pretty much everything else in Budapest!), therefore good value for money.The tour is described as being 45 minutes long, but a chunk of that is lost going through security barriers, checking coats and so on - a necessary evil.It's a huge building, so in the scheme of things you don't see a lot of it, and at the beginning of the tour it felt very rushed, but there was more time to stand and look at things in the main areas, like the grand staircase, the crown room, the main chamber and so on. It's a very interesting and beautiful building and the background information from the guide was good.Definitely worth checking out, though admittedly the best part about this building is the stunning exterior. It's breathtaking.

Breathtaking architcture. While we didnt actually go in, this is a must for a close look. Guided tours inside depend on parliamentary goings on. This landmark is a feature of the skyline wherever you are and is stunning to behold. Took far too many pictures! Needs to be seen from the boat on a night trip - awesome!
What a building!. It has to be seen while in Budapest! We never Went inside, but I have a feeling it would be just as spectacular!
Great architecture. Great architecture and very beautiful view. Take photos of Parliament from Buda side of city. Go left from chain bridge
Elaborate, lots to see. even though the tour guide tries to rush you through, there is more to see than I imagined. very worthwhile.

must see. We visited the Parliament by day...it's overall an impressive building. We bought out tickets from the hotel reception, so we arrived there, took lots of pictures and waited for our english guide. By night, that's when the Parliament is truly stunning. It is definitely a must see in Budapest
Beautiful. Beautiful building, nice experience, If you are visiting Budapest I am highly recommended. It is very nice outside the building, but inside is also really charming.
Worth a visit. Lovely building with beautiful interior. Take the lift up if you can- it was used by the Prime Minister private meetings.
Stunning. Possibly one of the most imposing and beautiful buildings I've ever seen. It is definitely best viewed from a distance otherwise you'll miss so much of it!

See it at night!. I stumbled upon Parliament when I was walking back from a club at 5am in the morning. The place is huge! It stands against the backdrop of the danube, i imagine there's tours and stuff, but see it at night, it's quite a sight!
Must see. The Parliament buildings are an absolute must see for any history buff. Easily accessible with tram or metro.

Wow!. Great 19th century architecture, impressive building from the outside and from the inside.
Don't miss a tour inside!

Could be fantastic.... The Parliament as a building is pretty spectacular, however the visitor experience needs some work.The ticket office staff made everything seem like hard work, no smiles and just not a great initial experience.Our tour guide was friendly, but the tour takes you in 2 rooms and then you're back to the shop.Overall not a great visitor experience which was a shame as it could be great.

Stunning by night!. This is absolutely stunning when illuminated at night and certainly is a very grand building. Can only comment about the outside which we walked by during the day and took a boat trip at night. Must see!!
Tour was brilliant . Worth every penny. Such a beautiful place and the tour guide was so funny and great. Well worth a visit as both outside and inside are breathtaking.

Great to see from the outside and the inside. Wonderful new museum and entrance to the visits inside Parliament. Highly recommended by our guide for the day, Andrea Makkay from Budapest Guide and well worth the 45 minute tour plus time in the museum. You can book your entrance ahead of time and I encourage you to do that as it can get crowded. In addition, you'll want to make sure the tours are running the day you are planning to go or you could be disappointed. The jewels are very very special and the house where the parliament resides is quite spectacular.

A Must-Do. You must definitely see this! It is a remarkable structure with a beautiful interior. A tip: either show up early or get reservations online. The tour is about 45 minutes long but I felt like I got a good experience for it. They are pretty liberal with letting you take pictures, except in the dome room where the Crown Jewels are (sadly, the best part). There is a cafe and restrooms everywhere. You can take the 2 tram to get there.

Okay tour!. We were in Budapest for over a week, so we added this to our itinerary. If you only have a few days, I would skip the formal tour. Of course, it is very worth while to walk by the building at night as it is lit up beautifully.I had reserved the tour tickets on the website prior to the trip, but still had to pick them up at the ticket desk. We almost missed the tour, but after a long queue for security we finally made it. The tour itself is mildly interesting and you only see a very small portion of the building. Several Christmas trees were decorated in the main hall, which were nice. I am glad we toured the building, but would not go back.
great place. I loved to walk around in this area. It's really impressive. normally we didn't had that much time but I'm grateful that we decided to do this anyway! Really worth to visit !

ah, for sure, see it by night, and approach by water. Seeing Parlaiment lit up at night is one of the most spectacular sights you'll ever see. Best seen across the river or from a ship. But see by day too, because there's always something going on, and the surrounding gardens are beautiful. On our visit, there was a fascinating demonstration going on.

Stunner!!!. I stumbled across this little beauty after an amazing dinner the btw was cheap as chips. It is a truly wonderful building all lit up at night. Unfortunately I had no time to take a tour, maybe next time?!

imposiong and always photographed. This is an imposing building and is worth the tour inside to see its scale and amazing architecture . Buy your tickets a day or so ahead of time it is a very busy venue and lineups are long

Very impresive. It has both an impressive exterior and an impressive interior. Loved the tour - although short, the guide spoke pretty good English. I also loved the fact that E.U. citizens pay half price. It was the highlight of my Budapest visit. If you travel to Budapest, definitely go there!

Awesome Gothic arhitecture.... ...and nothing more to say!
It's the first sight seen necessary to visit I mean!
You can the best photograph it from Buda side of from the bridge.
Didn't get inside but . But... It looks so btf, especially at night with all the lights on... U can see it from far away. Can't wait to go back so I can try to get inside .

great building. easy to find this building, a few mins from central ,just take tram no 2, and stop in front of parliament.
its really beautiful ,best time to visit at night
spend your evening sit around parliament and danube, you will love it!

OMG!!!!. This was so beautiful at night! it's incredible from the water and plenty of time to take a lot of pictures, you won't be able to stop snapping shot... I'm from Paris... but was bluffed by the beauty of the Parliament at night!

Beautiful Place. There are guided tours in every language along the day. It is worth paying but it is forbidden to take shots at the very center of the parliament where the royal crown is guarded by soldiers, What a pity!!

Powerfull building. When we arrived in Budapest by night we saw it first time and it was amazing. When we came out from metro station we came from the back side and very near to it so then you can see how huge really is. We stayed only two days in Budapest so didn't take guided inside tour but we find best place to take photo. If you want to take best photos go down to the bank of Danube and then with metal bridge to mobile boat station. Photos from ther will be unforgettable.

Beatiful. Great building really nice interior. Worth a look at the crown. I booked a tour and it was very informative. The renovations have transformed this Parliament House into one of the most amazing buildings in the world.
Parliament Visit. Nice place to take pictures and move around ..This is very close to Danube river and it is reachable by Tram and local buses .

All those exterior pix do not do justice. Everyone has seen the photos of the Hungarian Parliament building. It is situated beautifully on the Danube. The interior however is amazing. Beautiful wood and marble everywhere. I went on an English speaking tour of the building which was a big large but still came away filled with awe and appreciation for what went into building such a masterpiece. Many may think it is just a boring govt. building but is more than worth the cost. Hungarians have every right to be proud!
Simply amazing. This is the most beautiful building in all of Budapest, not to mention the way it lights up of a night.

Amazing place, but tour guide was sub-par. The Hungarian Parliament is an amazing building to see, and the tour explained the structure of their government. However, the guide acted as though she was not happy to be at work, to say the least. They have a nice selection of gifts in the shop (the girls in this shop were nice and helpful). Tour was a bit expensive for the price, but a must-see, if you want to understand how the govt operates.

outside view only. Ranked one of the largest parliament buildings (were told second to Westminster), these lovely structures on the riverbanks are beautifully lit at night. Surely a tour of the inside is well worth it, but just seeing them and walking around is an esthetic pleasure.

Worth a visit. After seeing the parliament building on a nighttime boat trip, we went the next morning for a tour. What a beautiful building inside and out. The tour with English guide was brief (1 hour) but we saw the legislative chambers and central lobby, both of which were just beautiful.

only saw the exterior. I believe there are times when you can go inside this beautiful building, however, when we were there it wasn't open to the public Walking around it was just amazing with all the workmanship. you can see this from the near by bridges as well as the palace hill and get some beautiful photos of this building.

Nice building to walk around. The exterior of this building is very amazing.It is worth to stroll around the building just to enjoy the detail of the building.It is worth to come back again in evening to see the beauty of the building with exceptional lightning.I did not go inside the building so I cannot really comment on the inside due to long queue.

Guided tour. Cannot just wander round by yourselves have to go guided tour, but they offer English language very frequently and several other languages available. Interesting tour, magnificient inside and out. Our tour guide was a very knowledgable, friendly guy. Only gripe is - not long enough! The buildig is massive would've loved to have some time to wander round and see what else goes on in there. You do get to see the crown jewels with the guards at either end. Interesting stuff.

Take the Tour. I debated whether or not we should take this tour on our trip to Budapest. My husband and I had very few days to spend in the area and even so, I'm so glad we went. The building itself is amazingly beautiful, it's worth the price just to walk the halls. The tour guide was very good as well. It's not a long tour, but they used the time well and there's something for everyone - an insight into the government, tradition, and craftsmanship.
Very impressive. the parliament is very impressive, especially at night overlooking it from the other side of the danube river!

Highpoint's of Trip. Loved the architecture and history, the building is just beautiful. It would have been nice if the tour was longer, but it the entrance fee was quite cheap for EU citizens, students or both.

Great building. A great building to admire from the outside both in the day and night.There's a little guard change every now and then (I think every hour..) - nothing close to London's, but it's nice and refreshing to see it.We took the guided tour inside, for which I have mixed feelings: on the one hand it's really interesting to see what's inside such a beautiful building - and it is really nice from the inside, on the other hand I don't think it's worth the entire 4000HUF (12 euro) - the explanation was good and clear but wasn't that amazing and didn't have many astonishing stories as you'd expect from such a building. Luckily there's a considerable discount for EU citizens (half the price) and even more considerable for EU students (1 4th the price!).To sum up: I'd recommend the tour only if you have time left, but it's not mandatory.

Nice and educational!. Guided tours inside the Hungarian Parliament are very well organised and extremely useful, if you are interested in getting an idea of their history and political system. The building itself is awesome..
Beautiful place. This is an amazing place at night. I have not been inside yet but if its anything like the exterior it will be fantastic

the parliament. This parliament is the second larger parliament in the world. It was built on the example of the London one and it is in an eclectic style. The guided visit is interesting and short enough not to be bored.

Parliament House tour. Did the Parliament House tour and was a bit disappointed as the tour only lasted about 40 minutes, cost about $20 AUD and with other language group tours going at the same time, it was very hard to hear our guide. The parliament house building externally is magnificent and I would say a good look at it from land, the river Danube and across the river from Buda is all you need.
One of the best sights in budapest. Stunning building to look at! We took the tour and thoroughly recommend it as you get to see the hungarian jewels as well as the grand hall and the houses of lords

Excellent Attraction and Design!!!!!!!!!. You should visit for sure!!! All that lights all that historic design it makes me to beleive that I am in onever period of history!!! You should visit for sure!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Definitely a Budapest must-see attraction!. Surely one of the Budapest must-see attractions, located on the Pest side bank overlooking the river Danube, just in front of the Fisherman Bastion, on Buda hill, ideal location for a wonderful Parliament panoramic photo.The Budapest Parliament has been built, starting from 1873, based on design of Magyar architect Imre Steindl, according to Neo-Gothic style (it can be easily recognized from the large amount of pinnacles, scattered on its full covering extension); nevertheless, even further styles can be found, like Neo-Renaissance of the dome.The building shows two exactly identical wings, symmetrical in respect of the central dome; one of such wings is dedicated to tourists’ visits, while the other one is utilized by the politics (and prohibited to the public).A very huge amount of bricks (millions), precious stones (hundred thousands), and even something like 40 kg of gold have been utilized for its construction, which involved almost thousand people; that resulted in a building that, even today, seems to be the tallest and biggest in Budapest.The Parliament can be visited exclusively through a guided group tour, that is arranged daily, at different hours between 8 am and 4 pm during winter season; I strongly recommend to buy the ticket on-line quite in advance (on web site www.jegymester.hu), to avoid long queue and even tickets sold-out.The guided tour is arranged in several languages (relevant tickets sale is properly diversified on above mentioned web site); the ticket fare is 2000 Ft per EU adult (about 6.50 Euro, plus 200 Ft for on-line purchase).Any visit is starting at the underground visitor center, where different nationalities are gathered; at the visit time, any person has to go through a scanner, for security check, and the group will be picked-up by a guide and a guard.Once left the visitor center, we entered in a gold-plated staircase, taking to the main floor of the Parliament; along the way, richly decorated corridors, statues on the walls, stained glass windows looking at Kossuth square, wonderful ceiling frescos.After that, we arrived at the Old Upper House Hall, presently dedicated to conferences; there, we’ve been delighted by the oak panels and paintings adorning the wall behind the podium, the lovely gold-plated decorations, the tables and seats. Several galleries are located at different floors, allowing the people to follow the Upper House’s meetings in the past.Continuing our visit, after passing through the Upper House Lobby, we’ve been introduced to the Dome Hall, the only ambient where photos are strictly prohibited; it’s really difficult to render the magnificence of such huge majestic hall, symbolic center of the Country. At the center of the hall, the Hungarian Holy Crown and other symbolic objects are protected, inside a glass case, by two Crown guards.Last step of the visit was the Grand Stairway, leading to the main entrance hall of the dome; its ceiling shows some frescos made by Karl Lotz, which masterpieces are even present at the Opera House and other important Budapest sites. Even there, the rich decorations left in our eyes a strong feeling of opulence…My overall impression has been fantastic! Good organization, guide very skilled and speaking a very good Italian, time of the visit properly arranged, in such a way to calmly see anything, and consolidate the information got from the guide.
Very interesting and also beautiful building !. A representative attraction for Hungarian culture and history, located near the Danube, in a scenic landscape. A must-visit in Budapest !

Magnificent architecture.. Day and night you can see the Parliament standing there from everywhere. It's really magnificent and awesome. If you take a closer look of it, the detail and delicacy are beyond words. You should definitely visit there!

Beautiful. No other words to be said.
We had no time to enter but although it's not an ancient palace, it's spectacle to be seen both during day and night

Magnificent view at night. visit this place at night...such a beautiful building to see especially at night..i called it charm of Budapest.. you'll get a chance to see entire pest on the opposite side of this building.

Interesting tour. Very nice tour , interesting . Comfortable buying tickets over the Internet , the place with a special history , showing the rich past of Hungary , amazing building capacity . Give an hour and a half of good history .

Great building from outside, little less inside. Tours are usually booked out for the current day, so you need to get the tickets in advance for a following day on site, or buy and print them online, opposed than mentioned everywhere it's not free for EU citizens except those before 7 yearsThe tour itself is quite short 30 minutes + 15 for the securityIt gives you a rough overview and some facts but no more details

Beautiful Building short and sweet tour :). What a beautiful building! We took part in a tour of the building, the tour was informative and it was lovely to get to see the internal beauty of this grand building. It was just long enough to get a feel of the Hungarian parliament and history of the country but not long enough to get bored. Just the right amount of information.A warning for people planning to take part in a tour. The price at Parliament (for EU citizens) is 2000 but for students (bring your I.D) its only 1000

Worth the cost. This is a lovely 45 minute tour of 4 of the several hundred rooms within Parliament, including the central dome room, (wherein lie the crown jewels!) and the great hall. The architecture is breath taking, and the tour guide proved just the right amount of information on the history and politics of Hungary.Although not listed on the website, there is sometimes a 9:45 English tour, which then allows you to see the changing of the guard around the crown jewels.

If you want to know the Hungarian History this is one of the places you should start your visit with. The building is exquisite. If you are into Architecture, History or Politics, you should visit the Hungarian Parliament. Guided tours in international languages (besides Hungarian) are available, you should request that. It is a very beautiful building, a joy for your eyes and senses. I have visited several Parliaments in Europe, but this definetly my favourite one, in every possible sense.
Amazing opulence. Beautiful building, never seen so much marble & gold in one place! Good guided tour, very informative.

One of many highlights in Budapest and an iconic landmark you will always remember. This incredible architecture jewel on the Danube is worthy of your time. Please admire the outside all 4 sides, but you must go inside to appreciate the many treasures and the cost that was incurred to build this opulent building. Excellent tour and one of the most impressive parliament buildings in the world for visitors to see. Visitor center downstairs was another great stop as well.

Worth going after all. Despite of waiting time and the relatively short guided tour, we were glad we went. The Parliament is by all means impressive.
Remember your passport and take into consideration that you have to pass a security check.
Beautiful interiors. Take the tour into the Parliament - it is worth it. It is very beautiful, especially the dome, where the crown jewel is kept.

One of the Most of Beautiful Parliaments. I did not get chance to see the parliament from inside.But I saw it from Road, from water, from Buda. It looks amazing from everywhere. It has a big garden. I visited the place in Oct-14. It was summer and flowers were beautiful.Hop on and Hop off bus service takes you closer to Parliament in all 360 degree directions.Parliament oversees the Danube river. Legislators might be having a very good view of the river from the parliament.

Wow! . The most beautiful Parliament building in Europe i presume. Amazing architecture, the building lights at night until 24:00 and is best enjoyed if you have a hotel facing it in Buda area. A must see.
Amazing. If you can book a tour do - was well worth it - the main lobby is stunning and very ornate. You get to see inside the debating chamber too - beautiful building
SUPERB!. The volume of the building and the interiors made me speechless. Despite the cold I couldn' help gazing at it. A miracle of architecture indeed

Wow. A clearly impressive building or buildings! Larger and more impressive than in London, but still very similar. Well worth a visit. Also try to get there at night when everything is illuminated. Wowfactor
Great at night !!!. Gorgeous! Great architecture. Breathtaking .You cannot miss it.day or night.Represents most of Budapest. Definitely will return ASAP!

Make the effort. Well worth the visit, amazing architecture, just stunning. But worth the waiting around for the English version of the tour. Nice cafe to have a coffee while you wait and clean toilet facilities for a small fee
Impressive. This Parliament building is a lot to walk around! But amazingly impressive at night. We saw it at daylight and was nice, at night is another story.

Majestic. Having seen a great deal of architecture in different countries, I would say this ranks at the top of my list for must see. It was especially beautiful at night with the entire structure flooded in all its glory.

Need to book in advance. Following the guide advice, we booked the visit in advance. The visit is very popular so do not be surprised to see this place crowded. The museum guide are excellent and provide you with rich information from the place. It is nicely renovated knowing that the whole roof has been burnt. Bonus: you will have the chance to watch the Hungarian crown and the royal soldiers having their salute every 5 min. Worth the visit.
