Overwhelming. If you are Hungarian or not, does not matter.The Hungarian Parliament buildning is one of the most beautifull buildning is the world and if you ever visit Budapest do not avoid it. It is almost impossible to describe in words, better to experience it.

Impressive gothic architecture. The Parliament building is huge! It must rival Buda Castle. It's impressive gothic architecture is interesting and tasteful. Sometimes gothic architecture can be "creepy" with the gargoyles and stuff but this had none of that. It was beautiful.
Ken Kleins' Review Parliament Building. Pattern after the English Parliament the interior is amazing. This building is huge. Please visit you will not regret it.

Be Careful. My husband tried to tie his shoe and was severely reprimanded in Hungarian for stopping and stooping over! Don't be surprised if you're asked for 'your papers'. Never leave home without them!

Stunning. This building is like a great ball of extravagance on the banks of the Danube River. By day it's stunning, standing out like a treasure chest when you look out across the city, by night it is one of the most beautiful sites I've seen through my travels. It's incredibly grand and really has the ability to take your breath away. I recommend viewing it from Buda Castle by day and from the pavement across the river by night. Don't miss this incredible site!

Huge. Huge building on the banks of the Danube. Very easy to find and magnificent to look at. You can go in and see some of the crown jewels, which are just as stunning as the building they reside in.

Nice building, average tour. It was nice to see the interior of the stunning Hungarian parliament building, but we expected way more from the offered tour.Out guide was nice, but the group was too big (about 40+ persons) for her; in fact I felt sorry for her. She gave some general informations about the building and only a short overview on the Hungarian political system, but only half of the group could hear it because she didn't speak loud enough (I'm sure she knew that people in the back wouldn't hear her, but she made no effort to speak louder - on the one hand I can understand that she didn't want to ruin her voice, but nevertheless you can expect to get a real tour for your money).The tour itself leads you threw the corridors of the parliament and into 4 (!) of the 691 rooms. As said in the title, it's a nice building, but the tour itself was rather poor.
Must see. Tickets are limited, so arrive early to buy guided visits. The building is very beautiful and worth the visit.

Beautiful but chaotic. We had booked tickets online in advance and if I can make one recommendation, it's to do this. We booked for a 12pm English speaking tour and when we got there, only four English tickets remained for the whole day and even then not for 2.5 hours which would have put us off. Plus there's a queue of about 60 people between you and the ticket desk!When we got there, the visitor's centre hall was swamped with people queuing. We had a frustrating wait at the info desk to check we could queue for security as we already had tickets, complete with a group pushing in front of us without waiting and then being served!Once we got into the queue for security we were sure we'd missed our slot. We were held in that queue for a long time, eventually it started moving and it turned out most of the queue were people trying to push in ahead of their time slot. The couple in front of us had tickets for 2.30 (it was midday at the time), and luckily the woman at the gate refused to let them in despite their protests.You go through scanners and the. Get met by your guide. The slot is 45 mins but you get walked around for about half an hour. It starts with you climbing 130 steps. Not a big deal to many, but worth noting if you struggle. There is a lift, but it was only a purple of minutes.The building is beautiful, well worth the entrance fee, and the guide spoke perfect English and gave us lots of information about the building and the history of the place. The tour ended in the parliament chamber, which was really interesting.All in all a worthwhile visit, but just make sure you book tickets in advance and don't freak out at the chaos in the entrance hall!

excursion feedback. We have visited the parliament on 29/12/14. they do several tours a day for different language groups - English, Russian, Spanish and German. if you are EU citizen - bring your passport - you will get tickets at half price. book tickets early in the morning for the same day. otherwise if you will come at 12 pm for 2.30 pm tour, most likely they will have sold out for the day Parliament building is very beautiful and the guide spoke very good English and told us some very interesting facts, however, the tour felt a bit too quick.

stunning building. Stunning building and worth a visit. You need to book tickets in advance - you can do this from tourist info places and is cheaper for EU citizens. Although the tour is worthwhile it is only 45mins and 15 mins of this was going through the airport style security. The café is nice and reasonably priced.

Budapest Parliament. One of the most beautiful buildings I've seen! Guided tour was included in our visit, inside is palatial and beautiful but the guards are annoying. We couldn't stop to get a picture out the windows without them hurrying us along. You can get great shots from Budapest Castle, Fishermans Bastion and each of the bridges.
Amazingly beautiful building. The building is so big ... so beautifully decorated. In my opinion, should not be missed. This is a really special place.
A must do if you are in Budapest. Spectacular building both inside and out, Very professional visitor facility and tours, book in advance to avoid queues

Stunning inside.. We booked our tickets online for a time that suited us. This worked very well, as it was very busy when we got there. The tour is only 45 minutes, but it was very interesting. It is a stunning building and the inside of the parliament is very ornate. Well worth a visit.
Iconic. We didn't go inside so I can only review the outside. But it is stunning, whether you see it from the bridge, the water or from the hill. Beautiful building.

Budapest Parliament Building. Truly beautiful building and an architects delight. Number 2 tram runs right alongside. There is an entry charge but frankly this is a place best viewed and enjoyed by walking all round. The small cafe on site is free to enter and the food/drinks available are reasonably priced.

overpriced visit. The building is incredible from the outside and one of the main attractions to see in Budapest. But that's it. We decided not to go through with the visit due to the prices. 16€ for non EU citizens and 8€ for the rest. Go through it if you absolutely want to see it, but for us it was not called for.
Relatively short but very interesting tour. Lovely building, both inside and out, and an informative tour of the Hungarian Parliament. Only lasts about 50 minutes but well worth the money.

Biggest building I've ever seen. My grandma who has been to 112 countries said this is the biggest building she has seen except for Santiago de compostela in Spain. But it is the nicest one I have seen. So much to see around this building. Also shoes on the Danube is right there. They tell you it opens at 8am but you are required to get a guide and it doesn't start until 10 and you can't buy a ticket the day before. So plan ahead. Tour only takes you through 4 rooms, 3 of which you can take pictures in. Costs 4k Hungarian or 2k for non EU students. 1k for EU students. It's definitely worth the 4k thoughthough and I'm cheap

Closed when we got there. The Parliament Information Desk told our hotel concierge that the building was open but when we got there, it was closed. There was a labour rally going on outside and we think they closed for security reasons. But they should have told the concierge that before we went there. Anyway, the rally itself was interesting (sort of like being in the old Soviet Union...) and the exterior of the Parliament was gorgeous. They are preparing an interpretation centre to open in spring of 2015 that will help English-speaking visitors understand more of the history, etc.

Beautiful building, horrible tour. We visited this parliament building on Monday.2014.December.22, I believe it is NOT usually open on Mondays, but was probably open this particular Monday as it would be closed for Christmas.If you plan on visiting, try and buy tickets beforehand. There is a limited number of people per tour and it seems to get quite busy. We signed up for the English tour starting at 11:15 am. It costs 4,000 HUF / person. At the current exchange rate, that's almost $18 Canadian / person.* * The only entrance for visitors is through the visitor centre which, looking at the front of the building with the river behind it, is to the right and down the stairs. * * As we had gotten there early, we went outside and walked around the grounds and took photos. The architecture of the building and grounds are quite impressive and beautiful. According to information from our cruise guide, it is the 3rd largest parliamentary building in the world. How this is measured I don't know.At about 11:05 am, we re-entered the visitor centre and joined the crowd of visitors that had descended upon this attraction. We waited and waited for the security to start screening visitors.At 11:15 when the tour was suppose to start, security still hadn't started and we were wondering what was going on. Finally, 10 - 15 minutes later, the tour guide asked for our attention and told us to go through security and that we'd re-group on the other side past security. So now we're all crowding around to get in line with other people for other language tours to go through security and for whatever reasons, they didn't start earlier and there are no line-up guide ropes (like the ones at airports), so we're all bunching together slowly. All this feels very unprepared, inefficient and disorganized. Bad planning overall. Whoever in charge of overseeing these tours should be fired.After getting through security, the tour starts and the information was presented in an informative but very dull fashion. The tour guide must have been running late because it felt rushed.The interior is very beautiful and immense. At one point, we were taking photos of the room where parliamentary affairs are discussed when the security guard got impatient and simply started barking, "Go, go, go!" Great attitude.The tour was pretty short and for the price felt like a total waste of money. There was no discussion of the exterior or the significance of the statues outside. The best part of the tour had nothing to do with the tour guide but was a photo gallery of the construction of the building just prior to entering the souvenir shop. If you plan on going, read up on the building interior and exterior beforehand, I found myself tuning out the tour guide.

Amazing building, any angle you see it!. Either you see it (and take night photos) from the opposite bank of Danube river or from the square at the rear part, this building is fabulous! I didn't have the chance to take the visit in the building, but it worth the walk around. It's simply amazing!!

The House. A classic Parliament building from 1885 upon the plans of Imre Steindl. It was renovated in 2009, now in full beauty you can enjoy the sight. We call it "Országház" (House of the Country).It lies in central Budapest, Pest side, right beside the shore of River Duna. (Danube). You can visit it in an organised mood from inside as well for a fee within a group.

Parliament building crown jewels a disappointment. We enjoyed the tour guide who helped describe some of the building history and a bit about the government operations. You have the option of an elevator rather than 100 plus steps to get up several flights to the main tour area. The room and guards where the royal crown, ball and third item was very impressive, even if the crown jewels were not. NOT what we expected. Overall the building is impressive and glad we went. Cost was modest, and glad we bought our tickets on-line before leaving the USA. We booked the English speaking tour at 10am which was a good fit for our schedule as we had time to enjoy a leisurely breakfast, yet have time to move on to other things that day. We walked from Le Meridian which turned out to be close to 30 minutes because we had to walk the length of the building to get to the visitor's center on the North end of the building.I think I would have preferred to arrive a little earlier, and have a coffee in the little café prior to the tour.

Amazing. During the holidays when we visited, crowds were heavy. There were about 30 of us with one English speaking tour guide. Multiple tours are happening simultaneously so if you want to hear, stand close to the guide. The interior of Parliament is as beautiful as the exterior. Watching the 2 military dudes guarding the King's crown was worth admission. We only saw a small portion of the building, but it was enough to get a good feel for the immense size and beauty. There are lots of stairs, especially at the beginning of the tour. If this presents a challenge, definitely take them up on their offer to ride an elevator up.

Jaw-dropping. This is an absolute must-see in Budapest. This building is even more impressive on the inside, with its gold paint and plating covering nearly every possible angle, as it is the the immediate eye on the outside. The tour of the interior itself is quite short, but very interesting, as is seeing the crown! You're allowed to take pictures too, which is really good (apart from of the crown)

English tour was so-so. The Parliament building is beautiful especially at night. We went on the English tour yesterday. It takes about 15 minutes to get everyone thru security and then there is a short tour. Our guide wore a headset and gave us the "canned" tour which only gives you a peak at the building. Between her accent and the echoes in some of the rooms we probably understood about half of what she said. We had pre-purchased our tickets. Tickets were sold out for the day when we arrived. While it was nice to see the inside of the building I'm not sure this tour was worthwhile.

Great views of the cty. Thankfully we were with friends living back in Budapest so got the information. The Roman ruins are being excavated and cleaned up hopefully this will give more attraction to the place.

Short but worth. The house of Hungarian Parliament is one of "must to see" in Budapest. The trip within the walls of the parliament is quite short, but the building (in & out) is beautyful and English speaking guide is comprehensive and short. Take the camera with bright lens with you, if you want to have sucessful pictures (allowed in whole building except central hall where the crown is located & guarded). The tickets are available online. After arrival you must go through the personal check out.

Many feelings. We are not visited the parliament inside but from outside it's huge and very beautiful. There are many statues around and a big Christmas tree. The solders come out and marched there. The view is fantastic.
Beautiful Scenery, a must! . Gorgeous structure! We toured around it as we were not to go inside as it was closed. Also went on a BigBus tour at night and saw it lit up... Absolutely amazing! A Must

Don't miss this fascinating building!. We almost didn't do this tour. We are so glad we did. This building is just amazing and full of history. The baroque styling is breathtaking. The statues and paintings are really priceless.

The architecture is very impressive. We visited the parliament during christmas time, the architecture is stunning and very impressive. My family didn't book a tour but we looked around ourselves. The square where the parliament is very beautiful and is a great walk to take. I would highly recommend to visit this beautiful building.

Great Cultural Experience/Visit. We visited here in December 2013 for a tour around the Parliament.The Tour Guide was very good & knowledgeable and made the tour interesting and worthwhile.Would definitely recommend a visit here should you be in Budapest although do check that they are open on the day that you require the Tour.

Beautiful during the day and at night. We visited the parliament a few times as there was just so much to look at. The architecture was very impressive and it looked even more beautiful when it was light up at night, definitely worth a visit.

Great Tour!. We booked online in advance for a morning tour in English, so glad we booked in advance, as even in the off months it was a full tour. The tour is very informative but not overwhelming or too long. Our tour guide did a great job of providing all the highlights without being boring - we both really enjoyed it!
impressive building. The best way to see the Parliament is at night. While this is an impressive building during the day, it is magnificent when it is lit up at night

The grand architecture time piece. The architecture of this era and location is just mind blowing. The fact that the building is still standing and in excellent condition made this trip even more exciting. To be walking around the grounds of the parliament building that once was the center of local government was a great find.

Fantastic Architecture, but tour too rushed. we had booked the tour before arriving in Budapest and were really looking forward to it, I'm sure if they allowed you more time to go round on the tour it would have been very good, but it took 15 minutes to go through security, which only left 25-30 minutes with the tour guide, it was so difficult to take good photographs as there was just no time to stop, having said all that I'm still pleased we went round

Stunning architecture amazing location on the Danube. Absolutely stunning location ,such an impressive building which you can observe either side of the Danube,..with the soft winter light ,as the sun was setting,it is truly beautiful.The history of the city is fascinating both old and more recent,...The city has many stories to tell,and has scene various leadership come and go...it has been tough..but the people are resilient and enterprising.we truly loved this place.

Tour of the building. Magnificent building and is well maintained. There are tours in different languages. English tours were taking place every 30 minutes quite popular even in December. Tour lasts 45 minutes but may have to wait for your turn. We waited for 1 hour. Worth the the entry fee of 2000 HUF for EU citizens.

Beautiful building. First, I reccomend to book a visit on the inside cause you may find a lot of people waiting and it's worth, you can even choose your own language. Our guide was very good and she explained a lot to us. The interns are so interesting that even them alone are worth the price of a ticket.Second, I think it's worth to visit the building itself, but the square it's interesting too. Take your time to stroll there :)Third, walk near the parliament by day and by night: lights are magical!

Hungarian pride. The upper house which is non existent now is available for tourists.it is like a small town with everything to allow the representatives to stay and concentrate on policy of the country

Worth it!. A beautiful building, and worth walking all around, as there are different aspects and facets to see. We saw the changing of the guard ceremony (11.30 and 12.30), which was simple but effective. We didn't go inside.
Front is a nice building. Would not make a special trip to the place - nice from the Danube - see where all the EU money has been spent!!!!!
Architecture. Absolutely worth a visit with your camera. Stunning location and surrounds. The architecture in the parliament area of the city defies belief.
Amazing. Very impressive place. Took the tour wich was very interesting. You see quite a lot of rooms inside. A must when visiting Budapest!

The star of Budapest.. The attraction of this beautiful architectural building is so panaromic by the river. One of the nightlight and it is so beautifully light up by nightfall. I cannot say much about the inside but is a must visit when you are there.

Nice building. The parliament is even nicer inside than outside. Nice paintings, sculptures, rooms. The visits were a bit fast, not much time to enjoy. we see a lot, but many rooms remained hidden, and the organisation of the visit is a bit messy at the meeting point.

Superb Architecture , an essence of Budapest. Visited here on a rainy day but was still fabulous. Great building and the surrounding. Loved the statute of the man by the river too. I hear the tour inside is good but we didn't do that. Had our fill from the outside. But a must do building and the areas around it.

Hungarian Parliament Building. This building has become iconic in it's majesty and setting, and is widely recognized as the building shown regularly on the Danube River Cruise advertisements. Beautiful in the bright sunshine, and a pleasure to the eye.
very cool building. Spent much of the afternoon walking around the Parliament building taking a ton of pictures. A beautiful square lined with many historical sites

LOVE the Parliament. We arrived in Budapest at night in December and the sight of the Parliament and Chain Bridge all lit up was spectacular. I love the way historic buildings are taken care of in Europe and thisis by far my favorite.

Visit to Parliament. Very much enjoyed a 45 minute tour of the Parliament building in the company of one of their excellent guides. Various major European languages are catered for. There is a reasonably priced café inside the modern underground entrance area.You will need to go through an airport like security at the start of the tour. The building is very opulent, but it turns out that all the marble and granite is fake. I couldn't tell. Apparently it is to save weight, as the real stuff would weigh 3 times more, putting too much strain on the foundations. While we were there, thousands of people were demonstrating outside against the government. It was relatively peaceful though, with lots of speeches.Definitely worth a visit if you have the time.
A Jewel by Denube. The Parliament sits like a jewel by the river.. absolutely stunning!! The tour is a must-do. Beautifully adorned building from inside and outside

To be a symbol of Budapest's sake. No you should not go, but would also be seen for the sake of Budapest's icon. Take photos and architectural details see attractive terms. I can not say here that the Parliament building we found enough to do special.

The building that glows. This building is spectacular especially from the outside, much like most of budapest, it is a brick built construction with a decorative fascia, so for those wanting to marvel at rawstone construction it isnt that! unfortunately the whole city bears the scares of so many wars that its building are mere pop-ups in the places that great structures once stood. This symettical gothic palace is a marvel to behold though, the walkign tours are expensive and quite crowded and to be honest didnt do the general awe any favours, if i could have my memory again i would probably have just visited from the outside and left the grandeur of the decor in my imagination as once again the hungarian Magnolia was in full swing
magic. The most beautiful building of Budapest. Worth to visit someone and inside. Reasonable price, wonderful place input in, and around the anagennisiak century style to fascinate.

What a building!. This has to be one of the most photogenic buildings in the whole of Budapest. Don't miss the small demonstration of sword play by the guards daily at 1130 and 1230. Not mentioned in any of our guide books.

take the guide! . if you are thinking to go to Budapest you musn't loose this building. here the very heart of the Hungarian history is kept alive. take a guide, there's one for very many languages. you'll definitely love it!

Must visit. Parliament was in recess so we were able to be taken around inside. It was Christmastime and so looked very festive. No problem with taking any photos apart from 1 room which is guarded by soldiers. Guided tour was very informative. There was a fairly long wait for our tour to start but well worth it. Wonder if the Houses of Parliament in London is anywhere as nice.
great building. A must see. parliament building very large with lots to see around the area,looks smaller from the buda side of the city.

It is a must see site when in Budapest. I strongly recommend this site to anyone who visits Budapest . I took a lot of pictures , inside and outside . The scale , grandeur , decorations , guide , it is worth you time .We were lucky , arrived just before a english language tour started .Fees - 2000 Huf for EU citizens (4000 for non Eu )-aprox 1 hour , the tour is a little short , you wont get to see as many things inside as you would expect . The tour includes 2 hallways , main entrance , crown jewels , parliament room .
Very Impressive. We did not have a chance to go inside but from outside its a very impressive building. It's within walking distance from the other major attractions, definitely worth visiting .
Must see. If you love history and have taste for good old look of the building. It is relay great that they preserve it that good :)

WOW !!!. These Parliament buildings are the most fabulous that I have ever seen. The site is huge - it took ages to walk around all of it to take it all in. We saw the sentries changing over - that was fun. There are scultures and sratues everywhere and it looked like there had been a clean-up of the stone as it looked brand new and we saw some workmen cleaning one og the large statues.
Only outside viewing but marvelous. We only looked the outside view of thus massive and most beautiful structure but have to confirm it is marvellous and well worth inclusion on a walking tour.

Impressive!. Fabulous architecture and a very grand square with marvellous buildings on all sides - soldiers on duty and some rather impressive statues to complete the whole experience. We wandered back along the Danube, taking in the installation of metal shoes on the banks to mark the Jews killed on the banks of the river, very sobering and poignant

Breathtaking. This is probably the most beautiful parliament building in the world. You must take time to see it from the outside in the day time and especially at night. We were not able to get tickets for an indoor tour as we had no printing receipt capabilities so if you want to take a tour, book from home before you go or have your hotel concierge book it for you so you won't be disappointed like we were.

Budapest bonanza. I visited Budapest in November was lovely time to visit the late winter sun on the city when looking down from fisherman's bastion on the red of the parliament.At night time was little misty with the Christmas lights peeking through was just magical The city of Budapest was just full of surprises and I must say I enjoyed that wee bit better than Prague.I stayed at hotel Erszasbet which was central and found a lovely traditional Hungarian restaurant.The people were friendly and plenty to do in my three nights did not do all I wanted.The marzipan museum is a must at fisherman's bastion it is a city I highly recommend and want go back to.
Great Architecture. Both the outside and inside old world style architecture were fabulous. Also, I believe I was able to access the archives trying to research my European family.

Spectacular!!. The Parliament building set right alongside the Danube is a very impressive building amongst many impressive buildings in Budapest well worth a visit. Tours can be arranged inside but only in advance with a tour company.

You Must See. We were not able to do a tour but don't let that dissuade you from visiting this building. It is magnificent and should be seen in the daytime as well as in the evening when the entire building is bathed in a beautiful light. One of the most beautiful buildings I have seen in all of my travels in Europe, especially as it sits on the Danube.

Parliament. You will need to book a guided tour as this is the only way to see the inside of the Parliament building. Best to book in advance in case it is busy as you may have to wait for a tour in your language. The tour is very informative and the building well worth seeing. We were going to have some tea before our tour, however the queue in the cafe seemed to move very slowly so we didn't have time. Arrive some time before your tour is due to start as you will have to go through security like at the airport, before visiting the building.

Beautiful building.. Impressive and grand building that towers over the city. The size and beauty of this building is just unbelievable. Took more pictures of the one site than all the others combined.

Out of this World. You will never walk through as stunning a building as this it is just undescribable architecture stunning the structure on the outside beautiful but when you go inside its fantastic and just one of the most stunning buildings in the World

Breathtaking. This must be the best so far I've been to visit, but what a treat so many rooms and you get to see four but well worth it and the guide was very informative and any question was answered.

Magnificent building. We booked this tour a head of our visit because apparently they need to do some minimal background check on each visitor. This was a very interesting tour. The building inside is as beautiful as the outside. The inside is so impressive with the stained glass windows, the beautiful ceilings, the marble floors and wooden carvings. The building is meticulously maintained both inside and outside. We were able to see the changing of the guard around the 1000 year old crown, the sword and scepter which is encased behind a glass display. Those national treasures were a treat to see since they played such an important role in the history of the country. Be prepared to be escorted by a guard through out the whole tour. They have a gift shop and a free bathroom available for patrons. Well worth visiting when you are in Budapest. It costs about $20.00 per person.

Stunning!. The grandeur of this building is something to behold. Take a 45 minute guided tour at a cost of around six pound for a glimpse of the vast interior. Photos can be taken in all areas bar one which is the area where the crown jewels are held and guarded by two impressive guards.Stunning by day but breathtaking at night. Take a walk along the opposite bank of the Danube and take it in. Highly recommended.

A statement of 'Power'.. Had not booked a tour and arrived 10 mins after the last English language tour. We had a guide book so joined the Russian language tour. Met a super young Moldovan couple who took us under their wing and translated the interesting bits for us adding to the guide book info. Must do tour if only for St Stephen's Crown, Grand Staircase and Assembly Hall.

Parliament visit. This building is amazing and seeing inside was very good. There is also a really good cafe and shop within the premises. However, the tour was disappointing to us at the start as the guide began to speak whilst many of us were still climbing up the many stairs and had set off before we reached the top. When we caught up, she was half-way through her talk about the area we were now in and I spoke to her at the end and told her many of us had not heard her. She did repeat what we had missed, but until near the end of the tour, we could barely hear what she was saying and then she appeared to turn up the volume on her microphone. A few people asked questions in response to her request to ask, but there were a few things she was unable to answer and made no attempt to assure that she could find out. Very disappointing tour although good to see inside.
History impressive. History impressive, a grand building of great magnitude. Two guards beneath the national flag and we saw the Christmas tree being hoisted.
Imposing. Cool and historic. Looks like something out of a Gothic novel. Love was put into its design and it shows. Nice views of area from it.check it out
Beautiful buildings. Based on London's Houses of Parliament. Very beautiful in the evening as it wonderfully lit. You can visit but need to book in advance (it's free).

Well worth the tour - beautiful interior. Take the Parliment tour so you know what your're looking at. Tour guides are good and explain things in detail. You'll see the Hungarian crown jewels in the Dome hall (but aren't allowed to take pictures of the jewels or anything in the Dome hall). Worth your time and the entrance fee to see this historic building.

Wow! Magnificent. What a building! An absolute must to visit. The sheer oppulance of the decore is astounding. Our guide was very knowledgeable. One tip - if you use the cafe you can use the toilets for free!
Must see. View the Parliament building at night. Particularly see it from the Danube. Take one of the many sightseeing boatsAMAZING such a beautiful sight.

Stunning building. We arrived with only minutes to spare before the next English speaking tour so had just enough time to look in the well stocked gift shop. After a fairly tight security check our excellent guide took us on the 45 minute tour of the building, including the chamber. Outside the building is stunning and best seen from one of the city boats on the Danube or from the Buda side, especially at night as it is beautifully lit. Internally it's an interesting building and well worth a visit.

Beautiful. Although I didn't do the Parliament tour I did go underground to the museum dedicated to the events of 1956 and found it very interesting, especially the 3D effect of a tank turning round and bearing down on you.....quite frightening so I can't begin to imagin what it would have been like in real life.

Wonderful Building. It is tough to think of a neater building that the Parliament building. The tour was short and didn't get to see much inside, but the outside is really the best part of this facility. If you have time, be sure to come back after dark and see it with the lights on. It is amazing and at the time of our visit, there were not may people around.

Most magnificent building in the world. Some of the best views of the Parliament are from the Danube across the river, especially from Batthyány Square. Guided tours of the inside are available, which is well worth the time even if you have to line up.

Unbelievable building.. Parliament building is spectacular inside and out. there is also a fantastic view of it from the Castle District across the Danube. This is a must visit place for any visitor to Budapest.
stunning. Very beautiful day and night. we didn't go inside but from the outside it was also very fascinating.

Better than Westminster. Tours in English. Very ornate inside. Interesting from a historical perspective to get and handle on the politics of Eastern Europe.I now know Hungary was on the side of Germany. Twice!Their history of anti semitism is not good!
the most beautiful Parliament. Beautiful view of the Parliament is from the river side by night! For me is one of the most beautiful Parliament, definitely!
Fantastic imposing building on the waterfront. We didn't go in but it was stunning from the outside. There are guided tours in English, check for timings if you want to go inside
The Parliament and surroundings. It's worth visiting, special mention to the change of guard ceremony in the evening. The tram stop is just opposite

Shame we couldn't visit. We wanted to have a tour around this very beautiful building but the tours in English were fully booked and so our journey by their very good underground system was in vain. If you really want to visit I should contact them before you travel to book your place as turning upon speck doesn't work

Quick tour, but worth it. Remember to take your passport of you're an EU national as you get in half price, and take note of the different times for tours in different languages. If you have to wait, walk downriver to the 'Shoes' sculpture, or take a walk across Margaret Bridge upriver. Impressive building, liked it a lot.

An amazing building. The Hungarian Parliament in Budapest is an amazing building. Seen from the river it seems to float like some form of confection. And seeing it from Buda On the opposite side of the Danube is a truly impressive sight. It's well worth going on a conducted tour inside, despite having to wait for some time before a tour commences, because there are so many features connected to the country's turbulent history. There is a very good souvenir shop which sells a range of books, CDs and DVDs about Budapest and Hungary.
Very nice building. The building can be seen from outside either during the day either the night. You can take nice pictures just from the opposite shore of the Danube.
So beautiful. This is the most beautiful attraction for me in this city. Looks so stunning, I don't have the words to describe the feeling I have when I look at this building.

Wonderful 19th century architecture, along the Danube embankment. Impressive 19th century architecture, inspired by the Palace of Westminster. Didn't get the chance to visit the interiors, but I would love to, next time I'm in Budapest.

If you're in Budapest, get a tour!. The Parliament building itself is quite impressive but the tour should go on everyone's "must do" list when visiting Budapest. Tours can be booked online (easy to do ahead of time to make sure you get the tour in the language you want) or at the visitor's center and they provide a unique view of the building in addition to important history.
Impressive architecture. Big and impressive building which you must see and take photos.Over night from bridge and other side of Danube you can create beautiful pictures of Parlament.

Magnificent by night. I did not find it that special inside or during the day. But it looks pretty awesome at night when you watch from the Danube. I would suggest a romantic stroll by the river with the magnificent view of the parliament by your side (from the Margit bridge to the chain bridge)

Big and impressive. First: This is really a must see in Budapest. The walk around with a guide was very long and very informing. However, we had to wait for 1 1/2 hour to enter because we needed an English-speaking guide.Outside you should see where the Soviet bullets hit in 1956.

Interesting tour. We joined a conducted tour which was very informative and interesting. I particularly liked the stained glass windows, which we were told had been removed during the 2nd world war to stop their destruction. The ornate wood wood is also very beautiful. Well worth visiting.

Wonderful Building . Imposing and spectacular, particularly at night when illuminated. Didn't go inside but the pictures look magnificent. Great views across the Danube and close to the Shoes on the Promenade Memorial which is another thing not to be missed

Breathtaking. It's definitely worth a visit!!!The main façade overlooks the River Danube, that is the best to see on a river cruise AT NIGHT.The official main entrance is from the Kossuth square. Take a tour inside, you won't regret it!When entering the Parliament, you can walk up wonderful ornamental stairs, see beautifully painted windows, glass mosaics and frescoes on the ceiling. My favourite was the sixteen-sided central hall that hosts the Holy Crown of Hungary. It was fabulous!!! :)
It is a must. Highly recommended to visit. Take a guided trip for the knowledge of this magnificent vision. So proud to be Hungarian.

AMAZING BUDAPEST. My partner and I were in Budapest in October 2014 and visited their Parliament House. We were just in awe of the magnificent building. We joined a tour which was very organised and informative and they had tours probably in most languages. This is definitely a must if you ever visit Budapest
You have to see this place. Gold everywhere and a rich history. We thoroughly enjoyed the tour and it was a great place to take photos.

Great visit but horrible staff in tourist shop. Beautiful building and the tour was very well done. We had a wonderful guide who was very knowledgeable and dynamic. The only down side was our decision to buy a souvenir from the gift shop. We were served by a certain Cherrell who was exceptionally rude when we misunderstood her question as to where we were from. I've never been confronted with such a horrible person during my time here so she's obviously an exception to otherwise pleasant Hungarian hosts but what a shame she works in a touristy place and, as such, represents Hungary...
Beautiful Building. We viewed this building only from the outside, both from across the river and on our river cruise. It is a very beautiful building with all its spires and towers.

Very imposing..... It is a very imposing and awesome structure by the Danube. It is worth a visit and your pictures with it as background will surely not disappoint. We were there during the changing of the guards and they were snappy and nice to watch.

If you prepare ahead it is worth the visit. The visit (tour) of the Parliament Building costs 4000 HUF (about $16) per person. I suggest that you book the tour online the day before you want to visit and print the tickets out. There are many options for the language of the tour, so look carefully at the options. Purchasing the tickets online and printing them will add 200 HUF (about 75 cents) to the ticket price. But then you are guaranteed to get the tour time you want. Buying the tickets at the Visitor Center of the Parliament Building can be problematic as you might be disappointed about getting the tour time you want. You enter the Parliament Building Security Screening at the tour time selected, not before. The tour last about an hour and the guides are very knowledgeable. The design of the interior of the building is breathtaking, and as magnificent as the exterior. There is a very nice cafe and restrooms in the Visitor Center. If your tour is shortly after lunch time, the cafe is a good place to have lunch.

A magnificent building. The view from Buda lend it self to such Majesty somewhat Buckingham Palace .At night a different a awesome picture. It should if not Listed one of the most beautiful building in the world the demention are flawless,(my opinion of course)

an amazing site at night. i didnt get to go into the building but i looked spectacular at night and HUGE!!! i read that if you have an EU passport you can get in for free. my gf is Australian so if it wasnt for the fact we were hungover she would have to of waited outside whilst i toured :-)

Great architecture. Unfortunately we didnt go inside, but even from outside, the Hungarian Parliament is grand and beautiful. The architecture as I understood is Gothic. Not just in the day, I would strongly recommend to see the building in the night. The best views can be from the opposite side of the river next to Batthyány tér metro station.The square in front of the building is also nice and there is a very nice park quite close to the building.

Expected more. Well worth paying for BUT I expected to see more than essentially three rooms. EAch spectacular I admit but for the money would have liked to have seen more. The cafe is worth visiting - despite my muffine being stale.

a well organised tour. We pre booked the tour and turned up in good time to go through the security checks - it was like flying abroad. The tour was brief but very interesting the restored interiors were brilliantly coloured with gold leaf everywhere. The new tourist centre built adjoining was excellent and provided so many good facilities. Well worth booking and going on.
What a building . Unfortunately didn't get to go inside but what a spectacular building. It's my favorite building when lit at night especially viewed up at Fisherman's Bastion

Stunning. This building is stunning to see in the day time and even better lit up at night.unfortunatly we couldn't go in as we did not know you have to pre book a tour and proof your a passport holder of a eu country in which we left our passports in the safe at hotel.

A nice tour. First of all, the building looks magnificent. Designed by Hungarian architect, it's a big building consider the size of the country. The parliament offers English tour which is very useful.
nice walk from Sofitel Hotel. This was a nice walk from the hotel and a huge place. You had to pay to get into the place and we were fine with walking all around it.

spectacular!. the building is highly impressive from outside and it is astonishing form the inside! it definitely deserves a visit. EECC visitors have a discount on the admission fee. Remember that you can only visit it with an official guide, at the ticket counter you will be informed at what time is the schedule for the tours in the different languages.
Don't miss it. Though it was not in our plans, we took a guided tour. It is really worth to visit it and don't miss to see the corner for the cigars

An Ornate Building!. This tour is quintessential for a visit to the capital city. The tickets are inexpensive and a tour in English was very well done. I never once felt like they talked above our heads. Tour is about 45 minutes or so, and they do not allow pictures of the jewels, but they are exquisite. Security has been beefed up here, but is fairly smooth. You can now purchase tickets in the underground entrance.
Amazing. Do not miss this place! Amazing art, history and architecture --- plus the CROWN JEWELS of Hungary. Highlight of my visit!
A must see!. Beautiful building. We got a guided tour for only 1000 florint (about €3.30) because we were under 24. Worth a trip inside!

Great architecture. If you see this in the day well worth a look at night to when it's all lit up can get some great shots from the danube toDidnt visit the museum so cant comment on that you have to pre book to go inside so bare that in mind before you travel
Very impressive building. Very near the bridge of chain bridge. The architecture is very impressive, with lots of details. The gardens are nice as well.

One of the most beautiful landmarks in Europe. Stunning building to see at any time, especially at night. Personally, I feel that this stands up with the top landmarks throughout the continent, but as is usual with Budapest, a fraction of the crowds. It would be nice if they had more tours that went inside, however. Best views can be seen from across the river.
Beautiful!. The entire building is stunning. You can't get a bad view, whether hundreds of feet away, on the other side of the bridge or right near it, it's an beautiful building!

great photos. we caught the tram past & walked back taking plenty of photos. we didn't go in. Don't miss standing on the little bridge with statue of Imre Nagy looking at Parliment - its just over the tram line in Kossuth Square...then walk down to see the shoes on the river bank

Stunning building especially in the night!. The building is amazing! I totally recomend to see it in the night and even better if you see it from a cruise boat as I did! The lights and reflection of it on Dunabis is amazing!
The view. you have to watch this building at night from the other side of the river. it's amazing. better than a closer look. !! :)
Perfect place to visit. You can take photo in every corner .. So beautiful..!!Try to walk around in the evening before sunset.. I'm in love Budapest really..!!
Stunning inside and out. The outside of this building is breath taking, especially when lit up at night. The tour inside is good, but short. A must see.

Extremely well Organised - pre planning required. You may be a bit disappointed if you just turn up for a tour. They have well organised information screens which tell you price and times of organised tours in English and other languages.
Don't forget ID as EU citizens get in for half the price as non EU citzens.
Well worth a visit.

Top sight. Don't miss out on a tour of the Hungarian Parliament. Although the tour doesn't take you to the currently used lower house chamber, you can see the similar chamber of the former upper house, as well as the golden staircase, beautifully carved walls across corridors and incredibly detailed and symbolic architecture. For instance, in the media lobby of the Upper House, you can find beautiful wooden sculptures depicting different trades and professions to serve as a symbolic reminder to politicians about who they are there to represent. Don't miss out on - possible - THE most impressive building in Budapest.

Impressive structure.. We just happened to arrive at the Parliament building as there was a changing of the guards ceremony (at least we assume that's what they were doing.) It was fun to watch. We did not go into the building, but just walking around it gives you the feeling of grandeur that must exist within its walls.

The construction is done. Last year we were in Budapest and the parliament was completely fenced off as they were doing something to it. Pics last year were not great with fencing in it. This year we found it was all done. It's so beautiful. And at night it's the color of gold and lights up the sky. It's so worth the walk to it and around it.

Worth seeing. You may book the tour forehead and pay online. It starts at visitor centre. The excursion is quite short, you will see only the grand staircase, the historic assembly hall and the dome. The interiors are rich and sunk in gold, everything is golden. After the tour finished I wanted to see more!

Parliament. The building was closed but the building is absolutely beautiful. It looks more like a castle than a government building. at night it is lit buy bright lights that made it look like it had been dipped in yellow butter. It was a building that was as beautiful during the day as at night.

Very Picturesque!. The Parliament itself is worth a look around. Sadly the area around it is a bit dead, but the Parliament Buildings themselves are stunning. It was great at around sunset with great views across the Danube.

Over night it's shining like a Christmas tree!. It looks amazing at night, we have been staring at it for almost an hour, it's one of the nicest parliament buildings for sure! Haven't been inside but can only imagine how beautiful it is.
Highly recommended while you're in Budapest!
The 8th world wonder !!!. You MUST see it one day. He's especially outstanding when you book a boat excursion (we booked ""Danube's Legenda") and see it , just floating by...it's wonderful!!!!!!!!
Something special. This building looks like some castle on the riverside. You can visít inside as well, the park is also nice and unique.

Interesting. An amazing building. The English tour was quite good, although it seemed that the guide was in a hurry a little bit. I could find tickets only for the next tour and I had to wait two hours, but I took a nice walk to the near by Margit Island.

Magnificent structure. The Hungarian Parliament, built in 1896 for the 1,000 year anniversary of the founding of Hungary is a huge and gorgeous building, both inside and outside. It is especially beautiful when floodlit at night which it is every night. The best place to view the exterior is from the Danube River on a boat but you can also get a great view from the Fisherman's Bastion or any place up on Castle Hill in Buda. The Parliament is actually on the Pest side but it is right on the River so if you stand in front, you can't see most of it unless you look straight up (not the best view). A "must see" when in Budapest.

Stunning building especially at night. The Parliament is absolutely gorgeous at night. Excellent views from the Danube cruises or from Fisherman's Bastion on the Buda side. We didn't have time but visitors can go to Parliament sessions or tour the building.

Culture at its best!. Don't just check this out when passing by. Make the effort to book a tour, it's worth every penny. The crown, sword sceptre etc are on display and internally is quite spectacular. Wasn't on my list, so pleased we made a last minute decision to go in!
Worth the visit for the architecture. Lovely architecture on the parliament building. Situated right next to the danube and well maintained. Cannot comment on the interior.

An interesting tour full of information!. We went on the last tour of the day during the last week of October. The tours book out very quickly so it is advisable to go early and buy your ticket for your chosen slot. We went at 2pm and luckily there were a few tickets left for the 5.45pm tour. The guide was informative and the pace of the tour was nice and quick. The building is absolutely fabulous and we were able to see the crown of St. Stephen. We were also lucky enough to witness the change of guard which was very interesting.

Stunning buildings but book tour in advance!!. Unfortunately we were unable to see it from the inside as the tours for the day were already sold out (and we got there about 10.45am) so I'd suggest go a day early to book yours. It resembles Westminster for a reason, it was designed by the same architect. Make sure you also get to see it at night, preferably from the cruise deck, absolutely stunning view, reminded me of scene from Harry Potter: magical, especially when you notice flocks of birds which apparently circle around the building each night: very memorable

Interesting and worth a visit but no more than that. Official tour of the Parliament buildings in Budapest. Cost 4,000 forints (about £11) but half price if you are from EU and have photo evidence thereof. Need to book your timed ticket for language required and numbers are limited so best to do this earlier in the day.Tour takes just under an hour and includes sight of the crown jewels. Despite its gothic architectural influences (modelled loosely on UK Houses of Parliament) construction was between 1895 ish to 1904. Nevertheless quite a spectacular building and even more so when lit up at night and viewed from the River Danube.It is a must see on any visit to Budapest but don't expect too much from the tour

Worth a visit. Definitely worth a visit if in the area. The guides are knowledgable and the tours are done in lots of different languages! You have to see it to understand the true beauty of parliament. Well worth the entrance fee!

Worth to visit. It is the best place to understand the luxurios magnificance of the city. The huge size of pure greatness splendidly matched with the city atmosphere in general. The great trace of the rich Hungarian history with interesting stories from guide.Don't miss even if you are not the fan of history.

a stunning view and interesting tour. This is a must see while in Budapest. The parliament is a massive property and an impressive view from the river. The tour shows the crowned jewels, parliament chambers, and the beautiful art and architecture of the property. the cost was 4000ft for a nice guided tour.

An interesting tour. This was my second time at the parliament in Budapest. The first one was a few years ago.The place was renovated since then and looks even nicer than it did.The tour itself was interesting but a bit short to my liking. The tour guide spoke perfect English and was very nice. They also have tours in French, German, Hebrew and I think Spanish too.Note that the tours are sold out quite quickly. When we got there around noon on a Sunday, they only had tickets for an English tour around 3pm.All n' all, I think the parliament is worth visiting even though the entrance fee is a bit high (compared to other attractions in Budapest)
Impressive. The building is amazing, located on the Danube. it's best viewed at night as the lighting is unbelievable.
Wonderful!. Worth to see it.well organized guide tours along the Parliament on different languages.Honestly,I didn't expect such a beauty.it impressed me.
Take the Tour!. The building is magnificent, inside and out. Art and architecture lovers - this is for you, as well as history and political buffs.

Beautiful although rude guards!. The Parlament itself is beautiful but the guards are very rude and arrogant. While taking tour in English constantly one guard following us and always kept asking to hurry up. One of the most frustrating things at entrance, while passing our metal detector, I was clearly ordered, from one of the guards, to put tray back to its place, while he was doing just nothing. Rude and always suspicious. Not strong personality and military attitude, rather just to be arrogant and intolerant towards who is paying....tourists! Hungarian attitude! Week!!!

Tour of the Parliament.... I got the tickets online. If you get the tickets online, you have the option to select the time that matches the language of the tour. The numbers in a group are limited and so don't wait to the last minute... The Parliament has about 691 rooms but you will only be taken to about four. However, the ones you'll see will give you an idea of the rest of the building... The main room houses the "CROWN" and it is guarded by a couple of Honor Guards. The CROWN on display was used for the last 1,000 years or so for the coronation of (I believe) all the Kings of Hungary... The price of the tour is very high for non-EU personnel - in fact, it is about double of what everyone else is paying but I'd say it is still worth it...

A glory at night and a white confection during the day!. This building is unbelievably beautiful. Looking more like an elegant palace than a parliament, it is beautiful from both the water side and the plaza side. We were very lucky to come across some members of the symphony playing for a promo video with the parliament as a backdrop. What an sight!

Amazing exterior and interior. Impressive looking on outside with craftsmanship of high quality.. This is followed through in interior. Knowledgeable guide with good English.
Only negative is that it has to booked.
Politicians know how to pamper themselves!

Amazing. This monument is fantastic especially at night . The view from the water is also a must.
Not to be missed!
Don't miss this.... This is a magnificent building. Take in the sight during the day but especially see it in the dark. The lights makes it look amazing with the reflection off the Danube.
a must in Budapest. Parliament building is a must when visiting Budapest; impressive Gothic style building. Good to admire it from all sides and also the other bank of the river.
Breathtaking view. Like most of the buildings in Budapest, beautiful, The Parliament stood out the most. The view in the night so enchanting that you cannot take your eyes from it.

Awesome!!. Definitely worth the visit. Took a guided tour, as I do not know a lot about history in Hungary I certainly learned a lot. The tour guide was very knowledgeable and did not rush our group through the building. Even if you only get a chance to walk around the exterior, this is a must see attraction.
Nice!!!!. We did not take the tour but it is worth walking around and visiting this landmark! Very Nice!!!!!!!!!

Buy tickets online before visit. Visiting the Parliament in November, we had no problem getting tickets for the tour, but it's easy to imagine how challenging it might be in summer. The tour is interesting and you get to see the Parliament chamber and the crown of St. Stephens. A worthwhile visit.

Glad we went!. If you want an English speaking tour then book early as this get booked very quickly as we quickly learnt. In the end we went on the Spanish tour (not that either of us speak Spanish) just so we could get to see this stunning building. So well worth the effort and for 2000 HUF each, great value for money

Well organized tour. Only way to see the building is going with the guided tour. The tour itself is around 45 minutes. Our guide was very well informed spoke English well. Her voice was loud so we didn't have to huddled around her to hear her. Beside of being informative, she answered many questions that tour asked her. The tour had enough fun facts to keep our young children(9,12) focused in the tour. Well worth the money. There is a café next to entrance and ticket booth, so you could have comfortable wait for your start time. You should book ahead.
Classy. Interesting history & the kings crown. Loved taking a few pictures & visiting this site. Information great too about one strong party control. Makes me think....

Beautiful Building Similar To Westminster Parliament. This is a beautiful building in neogothic style, very similar to our own Houses of Parliament in London. The square around it has just been renewed, and there is no chance of tripping over uneven paving. We did not have chance to do an internal visit but I was told that it is even more beautiful than the exterior. We saw the changing of the guard at 11.00 which was interesting considering there were only two soldiers.

Absolutely stunning!. If in Budapest you must visit this building, it is so unbelievably beautiful! It's worth viewing it from the Buda side of the Danube aswell, then you can see it in its full glory! It's also rather stunning in the evening when it's all lit up. Probably one of the most beautiful building in Europe!

Impressive building, but guided tours could be improved.... The building is impressive, outside and inside, and the tour is really interesting and curious, but the visit is quite short (only one of the sides of the building is shown because "it's symmetrical"), and our group (english) and german group started the visit at same time, and was a bit annoying to hear all the time the guide of the german tour that was 5 metres away from us, so if it's possible to choose, pick a tour that doesn't match with any other group. Tickets, better online and some days before. The lines may be long, and sold-out tickets if going the same day. Good price. Visits in 6-7 languages, always groups.

Day and night. It is impossible to go to Budapest and not see it, but please make an effort and go during the day and night, it is beautiful both times, but at night, with all the lights it looks like a different place.

Well worth the money. We paid to have a guided tour in English and were pleasantly surprised at the value for money. The tour was informative and the tour guide was friendly and had a few interesting stories to mix in with the history of the building. The only negative of the whole tour was the lady leading the German tour behind us. She didn't leave any gap between her tour and ours and seemed determined to speak so loudly that no-one could hear our guide (even though her group was half the size of ours).Once we did manage to move away from her the views and sights were amazing and the facts were of genuine interest. The crowns jewels were impressive to see in all their glory. Will be even better when the museum inside the building is complete too.

Impressive!. Really interesting to visit, the interior is as impressive as the external building. If you like neo renaissance and lavish gold you won't be disappointed. The entrance to the Visitor Center is located near the lion sculpture at the northern end.

Rush! Rush!. You need to book a tour. 2000HUF each for EU citizens, 4000HUF for non Europeans. Turned up 15 minutes before stated time, but not allowed to go through security until booked time. 50 or so in each group and quite a lot of steps to begin with...but worth it, it is a magnificent building. Tour guide very knowledgable, when we could hear her over the German tour which seemed to follow us. A couple of times the two groups were stood next to each other! Time for phot's where allowed, but 45 minutes tops, inclusive of security check.
Awesome neogothic monument. Marvelous building in neogothic style, the square around it has just been renewed, visit of the crown inside the building is a must

Wonderful building, pity we didn't hear much about it. We joined an English speaking tour to look through this remarkable building. It was worth it just to see the magnificent interior, but the tour was very disappointing. Our tour guide Andrea spoke heavily accented English and used a little microphone device, but it was very echo-y in the building and we could only hear about one word in 5. Others on the tour complained of the same thing when we talked amongst ourselves.Even when you stood right next to her, it was difficult to understand. It was a shame as she was a very nice woman with a pleasant demeanour and I’m sure she had many stories to tell, but we missed most of them.The tours get booked out in advance. I think you can book online, but otherwise, if you turn up to buy tickets, don’t be surprised if your tour doesn’t leave until much later in the day or even the next day.Despite the difficulty in understanding our tour guide, I would still recommend this tour as the building is amazing!

Imposing building !!!. Very impressive building, with exceptional architecture and fantastic location. It is built on the banks of the river and especially at night with the lights is fabulous !! Bravo to the author and the residents !!!

Dominates the skyscape. You cannot miss the Parliament in Budapest. It dominates Pest as much as the castle dominates Buda. After pictures and visit, ride the # 2 tram all the way to the other end and back. The route runs along the river. Another ride worth taking is #4 and $6 bus which take you from Pest to Buda along the main course of the city. I hope I'm right about #4/6. Check the bus map. ITs free at the hotel or wherever you buy your train pass from.
Amazing building. One of many beautiful buildings in Budapest. Situated on the banks of the Danube and definitely worth a visit.

Large and interesting, bit book early. The House of the Nation, or Hungarian Parliament is the 3rd largest parliament in the world and the biggest building in Hungary.The only way to visit is by a guided tour. You need to ensure that you book early for the day that you wish to visit to ensure that you're not disappointed as it can get very busy.Tours are in a number of languages so make sure you book the correct one.EU citizens and student can get a discount; so remember to bring your passport and/or student ID when you book.

Most recognizable building in Budapest. The building is stunning from the outside. Such detail was put into its construction. It is a great photo-op. I opted not to go inside as I read in the reviews that it takes a lot of time to get in and there is not much to see inside.
stunning, beautiful bldg. I couldn't get enough photos, the most stunning, from all areas in the city, up high or wherever, a stunning building

Great architecture. Saw the Parliament buildings at night and they are very impressive. The architecture is magnificent and very imposing, and they have used lighting effectively to ensure that nothing is lost in the dark. Great sight to see and can be reached reasonably easily from the nearby shopping districts which is a plus. Well kept benches surround it so that you can sit back and admire the view for a while.
Stunning. Hard to believe such a marvelous construction, architecture and detailed decor. You MUST see it, if anything in Budapest.

Parliament. The Parliament Building was my most photographed building from Budapest by day or night. It dominates the Danube River bank. They illuminated it as light with thousands of lights. The seagulls that were after bugs looked like fireworks or glittering stars. We were not able to go inside during our visit but just seeing it on the outside was amazing.
Architecture. Again stunning and so worth a walking tour. Stayed for an hour in the square in the view of the building drinking iced coffee.

Iconic Must-See Landmark of Budapest. This is the iconic building in most beauty shots of Budapest, and is featured on the cover of most Budapest travel guides. With good reason! We did an English tour of the inside, and it was pricey, but well worth it. The guide was great. You get to see the inside and the Crown jewels of Budapest (which spent some time in America's Fort Knox!). Be sure to buy tickets in advance!The building was bombed by the Germans, Russian, British and Americans during WWII according to our guide, but you wouldn't know it. It's gorgeous. It's been completely restored and was sparkling clean with a large new visitors center built underneath.It is one of the oldest parliament buildings in Europe, and it's the tallest building in Budapest and dominates the Skyline on the Pest side of the Danube. Take the No 2 tram after a trip here to see great views of this dramatic building and the lovely surrounding areas.

Superb Architecture, Great History, Great Place. This one was just amazing, it gives you the feel of the royal-ness with which the politicians of the State do their business and also the great history of the place. The guided tour is really nice, unfortunately we could enjoy only half the tour as there was a parliament session going on due to which a section was closed. Nonetheless the place is really nice, the garden outside is just beautiful. The Souvenir shop is not that great and of-course very expensive.
Poor guided tour. Took the guided tour while it was still free (Dec 2012). The building looks good from the outside but the tour was very poor. Nice building, crappy English :(

Great place. We bought our parliment tickets online. There was little indication about where to start the tour, it was a good thing we happened into the visitor information center, because the tour starts in there! After going through security we were on our way. Up many many many stairs ( there is an elevator option for those who need it). Our english speaking tour guide was informative and friendly. The tour lasted about 45 minutes and discussed alot of the history of parliament. Pictures were freely permited, except around the crown jewels. Worth the visit!
Worth a trip. Beautiful architecture with wonderful statues, The soldiers outside guarding the flag have guns and constantly move around.

Parliament visit. I could easily tell that the Hungarian guides/officials were very proud of their Parliament. We were with a 20+ person group; some were mobility challenged and required extra help getting up/down the stairs. Though beautiful and historically significant from the outside (most spectacular at night!), I'd pass on the tour; just a lot of traipsing around.

Let's feel the atmosphera of our history. The Parliament building is really phantastic- the decoration overallis marvelous - walpaintings and statues! You can admire the Hungarian crown jewelleries as well!

Hungarian Parliament. Worth seeing but somewhat disorganized in its overall operation. Also noisy in some areas as several groups are at the same spot at the same time. If possible, perhaps some type of hearing devices or amplification for each group. A very impressive building.

Impressive. I do not know how anyone would want to miss a chance to go inside this building. It is so iconic. I saw 4 parliment buildings on this trip and this is the most impressive. Inside and out.It only takes an hour, any longer it probably would be boring. But fascinating. I am glad I booked my tickets ahead of time.

You not necessarily have to pay to see it from the inside. The Parliament is a must-see attraction without question but try to manage to visit it during a national holiday (15 March, 20 August, 23 October), usually those are open days. You only have to be a bit patient because of the rows.By the way, the restoration works (originally started in the 1940's) had already been finished, the whole square and the building itself glitter.

A feast for the eyes!!!!. Such an impressive building and worth seeing in the flesh without a doubt. Tram number 2 takes you past the front and you can get off and spend some time there. Only a couple of stops down is the chain bridge leading to the castle. The view from the river cruise is really good. Loved it!

Must see the building, must see the Holy Crown. It is always an interesting thing to visit an active political building, especially if it is one of the most beautiful parliaments of the world.Change of guards is nothing extra, but to see the Holy Crown is a must (but read some history beside the visit).

About the set up. Just to be clear this is not about the tour but about the planning!We turned up for a tour and were told we needed our passports to book. We didn't have them with us so said to the woman could we book for the next day instead to which she said no. (However you can book online without a passport?)We asked when it was open for the next day and were given the information. The following morning on our last day we went to get our tickets to be told it was closed for the day!We were quite annoyed that there was no sign telling us this the previous day nor did the woman tell us. We would have made the journey back to the hotel for the passports has we have been given the correct info. Plan better than us!

Beautifully impressive. There is nothing to say except that there is no bad angle at this building. Beautifully impressive both days and nights. It is a good idea during the days to sit quietly and enjoy the sight.I walked to the riverbank to take picture at 9pm by myself and found it safe. There are heavy police presence and other tourist nearby. Do use precaution as in any other city especially around the park areas.
Disappointing. It's worth a visit, but just don't set your expectations too high. We only got taken into 3 rooms( probably because it's a working parliament).
Put it on you to do list. Great insight in to the Hungarian Parliament. Great building from the outside and so lovely inside we was very surprised not like how Westminster.

A must see in the evening. I don't think you can go to Budapest without seeing this building, it's so large and beautiful. I didn't get the opportunity to see the inside but the outside is spectacular, especially at night. A must see in the evening especially if you can see if from the river.

Organised tour of parliament. I booked this on-line through jegmester. It was very good value, and the tour takes in most of the inside of the parliament apart from the commons chamber. The insie is very ornate and the tour guide was interesting. The outside of the building is beautiful, and not at all crowded. We were fortunate to see the guards perform marching to music at 11.30. I don't know if this is a regular event, but my teenage boys enjoyed it very much.

Budapest Iconic structure. No travel magazine in the world can do justice to this iconic building. Seeing it lit up at night is what everyone might expect to be the highlight however this was not our most impressive view. We arrived on October 23rd 2014 in a light mist of rain to stand for 2 hours with thousands of people just to go inside. October 23rd 1956 was the start of Hungary's quest for democracy. It failed but Hungarian's still celebrate this day and hold it in high esteem. Our wait was rewarded with a walk up the grand staircase and past the Holy Crown and scepter. We later found out that there are two identical halls, one for tourists and other for government. This building is not as old as others in the area but is massive in size. Finished in 1904 the main façade overlooks the River Danube, but the official main entrance is from the square on the east side of the building. Inside and outside, there are altogether 242 sculptures on the walls.

Spectacular by day and night. A very spectacular and ornate state building which although your cannot go inside is worth a visit. In the front of the parliament (City side) is an exhibition regarding the 1956 Hungarian Revolution. On the river front of the Parliament there is also the simple but very moving "shoes on the Danube".

Take the Tour!. After visiting the area around the Parliament many times, we decided to take a guided tour of the inside. Tickets were purchased online and printed off the day prior to our visit. There is a newly opened visitor center that has walk up tickets, a restroom, gift-shop, and cafe. We arrived a few minutes early and decided to have a coffee in the cafe while waiting. Our tour was scheduled for 2:00 PM and an announcement was made precisely on schedule and our tour then started. First is a security checkpoint that requires passage through a metal detector. This is very similar to what happens at the airport. The only exception was someone had a pocketknife and he was allowed to give it to security and claim it when leaving (he was given a numbered card that corresponded to a locker his knife was placed in). We were then required to walk through a corridor to get inside the Parliament building where the actual tour started. This required walking up several staircases (an elevator was available if needed) and meeting our English speaking guide. Once the tour started, the guide gave explanations regarding many of the rooms and decorations but was sometimes difficult to hear if not standing close due to other groups passing by. The inside of the Parliament was spectacular and well worth our visit. The highlight was viewing the Crown Jewels in the rotunda guarded by two well turned out soldiers complete with brandished swords! All too soon the tour ended and we were led into a room where exhibits showed the progression of the recent renovations.

Choose your day carefully. I tried to visit twice, unsuccessfully. The first time, they closed it for private visits. The second time, no English-speaking guides were available. Perhaps pre-booking on the internet would prevent these dilemmas.

Nice place alot of polices. A very beautiful and stunning building, the size of this Parlament building is Huge. Recommended at night for a good camera shot. Surprisingly there was not many tourist at the spot at all. There was more then 100 polices walking around the area. Which was good at night pretty safe :)

Loved it!. Our hotel was really close to the Parliament (roughly 10 min walk). It is well worth a visit even if you do not go on one of the tours. We didn't and still loved it. We visited it during the day and were lucky enough to be there by chance when it was the changing of the guards. The Parliament is also really beautiful when it is all lit up at night.

The famous Budapest landmark. This famous building is the face of Budapest tourism. We had seen it many times in pictures but were mesmerised to see this architectural marvel. It looks fantastic at night from across the danube on the Buda side. We stayed in Novotel Danube from where you get a very good view from just outside the hotel ot from your room window if you pay extra for the premium room. It looks great from the river cruise. Other best location is to view from Castle Hill.
Great sightseeing. The greatest sightseeing in Budapest I think. Cool exterior worth to see both from the boat and from the ground behind. Don't miss!

Parliament Bldg.. This beautifully restored building is very impressive seen from a night river tour. It's the classic view that you see in all the tourist pix. The changing of the guard was interesting since the guards stopped to talk and take pictures with tourists after their ceremony.
Breath Taking. By day or by night this is the most espectacular historical monument of Budapeste. Astonishing view, we couldn't help taking several photos from every angle, at all times os the day.
