Awesome place to view at night. The Parliament can be view from Fisherman's Baston and is very beautifully lit up in the night.. the building has a great architect and very well made ... one can avoid going near the place .. however it can also be seen while walking on Danube Promenade

Stunning. We did not go inside the parliament building, but having walked all around the outside, it is one of the most amazing buildings in Budapest. Huge and ornately crafted, it is very impressive. Probably the brightest buildings at night too, makes for some amazing photos.
Must see at night. This is a beautiful building! Not to be missed at night. The building is huge and beautifully made. I stumbled upon it at night and could not take enough pictures of it beauty.

Beautiful Building. Before we go any further, the most important thing to know is be prepared to wait - for tickets, for your entrance time and then for the tour. We visited on a Saturday morning and waited approximately 45 minutes for tickets. The tours are done in various languages so the next tour may not be in the language that you want. Our timed tour was scheduled to begin over 2 hours later so we walked around the local neighbourhood to kill some time. We returned 15 minutes before our scheduled tour start time and people from the previous start time were still waiting to be let in. A bit chaotic. Once we were in (past bag checks and metal detectors), the tour was quite good but far too short in my opinion. This building has almost 700 rooms and we visited maybe 5 in 45 minutes. What we did see was spectacular. The architecture is stunning with lots of sculpture, long corridors and an extravagant main entrance. Once the tour is over, you are escorted out so there is no opportunity to linger to enjoy the beauty of this building.
Holy crown. Great oportunity to see this awesome building and the holy crown of the empire. :) Beautiful, magnificent. Discount for EU citizens.
Impressive. The tour of this building is informative and the massive size and elaborate decor is impressive indeed.

Extravagantly beautiful. The Parliament building was designed in various architectural styles, but with great taste. What awaits you inside is a whole lot of gold and the Royal crown, scepter and sword. The only way to take a look inside is to join an organised tour. They have them daily, practically in every language, just check the Parliament site for the times. Don't worry, the tours are not expensive and quite concise.

Beautiful Architecture. Loved the view of the glittering parliament in the night with Danube river flowing in front of it and the lights on the bridges. The lights of the parliament goes out at 1 AM so its a must visit at that time when one moment, u see such amazing view and the next moment it all blacks out.

Stunning building. A most beautiful and well kept gothic style building in lovely surroundings by the river bank. We walked, looked, admired and photographed happily for ages. We walked along the riverside to get to it and just before, there was an interesting sculpture of shoes marking the place where the jewish people assembled before being shipped off the gas chambers. Very moving.

A History Lesson. This must be one of the top attractions for any visitor to Budapest. Book in advance for one of the English tours. It takes around 10 minutes to gather and go through security so the tour itself lasts around 30 minutes and there are 135 steps to climb (although a lift is provided for those less mobile). The main sight is the Hungarian crown in a glass case and guarded by a soldier on each side. All around the hall are the statues of past Kings of Hungary and one Queen Maria Theresa who was crowned in St Martin's Cathedral Bratislava (which I visited later). At the end of the tour there is an exhibition and a shop and café. The location of the Parliament Building alongside the River Danube is very impressive and it is lit up at night.

Amazing !. It was amazing to look at from different angles during different times. I loved it at night up close and far away, also really enjoyed in during the day time from the front and across the river! (:
Didn't go inside. But outside architecture breath taking. Walk along the Danube from the city centre, pause to reflect at the shoes, Then stand back and admire the beautiful buildings!
Impressive. A must see place when in Budapest. You got to see it during the day and so at night to see the beauty of the parliament with all the lights. Wonderful & Beautiful!

Enormous and Stunning. You've probably seen this building a million times in advertisements for river cruises... and it's just as impressive in person. Take a tour of the interior, and a boat ride on the Danube at night for amazing photo ops.
Get reservations in advance. This is a wonderful building, and deserves to be seen on the inside, and not just from a bus passing along the front. Make sure you get tickets in advance, and enjoy!

Worth a look. The Parliament building is worth a look, but the new "tourist booking office" creates an expectation of better than what is delivered. We had our booked time, and queued with nearly 50 people for that timeslot. When the guide appeared, and only then, processing through the airport style security began. That took ten minutes! The guide then led us all to the second floor to see the chamber etc. All the group more than half way back missed almost all the voice commentary - in this day, provision of personal audio guides offers a much better experience. The whole tour was over in under half an hour. My colleague reported his disappointment about not hearing the guide back at the booking hall, but there was no apology. Disappointing.
Breathtaking!. Architecture is simply breathtaking especially the view from the Danube. Tours are also conducted within the structure. English is spoken widely and easy access by local transit.
a fairy tail. really beautiful building superbly located and whilst strolling outside and viewing from the river is great try to also arrange a visit to the interior which is spectacular.

our Guide is the Best. An impressive building especially at night - you can see it magnificently lit from the Danube River Cruise.Our Tour Guide is a woman w/ substance I can say, she answer all our question with wit. We say the Ceremonial Crown on the center of the Parliament - guarded by three guards.
Another monument. Just like basilica this building is another wonder of Budapest. It looks amazing both from near view and from far view from Buda side of city.

Prettier by far!. I love this building!.It is supposed to be based on our Houses of Parliament,but in my humble opinion is far more attractive.Whether the quality of the parliament inside is any good, you will have to ask the Hungarians.Best viewed from the River or from Pest overlooking the Danube.

Changing of the guard. Arrived to see this little ceremony. Unfortunately didn't have time to actually go into the building, but there is a nice modern entrance building that we weren't expecting as our guide book is a few years old. The situation right on the river is beautiful.

Beautiful building but terrible welcome. Since the opening of the new visitors centre, entrance fees have increased greatly but not the quality of the visit: security check is chaotic and lenghty, with that time taken off the already too short visit for such a huge building. The information is given mechanically and without interraction, and before you know it you are shooed out of the building. On the whole, you waste a good part of the day queueing and waiting for 25 minutes of information better explained in any guide book. A place to avoid unless you really, really want to see the (otherwise beautiful) interior.

Don't go on National Day (October 23). After waiting in line 1.5 hours in the cold and drizzle on October 23rd (when entrance is free), I realized why I was one of the few tourists in line. There is no information anywhere and most of the building is blocked off. I must have spent only 15 minutes inside - not a good waiting to visiting ratio! If you don't know anything about the building or Hungarian history it can be very frustrating! It is uniquely beautiful inside, but not worth the wait. Better to pay the entrance fee and maybe get more information on a guided tour (although judging from the other reviews here it doesn't seem like those are worth it either).

Book ahead online. We booked online the day before our tour and a lot of them were already filled up. I was nervous about not being able to print our tickets. But I just showed them the confirmation email on my phone and she printed out our tickets, no problem. It's a beautiful interior and the guided tour is interesting. We enjoyed it. The ticket office/entrance is hard to find because it's underground and can't be seen until you're close. When you're facing the front of the parliament building, and the river, it's on the right side.

Hungarian Gothic. This is an impressive building on the banks of the Danube, gothic architecture with much gold bling. The exterior looks great by night all lit up but the interior tour is limited and could possibly show more of the building
impressive. visit by day but better by night. very impressive building. also the inside is very nice. wait for the guided tour this gives a lot of information that shouldn't be missed

Most incredible building I've ever seen. This building is so amazing... spectacular!Its totally worth the visit inside, even if you can see just a little bit. The fee is just for the inside anywayA great option is to do the cruise on the Danubio, where you can get a great view of the Parliament. Thats a place everyone should go in a life time.

Amazing-day and night. An amazing piece of architecture, very impressive. At night it is illuminated giving it a romantic aura. The surrounding area holds many tales of history from the statues beside it to the figure of Imre Nagy looking out to the eternal flame.

Consider skipping the tour. The building is very beautiful on the outside and the inside but the tour of the interior might not worthwhile, especially if pressed for time. It is the most disorganized process to enter the building. We had tickets for the 10 am and the tour guide left leaving half the group behind!! The person taking your tickets at the door before security spoke only Hungarian and made NO announcements, and that is how half the group got left behind !!!! When I asked what was happening, nobody spoke English. Finally went back to ticket counter and nobody could help. When I asked for my money back, I was told "is not possible". The group got tickets for the 11 am tour and we were late getting in. Once you are in there, the building is nice but the tour is 25 minutes only and you have used up the entire morning in Budapest. And you have each paid $20 for the privilege.
Highly regulated. Tours of the parliament interior are interesting, and the ornate rooms are worth seeing, but the tour is highly regulated and timed to the minute.

Welcome to the Parliament. The main landmark of Budapest is no doubt the Parliament and tourists have a great opportunity to visit it. Excursions are run daily on different languages. During an hour excursion you will get to main rooms, the dome hall, see the main symbol of Hungary – the crown and find out a lot about the history of the country and the building. The architecture and facades of the building amaze and the interiors astound as well. So, it is definitely worth visiting. For people with special needs there is a lift.

Impressive architecture. Designed by the same architect as the the Westminster buildings, and just as impressive. Take a long walk around the grounds and you'll notice that each section of the building is breath taking. Make sure you take a look from across the Danube as well, it's truly stunning.

Gorgeous building.. This recently cleaned and restored building is simple stunning. One can enjoy the beauty if this building and it's architectural masterpiece from all angles. The ground cooling mist is fun and cool. Could use more plants.

Superb. Of the sites we have visited in 50+ countries over the past 30 years, this may be the most beautiful building we have ever seen. We have toured the interior twice and have so many pictures of it from the outside at all hours of the day and night. It is frequently the last place we visit each evening, just to stroll around it and feel the romanticism that it exudes.

Not the most interesting Parliament tour. Taking a Parliament tour is one our most beloved way of spending time abroad. Unfortunately, this one was the least interesting. Yes, the place looks amazing. Yes, it is very large. Yes, it has lots of golden decorations and many of the usual special European architectures. But we are here to hear the story! They should really reconsider the story telling part of the tour. Also, our tour guide skipped the most important parts (to our humble opinion) concerning the days of WWII and Arrow Cross regime. They literally ignore very important times in the history of Hungary and Europe.Two more tips for the organizers of the tour:1. Please give a few moments between one tour to another. We were right behind the Russian language tour and their tour really interfered with ours.2. Groups should be much smaller. We didn't even had the time to ask questions because so many hands were raised and time was very limited.

Stunning Architecture. A beautiful stunning building that is well maintained. View it at night when it is illuminated and you'll see small birds catching the light in the night air. View it from the Chain bridge and/or Margaret Bridge for clear views.

Almost as good as the Houses of Parliament in london. The parliament building was modelled upon the London building and it shows. A really impressive structure that looks tremendous at night and at day. Do not forget the camera
A must see on a visit to Budapest.. A brilliant tour around the beautiful parliament building - our guide was excellent. I would recommend this to everyone.

such an amazing building. The parliament sits on the Danube opposite the Castle and is absolutely huge. The architecture and all the statues are splendid. There are regular guided tours and this is well worth a visit even if you just want to view it from the outside.
Hebrew tour . The hebrew tour was terrible because of the guide tour, no body couldn't understand him, it will be better to take the English tour or other language you understand.

Worth the visit though groups are large. I thought this very interesting - learned much about Hungary and it's history. Beautiful structure. My only gripe is that the tours are about 50 people each for English. Difficult to hear commentary over murmuring. Went at 835 am and could only get 3 pm tour. Summer must be far worse. Can't imagine.
Magnificent structure and brilliant architecture. Especially at nights, this place is a must see. The lights add to the beauty and marvel of the building.

The Museum Ship Lajta is currently moored outside Parliament. SMS Leitha [the Lajta Monitor Museumship], the first river monitor warship in Europe and the oldest and also the only remaining, fully restored warship of the Austro-Hungarian Navy is currently moored on a pontoon in front of the Parliament building. Laid down in 1871 and launched in 1872, the monitor saw active service in the First World War. In 1919, ’Lajta’ and her sister ship, the ‘Maros’ took an active part in the so-called ‘Monitor Revolt’ which was one of the first anti-communist rebellions in the world. A military takeover was organized in Budapest against the communist dictatorship and naval support from the Danube was seen as crucial to its success. When the monitors appeared on the river, they hoisted the red-white-green national flag, instead of the Soviet red one. The people welcomed them, but the revolt was soon brutally suppressed by Hungarian communist forces. The monitor can be visited free of charge on guided tours which start every half hour from 10:00-16:00 Tuesday-Saturday.
A must see. Superb building inside and out. Cheap tickets and very good tour guides. Check dates before you book as part of the building may not be accessible (parliament sitting).

unforgettable experience. one of the most important places which you must visit during your stay in Budapest, outstanding architecture wonderful view either from the Danube side or land side, Moreover don't miss the tour inside the parliament available with different languages, I really enjoyed it.

Nice!. It's a really incredible building. Its history is very interesting. The guide during our visit explains all about Parliament very well and it was interesting again. The zone in which it is placed seems to be improved, as seen in different areas of Budapest.

Night or Day. Whether you are looking at the Parliament building by night or touring it by day, it is worth your time. Modeled after Parliament in London it is a great example of Hungary at is earlier peak. The tour is good to and gives the locals a chance to brag about their new freedom.

Beautiful Buliding. I think this is one of the most amazing and beautiful buildings which I have ever seen. Definitely go walk around it on a nice evening and take pictures or just take in the sights. The guided tour of the inside was also quite nice. Under the main dome, you can see the crown jewels and possibly view the changing of the guard. I wish I could go explore this fantastic building on my own, but we can't always have everything.

Easy must see. One of the more beautiful buildings in Budapest and it's easy to walk around the grounds during your visit for interesting architecture pictures. I didn't go inside, but the guards on post outside and fencing at the entrances didn't make it look enticing. (I believe scheduled tours can be made)

Spires and Domes. The Budapest Parliament is a beautiful building situated on the Danube, near the Margit Bridge. It was built after the Parliament buildings in London and has a similar feel to it. The area around Parliament is a beautiful place to explore, with the wonderful Ethnographic museum across the street, and all sorts of interesting buildings with curious balconies and windows marking their uniqueness. The Parliament is best viewed from across the river from Batthyani ter, or from from the Margit Bridge, where one can take the most beautiful photographs.

Beautiful building well worth a visit. The parliament building and district is well worth a visit, very beautiful buildings and lots to do and see. The guards parade is also worth seeing with great photo opportunities. There is also lots of nice places to eat and drink, which are very fairly priced.
Amazing architecture. From a distance this building is amazing, but up close it's even more impressive, and you can get up close, which was surprising.
Really amazing. Perhaps the most important and emblematic building in whole Budapest. You should visit it by foot, but also seeing it from a boat at night is really impressive!
Amazing at night. The Parliament is incredible to see and visit during the day, but make sure to stand on the other side of the Danube at night and see it all lighten up.... it's definitely stunning!
Don't miss this one. This is the castle like structure on the Viking Cruise ads. We saw it on a walking tour but inside tours are offered.

Fantastic tour . A tour of the parliament is a must-do activity in budapest. We booked at parliament itself and had to wait a couple of hours. We were told you could also book online in advance and I'd recommend doing this. The tour itself was fascinating. The building is beautiful and you get to see inside one of the two main chambers. There are quite a few tours a day in different languages. Every tour is very popular.

Beautiful Building. This was definitely worth seeing. I would recommend getting your tickets online prior to your visit otherwise you might not get in. The only reason I gave this a 4 and not a 5 is because they were very disorganized before the start of the tour.

awsome. Fantastic building and absolutely awesome lit up at night from the Buda side of the Danube. A bit of a trek up the Pest side, across Margaret bridge and down Buda side but well worth it especially if your into photography.

Oh What ?. real chocolate box architecture - stunning ! and from the river, even more so. Get the no 2 tram to the end of the line - alovely ride and drops you right by Parliament Square. A real MUST DO !
Beautiful building. I didn't go inside, but the outside view is stunning. One of the most impressive buildings in Budapest.

amazing building. We passed parliament building when we arrived late at night! It was lit up and the sight was breath-taking! We walked to it the next day and it was an amazing sight in daylight, its enormous. Even though we didn't go inside, im sure it would be just as impressive!

Wonderful visit. We had a visit in French and it was very interesting.
All this rooms and architecture. To recommend.

Excellent tour, wonderful staff. Following Rick Steve's recommendation, we booked a tour through out hotel. However, we did not look at printout and arrived 45 minutes late. Staff of Parliament ticket office was wonderful. Even though they were fully booked, they accommodated us on the next tour.Loved the building and history. Parliament's group tour guides are wonderful: full of information, energy, and optimism. Wonderful well maintained building--if there is only one building you can see in Budapest, make it the Parliament building (and try for the Opera, as well.)
Wonderful building. We walked around this area on a Sunday morning. Not too busy,The architecture is stunning. In the same square is the memorial with 2 soldiers at attention.

What a delight. Visiting the Parliament is a must. Tickets need to be bought in advance . The guide spoke excellent English and you could see in the building the influence of Our English Houses of Parliament. I was surprised that we could tale pictures almost every where.
must see. make sure you buy tickets on line to see the inside of this beautiful building and chance to see the crown!!!
Well worth a visit. Truly beautiful and ornate. You need to book in advance and If you are an EU citizen take your passport and the entry fee is half price.

Fascinating building. There is an English tour every hour I think. The building itself is fascinating and is a landmark in Budapest. I liked the room that is now used for conferences and the room where the holy crown is located too.

Magnificent building. We purchased our tickets online from jegymester.hu before we left the UK. We received etickets so did not have to queue. There is a discount for EU citizens and the cost for two of us was huf 4400. We had booked an English tour and arrived about 15 minutes before the tour. We took tram number 2 from the river. This stops outside the Parliament Building and we had to go down some stairs for the visit. There is an airport type of security first and then the guide will take you for the 45 minute tour. There are lifts available.The tour takes you to the main entrance stairs and hall, one of the lobbies, old House of Lords and to see the Crown Jewels. The size of the building is amazing - the decoration, sculptures, paintings, lighting and carpets are magnificent. I believe the building is just over 100 years old.This building is beautiful from the outside and the inside will not disappoint. There were queues when we got there so if at all possible, I think it is wise to prebook.Do not miss this if in Budapest. When you leave you can walk along the riverbank to see the Shoe Monument.

Impressive. The building itself is spectacular, and the furnishings inside were quite ornate. Worth taking the tour, although it would have been nice to have been able to ask more questions of the guide, who moved us through very quickly.

Beautiful Building Right by the River. If you've seen the countless ads by Viking on TV, you've seen this building on the "pest" side of the river. While it's only about 130 years old, they did a beautiful job of construction (both interior and exterior) and an excellent job of restoring after the war. The tour costs about $20 each (takes less than an hour) but is well worth it and you can take pictures everywhere except where they keep the royal crown. The house chambers are beautiful and the corridors, anterooms, etc. have been spared no limits in making this one of the top Budapest attractions.
Worth visiting. Beautiful building and good guide, fair price. System should allow online booking to save people having to wait around while their language tour slot comes round.

A must see. The government history and the pomp of the interior made the tour of parliament a must see. The opulence and furnishings were very impressive and the guide made it very interesting. Make sure to reserve a slot in advance since you can only go inside on a tour.
Awesome view!. What a great construction! What a great view it gives , makes the whole landscape of Budapest unique, surprising. Check it out at night too!!!
5 Nights in Budapest. No one on a break in Budapest should miss a trip to the spectacularly designed and finished parliament building which was a highlight of our trip to Budapest.

Don't miss it!. The sheer size of the building is amazing. If you are impressed with the outside, the interior is outstanding. Very interesting tour, we booked it through the hotel, and seeing all the magnificent paintings, rooms, staircases and ceilings was a complete treat. There is an elevator so you don't have to walk up the 100+ steps inside. My husband and I both felt this was a 'do not miss' in Budapest. You,will also see the original coronation crown and scepter. Allow one hour for the tour and get there 15 minutes early. Afterwards, you can walk along the Danube which is so beautiful

Hungarian Parliament a top attraction. The building is so incredibly beautiful that you should satisfy your natural curiosity to see the inside. It does not disappoint. The English guide was often hard to understand but read about it later and take in the interior sites. Recommend: purchase tickets on-line to avoid the long lines for tourists purchasing tickets that day.
Open??. Only open to tour parties on Sunday but library was open , free and interesting with good guides . A beautiful building with great views over the Danube

Not worth the money. It took longer to queue and get organised the the tour experience. The cost was steep compared to value. I asked a fellow hotel guest the day prior to our Parliament visit and his retro was that it was too short. Agree! Few area of huge building visited. Crown Jewels interesting but it ,doesn't compare to theTower of London. If you really want to go, book on line. We tried one Afternoon but no tours available. Got there at 9 a.m next day and managed to get desired 1pm tour. Yeah, not worth money or effort. Don't is shoes by the Danube though!

Must visit. A great attraction. Beautiful building from both outside and inside.While admiring the building from the outside, we were lucky to catch a ceremonial show by the parliament guards. It lasted for about 10 minutes. Then the guards allowed the audience to take photos with them.For the inside you must take the guided tour and I would recommended to book your tour (specially english) on the parliament web site. Or go early in the morning to book your tour as tours are soldout fast. English language guided tours time is at 10:00, 12:00, 13:00, 14:00, 15:00. We were lucky today (Sunday) there was an extra tour at 12:15.The tour was very interesting and lasted for about 30 minutes. With lots of historical information.If you are not physically fit ask to use the lift. Leave your guns, knifes, and pepper spray at home as they are not allowed into the building. The security is similar to airports but we were allowed to carry liquids.

Stunning. The tour is short. Still worth the tour inside. It appears that they have a new visitor's center at the right side of the building ( no longer across the street). The best part of the building is the view from down the river and from Buda.

Unmissable... The parliament because of its location in Budapest and the spectacular architecture are simply unmissable once you are in the city. The impressive building is on the banks of the Danube on Pest side and some of the most spectacular views and photos can be clicked from across the river on the Buda side preferably from Batthyany Ter or there abouts.Kossuth Lajos Ter on the M2 metro line as well as on the Tram line 2 is the station for the Parliament should you need to use the public transportation. The walk in front of the parliament on the Danube promenade is one of the most stunning in the city without any doubts.There is a tour you can also take of the building - you can buy it on the far side of the building - the ticket hall is on the basement floor just next to where the statue of liberty is. The Hungarian flag on the backside of the Parliament (if you are approaching from the Danube side) has guards standing in full attention - which is quite a sight as well.The parliament building's neo-gothic architecture is very impressive and one can't but be in awe of the place.

Wonderful Building Both Inside & Out. Booked timed tickets for the tour. Waited in the new entrance hall.( E.U citizens pay half the admssion price so remember to take your passport.)Tight security in all areas.The guide was very good and explained all the various rooms felt a little rushed at times, lots of groups going round. Stunning interior with elaborate gold leaf decoration. The crown jewels are very well guarded and you musn't take photos in this room. Interesting to hear some of the history of the building. After the tour we visited the new cafe for coffee which was very good. Stunning building from the outside and flood-lit at night. A must visit whilst in Budapest. Wonderful views also from the Buda side of the river.
Landmark no 1. Impressive building on the river, with the Hungarian crown jewels on exhibit, should not be missed when in Budapest

Interest tour of some Hungarian history.. Beautiful building and our guide spoke excellent English, but you could tell she had done this a thousand times. The tour isn't cheap and the ticket booth is new - down the steps below ground at the new visitor's center. A sign would be nice with directions!!!!!!!!! We were tired and our guide book said the tickets were one place, a bank said another and finally a coffee shop sent us "towards" the Parliament building and there is was BELOW GROUND WITH NO SIGNAGE WHATSOEVER.

interesting tour. Tour was very interesting but we felt a bit rushed as there were lots of tours going on around us with other guides and we could hear them talking over our guide so it was difficult to hear clearly at times. The security was very high so it felt like we were being herded around with little time to take in the beautiful surroundings.

a must do in Budapest. Extraordinary building, inside & out. Well worth doing the tour. Worth booking an English one a few days in advance, if poss, as they can get booked up in busy times even though they do run lots of them.

You can basically see it from anywhere. Amazing architecture and stunning views. A must see. You really can pick the building out from just about any vantage point in Pest because it is located on the Buda side.
It was wonderful!. I was shocked to saw this building. It's very beautiful. I liked it. When I walked on the opposite side I can see the whole building.

The outside is immpresive, the inside not so much.. The building is impressive at the outside and at the inside. The tours are all with a guide, in the most common languages, helpfull and nice. From my point of view, it's not worth to get inside the building, since we only viewed arround 4 rooms out of a huge building, and in the room where the Senate would gather (now Hungary has only a unicameral Parliament, so it's not used), we could only enter in a balcony and take a couple of photos. A lot of gold and nice to see, but very little things are revealed inside.

Beautiful. We were not able to go into the building during our trip, but the outside view was wonderful. We walked around the outside, learned some about this building from our tour guide, and this area is definitely a place we would visit again to learn more.

Huge and nice. Besides the Parliament we have passed in the evening when his lighting gives a special charm and experience. Countless towers suggest that there is a castle and not the parliament building.

a quick visit that shows you everything you'd want to see. the visit is great - 45 minutes' tour with a guide (many different languages available) and you get to see the inside of the building, the room where MPs sit, the room where the crown and sceptre are kept and underneath the big dome. If the visit had been longer it would have taken too much time of our holidays or become boring, it was just right!The guides are very knowledgeable, the one we had was able to answer all sorts of questions, which was impressive!

Amazing building.. We learnt about this building in an in depth manner on our boat trip down to how many rooms, how many miles of stairs etc., and the architecture is beautiful.One can visit inside at certain times.....we did not have the time.

Parliament Building Budapest. The Hungarian Parliament Building, also known as House of the Country or House of the Nation, is the seat of the National Assembly of Hungary, one of Europe's oldest legislative buildings. It is a stunning example of Gothic Architecture. It is a notable landmark of Hungary and a popular tourist destination of Budapest. It lies in Lajos Kossuth Square, on the bank of the Danube. It is currently the largest building in Hungary and one of the tallest buildings in Budapest. The inside of the Parliament building is equally as impressive as the outside of the building. The parliament building is symmetrical and thus has two absolutely identical parliament halls out of which one is used for official politics, while the other hall is used for guided tours. It is 268 m (879 ft) long and 123 m (404 ft) wide. Its interior includes 10 courtyards, 13 passenger and freight elevators, 27 gates, 29 staircases and 691 rooms (including more than 200 offices). With its height of 96 m (315 ft), it is one of the two tallest buildings in Budapest, along with Saint Stephen's Basilica. An entrance fee is charged. For tours the adult fee is 2520 HUF, the student fee is 1260 HUF. Payment can be made by cash or credit card.

Huge. Impressive. Tram no.2 stops right there. You do not know where to look first: statues, detailed decorated walls, vegetation, flowers, the Danube. You can lay in the sun on the benches and stare at the immense building around. It seems that no wall looks like another one. You must see it at night, from a boat on the river.
Beautiful. We wish we could have toured this beautiful building but unfortunately it was closed for tours when we visited. However, even from the outside it is impressive
Most scenic parliament. I havent scene all the parliaments in the world. But I would guess this is right up there. It looks so meticulously done from the outside.

A sight worth seeing.. Although we never went inside the building, we saw it during the day and at night. The view at night is specifically beautiful, and the whole riverside is lit up. Picture perfect.

Must see. Any visitor to Budapest cannot miss or be enchanted by the beauty of this building, designed to mimic Westminster but ending up dwarfing it with opulent elegance by a mile or two. Situated on the Pest side of the city and in close vicinity to Margaret Island it overlooks the Danube, casting its overwhelming beauty across the river in a popular challenge to the royal palace and castle hill on the Buda side of the divide. Tickets are cheaper for European citizens so make sure you bring your passport to take advantage of the discount on offer. The guided tour is fascinating and is an excellent introduction to the history of the country, giving a real sense of their identity as a people as an independent nation and later, as part of the Austro-Hungarian Empire. The planar hall and architecture is lavish but the centre piece, in the truest sense, not only for the building but the Hungarians as a people is the Stephen's crown, the crown sent by the pope to the founder of the Hungarian kingdom upon his conversion to Christianity. In this sense, the parliament becomes much more than a house of politics, it becomes the epicentre of the story of nation building for the Hungarians as a people. If you want to get under the skin of the Hungarians, do not miss this place if anything but to be in awe of the splendour and beauty of it.

Pristine Parliament. We managed to experience our first glance of the Parliament from possibly the best angle on our first day in Budapest. We sat in the cafe alongside the Fishermans Bastion and gazed over at the Parliament for a long time without pause. Dreamy views. Passed the Parliament again on a cruise and it was just as good if not better when seen up close in the night lights. Marvelous sight.

The most beautiful building I have ever seen!. We stayed in Budapest in close Parliament neighborhood literally 2 min walk and I was glad I can see this place so close at least couple times a day! Not only outside but it looks beautiful in the inside as well. Take your EU passport and buy cheaper ticket. I am not sure if always but on Friday morning say 10ish we booked English tour for 1400 so remember to book in advance!

mixed blessings. My Review rating is based purely on time spent around this magnificent building, and then viewing from the river at night, simply stunning! the city is a hotpot of ideas taken from various other cities, for instance the idea of Parliament based on the houses of parliament in London, and then when Pest was destroyed by flood in 1830 it was redesigned on Frances wide boulevards. For the main part of our tour it has to be said that because its not that long ago that it was a communist regime, that many of the buildings while being substantial are to a large extent....boring! However there is no doubt that the parliament with its over the top "wedding cake" architecture is the jewel in Pest s crown.

Huge ornate structure which is iconic and very beautiful. This vast building in Gothic style, with its domes and buttresses etc. is a sort of copy of the UK's Houses of Parliament. Inside the gilding and ornamentation is stunning, but for me the (excuse the pun) crowning glory is St Istvan's Crown at the top of the grand staircase. St Istvan (St Stephen) was the first King of the Magyars and was beatified. The wonky cross on the top of the crown shows it has been around (on battlefields?) Even though it is not a monarchy it seems that the Hungarians look back to the golden era of their history.Entrance lower for EU citizens. A pity that not much explanation is given by guides but the building speaks volumes in its own right
Fabulous. This Parliament is an incredible work of renovation. The gilt applied and the love and care in restoring this building is amazing. A great place to visit and well worth the guided tour.
Well worth a visit. I could have spent much longer here. The buildings themselves are beautiful and the guided tour is interesting.
Pretty lame tour. Alot of security for a look into two rooms of this massive building. Skip this tour and buy the book instead. Guide was also totally disinterested in educating the group
well worth it do not forget your EU passport. Well worth a visit, but your EU passport as this gets you in for half price, outside EU citizens get charged twice as much, a bit cheeky I think.

Stunning. We spent a good hour walking around the Parliament building and square. the architecture is stunning, plus you see a display of marching and countermarching by the Parliament Protocol guard. There is a huge statue of Kossuth the Hungarian nationalist leader on one side of the square, framed by a building still bearing the scars of fighting during the 1956 uprising. Well worth the visit and take tram 2 along the river bank afterwards.
Very hurried. This is an amazing building but because of the large numbers visiting,we felt very rushed. You have to go with a guide.

Great Building. we were fortunate enough to stay just around the corner from this beautiful building. It is even more spectacular at night when it is lit up, watch out for the birds flying above at night, they look like stars moving around because they are lit up. We went on a tour of the building which I would recommend. It was very very well organised and no long queues. The Dome hall was lovely with the crown jewels.

Architecture + History. Pros: beautiful architecture and interior design, tour was informative on Hungarian's recent history. Cons: the tour was too short; getting onto the guided tour was abit confusing as part of the Parliament was under construction then so tickets can only be bought at another museum and we were not clearly told where we should wait to go in.

Lovely. We spent the morning on a river cruise and got off at the parliament buildings, what a lovely place, didn't go inside as there were guards around and it didn't look like you could, but we saw the changing of some type of guard with music playing, possibly the national anthem, a very pleasant morning

Beautiful building. Although I didn't go inside I was able to admire the parliament. Hiding from the outside, absolutely stunning, especially strolling around the Danube and other beautiful buildings behind the parliament building.
well organized. This building ist a must in Budapest. The tour is very well organized and groups and languages don't mix.
One gorgeous room after another. This is a must-see for Budapest. The outside is beautiful day or night, but the inside is fantastic as well. You have to book in advance, which can be done on line.

Pricing of Attractions and Transport in Budapest. Have spent the pasttwo and a half weeks in Budapest and surrounds and came here with many thingsto see. As a citizen from a country outside the EU there has beendiscrimination in every public venue, museum and event in Hungary. Forexample, senior citizens in the EU travel free on public transport while other visitors were not even eligible to purchase a senior travel ticket. Entry to a tour ofthe Parliament was 2000HUF for EU citizens and for the rest it was 4000HUF. Many attractions and events were missed as it was necessary to pick and choose. Citizens outside a select grouppay so much more. Would it not be better to have more visitors at the sameprice rather than no visitors at the high price! It would seem sensible to makeALL visitors welcome rather than be seen as unnecessarily greedy. DO YOU NOT WANT VISITORS FROM AROUND THE WORLD?Do you think everyone is rolling in Dollars? Potentialvisitors be WARNED there is price discrimination everywhere if you happen to be from a country outside the EU.

Stunning. Fantastic building, truly stunning. We didn't go inside but spent an hour walking around the grounds. This building stands proud on the Banks of Danube and is a fantastic piece of architecture. A gentle walk from the Chain bridge along the Danube, past the iron shoes and you reach the Parliament building.

Visit the seat of government. Remember to book up in advance on line, if you want to do the parliament tour. We booked from our hotel once in Budapest. You need printed tickets. A very interesting, short tour, definitely worth a visit. Beautiful exterior and interior.

Amazing. This beautiful impressive building is of course the major site in Budapest, and is wonderful to see, especially at night - make the effort to see it after dark. Tram route 2 takes you right outside.

Impressive building with poor tour. Building an impressive and interesting.
The tours take place rather than unsuccessful.
Simultaneously walking around several groups, each in a different language, some of them entering the same room together and interfere with each other.
Visitors only a small part of the building.

Decision making in a spectacular setting. One needs a reservation for a tour here and the price is 20 euros per person. Groups are divided by language. We traveled with an English speaker and other groups were led by those who spoke the major language. The building has two wings each of which was to house one of the two parts of the legislature. At some point in the not-too-distant past the country moved to a unicameral form of government. The tour brings the group to one of the houses which is actually not used but which mirrorsthe one that is in use. The building is quite beautifuland not at all similar to the US congress. It's hard to imagine that laws are passed and arguments pro and con are offered in this beautiful setting. In thecenter rotunda there is a guarded crown jewels display The guards are at attention for 15 minutes and then change their position and the group is retired and another group of guards takes over.It reminds one of the guards at Buckingham palace who stand for a period of time, expressionless and immovable.
Disappointing. Short tour , it could have included so much more, made more frustrating by an inefficient security process - the wait was almost as long as the tour!

Amazing bundling which is beautifully presented. This is an amazing building which is richly decorated. The guided tours are a must as there is so much to see and learn about the building. Allow plenty of time as security into the building is slow and it can become quite congested. Photos are not allowed in some sections Certainly worth a visit.
Stunning. The Parliement was beautiful, the new visitor centre is great and the tour guide was very knowledgeable and fun to listen to.Definitely a must see. (from the inside)

Majestic building with a sumptuous interior.. Attended the guided tour (in English) of this enormous structure which I believe is the largest Parliament House in Europe. Think of Parliament House in London without Big Ben and then add some. The history here is as good as history gets and the interior would rivel some of the best opera houses in Europe. Well worth the money for the tour and commentry.

Impressive. A building (and what a building) that everyone has seen in one travel brochure or another, the reality far transcends any kind of photographic representation. Possibly just a little larger than life, it and its grounds are still a most impressive sight.
Fancy building without interesting history. Crown jewels were best sight. The building interior is ornate, but with little history (built in late 1800s).

Stunning. It was huge and just stunning! Especially when you looked at it at night from the Pest side. I kept on taking photoes of it knowing I would end up having photoes of the same angles. But it was just beautiful with Chain bridge in a background. Don't go after 1 AM. They turn off the light at 1.

Outside better than inside. The building is so very lovely to examine from every angle. I would not bother with the tour again. The guide's English was barely understandable and the volume on her mike system was too low for the large crowd in the tour. We had hoped to better understand the system of government and the history of the building and it's place in the system. The inside of the building is lovely to see, though the decor is much the same throughout, not to mention symmetrical like the outside structure. Enjoy the outside and consider whether the inside tour is worth the steep price.

overwhelming. You must know that you should check what time is the entrance in the language you choose. Many language to choose, but you'd better book your tickets through the internet- tehre is the limit of people visiting at once. Also check if there is no additional event because than you may not be allowed to see everything. PLACE beautiful, ful of nice paintings, decorations... RECOMEND

Spectacular architecture. Whilst I didn't actually visit the building, I saw it from the Buda side of Budapest across the Danube. The light in the late afternoon makes the building almost glow. I managed to take a number of beautiful photos of the building in early and late afternoon. Fantastic with the river in the foreground.

Over-rated. Perhaps I have been to too many. For 4000 Huf for a 30min tour for a size as big as this Parliament, I was a little disappointed. It is definitely a money generator for the city. Yes, it is beautiful ...

Unbelievable at night! . To me, this building is the most breathtaking at night. I have seen many great buildings in the world and this one standa out to me. After dinner, take a taxi down to Parliament and feast your eyes on this magnificent structure. For the best picture, head to the side of the building rather than the front. Have fun!

You must.... See this lovely building from both the Pest and the Buda side. see it from a boat and see it at night. It is gorgeous...one of the most magnificent bldgs i have ever seen. I did not take a tour...was happy enough just gazing upon it!
Impressive. We only just walked around the perimeters. Saw the raising of the flag. Nice ceremony. Good for picture taking. Impressive architecture and nice grounds.

Grand and historic. All visitors to Budapest will see the Parliament.It is important to take the 45 minute tour to learn its history.Perhaps, even more significantly, is learning of the turmoil,history, and personages involved in the historic grounds surrounding the Parliament building.

A must in Budapest. IMO this is one of the most beautiful buildings in the world. The outside is breathtaking and at night it is illuminated with many other sights in the city. The guided tour is about 1 hr long and tells the history of the building. The inside is beautiful as well. I suggest you buy your tickets in advance as we did because there was a long line for tickets. The website it not that user friendly for credit cards but worked well when using PayPal.
parliament. beautiful building and especially so at night when it is lit up... brilliant view of this if you take a boat trip down the Danube.

My favourite building ever!!. Fabulous architecture and particularly striking when viewed from the river or the Buda side. Lucky enough to have attended a concert in the Dome on a previous visit. I just love this building. It's awesome!
Breathtaking building. I literally gasped when I saw the Parliament. It is a fabulous building inside and out. The English speaking tour was informative and interesting. Well-done. Not to be missed!

Largest building in Budapest, and perhaps the most ornate. We took the Italian tour when the English tours were sold out on a Wednesday afternoon, but enjoyed being led through this cathedral-like legislative building. The legislature is now unicameral, and we only were allowed inside the chamber that is no longer used, but it was a very interesting experience.We were led through halls and open areas that rivaled the cathedrals in their opulence, with marble columns, huge paintings on the ceilings, and statues beyond count. There were even ornate brass cigar holders outside the legislative chambers, numbered to each member could keep track of his cigar.Perhaps the most revered symbol in Hungary is the royal crown, work by 52 kings over more than a thousand years. It is on display in a glass case guarded by two soldiers, in a huge rotunda where no pictures are allowed because of the reverence with which it is viewed. If you are interested in statistics, the building has 10 separate courtyards in its nearly 900-foot length. It has 29 staircases, 29 gates, 13 elevators, and 691 rooms. Our helpful hint is this: try to buy your tickets beforehand, or you may be disappointed by not taking the tour in a language you understand. They can be bought on the Internet, but we had no way to print them out and weren't sure if we could pick them up. And if you can't get a tour in your language, take the tour anyway. You will remember the magnificent building long after you forget the detailed explanations.

Magnificent building -Excessive fee. This truly magnificent and symmetrical structure dominates most views across the Danube from the Buda side and is stunning at night. Details up close dazzle.As for the tour, why should the cost for three rooms only and no photo taking in the main dome hall where the original crown of St Stephen resides be so expensive? This is the house of the people and while EU citizens get a bit of a break, other visitors pay dearly for a brief tour with long security checks and many steps. The meeting chambers and hallways are opulent and impressive but the tour says next to nothing about the government process.In sum, the tour does not match the magnificence of the building except in price.
Magnificent building. This building is just so grandiose. The inside is so opulent.just magnificent. Do not miss this visit to the parliament .
Magnificent. Absolutely stunning building both at day and night and up close or from the other side of the Danube, this is a must see.
Parliament by the river. It was a nice looking building, but it Was less impressive compared with other parliament in Europe. The guards uniform needs modern design.

Interesting but very short. Although it was a scheduled 45 minute tour 20 minutes are spent getting in and through security. Be aware there are 132 steps BUT there is an elevator so just ask . You probably should get tickets in advance. It's pretty interesting.
Parliament. Newly created visitors centre where you can only buy tickets on the day. Visit inside the Parliament very interesting.

Wow. Such a beautiful building. The detail is so intricate, and it's clear to see it is built and maintained with such perfection. The best way to see this is whilst on a boat trip. Make sure you get plenty of pictures!

Great guide. The building is very impressive. It is necessary to go in person and book a tour for later in the day, which is slightly inconvenient. The guide was very informative and the effort required worth it.

Wow - really pretty!. Whilst we were not able to do an internal tour driving around the exterior as much as we were able really highlighted what a magnificent structure this building is. It is beautiful lit up at night. Make sure you see it by night.

Fairy Tale Splendor. This Hungarian icon is so gorgeous, so perfectly splendid that it could only exist in a fairy tale. We lovingly admired everything we saw: the palatial dome, the truly golden arches, the inlaid mythological paintings, arrays of heroic statutes, and the medieval royal crown and scepter of King/Saint Stephen. This is a must see on any visit of Budapest. Unfortunately we were paired with a docent who rushed through the pitifully short tour walking us quickly through the chambers that we were allowed to see and spoke so fast that even if she didn’t have a pronounced accent, we would have had a hard time understanding her. It would have been very tempting to tune her out all together. The tour was supposed to take about 45 minutes. We were shepherded out in 20 minutes. We loved the interior glory of the Parliament, but most of the data presented by our tour guide could easily have been found on the Internet. While we weren't able to spend much time gazing and gawking at the interior of the Parliament, there is one consolation. The stupendous exterior of the building, day or night, is never off limits. From every angle, if you didn’t know its history and current use, you’d think that it was the mammoth imperial headquarters of the Holy Roman Empire.
Very Intersting!. On our first day he had a tour of the Parliemnt which was very intersting and worth the money. This is a must see spot in Budapest

Spectacular around sunset. Probably the best parliament building among the ones we visited (Berlin, Vienna, Budapest). Fortunately it was within 10 minutes' walking distance from our hotel, so we got to go there on two evenings. The impressive architecture of the building was accentuated by the lights that came on around sunset, making it look breathtaking. It's a great place to hang out, and it's within a stone's throw of the Duna Korzo - the walkway along the Danube river, featuring the 'Shoes memorial'. Do go inside the Parliament building, because it's as spectacular as the outside. Lots of gold and works of art... very ornate, very tasteful, very historic looking. I'd say: Parliament + Duna Korzo make for a well-spent 2-3 hours.

A Must See. The newly restored Parliament Building is not to be missed. Hungarians are understandably proud of this restoration which must have taken years. Unfortunately, those managing the tours seemed poorly organized. Our group of Englishh speakers kept competing for space with other groups of eager tourists with guides. The Hungarians seem to make up rules as situations arise. The attention to security in this building can be over zealous, particularly in the absence of proper signs or instructions from the guide.

The pearl of Budapest. Parliament building is the most recognizable landmark of Budapest, and one of the most beautiful buildings in the world. This building fascinates with its beauty and you can’t take your eyes off it. If you have enough time - take guided tour to see the building from inside; if not - go to Buda side and enjoy view to the Parliament from the embankment of Danube

Impressive building!. This is one of the most beautiful Houses of Parliament I've ever seen outside London. It is really impressive, large gothic buidling with majestic views of the city and the Danube. Definitely go and see this building and try and do a tour inside. The queues are long so it might pay to go online and book early.

Beautiful. This is an amazing building with lots of history. Having done research on it before we left made the visit more pleasant. You should not miss the opportunity to see it at night. There are benches outside that we just sat down and watched the people and admited the lights shine in the light. This also served as a reference point to guide us through the city.

All the fun of an airport without the flight. We get there at 12:30, told to wait until 15:15 for the next English tour. Buy tickets, come back at 15:00, told to wait ten minutes. Go and sit down and wait for English tour to be called as we watch various other nationalities be put through the metal detectors. At 15:20 we go back to the portcullis and are told that we have missed our tour which sneaked in behind the Spanish. No refunds, and given the presence of various gun toting goons we weren't inclined to argue too vigorously. Maybe it was better before the fascists took over.

Most amazing in Budapest. I found Budapest a charming city, with some contrast, depending on the area you are. I started my trip with some friends in the morning and we were strolling around the whole day. When the sun went down we were at the back of the Parlamient and when the lights swiched on, we were really sorprised because of the beauty of this building. We sorrounded and by the time we reached the front of the Parlamient we had no words. It was the most beautiful building I have ever seen. The city completely changes during the night. Lights are strategically set up that the city turns magic.If you have the chance and the weather is good, I would take a boat trip during the night to have the opportunity to immerse in the majesty that this city offers during the night.

Beautiful outside and inside. Amazing building, beautiful in the outside and especially at night. However, if you do decide to visit it you will not be dissapointed.We booked the tickets in advance, and went into the visitor Centre at the right hand side of the building 30 minutes before, as it is recommended. However, I realized there was really no need as they will organize the groups depending on the languages you have booked only 5 minutes before the time of the tour.The tour takes 30-35 minutes and it shows the magnificent rooms and stairs of one side of the building, which they say is exactly the same in the other half of it. It is just amazing, so full of history and beauty.A place not to miss!!
Amazing building, interesting tour. We enjoyed our visit to parliament. The building is amazing in its size and detail. The docent gave a wonderfully informative tour.
Can skip the tour. The guided tour is expensive and very short, 45 minutes gross and less than 30 minutes net. Cann't see much of the building

modern and still proud of the tradition. We visited the huge parliament building in august 2014.it was clean and tidy outside with soldiers on guard allowing pictures from the public as a reminder of our visit.We didn't go inside it was i believe the weekend
Woah - but kinda short. It's really beautiful and worth a look. You get a lot of info of the tourguide. I found it too bad that the tour only lasted for an hour.

Not available. The building itself is renovated which gives a feeling of a fraud - the building doesn't look its age :) There are underfloor steam fountains which work from time to time. General public are usually not allowed inside.

A must do in Budapest. The exterior is as beautiful as the interior. The neo-renaissance facade outside is breath taking. Visit it both during the day and the night (to see how well it is lit up).Inside go for the parliament tour. 40 kgs of gold were used in the construction.The third largest parliament in the world, it is a sight to see.

Beautiful Inside and Out. The tour inside is short and the guide was difficult to hear due to many groups in the same spaces. I listened for a while but soon realized he wasn't so interested in what he was talking about, so why should I be. Instead, I just spent the 45 minutes of the tour admiring the architecture and taking pictures. If you're looking for an educational experience, you'll be disappointed. If you're a fan of interesting architecture and don't expect much from the humans around you, you'll have a great time.
Looks great at night. Great for a walk in the evening along the river. Looks amazing when lit up. A bit out of the way of bars etc but good to see.

Can't be missed. A must visit if your in Budapest. They do tours in quite a few different languages, but make sure you book on one as space is limited. We find quite often, when the outside of a building is so beautiful, the inside tends to be a little disappointing. Not this place. Every corridor and stairway is amazingly decorated and that's before you even get to the Upper House Chamber or the main hall containing the Royal Crown. Our tour was in perfect English and kept us engaged all the way round without becoming boring. My wife is also pregnant and we we're impressed that the number of steps ahead was pointed out and happily used the lift which was made available. Well worth the entrance fee (reduced if you are an EU citizen)

Awesome!. Our guided tour was delightful and very informative. The history of this building simply boggles the mind. You may have to wait for a half hour or so to be admitted after buying your admission ticket, but, it's well worth the wait. This is a don't miss venue.

must see. very beautiful
the rooms are worth the small price to enter
do not underestimate walking distance around Budapest
Architecture and pomp. wMarvelous , grandiose,but fee was high for a gov bldg...beautiful grounds changing of guards inside and out

A gem in the evenings. The parliment building is a real architectural gem, especially in the evenings when all lit up... provdies a great counterpoint to the castle on the other shore.
During the day, it's also a ncie area to sit in the sun and watch the world, and the trans go by

Not worth the money. We had the guided tour, we think it is too short (less than 1 hour) compared to what you have paid. The building itself is magnificent, but we can only visit few rooms. I would recommend just taking pictures outside (especially at night) and not go for the tour.

Rushed and over-subscribed. Far too many people in one group, which meant you couldn't get a good look at things, and had to either shove your way to the front to get photos, or yield your spot to someone else. The guide seemed extremely bored and quite reluctant to answer questions. We were moved from room to room at quite a speed, and there was no time to stop and take in what you were seeing. This tour is NOT worth the money, as you basically see only about 4 or 5 rooms, and you are moved on really quickly.
Could be better. Had the guided tour of the Parliament. It is modelled both politically and architecturally on the British Houses of Parliament. But it was a bit slow. Good to see but not essential.
Beautifully illuminated at the night. Impressive during the day and even more illuminated at night.Definitely worth visiting! Make sure you are early enough to buy a ticket for your language trip ;)

Budapest parliament. Wonderful building, one of the symbols of the city!I suggest a visit in the inside: it is limited to a few rooms only, but definitely worth a visit!Also from the outside it is very impressive and it can be seen from several panoramic spots... the best is at night!

Imposing bulding. The building is very imposing and it can be seen from lots of areas, and you can enjoy it's different facades. It resembles a castle although it has a somewhat modern look. It's one of the objectives in the city center so you can't miss it

very attractive building. very attractive building, beautiful view of the river or the hill in the opposite. If at night look more beautiful because of the lights. One of the landmarks in the city of Budapest which will not be forgotten
A Must. Put this on the top of your list. The outside of the Parliament is stunning both day and night. We decided to take the tour and we were not disappointed by any means.

Awesome Parliament. When in Budapest in June 2014 we toured the Parliament Building which was truly awesome. The architecture, carved wood, gilded walls, etc make for a splendid feast for the eyes. At night it lights up and becomes a central focal point in Budapest. In front of the Parliament is also the edge of the Danube where you can see the Shoes along the Danube tribute to the Jewish people executed along the river. The whole city is just amazing. Loved it. Would go back again.
Disappointing, at least the toilets are free. We payed 4000 HUF per visitor. The building is very impressive but the tour is too short and not worth the money.

Make sure you book a guided tour in advance!!. We walked down here at 11am only to be told that you must go on a guided tour and there wasn't an English tour until 3pm so we had to come back. As EU citizens we got in for half price so it only cost about £10.00 for us both to get in. The building is huge and absolutely stunning inside. However, the tour is just over an hour long and you only get to see a small part of the building. Also, there is very strict security procedures to get through not dissimilar to the airport. It is definitely worth a visit though.
Amazing, a must see in Budapest!. In this instance pictures speak a thousand words, take a look at my images - viewed at night particularly it is truly breathtaking!

Magnificent at night. This iconic emblem of Budapest, you must see this from either a Danube river cruise or from the hills on the Buda side of the city (or both!). Make sure your camera is fully charged: you'll be using it a lot!

Orszaghaz. Clean and impressive. Easily reached by Villamos. Trams slow down while passing the building. I like Budapest very much and you are beginning to annoy me. This is supposed to be about the hotel I lived in.

Wonderful! A must see in Budapest.. By no means the Parliament is the first must see in Budapest. The magnificent architecture and the location on the Danube banks. For an indoor visit you need to buy tickets in the new visitors center, or better make your reservation on the internet. Not cheap, but worth every penny. EU passport holders may enter for free.

Nice to vistit at night. We were not able to take the tour inside so we decided to take the Danube night tour. The view of the Parlament from the river at night is incredible. The structure looks magnificent

Hungarian jewel in the crown. St Stephens day is a national holiday 21st August, and the Parliament is open for free. Most of Hungary were there during the day waiting patiently in the rain for miles just to get inside to see the Crown of King Stephen and the orb and sceptre which are guarded under the main dome, and this is the only part you cannot take photographs, although plenty try. Visitors like us paid for a guided tour which took in most of the parliament buildiing ending up at the main attraction, however the tours need booking in advance. Later the same day is the procession of St stephens right hand from the basilica to the chain bridge and back, where all the rest of Hungary was , singing the hymns, and applauding the various participants in the parade. A very proud people who obviously have a great respect for their independence and their history.I am very glad I saw it on that day, as it brough home the importance the people attach to their parliament. The building by the way, is well worth the visit !
Nagyon Szep!. Beautiful and old. Stunning structure of this quaint old building. Walking distance from Hotels and a lovely walk along the Danube.

Spectacular at night.. When I went there was no tour of the building (parliament might gave been sitting!). However at night time it is illuminated and the view of it across the Danube is wonderful. A must see.

Beautiful.. This building is so far removed from one's image of a parliament building. It is more like a fairy tale castle, reminiscent of buildings in Prague. The area round it is well tended with many seats and there is an exhibition underneath.
Pest side. This is the best known building from Budapest for tourist.One of a kind, should be viewed from the Buda as well as the Pest side.Wonderful experience.

Best location of Parliament.. Have not been inside as always being repaired when I have been but it is amazing site from Var.Standing on the Danube it is a beautiful Parliament Building especially at night when lit up.

Exquisite! A historical place worth a study not just a browse. It is worth being in there with a guide or a local who knows about it.Great history behind it to understand the past, the scars of the wars and how Europe has united, yet the fissures.
Nice view in the evening.. I only visit the outer area of this place. i went there in the evening, with its yellow lighting made the view more spectacular, the best time for photo session.
WOW!. This was an expensive tour - about $20 for adults and for a dry 45 minute tour. But, the building is amazing so I would gladly spend the money again.

Grand Building. visited here and looked round from the outside as was to late to go in. Building has obviously been recently cleaned and looks very impressive. You can walk round the whole outside and see the garden, statues and guards by the national flag.You can pay to go and look inside if you arrive before about 4pm.

Great building to see. A great historical place to visit, perfect landscape architecture. You have so much to observe all around. We felt the spirit of the city there. You can walk to the place and have a look around all of the streets and get the point of the Budapest.

Espectacular !!!. We had the view of the building from the hotel, but the cherry over the desert was the visit inside it. Something imposible to describe with words, you must see it. Superb outside, super great inside.

Not many tours; check in advance. The Parliament building is obviously rather stunning. However, we turned up (following a guidebook) expecting to be able to join a tour on the day itself. This was impossible as apparently there was only a Russian tour on that day. Check in advance if wanting to do this.

not cheap, but totally worth!. It wasn't our first choice - cause we are really budget traveller and 2000 forints is something for us, but it was great.
You can book your trip earlier, there are special hours for different language (there is no Polish though). Guide was nice and he was answering all of our questions. Inside of the Parliament is amazing!
Fantastic do not miss. 2000 huf was a bargain for a fantastic tour of this wonderful building. Outside looks superb , but inside is even grander. Interesting tour.

Fabulous building. Get tickets beforehand - in person only apparently.
Good tour, but the start was disorganised. Several groups with similar start times, multiple languages not clear which group was being allowed through. Was still a good trip, well worth going.

3rd largest in the world.. After Buenos Aires and London, this is the 3rd largest parliament building. Right on the Danube, it is an imposing structure looking across to the Buda side of Budapest. Weren't able to go inside, however.

A very picturesque building. Although I didn't go on one of the guided tours around the inside of the building, I did spend time walking around the outside complex and buildings. Great photo opportunities and interesting activity i.e. protesters in tents, just like in London.

Amazing building, but not the best tour. This was an expensive tour -- about $20 for adults and $10 for students (which student ID) and only a 45 minute tour. The building is amazing so I'm not sorry we did it, but the tour itself was a little dry lacking the good stories that would have made it come to life. Honestly, the whole thing was a little depressing too, as they have this incredible building (2nd largest Parliament building in the world with only London's being larger) and most of it is empty. It really underscores the very sad story of serial occupation in Hungary over hundreds of years. Still, I would recommend it as something you should do while in Budapest.
Impressive. Worth the time and couple of bucks to see this beautiful work of art. Good lighting for handheld photography. Ticket office closes at 1100 on Monday but can get tickets on line
Rivals House of Parliament in London. Amazing building and architecture. At night it's lit up and looks phenomenal. A must see and can't miss all in one

One of the most Amazing buildings of the world. When I saw the Parliament building in Budapest for the very first time (from the river) I was impressed. Years after that I knew what to expect but it took our breath away anyway. In any light the building is magical, huge, nice, impressive, unforgetable. We did not take the tour inside this time but spent at least 3 hours staring at the Parliament from the Danube and from the castle area too. Tip for best photos - wait for the evening light ;)

Spectacular "MUST SEE" (tour only so-so). I have been to the Hungarian parliament several times and took my Father and Uncle with me today. The tour was in English and began in the new visitor centre. The parliamnet building is always breathtaking. The third largest parliament building in the world and certainly the most opulent it is incredibly rich in decoration. One of the highlights is the Holy Crown of St Stephen, 1000 plus years old, it is the oldest royal crown in Europe and an antique masterpiece. If you are in Budapest, the parliament building is something that simply has to be seen!!! All that said, I have to mention a few criticisms. The tour guide was very knowledgeable, and her English was very good, but she spoke far too fast and not nearly loud enough. The tour felt rushed, and though we saw the Upper House Chamber, and a lobby and the area under the main dome with the Crown and the main staircase , yet it seemed hurried. It was disappointing that we did not go up or down the grand staircase, as the tours ran in the past. The brand new visitor centre is a bit spartan. Anyway Go!

Great building, but the tour could be better. The building is fantastic and very grand indeed. However we had trouble booking on line beforehand and the booking website didn't appear to be stable. The tour itself was fairly rushed and we had trouble hearing the guide. We've toured the British parliament and the London tour was far more informative. Don't be put off by this review. Do visit it just for the sheer grandeur, but don't expect too much of the tour itself.

Very nice. Like most stately buildings, it is very large. The building is impressive and the area around it is quite nice with a wide open space and seating areas to relax and take in the view.Right across from a metro station so very easy to get to.
Buildings again. We did not visit this separately but did photograph from the Buda side in the day and from the river at night.
Impressive!. The building is impressive, and also the museum. It worth to visit even if you don't go inside. The museum is also very nice, but not so good with children though.

The image. This is the most beautiful builing i have ever seen... it´s huge... it´s beautiful... it´s magnificente!The inside tour is a little bit poor... you onlu view a small part, but the guides are good

The second biggest Parliament in the World. When in Budapest, don't forget to go and visit this architectural highlight. A 45 minute tout takes you through the most important places. Tickets to be purchased in advance (at the desk or via internet-hard to get tickets on the day itself). Discounts for European Citizens.

The parliament building in Budapest. The parliament building in Budapest stands arrogantly above all other building around. Dominating the danube river and touching the sky with its dome. Very richly decorated outside and inside can easily show the attitude of the people towards its government and opposite too. Definitely worth a visit.
One of the most beautiful places on Earth. Make sure you reserve your ticket in advance to be able to visit this breathtaking building. it's worth the entrance fee.
Stunning. The architecture of this gigantic gothic building is stunning! Can be seen from various vantage points along the Danube! Surrounded by fantastic, historical sculptures.
Beautiful. What a beautiful building and quite interesting. To enter the houses of parliament though, you need to book.
better then the cathedral in Florence. By far one of the most beautiful buildings I have ever seen! It is in the same style but much nicer then the Cathedral in Florence.
A must see!. A visit to the parliament is not to be missed, even if you are not into politics. The building itself is worth a visit, and the history is very interesting too!
Below expectations. While very spectacular and beautiful from the outside the parliament is not that great from the inside the tour is very short. I wasn't able to enjoy it.

Finest Work. One of the most beautiful building in Budapest. Inside is even more beautiful and the guide explains the finest details and its like a palace and the architecture is one of the finest and most admiring.

Impressed. What a fantastic looking building! We walked all around it to have a look from all sides. We took the advice of friends and previous reviews and did not tour the inside. It was a nice day and we wanted to be out enjoying it.
