Beautiful to look at... This is a building best seen from across the river, when I visited there were renovations happening to the building so I couldn't really get up close to appreciate the building.
Being on the other side of the river however gave great views and great pictures!
Touristic spot.. Sincerely, the building is interesting to visit but everything sounds tourists oriented, a bit boring and the tour is much shorter than the line you have to afford.

organised tour. done an organised tour when we went here and from the outside th building is stunning and sits right on the river, the tour was cheap and lasted about and hour with a changing of the guard outside as we were waiting to go in

Go for it. Beautiful. Wonderful. We purchased our tickets on-line with the help of our hotel. The English tours do fill up quickly. There is a tin of security around and inside the building. My only complaint is that there was no where to sit, my son was reprimanded a few times for sitting on the floor. He was exhausted from all the walking we had done.

Careless ticketing. Girl selling tickets inside said there were plenty of tickets . We joined second queue after very uncomfortable wait we got to booth where surely woman told us sold out and yes the system is shabby. Inside , opulent and colourful .quite interesting.

Nice but not outstanding. Looks better out than in. Don't miss the fabulous Sevros hoard of Roman silver recently bought, and brought back by the Hungarian government is on view for free by entrance 12.
Beautiful and Fully Restored. The attention to detail in this restoration is wonderful. The entire area is bike and walking friendly, seeing lit up at night from The Danube River is beautiful
amazing architecture. although clearly new building, especially during the night is beautiful. HAs to be seen both from the Buda hill and from a closer view.
Parliament. Walking tours available in English & other languages. Very informative and worthwhile. beautiful architecture. very accessible for someone in a wheelchair.

Interesting tour. The building of the parliament is beautiful and the tour was interesting. You can join a tour in almost any laguage (for example Hebrew). It was nice to see the "crooked crown" which is the symbol of Budapest
Great Landmark in Budapes. Great views of the Parliament Building from across the Danube, plus it looks just as good up close and inside.

just go for it!. the parliament should be on a must-see-list of every visitor of Budapest. as they are very strict when it comes to a visit of the parliament i suggest to reserve a ticket in advance! the parliament is really worth visiting and it would be a pity to miss that really great attraction of Budapest!

Amazing Landmark. We did not get a chance to tour the building but drove by it twice and stopped for pictures. It truly is a remarkable building. If I have an opportunity to return to Budapest I will plan to take the tour.
beautiful Landmark. What a sight from a ship on the Danube and again in the plaza behind the Parliament. I would have like to visit but it was not open that day.
Worth It!. The tour was quick but interesting. Top 5 to see. Need more English tours. Half of our group were second language English anyway.

Worth the money. Purchased tickets online before I left home, and this saved time, and made sure we got tickets. Building is beautiful, and while this was about $16 each, I thought it was well worth it.

Fascinating building. It's really impressive how those buildings make you feel small and important at the same time. The stairs, the ceilings, the columns, the rooms can hardly be described. The view over the Danube river and the city is also breathtaking. It is definitely worth a visit!

Get tickets before you plan to visit. The tickets are sold by language. We arrived 3 hours early planning to buy tickets. To our surprise the tours are organized by language and all the English tours for the day were booked.We bought tickets for the upcoming Italian tour. During the tour we tried to keep a low profile and just keep with the group. The building is beautiful and is well worth seeing. Not sure if touring as an "Italian" really made the tour more or less interesting!

It is just as beautiful inside as it is outside. The interior of the building is beautiful. I was surprised that it was as attractive and that there was as much attention to detail as the exterior.Unfortunately the only way to see the inside is on one of the official tours, which right now are not being run very professionally or cheaply. Contrary to the guidebooks, EU citizens are no longer free. We paid HUF 1750 for an EU citizen and HUF 3500 for a non-citizen. That's a pretty steep price for what ultimately was 30 minutes of waiting for a tour to start and a 30 minute tour. And thankfully we didn't wait in the long queue to buy tickets at their booth (in the Museum of Ethnography across the street). If you do decide to go I highly recommend using the official website and buying your timed tickets online. It cost us HUF 200 to save at least 30-45 minutes waiting in line on a weekday in June.The tour itself was disappointing as well. It was a rather brief 30 minutes long and because of a lack of guards they sent our English speaking tour through with a Hungarian language tour which meant we had to stand very close to our tour guide to hear anything. Am I glad I went? Yes. Would I recommend it? To patient people, yes.

The dominant building on the Pest bank of the Danube. Did not go in but the outside is so well maintained the stone masonry fabulous and an architectural gem worthy of many photos from so many angles. It is in a lovely setting with open pedestrian piazza one side and Danube on the other unfortunately this has a busy road alongside. Not to be missed.

Loved It. Very well organized. Good guide. I like to see each country's government building and really enjoyed this one. It is not hard to get a ticket (www.jegymester.hu), or hard to get to. Tram 2 takes you right to the building. It is beautiful inside and out, and you really get to see something - the great staircases and the actual place where laws are made, etc. St. Stephen's crown and scepter are fun to see. All in all, worth it if this sort of thing interests you.

Must see. Book you tickets online to avoid the long queue and get a spot on the day you want to visit. Tickets are available here : http://www.jegymester.hu/eng/Production/480000/Parlamenti-latogatas.I have no additional comments, I saw there are plenty of details from others.

Gorgeous Building!!!. Things to know before you go:1. You have to buy your tickets across the street at the museum2. The price of admission varies on where you're from. (EU residents get in cheaper)3. They will search you for dangerous goods or weapons (similar to the airport screening)4. You cannot take pictures in the "Dome Room" where the Crown Jewels are.5. You enter through the north entrance and the tour takes 45 mins.6. English tours are offered 4-5 times per day (10am, 12pm, 1pm, 2pm, and 3pm) as I recall.Good tour, interesting facts, and the building is absolutely stunning inside and out (especially at night while lit up).

Beautiful building. Tour is well worth the visit but make sure you book your tickets in advance on line. The english tours were all sold out so had to buy a tour in spanish. Didn't really understand much but it was beautiful to see and the only way you can tour the building is on a guided tour.

Architectural masterpiece. By any world standard this is an exceptional building. The care that went into the construction, decoration and renovation is evident. In spite of the difficulty in getting in, it was worth the effort. Tours are offerred in several languages - though you should read up a bit first. Our tour guide was mediocre, hard to hear, drowned out by the following guide - and we were rushed out because the President of Turkmenistan was visiting. It is pricey, but well worth it. The ticket office is a good distance away in the museum across the street. We waited in line an hour to buy tickets, then had to wait another 45-minutes for our timed entry. Tickets/ tours are available online, and had we planned things better, we would have gone that route. A small museum of treasures near the front entrance was close due to the visiting President. We hope to see it next time.... there will be a next time for this fabulous city.
Impressive. This is a impressive piece of arcitechure, well worth walking by for a look. Budapest in general is a lovely place to visit.

Just as beautiful inside as out. Due to us not realising that we would have to book quite so far in advance we had to join an Italian tour or we wouldnt have had the chance to see it. It didnt bother us as we just went around and gawped. It is in immaculate condition - the rooms, the guards. The only diappointment was St Stephens crown, now I know crowns are symbolic but.....what was amusing was how you were watched like a hawk in that room and couldnt take photos. Really worth putting on your itineraryPS take your EU passport for a discount

Sumptuous building, short and informative tour. Spectacular on the outside, splendid on the inside, the parliament visit is a must. Elevator access is possible on request. Our English tour was arranged from the ticket office in the museum opposite and we had little more than a one hour wait. The guide was excellent and there are lots of photo opportunities and time. Yes, the Dome is out of bounds for photography but that is fairly standard with national treasures on display.

Amazing Building. Whow what a building, incredible architecture, I did not get to visit inside but just looking at this magnificent building from the outside is amazing. I also took a day and evening cruise on the Danube and it is fantastic to see this building lit up at night. One not to be missed, but very difficult to be in Budapest and not see it.

Stunning at night. Did not visit the inside of the building but what a stunning building externally and what a lovely setting.You can see why people say it was modelled on its London sister.See it lit up at night and you will not forget it.

An exquisite building. The hassle of getting tickets for the guided tour was worth it. You have to book online before going. My hotel did this for me. You are only allowed in with a group which has a limited number of participants. The number of tours per day depends on the language you want. I went at 10am with an English group. It is expensive and only lasts 45 minutes, but it is a "must see" in Budapest and a photographers dream. Security is tight so bring as little with you as possible.

Beautiful Architecture. The architecture of this building is stunning to say the least and at night it is even more so. Be sure to take a close look at the building even if you are unable to do the tour as it will amaze you.

Very hard to find the right word to explain this amazing building. Take a tour and just be blown away by what you see. Large gold cigar holders, the Crown Jewels on display. The rest will just astound you. For architects and historians and lovers of the finest things in life this has to be number one on you list

totally worthy!!. A beautiful building. I didn't book the guide tour in advance, so there was no English guide tour available by the time. Although I can't understand a bit Spanish, it is worth visiting it!

Amazing building . The tour is worth it as it is the only way to see inside the amazing building. I went for the 12 o'clock English tour but could not be fitted in until 3 so don't expect to be able to go straight on the tour of your language as soon as you arrive. We tried to book tickets online but they weren't Etickets, they needed to be posted and we were already in Budapest so that wasn't an option. I'm sure you can go in to the museum opposite and book tickets for a later date though to save waiting in the day. Tour was interesting and building was amazing although I found it quite difficult to hear the guide but she was very knowledgeable and friendly. Definitely something you must do when visiting Budapest.

Beautiful building. The building is a beautiful gothic-style building (the largest building in Hungary). We weren't able to go in because Parliament was in session. The views from across the river (or on the river in a boat) are spectacular.

Short informative tour. The 45 min that you can purchase has good information and facts about the government and building. It leads you through multiple interior rooms and provides nice photo ops. You can purchase tickets same day at the museum across the street or in advance online. Caution they do sell out and sometimes have shorter hours because of special events.

Very good, but.... Impressive building but strange that you need to pay to visit a Parliament. Tickets are sold inside the museum located one block away. There are guided tours in foreing languages, but you have to wait in the line at open air. In a rainy, a very hot or a very cold day the wait probably is a torture. No pictures are allowed exactly where everybody would like: under the dome.

Really impressive building. Very impressive white fasade building situated on the banks of the Danube river. The mixture of neo-gothic and neo-renaissance style (the dome). I've listened about it so many times and now I am satisfied that I had chance to finally see it.
An impressive looking building. Easy to get to and a visitor centre is in development. Impressive facade and take time to watch the changing of the guard and lowering of national flag.

Over the top. A beautiful and very large parliament building that looks more like a cathedral. I have never seen so many spires. We did a 3/4 walk around the building and watched a change of the guards ceremony. There were long lines to get a tour of the inside. We did not bother, as reviews told us that it was nothing special. From the parliament, going south, it is only a short walk on the riverbank to the Shoes on the Danube memorial.

City's grace. The most beautiful building in budapest to my eyes. Its huge and had beautiful architecture. Its view is amazing from the buda castle and the river. Its surrounding area is also very beautiful.
Amazing building. We'll worth a visit. Good guided tour in English. It is a beautiful building on the river Danube. Had to wait for the tour but worth doing.
Amazing. This is a lovely place to go which was quite when we went in the middle of the day. The building is amazing and awesome for pictures. You can visit inside but this is a bit expensive

Lovely building, terrible tour. The parliament itself is an impressive building, definitely worth seeing. Is it worth the entrance fee? Not really, as the mandatory guided tour in the parliament is short, hasty and uninformative. If you're not looking to waste money, just enjoy the parliament's beauty from the outside.

The most beautifull Parlement building of the world. This building is a big true gem! So much details. You just keep making pictures. Situated along the Danube you can see it from a lot of places. During the evening and night the riverside of the building is very well illuminated! You can also take a tour inside the building.

impressive building. Take the time to walk around the parlement building! it is hugh!!! Best time to do this is in the morning or late afternoon because there is no shade.We couldn't visit It because it was closed due to holidays but has appr. 690 rooms.
So beautiful.. Very well organized. We arrived at 1030 hoping to do the 1200 tour. It was sold out but they added a 1 pm tour. Interior is spectacular. Very informative tour.

Impressive Symbol of Budapest. Though the building is reminiscent of several I have seen in Germany, this neo-gothic masterpiece has some uniqueness to it, which rightfully made it a contemporary symbol of the city. This architectural dominanta is really impressive both if you look at it from Buda or from Pest embankment.
Amazing. Parliament is amazing. Structure and size is jus astounding. Finally they finished renovating surroundings so now you can look at whole building from every angle

Big and beautiful, but tour wasn't terrific. To be fair, it was the guide's 7th tour of the day, so perhaps try to get on an earlier one. It was also quite crowded and a bit difficult to hear her. The outside of the building was very imposing. The inside was mostly redone since the war except for the stained glass windows which they removed to the basement for safe-keeping.

Must be in your top 5?. This is a very impressive building and even though the tour (obligatory) lasts a mere 45 minutes I feel that it is a 'must see' for Budapest. It is so central to the city and there are a lot of very good restaurants (reviewed on Trip Advisor) nearby. Our guide was informative with sufficient humour to make the tour enjoyable and memorable. You buy tickets from the museum opposite but I suggest that you buy in advance online - it's a popular tour and you save time queuing. Along with the Market, Gellert Baths and The House of Terror - my highlights of Budapest.
Architecture and elegance at its best. A must-visit in Budapest - also must admire the architecture from the hills across the Pest side. This structure is the one thing you take away from Budapest
Well worth Doing. The guided tour of this impressive building was excellent. And, viewing the 600 year old crown of St. Stephen was a special treat for history lovers.
Majestic building. I think it is the second largest parliament building in the world. Second only to the Houses of Parliament in London. Thousands of windows. The building dominates the skyline.

Impressive. I didn't have the time to visit the Parliament, but from the outside it is impressive and can make other Parliament Houses look timid. The area surrounding is beautiful and bursting with life - people going to and from work, tourists and people just enjoying the area. Make sure to make a quick stop there.
only viewed from the outside. Very impressive in daytime, but really impressive when lit up at night. We did not get a chance to go inside.

The very centre of Hungary. Now the building works are nearly finished the experience of visiting Parliament by the guided tour is a must. The building is impressive both inside and out and the significance of St. Stephen's crown to the Hungarians is made dramatically clear.

Breathtaking architecture, a real beauty!. I didn't venture inside (unfortunately, time restricted) but the parliament building sits perched on the Danube and whether you observe views form Buda Hill or Fishermans Bastion or your enjoy a night time river cruise along the Danube, this building steals the limelight every time, from every angle, it is incredible!! London's parliament pales into insignificance!! SPECTACULAR!!

A beautiful building but an average tour.. My partner and I visited the Parliament building on a recent short break in the city. We arrived to book our tour at 10am in the morning, since the visitors centre was closed we had to queue for tickets in the museum across from the building. The line was very long and after 10 minutes we reached a sign which said that only one person per group was allowed to queue, so I waited outside and left my partner to get the tickets. After 40mins he emerged after receiving some horrendously poor customer service. Firstly a number of school group parties were allowed to go to the front of the queue, and as there was only one (terribly slow) woman serving this made the wait time greatly increase. When he finally reached the front of the line he asked for two EU citizen tickets, when asked he presented his drivers licence as proof of citizenship however she put the sale through as one EU ticket and one normal ticket, which was twice the price of the EU ticket. When he queried this she said that without the other person present with their ID she would not honour the discount. He said that I was just outside so he would go get my ID to show her but she said that if he walked away he would have to go to the back of the queue so would have to take these tickets. Further he only had enough currency for the reduced price tickets so was forced to put the inflated cost on his credit card, thus incurring further charges. We returned when the queue lessened to show my ID and get the ticket swapped, however she was very rude and simply stated that she would not give a refund. When we asked to speak to a member of management she simply kept saying that we would have to take it up with someone in Parliament! When we finally went on the tour it was not 50 minutes long as we were told but only 25mins. You are only taken into 4 rooms in the building so I definitely do not think it was worth the full price ticket. By all means if you can get the reduced price do attend as it was beautiful but on the whole experience was deeply dissatisfying.

Parliament tour. We visited in May and took the English speaking Parliament Tour. We did not see many rooms but those that we did we enjoyed very much. We also paid half of the price for the tour as we held European passports. We showed copies of them and the original EHIC card. The best part was watching the changeover of soldiers that marched off to lower the flag outside. This takes place at 6.30pm don't miss it. Airline security checking on entering but obviously needed.

Incredibly Beautiful Architecture. We went twice to this beautiful location; the first time we went on our own, and when we saw the entrance with workers and nobody entering the building; we thought it is closed that day. We were very impressed with the open and beautiful grounds around this historical building; so we decided to go again the following day.Then we went accompanied by our guide who advised us that it took 90 years to refurbish this great building to make it a piece of art. Our Guide led us to the Parliament entry point; it was crowded with groups; he went to buy the tickets; returned after 20 minutes to inform us that the queue was too long; never ending, and the next inside tour is after another hour. Therefore, we decided to enjoy the most beautiful building in Pest from the outside. The huge well maintained space outside the Parliament was a very relaxing place to sit and watch the whole area.If you intend to visit the Parliament from the inside; make sure to buy the tickets either online or before the tour day.The attached Photos are self explanatory.

Impressive building - we did not go inside. If you take an EU passport with you they will give you free access to the parliament. We were just passing and took time to have a look at the stunning architecture. The square has plenty of places to perch and spend some time. Handy with Margarit Island and the Tram stops.

Hungarian Parliament Building. We followed some advice from a lady we met in a bar to ignore the tourist cruises on the Danube, and take the public boat. The difference between the two was a glass of champagne on arrival and a glass of wine on the boat during the cruise. The difference in price was 4150 Huf, or about £12 EACH. It is a set fare of 750 Huf per person which you pay on board. We passed the Parliament building as we went North from Boraros Ter, and decided to get off. You can see the pictures, but until you actually see it up close you have no idea of the size and magnificent architecture of this impressive building. We walked around it and it took a good 40 minutes. Definitely well worth a visit when in Budapest. They do guided tours inside, but we didn't have time on this occasion.
Amazing. This is one of the most impressive buildings I've ever seen! Unfortunately, it's kindof hard to get tickets to see this building from the inside.

Lovely building. We only admired this building from the outside and it’s a very beautiful place. The view of this building from far away is stunning as it is when you get up close to it. There are some parks and benches outside the building so go and sit and admire for a little while.
amazing. as for me on of the most beautifull, elegant and gracious buildings in europe, big ben, eat your hart out

Book on line to avoid disappointment. Parliament is such a beautiful building and well worth a visit. We timed it just right on a Sunday morning to see a changing of the guards. However, we were not able to have a tour inside because all the tickets for that day had gone, so it is advisable to book in advance on line. Luckily, the day before, we had done a walking tour and our guide had given us lots of information about the building.

Beautiful Building. Beautiful building - Didn't go inside but definitely a must see when in Budapest. Looks great lit up at night also and they blow steam from the floor in the adjacent square which looks like smoke sitting on the ground!

Spectacular building, but poor quality tour experience. This building is an amazing piece of architecture inside and out. I understand that the government in this day and age does not need all of this space, so tours are certainly a good thing to offer. But the tour itself was lackluster - no, it was disappointing. Very perfunctory, not much information, guide was not interested in much other than keeping to a schedule, too large a group and over-priced. I would really not recommend it as a top site based on our experience. Rated 3 stars due to what you see, but as a tour, I would say it was only a 2 or 1 star experience.

Inspiring venue; Uninspiring guide. Interior tour of the stunning Parliament building is worthwhile. Get tickets at. Government office across the square (follow signs) rather than booking a third party tour that simply takes you to the entrance line. Entry is ticketed in 15 minute intervals in groups of approximately 20, by language. Guides are provided by the government. In our case, the guide was uninspiring. The venue deserved better.

Impressive and bold. So many superlatives come to mind when viewing this. We were able to view it by boat at night, when it was beautifully lit up. This was built during the Hapsburg period, when a parliament was allowed. There wee two chambers established. The resulting architecture is Gothic revival, with a Renaissance dome and a wedding cake filigree icing. Net overall: impressive and bold!!

Stunning. The parliment building stands on the side of the Danube. It is a very grandiose building, remind in one of the houses of parliament in London. It is possible to visit, but the beauty of it is the outside. When it I lit a night it is the jewel in the crown of Budapest.

A gorgeous building. From anywhere in the city, this building looks amazing. It is so ornate and the domes and spires make it look like a castle. Don't get too close though as the guards are wary and herd you away. Fabulous.

Fantastic tour. The Parlement in Budapest is without discussion the highlight of a trip to Budapest. The interior of the building is very impressive. Downsight is that the tours which are given through the building are very populair and soon sold out. Because the English and German tours were sold out in advance we decided to do the first tour available in any language. We joined the tour in Russian language. Although we did not understand any words said the building speaks for itself and the tourguide once in a while gave a summary in English. My compliments!!
Dominates Budapest.. Stunning building. It really dominates Budapest, and the view along the Danube. Some very serious guards near the flag on the land side. Walk by and take photos or do the tour.

Wonderful building. The Hungarian House of Parliament is the second largest Parliament building in Europe, built in neogothic and eclectic style in the heart of BudapestIt is very beautiful and it worth to visit.

Stunning building!. The building is really charming in many ways: inside, outside, from the other side of the river, from the boat on the Danube, from the back! Get a look at the agriculture palace too

Impressive dome. Book your tickets online! We booked the tickets the previous evening. We went straight to the line at the entrance at our ticketed time. It was a pretty swift tour with a tour guide from the parliament. The most interesting part of the tour is the dome under which the crown is guarded. It was an okay tour.

Impressive. I didn't go inside but took some amazing photos outside! Stunning building! Beautiful views of the Danube. Watched the changing of the guard which was interesting. Definitely worth a visit. Hope this is useful let me know and I'll keep writing more.

Book in advance at busy (ish) times or you will be disappointed. We didn't actually make it to visit the Parliament. We queued for an inordinate amount of time (around an hour) in some of the most disorganised and seemingly unfair queues I've ever been in, and eventually gave up as there was plenty else in the city we wanted to do.We decided to just enjoy the fantastic views of the Parliament building from the Fisherman's Bastion opposite, which was a far calmer experience!

The cornerstone of a very proud nation. Well worth a visit.. Our tour guide was very well informed, and obviously adored the building, making for a really enjoyable and informative tour. Tours are available in a variety of languages throughout the day.The building itself is one of the most impressive and recognisable landmarks on the River Danube, and is no less impressive on the inside. The tour is just right in length, probably taking between thirty and forty-five minutes, and showing you all of the most notable parts of the building.When we visited, they were just putting the finishing touches on new gardens, water features, cafe and visitor centre to the front of the parliament, making this an ever more unmissable attraction in Budapest.

Not a "Must Visit" site, but OK. If you want to tour Parliment, be certain to get tickets in advance! Tours are scheduled and limited. No ticket, no tour. Although we took an 'english speaking' tour, much of the docent's deilvery was difficult to understand. The Parliment Chamber itself was impressive. However, the remainder of the building, although restored and historic, is still a 'government building'. A better choice would have been the Art Museum.

Worth a visit. The dome is amazing and make the whole visit worthwhile. You have to buy your tickets from the museum opposite - and we had to queue for 45 minutes and when you get to the front of the queue there is not guarantee what time tour you will get - best to book online in advance.

Beautiful building with a grand interior - must see!. A walk around this building is a must, but you really need to go to one of the hilltops to take in all its beauty in one go.The English tour seems very popular so try making it to the first tour of the day. If you speak another language, the groups tend to be smaller so you'll hear the tour guide well (no mic) and be able to take some nice photos. We took the German tour and the lady was very knowledgeable and nice. The interior is beautiful, so it's worth paying for the tour.Lockers are available in the opposite library building where you can also purchase tickets for the tour.

Tour only for the Politically inclined -. The building it beautiful. There is no question that the magestic jem dominating the Pest side of the river is royal and holds the seats of power. But paying, waiting and schlepping through the tour of the cabinets inside should be done only if you are deeply interested in the ruling structure and political process of the past and present law makers. While gorgeous - and the only way to see the crown jewels guarded by the Crown Guards, be prepared to donate an hour of your time for only a glimpse of the rooms (once everyone on your tour pops in, looks, snaps a photo and then steps back out into the hall to make room). I'm glad to have learned the history, importance of The Professions and the circle of Kings (which are identical to those in Heros Square in case you're going there too) but could have probably skipped the admission.

Fabulous and majestic!. The Parliament has recently been completely cleaned and the surrounding area renovated so it stand by the Danube shining in all its glory.It's an impressive building and looks awesome at night. Make sure you get yourself across the river for great photo opportunities. There are also a couple of water features which adds to its beauty.

A must see. You have to see this building. Huge and majestic. Right along the Danube. Make sure you walk along side the river and not on the sidewalk in front of the building. You'll get a better view.

Imponent Building. It's a short walk in the shore of the Danube from Szechenyi bridge but you could also take tram #2 that goes along the river on the Pest side. Around the beautiful building there are open spaces and the Museum of Ethnography that is also beautiful from outside

Beautiful. If you are at the parliament building at 11 o'clock you can watch the changing of the guard. While not as grand as the British one, interesting just the same, the onlookers are invited to have photos with the guards after which is a bit novel. It really is a lovely building
A masterpiece. If you have only a couple of hours in the city and want to see something really breathtaking, that is the place. (With a little luck you don't meet MPs during the visit.)

Grand architecture!. A grand oriental building with amazing architecture. a must visit place in Budapest. Many green parks, bridges & restraus near the place make it an ideal place for any time of the day. Tram takes directly to the Parliament

What an impressive building!. This building and the Chain bridge to my mind epitomise the Danube and Budapest. This iconic building appears in so many photographs and I couldn't wait to see it and experience it for myself.

A must see!. What an incredible building!
The guided tour inside is a must. The interior of this building is amazing and our tour guide was very informative.
Definitely should be on the top 10 list of things to do in Budapest!
most impressive view from the other side of the river. It provides a great view if you go to the other side of the river and look back. The photo will turn out great if taken afar.

Make sure you visit. The surrounding area has been greatly improved in the last couple of years and is now quite attractive. However, you can only really appreciate this place by going on a tour.
The inside is jaw-dropping. It is stunning, no other way to describe it. Don't miss a tour ... well worth it

Parliament. Book your tour in advance - it's difficult to get a same day visit. EXcellent guide. If you have mobility issues there are a number of staircases but you can get an escort to take you to the various levels by lift.

Nice visit. We got ticket and appointment time to go for visiting with guided english tour .And it was on time and it was huge building but you can visit some parts.the The glass work are so nice and the courts paintings are nice.I recommend a visit.

Impressive. The parliament is actually much more impressive than I fist expected. It is much bigger than I imagined and the view you get of it from the Buda part of the city, across the river, is beautiful. For our bad luck when we went there , a section of the parliament was under repair so we couldn't get in, nor take an entire walk around it.

Stunning. One of the most admirable building I have ever come across. Best way to view the Parliament is to walk around to the back, where you can easily enjoy few hours on the grass, dip your feet in the water fountain and watch the guard change at 6pm. If you like your photography then this is the place to take some.

Nice building, tour could be more personal. Booked tickets for this place online, however upon printing these, what we found out was still had to go to another ticket counter and exchange this for proper tickets. Most annoying.The tour groups were too large, and as a result, the tour leader, although knowledgeable, could not speak loud enough and found it hard to control the large group.Smaller groups would be ideal.The tour time itself, 50 minutes, was just the right time.
WOW. This buildig is so WOW! I have no words for this. One thing is to see it on the photo and the other to see it in person and I was fascinated!!

The most recognizable monument in Hungary. You will never see such a beautiful monument in the world and a must see in Budapest. From all points of the Danube it can be recognized. At night it really comes alive with beautiful lights showcasing the castle like structure. It's massive and a great place to visit during the day. You can take guided tours inside or simply sit in the park outside and relax. Being in the city it's surprisingly quiet. It's a Parliament House, in my opinion it's to beautiful to be used for parliamentarians.

Spectacular Building. An extraordinary building and an architectural marvel. It is a building with an impeccable view from all the sides- from the land or the Danube.- by day or night. The boat ride in the Danube in the night should not be missed. All the facets of this architectural marvel can be enjoyed in full during the boat trip.

Magnificent. I only spent time near this from the boat on the Danube, but the architecture is shear magnificence. It is easily spotted from various places, which also makes a great backdrop for pictures.
Beautiful Government Building. If you want to go book early as the tours sell out quickly. Our guide who spoke English was ok, nothing special and delivered the basic information.
Must go. If you only visit one place in Budapest, this must be the Parliament. And the guided tour not to be missed.
ok. Lovely building but a bit of a disappointment inside, not what I expected, had to queue a bit and lots of giggling school kids didn't help.
An incredible building!. Take a short walk along the river and admire this large and beautiful building. The view of Buda is amazing!

Organise your own tour. There are organised tours which cost around 6,000 HUF, you can book it yourself for less than 2000 HUF over the internet, book in advance and get the tour in the language you prefer. Lovely building, you are shown just a few of the major rooms and the crown jewels. Informative tour guide in with the price. Take photo ID with you in case they ask for it as security is, not surprisingly, fairly tight.

Brilliant but takes a lot of wasted time. You have to book these tours and meet up well in advance of the actual tour which was a bit annoying. However the building is well worth seeing it is absolutely stunning. Only down side is the size of the groups going through it didn't feel very personal. However well worth the time

Splendor. The positive is that everything inside oozes history, splendor, magnificence. The negative is THAT strange feeling you get before being granted access to the building. Seemed like times of the Cold War still
Extremely nice. The parliament buidling itself is really nice, details like old-style wooden shutters are neat. The square is nice too. Riverside is great though perhaps from more distant views.

A place you should visit. We also visited the house of Parliment of Hungary.The architecture inside and outside is remarkeable. We where happy that we had also a glimpse of the meeting chamber of the delegates. (very impressive)The gards at the parlement are not very friendly.

Take the tour!. There is a tour! I highly suggest to make reservations online. The tour is approx. one hour long and it is worth it! you get to see the real crown jewels and some of the beautiful rooms of the parliament.

Worth a visit but hard to hear. We booked ahead for the English tour - it was in English but it was very hard to hear and understand, partly because of the accent and partly because of the echo. Never-the-less, we enjoyed the tour and got a good feel for the way that Hungary regards democracy.

Beautiful architecture. The beautiful red-coloured parliament has an awe inspiring architecture. The parliament towers over the city and is visible from almost anywhere whether from higher up, near the castle, or from across the water.

Beautiful inside and out. The parliament building is an impressive looking building from the outside and is definitely worth a look. The inside is probably even more impressive. Buy tickets for the tour and take a look inside. The tour gives you an interesting guide of the parliament and the decorations are incredible. It is quite a short tour but well worth doing.
Unbelieveble.... Orszaghaz is just amazing.One of the most beautiful and breathtaking buildings I've ever seen.We didn't see its interior,but exterior is more than enough to thrill you.Just great!

Best looking building in Budapest, the outside is enough. You can see the building from a ferry cruise but its worth getting up close.
I didn't go inside, so I can't comment, but from what I've heard its not necessary, on a sunny day its nice to explore the grounds and have a sit down with a nice funnel cake and drink in the sights!

One of the most beautiful building of all time. This building is simply stunning! You need to see it in the daylight and also at night when all the lights are up, surrounding the Danube! It's worth seeing it, at least once in a lifetime.

Great Budapest Attraction.. Well worth a visit.The interior is outstanding.Tours in English.German and Hungarian on the day visited.Be aware that there are a lot of shallow stairs on the tour.A charge is made for non Hungarians.
too short. The place is amazing especially the outside, but the visit into the inside is too short and too expensive for it. I recommend only to visit it from the outside

Should visit. A beautiful building, compared to what we have here in Scotland. The soldiers standing to attention at the flag were interesting and the water mist coming from the fountain was unexpected
Amazing architecture. Whilst I did not do the tour of the building when I visited, the architecture of the building is itself absolutely stunning - something you must see when in Budapest.

This building is a standout whether by day or by night. The first time I saw this building from a distance was from our hotel room. I thought it was a museum. The next day we had a tour guide with us and he said that it was the parliament. A closer look revealed a marvelous, detailed architecture. We passed by it again during the river cruise. It was well lighted at night time.

Magnificent . The architecture, sculptures and paintings are amazing. As other reviews have mentioned be sure to purchase your tickets in advance from the museum which is across the street. We were lucky to tour the same day as ticket purchase, but at 10am when we arrived at the ticket office the first tour available was for 4:45pm so we had to rework our itinerary for the day. The tour lasts approx 45 minutes and our guide was very informative and spoke good English. I would say it is a "must do" when in Budapest.

Beautiful. Words can only do harm!But as I have to put 100 characters here, let me tell you that this building is one of the most beautiful ones I have ever seen. And as you look at it more, more you realise its beauty.

Stunning. I am finding it very difficult to come up with another word for what you see in Budapest. Stunning just seems to sum up the whole city and the same is true for the parliament building. The inspiration for the design is supposedly The Houses of Parliament in London and as fantastic as they are I am afraid Budapest Parliament wins hands down. Although apparently you can go inside did not bother, I am sure the same lies are told in every Parliament building the world over.
Great exterior and the interiors are even better!. Please attend, that you need to buy tickets in advance, if you wish not only to see the Parlament, but to visit it (it's worth it for sure).

Beautiful and impressive. Magnificent buildings, you can sit outside and if you're lucky - I was - watch the military putting up the flag. I wanted to visit but did not buy tickets in advance. Having been told I could buy them at the museum in front, I realised the museum only opens at 10am whereas visits start at 8am.

Only Seen From The Outside. Whilst I only viewed the Parliament building from its exterior, the gothic architecture and attention to detail is marvelous.The building stands out in the scenery from views from the east bank and up at castle hill, but I can certainly recommend getting up close and doing a full 360 of the Parliament building itself. If you don't have a photo with this in the background then you've definitely missed a large portion of the city!

Very impressive!. Without a doubt this is the landmark of the city and probably of the whole country! What an impressive construction! You can look at it for hours... The most beautiful pictures are taken from the opposite bank of the river during sunset hours; don't forget to enjoy the view of the Parliament in the evening/night: it's absolutely magical. Unfortunately, we didn't have time to take the tour inside the building, but I'll definitely be back for that!

Wonderful building, great setting. Friends recommended a visit to the Hungarian Parliament building and they were right. It is a magnificent example of neo-gothic architecture and situated on the East bank of the River Danube it is ideally positioned for some spectacular photographs from the opposite bank or from one of the many river cruisers that pass daily. It is supposedly modelled on the Palace of Westminster but to be honest it is more amazing, beautifully symmetrical and better proportioned. The tour was booked beforehand which was a wise move as the queues soon built up and it save us getting soaked waiting for the 45 minute english language tour to start. Magnificent rooms and a glimpse of the central chamber and holy crown. Quite expensive for just 45 minutes but don't miss it!

Impressive. Amazing building from the outside, and the tours well worth the small amount of money. The guards inside are very tight on making sure you keep up and a couple of areas where you cant take pic'sA lot of history and impressive.

Tour was excellent. Pre-book the tour as they do sell out! Also there are no toilets - nearest are in the nearby museum building and they are 250HUF to use (cheeky!). The building inside and out is very interesting and Hungarian politics are fascinating. Well worth looking inside this iconic building!! Take an evening river tour and see it lit up - just beautiful.
Bit overrated. Hungarian citizens get in for free but for visitors there is a fee…if you are short on time, you can give this a skip

Nice outside, but amazing inside. . This building is one of the most iconic buildings in the world when looking at it from across the river Danube. But once you get inside is when it really becomes awesome. Book a tour and have a look at it up close. It shines like the jewel that it is. There are palaces that don't even come close to the rich architecture and style that the Budapest Parliament displays every day.

Beautiul building and stunning interior. Well worth a visit but try to book online ahead of your visit - we turned up at 1130hrs and the only available tour on the day in English was 1645hrs. They don't take future bookings at the ticket office but downstairs is a small coffee shop with free wifi so we booked our tickets there. They do say you need to print the tickets but if you arrive early, the box office will print them for you. Well worth a trip,
Historic and dramatic. The Parliament building dominates the Danube view from Buda. Best views are from Castle Hill area and when the weather is good, the lighting is sublime.
Impressive. Worth the walk... And the water that comes out of the floor to cool down people who come buy is very nice...
The most beautiful building in Budapest. Parliament is for me the most amazing building of the city. Additionally the most unique parliament building I have ever seen. Check it yourself :)

Excellent but book online before you even get to Budapest. This was a great trip and we were pleased to finally get inside but this was only after having queued on one day and not got in and then booked online for the following day - for a tour in French there being no places left at all on tours in English. The decoration is elaborate and matches the almost fairy tale like architecture. The square in which the Parliament sits is traffic free except for the trams and is a great setting.There is lots of renovation work going on including what appears to be a visitor centre so the booking for tours issue may be made easier quite soon.

Awesome architecture. The Paliament buildings are truly amazing. Of all the buildings I saw on my riverboat cruise - the Parliament buildings in Budapest were my favorite. I especially loved seeing them all lit up at night from our river boat as we sailed away in the evening.
AMAZING. HUGE and HUGE, best building in Budapest, you have to see it from all sites =] so book 1day around parliament.

Impressive inside as well as from outside. The house of Parliament is huge. Just walking around it, outside the building gives you some idea for it's dimension, architecture and it's beauty. We were lucky to get tickets for the English tour, 2 1/2 hours ahead. (There are tours in other foreign languages, as well-check the web site in advance) Tours are well guided for 45 minutes, except some time you hear the other guides on the background. But the history and the beauty inside cover all. We enjoyed the lightened house every night out of our hotel window from the Buda side and liked mostly the colors and reflection at sun shine.
Worth to see. Good organization. We got our tickets online, so we avoided the long queue.Tours are given in a large variety of languages.Interesting place to visit.

Beautiful building, worth visit, but need to go with tour guide. As it is a working parliament, you need to get a ticket (from across the street), reserve a time, wait in line, go through airport-like security just to be led around by a government guide through this building. Despite all that, it is worth a visit, inside is beautiful, outside is beautiful...the building is well preserved. The tour is somewhat short though and you can't veer off from main group...beware.

Exquisite Building. Although we toured the Parliament building in Budapest many years ago, we decided to go once more to see this incredible site on a recent visit with our children who live in Budapest. We were told that the outside of the building had been recently cleaned and we were not disappointed when we saw it. Even covered with years and years of soot and pollution, the building was beautiful. Now that it is clean, it is even more impressive. We were disappointed, however, that we had to pay the equivalent of about $16 per person because we paid in U.S. dollars. Visitors from the EU pay half that amount.While the building remains an incredible testimony to eclectic architecture, we found that the tour was not as extensive nor as detailed as the one we took about 10 years ago. It was only 45 minutes with minimum information. We were also accompanied by a security guard which was not done previously. I found the purchasing of tickets, the rules for standing in line and the rules for entering the building somewhat ostentatious. In spite of that, the building is definitely worth seeing both outside and inside if one wants to get a sense of the culture it represents.
Fantastic. This building is huge! Wonderful architecture. Guarded by national guard in every corner and entrance. Chains block close access to the building nevertheless you can see it veru well.

Tedious tour. Just admire this place from the outside. Tour not worth queuing twice - once to buy ticket at museum opposite (half price for eu residents on showing passport) and then I outside parliament. Only lasts 45 minutes, all rooms look the same over decorated and fussy.

Interesting. The Hungarian Parliament external architecture is amazing, the bulding looks more like a cathedral than a governmental building. The square in front with its water feature although new sets of the building. I arrived at the square at dusk and was just i time to see the ceremonial Hungarian Flag being taken down by a military patrol.

The square. We didn't get a chance to do a tour but the Parliament building and the Ethnographic Museum are amazing and worth a visit just for the photographic opportunity. Also note the Interior Ministry building with the bullet hole markers from the 1956 revolution.A strange dust/mist swirl blew up in the area around the fountains, looked very mystical but I am sure there is an ordinary explanation.The Parliament building looks beautiful, night or day, from any area.

meh. yeah it is decorative inside, but the english tour wasn't that great because the woman's english wasn't that great. the people were also not at all friendly and kind of made you feel like you were a nuisance. my husband and mom loved it though. i could have skipped this.

Very beautiful from inside. This building is truly amazing from inside!We were lucky to join an extra tour on a Friday afternoon and even though we were only inside some 30-45 minutes we enjoyed every minute. This was like being in wonderland watching all the details thought off by the architect.If you think you have seen something similar in London you are not far off: the style indeed reminds you off House of Parliament. Enjoy!

Amazing construction. I wish we could have visited it inside as well, unfortunately we had no time to wait until it was opened. But the construction even from outside it's amazing and there is no one who ever visited Budapest who didn't take a picture here! One of the best attractions in the city!

From the outside. As I have not been inside I only can comment on the outside look - and it is amazing in many occasions - daylight(sunshine), after dark, from the Fishermans Bastion, from the other sde of the Danube (Buda-side) and from the bridges.

Amazing building. Very worthwhile tour of a beautifully ornate building. It is worth buying tickets online as the current method of buying tickets involves very long and slow queues, although this might change when the new visitors centre opens. Definitely worth the effort
!!. It surely has a beautiful architecture. I didnt enter inside but the view with Duna is one of the most famous picture on almost every magnet ^_^
Incredible building, beautifully restored. An incredible building, beautifully restored with great vistas from the upper floors. Definitely worth queuing.

not worth the money!. we did the hebrew tour, the cost for it is a 3500 forint, the tour is about 40 minuts in the halls of the parliament we enterd meybe 2 rooms, the guid was nice perhaps the tour in english is better... also for the bathroom you have to pay extra.no storage for your things so you have to carry everything on you. my advice take a picture from outside it is a beautiful view and take a walk to a park next nice there when it sunny.

I am running out of superlatives!. The parliament building is one of the prominent buildings on the banks of the Danube and is prominantly used in any advertising on Budapest. It did not disappoint seeing it for real with a recently completed pedestrian area outside. Some good eating places nearby.

Do not bother!. A garish over the top overly opulent anchronism ..to hide the fact that Hungary has never has true democracy. Erected in the latter days of the Austria/Hungary Hapsburg feudalism, obviously modelled after the parliament buildings in London.Stand in line for at least 45 minutes to get a ticket with a set time for a guided tour, for which you need to then wait at least 1 1/2 hours, and at last you get a 45 minute mini-tour of a very small part of the building. Not at at all worth the bother or price.Do go to the wwII shoe monument close by, along the Danube if you do decide to go here.
Fantastic. I could have sat for hours and looked at this building, every angle and light gave a different perspective. Only of the most beautiful buildings In have seen.

Hungarian Parliament A Must See. This year has seen the first time in fifty years that there hasn't been some sort of scaffolding surrounding this building due to restoration. Today it appears as it would have when originally built in 1896. The building inside and outside are simply magnificent in execution. Tours are available in a number of languages including English. There is quite a queue for entry so it is better to obtain your tour entrance before hand. St Steven's crown, sceptre and orb are housed there guarded by Hungarian Army soldiers. A must see if you are in Budapest.
Such a magnificent architecture. One must see it in the dark from the boat cruise to really appreciate to the fullest. Worth visiting

Very Ornate Building. Well worth pre-booking your tour online. It's around £5 for a 45 minute tour, which is not long, but you won't be disappointed with the inside of the building. the outside is not bad looking either. The guide spoke good English and was very informative. As it is the parliament then expect strict security on entering (same as at the airport).

Stunning building. Always though UK Houses of Parliament was an impressive building - until I saw the Hungarian Parliament! Outside has been totally renovated and is now quite spectacular. Yet to go inside...

Beautiful at night. This is a beautiful building and worth the time for the short tour inside. Tour includes a walk up the staircase, viewing the crown, etc. and a chamber. You HAVE to view the building at night.

Rude guards and mediocre guides. The place is definitely worth a visit however it is far from welcoming.
Long wait for tickets in the rain (try to book online) rude guards.
Our Hebrew guide couldn't be understood, nor could the English one of the group next to us.

Difficult to get on an inside tour, but stunning exterior. Only managed to see the Parliament from the outside (walking around the surrounding squares, and of course from the Castle Hill across the Danube), as there were about 200 people queuing for tour tickets when we arrived.Definitely research how to get tickets well in advance, as otherwise you will either have to queue for hours or simply give the inside tour a miss (like us!). There are tours offered in English, but only at certain times.The exterior is still worth visiting though, as it is a very impressive building - set stunningly against the river and Buda hills. It's only a few minutes walk away from St Stephen's Basilica, and you can easily do both in the same day.

Stunning Gothic beauty!. This was my favorite building in all of Budapest. It commands attention in every picture. Take a river cruise. All the buildings and Chain Bridge are lit up. Avoid the Duna Palota and Budai Vigado river cruises. The food is terrible, service is bad, don't drink the wine that is included with the dinner.

Beautiful inside and out, worth visiting!. I came to Budapest twice in 2014, and visited the Parliament building twice.The first time, it was in the middle of winter so the sky was overcast. There was also building works right across the plaza between Parliament and the museum opposite, which was a shame because it ruined half of the view. Buying our tickets was a very long process and the staff were rude. However, once we went inside for the tour, it was very impressive. Everything was lavishly decorated with gold and there was still the crown from Centuries ago inside one of the rooms. The tour guide was very good, and informative. The tour lasted around 30-40 minutes, and was available in different languages.The second time I came to visit, I didn't go inside, but the building works were no longer there so I got to appreciate the building from all sides, and the weather was very hot and sunny!It's definitely worth visiting, and there are some great places to see it from the Buda side too - Gellert Hill, Castle Hill etc.

huge and breathtaking architecture. must see. huge beautiful building. the only way to visit the indoor chambers of the parliament is booking a guided tour at the local info point. anyway tickets often run out by noon. so it is better booking via web.

not bad place. there is a long queue to book the ticket and long queue to enter the place, preferable to book online or through hotel to save timei liked the place but if you have short time, you can skip it

Impressive on the outside..... Tours inside have to be booked and paid for ahead of time, and it does not take visitors to all of the building—key parts. Photos allowed except in the main central hall where the famous royal crown in displayed. Certainly impressive, and interesting in being modelled on the British Houses of Parliament but with real innovations like all-electric light and heating.Of course, it's the outside that is *really* remarkable, and huge! Try to take a river taxi to get the best view.

Magnificent. Be sure to book the tour at least several days prior to the visit, the group size is small and tickets are going away fast. You can book the visit online and print the ticket at home on jegymester.hu , very convenient.The building is a true neo-gothic jewel with rich and intricate decorations on the inside. The tour is a bit rushed and limited, but it's worth going inside at least once.No bathrooms inside, so take care of it in advance )

I really really wanted to go inside. but it was under construction :/ it was a huge bummer, since every hungarian I asked about the parliament said how beautiful it is on the inside...from the outside it is very beautiful and HUGE..so if you go be sure it's functioning now and book beofre time, as I heard it's highly requested!

Book in advance. A spectacular building with an amazing interior decoration and architecture. The only trouble being that you pay quite a lot for admission and are rushed round in just over 40 minutes. No time to loiter in a room if you want to take lots of photographs. You have a guide, a guard at the front of your party and one at the rear to make sure that you do not get lost. The building looks spectacular at night when it is lit up. Get a number 4 or 6 tram and get off at St Margaret's Island for a superb view down the Danube. Breathtaking.
Worth it going inside. Despite cues on the wind and the fast explanation of the building is one of the must go places, in my opinion thge most important one

Take the tour!. Take the tour, it's worth it. The inside of this building, along with the history of the building, was incredible. The tour was about 45 mins long and went through several of the rooms of the building, including the crown of the city. It's beautiful, and worth the visit. Tickets can be purchased online prior to your visit.
Amazing architecture. This building is an amazing thing to see, however we didn't venture inside as the queue was massive and we didn't really have time. Well worth seeing even the exterior.
Great visit. It's free to visit the Parliament, from the same arquitect as the Parliament in London. This one is very nice, next to the Danube...

Amazing. It is such an amazing building my partner and I lined up to go through the free section of it. And the decor inside is just beautiful the line did lake some time once you got in. If we had more time we would have looked into doing a tour of parliament. Overall it's a just see during your time in Budapest.

The most beautiful Parliament in the world. I would truly recommend anyone visiting Budapest, whether in the city for business or for leisure, to visit what is one of the world's most beautiful parliament buildings. Recently restored the magnificent structure is guarantees to wow both young and old. I have visited it three times in three years and every time I visit it is like the first time. A truly must see.

The Parliament bult at unlimited cost shows every 19th C Forint... The parliament viewed from accross the river on the Buda side is a stunning example of architecture of the 'no expense spared' architecture and design..One can book to tour the interior and I have to say I have never done so but it surely is a must..I live here and each month I tell myself that this is the time..Those with limited time always seem to find the time...It was , I think completed in the late 19th Century and a small town of 35,000 people could have been built so great was the no expense cost of this monument to ...to....whoever is in power.!!!!!It is on the banks of the Danube where any building worth its salt must be...The exterior has recenly been restored/cleaned and the surrounding area restored..How can one spend only three days in this great city.??? but this should be one of the sites to see if you have a limited time..
Beautiful building. Beautiful buiding. When the lights come on at night its stunning. Lovely to see on a boat trip. Nice area to visit

The Hungarian Parliamant (Országház). One of Budapest's most visited monuments is the Parliament building. Thousands of tourists and visitors visit the building all year round. Our virtual journey provides us with a preliminary impression and visual experience of the monument.The picture cycle presents the caracteristics of the building in four parts from inside, from outside and in details.http://www.parlament.hu/angol/angol.htm

Breathtaking. This is a really beautiful and LARGE building! It is seen in many of our photos, and we went to see it a bit closer one of our days in Budapest, although we only saw it from the outside. The exterior is just awe-inspiring, it's no wonder why every tourist comes to see it ;)

Wait a bit.... The building is nice, and they have tried to make the surrounding more attractive.... of course they have overdone it, but it could have been worse... Most probably it will become a more friendly visit when all the works are fully terminated, the visits better organized and the staff better trained... for time being, it is a bit chaotic, and the tourist season just started... They rush the works to finish them just before the elections, but all the management of it is still to be taken seriously by real professionals... should be OK by next October...

The most beautiful Parliament ever. This buliding is really worth visiting- the interior (as well as the exterior) is just stunning! You can see the wonders of the architecture, paintings inside. Not to mention the Hungarian crowning jewels and the latest exhibited "Seudo" treasures. During your visit you can also get to know more about the Hungarian electorial system and you can hear some interesting anecdotes.

Visit to Parliament. I visited here with a group of 17 last week. We had a very good guide who took us round this most magnificent building. It's very ornate & decorative. You are allowed to take photos in all the rooms but one. This housed the Hungarian Crown Jewels & is guarded by stern looking security guards. It's a definite to do when in Budepest.
Boring.. The guided tour isn't really interesting but the only way to get inside. The guiding lady was speaking very fast and you couldn't ask any questions.

it is HUGE and marvelous!. it is something special! you can go around it, you can go over the river and admire it from other bank of river and make great pictures! pity, I didn't manage to get inside :(

Beautiful outside and inside.. You see the parliament all the time, if you take a boat tour, or from the Buda side. The square in front (just recently finished) makes it also nice to see from the other side.The guided tour doesn't take long (about 40 minutes) but it's worth it.Hungarians have a right to be proud of their parliament.

Good tour of Parliament. A must in Budapest. Like walking round a much grander version of our own Houses of Parliament. Interesting place to visit. Tip: Book tickets on advance on line, the day we tried to go in English tours all booked up, so we booked on line for the following day to ensure we got in.
Impressing. This is a most beautiful and very interesting place. The square in front of the parlament is nice and impressionist. Must see.

Interesting tour, beautiful building.. There are English tours several times a day, we booked a couple of hours in advance. The cost was 1750 huf with an EU passport. Tour lasted 1 hour but this included the security check which took a little time and we had to wait around for the guard to escort us through the building so the actual tour probably only lasted 40 minutes. The guide was good and informative, it is definitely worth visiting. Very beautiful building inside. The new visitor center is due to open end of April 2014.

Very interesting and beautiful building. Although the exterior of this building is hugely impressive, the interior is even more so. You have to book a tour in advance - we were lucky to get tickets on the same day for later in the afternoon so I'd recommend doing this on the internet before you go. EU passport holder get a reduced entry fee.The tour takes in the grand staircase, the dome, the crown jewels and the upper debating chamber. The guide is very knowledgeable and we learned a lot. Probably the highlight of our visit.Note that there are no visitors toilets and you have to pay to use the ones in the Museum of Ethnography where the ticket office is, although they are building a new visitor centre which I expect will have toilets.
Lovely structure. Never got to go inside as i ran out of time but a wonderful building to look at all the same with guards doing there thing outside every hour. Well worth a visit in fact a must.

Wow. Set right on the rivers edge very like the houses of Parliament this is a magnificent sight to behold. But when we went there at Christmas 13 the whole place was closed off as they were re laying the cobble stones, and it was impossible to see all it's beauty

Visiting Budapest You must see this building!. It takes about a good hour the official visit, it is beautiful!
How ever many rooms are not open for tourists, still there are so many beautiful rooms and parts ot the building to see!

Interesting building, tour too short. The building itself was really impressive but the tour was not very long and we only got to see a few areas. Sometimes it was hard to hear the guide also because other groups were often in the same room.

Jaw-Dropping. The Parliament building was undoubtedly the most stunning interior I saw during my week-long stay in Budapest. We kept marveling at how anybody is able to concentrate on politics inside, as we'd just be staring at the architecture. The Hungarian Crown Jewels are also found here and are beautiful! The tour was highly informative, and actually gave us good information that we were able to use throughout our visit in Budapest, so I'm very glad we went early in the trip! The price can be a bit high for adults (half-off for students under 26), but worth every cent. Reserve a tour in advance or show up at 8am, wait in line for an hour, and hope and pray you get lucky and get in that day (as we had to). MUCH better to reserve in advance.

An interesting and informative visit.. The Parliament building is a beautiful Neo-Gothic building finished in 1902. On the banks of the Danube it stands out in its magnificence. The building was inspired by London's Houses of Parliament and is certainly worth a visit. We took a guided tour in English, during which we learnt a great deal about the Parliament past and present and were able to take pictures in most areas apart form where the closely guarded Crown Jewels are on display. A truly beautiful building and well worth a visit. Tours are at 10.00, 12.00 and 14.00 hrs. Check where tickets need to be purchased and bring proof that you are an E.U. Citizen for reduced rates.

Lovely building. This is a lovely building, only saw the outside as we were pushed for time, watched the change of the guard, and their feet must be sore with their slapping the feet marching. Defiantly worth seeing the parliament building.
Beautiful. If only all governments made their houses of parliament look like this. It is absolutely beautiful and great for tourists and they're love for picture taking. It's a must do in Budapest.

Finally got into the Parliament!!!!. Fourth trip to Budapest and finally got into Parliament building. Very interesting and glad we got to see it. Local guide was good and no problem with English. Do it you can.

Grand Splendour. All the ceilings and walls were very ornate with gold leaf in many parts. Huge candelabras and many paintings. Also you get to see the Hungarian Crown Jewels although they are very heavily guarded.
A Must See. This is one tour you should take while in Budapest. Inside the Parliament is Breathtaking. The gold, furniture, and history will not disappoint.

A Must See.... Don't let the term "Parliament" put you off...it's more of a Palace and really worth seeing. You have to get your entry tickets (and timed entry "slot") from the Museum of Ethnography at the other side of the lawns and tram tracks and from there on, the organisation of the visit is extremely slick and absolutely fascinating. Make sure you take some ID (e.g. passports) for your tickets.
Awesome Building. I love the look of the old building in Budapest. This one is certainly noticeable as you are coming over any one of the bridges.

Beautiful building, the tour was OK. The Parliament is a beatiful, large building (the 3rd largest parliament building in the world) and is therefore very impressive from the outside. (please also have a look from the other side of the river, this gives another nice view on the building). You can have a tour for around 4 euros (1260 HUF) for students or twice this price for adults. In our opinion, the tour wasn't that special, but it is still nice to see the building from the inside (quite impressive, but not a 100% worth the money).

Must-See in Budapest. Beautiful Gothic exterior, opulent interior. Organized tour is the only way to visit the building (3700 HUF/$19/15 Euro). Tour is tightly scheduled with less time for questions than several guests wanted. A must-see in Budapest, but could be improved with a more extensive tour and more time for questions.
Beautiful Building. Good tour, well explained worth a go especially at the reduced EU Student price. Worth spending an afternoon and take lots of photos.

Beautiful mix of Gothic Revival and Renaissance Revival architecture. The Hungarian Parliament (Orszaghaz) building found at Lajos Kossuth Square and the Danube Promenade is one of the most beautiful buildings in the city and a place that most visitors will include within their list of attractions to see while in Budapest. Parliament was built between 1896 and 1904 and features Gothic Revival architectural which was clearly borrowed from London's House of Parliament building. You can also find evidence of Renaissance Revival architecture can also be found in the dome that tops the building. This seems more like something you'd expect to find in Tuscany instead of here in central Europe. The mix of architectural styles produces a beautiful building exterior that can be admired from up close or across the Danube River on the Buda side of the city. During the day, you can see Parliament with blue skies very well from upon Castle Hill. The building is then lit up each night, producing another spectacular view of the building. Visits inside Parliament can be arranged but there are set times and limited availability. See the Parliament Website for visit and reservation details. Overall, we very much enjoyed seeing the Parliament building from both sides of the river and particularly enjoyed the higher vantage points of Castle Hill at Fisherman's Bastion. It is well worth taking a few minutes to admire the Parliament building from this location when you visit Budapest.
A must see.. The most beautiful building I have ever seen. It sets the whole view of the Danube up, so you can't miss it, but taken the extra effort to go on a tour inside was well worth it.
Amazing building!!. It is a must see along the river but when we were there you have to get a special tour so make your plans ahead of time.

Amazing to see. A Beautiful building with a lot of history. Tickets were expensive unless you had a dispensation (EU, Student etc). Tours are brief but you do see a lot. The guide was friendly but could have been more informed.

Place to go. Absolutely you should go in order to see the original holy crown and the respect that Hungarian officials pay to it. The atmosphere inside is somptuos, luxory forniture and architecture. The tour lasts only 45 minutes, I wish i could see more rooms, but anyway it's a MUST

Best to order tickets on-line. To visit the Parliament Building, one must obtain a ticket for the guided tour which lasts roughly 40 minutes. The tours in English are at 10 am and noon; depending on the season, other times in the afternoons. To order tickets online, use URL below (Note: jegymester.hu is where one can purchase tickets for guided tours, museums, concerts, operas, etc). http://www.jegymester.hu/eng/Production/480000/Parliament-visit(Be sure to scroll down the page to obtain entry times in the language you want. Tour fees are based on whether you are a EU citizen or non-EU citizen.

A Magnificent Building. The architecture of this building is magnificent if you go to the other side of the Danube at night (don't forget to take your camera) the photo's you can take of the Parliament building are wonderful, it is well worth the walk across the bridge.
Nicest parliament in Europe!. You cannot find any parliament in Europe like this. Do not miss to visit inside too. Fantastic building in a beautiful city.
nice building. Did not walk around the building, could see it everywhere we went. a very beautiful building and very substantial in the skyline.

Hungarian Parliament. The pre-booked tour is about 45 minutes long and is available in several languages. At the time of booking,tickets were available across the road at the Museum of Ethnography. EU citizens get a 50% discount on the entry price. I took the English language tour and found the guide to be very informative, and not just regurgitating a set script, willing and able to answer questions. The building itself is very ornate, and particular statues / carvings and paintings were explained by the guide. You are allowed to take photo's during the tour, except in the room holding the Crown Jewels.
Tour of Parliament. We did enjoy this tour. We had a very good guide. We got to see a nice selection of spaces in a beautiful building. I highly recommend it!
Parliament. An escorted tour of about 45 mins. Excellent English-speaking guide, learnt a lot about the history and current political set-up. Building itself is surprisingly beautiful.

Stunning. This parliament building is stunningly beautiful this was the view we saw from our hotel across the Danube .at night it's even more spectacular when all bathed in lights there is a lot of work going on around the building so we could not get too close but well worth a visit

Great place!. We had to take an official tour, which was excellent, and the detailed explanation by the guide was very clear and interesting.The amount of effort made to preserve the history is impressive as is the work being carried out to increase the access and interactive facilities.
Pretty Amazing. It's an unexpected and huge building on the edge of the river. Truly spectacular views, wonderful open area to take pictures and bask in the sun.
