Not allowed near. A beautiful grand building but unfortunately when we were there it was cordoned off due to ground work being done
Surprised. Was suprised at this building - Not as big at our HofP and security was so lax - Probably because the Hungarian are not a violent race and enjoy peace.
under renovation. The Parliament is great. but when we visit their it was under big renovation outside so we did not enjoy it so much. they said it will be finish in march 15.
beautiful building !!. The building is very impressive from the outside. I was there on 15 March, it international holiday and million people need to get inside !!

Plan ahead to avoid disappointment. The building on the outside is impressive and its halls must be equally stunning, but be braced for a long wait until you can find a free place for the guided tours in your preferred language (the only way to enter the Parliament building).

Wow!. It's so beautiful but unfortunately when I was there in March, there was construction all around so it was blocked off and I could not get close to it. But from afar, it is really breathtaking and it's huge!

Interesting. A very good tour around part of the huge building ,available in lots of different languages,the tour guide we had spoke English very fluently.Even if you don't take the tour the building is very impressive from the outside.
Lovely style. I was impressed, it really is wonderful. We couldn't visit inside because of works in progress just on the spot.

Expensive Tour for How Short it Is. The building is very impressive and it's certainly fun to be inside an active parliament, but for the $15 it costs to get in, you don't see much. The tour consists of the entrance hall, the crown jewels (which you can't get near or photograph), the exterior of a parliament room, then the parliament room. I was impressed with the guide who was great about answering questions, but having to see this with 40 people all bumping into each other to get photos was not the greatest experience of my trip.

Beautiful from A Distance. We saw the Parliament House from a distance, there is a great deal of construction around the entire area, which includes the Hungarian Academy of Sciences. That building is interesting for they have market the bullet holes from the 1956 rebellion with large, visible plugs. The Parliament itself may or may not be open or accessible when you visit, but even if you go to the area and cannot get in the walks nearby, including Liberty Square (you can stand next to Ronald Reagan, who is ironically, a few meters from the only major memorial to the Soviets in Budapest). SO take a walk down there even if you cannot get in.

Fantastic glimpse into history. Well worth a visit. The tour takes you through a magnificent and beautiful building built for a different and more influential time for a bigger Hungry. It's free with a British Passport. One of the best couple of hours we spent.

Ornate, historical - worth a visit especially for the history lesson!. Excellent tour of the building with an excellent dose of Hungarian history thrown in. Quite an impressive building! We would highly recommend paying the fee for the tickets to tour this BUILDING!!

Worth a tour. Site in the midst of being renovated so builders and fences around the building. Be sure to take your EU passport else you pay double to get in. Quick flit around inside but building is unique and worth a visit to see how grand it is. Left with a sense that Hungary was once a rich and powerful nation.

awesome structure, most see. We had a guided tour in the building, a very impress building, one you most see if you traveling the city. The crown is displayed in the Parliament upper floor, every half an hour there is a guard change which is very nice to see. The price is a bit high but worthy .

Go there!. Magnificent and interesting building. One of the most impressive building we have visited. A little troublesome to understand how to get tickets (can be done on the internet, we found out), but otherwise a nice experience.

Very beautiful!!!. When you see it the first time it is just: WOW! It looks really beautiful - also at night!We wanted to go in and do a tour but to book the ticket online - it wasn't possible at this time to pay it by credit card.... So we wanted to go to the ticket-shop in the Parliament it self... there was a big construction zone and we couldn't pass it - then we saw one loooooong queue.... No thanks....

parliament tour. visiting the parliament is one of the best things to do in Budapest , it takes about 45 minutes and takes you into this beautiful building.worth visiting and it's half price for EU citizens.

The whole building a building site!!!!!!!!!!!!!!. Walked here yesterday having seen the building from the river and from Castle Hill, only to find the whole site surrounded by heras fencing so couldn't get closer than 50 metres. I suppose everywhere needs to have maintenance done, but surely not the whole site in one go. If we go back to Budapest we'll certainly have another go at visiting, but if you're in Budapest for the next few weeks I'd check to see when it becomes accessible.

Gorgeous and elegant building!. This building is one of the most beautiful parliament buildings in the world! This building is elegant, class, massive and impressive. It's design is unique in the city and reminds a bit of the fisherman's bastion on the other side of the river. The lighting at night make it look magnificent by night!The inside tour is interesting! The building is well decorated and elegant. The tour guide knows the visit by heart and will tell their story like a well known song!

As impressive inside as out.. The Parliament is a stunning building from the outside, particularly from the bridge/river at night when it is all lit up. It's worth doing the internal tour too. They run guided tours throughout the day in numerous languages. They are currently building a visitor's office in the square outside the Parliament. but you can buy tickets from the museum opposite. Remember to take your passport if you are an EU citizen as you get a discount. The tour itself is around 30 mins once you get through security - a litlle on the short side, but enough to convey the key facts about the history of the building and how the parliament works.
Well worth a visit. Get there in good time at the moment as working on the grounds and pathways around are a bit difficult to navigate.

Lovely Building. This is probably the most impressive building in budapest.It is situated on the Danube and looks very impressive especially at night.The tour lasts just under an hour and is well it.When you bring your passport to the ticket office you qualify for a 50% discount.The rooms ,stairs and ceilings are really impressive as are the crown jewels .The tour guide we had was very good and made the visit enjoyable.

Dome to beat all domes. Parliament is a massive building You need at least half a day here and you must do the tour ( make sure you take your pass port to get half price tickets)The dome is the best I've ever seen unfortunately you cannot take pictures

Lovely at night. This building is huge but it looks just stunning at night after the lights are on. You have to see this in the river cruise when the entire city is lit up. The reflection of the light falls on the water and becomes all the more beautiful
A must in Budapest. Definetly a visit, quite brief for the price but the staris, the hall, the crown and the rooms are unique. Not very nice guards though....

Beautiful Building. When we visited Budapest, the Parliament building was having works done to it. However, it is evidently a well kept building. It looks clean and nicely designed and is well worth a visit as part of your trip to Budapest.

Impressive building but expensive!. The building is impressive on the outside and the in and the tour last for about 45mins having cleared security. The tour guide was friendly and informative and eas mote than happy to answer questions. The tour allowed a good look at the entrance hall, old upper chamber and the crown jewels, although no photographs wete permitted of these. The downside was the cost, despite what the guide books say there is now a charge for EU citizens of 1750HFt/ person.
give yourself time to visit. dont stay outside, go inside. it is worth it. the tour take about 30 minutes and if you think it is beautiful outside, wait for the interior...

Parliament. We seemed to be rushed around on our Visit. We previously visited 7 yrs ago and the group going around was much smaller and the guide took their time and we visited more of the building. Dont forget your passport for reduced entry.

Very beautiful. It is a great building, truly impressive. If you have time, you should also visit the interior, but I recommend buying online tickets in advance because this way you save a lot of time and trouble.

Wonderful Building - Terrible Guide. The building is amazing, the third biggest Parliament in the World. Very similar to London House of Parliament. It is fascinating to watch at this building at the sunset from Castle Hill, as it is well enlightened on the Danube.Interiors are even better, well decorated and elegant. It doesn't look like a 'political' house, but more like a Royal Palace built to show richness of old Hungarian Empire.The only problems are the guided tours, they last 20 mins and the guide did not even reply to our questions. 20 mins for such an amazing building do not give justice. Also, the surrounding area is all closed for some building work and to reach the entrance you have to go through a sort of labyrinth.

Amazing Building!. Although I didn't go inside and there was a lot of building works around when I went this building it still has to be one of best pieces of architecture i've seen. You can't miss it when visiting Budapest as its bang on the Danube river on the Pest side and I strongly advise walking past it at night to check it out lit up, this is truly breathtaking.

Amazing building. This is a beautiful building but unfortunately there was alot of work taking place whilst we were there and the whole building was surrounded by builders and building materials so we were unable to get the full benefit. From the Buda aside the photos during day and night are amazing as you can not see the building works from there

Amazing building. Amazing building. The tour was escorted and the security check (almost airport style) was slow on the way in. The guide was knowledgeable and spoke excellent English. However, the tour felt a little rushed. Take your passport with you (EU) and its half the price.

Fantastic Building. We have finally visited the Parliament on 21st February after years of walking by on our visits to Budapest. So glad we did. It is a fantastic building with lots of history and beautiful decorations.Due to reconstruction works on Kossuth square the ticket office was operating in the Museum of Ethnography, opposite the Parliament. EU citizens get 50% discount. Take a photo ID or passport with you. However they are hoping that the square will be ready for National Day on 15th March.There is tight security on entering the building, similar to an airport system with scans. You can take photographs everywhere except in the Dome (Kupola) where the Hungarian crown jewels are on display.The tour of the building was excellent. The guide who took us around spoke very good English, she was very knowledgeable, and made the tour around the Parliament very enjoyable. The tour takes about 40 minutes. If you want to visit the Parliament when you are in Budapest I would recommend reading the information on: http://www.parlament.hu/angol/angol.htm It tell you all you need to know about opening times, guided tours, maps etc. Enjoy.

impressive. although the builders are in -lots of building work being undertaken around the building and security is very tight - the tour of the building was excellent. The decoration inside is opulent and the crown jewels are beautiful. Tour only takes 1 hr but take identification eg, passport as it gives a 50% discount on the entrance price

Parliament building. Only saw this from the outside. Went past it on the river cruise and could see it well from the Buda - castle area.Fantastic building. Wish i could have seen it lit up at night time.

Excellent tour guide. Part of the entrance is being renovated with gardens and will be completed in the summer so most of your photos will have scaffolding in them from the outside. The tour inside lasted 40 minutes and the tour guide was very good- just enough information to keep you interested in Hungary's history without being overwhelmed several jokes for good measure. She also stopped to let you take photos of the beautiful building. A must do if you're in Budapest xx

Must-See!. Although I found the tour of Parliament to be a little pricey, it was worth it. The tour last approximately 45 mins with a guide, and the building is very impressive. We missed the last English tour of the day (information of tour times and languages is available on their website) and ended up going with the final group that day, which was in Spanish. Although we weren't able to understand the information the guide was providing, the building itself is very impressive, and well worth a visit! It is especially beautiful at night when it is lit up.

Couldnt find the entrance. There was construction going on or something when we went to go and experience the Parliament so we couldnt find the entrance. It does look really awesome from the outside through and at night too!
wow. Huge building was having lots of building work done on one side, best view is from River or castle hill area. Lots of different architecture.

well worth a visit. We almost missed this , so make sure that you don't. It's a 45 minute tour of the Parliament building, with an informative English speaking guide. Take your passport when you book the timed ticket.

Must-see for every Budapest tourist!. Before starting my Budapest trip I already booked a german-guided tour in the parliament, not least it is not possible to visit the building by oneself. The guide was very motivated and told everything about the history of the parliament, but also some witty anecdotes. The tour lasts about 45 mins and is also accompanied by security guards. Unfortunately it is not allowed to take pictures in the dome and from the hungarian regalia of royalty. Nevertheless the hungarian parliament is a must-see when doing a short trip!
Like any other Parliament. This was built when the region got its own autonomy . Was under renovation when I visited. But this old structure still quite an attrction in Budapest.
Beautiful building. Just like London but bigger! Beautiful building, at night it looks amazing. Set in a lovely section on the Danube - unfortunately did not get to go on a tour - maybe next time.

Monumentally place. Had a great tour around with lots to see. Tons of history and many photo opportunities. Lots of building work outside but still worth a visit. Don't forget your European passport for cheaper tickets.
Beautiful at night. Especially beautiful at night, when the it is dark and the Parliament is lightened. Beautiful architecture. I did not go inside, but walked along the Donau.
Beautiful. What gorgeous architecture, a beautiful building, work is going on outside which should make it even more attractive. A must to visit while in Budapest

Disappointed. Two weeks ago, we visited the Parliament - guided tour. When we purchased our tickets we were told that the tour would be short that day. After queing, security check and the tour, we were in and out in 40 minutes. We found it difficult to hear our Guide with background noise. All we saw was the main staircase and the Holy Crown of Hungary, guarded by an honour Guard. There was no shop where you could buy a history of this very impressive Parliament building. Next time, as we are regular visitors to Hungary, we shall make sure of a longer tour.
nice building. we went there on foot from Vacy street, but place around the parliament building is closed because of reconstruction.
Perfect place to visit. You can choose different languages for your excursion. The building is really nice and stunning! The guided tour is informative and interesting, you'll not be bored.
excellent guided tour. We did the English guided tour. The guide was very well informed and spoke English clearly and well. A very very interesting place to visit.

Unbelievable!. The Parliament must be one of Europe's most majestic buildings!
It is in the Pest side, between two bridges, the Chain bridge and the Margaret bridge.
Try to phtograph it from the Buda side, so as to capture all of its splendor!

Beautiful Building. It is one of the much sought after tourist attraction in Budapest. During my visit, outside of the Parliament was under renovation, but inside very beautiful building. there are guided tours, which are very informative. Inside you will find , gold plating, paintings and top of it original crown. and also cigar stand outside the house, which are numbered, so that during the debate members can have one or two puff and put their cigar on the stand and participate in debate and again come enjoy their cigar again.

Worth doing. First you need to get there! We walked from the Metro at Deak Ferenc along the Danube towards Parliament. We got to the display of shoes on the bank (no plaque to explain for those who may not have known what they represented) and then realised we were cut off by some of the many works. Not wishing to follow some others' example of using a pallet to scale a 12' wall, we walked all the way back to the bridge. Reaching Parliament Square, more fences to circumvent, so three sides of a square to get to the museum opposite Parliament where you buy your tickets for a timed tour. There is a small cafe here and the only loo you'll find. Beware, they are coin operated.Parliament itself is very ornate and grand and our guide was very informative. You also see the Crown Jewels.

Certainly must go. We have been there on January, and the whole building was surrounded by fences because of the construction of a big garden or park around the building.As this place is the current parliament house of Hungary, you cannot enter the building on your own and must join a guided tour which starts every 30 min. (on the time we were there). Tours are in different languages, so unless you want to wait for your tour I advise to check the time tables before going there.Inside, the building is very impressive. It looks like a palace, with high ceilings, decorated with paintings, granite pillars, state of the art statues, and a lot of gold and royal-looking.The heart of the building is the (original) holy crown of Hungary, more than 1000 years old, and always guarded by armed guards. Don't miss this one !

Nice view. The most impressive place in Budapest. Beautiful outside, but new inside. The show of colors are impressive for the pictures in the night. The best place to see it´s from the castle area. It´s amazing also the visit inside to see the crown. Recommended.

Fantastically ornate, but being renovated. The parliament building is an amazingly ornate and sumptuous building and well worth a visit. You can pay 7000 HUF to a tour company or buy the ticket on the door from Parliament for 1700 HUF (and you get exactly the same tour). The square around Parliament is currently being rebuilt so access is a bit difficult and you are required to queue outside several times during the entry process so wrap up warm (and no sharp objects)

Great attention to detail. The building is massive, I believe the second largest parliament building in Europe, overall it is gorgeous, awesome turrets and carvings throughout the building, the inside has an awesome feel, as though you're inside some part of Hogwarts.
Very nice indeed. Only part of the building is open to public but its well worth the visit. Very nice impressive architecture. Lots of gold around:)
Go to it!. Impressive, wide! Visit it, even if you have to wait sometimes to access. Part of the history of Hungary is explained during visit.

A Beautiful Building on the Danube.. The Parliament Building is a very beautiful building in appearance. There are many other sites to tour within walking distance of the Parliament building. To visit, exit the Kossuth Lajos tér Metro Station on the Red line.

get inside if you can. We were fortunate to be visiting Budapest in mid-March, and they had the Parliament building open to visitors as part of the national holiday. The inside is quite breathtaking, and the crown is on display. The outside is beautiful too if you can't get in, and if you are looking for the Jewish shoes, they are in front, down by the river's edge.
Like everyone says: a must visit. So beautiful inside; very informative and pleasant guide. Be forewarned if you don't do stairs well --there are a LOT of them! Definitely worth the visit.

Good tour. If you are an eu citizen take your passport as you get the tour half price. Tour takes around 45 minutes. You are allowed to take photos but not in the dome. Informative tour well worth a visit

Interesting building and worth the time for a visit. A lovely building. Amazing construction of the ceiling inside (especially the dome you are not allowed to photograph) and the countless carvings and statues were not only great to view but seemed to capture an essence of the country itself. Take the time for a tour of it if you visit Budapest.
Beautiful building. Worth a visit to see the inside of this beautiful building and the Crown Jewels...quick tour it only lasts an hour.

Stunning building. We went there last week and it was really excellent although one comment is that there is a lot of work going on outside and we had to detour a bit of a distance round the rear. This aside it was a great tour and reasonably cheap. we had an english speaking tour guide and wshe was most informative. The Crown jewels are kept here and worth seeing ( at no extra charge) but photos are not permitted of the jewels but anywhere else in the building was fine. Another must see place if in Budapest!
Nice visit. If you can don't miss this beautiful building. Book your ticket in advance, a guide will walk you through the rooms of this vast structure.

Absolute Must. Opulence at it's best! Sadly during my visit there was a huge amount of work going on around Parliament Buildings which detracted for it's appearance. Best views were from the river or Castle Hill.Inside the building was opulent - totally mind blowing. The stair case, the jewels, the changing of the guard. My advice would be to book your tour when you first arrive - don't risk missing out! You won't regret it.

Beautiful, well kept, worth the fee. This was one of the few tours we actually paid for in Budapest, and it was well worth the price. The entrance/tour fee is greatly reduced for citizens of EU countries so be sure to bring your passport. The interior is so well maintained and extravagant. You can take pictures everywhere except the room with the Crown Jewels. Our guide was informative. Highly recommend.It was a little long to get to from the metro because of the construction (we went in January 2014). You have to take a round about way to get to the ticket office and main entrance, so be sure to allow a little extra time to get there.
Great building!!!. Parliament is beautiful to see,especialy at night on boat cruise around the parliament!You will enjoy it for sure :)

awesome. This is a "must see" site. Unfortunately we could not get close to the building as they were in the middle of redecoration it, which was very disappointing. But still, we were very impressed.

Somewhat disappointed. While it is the third largest parliament, I was not as impressed as I hoped I would be. The tour was a lot of money for just 30 minutes and three rooms. You start through the grand staircase (nice) and then see the crown jewels (no pictures). You move into one more room, then see where they hold sessions. I would have liked to see a bit more. It is not the nicest parliament I have been in.
Great architecture. Desperate to see this building, unfortunately good not get near as the outdoor area is being re-paved - very disappointing

Magnificent building inside and out. The parliament building is in my opinion the showpiece of Budapest architecture (along with the inside of St Stephens). We took a English guided tour and were duly impressed with the inside of the building, it's magnificence and grandeur from carpets, steps, marble columns, domes, hallways, cigar holders, parliament sitting room and size. Only downside is that the tour is quite short (less than 45 minutes) and the cost relatively quite steep (3500F) and access is limited to the northern end of the building although both sides are mirror images. Pretty spectacular.
parliament. again fantastic architechture and looks even more fantastic when lit up in the evening.building kept very clean and of course very interesting history

Take the tour. I took the guided tour and must say I was impressed. The crown jewels are in there guarded by two soldiers with long kossack swords and it's evident they take these jewels seriously. The building is stunning and the tour is really interesting. I thought it was great and I'm fussy so I hope you enjoy.

Tour of Parliament. It was easy to book online using JegyMeister. The tour itself was well organised and informative and lasts about an hour. The day I visited coincided with a day that the Parliament was not sitting which allowed access to the Debating Chamber.There was considerable work ongoing to improve the amenity of the Parliament surrounds which should be completed in March 2014 and which will also improve access to the Danube.

beautiful! but be construction aware!. We were excited to go and see this beautiful building because it looks stunning from far, its actudally not like all the other building I usually see in other Europe cities but the park that surrounds it is under construction. The nearest place you can see it is maybe 15 meters away from it and through a metal fence :( but it is truly astonishing and worth to see close even through the construction.

Under construction. Open inside, but outside, around parliament they are redoing the cobble stone flooring and it looks like a massive project. Either way, it's visible from the Citadela and it is just stunning! It's huge and beautiful, don't miss it.

Beautiful building, short tour. The surroundings of this beautiful building are unfortunately under construction so we could not see it sourrounded with parks nor could we see the main entrance. It is also impossible to get at the back of the building (to the main facade) on foot since there is no pedestrian root between the Danube and the building, only a busy road. That's a shame... Nevertheless the building is still beautiful and grand, the tour however is short, cca. 20 minutes and feature the main staircase, crown jewels and parliament room. The tour is informative but it is not worth the full price - luckily EU citizens have 50% discount. Be sure to buy your tickets in advance, thay tend to sell out quickly and you'll end up waiting for a tour at a later hour. Only guided tours are possible. Understandably so.

Educational tour in beautiful surroundings. I took a tour of the seat of the Hungarian Government, in the capital city of Budapest. The building is astonishing from the outside and equally beautiful on the inside! I enjoyed hearing about the history of the Hungarian Government, as well as the history of the Parliament Building itself.

Under Construction. The parliament area is going through massive construction work at the moment. It's bit like a maze to reach the entrance , you have to go around and around…. Most advisable to avoid the actual visit until works are finished. You can still enjoy the magnificent building from the outside and from the other side of Danube.

Too expensive for the entrance ticket.. I must say it's indeed a beautiful architectural work, especially at night. [I'm strongly recommending you to visit the scene during both day and night]. I will rate this as excellent!I had also paid and visited the interior of the building. While my German friends asked them of the entrance fee, it was around 4-5 Eur. However, I was quite upset that the counter was telling us for those without an EU passport, one needs to pay 15 Eur. I have a feeling they just simply increased the price. Honestly, I would like to know if this is really true. Anyway, the visit only covered a small area of the building and took less than 30 min in total. The Q and scanning took half an hour or longer.

Very interesting building. Went on the tour which lasted about an hour. The building is interesting inside and outside. The rooms are all interesting and the guide gave a lot of information about the building and how it is used. It was disappointing not to be able to see the actual parliament chamber, but the one that is identical which is used for conferences.

Impressive architectural landmark. To being completely honest I must say that this architectural complex is the most beautiful I have visited in Europe. Its size is huge and in the evening his dome capture colors like never seen before. Try to spend several hours to visit, but I think the best way to enjoy it is to take one of the many boats along the Danube and let go for a few Euros round this fantastic river that divides the city. I suggest you taking the 18/19 hs boat to face the sunset falling on the top of the Parliament. Really worth to visit.

Spectaular Gothic Revival. Built in the Victorian era on the Danube this iconic Budapest building shows the influence of British architecture in its Gothic Revival theme. Meant to look like a Medieval Castle and to offer the right kind of venue for the Parliament, this building is one of the main architectural focal points of Budapest. Unfortunately the interior was not open at the time I visited since Kossuth Square surrounding it was under renovation, but I have seen pictures of the inside and it is well worth seeing. This building acted as a symbol of democrasy to Hungarians during the Communist Era.
It was beautiful. The parliament building, we were told, won Europe's pageant for MOST BEAUTIFUL. Why such a pageant exists, I don't know, but it was worth seeing.

one of the most stunning parliament buildings in the world!. Yes, it was so impressive and I have visited 72 countries worldwide, I would say one of top ten I have seen! But the drawback is that you stand in the line to purchase the tickets, you wait about half an hour in the queque and if you are lucky you get in. You struggle to choose from the 6 languages avaliable (En,De,Fr, It, Sp, Hun). And then the tour lasts less than 40 min including the security check and the waiting to get in! You pay 6 Euros as a European citizen (half the normal price) to see about 6-8 chambers out of 691 rooms in the building!!! A while ago EU citizens went in for free but now since the Hungarian government decided that you should not lose the money from 3000 visitors a day they decided to put an entrance fee! It felt nice all of us European citizens to mix and mingle our languages in order to make it into the tour and be amazed by the sheer beauty of this edifice but please do not charge 1 euro per chamber to members of the European family! It is enough to charge 10 and 13% service charge which is obligatory to all bills while it is supposed to go to the waiters but instead the government takes it directly and does not give anything to the staff!! My suggestion is since you have an entrance fee extend your tour to more rooms as they do in Ottawa in Canada or in Westminster. In both cases the tour is free, as it is in many Town halls around the world.

Stunning building. Unfortunetely, we were there while the building was being renovated, so we were not able to see the interior. The entire complex was turned into a constrution site. However, this did not take any of the beauty out of it! The building is still magnificant and huge!! We walked along the Danube since the tram #2 was working on a shorter line than usual (I know that there are buses taking you to the other side, just in front of the building, but we wanted to enjoy the views). Will come back again to see the inside for sure.

Beautiful. A must see. Over 40kg of gold leaf have been used in this building and it shows. It's amazing the 40% of it was destroyed in the war and has been rebuilt to the original spec.Very plush and brilliantly designed. Better than the Palace of Westminster.

Worth the visit. This is a beautiful building and the tour to go inside was well worth it. The interior was truly impressive. It was very ornate. We bought tickets on the internet as tickets can get sold out quickly. The time and day that was our first preference was not available, so we opted for another day and time.

Gorgeous building. I only viewed the Parliament building from a boat on the Danube during an evening cruise.The building is huge, very well lit, right on the Pest side of the Danube and remarkable in architecture and style fitting such a prestigious purpose.

Stunning. One of the most beautiful and most impressive buildings in Budapest. The only downside is the construction site around it (it is said that the reconstruction of the building is to be finished in 2016).

Such a stunning architectural landmark. Viewing the Parliament from both sides of the Danube is spectacular. My husband and I have never seen this type of architecture anywhere else in Europe. The Parliament is such an iconic Budapest landmark which you can photograph over and over again and still be stunned by its beauty. Loved this city!

not easy to get there but worth doing it. You buy the tickets in an opposite building (a museum) five minutes away, then wait at another place in the middle of a building lot (which should be finished by now) where the guide gets you and makes you walk into the building. Security check, no foto of the crown allowed. But wonderful building, great guide and a lot of explanations how windows were saved during war time. And you see the Holy Grail of the Hungarians, St.Stephen`s crown, probably the oldest existing crown of the world.No souvenir shop, no food, no facilities.
beautifull. beautifull building must see, attraction on all visitors list..take a pictures drink coffee and relax i hate rush

WOW!. I went on a guided tour to see the parliament and it really is amazing. be prepared to stay in line to get the tickets or come early as there are a lot of people who want to see it. Our guide was really great and had a lot of information that really impressed me. and the building on its own is absolutely a must see!

Nice building. Good and clear explanation from guide. A little comment that since it is in midst of some renovation around the area, we have to wait outdoor for at least 10-15 minutes before getting into building for security check.

More interesting than I though it would be.. Not my sort of thing normally but we had a good english speaking guide who was very helpful. lots of interesting elements to the tour and the building which was really interesting. Tour wasn't too long either, would recommend

365 Towers!!. The Parliament is a city in side the city, even kinder garden for the employers; Only a Mann with modern ideas could planned that!! I would like to visit it again....is so big, and the city has so much to see, you need a week!!

Best Parliament Building. It was amazing from the outside and the inside.
A must visit when you're in Budapest
It's too bad we can only see a very small part of the building.
Probably the most beautiful parliament..... ....building that I have ever seen! It's huge and the architecture is really amazing. There are guided tours, for free when you are resident of the EU.

Book before you go!. we walked all the way up there to find that it was being renovated , so there were very limited visits and they had to be booked on line. We did manage to book on line for the following day , but the visit was less than 1 hour and somewhat disappointing.
Nice building to see.. worth a visit to take a look on this amazing building. do not miss the guide in several languages. i have order the tickets in advance and save the standing in the line.

Brilliant architecture. A must photo op in Budapest.. We didn't go on the tour as there was construction done and we didn't have much time. But the view at night is spectacular with the lights and reflection in the Danube. A must see at night!

A building to be proud of.. Having been told that this building was modeled on the UK Parliament in London we had to go and see.We thought that we would have to queue for tickets so I asked the concierge at the Intercontinental Hotel(where we were staying) about times etc.No problem we ordered the tickets from him and left on a coach from the hotel to meet our guide and so no waiting at all.Fantastic building which my description will not be suffice to do it justice-you have to visit.Seeing the Crown Jewels alone was worth going for.Did not find the security too intrusive

Long queue to get ticket. Very impressive building looking across the Danube. Even more impressive when the lights are on at night, it's a picture you don't want to miss. Not sure if it's worth the effort lining up early in the morning trying to buy a ticket for a tour inside. Most visitors did like us. You get to walk up the grand staircase but most of the areas are out of bound.

Absolutely beautiful government building. We traveled to see Parliament when there was a lot of construction. It was torn up on three sides of the building, but that didn't deter the crowds on a weekday morning. They hope to have the construction completed by some time in 2014.There is a lot of security and your belongings are x-rayed, but that is getting to be very common these days.The tour is 30 minutes long, but security takes 45 minutes. The guide is very good, but doesn't wear a microphone so it can sometimes be difficult to hear.

Just the tip of the architectural iceberg . As other reviewers have noted, the tour is short and only includes three stops, but we found the guide's memorized spiel amusing. The building is huge and torn up on the outside; we would love to come when we could see more of the outside.

Funny tour. I had to review this because it was so entertaining. The guide was so funny and I'm not trying to poke fun, but seriously, her English tour was memorized as if she didn't know the language at all. It was impossible to hear her and so hard to understand most of what she said. Her punchline was always, "believe me when I tell you that". She must have said it 15 times. I did enjoy this tour. The building is amazing and you only see a portion, but it was really interesting to see many different rooms inside.

A brief, but worthwhile trip. The outside of the parliament building is unfortunately spoilt at the moment by the large-scale remodelling of Kossuth Lajos square; nothing, however, mars the gorgeous interior. Access is only by guided tour (available in a wide variety of languages at different times - check in advance); we had no trouble getting tickets on the day when we went in December, but this may not be true in summer. The only problem with the highly informative tour is its brevity, as it only encompasses a few rooms. These do include the former House of Lords, a mirror of the session chamber still in use, and the grand dome with the crown jewels (which may not be photographed), but not much more. What you can see is definitely worth it if you qualify for the 50% reduction for students or EU citizens on the relatively high 3500Ft ticket price - those not qualifying may which to consider whether a 40 minute tour (including security checks) is worth the price of asking.

Nostalgia of Glorious days. If you are in Budapest there is no way you pass without seeing or visiting Parliament. It is such a beautiful landmark in Budapest to see day time and night time. walking along riverside from Chain bridge to Parliament or from Budapest castle to Parliamentcan be recommended. of course if it's not too cold!
Quite imposing. I didn't venture inside but it's a construction site! The buildings are majestic and sitting along the river offers some good views.

Tour interesting, long queue for tickets. The tour was very interesting - it was about 45 minutes long. There was a massive queue to get tickets, which have to be bought in the museum opposite the Parliament as there is a lot of rebuilding outside the Parliament building - best to get your ticket earlier in the day so you don't miss the tour.

Interesting, but book ahead online. This is an interesting tour, but would bore kids. You have to get tickets online ahead of time. Otherwise you will end up wasting hours on just trying to figure out how/when to see this as the security arrangements are quite high. The tour and the building itself was interesting, and certainly in the top 5 things to do in Budabest.

Little country now, but once much larger.. The parliament in Hungary once represented a much larger population and thus seems outsized for the now reduced country. The Parliament Building is grand and worth touring,

more than Parliament. I have been in the main hall, balcony of this building as well, it has great location, wonderful panorama to Duna and amazing architecture. I have never seen similar Parliament in my life experience.
an absolute must. This building is amazing so much to see, the guide spoke good clear English and was mindful to let people take as many pictures as they wanted except of the crown jewels and guards.
Stunning outside and in. Not the longest of tours but well worth it to see inside this stunning building and the Hungarian crown jewels.

make sure you book online in advance or you will miss out. Last year we tried to visit the parliament but all days were sold out during our stay. This year we checked trip advisor on our arrival and booked on line as advised. The area around the parliament is being redeveloped so it is a big mess outside and it is rather difficult to access the area.The tour lasted about 35 mins after we had all got through security. The guide was good and well rehearsed in what she was going to say so as to keep to the tight time schedule. You can take photos everywhere except in the grand dome.The interior of the building is simply wonderful, so ornate for such a previously poor country. Be careful not to stand too near the guards or they may wave their long sword at you.Well worth a visit and usually I only go to thee kind of places to accompany my husband.On line it cost about £6 a ticket, much cheaper than buying through local tour operators.

Exquisite. The building alone is magnificent, seen from the outside, be it day or night. Inside, it is equally splendorous. The admission fee (for EU citizens) is only 1750 HUF and includes a guided tour. You can take pictures (except in the dome room, where the crown jewels are). You´ll have to be patient because there is a bit of waiting involved. Visitor groups are relatively big and sometimes you have to wait for a group to come out of the building before yours can go in. Then there's the security check which can take a while. Once you're inside and the tour begins everything should go smoothly. Just relax and let yourself be dazzled.

Do it if you have time!. They were doing construction outside when we went so it took away a little but when went inside for the 50 min tour and it was ok. I thought we would see more of it but still nice.

Impressive Building. The Parliament building is very impressive. They are rightfully proud of the heritage and history displayed inside and out. We enjoyed the tour, artworks and details of the building. Outside is a bit of a maze with all the construction but even that is an impressive undertaking. Just watch your step and remember this is a working goverment building and enjoy the tour.

Work in progress. All the surroundings of the parliament were a construction site, which ruin the beuty of the building.And I read in 2 guides books than entrance was free for EU citizens, that's not true, just a discount so we didn't get in. Maybe it's a contribution to these renovations.

Another beautiful Hungarian building. Our Hungarian tour guide had great English so this was informative & easy to enjoy. The construction underway makes getting in/out quite a trek - don't be put off though!
MESMERIZING. I took the tour and loved every minute. It is fascinating and beautiful is an understatement. I went twice.

WOW! What a view. After many years of renovation the impressive facade of that building can be seen without any scaffolds now and I really enjoyed the view from the pier in Buda. Especially in the afternoon you have a great view. I heard an old couple from Austria saying: "Now it shines in new splendor." and they also mentioned that they saw it the last time more than 40 years ago, when you needed a visa to visit Hungary. Unfortunately I didn't find the time to attend a guided tour, but I heard that they are very interesting. Maybe I'll can do that the next time. If you get the chance to see that building in the dark you will be impressed by the illumination. It's gorgeous.

Parliament. Booked our tour the day before on line as the tours fill quickly & its the only way to see the building. Interesting tour with plenty of information but you only see 3/4 rooms, would of liked to see more. The rooms we saw were beautiful & very impressive. Worth the visit even if the tour seemed brief.
Worth a visit. We attended the English tour F1750 for EU citizens. If you nthink the outside of Parliament is beautiful, wait until you see inside - breath taking. Do not miss

One of Europe's most beautiful Parliament. The Hungarian Parliament was built in the age of Romance, and the main idea was based on London's Parliament, so it is definitelly a remarkable building, that is worth to see, while cruising around Budapest.

Interesting. It's interesting to learn about the Hungarian politics. They kept the old crown inside no photo was allowed. We saw the change of the guard but it was nothing compares to changing guard in Buckingham Palace.
Terrific Tour. 45minute tour of Parliament which cost no more than 5 EUROS was worth every penny, a must in Budapest. Must book in advance

Hard to get in, but worth it. Even if you have to take a tour in another language, just get in if you can. The architecture is lovely, and ask about the "cigar-length speeches" in the gorgeous Parliamentary chamber. Unfortunately this temple of representative government does not mean the Hungarians have one.

Best seen from a distance. One of the most stunning buildings in town but almost inaccessible close to because of major works to create a new tramway. It is still possible to access the building for a tour but by the time we found the entrance we'd lost the will to visit.

Nice place to visit but not a wow. Get your tickets beforehand @ jegymester.hu. the first time we went there, the tickets were already sold out.
Worth a visit. U can only enter via 45 min guided tour. Construction work in front of the Parliament is supposed to end March 2014.
Impressive structure. A magnificent work of art. A structure well worth a visit, again it can be viewed from the river where you get a great view of its intricate workmanship and design.
parliament visit. interesting and well informed guide. perhaps could have been completed in less time and made easier by the ticketing and queuing arrangements.

Most exotic of world parliament houses. We were simply astonished by the grandeur and decor of this very beautiful parliament house. Although we had visited it on an earlier trip, but found it worth a second visit. A must see for all the visitors.
The tour guides were proficient in the history of the place as well as it's statistics.
The Parliament tour. Be sure to visit the Parliament. They give a great tour and are so very proud of their country. It was very interesting.
Well worth a visit . Very interesting and worth the money. Just make sure you take your EU passport for a considerable reduction in the entry price.

Take a tour here-the interior is stunning. I had to take a guided tour with a company to be sure I got a ticket in, heard to many horro stories of people going back every day to get a ticket and it was sold out for the day. The entry way to the second floor, and their crown jewels, are fabulous. You cannot take pictures in the room with the jewels. We got to go iin the actual parliament chamber, and it was quite impressive. Be sure not to miss this. Only takes an hour or a bit more. Definitely somthing not to miss. And, get some photos of the building at night from one of the tour boats at pier 10 or 11 by the Elizabeth Bridge. They are building a visitor center on the backside away from the Danube. Currently you buy tickets, if available, across the street at the ethnography museum.

Extravagant!. I am not sure why this is not higher rated on Tripadvisor. It is a fantastic building to tour, and you learn a ton about the Hungarian government and their history in 40 minutes. Worth the price of admission for sure!

Golden age. The visiting is only 40 minutes, but its very intresting.the touristgouide told the historic of parlament. i'd have like if guided tours will take longer. its a beutiful statue, everywhere are gold. My faivorite hall was the central hall, where we founded the holy crown of Hungary, with soldiers.
A lavish version of the UK houses of Parliament. knowledgeable guide, classic architecture, interesting history - well worth the entrance fee and the short wait for the scheduled tours.

need to prebook online but this wasn't in any of the reviews I read. I missed this entirely and wasted one hour. It was only made known to me that they set a limit on the number of people that can visit. This has to be booked online via jegymester.hu. They should have made it clear on their web site so that someone like me won't be wasting time travelling there, spent half an hour walking around and asking people where was the entrance. It took me half an hour only to learn that the booking is full on that day and I have to book online. It will help enormously if they would have make this clear on their website.

Wait a while. The parliament building is stunning to look at, especially from the river at night. Unfortunately, the tour was a disappointment. We were hurried up a grand staircase, got to look at the crown, scepter and orb, went into the now-unused chamber of the upper house, and that was it. About 40 minutes. To be fair, parliament was in session, which I suppose puts parts of the building off-limits to tours. And there's a lot of construction going on. We were told the tour is normally a couple of hours, but shortened because of construction. So my advice is to admire the building from afar, and don't bother going inside until construction is complete.

Not that Impressive. Me and my friend went to have a look at the Hungarian Parliament as the Hungarians are always bragging about how it's better than the UK one but to be honest i was not impressed as it was just standard.
Nice. Fantastic experience! It's a nice and historical palace that filled with stories and culture.Sadly, the building was undergoing some infrastructure construction .

Enjoyable but hurried. You can book in advance so you know when your visit will be, though there are even on days when it is pouring and out of the main season, large numbers. We had an excellent knowledgeable guide and the insights into the constitution and history were presented logically and held our attention. The building, though rebuilt, is beautifully decorated. The only issue was the "guard" who kept pushing the guide on and looking at his watch. Clearly you are on a very tight fixed timed visit. Just took the gilt of the gingerbread

What an amazing building. This magnificent building was constructed specifically for the legislature and is still in active use today. It was rebuilt/reconstructed after 1945. The legislative rooms are beautiful and the crown/country jewels are presented in a very lovely manner. It is great, and Americans should be proud, that President Carter returned the crown to Hungary in 1978 after we took it at the end of WW II. The staircase up the central section is quite impressive and they are reconstructing the gardens in front of the building to make it even more impressive. It is well worth scheduling a visit in advance, which is required.

Wonderful architecture but poor value and planning. Came here for architecture and was not dissapointed. However tour guide repeated information we received on a walking tour and lasted only 40mins. Booking office had 1 person despite large queue and we were left behind pre our 3pm slot so missed 10mins and had to catch others up. Try and go during a session of parliament. Will be cheaper, you can see democracy in action and have more control of time.

beautiful from the outside.thats it. the visit inside is not as intresting as the look from the outside and mainly from the buda side of the city. the area around the place is undergoing lots of construction work which makes it even more frustraiting to walk around and stand in very long lines. if you missed it- you actually didnt miss much.

Interesting Visit. Amazing Building - but you don't see a lot. If you've been on a tour of the Houses of Parliament In London you may be disappointed. But you do get to see the incredible architecture - so worth a look

A Magnificent Building Restored. Guides here provide a wonderful description of the past history and present use of this magnificent building. Everywhere you look there is something impressive to see. Some things are original, while others are restored. The outside surrounding of the building are still being diligently restored.

Parliament plays hard to get. Budapest's parliament buildings are undoubtedly impressive from the outside. Views from the river are particularly impressive. But try to get a ticket to join a group to visit the buildings and you will find language specific groups limited to 50 participants. Perhaps better preparation on our behalf would have avoided the frustration of a wasted visit, but looking at other reviews we are not alone.

What a place. Try to visit it as earlier as you can especially if you need an English guide, the day we visit it we had to wait more than 2 hours for the next free English tour and we went at around 10 am
Morning Visit. Well worth an internal tour. A Great building but at present there is a lot of work going on around it. Will be better on the outside when the works are finished.

Considered one of the most beautiful government buildings in the world.. Parliament – The Parliament Building sits along the Danube River on the Pest side. The main entrance faces the river, and inside the main entrance is the main staircase which is where the tour begins.It is the largest building in Hungary. It was built between 1885-1902 in a manner that emulates the British Houses of Parliament. Hungary had a bicameral parliament when it was built so it is perfectly symmetrical to signify the equality of the two houses. Today Hungary has a unicameral government.We took the guided tour in English. Key points of interest include:• The main stairway with its frescoed ceiling and brass and gold decorations and chandeliers. The decorations are actually gold leaf above 4 meters high. • The domed hall, with figures of early leaders around the base of the dome and a chandelier which is large enough for a person to climb down from the ceiling to clean and change the lights from the inside. This room, which is the only one where photography is not allowed, holds the crown and coronation jewels. • The lobbies outside the chambers have brass cigar holders, with numbers on each, so members would know which cigar was theirs. This link takes you to a great virtual tour -http://www.parlament.hu/angol/eng/virtualis_seta.htmThis link provides an overview - http://www.parlament.hu/angol/eng/leiras.htmTours are offered in eight languages – Hungarian, English, French, Hebrew, German, Russian, Italian and Spanish.You should book online because the tours fill up quickly. Follow this link for info - http://www.parlament.hu/angol/eng/tajekoztato.htmAnd this link for ordering and self-printing e-tickets - http://www.jegymester.hu/eng/Production/480000/Parliament-visit

Stunning. Possibly more impressive than British Parliament in London, this building is massive and beautiful. You can get a view from directly across the river, but limb castle hill for a bird's eye view.

Astonishing. It is difficult to visit the Parliament, but you must do all you can to get inside. The building is incredible beautiful and inspire a lot of respect. Try to buy tickets in advance, in order to avoid waiting at long queues. The exterior is impressive, a typical gothic project, which can be admired the best from the Fisherman's Bastion in Buda. Try to admire the building also during night, when you will have a totally different perspective

Parliment visit. Although there is alot of construction around Parliment it is well worth the visit. Suggest you purchase your tickets online before you go so you are sure to be able to fit into the English tour. The inside of the building is spectacular. The guide was very informative and answered all the questions the group had. The guards on either side of the royal crown reminded us of the guards in London. Well worth the visit if you are visiting Budapest and interested in all of it's history.

COLD & TORN UP ... a truly BAD tourist combination. could have made it "terrible" only by putting scaffolding up all over the buildings, as it is, there are huge cranes that one can not help but get in ones pictures .... the area one hopes to at least walk AROUND is being torn up as well so that you can not get within 3 city blocks of the buildings. heck, i am going to give this one of my rare "terribles" anyway.

Even more gorgeous inside. This is a magnificent piece of architecture and everyone notices the beauty visiting Budapest. But this will be the biggest miss of your trip if you do not manage to get inside. This is probably one of the most impressive interiors I have seen in my life. To make sure you get inside try to be as early as possible by ticket office (they start at 8) or even buy tickets some days before. They are not cheap (around 14 Euro) per non EU citizen, but it will be worth for sure.

Unpleasant surprise. I read carefully all he advises concerning the parliament visit.I made reservations from home to avoid the long lines waiting to buy the tickets,i chose Thursday and not Monday or Tuesday knowing that on these days the visit will be short because of parliament commities that make the visit short. So i have done all the right decisions but unfortunately the tour that was not cheap was finished after 20 minutes because the parliament had a commitie....I was very dissapointed and thought that it was not fair and may be they shuld cancel the tour at this day.
Beautiful building. Best seen from the Buda side or whilst on the Danube. Most tour buses offer a river cruise too. Great views of this gothic style building

A must see in Budapest.. We purchased tickets online before arriving in Budapest and it saved us from waiting in line with a large number of tourists. The Building is beautiful and the tour guide was knowledgeable. The history is interesting and it is absolutely worth the visit. Try to see the building from the river side at night - fantastic.
Best seen by night. The parliament was an immense project for the nation and is most beautiful when seen at night, its best attribute . The building is right on the river.

Couldn't get close to it. It seemed like everything in Budapest was under construction. But in a city with so many tourists, we were confounded as to why closed roads were not marked with alternate routes or walk-arounds. We kept ending up at dead ends, with nothing to do but backtrack forever to find an another way to get where we were going. But the trip to Parliament was the worst. We walked along the river until we got to the road leading up to it, which was...under construction. We crossed anyway, with one of us deciding to go ask the construction worker if we could get through. Of course access was denied so we ended up climbing up a wall and over a chain link fence to get near the road leading to Parliament. A parade of other tourists followed our lead and soon we were heading toward...another blocked entrance and more construction. No signs in any language, no arrows leading you around, and no access to Parliament. It looked beautiful from across the river. We will have to imagine the rest.

Must Do!. You must prebook timed tickets to tour this magnificent building. It's a short tour (about 40 minutes), and our guide was delightful and engaging.The interior of the building is magnificent. From the moment you walk inside, your eyes feast upon lavish interiors. The Dome area was something else!There is currently a LOT of public works going on outside the building which makes getting around cumbersome but if you know this beforehand and allow time you'll be fine. The images of what the green space will look like once completed will turn this area into a fantastic public park.Just a note, there are 96 stairs to climb once inside - they are on a gently incline and not difficult to walk, but some people may like to know this beforehand

The ultimate wedding cake. This impressive building, which dominates the river bank in Pest, is well worth the visit. The exterior is very ornate. The interior starts with a grand staircase and just gets better. The statues mounted high on the wall around the crown jewels are worth a second look. (No photos in this area.) The guide was knowledgeable and witty.
Road works. Building is amazing but awful of of paving work going on around it at the moment and the tour bus can't stop nearby

Beautiful, but too short.... the parliament is a wonderful building, sadly the whole city is under renovation, there are works everywhere, and even all around the parliament. go early to get tickets at the Ethnography Museum because there is a line and the groups are quickly full (maybe it depends on the language you want). we manage to get tickets for the tour starting an hour and a half later... finaly, we found it a little expensive for a tour that lasts only half an hour and shows only 3 rooms when it is told to us that there are almost 700 ones in the whole building...

Stunning! . We traveled here yesterday and while it was a stressful headache getting into the building with all the construction, it was worth it. The crown room took my breath away and everything was just so extravagant. I just wish I could have taken pictures in the crown room.

Not that interesting. We visited the parliament in the last week of October 2013, We waited a very long period of time out side with no seats.The tour was very short, we could not take photos in some areasand we felt like wewere being rushed out. Avoid this spot if possible.

What a House!. We viewed the Parliament from across the Danube which is necessary to view it entirely. It truly is a magnificent building and reminds one of the British Parliament building. Another fantastic photo op!

Take the tour. Not to be missed. The inside is just as intricate and beautiful as the outside. The guides are very informatiive. It is worth the expense. The only downside is the construction around the building is annoying. You have to walk out of the way just to get to the entrance of the Parliment Bldg. Wear comfy shoes.

Based on the British Houses of Parliament, not quite as good!. The views of the Parliament building both from, and across, the river Danube are stunning, daytime or nighttime. Unfortunately the whole of the area surrounding the building is being rebuilt, in stone slabs and blocks, so access and views were very restricted, though when it is finished it will be a wonderful open public space.Access to the interior of the Parliament building is strictly limited to guided tours, and only when Parliament is not sitting. There are guided tours in different languages at different times, and I would recommend turning up early in the day to book, as there were lengthy queues later on.The building is very grand, and the tour takes in many of the state rooms and corridors. Very beautiful and ornate, though, in my opinion, not quite as good as the Houses of Parliament in London.Cost of tickets was very reasonable, and definitely worth a visit if you have time.
A masterpiece. Words cannot express the beauty of this architectural masterpiece, it is incredible and at night spectacular.
Magnificent Building. Well worth a look, was being renovated when we were there but such a beautiful building. Great views of it from the Fisherman's Bastion

Amazing architecture and decor. Lucky us, we happened to be there on Hungarian National Pride Day, so it was free, but I would have paid to see this amazing building and its rich decor. Our guide was wonderful, and although it is under major exterior renovations at this time, the interior is worth your visit.
Beautıful. Only one word "AMAZING" ..We were there ın September , Buıldıng was closed and under Construction lookıng from outsıde was enough to break take

2nd biggest parliament in Europe. The second biggest Parliament in Europe was built inspired by the design of the first one, the british pair. At night it get incredibily enlightened and you can see its reflection on the Danube. Definitively worths the walk by the river.
Not an ordinary building. I was very impressive with the size and beauty of this place. Couldn't get inside as I didn't have much time but from anywhere you look it's always pretty and big.

The magnific simbol for Budapest. A building with a exclussiv arhitecture, includes history and
present. An inposant monument placed excelent near to river
Danube

very good tour for a working parliament building. This is a working parliament. Don't expect being there for hours. The tour shows the most impressive parts, and they are impressive indeed. Went to see the building itself and git all I wanted from it. Organisation-wise: Yes there are works around the building so access isn't so easy, but we didn't wait more than 10 minutes to get in. You need to have booked the tour online in advance. Beautiful building and a sound tour with no complaints.

Parliament. Would have been excellent, except the area arround the building is being landscaped it must be the biggest keyblock site in europe, However since this is temporary and will improve the area it is a positive.
Stunning. A stunning;y beautiful building both inside and out with a lot of history and a few architectural surprises inside.

Don't Go. You can take great pictures from the Budapest side and this is a lovely building. We couldn't get tickets -- didn't know to book online in advance -- and the area around the building is horrible, dusty, and a mess. No good photographs of the street side are possible. The "guards" at the construction fence are rude and officious. Don't go near the place.

Even with prepaid tickets, we did not get in. We bought tickets online, but our scheduled tour was cancelled because of a meeting. Stood in line for 30 minutes only to be told that could neither give us a refund nor schedule a later visit!

Europe's most beautiful building. It is considered Europe's most beautiful building. The Parliament has been getting renovated in the past years continuously and it is such a gorgeous building!They are building a parking station next to it, so it was closed off for visitors but could still get close enough for beautiful photos.

Nice but not sure if it's worth the wait to get in.. We had a nice organized tour of some of the inside. There was a long wait to get the tour and with all the construction on the outside of the Parliament it was hard getting around. If you have a lot of time in Budapest it's fine to take the tour, but nothing is missed if you don't see it.

big group, not that easy to hear. The building itself was impressive as were the rooms inside. We bought our tickets online which was an easy and straightforward process. Unfortunately while we were there they were doing some work to the outside. The only thing that let the tour down was the fact that the group was very large so it was difficult to hear the guide at times. There was also another tour going on simultaneously in a different language with the same number of people which added to this. If you just want to be able to have a look around though then it is good.

Interesting architecture. From the river it has some building work evident but from the land side the surrounding access and roads are undergoing significant change. Difficult to access for the disabled. The building is stunning and inside is amazing. The structure and form are worth the entry price alone. There is significant security and the equivalent of airport entry controls. A guided tour in English was available and although you are able to view comparatively little of the building it is still interesting.Tickets can be purchased on line, and significantly you can fix the time of the tour. Queuing in the museum over the other side of the square for tickets meant a wait while a screen told you how many tickets were left for the tour you wanted!!

Great building but very poor tour.... The parliament is a building that is really beautiful from the outside.It is very impressive and gives you the sense of something really special.It is built next to the Danube river so the mixing with the nature is something fantastic.It is very easy to go there by metro or tram.You can take thousands of photos from every corner and also from the opposite side of the river or the castle hill.The inside of the building is also nice,good decoration,nice windows,a crown room that you can see the crown of the kings of Hungary and the conference room.Unfortunatelly these are the only things that you can see from inside because the tour lasts only 40 minutes,they take you only to 5 areas and show you only the areas and the things i mentioned,nothing else.Finishing the tour left me with the sense of something missing,they really could show us much more...

Impressive. The Hungarian parlament is a very beautiful building, which we really enjoyed watching day and night from the Pest side, however when we were in front of it the whole street was laying open and this is due to last until March 2014, beware of this, taking nice pictures is thus impossible from the other side of the building. Also the streets around it are like a maze due to these building works and getting to the holocaust monument on the Danube is a bit of a detour, if you want to go there.

A beauty from the Buda side and a pest from the Pest side right now.. The Parliament of Hungary must be one of the Worlds most Beautiful Buildings and thus also one of the most photografed places in the World. Seen from the Buda side or from a Cruise vessel on the Danube it is really an extraordinary building. But right now (in oktober 2013) there is a reconstruction of the Square and the streets in front of the main entance wich makes it difficult to approach the site. Hoping on better luck on Another visit in Budapest.
Nice nice nice. Still under reconstruction but so nice to see from Citadella and Buda Castle. It is really nice to take picture from the Buda Castle and from the hill near to this.

Roadworks!!. Very ornate and decorative and nice from the river at night but currently extensive roadworks and renovations are a major blight. Why did a struggling country spend so much on this vanity project - but now I digress. EU visitors can enter but we did not have the opportunity sadly.

Visit to Parliament. Tour only 45 minutes long and you did not see much. Hard to hear the guide and why an armed guard following? Can someone explain why the different entry fees for EU residents versus other country residents (mainly USA) We paid 1750 per person and they paid 1000 per person. The interior was pretty but for price and length not really worth it.

What a Grand Place!. The Parliament complex is simply amazing! Very grand. There is a lot of construction going on right now, though (Oct 2013) which makes photography a challenge. And expect tons of people.
beautiful. like much of Budapest the architecture is beautiful i would highly recommend the hop on hop off bus to everyone as you can take the time to look around all of the buildings of importance

Seeing the Inside is a Must. We took a tour of the interior of Parliament and were amazed at its beauty. By taking a tour, they took care of getting the tickets and shepherding us through. Since it was undergoing some improvements, doing it this way was much easier than obtaining tickets on our own…but I would think that might change in the future once the improvements are completed (2014?) Seeing the building's exterior is one thing…but the interior is amazing.

Beautiful Hungary Parliment. It took us a couple of try's but we were finally able to get on an English speaking tour. There is a lot of construction around the Parliment so tickets are bought in the basement of the museum across the street. The website gave us incorrect information, luckily we wanted to see it so much we just walked over and went to the ticket booth. Great tour! Amazing building. There are quite a few steps so be aware of that element. It is a set 45 minute tour, may be less if Parliment is in session.
Gorgeous. Astonishingly magnificent and opulent. Excellent tour by Englisg speaking and knowledgeable guide. Photos allowed.

Parliament. This beautiful, intricately carved, white stone building is beautiful, it overlooks the Danube. It must be inspiring being a member of the Hungarian parliament, working in such a lovely setting.

Pretty to see, not much info. The tour was relatively weak with the tour guide not being overly engaging. Our English-speaking tour guide was very precise and it felt as if she was reciting a script. An armed guard follows you the entire time--is Communism really gone???

I hate to say this but I will . . .. If this wasn't created for tourists then what was it created for? I mean, is this Euro Disneyland, or what? Plus they run these cobalt blue lasers at night above the Danube (which is far from blue itself) and oh well you just have to see it.

Looked Great - couldn't reach it!. There is constant work being done to restore the lovely building, but because of the material it is built with, it is in constant need of repair, however as a new tram line is being installed it was impossible to get near the building, so we had to admire it from a distance - so be aware traveller and check when it is up and running again for a closer inspection and tour.

Under heavy construction. We visited the Parliament in October, and it was a huge construction site from all sides. To get to the Parliament you have to go around to the north side. The ticket shall be bought at the Museum of Ethnography at the upper east side of the Parliament. It is a hassle to get there. You have to sign to the specific tour and go with the guide. It is full security check before getting in but it is all worth it!!! If you liked the London Parliament, you will definitively fall in love with this one.
Hungary's pride. No wonder this place cost so much to build. A must see, although impossible not to notice this impressive building on the Danube
We'll worth the visit. Excellent tour but book online before you go as it's rather busy. It lasts about 45 mins. We'll worth doing.

Hungarian Parliament in Budapest - A World's CHARM. The Hungarian parliament is an outstanding exhibit and tour of not only history but of fantastic architecture and enlightenment of the internal halls and meetings places with the building. You cannot miss taking this tour if you are in Hungary. Even through the many wars in the city of Budapest, this Parliament Building has been restored to become one of the greatest sights in the world. Much more grand and multiple joys than at the Taj Mahal or the Pyramid at The Louve. This building ranks with the Notre Dame (in it's details and stories pictured in the windows and in the ceiling frescos).

Be Wary of a LONG wait to enter. The facade of the building is beautiful and the views of it from Castle Hill are simply breathtaking. However, the entire street and courtyard on the city side, where you enter the building, are in chaos, a massive construction project is underway. The decor inside is worth seeing, but I question whether it's worth the long lines and wait in order to see them. This is a working Parliament and if they are in session, you can only see the grand staircase and "rotunda" (with no pictures allowed of the latter). I would rather have spent the time exploring the areas around the building, visiting the Ethnographic Museum (where you get Parliament tickets), especially in good weather. The armed guards are gruff and the English-speaking tour guide was perfunctory--with a memorized spiel and no time for questions. The hordes of school children add to the melee.
Budapest parliament. Very interesting visit, the building interior is magnificent. Only problem is getting there , because street repairs and other public works force visitors through a long detour.
Worth a visit. Very nice frescos and the architecture was superb with touches of interest with cigar holders for members of parliament

Worth visiting. Yes - Parliament inside is almost as beautiful as outside - I was impressed by its scale. Visiting is possible only with a guide, and you can walk only in one part of building - but it's worth seeing anyway. There is a big model of Parliament made of matches inside - nice looking especially for children.If you want to visit Parliament in peak season - remember to book in advance or get on the queue early in the morning.

Amazing Parliament. The building is an amazing feat of architecture. We were unable to enter or get close to the building because of all the construction that is surrounding the building. Don't let that stop you from visiting around the property. Take a river tour to get some great pictures.

Beautiful and fascinating. When we visited in early Sept. the grounds and parking area were being worked on with great urgency. I know when the work is done the grounds will be a showcase for all the world to see. The guided tour through Parliament is a must. The crown room with stained glass windows is spectacular. It is also beautifully lit up at night when seen from the Danube.

Stunning building. We took the guided tour of the Houses of Parliament, which lasts about 45 minutes, buying timed tickets online. They are doing a lot of work to the entrance, however, once you have negotiated your way into the building it is well worth it. We were part of a huge group but the tour guide spoke good clear English and seemed happy to answer questions. The building is influenced by the British Houses of Parliament which is obvious both externally and internally. The interior is very ornate and guilded and quite beautiful. Well worth a visit.
