parliament. a beautiful building and a very informative tour BUT booking has to be done in advance and when we went it wasn't very clear when we would be able to go. If you're on a short 4 day visit you need to make booking for the Parliament a priority on your first day. We had to actually go to the parliament to do this
visit to parliament. Very imressive building - magnificent inside- at prent a lot of building work going on around the building but when finished will be one of the top attractions in Budapest

Amazing architecture. The architectural details of this construction are purely amazing. .Everything about it and around it it's simply beautiful. For people that are in love with architecture: you definitely must see it!

disappointed. Personally I was very disappointed with the visit of the parliament . The building was under scaffolding at the time of my visit . At the entrance ( side door) must go through security and meet the guide we spent 20 min waiting for all of them (security & guides) to decide if we could go ahead with the visit very disorganised . When asked the guide few questions she looked at us lost . They seems to learn everything by heart and when you ask something more specific they are lost !! and the guide spent the all visit looking at her watch. the visit last 30 -40 min flat !

Beauuutiful. Despite currently undergoing some building work the parliament is well worth a visit. The best view from the outside is from across the river, and it looks particularly amazing all lit up at night!It is definitely worth taking the tour inside the building as well. It only lasts about 40 mins (including going through a metal detector on entry) but you get to see so much grandeur and the tour guides are very informative. The Hungarian crown jewels are in there too. It's more like a palace than a parliament!I would advise going early to book a tour for that day as they fill up, and check when the parliament is in session because there are no tours when they're seated.Oooh also make sure you get the discount for being an EU citizen!

Interesting but not mindblowing. The building is eclectic sort of over the top in different styles it is interesting but the tour is short and I wouldnt queue more than 30 minutes for a ticket if its longer go for a boat trip or a beer.
Stunning building. Tour was fairly short, 45 minutes, but the building is truly impressive. The tour was just a means to see the inside as very little history was covered. Glad we went inside!

Beautiful building. Beautiful building, but all the constant building work around it means that the likely protests are shunned away. They forget to tell you that there was once a huge red soviet star on top during the occupation.

Beautiful inside as well. It looks cool from the other side of the river, but take a tour inside...very beautiful and you'll learn some interesting history as well. Plus they let you take pictures inside, but not of the crown. We waited in line for about 30 minutes and were able to get tickets without a problem. There's a lot of construction now on the outside but don't let that discourage you from touring inside--it's definitely worth it.
Must see architecture. Under remodel so not perfect but beautiful over looking the river, a must see if in Budapest.The view from the opposite side of the river afforded amazing photos.

Third largest Parliament Building in the World. It was interesting to learn that only Argentina and Romania have larger parliament buildings. This one is quite impressive inside and out and is worth a visit. Be sure to get tickets in advance -- possibly a few weeks in advance to guarantee a convenient time. There is a website that makes booking easy.
Beautiful. Lovely building but stay well clear until all the renovations are completed. Absolute chaos to try and walk around at the moment

Gorgeous interiors. Wonderful and gorgeous interiors, all gilded in Gold, a tour into the Parliament is a must when visiting Budapest. One of the most beautiful public buildings in Europe, plus you will learn very interesting details about the history of old and modern Hungary. Make sure to make reservations in advance at the web site (and at your language of preference) http://www.parlament.hu/angol/eng/tajekoztato.htm.

Very ornate building. Parliament building is a very impressive sight externally and even more impressive internally. Recommend the internal guided tour to see the ornate internal decoration. Book in the Museum of Ethnography across square from Parliament. Get to booking office early morning or day before to avoid queues or book online. If you are a EU citizen take passport with you for ID when buying tickets and you get a half price ticket for 1750 HUF/£5. Square outside is a building site at the moment as it is undergoing a major redevelopment.

fascinating - if you can get in. My wife and I had to visit the Parliament area three times to get in, but were glad we finally got in to see the inside of the building. I should warn you though: the whole surrounding area is under construction. While the intent is to complete the roadwork by spring 2014, I suspect it will continue to interfere with traffic and visits on foot for some time. Don't let this dissuade you from going, though. It's worth the effort it takes to get in.
A must see in Budapest. Inspite of the foggiest day and night ever this enormous and ingeniously built Parliment building looked just amazing.

A must see!. We queued for a long time to get our tickets for a guided visit but it was well worth the wait. We took the last tour of the day and our guide was very informative and interesting. We were expecting a 30 minute tour but it actually lasted about 55 minutes. The beautiful ceiling in the dome and the debating chamber were impressive, as was King Stephen's crown and the people guarding it.

Spectacular. The Parliament is spectacular both outside and inside. Did the English tour which lasted about 45 minutes and it was well worth it, the inside was spectacular and the only way to see the Hungarian crown jewel. I thought there was a 2 pm tour but was told that the next available tour was at 4.15 pm, the ticket office was in the Ethnographical Museum but there was no sign posting indicating that. Half price entry for EU citizens. All around the area is a massive building site and rather dusty and a long detour to the get to the ticket office, the waiting point for the tour is in the midst of the building site.
Good to see. Very beautifull guided view. Fabulous rooms, the only problem was that all the squares is a construction site. Is not easy to get there and you do not feel the "buzz of the location".
Excellent. Very interesting tour in English (half price if EU passport holder) 45mins long, which was just right. There is a staircase of 77 steps to climb - would not be suitable for some people.

Huge ... difficult fitting into your camera screen. Really grand. A looming presence on the Pest side, and can be viewed from any view point in the city. The best views, of course, can be had from Buda, across the river, but then you may need a panorama mode to fit the entire facade into a single image.

Beautiful building, rushed tour, outside a building site!. Having heard and seen many pictures of the Hungarian Parliament prior to our trip, coming to this place was a must!Getting tickets to begin with seemed like an impossible task at times in itself! We felt that information (such as terms of booking online/advanced bookings) wasnt really communicated to tourists in the best way!As the title suggests, you need to navigate through and wait in a building site when making your way to the parliament building. So for those with young children or anyone with asthma/breathing difficulties I would think carefully about visiting this place because there is a lot of dust flying about when its windy!The beautiful decor and design of the parliament speak for themselves so make sure you have a decent camera with you! The only thing youre not permitted to take photos of is the hungarian royal crown. Our tour which lasted about 40-45 minutes felt very rushed and almost like it was over before it even began! For a place with so much history you would think they took more pride in communicating this to others but I guess not!

A good use of an hour, but...... Other comments on Tripadvisor warned me that the visit would be short so I prepared for that to happen. I can confirm that that is very much the case. However, what I saw for the short time I was in the Parliament building was tremendous and worth an hour of my time. The ornate lobbies and main assembly room were very impressive. One thing worth mentioning, the area around the Parliament is being completely rebuilt and that will likely continue for another 12 months or more. The temporary meeting area was not without confusion when we visited - so visitors be prepared for this.
A building fit for a king. Stunning architecture and an amazing view of the river, one cannot imagine that it serves a goverment building.
What a magnificent building. Best seen from the fishermans bastion up on castle hill or from a night boat trip, it is stunning when lit up

In the middle of a building site. the area around the parliament is currently being completely rebuilt so getting to the start of the tour is a real pain. However don't let that put you off, the tour is excellent and so are the guides.

Wonderful building, terrible queues, overpriced. This building is supposed to be one of the highlights of Budapest, so we headed for the ticket office right after breakfast. On arrival, athe lady at the door said tickets were available for the 1pm tour. We joined the queue, which was not long. However, the tickets sales process is an absolute disgrace. Only one person sells tickets. We waited in line for one hour. In that time, several couples had given up and left. Only 6 people in the queue had been served. Tour guides appear from nowhere, waving lists of names and pushing ( literally) everyone else aside. The ticket seller spends ages with each of them totally ignoring the people waiting in the queue.Even though had seen only a few tickets sold, and most of them were for a French tour, by the time we got to the window the only places left for English tours were in the 5pm and 6pm times. We booked for 5pm, tickets were 3500 florin each.The tour left on time. The group was huge, about 40 people, most of whom could actually not speak English. If you subtract the ten minutes it took to get the whole group through the security check, the actual tour was only about 25 minutes. The building was wonderful, but you only see a small section. You can take photos in most of it, which is good since you don't get much time to actually look at anything. Compared to other famous buildings we have visited in Europe, this was very poor value. If you really want to go, try and get your tickets ahead of time, and be prepared for only a short visit. Otherwise, you will be as disappointed as we were.
Whata spectacle.. We only viewed the parliament from outside by boat and from acroos the river from the castle District. I looked at our pictures again last night and this place is spectacular.

Stunning building, sadly surrounded by construction. When the building work is finished it will be superb. Sadly cranes and lorries everywhere and roads around it closed. If you want a photo, take it from the other side of the Danube where the construction is barely visible.

Excellent English Tour! Book Online In Advance!. The English tour was informative, moved at a perfect pace and provided just the amount of historical and political perspective. The building is as beautiful and intriguing inside as it is on the out. The quality of the guide tends to make or break a tour like this, and ours was excellent: knowledgeable, perfect English (as a second language), good public speaker, seasoned handler of tour groups. There's always one in every crowd who does what we're specifically told NOT to do or asks a question that the tour guide had just answered -- fortunately, our guide was fully seasoned and handled these graciously and quickly.Do yourself a favor: book online and print your tickets out ahead of time. And allow a little extra time to get to the tour meeting point which is a little confusing and difficult to get to due to the current construction around the building. The online info says the tour is 45 minutes. Ours lasted close to an hour. I'm sure it's variable due to group size, number of questions asked, mobility/age of the tourists, etc.

Beautiful but limited access. This building is without a doubt, the centerpiece of Budapest and it should be. It's bueaty is without parallel. The artful decore is beyond comprehension. It is the most photographed building in Budapest.The internal tour is far too limited to justify the cost of the tour.
Under construction. Parliamanet is an exciting building but we were not lucky as all places around are under huge construction.

Trying to see the parliament buildings.. On Sept. 16th and 17th we tried to see the parliament buildings. At the moment there is a huge area of construction going on for blocks on the road around the buildings so we had a difficult time walking to it, When we got there we could not get tickets to get in. We tried again next morning so try and book your tickets well in advance. It looks like this construction will be going on for months to come. The exterior was beautiful but we didn't see the interior. Do your own research on the internet before you go since many of the guides in public places have no mikes and speak very softly with an accent hard to understand,

great views from across the river. if you are on the other side of Danube, be it day or night you will never fall short of noticing this wonderful piece of architecture. At night when it lights up its quite fascinating to watch.

Beautiful building inside and out. We took a tour of the parliament while in Budapest and were glad we did. Inside the building is beautiful with carvings and paintings. The guide gave a great historical overview. Tour is about 45 mins. Only drawback, they are building parking areas and walkways currently so terrain is uneven and muddy to get to building.

Worth the effort. If you visit the Parliament be sure to have a tour guide ahead of time. Security is obviously an important part of the visit and a guide will help. The history is fascinating and the official guide inside is quite nice and articulate.

You have to go inside!. After being in awe of the parliament building, we stood in line for over 50 minutes nervously watching the board tick away at the English tickets. Before we reached the window there were only 4 left for the entire day. Try to book on line, but if you can't go to the ethnographic museum, just behind the parliament building for the tickets. Go early. We were there at 10:30 and it was almost too late. The tour is absolutely unbelievable! If you have time to kill between your time of buying the ticket and your tour time, take the #2 tram to for forvam ter stop and spend the time in the Great Market Hall. You'll have a great day!

Amazing building. Definitely an amazing building with a commanding presence. The nicest and biggest parliament in Europe. Try to book your visit early to avoid massive queues. We waited in the sun but could not get a slot for entry so we just visited the place from the outside. If you like architecture, you will love this place.

See Interior on Guided Tour. The Parliament is one of the top sights in Budapest, and worth a visit inside, which must be done on a guided tour. We took the guidebook's advice and booked an English language tour on-line the day before, as the number of tickets for each tour is limited. Give yourself extra time to find the location outside from which the tour departs, because the ongoing construction around the building obstructs some of the surrounding sidewalks. You can take photos inside the building, but not in the room with the crown jewels.
Stunning Building. Apart from the construction site surrounding the building its quite a spectacular piece of architecture. The tour is well worth it and gives you a sense of Hungarian history.

Guided tour of the Parliament, well worth the visit. The Parliament was under a lot of renovation. We waited for the next guided tour. The Guide speaks English very well and very informative. You get to see the actual room where sessions are held. Very lavishly decorated for a parliament house.

More like a palace. We got access to the Parliament thru a tour. I don't think you can go in on your own. The inside rivals the Hofburg palace in Vienna and is, I think, the largest Parliament building in the world. To say it is opulent is an understatement. Coming up on it's 100 year anniversary, the city is making improvements to all the surrounding area for the planned celebration. Budapest is extremely proud of this structure and it is well worth the cost of the tour to get inside for a visit.we got to witness the changing of the guard( they guard the crown of St Stephen among other things) was fun to watch. It still has that communist era feel,to it all.

Parliament. There is a conducted tour of the Parliament which would suggest one takes. What is special? The building is very imposing, the interiors done up very richly for a Parliament House, the guide will also take you through the history which is interesting. Do see the building from the Buda side Fisherman Bastion has a great view. At night time when the building is lit the view from the boats on the river which take you past the Parliament is spectacular.

Stunning decoration. Did a tour to here. You get to see the grand entrance, the main staircase, one of the main chambers and its entrance area, and the crown jewels in the dome. The main staircase is breathtakingly stunning. Unfortunately at the moment (Sept 2013) there is a lot of work being done outside, so getting in is rather tortuous and can be muddy.

Awesome!!!. Unfortunately could not visit the interiors as it was a national holiday , but admired it from outside and the restoration work going on all over the place makes it difficult to move along. But the night views from the Danubius is not to be missed out. Such a grand building , every sphire to be admired!!!

Beautiful at night!. The Parliament is best admired from an opposite bank of the Danube river at night. It had a clear unobstructed view of the glowing building. Furthermore the riverbank was not crowded at all. Perfect place to hang out.

Chaotic, but beautiful. Thie grounds surrounding the building are undergoing massive construction right now, and the info and signage is very poor. You must buy tickets online in advance, perhaps a day or two prior, or you will miss out. Print them out yourself to skip the queue at the ticket office. Once you get there, tickets in hand, you'll be shepherded into a waiting area in the midst of the jackhammers and construction, with very little information forthcoming. Persevere, for your tour guide will fetch you! Those with the intestinal fortitude to weather the chaos will be rewarded with a very entertaining, if brief, tour of an absolutely beautiful building. You may want to try and avoid Mondays, as Parliament is often sitting, and there are fewer tours, and those that do run may be curtailed unexpectedly.

Worth to visit. I never visit any Parliament, this one was my first and was really worth to visit as it is one of the biggest in a world and really amazing due to architecture, design and of course a history.

gem of the architecture. You can see this building on every postcard or magnet.
It's a symbol of the city.
The view from the opposite bank of the river gives you a full perspective.

Absolutely beautiful building!. This majestic building sits along the Danube River and is breathtaking! It took 19 years to complete (construction began in 1885) and has a Neo-Gothic facade with turrets, arches, and more than 200 statues honoring Hungarian monarchs and military commanders. It is the largest parliamentary building in Europe.

A archetectural masterpiece. I never thought I would say this but I found a building which rivals if not exceeds the stunning visual impact of out parliament building the palace of Westminster
This place will take your breath away and stands comparison with other wonders like St Peters the Taj etc it is a must to visit

Dominant of the town. This building has a breathtaking architecture and it is very huge, so you can´t overlook it. We took some pictures of it during our walk along the river. But if you want to go inside, you must pay a fee.

A Must See in Budapest Even If Price Gouged. The Parliament is as iconic to Budapest as the Parliament Building in London or the US Capitol. This neo gothic gem dominates the Pest side of the river and provides a most impressive view from the Buda side. For years I have dreamed of visitin it and seeing the croen of St Stephen and wandering its interior. In the end the visit was disappointing. First of all the entry fee was 3500 Huf (florints) about $18 US. For that amout I was expecting a spectacular tour, especially since the wait in line was interminable to get a ticket. ( My advice is to get to the ticket booth early - between 9 & 10 am to get a time for later inthe day). The tour was perfunctory. I took the Spanish version. We climbed the grand staircase, looked at the crown and went to the legislative chamber. In all it took about 50 minutes, including the security procedures to enter the building. The guide unfortunatley was not good about taking questions. She had her schpiel and was not accessible when it came to questions. The object was to get us in and out quickly. It was frustrating fo those who had questions about the government, history etc.When in Budapest you have to go, you have to pay the inflated price but be agressive and firm about asking questions.

Stunning building.. I think I took more photos of this amazing building from different into of view than anything else in Budapest, just so beautiful. So sad that I didn't get to see inside, just not enough time in this beautiful city.

Wonderful building, average tour. To take the tour of the Hungarian parliament you need to buy tickets in advance, but you can only buy them on the day itself. The normal ticket-office however was closed for renovations, as were the square in front of the building and the surrounding buildings, so we had to buy our tickets in the cellar of the ethnographical museum. Here we had to stand in line for over half an hour, so we missed at least opportunity, but when we were finally able to buy our tickets at 2 p.m. we only had tour of 4 p.m. as an option, which wasn't advertised on any of the leaflets we had.The outside of the building was not visible from all the points of view due to large pieces of railing surrounding the square, but the parts of the building we could see were magnificent. The inside of this building, the largest parliament-building in Europe, is as beautiful as the outside. This inside was shown to us by our English-speaking tourguide, but the tour itself felt somewhat stiff. Also, the group was too large for the guide to handle, so she had her voice amplified by a portable speaker, which didn't help. If you were standing close you were able to understand her perfectly well, but when the distance increased she became harder to understand. Two more things I would like to note. There is one room where it is not allowed to take any pictures; here the Hungarian crown is stored. If you do try to make any pictures, the guards and tourguide will explicitly tell you it is not allowed.The second thing to note is that there are no toilets in the building that can be used during a tour.

Enjoyable Visit. Get your tickets in advance (not free) at the museum across from the construction. Close to the appointed time, join the others under a large white tent. The tour is very nice and the building is beautiful. Our tour guide had a soft and squeeky little voice which was hard to hear in the huge rooms and the large crowd.
Most beautiful building!. Even through the renovation process which is ongoing, he architecture of this building is spectacular! Best viewed from the river cruise I think.

Impressive building. There is currently a lot of building work surrounding the building, but its still impressive. You can boo tours (we didnt have time), and I bet its just as impressive inside as outside

Very Huge. I believe that this parliament is the biggest one that I have ever seen. Everyday I enjoyed sitting on the other side of the Danube (Buda) and looking at it. It is a wonderful experience, don't miss it.

Must visit..... We were a bit disappointed because there were renovations made outside and we had a lot to walk from ticket sale to the entrance. To get inside we had to wait till the last group finishes and we get our guide. Outside, no place to seat, there were elderly people waiting in a very sunny and dusty day. The inside was so beautifull that we really forgot about the trouble at the begining. Must visit....

Impressive inside and out. This was my favourite building in Budapest. The building is impressive wherever you are looking at it from. Although the nightime view on a Danube cuise was the best. We booked to visit Parliament Online before leaving the UK then we could choose the best time for us with English speaking guide. The tour lasts around 45 minutes and you only get to see a few parts along with the crown jewels. Well worth the £5.50 or so it cost. There are renovations going on outside so leave plenty of time to get there.

A Monument on the Danube. As impressive as the Parliament Building is during the day, it becomes magnificent at night! The combination of the building, the lights and the Danube make for an awesome picture.

Really huge building. the building is nice from outside and inside also. What is for me fascinating is dimension of tis building. I can compare with Austrian, Czech and Slovak parlaments (+- comparable countries according citizens) and the hugarian is really huge
Brilliant place. Very interesting and attractive place. Bought tickets beforehand on internet and enjoyed our visit.Recommended.

Magnificient. The parliament signifies the icon of Budapest. the marvelous piece of architecture.A walking tour is allowed when the Parliament is not in session. Its unique interior design, big halls, long corridors, central dome are worth visiting. Tickets are available in affordable price at gate #10.
Parliament. While we did not get inside, we were able to see it all lit in spectular fashion from the river! All I can say was WOW!

What a glorious building, inside and out. They are replacing the stone bit by bit, so some portions were not viewable when we were there in May. We were told that this will go on portion by portion. Do not let this stop you from spending time at this beautiful site. By all means, take the tour. The inside is very worth seeing. Make sure to take a cruise on the Danube and see the outside from the river. I was there with 4 friends and we all thought that this was a highlight of our time in Budapest.

Tour of parlament building. I've visited many important buildings in Europe and around the world but this truly qualifies as one of the most impressive. The views of the building from the Danube River at night are especially spectacular.
Parliament. A must see when in Budapest. This is a fairly quick tour (less than an hour) but you see several beautiful rooms as well as the Hungarian Crowned Jewels

The most beautiful building I have ever seen. The Parliament is absolutely amazing! It is especially wonderful at night. I think every person, who is in Budapest, should take a picture of this masterpiece of architecture.

Magnificent Architecture. Walked along riverside promenade to Parliament. It is getting a facelift and cannot visit interior now. It is a magnificent & imposing building to see. A wonderful bronze bridge with a standing man sculpture is nearby.

Mesmerising Parliament building!. The view of this stunning building is just difficult to describe in words. In the day it looks stunning and at night, its another marvel of stunning architecture!!!! If you visit Budapest, you cant miss it!
Amazing. This castle has spectacular grounds. This was an unexpected delight. Beautiful, well preserved. A true page of history that you can explore.

Just great. If one person visits Budapest for only a day I would hardly recommend him/her to visit the parliament. It is not only impressive by its dimensions; it is a beautiful building. And I would strongly recommend everyone to admire it also from the opposite side of the Danube and also from a Danube boat trip. Unfortunately this year the Parliament was surrounded by a big building site but I’m sure it is for the best and the area will look just great in the future. It is a building Budapest can be proud of!
Limited view. It was difficult getting tickets but the actual tour is just 45 minutes and you only see a small portion of the building.

fabulous. must see in budapest. although now it's being renovated and the whole area is under construction. if you don't have intentions to get inside, there's a best view from the opposite side of the river.

Great architecture. We weren't able to get very close due to all the construction around the building. They are planning to make it look like how it was in the 1930s, when the Nazi influence was beginning to take hold. Quite a strange conception, being so nostalgic about such a time. The building itself though is great to look at and well worth a trip to see.
Terrific!. The amazing architecture of the parliament deserves a 360 degree walk around the entire compound. Be sure to catch the magnificent sunsets particularly during the summer months.

Beautiful architecture. The only way to go inside the Parlament is by guided tour. There are multiple tours a day (when the Parlament is not in session) in various languages: http://www.parlament.hu/angol/eng/tajekoztato.htmWe got to the ticket office (located in the museum across the street due to construction) around 9:30am to find out that the next 2 English tours for the day were sold out. We waited another 30 min online to buy tickets for the next day, to find out that they only sell tickets for the same day. We eventually ended up buying tickets online, however, you must have them printed out- online confirmation is not enough to get into the Parlament.The guided tour was informative and interesting. The architecture and design of the building, both inside and out and very impressive.After the tour, I recommend walking around the Danube or taking the #2 Tram along it.

Nice, but you can easily skip this. We purchased our tickets the night before going because we read it was a "must see" . We could have easily missed it, as it did not enhance our trip at all, in fact it was a bit of a bother. When we booked, we had a choice of the 2:00 or 3:00 time slot. We chose the 3:00. That morning we went to Hospital in the Rock, and headed to the Castle Hill area afterwards. We had to rush away from beautiful castle Hill to get to the Parliament on time. The tour guide was 15 minutes late. She raced through the tour and spoke as a woman who has been leading this tour several times a day, 5 days a week, for many years.The Parliament was very nice. But only go, if you've seen everything else on your "must do" list, and if it fits nicely in your schedule.

Avoid. Tickets are expensive, difficult to get if you don't have a printer. The tour had over 50 people and the 30 from a tour group (with audio headsets) were given priority in the front. The guide spoke in heavily accented low tones so you could only hear every third word.The armed presence seems way over the top.
Good guided tour with lots of history references.. One hour guide tour was plenty. Very interesting and beautiful to see. Worth a visit. No shop ad no cafe so eat and drink first.

Very impressive.. Visited Hungarian Parliament today, the last day of our stay in Budapest.Booked ticket at museum across the road.... [also booked ticket for museum, only to be told when we got inside that we should have bought special 'photo' ticket... having waited in line for close on an hour to get it there was no way I was going to line up again! Walked out in a huff... this happens at all museums here... you want photos? Ask for a photo ticket!]Parliament tour took about 45 mins, guide was very interesting. Crown jewels didn't compare to the British Crown Jewels, but the whole tour was well worth the queueing and the cost.

Short tour, but beautiful. Go early and buy your tickets because we waited for an hour to get a 3pm slot when we went around 10am. The lines are not run well, and people behind you end up in front...anyway, the building is beautiful and historic. It's worth a view to see the crown alone. The tour is short though, only about 45 mins, and you only see around 3-4 rooms.
Beautiful place. Wonderfully looking building (both from in- and outside), only thing I don't like is dividing visitors into huge groups which certainly decreases pleasure of watching the Parliament
Building site!!. tried to access the Parliament, however, so much building work/tram line development, we couldn't find the entrance..... the building does look impressive from across the river tho!

Stunning parliament building!. There are limited spaces for the different tours (which run at specific times for each language offered) and there was a short queue before 10am (when it opened). It was interesting to find out about how the Hungarian Government works and to see the crown jewels and interiors of the great rooms. Take your passport/identity card if visiting from an EU country to get in with a discount.

Elegant, helpful history tour. Despite showing up a few minutes after our English tour departure time, we understood the sharp arm movements and head shaking to mean we could return to ticket office to change our internet purchased ticket time. The tour departs from a poorly signed waiting place around the Parliament plaza construction site by a tour guide a few minutes before the beginning time of the tour. The tour itself is worthwhile, informative with historical facts and views from within many main rooms including the coronation crown, treasures. Photos with flash are allowed throughout tour except for the treasures room under the center dome. We found te Parkiament tour a great way to begin our orientation to Budapest.

Incredible. No matter from which angle you look at it, or day or night, it is astonishing. Even with major construction going on, it is beautiful. The tour was fascinating, and the Crown Jewels complete with Guards were beautiful. Highly recommend.

Amazing. Very interesting tour if not a little short, beautiful building with lots of history. Tickets were easy to get and different language tours with a set time made it easier to understand. Well worth visiting!

Palace not the Perliament. This is the place when you can feel the "power of the government". The building is huge and beautifully decorated. I'm not sure about the quality of the job done by the people working there for Hungary, but for sure the quality of the atmosphere of the parliament building is highest and absolutely unique. I recommend.

traditional capital building tour. You get a nice guided tour in English with a native guide. The inside of the building is impressive and you get to spend about five minutes with the crown jewels which is plenty of time. There is some waiting for your tour to start but not too long. You spend about thirty minutes in the building start to finish.Tight security so don't bring too much with you and you will get thru security faster. you do not need identification or passports.

Hungarian Parliament Buildings. Beautiful buildings that also contain the crown jewels. Worth seeing and the tour itself is quite short. From beginning to end, about a half hour, but you spend a lot of time waiting in line for tickets, so trying to get them on the internet would be the best way to go. There is a government website, but it is not the easiest to navigate.

One of the best. Extensive external works make a visit a bit messy at the moment, but still worthwhile. They are just completing a 20 odd year exercise of changing all the external facade one stone at a time
A perfect view from Buda. For true, you can spend hours staring at the Parliament from the opposite side of the river, with a glass of tokaj or a pint of dreher:)
Breathtaking. Architecture and history give you a better idea of what Hungary was and is becoming. We were on a planned tour; be sure to have a knowledgeable guide to get you inside.

LOTS OF MAJOR CONSTRUCTION. A new subway/Metro line and/or an underground parking garage (depending on who you believe) is being built immediately next to the Parliament and is causing major problems for parking and big detours for those walking.Be warned that you can't just walk up and buy a tour. The English tours especially fill up 1-3 hours in advance and in the afternoon can be totally sold out.

Unfortunatly is renovation time now /2013/. The parlament is one of the best thing you could see in Budapest.Its located central, a beutiful building nearest to the danube, you can make nice pictures infront of the building, or on the other danube site, you have also a great view.In the night the parlament has great lighting system, so you can have a look also at night time.Unfortunatly, 2013, they have a renovation in the whole area near to the parlament, its would be a little bit diffcult, to get near to the building.

Wonderful historical building. The Parliament building is a wonderful piece of architecture, which is worth a visit. Nice views of the building may be seen from the Fisherman's Bastion on the other side of the Danube or from a cruise boat (after dark especially). For tickets you have to go the Museum of ethnography that is behind the Parliament building. To skip the line, one may get before a ticket for the museum, which is a very lovely building as well ;)

Beautiful, but allow extra time. I'm so glad we visited the Parliament - bought our tickets on line in advance which I highly recommend. There is a huge road/square project going on right at the building, so there is a lot of extra walking. We took the metro which was great, but we still had at least 20 minutes walking around the construction to get to the area to begin our tour. You can take pictures, and it is astonishingly beautiful.

Could not get in. Organisation to get tickets is a shamblesTry online before you go We queued twice ( take your passport) with two armed guards , to be told they did not know if they could book tickets for the next day

Fairy tale appearance. I have seen this building up close and from Castle Hill and the Danube itself. It never ceases to amaze.The interior is gorgeous but the exterior has storybook feel. It must be the most striking Parliament building in the world. Try and see it at night from the river.

Major Renovations. Unfortunately our trip to the parliament building was spoiled by major renovations which meant that we got to see very little of the outside of the building. Still when in town you have to see what you can.

Nice inside but fast visit. I did the guided tour. Went to Budapest in the middle of July, so the entire city was full of tourist. Got at the Parlament at 11:00 and I was only able to book the guided tour at 15:00 in Spanish. The tour took hardly 1 hour (we had like 15 min for picture) and the guide was good, but it was just too fast. If you want to have the guided tour in English better to pay the ticket before 11:00, during summer time.

Good but short!. Although all traveller guides say it is free for EU-citizens... it is not! You have to pay 1750 HUF to enter but firstly you have to get tickets. This is really a downer because the line is ALWAYS too long and the staff too slow. I advice to go early in the morning if you want the tour at noon. The tour itself was nice but only lasted for like 40min. You get to see the crown jewels and the Senate room. Nice, but too short. Our guide's English accent was quite funny but not always as understandable. We also think she always makes the same jokes on her tour ;)
Magnificent building. Absolutely amazing. Breathtaking Architecture, however it is undergoing an extensive exterior renovation.

Must See Place. If you come to Budapest then this is a must. The building is magnificient. You are allowed to view the parliament chambers and the Budapest "crown jewels". Do not miss this if you come to this beautiful city.

Excellent.. This was a highlight. The Hungarian Parliament is a must-see.Buy your tickets in the Ethnography Museum. The parliament is under reconstruction, so it can be hard to get nice photos outside.The tour was enjoyable, if a little short.

Building Works. Best viewed from a river boat to see the impressive rear, although one side of this magnificent building is shrouded in scaffolding. A walk along the Danube to the front of the Parliament turned out a big disappointment as the square in front of the building was totally inaccessible due to being remodelled. The original landscaped area had been totally ripped up and was being rebuilt with 2 metre high shrouding obscuring the view, this was August 2013,

Beautiful, worth the wait!. I would've liked to have seen much, much, more of this place! I really enjoyed the fact that we got to see the empty chamber, which is supposedly just like the one being used by the National Assembly. The grounds are being remodeled right now, so I don't know if they're allowing tours, but give it a try!

Where and how to get tickets. Beautiful building, richly decorated. Since the building is still in use as Budapest's parliament building, it can only be visited with organised tours. There are tours in English every half hour, French, Spanish, Hebrew...less frequently. Since the area around the parliament building is a construction site right now, you need to buy the tickets in the Ethnographic Museum, which is located behind the parliament building. EU citizen can purchase reduced price tickets, you do need a passport or the like to prove your citizen ship and students under 26 have reduced prices. After you bought your ticket in the museum you have to make it over to the starting point of the tours which is on the north western corner of the parliament building. Give yourselves enough time to find the meeting place since the works have closed of some of the streets leading to the building. Than enjoy.
Wonderful architecture, impressive!. A must-see location in the Budapest. Gorgeous architecture will surely impress. Both inside and outside are outstanding.

Interesting place to visit, better when the renovation is finished!. The building itself is pretty impressive (especially when viewed from the castle or the Danube), but at the moment the square outside is undergoing extensive refurbishments, leaving it a bit of a building site.Tickets for the tour are 1750HUF if an EU citizen, and you must take proof of this in order to qualify for this charge; otherwise it is 3500HUF. Tours run every 15 minutes or so, certain languages crop up more regularly within that cycle than others - we joined the queue at about 12:00, got our tickets at 12:15 and the earliest tour with available tickets was 13:45.The only issue was the rather poor waiting area that they put you in prior to the tour starting. It is essentially just a set of square marquees next to one another, and given the windy conditions that day, the dust from the building site was phenomenal and very uncomfortable. Tours start very promptly but I would not recommend getting there especially early for this reason.The guide spoke good English and was very engaging, showing the historic Coronation Crown and providing a bit of background to the Hungarian political system.It is a very impressive building and well worth a pop in if you are in the area. When the new Parliament Square is finished it will be even more impressive.

Seven Buildings in One. The Hungarian Parliament buildings are simly awesome. One of the reall stand-out sights in Pest, on the banks of the Danube, the fabulous architecture rivals the much older, opulent architecture of Pest. The standard of the proposals for the building of the new parliament bulding was so high that, in addition to the fabulous main building a further six new buildings were constructed at the site making this an architectural delight to visit.

Worth every minute. Get your ticket well in advance - the tours are very popular and sell out. Tours are conducted in many languages; our English-speaking guide was fluent and knowledgeable. The Parliament is a relic of a former empire and exudes late 19th-century elegance. You can almost hear the guns of World War I on the horizon. For me, the highlight was the central atrium, where the royal crown of Hungary is on display. Though there was some construction under way on the grounds, the inconvenience was minor, and this is just a sight not to be missed.

Retirement journey. A well spoken guide and the building amazing, however as there is alot of reconstruction hapoening at present it was quite a mission finding firstly the ticket office and then back to the entrance.
Incredibly large. These would have to be the most impressive of all the parliaments I have seen. Absolutely huge. Best seen from the river or across on the Buda side.
Absolutely must see. Check outside and inside too. Need to be booked in advance. Photo shooting from the outside is free :-) . entry ticket may cost a few euros. I visited the building with a group.

A Parliament with pizazz!. The entrance fee was $17 per person, the tour lasted 45 minutes, but if you want to see extraordinary architecture and beauty, then you must take this tour. Since it is a very popular tour and groups are organized by language, there may be a wait for your group to get into the Parliament building. Our tour guide was great, giving out facts about the building, function, and history throughout the tour. What was so striking was the extreme beauty without gaudiness. I would love to go again.

Fantastic interior, building site outside (dusty hot wait). Not to be missed. Whilst much of the pre1990s Budapest suffers from drab architecture, and half hearted restoration (including the royal palace), nothing has been spared in Parliament! We were happy that we took the tour. Word of warning, the tickets are pre-timed, and you buy them in the museum opposite. With the major building work going on, this is not entirely obvious, and many people were getting frustrated by needing to walk all the way back to buy tickets, for several hours time.

A must-see in Budapest. The Hungarian Parliament is a magnificent building, especially inside, and looks very beautiful when viewed from the other side of the Danube after sunset. Our guide told us a lot of interesting facts about the building and how the parliament in Hungary functions, but best of all, both entry and the guided tour are FREE if you are an EU citizen and show your passport at the time of booking! Be warned that the queues for tickets can be rather long, especially from midday onwards, so it is perhaps worth getting there early first thing in the morning as soon as the ticket office opens.
Peerless. None would say it isnt worth a visit! Absolutely magnificent!It doesnt matter whether we talk about architecture, history or simply the view!

not worth it. nice building, you can spare your time and just drive by it. bear in mind it is being renovated for the next few months so you should really skip it for now and just see it from the other side of the river.

You Should Not Miss It. The Parliamnet building is definitely the most beautiful building in Hungary inside and outside. It well worths a visit. There are guided tours in several languages. The only dark side is that there are large scale construction works going on in the huge square where it is located so the access is a bit cumbersome until the building of an underground garage and museum ends in the spring of 2014. Hungary's royal crown and the coronation regalia (safeguarded in Fort Knox, USA from WW2 until January 1978) are also on permanent public display here.
WONDERFUL BUILDING. We saw this building on the evening River Cruise, quite spectacular with lights, next day we did a tour inside, quite a remarkable place. Don't miss this

very beautiful building. such an amazing building, very nice architecture and to be seen absolutely... I had very good time in this part of the city even if the weather was very cold at that time of the year!

Parliament building. It is a while ago when I visited the absolutely beautiful Parliament building in Budapest, when I had the good fortune to do so with a private party, as part of a delegation to meet with the then speaker if the house.After our meeting we were given a guided tour of the building which must be one of the most beautful of its kind anywhere.Hungarians love to decorate and as a result, the Parliament building manages to combine great dignity with an intimate and almost domestic (on a grand scale of course) charm.It is like stepping into a gilded and fanciful palace.Despite the dictatorship now presiding over Hungary and lording it (literally) in the building, it is still worthwhile to visit and take a tour, especially if you like wonderful and idiosynchratic architecture. Also, In front of the building you will find bronze shoes of all sizes, lining the Danube riverbank.It is a commissioned art piece and a sobering reminder of the horrors perpetrated by Hungarians during WWII, when Jews were randomly rounded up, shot and thrown into the river.Sadly, the mentality which created such crimes against humanity are still very much present in Hungary today, and encouraged by those in parliament under the present Fidesz ruling party, but this should not put anyone off, because the architecture in Budapest is quite stunning, and worth a visit.

World's 3rd Largest Parliament. There are great tours daily for this must see building. You may need to buy your tickets in advance as they have sold out a couple of times when we tried to take guests. It houses the Royal Crown of Hungary under heavy security. You can take photos of the crown if you don't use flash. Elsewhere in the building, photos are OK. This is one of the definite must sees in Budapest. Tours are about 45 min to an hour, and loaded with information.

Prominent building but under renovation. The building appeared to be inspired by the House of Parliament in London in design but is less magnificant than the latter in appearance and layout. We cannot gain access near it at the time of our visit because a large part ot it and the area nearby were under renovation or construction. Overall, it is a prominent building which add some attractions to the skyline and is a famous spot for photo-taking.

The most beautiful parliament fo the world!. The Budapest Parlament (in Hungarian: Országház) is one of the most beautiful buildings of the world and defenately the most beautiful parliament. The building is located by the Danube river and it worth to get into the building as well (takes about 30 minutes the tour, it is available also in English, in German and in Spanish). As far as I know booking in advance is advisable.

One of the greatest parliamanet building in Europe. Absolutely must see and it is even nicer inside. Need to be booked in advance! Photo shooting from the outside is free of course. Entry ticket may cost a few euros (I visited the building with a professional group).

Construction. The building is gorgeous and I wish I could have seen more. Right now there is a ton of construction being done to it, and so a lot of the area is blocked off. A little bit of a bummer, but still worth seeing!
Amazing building, amazing history. I used to stop on the Buda-side at Batthyány Square and admire the building. Book a tour if you would like to see it inside as well.

A Must See in Budapest!. This is a beautiful building, inside and out. Be sure to go early in the morning to buy your tickets as the English speaking tours sell out quickly (especially the morning tours). We ended up taking one of the last tours of the day and had a great tour guide. We highly recommend taking the tour. We walked in front of the building, from the Shoes on the Danube to Margrit Island and also went by via boat. It is such a beautiful sight and the most beautiful building in Budapest.
Beautiful building. We only walked by the building but with all the construction we could not get really close. It still is an amazing structure.
Impressive view from the river. We passed the Parliament while taking a river cruise. It's a very impressive building and one of the biggest houses of government in the world!

Attractive Building. The 45-minute tour is very interesting and memorable, especially the tour guide has excellent English which makes the whole tour very easy to understand. The interior design and decoration of the parliament is gorgeous, and air conditioning system is very tricky. It is a must visit. However, there is a massive construction around the parliament, so even if you take the Tram #2 or the Metro, it is a long walk to the parliament.
A must visit!. We booked an English tour of the parliament and totally enjoyed it! This was the first time we visited any parliament and that too one with so much history.

Interesting visit. We took a 45 minute tour around the parliament building which was really interesting. It's beautiful inside but still a working building and the guide was good. The area is being redeveloped so its a bit of a building site outside. Not that impressed with the organisation and ticket sales. Website had the wrong time for the English tour which meant we had to wait nearly 45 minutes in a dusty "holding area" on the edge of the building site. For such an excellent attraction they need to get a bit slicker in this area.

Beautiful. Our last day in Budapest was just before their National Holiday commemorating the 1956 uprising against the Soviet Regime. Our tourguide gave us much insight to this holiday, as well as the history and signifcance of the Parliament Building.

Unique Building and interiors. Tickets cost 2520HUF unless you are an EU citizen and can get them cheaper. They are available on- line if you have a good printer to print them out. Going to http://www.budapest-parliament.com/visits.php will allow you to purchase tickets and see whether tickets are available for the particular tour(language) that you require. You can also see if extra tours have been added. We got on a 8.45 English tour because the 10am one was full. Otherwise tickets are available form the Ethnography Museum near Parliament. Well worth the visit
Intriguing. Interesting to learn the history of what the government was to what it is now. Beautiful buidling. Architecture and design features fascinating.
Under construction. One of the most wonderful building I have ever seen. It is however completely undergoing a renovation so you can not even get within 100 meters

Building Site but worth visit. They are building an underground car park and visitors centre so you cannot walk close to building - best way for a photo is by boat. Visited the parliament building and got in half price as took identification to prove foreign tourist. Not a lot of rooms to see but interesting.

Beautiful from other side of Danube. Due to ongoing construction, we were unable to get in, however it is a very beautiful building. Recommend going to the Buda side water front and looking across, especially early morning,

Impressive building well worth a visit. The guide our English-speaking group was assigned was not very good, but we still enjoyed seeing the elaborate decorations and the Hungarian crown, plus the building itself, once again. The building was designed for a Hungary that was much larger than its present size.
Nice and fancy, but under construction. The parliament is under construction, thus it is dusty and noisy outside, but inside is business as usual. The Crown of St. Stephan crowns it all!

Do not miss it, but .... This is an absolute must if you visit this beautiful city, but, be prepared to either wait in line to buy your tickets or purchase them through your hotel concierge and pay a little more. In the latter case, you will be pick-up by a taxi and driven "near" the entrance, where you will still have to line-up and be cleared by security. In any case, you should first CHECK first if parliament will be in session, otherwise you may miss half the visit and still pay the same price. This being said, it is absolutely magnificent and most interesting, so, don't miss it and enjoy!

One of the most beatiful buildings i have ever seen. Lucky we didnt meet any trouble to get into the building, thank God, cause maybe i will be annoyed as well if im standing in a long queue, hot temperature, just to be informed the tickets was out. The interior itself was breath taking, its really amazing how ppl could build such a beautiful design and stays like that for hundred years. inspite of the tickets issue, its really worth to visit.

Beautiful.... I did not go inside the Parliament building in Budapest but we drove into town just as all of the gorgeous lights of Budapest were coming on and the Parliament building was absolutely stunning. It is also a beautiful building during the day, but at night it is magnificent......and oh, so photogenic.
Nice place to work. The tour was thorough and included one of the parliamentary chambers. Beautiful art work and location.

Avarage at the moment, but in the future mindblowing. I give it alreay a very good advise, but for the moment an average judgement. You can't help the city has to prepare for the future, around the parliament there was an huge building excavation going on. A onderground parking place will be there.But I'm not blind for the future: the surrounding of the Parliament will be more beautiful then ever. You will be amazed, I already saw a preview at the working gates round the parliament. Hope they will finish this as soon as possible!

Parliment. WOW! Perhaps the most impressive building ever. They were working on it at the time and it was difficult to get really close during our walk around the area, but we had a wonderful view from our ship and took many pictures during the day and also as it was beautifully lighted at night.

Dont bother with the tour. The tour times are always changing, it takes a deceptively long time to get there right now because of massive construction and having to walk a huge city block out of the way. and the tour is about 2% of the building. It's colorful and gorgeous but you cant see too much so your time and money are better spent on something else in such a vast and pretty city.
Sensational building. Loved the architecture of the beautiful building right on the danube. At night it is breathtaking when it is lit up.

Breathtaking architecture. Don't miss the visit of the Hungarian Parliament building when you visit Budapest. You will get free guided tour if you are an EU citizen, where they show you the building inside. Right now, the square in front of the parliament is under reconstruction, so it looks like a battlefield but the building itself if still breathtaking. You can get the best view of this wonderful building from the other side of the Danube. ("Batthyány tér" metro station)
Amazing!. One of the most amazing buildings I have ever seen. Could not stop looking it or taking photos from all the angles. Situated on the bank of Danube, it is Hungary's pride.

Tickets are hard to get. We could not do the tour since the tickets were not available on the day we wanted to visit it. We saw only the outside and there is a lot of construction activity in the square outside. We could not get tickets - we waited for over 30 minutes and the ticket window did not open, we were told that sometimes large tour groups buy a whole bunch of tickets and there are none left for individual people - and there is no way of knowing that ahead of time. thought it was poorly organized. The view of the building from the river (on a boat cruise) is simply outstanding. Reminded me so much of the Houses of Parliament in London- I am told that the architect studied in London and this was built a few years after the London one.

Incredible site just on the Danube River. Forget the palace in Budapest and concentrate on Parliament. The building rivals most palaces in other major cities and is breathtaking from the Danube on an evening cruise. There was a lot of construction surrounding the site so we were never able to visit inside; however, you will need advance reservations if you want to visit.

Great, but pay attention to the practicalities. The guided tour is great, the building inside is fantastic and you get to see the crown, the guards, the parliament chambers, etc.Be aware that while it doesn't say on their site, if you're from an EU country and carry proof (ID card or passport), you pay less. Also, better if you don't try to go on Mondays: the queues are always bigger since not many attractions are open on Mondays. They only sell tickets for the day, you can't buy in advance. There's a site online where you can buy the ticket, but you need to be able to print is and they charge an admin fee. I used that site before leaving the hotel to check if there were still places available around the time I wanted, and then bought the ticket right there, no fee.

The wonderful symbol of the city.. No doubt it is the symbol of the city, to admire this wonderful and impressive architectural work I think the best point is above up on the castle hill, between the bastions placed exactly in front of the Parliament.The view is great and it gives an exciting panoramic view of the entire parliament, the Danube and much of the city.The night with the city lights the Parliament takes on a fairy-tale atmosphere.

Magnificent building. We booked our tickets online and waited on a hot day at the edge of a building site for our tour leader. Once inside, we were given enough information to satisfy our curiosity about this stunning building which is currently being renovated. Well worth a visit and it will be even better once the refurbishment is done and the gardens are reinstated.

mb next time. There is a huge renovation going on there. You can enter the building (somehow, according to the tour guide we asked) but walking around it is out of the question. We were enjoying the view from both the boat tour and from the hill on the Pest side of the city. Going from the chain bride towards the Parliament you will find "The shoes".Hopefully next time we visit we will be able to see more of it.

Must visit. One of the main attractions in Budapest... A historic and huge building that represents a lot of the country. It must be photographed when you are in Buda, in Pest or in the middle of Danubio because each photo will have a different meaning

Beautiful but on a building site!. The building is lovely both inside and out-stunning ceilings and columns. Tour guide was very good, it lasted half and hour. Due to construction it is a little difficult to get round to the entrance and you have to wait on the building site before your tour, but it's worth it!

Take a guide- Amazing Building. We went there with a touristic group. You simply need a guide so as to explain more about the building and the history of the Parliament. Very beautiful Royal building. The building is the largest and tallest building in Budapest . you can also see the holy crown of Hungary in the central hall. In my humble opinion it is a must go! Been there is Summer 2009

Beautiful Building- Tour it if possible. I was visiting Budapest with my class, so I was able to tour the Parliament with the group. The person leading the tour was very knowledgable and spoke very good English. The Parliament was beautiful. It's construction was amazing. I would definitely recommend taking a tour on your visit to Budapest if possible.
Amazing building. I am from a city that has another great parliament building (Buenos Aires), but I was amazed with the grandeur of this building.-

under modification. very noisy to get in this year because they doing a huge modification you turn around yourself to get in bring the ticket from the museum and the get in offffffffffffffffffffffff
very stupid
Magnificent. The Parliament building was quite the site to see upon arriving in Budapest by river boat. Day or night, it is magnificent!

Beautiful building by Danube. There is redevelopment going around the building and thus gets very confusing to approach. We have not yet been able to do the tour, but have been viewing the building from across the Danube, it is such a pleasure to do that !!Especially in the night, the lighting of the building is incredible and even all the construction work doesn't spoil the beauty.

One of the best places to be in Budapest. Entering fee ts not that cheap but its worth it. I think it does not shame the parliament in London. Nice "show" given by the guards inside. The dome room is the highlight of this place with the Hungarian crown (i understood its a meca for them) . You can take pictures inside except for the dome
Construction. Missed the tour as we ran out of time. Street in front of building under construction. Better view from the river but still a beautiful building. Would have loved to see it inside.

Worth visiting. We booked on line and didnt have to deal with the ticket office located some distance away from the entrance. The redevelopment going on around it is a mess and finding anything is difficult so plan ahead on this one. Once inside the tour itself is great. Our guide was very knowledgeable and we came away not only with an appreciation of a very beautiful building, but also a far better understanding of the country's history over the past century or so. I suggest doing this tour early in your trip so you have some background as you wander around

Beautiful architecture. The Hungarian parliament is situated on the banks of the Danube. Take a local guide if possible to explain the history of it all. You can take many photo's of this highly glamorous place except for the Crown Jewels which is not allowed. You do have to go through a security gate just like at the airport although this is not a problem. Allow 1-1.5 hours and put it on your must see list while in this glamorous city. Highly recommended.

Beautiful building spoiled by construction work. Visited here in June 2013. Gorgeous and spectacular building. Enjoyed tour very much and took some fabulous photos. The only downside was the building works outside the Parliament which meant buying tickets was very difficult. Very poor signage and almost gave up. Unfriendly and unhelpful staff, and onerous process to gain entrance to building, with no one to advice or explain. However once inside, you are in for a treat! Beautiful architecture, decoration and helped greatly by the professional and knowledgeable guide to took us round. Recommended! Just hope they sort the building works soon :)

The Most beautiful building in Budapest. This is a very beautiful building. It is best seen from across the river or from the river ietself. Unfortunatly, when we were there they were maintaining and there was nothing to be seen around the building. The building comes to life at night. Makes the most wonderful photos.

Wow!. Absolutely amazing building, right next to Danube(Pest side). Like someone said, A Masterpiece. Best seen from rivercruise, but it doesn't matter if you are on Buda side, because this is such a huge building that you can see it everywhere. Don't forget to check this nighttime!

A masterpiece. The second big parliament in Europe (London's is the first) built according to the London's parliament plans. Available only by guided tours. You can see only a small part of it, but is enough to feel that the parliament of your country is a small, poor appartment.
Beautiful architecture. Wish I had time to visit the interior of the Parliament - heard there is a maze or something. But the exterior of the Parliamenet is breath-taking nevertheless.

Great building. A must see in Budapest. Our guide did not mention that the building was inspired by Westminster in London. But an important part of the Hungarian story. As usual for this city, the general level of service and care has a cold war stamp all over it....reminded me of Cuba. But worth putting up with to see the splendor.......

A lot of effort. The area around had construction and the mecganism of getting tickets, waiting in the hot sun for entrance was rather unfriendly for a parliament visit. The building us very impressive and ostentatious . One wondered why a new democracy would need a parliament that looked like a cathedral. The tour guide gives one ancient and does not tell you about the present day system.

Parliament on the Danube. We had a wonderful view of the House of Parliament from our hotel room - beautiful by day but spectacular by night, fully illuminated. We got other perspectives when we took a river cruise, which was also lovely. It was a pity that renovation work spoiled the view from the other side of the building, but it will be worth it when the work is complete. Because we visited on a Sunday we were able to have an extended visit, and also see the chamber of representatives, not available when Parliament is sitting (3 times a week I believe) Once again we had to marvel at the way in which restorations after the second world war had been effected. This was a very interesting visit, and very worth while.Tip: take your passport or some form of identity when booking if you are a senior citizen and you will pay half price - you must book ahead as the tours sell out very quickly

Spectacular building. We viewed the Budapest Parliament buildings from the Buda side of the river ( from Fisherman's Bastion) and they looked spectacular. We also did a day cruise on the river and a dinner cruise at night, and the views of these beautiful buildings were incredible, especially when lit up at night. They are modelled on the London Parliament buildings. The guided tour of the interior of the buildings is an absolute must - the exquisitely painted walls and ceilings with gold leaf everywhere, are amazing. It was the highlight of our trip to Budapest. It was very interesting too, to be told how their parliament works.

Magnificent 1902 Neo Gothic building. This 1902 Neo Gothic Building is a must see in Budapest. Tours are given in different languages at different times and fill up fast so make reservations early. When parliament is in session, the tour is 30 versus 60 minutes but the cost is the same so schedule appropriately. There is a lot of construction in front of the parliament so get detailed directions about where to meet your guide.

St Pancras on the Danube. Eu citizens get in for half price at around 1750 forints apiece but this 3/4hour tour sells out virtually every day by 9am. If you want to go be at the ticket office in Mador Utca (behind the Parliament) or book via the internet.You will be shown 19th century gilded arches and statuary until your neck aches. One turn of century (unused by government as in 1946 this second house was abolished) debating chamber, some fancy staircases, cigar rests from the old days and a stand-back glimse at the royal Crown (recently returned from Fort Knox where placed by the Americans who aquired it for "safe keeping" after WW2)Actually the architecture is pretty similar to the wonderful St Pancra Hotel in London but one goes to see a home of democracy more than anything. Worth a look but quite rushed.

Beautiful beautiful building. The exterior is similar to the English Parliament but I believe even more beautiful. There is a short tour inside that is well worth the cost. It is very ornate and just gorgeous.
awesome from the river. A very striking view from the river where you get to sail quite close and can see it in detail. Lit up at night so looks magical.

Extraordinary architecture, and outrageous ticket price. I chose to view only the outside of the Parliament building due to the exorbitant ticket price for entry, and still it was rewarding to visit twice — once in daylight and once at night, when it is spectacularly lit.The entirety of three sides of the building (south, east, and north) were blocked off for renovation, but the west side (facing the Danube) was clear and easy to view from the path that goes along the river.

Excellent!. this is a for sure must see in Budapest!! the architecture was out of this world and the paintings were very unique! it was under renovation during our visit but still got to see everything!

Beautiful architechture. We visited the parliament house with the guided tour. the guide was very helpful and answered all the questions. the tour is interesting in the building is very impressive and beautiful. We booked the ticket on the internet. Free admission for EU citizens

Splendid, Poignant, a must visit. Apart from it's splendid location on the river, the parliament building still has the bullet holes in it from the revolution - you have to visit the parliament to get a taste of Hungary.

Under construction, avoid for now. There is a lot of scaffolding and construction going on, and there are no signs. Better stay away and take magnificent photos of this building from Budapest castle district next to the church.

Construction!. I would have given this 5 stars, but there was construction going on when we visited (June 13) so we weren't able to get close enough to see the great architecture. A bit disappointing, but still a beautiful building.

Lot of money to see very little. An extremely impressive building and, from what little we saw, a gorgeous interior. $35 for two to see a set of stairs and a rotunda with the crown jewels with some 16 statues around it during a 30 minute disorganized tour was a bit much. Have to reserve online or go to the ticket office to make a reservation.
Awesome. This is what a parliament building should look like! It's in a lovely area of the city along the Danube, with some great views.

Great and disappointing all a once. When they say the building is beautiful and breathtaking from the exterior it is not a lie. One of the most visually beautiful things I have ever seen. No matter where u are in Budapest this building is such a sight. It's currently under construction but this can't even take away from it, therefore we needed to do the tour( could it even be more beautiful inside). It was lovely but also disappointing cause on a 40 min tour and maybe it's cause our group was like 50 people so hearing and getting pics was a mission. It's 3500 huf per person or 1759 huf for EU citizens. Something u need to see but if u can't go inside the outside is the best part.

such a beutiful impressive building. A must visit when in budapest. We bought our tix at the museum near the parliment for the 945am english tour at 830am on sunday .... no line! We had breakfast abd came back for the tour at 945am and no line. Not sure because it was sunday or what but happy we didnt have to deal with long line. Metro line 1 got us to-from the touristy vaci street and the parliment in a jiffy.

If you are into History this is a must see!. Hungarian Crwon Jewels are in this building. Tour guide thanked US citizens for protecting them while Hungary went through its rough patch. President Carter returned them.
Full of History

Great english tour. Try for the tour just before noon to see the changing of the guards inside the building! This is a really interesting and colorful building to get to see Hungarian design on display.
Super architecture. We took pics of that lovely building without stopping. It just attracts the camera from every angle possible. It is a remarkable building.
Parliament. 'twas under construction when I was there and will be for some time. Recommend that this amazing building be viewed from across the Danube. Excellent view from the Palace as well.

Worth it!. We visitied the parliament. you are not allowed to visit it on your own, you have to join a guided tour, it's 1750HUF for members of the EU, but it is worth it. you'll get a guided tour for 45min and will get to know a lot about the parliament, budapest and hungary.but you should buy your tickets in advance (online: http://www.jegymester.hu/eng/Production/480000/Parliament-visit), because otherwise you have to wait a lot and tickets are limited. there are guided tours in many different languages!

Lovely historic building. The parliament building is one of the largest in Europe. The views from over the Danube are spectacular, especially lit up at night. The tour is worth it to see inside the building, although the areas open to the public are limited. The entrance was difficult to find due to all the building works around at present.

A stunning building. For me, this is the most impressive building in Budapest. Located on the edge of the Danube you cant fail to be impressed by its size, setting and structure. It's presently undergoing some fairly extensive building works around the side and rear, so viewing there is limited. However, viewed from the Buda side, it is truly a magnificent building.

Very Beautiful. This is the most beautiful building in Budapest. Unfortunately, when we visited they were renovating so the best way to see it was from across the river or from the river itself. In night the building comes to life and is an absolute must see.

A cool building - a must see. We weren't sure it was open due to all the construction around the Parliament. However, you must purchase your tickets in advance - we went at 10:00 in the morning but couldn't take the english speaking tour until 2:30. This might disrupt your day if you have other plans. It was worth the wait!!

A must do when in Budapest. One of the icons of Budapest a must do while in town makes sure to do the tour not long but still nice.Building is probably lit up at night as any in the world marvelous to behold by day or night.Highly recommended!

Undergoing a major clean-up/renovation from the exterior. Nice building - somewhat similar in style to the British Parliament Houses - but with the site is a mess with so much work going around. Still, worth a quick visit as part of the walk along the river.

Just another big building. It's is an amazing structure. You can't miss it when your in the city. But after seeing it so many times it loses its appeal. Around the front facade facing away from the river are many history billboards explaining the complex history of the building and the state. At night is looks magical, lit up. Try see it from the water, you will hardly believe it's the same building.

Breathtaking at night. We were unable to enter the Parliament Building at the time we visited. However upon arriving into Budapest on a cruise the illumination of the Parliament Buildings was spectacular and a must see.
Nice tour, a little short for the wait. Had to wait a bit to get in, but overall really nice building. Multiple language tours. Ongoing work limits appeal on the outside currently.
