Construction. Sadly we couldn't enter or get anywhere near the parliament, even though we wanted to since there was some street construction going on. We were only able to see the build from across the river. Breathtaking it truly is and a MUST SEE..
Parliament - Budapest. We took the tour and were not disappointed. It is a beautiful building both inside and outside. Well worth a visit

Amazing from the outside. Make sure you have your camera ready to take photo's of this majestic building on the banks of the Danube! If you want to go inside, make sure you don't leave your reservation to the last minute - best to look into this before you leave on holidays as you might not be able to get in

Is this really a government building?. When travelling with friends, we couldn't quite believe that this amazing building was the Parliament house. Such fine detail, and the attention to the restoration of the building as well made this a worthwhile visit.

Wow - step back in. This is a major working historical site and as such deserve the respect and acknowledgement of visitors - with daily guided tours and a design dating back many centuries - its well worth a visit. The area around the parliment is good and provide many littie restaurants, cafe's and bars to sit baxck relax and watch the world go by - the views over the Danube to Buda are also good on a clear day.

Houses of Parliament. This is an amazing building. Attracted lots of visitors but unfortunately not allowed in as parliament was sitting at the time. The architecture of this building was breath taking considering the time it was built. A must see.

Ornate Building - Swift but informative tour. Visited in Jan 2012, and as it is was a cold midweek day, were able to book on the spot( at 12.30) for the next tour (at 1pm); As I am a wheelchair user, we were seperated from our 'group' and led through a differant entrance and into a staff lift - after clearing security (it is like an airport security check). We were taken to the top of the grand staircase - where we waited the rest of our tour group, but which meant we missed the first little bits of information given by the tour guide; She continued her tour and we tagged back on; much information was given, and at the end she offered the chance to ask questions - but no one did. A very grand place and nice to see. The tour only took 45 mins, so we were able to fit it in and get on the next hop on hop off bus, and so we were pleased with the shortness of it. Worth spending 45 mins whilst in the area to see inside.Current cost is 1750HUF pp for adults from EU and 3500 for adult non EU - under 18's half above prices.

Magnificent Parliament (Orszaghaz). Fantastic architecutal masterpiece, Most of the materials are from Hungarian natural resources. the Uk tool the example of this gothic building for their own houses of Parliament and Lords. this one is much bigger that the one in London. Well worth a guided visit for the history and magnificent architecture

Imposing building. The Parliament, which sits on the banks of the Danube (Pest side) is a magnificent building, best seen from the river - we were on a cruise, and were able to see it in daylight (a bit foggy) and at night, which was spectacular

Dont worry about problems getting to tickets. I read several reviews about problems getting tickets to go around parliament which nearly put us off. However, i had been 7 years ago and didnt have a problem them so we decided to give it a go again. We walked up to the building at around 11am and walked up to the information sign saying what times the tours for different languages were at. There was an english one at 12 so we walked up to the guard at the 'buy tickets' sign who pointed us towards a door with 'x' over it. We walked in and down the stairs to the small ticket office area. We queued for around 5 mins then got two tickets for 3500 ft total by showing our uk id. It wasnt free but think it was discounted by showing the id. We then walked back out to the information sign and stood by the 'with tickets' sign until the tour at 12. There is security to go through so be prepared to empty your pockets or put your handbag through the scanner with your coat and walk through the metal detection machine. The tour was great and you can take photos all the way around you just cant use your flash in the dome hall where the crown jewels are. Well worth doing.
A beautiful Photo Op. The Parliament Building is gorgeous! See it both in the day and at night when it is all lit up! It is a great "background" for photos.
lovely!. Viewed from the Danube this is a truly eye-catching building despite its being on the flat Pest side of the river!

One of the most beautiful Parliament in Europe!. The architecture, the combination of the white and red colours, the unbelievable complexity of the structure and the symmetry of this fabulous building left us with awe! You should plan to visit the inside too. The luxury of the interior is dominant and the guided tour was very educational. Plus it is a nice way to spend some time away from the cold, although we had to wait outside for about half an hour before entering. Don't forget to gaze at it at night! It looks fantastic, especially from the opposite bank of the Danube.

The Parliament? Great! Guides? So-so.... Extraordinary building, average service - that is probably the best description of the Parliament sightseeing experience. The soldiers in front of the Parliament are very helpful and approachable, had no problem with getting the tickets. The tour - well, let's just say that the tour guides should provide us not only with the facts but they should provide a "tour experience. Not that you can find any flaws in the information that are provided (of course, if you don't mind the Hungarian version of local area history, which I do not) but one gets an impression that the guides conduct the tours with the "let's get it over with" approach.Nevertheless, worth the ticket - it is really an outstanding piece of human engineering.

Worth a trip but staff could be more helpful.. Would be so much more enjoyable if signs were in english and staff/guards more polite and helpful. The actual visit was a good one. Historical, beautiful and would recommend it to friends.

Failed to come inside, but building is captivating). I haven't been to London yet (but I'd like to go), but this building of Parliament also looks amazing - the best fotos are from Fishermen's Bastion when the weather permits (Unfortunately, during winter time it's rare, so I still haven't such fotos - but what a view...)

Technical Hitch By Us!!. I would highly recommend buying tickets online like we did because when you get there, there is two lines. We lined up and went in nearly straight away. When we came out 30 minutes later, the same people were still queuing up to buy tickets! We had a problem though. We were English and the tour was in Hungarian!! We booked the wrong tickets! Anyway we still went in and laughed at the appropriate moments when all the Hungarians laughed. They were great laughs though. Not being able to understand the tour guide was not a problem though because we still got to look around. It's beautiful inside and all amazing colours. It's even better on chain bridge at night though when it's all lit up. Great for taking pictures! I would HIGHLY recommend getting the English tour if you are English though!!!!

Beautiful Parliament. We took the English tour which was very informative. The guide was able to point out historical and decorative aspects of the building, and made us all want to research more of the history of the country. Would love to take the tour again, when I was more knowledgable

A nice place to see. The building is glorious inside out. The tour guide was nice and explained a lot. But the tour is only 30 mins and to be honest, you don't see even quarter of the building. But a good experience.
Amazing Building. Good short tour of parliament - the marble/opulence and gilding inside is lovely and guide was informative

Nice building - Poor guided tour. If you decide to visit Budapest, do not miss visiting the parliament. Find the website and book a guided tour (the only way to get in). The tour if free of charge for EU passport holders.The Parliament building is huge and impressive, with gold and marble everywhere, showing the wealth of upper class of Hungary.The guided tour lasts 45 minutes, but you can only visit a very small part of the building. The info given during the tour are related to the kings and queens of the past, although I expected some information about the communist period (not a word about communist period).DO NOT FORGET: BOOK A TOUR THROUGH INTERNET in order to avoid problems! You can only visit the building when escorted by a guide!
Epitome of Budapest. Day and night, the Hungarian Parliament epitomizes Budapest and its historic location on the Danube more than any landmark.

Must do.........Stunning architecture. You have to be inside to believe it....Pictures hardly do justice to this amazing architecture....Take the guided tour, its really good...we were able to see sort guard change....The guides are real good and explain beautifully....The trick is to get a ticket which is free if u are EU citizen and 3500 HUF for other and 50% off for students , they did accept our student id cards from outside EU. There is a long line for tickets if you don't have reservations. We have one by emailing them (not one on their website). Dont wait in line walk straight to the gaurds and get the tickets even if u have reservations, we missed this part and when we were at the counter it was time for he tour...they bumped us to next one...
stunning parliament. one of the prettiest parliaments i ve ever seen!!!at night with all those lights looks amazing! the design is so beautiful and in front of it there is danube river.

Read this review : it will save you a lot of time !. Take our good advice : go to the parliament building before 9.30AM to buy your tickets for that day.After 9.30AM there are no more tickets available and it is impossible to buy tickets for any other day than the current day.We had to find out the hard way (even after reading lots of reviews and the Lonely Planet Guide) and stood in line 3 times before we managed to obtain tickets.If you are an EU-citizen, bring your passport : it will get you in for free.
Parliament Budapest. A rich gothic cultural democratic heritage. A beautiful iconic building sitting right on the Danube under the view of the Buda hills.
Beautiful. You need to book appointment in advance to visit inside! It worth it! Amazing architecture! The saint crown is here!
amazing building. once of the most beautiful buildings I have ever seen. definitely worth a visit and spectacular photos can be taken from the castle hill across the river

Spectacular!. The Hungarian Parliament building along the Danube river in Budapest is simply one of the most beautiful and spectacular buildings in the world.
Definitely one of top 5 most impressive government buildings on earth, right up there with the Palace of Westminster in London or the Casa Rosada in Buenos Aires.
Especially beautiful at night when it is lit up!

beautiful inside and out. just and amazing place with the actual crown of St. Stephen on display, lovely historical rooms and tour of the parliament, helpful staff and very cool metal toy soldiers for sale in gift shop

The most beautiful parlament I have seen. I was amazed by Buchuresti Parlament but this one is now on the top of my list. Breathtaking! Architecture, place where it stands, surrounding. You can take 1000 photoes and you still want more!

stunning. We could not get too near the buildings, as they were busy with renovations and security guards were everywhere, but this is probably one of the most stunning buildings in Budapest and should not be missed.

Beautiful parliament.. The english tour provided by the Parliament (which is the only way to visit inside) was interesting and informative. Amazing building, as beautiful inside as it is outside. Worth getting up early to queue up to buy tickets! Don't forget to take passports to get EU discount.
Parliament. We took photos day and night because it is a very impressive building sitting as it does along the banks of the Danube. Probably one of the most photographed building in Budapest.

Great tour once you manage to get tickets. If you want to tour the inside of Parliament, you have to wait in line for tickets, which is a nightmare. I am not sure if they are government workers or guards that control the number of individuals that could go buy the tickets but they were extremely rude and were not helpful. Only 1 person in the family was allowed to go to the ticket area. Also, tickets are only sold for that specific day, so I suggest you get there early to buy tickets and return later for your tour, if necessary. We had to come back the next day because they sold out quickly. Parliament was interesting and our guide was great but as we were touring Parliament the same individuals were following each of the tour groups as we moved through the building and they looked totally disgusted. One of the individuals in our group asked a question and received an extremely rude response.
Good visit. We arranged visit through our Hotel (Hilton)...We were picked up promptly, but had to wait a bit outside until our timed entry was available.

Not free. Visited on 4 January and it is definitively no longer free to EU citizens. Non EU citizens have to pay double!
I quite enjoyed the visit, though it was brief and took an eternity to get the tickets.

What a building. We decided to have a stroll around the city and went on purpose all around the parliament. Get a ticket much before you decide to visit otherwise you might be standing in line for a good 1 to 2 hours.

Brilliant and free for EU citizens. This is a must to see and do whilst in Budapest, the architecture of the building is stunning very gothic with all of the spires, if you are a EU citizen and have proof of this i.e passport/photo ID/Driving licence then you can do the tour which lasts about an hour for free and is well worth it, as you get to go inside the actual parliament and the dome and see the crown jewels.
The second biggest Parliament in the world. . One impressive building that takes your breathe away. Its as beautiful as it is big. Tours are free for foreigners if you show your passport.

Free English speaking tours. The downside is you have to attend to collect the tickets before your tour (from the parliament). This means you may end up kicking your heels for a period or you have to return at the start time for the tour

Disappointed.... I was vastly disappointed by the lack of organisation. There were two queues signposted "for buying tickets" and "with tickets. It takes a good 40 minutes to queue before you're let into the compound to buy your ticket, and there is no-one around to ask anything - the guards outside who are manning the queue are rude and either don't know or can't be bothered to answer your questions.There was no information on prices outside, and being from the UK, I expected it to be free as an EU citizen. The majority of the people before and after me in the queue were EU citizens and all expected it to be free. There was no information on the times of the tour without queuing and it can be a good 2 hour wait or more depending upon your language. There was no option to enter the building without a tour guide. I must admit that at this point, I gave up when the cashier selling the tickets became very rude with me for asking questions. The outside of the building is beautiful, and there are great views of the parliament building from the Buda side of the Danube, but that is the limit. I happily queued thinking I would be admitted for free but was certainly not willing to pay the 1,750 HUF entry fee.

No longer free. The tour is no longer free for eu citizens - 1750 for eu and 3500 for orhers ! A lot for a 30 minute tour! Queue twice to get tickets - once outside for over hour or more and then again inside. Many people gave up because there is no information about how long you will queue nor is there anyone around to adk. Many people were not expecting to pay and therefore each transaction took several minutes- also ypu will need your passport. Only one member of your party can go inside to buy tickets. Organisation could be improved vastly, Once inside there is another queue to get through airport type security. The building is very beautiful - but you get to see a staircase, the room with the crown of St stephen and then finally the old parliament itself which is now used for conferences- and only from the press viewing part. A massive disappointment after hours of queuing. Okay for free but not worth the queue or payment.

Neo-gothic Majesty. The Hungarian parliament building is one of the most beautiful in the world, sitting in its neo-gothic splendor by the Danube. Go to the website http://www.parlament.hu/ and book your tickets for a tour in your language on a chosen day. This will save you much time as the queues for tickets are very long. Well worth seeing because of it's interior beauty, and ancient royal Crown of St. Stephen. The tours last 45 minutes and photography is mostly allowed, but sometimes without flash for obvious reasons.

Beautiful stained glass - queue for your free tickets early!. The interiors of the parliament are stunning - especially the modern patterned stained glass windows and dome. The tour guide's English was very clear, although the information delivered could have been richer in content and storytelling. Well worth a visit and is free to EU citizens. Make sure you bring your passport for free tickets... plus some snacks...and patience as the queue for free tickets can be long and slow moving, and the general confusion of visitors who haven't done their research can get tedious! The British Parliament in London also do a brilliant guided tour which makes for an interesting comparison.

Ornate is an understatement. This parliament is incredible and so ornate. You can look at it for hours and still see new things. Each of the people, the faces and the creatures are different and seem to have personalities.

Followed by goons. EEC citizens can visit the Hungarian Parliament free - but they don't make it easy. you have to queue to buy (for nothing!) a ticket then wait for your timed tour. After a security screening to equal an airport you get the payoff: a bigger and better building that the UK parliament plus the crown jewels as a bonus. But you are followed everywhere by plain clothes gooms with macs over their arms. Go near a door not on the tour and you are immediately accosted. But overall well worth it.
Nice building. Very nice building. Impressive. Worth the visit although it is a bit expensive. They also tend to rush the visit (last a bit more then 30 minutes).
Great commentary. The lady who did the commentary was first class and added numerous touches to the commentary. I cant think that a tour of our parliament would be as interesting

Amazing. The building is magnificent!!! Breathtaking to look at!!! We took the hop on hop off bus tour (green one) as it was easier to get to rather than walking, but we walked back to the main street and took about half an hour.
Information is terrible. Nice building but after waiting for 40 min they just said that the tickets are sold out for to day. Tickets for next day could not be bought.

How could you pass a bad law in such a great building.. We first saw this building as we arrived late in the evening, fully lit it stands alongside the Danube. Returning next day we couldn't believe it was a government building - it is awesome. Later that evening travelled again beside it in a tram, and still later sailed alongside it at night and again as we left on a cruise to Amsterdam.Do not miss seeing this

Breathtaking at night. Likes, It is hard to believe that much money was invested in its construction. But the outcome was every bit spectacular. It is a beautiful site during the day and even more spectacular at night when viewed from the Danube river.

Impressive. The parliament is very impressive inside as well as outside. However, it was a bit of a hassle to actually get inside for a visit. The first day we went there there was no information at all and a lot of tourists wandering around not sure where to go. Eventually someone told us that a guard had told them the parliament was closed that day so that was that. For one of the main attractions in the city it has pretty much no information available for tourists. We went back the following day and got in okay. It was free to get in for EU residents and there was a free tour. Although you only really get to see a small part of the parliament and you are rushed through on the tour it is very impressive and well worth the visit!

Beautiful at night. We did not go inside the Parliament but you should wait until it gets dark to take pictures of this beautiful building. I suggest to take the pictures as the lights go on and from the Buda Castle.

Worth a visit, and free to EU citizens!. The Hungarian Parliament is housed in a stunning building with wonderful architecture and a great setting on the banks of the Danube. You can visit it as part of a guided tour and I'd highly recommend doing this. The tours leave very regularly; lots of people quote 10am, noon and 2pm for English speaking tours, but we found (on a weekday in December 2012) there were English tours leaving all through the day, including ours at 2.45pm. You have to go to the Parliament (door X - security will let you in if you tell them you want a tour ticket) to get a ticket in advance, and if you show ID proving you to be a citizen of an EU country there's no charge. The tour itself takes 45 minutes or so and includes a look at the Crown of St Stephen, the symbol of the Hungarian State. If you go on a tour beginning at 45mins past the hour (as we did) you'll also get to witness the hourly changing of the guard around the crown! It was very interesting to see inside this building, and I'd highly recommend it if you have an hour to spare when in Budapest.
Must-visit. I would definitely call this place as a must-visit of Budapest. Amazing architecture and also great opportunity to visit it inside during tour. (free for Europeans)
Huge. Huge and beautiful building across the river. Too much crowded, so we didn't have much time to get inside. Next time.

Magnificent Building. This building is so magnificent that it could easily be a Palace. It came as a surprise to hear that it is just a Parliament. Its view from the Danube is even more beautiful than from the street. Really worth seeing from up close.

Great Architecture. We did not go inside but this is worth a visit to to look at; the architecture is fantastic.Again, intresting stories behind its contruction and you can also see the other buildings which 'lost out' in the competition design, at the same location.
Beautiful !. Very impressive building... Wherever you are, it has a wonderful view... I loved that !To take picture, I suggest to do it on the opposite side of Danube
This place is amazing. Building is huge and monumental. Definitely should be visited. Also nice monument at squares around it

Gorgeous inside and out!. Reserve a tour in advance. It is difficult to get tickets on the day of. Easy to get to. Right across the street from metro station. Both inside and outside are absolutely stunning! EU citizens get in free, other nations have to pay. Tour is under 1 hour so the site is easy to fit in among other activities. Take a still down the Danube afterwards for a great view of Buda and the chain bridge.

you can not miss it. Go around the building. You walk will take about 1.5 hrs. At the beginning each part of this huge building looks the same but it is not the same. They are all different. There is a square behind the Parliament and a monument for young boys who were killed in 1956 by Soviet tanks.

disappointed. We went to book tour which you can get into free if you are an eu citizen remember to bring passport. Our time given for English tour was 3 hours away and there was not much else to do in the area. So plan ahead.

stunning. The visit was free. Plan your visit and if you can show your passport the ticket and tour are free. We arrived at 9.00am to collect our ticket - the guard lets you through. The tour at 10.00 in English was 45 mins long and very informative without being boring. I consider the inside to be as beautiful as Buckingham Palace without the fine artwork.
Wow!. It's all being cleaned up right now, but despite the scaffolding this cannot fail to impress. That was some empire when all this was put together.

You have to make reservations!. Something we did not reaserch on the font end but apparently you can only get in with tickets you purchase in advance! From what people were telling us it had to be well in advance! The outside of the building is under construction and it was raining outside so I really don't know what else to say! Happy travels

Juwel on the Danube river. It's actual a castle with a fascinating arhitecture and style, looking perfect and majestuous at day and night. It's very picturesque and fits perfect with the bridges on the Danube.
Splendor at its finest. The interior halls of parliament are spectacularly ornate. Baroque at its finest. Breathtaking and awe inspiring. Just line up early to get tickets.

Worth a visit. When we were in Budapest in May we couldn't get in for a tour as it was booked out but when we returned in November there was no need to book, just joined the short queue of seven or eight and went on the tour straight away. It was free for us as EU citizens are not charged. Security is strict before the tour begins, bags checked etc. our guide was very good and the tour was very informative and interesting, but it was finished quite quickly. We just thought there would be more. Enjoyed it though.!

Impressive building. This building dominates the banks of the Danube on the Pest side of the river and is very imposing - we didn't go in and I don't actually know whether the poublic are allowed entry but I'm sure it is just as imposing on the inside.

An amazing building but get there early for a ticket!. The building is well worth seeing, even if you are not interested in politics - although the politics of Hungary are interesting at the moment and you may be able to engage your tour guide in some honest exchanges. And the historical details you will hear about on the excellent guided tour are well worth the queues - like the specially designed cigar holders for former MPs. However, do arrive by 8 am, then go back to your hotel for breakfast before returning for a tour at 10, 12 or 2 pm. Also, do take your passport if you are an EU citizen as you then get in for free. I have been twice before, and it is well worth the effort. I was later arriving today and all the tickets were already gone.

Excellent tour. We took a free guided tour of the place and were not disappointed. Our tour guide was very nice and friendly. It was just the right amount of information provided and halls we were taken to visit. The interiors are luxurious and exquisite. I highly recommend the free tour if you have 1 hr to spare in Budapest.

Not as great as expected. After reading Rick Steves' take on it, we thought we had to go. We're glad we did. But the wait to get in, even w/ having a ticket, is time that could be spend doing other things.

Magnificent Parliament Buildings. The Parliament Buildings are lit up in the evening - and were absolutely gorgeous. We were fortunate to be taking a river cruise that departed Budapest in the evening, and the view of the Parliament Buildings was breathtaking as we sailed by!

A must but try to book the tour through hotel . As the other reviews mention you have to do the tour. About 40 minutes. My advice would be to book tickets through your hotel. We turned up well before the tour to buy tickets 2 days running. Each time we lined up for 40 minutes in -12°c and at the last minute the guard announced the tour was full. Come.back in 2 hours...On the third morning reception at our hotel were helpful and rang around to get us tickets through an agency. Otherwise we wouldn't have gone back. Don't expect staff at parliment to help you.

Parliament House. As I said before it is a most beautiful building, from the river side it looks like a fairly castle, very impressive. The tour inside is short in 50 minutes you see the main stairs entrance, the waiting lobby and last where they sit in session. The tour is free for E.C. Members but the rest have to pay...and maybe to much for what you get.

Parliament on Danube. Since it's Parliament, it makes you think of London, but different of course, and remarkably significant in its own right. Some scaffolding in place to block the view, but not spolied by repairs ongoing.
What a sight!. We didn't enter parliment, but we were able to see it at night with all the lights. It was so amazing!

If you visit nothing else in Budapest, visit this!. By far one of the most beautiful buildings I've seen, at par with the throne room of Neuswanstein in Bavaria. The Magyar crown in here, al legendary crown received by St. Stephen and offered to the Virgin Mary. The decorations, done in the millennium celebrations are outstanding. We were lucky to visit the parliament chamber (usually you get to see the wing of parliament that is used for conferences).

beautiful building. But I'm not convinced is worth the 3500 forint it cost to tour the building. The tour is only about 45 minutes long, if that. I prefer the facades to the interiors of such buildings but if you are the opposite or only like interiors then go for it
Beautiful!. I took most of my pictures of the Parliment from various angles (from the Buda Castle, Fisherman's Bastion, boat along the Danube). It is a beautiful, beautiful building.

Beautiful, Beautiful, Beautiful. This is the 3rd largest Parliament Building in the world. And, it is one of the most beautiful buildings you will ever see.And, if you are fortunate to see it on a clear night from the west side of the Danube (or from a boat on the water) you will never forget the site.Contact Viator tours to get a tour of the inside of this magnificent structure.

View from the Danube. We took the riverride and saw this from the river - its amazing and looks like a fairytale building with all its towers. We didnt get time to see it from the land but we will next time.

Impressive building, tourist must-see. Must-see means lots of tourists. Queuing for tickets, then again with tickets, takes time because of security - could be improved for sure. The tour is short and you only see the main areas, but it's highly impressive and free if you have an EU passport, so well worth it.

very interesting tour,is free for E.U. Citizens. do not miss the tour,but you have to catch the line early the morning.about 8 o'clock.so you will have the free entrance around 10:30 or 11 and for an hour you will be guided in the parliament and his great view.i liked it.

Beautiful Building. Beautiful Building.Views of it from Castle Hill are stunning. Just as impressive close up. Would like to have managed a guided tour but did not manage to view inside.
Close to Shoes on the Danube.

Not to miss. Please book your ticket in advance in case the Parliament is in session. It would be a shame to miss out on this free guided tour. Although not all of the biulding was on show due to works , I would highly recommend this visit. The interior is breathtakingly beautiful, not to mention the handsome guards protecting the crown jewels.

Bring your ID!. Great short tour of an amazingly decorated place.
Make sure you bring your ID if you're an EU citizen as you will get in for free.
There are only tours at certain times of the day so make sure you know when these are or you won't get in!

Tour a magnificent building. The Hungarian Parliament building is underserved by the word "spectacular". It is impressive enough on the outside (to be better after completion of some cleaning and construction projects), but the inside absolutely astounds. You have to be in a tour to go inside.We had a very charming and knowledgeable guide, who took us through the main hallways, amazing grand staircase and into one of the legislative chambers (no longer used, due to Hungary's unicameral {single house} legislature, but identical to the one in use and usually closed).It is truly a highlight of Budapest, and worth whatever hassles it may be to get a tour appointment. (We were with a group booked well in advance and still were asked to change dates/times, so be flexible. I assume the booking was made through the channel in the web page: http://www.budapest-parliament.com/visits.php.).

Beautifully ornate. A splendidly over decorated Gothic masterpiece. Well worth the visit (book early and free for EU residents)Guided tour informative. UK Houses of Parliament on steroids on cathedral scale.

Huge building for a "huge" country. The parliement is really huge, and when it was build, long time agon HUngury was a huge country. Now it is only 1/3 left...Take a trip on a lake to have a good view, or from the castle its a great view to see it.
Beautiful building. Steeped in history, beautiful architecture. Looks amazing at night when lights reflect in the Danube. Views from Castle Hill are stunning.
A beautiful building. This is a beautiful building that is still used today, looks fantastic at night but you can't go inside

The iconic shot.. The best view of the parliament is from the Buda side where you can get that iconic shot of the building. Up close on the Pest side allows you to see in more detail the beauty of the building itself.

Crown Jewels. All the listings say tours in English at 10am, so we got there some 15minutes early, and found that you had to join a queue to be allowed into the ticket office, where they saw our photo copies of passport to prove our EU status, which got us in free, and then tickets for 10.15 tour. This lasted about 45 minutes, including time for security check. We then saw the grand staircase, the Dome room with the crown jewels, and 2 soldiers guarding them, and then the chamber for the Upper House, now abolished. Very ornate decoration, worth lots of photos

Take a tour inside. Most river cruise passengers don't get to see the inside of this magnificent building. Take the time to get a ticket. Gorgeous entryway and staircase, huge dome, the historic crown, wonderful wood carvings, fabulous stain glass windows, and the impressive senate chambers. For everyone in our group, this tour was a WOW.

Impressive. This must be one of the most impressive buildings that I have ever seen. Not so much at the back but the front is magnificent. You cannot walk in front of it but you can get brilliant views from the opposite side over the river.
Amazing building with great detail. Huge building, with great history and attention to detail in the stone work. Great views of it from a boat tour and at the top of the castle

Highlight. Probably the most photographed building in Budapest, but understandably so. Huge and VERY impressive, best at night. You have to see it from the Buda side of the river as you can't walk infront of it on the Pest side, however the view is just as impressive. Dissapointed that I couldn't get a closer look, because you are also not aloowed to get close to the building on the back side of it. Otherwise absolutely striking.
So gothic!. Parliament is the most characteristic sample of gothic architecture and a building you should visit for sure!

a beautiful and gracious structure, that should not be missed. took a tour with professional, and local guide, to explain the various rooms, theri functions, and period built. Would recommend this for anyoine who has an hour to spend in this wonderful structure
Fantastic Building. Take the No 2 Tram, only cost 350 Huf,£1 which travels along the Danube up to and past the Parliament Building. Fantastic building right on the river front.
Szt. Istvan Inspiring. Wonderful tour. Seeing the crown. orb, sword of St. Stephen was overwhelming. Ate at Gobelin Hall. A once in a lifetime experience. Food was exquisite. Service fantastic!
A Treasure!. This exquisitely beautiful building is worth seeing from the river both in daylight and illuminated at night. Delicate, powerful, and moving...
Parliament. This has a very gracious ant intricate sturcture. You can see the great view of this from teh Dabune banks.

Free tours to EU citizens. I loved this tour. It was fab to see inside such a stunning building. You MUST get here early for tickets. We arrived at 9:30, queued for tickets for 30mins and received a ticket to come back at 11. Take your passport with you to get free entry. The tour guide is very informative and tours last around 1 hour.
Impressive building. Very beautiful building. Guided tours are available in various languages. There is no entrance fee for EU citizens. It's worth visiting.

Impressive and beautiful building. Day and night, this building is spectacular. We recommend that for your visit take your Identity card and you visit it for free if you are EU citizen. We did and went for the 10am tour. We had a great tour around. The lady that took us was very friendly, very informative and educational. The interior of the building is as fabulous as the exterior. The tour was very interesting and well worth the time spent.

Very impressive. The outside of the Parliament is very impressive, as was the inside. The swords and crowns were very cool! Tour guide was very kind and very informative. A must visit if you are in Budapest!

Beautiful on the Inside, Beautiful on the Outside. It wasn't until our second try that we got tickets for the English speaking tour. We met people that had been there 4 days in a row and couldn't get in. We never did figure our why some days it is easier to get tickets than other days. For a 10 o'clock tour, get there at 9:00 a.m.
Interesting. Very nice old building situated on the bank of Danube with fantastic view on the river. The building is freshly refirbished. Worth visiting.

Tour a phototaking opportunity. You have to go around the building in a tour, which was relatively uninteresting but provided an opportunity to see excellent gothic architecture and an unforgettable roof in the dome room.

Impressive building.. The outside of the building is impressive by it's size alone. I would recommend taking the tour of the inside. While the tour isn't that long you get to see the detail and beauty of the work that was done on the inside.

Worth a visit inside. This is a lovely building though definitely more beautiful in nice weather. If you have the opportunity to take a tour inside then I would recommend this. The earlier you get to the building to queue then the better it is. We arrived at 9 am and queued in the cold for an hour. There are set tours for a variety of languages at various times of the day - we missed the English one at 10 am but joined the 10.45 french one. It is free for EU citizens with proof of identity. Definitely recommend to visit inside if you can.

Truly amazing.. Hungary has come a long way from the chains of communism to the freedom that they enjoy today. The Parliament was designed by an Englishman. It is fantastic. You must take a guided tour, so much to see and learn. It is truly breathtaking inside and out. They did a fantastic job. Don't forget to walk a few blocks and see the 7' bronze statue of Ronald Reagan to whom they are indebted for their freedom. Most Americans have forgotten what a powerful force for good and freedom President Reagan was in the world. The Hungarians haven't forgotten. President Reagan did say we are only ever one generation away from loosing our freedom.
very impressive. incredible and impressive interior...not easy to get access...make sure you reserve by e mail before

Impressive. The parliament is an impressive building. I was there during the celebration of the 1956 revolution and so it was specially decked up with the colors of the Hungarian flag. I did not take the tour due to lack of time but I am told that it is a nice one.The tickets to the tours are sold outside the parliament and there are tours in different languages.

Lights Out. What was there not to dislike about this. Whether seeing from Gellert Hill or on the Danube, the architecture takes ones breath away. At 96 meters, it towers over the other buildings, and still reminds of human silliness when you realise the entry can only be from the rear

Great tour and beautiful building. I wrote ahead and received a reply with a date and time for our tour. This is strongly advised as tickets sell out quickly and many people were turned away. Our guide was very knowledgeable and the building inside is stunning. I highly recommend a tour.

Simply Beautiful Interior.. Take the tour, but arrive EARLY for tickets (read, 8am!) I don't actually remember much of what the guide said, a few details here and there, as I was much too enthralled in the beauty of the building. Impressive from the outside, amazing on the inside.
Parliament. We were there on the 23/10/2012 which is a public holiday to commemorate the start of the Hungarian uprising on that date in 1956. Huge parade.

Parliament. One of the most beautiful buildings in Europe, is best seen from a river cruise or you can take one of the hop on hop off buses which are good value for money esp if you have heavy drinking session the night before
sight of the 1956 massacre of students. very poignant place but the walkway around which visitors are obliged to pass is rather untidy, could be improved

A Really Impressive Building. This is probably the most impressive legislative building I have every seen. Obviously no expense was spared to build this testimony to the Hungarian national spirit. We tried to get tickets for the tour on our own but were unsuccesful. as they were sold out. Managed to book tickets through the concierge at our hotel. There is scaffolding around some of it as part of a never ending upkeep program. Good tour and the tour guide was cheerful and knew her stuff. The organization of the line-ups to get in were a bit spotty.

Exceptionally rude staff and System for purchasing tickets a shambles.. We tried all day to visit Parliament without success.Arrived to buy a ticket and tried to ask officials who were hanging around smoking and talking to each other trying to ignore us what the system was.There were masses of tourists around all looking completely confused as the information signage is completely misleading.Officials were rude and disinterested and pointed in the direction of a queue to join. We queued for 1 hour and a half in the rain to be told with many others at the end that there were no tours available in our languages. We said that we would just join any group just to get inside and see ,but we were all told to go away by the same rude staff.If we had known this at the start we would not have wasted our time.

Really worth seeing!. The building is amazing. You should definitely visit it, being in Budapest. The interior makes really great impression, the amount of gold used to decorate it also does.The guide knows the history well and you can hear a lot of tittle-tattles also :)Visiting is free of charge for EU citizens.
Wow. Wow is correct word to use here! This building is truly amazing and spectacular! It's huge and its beauty is breathtaking!

what a sight. What a huge building right on the river, lots of history surrounding this building. They are in the middle of errecting wooden scaffolding around it to clean it but this didnt detract from its beauty.

Beautiful building. Definetly worth a visit if you have the time. You will need to queue at 8am to get your tickets for that days visit, this is the only way to get tickets. They are free if you are a european resident,(you will need proof) the tours are in English at around 10am, 12pm and 2pm, but they day we got there they had put one on at 9am. The tour takes about 40 minutes you are allowed to take photos. The inside of the building is quite breathtaking with probably the most stained glass windows I have ever seen and the ceiling in the domed part is stunning.
Interesting tour. If You have id from EU tour is for free. English tour was really interesting and long enough see all important places.
Visit to Parliament. Long queue to get in probably because it was the anniversary of the 1956 uprising - October 23rd. Viewing was limited to the corridors.

European culture at it´s finest!. If you like history - this is the place to go! Incredible interior, masterpieces of craftsmanship all around. Illuminated at night, the pearl right at the shores of the Danube.

One of the most stunning buildings i have seen. the title says it all. to see the Parliament building in all its glory i recommend a trip in to Buda and the Fisherman's Bastian where the best views are to be had

No tickets :(. Very attractive building but we were a tad unimpressed that having turned up for 8am as advised on the website & having seen no one else queuing we still were told they were out of tickets. Inside may be lovely but would advise you book in advance if you want to go. If they are sold out on a wet Sunday in October then I suspect they must be busy all the time.

Elegant, worth the visit. This was a very , worth the trip, visit. One advice is to get a good guide, preferably , one who has some kind of "inside information". For someone who does not speak any Hungarian, you will need a good resource person so you can really appreciate the art and the work and sacrifice Hungarians had to do to come up with such a massive structure

Back side under scaffolding (Sept. 2012). Approaching the building from town, it was very disappointing as it was covered with scaffolding. From the river or Fisherman;'s Bastion across the river and on the hill it was spectacular and a lot cleaner looking.

Just spectacular.. I truly believe this is the most fascinating building in Europe. When you see it from the other side of the river at night.. it's just make you lose your breath. I can not believe anyone visiting Budapest and not passing by this place, which I consider one of the greatest world landmarks.

Big ornate legislative building. Yup its huge. Yup its got over 88 pounds of gold leaf all over it. Yup it is the seat of the national assembly of Hungary. If you are a member of the EU then you can tour it free. If however you are not an EU member it costs the equivalent of about $18 for a tour. The tour leads you through yet another metal detector, Up a whole bunch of steps- into a room to see the "crown" and then into a meeting room and then to the chamber to see where everyone sits when they are working. Big Whoop. The tour guide couldn't have been more bored or less caring if anyone could keep up with her or even if anyone heard.So this review reflects the spriit in which the tour was given. She crowded people into and out of things as fast as she could and then demanded we leave because the tour is over! Maybe it was a language thing.I must admit that it was all the things people say, lavishly ornate, huge, impressive highly decorated, superlative this that and the other thing. But, the only special moment it held for me was when we approached Budapest at about 11pm by river boat and saw the whole building lit up like some kind of fairy tale. That truly was impressive.If you like big impressive buildings that are highly decorated, lavishly ornate, over done ( i mean the numbered brass or maybe gold plated cigar holders were a bit over the top) and well kept up even though they are still undergoing restoration then this is for you. As for me I was rushed through so fast I had no time to enjoy 3 dollars worth let alone 18 dollars worth. Go see St Michael's instead.

Breath-taking nightview. I never ever saw such breath-taking building in my life, and I visited lot of exclusive places. You have to get infront of the building by night. I stayed there like 30min, not moving, just looking at the Parliament. A must see!
Absolutely breathtaking.. The beauty of this incredible site takes your breath away. The crown and visit to Parliament Chambers was awesome.
Big!. We strolled around it, what an impressive building. There were guards standing around it. We found a geocache in front of it.

Excelent. One of the best things you can see in Budapest. I visit the Parlment some years ago and I really love it. You can also make excelente photos of the view if you take a boat. The arquitecture is amanizng and inside you will be surprised.

Great building. The Parliament is accessible with Line 2 of the Budapest Metro, from the Lajos Kossuth Square station.The Parliament is the seat of the National Assembly of Hungary, one of Europe's oldest legislative buildings, a notable landmark of Hungary and a popular tourist destination of Budapest. It is currently the largest building in Hungary.Similar to the Palace of Westminster, the Parliament Building is in the Gothic Revival style; it has a symmetrical facade and a central dome. Also from inside the parliament is symmetrical and thus has two absolutely identical parliament halls out of which one is used for the politics, the other one is used for guided tours. It is 268 m long and 123 m wide. Its interior includes 10 courtyards, 13 passenger and freight elevators, 27 gates, 29 staircases and 691 rooms (including more than 200 offices). With its height of 96 m , it is one of the two tallest buildings in Budapest, along with Saint Stephen's Basilica. The number 96 refers to the nation's millennium, 1896, and the conquest of the later Kingdom of Hungary in 896.The main façade faces the River Danube, but the official main entrance is from the square in front of the building. Inside and outside, there are altogether 242 sculptures on the walls.

Worth going to if you don't wait too long for tickets. We arrived at about 10AM on a Thursday and got tickets for the earliest available English tour which was at 3:45PM. We waited in line for about 20-30 minutes, and felt that this wait was worth the 40 minute tour into the Parliament building. When you arrive, there are two lines which are clearly marked -One For People with Tickets, and One For People to Buy Tickets. They only let a few people in at a time to buy tickets. If you are a couple, they only allow one of you to go in and buy tickets for the two of you. The tour guide was hard to understand and the information she provided was so-so. We got to see the changing of the guards at 4PM.

Worth the Effort. Initially I experienced some difficulty in obtaining a ticket to tour Parliament. I sent several emails which never received a response. After some consultations with members of the TA Budapest Forums I got a quick response after using a different email account and had my ticket in hand a few days before departure. Unfortunately once I arrived in Budapest I was not able to go on the day I had planned and had to queue up with the rest of the great unwashed in hopes I could get a ticket. I was able to get in an English tour later in the day and despite the seemingly unorganized groupings of the tours, I settled into my group and didn’t mind the stops as we waited for the groups ahead to move forward. The beauty and plush decor of the inside of the building was truly mind boggling. Although the tour was quick, it allowed for several photo ops with time to ask the tour guide questions. As we funneled out on the heels of the group ahead of us I was glad to have had the opportunity to go on the tour. It’s quick but rich and not to be missed.
Be sure to go early. Get there early to get a time to tour the Parliament. The tour was well worth the time and money. Building is huge and decorated very nicely.
Fantastic building. You MUST get your entry tickets early in the morning, we were not told about this so were unable to visit. it is suggested about 8.30am to apply.

beautiful from the outside. So far I did not have time to go inside. From the outside I found this building as beautiful as the British one. I heard that the there are guided groups for a complete inside tour. Maybe next time...

work in progress. They were cleaning and working on it - so we couldnt get a real good look at it - even from outside -- but when its done - it will be fabulous - - the "compound" is huge!!! the archetecture is awesome

Beauty on the river. Day and night, this building is spectacular. We did not get to go in, but saw it close up from the outside, and then from everywhere else: the boatride on the river, the Red Bus. It is just so impressive.

Fast way to but tickets to the parliament. Normally you would need to wait 1.5 hours just to buy tickets and than you may set the tour at a time which isn't what you want. So the easy way is to send a mail to the parlament (chack the web site): idegenforgalom@parlament.hu give your preferable tour language time and number of people with you (can be even one) They are very responsive so you will get the confirmation letter within a day or two. Take the confirmation letter and go to gate X (you need to show it to the officer) no need to stand the line. you can come 15 minutes before your tour starts. The tour takes 50 minutes.

Amazing place. If you are planning to visit the parliament then if you cannot get a ticket online (we couldn't) you will need to be there at 8am to purchase one. Take Id and you get in for free if you are from the EU. We did and then went back for the 10am tour. After a little confusion at the gate (no-one knew where to stand) we had a great tour around. The lady that took us was very friendly and we are so glad we did it. Afterwards take a walk down to the Danube and see the metal shoes along the edge(to the left of parliament as you walk down) It is very sad but the artwork is amazing.
YOU SHOULD GO!. Worth to go there. For European Union Citizens free access. We had an english speaking guide......!!!!One of the best sightseeings in Budapest

A beautiful building...inside and out. The interior of the building is as fabulous as the exterior. The tour was interesting and well worth the time and price. The wait outside was a little inconvenient and would be more so in inclement weather, but they in the process of constructing a better alternative.

Don't Do What I Did!!. This is well worth a visit although I guess with a lot of hanging around it is best on a dry day. I arrived at around 11am and queued for around 30 minutes only to discover I was allocated a ticket for a visit at 3.45pm. So this meant returning but it is well worth the hassle although I think had I planned my visit better (using the website) I could have eased things. The tour itself is 45 minutes and is very interesting. Best of all as an EU citizen it was absolutely free.

Awesome both inside and out. If you have chance you must visit . We booked the midday English tour on a Sunday. Most people see only the outside which is truly beautiful situated on the banks of the Danube.Parliament looks great during the day but loved the sight at night on a boat tour when all the major sights are illuminated. As stated you must go inside,you only visit about 4 rooms but the splendour.majesty and decor are mind blowing. The great hall is truly great,never seen a hall so splendid and have visited UK Houses of Parliament. The guards on duty at the Hungarian crown give the occasion a sense of service and only adds too the grandeur of the place.
Parliament. Beautiful building right on the Danube. Tram and bus stops right outside. Some renovation ongoing when we visited in October. Lit up at night so spectacular to view then.
Maybe the Best Parliament in Europe. Like most things - get these tickets early since they run out as the seats are limited. Definitely worth the ticket.
Wish all Parliaments are like this one. Beautifl beyond description! I think it gives the English parliament, for which it was fashioned after, a good run for the money.

How to get entrance tickets in advance. First of all, check the web camera to see what to expect in the Parliament before you go:www.parlament.hu/parl/hun/virtualis_seta.htmFor a guided tour in your preferred language, send a email to idegenforgalom@parlament.hu , indicating date, time, number of persons and language preffered. They normally will confirm your booking in an hour by send you a Confirmation Letter stating all details. Then you go to the Gate X (backside of the Parliament, close to the Eternal Flame) 15 min. before the tour starts, pay the booking fee (3500 HUF for non EU citizens and 1750 HUF for EU citizen), get your tickets and join the guided tour. They only accept Hungarian cash or credit cards, and photos can be taken into the Parliament building. There are no public cloak rooms or lavatories. Also please note that tours can be cancelled at any time by the Parliament.Thanks to "Budapest1972"!! Good luck!

One of the nicest parliaments ever. I have been to several parliaments around the world. I can really say that this one of the most lovlely places to be inside. very reach colourful huge and impressive buildings.You should come early in the morning 7:30-8:00 am to buy tickets and then you come back on 10:00 for the guided tour. We had Yohana wich was great guide.

Must see, but not on your own!. The parliament is a must when you come to Budapest. However, your chances of getting in by just showing up are slim. Through most hotels or the abundant tour kiosks around town, you need to join one of their excursions. Yes, it will cost a little more, but you WILL get in. Tour groups have appointment times, and a new group enters the building every 10 minutes. Groups stay together with their guide, and are in the building about an hour. A good guide will provide a wealth of information, on both the building and the history of the Hungarian people's, during that time. There are 96 steps inside that you must to able to walk. You will go through a security screening prior to entering. Most guided groups do NOT take you back to your hotel. Did not see any elevators in the building.

incredible. This is an amazing building to see. I walked up in the day to get a better look and it is just stunning. BUt its better to see at night when all the lights shine on it. Also take a boat trip at night so you can see everything lit up (take warm clothing, gets COLD)
Two metres longer than Westminster. Amazing beautiful building - allegedly two metres longer than our Parliament. Visit it in the daytime and by boat in the evening - equally enchanting.

Beautiful Building. Getting tickets for a tour of Parliament is awkward - get there early and don't expect to get into the first tour. You can't get individual tickets in advance. The tour guide spoke too quietly, but just being inside this great building was worth the effort.

Largest Parliament after London. This is a must see. The interior is divine and the scale is enormous. There are paid tours if you arrive on foot but arrive early in the day to receive an afternoon booking. You'll have to fill the time in between. All the tours stop here too. I believe that admission is free for Europeans, (who required their passports for proof).

The Parliament buildings at night!. They look absolutely stunning from the outside at night. We booked a 2 hour evening river cruise at the beginning of dusk to get both the daylight and night time views of the stunning buildings along the river, with the parliament buildings being the stand-out piece. It is absolutely breathtaking.

Prepare to be stunned!. This is impressive during the day but at night it really comes into its own. Lit up it is simply stunning with capital S! I viewed it at night on a boat trip along the Danube and was blown away by it's beauty! Prepare to be stunned!

A MUST. You have to see this building from the inside. Look at the environment in which our our leaders made all those bad decisions... :-) Without joking: truly a memorable visit. Tickets can be bought only early the morning and they go quite fast, so get up early and join the queue.
An impressive building!. For a better view of this beautiful building I recommend you a short cruise on the Danube or to cross the river and look at it from the other side.

Free tour in English (sort of!) for E.U. citizens.. Tours are free for all E.U. citizens. English tours are at 10.00 am, 12.00 a.m. and 2.00 pm.You must "buy" your ticket beforehand at Gate X. When we got there on our last day the first 2 tours were full so I would recommend getting your tickets the day before. The tour was supposed to be in english but it was actually "Hungarish" and difficult to follow not helped by terrible acoustics in the building. The building is very ornate and worth a visit. Useful exercise in watching how different nationalities regard queueing. Tour lasts 50 minutes.

Impression architecture . You should come early for tickets. Tickets are sold from 8am, we were there at 7:30 and at 8 the queue was really long. If you posess an EU passport admission is free. The building is really impressive and the largest in Hungary and the largest parliament in Europe. You get to see the large central stairways, the room with the crown juwels and the house of Lords.
Wonder of the World!. I cannot imagine a visit to Budapest without a tour of the Parliment House. It is fantastic, and drips of history.

Worth visiting, but be prepared to wait a long time and some confusion. It's probably a waste not to visit the parliament, unfortunately unless you reserved the tickets online and I strongly recommend that you do, be prepared for confusing queues and a long wait... be aware that there are 2 lines, the left (with a sign saying "Ticker Line") is to purchase the tickets in Entrance X, entry is allowed for only a few people at a time and there's only 1 cashier, so it takes time (tickets there are sold for this day only, so if it's all soled out, you need to come back the next day), once you have the ticket - you should be waiting at the right line (sign says "With tickets") a few minutes before the designated tour time. Be prepared :) but definitely visit !!!

Beautiful- especially at night. That is one of the most beautiful bildings which I have seen while staying in Budapeste.It is really beautiful at night- when all in lights.We boat a night boat tour and it was really great to see this fantastic building. Strongly recommended.

Wonderful. WHen visiting Budapest, it is a must to see at least from the outside. Believe me, this is one of the most wonderful Parliament building on the planet. If you have time, do not miss to check the inside as well.

Beautiful building. This building is so photogenic. The best view is from the Danube on one of the boats, or from Buda. We tried to get in on a Monday but due to a state visit the building was closed to tourists. People with EU passports get in free. Was told it's best to check the internet for opening times.There was a lot of renovation work taking place at the time we visited so the garden area was closed to the public. Howerver, there were some interesting historical posters of the Parliament grounds on the herris fencing around the Parliament building.

Fascinating building. We joined one of the many English-language guided tours which was really informative and the guide did her best to make it fun, though there was a pretty big crowd - understandably. Anyway, the building itself is simply unique and I can only recommend it to architecture fans. It is a must in Budapest. - while it's free for EU nationals, Other visitors must pay entrance fee.
beautiful. we booked a tour with a private guide which meant we where able to bypass the very long queue0for tickets ,the insde of the building is fantastic it is a must do when you in budapest
It `s breath taking. The architecture is incredible! It `s breath taking...Take a 2 hours guided tour, and make Danube at night !

Didn't get tickets :(. The ticket scheme is very strange and unhelpful. You have to get there at 8am if you want any chance of buying tickets, and this may be many hours ahead of when your tour actually is. Tickets are also only available on the day, so forget about buying them in advance. When we tried to get some information from one of the ticket sellers/guides, she was unhelpful to the point of rudeness.This said, the building is very impressive on the outside, and we enjoyed walking around it.
Beautiful Architecture. This building is absolutely gorgeous - completely guilded and just incredible. Definitely worth checking out.

Amazing!!. What a building!!!! Amazing to see from the outside but don't miss the tours on the inside. Check in their site what time there is a tour in your language and be there at leat 30 mins before the start time.

Like a dream. Visiting the many different rooms in the building was like my little girl princess dreams. The architecture, decoration, and the spirit of the place is magical. I suggest reading the history before/during the visit for a even more meaningful experience.

One of the best. This is one the best Parliament buildings in Europe. I have been there several times and love the spend time around it. Especially from the Danube side it shows an impressive standing to take photos. It is definitely number one to see in Budapest.
Very nice to visit!. Very interesting place to visit and very rich with a lot of wonderful details. The organization of the ticket is not very clear and the guide in english was hard to understand.

Awful arrangement. An awful arrangement to get the tickets.
Tickets office is open from 8 a.m but tickets are not available in advance. Moreover, you have to wait ~2 hours in a queue to get the tickets if you came later than 9 a.m, no matter the time of excursion you need.

Amazing!. I couldn,t believe that such an amazing building was Parliament! It's marvellous and couldn't be compared to anything else. Unfortunatelly, we didn't visit it, but had a lot of nice photos around it))

Impressive - but we couldnt visit inside. The outside of the building is very impressive, especially from the river side. We went to go and visit the museum on a Sunday, although it is was closed to visitors which was disappointing. Also a lot of one side of the building was covered in scaffolding so couldn't see as much as we hoped!

My favourite building in Budapest!. If only the Parliament building in London was as beautiful as the one in Budapest. The building itself is grand and can be seen from various angles - the river, the Buda castle on the hill, etc. At night the building is beautifully lit up. It really is lovely. My favourite building in Budapest without a doubt!

get up early, it's worth it!. having read other reviews, had early breakfast, took metro & got to Parliament building by 8.45a.m. Waited in a short queue until security guards beckoned us thru to ticket office where we were offered tickets for 2pm English tour. Returned at 1.45pm & enjoyed seeing the interior & hearing some interesting info like how the cooling/heating system worked, also viewing the cigar-holders outside the session room. The staircase on entering is stunning! Well worth doing & don't forget to take your EU passport to get free entry.
The parliament building. A beautiful building, especially when viewed from aboard ship..at night too. Something Pest can be proud of.

If You Love History. We have visited this three times. The design is stunning. The craftmanship cannot be duplicated. The Crown of St. Steven is a site to see in itself. The gold leaf throughout is wonderful

MUST SEE!. it's well worth the money and time to see this architecture marvel!
Tour guide speaks almost fluent clear English, though there were times noises from other tour groups may interrupt, so it's best to stay close to tour guide.
take your time and feel the building speak

Not worth the money. EU citizens can visit the Parliament Building free of charge upon proof of nationality.For foreign citizens the entrance tickets cost 3 500 Ft for adults= $17 USD. Sounds like Communist pricing! Save your money and take pictures from the outside.I paid to see 2 rooms after waiting outside 40 minutes and reserving tickets in advance. The staff is very rude too. My 3 pictures are all you get to see.

Wowww. The palace is fantastic and full of history. To visit the Parliament you need to book a tour. Some hour before the tour, go in front of door number X and give your name to the guide. The tour is free for EU citizen

Simply stunning!. This is a beautiful building on the outside, but when you go inside it just takes your breath away. There are lots of stairs up to the dome room, but the climb is worth it. Carvings, marble, gold prevail. Fascinated by the natural air conditioning and the handmade rug that took 11 women 9 months to make. A must see on a trip to Budapest

If wonderful historical buildings are your thing. We had a wonderful tour of the most famous building in Budapest. Please get on line early to get your tickets. Well worth standing in line for....one of our top 3 sights in Budapest.

A beautiful building & an informative tour. The building is beautiful and impressive from outside but you have to see the interior to experience the majestic beauty, history & breathtaking scale and decor!

Wow.. You won't believe how close you get to the oldest crown jewels in Europe. Surrounded by architecture and design that compares favorably to many esteemed museums, this 40 minute tour is well worth your time. Make reservations and get there early. The exterior is amazing in itself, both from the Pest embankment and of course when viewed from across the Danube at night.

Beats our U.K.Parliament Building. Absolutely beautiful architecture both sides but best from the Danube (on a river cruise) or the Buda side of the river. We didn't go in the weather was beconing us to stay outside. Has to be seen!

Arrive early to collect free tickets. Although the tours are free if you present your eu passport you must arrive early to collect your tickets. We were there at 7.45 and the queue was already big for the 8am opening. Our tour was at 10am and we used the time between to check out other sites near by. The tour was very informative and the parliament very beautiful. Would recommend.
Incredible. Definitely view this at night when it is lit up. Take photos prior to midnight because that is when they shut all of the lights off.
Can't miss it. This is a major sight of down town Budapest. It can be seen from either side of the Danube river. Take a night drive or a night tour and the beauty of the evening comes out.

A must see if in Budapest. We took the english tour, the tour was booked by our private guide. It is very interesting and it is Huge. The tour itself is about 1 hour which is not too long. You can take picture in some area and it is very informative. A must see in Budapest.

Stunning building. The architecture of the parliament building is amazing, saw it first from our river cruise, then walked past it later. Get as close as you can as the decoration is truly amazing, such detail. Very imposing and beautiful building.

Incredible beautiful interior. get tickets ahead of time to enter;usually long lineups. Sumptuous interior with gold leaf, subdued green and red highly decorated walls. The gold crown on the first king of Hungary is on display with 24 hour guard. Do sign up for a tour.
Good to visit. The building is a one of the most beautiful ones in budapest. Free visits. Inside you can see the crown of the king and the guards around.
Parlament. Spectacular building, supposedly the largest parliament building in Europe. Do not expect to get too close, especially when Parliament is sitting, it is well guarded. :)
Simply beautiful. It is a fine piece of architecture. Beautiful from every angle. The best way to see the Parliament is from a boat in the Danube.

Magnificent building on the Danube River. The Parliament (Orszaghaz) is a magnificent building directly on the Danube. We toured this amazing piece of architecture in May when we visited Budapest. Do not miss the history attached to this building. Do not miss a chance to see this amazing site lit up with lights.

Beautiful View from the outside... We took the tour and I paid about 25 dollars for the tour for me and my 12 year old.. we literally saw the crown room, the parliament room, a sitting room and the staircase.. Overpriced for what we saw.. it is beautiful inside however in my opinion not worth what we paid..

An architectural wonder. The Parliament is the most expensive building ever built in Budapest. It is a magnificent building. There is an entry charge of about 2 Euros, but well worth the cost. Beware of the long queues.

Beautiful Parliament of Budapest. I think the Parliament (Orszaghaz) of Budapest is one of the most amazing building, I've ever seen in my life. It has wonderful landing (near the Danube), and the building is so enormous. You can catch up English guided tours every day at 10.00, 12:00 and 14:00. It is really worth a visit.

Opulance. THe Parlaiment is very much worth a visit to see how a country spends its money when is is feeling very rich and stil under royal influence. It is more like a Palace then a legislative home. Well worth a tour.
A visit not to be missed in Budapest. A visit not to be missed in Budapest. For EU citizens is free (only IDs). A memorable and unforgettable achievement.

Beautiful building. A very interesting tour, which takes about an hour, with an excellent guide who spoke very good English. The tour only takes in a small part of the Parliament building, but includes the Crown Jewels, and is free for EU members. There are a number of tours with an English guide throughout the day, but booking is necessary.

Great building..poor entry system. I just wanted to suggest that if you want to tour Parliament, make sure you secure tickets BEFORE you get there and go early. Check the times of the tours and que up early. There are just so many tours during the day and they will bump you to the next one unless they run out of time at the end of the day. Good tour and available in English with a guide. The building is beautiful and worth taking the time to go. Just plan ahead.
Only saw it from the outside. What a magnificent building! I only saw it from the outside at night and during the day, but one should definitely at least see the exterior.
Worth a Visit. Stunning building, both inside and out. If you are an EU citizen you can gain free entry into the Parliament building.

shortest tour ever. we've waited almost an hour to get the tickets and finally we had to book for the tour that started two hours later because when we reached the cashier the one we wanted was sold out. They have the stupidiest system ever because you need to walk a distance of 200 meters from the point of the queue and each one was allowed to start wallking to the cashier when the previous person started walking from the other side!!! not earlier. the tour is very short and the english speaking guide is not understandable.The only good thing is that the tour was free

Queue.. Lovely building but the wait in the queue isn't really worth the 40 minute tour. We arrived at the building about 9:30 and waited for over an hour to get in to buy the tickets. The upside was that, because we are Scottish we didn't have to pay for the tickets. English speaking tours are at 10am, 12pm and 2pm. Worth a look if you get there early enough.
Take a stroll of the surroundings as well. Parliament grounds are very interesting as well with many significant monuments and beautiful bronze sculptures.

Good but not riveting. As guided tours go, this was fine, but short, and poorly-paced. The building is magnificent, but the tour lacked much character - it was just a well-rehearsed statement of facts. Interesting facts, but dull in their delivery.As a tip for I suitors, go to Gate 10 (x - back of the building on the side closest to Margaret Island, facing away from the river) at 8am - no queue for tickets at all, and you can book any of the tours later in the day (which come in several languages). If you take a passport or proof of your nationality, EU and Swiss visitors get in for free.

Amazing!. The whole building is astonishing but we 've been waiting two hours in the line to book our tour. In front of the cashier there was an announcement that you can book your tour through email . Anyway the experience worths the fuss...

Nicer on the outside. It's a nice building, certainly. But the inside is just too much - too much marble, too many fancy red carpets. After a while is just becomes... well, almost ugly, unfortunately.Also, there's a monstrous queue to get inside. You have to buy your tickets (free if you're a EU citizen, bring a passport) inside this little side room, but you're not allowed to just walk across there, the guards let you in in small groups. Then, you have to wait in another line until the tour actually begins...

Spectacular Building. This building is getting some renovation done to it at the moment so you cannot get too near to it.A new visitors center is being built underneath and will be ready in 2014 but at the moment you have to Que outside for a ticket to get in,we waited for 2 1/2 hours for a ticket in 95deg temperatures only to be told at 3 o-clock to come back at 6pm for the English speaking guide which was a wast of time because she had a very bad accent which people could not understand and we were rushed round as it was the last tour of the day.A small tip is get there before 8am to be sure of a ticket.BUT the parliament building is spectacular inside and a must see for all visitors to Budapest.Do not try and get to the front of the building as this can only be passed by road.

Beautiful. The view of the Parliament from the Buda side of the river is great. Especially at night. But inside the Parliament is better yet. A must during your visit to Budapest. The line if usually long, but it is worth the wait.

AMAZING!. Gorgeous architecture, Just loved to have the opportunity to see it.Our guide was very monotonic and a bit boring. She knew the information by heart and just said it with no emotion or excitment.One hour on the queue to get tickets wasn't very fun either, but the place is worth visiting for sure.

Beautiful!. The building is gorgeous! I couldn't figure out how to go inside...I'm not sure you can? But it's worth a walk by. Also, the view is AMAZING from the Hilton on the other side of the river (I can't remember what the area is called, but it's right where the Hilton hotel is). Gorgeous at sunset.

Great and awesome architecture, the best parliament building in Europe. This building is amazing, from my point of view better than the parliament building in London. Awesome architecture and can be seen standing proudly. You can take a good picture if you take Hop on Hop off tour which includes boat tour in the price.The boat tour will bring you very close to the building.
Like a church inside. We enjoyed seeing the beautiful parliament!! You are allowed to ake photos, we had a tour guide who knew the history of Hungary.
Parliament of beauti. Parliament house was the most beautiful buildings I have ever seen. It must one of the wonders in the world. Especially during the evening with all the lights on
